reviews.author: Adam B.
reviews.description: We were here for an Austin FC watch party and the vibe was awesome. The band was there, they had a huge screen for the game, and the energy was through the roof.   I tried their special beer release, Mikalla Mist, and it was a beautiful, bright, crisp Pilsner! I also had their Belgian style Gold Fist. It was nice and hoppy and perfectly sour. My final beer was a stout and it was something about the Simpsons. It was also really good.  Great place, awesome tacos, fantastic beer.

reviews.author: Steven C.
reviews.description: Beer is great and reasonably-priced with good variety. The food truck out back is far better than it has any right to be, with delicious mexican food at a reasonable price.   I highly recommend the fish and barbacoa tacos, as well as the burrito+quesadilla. The chips/salsa aren't too shabby either.   Haven't tried the burgers so can't comment on those.   If you want an affordable spot to come eat, drink, and be merry in the Austin area, look no further!   Plenty of space to sit inside, or if the weather is nicer, even more space out back! You order everything at the bar, get your beer immediately, and pick up your food from the truck out back if you ordered that.

reviews.author: Junus A.
reviews.description: Megaflora has reinvigorated my love for IPAs, which waned heavily after I hit the quarter century mark. I think it's the hazy kind, and they mix it up with melony goodness (love melons - all kinds of melons). Your palate ends up fielding a fruity punch; no getting your jaw kicked in by puckering hops. Great shit. They made it year round too, with the badass stylized can design and all (most of those ones are seasonal only).  With that being said, please offer La Verdad year round. Please  These dudes' merch game is on point, they really need to take their little stylized logo print for the cans and sell it on more apparel. Whoever does their art is a fucking genius. I love my Cold Glory shirt and my Megaflora mask. I love my Lazer Salad pint glass cup thing. They have a bunch of badass koozie designs. Basically, their merch game is next level already, but I see so much potential. I guess they are keeping their operation relatively small scale, and there are only so many ppl who are going to buy brewery merchandise in central Texas, but I dunno. Love the art.   At the end of the day, though, nobody is going to buy any merchandise if the beer sucks. Beerworks' beer does not suck. The new Eastern Philosophy beer they came out with is a great example of Austin Beerworks' beer not sucking. When I read it was a jasmine tea infused lager (I love jasmine tea) I had to check it out. Super solid, 7.5% but doesn't taste like it. You're supposed to drink it over ice. So novel, so well thought out, and so well executed. ABW's motto (I think) is "Hellbent on Excellence" and they are certainly living up to that standard. I'm so fortunate to live here in Austin with great breweries like ABW. I'll be even more fortunate when I can walk into HEB and buy La Verdad year round, but that'll come in time. Thanks, Austin Beerworks.

reviews.author: Courtney B.
reviews.description: I  came here the other day with a friend to have a chat and really get ready to center ourselves for the week ahead. I ordered a Lazer Salad which is a double IPA.   Here is the breakdown:   The beer appears as a golden amber color with a one finger head of white  foam. The aroma of the brew gives a tropical fruit vibe with hints of tangerine and mango mixed with some  undertones of a grapefruit hop and a little bit of pine. The taste begins with a tropical fruit sweetness mixed with a  doughy taste. As the taste lingers, more and more hop comes to the  tongue starting out with grapefruit followed by some flavors of an herbal and pine hop. The body of the brew is average in thickness and creaminess  with a carbonation level that is lighter. Overall this is a well-balanced fruity IPA that if you are not careful can put you on your ass!  #supportlocal

reviews.author: Mark M.
reviews.description: Excellent brewery, parking can be a challenge during the weekend. They have some the finest craft brews on tap in Austin. I have enjoyed their Mexican style lager and other Pilsner style brews. They have some nice tropical IPA to satisfy even the most discerning of beer drinking palates. At least 8 tables outside that have shade, which provide a nice social gathering space to enjoy a sunny Austin afternoon with a beer and some fresh air as you contemplate the mysteries of the Universe. There is also a food truck that serves some decent fish tacos.

reviews.author: Amanda S.
reviews.description: I visited Austin Beerworks over the weekend for a benefit/fundraiser event and had a blast! The beer was refreshing and my frozen drink was delicious! I had 2 of the cranberry frozen mimosas, which I could have sipped on all day. I was glad to see they offered other things besides just their beer. The space was perfect for our fundraiser. My kid enjoyed the play area with the hill/tunnel and there were plenty of other kids for her to play with. I'd definitely come back here to hang out with friends or family.

reviews.author: Vanessa S.
reviews.description: A local staple. Everyone knows about this place so don't expect any one on one experiences. Great outdoor area, family friendly, and be on the lookout for events! Don't forget to walk on the right side of the bar for stickers and other treasures

reviews.author: Mina P.
reviews.description: I'm surprised I haven't been here sooner because I love their beer. There's ample seating indoors and outdoor, and they have a great selection of beer.   There was also a food truck that sold burgers, where you had to order at the bar. I would definitely come here again :)

reviews.author: Kasey F.
reviews.description: Visiting on a Sunday afternoon. Plenty of outdoor space. Nice and sunny with umbrellas and patio tables. I ordered a 4beer flight from the 25 or so they offered. They're all good so far. (My only disappointment is that they don't offer a sour. Please, make a sour!!)  Currently waiting on my food order. There's a taco truck here today.

reviews.author: Stephanie S.
reviews.description: Love this place and love that they have food trucks. Great indoor and outdoor seating as welll

reviews.author: Tristan B.
reviews.description: Solid beers, cool space. Bartenders are a little cold and the tap list while usually varied, can sometimes be a bit lacking.   That aside, still a solid vibe and a good place to meet up with friends.

reviews.author: Lisa C.
reviews.description: Kudos to the staff at Austin Beerworks -- class acts all the way. We were in your original taproom Saturday (March 5) for a Celebration of Life for a friend. Your staff was amazing. It was a perfect way to pay tribute to our friend, and y'all were so great as everyone struggled to leave on time. You could have been rigid about shooing us out the door on the dot, but your staff showed great generosity of spirit toward a grieving group, many of whom were in from out of state. Thanks for creating such a warm, welcoming space for this event. You demonstrated the best of Austin, Texas hospitality and friendliness.

reviews.author: Andrew L.
reviews.description: I feel conflicted giving a fairly low rating given I consistently think of ABW as one of the top handful of breweries in Austin, but I'm giving this as a rating of the taproom experience moreso than a rating of their beers. I've also only gone during Covid, so I'm looking forward to giving them a try in the future when I can comfortably get the full experience.   Compared to other patios in the area I find theirs to be pretty lacking. There were no fans in the summer and no heat lamps in the winter. Their space isn't particularly large so there are fewer tables than other locations. This leads it to be uncomfortably packed on weekends, both in terms of how close tables are and the lack of distancing enforced in lines.   One weird thing working against them is just how available their beer is around town. Every HEB and bar will have at least a couple of ABW's beers available, so they lose out on the necessity of going to the taproom to try their beers. Even their seasonals get around town pretty well both in stores and on tap elsewhere.   On that note, and to not make this review totally negative, their beer is absolutely phenomenal. All their flagships are good to great examples of the style, my personal favorites are the Sun Shovel (think blue moon but with some hop prescence) and Fire Eagle (leans more towards West Coast IPA, but has enough juiciness to be really refreshing in the summer time).   Their seasonals also absolutely knock it out of the park. Sputnik (Coffee Oatmeal Stout) is an absolute must if you're in Austin in December and is probably the best beer I've had since moving here. The Heisenberg (a combination of a Pilsner and Hef) and Black Thunder (Black Lager) are two other stand outs to me.  The food truck is good enough that if you need something to snack on while you're there you won't be totally dissatisfied, but I've usually felt compelled to go elsewhere for food.  Overall, can't recommend their beer enough, but you don't need to visit the taproom to get the full experience.

reviews.author: Scott S.
reviews.description: We enjoyed a couple in the tent on a recent chilly Saturday afternoon. The beer is great and the variety of experimental beers makes for a fun beer day. Good beer people!

reviews.author: Sandi N.
reviews.description: After three months of sheltering at home, Austin Beer Works was a first outing.  They did an excellent job with social distancing, wiping down each table after guests left, and mask enforcement (when not seated at table) in a firm but polite way.    No inside seating right now and the outdoor tables are shaded and a good distance apart. It is reservations only. depending on the time you make the reservation for, you will either get an hour to enjoy your table or two hours.  They go over all the rules with you when you arrive.  They have some great beers, both on tap and in cans. You can purchase some to take home with you as well!  I ordered a sour raspberry-lemon Einhorn.  So summery and refreshing!  I ended up drinking two.  My husband had an Essential IPA and the Small Spoon session IPA.   We didn't care for the Heisenberg Heff-lager (a bit too banana-ish).  The only thing that would have made the difference from 4 stars to 5 would have been some kind of food! Even a bag of chips or pretzels to go with the beer would have been awesome! We saw a food truck parked there but unfortunately it was not open.

reviews.author: Sherry P.
reviews.description: I like the set up and idea. Inside brewery and seating tables. Outside food truck. Order everything inside.  Comfortable atmosphere, good inside music, and great variety of beers. The tacos and burger are fantastic!   Get you a cold one!

reviews.author: Cameron N.
reviews.description: I don't have anything negative to say about Austin Beerworks other than the occasional difficulty with parking. I've only had that issue a few times though. The staff is incredibly helpful and knowledgable, but I think the best part of the experience (other than the drinks) is the atmosphere. The interior is very spacious which makes it a perfect space for a casual happy hour with coworkers while the exterior has an abundance of seating. I'll definitely be returning if I am ever up that direction!

reviews.author: heather g.
reviews.description: Austin Beer Works doesn't always have Spurs, but when they do, they are THE BEST!! If you haven't tried a Tropical Einhorn and you like spurs, you're missing out!  The staff are AMAZING and the set up both inside and outside are fun. Totally family friendly and they have an awesome food truck on site (permanently)

reviews.author: Novalina N.
reviews.description: Cool that they're open now!  Arrived around 4 and it was busy so waited around 20 minutes before we could be seated  There's no markers on the ground so lines seemed to form in different places when I was there. Didn't particularly like it when people were right behind me (thanks covid). Hope they add these markers soon!

reviews.author: Desiree G.
reviews.description: I really want to love this place but their service is just terrible. Every single time I come, they make it feel like it's an inconvenience to them that I need a minute to order or if I have a question, they make it seem like I should have their menu memorized.   They do have a larger beer selection for local breweries, parking is hit and miss, outdoor seating is mostly shaded. Inside is picnic seating. There's a food truck here if you get hungry. I feel ok bringing my dogs here.   The service is just that bad that I can't recommend them as much as their beer gives them credit for.

name: Zilker Brewing Company and Taproom
accommodations: Best nights on Friday, Saturday, Sunday

reviews.author: Jason Z.
reviews.description: Awesome tasting beer and top notch service from Nick! Will have to return and drink more beer.

reviews.author: Mina P.
reviews.description: The space is nice and I love the food truck spicy boys that's there. Overall, the beer selection is pretty good and I love the merch. I was a bit surprised with how sweet their double ipa was, but there are other selections of beer that were more on the bitter side and less on the sweet side.  The outdoor space is really nice and I'd definitely come back here again.

reviews.author: Hannah E.
reviews.description: The only good thing about this place is that Spicy Boys is available. The one waiter with pink and blue hair completely ruined the entire experience for my friends and I. He was blatantly rude to us for no reason whatsoever.   Never coming back.

reviews.author: Anne C.
reviews.description: Super cool space and vibe!  We stumbled (not literally) upon this as we were heading back to our hotel after visiting another brewery in the area.  We were pretty full from lunch at Franklin BBQ - but they had a food truck at the ready if your stomach started growling.  We sipped our brews out side but they have a nice sized indoor seating area too if the weather gets a  bit chilly.  Super cool neighborhood vibe as I saw several families and even a softball team enjoying a pitcher after their game.  I wish I had more time here but am bookmarking it to visit again the next time I'm in Austin.

reviews.author: Shaji K.
reviews.description: Stopped by over here on an early Saturday afternoon before the crowds showed up. Large space with both inside and outdoor seating as well as a food truck parked to the side.  Decided to try a couple beers: Marco IPA ($6) and Friends with Benefits ($7). The Marco is well balanced but still had plenty of hops. Friends with benefits is more on the hazy side that sticks with you. The latter paired just fine alongside one of the sandwiches from the food truck.  Service was quick as there weren't many people at the brewery yet. A couple hours later the spot was packed, so best to come early.

reviews.author: Tim R.
reviews.description: Good beer. Nice outdoor seating area. Down the street from Lazarus brewing company. Nice place

reviews.author: Tomas R.
reviews.description: Fun spot to check out whilst in Austin or as a local. Zilker has always been a staple of East 6th even before East 6th became the hot neighborhood. They have indoor and outdoor seating and from my recent visit, I discovered they even sell wine here!  They had a food truck on the day they went so I'm certain there's food to wash down your IPA.

reviews.author: Paul R.
reviews.description: All the 4 and 5-star reviews are spot on. Zilker Brewing is a great venue to have a brew or two and people watch from their 6th St patio.  Their indoor taproom is closed and they are adhering to the social distancing guidelines. We had a large picnic table to ourselves and were very comfortable chilling out on a breezy Sat afternoon.   I really enjoyed their Lazy Daisy Hazy IPA. It's a wonderful IPA that has a hint of sweetness and a citrus finish. Plus 1 gave 5 stars to their LA Beer American Pilsner. This is a typical Pils that drinks lite and is a perfect brew for a warm day.   Hungry? Spicy Boys Chicken food truck is onsite and is producing wonderful spicy chicken (Duh). They offer a range of sauces from sweet to hot as hades. We went midrange spicy and felt the heat.   Not a beer drinker, they offer wine, water, soft drinks, and surprise a frose' .  Solid 5-stars!

reviews.author: Madeline C.
reviews.description: Always one of my favorite brewery spots. They have the best hazy IPAs and great sours and generally interesting seasonal drafts, friendly staff, and a super yummy food truck (Spicy Boys) right in the patio area. Only thing is it gets pretty busy on weekends so it can be tough to snag a table sometimes, but it's worth it.

reviews.author: Lazar V.
reviews.description: There is a reason that this brewery is always packed, the beer is awesome! I've checked out several local breweries in the area and this one is at the top of my list right now. The beer is great and the service is awesome. The staff are welcoming and willing to help you select a beer if you're undecided. Spicy Boys food truck is in their parking lot, so grab a few beers and enjoy the awesome food. Plenty of seating outside with some seating inside. This place is popular, so the seating will always fill up quickly. Dog friendly as well

reviews.author: Mckenna R.
reviews.description: Omg I wished I lived in Austin just for this brewery. I had their mixed berry sour and it was incredible! Also all of their Hazy IPA's were delicious as well. I love the ambiance here and can't wait to visit Austin again for this!

reviews.author: Lucas E.
reviews.description: Zilker BC is an awesome spot to grab a beer, grab a bite, chill out and enjoy the great vibes of both the brewery and the neighborhood. The space both indoors and out is perfect, and encourages coming together. Great for groups, but would be fine for a date night as well. A few bar stools but mostly community style seating. The food truck permanently stationed out front is great. The beer is excellent, focusing on IPAs but having many other interesting seasonals. Prices are more than fair, swag is cool. Zilker has it all, ipA to Z. Drink local!

reviews.author: Ryan P.
reviews.description: Nice little micro brewery with seating indoors and out, and they are dog friendly. Good selection on tap. I had the Juicie Juice sour, and the Marco IPA - both great craft beers. Also have to mention they have some cool merchandise with very cool graphic designs for the brand.

reviews.author: Shannon H.
reviews.description: Quite good beer -- loved the coffee stout.   Was told that it's oddly not a normal spot for locals, not sure why.   I loved the food truck onsite.

reviews.author: Karley M.
reviews.description: AMAZING beer here. We loved the hazy IPA. The outdoor seating is fun and great for people watching on E 6th. There's a fried chicken food truck here as well that people say is the absolute best. Brewery has cool swag too!!

reviews.author: Craig T.
reviews.description: Loved this place. I've tried about 4 of their beers so far and liked all of them. Icy Boys jumps to mind if you're looking for something light and crushable. The Midnight Voyage is also amazing if you like hazy IPAs.  We went on a Friday night and sat outside because of Covid. There was a line but we got lucky and got a table fairly quickly.  The stuff is super polite, and the merch is great. Spicy Boys Food Truck is on site with great Thai Fried Chicken.

reviews.author: Jasmine C.
reviews.description: This brewery is outdoors and indoors. Good place to chill and hang out with friends. They also have a food truck outside.

reviews.author: Nina T.
reviews.description: Didn't plan the visit but passed by and thought why not! Not very familiar with beers but appreciated the staff sharing the knowledge to help picking on one. Found one high table on the corner, table was clean, weather was breezy, beer was good! Look at that half pint size. Great spot to quench your thirst in a warm weather.

reviews.author: Sam L.
reviews.description: Had a couple pints and hung out on their lawn for a while. Very relaxing, great beers. They share their lawn with a foodtruck which was incredibly convenient

reviews.author: Christa M.
reviews.description: Cool outdoor patio.  I enjoyed the 2 stouts they have on draught.  Very bold and deep with an experience of coffee notes.  Covid has preventing them from opening the inside for tasting, but they had plenty of tables outside.

reviews.author: Carlson Z.
reviews.description: What a delightfully quirky brewery! Places like this are in woefully short supply these days. They have a beer it forward board where you can pay in advance to give people you nominate free beers. I hope to see Matthew McConaughey and the three-legged dog to come and collect their free beers one day.

reviews.author: Bob L.
reviews.description: Austin is rich with craft breweries and 4th Tap is an excellent addition to the mix. I went there recently with my son and DIL to enjoy their beer and treat ourselves to some outstanding Laotian street for from the SXSE food truck. My favorite was the coffee stout but the amber ale was worthy of another taste.   Located in the obligatory warehouse area the facilities encourage family and pet attendance. Inside seating has a wide variety of games for those at  a loss for words. Outside seating is ample with umbrellaed picnic tables.   Also, it's within walking distance of Q2 Stadium.   Will I be back?  Youbetcha.

reviews.author: David D.
reviews.description: 4th Tap perfectly brewed beers definitely helped me get through this past year. Now that businesses are starting to reopen they've begun reintroducing some of their staple events like Good Set. Love seeing local comedians while enjoying a delicious flight. Happy that they still have a great food truck available. 4th Tap is such a wonderful addition to our community.

reviews.author: Sasa S.
reviews.description: This was our favorite of the breweries in the area. We tried a handful of their beers across the spectrum of styles (everything from a pumpkin beer to a porter to a sour). They hit the mark in every category. We loved every beer we tried and the staff were super friendly and helpful.

reviews.author: Melanie H.
reviews.description: Not only does it have good beer, friendly staff, and a good vibe, 4th Tap also has the most well-supplied (and clean) women's bathrooms of any of the Austin breweries. It may be random, but I'm just so appreciative of any business that thoughtfully provides quality sanitary supplies and handy stuff like hair ties and bobby pins. It's the little things.

reviews.author: Brent L.
reviews.description: First, I must profess.  As much as I love my hometown of San Antonio, Austin really has it going on regarding the microbrewery/brewpub scene.   There are so many options in the ATX and 4th Tap Brewing should NOT be overlooked. From their awesome craft beers, to their homemade pizzas, this place has it going on!  Beer - they have precanned beers, crowlers and growlers to go, as well as a handful of fresh beer on tap if you want to hang out in this cool joint/  On my visit, they had nine beers on tap, and I settled on the "Can You Dig It" amber ale.  It was definitely good, and I would get it again the next time I visit, but it was pretty similar to an amber ale you can find anywhere else. A little sweet, a little caramel taste to it, and just the right amount of hops - but not too much!  I didn't sample them, but they also have a could of IPAs, a sour, and a couple of different stout types.  Now, let's talk about the food! The pizza is SUPERB! They have several pizzas geared toward carnivores and herbivores alike.  If you don't see a prebuilt pizza that appeals to you, you can always build your own custom pizza.  They also have a handful of salads.  My friends from the ATX shared the 12" "Backdraft" pizza for $12.99 with me.  It was LOADED with huge slices of pepperoni, jalapenos, and house made spicy Italian style sausage. The crust was thin and crispy.  Even if you don't like beer, I recommend stopping by here for a pizza - it.was.that.good!

reviews.author: Eric C.
reviews.description: Wow 4th Tap was amazing tonight.  I love craft beer but was skeptical with covid. I was so surprised when I saw that I could book an outdoor seating table in advance. We booked a table a couple hours before we were planning to meet up.  Staff was super friendly. Beer was great...loved the Running Man, didn't really care for the gingerbread. Outdoor space was nice and spacious. Definitely felt safe during covid times. Food from the truck was delicious. Props to SXSE because their food is absolutely delicious. I had the beef skewers and upgraded to crispy rice. It was so flavorful and delicious.  Thanks 4th tap for the ease of booking a table, keeping things safe during covid, serving delicious beer and having such a great food truck.

reviews.author: Alysa L.
reviews.description: Here's why I luv 4th Tap  1.) Great drinkable, delicious beer!  My current favs are: ALL OF THEM!  haha I'm kidding.  Try Stay Gold and Kung Fu Robot.  They're so good you will want more.    2.) Great staff.  Really nice, accommodating, and they keep everyone's safety in mind by wearing masks and sanitizing ALL THE TIME!  So no CardiB, I won't get Corona virus here!   3.) Great vibe.  As a woman, I often think of, "is it safe for me to drink here alone?"  when out at bars.  I've never had this concern at 4th Tap.  4th Tap is open and bright and has lots of space to be alone or hang with guests.   As I mentioned the staff are great and wear masks and they look out for their guests in other ways, too.    4.) Great bar seats. Great bar seats are an unrated variable and let me tell y'all, I don't slide off these seats!  They're comfy and allow me to drink more beer.  Cause it's all about the beer!

reviews.author: Dawn H.
reviews.description: Pretty basic tap room and smallish brewery, but LOVE the fact they're a co-op! Putting out some decent IPAs and stouts. Offering eight taps to choose from at any given time, including their four core beers and four orbitals. Can order by pint, half pint, and/or flight. Very reasonably priced... and several little options for self entertainment including board games, a TV, and a piano. A must stop if visiting the now named "Austin Craft Beer Corridor" (i.e., there are several breweries in the adjacent area). Support local! Cheers to the shared love of good beers!

reviews.author: Monica D.
reviews.description: I typically like IPAs but 4th Tap has a great blonde ale! The tap room has long tables with a large assortment of board games available. You can also sit in the production area as long as you follow the rules such as "1. Be Cool" and of course, others like don't touch the equipment. The parking area is very limited but the location can be accessed by public transportation. Outside they also had a pizza food truck.    Fun place to hang out!

reviews.author: Lanie L.
reviews.description: Solid brewery, but I wish there was more varieties of beer offered.  I opted for the flight, which is 5 for $12, but you have to go for the 3 core and can only choose 2 orbitals. It's a shame because I didn't care for 1 of the core items, a really fruity gluten-free beer. (I had a sample and didn't really like it).  Fortunately, I asked really nicely if I could swap it out for an orbital, and the employee said she could. But when my cousin tried the same, she was denied.  +2 Vitality (Core): Spring Ale-and their lightest beer they offer. Smooth and good flavor. Perfect for if you're looking for a light beer.  Zephyr (Core): American Pale Ale-A little more hop to it, but still a smooth and light option.   Long Walk-Grapefruit IPA-Light notes of citrus, hoppy, and refreshing. But in an increasingly crowded market of grapefruit beers, this one gets lost.  Mega-Citrus One-Double IPA-Basically a stronger version of Long Walk. To me, it tasted almost identical, which makes me wonder with such a limited menu, this one is offered. (But then again, why did I choose to sample it? Not too sure myself.)  Brick Top-Robust Porter. I'm not a porter drinker. At all. But once I started sipping, I really enjoyed it. This is a popular and enjoyable one.  Sample cup pours are generous and the prices are really good for the amount you get. (I couldn't finish my entire sample flight!). There indoor seating as well as seating 'outside' in the brewery area. There is a ping-pong table, plenty of board games, and apparently, rambunctious wrestling matches that happening quarterly that brings the whole neighborhood out.  I didn't get to see any wrestling happen this time around, so all in all 4th Tap offers good beer at good prices, but I'm looking for something more to wow.

reviews.author: Justin N.
reviews.description: 4th Tap? Well it happened to be the 4th brewery I went to on this lovely Friday Evening. Lots of seating area with lots of great beers to sample. They had quite a few decent beers. But for me, what made 4th two truly memorable was the little gaming area they had. Truly unique and super awesome

reviews.author: Christine A.
reviews.description: I'm not a beer drinker at all but I love and appreciate this brewery!! They are a part of our Divine Canine "Barks for Beers" and with their wonderful support we are able to provide free therapy dog service in Central Texas. Purchase a pint glass and get free pours at many Austin and area breweries!  The general manager, Erin, is amazing and strongly supports us. Look for us here every May for the entire month. We bring our amazing therapy pups to the brewery to love on everyone.

reviews.author: Scyenna B.
reviews.description: Got this place confused with another.  There are so many Breweries in Austin, it is too much fun. The 4th tap offered a quaint space that wasn't too busy but offered plenty of seating and a great menu.

reviews.author: Leila R.
reviews.description: Was happy to discover this place so close to where I live. Came here on a Sunday afternoon and it was moderately full. The space is nice and the AC was turned up, so it was a great respite from the heat. Got a flight of their beers and not a bad one in the bunch! The bartenders were very friendly and knowledgeable and were able to make some solid and informed beer recs for my date who had no idea what beer he wanted.   There is even a piano randomly sitting amongst the tables and a random patron got up from his table, chugged the rest of his pint, waltzed over the piano, took a seat and then started playing and belting out Billy's Joel's "Pianoman". A pint w/free entertainment is always a plus!   Can see myself coming back in periodically to check out the new stuff on the rotation

reviews.author: Doug B.
reviews.description: The beers are well crafted. The IPA is fantastic. Kung Fu Robot is a well-balanced and sophisticated IPA. Great afternoon.Oh yeah and they're totally kid friendly.

reviews.author: Angie W.
reviews.description: Great little brewery tucked away from the crowds up north.  Beer was on point.  Service was stellar with friendly bartenders and servers.  We at around playing games, drinking beer, and enjoying the company.  Food truck out front if you want something to nosh on.  Check this place out!

reviews.author: Sam V.
reviews.description: Another unassuming microbrewery in a warehouse that opens into a glorious playground for adults. I wish I had gotten the names of the bartenders because they were so sweet to my mother, who is a lightweight and does not drink alcohol, but was feeling adventurous :) They even went out of their way to grab a beer they were out of on tap, but had a can of it in the back for her to try. She loved it, so she got it on the house. Incredible customer service.   There are plenty of large picnic tables in the taproom, and a whole shelf of board games to keep you and guests entertained. There is a grand piano off to the side of the room, so you know fun times are had here.   In the brew house, there is more seating, a wrestling ring (not sure I get it?), and a ping pong table! Game on.   I really enjoyed the grapefruit hints of the Longwalk as well as the tamarind acidity of the Renewal. Tasting is highly encouraged here as well. My family and I enjoyed ourselves immensely. At the end of the night, I paid a $12 tab! Great drinkin' to do on a budget!  Thanks for taking care of us and for being awesome at life!   -xoxo

reviews.author: lea c.
reviews.description: My first time at this spot. You walk in and it's an open space well developed. Bench seating isn't comfy but allows large groups to fit together. You get to taste before you buy. Then there is the back area where they brew. Ping pong, bean bag toss and a wrestling ring. Yep. We ordered pizza and they brought it right in.

reviews.author: Jennifer J.
reviews.description: Great beer and a different vibe/scene than most other places! Hoping to come back the next time we're in town!

reviews.author: Katherine M.
reviews.description: We brought a large group here the day after a wedding. It is often challenging to plan an activity for dozens of people, or to find the space. We decided we didn't need to bother reserving space as many people would come and go during the day. Ultimately most people stayed as the beer, coffee, and food were great. We were also able to secure about four continuous tables which was great to host our family and friends.   I plan to come back as I've heard their beers are gluten reduced as well.

reviews.author: Deya Z.
reviews.description: I've been here twice and each time was a different experience. If I were rating solely on my most recent visit on a late Sunday around 8:30, it would be 2 stars. The beertender literally saw me walk in off 6th before a tech bro on the side closest to him, saw me, then proceeded to serve the other guy...the line was so short with only 2 people (one of which was me. So I walked over to the other area and he walked away. Luckily another server saw me and helped. Not sure if he was judging me bc I was wearing a mask (I'm traveling hence being in Austin)...but check your self brah. If this review was based on him alone, I'd say f--- this place.   BUT I'm basing this review on my beer experience and that is a solid 3-4 star. I had the winter warmer during my first visit and it was tastier than others I've had. More recently I had the lightning wolf IPA which was a bit more watered down than i was expecting. Still flavorful, less hazy than I thought it would be, and very subtle.

reviews.author: Taira H.
reviews.description: I wish they had more beer options but we got the Pilsner and one of their Belgian beers. Both tasty.  The atmosphere is great for hanging, day drinking, or even work related meetings. They have a huge patio space and the inside is also nice to hang.  Overall where they excel at, is their tacos! I got the carnitas and asada thinking $4 for a taco was too much... but then I got them and they are bigger than expected. My bf got the two chicken tacos and we ate them soooo slow just because they had so much flavor and the meat was so tender. I'd go just for the tacos every time. Hats off to the cook!

reviews.author: Linsie W.
reviews.description: Yum! What a fun place and good vibes for a big group. And the tacos were good! I wouldn't say it was the best or most authentic street tacos but it hit the spot just fine. It's a dog friendly place but if you're wanting to sit inside, let's aren't allowed because it's against health code. They have plenty of seating outdoors and you can also reserve a room for reservations if you have a big party. Beer was good and they also have a 20% off promo for wine if you order a whole bottle on Tuesdays!

reviews.author: Valerie S.
reviews.description: Brought my sister here because she was visiting and wanted to try some breweries. I'd also never been so it was a good chance to try something new. Lazarus just became my favorite brewery in Austin. Excellent vibe, great beer and plenty of space to sit and chill and chat.

reviews.author: Shaji K.
reviews.description: Thursday late afternoon - stopped by here to check out yet another brewery on the street. Mostly packed with people working on laptops, but the open air setup doesn't make it feel too crowded.  Was able to quickly get a seat at the bar and order from the scannable menus. Decided on the Prodigal Pills ($6) to go along with a Breakfast Taco ($3.50). Pilsener is light and crushable, though not much flavor. Breakfast taco comes out fast - packed with eggs, cheese, pico de gallo, and bacon. Thankfully not a stale tortilla and even balance of ingredients. Finished the day off with the Double Predestination IPA ($7)- definitely more of a kick, possible some overkill on the hops.   Service is a bit hectic as the bartenders work off the many tables. Fine spot to relax, especially outside where there are tables available.

reviews.author: Mina P.
reviews.description: Good spot to chill with friends. I came here last weekend with my husband to meet up with some out-of-state friends who were visiting. Their guacamole and tacos were good and so was their beer selection. I honestly don't remember which one we got, but just had whatever the servers recommended and they were all good.  The outdoor seating area was nice at night with the hanging lights and is dog friendly (always a bonus for us!).   Street parking is close to impossible to find in the area, but there's paid garage parking. It is pricey, but the only spot we were able to find that wasn't too far from Lazarus.

reviews.author: Matthew H.
reviews.description: So fancy! We showed up just in time for the great weather. The beer and the food are both equally good! Great patio vibes and plenty of parking for easy in and easy out.

reviews.author: Al K.
reviews.description: First brewery stop in Austin and it did not disappoint. Great options and loved the atmosphere.  Service was great and staff were nice.  Again, the seating options and drink choices were a huge bonus. Coffee beverages looked delicious. Friend got an espresso and recommended it.  Locale is fantastic as well. Very accessible.  Would definitely recommend!

reviews.author: Ryan P.
reviews.description: If I were a local, this would be my hangout spot. The beers were superb. I got a Disco Prophet, a strawberry lemonade sour, and a Big Sky IPA - delicious and refreshing.  But the real star was the appetizers. We got chips and fresh guacamole, which paired excellently with the beer. But the real winner was the fried chickpeas, which were like seasoned corn nuts! I've never had anything like that, and it's enough for 3-4 people to share, despite only being $3.  The place was clean, staff was friendly, and there was plenty of seating. Definitely a must-see brewery if you're in the area.

reviews.author: Lazar V.
reviews.description: Good quality beer with a variety of awesome food. This European style brewery always seems to have something going on.   Showed up on a Thursday evening for dinner and was impressed with the amount of people who were here. There is picnic table seating out back with tents in the front for additional seating. There is also plenty of seating inside. There is plenty of seating but the like to order may take some time to get through, so plan accordingly.   I went with the torta as my meal. The bread was authentic and the fillings inside were great. If I had to change one thing I would have asked to get the torta with chorizo although it isn't listed as a protein for the sandwich.   This is a great local spot to check out and a place I will most likely be a regular at.

reviews.author: Tandis H.
reviews.description: This place has plenty of outdoor seating with fans that keep the flies at bay mostly. The inside was nice and they have everything you'd need to hit the spot. Tacos and beer.   The beer was pretty good. The only sour beer they had at the time was a Ros flavored one that unfortunately tasted a little too much like wine, but was still digestible. My hazy IPA was not hazy at all, but was still fine. I wish the beers were served a bit colder.   The fried chickpeas were a good deal for $3 we thought they could serve like 10 people. The 2 of us only made a dent in like 1/5 of the bowl. But hey, they're snacky so maybe someone could down the whole thing if they really wanted to!  The carnitas taco was really good. I highly recommend it. The al pastor was alright but didn't pack the flavor punch of the carnitas. I doused my tacos in the free salsa that was in a mini fridge nearby. The red salsa was so good and added a layer of light smokiness to my tacos. But then after a while I thought I sensed some heat? I assumed it was the green salsa so I continued to douse my tacos in the red. Idk it must have been the red salsa that was hot, because by the end of my meal I was feeling sick to my stomach. Never felt that way from spice but needless to say the beer didn't taste too good after that either. Luckily I recuperated by sipping 2 glasses of their Yeti water until I didn't want to vomit anymore.   I can't place my distaste after this meal on the restaurant since it was mostly my own doing . I assume they label their salsas and I just didn't see it.

reviews.author: Callie M.
reviews.description: Super cute spot to hang out with friends! They have a ton of outdoor seating and can accommodate large parties. We had about 20 people in our group and we were able to pull up tables and chairs for everyone.   The place is really well decorated so we were able to snap a few cute pictures!

reviews.author: Bo B.
reviews.description: This is a great spot for drinks and they also have non alcoholic drinks at night too like chai and matcha lattes. There's also plenty of seating.

reviews.author: Gennesis V.
reviews.description: the WORST customer service that I've in my life!!!!!! How is possible that I staff said ' shut your and finish your beer? I know it's was last called for getting last service, but please if you don't wanna have more clients PLEASE dont sell more drinks, really bad experience in this place.

reviews.author: Jason K.
reviews.description: My wife and I were in Austin for a long weekend and this could be the best tap room I have been to in a long time. Tons of outdoor seating and great free water. I got the 40 Days and 40 Nights and the Lil' Sebastion Bach Maibock and the Walking on Water.   I ordered 3 beers and they were spectacular and the service was splendid. I ordered an al pastor taco and the carne asada tacos. They were super flavorful and perfect, especially for a tap room.  I got a couple of stickers and the atmosphere was just fantastic. You should definitely try this place!

reviews.author: Shradha A.
reviews.description: A new favorite find! New Year's Eve could not be better remembered. Love the ambiance, including the music playlist. The patio is simply perfect. The beer variety has something for everyone and the tacos are a handy nibble option.

reviews.author: Karley M.
reviews.description: This brewery was walking distance from our air bnb when visiting Austin. It quickly became our favorite spot and we went back a couple times. Beer was delicious and staff was extremely friendly. They also offer other things besides beer. There's a lot of space here too. All around gem!

reviews.author: David M.
reviews.description: Hands down the best brewery experience we encountered in Austin. It's a little bit if everything and that's not at all a bad thing as without exception they are all done well. We saw they were open early so we went in on a weekday thinking we could knock this off our list of a full day planned. We weren't real clear on their hours entailed so there was a not so unwelcome idea of a little day / morning drinking to get the day started. We realized this was going to leave us with the opportunity to have a few small samples or perhaps one nice pour. Upon our arrival we were impressed at how the location spanned the corner of the street and had many "compartments" of seating areas. I'm no way were Amy of them on the smaller side. Street parking was easy enough and we headed on in.   Very impressed to be greeted with smiling faces along with plenty of good morning exchanges. We were very pleasantly surprised to see they offered an array of espresso drinks. What a welcome pivot to our plan. We ordered up and came to realize they had food as well. Pretty happy about that. There were the assorted pastry items and breakfast TACOS! I noticed there was also queso fondido on the menu and that was screaming please try me. I went to order and was told this item is generally served later in the day. I suspect my sadness to hear this news showed as there was a quick offer to fire up the required kitchen equipment to make this happen (the salamander for those curious).   The lattes were delicious. So much so we ordered up a second round. Near completion of those the awesome cheesy chorizo goodness arrived. Bubbly hot and looking superb. It was all I could do to keep myself from grabbing a chip and putting a scoop of this bubbling sub nuclear cheese in my mouth at the price of completely burning my entire mouth. With a little patience I snuck a few small bites being mindful to blow as to not scorch my mouth. OMG was this delicious in every aspect.   Right away we knew this was just fine with a latte but was screaming for a beer to accompany this perfect breakfast fast. Such an awesome selection of beers. The bartender was beyond sweet and gave us many short pull samples of the tappers. I landed on the one that worked for me. My wife found one that worked well for her. By the time the beers arrived it was clear this was not going to be a short stop. Instead it was clear this was our impromptu plan for the morning. Completely five star experience from the word go. So much so we took the liberty of an evening stop later that week. The vibe of this place was so cool with any hint of pretentiousness. I'm no expert on all the brew options in Austin but this was clearly number one for us based on all it included and the absolute outstanding hospitality from the coffee bar to the bartender to the cook who brought us the miraculously amazing queso. No matter you plans I would highly suggest  in fact nearly insist this is a stop not to be missed. This reviews has been locked in draft land fir a while but there is no doubt this place is still thriving and for all the right reasons.

reviews.author: KC C.
reviews.description: We must have visited on the wrong day.  There were just 7-8 beers on the menu and nothing really intrigued us.  I went with my favorite kind which is a stout on nitro.  I hate wasting beer but I drank just half.  Not only were the beers not flavorful but they were not cold.    I will say their tacos were really good, and the place is super huge.  For a Monday it was pretty packed at lunch, but still spacious enough to stay 6-feet away if desired.  It's not hard to find a seat bc the place is sooo big.    Wouldn't come back for the beer, but for the tacos?  Yaaassss!

reviews.author: Scott N.
reviews.description: Central District is a great place to grab a quick beer for happy hour or get some work done. They have a generous selection of local, craft beers, including some that they brew in house. If you like sours, you can get a flight and try all of them!   In addition to plenty of space for large groups or meetings, there are plenty of outlets around for getting some work done. The staff were friendly and extremely fast. Parking can be an issue in this area, but there are plenty of paid lots nearby, so it shouldnt be an issue.

reviews.author: Cheryl K.
reviews.description: Slightly off the beaten path, near the visitor's center.  Not a lot of signage, so a little hard to find. The beer menu wasn't extensive, and was heavy on the sours.  I like a good sour so I did the tasting flight.  Hubby had a Belgian Quad that was very good. The sours were quite tasty, my favorite was the Key Lime Pie Gose - all it was missing was a graham cracker crust! The staff was friendly and knowledgeable about the menu, so if you have questions they can point you the right direction. Inside there were plenty of tables and you could see the brewing room.  The day we were there they were not actively brewing.

reviews.author: Kristella P.
reviews.description: You can't go wrong with any beer here. This is one of the few places I got a flight and didn't not really like any of the beers.  My favorites were the Violet Crown Black Kettle Sour and Gold on the Ceiling IPA! Such quality craft beer

reviews.author: Mylesha D.
reviews.description: Getting there: Located in DT Austin, walking distance from the visitor center. Street parking is all around and there is a parking garage across the street at the hotel.  Experience: We came here to kill time before our flight, and I am sure glad we did. Their selection of beers were right up my alley. They had a variety of fruit flavored beers. The brewers were super friendly and inviting, I even let him choose my last flight choice. I loved the ambiance of the industrial rose gold with the green wall paint, and the live plant accents. It felt like a relaxing place to go work, study or just hang with friends.

reviews.author: Hani C.
reviews.description: Really enjoyed this spot. Didn't hurt that it was 2 minutes away from where we were staying and pretty much in the center of downtown.   Love any place that offers beer flights, as it's the best way to really know what you like and what your taste buds are in the mood for. I typically go for lagers or Belgian-style beers and personally loved the Lingering Sunshine and Wit-Tington.  The atmosphere is chill, laid-back, and the plants everywhere are totally my vibe. You can tell it's frequented by drinking tours as there was constantly small buses/vans waiting outside for parties drinking inside. Music also made for a nice ambiance and the girls who took care of our order upon arrival were very sweet and informative.

reviews.author: Desiree D.
reviews.description: What a hidden gem in this area of town.   Stopped in 2 times whole in town for the week.   I highly suggest coming here, their beer is great and layered with flavor. And yes they have flights.   Peep the plants hanging too!  Cute decor.  I came in February and they did not have an outdoor section. Not sure if they ever will.

reviews.author: KC C.
reviews.description: The hubby and I are from Cali, so we are spoiled with some pretty good breweries.  Came here on a Saturday for some afternoon beers.  Was so good we came back Monday to finish off the weekend.    There's a good variety of beers so we did eight tasters and ended up with three separate glasses.  They had a special when we were there called the Apple cinnamon sour; it tasted just like apple pie.  If they reproduce it, I highly recommend a glass.    The place itself is super posh, establishment clean, service was great and staff very friendly.  I would def recommend this brewery.  Oh, met Cooper...he's one of their brewers.  He's really nice.

reviews.author: Aleah H.
reviews.description: I stopped here on a whim while exploring Austin via Lime scooter, and it was a solid find! A no nonsense brewery where I genuinely enjoyed every beer I tried-- A gem!   We sat at one of the handful of the tables they have sprinkled in the sidewalk outside. The street was pretty low key for being to close to 6th, so it was enjoyable on the sidewalk! You still order at the bar which was no problem, and the service was quick and efficient!   Rhythm is a Dancer stole the show for me! It's a sour, but it is muted enough that I could drink multiple without my mouth being pursed from tartness! The Kolsch was great, as well. We also tried the soft pretzel which was SO airy which I loved. It also came with a garlic sauce so not your typical pub pretzel, but a very tasty take on one!  Employee's wore masks and maintained distancing, as well, which is great. We found this brewery on a list of spots still enforcing safety restrictions, and can confirm they were!

reviews.author: Kim L.
reviews.description: Cute afternoon day drinking spot that we found via Yelp. Bumped a star bc of their limited seating (one barrel table) outside, the main bartender was not very helpful and some of the drafts we wanted to try were out.   We sat outside and people watched and enjoyed our flights.  Really liked wit-tington ale, weiz of TX, short straw stout and violet crown. Bummed they were out of the Firenze estate.

reviews.author: Lynn D.
reviews.description: This was a really cute brewery with great service. They had some interesting beers and offered flights and snacks. Nice central location. Very clean and Covid compliant. I had a cherry lime made beer, a pretzel and a bbq beef empanada. Pretzel was a little over cooked but the empanada was delicious

reviews.author: Aaron F.
reviews.description: Absolutely wonderful stop off while walking downtown Austin. The staff was super friendly and welcoming. Tried a flight, Wit, Violent Crown, Texas Skies, Affogate. Went with the Wit. You will taste why it is a gold medal winner.

reviews.author: Chelsey S.
reviews.description: Love this small brewery in a great location downtown Austin. The space is bright, clean, and nicely decorated. My husband and I both had flights. The standout was the Wit-tington by far. The Strawberry Wayne was pretty unique and had a nice pink hue to it. The  staff was very friendly and gave great suggestions of which beers we should try. You can get a crowler of any beer, which was great for us to take home! Can't recommend CDB enough!  Really enjoyed the indie 2000s playlist as well!!!

reviews.author: Stephen S.
reviews.description: The 30+ times I've been to breweries I've discovered that they truly are the happiest places on Earth. Customer service and courtesy are typically top-notch because...well...it's a brewery.   First let me point out this rating is based more heavily on service than the wonderful beer they served( I'd give a solid "B" on that spectrum).  Walk in, bartender says "hi" and starts cleaning mugs. We look around trying to figure out when he'll actually approach us. Ok...oh look menus, guess I'll grab one. Standing there waiting for the "what can I get ya?" Or "first time? Here's our menu, let me know if you have any questions." Bartender jargon. Nothing. My wife says "yeah it's our first time here." "Oh, ok" responds bartender. Finally we decide on our own we'll do a flight and order a pretzel. I'm assuming they specialize in IPAs since they have 4! He takes the order.   I return a beer because a random fly fell in one. I tell the bartender I hate to waste good beer but can I get a new one, a fly fell in mine." No reaction, he just asks which beer and refills it.   Good craft beer, subpar service.

reviews.author: Tala B.
reviews.description: I wish we had a place like this near my home -- I would be here every weekend (once the pandemic is over, of course)!   My sister and I were visiting Austin, TX awhile ago and wanted to do an Escape Room -- There is one right next to this little brewery, so after we finished the Escape Room (we escaped, by the way!), we decided to enjoy some beer and celebrate.  This spot is in a less busy part of the city and there were not a lot of people inside, but I was in love with the interior decor and the ambience. Very calm, chill and relaxing. We enjoyed our beers too! Overall, I loved it and wish there was one near my house.

reviews.author: Ryan W.
reviews.description: This is a pretty good brewery. I mostly drink IPAs so I got both of them they both tasted very good and smooth not so hoppy/ dry but very tasty and enjoyable. The ambiance is nice and quite very retro with a "we work here" feel which is a good feeling. The bartender was very helpful and attentive. Overall loved the experience and worth the stop if your in the area.

reviews.author: Jodi H.
reviews.description: Came by with good company for some brews on a hot Sunday afternoon. The women-lead space and brewski selections are rockin', but they're missing a key component--wifi.  I know, I hate sounding like your typical phone-using human being, but every time I'm downtown wifi is super handy. It helps us decide where we want to go afterwards! Anyways, Central is set up like your typical clean and succulent-friendly microbrewery these days. They have board games and serve yourself water (sparkling OR still. THAT's a first!!). They don't have outdoor seating, but plenty of seats indoors. They also sell small bites and other drinks like wines and ciders. Their guest list is pretty solid with brews from Zilker and Independence to name a few other Austin loves. I got a taster of Central's own beers. We really did not enjoy the milkshake IPA that had a strong vanilla aftertaste. It was way too sweet, but to each their own.  Their restrooms are clean and they allow outside food too. SCORE! Now if only the owners would install some wifi...our taptender told us that the owners are still getting that set up. So that's a great sign! They also don't validate parking, so if you need to drive to get here...come on a Sunday when parking is free downtown. Pro. Tip.

reviews.author: Andy O.
reviews.description: The jalapeo bread is a must, an amazing brewery right in between 6th st and rainey st with a modern and hipster feel but good for the dad and for the mom looking for a break from The kids as well as the working adults needing a good brew, there's Baird games as well for some quick fun. Electric scooters all around so it's easy to keep bar hoping around. Great spot

reviews.author: Marc M.
reviews.description: Great little spot in downtown.  They really push the flights which is great because they have quite a number of solid brews.

reviews.author: Hilary E.
reviews.description: Came here on a Saturday night, and it was pretty empty actually. The guy who served our small group said they're more of a weeknight spot where people go after work. However, I liked that it was fairly empty. We could talk and hear each other, no line for more beer, the guy working was very nice, and it felt like we had the place to ourselves. I'd go back here in a minute, either earlier in the night before the rest of the evening plans or for a break inbetween places. The beer was good, and the place is very clean and pretty inside.

reviews.author: Mariah F.
reviews.description: Their beer is so good, light and refreshing. If you like sours, they got you covered, ipas? Sure they have that too. You can of course get a flight of beer to taste multiple flavors and I'd recommend doing that...then going back and buying a pint of what you loved the most.   The service was A-1. The woman at the front was very friendly and was open to answering my 500 questions about when they opened, if I can taste different beers, what're those people in the corner with the purple drink drink drinking? In addition to that I'm pretty sure the owners were also just hanging out in there and they were chatting with different guests which made it feel very homey and inviting  Price- on par with other breweries  Great location! Especially if you're just moseying around town ( like I was) and happen to stumble upon it.   The aesthetics are on point. Beautiful Edison bulbs and plan fixtures. Both benches and tables so you can come with a large group or chill on a date.

reviews.author: Eric G.
reviews.description: We went here a month or so ago in the evening. It has some indoor seating, and a loooooot of outdoor seating along with some very tasty food trucks! Perfect place to bring a group of friends, all get your own food, and then get some drinks at meanwhile brewing. You can order drinks both indoors and outdoors, so if you feel like just staying outdoors you can definitely do that! Drink options are super varied, so likely you will find something you like... Even if you're just sleepy and need coffee :) Definitely check it out if you're looking for an outdoor drink and food place to hang out with friends.. dog.. etc. It is kid friendly, too!

reviews.author: Emily E.
reviews.description: I've been hearing "You need to checkout Meanwhile Brewing sometime" ever since it opened, and I FINALLY got to check it out!  First off, the building is massive and almost looks like a Church...for beer (aka the best kind.)  When you enter, you are greeted by bright and welcoming decor, and plenty of plush, velvety booths as well as tables/chairs for additional seating in their "private event" space.  There tends to be 3-4 bartenders at all times which is great, because there really isn't a great space for lining up so patrons end up in cluster/blob.  (Not super important.)  Beer wise, there is an extensive menu with an adequate mixture of flavor profiles.  They have several non-alcoholic options include coffee and tea, as well as some mixed drinks and even a sake?!    Their Black Lager was a personal favorite - smooth and despite its dark color from malt, it wasn't overly malty.  All around great flavor and a tad too easy to drink (wink, wink)  Their Blueberry beer had a slight tartness and sweetness.  Very pleasant.   Their Hefe was slightly disappointing for my tastes - it just felt a little flat.   Regarding their outdoors space, wow.  We came during music performances in the evening, and they went all out!  I will note that it was incredibly loud and hard to hear, so if that's not the vibe you like, avoid their music sessions.  They have three food trucks on-site to help you stay awhile!  Plenty of picnic tables and loads of doggy friends to meet!  Overall, great experience and will definitely continue to make the trek out!

reviews.author: Eugenia L.
reviews.description: Meanwhile is a great place to meet up with friends who don't want to venture too far beyond city limits. Better yet its family friendly with a soccer field, playground set, and more open space for kids to round around.  The drink menu has a little bit of everything from coffee to cocktails and of course beer. If its a warm day I'm going with the Who Doesn't Like Pineapple because it's tart and refreshing. It'll give you summer beach vibes but without the annoying tourists and sunburn. Well maybe not the sunburn part since it's TX.  With several food trucks on site it tempts you to order something from each to share with the group. Just make sure to save room for dessert at Besame!

reviews.author: Allison G.
reviews.description: Such a fun brewery about 10 minutes from the airport! We had several beers and got food from the taco truck! I tried the Pub House Ale, the Pilsner, and the Marzen. They were all super delicious! They also allow you try samples at the bar. If you're not a beer drinker, they have cocktails, wine, and coffee to choose from. They have tons of food trucks outside that seem to rotate daily. There was a taco truck today we really enjoyed. There's tons of space indoor and outdoor for seating. It has a great vibe and is also dog friendly. Highly recommend, especially if you're waiting to check into your air bnb! Definitely check it out!

reviews.author: Amanda S.
reviews.description: I'm a thirty something with a toddler and this is my paradise! Meanwhile is practically in my backyard in Southeast Austin. I can choose from a variety of beers, cocktails, wine, Frose or coffee to sip on AND they have a selection of 4 food trucks to fill my belly. Wait for it though .... I can enjoy these things while my kid expends her energy in a safe, kid friendly environment! Wooohoo I'm here for it! This absolutely is my favorite spot in town right now. Our family can't get enough of it.   My favorite beers are the sours! They have pizza, BBQ, taco and ice cream food trucks, so everyone can surely find something they love with this variety. The open outdoor space is magnificent. On the weekends recently they even have some flea market vendors out which is fun. The best part though is the playground for my little one! Also the astroturf seating area with the little hill my kid loves to do rolls down! At this stage of my life I don't think it can get much better than Meanwhile. I love this place.

reviews.author: Carly C.
reviews.description: Meanwhile Brewing is massive. Meanwhile has the following food trailers: pizza, taco, barbeque, and ice cream. They have a great little stage for entertainment, a good variety of beers (as well as wine and cider), and it's extremely kid and dog friendly. There is street parking (there's a parking lot, too, but it's definitely small for how many people can fit in this establishment). We thought the bartenders were friendly and efficient.

reviews.author: Eric B.
reviews.description: Update:  Since management respinded to my review and mentioned an outdoor beer station being added, I'll up to 3 stars and try again after they do open the outdoor annex, at which point I'll update ratings again.  The beer and mixed drink choices were large btw.  :)  Cool venue, so I bumped Meanwhile Brewing from 1 to 2 stars.  MEANWHILE (so aptly named), below are pictures of 2 lines to get a beer.  Neither moves fast.  Really.  At a brewery?  Is this their 1st rodeo?   What's the point of having a venue if you have to wait in line 30 min or more for a beer?!?  I'm just gonna bring my wife her beer and she can hang with friends while I simply get in line again and try and tell myself not to be grumpy that my life here will be a circle of order a beer, drink it in line to get the next beer or perhaps letting an advance beer get warm so I can be out of line for a few minutes between trips.

reviews.author: Rachel G.
reviews.description: One of my favorite spots in Austin. I love the venue under the live oak trees, the open space, and the playground. No hard alcohol, but I feel they make up for it with their creative cocktails and house-made seltzers.   The food trucks give enough variety that there is something for everyone -- pizza, BBQ, Mexican, and the BEST ice cream! But the best part for me is sitting back in the Adirondack, cold drink in hand, watching my little one playing on the playground with a live band in the background.   I hope we continue to get more places like this in Austin!

reviews.author: Steve H.
reviews.description: Easily my favorite brewery in town.   The food trailers here are all bomb and on point. This is an awesome spot for lunch. You can get everything from world class tacos, great pizza to Texas Monthly Top 50 ranked BBQ.   The beer is absolutely amazing. The collabs with local breweries and bars such as Cosmic and St. Elmo are all cool and tasty -AF.   The to go beer options are always great. You can have a few pints and come home with some amazing beer to finish the night at home watching a movie with.   I've seen a few shows here. Saw Eternal Champion here and had a blast. The venue is great for live music, anytime they have a live show its worth the cover to hang out and see some live tunes and have some amazing beer.   The best thing about Meanwhile for me happens to be that its extremely family friendly. They have a playground a soccer court and large open field that is perfect for flying kites. They are all fenced in so its the perfect spot for me to bring my daughter to play. My family comes here regularly and we really enjoy the family friendly aspect Meanwhile offers.   I could go on and on about how much I love the beer and just this space in general. Its really do not miss Austin location now.   Thanks for offering so much good stuff Meanwhile you rock!  edit: I almost forgot to mention how awesome the coffee and breakfast tacos by Pueblo Viejo are here.

reviews.author: Krista H.
reviews.description: A hidden gem! Meanwhile is one of my favorite places in Austin! It is located in the middle of a business park, but once you get on the grounds you feel like you are truly transported. Not only do they have their brewery and taproom on site, they also have 4 food trucks! You can pair your beer with tacos, pizza, bbq, or amazing ice cream!  My personal favorite beers here are their sours. They keep their menu fresh and change it up frequently, so if you see something you might enjoy, go quickly! The best part about their location is the open space and seating area. There are so many tables and benches throughout the back and they even have a stage with live music on certain days. The environment is so fun and you will see lots of dogs and children around too. I appreciate that they have a playground for kids.   If you are not a beer drinker, they also serve cocktails made with seltzers and amazing coffee drinks! I love their vanilla latte and will opt to get that most of the times I go there!  Overall, there is something for everyone here! Between the drink selections, food options, seating area, and live music, everyone in your group will have fun! I will always recommend Meanwhile!

reviews.author: Tim R.
reviews.description: Excelllent place. Good beer great venue food trucks on property. All you need in one location.

reviews.author: Clem F.
reviews.description: They have beer. The staff serves the beer. They seem happy to work here. Like the management have not sucked the life out of them by over working them and prohibiting them from taking time off. It's nice to see people with life and a sparkle in their eyes. I wish I still saw that when I looked in the mirror. Oh, did I mention that they serve beer?

reviews.author: Gwendolyn B.
reviews.description: Came during icemegeddon 2021 and had to come back and try it out again.  Beautiful location and amazing beers!  A must visit!

reviews.author: Robert H.
reviews.description: Here's a secret, a lot of folks who go to these breweries don't go because of how good the IPA or the cider is, they have a long list of other factors.   We had an IPA and a cider, they were good, not life-changing, but decent. I have yet to sample the entire beer selection but I will. And you know why? Because of everything else the place offers ensures I'll be back.  The tacos from the taco truck were really impressive, exceeded expectations actually. The pizza was equally excellent.   The set up for the grounds was spot on. The trees, the playground, the environment with families, dog owners, young people, it all meshed well because everyone had a section that fit their methods of socializing.  You can't tell me this isn't a science because significant thought (and money, I'm sure) went into developing this experience. Bravo!  Now I need to drink some more of their beers.

reviews.author: Calily B.
reviews.description: This is probably one of the best breweries that opened in ATX in 2020 - during a pandemic at that! Since their opening, they've been doing gangbusters business with no signs of slowing.  Obviously, when you visit, you'll notice they have a huge space and $$ was spent to fully build it out. It's not a small brewery that grew up, it was built to be big. There is plenty of seating inside and even more seating outside on the turf + mulch area. But, be forewarned this place is busy. Saturday afternoons are packed with people with pets and families. There is a playscape so parents like this place.   Now, to their beer. Meanwhile brews consistent and good beer. They have a variety of beers from regular German Pils to New England IPAs. Nothing infected and nothing with off flavors. They always seem to have a good rotation of beers.   Don't like beer? They also have wine, cocktails and coffee! Something for everyone.   While they don't serve food, there are numerous food trucks to order from.   Even though the lines can get long, they do move pretty quickly (especially the line that is at the main entrance).   We would come here more often if it were closer to us, but getting across the river is the hardest part. :)

reviews.author: Katie N.
reviews.description: Amazing place! Love that it's in the warehouse district, so it's off the beaten path. A TON of shaded seating and room to spread out. There was a kid's bday party there and we didn't notice (yay for our dog). There was plenty of water to help yourself to as well as a nice list of beers. They were all incredible (even the German ones)! They also have some cocktails, frozs and coffee available. We got an iced dirty chai on our way out, since their coffee looked and smelled good. WOW! Nice and strong! I am very picky about coffee being too weak and having to add extra shots of espresso, but this was on point!  We will definitely be back! Great, friendly staff, and we especially loved that we could order beer starting at 10a on Sunday! In early and out early!

reviews.author: Rachel F.
reviews.description: A MUST go to in Austin!!! Highly, highly recommend. 100/10, great beer, tasty cocktails, delicious frozen ros and a killer hard kombucha  This is place also has amazing food trucks too (dough boys- out of this world garlic knots with a lemon ricotta dip*drooling) and a beautiful outdoor area for adults and children (there's a playground!). Adults can have a beverage and lounge while their kids get their energy out. Very fun spot!!

reviews.author: Arlene T.
reviews.description: Third time here.... 5 stars for the outdoor area ... super cool and big play area for kids off to the side which is great so that other people who either want to get away from kids or are not particularly into kids running all over the place around them while enjoying beers won't be annoyed by them. #notthattheresanythingwrongwithkids  1 star to the beer servers.... attitude like snobby coffee barristers! I'm always mystified by ANY questionable servers ... don't they know that if they'd give better service, they'd get better tips?!?!!   3 stars to the beer

reviews.author: Tom T.
reviews.description: Meanwhile Brewing has a large complex. Plenty of seating. It is kid and pet friendly. Their selection of beers is very good. We enjoyed the beers we had. They have an area setup for food trucks. This was a well thought out venue. If you get a chance, I highly recommend trying Meanwhile Brewing Co.

reviews.author: Lucas E.
reviews.description: A very Austin brewery, but I mean that in a good way. A lot of thought was put into design, decor and layout - and it shows. Very chic, but also comfortable . Gorgeous outdoor spaces, this is a great place to hit when we get good weather in central Texas. REALLY good beer, tons of styles - but all really well made. Any beer drinker will love a visit here. A variety of food trucks at peak times makes for a versatile dining experience for your group. Very family friendly with a nice play area for kids. Just a great spot. Drink local!

reviews.author: Alex R.
reviews.description: Easily missed if you're only looking on the main drag but this brewery is just off S Lamar on Oltorf. The beers are excellent of course but don't skip the food. Their pizza is the highlight to me. I would suggest getting slices because they are reasonably priced and it gives you the opportunity to try different options out. They have a wagu beef slice which is unique and delicious. My personal favorite is their Calabrese which I would describe as an elevated pepperoni pizza.  This is a great place to go if you don't have a reservation on a busy night because they have a ton of seating and parking.   Also check the schedule because they have live bands playing in the main dining hall.

reviews.author: Roland D.
reviews.description: TLDR: above average beer and a really nice atmosphere  came here for a flight and a little snack after work last Friday. First off, I really liked the atmosphere. there is a bunch of outdoor seating, which is always a plus.  For drinks I got a flight, so I got a variety of beers. Overall, they were pretty good, however, they don't have a lot of variety in the styles available. I also got a slice of pizza, which was much better than I expected for brewery food. All said and done, it's definitely a spot worth visiting, but isn't the best that Austin has to offer.

reviews.author: Justin N.
reviews.description: This is a Highly Recommend kinda place.   Staff - super friendly and knowledgeable about the drinks and food products.   Environment - lots of seating indoors and out. You can spread out and work. You can dine in and chill. Go alone or with a party and still feel like you have the place to yourself.   Food/drinks - i have yet to have a bad food item from these guys. Everything is delicious and surprisingly thought out. It will take you by surprise. And the drinks. There are plenty of options to taste and enjoy based on your preferences.   $$$ - it is a little pricier then you might expect. But truthfully, for what you get, I will continue to come back here and spend the money.    Give it a shot. I do not think you will regret it. I would recommend this place over Pint House pizza or even Dominoes ;).

reviews.author: Lee D.
reviews.description: 10-24-21  As you can probably figure out, I like beer.  This is my drink of choice. And visiting breweries just takes the experience to the next level.  Quality/Quantity - Beer was mediocre. My family did not like the menu here, so I was pressured to quickly finish my beer and sadly leave.  It should be illegal to only drink one beer...  We hit Trader Joes on the way back and realized they carried the whole line of their beer, so as you can guess, I got two more six packs:)  Now, I am happier.  Atmosphere - You need a much bigger parking lot, especially since almost everyone drives a huge truck. We got lucky with a space, but had to share some of the space with the huge truck to the right and the huge truck to the left, LOL. Teri Joyce and the Tagalongs were playing tonight. They did a good job, the place was hoping. Both the inside and outside spaces are large; however, again too large for their parking lot. Can some people carpool? They also had a small outdoor stand to order beer and food. Additionally, there were plenty of seats at the bar. The team seems to be working pretty hard.  Service -The bartender was just okay. Not much to write about, I ordered, he gave me the beer, and I left; still left a tip though :)  Price -$6.50 + $1 tip  Owner Suggestion - Did I say you need a bigger parking lot? Wish I had more time to enjoy your place, but no fault of yours. Hopefully next time. Keep up the good work.

reviews.author: Jenn R.
reviews.description: We usually love ABGB, good food, good atmosphere, good service. It's a nice afternoon and we decided to come over for lunch and sit outside with our dog. Food was great as usual and initial service was awesome.   When we'd arrived, someone else was there with a big dog. Saw this person leave the dog unattended for a few moments and let it walk around off leash. This person leaves and everyone sitting outside can hear the staff saying someone let their dog poop by the tables, left it, and how gross that is. We agree, that's completely rude.   After a few minutes two staff come over to our table and loudly say something to the effect of  "hey, you let your dog sh*t over here." We politely explain it was not our dog, perhaps it was the person here before us. Sounds like they knew that person because they walk off saying  "x would never do that".
