I get it, super uncool to clean up after someone else's dog, but also uncool to blame us for it. We arrived, walked right by the same staff and directly to a table (no bathroom breaks). Created an uncomfortable situation which prevented us from staying longer and ordering more.

reviews.author: Shelby L.
reviews.description: Absolutely love this place! Great beer selection and delicious pizza! Outdoor area is super big and has a very chill vibe.

reviews.author: Jane O.
reviews.description: I love the large comfortable space and the superior music. The beer is good and the food is acceptable. I've been here several times and always felt safe and was able to find a parking space. This is a great place for groups, couples, singles.

reviews.author: Sj G.
reviews.description: It looks like a really nice beer garden.  The weather looked like rain so we sat inside.  They do have restrooms and they are clean.  Food is hard to decide if you are lactose intolerant.  We found a Pulled Pork and it came with a pint of beer. We also got two pizzas for the rest to share.  We had the wagyu and 2 choice of the specialty pizza cauliflower. That was a good choice.  I don't care for beer so I had a cider.   They were out of watermelon So I had cranberry.  Very tart but refreshing.  The bar tenders were all so friendly and nice.  I didn't see anywhere to get beer flights and my son had his bday.  Nothing special like a drink or come out to table.   It's a nice atmosphere with nice folks.

reviews.author: Alex M.
reviews.description: Great outdoor place with plenty of seating for medium size parties. The indoor aesthetic reminds me of a disco roller rink, super groovy.   The food alone is worth coming for, it's upscale apps that are absolutely delicious and they also have pizza.  The con (and why I'm only giving 4 stars) is that this is a beer garden that has ONLY SIX beers available - all brewed in house. I wish they at least had some local options that made the beer list a bit longer, after all it is a beer garden. They also have a small list of ciders and wine available. The "Industry" Pilsner was great and a nice light beer but

reviews.author: Jessica P.
reviews.description: We got a specialty pizza we jalapeos, ricotta and strawberries and really weren't sure what we were getting into, but good god it was delicious. Good food. Good booze. Good atmosphere. Loved it.

reviews.author: Diana C.
reviews.description: This please was a gem to find on my recent trip. The ambience is great both indoors and outdoors. Happy hour is great as well. Slice of pizza and a pint for $8

reviews.author: Clara C.
reviews.description: *COVID Update*   ABGB is a must visit when in Austin. Parking in their lot is ample. Restrooms are on-site in the corner. Seating is self-served both indoors and outdoors, and there is free WiFi! Masks aren't required here, and most people don't wear them inside or outside. The menu is on a QR code, which is posted on each table. The water station is in the back.   I got the beer flight $15 as it was my first visit. The pilsner is definitely my favorite; it's a popular one! It's odd that there's only 6 choices, but it helps especially for those who are indecisive. If you order one beer, it's about $6. When I visited on a Sunday afternoon, they had live music and many couples were dancing along. I totally missed the memo to bring my boots and hat.   I tried the Calabrese and homemade sausage pizza ($3.50 per slice). Both were delicious.   Obviously with the live music, it's loud inside, but it's a fun place to hang out with larger groups.

reviews.author: Melinda N.
reviews.description: Very relaxing place. Smaller than brewtorium but at least you can hear each other. There was no music when I went on a Thursday after work. I did a flight to sample their good stuff. It's 5 five ounce pours so it's filling! The bruschetta was good but needed more salt or balsamic dressing. It was still tasty. But the stuffed peppadews were really good. I'll need to come back to try their pizza. There's indoor and outdoor seating. Staff know their stuff. Parking seems to fill up fast. Right off of south Lamar

reviews.author: Sierra R.
reviews.description: I thought ABGB was a good time! I enjoyed the live music on the night we visited, which happened to be their 8-year anniversary. I had the Day Trip pale ale, and I thought it was pretty delicious. The salad I ordered was also yummy; I especially liked the golden beets. But the star of the show was the pretzel with pimento cheese for SURE.

reviews.author: Shannon L.
reviews.description: Really like this gem of a place. Food was delicious with plenty of outside seating.  They now have ordering outside which is a real win and helps with the lines! Live music is another perk of this spot.  It gets crowded i. the evenings so ride share is a smart way to go.

reviews.author: Josh H.
reviews.description: I have to ability to work from anywhere, which let's me drop on on places randomly. It's nice because I can keep a running list of spots to check out when I find myself nearby and I don't need t hop on a zoom meeting with a client. ABGB is one of those spots. I stopped in here for a quick beer during covid and it was pretty solid, this is my first time back.   The wifi is good, clearly. I'm writing this review and it hasn't faltered at all. The beer selection is small, but what I've tasted has all been solid. Both in flavor and body, they are true to what they are brewing. Quiet and mellow atmosphere is lovely is for getting some work done and maintaining a medium focus. The garlic fries smell delicious.   The only downside is that I'm getting a little bug action. But I'm also sitting under a tree, in Texas, in June.     I'll be back and probably to eat.

reviews.author: Dayna M.
reviews.description: We love ABGB.  The pizzas are delicious.  The salad is amazing.  The beer is cold.  Parking is always perfect.  The wait is always minimal.  The staff are super nice and helpful.  The taste of the pizza is ON POINT!  We always have a great time here.  When you first walk in, the smell of the pizza is out of this world.  it's a great place to take friends from out of town.

reviews.author: Taylor T.
reviews.description: Great space, pizza, beer, and music. Lots of parking too. Good for large groups and an easy going night with friends.

reviews.author: Kelsey M.
reviews.description: Great place to take the dogs and have a pint! The beer is great and the pizza is equally as good! Friendly staff

reviews.author: Eric R.
reviews.description: Such a great piece of the South Austin community. The food is better than it has to be. The employees at all levels are outstanding. Everyone is helpful and friendly regardless of how busy they are.   Food and service aside, this is just a great place to spend time with the people you love/like. Every time I've been here has been memorable.  Showed up on a Saturday afternoon with a party of 25+ and we immediately found a group of picnic tables and spent the next several hours just enjoying each other's company.   Everyone enjoyed their food and drink but what we'll remember and what I'm most grateful for is the ambiance and hospitality at ABGB.   There's plenty of places to go eat, but when you have a large party and want to make memories with an Austin feel, look no further.

name: Central Machine Works Brewery and Beer Hall

reviews.author: Christina F.
reviews.description: Super cute - chill vibes, plenty of tables (inside and out), and good drink choices. The bartenders were kind and helpful and willing to answer questions.   Drinks were about ~$11

reviews.author: Charlie S.
reviews.description: Very cool build out. Huge inside. Huge outside. The mosaic IPA was very tasty. Parking is not good. The streets are full as well, so get there early. The pizza was so so. Crust was fine, but it was too salty. Yep, pizza is salty, but this pizza was too salty.  They gave our salad away. It was not there with our pizza. Someone else thought they had ordered a salad, but hadn't, and they have our to them.(they admitted this) ??! Really? So we get to wait, while the pizza gets cold.  They are still working kinks out to handle the crowds. They take food orders at the satellite bars, but don't have menus there. So the bartender explains the menu instead of pouring and collecting on the check. A second person there would be helpful.  The salad? Kale salad, and it was delicious. Bits of ginger in it. Yummy.  We probably won't go back. If a kale salad is the only thing to pull you in, there are other places that better deserve your patronage.

reviews.author: Haley Z.
reviews.description: Great place to meet friends and groups of people out in nice weather. Awesome ambiance and large space inside and out. Beautiful artwork inside and outside showcasing local artists. This place is very well upkept and always clean.   This place is busy A LOT. Expect major lines to get drinks on the weekend. The inside is a bit loud and stuffy during busy nights even with the large doors open. We love sitting at the picnic tables outside. Majorly dog friendly and kid friendly. If you don't enjoy beer they also have cocktails.  We seem to always miss the live music, but they have a large stage where you can see well anywhere you sit. Parking lot in back gets filled pretty fast, but it's easy to find spots on the street nearby.   They could use more draft options and I have not tried the food yet, but this breathtaking place is definitely worth a stop!

reviews.author: Jay L.
reviews.description: On a saturday (and maybe every other day too!) this is a great spot to meet friends, eat some food, lidten to live dj and later a band. Food was good. Probably 4 star but the ambience raises it to 5 stars overall. Caesar is basic (good dressing). D3viled eggs are good. Hummus was the weakest, kind of lumpy and not a ton of flavor but vegetables very fresh and chilled and pita very nice and warm. Pizza very good. Didnt have any beer which i'm sure are good.

reviews.author: Chilly P.
reviews.description: i've been wanting to visit central machine works for sooo long. i went the first time and they were closed for a private event. i finally got to visit last night and had a great time. the space is gorgeous. love the art and plants. bartenders are nice.  my only critique is that it's quite expensive. my partner + i got 4 mixed drinks and two burgers... the bill was about $100 (including tip). other than that, i would def go back with a group of friends, lots of space to spread.

reviews.author: Chelsea M.
reviews.description: My husband and I love central machine works - have friends in town? Need some where dog friendly? Family friendly? This is the spot. From day drinking and listening to live music or cocktails and dinner, we love that there's always plenty of space, good drinks and great food. Would recommend their pizzas and we recently tried their cheeseburger.

reviews.author: Marcus R.
reviews.description: First off this place puts on the WOW factor soon as you walk in. The outside seating is what you will see as you walk into the facility. Ample room both outside and inside to sit with your friends or family members. Either way as you walk in, you want to go to the left of the building towards the Tap Room. Yes, it's labeled on their wall.  The Tap room is where you will order your beer, food, and start your tab. Once you order your food you can pick where ever you choose to sit. They do give you an LED lighted pager. So once they page your, there is a particular location where you go pick up your food. It won't be in the tap room. LOL  Their large pizza holds 8 slices. Feeds two to four people depending on your tape worm's needs. Their pizza is phenomenal!!!   They have a great home brew selection on tap and if you are not a beer drinker, they have a great hard liquor selection.  Parking is a dirt parking lot (so if it rains expect mud) and could potentially get limited when this place is busy.  Again ample seating so it's a great place for large groups.

reviews.author: Clint S.
reviews.description: We headed straight to the bar, AKA The Tap Room, to place our order.  I nicknamed our barman Big Daddy J, and we were off to a great start.  We ordered the grilled broccolini which was out of the world along with a pepperoni, sausage and mushroom pizza. The sausage was clearly made in house and delicious, and the sliced mushrooms were fresh.  The place is expansive without being overwhelming, and there were several parties being held. Overall, we had an absolutely wonderful time.

reviews.author: Kolby G.
reviews.description: Absolutely love this place, I've been here several times. The people watching is fantastic. There are sooo many cute pups to pet and play with! Staff is incredible, and awesome!  Snacks and Sides:  Deviled Eggs - 4/5 Roasted Broccolini - 4/5  Pizzas:  The Machinist - 4/5 The Fulcrum - 4/5  Mains:  Rachel Sandwich - 5/5  Super cool spot. The staff is phenomenal, they mixed up an amazing mocktail on the fly for me. Was really, really delicious. Pizzas are tasty, but the sandwiches are where it's at! Great spot for a chill day or fun with friends.

reviews.author: Edwyn A.
reviews.description: Great beer hall to spend a weekend afternoon. This space is spacious with lots of indoor and outdoor seating. They also have a variety of cocktails too which is great if you want something a little more lively. They also have good food. We got the pizza with three toppings. The crust was just right and the toppings were good quality. As for greens, we had the broccolini as well which had a kick of spice and umami. There were some items not available. The lines move fairly quickly too but I never felt rush. They also have a gallery featuring art works and a stage out back with live entertainment on weekends. Parking is out back so don't get too discouraged if Waze takes you to the front - you will have to go a street over to find the entrance to the lot.

reviews.author: Nadine L.
reviews.description: Really great vibe. Especially for fall evenings in Austin, sometimes there is a band playing.  Their white pizza that is artichoke and spinach is delicious. They also have cocktails, not just beer, which is nice if you aren't a beer lover.  The blueberry smash is too sweet for me but my friends loved it.  The bratwurst is good too.  I wanted to try their creamsicle pop but it was sold out.  Parking lot tends to be full so you may have to find street parking.

reviews.author: Lazar V.
reviews.description: Family and pet friendly brewery with awesome beer, cocktails and food.   Stopped in on a Thursday evening for a work event and was impressed with the amount of people here.   Walked up to the bar and was impressed with the liquor selection and beer choices. This being a brewery I was pleased to see a cocktail option. The pizza is super good here too. Definitely grab a pizza when you're here.   The only negative thing is the parking situation. Parking goes very, very quick. If the parking lot was larger this would be an easy 5/5. There is limited parking out front, around back and across the street but a majority of parking is a brisk walk away.

reviews.author: Amy G.
reviews.description: First of all, the general experience was underwhelming. The only thing this place has going for it is its size and flexibility. It's an easy spot for big groups. I wasn't too impressed with the food, either with the variety of things on the menu, or the flavor of the food itself. The best thing I got was a kids' hot dog, which was an all-beef hot dog on a decent bun, exactly what I was craving, and very difficult to mess up. The pretzel and German potato salad were just ok. The beer cheese dip for the pretzel had a funny after-taste. My friend wasn't too impressed with her drink. We thought it was weird that they have a "Rachel" sandwich that's really a Reuben. Rachels are usually a spin on a Reuben, either made with turkey, or cole slaw, or something other than corned beef and sauerkraut that's on a usual Reuben. Anyways, they didn't get my order quite right, but corrected it. (I asked to add cheese on top of the hot dog, and at first it came out naked.) Missing a special request isn't too unusual, and they corrected it right away, so it wasn't a major deal.  But things got weird with some friends' orders. We were part of a large group. Two people were wearing political shirts. It was at the very least a strange coincidence that both their orders were not fulfilled. They waited and waited for their food and it never came. Others who ordered after them got their food sooner. There's no proof they were singled out for their shirts, but it sure looks suspicious... The staff said they'd correct it, but they were still slow to do so.

reviews.author: Shelby W.
reviews.description: Since my previous post, I've come back and still love it! The fire pits outside are a nice touch on the chilly winter days. I ordered food as well and got the Rachel Sandwich and a friend got the burger. She loved her burger and I absolutely loved my sandwich! The meet was amazing, and the bread was perfectly toasted. They had a slaw as well that was so unique, I would absolutely order again. We also all split the pretzel which was decent, but would probably recommend a sandwich or pizza over the pretzel.

reviews.author: Christine L.
reviews.description: So prior WW2 factory and now outdoor brewpub that is pup friendly??? We sat yay to this and I saw many fur babies enjoying the ample outdoor space.  Peeps hanging out and dome brought board games. Inside there are hanging plant baskets and outside butterfly plants and giant sunflowers! Lotsa space and social distance is possible. Big parking lot.  Highly recommended but don't forget the bug spray!!

reviews.author: Bo B.
reviews.description: Loved the pizzas here! Definitely the best in Austin that I've tried thus far. The crust is even nice and crispy on the outside but soft on the inside.

reviews.author: Christina H.
reviews.description: I'm a fan of Central Machine's location and concept, but was disappointed by the offerings. We ordered the Pale Ale, Mosaic IPA, Warm German Potato Salad, and a Margherita Pizza.  Let's start with the vibes: pup friendly (even "indoors"), food offered, fans blowing, plenty of seats inside and out and cozy Austin decor that makes you feel welcomed.   The Pale Ale and the Mosaic IPA both tasted similar, both were quite sour, more like a cider in my opinion.   The Warm German Potato Salad tasted like mashed potatoes mixed with a tinge of vinegar. The Margherita, lots of sauce, not enough toppings.

reviews.author: Kristi M.
reviews.description: I've been here a few times with friends and every time I am blown away. The food is terrific, the vibes are immaculate, and the drinks HIT! All of the pizzas are *chefs kiss*. The frozen espresso martini are hands down my fave bev on the menu. The customer service is next level. I had a friend visiting from out of town so we asked what time the fire pits come on and they immediately jumped to light them up for us. 14/10 suggest this spot!

reviews.author: Ms. Chew B.
reviews.description: They got rid of the white pizza! The new offering lacks all the things that made the former one good are missing (garlic forward + artichokes + spinach  = delicious -- replaced by "The Fulcrum" = weird pickled peppers, sun-dried tomato "pesto" that is not even remotely pesto, and rather flavorless except for the pickled peppers. Pass.   You know when someone comes from out of town and you talk a place up and then go there... and the thing you'd just recommended is a weak/borderline gross version of what you'd just talked up? And then you feel strangely responsible? :(   Bring back that white pizza, please!

reviews.author: Lauren K.
reviews.description: I stumbled in here on a rainy Friday night and boy was I glad I did! This converted warehouse space is gorgeous complete with cafeteria style tables and leather couches. The outside garden has a stage, fire pits and busy tables filled with students, Texans and tourists. It's all cropped by the traditional TX sting lights above your head.    There was a DJ spinning 45s inside that could be heard both in and outdoors. It was a sound garden of absurdity that wafted through the air. Think, Rosemary Clooney but knocks offs of what he could find at Goodwill of her. (ATX, don't ever change!)  The bar is in the back and after getting the lay of the land, I stepped up to the bar in the back and asked for a recommendation. The bartender asked what I liked and promptly brought me a dark porter in a plastic cup. It was delicious! It was the perfect way to end the night.  Hours and location information can be found on their website. Now scoot along, lil' doggie! This festival of fun is waiting for you.

reviews.author: Adam T.
reviews.description: This might be my favorite spot in Austin right now and it is still pretty chill/not well known so I hate that I'm writing a good review.   Some of the best beer out there I think and they've got awesome food to go with it. Burgers are really good along with all of their bar type things.  Pretty good happy hour specials during the week.   Good amount of space inside and out with a ton of parking and it is right next to Better Half so easy to hit both places without having to go anywhere.

reviews.author: Jackie K.
reviews.description: Hold Out Brewing is a good spot for bar food and drinks.  I was lucky and somehow got in line to order at the counter before the line got too long, and the food/drinks came out quickly after that.  It's above-average bar food, with nice and crispy curly fries and in-house baked chocolate chip cookies, which were nice surprises.  The one tip I'd make about Hold Out Brewing is to Uber there.  We drove, and the parking was somewhat terrifying.  There's actually a good-sized lot out back, but it gets really busy during happy hour.

reviews.author: Robert H.
reviews.description: In this town, if feels like there's a brewery popping in every corner. I'm not complaining, simply making an observation. But what this means though is that you have to do something to stand out. You can't just brew your own beer and sell it in the warehouse, those days are gone.  Hold Out has a unique and very advantageous situation. They're next to Better Half (I think they're the same owner or partners?) and make great use of the property together as well as the opportunity to collaborate.  Additionally, Hold Out has their own food. While their menu isn't as complete as Better Half's, it's pretty decent for a "happy hour at the brewery" trip.  But you can't asses them without considering the Better Half contribution, which I've reviewed separately and loved.  The beer is good, although it lacked range in variety as there wasn't much darker beer. A lot of IPA selections, which I'm sure the market loves...but I don't.   I stuck to the lager and a couple other beers, all with weird names but I guess that's the game these days.   I had the vegan frito pie which was way more delicious than expected and had an interesting mix of flavors.   Of course, it all tied in well because we had dinner from Better Half and I don't need to tell you how good that was. You gotta try the grilled halloumi, trust me.  All in all, good vibe, great property.

reviews.author: Amanda S.
reviews.description: Loved this place! All of the beers we tried were great. Not necessarily knock your socks off beer but definitely quality, good beer. I like that then allow smaller pours such as 8oz and 10oz. The staff was super friendly and easy to talk to and ask questions. Boyfriend and I both ordered the Hold Out Classic burger and it was just that - a classic burger with smash style patties. Super tasty. I ordered the comeback sauce on the side which helped make the burger not so messy. The curly fries were good too although I felt they were a little over cooked (but my boyfriend liked them crispy). If we lived in Austin, we would definitely be returning to Hold Out! Oh and also great seating options from indoor, outdoor with a covered patio and then non-covered outdoor seating.

reviews.author: Teresa L.
reviews.description: Hopping brewery in downtown Austin. Great selection of beer. Didn't eat but the food looked good. Definitely recommend to  your must visit brewery list.

reviews.author: Diana S.
reviews.description: We've been waiting for over an hour and still have no food. Please give me my food I am hangry. I got charged $2 for an avocado.  Update: food tastes good and is aesthetically pleasing. Not worth wait. Adding back 1 star

reviews.author: Cameron N.
reviews.description: Major vibes! There's tons of parking and lots of space to hang out. The food complements the drinks perfectly

reviews.author: Kaitlin O.
reviews.description: I had about 8 people in my group for Sunday brunch. Was told the food wait time would be less than an hour. It took 2 hours for everyone to get food even though we all ordered right after each other. Food tasted good but definitely not worth both the price and the wait!

reviews.author: Susana P.
reviews.description: Good food, beer, and great location downtown. Also has huge parking lot out back. Recommend and would come back again!

reviews.author: Jevin H.
reviews.description: I was holding out on writing this review, but after seeing my friends rate it two stars, I had to go ham. My group was around 8 people. We ordered one dish per person. The food arrived an hour and a half later. I am confused how it could've taken so long for food to arrive. To make matters worse, the waiter said "sorry for the hold out" and laughed when he gave us our food. I held out on my laughter for that one. It should not take that long for pancakes or burgers to be prepared. No clue what was going on behind in the kitchen but the chef definitely holding out on cooking or something. Hopefully this was a one off experience, but I'm not holding out faith for this place.

reviews.author: Carly C.
reviews.description: Still relatively undiscovered. Great beer selection, friendly staff, and all around good feel to the place. I will return for one of those delicious looking burgers

reviews.author: Bernie W.
reviews.description: Wow, I would say this was our favorite place on our recent trip to Austin, tucked away on a side street off of West 6th it is a true hidden gem although no hidden handshake was needed to enter the converted spacious quonset hut.  Out side under cover were rows of picnic tables, beer was served inside and the food was brought out.  While the beers were outstanding, the food was unexpected, beyond the burgers which we did not try, they had a few interesting dishes such as a Crispy Artichoke  and Pimento and a Indian chickpea inspired take on the chili Frito pie, both were excellent and we are not vegetarians, we just wanted to try something new.  The smoky Rauchbier styled Marzen (?) was unusual and worth a taste but a pint was a little over the top.  Note for those who commented on slow service we were there on a Wednesday and there were no issues, I am sure a nice weekend might be another experience.

reviews.author: Sophia C.
reviews.description: Yummy food paired with good drinks, Hold Out is the perfect spot for a late night hangout with friends. They have a spacious outdoor patio that's great for dogs, and a convenient parking lot right across.   I ordered the fish sandwich and a strawberry sangria, and both were a hit! The sandwich came with delicious fried fish and various sauces (with a bit of spice) in between amazing thick toasted slices of bread. The sangria was refreshing and sweet, great for those who like fruity beverages!

reviews.author: Mindy H.
reviews.description: A modern hip Austin beer scene vibe with a full menu and brews. The beers here were pretty good. They have a spacious covered dog friendly patio. A great food menu that includes brunch. The curly fries were delicious. You can even order food next door at their sister better half cafe and get it delivered to you here. Their restrooms were brilliant. Best signage of this time!

reviews.author: Kristine C.
reviews.description: Has a couple of vegan options including the overnight oats and sweet potato hash without the sauce and eggs. We waited over 2 hours for our food to come out, portion size was pretty small and it was pretty average tasting. I got the sweet potato hash made vegan and it tasted okay but definitely not worth the wait/price!!!

reviews.author: Evan L.
reviews.description: It took 2 hours for all of us to get our food. The price was okay for the location + what I got, but personally I wasn't a huge fan of the cocoa crumble with the pancakes. Would maybe come here again and try something else if I heard the wait was less than 30 minutes

reviews.author: Christina H.
reviews.description: Beer, wings, and curly fries: the essentials to the ultimate chill weekend. I would suggest ordering your own wings, do not share. I am a huge fan of IPA's. Hold Out Brewing's IPA selection did not disappoint.    TIP: Hold Out shares their private lot with Better Half, it's much easier to snag a table here versus Better Half.

reviews.author: Jay L.
reviews.description: The food is always superior here. Always exceeds expectations for presentation, freshness, and flavor. The kitchen sink salad for $6 is fantastic. Vegetables are fresh and crunchy, the beets are chilled, the nuts crunchy, the small pear shaped tomatoes are excellent and the dressing is outstanding.  1/2 for $6 is incredible value. The burgers are great and the crispy chicken sandwich (during the week ar lunch) is one of the best in Austin and for the price is perhaps best value too. Have had some ciders that seemed very vinegary and perhaps not right but food is always great.

reviews.author: Sierra J.
reviews.description: Hold out is a fairly new spot in Austin and is next to better half so we had to check it out! They have mostly Hazy juicy IPA's, so if you love those this is the place for you! My husband is one of those people and had a great time. I love sours and got the "syke!" And I thought it was great. They have food as well which we didn't get to check out but it looked awesome! I grab a cute cropped tank before we left. Hold out has a covered patio with a good amount of seating and seating inside. Our favorite part by far was the bartender that helped us. We didn't get his name but he has red hair and a mustache to match. He gave us some awesome recommendations to check out in Austin. Go for the beer stay for the hospitality!

reviews.author: Nan T.
reviews.description: Good place if you're looking for a lively spot to take friends or out of towners into the heart of Austin. Good drink prices and a good selection of beers, but I didn't find the two beers I tried to be anything special. They have a great food menu and the burger is really good, but it took quite a while for my food to come out. The ordering process was also a little chaotic -- long, long lines and loud music at the counter so it's hard to communicate with staff. Parking can be a nightmare if the lot in the back is full, and the roads are very narrow and uneven when you arrive at the brewery. Ultimately I think this is a good place for those looking to get the Austin experience, but I don't think I'll add this place to my usual rotation.

reviews.author: Christina H.
reviews.description: If you have never tried Adelbert's, what are you waiting for? Adelbert's is located in a prime location near Burnet and more predominately, the Domain. Skip the crowd at Rock Rose Ave and come to Adlbert's instead. Not a single thing I would change about Adelbert's!    Adelbert's serves more than just brews, they also serve ciders, meads, wines, and non-alcoholic beverages. If you have never had meads, I'd start slow with a sample, as it's very potent in flavor! The Dale was refreshing, while the Sauvignon Blanc was a crisp white wine.   If you are wanting to host events of any kind, Adelbert's is here for it. Scott, the owner and Sean, the manager are incredibly accommodating!! They were so sweet to open early and to even allow the food truck on site to help cater to us. If you are looking for a quick tour, you can ask them as well to check out their facilities.

reviews.author: Jake H.
reviews.description: I really like the beer here. I love the $18 flight and the pint glass you get to take home at the end is the coolest pint glass I've ever owned. Unfortunately, they do not allow dogs inside. As a dog owner who lives in the brewery district, this establishment is simply off my list anytime I go out with my little gal.   I do love this place but it's hard to give a perfect score to a place I can't frequent. Especially when they have ~10 competitors in a 5 minute radius and none of them share the same policy. As a result, I am updating my review from 5 to 4 stars.

reviews.author: Roland D.
reviews.description: Cool Staff, great beer, really good vibes all around.

reviews.author: Jana N.
reviews.description: This place is on my Covid-19 safe list. They will continue to require masks.

reviews.author: Cynthia L.
reviews.description: I sampled a flight of their Belgian style beers and enjoyed them all. The staff was polite, and the food from the Emoji food truck was tasty and reasonably priced.

reviews.author: Dan P.
reviews.description: Overall vibe: relaxed, quirky Austin  Service: good beer knowledge. Hillary was very nice at the counter.  Beer: excellent quality. Great Friday from raspberry wheat beer to Belgian style ale  Overall cleanliness: above average  Price: average for good craft beer

reviews.author: Chris T.
reviews.description: This is a nice stop. The entryway can get a slight bottleneck, just be patient. The beer is worth the wait. I got the seasonal raspberry beer that was brewed for owner daughter wedding, oh my gosh! Delicious and refreshing. I ended up buying a 6 pack to take home. I think it is gone now, but so good!

reviews.author: Rishi R.
reviews.description: Great people. Great drinks. An awesome time. My fav is the mald wine. Darts in the back food truck out front

reviews.author: Taylor Z.
reviews.description: Large spacious venue with plenty of outdoor seating as well. I love that have arcade games and foosball, fun spot for a group. Come thristy.

reviews.author: Alex C.
reviews.description: I'm a fan of dark Belgian style beer that's not too sweet so Adalbert's gets five stars right away.  I love the Philosophizer and the October Rust.  There seems to be good social distancing. There's hand sanitizer on the counter. Growlers are a possibility as are CDB sodas. The people are friendly and seem to know about the beer. I only discovered this place after the pandemic it started so I've never really spent time inside. But I've been sitting on my own porch enjoying it quite a bit and when things get back to normal I hope to spend a few hours at Adelbert's.

reviews.author: Matt M.
reviews.description: This brewery is a 10/10 if Yelp let give this opinion I would. The bartender was absolutely amazing giving me amazing recommendations. The GM proceeded to stay late with us and show us the absolute best of the best mead I have ever had. He was amazing the bartender was amazing and if I ever re-vist Austin this is a must have on the to do list. Do NOT miss out on this amazing experience. Do not go to Austin beer works this place is literally 10x better if not more.

reviews.author: Saunya O.
reviews.description: This was a great brewery to go to after work for drinks with friends or coworkers. I love the idea that's you are actually in the brewery itself.   The neat thing is that they have artwork that's for sale on the walls. The art adds character and is a large variety of different themes all from local artists.   No good is served inside the brewery but there is a really good food truck on the outside.   The beers are amazing and you can sample before you buy.  Liked this brewery and beers are very creative.

reviews.author: Missy J.
reviews.description: Love coming here and just hanging out. The bartenders are always very sweet and willing to let you try things before you get a whole glass. I always enjoy their IPAs. They have a food truck outside with I think chicken I usually just get the fresh popped popcorn it's delicious and great to snack on while drinking beer. They have a Nintendo Wii with Mario kart and two old-school arcade games they also have a Foos ball table and darts. There's also boardgames that you can check out with giving them your ID, an awesome place to hang out with friends, kids and dogs!

reviews.author: Jodi H.
reviews.description: I had my first Adelbert's beer through HEB, with their Naked Nun witbier. I have been hooked since then and finally made it into their tasting room.   It. Was. Heaven. They have an outdoors area that's shaded for those with doggos or who want to enjoy the heat and eat from their food truck. I had the Triple B, which was surprisingly crisp and floral for a belgian. They had a variety of beers which I wanted to taste, but we arrived late with one hour to spare before closing. That just means I need to pay another visit to truly enjoy the place.  They have a private parking area shared with neighboring businesses and strong wifi. The best part is the indoors games like 4-player Mario Kart (WHAT!), darts, and a bunch of board games. They also give free stickers, plus our lady taptender that day was so kind and welcoming.

reviews.author: Tisha T.
reviews.description: Met up with some work peeps for a happy hour of sorts. I originally didn't plan to attend since it's a brewery and I hate beer with a passion. However I checked out their site, saw they had some wine options and a food truck--so I happily tagged along. The bartender who greeted us gave us the rundown of everything. Served us with a smile and was very informative about the beers, of course. I had a great bottle of pinot grigio while my friends enjoyed the various beers available. I had a great time checking out the art that they have on the walls for sale. We also played a game of jumbo sized connect four and Mario Kart on the big screen. A large collection of board games are also available to borrow while hanging out enjoying your drink in the taproom. Very cool place, warm vibes. Great food truck on site as well.  Definitely will return soon and bring my beer drinking friends.

reviews.author: Justin N.
reviews.description: Really good beer at Adebert's. Lots of cool wood barrels and lots of people around for a fun Friday Night. At certain times you can challenge the bartender to a game of Mario Kart which is truly unique but just add the the overall great experience at Adelbert's

reviews.author: Alysha M.
reviews.description: This place is great! Get the wristband if you're a first timer- only $15 for six "half pours" which are definitely more like 3/4 pours haha  The mango wit, naked nun, and hibiscus saison are AMAZINGGG.   Cool art, live music, food truck (although they left early, which sucked).  The only real disappointment? The brewery closes at 10- we coulda stayed all night!

reviews.author: Dawn H.
reviews.description: Three words: Belgium style brews! Oh my goodness, where have you been hiding from me Adelbert's?! This is by far one of my most favorite craft breweries in all of Austin, if not in the United States. For those of you that really know me, you know that I L.O.V.E. Belgian beers...so much so that, yes, I traveled to Belgium JUST for the beers (okay, I ate some mussels and saw some pretty cool stuff too, but...). For those of you not in the know (no insult meant for those who are), Belgian style beers are pretty high in ABV, so amateurs enter gently. Just looking out for my Yeeps! :D  Adelbert's doesn't look like much at all from the outside. Tucked away in a warehouse district, it can a tad difficult to find, particularly at night - just look for the little white lights and the picnic tables outside. Park, walk through the plastic flat "doors" and you will discover a beautiful huge space with stacks and stacks of barrels, merchandise for sale, lots of local art hanging on the walls to purchase adds to the ambiance; plus games to play such as giant Jenga, foosball, and darts and that's one fine outing.   But the beer! Oh my gosh - the beer. Handcrafted at its best. So amazingly fantastic and such a great deal. On your first visit be certain to buy the 6 half pour (really close to full pours - yay) tastings for $13. You get to keep the glass and get $2 off beers when you bring it back on your next visit. Regular prices range from $4-6 a glass, which is phenominal in the first place for such high quality ale.   ALL great, two personal standouts for me were: *Flyin' Monks Quadrupel: 10.9%ABV, aged in rum barrels with hints of spice, deep, dark, and lovely. *Philosophizer Saison: An easy choice. 7.8% ABV, very mild carbonation with a hint of pepper. Fantastic.     To add some icing to this already oh so sweet find, the founder and brewmaster Scott and staff cannot be any more friendly or knowledgeable about the beers and brewery.   Highly highly highly recommend. Simply doesn't get better than this IMHO. Cheers!  TIPS:  *The brewery has a license so you can take a large bottle home for a reasonable price of about $9 to $12, which is average. They also sell retail at area Austin locations (visit their website for exact locations).  *Tours are available (see website for details).   *They typically have a food truck on site on Saturdays.  *Fido friendly pergola area - not allowed inside.

reviews.author: Sam V.
reviews.description: Ya'll are probably already aware of my latest and greatest obsession with collecting pint glasses from assorted breweries. For our first stop in Austin, we stopped by this unassuming warehouse. As we walked in, the live jazz band was jammin' and the beer taps were flowin'.   Michael and his bearded friend were fantastic bartenders. I really appreciated their hospitality. Michael instantly could tell I was new to this particular brewery and proceeded to explain the process to tasting their beer samples. He even noted that I had a minor with me and offered a brewed hibiscus tea for him. They really cater to all ages! We paid $13 for six half poured samples from a souvenir Belgian tasting glass. One yellow wristband later, my siblings and I were playing ping-pong and giant Jenga in the back of the warehouse.  The stringed lights on the ceiling made it feel welcome and homey. They had a wall of local art for sale ranging from $30-$300! I had my eye on a Sinatra painting, and as luck would have it, it was indeed the $300 piece lol. I stared at it longingly for most of the night, but couldn't bring myself to throw down on it. My favorite craft brews of the night were the Naked Nun and the Philosophizer. Brilliant names and great hoppy flavors.  Once it got too muggy in the taproom, we ventured out to get some grub. The food truck of the night was Emoji Grilled Cheese. (See their yelp site for my review) It was mouthwatering and delicious. We visited a couple other breweries throughout our trip, but Adelbert's was my all-time favorite.   Thanks for a great time!   -xoxoxo

reviews.author: James R.
reviews.description: Great place to spend an afternoon. This another place where you pay a fee, get a glass and then you get 6 pours of whatever they have on tap. I could only do 4 pours due to a time constraint but what I had was very tasty. The mango wit was a standout for me as I could actually taste the mango unlike some other brews which lose that flavor in the process. Black Rhino was also very tasty. Besides the good beers the place has TVs and games and most importantly art to sell! If I hadn't been flying on that trip there were a couple of pieces I was interested in. Overall a worthy stop in Austin instead of having to drive to Dripping Springs for good beer.

name: Oasis Texas Brewing Company
accommodations: Garage Parking, Private Lot Parking, Valet Parking

reviews.author: Jeraz C.
reviews.description: This is my NUMBER ONE PLACE to bring any one when the visit me in Austin.  Located 40 minutes West from downtown and perched on top of a cliff with sweeping views of lake Travis, this is the place I bring my guest on their last evening in Austin to watch the sunset and to serve as a poetic end to their trip.  Things I like: - The view, absolutely stunning, come hear around sunset and listen for the bell they ring as the sun sinks below the horizon. - The food, the truffle fries here are awesome and for $9 they can feed 4 people, they even have great salads and a wagyu burger all reasonably priced  Things I don't like: - Oasis is kinda far from Austin, there isn't much they can do about it, but the drive is definitely worth it from time to time - The lack of space on the balcony, if you want to sit on the balcony overlooking Lake Travis, you may be disappointed, the tables by the ledge fill up quick so you should get there at least an hour before sunset   protips: - get there early to get good seats for the sunset - avoid the oasis restaurant, they have long waits for sub par food, just eat up here instead  - TRUFFLE FRIES

reviews.author: Swetha S.
reviews.description: There was so much going on at this venue, so let me break it down based on my experience -   1. Views - INCREDIBLE. If there is one and only reason to visit this spot, it's for the view. All of their restaurants overlook Lake Travis. And it's stunning.  2. Space - there are multiple venues here - restaurants, brewery, cocktail lounge, some gift shops (closed as of Mar 2022). Every space has a viewing deck, which obviously gets filled fast. There was ample space inside and outside too. Each one is on different floor. And you cannot carry your drinks to the restaurant space as they don't have license. 3. Live music - there was no live music when I visited on a Friday. But they did have some pretty neat setups 4. Food - French fries was meh! Wait time was HUGE!  5. Cocktails - Skip them. Not worth it.  Can't speak about the beer itself as I had not tried it. 6. Accessibility - about 30 mins from Austin, so not that much of a drive.   Would come here again for the views I!

reviews.author: Ruchi J.
reviews.description: This place is so so so cute and is a great way to spend a Sunday afternoon. The view of Lake Travis is beautiful, the food is great, and the drinks are awesome too!  We went upstairs and got lucky as we snagged a table right as some people were leaving. We ordered some apps and some beers and spent some time taking pictures of Lake Travis. The view was awesome and a great way to say hello to Austin.  The place doesn't have much in the way of vegetarian options, but I did enjoy the appetizers and the view :)

reviews.author: Tanmay T.
reviews.description: Come here for a good beer, snacks and most importantly the views. I personally think the views are better from here than from Oasis restaurant. I was also impressed with the quality and quantity of the parmesan fries. They have plenty of tables inside and outside. There are plenty of space heaters near all tables, so you won't have difficulty finding a table. There are plenty of non alcoholic drinks too and the place seems kid friendly.

reviews.author: Kyle H.
reviews.description: Very cute brewery on Lake Travis with amazing views.  Had a large seating area inside and out. They have a stage for live music. They also have food, wine, and cider.  Orders their burger with truffle fries. Pretty tasty and those fries were crispyyyy! Would go back just for the views.  The beer was okay but that's not the reason you come here.

reviews.author: Slava C.
reviews.description: Great chill out place with the positive vibe.  Enjoy wide selection of beers and delicious food topping off the amazing views along with the live band performance. What else would a soul need?! Sit back, relax, have a cup of cold one, watch a sunset and enjoy life!

reviews.author: Korey A.
reviews.description: The view here is amazing and the food is so much better than their neighbors.  We love being able to hang out inside or out with entertaining things to do.   I will say that neither my husband nor I are a big fan of their beers,  which is a bit of a bummer considering that it is a beer place.

reviews.author: Rebecca W.
reviews.description: Made our way to The Oasis during a recent trip to Austin with some friends. It was definitely a bit away from the main city, but a beautiful scenic area. The Oasis is right on Lake Travis, and features a bunch of small stores and outdoor areas in the land surrounding it. We were there on a Friday afternoon, and surprisingly not a lot of stores were open, which was a bummer. Of course though, we were there for the brewery, which we were able to make it to. They offer plentiful indoor and outdoor seating; it was a nice sunny day so we opted for the outdoor seating. It was lovely outside but it was SO windy, even after we tried to switch locations outside. It was hard to keep our food from blowing away! The view was super nice though, so despite the wind, we appreciated the scenery surrounding us.  For food / drink - of course, I focused on beers. I was a bit disappointed to learn that they didn't offer flights - they had a good number of offerings, it would make sense to do flights! Oh well, at least they offered half pours, so I was able to try 2; I went for the gose (kiwi dragonfruit) and the Oktoberfest. Both were OK, not the best ever beer but refreshing; I definitely favored the gose! My friends enjoyed their pours as well. For food, we all split some apps, going for the OTXBC trio, the bretzel, and the truffle fries. The trio was a bit disappointing - it was underwhelming and a little piecemeal (we had thought everything would be mixed together but it was just a pretzel on top of the chips with the dips on the side). The bretzel itself was tasty, but the sauce was interesting; we thought it came with queso, but the dip we received looked nothing like queso and was thick with chunks of something in it (pepper maybe?). It was tasty, but unidentifiable. Lastly, the truffle fries were the best option - they were nicely seasoned and crispy with a large volume. We all enjoyed those! The prices were relatively reasonable for what we got in terms of quantity and quality.   Overall, we enjoyed our afternoon at Oasis Texas Brewing Company. The space is lovely with a great view, but the food and drink is just OK; you're definitely more there for the experience. I would definitely make it back to OTXBC during a next visit to Austin to try more beers and take in the nice view!

reviews.author: Karen Q.
reviews.description: 10/10 views, okay food. Heard food was better here versus the Oasis Restaurant. We only ordered apps, so can only comment on these. They were pretty basic, though we really enjoyed the truffle fries. We arrived around 2pm on a Friday and there was plenty of seating. Very windy though FYI.

reviews.author: Eric G.
reviews.description: Might want to update the hours of operation  So guests know your closed before driving 30m.

reviews.author: Shradha A.
reviews.description: The Tap Room on the third floor and the Barrel Room on the second floor both achieve unique ambiance and draw slightly different crowds. We got to experience and enjoy the best of both in a way.   Amazing fresh made as well as barrel aged cocktails, a nice range of food options, and of course, breathtaking views.   The Barrel Room is rustic chic with fancy couches and a pool table. The tap room is plain rustic with a live music stage. The tap room had burgers and sandwiches to accompany the beers brewed on site. The barrel room offered pizza and wings to eat in between cocktail sips.   Oh, don't miss observing the really cool stairs in between the two floors.

reviews.author: Ali W.
reviews.description: Have some family in town and wanted to take them somewhere to watch a good ol Texas sunset. OTBC has some of the absolute best views in all of Austin. Even on this cloudy day the sunset still peaked through and gave us a show.   Drinks are good but food isn't really anything to write home about. Its more about the experience you get here for sure.  They have a large parking garage and parking lot on site with plenty of free parking even on a busy night. There's also a golf cart shuttle to get you from the lot to the entrance if you need it, but it's also a walkable distance.   Really great spot to visit if you want a nice spot to watch the sunset and definitely has that wow-factor for visitors!

reviews.author: Mark M.
reviews.description: Have a visitor in from California and wanted to show our beautiful sunset by Lake Travis. This is a great place for that and the food is always good.  The space is large and everyone seemed to be following the safety rules while indoors. We were a party of 8 and we had plenty of space.  I ordered the basic burger and they usually prepare it Medium rare. I asked for medium well and wanted only mayonnaise and cheese. It was cooked the way I requested but was very dry since they did not give me Mayo. My wife ordered the Fish Tacos (3) and said they were great. She ended only being able to eat 2 and another guest finished her last one. She said she would order again next time.   All in all is was good just not great.

reviews.author: Van N.
reviews.description: I really really tried for this place. I took my parents here, I took my friends from out of town, and I even came for a birthday party this weekend. The whole experience overall is just underwhelming? If thats the right word. There is always the steps  1. get in line to get on to the wait list 2. once in front be told the wait is 1-2 hours 3. get in line again for the bar  4. finally get seated and wait again for slow service.   One question is Why? Why would you even go here? The wait is 2+ Hours sometimes. The food is cafeteria quality at best. They are SEVERELY understaff. Oasis Brewery has better food and literally the same exact food. The quality of the experience over all does not justify the amount of time, money and effort for this place.

reviews.author: Laura H.
reviews.description: Pretty gross, dirty, staff doesn't seem to care. The girl working on Wednesday nights is horrible and should never work around people. Seemed super angry to be there and yelled at customers tonight, then just stormed off... super weird vibes. Definitely won't be back I don't get what the hype is about with this place. Maybe if the staff actually cleaned up or were nice to customers this place would get a couple more stars.

reviews.author: Diana V.
reviews.description: An Austin must see! Beautiful views, with many options for eating and drinking. The bartenders were super attentive and nice.   Just knocking one star because I could only find one elevator and it was out of service. I'm in a boot and it was hard to get up all those stairs. If you need help call first to make sure the elevator works.

reviews.author: Callie M.
reviews.description: Views: 5/5. Such a scenic view overlooking Lake Travis. My favorite time to come is when the sun sets. The Texas skies are truly breathtaking during this time and Oasis is perfectly positioned for patrons to see all that the sun has to offer. Come 1 hour early to snag a table next to the railings in order to get the best (unblocked) view.   Food: 3/5. My date and I only ordered the Pico Verde. It was a refreshing snack but nothing special. We would've ordered more but there wasn't a huge selection and nothing that caught our eye.   Drinks: 3/5. Very limited selection of beers. It's almost weird that this place is called a brewery because there are literally like 8 to pick out of. Most people just come here for the view though so it's not a huge problem.   Overall, definitely a gem in Austin. It's a great place for dates or just to hang out with family or friends. It's so pretty here that it doesn't even matter what I'm eating or drinking!

reviews.author: Johnson W.
reviews.description: Family visiting Austin, Oasis is the must go place to see the beautiful lake and sunset!  We were at the brewery on third floor, ordered some beer and food, kitchen was bit slower than normal (they were busy! So that's fine), we ordered 3 items and they only gave us one and the guy took my call alarm and about to walk away, so I asked him where are my other two items, and he looked confused then asked me, else you ordered? So I told him what they were, and took him a minute to look around, and it was sitting right next to the first item, but he just simply looked confused!  I wouldn't suggest to come during busy weekend, unless you don't mind of waiting longer time, and getting mixed up on what you've ordered.  Overall still a great place to take visitors.

reviews.author: Juliana S.
reviews.description: Just go! You won't regret it.   Everything is was amazing! We had French fries and avocado dip to go with our beers. Fries comes with a truffle aioli.   For the beers we had Grand Cru Dark Ale and Samurai Lager.   The Grand Cru Dark Ale comes in a small cup. The server assured me that was a good amount unless I was really found of dark ale. He was right that was a good amount because that beer is strong.   I pretty sure I wasn't going to finish the beer if I had asked for a double sized cup.   Really nice experience over all.   I would recommend this place a million times.

reviews.author: Melanie B.
reviews.description: I truly wanted to love this place.. Texas weather is just right this time of year, the views make you want to make the drive from Cali to the lone star state just to get that perfect pic over the lake with a drink your hand in the free state of Texas....but don't be disappointed when you are greeted by a not so friendly mask police manager that wants to wear his mask under his nose ....   the guacamole had zero taste the salsa was watery and had zero flavor... the chips were the bottom of the barrel... all of the guests seated around us were unhappy and didn't receive good service either but were happy with the views. The fellow guests/visitors we met were super cool and that was the best part... the drinks food and service were way below average... what is it with these places? get it together! the views bring us there but you need to pick it up from there... managers are clueless... bartenders were so rude....embarrassing for Austin...  so many visitors and this is their first impression of Austin unfortunately... we can do better.  We ordered 2 pizzas and left 80% of them on the table....Tasted frozen with ragu sauce.... I can't even begin to explain the regrets I have going here... The guy that gave us a ride on the golf cart up was very nice and now I feel he may have been trying to warn us about going there..  Bathrooms were gross and tables were nasty... nobody was cleaning up after people.... trash and masks everywhere and near the water... I follow not unfollowed their social media page and the pictures are very enticing but it's the exact opposite of what you actually get... from the drinks to the food.. Fire pit was a nice touch.. we stopped to talk to other guests there on our way out... Its a one hitter quitter for all..  won't be back... what a waste of location.

reviews.author: Tara G.
reviews.description: Sour Beer? Say less!! Oh my goodness yes it's what you never knew you needed!   Staff was hospitable and knowledgeable. 1st timer with zero stress.

reviews.author: KayTee K.
reviews.description: My favorite brewery! Love, love, love the beer so much. They also do some really fun events! My favorite the candy themed anniversary! Blueberry cobbler is my favorite.   Jeff if you read this- please put warhead on the tap regularly :)

reviews.author: Carly C.
reviews.description: Blue Owl Brewing is known for their sour beers. I am happy to report that they also have a normal pilsner and IPA, as well as ciders and some sort of frozen beer drink. The bartender was super friendly and let us know we could split a tasting between the two of us (one of us would get a glass cup we could keep and the other person would get a plastic cup). Since I am currently short on glasses, I chose the cup I wanted. They had 4 choices at varying prices. We really enjoyed all of the beers we had - they are definitely unique. I did the hazy IPA and a coconut IPA. They also have a ton of soft shirts for sale, which I am a big fan of. This is a great spot to grab a cold beer on summer day, since there is indoor seating, as well as a covered patio. I will definitely return to this little gem.

reviews.author: Quinn H.
reviews.description: Buyer Beware!!   You don't get to have a choice in whether or not to buy a souvenir beverage receptacle :(  Unfortunately, Blue Owl Brewing doesn't sell beer. It sells cups and glasses, which come with beer in them.   I paid $9 for a cheap blue plastic souvenir cup in order to get one beer. I was traveling to Austin by airplane (during the weekend of the TSA meltdown at the airport) and don't have room to carry around a cheap plastic cup, much less a glass.    If you think you might want to drink two beers you have to upgrade to buying a glass for $22, which then entitles you to two beers, at $11 each. One of which comes in the mandatory souvenir glass -whether you want it or not- and the other in an even cheaper clear plastic cup. If you want to share four beers with friends you have to buy the largest glass for $32 (I may be off slightly regarding the price) and they will give you a souvenir glass and three, even cheaper, plastic disposable cups. You can also choose to refill the same glass four times. In any case this will cost you $8 per beer which is the cheapest options if you're looking for volume.  Please note, you are not allowed to bring your own reusable glass/mug/plastic cup and buy the beer. Because, this place sells cups and glasses. Not beer. The beer is a byproduct of buying a glass.  From an environmental perspective, this is not a responsible business model. Stop selling plastic cups and start selling beer. Get a dishwasher so you a can re-use your glass inventory.  When you go to a brewery it's usually because you want beer. Not a glass. If you do want a glass you can pick one up at the gift shop. Honestly, my friend and I should have walked out after learning of the cup-buying scheme, but we had just walked two miles to get there, and watching the confusion spread over the faces of thirsty consumers who came in after us was priceless.   Locals with B.O.B. growlers didn't seem to mind. I have no idea what a growler would cost, or how many,even cheaper, plastic cups it comes with.  We won't be going back unless they start selling beer instead of glasses. The business model didn't sit well with either of us. Granted this is a subjective observation. One star for the server as she was polite and seemed a little exasperated in explaining the business model. One star for the beer, they have some good flavors here. And one more for the atmosphere as it had a nice vibe.  We both placed our cheap blue plastic souvenir cups on top of the growing stack of other cheap blue plastic souvenir cups  in the recycle bin on the way out.

reviews.author: John P.
reviews.description: So I'm a big fan of being fair, so here goes. A friend and I stopped by while in Austin and the place was packed. I think we got there at the right time because we were able to secure a seat inside where it was considerably cooler than the outside seating.   The process for ordering was fairly simple and the lady helping me was kind enough to break it down for a new out-of-towner. We got 4 sour beers and they were really interesting. On this particular occasion I had a new experience after I finished my 2nd sour beer. I learned that sour beer gives me heart burn. 1st time ever. I was asking my friend what this fire in my chest was. She loved the sour beers she ordered and we got glasses to remember the occasion. BOB... you'll always be my first.   I recommend checking it out and if you like sour beers Blue Owl Brewing will put a smile on your face. The staff is friendly and hip, and the beer flows as does the good times.   Prohst!!!

reviews.author: Kelly M.
reviews.description: We loved coming to Blue Owl Brewing!! When we came, they only had the patio open for drinking at the brewery due to COVID, which was nice and very comfortable.   We ordered a glass and got 4 beers with the glass, if you are not able to finish your 4 beers, they will let you take the extras to go in cans! I believe the size we got was $20 per person. They had about 3 different options for sizes of glasses. The girl said we could even share one order if we wanted less beers per person.  I love all the options of the beers (they are all "sour" and DELICIOUS)!! My all time favorite that I tried was the Jubilberry!  The only complaint I would have was parking was a little hard to find but we ended up parking in a lot close by.  We will definitely be coming back when in Ausitn!

reviews.author: Catherine F.
reviews.description: The worst brewery experience of my life. Extremely long line, only one woman was working. We ordered canned beers and went outside to the patio are. She came outside and said we had to drink canned beers off the property and took away our drinks saying she could bring us new ones in glasses -- AND SHE NEVER came back. There was NO CLEAR MARKING that canned beers were equivalent to to go beers and QR code's we're on the tables with the option to order canned beers. Little to no seating and a water fan was blowing, causing the customers to get wet. I would never recommend this place!

reviews.author: Matthew W.
reviews.description: Great sour beers! You can't beat their deal where you pay $20 for 4 beers and you get to keep the glass. Honestly, you can't go wrong with  any of the beers they have. I'd recommend the little boss or the van dayum.

reviews.author: Michelle D.
reviews.description: This was our 3rd time being here....as we live in Dallas....but every time we visit we come.  They always have great brews and flavors.  The staff if exceptionally nice and has great customer service. I'm not a beer fan but I do love their Peach and Blueberry beers!  Their coolest thing is for $20 you get a great glass with beer and 3 others in plastic cups. Cool concept and a lot of beer in pours.  Getting a great following and you should go!!

reviews.author: Madeline C.
reviews.description: I don't know how I've failed to review this place yet, because I literally purchase something from here every week and finally got to sit on their patio during a beautiful sunny Sunday. I cannot recommend it enough -- thought I didn't like sour beer, oh boy I was wrong. Absolutely ADORE the Tangerina, Tiki Hop Totem, Plum de Plume, Limetastico and Jubilberry beers. And they had a Plum de Plume + mango beer slushee, so yum! Patio was very full on Sunday so we had to wait to snag an outdoor table but it was worth it. The staff is always incredibly nice and feels safe for COVID. Every Thursday they spin a wheel for a growler deal -- entire growler of amazing beer for $9! And their merch is so cute, definitely have a koozie collection now. Biggest perk of in-person is if you buy a beer glass (pictured here with a very cool design) you get 4 pours for $16. It really doesn't get better than this.

reviews.author: Nishanth E.
reviews.description: Absolutely tremendous sours, possible the best I've had in the country! Would highly recommend any of their sours ranging from iLimetastico to Teeny Hopper. Picked up some cans to go as well on the way out, would definitely recommend to anyone visiting Austin and specifically around that area.

reviews.author: Kelsey G.
reviews.description: ONLY SOURS- not nice servers. The girls working were not friendly or welcoming. If you are looking for a well rounded brewery this is NOT IT! They serve only sours + 1 Pilsner. Also, policy is not ideal. You have to buy a pint glass for at least $25 in order to drink. Glass was cute, ambience outside was nice

reviews.author: Rebekah G.
reviews.description: The beer is amazing, but I'm not a fan of the 4-drink i policy. I know you can spread them out over a month or get cans, but it makes it a little harder.

reviews.author: Libby B.
reviews.description: A brewery that does only sours! I was so happy to find this place while exploring East Austin. You know, it's been a while since I walked around a neighborhood without my phone constantly telling me where to go. This time I did, and Cesar Chavez led me here and to so many other amazing spots!   You walk in, order a glass that you get to keep! And then you get 4 beers in that glass! The best part? If you are like me and get the cool goblet at 16 oz. you can't drink that much beer at once. You can keep your tasting card and come back for the other 1 or 2 that you maybe couldn't do at visit #1! I think the limit is about a month between visits, but I'm not sure. Honestly, we came here 3 times. One time we didn't have our tasting cards so just did 4 tasting size glasses. Yes, we are big fans and came back to Indy with 4 glasses!   The patio is covered which is great during Texas spring/summer. If you're lucky, and someone leaves and hands you their card, double bonus!   I highly recommend visiting because even my husband, who does not love sours as I do, found a beer he liked (Van Dayum), and we even passed on the love to my sister-in-law who lives in RR! (How has she not been here yet?!)

reviews.author: Maritza M.
reviews.description: Spent a whole evening here due to the unusual policy of requiring you to purchase a glass that comes with 4 pours. We drank our 4 14 oz pours over the course of a few hours, but it's nice that we had the option to bail earlier and take home a can instead. The patio is nicely set up with distanced tables, fans, and hand sanitizers at every table. We brought over food from Vegan Nom, a couple minutes walk away. My partner and I each tried 4 different beers. All were delicious! This was our first visit to the brewery despite buying the beer from stores many times. I would definitely come back but with the awareness of the policy that you have to buy at least 4 12oz pours (you can split amongst multiple people though). I think the real highlight of visiting the brewery are the frozen beer drinks. They had a "Mexican Marteeny" available the night we went, which is based on the Teenybopper ale with some other things mixed in. Amazing, and a great final glass! The bartender was lovely and was able to answer all our questions, too.

reviews.author: Don L.
reviews.description: Do you like sour beer? If you answered yes then why aren't you here already?  If you don't like sour beer, verify by trying the definition of it at Blue Owl Brewing because "The Owls are not what they seem." - yep, they're Lynch fans of the best show to make it to TV.  BOB is your uncle and your favorite sour beer. Come in and select a size, get 4 samples in that glass, and when you finish - keep it! The glass is yours.  Heavy rotation keeps its original and I love it. They have some staples for those trying to have a routine.  Buy some swag and get the brand out there! #LittleBossIsMyFav #BlueOwlSightings

reviews.author: Shelley B.
reviews.description: Listen- I love the beers. But the way you have to purchase them is so weird. You have to buy 4 or that's it. Sure, you can split it or take some home but sometimes I just want 1-2 beers on site and not have to buy 4. My boyfriend and I came and bought the 4 but then wanted one more. Nope, buy 4 more or none. We picked none and left. I just wish we could come and buy one or two beers without being forced to buy 4.

reviews.author: Eric S.
reviews.description: If you like sour beers, youll love this place. Personally i find it gimmicy. The sour beers dont do it for me. Also they make you buy a pint glass before you can order.  The main draws are that its in a cool neighborhood, i like that the beers are highly alcoholic. Also their patio is dece, but it could use more seating. Finally, their gimmicky ordering system causes people to leave free beer tickets around constantly. I like free beer.  The big gimmick, which I find annoying, aside from the sour beers buying a glass when you to get a drink. When you buy one, you're basically comitting to four 12 oz. pours and possibly coming back in the future. There are other sizes, but the 12 oz. Is the best value and it feels weird drinking beer from a shot glass.   You can bring a glass you already bought, but overall its annoying to bring a pint glass to a bar. If i wanted to clean my own glasses, i would drink at home. Thats why youre kinda commiting to coming back by buying one.  They give you a sheet to check off the number of pours. The sheets are transferable and can be used on different days so make sure to hold on to them. Also, we usually find a sheet of people who didnt use all their pours so youll usually get a few free.

reviews.author: Eliott L.
reviews.description: Came here with a couple of friends on a Friday night because of a recommendation from a friend of mine, and it did not disappoint. For $16, my friends and I each got a normal sized glass to take home and 4 pours of any choice (you can do 8 half pours). There are also different types and sizes for glasses, so you could opt for a bigger or smaller glas.   Beer/Sours: Great quality drinks with a wide range of flavors. If you don't like sours this may not be the place for you, but definitely give it a shot if you like beers in general.   Service: Nothing to be said here, super nice and friendly staff! Felt right at home.   Atmosphere: Great! Nothing that prevents you from enjoying your afternoon or your conversation.   Definitely coming here again, hopefully I'll collect all 4 glasses!

reviews.author: Ricky R.
reviews.description: When we were walking over to this place from Lazarus brewing my wife said, "I think they only have sours". I was like no way, I will just grab an IPA or something... Oh man was I shocked to see that they literally only had sours. With that being said let me start this shockingly high review for a place that only has sours by saying... i do not care for sour beers. So a 5 star coming from a person who doesnt enjoy sours should say something.  I loved everything about this place. This place is in a cool location, has a great logo, has great aesthetic, and a really cool flight idea. If it wasnt all sour beers... I would live at this place.  Let me explain how the flights work here. You pick your glass size... If I were to guess I would say 4oz, 8oz, 12oz... but honestly that is a guess. Then you get 4 samples in that size. You bring up your sheet, they check off the beer and you sample it. Oh and the best part is that after you are done you get to keep the glass. Oh and the prices are not crazy. I want to say it was $6, $8, $10, but that might also be off. This is definitely one of the coolest strategies I have seen for flights at a brewery ever... Oh and the glasses all looked really neat for sure.  Now onto the beer. Like I have mentioned multiple times already, I am not a fan of sours, but I liked the initial flavor of most of these beers. We had the wee heavy, the red, the earl grey one (lazarus colab), and the cherry stout. Everything had a great crafted flavor, until I hit the sour note. I relied on my wife to drink most of these, but I was very impressed by everything for sure. And my wife was happy with everything as well.  I would suggest anyone in Austin come visit this place for sure. Definitely worth the trip and more so if you like sours!!

reviews.author: Raquel C.
reviews.description: first of all the food truck on site Bonita Los 3 Reyes is delicious as all tacos I've come to love, I can put this truck on the top favorite spots. get food for sure. next the brewery- huge open space outside with plenty of seating. I wont lie to you yelp, I am not much for drinking beers but for this brewery, I might knock one beer out and enjoy the patio more than anything. shout out to the staff for being awesome and helping me find the right beer for me.

reviews.author: Michaela P.
reviews.description: Like the space like the amenities like the food trucks like the peeps. The beer not so much. We did two flights. Eight beers. A couple were good. A couple were bad. The rest were just mediocre.  Dog friendly. Plenty of seating inside and out. Good prices. What does this place do for parking?

reviews.author: Tara K.
reviews.description: What a cute brewery!  They have a decent selection of brews and plenty of indoor and outdoor seating.  They have a big screen tv good for watching sporting games, and they have a food truck for munchies.   I was impressed by the women's restrooms as it had tampons, pads, and lotion.  How thoughtful!  Good mix of clientele too.

reviews.author: Rob P.
reviews.description: My friend's band was playing for free here as a pre Austin FC party. I was the only person here not wearing green, it seemed. Had 2 beers, 1 was really good and 1 was eh. They had a Mexican food truck in the back and it was meh, I wouldn't recommend. Line inside to get a beer was ridiculous... I would have had more if it wasn't such a wait. Seems they could use a bit of logistical help.

reviews.author: Brent L.
reviews.description: This is a very wide-open brewery with plenty of places to sit, stand, chill out, hang out, etc.  I had the Cowboy Bevo (which is a brown ale).  I usually love the sweet, malty taste of a brown ale, but the IBU rating on this one was a little high for my tastes.  Not terrible, mind you, and I would consider it again. Just a little hoppy for my tastes.    It's in an industrial park, like many breweries are, but it was a nice, spacious, and clean set up. Service was quick too - so was parking.  On my last visit, they even had a local band playing from within one of the loading dock doors.   Bottom line, great tastes, services, parking easy, and some good live tunes.  Check them out!

reviews.author: Eric B.
reviews.description: My dog hopped up on the counter to demand a winter porter, but was immediately met with a dog biscuit.  Meanehile, my wife ordered a dunkelweizen whilI ste thw winterbrew and proceeded to a Murcielago.  I loved the later on nitro.  Friendly staff, counter service, plenty of room inside open to air and outside in the sun.  It's my 2nd visit.  We enjoyed the food from Tsuke Hoten and there's a pizza truck too.  We'll be back for more.

reviews.author: Christa S.
reviews.description: Went here on a sunny afternoon with Kelly L. She had been, but it was my first time - although I'd been eyeing Hopsquad as it was building up and it had been on my list to visit. The parking is limited, so plan ahead. The space is bigger than it looks from the outside - as it has an indoor bar as well as an outdoor picnic table area. I tried two beers (can't remember which ones) and they were both very good. The menu had good variety, so I feel like it's a good spot to bring a group that could have diverse beer tastes. The staff was friendly and seemed to be happy working there. I would definitely visit again!

reviews.author: Mr. S.
reviews.description: The beer was not good. 2 of the flight beers were offensively bad. And a couple were okay...Would not return under any circumstances.

reviews.author: Taylor Z.
