reviews.description: Make reservations for dinner. Midday, you usually do not need a reservation, unless you are visiting during a holiday/peak busy time.   Indoor and outdoor seating available. Super casual outdoor setup--plain, wooden, picnic tables and benches, under umbrellas, which do nothing to shield you in hoooot weather. Better sit inside, and enjoy the classy, French province style ambiance. Really enjoyed both times I visited this place and dined indoors. Great for a date, a family gathering, or a casual friends get together.  For lunch, you order and pay at the bar, and then wait for your food and take it to a table of your choice. For dinner, a waiter serves you, providing a complete dinning experience. Staff are friendly and accommodating.  Loooved the pascal burger $16. It hit the spot the first time I tried it. When warm, the soft Camembert cheese melts into the cornichons, caramelized onions, and grain mustard, creating a perfect medley with the juicy patty. The meat was flavorful and well-seasoned, bursting with flavor. Definitely, one of the best burgers I've ever tried. Try this. Eat it while it's hot. When it cools down, it looses its ooomph. When I ordered this during my second visit, I waited until it was cool, and I did not get the same kick out of it.  Fries were perfect--well seasoned, crispy, and delicious.   Duck confit with polenta $27 was a small portion, but every element was executed perfectly. The duck was delicate and bursting with flavor, thanks to the bright, citrusy orange sauce. Polenta was crunchy and fun to eat, fried in a form of thick sticks.  Would return anytime I'm back in Austin!

reviews.author: Van N.
reviews.description: We came here for a 'light' meal. My friend got the mussle and fries which were definitely good enough to share if you wanted to. I got the scotch egg and escargot dumplings. Its after all just an egg and a few dumplings. They were super filling! A super delicious mistake on my part. Then of course we had to get the dessert creme brulee was okay. The star of dessert was the bread pudding. I cannot wait to come back and try everything else on the menu.

reviews.author: Vivian P.
reviews.description: I fall in love with this place the first time I tried it after living in this neighborhood for so long. You can come here for drinks at the bar but also sit down for a full dine in experience. Their desserts here are especially amazing. I tried their banana crepe and it's amazing!! I love how the banana tastes didn't get completely covered by the chocolate and also how cute they decorated the plate!

reviews.author: Will C.
reviews.description: First visit, so my assessment change over time. My initial sense is that while the food is good, the service needs some work.   No complaints about the food, which was quite good, such as the Heirloom Tomato Tarte and the Salade Nioise.  The ratatouille could've used a bit more bread, and I thought the toffee flavor of the mango gelato-bread pudding dessert we got to be overpowering.  Drinks were varied and interesting, with French component takes on standard cocktails (e.g. "The Vielle Fashioned") that worked for some (their variation of the French 75) and  less so for others (I believe the Frontera Sidecar).  What definitely fell short was the service. I don't need overly attentive service, but it's not reasonable to be out of water for half an hour, unsuccessfully trying to flag down a waiter time after time.  This is particularly a problem given the small size of their water glasses and the lack of a water bottle for the table. Fixing this relatively small problem would be huge.

reviews.author: Bree B.
reviews.description: The service is out of this world at Hopfields. Every single employee welcomes you as a dear friend. The beer selection on tap is incredible and every single dish is curated with fresh ingredients while keeping the menu innovative. I think this would be a perfect place to go on a first date or meet up with friends. The ambience is intimate, but also very warm and open.

reviews.author: Sunita H.
reviews.description: The cheese board was the highlight of our meal. My partner got their Pascal burger and didn't love it, I got the lamb bolognese which was more of a stew sauce and not a marinara. I like the ambience of this place more than I liked the food.

reviews.author: Emily M.
reviews.description: Updating this review because I've now done brunch at Hopfields for the first time, and it was just as lovely as dinner! Everyone I was with really enjoyed what we got -- we tried the French toast with berry jam and toasted coconut, croissant breakfast sandwich, avocado tartine with a fried egg, eggs benedict, and grapefruit mimosas. Great service, chill ambience (especially for brunch at 11am on a Saturday!)--just great all around. I continue to be surprised by this place but I'm not sure why it's surprising anymore, Hopfields is just genuinely good!

reviews.author: Morgan M.
reviews.description: We had our first visit to Hopfields tonight and I definitely think we'll be back. Its one of the most interesting places we've been in a long time. This restaurant had low key MeowWolf vibes. Every room a little different and the menu was full of surprises. Don't come here expecting a classic version of what you see on the menu!  We had the escargot dumplings, ratatouille, and moules- all presented quite differently than what we imagined. The food is good, not great, but very fun to experience. I wished we could have tried a few more things just to see what they would bring. Dress for the possibility that you might spill red sauce on yourself, because you will. Overall, it was a great little night out and definitely something new and different. If you're expecting traditional French food, you will probably be disappointed. If you're open to surprises, I think you'll enjoy it here.

reviews.author: Kimberly T.
reviews.description: AMAZING. such a great restaurant. Escargot dumplings and mussels are to die for! Going back as soon as I can.

reviews.author: Alan C.
reviews.description: February should be the peak of PEI mussel season.  We came for the mussels.  Unfortunately I don't think the cook particularly likes them.  I had the overwhelming feeling that the cook never tasted the dish as it cooked. There was no sauce, the mussels appeared to be steamed okay and then a ton of chili powder or paprika was dumped on them and that was how they were served.   The powder made for kind of a paste because there was no, or very little, other liquid such as wine or vinegar or tomatoes or much of anything else.  I love to scoop up a tasty broth in the mussel shells and sip it while gulping the seafood,  but this was very dry.  The dryness and high chili content made it very hard to taste the mussels. The fries on top soaked up what little moisture that had been present.    The french onion soup, however,  was excellent.

reviews.author: Stevie K.
reviews.description: Always love a nice lunch at Hopfields! The duck Rueben is mouth watering good, but you honestly can't go wrong with any food item! Love the chill atmosphere and patio option.

reviews.author: Henna A.
reviews.description: We got here on a Sunday evening and were told there was a want of 30 mins to sit indoor when there were empty tables but we were okay and sat in the back lot where they had outdoor chairs and picnic tables. If you're outside you have to get your food and drinks by going back inside by the bar to put your order. To our surprise, the cocktails didn't have actual liquor which was strange. The boards they brought out after a good hour after ordering along with the fries were a bit lackluster. The indoor dining was very cute however overall experience and food taste wasn't great to come back to

reviews.author: Jenn B.
reviews.description: We ended up finding Hopfields thru Eaters List of best Burgers in Austin! Hopfields was #5! #5 guys and not to be snooty but I didn't even look at anything past P Terry's which was around #15! Hehehe P Terry's is good (it's a local chain, made to order) but it's a drive thru and I was looking for more of an "elevated" experience tonight! No shade to my P Terry lovers!! So the Paschal Burger is $16 Medium rare, and slathered in ooey gooey camembert cheese and mustard! I enjoyed it! I regularly lean toward a sweet burger with carmelized onion (which were included), BBQ sauce, bacon jam and other ingredients like these. This burger is just savory not too bold and a textural delight! See the video for the "unboxing"! I would give it a solid 7/10.

reviews.author: Courtney E.
reviews.description: This place has hands-down one of the best burgers in Austin. It's a casual little bar with craft beer and amazing French food. Their burger, covered in camembert or brie, carmelized onions and whole grain mustard is so delicious!! Pair it with crispy Pomme frites and homemade aioli...it's a mic drop moment. The staff is kind and helpful, their craft beer choices and a small but wonderful wine list just rounded out the afternoon. All they have left to do is claim their yelp listing! LOL  But seriously, if you are a foodie, this should definitely be on your list of places to frequent. I'm sure they have many other amazing things to eat there, but their burger is so good that we've never ordered anything else!

reviews.author: Javier E.
reviews.description: It has a very classy vibe to it, the choices for food and drink reflect it. I wish they had more variety in their menu, with cheaper options. I suppose you pay extra for the upscale vibe of the place.  This is not saying that the food is bad, in fact it is very good. The wine and beer options are the best in the area, now that Vino Vino is closed. The great thing is that you can go there for drinks, without ordering food, and have a great time sitting indoors or outside. The staff are very professional, welcoming, and they use their knowledge about the different wines to make suggestions.

reviews.author: Mark A.
reviews.description: Came for dinner, without reservations, on  Friday. It was pretty empty and easy to get a table, so we sat in the middle room of the place, which was somewhat of a makeshift library/lounge with old foreign decor.  We got olives and almonds to start, with escargot, which came with small lettuce leaves and was in a red sauce (not your typical garlic butter). It was really good, different and interesting to try it in a different preparation. For the main, we split the steak and frites. It was probably the smallest portion of steak I've ever seen and if I had eaten it myself I probably still would have been hungry. But, it was really nicely cooked and seasoned, as well as the fries. So despite the size it was super good.  Don't know if I'd come again, also because they only had some special cocktails and not a full bar, but it was interesting to try the place.

reviews.author: Jason M.
reviews.description: This place puts every other beer store in ATX to shame. The variety of options here seems endless. The dude behind the counter knows more about beer than most sommeliers know about wine. That's just icing on the cake. They get every limited release and seasonal that drops. Prices can be a little steep but hella worth it.

reviews.author: Josh P.
reviews.description: If you haven't been to The Brewtique in Cedar Park, you definitely should check it out.   Anytime you stop by, you'll meet either the owner or his wife and they are both nice and very helpful. You can pretty much buy anything they have in singles and they always have their inventory listed online along with the untapped rating for each beer, which I find very useful. They have a solid selection of local stuff and occasionally some more rare stuff as well. If you're immunocompromised, you can call your order in and they'll bring it to your car; they also have a very sanitary setup inside and require masks (of course) and make everyone use the hand sanitizer when you come in. We've been there about 5 times mixing that in with buying direct from breweries but I really love the diversity you can get while supporting local at the Brewtique

reviews.author: Greg M.
reviews.description: Great place to try out a new beer then buy a six-pack or two. We had a couple beers each (they sell singles if you are hanging out) and then bought some to take home. Taco Truck pilsner was great, Mama Pisner, and there was a pickle beer that was probably a tad too pickley for me (go figure).  Great/fun selection, good prices, knowledgeable staff, and lots of picnic tables out to keep you spread out and safe. You can get snacks too, or play Starship Troopers pinball (Do You Want To Know More?!?). We had  a good time just chilling there on a Sunday afternoon.  Oh, and they recycle those plastic can holders that craft breweries use. Bring yours back to help out the brewers in town!

reviews.author: Philip J.
reviews.description: Really impressive beer bar and shop in Cedar Park. If you're a bit of a beer geek, head over here and you're sure to find some new stuff you haven't tried before. If you're more beer curious, head over and chat with these friendly folks. They know their stuff and helped me to pick out some new beers.  There's a good range of price points here too so you could find a good gift here.   Website is also really useful and lists out everything they have if you like to head in with some ideas of what to grab.   Good atmosphere in there too if you're drinking in.   Overall highly recommend and glad they are here.

reviews.author: Paul R.
reviews.description: A craft beer lover's nirvana. Come here peruse their extensive inventory pick out a beer and enjoy either on site or grab a few brews to go. I could go on but that's it. Come here and drink good beer, but.  These guys got it goin (sic) on where else can you find a Maine Brewing Co beers or a selection of IPAs that will blow your mind.   Folks here are friendly and of course knowledgable and provide a high level of customer service. Case in point I was out of town and a pal informed me that they had a very hard to find beer available. These nice folks held my order until I arrived, almost at closing time.  Nice folks and righteous brews!

reviews.author: Meg K.
reviews.description: Such a cool spot. I don't live in Cedar Park but I'll be making regular trips here to check out the cool beverages!

reviews.author: Greg W.
reviews.description: Review time kids!! So the bride is out of town for business, what does any good husband do???? He meets some buds for suds!!   We all met at another place for happy hour when bud 1 recommend this place for some take home treats. I mean,come on, we know a beer-n-burger nut like me can't say no.  This place is totally chill with a few picnic tables to relax and converse with friends. There is also a couple of other chairs if that's your thing. Sampling on sight is totally cool too.  On to the selection of beers. All I can say is,if you can't find something here that you would like, go home,empty handed and admit you have no taste. That's right, I threw the blame squarely on you! Why? Because they must have better than 300-400 different beers to choose from!  Now go, prove me wrong and try that chocolate oatmeal stout or triple ipa !!

reviews.author: Whitney B.
reviews.description: I really can't say enough good things about the Brewtique.  They have an amazing variety of drinks and they're always bringing in new items. The team is incredibly helpful, very knowledgeable about their products, and all around just a couple of really cool folks.  Just tell them what you're in the mood for, and you'll absolutely receive a satisfying recommendation.  They're dog-friendly both in and outside, and are super welcoming to well-behaved pooches. They also do some really cool charity events on behalf of some great organizations. There's almost always something going on in the evenings -- live music, comedy shows, football games, game night, beer tastings.  They also have some neat retro arcade games and board games on hand to entertain.  There's always a reason to pop in and have a drinks!

reviews.author: Dan S.
reviews.description: Great place. Owner always remembers you and knows what you like. They keep an amazing selection that is always changing. If you want to try some beers they have tables inside and outside. Personally love the selection of Texas beers and sours they have.

reviews.author: Short Fuse S.
reviews.description: Just a fantastic place. I had a friend come in from San Antonio and he kept saying he wished there was a place like The Brewtique in his neighborhood. There's a great beer selection, and the owner is a really cool dude. Plus, they carry my favorite beer even though I'm the only one who buys it. That's dedication to customers!

reviews.author: Javier A.
reviews.description: What can I say about Brewtique that hasn't already been said? Great and various beers available here keep me coming back and back. Mgmt is top notch, friendly, and above all knowledgeable. I am always impressed with the ambiance. It feels like a great big community. Service with a smile and a laugh makes my trip there memorable. Also they have great events, live music, and  board games to boot! 3 cheers and a beer for Brewtique.

reviews.author: Jarod P.
reviews.description: Love this place. Great selection. Knowledgeable owners.  Fair prices.  If you remember this location when it was under previous owners, you'll find it's been nicely updated, more tables, chairs and such, even arcade games.  Keep up the good work Brewtique.

reviews.author: Matt M.
reviews.description: Cool little place, glad to see that the old bottle shop here was replaced by another. Owner(s?) seem to care a bunch, and have been available to point out new releases/limited beers, make recommendations, and take pics of my dog.   Prices slightly higher than other big retailers, but selection is much better (tip: check their Instagram for limited beers and new stock). Also, a good selection of CBD products for those interested. I have never hung around to drink there, but you can for a small per-beer charge if you want.   Hope this place keeps getting tasty limited beverages and doesn't turn into a vape emporium like the last one!

reviews.author: Catalina M.
reviews.description: Welcome to cedar park the brewtique! Had the absolute pleasure of coming here today. Great atmosphere, awesome beer selection and such a friendly welcoming owner.  The bottle shop that lived here prior (RIP) was great, but the new layout and even better beer selection really sets this place apart! Such a plethora of great beers and a cool little shop you can crack one open and enjoy it right there! Looking forward to my next visit!

reviews.author: kenneth m.
reviews.description: The Brewtique has the best selection of fresh beer in the area. Prices are more than fare, and the staff tends to go above and beyond to answer questions.  Bathroom is always clean and stocked with soft and plush 2-ply charmin, they don't skimp on the good stuff! The owner was quite nice and helped me carry my order to my car, even sent me a nice wink and a smile while I was pulling out.

reviews.author: Matthew M.
reviews.description: Need a beer? I mean a great beer? Do you want to enjoy it while killer music played? How about suggested by avid beer enthusiasts. Well, you're home. Enough said. This place hits all the check boxes. Fast WiFi for work, big tables for games. Endless beer.

reviews.author: Luis P.
reviews.description: Craft Beer. Wine. Cider. A great neighborhood little store that always has something that the big stores don't carry. All you have to do is to ask, and they'll give a great recommendation. It's probably the thing you'll always want to do as they carry seemingly hundreds of brands of beer.   And it seems like they are trying to bring more cool events to the Cedar Park area like Comedy nights and Movie nights. Check it out and check out their vintage pinball machines!

reviews.author: Justin C.
reviews.description: If you haven't been here, please stop by. This place is absolutely wonderful. Every time I go in, always greeted and asked if I need anything. There is always something special for a random night of the week. The price to pop a top is great, individual cans or packs is really nice. Exactly what a bottle shop should be. Looking forward to the future of this place. Best of luck.

reviews.author: Marion W.
reviews.description: Absolutely amazing. Great selection of beers. Really fun to pick out singles and drink them there or take them home for later. They have a lot of fun events throughout the week like game night, comedy night, and brewer educational events. The passion is obvious with the owners, and they're super friendly to boot. They're building a great community in a cool location. We love coming here and are so thrilled to have such a cool place so close to home!!

reviews.author: Christy B.
reviews.description: I love this place!  The beer selection is amazing, and the owners are above and beyond welcoming!  Every time I walk through the front door to grab one of their new arrivals, Scott and Jana greet me like an old friend.  Also it has so much more to offer than just beer, everything from game night to comedy shows and little bit everything else in between.

reviews.author: Jamie P.
reviews.description: What a cool place! I was meeting two others for a lunch and we decided to give it a try. They have an expansive patio area with seating to get some fresh air, but it's also enclosed so you're protected from the elements. There's also an indoor seating area, which is where we sat since it was a bit chilly out.   They make ordering easy by providing a QR code at your table where you can input your order through your phone, or you can walk up to the bar and order. They have an array of brews on tap and a few ciders too.   They mainly have apps, sandwiches, and salads. We ordered the Buffalo chicken dip - yum! It came with colored carrots, celery, and bread for dipping. We followed this with the pulled pork sandwich and the pimento and bacon jam sandwiches. Everything was good. The pimento and bacon jam sandwiches were quite rich and could easily be shared. Overall, I'd definitely recommend this place!

reviews.author: Krista B.
reviews.description: ELECTRIC JELLYFISH - okay, if you need me to say more than that, keep reading.  The newest rendition of Penthouse Brewing is NOT a pizza restaurant (honestly didn't realize that until I looked at the menu). Their newest location focuses on showcasing their brewing. The ambiance is really modern and trendy with TONS of space to feel like you can breathe (especially during these COVID times). The beer is wonderful, as always, and if you need a recommendation, refer to my first two words of this review.  Food order: - Texas Pretzel with cold whipped beer cheese - HUGE pretzel, so delicious! Admittedly, I could've lived without the beer cheese as it did not add enough flavor to really warrant the additional cost. - Whipped Burrata - Burrata is my second favorite cheese (to queso of course) so I HAD to order this. Basically it was a deconstructed caprese salad and I am all about it!  - Pulled Porker - To be honest, you could probably get better pulled pork at the 100+ BBQ restaurants Austin has to offer but it was very tasty and hit the spot!  If you are a newbie to the Pinthouse family or a regular, check out their new location - it will not disappoint!

reviews.author: Keay A.
reviews.description: When I heard the name Pinthouse, I wasn't expecting it to be as awesome as it was!   The atmosphere was so light and open, TVs mounted for entertainment, swinging chairs and a whole upstairs and of course, a brewery behind the bar.  I came here with a big group for a friend's birthday, the staff were incredible and they accommodated us all without hesitation.   I'm looking forward to the next visit!

reviews.author: Jeremy M.
reviews.description: Huge beautiful taproom that looks to be pretty new. We went on a Saturday and it was packed but were still able to find a table and get quick service. They had a great selection of beer and a couple of ciders on tap.  I didn't find any wine or liquor though so be aware if you have a non-beer drinker in your group.

reviews.author: San Juana M.
reviews.description: The atmosphere was awesome at Austin hot sandwiches was spicy  there was games and great musi.

reviews.author: Brian G.
reviews.description: Came across this while driving past it.  Great place with really friendly staff.  And the beer is amazing.  Try the sour beer.   Will definitely come back soon!

reviews.author: Daniel B.
reviews.description: My friend and I just came to Austin for our first time and The Pinthouse is near our hotel. We decided to walk the 27 minutes and check it out. This place is great! We tried the pickled shrimp and they were good. I had the seasonal Blood Orange Cider and it was good. The staff are amazing!! Kiki, Cotton and Kelsey were very nice. They made great recommendations on food places since we are foodies, helped me pick a stout (Autobahn is the stout) I actually like and only allowed me to get it in a smaller glass and most of all they have great personalities!! Check them out you won't be disappointed!

reviews.author: Steve H.
reviews.description: I am absolutely in love with the new Pinthouse! Their new space is amazing.   Now I'm no fan of pizza so the food at their other establishment was always kinda meh for me. I saw the menu here and at first was like who wants "sandwiches and hummus with beer".. boy was I wrong... I loved the boiled peanuts, the humus plate and the pimento cheese sandwich. All the food I was served at Pinthouse was fresh and tasty and I'll certainly go back for more.   Their IPA's are top notch as they always have been. They have a crowler for to go and do growler refills.   Go here. Have fun.

reviews.author: Gnet A.
reviews.description: We don't live too far from this place and we were looking for a new spot to take our guests from out of town to but it ended up just being us two. We weren't leaving until we tried some beer and food and we like the ambiance of the place. A person comes to greet you once you walk in and pretty much give you the low down of the place and how its runs. Service is friendly, helpful, and done exceptionally. They are doggie friendly too.   You only need to wear a mask when you go into the inner part of the place. It has a lot of space and a lounge area with a swinging seat, so it has that cool laid back type of vibe. You can scan the code on the napkin dispensers for the menus. I ordered the DEADLUS CHARM (Belgian Blonde) and hubby got the OF SOUND MIND (Fruit and Sour). For food, I got the chicken and Brie sandwich and hubby got the chicken sausage sandwich. They were both tasty and the food was delicious and fresh. We recommend, we will return, and make this spot one of our go-to for our hangouts.

reviews.author: Elizabeth M.
reviews.description: I went to Pinthouse with some friends for a Sunday afternoon lunch and had a great time! We got there in time for brunch, it ends at 3pm, so I decided to get their Rodeo Bagel and a potato cake. Unfortunately, they were out of actual bagels so they gave me a bun instead but it was still quite good. The potato cake, however, was absolutely amazing. It was perfectly crispy and topped with flaky salt, I think I could've eaten five of them alone and been happy. My main complaint about the setup is the fact that a big portion of the tables will get wet. We went during a huge storm and barely got a table because everything was either taken or wet. There was also supposed to be live music but they couldn't play because the stage was wet.   COVID Precautions: Masks are encouraged but not required. All employees were wearing masks though!

reviews.author: Dawn S.
reviews.description: We came here for an "end of school year- let's celebrate we survived teaching in a pandemic-we all have been vaxxed-and finally can be in the same room without a mask"-party!!   We had pre-ordered a bunch of food while everyone got their own beverages. The food was great and so was the service. I believe Stephanie was our waitress?   Ordering drinks was a little slow-they only had two people working the taps. We are on summer break so who cares?!? We had time to wait!  It is a great space: open-clean-and inviting. It has very tall ceilings which makes the space seem much bigger.   A few friends said they would come here back in the day when it was Midnight Rodeo. We heard a few fun stories.   I heard multiple people comment that they will come back- even a few that lived on the other side of town. I know I'll be back.

reviews.author: Kyle W.
reviews.description: Good beer, good food, good atmosphere. Hard to go wrong with anything at any of the Pinthouse locations.

reviews.author: Sarretta M.
reviews.description: We decided to try Pint House Brewing after receiving coupons in the mail. One was for a free salad or sandwich and one was for $10 off. We weren't sure where the location was, but following directions, we were able to find it just east of Woodward at Ben White on the southside access road. They really need better signage because the entrance is on the south side of a large warehouse-looking building.  But it is definitely worth finding! We were greeted at the outside patio which is wonderfully shaded and well set up for live music in the evenings. We were shown to a table and told to remember our table number before we went to order at the bar. All the staff were appropriately masked and social distancing seating was enforced.  To take maximum advantage of our coupons (because we will be leaving Austin in two weeks) we ordered separately. I ordered the Italian sandwich with a side salad and an iced tea.  My husband ordered a chicken Caesar salad, an iced tea, and a blackberry cider. The drinks were all self-serve which made keeping our glasses refilled easy.  Our food came out very quickly, as we were some of the first people seated. And it looked amazing when we got it! See photos. My sandwich was huge! The bread was perfect; soft inside and thick and crusty outside. The fillings were amazing with several kinds of meat and cheese and vegetables with a dressing. The flavor was outstanding and I made my husband try it because I knew he would like it too. My side salad was also terrific. The dressing was an olive oil vinaigrette that was just perfect and the homemade croutons made it that much more delicious.  My husband's blackberry cider was so good that he had me try it, and it was delicious! It was slightly sweet and full of flavor. His Caesar salad was huge! It had the same homemade croutons and an incredible garlic Caesar dressing that even I, a non-fish eater, liked.   Try this place! They appear to be owned by the same company as the Pinthouse Pizza locations in Austin, but they are focusing on their brewery, sandwiches and salads, and they are all delicious!

reviews.author: Amrita J.
reviews.description: Had been wanting to check this place out and wow, what a beautiful interior, does not give off "brewery vibes" at all.   For a brewery it is very modern with it's decor. Love the seating and the chandeliers and all of that when you first walk in, way to go whoever the interior decorator was!   That being said, let's move on to the real reason you're reading this.....you wanna know about the beer!   Well I decided to try their flight, which came with 5 different beers of your choice.   The most popular beer is the electric jellyfish, which is what I ended up settling on after my flights as well. They had also just released some new beers the day I went, and so I tried the "dude blueberry" which surprisingly as someone who isn't a fan of heavier beers, I actually enjoyed it. Don't know if I would've handled a full glass of it, but definitely enjoyed the trial version.   All in all, a great place to gather with friends, super chill and low key with a nice vibe.

reviews.author: Mindy H.
reviews.description: Pinthouse is one of my top five favorite breweries of all time. I am in love with their newest airport location. The space is beautiful. I love the indoor and outdoor dining space! Perfect for my pups to visit with me. The full restaurant menu is also exciting. Recently came here for Sunday brunch, which was amazing! Loved the gluten free breakfast sandwich! My friend loved the croissant sandwich!

reviews.author: Courtney B.
reviews.description: I came here about two weeks ago with a friend. We ordered two bottles of vino to share while we got all caught up. We sat towards the entrance of the establishment so we could enjoy the breeze and people watch. As we only purchased vino, I cant comment on the beer offerings. However, the beer offerings are mostly the same at the Round Rock location (my primary spot)  and beers offered there are excellent!   Happy Dining TX!

reviews.author: Stuart D.
reviews.description: Once again  Pinthouse Brewing rose to the occasion.  Love their beer.  The Chopped salad is one of my favorites.  Tried the pickled Shrimp and it was great.  Also ordered the Italian Griner, and beer to go.  Called in an order during the peak Friday night rush after getting into Austin and was facing a visitor from out of town AND a bare fridge if I went straight home, so I placed a carry out.  They had it ready to go for carry out as promised.  Everyone is happy!

reviews.author: Alex H.
reviews.description: Nice clean space.  We had the Birria dip and burrata salad, both were excellent.  Magical pils is fantastic.  Loved the QR code order/checkout at your table system, was very streamlined and easy to use.

reviews.author: Monica S.
reviews.description: Great food, kind staff, cool location. The ability to choose inside or outside depending on the weather makes this our go to place for meetings outside the office when we need to breathe but still get work done. Highly recommend the chicken and brie sandwich...I try other things but always end up needing to return a day or two later to get my fix!

reviews.author: Mike T.
reviews.description: Big fan of PHP. Made plans to check out the newest location. Got there with a hungry family and expectations of pizza and beer. Finding out after we finally get a table that they intact do not serve pizza was a huge let down. Why did they decided to invest in a massive location like this but not offer pizza!? Pizza + Beer is the tag line and the entire foundation of the brand. To have one location ( the largest and newest one) not offer half of what the existing customer base has come to love and expect is a massive miss step for the brand. Good thing Meanwhile Brewing Co. and Independence is right next door.

reviews.author: Mark S.
reviews.description: I really like this place. The beer is great, the Kolaches are tasty, the staff is nice. But twice I have been here and been chased out because the management has closed for a private party. That says to me that customers come second to people who can afford to buy out the place for their own amusement. I'm sorry to say I won't be back. Our group of six took our business to Oddwood down the street. We'll go back there again and skip Batch.

reviews.author: Lydia H.
reviews.description: I don't think I'd ever had a kolache before I moved to Texas. I was pretty unimpressed when I tried them from random donut shops around Austin. However, since trying Batch, I can declare that I LOVE kolaches. At Batch, the bread is so incredibly soft and fluffy. The jalapeno cheese and sausage is my favorite, with the pepperoni coming in as a close second. The sweet kolaches are also delicious and taste just like a donut! I always get a chai latte as well -- and it's so good, not too sweet!   The space is perfect to work out of -- it's relatively quiet, has ample seating and outlets. There's even an outdoor area with tons of picnic benches. The entire staff is super friendly and welcoming.

reviews.author: Steve L.
reviews.description: Cute spot that a friend in town had recommended I try for both the beer and kolaches. Lots of space inside, a decent amount of taps (maybe 8ish...for a smaller operation), has available beer to go (although sadly not the one on tap that I reeeeeally wanted lol), and an assortment kolaches - both sweet and savory.    The staff is super nice and laid back, and helpful on picking menu items/drafts when seeking recommendations. But, for at least my first beer, there was no recommendation needed. Earthly Pastry was a no-brainer. A peanut butter with vanilla (and milk sugar). As a PB stout fiend, this...was freaking delicious. If I didn't wander by around like 2pm, I would have definitely had another. I was a little upset they didn't have any canned to-go, but c'est la vie (and the staff/email support were super prompt after the server suggested I email someone to see if/when they might be canning).    Beer aside (and it's delicious), while I didn't have the kolaches, they looked delicious - though, the varieties that they happened to have out didn't really speak to me, likely because I just came from brunch at Nixta...and basically eating and drinking my way through Austin...food guilt prevailed. BUT, next time...definitely.  They also have a full-blown coffee bar and people come on by to came out like a Starbucks, with free wifi n all - and I'll admit, I did find a seat next to an outlet for some charge time. It's just...a very chill, cool place tailoring to a spectrum of clientele. Good stuff!

reviews.author: Jazel M.
reviews.description: I haven't been in Texas in a while... So I just want to be clear that they don't really have kolaches in other states especially in the Northeast.... Which is really weird when it comes to people bringing things for breakfast. That means no breakfast tacos and it definitely means no kolaches - just donuts all the time haha  So of course the first thing I did was go to Shipleys but it didn't hit the spot? My husband found this place just driving by and got these. YUM. First of all they're huge. I loved the jalapeo cheese (pictured) I basically ate it in 30 seconds and which he'd gotten me two! Place looks like it has great vibes so need to sit in sometime!

reviews.author: Hailey W.
reviews.description: It's ok. Kolaches aren't warmed up so that bothers me. It's located near my house which is a plus and there's a large outdoor area.

reviews.author: Kaitlyn R.
reviews.description: *Masks Required to enter*  This is the place for Kolaches! The flavors are rich and they're generously filled. Both savory and sweet kolaches were mouth watering. I loved the bread, it's so soft.  My favorites were Pear with earlygrey tea and Lemon (flavor of the day), Pepperoni with Cheese, and Jalapeo Sausage with Cheese.   They serve beer on tap, canned beer and house/brewed coffee.  Outside seating area is spaced out nicely for social distancing and is covered by trees. Plenty of seating, so bring some friends!  We'll be back to try more for sure.

reviews.author: Doug P.
reviews.description: Be honest, wasn't impressed.   I liked the backyard vibe and the picnic table approach, but the beer selection seemed a little unimpressive.  For as highly rated as it was it was a bit of a let down.

reviews.author: Jenna S.
reviews.description: They just started brewing their own beer and it's so yummy! I love seeing bands here - they have a calendar and the show we saw was so low-key and cozy.

reviews.author: Cam W.
reviews.description: Great place to chill with friends, dog etc. Tasty kolaches and good Java. HOWEVER, if you are going to go so slow that people have to wait 30 minutes in line for a pastry, coffee etc then the least y'all could do is provide adequate and accessible WiFi. Absolutely terrible. Didn't work and compete waste of a trip here.

reviews.author: Stacie H.
reviews.description: Delish! Every kolache I've tried (sweet and savory) has been solid. I always opt to warm them up so they're extra toasty. I recently tried the iced chai for the first time and was really impressed!  The back patio is well kept and now has even more spaced out tables for relaxing. Also a nice option for a quick grab and go.

reviews.author: Patrick M.
reviews.description: Ordered 3 kolaches to go early in the day. Had to go around to the back patio as the interior is closed due to the lingering elements of the pandemic. The kolaches were quite good. I ordered the: jalapeo sausage and cheese, ham and cheese and the pepperoni. I look forward to when they are fully opened again.

reviews.author: Misha T.
reviews.description: Went with the classic sausage/cheese/jalapeno kolache and was not disappointed. It's quality stuff. Great tasting sausage, good dough. Make sure to let them warm it up for you.

reviews.author: Joseph V.
reviews.description: Came here for drinks on a Saturday night with friends. They were sold out of Kolaches for the day. But fortunately they were not sold out of great craft beer! Staff was very helpful and friendly. Would recommend as a chill place to catch up with friends. Will certainly be back!

reviews.author: Mindy H.
reviews.description: Second time at the outdoor oasis of Batch. Incredible bites, brew, and coffee. Escape from the crazy and relax in an outdoor oasis of Batch. Food is good, but done early. Coffee and beer excellent.

reviews.author: Nathan F.
reviews.description: It took me too long to come here, tons of new beers every week plus incredible kolaches is a great combination that will keep me coming back more. Love their collaborations with several local breweries and the various kinds they have. If you love Hazys or stouts in general you'll love this place and their huge patio

reviews.author: Carlie L.
reviews.description: Really delicious kolaches and beer! I had the vegan sausage kolache and the hazy IPA. Would definitely return if (when) we find ourselves back in Austin!

reviews.author: Tiana W.
reviews.description: Tasty and delicious! Chocolate wasn't my favorite but the sausage jalapeo was really good w a nice little bite to it. Fresh tasting dough as well.

reviews.author: Amber S.
reviews.description: Was visiting a friend who brought me here for brunch! Plenty of distanced outdoor seating. Simple but sufficient menu consisting of sweet and savory kolaches, coffee, beer, and more. Ordering was simple, and food and drinks came out quick and fresh. I got the pepperoni kolache, veggie sausage and cheese kolache, and Alishan beer. Both kolaches were fantastic, but I had a slight preference for the veggie one! (It's a vegetarian sausage, not veggies + sausage.) I'd recommend getting 2 kolaches if you're not too hungry and 3 if you are. The beer was light, and I believe it was infused with tea and honey. And they filled it to the brim! Definitely worth the $5. In total, my meal came out to $13-14 before tip. Would definitely come again. Great atmosphere.

reviews.author: Lindsey O.
reviews.description: We were super excited that Batch opened their own food truck and were anxious to try (the bbq place moved). The FT doesn't open until 3, at least on weekends, so we had to wait a little while once getting there. With their new covid- outdoor only ordering for beer it's hard to order anything else but their own brewed beer because the other cans they have are in a window display 6ft away. But, their beer is good, like this new carrot cake beer is pretty unique!  For their sausages, the price/quality is pretty good at around $6.50 each. The only bummer was the bun, it was too thick, dense and the sausage and toppings just sat on top. It was a little difficult to eat, but the flavors were great.

reviews.author: Yunny D.
reviews.description: Since Covid, we have been enjoying their amazing outdoor space which has a ton of picnic benches that are so well spaced.  Now they have a food truck on site 3-9pm with sausages and Belgium fries, which are so good and so reasonably priced.   Love this place.

reviews.author: Kourtney S.
reviews.description: The inside/outside atmosphere is really cool being in an old home/building that has been redone to preserve the old age beauty. I spent my time at the patio bar. Both bartenders were such a joy; not only to myself but everyone. They spent the necessary time greeting everyone and helping to figure out how to get to a table asap. Even among small conversations between tables, the bartenders were on top of their serving game.   I have had the waterloo and center cut pork chop. I'm not usually a pork kinda person but the peach chutney was SO good. It was the perfect amount of food and tasted so yummy.   I will definitely go back when I am in Austin. This is the type of place to visit with friends and family for a great evening of sharing small plates, good drinks, and lots of laughs. Or it's old-timey beauty makes it a wonderful date night place. Or grab a cocktail and sit on the front porch people watching... the diversity of the restaurant is really for any occasion.   I can't wait to visit for a weekend brunch!   Thanks so much for the food, drinks, and amazing service!

reviews.author: Yzabelle O.
reviews.description: If you need a date night spot for a cozy dinner then @moonshine_atx is the place to be    #moonshineatx has added on additions to the restaurant, and their new bar area is intimate and cozy; Perfect for dinner or grabbing a drink    We ordered: Food  The original Moonshine corn dog shrimp served with honey mustard + blueberry dipping sauce   Baked macaroni with pimento cheese + bacon gratin   Jalapeo hanger steak served with garlic mashed potatoes   Chicken fried steak with chipotle cream gravy and garlic mash   Drinks  @mcphersoncellars 2019 Sangiovese  Dessert  Cobbler of the day: Apple and cranberry cobbler   Sera the bar manager was our server. She was knowledgeable about the wines, especially @mcphersoncellars and was a great help in selecting a great wine to accompany dinner   This was our first time trying Texan wine and it was oh so good!   If you're only looking to grab drinks or even a drink after dinner, Moonshine recently opened a Speakeasy inside the restaurant. @kinfolkaustin can be found downstairs and it's by reservation only    Moonshine has been a favorite dinner spot of ours and we always look forward to each meal here. Highly recommend for the food, experience, and service  Big thank you again to Sera to making our dinner experience even more enjoyable.

reviews.author: Jacky C.
reviews.description: #2 most reviewed spot in Austin and it did not disappoint. Southern food usually means being unhealthy and my ever failing diet goes further down the rabbit hole. No regrets what-so-ever.  We got here around 7PM where we had a 5 minute wait before a table opened up for the two of us. I got to see how massive this restaurant was as we were lead to a heated tent, which was set up adjacent to the building. The table comes with free popcorn, but we had to ask the server about it as they were never pre-served before we arrived. NBD.  I started off with a Good Hearted Old Fashion ($13). First thing I noticed was that the glass was only half full, but it's supposed to be like this due to the nature of the drink. Tastes great and it's the popular drink ordered. Just sip slowly.  For appetizers, we split the Fried Green Tomatoes ($12) with smoked shrimp, tomatillo aioli, and pimento. Pretty much a way to saying you weren't all that unhealthy, when in reality it's also battered and fried. The smoked shrimp makes it worth ordering from a price perspective and they happen to taste great together.We also ordered The Original Moonshine Corn Dog Shrimp ($12), fancy enough to their own trademark on it. Came with a honey mustard dipping sauce. Tastes pretty good, but it wasn't unique as I've had similar items like this, just not served on a stick.  For the entree to split, we got the Chicken Fried Steak ($18), essentially a giant batter fried chicken with chipotle cream gravy and yukon mashers. This alone between the two of us along with the appetizers was enough to fill us up generously. Tasted amazing and an excellent option if you're not feeling the pork or beef, essentially tired of consuming BBQ all week.  Overall, great food, great service, and a great experience. Would recommend making a stop here if you're making a stop in Austin.

reviews.author: Alex F.
reviews.description: EXPECT TO WAIT!! If you are trying to find convenient parking, they offer valet. Went up to the hostess stand and for a table of two, got quoted at least 90 minutes. That was a true 90 minutes. We were lucky enough to get a seat at the bar after 20 minutes but people who checked in around us were not so lucky. Even after people turned in their pagers and left, the wait was still true. While you wait you can order drinks and appetizers at the bar. The bartenders were friendly, helpful and attentive. We ordered Brussel Sprouts, Chicken Fried Steak, Chicken and Waffles and Banana Pudding. My favorite part was the Brussel Sprouts. They were simple, slightly sweet and cooked nicely. The chicken and waffles were good. It seemed like there is cornmeal in the waffle. I enjoyed this as I thought the similar taste to corn bread really preserves the savory part of this dish. The chicken fried steak was just alright. Expected more after hearing it was the 3rd best in the state. The pudding was great. Great flavor but if you like an abundance of wafers it might not be for you. Overall, this place is great if you do not mind the wait. I do not think I would wait that long for it again.

reviews.author: Michael A.
reviews.description: In an effort to clear out more of my old review drafts, I'll be posting some that are long overdue. Unfortunately, some of the finer details are now lost in memory, but Moonshine Patio Bar and Grill was our last meal in Austin, Texas. It was for a Sunday brunch (8/15/2021).  Conveniently located in Downtown, we were actually able to walk here from the hotel. At over 5.1k reviews, this would definitely appear to be one of the most popular restaurants in the city. That said, I was pretty interested to see what it was all about.  To eat, I ordered the steak and eggs. It took a little while to get our food, but service was friendly. The place was packed, as expected. Overall, I thought the food was good. The atmosphere is what really stood out to me though. While I wasn't super impressed by the food, I would not be opposed to returning.

reviews.author: Haley Z.
reviews.description: Came for the Whiskey selections and left pretty happy with trying that out! We sat out in the back covered patio area which is cozy. The food was very good, but not amazing. I think it's a fair price point for being downtown and being a more talked about Austin restaurant. My pork chop dish was ($22), looked good but tasted like nothing special. I would come back to try the brunch, but I'm not rushing back for anything other than the drinks and outside atmosphere.   It took a long time to get our food even though there was only 2 other small tables of customers outside and a few inside. Our waitstaff was very attentive and had great recommendations for drinks after talking to her a bit. They have vast options for drinks and drink deals on certain nights which is why we stopped by.  Street parking is a hassle here, especially on the weekends, but luckily it's close to a lot of places downtown and makes for an easy walk.

reviews.author: Christina H.
reviews.description: Despite the high ratings, I was underwhelmed with Moonshine Patio Bar and Grill... I came in for brunch and ordered the Chicken Fried Steak. Moonshine is the definition of a southern brunch, as there are no light meals here! The Chicken Fried Steak was nothing extravagant, comparable to Jack Allen's.

reviews.author: Marcus R.
reviews.description: My friends and I came here for dinner the other night. I want to say that Yelp led me right with the photos and recommendations. Everything with the Yelp Hype is real. This place and environment overall is awesome. The staff here was  is really great! Plenty of seating, but I can see how this place would have wait when it's busy.   The place has a outdoor heated seating. It was very warm and toasty comfortable. The sliding door of the patio, you could feel like the Hulk when you're trying to open it.  All the beers we had were in a can, and we came just at the right time for happy hour. As other Yelpers stated I was truly amazed with the prices and portions of the food. I had the pork chop and man that chop was so delicious!! Another buddy of mine had the same thing. Another one had the turkey club sandwich and that thing was huge!  We also ordered some pretzel sticks and those were the perfect appetizers. You also get a bucket of free popcorn.  One thing about coming here it's easy to find; however, parking may be a bit of challenge when busy. We lucked out during our visit here and were able to park right on the front of the building.  I definitely want to come back and try some other items on the menu. Great food, drinks, and the prices are right here!

reviews.author: Cathy O.
reviews.description: We came to Austin and Moonshine was the first lunch place we hit up, based on a friend's recommendation.  I wasn't super hungry, so decided to try the cornflake battered chicken salad. The chicken was excellent. Crunchy on the outside and very moist inside. The salad came with 3 large pieces. But my problem was that I dumped the dressing throughout the salad so was therefore stuck with it. And I thought it was a not great honey mustard dressing. I am usually not at all picky, but the dressing was too thickly and too mustardy. If half stars were an option, I'd give my salad a 3.5.  My husband ordered the chicken steaks smothered in a white gravy, and really liked it. Before our entrees came, we were brought a large basket of popcorn. That was a nice touch.

reviews.author: Ramona A.
reviews.description: My salad was amazing! It's actually called a grain bowl... order it! I had an old fashion and a whiskey sour that were also delicious. I wish I would have tried the moonshine.

reviews.author: Caryn N.
reviews.description: Let me just share how fresh the food was. I ordered an amazing salad and added a few extra items to set it off.  I believe my friend ordered a steak with grits and I wanted to take his plate as well as mine.    The service was amazing and the atmosphere is on point. I will be returning even if it's a 48 ago but the experience is quite intense and is great for any type of meet up for business and personal.

reviews.author: Brian B.
reviews.description: On a trip to Austin, we came across Moonshine and really enjoyed our dinner here.  We started with the pretzel sticks and pimento cheese as our appetizer - so good! The pimento was very flavorful and the pretzel sticks were baked to PERFECTION.  For my entree I had one of their fried chicken sandwiches. The chicken patty was very thin compared to most fried chicken sandwiches I've had, but the flavor was still there in every bite. The accompanying fries were yummy as well!  NOTE: on Mondays they have 50% off wine bottles. Just in case that's useful for you ;)

reviews.author: Michelle L.
reviews.description: New Year's Day, came for lunch. We waited for about 30 minutes, but they have a bar in the back while you wait. It was walking distance from our hotel on Third Street.  We got seated at the patio outside for a party of 5, and they adjusted the shade for us since the sun was in our face.   The service was okay, the food was pretty good. The size of that chicken friend steak was definitely Texas size! The cocktails were delicious. We even got a flight of moonshines, but that was a bit hard to drink. It was way to sweet for me personally.   Overall: Cleanliness: 8/10 Food: 8/10 Service: 7/10

reviews.author: Ria G.
reviews.description: Visiting Austin and decided to check this place out for some wonderful Southern food. Everything we ordered for brunch was extremely tasty and flavorful.   If you're looking for something on the lighter side, go for the Migas. Both the Beyond Veggie Burger and Backyard Chicken Sandwich hit the spot as well. They even accommodated my friend's request to switch the bread to a biscuit. The sauce that comes with the Sweet Potato Tater Tots is phenomenal.   They have great heated outdoor seating (tent style), wonderful servers, and generally a great atmosphere!

reviews.author: Ted G.
reviews.description: This restaurant just kind of pulls you in from the street. Being one of the oldest buildings in Austin, this place is obviously well known, and we were lucky to get in.   The atmosphere inside the restaurant just emanates southern charm and the menu offers some excellent southern comfort food entrees. Any time I find an appetizer not normally seen on a menu, I have to try it, and in this case, it was the deviled eggs.   I typically don't have the courage to try anyone else's deviled eggs because I am very picky when it comes to those, so I swore they better be good and they were very good. They were creamy, flavorful and had no pesky surprises like celery or relish.  One thing I never thought I would eat for dinner is chicken and waffles and being in Austin I decided I had to try. I was impressed with the seasoning of the chicken and the light breading. The waffles were fluffy, they came with plenty of butter and syrup. This entree was the epitome of sweet and salty, and a little bit spicy.  The staff are great, the drinks are great, and the atmosphere is alive. Cheers!

reviews.author: Joy D.
reviews.description: I seen this this place on yelp and people was talking bout it. Im not impressed @ all. I'm  cut to the chase, my friend order chicken and waffle and it had hair 2x.  For real, how the fuck we spend the food back the first time, and came back with hair again. Smh.. I'm pissed!!! The manager came and apologize.  She was sincere,  and offered us round of minomas, we declined and left. I'll definitely not come back again.  The only positive is my server Tony was great!!

reviews.author: Derek R.
reviews.description: Decided to take a break from bbq and try something different. After a quick yelp search decided on this place and glad we did. It was an easy walk from our hotel in downtown Austin so that was a plus. They start you off with popcorn which is something different and nice. The popcorn was jazzed up with what I believe to be garlic and paprika and was amazing.  I got the old fashioned and wife got a drink called the fiddler which was whiskey spiced up with jalapeo. Both were really really good.  For an app we got the deviled eggs. Got to say not impressed. They used a lot of mustard and neither me or the wife cared for them.  For a main course we shared the chicken fried steak with mashed potatoes. It was absolutely enough for both of us and must say it was delicious. We also shared a side salad.  For desert we shared a banana pudding. Let me tell you order this it's fantastic.  The staff were very friendly and helpful and the ambiance of this place was also super nice and unique.  Definitely recommend and would come back.

reviews.author: Corrie S.
reviews.description: A fun spot for breakfast, brunch or lunch!  The first thing I'll say...GET THERE AS ITS OPENING. We showed up a few minutes before it opened and had a 15 min wait! Had we gotten there later, I think we'd have had to wait quite a while. Its flooded with customers on the weekend! Curious what it would be like during the week?   Service was wonderful! Our waiter was fun, knowledgeable and attentive! I think that was the case across the staff. They take the service seriously!   The food is decadent! It's heaping portions with a southern flare. I got the green chili hash that was pretty good. My favorite part of the meal was the biscuits we ordered as an appetizer. Delicious!   This is a great spot! My friends and I enjoyed it! The menu is pretty straightforward. You'll walk away full of yummy food.

reviews.author: Davidm A.
reviews.description: Ok this place is delicious and very busy butt well worth every second of the wait. My wife got the chicken fried steak. Which was a big as "bigfoot" foot print. And greatly mouth watering. I got the jalapeo shutter steak which at first site looks small but will fill you and and have you in an awww that was good. Marissa our server was very attentive and could run us through the whole menu and make sure that we choose what we were craving. They start you off with popcorn at your table for some finger food and homemade cornbread with every meal. My wife also said that there moonshine was very smooth to the taste and went well with the meal. High recommend coming and eating at this reatraunt. Try and make sure you get Marissa she is great server.

reviews.author: Ginger B.
reviews.description: Great place loved the food!! I had the Salisbury steak and it was very tasty also my friend had the roasted Romain salad  So good!

reviews.author: Elvira A.
reviews.description: Last Stand is my neighborhood brewery! I love everything about this place. The beer selection is pretty damn good! Favorite being the Citra Smash IPA! I've had pizza, fried pickles, and crawfish here, and all of them pass the YUM test! Plus they have great happy hour specials, which is always wonderful for our pocketbooks. The vibe is chill and PAW friendly.

reviews.author: Julie H.
reviews.description: Beer, friendly bar staff and overall vibe of this place is 5 stars.  Value of food is a heartbreaking 1 star. Burger and fries for $12? Fine if the burger is decent size. We were both surprised when we were served P Terry's size burgers and less than 1/2 the fries. Honestly, nothing wrong with the portion size but it was absolutely not worth $12. The burger is clearly a frozen patty and the bun wasn't even warmed.   Just read through all the reviews and a HUGE props to the staff for enforcing mask wearing when it was required. That's enough reason for me to come back. We'll support this business and drink the great beer. We'll skip the food though.

reviews.author: Yelp Y.
reviews.description: It's a decent spot.  Big warehouse with a nice little outdoor nook populated with picnic tables.  Food in terms of the "loaded" fries leaves a lot to be desired (they're not really "that" loaded, so the price for the product is absurd); the pickles tasted good but the fry was quite irregular; the spinach artichoke dip is delicious but the chips cannot lift the dip without you helping them along, either by doubling up or scooping with a utensil.  Beer is alright.  One of the lagers is so-so but the raspberry sour is pretty good.

reviews.author: Melissa G.
reviews.description: Super excited to have another brewery in the South Congress area to go enjoy some tasty as heck beers and get in your order for some Southside Flying Pizza or other tasty snacks and items on their menu!  This location will forever be in my heart as the first time I ever stepped foot here was when we were in desperate need for some warm food, cold beer, and water.  Beers:  I have been enjoying the melon + grapefruit notes in their Simcoe Pale Ale as well as their summer seasonal ale Vaquero Ranchers lager that is just easy and smooth to drink down on a summer day.  Unsure what to get - check out their crowlers to-go and canned beers! I grabbed a sixer to take home with me the last time we were here just so I can try the variety of other options they have here.  OH! Also I noticed they have a frozen drink machine too!  check it out for me, eh?!  Food:  We came here on a weekend and there was a crawfish broil happening to our surprise!  Easy to order online, at your table, and/or at the counter. I really love the option to order directly from your table and be able to pay without having to get up and go to the counter especially if you are nailing that ping pong game against your friends!  We really enjoy ordering and eating pizza here as Southside Flying Pizza nails it every time and there is enough to enjoy with everyone.   Outside / Inside:  all COVID safety measures are practiced here and taken seriously both inside and outside.  There is PLENTY of seating outside and ample amount of space to move around without it feeling crowded at all.  Snovid: When we experienced about 5 days without water we noticed that Last Stand Brewing were offering water fill ups. We grabbed our containers and made the quick drive down South Congress to get our fill.  I am SUPER appreciative of the kindness, ease, and availability to be able to get some water for our needs during the snowpocalypse that all of Texas experienced.  I will forever be in debt to Last Stand as the showed their genuine willingness to help their community out in a time of extreme need.  THANK YOU, Last Stand! You are truly a life saver.  I appreciate your kindness and help always!

reviews.author: Alysha M.
reviews.description: We weren't huge fans of the beers unfortunately, but glad to have a new option in south Austin! They have a lot of space with games, Southside pizza, and dogs are welcome :)

reviews.author: Sara F.
reviews.description: I discovered The Last Stand at the original location in Dripping Springs two years ago.  I'm  so happy that they opened a larger 2nd location in my SoCo neighborhood. It's by far my favorite brewery in Austin, they always serve great beer, good service, live music and delicious pizza.  I celebrated my birthday there with close friends and everyone was impressed.

reviews.author: Brooke P.
reviews.description: Great neighborhood spot, great atmosphere and super friendly staff.  I love the beers here, they have a solid selection.  The space is very large as well if you want to bring the whole crew.

reviews.author: Nicole D.
reviews.description: Well we gave it a try, so sister and I stopped here for a nice cold beer last night. We were stopped when walking in the door by a rude ass employee (dark curly hair with glasses) literally yelling at us about a mask from across the room full of people. We are fully aware some spots still require masks and as we tried to ask if we can sit outdoors she rudely interrupted us and continued to tell us she won't serve us unless we have a mask. Shit lady haven't you ever heard of customer service or even normal communication. She could have approached us and explained their policy it was not necessary to demean us for making a mistake.      We walked outside my sister was livid and embarrassed. I talked her into staying and me walking in with my mask since she has forgot hers and her sitting outside on the bench area. I saw the employee again and asked if we could sit outside at a table which was our original plan (if she listened and didn't scold us like children) she said I can order since I have a mask but my sister can't leave the table with a complete attitude. I ordered got the beers, drank them and we left.      The beers are good but not worth the rude inappropriate staff. There are plenty of local breweries with good vibes and good beer! Don't waste your time.

reviews.author: Jennifer M.
reviews.description: It is always great to have new breweries on the south side of Austin.  This is a great addition.  They have a large variety of brews as well as some wines and proseccos.  They have a fairly big outdoor area and indoor area.  They also have bar games inside and dogs are welcome.  The beers were cold and some were pretty tasty.  The food was just okay.  Hope to come back and try some new beers.

reviews.author: Peyton G.
reviews.description: I went on a Monday and they have the best deals!   A large pizza for $9 bucks or a burger and beer for $10!  The pizza was good and the wings were average. I love wings so they didn't disappoint. The bartender was nice. They have pool and a couple of other games. Beer is brewery price like 6-9. There are sports playing. Single and couple or group of friends. Pretty chill I would come again. They had a stage so I wonder if they have shows?

reviews.author: J P.
reviews.description: I love this place.  Beers are great and they have slushy drinks too.  Super large space with lots of tables.  The staff here is also very friendly.

reviews.author: Taylor P.
reviews.description: If you enjoy being harassed over a mask policy still while you drink mediocre at best beer, this spot is for you! Last stand more like Last Time, cause it's the last time I'll stop in.. Nothing Texas about this place either, decor is lame duck and outside tables are disgusting..

reviews.author: Marc C.
reviews.description: My friends and I enjoy the atmosphere, but we frequently don't get good service here. The bartenders don't seem to be on the same page as far as pour amounts go, either. Depending on the bartender, you may get a tap beer in a small plastic cup or a pint glass. I asked a female bartender why that was, and she said they do either "double" or "single" pours. I went back the following week and asked for a double pour of the same beer from the week before - this time with a different male bartender - and he said they only do beers in pint glasses. I guess there is a lack of communication on that front but it's resulting in customers asking for double pours and being charged more for what should be the normal amount of beer and frankly that doesn't sit right with me.  The value of the food from Southside Flying Pizza is also overpriced. The quality of the food is not equal to what they're charging, and they're frequently out of menu items and condiments by the evening. I've never been for lunch but their "special" is a slice of pizza for $4, which hardly seems like a special to me considering the quality of the pizza.  They make tasty beer, though!

reviews.author: Michael H.
reviews.description: If you're looking for your neighborhood bar, look no further. Beer is cold and the food is good! Ashley helped me and I felt at home! Live music Thursday - Saturday! Check this place out! I will be back, again!

reviews.author: Amanda K.
reviews.description: A great new addition to the neighborhood!! Plenty of outdoor and open air seating, and they are on point with covid precautions. The beers are good and they have some guest taps which is nice. They also serve south side pizza and have tons of games. A great place to hang out; and family friendly.

reviews.author: Jake A.
reviews.description: I believe this location just recently opened. I ordered a couple of six packs off their site for pick up to see what their beer was like. I tried the Craftsman Light and Texas Forever. Both were great tasting brews. They were both light with very distinct flavor notes from each other. I loved them both! They also went well with food as they are crisp light beers with a smooth finish. Glad that this place is nearby, I plan on grabbing some beer from here on a regular basis.

reviews.author: Ryan M.
reviews.description: This location just opened and our experience was great! We brought our two dogs and they were able to place some picnic tables out front in their parking lot. Food purchase required with beer so we got chips and queso with our Hefe and Citra IPA. Really good stuff.

reviews.author: Paul L.
reviews.description: Nice draft beer selection and a good amount of seating. The outdoor patio is a great spot for conversation and hanging out on a nice night. It's great to have another brewery in South Austin. The overall taste of the food and drinks are OK (there's better beer and pizza in Austin in general), but the staff is friendly, the location is convenient, they're pet friendly, and their prices are fair. Definitely worth a visit and will be back.

reviews.author: Rob S.
reviews.description: Great beer and the best pizza I've had since moving to Austin.   The Southsider pizza and the West Coast IPA were GREAT!!!

reviews.author: Rudy S.
reviews.description: Best beer on the "Planet"  Sad to see original tasting room move. However we are super excited for new location!  When available go for the Silverback!!  Busch League ranks high too.   Every Saturday should have a few Bucket Heads on the menu!  That is all.   Werd

reviews.author: Leila R.
reviews.description: Came in on a gorgeous spring Saturday afternoon and enjoyed my free...yes free...beer tasting here. Now, the "free" tasting is 3 tastes of anything they have on the board in the little taster glasses. There is an option to purchase full pours which includes a glass.  I have always been a fan of Thirsty Planet's beer offerings as I have had them at several brewpubs around Austin. Their Buckethead and Double Buckethead are my handsdown favorites! When I was out and about and headed to some other breweries, I stopped in here and was happy I did.  The staff was very nice and there is ample communal seating inside and out. They also offer tours, but I did not take one as I was a bit tight on time.   For a glorious afternoon in a chill atmosphere with great beer offerings and a little roadtrip out of Austin, this is a great place to spend it!

reviews.author: Fernando V.
reviews.description: Nice brewery with a good selection of beers. We happened to show up during an event so we got to hang out in the breezy back and sample LOTS of beer which was great. No food and a little warm so keep that in mind when making a visit

reviews.author: Christine A.
reviews.description: Just get the Thirsty Goat. It is a crowd favorite. We stopped in on a recent Pub Crawl and the place was hopping. Since they don't sell food, your pup is welcome and we had fun lovin' on some sweet dawgs! Uh, the four legged ones.  They are great at working the crowd and selling their beer glasses. Katherine was there at the door on the one day (Saturday) that we stopped by to explain how it works. Lots of t-shirts and ball caps to pick through and new fun people to meet. Everyone's happy with a beer.  I also love that Thirsty Planet supports Divine Canines, a therapy dog group that sponsors training for dogs to service hospital patients. Just wish they were open for more than 4 hours a week. Rumor has it this outstanding brewery will soon move to a new much larger space on South Congress.

reviews.author: Heihachiro K.
reviews.description: The Buckethead IPA was awesome! 8.9% and full of deliciousness. I was rather impressed by this brewery and how similar the atmosphere and brews were to the San Diego brew scene.  We got a great deal - take home pint glass with three pints for $10! Sweet!

reviews.author: Khiem L.
reviews.description: I came here on the first leg of a drinking bonanza. The weather was behaving and so we grabbed a table outside and started boozing it up. It's cheap to get a few pours and most everything there is close to some ambrosia of sorts. I've definitely had the goat everywhere so I was glad to try the only-found in-house bevs.   I do not like IPAs so what did I try first, the double bucket head IPA of course. Awesome taste. Not so bitter but leaves you feeling good. Pretty strong so it was a great way to start the morning. I can't recall the other beers I tried but I do remember leaving happy.

reviews.author: Amy G.
reviews.description: Stop one of three for a brewery tour...   I had three of their beers: Lemon Bitch - Special beer on tap. I don't have any of the ABV info but it had a nice lemon taste to it. Very refreshing for the hot weather.  Thirsty Goat - American-style Amber Ale, 6.5% ABV. Had a nice spicy finish with the beer.  Yellow Armadillo - Light American-style Wheat, 4.0% ABV. Very refreshing. Had some citrus flavors in there.   There is a nice outside area with picnic tables and plenty of seating inside and out.   The guys there were so nice. Very engaging and informative when it comes to the beer info.   When I make it back to Austin, I'll definitely be stopping by again.

reviews.author: Ron U.
reviews.description: Stopped by for a tasting. There are a wide variety of flavors and I especially liked the Palehead. The outdoor "patio" area is lacking but the indoor tasting area makes up for it. From what I understanding they are opening another place soon.  Take advantage of the "Barks for Beer" sale. $20 for a special pint glass that's good for a free pint in several restaurants and other breweries.

reviews.author: El S.
reviews.description: Thirsty planet was the first stop on a brew bus tour I went on.  So I remember it the best.  The only think I didn't like was their smoky beer.  But it's not like I didn't know it would be smoky.  I ordered it anyway and didn't like it so that's on me.  Regarding the brewery itself, it was a well thought out taproom with quality beers.  I liked that they have games to play - always a plus for me.

reviews.author: Sarah G.
reviews.description: More like 4.5. We had a great post-Zoo visit here on a sweaty Saturday afternoon. $10 for a sweet glass and three pints always works for me. They'll also give you a small tasting glass for free, but why bother with that?   I've been a fan of Thirsty Goat amber for awhile, and this visit turned me on to the Hoppy Blonde and Buckethead IPA. I'll be looking for all of them at local bars.  The "tour" is one room, but hey they're a small business, which is cool. Very informative, maybe more than the average beer fan will want, but beer nerds will love it and it's not hard to step out and back to the bar if you get bored.   One downside, it was super stuffy in the tasting room. Not sure if their AC was acting up or just couldn't handle the crowd and the July heat. However, that didn't stop my group for staying and drinking until closing time. I'd recommend Thirsty Planet to any beer lover visiting or living in Austin.

reviews.author: Rachel E.
reviews.description: Stopped by the brewery for a birthday beer crawl. (Is it really a crawl if you only go to 2 places?)  We signed up for the tour online (which is free) but there was no list and it seemed like they weren't going to do the tour at all. You might have to remind them. Once we mentioned our interest, they announced it and a bunch of people joined in. I'm not sure reservations are really needed at all for this. The tour was fine, nothing to write home about. If you've done a tour before you've probably seen everything they have.  I liked a lot of the beer we had, especially the thirsty goat ale. They were out of the wheat but had a rhubarb beer which was interesting.  Staff were friendly and when not totally overwhelmed with people, happy to engage in conversation about the beers.   It did get quite crowded and I understand why. The outdoor patio is lovely when the weather is nice and they have tons of games. For me it was a bit too crowded and noisy, but that's the small price you pay for free - $10 beer. (You can either get 3 tickets for a small glass for free or 3 pint tickets + a keepsake glass for $10.)

reviews.author: Nina H.
reviews.description: Checked out their brewery tasting and tour this past Saturday.  Warning: there are times it will be quite crowded like when bus loads of people stop by.  However, even despite the crowds, the bartenders did a great job of serving everyone.  $10 gets you a souvenir pint glass and three full pints (plus you can taste a few oz of the other beers they have for no additional charge, so really you can taste 7-8 taps for $10).  Their yellow armadillo and thirsty goat are both solid crowd and palate pleasers.  I liked their merch as well, bought a ladies tee for $18.  The tour was about 25 minutes long, but it was the hottest part of July and it was not a/c, so I think they mercifully made it quick for us.
