We brought kiddos and the outside area was kid friendly, although not completely fenced in by the side of the road, which was a bit nerve wracking.  I wish I had brought some more small bills as tips collected in the tasting room go to a local charity, which rotates monthly or seasonally.  A fun way to spend a Saturday, would be even better in the cooler months of the year.

reviews.author: Jessica M.
reviews.description: Well, THIS place is awesome.   Heck yeah Thirsty Planet, go you. $10 for three pints + a pint glass + brewery tour = fun Saturday. We stopped by this place and had a swell time. The owner/brewmaster was super nice and friendly, in fact, everyone who worked there was awesome. If you don't want to drink three beers, you get a tasting glass and three free tasters. But then you don't get an awesome pint glass...   Only gripe? No AC (in August, yuck) and it is SUPER LOUD inside. And it seemed that the more people drink, the louder they got and it was just incredibly noisy.   If you like Thirsty Planet beers, or beer in general, definitely worth checking out.

reviews.author: Marshall J.
reviews.description: If there were 6 stars...  My family rented the brewery on a Saturday night for a birthday party. Thirsty Planet was flawless in their delivery! They were professional, yet easy to work with, responsive and surprisingly affordable. Jason did a great job behind the bar causally handling the beer orders while educating those who wanted about their beers.  PRO TIP: They use Sonos wireless music system, but do not have an external headphones jack. Download Sonos on your phone and the then manage/update your playlists and you can listin to an iTunes playlist by going to "This iPhone" (I assume the same for Android phones) and then Playlists. If you do not want an iTunes playlist, you can create a playlist in Sonos app ahead of time or play Pandora, Spotify, XM/Sirius, etc).

reviews.author: Holmes S.
reviews.description: Came here for the first time today, its a really cool place. I liked the beers and you really can't beat the price. Staff were really good, I wish I lived closer, i'd be here all the time.   The only downside is it was a little hot inside. But everything else was outstanding, so gets 5 stars from me :)

reviews.author: Mara F.
reviews.description: Thirsty Planet is my new BFF.   Seriously, if you haven't gone on a 'tasting' - you MUST.   It's free!  The owners are great, very knowledgeable and you can tell love their craft.  We bring out of town guests to tastings as well as part of our Tour of Austin.  Be sure to ask for their brew when dining in and around Austin.

reviews.author: Kris U.
reviews.description: This is a great addition to Austin's micro brewery scene.  I first tried their Buckethead IPA at Second Restaurant and enjoyed it enough to look for Thirsty Planet's website, where I discovered they offer tours most Saturdays.  No information about the tours is provided on the website, but here's the deal: sign up online, when you go there's an optional tour, plus four 4 oz. samples for free, or you can purchase the "souvenir glass" for $7 and use it to get up to 4 pints free...a nice deal (although, I don't know about you, but I couldn't consume 4 full pints in 2 hours).  They have a nice large indoor tasting room with communal bench tables and an outdoor patio as well (but it offers no shade).  On to the beer:  * Buckethead IPA - one of my new favorite local IPAs; it is well balanced with the bitter and hint of sweet, with a pleasing Amber color and a mildly citrusy nose.  * Thirsty Goat Amber - a lighter amber, malty but with a slight hoppy finish.  * Double Buckethead IPA - an even stronger bitter taste than the Buckethead...save this one for last. * Yellow Armadillo Habanero - I could definitely taste the habanero flavor, but the spiciness was tempered by a pilsner-like base.  It's surprising how easily this beer can be consumed.

reviews.author: Evan H.
reviews.description: The tour guide was very knowledgeable and gave one of the better tours I have been on. The brewery has a nice outdoor seating area along with jenga and other games to play while you drink. Thirsty goat is a failry good brew however the other offerings on tap were pretty bland and run of the mill compared to other breweries in the Austin area.

reviews.author: Orion G.
reviews.description: I stopped in here on a Saturday afternoon while out cruising the area. It was pretty busy, but I was able to get in fairly easily.   The place had a nice welcoming feeling to it, and stepping up to the bar got me a friendly greeting. I was not familiar with their brews, but saw one called "Twist and Stout", and being a fan of the dark stuff, went right for it. Oh my... *smiles coyly" This stuff was liquid sex.... and I knew it was going to get me in trouble.  So next up, I explained my fondness of the dark, but felt the need to expand outward, what would they suggest. The man behind the counter said without hesitation - "Thirsty Goat Amber"!  Boyo was he right! After two pints of that, I had an expression similar to the one on the label, so I took some time in my truck to eat a sandwich before driving away.  Yup, I'm going back!

reviews.author: Itsabout T.
reviews.description: All good.  Very pleasant atmosphere and chill crowd.  Great beer, terrific value and even cool t-shirts.   What else? Well the tip jar goes to the selected charity, this time summer camp for underprivileged kids.  So good, can't wait for next visit.

reviews.author: Joe T.
reviews.description: Came here on St. Paddy's Day to get some BBQ from Lotz of BBQ (deaf owned) and ordered some beers to go.   This place is awesome. The food / beers were fantastic. I'd recommend the Hazy IPA.   Wish they had a year round tap room.

reviews.author: Fox E.
reviews.description: Not to be confused with 069 TNA which is what Barbi's brewing.  We're not a fan of breweries and this is no exception. I think breweries in general are overrated and again this is no exception.  Having said that this one is one of the better ones we've ever been to in Austin and their products are available all over Texas and are much better than some of the rifles. I mean rivals, but then again this is Texas, so maybe I mean rifles.

reviews.author: Christy B.
reviews.description: Outdoor seating only but tons of picnic benches.  They don't do flights or tastings but decent selection. Hubs got the IPA and rated it 7/10 for its nice light, refreshing hoppy-ness. Staff super friendly and willing to open a bottle to give me (who hates beer) a taster.

reviews.author: Jingyan Y.
reviews.description: Many tables scattered around for outdoor covid-friendly seating, dog friendly! They weren't serving from tap when we were there in Jan 2021, but you could get a growler or a 6 pack (mix 6 pack for $10) and drink it outside! They give you glasses. Bring a bottle opener!

reviews.author: Tim H.
reviews.description: Cool brewery with a huge selection of beers, but nothing extraordinary. The brewery does not have an actual taproom open regularly, but instead is open only Saturdays from 12-4 pm in their parking lot. I went during their anniversary event and it was $25 for a glass that you keep and 6 8 oz pours of your choice (you can do 12 4 oz pours instead). Majority of the pours turned out to be larger than 8 oz so you can really get trashed here. They had 44 beers on tap. Pretty insane. Unfortunately, none of the beers were that great. They had like 4 food trucks and a lot of porta potties (lines can get long).   Overall, this was a quantity over quality brewery. We had 4 people in our group and none of us were impressed, although, we are from California and are spoiled by all of the good breweries out here. If you just want to get the job done and get trashed on a Saturday afternoon, this is your spot. If your a real beer lover, you may be disappointed

reviews.author: Jodi H.
reviews.description: I think all of the yelper complaints are the same: why not open more than one day a week? And for more than 4 hours at a time?!   Maybe it's an exclusivity thing...it sure works. If you are visiting Austin and have a free Saturday early afternoon, be sure to hit up 512 for your beer desires. You can take your tasting cup home as a souvenir. They have outdoor seating, merch for purch, and are kid and dog-friendly. Double wow! My boyfriend and I made it to 512 at the tail end of their Saturday hours, but we were able to share a tasting for one. That was perfect because it was the safest way to drink, play some ladderball (it was my first time playing that!), and drive to dinner afterwards.  They have clean restrooms and an easy way to purchase your guitar picks as proof of beer-drinking capability. When you park (plenty of parking btw), walk first to the door on the tasting room's left. You can purchase your tasting power, then head over to the main room for the adventure. When we went, there was basically one taptender pouring while a barback was helping him out with the glasses and stuff. It seemed like a lot of regulars were there, mostly 30+ in age, but all having a great time socializing. There wasn't a food truck there, nor any food on site, so bring your own or head out to eat afterwards.

reviews.author: Crystal H.
reviews.description: Came here during their passport beer event thing. There was live music and it was outdoors. It was $25 and you get to keep the beer glass. You get to taste 6 full glass beers or 12 half glass beers and can pick if you want them to pour half a glass or full glass. The beer list was extensive! There were probably 2 beers we really liked and tons of unique ones that were puzzling to us. They also served some complimentary cheeses. There's also a few food trucks for hungry people. The only thing bad about the event was that restrooms were porta-potties. Many people brought their dogs to the event too. Cool to people and dog watch.

reviews.author: Thomas N.
reviews.description: I really like that Smash Mosaic!  What a cool place to swing by and pick up some beer and a tacker!

reviews.author: Flora R.
reviews.description: We stopped by open house hours on Saturday and got exactly what we were looking for - a chill place to enjoy some favorites (pecan porter!) and try out a few new things (smash mosaic ipa) served up by friendly and informative beer makers. I'm glad we made a point to visit and will likely bring friends here when visiting in the future.  This place is dog and child friendly with a handful of picnic tables outside and an optional, small 'tour' if you're into that.

reviews.author: Scott G.
reviews.description: Had a chance to go to their 11th anniversary fest and it was an experience to try the whiskey barrel double pecan porter, the nitro pecan porter, the pumpkin pecan porter, the cafe oh la la and many others I had no idea produced.  Live music and many of their employees talking about their brews. Food trailers were good too. Had a B.A.T. Grilled cheese sandwich which was tasty and somewhat greasy but matched well with the selection of craft.

reviews.author: Steve E.
reviews.description: Been wanting to visit this small brewery for years but they're only open on Saturdays from Noon - 4 PM.  It was great to see a small brewery keeps you origins.  Nothing fancy here just great beer and a good vibe.  Glad I finally got to visit in person.

reviews.author: Billy V.
reviews.description: 512 Brewing Company review could be short and sweet. Only open on Saturday's 12 to 4 pm (taproom). Ugh... 512 Brewing Company was the first beer I tasted in Austin. Had an IPA. Very tasty. I like. Me, happy camper. 512 Brewing Company taproom mostly outside. Ugh... You buy your beer and hang outside in beer garden. Very unique way to order beer. Buy tokens (12 for $24) at one location. Then walk to beer taps. Ugh... They give you two 8oz glasses. Yeah... Never a fresh clean glass to try delicious beer. This is a comfort I like in a taproom I feel it makes a big difference in flavor and service. My two cents. I have only had their IPA. I am an IPA guy. I like the classic flavors and full body beer. 512 Brewing Company IPA does a good job for me. I would like the tasting experience as an option. I really enjoy a 4oz sample to try all the beers. Not a fan of using my beer token on a maybe. Oh well. 512 Brewing Company I will be back just not that often...

reviews.author: Mike M.
reviews.description: Terrific! Pre purchased tickets with friends on EventBrite, then headed over for a Saturday tasting.   Limited crowd, numerous beers on tap, efficient and knowledgeable staff. It was tasty and well done.

reviews.author: B H.
reviews.description: I used to take the train downtown so I'd always stop at Champions by the station and have a Pecan Porter or three while waiting for a pick up.  After relocating and driving myself to work like a pleb for the last 2 years the thing I missed most was the beer.  The few times a month I'd venture into Specs I'd always ask the beer guy about this(and Hitachino) and was always met with the tired response citing the owners devotion to sustainability.  I grew to loathe the environment.  Every time I'd toss something in the blue bin at work I'd scowl.  It just wasn't worth it.  I wanted this beer in something other than a keg.  Low and behold on my last trip in I see a stack of 4-packs of Pecan Porter.  The most perfect stack since the pyramids.  Beer guy saw me and came over to share in my unbridled joy.  I cursed the owner one last time for making me wait so long.  And grabbed two.

reviews.author: Kiley K.
reviews.description: 512 had the honors of providing me with my first brewery tour. It was great, but definitely a little different than I expected. I attended the first weekend where they changed their "style" of the tour. They have not updated their website to list the correct details. Admission is $12 per person. This gets you the tour (optional), a small 512 glass souvenir for tasting, and 6 tickets for beer tasting.   The tour is said to start Saturday's around noon. However once you arrive, they will let you know how long they are going to wait based on the amount of people waiting. (they like to fill up)  That being said, we had about an hour wait outside on the patio-ish area (no cover, bring a hat and shades) to enjoy some brews! The weather was great and they have giant Jenga and corn hole for you to enjoy. Dogs are also welcome outside. If you plan to skip out on the tour and just enjoy the beer, bring lawn chairs as the tables get crowded after a while.   IF you decide to attend their tour, keep in mind that it may not be exactly what you expect. The brewery is small and there are only about 3 sections to view in cramped spaces. Get up close to the tour guide so that you can hear because they do not use a microphone. They have some work do to on the tour, but overall I enjoyed it.  Stop by 512! Besides, you can't beat $12 for 6 beers!

reviews.author: Greg B.
reviews.description: I really want to give 512 a 4.5. Almost a perfect experience for us. My girlfriend and I went to the Saturday open house and it was great.   For $12 you get an 8oz 512 glass to keep and 6 guitar pics to trade for different brews. There beers were all great, we even got to try some limited edition that's not being distributed yet. The "bartender" was really cool, knowledgeable about the beers, and overall pleasant to talk to. The only thing missing would be some type of food truck or snack.   Definitely give this place a try if you are a beer lover!

reviews.author: Bryan B.
reviews.description: Love their Pecan Porter. Try this places out. Had a good time in ATX. I did try most of their lineup at the time and it did not disappoint. Love 512!

reviews.author: Michelle G.
reviews.description: I've been wanting to visit this brewery since we moved, but it is o my open 12-4pm on Saturdays. Outside seating only so be prepared in warm weather.. beer is great! You purchase a very small glass for $12 but you also get 6 guitar piks that you trade in for refills on the beer so actually a great deal! We would definitely come back, just earlier in the day so we can drink our 6, and also cooler weather!

reviews.author: Lorrie M.
reviews.description: It's pretty rare that I like MOST of the beers at a brewery. Usually there's one or two stand outs, and that in itself is unusual.   However, 512 takes the cake on my brewery tour of Austin this time around. We showed up around noon, definitely past their "tour" time and it wasn't even available on their eventbrite / website anymore. Regardless, the brewer (New-ish Guy, woo!) let us in the tour and filled our two glasses with delicious Pecan Porter that was on nitro at the time.  I definitely loved their IPAs (IPA and Seven), their Wit was also not bad at all. The only thing I was a little eh about was their Pils and that's ok with me. They were incredibly knowledgable, the tour was fun, and they're doing some really cool barrel aged stuff that you don't see at a lot of breweries. They're also very dedicated to self distribution, despite how difficult that seems, so I'm definitely looking forward to other 512 beers I can get my hands on in the future.

reviews.author: Caryn K.
reviews.description: Came here with the fam-bam to celebrate Father's Day and we were not disappointed. There was beer for the whole family and the outdoor seating area came complete with bags, jenga, and ladder toss. The cost is $12 for 6-8oz beer samples! Probably the best deal in town. Highly recommend this place if you are looking for a place to hangout with friends. I'd recommend bringing food with you as there isn't much close by, but otherwise great place to just go and chill.

reviews.author: Connor B.
reviews.description: This is one of the best breweries in all of Austin. Great beer, great atmosphere, and the owners know their stuff. If you haven't been, you need to try it!

reviews.author: Garrett O.
reviews.description: Enjoyed my first visit to Southern Heights! The staff was friendly and there was a decent selection of draft brews to choose from at a reasonable price (I enjoyed their sole Porter, the Samoan Joe). I hope to try something else on the menu if they grow their dark beer menu.  The environment was great on a Sunday afternoon, with several folks there enjoying the NFL playoffs on their TVs.  Wish they had a bit more to choose from in terms of snacks or food (TacoWey is a decent food truck parked outside).  Seems as though this place is a bit of a hidden gem, given that its location is literally hidden off 183. Look forward to another visit.

reviews.author: Melissa L.
reviews.description: I am so whelmed by this place, it is exactly the bare minimum for all of its flavors, you want an IPA, you get exactly that, you get a porter, you get exactly that.there is not much of an exciting factor of this place but there is a tasty factor. It's good.

reviews.author: Rachele G.
reviews.description: I read a few people saying this place had the best IPA's in Austin and they didn't lie... There are so many different IPA's on the menu. Every single one of them was delicious! I tried so many that I don't remember which one was my favorite.   Either way, if you like IPA's then try out Southern Heights Brewery!

reviews.author: Ryan W.
reviews.description: This was a great find. Service was exceptional gave a military discount of Veterans Day which was very nice. The evergreen IPA was very good kept us there for a few hours. They also had Cornhole set up in the back which is always fun. For food they have a taco truck right outside another great find. Overall a great experience and we will def come back.

reviews.author: Jodi H.
reviews.description: Visited this wonderful brewery with my boyfriend over Thanksgiving week, and they are well-rounded with great board games, awesome hazy IPAs, and free stickers, jk a wonderful spacious atmosphere.  I would highly recommend this place for casual dates, group meetups, and all your brewery outing needs! We both had a pint of beer to start with, then ended up with a set of tasters each to try more of their other beers. I was so pleased to see on their menu tonnnnns of hazy IPA's, but also that they had a larger number of beers on tap to choose from! That's always a mini gold mine when there are over 10 beers on tap. There were two beertenders on shift when we went, and we had to wait a bit for us to get our orders in, but the place is so chill and so spacious that we didn't mind waiting. We saw a lot of other couples, small groups, and even people with their dogs inside!! So dog-friendly brewery, check!   They also had cornhole indoors as well as pool! I love that this brewery caters to making itself a great source of beer, but also a great place to hang out. That is sometimes forgotten, but this warehouse style brewery does it all. Everything is super low-key, and they even had a food truck outside too.  Their restrooms are clean, wifi strong, and their brewery holds plenty of parking space! I can't wait to come back again.

reviews.author: Lyndsay W.
reviews.description: Cute, spacious place off the beaten path. Plenty of indoor and outdoor seating. Lots of beer options and good vibes. Cornhole inside-- you love to see it!

reviews.author: Trevor C.
reviews.description: Hands down the absolute BEST IPAs I've had in Austin. I literally tried every single beer on tap and enjoyed all of them. It's a little off the beaten path but, it is most definitely worth the trip! They've got hazy IPAs for days and they can appeal to any palate. Walking into Southern Heights I wasn't the biggest fan of IPAs, I had never found one that really really did it for me...this place made me rethink my stance on IPAs.   They are posted up in a super cool warehouse that's mostly open and is welcoming to parties of all shapes and sizes. When I went, there were even a lot of kiddos there. The staff was amazing, they were super knowledgeable about their beers and beer in general and they treated my friends and I very well! They have a food truck that comes on the weekend and it is for sure worth a visit as well.

reviews.author: Philip E.
reviews.description: Solid, hidden gem in far East Austin. It's worth the stop, and bartenders are kind people as well.

reviews.author: Angie W.
reviews.description: Made it by the brewery on a quiet Sunday and so happy this place exists.  Great beer.  Friendly staff.  Spacious bright and open space.  Didn't try the food truck but menu looked great.  Would be great to catch a game on tv, play games with friends, or just spend time being able to hear each other talk.    A bit of a challenge to get there if coming from the south but persevere.  You won't regret it.

reviews.author: Will S.
reviews.description: Great beer, good people, and a friendly vibe.  No wonder you can usually spot neighborhood regulars enjoying this gem. This is definitely a place you should check out.

reviews.author: Michael E.
reviews.description: By far one of my favorite breweries in Austin!! Definitely a hidden gem! I come here all the time and every time I come, it is a great experience. The staff and the two owners are extremely friendly and welcoming.  They have a wonderful selection of IPA's (probably the biggest in Austin), as well as a great selection of light beers and delicious dark beers. Regardless of the type of beer you like, I am sure you will find one of their beers amazing. And they are very good about letting you try whatever you want to make sure you get the right beer.  Highly recommend checking this place out if you are visiting Austin and are looking for a great brewery or if you live in Austin but have never checked this place out.

reviews.author: Elsa J.
reviews.description: When people say of hole in the wall, they're thinking of Southern Heights. Literally nestled in an out of the way office complex, one would never know! Places like this don't attract uppity people and the interiors resemble that. A great color scheme with not a lot of exotic patterns, the place is rustic and industrial. One of the owners, Mike, will graciously give tours of the brewery that produces the beer sold up front.  The beer selection is IPA heavy. Though the selection changes, at the time I went there was five IPAs to choose from. This brewery leans towards dark and bitter beers. A friend mentioned to me that drinking one beer felt like drinking three, and for me the coffee stout hit me harder than anticipated.  Southern Heights is Austin born and raised, by people who work industry jobs along side the rest of us. This is where you can drink local and meet local.

reviews.author: Zachary A.
reviews.description: Southern Heights might be my new favorite spot in town.  Perhaps most consistent IPAs in town, both hazy and traditional.  Some sour and dark stuff available, but this is IPA destination first and foremost.  3 TVs and free WiFi.  No sports packages, but got the main channels if your game is on network.  Indoor and outdoor seating, dog-friendly, easy parking, and free games.  Tons of space in the back and great place to chill and have a quiet night drinking, or have fun and drink throughout the day.  Saw families with babies and dogs, and also a birthday party tables over.  Cans to go available as well.  Food smelled great out back with Vietnamese, Texas BBQ style, fare.  Only good east side brewery in town - will make this my new goto!

reviews.author: Ben M.
reviews.description: Nice visit to Southern Heights Brewery today! Place was PACKED for an East Side Brewery Tour. Service was slow but they were understaffed for sure.   This brewery offers an EXTENSIVE selection of IPAs, which is great for my dad bod figure.   They had Crawfish on special. They were excellent. Me and the shorty smashed these!!   Far East location if you like that area. Solid parking.

reviews.author: Kasy S.
reviews.description: My buddy and I just heard about this little gem last week and decided to check it out ASAP. Luckily we got to stop by Sunday November 26 for a few afternoon pints. This brewery may have the greatest juxtaposition between the outside appearance (plain and nondescript) and the beautiful tap room and quality beers within.   Both of the owners were behind the bar (Austin and Chris) and were happy to talk shop. Austin showed us around and told us about how they started, their backgrounds, their current beers and plans for the future.   We both had the pub ale (great, imminently quaffable, low ABV, everyday drinker), then my buddy had the pale ale while I opted for the West Coast IPA. Both the pale ale and IPA were absolutely fantastically executed and perfect representations of their styles. I can't wait to try the special porter that will be coming up in a few months.  Back to the space: the tap room is beautiful and you can tell that the owners have really poured their heart and soul into this place. There was a large TV on the wall, tons of bar seating and several 6-8 top tables. The bathrooms were industrial chic in the best way. Bonus points for free WIFI. These guys are off to a fantastic start! Right now they do not have an outdoor space for our four-legged friends, but one is in the works.   Stop by and try some awesome beer from some really great guys.

reviews.author: Christopher L.
reviews.description: I went here with my girlfriend to play some boardgames and try some new beers. The beers here were awesome and very drinkable. I'm not a heavy beer, crazy hops kind of guy so having easy drinkable beers is awesome to me.   The space is awesome and very spacious and the flights of beer were great. Will definitely be back!

reviews.author: Mary W.
reviews.description: This place is amazing! Phenomenal beer and the absolute best part is the service. The gentleman behind the bar is insanely polite and friendly. I will visit here again and highly recommend.

reviews.author: David D.
reviews.description: David, the bartender is delicious. He really knows how to pour. I tried every beer and can't pick a favorite. But.....Dave IS here man. There are two of us actually. We're both here. Best brewery in Austin.

reviews.author: Josh L.
reviews.description: Great beer! Lots to choose from, $10 flights of 4, and a huge warehouse you sit in with a great view of the tanks. Plenty of group seating.

reviews.author: Tina N.
reviews.description: New brewery with lots of seating inside and out and dog friendly! Also has a food truck on site and is down the street from St Elmos, Austin Winery etc. The beer was good and I imagine as more people hear about it, the vibe will pick up!

reviews.author: Ellen E.
reviews.description: We came here what I believe was opening weekend! They had 5 beers on tap, with the option to get a flight (3 pours- $7), beers to go, or full pours to enjoy. They  had staples like a Pilsner, or you can try something a little different like the sparkling golden ale (IMO heavy on the brut flavor). They have seating inside as well as outside, and they're dog friendly! They also had some cute shirts/apparel with their logo on it for purchase. I'm looking forward to coming back and trying this place once they expand their selection a little bit, but overall it was good! It's also right down the way from St Elmos Brewing, so add it to your list and hit them up when you're in the area/getting your beer fix.

reviews.author: Bryon T.
reviews.description: Visited for the 1st time on Friday 6/25/21.  Had the pleasure of meeting the owners who were very friendly, helping serve customers.  The gentleman who served us our beers was also very friendly.   The beers were all very good and we enjoyed our flights.  Sometimes new breweries take time to develop a good list of beers, but I was impressed.   The setting was nicely laid out and decorated.  Indoor seating with AC for those hot days, as well as outdoor seating.   Check out Vacancy and support local independent breweries!!

reviews.author: Jeff W.
reviews.description: Spectacular!  Taps are unreal top to bottom. If you miss the Juicy Lucy or the June, you're mistaken.

reviews.author: Steven A.
reviews.description: Add this to your list! The beer is great and so is the vibe. There's seriously not a bad beer on tap, so try them all. They've got Indoor/outdoor seating and are dog friendly. To top it all off the staff is really friendly!   P.S You'll thank yourself for trying the food truck   Cheers!

reviews.author: Amanda B.
reviews.description: Not inclusive at all. Felt really uncomfortable after walking in and asking some questions. Implied I was old and didn't know about beer. Kinda weird since I am a brewer from another state and I didn't realize there was an age limit on beer.

reviews.author: Martin P.
reviews.description: This place is amazing! Great selection of beers, great atmosphere, seating inside and out, and dog friendly. The food truck was good too and it was nice to get to chat with the owners a little bit - good luck to them!

reviews.author: Russell B.
reviews.description: Great beers especially loved the IPAs space is really cool and well designed. Will be back again soon.

name: Black Star Co-op Pub and Brewery

reviews.author: Elizabeth G.
reviews.description: A shady porch, games for everyone, inside and out, family friendly, dog friendly and oh so yum!  This place has it all.  The food is outstanding, particularly the avocado club. During May, they sponsor Barks for Beers supporting Divine Canines Therapy dogs. You buy a Pawsport for about $30 and get a free draw at over two dozen local craft brewers! Miss Sophia will be around to greet you most of May, and whenever else her human wants something good to eat!  One of Austin's hidden gems

reviews.author: Ryan S.
reviews.description: This is a good little spot to come have a beer. I think the food is a little pricey for the quality.   I tried the fish and chips and it was alright, for 22 bucks I would hope I would be able to say more than that but I can't. The batter is great but I can tell the fish is frozen.  I will say the fries are pretty good.

reviews.author: Mary S.
reviews.description: We like coming back to this location for the great food and beer selection. They have a large group and dog-friendly patio seating area that this part of Austin really needs. Their service is great and friendly. I recommend coming here with a growler for some of the best beer brewed in Austin. The food is always excellent and never disappoints, regardless of what we select.

reviews.author: Alex C.
reviews.description: There's plenty of space here to sit outside and it can't be be on a beautiful day. There's a great selection of beers and now you can even take some home in a sixpack. The menu seems to change now and again but I've never had anything I didn't like. It's hard to beat a basket of fries or the buffalo cauliflower. I've always enjoyed the fish and chips and veggie burgers. The staff has always been friendly and helpful with suggestions.  Anytime I brought a friend we've always had a good time. I'll be back here.

reviews.author: Sierra R.
reviews.description: I've been here twice and both times were pleasant visits. Last time I tried the "Wish You Were Queer," which is a hoppy, floral beer. I loved it! I also ordered the avocado club sammy. The fries were thick and salted. I'm sure I'll be back!

reviews.author: Wes O.
reviews.description: One of the best "better" burgers in Austin.  Plain and simple.    It's a bit hard to find from Lamar because it's semi-hidden in the Midtown Commons apartment complex.  Like the Triangle and most other new Austin developments, there's retail and restaurants on the ground floor.  Decided to drop in here tonight because the burger came highly recommended.  I'm definitely glad I tried it.  The burger is deceptively small.  It looks like a smaller burger, but the density of the high quality burger patty combined with their bun makes it more than a meal.  Don't forget their fries, which were described to me as English style chips.  The fries look like flattened steak fries and are exceptionally crispy.  I'm not sure what the seasoning is, but it's strangely addictive.  Black Star has a huge variety of beers for the drinkers.  For the non-drinkers, they have a variety of canned and bottled soft drinks, although no fountain drinks.    Being a co-op, the service is friendly and obviously takes a lot of pride in their pub.  The quality of the food and the service both show that.

reviews.author: Gurpreet L.
reviews.description: I tried some of their veggie options, including the impossible burger, and would say their food is average. However, their range of beer selection is on point. There is a little something for everyone - from sours to stouts. I had one of the sours, a cider, and split a beer flight of beers I can't remember. Loved all of them!

reviews.author: Jodi H.
reviews.description: Brewpub: dog-friendly, veggie options, friendly staff and strong wifi! SCORE!  Came through with a good friend and my pup. We loved it. Pups have to stay outdoors, but you're allowed to bring them indoors to place your order. They have tons of beer options, great in-house brews. I was floored by their options! I always go for the flight when I try a new brewery to get a better taste of what they offer. I loved pricing: 4 for $10, and my favorites were the Island Baby (pineapple what!!) and juicy Fructis hazy IPA. They had a bit of everything, so that's always nice for beer geeks. Quench my palate, Black Star! They have their beer menu overhead--super easy to read. They also have great happy hour, but we arrived later after it was over. The food menu is on the paper menu that they have at the front of the line. Grab yourself the menu while someone stands in line for ya!   They also offer food specials for that day. It looked good--I think it was some sort of tofu (veg) tacos, but I wanted fries...so went with their avocado club. It was a bit heavy on the mayo, but it tasted great. Their chips...crisps...fries whatever you want to call em were the REAL WINNER. Y'all. Fries are so crispy and uneven...wedge-style. BUT not dry or lukewarm. They are delicious. I would go back just for their addictive fries. Trust me. They also offer the impossible burger too for veg folks, and other options like grilled cheese. I just love how veg-friendly they are. THANK Y'ALL. Grilled cheese gets old for us who don't eat meat.   The atmosphere is very chill and with a darker ambiance. It seems like the perfect spot for group hangs or a relaxed date. Parking was easy, especially since there's a customer parking structure that's free. It's also close to public transportation if you choose to take it. I love this spot--I can see this becoming a new favorite.

reviews.author: John K.
reviews.description: Vulcan IPA and the best fish and chips in Austin. It's a bit pricy, but tips are included in the price and people there are paid a living wage. If I lived closer, I would be a member.

reviews.author: Kimber G.
reviews.description: I adore this place!  Cool (ABD humble) people, great beers, ciders and such delicious food!  Right now menus are limited but I hear they are getting more beers next week for Octoberfest!   Thank you BlackStar Coop!  We LOVE you!

reviews.author: Danielle R.
reviews.description: Checked this place out for the 1st time today and LOVED it! Very good beer and delicious food too. Had their house hazy IPA and Oktoberfest beer, wonderful! Sundays and Tuesdays are the best for great $$ deals too. Their burgers, fries, wings, and  chicken sandwich was very good and the staff is incredibly friendly!! We are definitely coming back again soon :)

reviews.author: Esther S.
reviews.description: I cannot emphasize my love for this place enough!!! Usually I am not the type of person to seek out breweries/pubs simply because they are loud and not too clean. I make an exception for this location due to the fantastic service I am given every. single. time. (NO TIPS HERE!! They work and treat you well because thy are paid good/decent wages!!!!!!)  Atmosphere: 4 Pretty big, can get crowded on evenings (cause it's freakin great). Lots of indoor seating and ample outdoor seating (covered)  Food: 4.5 Most of the food I have had here has been pretty decent. I knock off half a star because I've noticed a slight inconsistency in the servings (read about fish and chips) Fish and chips: my go-to food. Usually comes with 2-3 strips of fish and the potato wedges/strips are always well cooked, and come it's this out-of-the-world sauce!! Addicting af but wish they would consistently give 3 strips of fish ): Fried avocado tacos: awesome!! Sounds like it would be plain, but came with these giant thicc bacon strips on it that really added the savory taste Cheese board: nice variety, definitely love that the cheese is locally sourced from Antonelli's! Good mix for everyone's taste buds and really liked how there was plenty of bread too. Ice cream: seasonal flavors but I tried the pecan and regretted only having one scoop.  Service: 5 The servers here are always!!!!!!!!! SO cool and nice and helpful. Whenever we need drink recs, or anything at all, they are there to help! Even called in to ask if they were playing a game before, and offered to put down the big screen to have us come by and watch as we ate.

reviews.author: Laura G.
reviews.description: loved it! Staff was friendly and the food and beer were great. I got the cauliflower app and my boyfriend got a fried chicken sandwich that he said was the best thing he has eaten in a while

reviews.author: Nikki A.
reviews.description: I've always seen this place and been curious to try it. So, when my friend was visiting from Vermont, I decided it was the perfect time! I always like to eat locally. We split the tofu tikka masala and buffalo cauliflower (we added bleu cheese). I'm sure I could've eaten the whole bowl of of buffalo cauliflower by myself. It was super tasty. The sauce was just a little bit vinegary and the cauliflower soaked up all the flavor. Get it with the cheese, if you aren't vegan. It gives it that extra sharpness. The tikka masala was a bit spicy. I was surprised by that. We both liked it. The tofu was perfect with it. You have to know how to do tofu just right, and this was it! Everything was gluten free, for my friend. I can't wait to go back after I have my baby so I can partake in the adult beverages. I had my eye on some that they made there.

reviews.author: Bill M.
reviews.description: Black-star Co-op is cool, but the food isn't all that. They brew their own beer and rotate other craft brews, but I always get their Vulcan, a rye IPA.  Foodwise, the only things I've liked are the chicken snack, and the seasoned chips. The burger is just okay, but the fish for the fish and chips needs salt and let's get some dang tarter sauce. They serve it with an aoli, which lacks seasoning. A side of coleslaw would go a long way too.  I'd be back, primarily for a cold one, and I would not not go for food again, but not by my will.

reviews.author: Nikkita F.
reviews.description: Great spot for post work drinks. I think theres only beer so keep that mind.   Pros: easy to find a spot inside or outside (although Texas so nothx), easy parking (lot or garage), delish fries and cheese boards and fried avo tacos, you can get flights of house beers for only $10, I believe they have board games too   Cons: I think only beer available (fine by me but depends on your group)

reviews.author: Condescending K.
reviews.description: My fav brewery in town! Deeply wish they would bring back the island baby and the wings w/ spicy bbq (?) sauce.

reviews.author: Shawn P.
reviews.description: This place was legit delicious. Had the buffalo cauliflower and it was amazing! The atmosphere is great and the beer was yummy. Lots of options veg and beef options

reviews.author: Andrew L.
reviews.description: Chill beer garden style hang out spot, having passed by a bunch of times it never seems crazy busy and on a beautiful Saturday night we were able to get a table outside without any issue.   Their beer selection is great, with a wide variety of beer made in house and other local breweries. The food selection leaves a little bit to be desired. The season chips were delicious, they reminded me more of steak fries if you put them in a broiler to give them a nice crunch. Besides the chips nothing on the menu really stood out to me as too interesting, and most of the reviews I read were pretty disappointed with their other food.   They also seem to have events  and good happy hour deals pretty frequently during the week. Overall, it's a good place to grab a beer in the area and enjoy a nice night outside, but I wouldn't come here too hungry.

reviews.author: Goretti A.
reviews.description: Good for takeout! Fish and chips was so good and the wait time for pickup was mot super long at all. Highly recommend!

reviews.author: Jennifer D.
reviews.description: This place was pretty spectacular. I've been wanting to go for a while and it finally happened! It was in the low 70s and perfect weather. The hill country views are beautiful and I'd imagine sunsets here are gorgeous. Outdoor games available. Dogs on leash are allowed.   Lots of seating and an interesting idea on how to hold your seats/table. It was nice not having to worry about somebody taking our spot while playing with the animals. You can also get food for them at the bar. They were pretty gentle and didn't mind selfies.   Lots of beer, cider and wine options. I had the sweet Sangria (Messina Hof) and Cherry Cobbler by Martin House. Both delightful and fruity.   They have 2 food trucks: Gringas Grub Shak and Kelly's Hill Country BBQ. I went with Kelly's and got the Brisket Elote Parfait and it was so, so good. I want to go back just for that! There were so many options to choose from. There's really something for everyone. I'll definitely be back!

reviews.author: Evie T.
reviews.description: Super cute and fun. Didn't see any llamas though but the sunset made up for it. Friendly and knowledgeable staff. If I remember correctly the drinks consist of beer, wine, and soda. (Water cooler is available as well)   Seating is on a first come first serve situation went on a Friday during spring break and had no problems at all!   My only con is on the day we went there were a lot of children everywhere. Running everywhere. Of course that's more so on the parents but just keep in mind that there may be a bunch of kiddos .

reviews.author: Kat C.
reviews.description: This place has amazing views. The staff is very friendly and prices are very reasonable. It is kinda of hard to miss having a great view and a good beet. The weather was on point. Plus we saw a few llamas too. It is a fun place to go and have a beer and enjoy the view.

reviews.author: Erica N.
reviews.description: Loved this spot. Can't believe I hadn't been here before. Spent the birthday weekend out in the Driftwood/Wimberely area and our friends told us about this spot and we were not disappointed. Although it's kid central (which can be good or bad for some people), the views (especially for sunset) are amazing. The drinks were good. They have multiple fire pits during the winter time. Lots of seating. Llamas Ofcourse. What more could you want?!

reviews.author: Melody C.
reviews.description: This place is definitely worth checking off the list. Great selection of beer - although it seems like the tap beer struggles to be kept cold. Everything was pretty luke warm. The llamas and donkeys were hanging out though so that was fun!

reviews.author: Kris U.
reviews.description: This is a brew pub with a lovely outdoor space, expansive Hill Country views, and entertainment for all!  | Experience | You can't beat it!  It the best of what the area wineries offer in terms of a place where you want to spend a leisurely couple of hours, with a great assortment of local craft beers on tap (and options for the non-beer drinkers).  I like that there is a variety of seating options (picnic tables, Adirondack chairs, barstools) and they are nicely spread out.  Aside from the view the main attraction is their resident llamas and mini donkeys, and trust me, splurge on the bag of feed for optimal up-close interaction with these adorable camelids!  | Beverages | A nicely curated selection of local beer on tap, and surely something to please everyone.  There's also a selection of cider, hard seltzer, wine, and non-alcoholic beverages.    | Eats | We didn't eat here, but there's an onsite resident food trailer offering tacos, quesadillas and burgers.

reviews.author: Madeline A.
reviews.description: I love this place! The Shady Llama is perfect for gatherings large and small. It's kid-friendly, dog-friendly (just don't let them get close to the llamas) and the views of the hill country are gorgeous. My only suggestion would be to add a really nice, healthy mocktail to the menu. We had the lemonade, but it was an artificial lime green, which was a little unappetizing.

reviews.author: Kristine V.
reviews.description: After a long dip at Blue Hole Regional Park, the Shady Llama is a place to go for a quick bite, beer, and incredible views. As soon as you walk in, the chairs and hammocks out provide a nice campfire style vibe. There are a ton of trees to keep you cool, and the view of Hill Country is one of a kind. To your right, there is a small fence with adorable llama's you can feed and pet. I didn't get to try the food, but the bbq smelled incredible.  Lots of beer and wine options, and great place to bring your friends for a relaxing afternoon.

reviews.author: Mallorie T.
reviews.description: This place is super cute and I had a wonderful sour for only 6$! It was really good ((: the only thing that was tough is that they have a small parking lot and it took me quite a while to park. It's a beautiful view and fun to see llamas and donkeys!

reviews.author: Erica C.
reviews.description: A friend invited me to The Shady Llama on a Sunday afternoon. Such a wonderful place! Great for hanging out with friends. The check in is nice, you tell them how many people are in your party and they give you a table sign to reserve your spot. The beer selection is local. Wine is local as well. The llamas are an extra treat to see. You can purchase feed at the bar. The view of the valley and hill country is fantastic. This is a great place for groups, dogs and is kid friendly too.  All staff members are friendly and helpful.

reviews.author: Brittney B.
reviews.description: Visited here with a group of friends while on a weekend trip, and this was hands down our favorite spot. The llamas were so cute and funny, and the drinks were great. We enjoyed keeping warm by the fire pit, and I imagine the sunset view is spectacular. Wish we had spent more time here!

reviews.author: Shannon B.
reviews.description: What a perfect place to enjoy a relaxed few hours on a nice weather day in the Hill Country! The Shady Llama, just west of Wimberley on the way toward Dripping Springs on RR12 is a gem of a yard bar offering Texas-based craft brews, soft drinks, and wines with a killer view and a few furry mascots to feed and pet.  Our family loves this place. We can each enjoy a tasty beverage we like, have a good lunch from the Gringa's truck we like from Wimberley, and feed some alfalfa to some llamas and burros.  There are plenty of socially-distanced places to lounge around the terraced and tree-shaded yard, and everything is outdoors. It's actually perfect for pandemic times.  Pro-tip: do not try to come here during any weekend with special events in Wimberley, like Market Days or Rodeo. The parking lot has limited capacity. Lazy Sundays are the best time IMHO.

reviews.author: Michael L.
reviews.description: THE BIG: Scenic brewery that overlooks Texas Hill Country...with a llama and donkeys!  THE BLACK AND WHITE: I thought this place was a brewery but a brewpub will do! Plenty of great drinks on tap as well as friendly bartenders.   The bae and I came here after a swim at the neighboring Blue Hole Regional Park. Short 11min drive will get you to Shady Llama from Blue Hole.  The star of the show is the petting zoo featuring the llama and two donkeys. You can get up and personal with the llama by feeding and petting. I was a little hesitant to get too close because who knows if he'll spit.  The view of Texas Hill Country is breathtaking and you could sit here for hours just taking it all in. There were two food trucks on site offering tacos and bbq.  THE FINAL BAMBOO: The vibe here was so nice. Great place to unwind after long day at the pool or chill with friends until dusk.

reviews.author: April L.
reviews.description: Cute beer garden nestled in the wimberly hills! They have a huge selection of beer and some food trucks. It is very family friendly and the llamas are so sweet! Be sure to ask the bar for some llama food the feed them.

reviews.author: Brett R.
reviews.description: Perfect place to kick back, relax, and enjoy the beautiful Central Texas weather. So simple but relaxing. Kid friendly atmosphere. Exactly what I hoped to find!

reviews.author: Cayla G.
reviews.description: We were milling about in Wimberley and wanted to find a relax, safe spot to go enjoy the sunshine so we went to The Shady Llama. It exceeded our expectations! The beer selection had at least 10 on draft and another 15 or so canned. We loved the socially distant setting, the polite staff, the llamas, and the music! I'd love to come back here when I'm in Wimberley again! Note, I cannot review the food trailer on site as I only had the beers!  P.s. the Tang IPA from Rough Diamond is 5

reviews.author: Brittany A.
reviews.description: The food trucks have some great options and the beer and wine selection is pretty extensive. However what really sells it is the whole vibe! The staff is super friendly, the view is outstanding and there's even a play area for the kiddos. My son spent about 3 hours playing and blissfully out of my hair and off the iPad! We will definitely be ba

reviews.author: Jeff C.
reviews.description: Judging from the recent reviews, I guess I'm in the minority. But I miss pre-COVID Shady Llama.  It's just not the same and the magic is gone. Given that literally 100% of the place is outside,  their COVID protocols are way over the top.   Why do you need to assign picnic tables??   And all the hammocks are gone (risk of transmission is greater from canvas than wood??).  At least they stopped doing the inane requirement of reservations they were doing for a while.   So if you're uber paranoid and love restricted freedoms maybe it won't be an issue for you.    But it just made my wife and I sad to be back (1st time in a year and pre-pandemic we were regulars).   Yes they have good beer, and higher prices now to offset the fact that people obviously aren't flocking there like they used to.  And the view is great and it's fun to see the llamas and if you never went before maybe you'll be none the wiser.  But for me it's just a sad reminder of what it used to be and a testament to how much fear and paranoia have all but ruined our country.   I won't be back until they restore everything to pre-pandemic protocols.

reviews.author: Katie B.
reviews.description: Just all sorts of whimsical in brewery form.  Their table designation decor they give you at the front so you can claim your spot without fear of anyone scooping it up when you're grabbing a beer or going to gawk at the llamas or mini donkeys is adorbs and shows attention to detail and a winning customer service experience right off the bat.   The tables are spread out nicely and there's plenty of shaded options or exposed ones, depending on your tolerance for the sun/heat.   It's actually on top of a hill so you can get a lovely panoramic vista of Hill Country, so you better believe if you're there at sunset, you'll be getting a gorgeous setting to close out on.   They don't brew their own beer (or wine), so they offer up a glimpse of Texas' finest on tap, which I appreciate. During COVID, every order came with chips or a treat (from a Costco assortment), but there's also a taco truck in the back if you're looking for something a little more substantive.   Kid and dog friendly, and since there are cute animals roaming the grounds (but fenced away from the tables), there are a lot more kids also roaming the grounds, so if that's not your thing, this may not be the place for you ;)  They have 6 llamas and two mini donkeys, and while the guy checking us in made it seem a sighting of them is rare unless you get there right when they open because that's when feeding time is, they were ever present during our midday visit. You can purchase feed for $1/bag to lure them over, and so I have a feeling we just had an extra generous crowd that day that always kept them fence curious!

reviews.author: Karen D.
reviews.description: Came on a weekday evening and had a glass of rose. Was disappointed to find that the llamas had already retired for the day and usually come out during the mornings. However, the scenery was picturesque, and I loved the overall charm of the outdoor space. Service was on point.

reviews.author: Andrew Y.
reviews.description: The tour was fantastic and very informative.  Well worth the $15.  More than that, at the end we ended at a tasting room where we sat with others on our tour and chatted.  We ended up walking down to a winery with some of those on the tour with us where we sat and chatted and then ended up going to dinner with them.  I highly recommend visiting the distillery and taking the tour!!

reviews.author: Amanda K.
reviews.description: Well Austin, I finally made 2k reviews on Yelp. I must have no life. haha!  My husband and I had come across Still Austin Whiskey while having drinks around Austin. My husband loved their whiskey and wanted to check out their place of business.  Sunday afternoons a few times a month, they do drag queen bingo. After the gym, I showered and we came here around 1:30ish. The drag queen bingo was underway and quite crowded. We grabbed a drink from inside and headed out to the beer garden area to observe. It was so much fun and recommend it.   They have a variety of drink cocktails to try with either gin, whiskey, and a beer or two. My husband got a flight and said it was good. I opted for the gold rush which was bourbon, honey, and lemon. It was quite tasty and strong.   I would like to note that I am gluten intolerant. I talked to the server and the manager about the gluten content. I was told that due to the distilling process basically, all spirits are gluten-free. I disagree with this information because I have had issues with some booze in the past as well as people in the gluten-free community. However, I am intolerant and usually only affected by gluten digestive-wise. I did have some mild digestive issues later that day but I made the choice to have a drink here. So make your decision wisely if you have problems with gluten.   Overall, this is a great place to grab a drink and chill for the afternoon in south austin. There are plenty of other things nearby to check out including food trucks and places to drink. The parking lot can get crowded so look for the overflow parking area or follow someone who is going to their car to leave.

reviews.author: Ryan S.
reviews.description: Great place! I am not big on whiskey/bourbon but the cocktails here are pretty damn good. I got the blackberry bourbon cocktail and I highly recommend it.  The ambience in the place is great and staff was very friendly. Overall good vibe, great place for a date!

reviews.author: Shannon L.
reviews.description: Fun spot with outdoor seating.  Whiskey and gin bevs along with a food truck for snacks.  This area on St Elmo is hopping with many fun entertainment options.

reviews.author: Jason B.
reviews.description: They make local whiskey that is good! Support local every time then you factor in they make amazing cocktails with it. Not basic cocktails but amazing over the top that are so tasty! Wakey Wakey is one of my favorites! Love this area old ware houses that keep the true Austin vibe! And great food around too like next too it so you can keep drinking! You will love this place!

reviews.author: Tony P.
reviews.description: Good austin outdoor spot. Came here for Sunday drag brunch bingo.Good time and the drag host was pretty funny and friendly. Dog friendly. Got an old fashioned for 6 bucks so that was a solid deal. Didn't get any good but it looked like a bunch of fried options which my friends seemed to enjoy. It was about 60% full on a Sunday afternoon. I will say that the music was way too loud during the bingo so that made it hard to talk. Outside of bingo, the volume was fine. Overall I'd recommend it. If not, St Elmo brewing is next door.

reviews.author: Mikhael W.
reviews.description: Our guide was pretty freaking awesome. I don't remember her name but she was a pretty red head with cool tattoos. I'm a tequila girl so I wasn't too eager to learn how gin and bourbon are made, but she really had my attention the entire time!   We were in a group of 10 which was just right. Everyone could get a few questions in if they wanted...laid back...chill...ITS AUSTIN!  Now, to the best part....and boy I was a bit disappointed. I've been on several tours in distilleries and the tasting at the end could get you about 2 shots away from tipsy. Typically there are about 4 samples....1.5-2 ounces each.....  Here....there were 2 samples with 1.5 ounces TOTAL!  I know all they do is gin and bourbon but can a SISTA have a bit more?! The tour is around $15pp, but I'd be happy to pay the standard $30-$40 for a tad bit more licka.    The gin and bourbon are still yummy!  Get a cocktail.....The old fashioned will have you stumbling!

reviews.author: Christine H.
reviews.description: The best whiskey tour I have been on!   I booked a tour to surprise my boyfriend. When we arrived, the place didn't have electricity or AC due to an electrical issue in the area.   Rather than cancel, they treated us to some complementary drinks to make up for the electrical and AC issue.   The staff was very friendly, professional, and turned a bad situation into a very fun and amazing time. Couldn't have imagined it being any better!   The guide was very knowledgeable, the tour was insightful, and the tasting at the end was great! Go support this local Austin business!

reviews.author: Diana G.
reviews.description: So, we decided to just stick with tasting their liquor instead of getting drinks. They don't have tasting flights, but they do have an option to order a taste of any of their liquors for $2 each. That's not bad at all. We were able to taste the whiskey and gin. The two year whiskey was the winner. I did see some yummy cocktails that I would love to try in the near future.   They have inside and outside seating. The outside patio has a cover for shade, but you do have areas where you can get sun   There's a food truck on site.   Parking is available on site, but shared with the other businesses. For those that want to make an afternoon or day out of your visit, the other businesses are all drink or food related.

reviews.author: Katie S.
reviews.description: Maybe the Bummer and Lazarus distillery on treasure island in San Francisco has bumped my taste in gin up a bit, but this place was pretty alright.  Considering they only have one gin, I think this place is still workin on it. I didn't try the whiskey so that's probably what this place hits outta the park.

reviews.author: Carlson Z.
reviews.description: We booked the whiskey tour for $15 per person and had a great time on a lazy Sunday afternoon. Our tour guide was incredibly knowledgeable and was able to answer all our questions. I felt like I got a lot out of the tour and now have a basic grasp of how whiskey is made.   The distillery is pretty small and they currently sell bourbon and gin as their bread and butter, both of which you'll get to sample at the end of the tour. Highly recommended to check it out as it's just a fun atmosphere.

reviews.author: Jenn C.
reviews.description: This place is a must-visit! We loved the atmosphere and setup. The drinks were amazing!!! The attention to detail was impressive including the branded ice cubes in the cocktails. The bartender was very attentive and knowledgeable. We wish we were in town longer because we would visit it again. We will definitely be back during our next Austin trip.

reviews.author: Heather B.
reviews.description: Employees are friendly and extremely knowledgeable about their products.  Knowing very little about the best ways to drink whiskey, I really appreciated the education they gave me and the ideas.  I absolutely love their Straight Bourbon Whiskey!

reviews.author: Mark J.
reviews.description: Wow.. I have tried a number of Texas whiskeys and while they are all pretty good, they tend to have quite a bite since they don't have time to age. Still Austin has one of the smoothest Texas whiskeys I have had. They also have a nice gin. Their tap room is nice and the staff was great.

reviews.author: Christy B.
reviews.description: Really great atmosphere. Cute decor. They have their own made gin and bourbon and offer $2 tasters of each.

reviews.author: Julie L.
reviews.description: We really enjoyed visiting and discovering the behind the scenes magic at Still Austin Distillery. A scheduled tour with Jason was the highlight in addition to great education followed by excellent samples. Still in Love tour was perfect. Staff all friendly and fun! We will be back! Yum

reviews.author: Marianne L.
reviews.description: We went to Drag Queen Bingo one Sunday for a friend's birthday and had a great time! The drinks were delicious and even our friends who aren't whisky fans found cocktails that they loved. The food truck was delicious, although we had to wait a while for food. They apologized for the delay at the end of the shift and brought out cookies for everyone! The place has great parking, plentiful outdoor seating and an overall good vibe. We will be back!

reviews.author: Cynthia D.
reviews.description: Wow. This place is making some serious showstopper whiskey. Buttery and caramely and ever so lightly sweet, it's so satisfying to sip on this while listening to my vinyl collection, which I've decided is my latest "thing."  They are currently running a live music series, which is how I became aware of them -- they often do cool giveaways with samples to promote local musicians.

reviews.author: Malinda F.
reviews.description: Still one of our favorite outdoor hang outs!! But have to like gin or bourbon  Bearded guy food truck had awesome snacks!

reviews.author: Dan G.
reviews.description: If you are looking for a unique and cool place to taste various whiskeys, try Still Austin Whiskey Company.  The staff was fantastic and knowledgeable and we tried some of their whiskey as well as some mixed concoctions that were fabulous.  There is a great open patio area that shares space with a food truck and the Bearded Bread Company, but the winds were blowing like crazy and the temps were too cold to be outside long. Definitely try this place!  And then explore other spots in the same Industrial Park!  The artwork on the buildings is also great to tour on its own.

reviews.author: Suzanne P.
reviews.description: Amber Ale is amazing! IPA is good.  Very friendly staff and customers.  Price is now $5 per pour - 16 oz pours. The place is very small and in a warehouse area, hard to find. Hope they make more stouts and porters. Great place to stop.

reviews.author: Teresa B.
reviews.description: We had heard about Bluebonnet for a while and finally decided to check them out on a Friday evening. We were shocked to find a packed house! The picnic tables outside are plentiful but were all full when we arrived. Luckily two guys let us join them. I had the Raspberry Berliner Weisse and it quickly became my new favorite. It is sweet and crisp without being overly sweet. Our friends both got the Cream Ale and loved it. We all walked out with growlers. Everyone there is super friendly and very welcoming. We had the baby with us which was fine (there were a few kids there)...but every time a car was exiting we would have to wrangle him down (minor downfall of basically sitting alongside the parking lot). We are looking forward to visiting again.

reviews.author: Michaela P.
reviews.description: Nice little brewery in a warehouse. Seating is all outside in the parking lot. Regulars bring lawn chairs. Beer was okay. Food was meh. Plastic cups are a turn off. I'd stop in again if thirsty and in the area, but wouldn't go out of my way to get here...

reviews.author: Eric C.
reviews.description: Bluebonnet Beer Company is simply amazing. They are a little difficult to find, look for the side street behind the post office and you should notice it on the right.  Their beers are super delicious, I had the wit, pecan brown ale , cream ale and hef. Out of all of them, the cream ale and wit come highly recommended. They are so smooth and drinkable.  There is a schnitzel food trailer that serves some pretty decent food. The place is small but all of the employees I encountered were nice and friendly. For seating, there is only plastic benches avaliable located in the front of the brewery. Not really any kind  of shade or landacaping but this is expected since it is such a small brewery.  It may not have all of the amenities and backyard space that other larger breweries in Austin have. But if you love beer and want to interact with some awesome, friendly people then Bluebonnet Beer Company is the way to go. Everything is tasty and pints are currently at $5 each, you can't beat that price.

reviews.author: John R.
reviews.description: Good variety of tasty beers on tap, and they run true to form. We prefer a selection like this vs say five different IPAs. Good seasonal beers. Food truck on site. Decent seating for a smaller brewery. Lots of parking. The Tap Room is only open Thur-Saturday, so if we find ourselves on a Sunday beer drive, we have to pass.

reviews.author: Isabel R.
reviews.description: If there was a zero I would not give this establishment any stars. We go when it's raining and all tables are outside for the exception of the owners table that was inside. We asked if we could move our table in and was rejected instantly because "there was no room" (there was enough). Hospitality was at a negative and we were highly considering the beer mug club but the lost a customer and a loyaled customer.  Bluebonnet Brewery you all need to focus on customer Hospitality and not just your sales.

reviews.author: Sereena J.
reviews.description: Great little brewery in my hometown of Round Rock!  My family and I came here on a Friday around 6:30 to grab a few beers and relax. If it's cold outside, I highly recommend bringing a layer or two as there is only a bit of seating inside but about four picnic tables outside. Also, wait to grab dinner at the brewery as they have rotating food trucks Thursday-Saturdays. When we went, they had a lobster roll truck that served amazing rolls.   I started out with their Oktoberfest beer, which was very good! My mom, who is not a big beer drinker, got their shandy and thought it would be great for a hot day. The beers are $5 a pint, and I thought it was really cool they have a series related to the Immortal 10.   Parking is not a hassle, the beer is very good, the people are friendly, and your hardest job will be finding a seat. Enjoy!

reviews.author: Shannon B.
reviews.description: Hello there, Bluebonnet Beer Company! Delighted to make your acquaintance! I don't know why I am just now discovering this treasure trove of highest quality local craft brews, but I'm so glad I'm educated now. Brewmaster David Hulama and his partner Clare have something special going on here, and yes, dirty hippies, it's up in Wilco off a toll road - don't worry, you'll love it!  Opening up special to host a local running group for #globalrunningday? + 1 star Serving 10 different varieties of delicious beer for all palates and ABV levels? + 1 star Evening shade to cool the outdoor picnic table seating? +1 star Friendly and knowledgeable staff taking orders/payments and serving patrons? + 1 star Discounts for American Homebrewers Association members + 1 star  During my visit on a Wednesday evening for a special event, the available beers (from highest to lowest ABV) were: Immortal Ten Castellaw Quadrupel (10%) Immortal Ten Kelley Imperial Stout (10%) India Pale Ale (7%) American Amber Ale (6.5%) Vienna Lager (5.5%) Cream Ale (5.5%) Texas Pecan Brown (5.5%) Bluebonnet Wit (5.4%) German Pilsner American Amber Ale (5.3%) Texas Summer Blonde Ale (5.2%)  Other good stuff to know: + Pints are just $4. Flights (4x 6oz pours of your choice) $10. + Located just east of Cedar Ridge High School in an industrial park behind a post office. Waze knows the way. + Tap room generally open only Fri-Sat 5-8p, but check Twitter and FB for special events. + Rotating variety of food trucks usually parked during open hours + Single stall restroom is in the back, next to the small air-conditioned tasting room + Venue available for parties + Kegs available for purchase + Find their beers served at area restaurants and bars, including The Dig Pub, Cover 3 RR, Greenhouse Craft Food, and more.

reviews.author: Chad T.
reviews.description: This is the best beer in Texas!  I've been coming to Bluebonnet since 2103 and its amazing!

reviews.author: Alexis B.
reviews.description: We love blue bonnet. It's really the only brewery in the area and we are used to living in the domain where there are like a million options.   Beer is tasteful and I don't always love IPA. Their indoor seating is limited by this isn't normally a problem in Texas. They have plenty of tables outside and also have tents in the summer. No food but there is always a food truck - if you follow them on Facebook you can see what it is ahead of time.   Staff is always friendly and accommodating. Plenty of space for puppies here too.   They are only open Friday evenings and Saturday! I wish they had some openings on Sunday.

reviews.author: Doug K.
reviews.description: Try the Amber, pecan brown or Irish dry stout Fantastic beer. Great off track location.

reviews.author: Eric J.
reviews.description: Prior to coming here, had heard consistent HIGH positives on this place...  Firstly, Marga (aka the Beer Snob), and I checked out a Pale...and their Pale was Very Good...asked for a sample of their IPA,...and before even drinking it....getting the nose of the beer -- already knew that it was -- Spot On and the-way-it-should-be!  Their Cream Ale was a new beer idea to me...tried that and WOW, creamy and light...Very Good.  What a Great Place and Team!!!  Thank You soo Much!!!  Eric and Marga  p.s., when it finally gets a bit cooler, we will be by with Kodiak, "The WunderMutt"

reviews.author: Samuel B.
reviews.description: Middle of the road Brewery. Simple and plan. Nothing crazy. Probably following German Purity Laws. If you're looking for basic styles of beers here is your spot. The IPA is nice classic take. $4 all pints. Can't beat that

reviews.author: Jason M.
reviews.description: Great beer and great people. I only wish they had more seating. They have a loyal customer base which speaks to the way they treat there patrons but also means the little seating they have is always full. If this place would just expand, they could run the Round Rock beer scene!

reviews.author: Jay N.
reviews.description: This a Hidden event pastors please have a new brewery was there Oktoberfest was a good idea the Oktoberfest was fun Had a chance to experience great good different types of German beers and bratwursts it was a lot of fun for family and friends

reviews.author: Lisa B.
reviews.description: I'm rating Blue Bonnet 3 stars because while we love their beer and have enjoyed it the very much during their Oktoberfest, we were pretty bummed when we went on a Saturday night. We know that they are popular and were even excited to try Jimmy Vega's Smokehouse but when we arrived half of the available tables were set as reserved. There was literally no where to sit. Every table was packed. We had our 3 yr old son with us, so standing wasn't an option, especially since we wanted to eat too. We asked anyway if any of the tables were available and was told no, they are all reserved for 5pm, but you could squeeze in anywhere else. In the end, we left irritated and disappointed, while I understand reserving tables, but when you only have 10 tables and you reserve 5 of them, that doesn't leave much room for anyone else.

reviews.author: Britt J.
reviews.description: Bluebonnet is a great craft brewery with an outstanding lineup of ales, seasonal lagers, and wheat beers. I really enjoyed the Vienna lager. The owners run a hands on, customer friendly business that is a real pleasure to visit. The perfect place to relax with friends and enjoy some really good beer!

reviews.author: Katie K.
reviews.description: Really enjoyed the beer here. My favorites were the Hefeweizen and the Summer Wit.   The guy at the counter was very friendly and went through a description of all the beers. Good place to get a flight to try multiple beers.  There was a food truck present, too. I didn't get any food, but maybe next time!

reviews.author: Melody B.
reviews.description: Beer is good. Great to sit outside and have conversation but the noise from the food truck generator made it hard to have hear.

reviews.author: Nicole G.
reviews.description: Locally owned family run business that has delicious beer. They always have at least 6-8 beers on tap and a couple seasonal favorites. They have a solid line up across a wide style of beers. The summer wit is a favorite along with the Kolsch styles they release during the fall. I would love to see them expand to a new location  with a climate controlled tasting room which I think would bring in a lot more clientele.

name: Gourdough's Public House
accommodations: Good for Brunch, Lunch, Dinner, Late Night, Dessert
Best nights on Friday, Saturday, Sunday

reviews.author: Kike A.
reviews.description: I visited Austin about a year ago and I still remember this experience vividly!   First, the ambience was very casual but the food was so good! For all my people with a sweet tooth, this is definitely the place for you. With all the fried foods you can think of, I definitely had to pace myself.  I also got "The Big Cheez" (not pictured) to start. It was sooo good. It's mozzarella cheese wrapped in donut dough deep fried with a butter and cilantro buttermilk dressing. This is definitely not a place you go to and every week unless you plan to spend some nights in the gym LOL.   This is great for cheat days and I love that they have very fun takes on regular donuts.   Check out my video + pics on my food page for more!  @TreatsofTexas  https://www.instagram.com/p/CFQBlzOHXnL/?utm_medium=copy_link

reviews.author: Fay G.
reviews.description: I LOVE THIS PLACE. The donuts are fried to perfection, every time. The plates are unique. Gourdough's is great to bring guests to experience what Austin has to offer.  Portion sizes are very filling, except for the Grilled Cheese. The prices are high, but you will have a quality, fun and delicious experience.  My second time here, I ordered the Country Clucker, and the Pia Colada (again). The Pia Colada was still delicious, but I fortunately the bartender did not go all out like last time (I missed the coconut shavings and umbrella). The Country Clucker was a solid choice. I LOVED the candied jalapeos (slightly spicy). The creamed corn was a bit flavorless for my liking, there was a HUGE piece of chicken, and the donut was great. I'm not sure if I'd order this dish again, but I did love the jalapeos. The entrees do not come with a side like the sandwiches and burgers, so my dad and I split a side of fried okra. The side of okra is different from the appetizer of fried okra - instead of frying the entire okra, it's just little balls. The side also does not come with the delicious dipping sauce, but luckily we were able to ask for it. I was soooo full after this meal. My dad ordered the Pork My Avocado - he devoured it! If you like fried avocado and refried beans, it's a good choice. Kind of a Tex-Mex spin, with the queso on top too! He always loves a local beer, and orders the McConaughaze beer every time. My sister ordered the Double D's. She couldn't finish it! Instead of the chips, she got the jalapeo potato salad (subbing a side will cost extra). It wasn't spicy at all, and I wouldn't say it was outstanding and worth paying extra for it. Her S.O. ordered "built his own" Grilled Cheese with garlic bread and two types of cheese. He is a VERY picky eater, but he loved it! Said it was "better than anything he can make himself," which is saying something. He was the only one out of us who had room for dessert. He got the Sin A Bomb and ate it all up. It tasted like a king cake filled with cream cheese!  The service from our waitress could have been improved. She was not attentive, and the service was slow. We relied on communicating with other staff members for some of our requests.

reviews.author: Melissa V.
reviews.description: We came in for lunch and it wasn't very busy. Took a long time to get waited on, but a grumpy guy finally showed up and took our order. Drink...
