reviews.description: Liked how chill this place was! Huge screen for sports. Bench seats with high table and a bar. Some doggos were there and you can bring your own food in.  I think a coffee shop was attached too but it was closed at night. We got two samplers and honestly it's hard to pick a fave and the flavors were fun!   Great place to hang out and have some drinks. *went in the fall! Plan to be be back this spring since the doors will be open * fingers crossed**

reviews.author: Amber K.
reviews.description: I really love Fairweather's concept and having a new addition to Metric Row that isn't another brewery! (Love to y'all breweries, though.)  I came here the day after opening day with a few friends who love cider (I'm indifferent) to try out their brews. I have to say I was pleasantly surprised!  We each ordered a flight of their four ciders on tap. One was the Common, which is the base for all their ciders. Another was one of my favorites even though it involved a little heat from some peppers! The last two were hopped ciders, and the bartender/co-owner told us if we tried them first in different orders, we may like one over the other. He was right, both both were delightful.  I want to give a five-star review to support a new business, but my only tiny complaint would be the fruit flies. Some kept buzzing about here and there, but you can only imagine they want to get a taste of this dry cider sweetness!  If you're a beer person like me, you may have found a new hangout for your friends who don't love beer as much as you. But you'll still enjoy what Fairweather has to offer -- so much so, I ordered a 12-oz pour of my favorite hopped cider after my flight!  Good luck, guys, and congrats on your opening!

reviews.author: Emily K.
reviews.description: This cider is heavenly! If you like dry, innovative ciders (think boysenberry, blood orange + hops, cider with electrolytes) you've got to check out Fairweather. It's well-priced, and the tap room is spacious and bright. You can even take a crowler home!

reviews.author: Mindy H.
reviews.description: Fairweather was a surprise find for me thanks to the wise owner of Sunrise Mini Mart.  That guy knows SO much about all different types of distilled liquids, I wish I had a brain that could store that much knowledge.   I digress, this review is about the awesome family who started Fairweather (super friendly and knowledgeable).  I bought their cans of Common and was blown away.  Cideries claim to have dry cider all the time, but it's not TRULY dry.  Common though was legit.  These guys are making a truly BONE DRY English style cider from apples sourced from the PNW.   It's not perfect yet, but you can taste the potential. It reminds me of Shacksbury.  The fun artwork on the can intrigued me to go check out this spot that was just a few minutes drive away.  The tasting room is TINY! Start small and dream big! Kuddos to them for turning a cold warehouse space into a fun modern hipster community watering hole.  On a Friday night, get here early to even find a spot to sit!  I arrived around 5:30pm and sat at a high table outside and had no line.  By 7pm, people were crowded elbow to elbow, with a long line.  There also is very limited parking.  Be prepared to take time to find a spot and walk.  When they state they are pet friendly they mean it. Not only was my furry friend chilling with others, we were soon joined by a parrot!  I had a great time. I had come by myself, but ended up having several great conversations with people I had never met before.  Truly this place is only months old, and has quickly become a new neighborhood hang out.  The ciders are all 6.5%.  You can enjoy a flight of 4x4OZ for $10, enjoy a glass, or enjoy a guest cider or something from Austin Winery. I love the local support for other local liquid makers. There is a wide range of ciders to choose from.  They have some fun experimental ciders that were not like anything I have tried before.  It's hard to choose just four for a flight.  They have their staples- Common, EZ TEA, and Tejano Dreams, but also some Dry Hopped Ciders, and fruit ciders. My favorites were Tejano Dreams (nice kick), Gin Bot, and Dr. Rudi.

reviews.author: Elyse Z.
reviews.description: If you like dry ciders, this place is for you. The Tejano Dreams is my favorite. They also have wine if you are not into cider.   Place is a little small. You can get a flight or by the glass. If you are usually a beer drinker or new to ciders, they will definitely let you try a few so you can find your favorite.   If you are hungry, there are usually food trucks at 4th tap and they let you bring food in. It is not officially dog friendly but sometimes they have a table outside when the garage is open.

reviews.author: Mariah F.
reviews.description: Fairwheather cider was definitely a surprise and a hidden gem. It's a very small location but it is in the burnet brewing scene, as it's located right next to 4th tap. Their cider is so amazing with fusions with sweet tea, gin, wine and different fruits, it'll definitely give you a pleasant experience you may not have been expecting. They also have so many more flavor options than what they offer in the store so id go to the cider for more options. You can also take pictures in front of the interesting wall art with the unicorn things going on.

reviews.author: Alex D.
reviews.description: Great local cider, in the "brewery area" of north Austin. They're got cute merch and you must try the jalapeo cider!

reviews.author: Angel L.
reviews.description: This taproom has a very minimalistic and industrial aesthetic that makes it a perfect place to catch up with a friend. It's quite small, but there was ample seating when I was there. Their cider is different from most of the dry ones I've had before - my favorite was the common with citrus-y flavors. The Apple flavor wasn't as strong as I was expecting (or used to with other ciders), and maybe that's just the case with a "true" dry cider. It tasted almost like a wine, which is great if you're a wine lover, I suppose!

name: Cork and Barrel Craft Kitchen and Microbrewery

reviews.author: Amber E.
reviews.description: Amazing outdoor space. The cocktails and food were great. Definitely my new favorite place for outdoor dining.

reviews.author: Mark S.
reviews.description: Homer made this visit special. What a great guy. Knew the tricks of holding off on ordering everything at the same time so the courses would come out properly. Always a smile an great attitude. Oh, and the food is good to.  Come here and ask for Homer. And no I'm not his brother. Haha

reviews.author: Dana T.
reviews.description: Very disappointed.  The restaurant is beautiful inside and out. It all goes downhill from there.  The service is sub-par. I'll never understand why a server would bring the appetizer with the entree. I also heard complaints from adjacent tables about incorrect orders.  The food is overpriced. It's pub grub. It's not even good pub grub. The chicken was over cooked and dry. The house made chips were stale and greasy.  The beer/wine list is average at best. The two "house brews" I tried weren't bad but nothing to overcome everything else.  Overall it's just overpriced bad service and food in a beautiful setting.

reviews.author: Stephany G.
reviews.description: Super friendly staff. Artichoke dip, and flaming bacon appetizers were tasty.  I had the Chicken pesto sandwich. Flavors were on point. Nice atmosphere.  Didn't like that we were uncharged when we were offered more "crostini" for our spinach dip. Would definitely add this to the rotation if I lived nearby.

reviews.author: Bee B.
reviews.description: Checked out this Irish microbrewery today and enjoyed the live music they had out on their patio. Large patio with some green space to play corn hole and they're dog friendly. We ordered the burger, garlic pretzels, fish and chips, and the charcuterie Nosh board. The drinks we ordered were the white sangria and blueberry wheat beer. The garlic pretzels and charcuterie were delicious. Interesting, cool place

reviews.author: Kiva C.
reviews.description: This place never disappoints. They have ample indoor seating with standard and bar height options. Their outdoor area is massive. They have covered seating under a pavilion which is equipped with heaters and fans for any time of year. They have some uncovered seating as well and a mini amphitheater vibe for live music. They also have picnic tables on the grass and a ton of room for kids to run wild and free. They are dog friendly outside. Today we opted for the back patio and had the pleasure of being helped by Aniya. She has such a kind, gentle, and engaging energy. She impressed me with her knowledge of both the bar and food menu down to knowing the size of the pours. Aniya also had some killer recommendations! If you're in the area, you've got to try them out and ask for Aniya!

reviews.author: Mike N.
reviews.description: Two out of four meals were poorly executed.  The first, a Lemon-Thyme Petite Poussin was ordered and they delivered Lemon-Thyme chicken wings instead.  The other, my meal was a Reuben and it NEVER showed up.  I ate my side of Mac and Cheese, the rest of the Charcuterie board and waited.  Eventually, the server who has worked here since the place opened asked me how I enjoyed my meal.  LOL!  Is getting 50% of an order correct good for table service?  The place is nice, crowded, blah, blah, blah.  I wish it was better so I could come back more often, but they just don't have it together.

reviews.author: Alyssa R.
reviews.description: I've gone twice so far.  First time was terrible. They have us a terrible table when the restaurant was empty. Service was terrible. Out of almost everything we wanted. Food was average and took forever coming out. Second time was a lot better. Nice table on the counter patio. Food was available and came in a timely manner.  I really enjoyed the Pear and Fig Pizza and Wings. As well as the burrata

reviews.author: Melanie B.
reviews.description: Such a fun new spot! Met a bunch of girls for lunch. Ciara was the sweet host that was so accommodating. We had reservations but switcheroooed on her with the table and she was super nice. Found us the perfect spot.  Angel was our waitress and she was just as great! Larger group... kept her cool... recommended great choices for us.. I had half arugula salad and sandwich and 2 glasses of Sauv Blanc ... the managers came by and checked on us... one lady and one man...  Great service, great outdoors... good filtered water... yes I can tell...  I will be back to try out patio and bar in the very near future!  Would love to try more items on the menu. And I did tell Angel I would be back to see her... I love that it's dog friendly and the outdoor seating is amazing... love the string lights... good ambiance... clean bathrooms...  Great for lunch date, happy hours or large groups!

reviews.author: Katie M.
reviews.description: I really like this place. Its interior is beautiful and thoughtfully designed. There a large yard with plenty of space for the kiddos to roam as well.   We had an excellent server and really liked the "Snug" we sat in.  The seating options are pretty and a unique feature actually.   Seating: Large tables, small tables, "Snugs"(private little cubby with plenty of room), bar seating, outdoor tables and cozy seating around a fireplace outside.   The food: Pretzel w/ dipping trio. Yes! These are excellent w/ an awesome sourdough flavor.  The fish and chips was pretty good. Great batter with a ton of flavor in it. The pizza (ordered without the pepperoni). The dough was under proved and under cooked. Ok at best.  The irish stew was pretty to look at but had none of the heart or depth of flavor that you'd expect from a stew. My soul was craving a hot heart stew, no luck. Disappointing.   Drinks: No wells here!! Just a quality selection of excellent wines and spirits.   We'll definitely be back and try a new selection of foods! If you're looking for a place to visit/meet up, this is a great venue. Plentyyyyyy of room!!

reviews.author: Sam B.
reviews.description: Can honestly say I look forward to coming back here. I want to start off by saying I hadn't eaten breakfast, lunch, or dinner prior to arriving there which you could only imagine I was hangry(hungry + angry)    So I park my car and Soon as I step on the curb to make my way towards the door the hostess had already opened the door and was greeting my wife and I with a warm and friendly greeting.   As a manager myself, I always preached that our customers should never have to touch the door and I was so glad to see this establishment have the same values about it as I do.   We sat down and in no time our waiter Homer was at our table greeting us. I must say he was very personable. He truly grasp the concept of building rapport with his customers.   The food came out pretty quick which was a huge plus because a I stayed before I was "Hangry"  My fries were cold, but then again they're fries so I just asked for some fresh ones that had some heat to it lol.  My wife order the 8HR Braised Short Rib and she stated it was just ok.  I asked for lemon pepper wings, My receipt shows that's what I got, but I can tell you that want what came in my plate. Was I made about it NO, why you ask? Because whatever the heck it was taste pretty darn good. I should have asked what was I given because I wouldn't mind ordering it again.  My fish and chips was freaking AMAZING and whatever little SAUCE they give you to dip you food into.... AMAZING!!! make sure you ask for extra so you get enough to dip your fries in it to lol. My wife tried my fish and chips and said she couldn't wait to come back to get that next time.   On our way out the door the host struck again with grabbing the door for us and she did it with a smile. As I was walking my way to the car another employee told me how much they appreciated our business and I'm thinking to myself write your done working your on your way to your own car to head home and you still take the time out to make is feel special. I feel that the friendly service has us excited to come back and eat here again and we are looking forward to it.

reviews.author: Andrea B.
reviews.description: Beautiful restaurant!!! Service was awful! Food just ok!  The fish and chip is flavorless! The carrot cake was strange!  The lemon pepper was was good!

reviews.author: Tamara R.
reviews.description: Beautiful restaurant with pretty good food as well! Have been a few times in both large and small groups, and there's always such a great atmosphere indoors and outdoors. Everyone's always been happy with their food, and I can't stop thinking about their fish dish that's sadly no longer on the menu.

reviews.author: Lauren T.
reviews.description: Cool spot for inside and outside dining. The outside patio has strings of lights everywhere and a cute "whiskey barrel" table for a couple to sit at.   We had their lemon thyme wings and there so awesome. So crunchy and flavorful. We also had their special pizza and it was good! A little too greasy for us but you can tell everything was extremely fresh.  Our server was super friendly and she even let me sample the Bloody Mary mix that I asked about.  The charcuterie board looked tasty, we definitely want to go back and try it!

reviews.author: Mariel V.
reviews.description: They brew their own beer and have a massive selection of good wines and provisions. It wouldn't be an Irish pub without these yummy fish and chips, now would it?!  It's the only time I'm down to go to a pub - I'm not a beer person but I love a good beer battered Irish fish and chips. The only way I'd take beer.  The place is gorgeous, spacious (big groups are welcome!)  We wished we didn't have to leave. Their back patio is beautifully by a creek. They also control the mosquitoes which could ruin any patio dining experience for me. It's a win all around!  I can't wait to come back to this piece of Ireland in Round Rock, the managers told us that a lot of their restaurant decor are from Ireland shipped here. That's pretty personal and lovely in my book.

reviews.author: Kim N.
reviews.description: Was very excited to try this place because of the pictures we saw online. Coming into it, it actually looked very casual like a sports bar almost. We meant to come in for quick lunch. However, quick it was not. We waited 45 minutes before we said anything. The server kept coming to us and saying "your food will be right out" every 10 minutes but nothing more. We saw people getting food after us which raised concerns so we asked our waiter who just said "its coming"  and finally asked to see to a manager. Manager came and explained that the cook dropped the food and had to remake it.  In conclusion, we told them that we would have wanted them communicate that to us from the start so we knew why others got their food first. The manager just shrugged it off and we were so upset that we couldn't even finish our food. Thumbs down on service and management.

reviews.author: John B.
reviews.description: This place has so much potential but on my visit it was a total and complete disaster.    Parking - Small parking lot for the size of the venue, saw a sign that said additional parking at Dell diamond which is a good ways up the street.  They do not have any valet parking. I ended up parking at the R Bank lot (about 1/2 between the two spots) that had a sign that said towing was enforced from 5p - 8A but we were assured they had an arrangement and that we would not be towed. It worked out but still was quite a hike.  Atmosphere and decor  The architecture and furnishings are outstanding and really are enticing.  Round Rock does not have many restaurants of this style. The place is packed and you need to make a reservation.  We sat by the window in the bar, a little after 630 and we were baking because of the heat. The air conditioning was not working well enough to keep everyone comfortable, several in our party were visibly sweating.  Adding ceiling fans and putting some type of treatment on the windows would help considerably, this is only going to get worse as summer temperatures begin to return to the 100 +.  The windows face the west,  Service  They are terribly understaffed. Typically for a new restaurant, owners over staff and make sure that the service is beyond good. The service here was beyond bad. Our server was working her tail off and trying to maintain her very large group of tables.  Everything was taking too much time.  There were large gaps of time between ordering and receiving, especially on the drinks.  Two of our rounds were forgotten and upon reminding our server, she quickly darted to the bar and then returned in short order.  Sadly, some of the drinks were no longer chilled and cold  but warm - obviously has been sitting unattended for some period of time.  Drinks  The drinks were overpriced. For example, a vodka martini (Tito's) small demanded a $15 price tag. As mentioned above, the drink was warm and did not taste good at all.  The typical turnaround from placing an order for drinks to receiving them was at least 10 minutes.  On the positive side they have some unique drinks on the menu, an old fashion that comes to the table actually smoking, when they remove the cover. A neighboring table ordered one and it was quite the sight.  Again, some great potential, but because of under staffing and other issues they fall short.  Food  Several of my dining companions had been here before and strongly recommended the Reuben sandwich, saying when they had it a few weeks ago it was fantastic and perhaps one of the best they had ever had eaten. Well, for me, not so much.  The meat was not sliced well, was chunky and tough, the Reuben arrived luke warm and did not taste all that great.    Others in my dining party, ordered the pretzel appetizer and the pepperoni pizza.  The food met expectations, but nothing spectacular.  The dipping sauces for he pretzel were unique - beer cheese, red wine tarragon butter and a garlic cream cheese.  They asked for some small plates, everyone of the plates had to be wiped clean.     One dining companion ordered the charred vegetables.  We were all surprised at the how small the serving was for the $14 price tag - and the comment was they were over charred.    They do have a patio that does not take reservations and seating is first come first serve.  The bar and food are different from the indoor main venue.  Interestingly, they have a food truck that is serving a different menu from what is inside.

reviews.author: Lanie M.
reviews.description: We've been here on multiple occasions and every time it's been wonderful!  The food is great and the drinks are just as good. I love the huge outdoor area for the kids and dogs to play! Today we had Aniya as our server, and she was terrific! Super friendly and very knowledgeable on everything. She had great suggestions for us on both the food and drinks.

reviews.author: Andrew Y.
reviews.description: First of all, the place is beautiful inside and out. That's the main sell 100%. The food is good and so are the drinks but a little overpriced for their outdoor menu. A guiness draught at any type of irish pub shouldn't go for $9 nor any bar for that matter in my opinion. All food and drink prices could be $1-2 less, especially if it's a limited outdoor menu. If we were dining in (and it's beautiful inside + full menu offered), I could see those prices being fair. If the drinks were to be $1-2 less in the future, we could see ourselves being regulars, but definitely not until then.  Two of our friends ordered the wagyu burger, when asked on how it compares to a non-wagyu burger, they said they wouldn't have noticed anything especially different to a regular burger in comparison if they had not read the menu.  Nonetheless, they seemed to enjoy it.   I would order the reuben sandwich again with the kimchi slaw. I thought the kimchi slaw was very creative and it added nice flavor contrast to the otherwise classical meaty cheesy aspects of the reuben. The kimchi by itself was good, they use older more fermented kimchi, which gave the sandwich a bit of sourness to it.   My wife ordered the fish n' chips, one of her favorite barfoods. The fish itself was very moist and tender and it appears much larger in portion size than what we were expecting when looking at other user's yelp photos. The chile-lime tartar sauce wasn't very 'chile-limey' at all, it tasted just like regular tartar sauce, don't get me wrong - we LOVE any tartar sauce, but they could dial up the chile and lime all the way to the moon if that's what they're advertising.   Lastly, the staff was nice, although our waitress basically dissappeared for the second half of our stay and kept forgetting/taking an unquestionably and questionably long time to get our drinks and takeout box. Service was just OK, there is always next time.   Bonus points for the restrooms, very neat, clean and well decorated.

reviews.author: Elvira A.
reviews.description: Having brunch here isn't simply eating a meal, it is a complete experience. Yes, the food is AMAZING! The Fish and Chips  and Reuben Sandwich are delicious and portions generous. The craft beer is also the best (Huckleberry wheat).  Plus the place is filled with great atmosphere, and plenty of history. Our server (Jewels) pointed out the wall plaques located all along the restaurant filled with tidbits of information. This contributes to the experience. The music is great and staff friendly. A very happy place! We drove from South Austin to visit, definitely retuning soon!

reviews.author: Rachel W.
reviews.description: Pinthouse is my go to pizza and salad place. My mom and I discovered this place when we were looking for restaurants with gluten free options and I'm so glad we gave it a try.  To start off, I got the Pinthouse chop salad. This has to be the best darn chopped salad I've ever had. All of the ingredients were adequately chopped up and had just the right amount of dressing. I daydream about how good this salad is.  I also ordered the honey pear pizza on gluten free crust and WOW- what a genius combination! The sweet pears complement the prosciutto, balsamic, and basil so well. It was like a symphony in my mouth.   I love the patio area- just the right amount of sun hits it.   This is an Austin staple for me and I'll keep bringing friends and family here. Next time I'll have to try a beer on tap while watching a sports game and chowing down on amazing pizza.

reviews.author: Anthony T.
reviews.description: The environment of pint house pizza is really chill for grabbing a drink. Came here during happy hour and got a beer and pizza.   Got the local jellyfish IPA and a sweet pizza that wasn't too sweet. A nice sweet and savory flavor that combo the beer well. Also tried the pretzel for appetizer. It was my first time and was a bit too salty for my liking.  Parking was a bit rough to get to since barely in the front and back of the building but coming in early should be fine.

reviews.author: Amy Z.
reviews.description: Pinthouse is a great place to come, especially if you're with a large group of people and looking for a casual setting. They offer pretty unique pizza flavors, and this time I tried out the Honey Pear (8.5/10) and Shroomin' Goat (7/10). The Honey Pear was a nice contrast of savory and sweet, without being overly sweet. I'm a huge fan of honey on pizza, so this was definitely a good choice! The Shroomin' Goat has crumbles of goat cheese, with lots of greens and mushrooms. I liked this pizza, but it was a bit too salty for me, and I wish it had more balanced out flavors.   I ordered a medium pizza (~$20) with half of each topping, and I'm glad I got to try out both combinations! The medium pizza, by the way, is huge and more than enough for one person. I was pretty full after three pieces but am happy to take home leftovers. The place also has a nice bar area that has pretty well-priced beers and ciders. There's a blood orange cider that I tried, which was really good. Overall, definitely recommend Pinthouse for anyone who wants a chill, fun pizza and beer night!

reviews.author: Diana N.
reviews.description: Between the 2 of us, we got 2 smalls, and it was plenty to share! Thin crust, very crispy, very fresh! Pretty cheap for great pizza! You can get 2 different kinds on a pizza, even a small!  Small 10" - $8-8.50 Medium 14" - $16-17 Large 16" - $19.50-20.50  In order of favorite pizza: Cannonball and The Works (tied), then The Hoe Down and all a'sprout it (bf doesnt care for goat cheese though).  **CANNONBALL (like a meat lover's)- Red sauce, house cheese blend,pepperoni, bacon, local crumbled sausage, Canadian bacon. Very good. Very crispy.   **THE WORKS (like a Supreme)- Red sauce, house cheese blend, pepperoni, Canadian bacon, local crumbled sausage, green peppers, garlic, mushrooms, red onions. Good, basic supreme pizza  THE HOE DOWN- Red sauce, house cheese blend, roasted red peppers, roasted CAULIFLOWER, roasted GARLIC, RICOTTA, pepita PESTO. Kind of expected more out of this bc I love roasted cauliflower and ricotta. It was good but probably pass next time.   ALL A'SPROUT IT (monthly pizza) - roasted BRUSSELS SPROUTS, caramelized onions, savory BACON, GOAT CHEESE, BALSAMIC reduction. Love goat cheese and roasted Brussels sprouts. However, this was good but passable.   **My bro's favorite is HONEY PEAR-  Extra virgin olive oil, house cheese blend, sliced pear, caramelized onions, blue cheese, prosciutto, basil, local honey. I will try this next time even though I'm not a big fan of blue cheese.

reviews.author: Nicole I.
reviews.description: They get it right every single time. I'm blessed to live so close !!!! Thanks to the crew as always

reviews.author: Emily N.
reviews.description: Best pizza in austin! Better than home slice!  For starters; MAKE A RESERVATION/JOIN THE WAITLIST ONLINE when you're on the way so you don't have to stand outside and wait in texas' jank weather.  They have a beautiful variety of locally brewed beers that are solid and also go on sale during happy hour!  Interior is a ton of long tables which are perfect for groups.   Great innovative flavor combinations across the menu for pizzas. Would recommend.

reviews.author: Alyssa K.
reviews.description: Great laid back dining experince! The inside can get pretty crowded since it is first come first serve seating!

reviews.author: Amanda K.
reviews.description: This review is based upon the bar and drinks only.  My husband and I stopped in for a drink since we had dined earlier next door and didn't want to overpay for another drink. In retrospect we should of dined here instead because the prices were way better and it smelled amazing.  Anyway, the bar area was nice and plenty of places to stand and or sit in the dining area. The food smelled so good and would love to grab a slice and a drink next time while here. They have gluten free options to include side and pizzas.

reviews.author: peggy e.
reviews.description: Best beer, best staff, best pizza! The staff is always  my favorite reason to come here! They have improved the "Beer Mates" appetizer and it's a meal on its own! We love Pinthouse!

reviews.author: Allison W.
reviews.description: We ordered ahead on their website right when it opened at 11 AM. We got a medium honey pear ($17) and a medium banh mi ($16).   Banh mi: the pickled red onions were the star of the show for me. The flavors of the toppings do remind me of banh mi. I would eat this one again for sure. The sriracha on it was a nice touch. It had a good balance of acid, spice, and freshness.  Honey pear: this flavor surprised me in a good way. I just gave this place 4 stars since I thought the toppings on this pizza was lacking a bit as I felt that there was a bit too much crust at the edges, especially compared to the banh mi pizza. I feel like the topping placement could have been more even - some slices didn't have much else besides caramelized onions.  We ordered ahead, and then just picked up our pizza from them and sat down in the store. This place has no waiter, you just order from a counter. The seating is very homey since it's a lot of big tables and bench seats.

reviews.author: Andy N.
reviews.description: Wow. Without a doubt, one of my favorite places in Austin, TX. I had grown tiresome of pizza, but Pinthouse reignited my love. Their innovative twists on a classic dish was truly incredible from the first bite when the diversity of flavors exploded on my tastebuds. Also, the price was phenomenal for the amount you get. One small pizza was MORE than enough to fill me up and leave me beyond satisfied. I'm looking forward to coming back and trying all their specialty pizzas. If you're looking for something incredible and affordable, this restaurant is an absolute MUST. Innovative, fresh, affordable, and delicious; it can't get any better.

reviews.author: Edgar R.
reviews.description: I've been to Pinthouse Pizza a couple of times now, but decided to take my family for the first this past weekend.  They really enjoyed the music, loved the food, and liked the variety of draft beer. The people at the bar were really nice and offered assistance with picking different beers for our flight. The lady taking our food order was in a bad mood, but that shouldn't take away from the restaurant's review.  Will definitely be back.

reviews.author: Ann K.
reviews.description: Obsessed with the pizza rolls, best GF pizza in town, and Italian chopped salad is delicious and you can add golden raisins, pepperoni, blue cheese, and it will knock your socks off! Love this place!!!!!

reviews.author: Carly K.
reviews.description: Awesome beer and great pizza. The one with honey is fantastic and the salad is pretty good, too.

reviews.author: Doug P.
reviews.description: Super fun place with lots of cool beers.  They have pizza, pretzels and other brewery food.  The chips and salsa could have bought at the convenience store across the street as there was no creativity for $6.  The pretzel and pizzas were top notch.  We tried several of the beers over the course of two visits in two days.  All were really good and I would have the. Again if I ever go back.  The beer bases are awesome as well. Very helpful in finding the right beverage on a hot Texas Summer day.    Worth visiting!!

reviews.author: Nicole P.
reviews.description: I went once and will def go back! They have an extensive beer menu and the food is great. This was our backup dinner after our planned dinner failed and I was really happy to have a good experience as we randomly chose to dine in. Service was friendly and offered beer suggestions when I asked. We ate chips, queso, and pizza. queso and salsa were great considering we weren't at a tex mex place. The pizza was cheesy with flavorful toppings. They have a small patio and there's parking in the strip center it's located.

reviews.author: Dawn H.
reviews.description: Always been such a huge fan of all things Pinthouse...food and beer! Their crust sets them apart from other 'za joints and they craft brews are right up their with any of the big guys (if you know, you know!).   During Covid quarantine, I have been taking advantage of their online beer release ordering and curbside pickup. Yay! Really hope this "new" process doesn't change. I also discussed they sell their dough to go, so I've been getting more creative in my own kitchen making pretzels and other yummies.   What else can I say? Nothing really, except go...just go! If you haven't yet, you're sadly missing out on this Austin institution.   Congrats on all the expansion and continues success Pinthouse! Cheers!

reviews.author: Sandra Y.
reviews.description: I'm a fan! I love this place! Their happy hour is amazing! I want to drink their ranch by the pint!  (I've discovered I only really LOVE love their specialty pies though - Honey Pear is possibly my favorite pizza of all time and the Banh Mi one is so fun and spicy and there's so many textures and flavors but it all works really well.)  Pictured is The Works and it wasn't anything special in my opinion. But I will always go back!! For Honey Pear  Note: Happy hour is M-F from 4-6pm and its $2 off pints of PHP beer as well as $2 off beer mates (cheesy garlic bread). Only complaint is I drink beer too slowly so maybe next time I'll order 2 before happy hour ends ;)

reviews.author: Daniel D.
reviews.description: Not only are the pizzas here at PHP unique, the flavors somehow just work amazingly well. For example, my friend convinced me to try the honey pear pizza (I was suspicious but got it anyways), the tanginess of the pear with the sweetness of the honey and caramelized onion, with the saltiness of the prosciutto made it one of my all time favorites! Of course, they have "regular" pizzas as well, which were also quite delicious. PHP is also a brewery. I won't claim to be a beer connoisseur (it was good beer, that's all I can say), but the combination of beer and pizza here is amazing! Great laid back atmosphere with excellent pies.

reviews.author: Monica S.
reviews.description: My favorite pizza place in Austin (and maybe ever!). I always go for the honey pear pizza with a side of ranch and a TX Keeper cider. Last time I was there, they let me know that my pizza wasn't to their standards because the dough had bubbled up a bit too much and caused some of the cheese to pool in places. I would've eaten it happily anyways, but they promised to bring me another, better pie after a while. They did bring one, but it still wasn't quite right to them, so they brought it to me in a to-go box, and promised to get the next one right. A little later, they brought out the "perfect honey pear" alongside a $20 gift card for my patience. I've never had a staff go so above and beyond for me! Always feel taken care of here, and always leave feeling wonderful.  Thanks, Pinthouse!!

reviews.author: J.J. B.
reviews.description: Phenomenal food, service, and authenticity.   I was impressed with the full English breakfast, especially since they had real black pudding. Also the English breakfast tea tray was on point. The service was friendly and attentive. Authentic and laid back pub atmosphere.   Highly recommend for an authentic English Pub experience in the Austin TX metro area. Head on up to Round Rock for Kenny Fort Pub.

reviews.author: Sam P.
reviews.description: I was working in Round Rock and we were looking for somewhere for lunch - spotted place on Yelp and bring British and sporting some old faves on the menu, decided to give it a try ! Very glad we did.  Full of cool British decor, we were met by the owner ( Tim?), really nice bloke and super friendly! It made me feel like I was at the local ( pub) back home.  Went with the curry and being vegetarian, was excited they had a cauliflower version which was great and very authentic! Loved the naan bread too.  My colleague got a burger but after spotting the fish and chips wanted to rest that - so we tried that and it was crazy authentic. Loved the mushy peas, curry sauce and the delicious tarter sauce . The dish is huge so easily enough for 2 !  Lovely place , great owner and fabulous food

reviews.author: Robin C.
reviews.description: Anything short of amazing would be doing this pub an injustice! A colleague of mine recommended Kenney Fort Pub for their brews and food. We finally got over there today for lunch to try it out and holy cow were we impressed! The location is tucked away in a commercial development and their frontage faces interior to the subdivision. When you get to the entrance you can feel the attention to detail and hospitality the second you walk in. The owner immediately greeted us and seated us right away. The dining area was spacious and airy. The  bar had a nice open feel, with visibility to all the brews on tap. We accessed the menu on our phones and were able to quickly place our order. We enjoyed vanilla beers which were full of flavor, just thought they might be a porter which they weren't. Only recommendation I would make to the owners is to list their beers by category on their menu so folks will gavitate to what they like. The names by themselves of the beers can be a hair unclear on whether they are a stout versus a pilsner kinda thing.   We enjoyed the hot pretzels with beer cheese that was super flavorful. For entrees we had the Kenney Fort Burger which was served on a warm pretzel bun with string fries and an amazing chargrilled burger which was super juicy. My husband has the fish and chips which came with fantastic wedge fries (I would sub for those with my burger next time) and several different dips for the crispy flaky fish. What we found most amazing was that this all happened with the owner running the entire restaurant and bar. He was on point the entire time and we had an amazing experience.  Lastly (and my personal favor), when he brought us the check, it had an RFID to pay on our phones using Toast. For anyone during this pandemic who has eaten out and either had to wait forever for a server to process your payment...or worse, had a server standing over you awkwardly handing you a device for you to pay your bill and put their tip in, you will appreciate this user-friendly and easy option to complete your check and close out your meal. LOVE LOVE LOVED THIS!  Enjoyed our entire experience and most definitely this is our go-to place going forward. Can't wait to try more beer selections and other menu items!

reviews.author: Jack K.
reviews.description: I just took a trip across "the pond" for my first visit here. Not really across the pond but 15 minutes away. This definitely brought me back to my Navy days of Portsmouth and London Pub style fish and chips! Perfectly battered and fried with that nice light crunch when you bite into it. The buffalo cauliflower bites was a first time try for me also. All vegetables need too be made this way. Not too spicy but just right.  This was a takeout order and everything was still hot and crispy when I got home. Perfect spot for any occasion.

reviews.author: Mandy W.
reviews.description: Best fish and chips around! I have to do the small entree the full order is HUGGEE! Everything is delicious and definitely a great spot to try some new foods like the Scotch eggs! They have a great selection of beers and cocktails as well. Staff is always awesome and never have had a bad experience.

reviews.author: Christian C.
reviews.description: I've always been told that British food is boring and bland.  After eating it for the first time at The Kenney Fort British Pub, I can undoubtedly tell you, that is not the case.  The first British food item I had become really curious of is a Scotch Egg and I was finally able to get my hands on one here.  A Scotch Egg is a boiled egg wrapped in sausage, coated in bread crumbs and then deep fried or baked.  Simple enough, but Kenney Fort serves it on top of chopped and pickled veggies that takes it to another level.  I would come back here just for the Scotch Egg alone.  My wife ordered Fish and Chips which was battered and fried to perfection.  I'm not big on fish, but I asked for more than just one bite and enjoyed it very much.  It came with a side of tartar, curry, as well as mushy peas, which were delicious.  I ordered Bangers and Mash, which came with three sausage links, mashed potatoes, and peas in a tasty, tasty gravy.  This dish was top notch and surpassed my expectations.  Every bite was packed with flavor and very enjoyable.  The beer options here are plentiful, which also contains many local brewery selections.  Unfortunately, it was noon when we came, and a bit too early for me to crack one open.  However, we are both very excited to try them out as well as some of Kenney Fort's other food items.

reviews.author: Christina M.
reviews.description: Nice courtyard! Greta selection of cold beers on tap. Had the Masala there and it was very good!

reviews.author: Samuel T.
reviews.description: Was there about 9 pm last night. My companion wanted a really good burger and Yelp gave us this place.   We were the only patrons eating at tables. There were a few guys at the bar. Since I wasn't really hungry, we decided to order their signature burger which is made with ground brisket and ground meat from short ribs. I asked for it to not be overcooked. We talked about the cooking temperature with the waitress and she assured us it would be cooked medium. When it came out it was more like well-done. Pretty dry meat and not all that tasty. The bun seemed like it was homemade and was good, as were all the veggies they put on it. Fries were nothing special.   We will be back and I will try their fish and chips.   Service was good and the prices for what we had were consistent with 2021 inflation prices. I am sure this would be the place to be when a soccer game was on.   Music playing on their sound system was very good too.

reviews.author: David K.
reviews.description: Very nice atmosphere. Plenty of parking spaces. Friendly attentive staff. Delicious food. Great beer selection.

reviews.author: Susan B.
reviews.description: Fish and chips reminiscent of London's open market stalls, and you don't want to miss the squishy peas. Thank you Kenney Fort.

reviews.author: Jeremy A.
reviews.description: Great pub with great food.   Been here 6 times so far.   Just super loud inside.   Very hard to hear each other while dining.    Great beer selection and good cocktails too.   Can't beat the fish and chips and their burger

reviews.author: Taylor A.
reviews.description: As a Brit in Austin, after moving here and finally settling in, naturally the next step was the go on a hunt for good British grub in search of a slice of home. I came across the Fort Kenney Pub in Yelp and knew that the following Saturday would start with a fry up!  When we walked in, the staff were all super friendly and welcoming. It wasn't busy as it was still early but there was plenty of seating and the football could be seen from most of them.  The food was great and everything I had hoped for! I subbed black pudding for an extra sausage which our server was more than happy to do. The sausages were really delicious!  Really enjoyed spending my Saturday morning here eating a yummy breakfast. I would love to come back to try some of the other meals on the menu!

reviews.author: Adam L.
reviews.description: A word to the wise, the Sunday dinner is insane for a mere mortal.  My wife was definitely a victim of eyes bigger than tummy!  I got a burger that was actually pretty remarkable, tho I couldn't enjoy the pretzel bun thanks to this stupid diet!    The bathrooms are clean and the entire facility is well kept.    The staff was outstanding and everyone was super.on the ball.

reviews.author: Michael T.
reviews.description: Dirty floor dirty menu dirty silverware and who ever works there looked like kitchen help walking back to the kitchen with his pants sagging last thing I wanted to see was his butt and underwear food was cold and bland and had to ask for beverage refills and the ticket seems the bar area and those around are more important then dinners

reviews.author: Natalie K.
reviews.description: Today, on this lazy, rainy, gloomy, post-#AustinBlizzard2021 Sunday, Hubs and I were on the hunt for some true comfort food! Thus, we knew that crossing the proverbial pond was a must! This is how we found ourselves at Kenney Fort Pub. Can I just say, y'all, that what we had here was just what we needed? This is true English pub food, and it warmed the very cockles of our very recently frigid hearts!   Hubby went with the English Breakfast! As he was wolfing it down, he looked up at me with an actual sparkle in his eyes, and he said, "Do you know what this reminds me of most recently, honey?", and I said, "Yep!"! I knew right away that he was referring to that Irish Breakfast that he got at the military part of the airport in Shannon, Ireland, on the way to his too long deployment in Afghanistan in 2018! The picture that he sent me on WhatsApp of that breakfast in that airport is burned in my memory forever!   I went with the Sunday Roast, and it was bloody fantastic, as well! The picture tells the whole story! So good! Chris ate 3/4ths of it, which is our usual division of restaurant food, but I just loved everything about it! The horseradish sauce was MAGIC! I could bathe in it!   We ended with the Sticky Toffee Pudding, and damn, y'all! Just damn!  Bottom line: if you've never tasted either of these traditional plates across the pond, but you're the sort that likes little tastes of many things, both of these dishes will be RIGHT up your alley!   And, even if you're not down for little tastes of many things, you'll absolutely wax poetic about that pudding!   What a fantastic find!   p.s. Our server was Noah, and he was a gem!

reviews.author: Lyla A.
reviews.description: A solid 4 star experience!  I loved the fish (the chips were ok!). The burger was smokey and the meat was fresh. The fries that came with the burger were tasty. Everything was well seasoned. The kids fish and chips was great and my 5 year old ate it up.   I did not like the tikka masala. It was not creamy and felt heavy on the cumin. It was a smaller portion and not very much sauce. This was the only dish I didn't care for.     Also, when you pack up a to go order, please package the naan separate from thee sauce. It was packed together and the naan was all covered in the sauce that I didn't like so I didn't eat that either.    They need clearer instructions on what their pickup curbside process is. It was a little confusing but we just called and the man who answered brought our food out.  Maybe we were supposed to go get it inside?  I don't know.    I'm glad Kenney Fort Pub is in our neighborhood. I am sure  that we will be ordering curbside from them frequently.

reviews.author: Eva Maria T.
reviews.description: Cool neighborhood British pub with proper fish and chips. Come with an appetite because the large was the size of my forearm. Loved the tarter sauce and Indian curry style sauce which accompanied the fish. The Mr. had the cheeseburger on a pretzel bun with British style bacon. Happy hour drink prices are $2.00 off. Very friendly and attentive service. We will definitely be back.

reviews.author: Netta K.
reviews.description: I had really high hopes but I left disappointed.  I have had British food in a many locations and this left me wanting.  I feel they either put an Texas flare or their own take on what British food taste like.    The burger was good, you  can't really mess up a burger.. well, maybe. The banger and mash, yall.... no. It tasted like a warmed up Slim Jim, the mashed potatoes had an odd flavor that none of could place. Maybe the mustard?  The staff was very helpful but it kinda sucked I couldn't even get a paper menu, my QR reader wasn't working on my phone.   I'll give it another try but will definitely not get B and M again!

reviews.author: Jennifer M.
reviews.description: The food is fantastic! We've been to the UK several times and this is authentic to what we get there.  The restaurant itself is a bit warehouse ish. I feel like they could have done better to give it a pub feel. It feels nothing like a pub which was disappointing.  I'm docking one star for the Pimm's Cup. It's made with that awful soda machine Minute Laud Lemonade. It was horrendous! That was all I could taste. Simple syrup and Minute Made Lemonade.  I also docked a star for the music. It was SO LOUD. My husband and I couldn't talk. Literally. Couldn't hear each other. We were starting to question whether we're hitting an age where we say things like "the music is too loud", but no. No no no. This was freaking ridiculous! They had a lady there playing it for an hour before she started what I think was a quiz or game. Music should add ambiance. This felt like we were sitting front row at a concert. It was insanity. To the point I'm totally okay removing a star because of it.  We'll probably go back for the food, but if we're in the mood for a cocktail, or conversation, it won't be high on our list.

reviews.author: Nancy P.
reviews.description: Can't believe I haven't written a review here yet.  I went out of my way to get here. Was so looking forward to eating real British food.   I was going to be out this way during my first vaccine shot at Dell Diamond.  It was around lunch that I arrived here.  Waited a short time until they opened. Yes, I was the first one there.  First stop was to the loo.  Yes, it was labeled Loo. Started off with an order of iced tea.  Sorry, Brits no hot tea on a hot day. I asked the server if I could possible try the Black pudding they serve with breakfast. Turns out the server was one of the owner. So I got a slice. Ordered up a Scottish Egg and a plate of Bangers and mash.  I have had Scottish eggs before. These were a bit different because they used British sausage.   British sausage is very much leaner than US sausage.  The sausage meat surrounding the soft boiled egg was denser.  And it was served with picalilli (British salsa).  Loved these starters. Next up the bangers and mash and a slice of black pudding. Had to try the black pudding first.  Trust me it is not a pudding but a blood, oatmeal, pork fat, spices sausage. Before you turn your nose up, try it. A little nibble and interesting flavor. Bigger bite and it was good, before I knew it I finished it off and wish I had more. The banger was a Cumberland made sausage.  Lean pork shoulder meat makes it different than US sausages. Once you get over the difference, It is really good. But the mash potatoes, oh wow. They add mustard and cheddar cheese to theirs. Next batch of mash, I plan on adding mustard to mine. Now if that isn't enough, Red Onion gravy.  Take a slice of sausage, dip into the mash and make sure you have the gravy on it.... Prefect bite. I keep thinking the next time I go, I will get the fish and chips. But as I am writing this, all I can think about is the Bangers and Mash.

reviews.author: Karen B.
reviews.description: All the way from Vancouver Canada! This is the best BBQ I've tried in Texas! (Yes, I've been to all of the BBQ places in Texas).  Clean restaurant, great music and the service is superb!   Thank you!

reviews.author: Brendan L.
reviews.description: Best no-line waiting bbq in Austin  Absolute goodness   Yep good stuff they want me to write more

reviews.author: Mark V.
reviews.description: My wife and I love slab, but we were extremely upset that the Burnet location decided to close 15 minutes early on a Saturday. Closing at 8pm is already a bit early for a weekend night, but shutting off the open sign at least 15 minutes early is crazy. It could have been longer, but it was off when we got there, so who knows when they did shut it down.   The new phone and order system also sucks. You can't talk to anyone, it just sent us to voicemail. Even the online now shuts off early due to toast tab not taking pickup orders when we tried to put one in on our way there.   You are not the only place in town that sells great bbq, guys. If you keep making it difficult to buy yours, people will just go elsewhere.

reviews.author: Danielle W.
reviews.description: The ribs were so Smokey and delicious! They fell right off the bone. The sides were great! Nothing was dry. The glaze on the ribs was the perfect sweet and spicy with the habanero glaze.   We are definitely going to be back.

reviews.author: Nikiba J.
reviews.description: My niece and sister spoke very highly of Slab BBQ, I'm all for some good bbq! I save calories for good food.  The first turn off for me the secret shopper was that the cashier stated he could not change $100 bill for a $55 order! Wow.  Second, as you can see in my pictures my sliced beef sandwich was drrrrry! So d@'-dry I got beef stuck In my throat from trying to wash that dry ass beef down and that was without the bread!! I felt some foul vibes when we approached the counter but I just thought I was tripping. I truly believe the meat cutter knew he sold us that dry ass sandwich as well, so 1 star jerk!

reviews.author: Bell A.
reviews.description: Slab was just okay. I wasn't wow'd by my food. I did love the restaurant set up and music. The staff was nice too.   I ordered the Chicken W.A. With a side of mac and cheese. I love baked mac and cheese and I don't believe this one was.   Overall meh for my tastebuds.

reviews.author: Kara M.
reviews.description: Great BBQ for an even greater price! I was really impressed with everything we tried, and for it all being just under $50, it was worth it. It's not your "traditional" BBQ stop - the menu is really fun and there are some pretty creative treats to try, from Texas-sized sandwiches to habanero strawberry glazed ribs. The meats were tender as could be, the flavor was incredible, and the sauces were amazing. Will definitely be visiting again!   Service: 5/5 Food: 5/5  Individual food ratings: - Habanero Strawberry Glazed ribs (5/5): sweet and spicy (but more sweet), these ribs were perfectly tender and had really great flavor! You can get them without the glaze, or get the glaze on the side. - Smoked Gouda Mac'n'cheese (4/5): pretty tasty mac, very cheesy and creamy, would be great with hot sauce or meat. - BBQ nachos w/brisket (5/5): super loaded, huge shareable portion, and great flavors! Add extra sauces on top to get saucy. - El Jefe sammie (5/5): brisket, onions, peppers, and Fritos for some crunch, this was a great sandwich and super filling! - Twice baked potato casserole (3/5): needed a kick or maybe some more salt/pepper, but was good overall with the dank white sauce on top.

reviews.author: Priscila M.
reviews.description: First time at Slab BBQ and it's already our go to bbq in the area. First, all meats are gluten free! Yay!!!! Second, their meats are delicious! I had the chicken and the brisket and both were really good , seasoned well and very moist - cooked to perfection. I couldn't finish my salad and took maybe half of it home. So, portion wise, this is also a win. My daughter had the 1/2 ribs and we were all taken by surprise on the flavor. Seriously, TRY their RIBS!!!  They have a selection of different sauces, including a strawberry one that came with the ribs. I was very skeptical at first, but it worked pretty well. However, their mustard based one is my favorite.  We can't wait to be back!

reviews.author: Rose J.
reviews.description: Finally a barbecue joint worth raving about. When you enter you are met with the smooth sounds of  music. Very chill vibe!!!   The menu pretty easy to survey and food comes out quick fresh and hot! Those are the things I love quick fresh and hot. The prices are appropriate and the sides are reasonably priced. Also the baked beans was the business. Oh, yeah the nortorious BIG was delicious! It's topped with Cole slaw and piled with brisket very tender meat!   I love this place and it was a short drive from the hotel.

reviews.author: Mandy W.
reviews.description: Staff is great, atmosphere is relaxed and fun and food came out promptly but the food was just meh. Not bad, not great but I was expecting a little more flavor. The smoked gouda mac n cheese just tasted like smoke, no cheesy texture or taste. The twice baked potato casserole was just mashed potatoes. The pulled pork was dry and flavorless you definitely have to use sauce for it.

reviews.author: Steffie S.
reviews.description: Good stuff! I was very hungry in the late afternoon and heading to play many competitive games of ping pong, so I stopped here. The food was yummy. The pulled pork sandwich had very good flavor and the Mac and cheese was fabulous. They also serve beer which complements BBQ , IMHO. The service was courteous and prompt. The dining area was clean, though we opted to sit in their temporary outdoor seating area because it was a beautiful day. Check it out as an alternative fast food option.

reviews.author: Yoko C.
reviews.description: This is the Texas standard!! (4.5 star) I really wish I came here starving. We only made it here because people say it is worth trying after having brunch at somewhere else. Their ribs were awesome!! We were advised to try assorted sliders, but personally I wish I ordered even more ribs. I like the idea of using berry jam as sauce as well, something I've never done but quickly appreciated. Let me come back here to try more ribs in the near future!

reviews.author: Gregg M.
reviews.description: This is an easy to find place that gives you a feel of a comfortable locals/neighborhood place. Lots of TVs and some covered outside seating as well.  We thoroughly enjoyed our meal! Our party of three started with the double meat bbq brisket nachos, then we shared 1/2 # of ribs, a Texas Tornado wrap with double brisket (absolutely LOVE their brisket) then added an extra large order of the smoked Gouda Mac and cheese, green bean casserole and finished up with a banana pudding .  Gotta say I haven't eaten such great bbq for years AND took home enough for another meal.  This is my new go-to for Austin BBQ! They have a nice selection of regular and craft beers as well.  Definitely a repeater!!

reviews.author: Brandon K.
reviews.description: I've now been here 3 times and if it wasn't for my last visit, it would probably be a 5 star but the last trip was definitely not ideal. The first two times I came here, I ordered the nachos and walked out so satisfied. It is a massive portion that includes all the toppings you could ever want.  They are truly some of my favorite nachos in all of Austin.   This most recent time, I decided to switch it up and went for the trio slider.  My buddy ordered the same thing and both of us walked out of there, not sure if we would come back.  The bread was hard, and the meat was room temp at best. We came in around 12:30 on a Saturday which I would have assumed is a pretty popular time with some of the freshest food but I was definitely wrong. It almost seemed like they were trying to get rid of food from the day before.  I will probably be back at some point but I don't think I would ever order the sliders again (which is such a bummer for a place 100% known for their sandwiches)  All that being said, the first two trips made a great impression and the workers there are all fantastic so I'm still happy to support this place.

reviews.author: Kels H.
reviews.description: Run, don't sit on this place. The food is out of this world!! Delicious, hot, fresh and fast! The staff is also knowledgeable and friendly! Very underrated. Austin has lots of great bbq, but this place hits the top of my list on all accounts.

reviews.author: Stephanie S.
reviews.description: There were brisket nachos involved too but I only got a photo of the ribs as the nachos were halfway gone by then  they were excellent and a generous portion. The St. Louis ribs are some of the most tender I've had.  I wasn't a huge fan of the bbq sauce that came with the ribs but it's on the side and they have other sauces available as well- the one it came with was a little sweet for me. Planning on bringing my small rib aficionado this weekend after the pumpkin patch.  One complaint... the kids meal ribs says it comes with two.. TWO. Mine will be asking where the rest are if I ordered him a kids meal  they do have a great amount of meat on them but I have a 3 year old that eats like a teenager when he has ribs in front of him so these kids meals won't work for us  we will be getting a whole rack and I'll be lucky if *I* get to have two.

reviews.author: John P.
reviews.description: I got the Texas tornado and the McDowell. Two separate occasions and they were amazing. True Texas bbq. The Texas tornado was delicious and perfect for the one who isn't sure what they should get. The McDowell is the McRib on steroids, I wasn't ready. The staff  is welcoming and friendly on top of it all. 10/10. Next time I'm going to order the Chiknwa.

reviews.author: Lauren R.
reviews.description: Stopped by for the Yelp Texas Trending Machine today around 11:30 and it was clear that this plce already has a place in the heart of locals. The line was long, but luckily I was able to head to the to-go desk and place my order fairly quickly...Brisket Nachos packaged with all the ingredients separated so as not to get soggy. They easily survived the drive home to Cedar Park and were super delicious and unique! Like a chopped brisket sandwich on tortilla chips with queso. Um, yes, please.  This barbecue place has a vibe like no other. The walls and music combine hip hop with classic Texas in a way I would not have dreamed possible, but it works. Pretty trendy spot. I really appreciated the clear partitions separating tables as a covid precaution.

reviews.author: Eduardo C.
reviews.description: Food came out fast and was pretty good. I would recommend they have a person always at the bar that way people can be welcomed to eat there and get more drinks. I would come back for sure though

reviews.author: Lorri P.
reviews.description: We hadn't had any bbq since we arrived in Austin for our vacation. We found Slab on Yelp and we were impressed! The sliders, brisket nachos and chicken sandwich were all delicious. The max n cheese was good, it had a smoky flavor, like it was cooked on the grill. The potato salad didn't have any flavor but we just know not to order it, it was a side and not the star of the show like the meats. The music was great! If I lived here, I would definitely be here once a week! Great food and vibe!

reviews.author: Michaela P.
reviews.description: Nice location with plenty of outdoor seating. Food truck with pizza next door. Dog friendly. Tried four of the brews on tap. The IPA and HC Haze were both very good. The Kolsch was okay - a little flat and slightly bitter. None of us liked the Rye Wit - must be an acquired taste.   We likely would have stayed longer, but it was chilly and windy. We'll be back in fairer weather to try the pizza.

reviews.author: Joseph S.
reviews.description: Say yes to the Saison! The Coconut Porter was also a mouth full of tastiness. We will be back for sure.

reviews.author: Sandi N.
reviews.description: We discovered this brewery after hearing about a new pizza truck opening next door to it.  Hitmaker has a nice outdoor seating area, clean bathrooms, ample parking and friendly staff.  The menu is not huge , but the Kolsch and Hazy IPA we had were good.  Great place to grab a pizza next door and sit outside with a cold beer!

reviews.author: Jodi H.
reviews.description: Welcome Hitmaker to the South/West-ish Austin microbrew community!  I love that there's newcomers to the brew scene here in South Austin. I've had Hitmaker on my radar for a while. I came through with a good friend close to closing hours on a weekend. We were stoked to try their flights, which was great to get a taste of everything. Their menu is limited at the moment, since they're pretty new. I didn't feel any sort of type of way towards any beers in particular, but I do love that they had a Belgian called Accidental Trappist. Their rye wit I love too. They tried to have a little bit of variety in their menu which I appreciated.  The brewery also smells new too. I love it. It's like the smell of a baby or a puppy. Weird. So let's move on. They have board games for all, clean restrooms and TVs. The seating options are endless. You can go outside and play outdoor brewery games or sit indoors at the bar or in their many picnic tables. Parking is also super easy, and the taproom is easy to locate with their brightly-lit sign (especially at night). I definitely see us coming back here more often, especially since our taptender was a sweet and informative man who was so kind to stay a little past brew hours to let us finish our conversation and beers. I will definitely be back for the exceptionally kind service and cozy brew times.

reviews.author: Paul R.
reviews.description: A friend recommended that we meet up at Hitmaker Brewpub. Hitmaker? The Google provided some excellent information: "The co-owners started six of your favorite neighborhood bars/restaurants - MugShots, The Hideout Pub, Bender Bar and Grill, Pour House Pub, Violet Crown Social Club and Pour House Pints and Pies." Having been to a number of their locales I looked forward to having a few Hitmaker beers.  The bottom line their beers did not disappoint. My IPA was not excessively hoppy and had that typical fruity citrus flavor. Plus one stepped out of her comfort zone and went with their Kolsch offering. My tastebuds told me this was not a typical Kolch as it was pretty lite and could have masqueraded as a lite pale ale. A good summer beer.   The bartender on duty was very knowledgable and was eager to fully describe their offerings. The taproom is cozy, dimly lit, and cool. Perfect atmosphere for quaffing excellent brews on a hot summer day. Lastly, feel free to bring your mutts.

reviews.author: A S.
reviews.description: I live pretty far from Hitmaker but have tried to visit a couple of times when I happened to be in the area. I recall both times they were closed when I was near by. My plan was almost foiled again, but this time luck was on my side. Due to Covid-19 the hours online didn't match their actual hours so I got there an hour before they were actually set to open. I didn't want to wait around for an hour until opening time so I was going to head home. As I was leaving I happened to run into one of the workers (maybe an owner) and after explaining my dilemma he graciously agreed to let me in an hour early to enjoy their beer. I was delighted and thankful. I got a glass of the Summer Saison and the Hill Country Haze and enjoyed both. The service was great and the atmosphere was enjoyable.

reviews.author: James B.
reviews.description: Wow.  8 beers tried, and 8 beers worth trying again! The kolsch is such an easy drinker, light and refreshing!  Pale ryeder and rye wit have a bit more flavor but still an easy drinking wonderful drink!  It'd be hard to stick with just one here, but if I did; I'd probably go with French Saison, wonderful taste and a bit stronger than the others.  Coconut Porter isn't the best porter I've had, but if it's cold outside this would be my drink at the brewery. Hill country Haze is an IPA I could drink, but I'm not an IPA fan.  Accidental Trappist is good.  I can't put my finger on it... you just have to try it.   The brown ale is a little heavier than most and I'd be tempted to grab it instead of the Porter.  They have some cans of wine and a cider too.  $2 tastes 6oz.  $4/5 16oz pours.

reviews.author: Mike M.
reviews.description: Terrific place. Numerous delicious beers on tap. Was on site during their grand opening and they handled it well. A lot of activity here. And delicious beers.  We also appreciate your support and Divine Canines through Barks for Beers.

reviews.author: Greg W.
reviews.description: Review time kids!   What does one do when new to the area? If you are anything like me and the ever so lovely bride, you go exploring every chance you get!   After hitting a farmers market and a flea market we decided to take the route less traveled home by watching the compass and staying off the major arteries. This is where Lady Luck showed us a sign that I almost can never resist,"Tasting Room Open", like a mosquito to a bug zapper ,I'm in!!   I have to say I really dug this place for a few reasons beyond the fresh beer selection. First is general layout,not to big or to small,its just right. Second is decor,simple,industrial,clean. The focus here is on their craft brews not a bunch of goofy crap on the walls. Third is noise, this place was chill. I was actually able to converse with my bride without the aid of ASL!   On to their craftwork, after meeting the very friendly barkeep we decided I'm a picky bastard and he had me try a few samples, all were very good. Landing with the Kolsh really hit the spot!!  Caveman review? "Go here,have beer,bring friends too!"

reviews.author: Blair B.
reviews.description: Delicious beers with lots of outdoor seating! A great find for lovely weather. We were also able to bring our dog, which was a great plus.

reviews.author: Robyn G.
reviews.description: Excellent selection of their own craft beer and everyone is very nice!  Outside seating also!

reviews.author: Amanda S.
reviews.description: Non of the beer was disappointing. Came here on a Sunday and it was peaceful. Place is small but clean. Definitely say give this place a try. Kid friendly. Indoor and outdoor seating.

reviews.author: Ed J.
reviews.description: Really good beer in a neighborhood bar setting.  Particularly enjoyed the Saison and Porter.  Look forward to enjoying the patio once the weather is favorable...  and love those $2 portions - great for sampling all the options and still being able to drive home (but barely).  Did I mention the beer is legit?

reviews.author: Michael V.
reviews.description: Outstanding beer!  If you are out and about doing some hill country drankin', treat yourself.  You will be glad you did. They have something for everyone.  And the taproom is awesome, too!

reviews.author: Katie T.
reviews.description: My girlfriend and I stopped here for a beer after hitting up the nursery nearby. I'm glad we did! The staff was friendly and the beer was fantastic! I got the hazy IPA and she got the kolsch; both were very tasty! We'll definitely be coming back with friends.

reviews.author: John B.
reviews.description: New taproom in the area, no food or anything but the beer is great and they have a small and friendly team. Would definitely recommend it for beer-lovers. Had the Rye Wit and Hazy IPA, the latter was incredible!

reviews.author: Gino G.
reviews.description: Great beer! JC was a pleasure to talk with on my maiden trip to HM. I'll be back for sure.

reviews.author: scott k.
reviews.description: Great beers...... recommend the French Saison, Pale Ryder and Rye Wit.  If you are in the area gotta check this place out!!!!!!

name: Last Stand Brewing
address: 12345 Pauls Valley RdBldg I and J

reviews.author: Sarah W.
reviews.description: I enjoy the beer here and the food from the food truck.  Grilled cheeses, patty melts, burgers, fries - delicious!  You can do a 4 beer tasting flight and they have around 12 or more on tap.  You can buy beer to go in cans or they have growlers available and some cute merchandise.   Be aware the v neck tee shirts they have right now are cut pretty tight/narrow.    They have a nice back patio where you can eat and drink and bring your canine friends and sometimes have local craft vendors back there as well.   I really like their Coffee Kolsch beer!   You definitely need to walk next door  and check out Revolution Distillery - simply fantastic gin and cocktails with a free tasting of a few of their spirits.  Can't buy bottles of hard alcohol on Sundays but they were still open today (Sunday) and they are happy to serve you delicious cocktails!

reviews.author: Katie N.
reviews.description: Fantastic beer and location! Quiet and just relaxing! It's dog and kid friendly but happy there's no playground so there aren't that many kids. All of the beer is fantastic, even if it's not the style I prefer (like pales)).  The food truck is excellent as well. Make this place a priority!

reviews.author: Ashley L.
reviews.description: First time here and love it! Plenty of space and open seating inside and outside. It's nice to have brewery in south Austin that offer quality drinks and food options. South Side Flying Pizza is also located inside the brewery, which is also delicious!

reviews.author: Everett T.
reviews.description: A good brewery that's just a bit overshadowed by its neighbors.  When you're standing near giants, you live perpetually in their shadow. Such is the case with Last Stand. It's a good brewery. It's got old school Hill Country funkiness, as evidenced by their chicken shit bingo games (every 3rd Sunday!)  For better or worse, it's also just down the road from the behemoth that is Jester King. Hell, there's a great distillery 10 feet away! Last Stand's brews are good; this visit I had the Citra Smash, Simcoe Pale Ale and the Fuzzelicious. But I'd be lying if I said I wasn't thinking about Jester King with every sip.

reviews.author: Dawn H.
reviews.description: Way overdue review! Been enjoying LSB for quite some time now. Just a great, colorful, and fun space. Large beer garden with Chicken $**t bingo every 3rd Sunday of the month. That beer tho!  They focus more on the hoppy-side (love their CitraSmash); however, they also make great porters, stouts, and other seasonal brews including barley wine. A flight of 4 - 2oz pours will set you back 10$ if it's your first visit. Then, go for a full flight!  Light snacks available (pretzels, etc.) and food truck on-site at times.   Package available for sell and they also custom fill 16oz crowlers. Cans also available at ATX merchants (e.g., HEB).   Support local!   Family and Fido friendly. Cheers to the love of great beers!

reviews.author: Sasha R.
reviews.description: Last Stand keeps fundraised money they owe to local dog rescues and uses it to open up a second location. I'll never again support this shady business.

reviews.author: Jarrid S.
reviews.description: While the beers are great. The customer service is not amazing. You walk in and have a seat the server greets you and asks how your day is, and then a few minutes later another server says oh if You want to order the line is over there. How about the first person tell you their process, Or better yet - how about a sign hanging from the ceiling with an arrow that says order here. Lots Of people were Frustrated by this because they too had all taken a seat because of no direction. The beers are good but manage your business better if you would like to increase the positivity of your customers experience also the revenue you could generate.

reviews.author: Raquel C.
reviews.description: Not a big fan of the beer, but I did enjoy the environment. The staff was friendly. Cornhole outside and plenty of tables for sitting.

reviews.author: Falon R.
reviews.description: The beer is so good! We went to the south Congress location. The atmosphere was nice. My 3/5 stars is due to the build your own pizza coming with cheese (which we don't and can't intake) so we spent $20 and weren't able to eat it. I'm hoping someone else ate it because it hurts my heart to think a cow gave her milk for nothing. We were told that we had to purchase another pizza. We decided it would be best to go elsewhere for food. My only advice is to inform the customer that the pizza comes with cheese automatically. We wouldn't have known otherwise. We will be back for the Fuzzylicious IPA!

reviews.author: Greshka P.
reviews.description: This was our second brewery on our beer tour, while in Austin. Small place, and not many beers on tap, but you can still find some good ones.  Their beers are listed on the wall on tap, and they also have them in the fridge if you want to take some bottles home.  They do flights, and of course that's what I did to be able to try more. The Coffee Porter was like drinking actual coffee.  Delicious!  I left this one for the end, after one sip since it ended up being my favorite. Imperial Oatmeal stout was just OK, in my opinion.  They also had it in Whisky Barrel Aged - same alcohol content but the barrel aged process always makes it taste stronger.  I wasn't loving these so didn't finish them.   Holiday Ale - was good, tasted just like it's name implies. The one that surprised me was the Smash Citra. I usually stay away from IPAs (too hoppy for me) but this was amazing!  I could have had a second one.  Service is hit or miss.  They were a bit slow preparing our flights.  One of the ladies was really nice and friendly, the other two people behind the counter, not so much.  You can enjoy your beers inside but the outside is really cute. Looks almost like a schoolyard with long wood tables, space to walk, and a cute colorful seating area near the exit.  Across from them there's Revolution (locally mad gin) and another brewery. So, this is a good place to "park" and enjoy a drinking day out with friends, without having to drive around for more.  3.5 stars

reviews.author: Kristen L.
reviews.description: Huge space indoor and outdoor and their menu has great food. Lots of beers and wines to choose from - definitely going back often!

reviews.author: Leila R.
reviews.description: Came here after a stop at JK and this place was a pleasant little surprise!  Far less crowded than JK and the outdoor patio area was fantastic on a gorgeous spring day to just vegge out, hang w/friends, enjoy some brews, and play a mean game of cornhole!  Their beers were very hit or miss for me. I did the sampler and nothing really stood out, but none were undrinkable, just not really my style. If you like hoppy beers, then you will probably enjoy their selections more than I did. Their stout was ok, but in all fairness, probably not the best choice on a warm day as it was heavy.  I will say, what stole the show for me here was our little discovery of their Revolution Spirits barn. They were doing a free tasting of their gin and Cafecito coffee liqueur, both of which were absolutely awesome!  I really like the gin as the lavender in the batch we tasted was very prevalent. I am usually not a gin drinker, but the mix of this w/the hibiscus tea that they served was perfection!
