The Cafecito, however, was so mindblowingly good, I immediately dropped the $25 to purchase a bottle on-site! It is made w/Cuvee and packs a delightful, caffeinated, yet alcohol-y punch. I have paired it drizzled over some coconut, chocolate chip, almond vanilla ice cream, and it is what dreams are made of!  I probably would come back here in a few months to see if they have any different beers on their rotation and to restock on the spirits.

reviews.author: Neel A.
reviews.description: Vibes. Awesome venue and a great beer list with a diverse set of brews. Juicy IPAs? Check. Imperial Milk Porter? Check. Barleywine Ale. Check.  The outdoor patio is perfect for hanging out and day drinking. Cornhole and jenga patio games make it a really fun atmosphere. Food truck was outside to add a booze buffer from the beer imbibing.   Definitely will be back next time I'm in Austin! A distillery and a cidery are also located in the same complex so it's a great vacation destination.

reviews.author: Jeff S.
reviews.description: I've been a fan of their Simcoe Pale and their Smash Citra IPA for quite some time now. I've been meaning to check out Last Stand and I finally had my chance recently.  Located off of Fitzhugh Rd- Same road that brought you Austin Beer giants Jester King- , Last Stand is a bit smaller but still has those breathtaking views that we've all come to know and love out there. They also offer a good selection of house beers that you can't find at your local HEB, Spec's, Twin Liquors. I had fun sampling them and look forward to seeing what they have next time I go!

reviews.author: Lana L.
reviews.description: I'm not much of a beer person, but I do try to appreciate it. Came here on a Sunday with friends to check the place out. You can ask to try some of the beers if you're not sure what you want. The samples are very generous and the people working there are nice and helpful. I sampled four different ones before deciding on the pale ale. The coffee one was also great, not like anything I've had before. You also have the option of getting a flight/sampler with four different beers if you want variety. There is outdoor seating too!  Taste | 3.5 Atmosphere | 3 Presentation | 3.5 Service | 4 OVERALL | 3.5

reviews.author: Calily B.
reviews.description: Great new brewery in the Dripping Springs area. They currently have a solid five brews on tap. Our faves were the BPA and Coffee Porter. I will say that I need a session beer from them... something a little less on the alcohol would be good, but that's just my preference.  The location is just a few minutes down the street from Jester King (so if you're already out at JK, come give Last Stand a try!). They are located in a really cool business park. There's also a distillery a few doors down!  There is a couple of places to sit inside and a full outdoor area with seating (if you're allergic to hay, it might be an issue).

reviews.author: Diron K.
reviews.description: We were out pub crawling in the Dripping Springs area and found this place. They have quite a few beer choices and an air conditioned section so you can enjoy your beer and the place is very customer friendly. Cool place.

reviews.author: Michaela P.
reviews.description: Good beer. Good burgers. Nice spaces inside and out with plenty of room for groups. Dog friendly. Don't forget your growler!

reviews.author: Christine A.
reviews.description: This was the last stand for us during a wine trip through Hye and Johnson City. As we circled back to Austin, the Mister decided he would confuse his brain after the lovely wine tastings with a beer. This was dessert, he explained.   However crazy this idea was, I am now a fan of hitting all these breweries five minutes before closing. We were the only customers and serendipitously met the owners and their beautiful white boxer! The guys enjoyed their Coffee Porter and Pale Ale and we were on our way home quickly.

reviews.author: Mindy H.
reviews.description: Argus Cidery's website mentioned they were open on Sunday. But when we arrived, they were definitely closed.  So since we were there we thought we would check out Last Stand.  Last Stand is located at the back of the warehouse properties in the cute little green buildings, next to revolution spirits.  There is plenty of parking.  They have a small inside tasting room with space to sit down, and an outdoor area that is dog friendly.  There are some trees shading the outdoor area, but they have also put up some netting.  The area is barked and they have some nice tunes playing.  They have a corn hole with bean bags, or across the street a Frisbee Disc Golf course set up that doesn't look like it has been used in awhile.  The only negative on the outside space is that it had a large fly population.    The competition for micro breweries in Austin has become fierce.  There are many options to select from.  There is a bit of something for everyone.  My beer tasting adventures with my expert husband have developed a palette that appreciates this alcoholic beverage.  Last Stand out of the many I have tried is just OK - Average.  The beers just fall flat and thin for me.  They are missing that full flavor quality profile. You can select from a flight of Year Round Beers ($7), or a flight of their rotating taps ($10).  Their rotating beers always feature the following: their ongoing Farmhouse, SMaSH (single malt and single hop), and a Single Barrel Series.  They also have some growlers you can select to fill up to go.  The two that I found decent from their menu were the Pale Ale and Coffee Porter.  The coffee porter is made with local Summer Moon cold brew, which you can taste in the unique roasted and nutty tones.  While not rich and creamy like most coffee porters, this still has some good flavors.  The staff were friendly and helpful.

reviews.author: Amanda K.
reviews.description: My husband and I had seen this place for a while since we moved to this side of town. Usually I am running by it and we decided to finally stop in for a drink on a Saturday afternoon.  We decided to do a flight of a piece of the ciders so we could try them all. It was the perfect choice as we both had different opinions of what tasted good.   There are a few food options but we didn't eat here. They had a guy in the outdoor seating area that was cooking up some food on a grill.   Overall a cool chill place to grab some drinks and hang out inside or outside.

reviews.author: Stacie H.
reviews.description: Moontower is a great neighborhood spot! The patio is mellow and the ciders aren't too sweet. I like that the offerings keep expanding with ciders, coffee, snacks and there's special events held on premise too including one with baby goats. I also stop by for refills of SoCo ginger beer with the rotating seasonal flavors.  Check out Moontower and the personable staff will convert you into a repeat customer!

reviews.author: Paul M.
reviews.description: Fantastic cider and a great atmosphere. The staff are friendly, and we will definitely be coming back!

reviews.author: Ang B.
reviews.description: Dear Moontower, I love you.  Great patio, the staff seems to really care about what the company is doing. The cider flights are where it's at the get a full experience of the range being done here.

reviews.author: Ashley F.
reviews.description: Really great dry cider!  Nice outdoor space too that's dog friendly.   Would be nice to see a few more items of food on the menu but the cheese plate is delicious!

reviews.author: Christopher D.
reviews.description: Do yourself a favor and stop by the Tasting Room at MoonTower Cider Co., over on Tillery Street, proudly brewing fine cider on the East Side.  I was fortunate enough to show up just after the room opened (2-9 five days a week) and the ambiance and mood was perfect for a cloudy day: French  jazz on the stereo, clean lines in the furniture and understated appointments and the well-informed and cider fan Anne-Claire behind the bar. She patiently walked me through ciders in general and expertly helped me understand one cider from the next from the "core four" and special tastings.  Dog-friendly and laid-back, this is the perfect place to escape from the mayhem of daily life and enjoy an artisanal brew made by the good folks right here in town. How artisanal? They brew their own mead.  Anne-Claire or others will be happy to recommend the cider for your palette and will speak to food pairings as well. All in all, a low-key, friendly no-pressure environment. There are no sales people here: there are artists happy to help you discover and share their fondness for cider.  Go.

reviews.author: Nicole G.
reviews.description: I've only been by once, but they did a great job with distanced service! They gave me a little buzzer for when I needed something, brought my drink out to me, and had hand sanitizer at every table. They're just doing outside seating and to-go as of 9/11.  Their Pomme Blush was delicious--not too sweet. I'll be back!

reviews.author: Rhys G.
reviews.description: Went on my anniversary with my girl , Great place to hang and try ciders , great selection of ciders and friendly staff . Recommend for anyone who likes ciders and looking for a place to hang outside on these weird times.

reviews.author: A Seal -.
reviews.description: Complex yet approachable, obsessive but laid back, a treat but also something you could drink all day. Moontower really reassembled my brain when it comes to cider. You'll want to easy into this space, try every last thing they've made, and tell all your friends about it. Such a welcome break from all the overly loud, vibe-first, money-grab breweries popping up around Austin. These people care about making an incredible product and giving you a relaxed space to enjoy it in. Kudos, y'all. See you every week!

reviews.author: Kelsey R.
reviews.description: We just tried the two cider flights and cheese plate. Loved our experience! None of the other Cider places were open due to Corona so we were very glad to find a place with out door seating and serving cider on tap. The waitress was very sweet and educating as well! Will definitely go back!

name: Abel's On the Lake
accommodations: Best nights on Monday, Friday, Saturday

reviews.author: Hermes P.
reviews.description: I came into use the restroom since Mozart's next door was beyond capacity. I was told customers only. That's fair. I asked if I could just pay for something so I can use the restroom. I was told the cheapest thing was an $18 shirt. Upon checking the menu online, I can see that that was a lie. I would have gladly paid for $12 nachos to eat but nope..the cheapest thing was the shirt. Gotta keep people from not using the bathroom.  I can understand the policy. But lying and turning away a transaction to hold a principle? It deserves a Yelp review.

reviews.author: Nikiba J.
reviews.description: I would really like to give Abel's their 5 stars which they probably deserve but the Restaurant sits at the bottom of a hill. This is not ok when you're bringing in a bus loaded with passengers. Shell passengers at that (Shell has a zero tolerance for unsafe practices). Cars on every side of the street so a bus would have to unload in the street. Luckily for me this time Heaven was on our side by allowing us to get our buses up from the hill. Going down the driveway was just as challenge because we had to turn just right to make the turn to drop the passengers off at the door.  The OS came when we had to turn the buses just right to get out the drive and up the hill onto the street. What makes this even more dangerous are the pedestrians walking in front of the bus, to the side of the bus and in the back of the bus.  It takes a skilled driver (like myself) to be able to get out of the mess I was in. This was the perfect time of all the times I should told my clients dropping them at the door was unsafe. But there I went.  If I didn't position the bus just right getting up that hill a tow truck would have to be called to unstick me. That's what we call bottoming out the bus, when the axil is stuck on concrete enabling the bus to move.  Now my coworker trusted me and followed me right down that forsaken hill and tried to get up the hill as I did.  Now mind you, if we get the buses stuck it will take a tow truck at least 2 hrs to be dispatched and out to our location. It's cost $$$ for a bus pull out, the restaurant is located in a neighborhood so they would have to use an alternate to their homes, patrons inconvenienced, our passengers stomachs full they ready to go to get to their hotel. Shell most definitely will report us for an unsafe practice and we would have to answer for that unsafe practice....just a mess. Anyways, I got my bus out and the other bus as well. There was no bus parking not enough curb parking so we were unable to dine at the restaurant. I forgot about that so I change my rating to 1 star. J/k

reviews.author: Elizabeth G.
reviews.description: Great spot for a local craft beer by the water.  Not too many vegetarian items on the menu, but they are willing to adjust on request. The items I enjoy are very tasty.  This spot is extremely puppy friendly, so enjoy your doggie date! The Christmas light show is also amazing!

reviews.author: Stacy B.
reviews.description: The food definitely exceeded our expectations, and "Rob" our server was beyond amazing. We look forward to visiting again.

reviews.author: Andrew R.
reviews.description: The location is so fantastic that it's tragic the low quality of food served here. The prices are low, but you get what you pay for. My wife got sick from spoiled coleslaw in her shrimp tacos, my burger was bad but maybe it's just me with the burger bun was like some kind of home made wonderbread bun where my finger goes through the bread ruining the burger with such thin bread. The steak sandwich my son had was covered in processed cheese. processed cheese says it all. I might go back and order the club sandwich my other son had which looked as good as the classic plate gets. I'd love to see a new cook and menu take over this idillic location.

reviews.author: Aleric H.
reviews.description: Absolutely amazing Experience! Great Food, Great Views and Rob my waiter has been fantastic the couple of times I've come so far!  I have to say that I almost didn't go because of the reviews here, but my experience was totally different. And it was absolutely a 5 star experience.  Overall the Views are objectively great right off the water, the food has been very good both times - I had a really good Salmon dish most recently. But more importantly the waiter Rob has been incredibly kind and attentive - even offering Iced Tea "to go" both times.  I'd recommend you judge Abels for yourself and come to the restaurant -- I actually asked them about previous reviews and they did say they've been really shifting all of their service to be the best and that's what I've seen first hand.  I can't speak to how they were in the past, but today the experience is 5 stars!

reviews.author: Amy G.
reviews.description: Each time I come here I'm more and more disappointed. I used to come here frequently when I was new to Austin but I think my standards were lower and theirs were higher. First of all, it's a pain to get parking around here. Once you're parked, you're better off going to one of the neighboring establishments. The food is so mediocre and overpriced, and I've nearly tried it all. It's not bad, but I'd say it's on par with many chain "bar and grill" type of restaurants. The view of the lake is the only asset that draws crowds.

reviews.author: Andrea B.
reviews.description: My son held his wedding here !  The staff was extremely nice and polite! The food they catered was delicious! The views are great ! It's was extremely cold this weekend but I will be back when it warms up!

reviews.author: Kim B.
reviews.description: I came here for my graduation dinner (NOT on graduation weekend - so it wasn't that busy) and it was honestly one of the worst dining experiences I've ever had. It was embarrassing for me because I picked the place. Thank God that my friends and I are pretty chill people, so we just rolled with it.  However the service was abysmal, the Mexican Martini was not drinkable, bathrooms were filthy and there was not a manager in sight the whole night. Well, at least not until we left and saw them all chatting on an unoccupied patio to the side of the restaurant. I guess it was socialization time while their servers are outside floundering. The girl who served us was seemingly taking care of the whole patio (although failing) and said it was her first week. Wild.   Two people from my party didn't get their meals until everyone else finished. We had to basically beg for our drinks. And the food was honestly 2 stars at best...  Only good thing about this place was the ambiance

reviews.author: D S.
reviews.description: I would give this 20 if I could. Visiting from San Diego, we found Abel's on an idyllic Sunday afternoon.  Although there was a wait for a table, Johnny, the BEST bartender/server EVER, found a couple of barstools and made room for us at the bar.  Johnny makes a GREAT host, and GREAT Bloody Mary!  World class. Perfect blend of spices with other ingredients.  I had the Texas burger (YUM) and my husband had Abel's Tex-Mex twist on a Philly steak sandwich. "Absolutely delicious!" The open air bar on the lake is a beautiful setting, the weather was perfect, multiple football games on big screens, and a great vibe.   Fabulous food, and not at all expensive.  But Johnny made our experience superb.

reviews.author: MIchael P.
reviews.description: I've been coming to Abel's for years but hadn't been back since the start of the pandemic. I went tonight and I am so happy I did!  Abel's will be in my routine rotation from here on for dinner and drinks.   They have always had a strong kitchen for an affordable bar and grill - so much better than the place next door. Tonight, I was taken care of very well by two affable gents at the back bar, Stuart and Eric. Stuart told me I should try the blackened redfish. He shared it was a new rotating special. I was amazed how perfectly it was seasoned and cooked.  One of the best redfish dishes I have had in months. I immediately asked what I need to do to convince them to serve this on the regular menu. They said let our management know online so here it is.  I was texting friends about how good it was and that we need to come back soon. Please keep this dish on the menu - as often as possible - and give your chef a raise.    Another fun plus - Stuart and Eric know their sports. We had a fun smart conversation about all current sporting events.   Bottom line.  If you are a sports fan, go here. eat the redfish, ask for Stuart and Eric. drink, have fun and repeat. Also, brunch on Sundays for early fantasy games is another great call.   Five stars on this visit. See you soon.

reviews.author: Ben B.
reviews.description: One of my favorite spots in austin! Love sitting on the water after a day on the lake. Friends and family always enjoy the food as well.

reviews.author: Molly G.
reviews.description: Sweet waitress. She was clearly slammed. That's not the issue here. Sweet potato fries were delivered to the wrong table by someone running food. Pancakes were burnt. Both out of her control. She got them both taken off rightfully so.  The BIG ISSUE was ours and two different tables cards were wrong up wrong, mixed up, and delivered to wrong tables. Our credit card went to someone else's table and we found it ourselves. Still not mad at that sweet girl at all for the record. Our tab came out cheaper and we signed it and got out. Forgive us of our sins. What was EXTREMELY CONCERNING is the manager approached my father IN THE BATHROOM and chased him out the front door. My father explained that a transaction was made and there was a signed document, end of story. Argue that with anyone especially when we were on the street walking to our car. What does the manager do? He THREATENED to call the cops! My husband, who paid the tab suggested to the manager that we go inside and talk privately. The manager proceeded to discuss this private matter  in front of customers IN THE PARKING LOT! Legally, we did nothing wrong. Transaction was made between the establishment and our family. Signed document. Off the property. Boom. If he would have came up to us and started with excuse me, we messed up, can we fix this please- would have been the start to a better approach. Chasing my father. Threatening to call the cops. Discussing in front of customers after we left. We could have sorted it out had he not been so aggressive. I was in the service industry for 8 years, he was 1000% out of line. The scenery is pretty nice though. One star fir that.

reviews.author: Viviana R.
reviews.description: First time here... and yeah the food was not good at all. Ordered chips and queso, chips were stale and queso was clumpy. I had the chicken sandwich and it was bland. A person of color definitely did not make the chicken, because if they did it would have been seasoned. Best part of the whole thing was the Dos xx.

reviews.author: Karyn C.
reviews.description: We went for dinner with 3 kids and 3 adults. Food was good.  Came out fairly quickly. Our server was nice as well.  Beautiful view and had a nice time.  We got there early and thankfully got right in. :) wish they had crayons and coloring pages for the kids.

reviews.author: Amber R.
reviews.description: Bad customer service, I felt like I was being discriminated. Drinks are pricey and don't even taste so great!!!

reviews.author: Aubrey A.
reviews.description: Have no idea what the food is like because I didn't get to try it. Came in with a few friends and sat for about 15 to 20 minutes, after waiting I had told the hostess that we hadn't been helped yet, she then said someone would be out shortly to help us. Waited there about another 10 minutes and still no help. They were not understaffed by any means, in fact there were people standing around doing nothing which was why I was so irritated. I had read the bad reviews and decided to dismiss them and try this place for myself, wouldn't recommend.

reviews.author: Alicia R.
reviews.description: I've been to abels three times now and had Carrie as a server every time, she is extremely helpful and attentive every time! She's made very good suggestions for food and drinks and always makes sure we have everything we need! Next time you're in texas come visit Carrie at abels!

reviews.author: Jeff L.
reviews.description: Please don't come here. The managers are rude, servers are 45 year old men who think they have power and are so rude. Don't come here waiters are rude and food takes minimum 1 hour to come out.

reviews.author: C A.
reviews.description: Bad costumer service they take 20 mins after u seat just to take u order and drinks are so expensive that they still have no shame to ask for tip and if u say no I want my change back they get all with a attitude and they don't even come back to ask u what else u need and they really racist they were acting like we weren't going to pay so after they brought our 1st drinks they brought the check right away what kinda costumer service is that I'm pretty sure I'm making more money then them and they don't even know it y'all need to work in a lot of things in this place cause that's why it's empty all the time cause of y'all service have a nice day!!

name: Odd Duck
accommodations: Street Parking, Validated Parking, Private Lot Parking, Valet Parking
Best nights on Monday, Wednesday, Saturday

reviews.author: Quin T.
reviews.description: AMAZING!  I have been wanting to check out this place for 2 years and we finally bit the bullet. The hold up has been the negative feedback from my trusted foodie friends. However, I have a feeling they all must have visited during a weird menu transition that they did not find pleasing because Odd Duck has great ratings! I could not acquire a reservation for 2 so we arrived around 4:45 to ensure we at least snagged a spot at the bar. However, the hostess provided us with a table on the patio with the knowledge that another party would be arriving at 7:00, no problem! I was thoroughly impressed that they had employees lined up behind the hostess stand to show each guest to their seat!    Happy Hour runs from 5-6 so we took advantage of their delicious $8 paloma's! I could seriously drink those all night! They also have 25% off bottles of wine under $100.  We dined on the redfish ceviche which was refreshing, the cheddar cornbread that was so delicious, between 2 people, we ate the entire serving! The scallops were delicious, but I was obsessed with the celery escabeche that accompanied my husband's wagyu sirloin cap. I think the next time I will inquire about having the scallops prepared with the escabeche.  We also tried the chocolate fudge pie, but although the dried chiles were only sprinkled on top of the pie, it was still too spicy for my husband.  I clearly gave Odd Duck 5 stars because I was highly impressed and I plan on making a quarterly trip here to check out the new revisions.

reviews.author: Andrew K.
reviews.description: Underwhelming, overhyped, nonsense.  If you are going to act like the best restaurant in Austin then guess what I am going to review you like one.  First things first, don't bother coming if you don't have a reservation, they have the tables and the space just not the will or want to seat walk-ins.  First time we showed up directly at 5pm as the place opened.  There was a minimal crowd ahead of us, maybe 10 people.  We were informed for a table for 2 it would be a 3 hour wait...  The restaurant was practically empty.  If you are this lauded as a top restaurant but can't employ enough people to take a 2 person walk in at open, then something is seriously wrong.  So we came back the next day with reservations for 5 o'clock, again no shortage of tables, but a definite shortage in staffing/management.  We were seated promptly, told we could only order once from the menu, and our server didn't understand what or wasn't on the happy hour menu.  We were told 2 cocktails were on the happy hour menu turns out this was incorrect and was only corrected once we pointed out the cocktail we ordered was not listed on the menu as being discounted.  He was nice enough to "discount" the drinks, but again for a top restaurant in Austin your waitstaff seems to be poorly trained and unfamiliar with the menu.  By the way the happy hour is absolute worst.  5-6pm, 1 off a few beers, 8 dollar palomas, and 25% off ridiculously priced wine, and large beers.  The eazy peel from jester king was going for 44 dollars here.  I picked it up from specs for 15 dollars, absolutely outrageous.  Do not come thinking the happy hour will save you any money.  Uchi down the street does a much better job (not only at happy hour but for everything else in general)  We ordered the kale beignets, the achiote carrots, oyster mushroom salad, wagyu burger, seared scallops, and the sirloin cap steak with broccoli.  I will be the first to admit that the veggie plates were outstanding.  Really amazing flavor combinations, fresh ingredients, I was thoroughly impressed. The wagyu burger with collard green, chicharron and pimento was also a highlight, cooked perfectly and extremely juicy.  Then came the 36 dollar wagyu sirloin cap...  The aftertaste from this steak was horrid.  I've never encountered this flavor before but was a chemical taste that had me wretch, a few bites and had had enough.  My wife also felt something was severely off, and we sent it back.  The sear scallops (35 dollars) were just ok.  A lovely sear, mediocre sauce miso butter sauce and 3 tiny scallops a complete let down.  This restaurant thinks far too highly of itself.  If you are going to act like a pricey exclusive restaurant that makes me jump through hoops to dine here and charges an arm and a leg, I better be wowed at ever step, and that's far from what happened.

reviews.author: Emily W.
reviews.description: I really wanted to like this place. We came here at the recommendation of multiple friends but I just felt like the food was good but not as exciting as the hype. I feel like the similar concept food in Chicago is much better.   The vibes were fun and everyone had a good time. Pricing was reasonable.   Free valet parking

reviews.author: Mike D.
reviews.description: Having really high expectations for a restaurant can be a tricky thing.  My expectations for Odd Duck were extraordinarily high... and the food, drink, and service blew my expectations away!  This experience was simply an incredible delight for my tastebuds!  I was seated at the bar and service was attentive and prompt!  Prior to taking my order, the bartender asked if I had any food allergies or dietary restrictions.  When I told him I was restricted to gluten-free items, he grabbed a special gluten-free menu for me and explained the differences to me.  Most everything on the main menu was either gluten-free or could be made that way without differing from the original recipe too much!  My visit was during Happy Hour.  Odd Duck doesn't offer a ton of HH drink specials -- in fact, the paloma is the only cocktail at a reduced price.  I opted for that and good thing I did because it was the perfect paloma!  Truly the best I have ever had!  Of course, I went there for the food... so let's talk about that. I started with the Redfish Ceviche -- I have enjoyed many variations of ceviche and Odd Duck delivered the absolute best!  So far I was 2 for 2... so I was quite happy with myself, but also a little worried that the entree could not live up to the rest of the meal.  My worries were silly and unfounded -- the Wagyu Sirloin Cap was packed with layers of flavor and was the best part of my meal!  Overall rating: *****FIVE STARS*****  Gluten-free rating: *****FIVE STARS*****

reviews.author: Rajiv K.
reviews.description: The old fashion was made well. The food had incredible flavors.  Tapas style. Loved the first two dishes: roasted carrots and mushroom tostada. The accompanying seasoning is incredible. The scallops were equally good, but only three scallops came in the dish. This was not so hearty given the price of the dish, but flavorful. The pork dish was nicely made, smoky flavor, had kind of an Indian grill feel to it... but for us the taste had a quick diminishing return. The dish was hearty though with a lot of meat on the plate.   I wasn't too much in a dessert mood. Was simply going to have a spoon or two of the chocolate pie, but they brought out the donuts by mistake. Thank goodness, they were amazing. I enjoyed it more than the chocolate pie.   Service tonight was simply outstanding. The waiter took my dietary restrictions to heart and really did a great job helping me navigate the menu. I wish more places did this. I felt the service here from our main and accompanying servers is what other restaurants should aspire to. Bathrooms were kept clean. I wish this place continued success. They have something really great going on!

reviews.author: Lauren W.
reviews.description: This was simply the best dining experience I've had in the recent years or maybe, ever. From beginning to end, I was thoroughly impressed with the staff and how easy and enjoyable it is to dine at Odd Duck. It's a place with friendly staff, great drinks AND great food, and ambience is casual but unique. Perfection.  You can tell the owner takes their time to hire the right people because everyone we interacted with were so friendly. I think it matters a lot walking into a restaurant and enjoying a meal.   Parking around this area is usually not the most pleasant but fear not, they have complementary valet parking! That easily eases off the anxiety of missing your reservation time because you were looping around the area for a decent parking spot.   We came here on a Saturday at 5:30pm and it was perfect because I get hungry around that time. Okay, there are more reasons-it was not very crowded, it was happy hour for some drinks, and the lighting was perfect with the blinds pulled up since the sun has set.   Surprisingly, the drinks here were super good, like high quality to sip on. I got the draft paloma and it was very well-balanced. The other drink we ordered was Nice, Bryce, we were eyeing it and the waiter also made that suggestion. Both are different and definitely would get again.  Everyone was great about making their recommendations and the top choice was the scallops and ceviche. We couldn't get seafood this time around but I will definitely come back for those two items.   Waiter was great at making recommendations based on what we like and what he thinks is great. Easy to talk to, checking in on us just enough, and other staffs help with serving the food and filling up the water so that was cool to see everyone work as a team.  On to the food! So we got the cheddar cornbread, mushroom chorizo tostada, achiote roasted carrots, and wagyu sirloin cap. Cheddar cornbread is a must, it was fresh, the butter on it was amazing, and filling too. Mushroom chorizo tostada had a bit of citrusy to the flavor and it's delicious. For the achiote roasted carrots, what stood out to me was the burnt toast hummus!! I want a tub of that whatever it is! I think I would've liked more of the hummus and less chunks of the carrots. Don't get me wrong, the flavor profile is still very good, I think for my likings, the carrots can be slices so it's easier to consume. Wagyu sirloin cap was the star of the show for us, it was cooked very well (as in good job not well steak!), though I probably want it to be a bit more well.  We came here to celebrate our anniversary but it is a casual place so this is good for a date night or regular dining! The great thing about this place is that the menu changes so you can always find reasons to come back here. I can't wait until I come back.

reviews.author: Leah D.
reviews.description: This place was delicious! The restaurant offers complimentary valet which is nice. The restaurant is decorated with wood from the original Shiner Brewery. The staff was very friendly and gave off the fantastic Austin vibes!   We sat at the bar and had the frozen chili margarita. It had great flavor and was well balanced. I tasted the Paloma and it was one of the best I've ever had! I also had the Naked Lunch cocktail which has beets. I'm not a huge beet fan but I'd drink this again. There was a special cocktail called Buckle Up Buttercup. The drink was a little salty, a little sweet, and you could really taste the bourbon.   For food we tried the kale beignets which were soft on the inside and crunchy on the outside. We also had the mushroom chorizo tostada with beautiful, fresh bean sprouts on top. I LOVED the mushroom chorizo! I could put that s*** on everything. Lastly we had the ceviche. The fish was fresh and the homemade chips it came with were the perfect pair.   As a first time guest, I was very impressed! I'll be coming back next time I visit Austin. Make sure to call a few weeks ahead for a reservation. They book up pretty fast!  10 out of 10 would recommend. The food was too good to take pictures

reviews.author: Chris J.
reviews.description: Visited Odd Duck after months of waiting for a reservation, and was met with food and service that went above and beyond expectations. A local farm to table establishment with an elevated twist, I highly recommend Odd Duck as a go-to spot in Austin.   As many other Yelpers have surely noted, Odd Duck's menu is seasonal, so I'll spare you the details regarding the food I ate, as the menu has most likely changed. Feel free to sit back and trust your waiter's suggestions, as they are veterans of their craft.   One thing that I would like to commend Odd Duck on is their extreme attention to detail, which was immediately noticeable to me. From their unique plates and cutlery to the maintenance of their restrooms, this dining experience made it well worth the price point. Additionally, our waiter made it a point to clean our table throughout the meal, which was awesome.  5/5

reviews.author: Tiffany H.
reviews.description: Odd Duck is an OG in ATX's food scene; I've known about it since undergrad (10+ years now!) but haven't had a chance to try it until I was in town recently for work.   Before local/farm2table was cool - Odd Duck was doing it. It still feels great to support local farmers and producers though.   The food here was OUTSTANDINGLY flavorful -- bringing it to that edge but showing finesse and balance. I also appreciate that they made vegetarian versions of certain dishes so there are some options for Vegs!   My only regret? Not coming here sooner!   The menu will be different when you visit, but we thoroughly enjoyed each dish! We had the:  *Redfish Ceviche (leche de tigre, persimmon, cucumber, potato chip) *Cajun Pork Rillette (apples, pickles, Sour Duck Market sourdough toast) *Dry-aged wagyu burger (pimento, BBQ sauce, beer battered onion ring) - like an EXPLOSION of flavor.  *Wagyu Sirloin Cap (beef fat papas bravas, soubise, green bean salsa verde)  *French Toast (Vanilla Ice Cream, Cajeta, Apple, Pecan, Brown Butter Cereal) - yes, we had French Toast for dessert! So good and I recall just a pinch of salt from keeping it from being overly sweet!

reviews.author: Karen Q.
reviews.description: Pictures of menu on August 17, 2021. Reservations are strongly recommended as this place is quite popular (rightfully so though)! We picked the tomatoes, quail, and cornbread and everything was 10/10. I don't typically eat cornbread but theirs is MAGICAL and a must do! Their service was also A+, they were kind enough to mark the menu with vegetarian options, they even provided ways to alter some of their dishes to make them vegetarian (see photo). The French Toast dessert was also a delight. I'm a big fan of their rotating menus and will happily return to try more.   There is complimentary valet parking. You can also find street parking by the restaurant. They have happy hour 5-6pm daily with drink specials only.

reviews.author: Henry Y.
reviews.description: Review 10-K Odd Duck Trading Symbol: ODD  Item 1. Business The Odd Duck is one of the places that I've been meaning to try ever since I first came to Austin for undergrad so many moon ago. Generally, the dishes are thoughtful and come together in just the right spots. There are a few aspects of the dinner where the execution could be more polished, but I'd wager the average visiting venture capitalist would hardly notice.  Item 2. Discussion and Analysis of Results of Operations The assets: - The roasted carrots were phenomenal. It's rare to find a dish where the carrots were the star of the dish, and Odd Duck hit it out of the park. If there was one element to highlight that enabled this, it would be burnt toast hummus. Spicy and savory, hell I'm waiting for this dip at the nearest Central Market. The crunchy fried chickpeas were a welcome airy, textured munch. - The wagyu sirloin cap was thoughtful in its conception. The celery, broccoli and dill really brought herbaceous elements that complemented the subtle earthy-funkiness of the dry-aged beef. Extremely enjoyable and every bite was as satisfying as the last. Medium rare but not bloody - Dessert was the dried chile chocolate fudge pie. Holy cow, while chile chocolate isn't exactly a new combination, it's certainly not seen in many restaurants. Who says you can't turn up the heat during dessert? The white chocolate peanut butter whip is something I'd eat by the spoonful (and I'm a 'cold brew, no whip'-kind of guy. *Chef's kiss*  The liabilities: - Obviously by the price of the wagyu, there's no way it's Japanese wagyu. But   I found the wagyu a bit *too* firm. You chew, and chew, and chew, and chew some more. It's really a mouth-work out, which can be so antithetical to how wagyu is classically portrayed, e.g. melt-in-your-mouth goodness. I get that it's not the real deal, or that it's just the sirloin cut, but much leaner and less marbled than I would've expected. - Cheddar cornbread was decent, but did not excite, which is something I'd expect given the rest of the menu. It's a fairly expensive piece of cornbread given the price. I will say the texture is extremely fine, but at least nostalgia's sake, would've appreciated more grittiness/texture, perhaps a thicker crust. One final point would be the consistency of the cook, the bottom 10-15% of the cornbread was under-cooked and relatively more 'mushy' than the rest - One suggestion for the fudge pie is to add an ice cream or light sauce element because the pie was fairly dry  Item 3. Other Information - Complementary valet parking is always welcome along South Lamar - Great vibes and ambience - Always appreciate when a place focuses on shareable plates

reviews.author: Justin M.
reviews.description: My first encounter to Odd Duck I went solo as my date was feeling ill. I opted to try two main dishes starting with the quail which was outstanding. The goat cheese stuffing was beyond perfection and while I normally don't like chorizo it wasn't overburdened w/ traditional spices making the protein aspect of the dish wonderful; crispy and juicy.  The baba ghanoush had just a weeee to much cilantro for my tastes but overall a spot on accompaniment to the dish. Finishing the dish the salsa macha hit the perfect notes for heat.   Being a huge scallop lover I'm a stickler for the perfect mollusk. Odd Duck seared them to perfection with a great amount of caramelization and tender on the inside. While the menu said "celery puree" I picked up right away the it wasn't something in my years of being a chef never experienced. The puree was Kohlrabi. The vegetable mash was a smart move as the acidity cut the fattiness from the bacon lardon. The chili crisp was a very nice addition as it gave the dish a sweeping hint of heat, enough to compliment, not overpower. Well done.  I paired my dinners with the Hi Sign "El Berto" Lager. A very nice draft beer which went down smooth and didn't have the "hoppiness" that a more robust beer like an IPA has. I also sampled "The Hop Sauce in My Bag". What a refreshing beverage. The codka went down smooth while the ginger and citrus flavors made me with I was on a porch with a nice cool breeze!   My second encounter didn't live up to the first experience. I split the marinated cucumber and melon salad which was perfect for an early July night. The melon was juicy and the fragrant herbs of mint and basil made sure each bite popped with flavor. Excellent starter.   I opted for the aged Pork and while flavored spot on had an extreme amount of gristle. I found it very hard to impress my date while having to napkin off my mouth to expel what I couldn't chew. The rest of the dish complimented the flavors very well so no complaints for the overall flavor profile.   This was my dates' first time at the restaurant and she opted for the nachos. It was a rather bland dish overall but was saved by the amount of chicken and a good choice of using vadouvan pico.   Dessert was the lime panna cotta. Let me tell you the citrus in this dish make eating it like listening to a symphony from heaven! The almonds gave a nice texture balance juxtaposed to the toasted meringue which gave a somewhat campfire marshmellow vibe.     We split a bottle of Elyse Zin which was bold yet smoothed out in the mouth after just a moment.  Very nice and went with both of our entree's perfectly.   All in all these were brilliant efforts and before I forget, the staff was amazing. Kudos to the hard-working chefs and the knowledgeable front of the house for making my move to Austin memorable.

reviews.author: Katherine M.
reviews.description: When people say Austin has a great food scene, I think of Odd Duck as the pillar of that. My friend and I both agreed that Odd Duck would populate our top 10 restaurant list that we had ever been to.   We had the scallops dish, ceviche, beets, and tostadas. Everything was delicious, but the scallops dish was the best.   The interior and service are on par with Michelin starred restaurants, but have a more authentic Austin vibe. A must visit if you are in town.

reviews.author: Callie M.
reviews.description: A gem in Austin for their authenticity and willingness to explore.   I loved dining at Odd Duck so much that I'd say it's now one of my favorite restaurants in Austin (first time was earlier this month). I'd go through all the dishes but that wouldn't be helpful because the menu changes seasonally (since they are a farm-to-table restaurant +1). First, I love that it's tapas styled (+1) because it means you get to try more dishes and nottt feel like you're over ordering!   What stands out to me about this restaurants is their sauces. The ones that I had with the heavier items (the red meat dishes) were rich and dimensional. Some of the flavors were unique because it had some aspects of familiar tastes mixed with ones that were foreign to me. I loved being able to try all the dishes because I knew I was tasting a unique dish that was created (or crafted) by a talented chef.   From a bar seat, I could tell that the servers and chef love what they're doing (trust me, it doesn't go unnoticed). I love knowing that my meal was made by people who are exploring, learning, and having fun! I honestly think it's hard to NOT want to support a restaurant like this..   Every foodie's must-try for sure.

reviews.author: Grace K.
reviews.description: Odd Duck is definitely a must-visit if you are in Austin!  This restaurant supports the local Austin community, so it is neat seeing the various sourced goods within the innovative dishes here. It started in a trailer but transformed into what it is today with its farm to table creations.  We found street parking luckily, which was right on Gibson Street W. I did notice there is a private parking lot with valet included in it. I highly recommend making reservations. I found my reservation about ~3 days prior to the date. There are bar top seatings and outdoor seatings available. It's great for dates, friends or family (more for adults).  FOOD: Cajun Pork Rillette (4/5; Apples, Pickles, Sour Duck Market Sourdough): The cajun pork rillette was decent but enhanced with the addition of the veggies. The pickled veggies brought life to the dish. It was my first time trying rillette though, which is pork meat that is submerged in fat then cooked at an extremely slow rate. Another important note was the sourdough (it was baked perfect).  Mushroom Chorizo Tostada (5/5; Squash and Pepita Butter, Radish, Pickled Onions): This tostada was something else! It is very unique, and I loved all of it (including the texture of the tostada). There are 3 pieces, but I ate 2/3. I could have ordered another one for myself. The squash and pepita butter had some flavor, which helped bring another part of the taste element into play. Nothing overpowered another.  Apple Salad (4/5; Smoked Squash, Lavender, Chevre, Black Pepper Pecans): This is a lighter dish. I am not a big fan of apples, but I can assure you that I ate them in this salad! Great flavors that burst in your mouth... even the black pepper pecans.   Wagyu Sirloin Cap (5/5; Papa Bravas, Soubise, Green Bean Salsa Verde): My date loved this. He is an all time meat-lover, and he raved about this. The wagyu was cooked perfectly at medium-rare. It easily became one of my top 5. I also have to mention the pickled veggies with the papa bravas because they were delicious. I did not try much of the soubise (white onion sauce), but it was not overpowering. It added a nice, subtle savory taste with the wagyu.   Service was great and attentive. Everything came out on time. Our drinks never touched bottom.  Would I come back!? Definitely!!! They change the menu pretty often too. I am a fan.

reviews.author: Comyar Z.
reviews.description: We had a fantastic dinner at Odd Duck. We had a large-ish group of 6 with various dietary restrictions and our waitress was really amazing about catering to everyone! She created customized menus for each person indicating what they could/could not eat and even came back with variations of dishes the chefs said they could do. The service here is excellent, as was the food.  Food is tapas style, so we were ordering tons of dishes for the table. Their menu changes frequently, so what you get really depends on when you go. Overall, we had a great time here and would love to come back!

reviews.author: Elizabeth Y.
reviews.description: Great place to eat at while in Austin!   Even when it's hot, the outdoor patio has shade and fans. the inside was blastingly chilly!   We were greeted immediately by the hosts and taken inside. The drinks were amazing. we ordered cornbread to go since we heard such amazing things but I wanted to try so many things on the menu and there were only 2 mouths to feed.   Unfortunately no duck egg for the dinner menu.  We got the wagyu beef which was slightly a bit more raw then I would have liked it.   Drinks were pretty good with the Cucumber Daze and a watermelon drink (can't recall it was one of their seasonal drinks)

reviews.author: Stephanie O.
reviews.description: Food was unique and delicious. Open kitchen also was cool and made you really appreciate chefs.

reviews.author: Anni D.
reviews.description: Do yourself a favour and just make a reservation here. Odd duck is spectacular.  The happy hour drinks are a steal - $6 for some awesome cocktails. We tried the in house sodas as well and they were really unique.  Our server was super attentive and designed a tasting menu for our big group. Every dish was *fantastic*. My personal highlights were the scallop, zucchini salad, and French toast.

reviews.author: Alex R.
reviews.description: So right now this is my favorite restaurant in Austin. I think it's the best value for food, experience and price. I had their steak most recently which was delicious but if you're not looking to splurge like that the burger here is awesome.   The look and feel of this spot is super modern and cool.  But I think the best part of this place is the service. I mostly eat at the bar and they're exceptional there. One thing I was really impressed with is that they really take care of people that have different food preferences. I personally don't have eating limitations but for those that do they have curated menus so you don't feel that you have only one item to choose from if you're vegan/vegetarian.   Pro tip - make sure to take advantage of the valet. I believe it's fee (plus tip). The adjacent street parking on Gibson is a hill and is normally full anyway.

reviews.author: David P.
reviews.description: The best burgers, awesome drafts, and great pours. The staff is just friggin' Awesome! The bar is built for comfort. And those special people will understand. They have any and all the answers to make you hungry and thirtsy, with amazing musical stories, attitude, and the They Deliver! CHECK IT OUT! (And no, I don't work there...just a retired burger, beer, and tequila snob) Check it out! No snobby attitudes needed. Just be laid back, and enjoy!

reviews.author: Dawn H.
reviews.description: First and foremost, yay to a pretty great craft beer selection and knowledgeable pourers. Second, great patio space [esp for Lakeway], with some casual live tunes at times. Overall, a really nice place to grab a brew and chill.   Everything else: Food is very hit or miss, high $ for average/poor quality, service is also so-so sometimes, could be kept up a bit better.   Yep, 3 stars. I'll continue to return for the suds. Cheers!

reviews.author: Dhwanil S.
reviews.description: We were looking for a lunch place with patio open close by and this came up. We went there and we're amazed to see how big is their patio. Plus it was very nice and clean which is a plus.  We were greeted nicely and made to sit at their patio table in next few minutes. Our server was very good as the water came out fast and after placing drinks order it came out quick too.   For food we ordered brussel sprouts and fried cornbread as appetizers. Brussel sprouts were usual but corn break was too sweet than usual. Than we had aglio Olio pasta without chicken and it came out okay. Though I liked their chicken pesto club.   All in all, it's a nice place to have drinks with big outdoor patio, good service and decent food.

reviews.author: Gina H.
reviews.description: Honestly I really wanted to write a positive review but instead I got very sick off the food tonight and still suffering. When I return this time ithis time it's different I believe the managers are different and is now owned by someone elsomeone else. They know they no longer make the drumsticks like before now they have dried up, comma bad bad dark meat of low quality, comma instead of the succulent white meat of chicken they normally do cook. They served me a very old salad it was horrible I didn't even get to taste it the tomatoes were rotten and smell it was were rotten and smelled you could tell the salad's been in a refrigerator for a long time period period the hamburger was a $22 hamburger small I took a picture so everyone could see a $22 hamburger with little fries. I'm not a glutton I just don't understand why someone would raise a hamburger that high I know that meat cost a lot these days, but but if it is small let it be an amazing tasting hamburger and his hamburger instead of dried up. To my shock I wasn't planning to write a negative review until I got home with a bad sickness my stomach is still hurting I don't know if it's what I ate or the chicken tasted funky. I don't think I can return back to this restaurant ever again I find it to be shocking that these people were very nice to me this time around  and didn't understand Why I felt bad after 35 to 45 minutes still feeling bad is still feeling  bad stomach aches..Hope this helps everyone out there who understands that if you're gonna pay over $50 for a meal it better be a good one instead of a  stomach ache!! New ownership but not in a good way!

reviews.author: Khristina P.
reviews.description: Will have to say I'm sad to leave this review.  I LOVE the ambiance!  They have a great outdoor patio!  Could have an awesome outdoor bar too... service is horrible!!  Food comes out late, and wrong... sometimes cold. Wish they could fix that because it's a really Cool spot. I've been there 4 times and each time, The food and service were the same. :(

reviews.author: Kimberly M.
reviews.description: I recently discovered this place, a must try hidden in the back of shopping center. Food amazing  drinks are great and live music! How can you go wrong with this place?! Additional plus is their large outdoor lit patio.

reviews.author: Frank T.
reviews.description: What a ridiculous response by the ownership. It's very clear that the ownership of this place does not treat their employees with respect. A lot of your staff has turned over. Such a great patio that the majority of Lakeway will not go to because the owner has little man syndrome and talks down to his staff in front of customers. It's apparent now you don't take criticism very well. Re-read this a couple times and adjust your business instead of reading Dr. Seuss books.

reviews.author: Tony J.
reviews.description: First time visit. Nice restaurant. Too cold to go outdoor but it would be nice during warmer days for sure. Small kitchen and small menu with decent size bar. The food we ordered was very good. Smell of seafood overwhelmed the restaurant upon entry. Interesting layout where trays of utensils, etc from the kitchen come through the restaurant to get to cleaning room which is right off the traffic to the restrooms. Shannon was outstanding waitress!  In all, will return but it didn't become our go to restaurant.

reviews.author: AJ D.
reviews.description: Meh. Went for brunch and was underwhelmed by the menu. Very basic offerings. Also wife is obviously pregnant and waitress was pushing mimosas and drinks. Not a huge deal but kind of weird.   Got the breakfast club sandwich. One bread had burnt edges the other under toasted. Hot as heck outside and no lemonade or "refreshing" options. Again nothing concerning just off.   Wife got the "egg plate". Self explanatory. Not sure what I was expecting but wish I just went to Waffle House..

reviews.author: Steve B.
reviews.description: Fantastic restaurant!!! First time to this restaurant and we'll definitely be back.  Outstanding food and service!!   I had the BBQ baby back ribs and my wife had the salmon. Both dishes we're spot-on!! Super high quality ingredients with delicious homemade sauces. Salmon on a bed of creamy risotto and the ribs on whipped mash potatoes. Not your traditional dryrub Texas BBQ.  We had a few martini's "up" and they were perfect.  Very generous size...Shaken with little ice crystals.  We got to meet the owner Eric and he's a great guy that you can tell has tremendous passion for his business and ensures his guests are well taken care of. Real attention to detail for a small neighborhood grill.  Found out that the chef has two Michelin Stars and his food backs it up!  Finally, our waitress Shannon was as Friendly, kind and prompt as you could hope for.  Live music too!!  Great neighborhood spot!!! Can't wait for our next visit!

reviews.author: Gerardo D.
reviews.description: This was my first visit. They have a really nice patio where we could enjoy the sunset with social distancing.  Service was excellent. They have a very complete beer list which included a local breweries. I had a burger which was good, but not exceptional.   We had a really good time and we plan to come back.

reviews.author: Bill V.
reviews.description: 3rd time was not a charm. Instead of Hope and Thyme, more like Waste of Tyme. Was there on a Thursday night. Musician who was truly awful playing his music too loud. They tried to seat us at a table that had yet to be cleaned. Then we waited 5 mins for anyone to come by the table once we were seated.  Despite placing our orders right away, we learned 30 mins in that there were still 10+ dinners ahead of us and it would be more time. Best thing of the night was the waitress offering to cancel our order and close out our tab with our drinks only.   Our previous visits were OK but never lived up to any of the reviews we've read.

reviews.author: Adao J.
reviews.description: Great environment, taste food and delicious beer.   Really friendly staff is an addition to the delicious food and vast options of beer, drinks and wine.   The outdoor area is cosy with a great view. Also perfect to bring your dog to enjoy a brunch on the side of your best friend.

reviews.author: Lee M.
reviews.description: Tasty food, friendly and timely services plus good music. Very family friendly, especially at the patio.

reviews.author: Regina J.
reviews.description: I will never go here again. Bathrooms are broken and dirty. Food has gone downhill as the prices are higher. Issues with the New ownership relating to several things.

reviews.author: Pete C.
reviews.description: Great menu...lots to choose from and a great selection of draft beers  Ambiance outside dining under the live oaks is wonderful

reviews.author: C. J.
reviews.description: The overall quality of not only food but ingredients and recipes has declined drastically in recent months. The caesar salad dressing went from creamy and rich with anchovy, to a simple blend of olive oil and parmesan cheese. Brunch items consist primarily of store bought premade processed ingredients straight from HEB. Sitting outside long enough you will notice employees running back and forth with bags from the HEB next door as the restaurant runs short on supplies throughout the day. A simple stroll toward the bathroom provides a clear view of the pantry stocked primarily with Knorr mixes and highly processed precompiled ingredients. For example a $22 Eggs Benedict Entree consisted of store bought Thomas English Muffins, pre-packaged ice cold Parma Prosciutto, Ore-Ida frozen potato cubes, and "hollandaise inspired" Knorr Bearnaise sauce powdered mix (almost more powder than liquid sauce). The side of bacon I ordered was unmistakably signature Hormel fully cooked bacon drenched in liquid smoke and processed applewood flavoring. It is truly a disappointment to see a local staple that once emphasized farm to table ingredients transition to a business model that more closely resembles "frozen food aisle to table."

reviews.author: Tiffany J.
reviews.description: We had a great time this last Saturday at Hops and Thyme for a late Mother's Day celebration. I wish I would have gotten more pictures of the meal. Their outdoor dining area is so nice and the live music is great! All of their cocktails were great. We LOVED the Brussels sprouts. We got two servings of it. We also got the charcuterie board and fried cornbread and really enjoyed those as well. I had the aglio olio for my main and it was tasty. The bread pudding for dessert was a great finish! We met the new owner while we were there also and he was so welcoming. What a great neighborhood bar. We can't wait to come back to Austin to visit my MIL and go eat and drink here again.

reviews.author: chris w.
reviews.description: The Braveheart black and blue is one of my favorite burgers around Lakeway. The cooks know exactly how to do a perfect medium rare, and I highly suggest that.   Hops and Thyme have a great selection of beers to go with this awesome burger no matter what your preference is.   The patio is a perfect place to spend an afternoon munching on great food and sipping delicious beers.

reviews.author: Ann C.
reviews.description: This was our first time going to this restaurant and all I have to say is YOU HAVE TO GO!!!  The food was amazing, and reasonably priced for the portions you receive.  The atmosphere is awesome and the staff was so friendly!! And there is live music!!  We sat outside on the patio, and what a great time we all had.   We will definitely be coming back next time we are in town.  Thanks Hops and Thyme, well done!!

name: Anthem
accommodations: Hipster, Romantic, Intimate, Trendy, Upscale, Classy, Casual
Best nights on Monday, Tuesday, Saturday

reviews.author: Tanya S.
reviews.description: Anthem is our favorite spot for amazing food and the best drinks on Rainey street 10/10 recommend their chicken sandwich, it is JUICY and has all the sweet, spicy, and savory flavors packed into a sammy - get it with yummy fries on the side  for drinks - we LOVE the lychee lowdown which comes with grey goose, lychee, ginger and lemon, it's 10/10. the frozen blood orange marg and EXSW drink are also amazing  can't forget their KFC chicken as an app, that's a staple when you come here!

reviews.author: Capers B.
reviews.description: Came here on a date night while my boyfriend and I were in town and this place was pretty cute.   We Ordered:  Mai Thais - Sweet and strong Lychee Lowdown - Tasty and a great price for their all day (?) happy hour Charred Spicy Edamame - The char has good flavor but the seasoning wasn't spicy and left it a little greasy. Would just get it salted next time. Queso Loco - Not bad, had good flavor.  JFP Popcorn Chicken: Kung Pao - Really delicious, I could have eaten just this.  Nam Nom Noodle Salad - Also really tasty and would definitely get again. Bonus: it came already split so we didn't have to fight for the last bites. Hilo Hawaiian Sandwich - Was too full to really give this a good enough try but what I could manage to eat was great.  Hong Kong Waffle - Best dessert I've had in a long time. I'm a sucker for treats that make you feel like a kid and this absolutely nailed it.   Our server didn't seem like they wanted to be there but it seems like the crowd can get pretty rowdy so I don't totally blame them. With a few swaps in food, though, I'd definitely still come back.

reviews.author: Shaurica M.
reviews.description: First off, let me say that Anthem has INCREDIBLE food!!   My husband and I ordered tons off the menu (lol) and enjoyed every bit! My special favorite was the deviled eggs! Who knew deviled eggs could be so fancy! We had incredible service as well, and the ambiance was absolutely beautiful, one of our favorite spots to dine when we were in Austin!

reviews.author: Adriana C.
reviews.description: This place was so awesome! The drinks come in the coolest cups. The brisket rangoons were life changing and I got a chicken sandwich as well. The area is cool, speaking as a tourist lol, and it was a great spot to kick off our first night in Austin!

reviews.author: Brian B.
reviews.description: Before I get to the DELICIOUS food, I wanna give a shout out to our server, Christian. He was super friendly and helpful and made us 2 Austin visitors feel right at home. Thankful for you!!!  Now, the food. The JFC Popcorn Chicken was FIRE. We ordered the honey sesame version that was sooooo tasty!!  The sweet potato waffle fries were a hit too, and so was the chips and guac.   We also had espresso martinis that were surprisingly without coffee beans but still tasted good!  Overall, we LOVED our experience here. Whether it was Christian's incredible service or the amazing food, everything about this place was a treat. Would love to come back next time we're in town!!!

reviews.author: Brittany N.
reviews.description: Located on Rainey street. There is a public parking lot right next to it which I recommend for a short walk. The vibes and decor are amazing and the music is bopping. Asian fusion food serve here and they're all amazing. I don't think I've ever been so impressed with an Asian fusion menu and that's coming from a person who loves Asian fusion food! Honestly everything tasted so great I would recommend everything haha. The host did check us in and mentioned it would be an hour to hour and a half wait but we honestly only waited for 20 and was seated right away! Food is delicious but more on a smaller portion/tapa style for what we ordered.

reviews.author: Stephanie B.
reviews.description: This place was great.  I came for happy hour with a friend and we got several happy hour snacks and drinks.  Both of our drinks were so delicious that we each got the others drink order for the second round.   The yummy fries were so so yummy.  I highly suggest.  The brisket wontons also were so great.   The place is super cute.  I would have much preferred to sit in the front more part of the restaurant with the bar. It's decorated so adorable and the booths are intimate and adorable.   The service was amazing. We had several different people waiting on our table so I'm not super sure how that worked out but it did.  It worked very well.  10/10 recommend.  Great place.   It was kinda hard to find parking tho.

reviews.author: Steffie S.
reviews.description: A cute sorta tiki lounge. Want a micro staycation? If you allow your imagination to suspend disbelief, Anthem could be a tiki lounge on one of the islands of Hawaii...without the airfare to get there. The decor of longboards, hula girl jiggle figurines, and tiki torches can transport you for an hour or two to a tropical paradise.  The service was perfect! I unfortunately did not get the bartender's name, but he was prompt in greeting me, and offering to get me a drink to start my evening. My guy was parking the car so I ordered appetizers and drinks before HH ended. We had blood orange frozen margaritas which were delicious. We tried the fried cauliflower and some guacamole. Both had good sized portions and were tasty.  Another bartender checked on us as she walked by, which was great. I love when everyone works together to provide excellent service. There were two hosts at the door to greet people- they were both professional, warm, friendly, and prompt as well. Good job, Anthem in choosing excellent staff.  The decor was spot on. It felt upscale without the upscale prices. We sat at the bar, and the stools were comfortable enough to have a full meal if you were to choose to do so. Overall, the place was clean and spacious as well. Go check it out and let me know what you think. Aloha!

reviews.author: Teah R.
reviews.description: I was blown away by this place - Texasian?! I have never heard of that fusion before but I am so glad it exists. I wish this was everywhere!  A group of 9 of us came here for dinner and we were all so impressed with the food. The appetizers are where it's at . The yummy fries blew some of us away - WOW. The brisket rangoon was outstanding. And the miso mac daddy....c'mon.   I would say the appetizers were more star players than the entrees. Don't get me wrong, the entrees were delicious too but I can't get over the apps.  The service was good. Our waitress was attentive and checked on us frequently. However, she did tell us there was a 2 hour service limit....  The decor was very cool and the whole restaurant had mood lighting. We had reservations at 6:30 and it was pretty dead at that time but really picked up 30 minutes later. Once it was a full house the atmosphere became louder and more vibrant. Right on S. Congress, where the bars are, I didn't see many parking options.  Overall, I want to come back here. I want a texasian restaurant in my city immediately! For now, i will just have to recreate their menu on my own.

reviews.author: Elissa S.
reviews.description: It was late and we were hungry on a Saturday night...  we assumed we had Fast food or ihop as options but took a gamble and stopped in to see if they were still serving and found YES ... until 11:00!!! We had burgers which were tasty and cooked perfectly... fries were delicious also .  The staff was friendly and chill ...the vibe is great and while it felt busy it still offered a sense of intimacy. I look forward to going back!

reviews.author: Darlene K.
reviews.description: Everything was good. Really enjoyed everything about this place.    I would love a little more sauce. I'm just obsessed with all the sauces they used on the cauliflower.  The noodle salad was like the insides of a spring roll with hoisin/peanut sauce. Also, they were nice enough to split the salad for us.

reviews.author: Amy G.
reviews.description: It's probably clear from other reviews that two of their best dishes are Brisket Rangoons and Miso Mac Daddy. However, don't sleep on the Nam Nom Noodle Salad! I almost never order salads from restaurants, but this one is worth it. It's the most flavorful salad I've ever had, and the balance of textures sends it over the top. Just as I was proofreading this post the manager came by to check that my meal was good. Their attention to detail keeps Anthem at the very top of my favorite restaurant list!

reviews.author: Roberto G.
reviews.description: I waited few minutes to be seated but once I entered they were friendly and I really enjoy the cocktails and the meal.  The quality for the price is amazing, I definitely recommended

reviews.author: Justin M.
reviews.description: Lychee cocktail was great and Sputnik beer was good. Hawaiian burger was great. Had the cauliflower bites which were delicious. Good place nice staff. Would go again.

reviews.author: Andy O.
reviews.description: Been here a few times and the vibe + good always on point. The Mai tai in the Chinese to go box is worth the experience. Outside sitting is fun because of the sounds of rainy st

reviews.author: Kia L.
reviews.description: LOVE LOVE LOVEEEEEE this cute gem! I can't believe it's tucked away on Rainey street. Street parking is hard to find unless you come on a weekend day. They have weekday happy hour which is basically only good for the drinks. Not many shareable food items on it. I'm so glad to have found this spot. The drinks were so great! These two drinks gave me the perfect buzzz. If you like fruity drinks try the Splash and EXSW (East by Southwest) hate the name but love the drink. We ordered the furikake fries which is the perfect comfort food and filling definitely big enough to share between 3-5 people! We also ordered the popcorn chicken, I personally did not like whatever coating/breading. Service was fast. I would definitely dine in again for weekend brunch or an early dinner.

reviews.author: Dale D.
reviews.description: Came to the street just to see it.  Needed a meal before getting on a plane home.   Food was pretty darn good. The tiki vibe and staff were a bit odd.  I had been so use to the welcome wagon from everyone since we were tourist but not here.  Felt like a locals only spot.  Again food was pretty darn good.

reviews.author: Melissa D.
reviews.description: Wooooow this place is awesome. I read about this spot online and wanted to try it because of the extremely unique menu items. It was a fantastic decision. It is a savvy mix of Asian and Latin cuisine with a fun spin, and it's affordable. Don't sleep on the miso Mac daddy -- it's a combination of like Mac and cheese balls and sushi. Truly amazing. The fried tofu app was delicious as well. For entrees, my partner had the noodle salad (yum), and I had the vegan curry dog (comes on a pretzel bun), and you can't go wrong with either. Really, it seemed like you can't go wrong with anything you choose here. Staff are all young, welcoming, and friendly. Added bonus: GREAT happy hour and cocktail menu in general. I'd eat here weekly if we were local.

reviews.author: Moquita Q.
reviews.description: I loved dinning out here. The staff was nice the Decore was inviting. It reminded me of the surf restaurants off the beaches of Galveston. The food was great. I would recommend you order their fried shrimp and French fries. They have a bit of spice and come with cole slaw and dipping sauces! You get about 10-12 pieces and a ton of fries. It's enough for 2 people.

reviews.author: Desiree G.
reviews.description: I've come here for their fun cocktails and finally decided to stop for food since I was staying at a hotel nearby. Get a reservation!! It gets busy! Even ordering takeout was a great experience. Got the appetizer sampler which had all great items. Was plenty for 2 people. Also split the chicken sandwich which was yummy and a nice take the traditional fried chicken. The person with me highly recommended the pineapple dessert, though I couldn't try since I'm allergic. Will be stopping here regularly on my trips to rainy.

name: Growler USA - Austin
accommodations: Best nights on Monday, Tuesday, Friday

reviews.author: Derian T.
reviews.description: This place is outrageous! Every time I find myself in this establishment, I am off-put by the care shown to me by the staff, and how excruciatingly good the service always is. Also another thing that irks me is just how good the pretzel is. Why can't other tap rooms produce a pretzel of the quality of the Food Truck Bavarian Pretzel.  Also the price of beer during happy hours, Friday's, and Sundays is OUTRAGEOUS. $3 on select beers?? What is this? My friends fridge?? On top of this the incredible selection makes me red in the face with frustration, that like that special someone, keeps me coming back for more.   All and all this establishment is painfully well run and makes me smile.

reviews.author: Addison R.
reviews.description: Rude manager and poor price transparency  I visited with a group of friends this weekend and ordered a pitcher for the table. We didn't have the menus out anymore so I asked the waiter how much it cost. "About $20" she said. When the bill comes, the pitcher was actually $50! The whole table ordered some, and we were all pissed.   I called the manager afterwards to express my frustration with how the waiter mislead us. He proceeded to criticize, mock and delegitimize my concern. He said I should have "read the menu", but the waiter should also know the prices. "About $20" is wayyyy off from $50.   Growlers literally does not care about their customers, and will gladly yell at you for THEIR mistakes.

reviews.author: Ryan K.
reviews.description: Great, friendly bartenders... so many options on tap. Great place to try a new, local brew!

reviews.author: Stephanie A.
reviews.description: Came here with a few friends for the Friends Trivia night.  We ordered some draft beer from the many selections. The waiter was very informed on all of their selections and was able to answer all  of our questions - with a smile.  Ordered some wings, a sandwich wrap, chips and salsa. Food was decent and priced fair. Service was fast even on a busy night.  Pros: Beer selections Staff's knowledge on the products offered here  Cons: Parking - Parking and Parking well rather lack of

reviews.author: Eliott L.
reviews.description: Good vibes, and great location. $3 draft IPA? Sign me up-- they have great daily specials and have a super nice staff. Ask for Sam if you get the chance.

reviews.author: Madison W.
reviews.description: Everything taste so good and cooked so well. Will definitely be coming back! Ordered online and was ready 10 minutes early. Stayed warm the whole way home and is delicious!! The sauce is to die for!

reviews.author: Nathan F.
reviews.description: Love this place and one of the only places near campus that provide growlers to go and have a variety of stuff. Friendly and helpful staff and great selection I'm basically a Covid regular

reviews.author: Roy G.
reviews.description: Average tap house with decent food.  The parking lot is small but there was parking both times I came by.  The beer selection is pretty good.  They capture a broad spectrum of tastes and styles of beer. The food is bar style, wings, fries, tots, sandwiches, etc.  nothing I ate was noteworthy. There is room for improvement on greeting and service times.  There was one person working the bar and another waitress floating but no one approached us so we got up and asked.  Then another gentleman came from the back to wait on us.  There were not enough people in this place for the service not to be swift and great. Especially when I bring a party of 8 that are all eating and drinking. Anyway it's a good stop for a quick bite and a beer if you're in the area.  Just not a place on my list to revisit.

reviews.author: Bethany M.
reviews.description: My weekly go to, I love the friendly service and upbeat atmosphere, and of course beer selection.  Great specials and a full menu.

reviews.author: Sirena L.
reviews.description: Growler USA is definitely one of my favorite places to go to for drinks and food. There's a fantastic selection of beer; with something like 100 taps, you're bound to find something you like, whether you want a sour, IPA, or stout. Most of them are Texas beers and the selection is always changing. If you're not feeling beer, there are plenty of other drinks too: sodas, kombucha, wine, cider, mead, etc. A huge plus for me about Growler USA is they have pours starting from 4oz -- perfect for flights and lightweights! -- to the typical 12/16oz, and of course they fill growlers.  There is also decent food that goes a bit beyond typical pub food and is of course more varied than a food truck at a brewery. I'm particularly fond of the tater tots and mac and cheese, but it looks like they've added some new items to the menu in the last couple of months.   Another great aspect of Growler USA is the incredible staff. There is one woman in particular - her name eludes me - but she is extremely knowledgeable about beer of all kinds and can give you some great suggestions based on what you're feeling (or even if you're trying to do a beer and food pairing)!  I believe there is also some kind of special every day of the week.
