I know Sundays are $1 off sours, happy hour all day (discount on all appetizers), and I believe the tapover beers are discounted as well. Plus they do special events like Beer 101 classes. For all these reasons, I think Growler USA is a great value overall and there really is something for every taste. I know I'm always learning and trying something new every time I come here, and it keeps me coming back!

reviews.author: David K.
reviews.description: I'm so glad this place opened in such a safe manner during COVID. Everything is so clean and follows the procedures. Also AJ's playlists are fire. Tap takeover is a must

reviews.author: Lauren S.
reviews.description: Take advantage of the specials and this can be a very reasonable place to get a good beer. The extensive menu and regular Tap Takeovers encourage would-be cicerones to expand their palate.  Don't bother with an entree. Food is mostly overpriced and underwhelming, so maybe get a large appetizer to share with your party. The wings and tots are alright and I hear good things about the pretzels.  The staff is all pretty nice. The price point and atmosphere attract a slightly older crowd for a location so close to a university, so don't worry about this place being flooded with undergrads like myself most of the time.

reviews.author: Rohan C.
reviews.description: Growler is an American classic. If you're not going to Growler during Tap Takeover on Thursday, what are you doing? The staff is amazing, AJ and Cannon are amazing people.

reviews.author: Clint S.
reviews.description: This place has countless things going for it: a friendly and knowledgeable staff, phenomenal selection of beers, and stellar food.   My partner and I come here at a minimum of once a week.

reviews.author: Tom B.
reviews.description: *MANAGEMENT PLEASE READ THIS*  Whoever you have bartending today needs to be spoken to. I generally write positive reviews, but this needed calling attention to.  I just walked with my wife and daughter for lunch.  We waited a few minutes to be seated, or told to seat ourselves - but were totally ignored.  Finally a guy at the bar told the bartender that we had been waiting a while and she said, loud enough for us to hear, "I don't care, I'm busy."  The place was not remotely packed.    Terrible, and very rude, service by the bartender working today.  Candidly one of the worst experiences I've had, and we didn't even make it to a table.  We headed over to Torchy's for a great meal instead.

reviews.author: Jana N.
reviews.description: Great Lunch Place!!!  Really cool place. I love it. You can get your eats, drinks and growler for later. Yummy fish tacos. The menu was fun. Tots and tacos sound good to me!   I didn't think to buy a growler but the manager told me about their growlers. I now have a glass   free growler that is insulated.    Love the samplers. And they have kombucha on tap that is the Best I have ever had. A few beer and a kombucha for good measure.   YUM!  After a bevy you can go to Malvern's and Oat Willie's.    Thanks!

reviews.author: Kathy Z.
reviews.description: This place is great for happy hours for small to medium sized groups. They have a broad selection of draft beers and the menu is organized so you can easily find the type of beer you are in the mood for. The tap takeover beers are $3. I've been a few times when tap takeover brewery is there and they let you sample some of their beer. They also have reverse happy hour on Saturday nights. I've had the tater tots and pretzel, and both are simple but delicious. Parking is easy, and the staff is helpful and friendly.

reviews.author: Taylor Z.
reviews.description: Wow oh wow! Free wifi, tons of awesome board games with all the pieces, lots of seating and the ability to raise the windows, plus over 100+ beers on tap?!?!). This is an amazing hidden gem on campus... I can't believe I haven't went to this place before! They have some awesome deals and $3 growler fills on certain days (which is unbelievable deal).  I will be back thirsty to drink! Check this place out for sure! If you come during happy hour they have some awesome deals for food as well (your typical bar fare).

reviews.author: Hillary K.
reviews.description: This place is awesome. It's definitely got that local bar feel. The people walk in and are greeted by their first names. My favorite thing about this place is the selection of beers and that you can get 4oz choices for roughly $2. That way if you don't care for something you didn't spend $6-$8 on a glass. There are TVs and good music playing. The staff were incredibly nice and helpful. The food selection is good and tastes good as well. We will definitely be back. This is a feel good place to relax and have a drink and bite to eat away from the typical touristy spots in Austin.

reviews.author: Laura O. D.
reviews.description: First customers in yesterday,and had a great experience with bartender "AM". She was friendly and knowledgeable about huge beer selection. In the end we bought 2 additional growlers on her suggestion about some rare / different local beer from Live Oak Brewing. Also bought the 512 IPA for my Bro. Honey Sriracha wings and tots were a nice snack while we tasted the different beers. Great place and atmosphere!

reviews.author: Heather T.
reviews.description: We had an excellent experience here for lunch. I have loved having Easy Tiger breads from Whole Foods at home, but did not realize they had restaurants, too.   We tried out the Lamar location and it was extremely tasty and a super chill atmosphere. They have a great outdoor patio area that is quiet but comfortable (even had heaters and fans).   What I was most impressed by was how the staff accommodated the needs of an ADA guest that was sitting with us. They really went above and beyond to make everyone comfortable. I will definitely be back soon.   PS - Try the beets, they're delicious!

reviews.author: Avery P.
reviews.description: So I traditionally love Easy Tiger and we frequent the North location for happy hour pretty often. We ventured to this South location excited that they have an outdoor space for kids.  The good:  Beautiful place with indoor and outdoor seating Fenced area for kids to run around Delicious food, beer, coffee  The not-so-great: When we arrived, there were a ton of open tables but we were told there was a 30 minute wait to be seated. After roaming around for a while and seeing none of tables were getting used, we asked and were told that they were giving the kitchen a "chance to catch up." I wish they would have let us go ahead and get seated while we waited The prices seem to really be going up. $14 for a pretzel? I mean they're delicious and the cheese sauce is amazing, but I'll probably never order one again if they're the price of an entre.  In conclusion, we'll probably be back, but if we have the kids with us, we'd probably only go for happy hour or just coffee and pastries rather than a full meal. It's just too long a wait and too pricey for a family meal.

reviews.author: Samantha C.
reviews.description: Loved the variety of outdoor seating options, particularly the non-smoking upstairs area. They do trivia in that section on Tuesday nights, so expect it to be packed. There are ceiling heaters for the colder days, and long family-style seating primarily. That patio also has a bar, or you can order food through table service as well.  Mostly glutenous things on the menu, so would not recommend for special dietary needs. I had the waffle fries, which were tasty and served in a small bowl. Would definitely return again.

reviews.author: Robert H.
reviews.description: I still remember the first time we went there. It was on the slow end of Dirty Sixth, where the old Havana location was.   I recall it vividly because of an interesting Interaction I had with the bartender.  As I looked at the menu, I asked about the pastrami and he said, "Its good. So good in fact, it's the second best in town, behind Pious Pizza."  I remember thinking how it was honest but cocky at the same time. Sure, you may not think it's the best, but you sure you're second best?  Well, he was right.  Fast forward to a cool, hazy night in 2022 at their South Lamar location. First of all, the building is immaculate, an intentional nod to their style and culture. I love it.  My wife had the prosciutto baguette, which was delicious. Although the bread almost stole the show on that one.  The kiddo had the chicken schnitzel and, man, who puts that much effort into a kids plate? Really tasty and well executed.  I, like always, went with old faithful, the pastrami sandwich. My old friend was as delicious as always, as it didn't disappoint. The bread was great but didn't come close to stealing the limelight.   I've always worried about Easy Tiger turning into one of those Austin brands (talking to you Torchy) that loses its way, and I'm sure some may feel that way, but the experience at South Lamar could've been back at that old Sixth Street basement.   Five stars, folks.

reviews.author: Joanna L.
reviews.description: I have been dying to go to Easy Tiger ever since they opened on South Lamar. Today I was craving pastrami in particular and was in the neighborhood so I decided to go get the pastrami sandwich to go.   First impressions: convenient location, lots of parking options, clean restaurant and bathrooms, friendly but unknowledgeable staff, quick service but the restaurant was nearly empty at 3pm in the afternoon.   When I checked out at the counter I was taken back by the price. $23 for a sandwich ($18+ tip). Probably the most expensive sandwich I've ever ordered, even when staying at a five-star hotel and ordering room service. OUCH. I still purchased it in hopes for a big fat pastrami sandwich that I could possibly split up for two meals.   When I got back to home and opened the sandwich I was hugely disappointed. Where was the meat?! It only had a thin layer of pastrami and sauerkraut between two thick slices of oversized bread. WHAT?   The taste was average to mediocre. Absolutely nothing special about this sandwich. Bland, no substance, too much bread. I felt ripped off.   On the positive side the sandwich was homemade (fresh baked bread) and fresh prepared  sauerkraut and dressing, so at least I knew it was quality food/whole food and not processed junk. Sadly that wasn't enough to make it remarkable or worth the price. I was also very disappointed it did not include a big fat pickle. That would be a very easy and tasty addition.   This is Austin full of amazing food and amazing restaurants. Easy Tiger does not make the cut for me, nor would I recommend it to anyone else local or coming from out of town.   Recommendations to management: pile on the pastrami, reimagine the sauce and include a pickle. House made potato chips or even any kind of potato chips would have helped justify the price a little. Also, more training and knowledge needed for the staff as they could not answer my questions about the products and menu items.   Don't waste your money and time on a boring sandwich. I so wanted to love this place.

reviews.author: Jelexus M.
reviews.description: Okay so, I ran across this post of super cute bars in Austin. Well of course I had too try them ALL. Starting with Easy Tiger.  Location: upon arrival it looks like an outdoor situation but once you park your car around the back you slowly realize it's a indoor/outdoor vibe. Areas have great coverage from the sun and I love that they have fans as well as Heaters on the ceiling!   Food: The Food was Fan-Freaking-Tastic. I won't lie first glance at the menu I was ehh. Nevertheless I asked my waiter chandler what should I order he made wonderful recommendations.   The pretzel  10/10: crispy outside pillowy soft inside   The Cajun Chicken Sausage 10/10: that prefect snap you want from any sausage casing and the home made Chow-Chow was the prefect topping.   The breakfast potatoes  10/10 : It was like the par-boiled the pots then fried them    Brussels sprouts 8/10 : Great flavor just wanted them a little more tender   Our cocktails 8/10  We order 3 different kinds all three were just okay.   The dessert and bread too take home was also really good.   All in All I would definitely recommend stopping by.

reviews.author: Ashley N.
reviews.description: This one hurts my heart because I had been so eager to come here.   A big group of myself and a bunch of other girls had decided that Easy Tiger was the place we wanted to support this night! I was so excited because, like I said, this was a top place on my list of places to go!  We had called the day of to make sure they could accommodate a large group. They said yes. We let them know when we were coming that night and how many of us it would be. All good (we thought)!  Our group starts to arrive at Easy Tiger and we realize that they thought we were coming the next morning and not the time we had told them. Okay, no biggie, we can fix this. We had also been told that there were only two servers that night. You could tell they were overwhelmed. We had made it clear that we wanted to make it as easy as possible for our server since there were so many of us. We were told that they would be able to give us two long tables next to each other so our group would be at least semi close. This didn't happen. Again, whatever... It just kind of sucked.  Now on to food! Yay! Most of us were starving. I can't speak for everyone else but I decided on the Pretzel. It looked so good in the IG photos. When it came out (fast if I may say), it was cold and not soft :( The cheese and other sides it came with felt like they were just taken out of the freezer. Inedible. Sad Ashley.  I drank a Peach Mule that was A1!! That was the highlight of my time here!  Would definitely come back, sit at the bar, and maybe order something different. I'm sure this was just a case of miscommunication and I'm excited to give them a second chance!

reviews.author: Harriet D.
reviews.description: I LOVE THIS PLACE! I always leave with a fresh loaf of sourdough bread. The pretzel and beer cheese is the perfect snack if you're attending one of their weekly trivia nights. My personal favorite sausage is the kielbasa - it tastes as amazing as it looks. My favorite cocktail here is their aperol spritz, or one of their weekly beers on tap if I'm doing well in trivia and need to keep my brain on. Highly recommend!!!

reviews.author: Eric B.
reviews.description: Great atmosphere, bakery, food and coffee AND has a full bar. Excellent bread. Breakfast all the way to midnight this is a great place to go. Also has a rooftop deck. The price is right as well. Young and trendy without any of the modern pretentiousness.   Very welcoming.

reviews.author: Jevin H.
reviews.description: The beer at here was pretty good. I liked the heavenly haze and my friend got the pog-slammer. Haze was a IPA similar to electric jellyfish from pint house. Pog had very citrus-y flavors which I liked. I also got the pretzel which was decently sized. The dips were good for the pretzel.  The bad part... the service. We ordered three beers the first time around, which took around 15 minutes to arrive. The beers weren't really cold at this point. I am not sure how that would be possible but I expect it to be the waiting staff seemingly lounging around talking to each other doing nothing. We asked for the waitress and it took an additional 10 minutes for her to arrive. We then ordered more food and drinks which took additionally extremely long amounts of time. The kicker was that there were two other seated tables so the place was basically empty. I would really recommend going to the 7th location over this one, at least while the current waiting staff is still doing what they did when we went.   Food was alright. Service was shockingly bad.

reviews.author: Zulema R.
reviews.description: It's a Wednesday at 1:30 P - there is a ton of people at this location - parking lot practically full. I'm not sure if this is a usual occurrence. If it is, they do not have enough staff so accommodate everyone.   The hostess was lovely and sat us down immediately but we sat for 10 minutes without any water or waiter for our section.   Please hire more people

reviews.author: Christine H.
reviews.description: I like the ambience. During the day time, you can study, meet up with a friend, or go on a date! There is parking, indoor seating, and outdoor patio.   They have great pretzels and drinks. If you go from 7-10 am on the weekdays, they have $5 special of any coffee with pastry!

reviews.author: Johanna J.
reviews.description: We stopped by for a late lunch on a Monday and this place did not disappoint. We decided to sit in the upstairs area. Our food and drinks arrived promptly and everything was delicious. I haven't visited after work which tends to be more lively.   Overall pleasant experience and menu prices are reasonable. If you're new in town or just visiting, it's worth a trip - I do recommend.

reviews.author: Dave A.
reviews.description: I went mid-afternoon to pick up salad and bread. They texted me ahead to let me know they were out of pre-sliced bread but had whole loaf of same flavor. I accepted it but had wanted pre-sliced. There is a lot of construction underway and it makes parking cramped.   Also, I could not locate the curbside spots. I went to the host stand to pick up. Nearly got run over by an impatient driver driving around the "Slow Down, Stay Awhile" sign. Ironic.   The Winter Kale salad seems overpriced for the portion size. It is tasty, just on the small side.   The North side location is much better. Maybe this one will improve after construction.

reviews.author: Vivian C.
reviews.description: I really enjoyed the atmosphere! My fianc and his dad enjoyed the beers here, while his mom and I happily sipped our latte. All great.   We all shared a sourdough bread and wow it tasted so fresh and tasty! It was as if it was freshly baked (which I believe that's what they advertised) and it was more than enough to take home to enjoy for breakfast the next day. We also all shared the sausage sampler with the sauces that go with each sausage which I LOVED. Each of them had their own taste and they did an excellent job pairing them with the appropriate sauce.   As for my entre, I ordered the prosciutto baguette which was quite huge! Very delightful, but I ended up not finishing it. Their bread portions are very generous.   Would love to come back!

reviews.author: Dawn S.
reviews.description: A beautiful fall evening in Austin deserved a patio visit. We sat upstairs and the view didn't disappoint. We just missed the sunset but the sky was still stunning.  We grabbed some menus and decided on drinks and a giant pretzel. We also got the charcuterie board. My friend got a margarita which is said was 4/10 on a scale of margs. I tasted it and to me it tasted like a melted frozen margarita. Way too sweet for my liking. I wanted a cab (wine of choice) which they didn't have...I got a Malbec which wasn't horrible but I prefer a good bold cab.  The pretzel was great as always and the charcuterie board was well laid out. Neither one of us like the almonds. They had some sort of oil on them. What I really was sad about was the jam. I was hoping for a fig jam but it was not. My first bite was not good at all. I even asked the waitress what it was...she very nicely called down to the kitchen on her little mic and found out that it was a strawberry ginger jam. Those two flavors do not go together in my personal opinion. The ginger was way too strong and over powering.  The cheeses on the cheese board from Antonelli's Cheese Shop were on point. The goat cheese with honey was great. The blue cheese was yum and the Gouda was "Gouda".  ba dum tss.   Overall- this place is a no brainer for a casual night with friends over a pretzel and a beautiful view.

reviews.author: Sean Matthew L.
reviews.description: Easy Tiger has a warm special place in my heart. When their 6th street location closed I was so sad, but then like gremlins overnight they multiplied in the best of ways. Having an east austin, and south austin offering and more is such a boon.   We love their snacking/grazing boards. What millennial wouldn't? They're basically adult lunchables. Meats and cheeses and nuts and jams, oh my.   The pretzels and beer cheese are also legendary. But so much so that they sadly often run out of pretzels like they did for us the other day.   We love the use of covered and outdoor seating, especially in this time.   Wanting more substantial fare, they got you. The sausages, pastrami, the blt, all incredible. Really you can't go wrong. So, go!

reviews.author: Linda M.
reviews.description: Easter Sunday and no reservations? No problem. My friends and I decided to check out the new South Austin location of Easy Tiger. It was my suggestion and, thankfully, everyone loved it!  We started with a cinnamon knot, a soft pretzel with mustard, and a round of mimosas. The pretzel was out of this world! Warm, with a light sprinkling of Kosher salt, a crispy exterior and the lightest, fluffiest interior EVER!  We got it with a nice whole grain mustard; cheese was an optional side. The cinnamon knot was pretzel dough in a different shape with a sprinkling of cinnamon (it was savory, not sweet). Good, too, but it wasn't warm, so it got overlooked as we focused on the warm pretzel. As you can see from my photos, we were overcome with hunger and I almost didn't get a picture of the pretzel at all! It was that good.  We moved on to the Grazing Board, a side salad, and avocado toast.  The grazing board was truly a show stopper. It included a blue cheese, guyere, and brie, Prosciutto, sweet red grapes, dark and white raisins, slices of sour dough and walnut cranberry bread, tiny, tiny gherkins, candied walnuts, apricots, whipped butter and other toppings. It was visually stunning, but equally delicious. The house salad had the best, giant croutons and a light, delicious dressing with fresh greens, cherry tomatoes, radish slices. The avocado toast was a thick slice of grilled sour dough topped with a generous mound of mashed avocado, cherry tomatoes, and thinly sliced radishes. Delicious!  The space at the S. Lamar location is very nice, bright and open. There are several outdoor seating areas, so no problem finding a spot to sit. There might be an issue finding parking, as the parking lot is small (and each parking space is tiny!)  I cannot wait to go back and try some other things on the menu as everything I saw coming out of the kitchen looked good. I want to try it all!

reviews.author: Sabrina B.
reviews.description: This is a joint review from me and my partner. We went on two separate occasions. I went with my coworkers on a Thursday for an outing/birthday. The place itself is cute. Allows dogs. Twinkling lates. Cornhole off to the side. Just a cute, trendy, Austin-like place. But the experience was lack luster. The food took very long. The establishment didn't own enough cups, so part of us had to share cups or just didn't have water. The food was mediocre, save the fries. In this kind of weather, you should be prepared for flies to constantly fly around and land on your food. The drinks are also weak and the time between them will sober you up.   My partner went a separate time. This time I had three things to eat: a strawberry and goat cheese salad, French toast bites, and ricotta toast to share. The salad was ok, but smelled absolutely rank. Even the vinaigrette smelled super off, and not in a heavy-in-vinegar kind of way. The goat cheese wasn't the best, and frankly you could see the indentation of the packaging. The French toast bites bad poor texture. You'd expect to use a slightly stale brioche but instead was a baguette style. It was not soaked enough in the egg mix before cooking for it to have a fluffy texture. Instead, it was hard and unenjoyable. A poor quality baguette instead of the nice ones at real boulangeries. The ricotta toast was the best part, but still wasn't that great. Texture was also off, like an overcooked steak that takes too much force to rip apart. Not only that, but the food took 1 hour to get here.  At the end, they took his card and forgot to return it for 30 minutes. Couldn't get a hold of the waiter and left very late due to him forgetting about us.  Twice have they been very disappointing! Don't recommend this place unless you just want to waste money on a company credit card or take your young mother-in-law that you hate.

reviews.author: Piyush A.
reviews.description: What a gem on South Lamar! There are some business that have survived the pandemic, some that have folded, but there are very few that have creatively embraced it. Easy Tiger has gone beyond that where they started the business during the pandemic and built something absolutely majestic.   Drinks - Ofcourse the beer selection is amazing but the best part is that there is something for everyone. They have a great selection of wine and some really cool cocktails.   Food - This was a pleasant surprise. I have never heard my food snob wife utter the words "This may be the best avocado toast I've ever had" .. not just that the Brussels sprouts are a delight and the egg sandwich is really good too  Ambience - This is where they go from being great to phenomenal.. the outdoor area is a perfect setup and the best part is that they have a little kiddie park for the little ones. All this overlooking the green belt.. does/can it get any better?   One thing to add .. on a good day parking lot gets full very fast so plan accordingly!   A must must go for a nice sunny day or otherwise :)

name: Whisler's
accommodations: Best nights on Thursday, Friday, Saturday

reviews.author: Angie M.
reviews.description: SHAKE IT TILL YOU MAKE IT!   After dinner last night we decided on going bar hopping. I really don't know the places to go so I trusted my brother and his girlfriend's opinions here. They wanted to show me the places where they have gone on dates and enjoyed.   Whiskers was one of the first stops we made after dinner. My brother told me that this bar had plenty of different rooms that you could go into. So we first walked around and went into each of the rooms before ordering some drinks.   Me being the smart 25 year old that I am decided for the evening since I had already had vodka at dinner I was going to only drink white liquor for the evening because I did not want to screw myself and be really hungry over when my parents got here the next day. (HAHA)!   I looked over the seasonal menu and decided on the Sage Advice drink! It had citrus juices in it as well as vodka. And it was spectacular. All of the flavors in this beverage complimented each other very well. It is definitely one of those drinks I would classify as dangerous. If you had a few of those you might be on the floor. It honestly tastes like juice. So one too many might lead to you not being able to walk. So just be warned.   The inside of the bar was decorated for christmas. They went all out. There were chandeliers at the bars and lights everywhere and even one big christmas tree all decorated in white lights.   It is definitely one of those bars that you need to check out next time you are in Austin. I have only seen it with the holiday decor, but I am sure they decorate it all out for other holidays as well!   The staff and service was great! Very quick and easy. It is a busy bar so you might have to wait a few minutes to get a bartenders attention. But it it all worth it at the end of the night!

reviews.author: Brandon Y.
reviews.description: An East Austin staple with an eclectic and quirky dcor.  If you are looking for a quiet, stuffy cocktail bar, this place is not what you're looking for (at least on the weekends). I would characterize it as sort of a slightly dressed up dive bar with some very unique vibes. The interior has the feeling of an old wild west sort of saloon, crossed with an old cathedral, crossed with an old hunting lodge. Past patrons have written messages on the walls and it is interesting reading some of their musings while sipping on an old fashioned. The exterior bar is fairly standard, although there is a random bath tub located in the middle of the backyard area, which is another interesting quirk.  Generally, the cocktails here are quite good; sometimes they pre-make the cocktails in a larger batch, cutting down on the wait time a bit. My experience has generally been positive with the pre-made cocktails.  One downside here is that it is very popular and is therefore quite crowded much of the time. During the busiest hours on weekend nights, you can expect to encounter a line to get in and another line to get drinks. That said, if you're with the right company, a few minutes wait for cocktails is pretty tolerable.  If you are visiting Austin, this is one good spot to check out to experience the "charm" of the area. Additionally, being on 6th, this place is very walkable to other bars and makes for a great place to start or end the night.

reviews.author: Anni D.
reviews.description: Was recommended by multiple people to check out this spot but I was pretty unimpressed. We came here on a Thursday night and it was extreme packed. Waiting 30+ mins at the bar to order drinks is not fun.   The drinks themselves were just OK. Nothing spectacular or out of the ordinary. Not sure what the hype is about.

reviews.author: Katherine M.
reviews.description: This is my favorite bar in Austin. Take that with a rim of salt as I do love Mezcal. Their frozen cocktails are delicious and reasonably priced. There is plenty of space downstairs, but if you really enjoy Mezcal head upstairs to the tasting room where an expert will line you up with a tasting based on your preference. A must visit in Austin.

reviews.author: Shelby W.
reviews.description: Whisler's has been a gem on the east side withe great vibes and phenomenal cocktails. Came here on a Saturday afternoon and had the best time getting some drinks while sitting on the patio. The bartenders are awesome and extremely helpful when ordering.   We ordered a few drinks, and we loved each one of them! They even offer happy hour 2-5 daily which includes an old fashioned, a gin lavender drink, mule, and many more. As we were leaving the lines for the bar were getting pretty long, however the bartenders move pretty quickly so the wait was not too bad. Love this spot, especially if you are looking for some unique cocktails.

reviews.author: Lauren R.
reviews.description: Whisler's is an excellent stop on E 6th street. Their cocktails, service and music selection are top notch.  It's often easy to find a spot to sit indoors or outside. I highly recommend the Temple of Doom cocktail if you like mezcal and pineapple. Great spot for a drink before or after dinner.

reviews.author: Swati G.
reviews.description: This is my all time favorite bar in Austin, and the only reason it isn't getting five stars is because of how busy it can be on weekends. The bar upstairs is a mezcal tasting room which has yet to disappoint me. The bartender will tailor your tasting to what you and your guests are interested in trying and also ensure that the space isn't too overrun by other guests. Push through the crowd and add this bar to your itinerary when visiting Austin and I can assure you won't be disappointed with the experience.

reviews.author: Chanele R.
reviews.description: I really enjoyed my drinks here, and the inside ambiance was awesome. It was a hot afternoon, and it got a bit uncomfortable inside (no a/c), but it would be an awesome place on a cool fall day (the four we have in Austin!). I tried the old fashioned first, having heard it was "signature." It did not disappoint! My second drink was not as good (something to do with ambition in the name?), so I will stick to the old fashioned next time.   Also, I feel it's worth mentioning that I didn't feel any sort of discrimination. Having read some of the other reviews, I was a little nervous to visit as older than 30,  but I found no problems at all. I had no issues getting drinks. Only once did an employee act like a jerk because the inside bar was closed, but that wasn't readily apparent, and he got snippy that I was waiting there. He did it with others, too, though. I think everyone's experiences are valid, but my experience was not that this bar only caters to picture perfect 20-somethings.

reviews.author: Kolby G.
reviews.description: Easily one of the best spots in Austin. Staff is amazing and super friendly. Drinks are tasty. The inside is a lot of fun. Normally a very chill spot but can get busy and noisy on the weekends. They even come up with off menu mocktails on the fly. Fantastic spot!

reviews.author: Krista B.
reviews.description: This was one of my go-to bars to take visitors in Austin pre-COVID and I am so happy that I have been able to visit now that bars are reopening (safely)! Definitely recommend going after dark because the setting of the inside of the bar is part spooky/part western-y/part old-timey and kinda makes you feel like you could meet a vampire in the corner... but in a cool way! I have had many different drinks from their set menu but admittedly their bartenders know high quality cocktails on and off the menu so order your heart's wishes.   My most recent order: - Twisted Nerve - Fancy, not-too-sweet, and so refreshing on a warm day! - Whisler's Old Fashioned - Smooth and will put some hair on your chest.  Give this bar a shot! Or take a shot... No judgement here.

reviews.author: Sheila K.
reviews.description: Loved the vibe here. Plenty of space, two bars, and a tasting room. Great local place to visit in Austin if you're from out of town. There is also a small tequila tasting room upstairs.

reviews.author: Karley M.
reviews.description: Loved the environment here and the outdoor seating. Super chill with lots of space. There's a food truck here but we didn't eat there so I can't comment!

reviews.author: April L.
reviews.description: Hey y'all! This is my first review on yelp. My bestie went to wee wee and...get this...GLASS!!! On the floor!!! Ok and I'm not like the least clumsy person . I've made mistakes in my life !!?!? But like hazard much??? Hoping for more whiskers

reviews.author: Joey D.
reviews.description: A little pricey but a great vibe and amazing crafts. Will definitely return next time I'm in town.

reviews.author: Ashley C.
reviews.description: A true East Austin Vibe. Great specialty cocktail list, food truck outside, solid bartenders.

reviews.author: Christina H.
reviews.description: Whisler's was the best accident I stumbled upon in East Austin. Delicious drinks, no matter what was ordered. The tea + alcohol mix is the best thing that's ever been created. I can't have any thing else! If you're one of those people who say, "I don't like *insert disdainful alcohol color of choice*", trust me, you won't discriminate alcohol after coming to Whislers.

reviews.author: Sophie H.
reviews.description: Jesse is the most outstanding bartender at this establishment! After the bald fellow working at the indoor bar proceeded to ignore my group for 15+ minutes while he served people who came in behind us, we confronted him and he said "it's called waiting your turn"  we made our way to the back bar where Jesse took our order and immediately made the drinks, (which were amazing!) and apologized for his coworkers incompetence. His great service completely saved our visit and we will be returning to this establishment!

reviews.author: Junus A.
reviews.description: Last night my wife and I made the mistake of going to another cocktail bar that wasn't Whislers. Big mistake. ~$30 and 45 unimpressive minutes later, we hightailed it over to East 6th.   First thing I noticed is that they nixed their dinky parking situation to make room for even more patio tables. Perfect. It's not like Whisler's really needed the space, but with the interior bar unmanned and COVID in the air, it's a welcome addition.  I'm always surprised when people say the cocktails here are unimpressive. I don't know where else they are drinking (in ATX at least), but I'd appreciate a clue-in. Whisler's does a damn fine job; we always drink too much here because we can't stop sipping on inventive and tasty cocktails.   Last night's outing had two standouts I'd like to highlight. First, the Drab Majesty. With rum, cachaa (a fermented sugarcane liquer), beet, raspberry and lime, the drink struck a sweet spot between sweet and savory, with some carribean flair to boot. Next, the Feel Good Hit of the Summer, mint julep-inspired with an attitude. Couching the bourbon inside a fruity melangerie of cantaloupe, apricot, lemon and lemongrass made for a supremely sippable summer drink - a sublime libation if I ever had one.   Last note; I love coming to Whisler's and walking out having tried multiple types of alcohol I never knew existed. It's always fun to learn a thing or two!

reviews.author: Caroline N.
reviews.description: I had heard really great things about Whistlers. My expectations were that I would have a great drink and prepare to wait for it.   To my surprise, I got a great drink without the waiting part. I had a twisted nerve which was fantastic. Not sweet, not dry, just really smooth. The other patron in my party had an old fashioned and said it was perfect!  The prices are great for how strong the drinks are. The music and energy were reminiscent of the speakeasies. I definitely recommend and will be visiting this establishment again to try some of the other drinks on the menu.

reviews.author: Ashleigh K.
reviews.description: When staying at arrive hotel in Austin I was thrilled to see that whisler's was directly across the street from our hotel. This place is bustling at night. I am not sure if there was an upstairs as we hang out on the lower level. Downstairs there's was two bars one inside and another outside in a tented area. The vibe here is very romantic and relaxed. It has almost a speak easy feeling about it. We ordered several drinks off the menu and loved all of them. The bartenders were all pleasant and kept up with the amount of people. I would not recommend if you are someone who gets claustrophobic though as it can get really packed. Whisper's is super loud and open very late.

reviews.author: Matthew W.
reviews.description: I came here on a motorcycle ride with my Combat Veteran Association January 22nd, 2022. It was my first time here and it is on a beautiful road in Texas Hill Country.  The company is Military Veteran owned and a very family friendly property. There is a play area with a jungle gym and lots of picnic tables outside as well as a smaller covered outdoor seating area. I honestly didn't see an indoor seating area so I'm not sure if there is one. The covered seating area is where the bar was to order your drinks. They had about 12 beers to choose from some I did a flight of 4; 3 lagers and 1 stout. It was only about $11. The flight was four four ounce pours. They also serve some local wine if I recall.  There was a food truck on site serving up great bbq. I had their turkey sandwich and a cup of beans. Both were extremely good. The turkey was freshly smoked or bbq'd and perfectly tender. The beans was saucy with their sausage and veggies. For $15 I was stuffed. They also had small buzzers to give when ordering so you knew when it was ready and worked on the entire property.  I really want to return here on a warmer day and in the spring and/or summer. The same road this is located on also has a winery or two I believe so it would make a very good day trip or even weekend adventure to the area to explore all the local spots.

reviews.author: Mitchell C.
reviews.description: Great people, good beer, relaxed outdoor family friendly place!

reviews.author: Olga U.
reviews.description: My first and only time visiting, I happened upon the best Oktoberfest celebration this side of the Atlantic I have been to yet! What an awesome accidental event to stumble upon, although I'm sure I would've had just as great of a time here were it just a regular weekend. Great beers, fun crowd, lively polka music, very cool artisan craft fair, and one heck of a time in a beautiful beer garden setting. Well worth the drive from Austin if you're visiting!

reviews.author: Melanie B.
reviews.description: This place was recommended to me in a local group I'm in with fellow America lovers!  The only thing I'm disappointed in is not knowing about it sooner. Great atmosphere, great service and great beers and I'm not a beer drinker. There is something for everybody.  When you visit a place like this your faith and hope in our country will be restored. The news and maybe even your own neighborhood/community could be negative or living in fear of what's to come, get out.. turn off the tv, hang around your fellow Americans and breathe in some good ol Texas Hill Country air! Does a body good. If that doesn't make your mouth water then stay home...   Food Trucks! Live Music! Veteran owned! Dog friendly!  Face friendly! Goof folks! Oh and beer!  Cheers!!! Merica!!

reviews.author: Katie N.
reviews.description: The area is nice and spread out with a ton of room for kids. We loved the shade and separation of everything. The idea that this was founded by veterans and gives back to veterans is amazing.  The beer itself, I was personally disappointed in. It was too "heavy", if that makes sense. We tried 3 and one I enjoyed but didn't love. It seemed like they were heavier/stronger than they should've been. Plus a lot of "froo-froo" drinks such as mead, etc. made up half their offerings. I get that you need some for people that don't like beer but they had too many.

reviews.author: Joe L.
reviews.description: Enjoyed Octoberfest at 12 Fox Beer Co in Dripping Springs this past Sunday. What an awesome event with vendors selling all kinds of things, food trucks providing some delicious victuals, the Reed Meisters playing some great Polka music, and 12 Fox serving up some incredible beer. Without a doubt...12 Fox brews up some incredible beers. I really loved the Negro Sombrero. One of the best and smoothest beers I've enjoyed in a very long time.

reviews.author: Ron U.
reviews.description: Yeah, we really dig this place. A wonderful and eclectic variety of beer choices await for you to explore. This is also a pet friendly And kid friendly place too. Sit under the picnic tables and watch the world go by while you enjoy some of the best beer we've ever had. I also would like to mention the food menu it's pretty solid two. Come on out and get some all over you!

reviews.author: Tia H.
reviews.description: Such a beautiful place to enjoy a few drinks. Very kid friendly with a big play area. Super friendly staff and patrons. Lots of cute caterpillars crawling on the tables under the trees. I really liked it here.

reviews.author: Brittany N.
reviews.description: We absolutely LOVE this local (veteran owned) BREWERY!!! They have many of their own beers on tap (featured beers change often) and they also feature other local beer, wine, cider and mead.  It's a family (and dog) friendly establishment featuring an awesome tactical playground!  They have food trucks, live music events, and seasonal family fun events.  We are happy to have them in our "neck of the woods".  The owners are kind and always welcoming! We hope they stay around for a long time to come!  They have over 80 picnic tables spaced outside across the property, so you can pick any table that fits your style!  Clean restrooms! Free to use water and ice machine!  Changing table!  Rona Rules! Great place to have an outside birthday party or celebration!  The list goes on and on!!!  At at time when our local businesses are struggling to stay afloat, and many are threatened with permanent closure, we are happy to support local business!  12 Fox has gone above and beyond to give back to the community, help neighbors, and support other small businesses at a time in need.

reviews.author: H C.
reviews.description: We have so much fun at 12 Fox, every time we go. I love their beer, their location, their food trucks, and the people. It's always a great time, and worth the trip.

reviews.author: josh m.
reviews.description: This place is a little slice of heaven.  Great beer and food and a playground to boot.  To all the one star review Branch Covidians - STAY HOME and leave the place to the folks who enjoy great beer mixed with the freedom Texans used to enjoy uninterrupted by your petty tyranny.  Viva la Fox!

reviews.author: t. h.
reviews.description: This is an amazing brewery located in the beautiful Texas Hill Country! The owners and staff are really great and think of everything to make their customers and friends welcome and safe. Wide open spacing for picnic tables, posted Covid rules, great brews, food options, big oak trees, fire pits, a kids playground and live music on the weekends almost all year!

reviews.author: Dawn H.
reviews.description: Oh, what a great find! The hubs and were out brew hopping a few weeks back and we saw a sign on the corner of a crossing that stated "12 Fox Beer Co" [insert arrow]. Any of you who know me at all know my great penchant for craft beers, especially local, and I'm always up for a new brewery. So, turn left it was.  Parked in the large gravel lot. Walked up the trail to the building - HUGE kiddo playscape - I wanna slide! :) Very chill, nice place with a great patio and lots of other outdoor seating.   The proprietors/brewers are Army Combat Engineer veterans who learned about and found their love for beer while being stationed in Germany. Hence, they dozen lineup of Euro-styled offerings. They use single sourced malt and rainwater to create crisp, clean suds that aim to please. Of course there's hefe, pils, saison, dunkel...they also do a solid IPA.   Highly recommend! Really great folks, brewing their best, and serving one of the most outstanding charcuterie and cheese boards I've seen anywhere...no joke (and you might know that's also my "thing"). Go hang out in the Texas Hill Country, sip a cold one, get your snack on, and listen to live music on select nights. If a band isn't playing, some locals might start a impromptu jam session. What else could you ask for? Cheers!  Note: at time of last visit was informed they were going to have 2 food trucks on-site. Icing.

reviews.author: Holly C.
reviews.description: This 95% outside facility is just the best. They allow more than the needed room based on the restrictions in place, and have so much open space, there is freedom to chose your seating. They are meeting or exceeding Covid restrictions, in every way and every day. Beautiful, well kept lawns, with trees and tables, its just a pleasure to visit. Delicious beer, great people, and the tastiest food trucks I have ever had. I highly recommend them.

reviews.author: Stephen M.
reviews.description: Brought the family here hoping to find an outdoor beer garden with lots of space: what ought to be the perfect COVID-safe situation for a relaxing evening. Instead we found a business observing no COVID safety precautions whatsoever other than a chalkboard a-frame asking patrons to stay 6 feet apart, a guideline which I seemed to be completely alone in observing. Not a single member of the staff was wearing a mask, nor were 95% of the clientele while ordering at the bar or moving around the establishment. No capacity controls were in place, and the place was generally indistinguishable from a pre-pandemic beer garden.   A ton of wasted potential here, it's a shame the business owners aren't interested in being responsible members of the community and taking basic safety precautions.

reviews.author: Briar W.
reviews.description: Great beer and great atmosphere. They do tons of events throughout the seasons and have live music every week. Huge kid playground. Food options are a little slim.

reviews.author: Casey M.
reviews.description: We've been here a couple times now, and both times we've loved it! It's all outdoors, so if you don't like that I would not show up. Plenty of seating, and you go up to the counter to order and get your stuff right away! This last visit we got the raspberry Meade, it wasn't too bad... Don't think I could drink too much of it though because it is so sweet. There's a playground for kids so parents can hang out while their kids have some fun too, lots of times they have a live band or singer playing. There's easily accessible restrooms, and a food truck if you get a bit hungry. Overall wonderful spot that's out of the way and away from the craziness... Just go here!

reviews.author: Robin S.
reviews.description: Absolutely love this place! We are in Cedar Park so we don't get to visit as often as we like but wow I'd give this place 10 stars if I could. Amazing beer (and mead/cider for my gluten free hubby). Super family friendly. There's a big playground and teeter totter for the kids. Nice folks behind the bar. Amazing live music and food trucks most weekends. Came here for my bday because I knew the whole family would have fun - and we definitely did. Bought some beer, food, and apparel. So happy to support this awesome business. Highly highly recommend - you will love this cool little brewery too!

reviews.author: Michael S.
reviews.description: Can't say enough positive about this place.  The folks behind the bar were extremely friendly.  The tables are socially distanced and we felt very safe.  The beer was absolutely amazing.   The beer was absolutely incredible.  They seem to focus primarily on Belgian style beers, which is my absolute favorite, but they have some IPAs that will appeal to the hipsterist of hipsters as well.   We also tried the Cranberry Mead as well as their cider, which was crispy and dry that would appeal to any lager or Pilsner fan.   The outdoor area was expansive and, frankly, beautiful.   The staff were very friendly, accommodating, and genuinely excited to share their knowledge.  It was fun to get their perspective on what I should try.    One thing worth mentioning...that I have seen in comments:   The folks behind the bar don't wear masks.  The order process is 6 foot distances, so no big deal for me, but some may have a problem with this.  Although I feel we are being extremely careful with covid guidelines, for some reason, I felt perfectly safe here.  Overall, I was extremely impressed with the quality of the beer, the beauty of the grounds, and the charming staff. This place will be a regular haunt for us.

reviews.author: Sylvia A.
reviews.description: Vey nice away from the Austin and they appreciate all vets free beer discounts outside is the best way for all to go  family oriented and kid and pets are welcomed

name: Pour House Pints And Pies
accommodations: Best nights on Wednesday, Friday, Saturday

reviews.author: Chalin S.
reviews.description: What a cute lil place! Lots of outdoor seating!   Lots of beers and they make a good marg.   The snack - are what I'm all about here, the hummus was good, friend cheese oh lord (but wait you can't go wrong with that can you?) and the MUSHROOMS were so yummy!   Warning - the house red will give you a headache

reviews.author: Ruth S.
reviews.description: Not sure why people are giving more stars than this place deserves. If you actually read the peoples' reviews, they really meant to give less stars.   Here's why:  The pizza is just bar pizza. It's nothing special and if I'm being honest, I would have been much happier just going to Costco for pizza   Imagine your pizza covered in melted plastic that has cheese flavor. That's what's the pizza is like; bar pizza. Pizza you'd love to eat when hammered. It tasted like Red Baron.   Let's talk about the cocktails. I can't speak over every cocktail in existence but if they're anything like the margaritas... lol... don't order a cocktail. The margarita here was so bad, I'm sure my husband could make one better with margarita mix and Jose Cuervo. Gross .   I wish I could tell you that our experience here was fluffed with great service... unfortunately, that isn't the case. I understand being understaffed because of the C word, but I watched my waitress, and she was so inefficient, I was very tempted to get up and serve myself. Also, they weren't understaffed. There were plenty of servers for the lack of people that were present. Be prepared to sit for awhile staring at your feet until you can order anything. Be prepared to stay thirsty while you eat. Ask for everything you need from the start, or be prepared to not need it by the time you receive help.   Last but not least, the bathrooms. Those things are important, are they not?  they are to me. I will say, they are definitely public bathrooms. Have you ever been to a really gross gas station bathroom? Ok, then you know what these bathrooms are like. I wonder, does anyone even clean them? Oh well, we will just blame it on the C word this time around.

reviews.author: Steve B.
reviews.description: Still here.  Still serving tasty food.  A large, varied, frequently changing 35 tap wall and smart friendly beer savvy staff.   This remains a favorite neighborhood hangout and I love the food, the beer and the staff and really love the place.  Pretty sparkling clean, nice patio and if they had some heaters a patio that would be great in December,  January and February too.    The formula here, as with all the bars in this ownership group, is simple and effective: great staff, nice place, decent food, good beer and inexpensive drinks.  No wonder they have outlasted the last 5 occupants of this building!

reviews.author: Ralph S.
reviews.description: The pizza is usually delicious.  Our cocktails are reasonable.  The staff Always are Friendly and accepting!  Our pie tonight didn't meet our expectations.  We ordered the el supremo.. if was good but it was too dependent on the pepperoni and not enough of the other toppings.

reviews.author: Joel T.
reviews.description: I've been passing up some awesome food and beers for years.  Don't make the same mistake I did.  I Yelper plead with you!  I also learned two things I've been missing in pizza, too.  I've passed this place dozens of times.  It sits on the fringe of a west Austin neighborhood and several apartments/condos between them and 183.  I believe it is affiliated with a restaurant that has a place in Fort Worth, too, but I might be wrong.  What I'm sure of my first visit there was killer!  I'm planning on going back when I can eat and drink a whole day away!  They have a great outdoor area with plenty of umbrellas and we chose a table.  The server acknowledged us right away.  We QR'd the menu and by the time we'd made a choice of food our beers were on the table and cold (good pour on the Guinness, btw).    We ordered a pizza of our own:  Sausage, mushroom, green peppers and spicy marinara sauce.  Okay, first... You know how some chain pizzas you have the ingredients all coming off together leaving you with less than even a cheese pizza?  Not here.  Every thing is chopped into small pieces and spread evenly over the entire pizza.  Every bite comes with a mouthful of exactly what you ordered.  Second, put some of that marinara on a piece of canvas and I'd eat it.  The spices brought everything together.  We got wings too.  Golden Buffalo.  Perfect heat! Crispy.  Meaty. Those wings were gone so fast I was looking at other tables to see if someone had snatch a couple off our plate LOL  We were licking the hot sauce off the plate.  I'M DOUBLING THE ORDER NEXT TIME!  Great service, cool vibe, good food!  Did I get lucky or find bar food Nirvana?  I dunno.  I'm going to rock a five star and adjust as I need to, but I'm not going to deprive myself of another visit here for sure!!

reviews.author: Russell B.
reviews.description: Still absolutely wonderful after all these years! They remember our order and pay good attention to our table. Will be back soon and often.

reviews.author: Steffie S.
reviews.description: Fun Neighborhood joint.  This feels like a place where you'd walk in and they'd say, "Norm!"...if that were your name and you were on an episode of Cheers.  The beer was deliciously cold served in a thick glass to keep it that way. The pizza was generously embellished with toppings, and the crust was above average. The service was timely and courteous. I really liked the outdoor patio. Part of it is covered with fans, and part was uncovered with tables with umbrellas. The only drawback is there's a lot of road noise. We sat at a table as far away from the road as possible, and it was acceptable noise-wise. When our world health situation is better, I hope to see all the tables filled with large groups of friends enjoying pints and pizzas. For now, come check it out with your close friends and/or significant other.

reviews.author: Cristian S.
reviews.description: Excellent beer ! Excellent pizza ! Very rich crust ! I loved this place! I'll be back soon !

reviews.author: Krystal M.
reviews.description: I'm a pizza fanatic! Pizza is one of the best simple yet so tasty. Went on a Friday early evening busy but service was  good and manager came out to help his servers and cleared tables. Kid friendly and pets welcomed would definitely recommended

reviews.author: Kerra S.
reviews.description: I really enjoyed this place. It was way more laid back then I expected (place is always popping outside!!) which was great, I'm not for the "pay twice what it's worth because we are fancy pants".  Everything was very reasonably priced, and freaking delicious! We tried a few of the drinks (I tried a few of the beers) and it's safe to say I left tipsy and happy! Can't wait to visit this place again and try some new pizzas and beer!

reviews.author: Andrew S.
reviews.description: Great waitress service initially. Drinks served very fast. Good pizza and tasty fried pickles. Would have been a 5 star review until the douchebag black dude in the red hat that works there ushered us out very rudely since they needed our table even though the back dining room was basically empty. Will never go back

reviews.author: Jana N.
reviews.description: I hope they open earlier again soon. I miss going there at 1 or 2 after work.   The parking lot area on the right is awful. So park in the back for you don't get hit.

reviews.author: Amy G.
reviews.description: My friends like this place, but I don't see the draw. The pizza is mediocre. Fortunately tonight I discovered their sandwiches are good. I got the Pourboy, with Fries. Everyone else in our group who wanted food ended up being in a sandwich mood, so the Chicken Parm sandwich got good reviews from two of the guys. The fries were well-seasoned and looked promising, but were a little cold and soft. Other times I liked the Fried Pickle Chips, but could only eat a few pieces before they got overpowering. It's not like we'd eat that many pickles out of the jar in one sitting! I think the server mixed up my friend's beer order. The final blow to this spot is that their outdoor chairs are wildly uncomfortable. I even brought my own seat cushion the last few times I came! This time it saved my butt, but my back still hurts. I'd give Pour House a 3.5 but I'm in a generous mood so I'm rounding up.

reviews.author: Darrel R.
reviews.description: Been monitoring the website to see when this place is open, and I STILL have not seen this place close down for even a day while clearly rat infested. Clearly haven't taken any time to fix their rat problem. Will not be coming back until I see an exterminator outside.

reviews.author: Chris M.
reviews.description: Knowledgeable staff. Friendly staff.  Rotating taps. Great food.  What's not to like.  Comfortable patio.

reviews.author: Mickey W.
reviews.description: Visiting from Seattle and went here with my son this week.  We both ordered pizza which was excellent. Tasty crust on the pie and toppings were top notch.  Tried their "West Coast" IPA, not to hoppy but well balanced.  I'll be back!!

reviews.author: Loren B.
reviews.description: At first glance, the interior of Pour House looked a little un-maintained. But, then of course, Austin. Where everything is underground. I was excited about the local beer list, though the stout selection was a bit thin. I went with Redhorn, a coffee stout that was a little short on stoutness for me. But, the flavor was good.  We ordered three 8" pizzas to share: El Supremo, Hawaiian, and a Veggie pizza, providing plenty for two adults and two children. The pizza was quite good, as in Austin-good. I couldn't put my finger on it, but there was something unique about the flavor.    Our server was very good, personable and informative. We ate a late lunch, during which a growing number of what appeared to be regulars gathered mostly around the bar. The location is a bit secluded from the rest of Austin. But, it's near the technology district, where I was working for the day.  Parking was a little confusing because we approached the building from a side where the entrance wasn't visible. It's a private parking lot with plenty of space. Outdoor seating is available. Highly recommended!

reviews.author: Karan P.
reviews.description: Pour house is a pleasant open patio brewery serving delectable pies and the best garlic bread in Austin! I prefer an afternoon visit to enjoy the sun on the patio. The garlic bread has a nice char and is brimming with heavenly garlic flavour!

reviews.author: Pax S.
reviews.description: Wow, what a comeback from Corona this place has had. I've never been happier to see the wait staff and bartenders (especially Justin) return to their jobs. They're really into sanitizing every space that has been used and I've never had a vegan pizza like The Spock. Couldn't be happier with this place's redemption. Come support them, especially at the beginning of the week!

reviews.author: Marcus R.
reviews.description: This was the first trying out this place. My guys from work and I were in training this week so we thought about trying it out. The environment was chill and not too busy during lunch time so that was a plus for us because we needed to be back for training within the hour.  Three of us ordered the Cubano and it was so tasty! I definitely enjoyed the pickles and pork amongst other fine ingredients they packed on that pizza! One of guys ordered the regular pepperoni pizza and he said he liked it a lot. The crust and dough of the pizza was cooked perfectly thoroughly.  There salads were delicious and portioned perfectly. When you arrive the parking is all in the back area pretty much, and you enter through the patio area. They have signs for you and that guide you to entrance.

reviews.author: Raquel C.
reviews.description: Love getting a pizza from here while enjoying some craft beer at Celis. You do have to order thru the app, you can't just walk up and order. I've had a few different pizzas from them, and they are all good. Definitely one of my go to's.

reviews.author: Virginia R.
reviews.description: We really wanted to like this place... we live really close by. I didn't want to make dinner and my husband suggested that we try BackDraft.  It took over an hour to get our order. The brewery was having trivia night so maybe they were swamped with orders? Regardless, while the food tasted great, the portions (pizza and pizza rolls) were pricey for what we got. Paid over $50 for dinner (one salad, one small pizza, 3 very small pizza rolls and one dessert.)

reviews.author: Jake H.
reviews.description: BackDraft Pizzeria would have gotten 5 stars for the flavors of the pizza and pizza rolls but the timing was so slow, it left me wondering if I was just starving when the pizza was finally ready. They were so busy that they ran out of cheese and took about 40 minutes to prep the ingredients. I did enjoy the dough and the selections of pizza.

reviews.author: Thomas O.
reviews.description: On a slow afternoon trying to use their app. Asked the guy if he could help and he is every kind of rude. Place the order wait 40 minutes. No text so I go check and get snapped at. At 1 hour I go back to tell him to forget it. OH its ready now. All I ordered was pizza rolls. They were burned on the outside and cold in the middle. Terrible just terrible.

reviews.author: Greg H.
reviews.description: Terrific pizza, but painful service.  BackDraft Pizza is wonderful pizza.  But, ordering it, customizing it, and paying for it is a pure pain in the ass.   I've gotten their pizza on at least three or four times over the past year.  And each time, the ordering process is a bad joke.    For example, last night, with a windchill of about 20 degrees, I stood in the ordering window for roughly 10 minutes, because the ordering app would not work.   After entering my debit card info including cell number and email address, there was no "submit" button on the app.  I handed my phone to the clerk and asked him to show me where to click it.    After getting my phone, he squinted at the screen, stating he didn't have his glasses, and couldn't read it.   We fumble with the app for another five minutes, with no success.  Meanwhile, I'm freezing my ass off.   Finally, after almost 15 minutes, the guy grabs the iPad, takes my card and enters the order manually, and then has to re-insert my debit card. Once they finally get the order, I ask how long it will be.  "About 20 minutes" he answers.  I look at my watch and it's 7:15.   At 7:40, 25 minutes later, I had not gotten a text yet.  Since I had waited more than 25 minutes, I went out to check on it.    I figured they'd have it ready by then.   Oh no!  It'd be another 5 minutes.  This was like the Seinfeld episode at the Chinese Restaurant.  "Another 5 minutes."  I had to duck around the corner, to get out of the wind.  I had left my coat inside, as they had led me to expect the pie to be ready.   These as**holes  kept me waiting another 15 minutes, before they finally delivered the pizza, about 40 minutes after I first ordered it.  I thought I would freeze to death before they handed over the pizza.   It was terrific, as usual, but I won't be subjecting myself this type of suffering, because the Company can't get its app to work--and then subjects the customer to a consistent routine of misery, just to order one of their pizzas.  It's great pizza, but definitely NOT worth the labor required to simply ORDER ONE ONLINE.  The pandemic's nearly over. Perhaps it's time to junk the app, and TRAIN THEIR STAFF HOW ACCEPT ORDERS MANUALLY.

reviews.author: Olivia H.
reviews.description: BackDraft keeps switching up their home on us, but we will follow them all over Metric. Our favorites are the Shrooms to the Moon (Mushrooms, Caramelized Onions, Sausage) and the Backdraft (Sausage, Pepperoni, Jalapeos) pizzas.   They are the perfect accompaniment to a pint of draft beer from whichever brewery is housing them at the moment. But if you're looking to just bring their pizza home, you can also order online ahead of time to skip that 20 min wait on site.

reviews.author: Ashlynd B.
reviews.description: The food itself was really good. My only gripe is that the photo for the pizza rolls shows 6 of them, and there's nothing in the description to tell you otherwise, but you only get 3. I was quite disappointed to pay almost $8 for 3 pizza rolls.

reviews.author: Marcia L.
reviews.description: This is the 3rd time they canceled!!!!! Horrible service. Don't act like you're taking orders when you can't! Total BS!!!! I will never again try here.

reviews.author: Justin H.
reviews.description: Ordered a few pizzas over the weekend, and thoroughly enjoyed them!  If you like pizzas that are lighter and refreshing, then this is a place to try. My favorites were the Twisted Rita and Sweet Sow. The Shrooms to the Moon had some good umami to it -- it's the most flavorful, but a bit heavier than the first two. Also -- if you like pizza rolls, then I would definitely try the Rollin' Ronies.  I will definitely be ordering these again in the near future.  Note about ordering: I ordered online and picked up the food. I will say, however, that the order was not ready by the estimated time. Instead, you can wait for a text notification to pick up the order. I didn't know that, but now I do!

reviews.author: Abby T.
reviews.description: The pizza and garlic bread was good but they didn't deliver my dessert. More sauce is needed but overall, ok

reviews.author: Sam G.
reviews.description: I ordered using Yelp grub hub for my very first time , apparently they never got my the order. I went to them and made me pizza  on the spot I ordered around 6:30 finally getting my pizza at 9:16 and had to pick it up myself  tried to cancel my order and they never picked up the phone . I dnt know where there was a disconnect but it needs to be fixed . Delivery was trash but also no communication with the customers.

reviews.author: Joe I.
reviews.description: I know this review will never make it on the board. The pizza was average at best with no significant flavors, crust or sauce components.  Maybe I have Covid (been vaccinated), but can't agree with all the great reviews about this place.

reviews.author: Olivia V.
reviews.description: Looking at recent Yelp reviews, I was nervous about how this place would turn out. BackDraft did NOT disappoint.   First off, where is it? There is conflicting info on Yelp and their website. I called ahead because going to the wrong pickup spot would turn me into a hangry rage. They did not answer the phone but the host breweries did. CONFIRMED: They are currently located at Celis brewery.   We ordered 2 pizzas for pickup on Grubhub on a Friday night. BackDraft and pepperoni. They were ready in about 30 minutes. CONFIRMED: The pizzas were AMAZING. Like... hands down some of the best pizza I've ever had. Their homemade sausage and humongous thin pepperoni slices were phenomenal.  I can't speak for anyone else's experiences recently. It sounds like delivery may be questionable? But as of April 2021, if you can drive to pick up a pie, this is the place you need to go.

reviews.author: Rob R.
reviews.description: Really nice Naples style pizza with quality mozzarella. Nice crust and supplied parmesan and red pepper. Cute lil baby in the truck.

reviews.author: Christian C.
reviews.description: Oh man.  The pizza here is fire.    It's located right in front of 4th Tap Brewing Co-Op  which is a perfect pair.  We ordered their signature pizza, The Backdraft.  It's topped with House Made Spicy Sausage, Pepperoni, Fresh Jalapeos, but we also added mushrooms on ours.  It's a thin crust style pizza that is PACKED with flavor.  Our buddy ordered the Kale Yeah Caesar salad which he was very pleased with.  The guys that run this truck are really cool and definitely dedicated to their craft.  Backdraft Pizzeria is definitely up there on the short list of Austin's best pizza.  I'd be surprised if they didn't branch out and open up another location in the near future, especially in the downtown Austin area.  I would highly recommend giving them a visit and try their food.  How can you say no to a fantastic pizza and a frothy craft beer to go with it?

reviews.author: Britt C.
reviews.description: Had a craving for "real" pizza and BackDraft was in the top 3 when I did a search but it was the great reviews and photos that sealed the deal. We quickly ordered the Backdraft pizza, a pepperoni pizza, and wings. The order was delivered contactless and on time, hot and ready to eat. We've lived in Austin for almost 2 years and I've been disappointed by all the Austin favorite pizza spots but my days of yearning for good pizza are DONE. My husband and I are both now completely obsessed with Backdraft and I'm sure will be ordering it again very, very soon.

reviews.author: Danny H.
reviews.description: I ordered on Yelp App to delivery.  2 pizza and a salad, but I just got 2 pizza. where is the salad.  I called to the restaurant but didn't answer.

reviews.author: Brooke B.
reviews.description: I'm a sucker for a good cheese pizza, and this place has it. I was super impressed by the dough, tangy sauce, and the perfect amount of cheese. I do wish there were a few more options to kick off the meal but hey, when I'm craving cheese pizza, this is the only place to curve that craving.

reviews.author: Michael B.
reviews.description: TLDR: BackDraft is back, and they're better than ev-VAH!  I'm a longtime fan of BackDraft, even once calling it 'the best pizza you can get off a truck'.  That's damning with faint praise, as this is some of the best pizza in all of Austin.    Back when I first tried them, the food truck was parked down on 360 near Bee Cave.  But now that both I and they have moved to the north quadrant of Austin, and they're attached to an excellent brewery to boot!  By far, my favorite is a slightly altered 'Shrooms to the Moon', which is a triple-whammy combo of homemade spicy sausage, mushrooms, and carmelized onion. If you look at the picture, you'll see that the crust has the  right amount of 'char' or 'leoparding' as some call it.   Whoever's doing the pizza-slinging at BackDraft knows their stuff. Get down here when they're open, grab a brewski, and you're in for one of the best lunch combos that Austin can serve up!  Some Tips:  1) I said 'best lunch', but be sure to check their hours before you come. I'm pretty sure they just do lunch Friday and Saturday.  Otherwise, they follow brewery peak hours and just do evenings.  2) Try the Shrooms to the Moon but ask them to hold the caramelized onions.  Without the onions, you get a spicier, hotter pizza which goes perfectly with a pale ale beer to wash it down.  You'll end up with a pizza-nirvana feeling of a warm glow in your tummy.  This place scores a 5 out of 5 on the 'CTJ Scale', as noted below.  5 out of 5 stars: Come-to-Jesus good. Would be OK passing away after finishing a plate here. 4 out of 5 stars: Come-to-Mary good. Would be OK being seen eating here by Mother Mary. 3 out of 5 stars: Come-to-Joseph good. Would be OK having a beer here with Jesus' Dad. 2 out of 5 stars: Come-to-the-Apostles good. Meh. Wouldn't have my last supper here. 1 out of 5 stars: Come-to-Nobody good. I wouldn't have my penultimate supper here, either.

reviews.author: Jeannie L.
reviews.description: At noon on a Friday, it only took 13 minutes to get my food. I got pizza and wings to go. This is one of the best pizzas I have had in Austin so far. The crust was very thin and had a good crunch to it. The sauce for the wings had a slight sweetness and wasn't too hot. I also appreciate that they put the buffalo sauce for my wings on the side, so that they wouldn't get soggy before I got home.

name: Sidecar Tasting Room
accommodations: Best nights on Friday, Saturday, Sunday

reviews.author: Melissa C.
reviews.description: Went today with friends. Had the red wine flight...rose', montepulciano and the Tempranillo...liked them all but not enough to buy.  Had the meat and cheese plate...yum.   Ann (sommelier) was sweet and knowledgeable.  Flagship winery is Big Springs winery (which we visited today as well)   BUY LOCAL  SUPPORT LOCAL

reviews.author: Mark R.
reviews.description: Had a great time at Sidecar. Stopped in for lunch and a flight of wines as our first stop in Dripping and really enjoyed the setup. Lunch is from a food truck (trailer) on site. My group tasted reds and whites and all were very tasty. Food was good - had burgers and they were good quality. Setup was nice with covered tables outdoors or an indoor option. I didn't check out the brewery onsite but did see some guys partaking in the brews. I would not hesitate to return.

reviews.author: Cory Jo M.
reviews.description: Super cool environment and beautiful decor! The vibe here was awesome! The wine was okay. I like sweet wine and the wine flight was dry so I didn't enjoy it like a wished I would've.

reviews.author: Lacy B.
reviews.description: This place is so cute!!! Amazing service. Delicious empanadas. Love the ros! We sat outside under the oak trees and enjoyed the scenery. Perfect first stop of our bachelorette weekend!

reviews.author: Tiffany Y.
reviews.description: Visiting from California and we wanted to go wine tasting and this was a winery nearby so we decided to give it a try. No regrets! Anne was very welcoming and friendly. She also gave us information on other wineries/breweries/distilleries to try. I had the $15 flight of reds and she also gave me an extra cup of red wine, Needy B*tch, I ended up buying a bottle! I finally found a great bottle of red that I actually enjoy, sad that I can't get it shipped to me in California. Drippin' Sweet is also great, bought a bottle as well. Love the descriptions given to the wines it made them sound all delicious. And they were! (According to all the ones I tried).

reviews.author: Jules A.
reviews.description: This little place is amazing!! A very welcoming and clean environment and have a nice selection of wines. Also the cheese and meat platter is so good!!  We stopped by on our way to Dallas. You definitely have to check it out!

reviews.author: Tracy M.
reviews.description: Great little place to go taste and snack! We had a flight of the white and red and they were great. We had one of each of the empanadas and all three were so good! I'm not sure where they get those things but they are amazing. My favorite was the bbq one. They also have games you can play. Would be a good place for a date!

reviews.author: Jeanette D.
reviews.description: Pretty good wine tasting. We did the red wine tasting. My favorite wine was the Tranquillo wine. $15 for 3 wines which is a little weak for wine tasting but the cool ambience made the trip worth it and the portions weren't weak.

reviews.author: Briana N.
reviews.description: Talk about southern hospitality. So we came here from a airbnb in dripping springs. It was a little far for an Uber to pick us up, but we got one. So we are there enjoying wine glasses, wine flights, food, the atmosphere. Everything about this place is so cute and amazing. But trying to get an Uber home seemed unlikely. Everyone kept cancelling on us and the bartender Ann or Annie (plus the last two customers) kept telling us that we were not gonna walk the 2 miles home. Annie made sure that we stayed till she closed and literally DROVE US BACK TO THE AIR BNB!!!. She was the sweetest thing and didn't even want to take any money from us. We had a back and forth of take it, no keep it, take it!! Haha I'm 80% sure I got the money in her cupholder before I left but I was the tipsy one so who knows haha. I really hope I did because driving us back to our Airbnb was above and beyond.

reviews.author: Mallory Y.
reviews.description: Absolutely great place to stop by if you are in the Dripping Springs area. The service was top-notch and the decor is really eclectic! They have wine flight options or you can enjoy a glass if you chose. The server was incredibly knowledgeable and had great recommendations for everyone in our group. She let us try what we wanted before committing to our drink of choice. I ended up going to wine cocktail called the Texas Kiri and it fresh rosemary in it which I though was a nice touch! They also have live music outside and plenty of areas to sit and enjoy listening to it. Definitely try this place out!

reviews.author: Jenni S.
reviews.description: Super cute little place in drippings springs, but I wasn't a huge fan of the wine. Sad, because I really wanted to love it. Maybe next years harvest will be better!

reviews.author: Tanna L.
