reviews.description: My friend and I were looking for a bar to hang out at. We came across Sidecar. Everyone is so friendly and enjoy the time we spent here.

reviews.author: Steven A.
reviews.description: Great experience for a weekend visit by friends from out of town. They had a great selection of delicious wines as well as live indie folk music. Will definitely come back and would recommend!

reviews.author: Jesse M.
reviews.description: Being in the Industry, it was a pleasant surprise to visit the Sidecar Tasting Room! Claire was an awesome Host, knowledgeable about the wines, and gave great info on recommendations. Clean and tasteful Wine Bar and I enjoyed the Red Flight! Took a few bottles home to enjoy!

reviews.author: Marilyn M.
reviews.description: Great ambiance, really good wines! We did the tasting and bought a bottle to take home! Hide gem in Dripping Springs!

reviews.author: Jennifer E.
reviews.description: We were in town for another winery quarterly wine pick up party.  That winery no longer allows you to open your bottles of wine at the party or allow dogs.  As such, it wasn't a great day.  We decided to go some place else.  We showed up around 4pm on a Sunday and had the entire place to ourselves. It is so cute.  I love the decorations and the vibe. We did the wine tasting which is $7 or waved if you buy a bottle of wine.  Megan was wonderful.  She was full of information and funny.  We had such a wonderful time we decided to join Bell Springs wine club.  Three bottles a quarter. No sign up fee. They have a wine pick up party that allows you to bring your dogs.  20% discount the first year and the discount increases every year you are a member.  Free wine tasting for you and four people either at Side Car or the winery itself. You also get to pick which three bottles you want. We signed up on the spot. What is NOT to like! We enjoyed many of their wines but really it was Megan.  She made us feel so welcomed and was so friendly.  Bell Spring treat her right, she is a HUGE asset to you.  We can't wait to attend our first wine pick up party.  Hope to make it to first Thursday soon and hang out at the Side Car.  If we lived in Dripping Springs this would be a weekly stop for us.  What a great place in this sleepy town.  We are so glad to part of their wine club and excited for the many cool events moving forward.  This should be a place to stop if you are in Dripping Springs.

reviews.author: Paige M.
reviews.description: LOVED the atmosphere! Such a cute place and great dry whites. The girl working there had a wonderful personality.  She was so easy to talk to and very knowledgeable. If I'm just hanging out, looking for a nice place to chill with a glass, this will be it!

reviews.author: Aaron M.
reviews.description: Great atmosphere and wonderful selection of wines. Don't let the road it's one stop you from enjoying this spot.

reviews.author: Peter V.
reviews.description: This place has a great selection and wonderful staff. Claire (taller with blonde hair) is absolutely fabulous. She really gets to know the clients. Also very knowledgeable. I recommend the Needy Bitch red wine.

reviews.author: Claire P.
reviews.description: This was the perfect stop off while driving through. They had good wine, good service and great ambiance. We would definitely recommend to anyone driving through Dripping Springs.

name: Whip In
accommodations: Best nights on Thursday, Friday, Saturday

reviews.author: Marsha M.
reviews.description: Dear Lort, why was it so cold during my visit to Austin when I stopped into Whip In? On an average sweltering Austin day/night I can imagine Whip In being the essential local spot for a quick beer or 5. With a great selection of beers on tap, along with extensive coolers for carry out, this place seems just great.  Apparently they have food too? Whip In should be the norm for corner stores/bars everywhere. Kudos fellas

reviews.author: Jeremy D.
reviews.description: Are you hungry and upset leaving empty-handed after waiting 45 minutes? "Oh well" will essentially be the response.  Ordered/paid for pick-up. No food or even an acknowledgement really of something gone wrong.  I think it's a management issue - just a waitress and cook were there to shrug and say maybe someone else took it.  Mistakes happen, but the lack of reaction leaves me baffled i.e. offer empathy or refund or comp...  Sorry, but y'all lost a neighborhood regular!

reviews.author: Sarah C.
reviews.description: I ordered a to-go meal tonight via Postmates, and when I went to pick it up, I was met with extremely rude and disrespectful behavior by one of the bartenders. Upon arrival, I asked where I needed to pick up my food, and I was pointed to a shelf. The bag had my first and middle initial, but not my last name and was labeled UberEats. I asked them to find my order. With some back and forth, it was determined that my order had been mislabeled. Mistakes happen, and I understand that. As I'm trying to sort this out with a female bartender and a cook, the other bartender, a tall burly man with a beard, a Marlboro hat and a camouflage shirt rudely shoved the bag of food at me, cutting me off, and said, "this is yours" and turned around and walked off.   I supported this business at the beginning of COVID by shopping in their makeshift grocery store, and even buying t-shirts. I only recently acquired a taste for Indian food, so I was excited to try it tonight. I will never be back. I was also told they don't have a manager around, nobody is in charge, and as I searched online for a way to contact anybody running this place, I came up empty.

reviews.author: Mark M.
reviews.description: This is a unique locally grown spot that is worth a visit in South Austin. Prior to the pandemic a popular spot to catch bands on the outdoor stage, not too sure about the music situation right now. The Whip In is a corner beverage depot with a quality selection of craft wine and beer. If I may add, a very quality selection of wine and beer. If you want to expand your palette and try  a new craft beer or wine, def stop in. Very large selection of chilled rose, which I found impressive. The selection of beers by the glass is also impressive. This is a very cool spot to come in and meet friends, and grab a pint. The Whip In is also an Indian restaurant. The quality of the food is not a 5, but a 4. If you are looking for great Indian food there are better options, but the overall experience here and what it offers is above average and worth a visit.

reviews.author: Isobel B.
reviews.description: Lowkey but super yummy. It's a really chill place to talk and catch up with people while having amazing Gujarati food. I got the lamb biryani and lamb samosa and would highly recommend.

reviews.author: Rishi K.
reviews.description: Quality of food is progressively becoming bad.  Last night the garlic naans were cold and dry.  It seemed they reheated it to serve.  Curries were cold too. Bit disappointed.

reviews.author: Michelle C.
reviews.description: Great selection of local and international beer and wine. The food is fresh, and consistently meets expectations. It's a great environment.

reviews.author: Hope F.
reviews.description: Really disappointing tonight at the Whip In. I think it was an off night? First off, the draught board which is usually full up to 70+ was very scarce, so not sure what was going on there.  We ordered the chicken vindaloo and chicken shawarma. I was confused when our food came out for 2 reasons: 1) I wasn't expecting a wrap and fries for the shawarma- just was expecting rice since the menu didn't describe it as a wrap, but whatever - my bad 2) it came in takeout containers with only one set of silverware (plastic)  I went back inside to ask for another set and also asked if why (out of curiosity) the presentation had changed to takeout containers. I was told "it's a covid thing". I tried to explain nicely that I understood - but have only been in Austin since covid and have come every week or so since January, always with plates etc. She repeated, seeming annoyed with the question, that it was a covid thing, shoved me two mini plates and some silverware and walked away. Ok, cool!   I'm only giving a 3 because I have been here 6-7 times, always with a great experience. Tonight was a 1 star for service, but honestly food was below par as well. Leaving a sad customer :(

reviews.author: Jessica L.
reviews.description: Love love love whip in!! I always get the nachos...they're the best nachos in ATX!!! Also love the beer selection!!! Whip in   isn't like a fancy place, it's more chill atmosphere.

reviews.author: Heather H.
reviews.description: Man I used to love this place. But ever since the new owners came in, fired the management staff, TOOK TIPS FROM PEOPLE THAT EARNED THEM, and the outstanding amount of disrespect I see to their employees- I'm never coming here again. Or the Quickie Pickie because they own that too. And they treat those employees horribly as well. I can't believe the things I have seen and heard the owners say!! Cannot support this, and I plead to everyone else to do the same.

reviews.author: Candice L.
reviews.description: What's not to love sbout a convenience store/taproom/indian restsurant/package store? Efficient and friendly service. Indoor and outdoor seating. Nice, clean restrooms (a very pleasant surprise). Easy parking. Convenient location. It has everything. The food is genuinely good whether you're getting standard bar fare or the tasty Indian specialties. We hope to return when a band plays on stage, but we had the best relaxed lunch on the covered patio on our way out of town. Who knew you could find a little calm oasis so close to the interstate? It's quirky and perfect.

reviews.author: Matt C.
reviews.description: Beers on tap for days, weeks, months, years even! Amazing little spot totally worth taking a break from I35 or the snowpocalypse or COVID or whatever!

reviews.author: Neil O.
reviews.description: This might be one of the hardest reviews I've ever made. I have come to the Whip In for years (I still remember playing a show here when I was a kid in my father's band and having one of best and most interesting Indian fusion chicken fried steaks of my life) and always appreciated (and still do) what they're doing. But the prices are just getting too damn high.        As of the past week, every single beer on tap has risen by a price of roughly $3 on average; essentially the base price for any beer on tap STARTS at $8, and without a doubt that's the highest I've seen at any establisbment in Austin, and I have been to an uncountable number. I also had their $12.99 Kurma (also known as Korma in some resturaunts) and it was good, but more like a $8.99 Korma at Tejis as fas as quantity and depth of flavor goes.        Make no mistake, this is an indesputed historic establishment that's likely also struggling with COVID and I'll still support it, but seeing these changes is just disheartening and it's getting harder and harder for me to justify still stopping in on the weekend.

reviews.author: Caroline G.
reviews.description: Really disappointed. I've come to the Whip In each time I've traveled through Austin for years, and always loved it for its ambiance and food. Most everything has changed. When I asked about NA beer options for my partner I got a curt "No" and the server left. The layout is much less cozy than it used to be, and sadly, I won't be going back.

reviews.author: Andrew V.
reviews.description: Whip-In, what happened? I've lived down the street from this place for a year and have come at least once a week. It has steadily declined. Constant staff turnover, and the menu and beer selection has shrunk to basically half of what it was.   The food in particular is a shadow of what it used to be. Tonight, after finding out they didn't have any of the specials on the board, we ordered chips and queso and after bringing us one order, they brought us a second mistakenly? Both had stale chips and the queso was burnt. I asked for no cilantro in my dish due to an allergy and it was absolutely lousy with it. Tried to drown my sorrows with a beer and was served the wrong one.   Honestly, not sure what changed but this place isn't what it used to be. Hopefully it's just an off night, but I've thought that several times in the past few months and it's only become worse.

reviews.author: JR L.
reviews.description: Went here for a work meeting and I truly enjoyed the environment. Pretty relaxed and helpful bartenders and servers. It has a decent selection of both food and beer. I ordered a chicken tikka masala curry along with two beers - Belgian ale and a wheat. The CTM was a decent size and quality for the $12 tag. I'll definitely come back again to relax with friends and my doggo in the future. I thought the fridges in the back full of beer was pretty cool.  TLDR - decent food and draft beer selection - bunch of freezers with lots of beers and shelves of wines - cool music - had one TV inside from what I could see

reviews.author: Candace A.
reviews.description: I love this place.  From the outside you would have no idea how great this place really... dare I even call it COOL?! The beer selection for purchase might be my favorite in town that I have found so far. They carry my two favorite breweries which aren't found many places and then have a multitude of beers on tap, too! I love the tarot card feel at each of the booths and then the perfect little patio outside.  Dog friendly, live music when the world is allowed to sing again, and Indian food? You would never know.... we brought some friends here recently and quite honestly... this might be my new little "let me take you to a local spot we love....." for our guests. Go. Have a beer. Buy some to take home.... and definitely get some garlic naan.

reviews.author: Marcus M.
reviews.description: They have a really great selection of wine and beer as well as both on tap. I got the Chicken 65 which was really delicious. Will definitely be back.

reviews.author: Dmitri J.
reviews.description: I'm so pleased the Whip in is here to stay! They have a multitude of beverage and menu options. I got one of the curry's and it was exquisite. They also cater to many different diets. The staff is friendly and location is beautiful. If you haven't been in a while they remodeled the indoor area which is super conducive to COVID-19 distancing. The patio is covered and a great place to grab a drink and a bite. 10 of 10 stars.

reviews.author: Ryan R.
reviews.description: Great place to pick up some mainstream as well as your out there beers. This place has a little bit of everything, from beers to ciders, wines, and even serving beer on draft as well. They also have a nice little courtyard on the side which looks fairly pleasant. Overall definitely enough beers in stock to keep you busy, only thing I've noticed is that their price point is a little higher than say Specs by $1-2 on various beers.

reviews.author: Crystal M.
reviews.description: This place is a gem in dripping Springs. We definitely need more places like this!  You walk into a beautiful large spacious entrance where all of their vodka is on display. In the mornings they have a build your own bloody Mary bar which is definitely where I'll be camping out. The other drink we tried is one of their slushy's, the hurricane. Don't be fooled... These are doubles and they sneak up on you fast! The sugar to alcohol ratio is on point.  For the pregnant and nursing ladies there's three different mocktails, and friendly bartenders that are willing to put together anything your heart desires. The food menu is great! A little bit for everyone. Salads, soups, even a box for kiddos. Outside is beautiful spacious and open all of the live oak trees are immaculate and the space is well laid out.  They have one small play place for kids, lots of yard games and lots of different areas to sit and hang out. Including a turf area. This place is definitely want to come see!!!

reviews.author: Brooke S.
reviews.description: We had such a great tour experience Saturday! We have loved Dripping Springs Vodka, and Gin since we moved to Texas. The clean, pure taste is better than Tito's and we will miss having this when we move soon. The tour was great, and informative. Our tour guide was nice. I wanted to ask him to take our group picture, but in the hour we had our tour, he rubbed his nose, scratch his nose, and touched his nose every few seconds. It was gross. So we didn't get a single picture bc I couldn't ask him to hold my phone! Other than that, the tour was great!!!!!  I rarely leave a review, but this would change someone's mind on whether they would ever come back somewhere these days. I love this company too much not to help them change it!

reviews.author: Lorel H.
reviews.description: I cannot believe that we had never been here before. We go to deep eddy's every time and have never looked up any other distilleries in the area but I'm so glad we did this time. The property itself is gorgeous and it is coupled by the fact that there liquor is also very good. Ryan had the flight and had their 2 bourbons which he said were okay and then he had the traditional gin which we really liked. They have their cocktails on tap and I got the Raz N Shine cocktail which was made with their orange vodka and was absolutely delicious. We ended up getting another flight of the rest of their liquors after that, and I'm so glad we did because their straight vodka is so good. It's so smooth you could drink it straight. We will definitely be back next time we are down!

reviews.author: Clay R.
reviews.description: Great time touring the distillery, great to taste spirits that are only found at the distillery as well,  awesome facility and team all around

reviews.author: Ernest C.
reviews.description: Made the trip as a pre-anniversary celebration and it did not disappoint. Enjoyed the venue, the drinks and the service provided by the entire staff. Will definitely be coming back.

reviews.author: Priscilla E.
reviews.description: They were accommodating, kind, and entertaining to our last minute (day of) request to do the tour. The tour and tasting was well priced and included a souvenir shot glass! We enjoyed lunch and drinks after the tasting and tour. The food was delicious, the staff was friendly, the drinks were tasty, and the atmosphere was buzzing.

reviews.author: Robert M.
reviews.description: Dripping Springs Distilling is just now opening its spanking new tasting room, patios, entertainment venue and production facility, and it is splendid. I went there four years ago, when the tasting room was essentially the lobby to the distillery. While I great.y appreciated what they were doing with their gins and vodkas, the ambience was like drinking in the lobby of Atscott manufacturing in Pine City, Minnesota. This new facility reshuffles the entire deck.  It has taken them a while to complete, but it was worth it. The new venue is spectacular -- well designed, comfortably modern, spacious and welcoming. It's not only a tasting room, it's also a credible restaurant with an interesting menu, specials, and a exceptionally friendly staff.  We went on the second weekend of the 'soft 'opening', but they seemed to have already worked all the kinks out. They were welcoming and prompt and attentive. Our server, Jack, went out of his way to answer questions, including about plantings on the grounds and ingredients in the dishes, and to offer suggestions about cocktails.   I had the street taco daily special and an Electric Lady cocktail. My companion had the jalapeo cornbread muffins and a French 75. The street tacos were small but fully packed. The spice mix could have been spicier,  it then I like hot. The flavors though were indeed special. Nothing dominated, so you could appreciate the protein and still enjoy the comity cheese and the light drizzle of sour cream. The tortillas were a bit small, but you expect that in a street taco. My friends jalapeo corn muffins were excellent. A well constructed corn muffin with one slice of jalapeo that came up and kicked your butt on the after palate. There were plenty of them, so we took lots home for later. The regular entre menu is interesting enough (two different pot pies, additional comfort type foods) that I'll be back.  I should not forget the flight of spirits. I've always respected their two gins, and I often buy them as they are available at Twin and Specs. Very solid, unpretentious and well crafted. I'm not a vodka guy, but my friend liked their offerings. Their 1876 bourbon still needs some maturation and work though. But such is the case with whiskey.   The full grand opening is coming up, with all the hoopla expected. Once the noise is past, Dripping Springs Distilling, with its multiple brands and spirits, will be a destination you'll want to add to the itinerary.

reviews.author: Glenn C.
reviews.description: Had a great tour and excellent spirits tasting. Very informative and lots of fun. Love Dripping Springs vodka and highly recommend lime and jalapeo mixer!!  Makes a great cocktail.

reviews.author: Corey W.
reviews.description: This place is amazing. The food, drinks, service, landscaping, and all the above we nothing short of awesome. If you're in the area and are looking for a good distillery to visit, then I highly recommend this place.

reviews.author: Mark S.
reviews.description: Only go here if you like amazing food, drinks and people!  Otherwise this place isn't for you. Only ask: later hours on Fridays!

reviews.author: Teresa G.
reviews.description: Amazing distillery in Dripping Springs! While there, you can take a tour, have an extensive tasting, order cocktails and food, and explore various indoor and outdoor areas. Great spot to spend a few hours.

reviews.author: Marya B.
reviews.description: This was a fun afternoon outing for us.  We had tasted the orange vodka at a local restaurant, and we were intrigued at what else they had to offer.  We booked a tour, which turned out to be very informative and Talon was a great guide!  The only (teeny) downfall of the tour was the distillery was operational that day and was a little noisy and difficult to hear our guide.  We enjoyed a cocktail and lunch on the patio.  I had the Basil Sour and my husband had an Old Fashioned.  We both had the grilled cheese and tomato soup.  Everything was delicious!

reviews.author: Cody P.
reviews.description: Great experience! tour was short but informative. If you take the tour I would recommend Talon as your guide. He's well informed, and has a great sense of humor.

reviews.author: Alex B.
reviews.description: The tour was great and our tour guide was awesome. It was great to see a distillery that truly cares about their products and that people enjoy them. Will definitely go back. Dripping spring will be my choice of vodka now saw a lot of previous review commenting on size but has plenty of room indoor and outdoor. We enjoyed sitting and having a cocktail for awhile after the tour.

reviews.author: Roz S.
reviews.description: Our visit to the Dripping Springs Distillery was extraordinary. We hosted a group of 12, many were visiting from the UK. The tour and tasting was fantastic. Talon, our tour guide was so knowledgeable, engaging and witty. We started with drinks prior to the tour and Miley was so outgoing and welcoming. The follow up lunch and drinks topped off the afternoon. The food was delicious and our server Jake was so accommodating. Everyone enjoyed the beautiful grounds and tried their luck with the cornhole boards. It became a bit of a competition! The group said the day was superb and the quality of the gin rivaled the best from across the pond.

reviews.author: Terra B.
reviews.description: We had a wonderful time at the Dripping Springs Distillery. Talon led us on a great tour and tasting, and then we enjoyed great drinks and lunch. I actually commented to my husband that everyone we encountered there was positive and friendly, which can be rare these days. Highly recommend!!

reviews.author: Carlos V.
reviews.description: My wife and I had scheduled a tasting and tour of the distillery several weeks before we were arriving in Austin.  Unfortunately, our plane flight was cancelled the day of our arrival.  We were very disappointed.  I called the manager, Kristi Quick, and she accommodated us completely.  Seldom do you see such actions any more.  She took some time our of her busy day to let us sample the spirits and even gave us some great local restaurant recommendations for lunch and dinner!  Her gracious hospitality was very much appreciated.  This is now going to be my vodka of choice...

reviews.author: Heather A.
reviews.description: We had a great experience at Dripping Springs Distiller.  Not only was the tour interesting but the staff really went out of their way to make us feel welcome.  The tasting was wonderful, especially the vodkas- so smooth.  We look forward to visiting again soon.

reviews.author: Mindy H.
reviews.description: Still awesome as always, but even better. You don't need appointments to visit anymore and they have a great indoor/outdoor seating area where you can enjoy cocktails. They also make whiskey now. There is alot of construction onsite to build a restaurant and much more.

reviews.author: Kathleen K.
reviews.description: A tour/tasting at Dripping Springs Distillery was such a fun way to spend a Saturday afternoon.  Our guide Talon was so informative and we learned so much and had a lot of fun!  The vodka was amazing especially the Orange!  The grounds are amazing too--thank you!

name: Culinary Dropout
accommodations: Best nights on Wednesday, Friday, Saturday

reviews.author: John B.
reviews.description: Popped into the area looking for lunch and stumbled upon this place. Glad I did!   Loved the atmosphere with it half outside dining and inside dining. I think it's so versatile you could bring family and kids here, or turn down in the evening with a hot date for a nice dinner.   The cocktails are very good. I had the "Room Service" which is a refreshing gin cocktail.   The smoked salmon appetizer was sooooo good with the saltiness from the capers, perfected toasted ciabatta, and perfectly cooked egg. Highly recommend!   The Shaved Prime Rib sandwich was very good as well, and my son had ordered the Turkey pastrami sandwich, which was also very good!   We sat at the bar and the staff was top-notch. Friendly, attentive, intuitive and on their game!   I recommend this place for any occasion.

reviews.author: Trenesia S.
reviews.description: This was my first time visiting this place we came in town for the weekend and had brunch here at the bar   - we stayed in a nearby hotel so we simply walked however there plenty of garage and street parking available if you're not close   Went on a Sunday around 11:15am for brunch ... we always choose bar seating to avoid waits .. (there was a 5 min wait for tables not bad )  I ordered the peachy mimosa and added a tequila shot it was perfect . My boyfriend ordered the breakfast sandwich he  loved it For food I ordered the hash bowl another great choice no complaints ( it did take a while to get your food which is the only reason for my 4 star review ) but the wait worth it . Bartenders were friendly and available.

reviews.author: Braden J.
reviews.description: Culinary Dropout, more like you'll wanna Drop In...bad puns aside, easily one of the best places in the Domain to gather a group of friends and enjoy their very spacious patio. Certainly compliments the great food they have to serve as well.  Atmosphere: Very fitting of the domain and Austin, modern hipster style so very open with a nice view of the domain surroundings. Live music is played on occasion as well, which really makes for that feel of a local flavor styled joint.  Food: Having come here several times and trying most their food items, you can't really go wrong with any particular choice, just whichever suits your craving for that moment. My personal favorites though is the Fried Chicken. Most certainly worth the wait, and comes with flavorful mashed potatoes and gravy mmmhmmm. Meat is well cooked with good texture and doesn't have an overly heavy taste or feel that most deep fried foods commonly come with.  Service: Every time I've gone services has been great. Staff is friendly and can help accommodate any assistance or questions you may have.   Hungry around the domain and need a place that will leave you full with a good experience? Drop-in to Culinary Dropout. Perfect for anyone seeking a casual and enjoyable night.

reviews.author: Elisa M.
reviews.description: Joined folks for lunch and I think I went wild on the appetizers that I was full when it came time for the main dish. We ordered the Brussels, deviled eggs, and  bread, my sister ordered the kale salad with steak and my friend ordered the chicken bbq salad.   So I'll start with the bread - it's grilled and has some balsamic on it. A little salty but good. The deviled eggs came 3 to an order and I love a good deviled egg but this was "meh" at best. Seems like it needed a little more seasoning and there wasn't anything special about it. I will say I'm not usually a fan of brussel sprouts but these aren't mom's brussels. These were fried and then tossed in a sauce (Korean go-guchang) and is a little spicy but oh so good. The kale salad was a lot of small pieces of kale, the steak was tender but I can't say I'd order it again (or steal it off my sister plate). The chicken salad was good and came with a deviled egg.   Overall, it was a good lunch - we did order 4 drinks and the total came up to about $100.   We were able to sit outside on the porch under a heater which made it a great atmosphere. I will say that I saw the chips and dip and will come back to try that.

reviews.author: Chastitie A.
reviews.description: Culinary Drop Out is a good place to recommended for a hang out spot with good food and drinks. Very trendy place, and there's usually live music on the weekends. The outside patio "pre-COVID" had lots of games for guest to play. There's enough TV's to watch sports from anywhere you're sitting. I recommend ordering the fried chicken and homemade mash potatoes. I think it's their most popular dish. The dish is fried to the perfect level of crisp, and it's very juicy!  I also like their salmon!  As far as the drinks, if I'm not ordering my usual Austin Eastcider, I'm getting their jalapeo margarita! One of the best in town!   The vibes are always good here.

reviews.author: Raychel R.
reviews.description: I originally discovered CD when I used to live in Arizona. It was always THE spot to hang out on the weekends with large groups. I was happy to see CD had an Austin location!  We came on a week night and it was still pretty crowded. Wait time was about 30 minutes, so that gave us some time to walk around and do some window shopping at the Domain. Once we were seated, we put it our order right away.  Pretzels and Fondue: The softest pretzels!!! Perfect for dipping in the provolone cheese sauce. We actually got 2 rounds of these as they were that good.  El Matador: tequila, elderflower, ginger agave, and orange bitters. This is my favorite drink here. Has enough of a fruit taste without being overly sweet. And the bartender made it with a lot of love. Lol. Only 2 drinks and I was finished for the night.  Our server was really great and kept checking on us throughout the night. Fun crowd. Fun music. And a really fun time.

reviews.author: Ashley B.
reviews.description: Just tried to eat here tonight (Tuesday 2/15). Got here around 7:30pm and was told there was a 30 minute wait- no problem we waited. At 8pm on the dot we got a text our table was ready. We were seated and already knew what we wanted so the second our server came over we ordered, maybe 8:05pm. We saw tons of dishes coming out but figured with how busy it was it might be a bit. At 8:35pm someone (not our server) came over and told us "so sorry about the wait, you're up next" we waited 15 more minutes after at least 15 orders came out and finally couldn't stand it anymore and left. We wasted an hour and a half and still left hungry.   The sad part is this is not the first time we've experienced bad service here. Last time we came here with a reservation and were sat outdoors when we reserved an indoor table. 20 minutes passed and no one came to our table even though multiple servers passed us. We asked a girl who was clearing tables if there was someone who could take our order and she came back and said no one wanted to so she took our order. I guess that should've been our red flag last time not to visit again but we love the food and gave it another chance.   We've been to Culinary Dropout at several locations in Arizona and never experienced anything like this. The Austin location definitely doesn't hold the standards of the others. We won't be returning and suggest you don't either unless you have 2-3 hours to spare to wait for your food.

reviews.author: Christina F.
reviews.description: Seems like more of a young person drinking place than a good food place.   I didn't love the pretzel bread with cheese "fondue." The cheese seemed like the fake cheese you get in prepackaged containers/baseball games. The pretzels were slightly warm but were a bit dry. Would not recommend.   We both had the Turkey pastrami and didn't love or finish them. I had the French fries and they were good and friend had the side salad and said it was good.

reviews.author: Ashley G.
reviews.description: Get the butternut squash lasagna!! So amazing and melted in my mouth!! Make a reservation but great atmosphere with ping pong and corn hole.

reviews.author: Callie M.
reviews.description: Originally was going to stop for a quick lunch but got ahead of ourselves when looking at the menu.   Brussel Sprouts (3/5): not crispy like I expected it to be but the flavor was solid and unique.  Salad (4/5): they made kale taste good. that's impressive!   36-hour Pork Ribs (3/5): very sauce-y and therefore, very messy. At least the flavor was decent. The ribs itself were are not very tender.   Steak Frites (3.5/5): not bad but also not great. The salad on the side was great tho.   Korean BBQ Skirt Steak (4/5): lots of flavorrrr. Better than the Steak Frites. The meats on these two dishes actually tasted the same but this one had sauce. I actually liked this main the most out of the ones that we tried!   Overall, chill spot for a nice dinner with friends. I would rate this place a 3/5 for the food but probably bump it up because of the ambiance. There's lots of space and a few games to play so the vibes probably make up for the food.

reviews.author: Sabrina S.
reviews.description: Located in the Domain, this is a hoppin' place on an evening for a weekend dinner. Bit of a wait for a table for 4, but no worries.  Eventually we were  seated and our server was super friendly.  We ordered a couple of drinks to start. I didn't care for my cocktail two to mango at all. Hardly tasted the fruit flavors of pineapple, guava, orange or the mango white claw, since it was so overpowered by the vodka. I just passed the drink onto my son. We put our order in for our meals and it took quite a bit of time for the meals to come out. We had to flag down our server to find out what was going on. She mentioned they had many orders and were backed up.  We were a bit disappointed when our meals arrived. My burger was super dry and my son's salmon dish looked like an appetizer. The portion size of the salmon was small and the amount of risotto it was sitting on sad. We left very hungry. Service was slow, food and drinks are overpriced. Not sure we'll come back.

reviews.author: Erin S.
reviews.description: We had a party of 8 at 1:30 pm on the Friday of ACL weekend. It was pretty packed, but they were able to accommodate us. Service was great!  Here's what I tried: - Evil Jungle Princess ($13): This fruity rum drink was good! - Soft Pretzels and Provolone Fondue ($13.25): The pretzel bread was good. The cheese was good. $13.25 is a lot for what it is though. - Gojuchang Brussels Sprouts ($6): It maybe came with 5-6 total brussels sprouts. It tasted good, but super not worth it. - The M.A.C. Burger ($14.50): Their take on a McDonald's Big Mac. It was good!  Fun vibes. Convenient if you're staying in the Domain.

reviews.author: Angela W.
reviews.description: Music is loud, crowd is loud, I consider this a great place for my family of 4 dining out. With two young kids, I often have to rethink my choices. Culinary dropout is great. We love their grilled asparagus, it comes chilled and their seasoning plus whatever methods used really brings out the sweetness of asparagus.  Fish and chip is the real deal, been to many places and felt disappointed, NOT here. Pure deliciousness and we can't wait to come back for more!   Sorry for my rather short reviews nowadays, my hands are kind of full lol

reviews.author: Jeremie T.
reviews.description: Nice location. Great outside and open atmosphere. Vibe was just right. Highly recommend to anyone visiting Austin domain area.

reviews.author: Lee D.
reviews.description: 10-25-21  Quality/Quantity - Gochujang Brussels Sprout - I would have preferred the brussel sprouts to have been a little more crispy. Could not really taste the gochujang flavor, not spicy at all. Kurobuta Pork Ribs - My favorite, good flavor. Would have preferred more fries though. Spicy Vegan Curry - My daughter's choice, I guess it was good, but not something I would have ordered. Had a hint of lemon grass after taste, which is a little different from Indian or Thai Curry. Separated rice versus rice combined in the sauce is also preferred, so we can control the flavor.  Atmosphere -This is a very good spot. I like both the indoor and outdoor space. There were a few activities (cornhole, etc) for the guests. I like the choices of seating - regular tables, high top tables, bar seating, couches, etc. Additionally, your huge wrap around bar was nice. Lastly, I am always a fan of an open kitchen concept.  Service -Julia did a good job; she came back and refilled our water often. It was really busy and the entire team seemed to be working hard. I also noticed 2 employees picking up garbage as they walked back and forth serving customers, this is always a positive plus.  Price -$49.80 + tip  Owner Suggestion - Seems like you are very successful, owning quite a few restaurants. Congrats on all your success, and wish you many more. I look forward to trying your other restaurants in the future.

reviews.author: Brittney T.
reviews.description: Wow - this place is SO good. We were in town for the weekend and decided to eat here because it's dog friendly and right near our hotel. Place was very busy on a Saturday night - multiple parties out on the porch.   I still dream about their chopped chicken salad! - so good!    They have a big drink menu with cute cocktails. Staff was so nice and my dog loved all the loving he got from everyone there.   It's definitely a casual/loud/fun ambiance!

reviews.author: Samantha L.
reviews.description: This is one of the biggest bar/restaurants I've ever been to in America! They have indoor seating and half outdoor seating (it's "outside" of the restaurant but still covered on all sides - great for when it's cold out!   It's a cool bar with live music and games but my favorite part is the food!   We got the cheese fondue that came with a bowl of pretzels and it was nothing I expected at all - pretzels are okay at best usually and most places has cheese that taste gross but this was the best pretzel/cheese combo I've ever had!! The pretzel balls were pretty big in size from what I was expecting, they were warm and perfectly seasoned and delicious! And then the cheese - wow I could literally drink a jar of it if I wasn't my age and getting heartburn everyday as is. I haven't stopped thinking about the pretzels and cheese since my first bite! I definitely want to go back to Austin just for this dish.   And then for entree my boyfriend and I split the butternut lasagna and they were so nice enough to split the dish for us without us having to ask.   Oh yeah and for drinks (I forgot to take a pic) but we got the Smashed Irishman and it was so good we ordered 5 through out dinner.   The staff was really nice and the place was super busy so some things took a little longer to come out and we were forewarned before ordering anyway.

reviews.author: Savannah M.
reviews.description: This place was such a good vibe. We came for brunch, and it would have been an hour wait but open seating at the bar. To my husband and my luck there were 2 seats open.  It was Sunday around 2ish and there was a guy singing with his guitar.  The speakers were amazing you can hear him inside and out on the patio.  Friendly staff. The food was so good. My husband and I are some carnivores but today we both ordered vegetarian options  Don't let that fool you. Both dishes were packed with flavor. My favorite was the vegetarian spicy curry. Holy cow was it good. So good. Would definitely visit again!!

reviews.author: Caryn N.
reviews.description: It's something about the atmosphere that continue to have my attention. The service is attentive and coming to CD for a good piece of fried anything works for me.   At this point I just need to wait for the games to return. The waitress shared that before Covid they had games for adults like png pong.  I'm ready!!

reviews.author: Michaela P.
reviews.description: We've heard great things about this place and decided to give it a try for brunch. Made a reservation. Glad we did, as it filled up fast soon after we were seated.   This is a great place for large groups. More bar than restaurant.   Cocktails were tasty and reasonably priced. Large selection of beer on tap. The menu is a little thin, and our brunch items weren't anything special.   Service was top notch. We'd come back for happy hour, but probably not for a meal.

reviews.author: Brittney T.
reviews.description: So fun! This place is huge and dog friendly.   They have flights and all sorts of different cocktails for you to try. I do love vodka - so this distillery is a lot of fun.    The staff is fun and knowledgeable. They made a lot of good recs for drinks.    They have a little food stand inside for some small bites.   Would recommend to stop by if you're in Austin!

reviews.author: James B.
reviews.description: Wasn't blown away; except for the great flavored vodka.  But for $10 you only get 4oz. Which you can get at almost any liquor store.  They have mixed drinks and such. And some sort of food options. I'm not impressed with the bar service either. They have a barrier up for a line, but they don't actually use it.    Highly recommend orange, lemon, sweet tea and peach vodka.   It's not a bad stop for a drink. But only get one. There's a cop in the parking lot waiting to nab a drunk driver.

reviews.author: Jake H.
reviews.description: Deep Eddy Vodka Tasting Room is a great spot to hang with friends while sipping any number of their flavored vodkas. My favorite is probably the peach vodka and they have many cocktails to choose from. We went on a Sunday where there were local vendors there too as well as live music. Head to Dripping Springs for the great tasting room. Unfortunately, the distillery near Buda is not one that is open to the public, so the tasting room is where to go.

reviews.author: Angela R.
reviews.description: We started our bachelorette day here. The Bloody Mary was so yummy! I got it spicy. Sometimes they're a hit and miss but here... not a chance. The bartender made it to perfection! I also loved my souvenir glass I got to bring home with me. The vibe and atmosphere of this tasting room is super chill and cozy. 10/10 recommend !

reviews.author: Shradha A.
reviews.description: Like I was saying earlier, I find tasting rooms gimmicky and this one is a perfect example of it.   We chose to come here because I have deep respect for Deep Eddy as a company for their commitment and contributions to the local community. They've gone above and beyond again and again. Respect!  The tasting room is a large hall, with flights consisting of tiny cups of flavored vodka. You don't taste the actual spirit because the fruity flavors are so sweet.   The "Colombian" food options on-site is a joke. It's an old school concession stand (movie theater of the 80s style) with heat lamps keeping nacho chips warm on a folding table. Don't expect tacos or empanadas.  The space, both indoors and outdoor, is quite large. And they have a cute performance stage inside.  We stayed a total of 15 minutes.

reviews.author: Valerie V.
reviews.description: Wonderful space for great and unique cocktails. Both indoor and outdoor seating are roomy and spread out. They were already decorated for Christmas when went today 11/6. I loved the Spring Sling and the Ruby Red one with the jalapeo. Definitely a must do in the Austin area if your are distillery and brewery

reviews.author: Natalia R.
reviews.description: Spacious - great for large groups!  Food - one small food truck  Drinks - the vodka is a bit harsh; personally preferred the cranberry flavored vodka best (smoothest). Bartenders are very friendly and fast but the drinks are simply made and during Covid they are all touching the mint in their hands by smacking it. Id rather a gentle crush/roll in a glass... felt a bit gross (others commented too).  Wish there was live music Saturday afternoon at 4  Games outside like giant connect 4 etc  Parking- gets full on weekends so a bit tight  The decor was cute  Sheriff at the door to handle anyone getting a little too cray

reviews.author: Kimberly M.
reviews.description: A lovely farewell brunch was held here in the tasting room. There was ample seating both indoors and out. The bartenders were attentive and the drinks were tasty too. We'd like to return and sample other beverages.

reviews.author: Melissa G.
reviews.description: Finally I was able to make it out to the distillery with my good friend early on a Saturday so that we could get some direct tasting vodka notes from Deep Eddy themselves rather than me taking shots at bars around Austin.  Parking was easy for us but do note that we showed up around 11:20AM on a Saturday so we didn't have any issues.  The later you arrive parking could be a thing and you may have to wait/stalk someone who is leaving to get a spot. Also as the day got later there were many buses and charter vans parked in the front and roundabout chilling out as the company they are driving around are inside getting down too.  Cocktails in a paper cup runs $8 with plenty to choose from the menu that is thoughtfully laid out in sweet, sours, spicy, etc. A nice mason jar with the Deep Eddy logo is $12 and slightly larger.  Do know that they will not refill your mason jar after you buy your first one so be prepared to be clanking around the distillery with your extra mason jars if you keep going the $12 route. Also be careful with your glass too - I saw many people let that mason jar slip out of their hands and the mason jar just crash on the concrete floor. So sad! Also frozen drinks / cocktails can only be purchased downstairs so be ready to wait in a little line if it is busy.   Loved the areas to sit inside the tasting room and even in the 2nd large downstairs area.  The pillows, decor, and the small touches around the sitting areas on the first floor are super cute and selfie-worthy.  I can imagine in the winter, with the large fireplace going, this space is cozy AF!  We didn't go outside at all as it was super hot in July but it looked like there are plenty of tables, shade, and seating for some large groups both in the front, side, and back areas.  After 2 cocktails in a mason jar we were feeling a good buzz and knowing we still had to trek back home (south Austin) we cut it off there. By the time we left around 2pm the place was buzzing with people, all 3 bars had 10+ waiting to be served, and I wasn't planning on waiting to close my tab in a long line.  I was super surprised to find out you can close your tab at the merch area with the cashier there so don't fret and add in that mug, stickers, shirts, bar additions, and Deep Eddy cool pool lady in red signage to your basket to check out while you close out your tab. You will save yourself some time and be out of there in a jiffy!  We plan to come back especially now knowing they are opened on Thursdays at 11am!!!!

reviews.author: Sarah H.
reviews.description: My Husband surprised me with a day-date to Dripping Springs, Texas. I am a huge fan of Deep Eddy Vodka and this was an amazing way to try all of the flavors.  The set-up is gorgeous and feels so clean when you walk in. You get a behind the scenes taste of where the best Texas vodka comes from. The staff was kind and knowledgeable. They answered any questions we had about the drinks. I ordered a $10 flight and my Husband got the Orange dreamcicle drink. You have the option to get your drink in a mason jar as a keep sake.  There is a great gift shop on site, so we got matching shirts because we are cheesy like that.  There was a delicious food truck out front that had Vegan and Meat Eater options available. I like that they cater to both.   There is so much to do in the surrounding area. We went thrifting and enjoyed the nature that Hill Country has to offer.

reviews.author: Bret B.
reviews.description: Huge fans of Deep Eddy's grapefruit vodka.  Great with soda for easiest of easy beach drink.  Fun first stop before three winery visits nearby.    They have a responsible pandemic process in place managing number of folks going through and requiring masks.    Highly recommend Deep Eddy's as first stop when in Dripping Springs.  Cheers y'all

reviews.author: Jamie P.
reviews.description: I really enjoyed our short visit to the Deep Eddy distillery. We are already big fans of Deep Eddy's vodka and all of their flavors, so we had no doubt we would enjoy our time there. The cocktails they serve at their bar are innovative and refreshing. I ordered the Spring Sling and he ordered the Austin Mule. We both enjoyed the drinks next to the patio where they had multiple groupings of chairs spread out on the lawn. Other than drinking, there's not much else to do here, but it's definitely a lively place to enjoy a drink with friends! Our bartender was also very kind and helped us choose the right cocktails for each of us.

reviews.author: Amanda S.
reviews.description: The Deep Eddy Tasting Room is making some delicious cocktails! We found ourselves here with friends on a Saturday afternoon. The weather was perfect and they have a nice little patio area. The spot is family friendly meaning you can bring your kids, but there isn't a lot for them to do except run around in the patio area. I would have liked if the patio area was fenced off and not open to the parking so I could relax a bit more. I had to keep a close eye to make sure my kid didn't wander off. I enjoyed both of the drinks I tasted and would definitely stop in here to explore more of the tastings, but will likely leave the kid at home next time.

reviews.author: Matthew W.
reviews.description: No complaints here. You can take home the souvenir cup or jar whenever you order. Try the Texas tea and you won't regret it. Everything here is made to order with frozen drinks being located downstairs. The service is also great! We went on a Sunday and had a wonderful experience. They also have a nice selection of merchandise.

reviews.author: Heather M.
reviews.description: In our multiple trips to central Texas, we kept missing Deep Eddy although we tried each time; just unlucky timing. FINALLY this past weekend we got there when they were open! Oh we were so excited and the place lived up to the hype. The seating atmosphere both inside and out is very roomy and comfortable. All the staff is friendly and easy-going. Everywhere including the bathrooms were incredibly clean. The cocktails... the cocktails are downright amazing. They're inventive, delicious, and fresh. You're going to have a hard decision to make no matter what kind of drinks you like... I actually ended up ordering two at once because I couldn't decide! On the way out, we stopped at their little gift shop and man do they pack that area with goodies! Talk about variety and options. The shirts are awesome and made very well to boot, and they have tons of other merch. I left with a soft tanktop, a wicked fun tin can that I plan on using for a cactus or succulent vase, a magnet, and a collapsible dog bowl! We'll be back every chance we get. Loved it, loved everything, love the vodka.

reviews.author: Ara A.
reviews.description: Excellent service, great drinks with all their offerings. They don't charge for mock tails which is very nice if you don't want alcohol.

reviews.author: Jaclyn L.
reviews.description: I LOVE THIS PLACE! You got games outdoors, a stage indoors, vodka tastings, frozen vodka drinks and more! We've been here twice now and always have a good time with our daughter!

reviews.author: Riley B.
reviews.description: PSA: NEVER go to the Deep Eddy's Vodka Tasting Room!! HIGHLY DISAPPOINTED AS A REGULAR DEEP EDDYS ENTHUSI  My friends and I went out to celebrate Maddy Montgomery's 22nd birthday and were harassed by the manager for being "underage".   The whole group willingly gave our ID's for inspection and the birthday girl's ID was "questionable", so she was taken to a cop car by a Sheriff, put in the back and questioned.  While Maddy was at the cop car getting her ID verified, the rest of the group had our full drinks/cups (that we paid for and were able to take home), snatched out of our hands. We all requested a refund for the drinks and were denied??  After the Sherriff verified that Maddy's ID was real, the manager proceeded to threaten tresspassing charges against us??   I have never experienced anything like this and would love to be contacted/reimbursed for the mistake that was clearly made.

reviews.author: Kylie W.
reviews.description: If you have the time definitely a cool spot to check out. Indoor and outdoor seating with a little gift shop. Got some flights to taste and a frozen drink

reviews.author: Mike R.
reviews.description: Our Jeep club organized an event at this establishment, anticipating a fun and enjoyable experience.  Wrong!  I will preface that this whole COVID thing has still, for some reason, has some still on edge.  However, this place has taken it to new heights.  While the great state of Texas has opened to 100%, this place seems to have missed that memo.  We literally got yelled it for actually standing up at our tables and told that if we do stand to have a mask on.  Additionally, we got yelled at for moving a table.  The guys exact words were "I'm picky where our furniture is placed."  Additionally, if you want to get a beverage, you actually have to MAKE A RESERVATION just to go in get one.  That is ridiculous!  By the way, the Hays County police are on site to enforce all of this over-the-top nonsense.  Most of us stayed for a single drink and then left for better and more fun pastures.  It's obvious that this place has forgotten all about who the consumer is and how we should be treated.  Not only will we never go back, but I am never going to purchase any of their products again.  By the way...the Jeep community here in Texas is very tight-knit and we will talk...

name: Crown and Anchor Pub
accommodations: Best nights on Monday, Wednesday, Friday

reviews.author: Joe T.
reviews.description: After calling a dozen other restaurants and bars, who have posted in inaccurate hours on Yelp, which we found out by calling all of them to find them all closed and they said they were open, we stumbled upon the Crown and Anchor. 38 nicely chosen taps, amazingly friendly, with a awesome atmosphere. Jarrod, the bartender, and Sam, the waitress made us feel at home and I made what was it looking like a pretty bleak Christmas Eve into a wonderful party night. Between the two of them, awesome awesome is the only word that I can use to describe the feeling of hospitality on Christmas Eve, it saved our night and made us loyal customers of crown and anchor whenever we will layover in Austin or visit.  Bravo and Cheers to Jarrod and Sam. We will be back whenever possible! Thank you!

reviews.author: Brian E.
reviews.description: Great beer selection and awesome burgers.  This is a great spot to sit outside, drink a few beers, and just enjoy the day.

reviews.author: Kaelyn M.
reviews.description: Decent food and atmosphere. EXTREMELY disrespectful and inconsiderate bartenders and cooks. This place has definitely gone downhill in the past few months. Could have potential if it weren't for the horrible staff.

reviews.author: Amanda F.
reviews.description: So, being new to Austin I'm always looking for cool local spots to take my pup that aren't pretentious with some good grub and drinks. Let me tell you...this is hands down my new favorite place. The staff here is amazing!!! They even brought my dog a piece of bacon!!! The fries and BLT were delicious. They even came out to check on me and gave me a free local entertainment paper so I can see what's good in Austin :) Thank you guys so much! I can't wait to be back!!!

reviews.author: Laurene A.
reviews.description: I have been driving by CandA up to 4 times a day on my way to/from work for years now and kept thinking "we need to go, we need to go". We finally decided on a random Tuesday to pop in after work and we're kicking ourselves for waiting so long! This place was so great! They have QR code menus on each table for both food, and beer, and they were so user-friendly, and easy to navigate. The tables are spaced out, and there's seating on the front deck, under the cover on the patio, and some inside as well. The staff was seriously THE friendliest we have encountered in Austin, especially during COVID times. They checked on us regularly, and basically made it so we never had to go in and order anything, because they were SO on it! They are amazingly, over the top, dog friendly!!! It's one of the few spots we can sit under cover with our dog, they have tons of water bowls, free snacks, and they even brought him out a very special snack from the kitchen! They gave him lots of love, and were happy to have him there.  We ordered cheeseburger baskets with fries and they were so delicious! The portions were huge, but the burgers weren't so fat you couldn't handle them semi-gracefully. They were loaded with melting cheese, and the smoked bacon was amazing. There was an abundance of toppings, and a huge pile of perfectly crisped fries. The beer selection and HH is just awesome, we have zero complaints at all! We'll definitely become more regular patrons here, and I highly recommend going out of your way, giving them a chance, and checking out this perfect neighborhood bar!

reviews.author: Feather F.
reviews.description: This place is the best ! My boyfriend is an alumni and I look forward to coming here more than anywhere else when we come back to visit Austin . Best burgers and fries ever !! See you in November Crown !!!

reviews.author: Lauren T.
reviews.description: A+ beer selection, delicious burgers for an incredibly cheap price and possibly the friendliest staff I've ever met at a bar (and I drink at a lot of bars).  My fianc is that obnoxious person who walks into a room and immediately tells everyone we're from out of town. Maybe that attributed to the friendliness but I won't complain.  We were trying to see as much of Austin as we could in one day, but if we had more time we would have stayed for a few more beers. Great patio too.  I can imagine this place being a complete cluster during football season. My alma mater plays Texas in 2025 and we may need to be here to find out :)

reviews.author: Jessreen P.
reviews.description: This place is awesome, and the staffs are very friendly. You can also bring your pets here. 10/10

reviews.author: Nia H.
reviews.description: Been coming here for 20+ years. Best burger and fries in Austin, and always a good beer to go with it. COVID-19 precautious in place,  which we appreciate being in the healthcare for Le. Now we just call in an order to go and sit in our car to eat it. While it's not the same as hanging out on the patio, it's still a great experience.

reviews.author: Jonny M.
reviews.description: Looking for a slice of "old Austin"? A large selection of craft beers? Affordable and tasty food menu? Great atmosphere?  Look no further than the Crown and Anchor pub.   If you're looking for an expansive beer menu, they have it. Just about any craft beer you can think of is available.   If you're looking for great atmosphere, they own it. The owner Derven has been operating the place for 25 year and is a true Austinite. He has played gigs with many of the areas legendary musicians back the 80s. You can find him at the register most days haggling regulars and slinging beers.   Food? The food menu has the essentials and is affordable and tasty. It has enough options to satisfy just about anybody including a vegetarian or vegan and the food is always great and reasonably priced.   What else? Pool tables. Check. Darts. Check. Plenty of sitting area? Plenty of parking? Check and check.   Overall Crown and Anchor is a mellow and great dive to try a new beer, eat good burger or to clank glasses and cheers with beers at.   The old show Cheers comes to mind. It's a must stop for the neighborhood.

reviews.author: Eric S.
reviews.description: The second member of the grad school holy trinity (the other 2 being spiderhouse and taco joint).  Its basically the perfect neighborhood bar. Basic wooden tables, a nice porch, 3 dart boards and 2 pool tables. You dont have to pay for darts, but you need collateral. They always have a great selection of beer, also they always have a nice deal on some type of beer they're trying to get rid of. Your dollar will go far at this place, especially during happy hour.  In terms of atmosphere, its no frills. Its great for big groups and small groups and hanging out. The porch is enclosed with screens but it is a little hot in the summer. Its great in the fall and spring though.  In terms of food, nothing is really stand out. But, it isnt bad either. Their burger is like the perfect backyard barbecue dad burger. Their fries are pretty good too but there jot artisanal. The cheese fries have a healthy amount of cheese. The nachos are fine too. The prices are a little high compared to the drinks. But, they're not unreasonable.  A lot of researchers at the university have happy hours here, so it gets busy on fridays especially during the semester. People from the neighborhood come too so theres always a crowd. That being said, youll usually be able to get a dart board or a pool table if you want it.

reviews.author: Bill G.
reviews.description: Hey! You have to have some beers here before you walk to the stadium for a football game. Yes, you have to. I do. Many people have been doing it for years and you can see it in the age difference. old and young, people grow up drinking here before Texas Football Games. An Austin tradition and staple.

reviews.author: Kelli R.
reviews.description: I'm new to Austin and this is one of my favorite places.  It's a locals spot right next to the UT campus, so of course it attracts a small college crowd, but it also attracts this amazing group of locals who are super friendly and welcoming.   The people that work here are so nice and they are the reason I went back.  They also have a great beer selection and the bartenders are very knowledgeable about all of the beers.  This place has been there forever and is just a great laid back spot to play pool or darts and just hang out with good people.  Also the burgers are SO good!!

reviews.author: T M.
reviews.description: This place is the best. Hands-down my favorite burger and fries and ranch in Austin... maybe anywhere. Just a simple down-home delicious burger. There are some really awesome staff here (only one pill to occasionally deal with) but overall pretty good odds. Good atmosphere, really affordable, extremely crave-able food in my opinion. Only thing missing is dessert! The first time I came here I ended up going at least once a week since, until sadly I had to quarantine out of state. When I get back though, it's ONNN! I'll be there twice a week probably! I miss it ALL THE TIME!

reviews.author: Soham R.
reviews.description: The ambience is great for watching sports with friends. I didn't have drinks but the food was not that great - the bacon and toast were a bit overdone.

reviews.author: Thomas H.
reviews.description: Friendly staff, good prices, clean bathrooms.   Main downside is they don't serve liquor, as to why? I have no clue.

reviews.author: Troy H.
reviews.description: Spent a moment and made a meeting place for myself and friends. Came here for the burgers and some conversation and we were not disappointed with either.    I am not a burger snob, but I really do enjoy a nice burger and here they have it. You cannot rate it at the top with many others in the area of Austin, but for the price, the atmosphere, the location, and the great staff you cannot go wrong here.    It's a really solid burger that can feed your conversations with friends or fuel your hunger for a long night at the pub. On a side note, the fries were really good as well.

reviews.author: Ashley A.
reviews.description: I walked in and my fiance took a picture of the menu so I could read it on his phone - I wasn't wearing my glasses and the beer menu was too small/ far away to read it. I encouraged the customer next to me to go ahead and order because I didn't know what I wanted and the bartender was SO rude and rolled his eyes and said we were instagramming. I left immediately and I'll never return. I don't need some angry hipster rolling his eyes at me when I'm about to tip him. There's a lovely bar just a half a block away (walking distance) called Posse East with better service and more seating space. Don't waste your time on the pretentious staff here who judges their patrons. Horrible.

reviews.author: Ty C.
reviews.description: This is borderline 5 stars, so I'll give the benefit to them.  Nice bartenders.  Great beer selection and beer prices.  The price varies depending on the type of beer and whether it is happy hour or not.  I got a pint of 512 pecan porter for $4 during happy hour.  They also have pitchers available.    This place is not upscale, but it is a chill place to grab a beer and hang out, watch the game (NBA playoffs and baseball were on while I was there) and there is indoor and outdoor seating and two pool tables.  I was there on Sunday night and pool was FREE!  I suck at pool and don't particularly like pool, but I was up for a few games to help kill the time, so that was an added bonus, especially if you like pool.  There were probably 20 or more beers on tap, lots of bottle and can options, so I'm sure you will find 2 or 5 things that you like.  Parking was free on Sunday.  Pro tip, go on SUNDAY!  I didn't get any food, but it looked like everyone was ordering nachos.

reviews.author: Oscar N.
reviews.description: A great campus bar with cheap food and cold beer l. This is a great dive bar on the north side of UT with great cheap food and lots of beer specials. A spot to meet for a drink or two.

name: Vigilante Gaming Bar
accommodations: Best nights on Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday

reviews.author: Jessica M.
reviews.description: We've been here twice pre-covid. I'm not sure what it looks like during the pandemic.   Great food, lots of board game options.  I wish there were more 2 player options. I like how the game menu is categorized.

reviews.author: Dorris W.
reviews.description: It's different from other board game cafes I've been to; first the whole inside ambiance is very rustic with dim lighting giving it a very nice cozy feeling. Next each table has a little bell you can call a server which is nice especially if you are in the middle of a game and you don't want to be distracted trying to flag down a server.  When you book a reservation they need the number of guests because they have a special menu for games that cater to a certain number of players which I think is an amazing and smart idea. They also have a game master available if you have any questions, but the servers were also very knowledgable with gameplay. The games all have a wooden box container to make give it a fine wine kind of vibe which I thought was cute and quirky.  The reason I had to knock off a star is due to the food ordering. So they have a deal of ordering 3 dishes and you get $3 off. You think simple right? No, there is no writing on the menu or explanation from the staff that you MUST tell the server that you are doing this deal which I think is silly needing to DECLARE it and the next is you have to order to the multiples of 3 dishes all in one go. Besides that annoyance, I think overall the food was inexpensive and delicious. I like that it comes in smaller portions so you try a little bit of everything. I had the mushroom kingdom burger, fries, pretzel bites, and cookies (remember to order at least 20 minutes before leaving since it takes time to bake). All the drinks were good like the boozy milkshakes and fyi if you want a cute instagram photo get the rainbow road.

reviews.author: Amy Z.
reviews.description: I absolutely loved the concept when I heard about this board game bar for the first time! They provide you a menu with a huge variety of different games. The workers there were incredibly helpful in recommending and explaining games. I was so impressed by their knowledge and how well they were able to go over game rules so we all knew how to play. We ended up playing Secret Hitler and Red Flags (which is similar to Cards Against Humanity but focused on dating). You can play as many games as you want here, all for the charge of $5.   There are also a bunch of food and drink options you can order! Currently, because of Covid, they only seat outdoors which is unfortunate because there are really only three tables. Make sure you place a reservation at least four hours in advance! The tables had heating poles next to them so at least it wasn't too cold. I had a wonderful experience and would highly recommend this place for an outing with friends or family!

reviews.author: Emily N.
reviews.description: *OUTDOOR SEATING ONLY (as of Jan 2022) AND RESERVATIONS (are practically) REQUIRED*  - super knowledgeable game master Brandt - awesome variety of games - cover fee of $5 per person - stand heaters outside for if it's cold - food and drinks available ($5-7 per "snack", discount if you buy 3) - fun for all ages! - games can accommodate groups up to 8 people in size, but tables are more comfortable for 6

reviews.author: Kendall H.
reviews.description: For NYE we rented the wizard private room and spent hours eating, drinking, and playing games. The room really made our night special with the insanely detailed decor, Bluetooth speaker to customize the gaming vibe, and remote controlled fan for comfort. The waitresses were also so kind and we all felt right at home. We ordered almost every drink and small plate on the menu. I recommend ordering an old fashioned and the dumplings - the sauce was so good! In the main area, they had a nerf gun war planned to end NYE along with a champagne toast. Everything they do is well thought out - definitely give it a try!

reviews.author: Rachel W.
reviews.description: Loved this place! Such a cool concept. The food was fantastic and great drinks as well. Came in from out of town and stumbled upon this place. Highly recommend checking it out.

reviews.author: Wayne N.
reviews.description: If you're ever looking for a place to just hangout in the evenings, play some board games with some friends, or try some board games that you're thinking about buying, Vigilante is where it's at. It's got everything you could want for a nice fun evening.  Ordering system is pretty simple - just tell your server what game you want and they go fetch it. Once you're done, flag someone and pick another game.  Food is pretty simple and if you order three things all at once, it's a little cheaper. I wasn't particularly hungry the couple of times I went but the pretzel bites are decent with queso. The sandwiches and milkshakes also don't look bad though I can't vouch for it. They got a lot of drinks on tap too.  Sit back, kick back and relax!

reviews.author: Alejandro D.
reviews.description: Well, since I wrote my last review, I've played a lot of board games, been to lots of board game bars, and new places in Austin have opened up.  And for a minute, I thought: the competition is getting tough... There are cheaper ways to go out and play board games now, and there's always tons of places to eat in Austin   But honestly, Vigilante still deserves five full stars because they provide a unique experience you can't get anywhere else. The service is EXCELLENT. The wait staff is always extremely friendly and makes you excited to be there. The game masters are truly that, and can teach you a game as fast as possible. The food is also much improved and truly enjoyable. While also staying out of the way of the real focus: playing games with friends!  By always innovating and keeping the experience top notch, Vigilante will always have a spot in my rotation.

reviews.author: Kyla S.
reviews.description: We had a great experience here! My advice is GET A RESERVATION! It's much smoother that way! The food was okay, most of it we liked, but when we ordered the Gyro and we didn't eat it our waiter noticed and was kind enough to take it off our tab! We have an excellent waiter! The bartender was great, and the hostess at the front door was super cool! I'm very glad we got to experience Vigilante! And when we are back in ATX. We will be back :)

reviews.author: Ellen G.
reviews.description: We loooooove vigilante. This is one of my favorite spots to take my friends whenever they come visit us in Austin. I know covid has been hard on them, but they've handled everything with grace and care.   The staff is awesome and will help you pick out the right game for your group if you are unsure.   When you go, order the Thai fighter. It's my favorite thing on the menu.

reviews.author: Eve R.
reviews.description: So much fun!!!   We just left this restaurant and had the best time! If you are looking for something fun but something chill this is for you! The food is so good! We got the dumplings, pretzels, gyro , burger and cookies. They have so many games to choose from and have "game masters" to help you pick a good one. We stayed for 2 hours. It's been a long time since I've laughed so much. No one was on their phone, no one even wanted to leave the table to go to the bathroom. Oh Drinks were great too.

reviews.author: Colette E.
reviews.description: Wish I lived closer because would frequent this spot. From the robotic server calling system to the custom game tables, no other gaming bar I have been to can compare. The drinks and service were top notch and the game masters helped address any questions. Fun for experienced and new gamers alike!

reviews.author: Katherine C.
reviews.description: I really can't speak highly enough about the team at Vigilante. They are so professional, helpful and friendly. We celebrated a birthday party and had a fantastic time. Everyone loved the food, drinks, and games. We can't wait to visit again!

reviews.author: Marcus Q.
reviews.description: Dropped in today glad I did! First time here and Chris was awesome welcoming and friendly! Did the 3 course where you pick three awesome food items on the menu! Chicken tenders light and crispy and Mushroom burger amazing! Started with Brussel sprouts and it makes you realize you definitely were wrong as a kid they are awesome! Board games drinks and video games at the bar you just can't beat it! Management and staff are amazing!

reviews.author: Jennifer M.
reviews.description: This is such an amazing concept and we had a blast!  Our group of 4 came here for an adult game night and were not disappointed.  They have a huge variety of board games to choose from.  These game range from easy to hard, long play to short play.  We ordered several different appetizers to share as a table and we each had a burger.  The appetizers were decent and the burgers were very small but pretty good.  This place is definitely not about the food but about the games.  It is good for the snackable items, but I wouldn't plan your dinner here.  The drinks are good and very reasonably priced.  We had a reservation for two hours, but we ended up staying there for about 3 and a half hours and we were not kicked out or asked to leave.  The staff was all super friendly and helpful.  This is definitely a spot that we will be back to.

reviews.author: Katrina S.
reviews.description: Game and drink selections are great, staff is fantastic, but the food portions are stupid small. I understand they want to keep it snack size so you can focus on gaming, but when you make things gluten free, i.e., take away the buns, the portions get reduced significantly, but the prices don't get reduced at all.

reviews.author: Marley R.
reviews.description: My family and I had an excellent time at Vigilantes on our trip at Austin, TX! Our server was super attentive while we were playing games. The food options are super cheap and they are all SO good! You can choose from 60+ board games on the app too- we played Clue and Bad Medicine. Overall it was a great experience and I highly recommend if a group is looking for something to do at night time!

reviews.author: Colton L.
reviews.description: I've been here many weekends since moving into the Crestview neighborhood. It is easily the best bar in walking distance. Cocktails are amazing. Bar food is delicious and perfectly snackable. You can never have just one plate. The staff is always friendly.   By far the most unique and best part is the extensive bored game library. This makes it the perfect gathering place for parties small and large to get together for some wholesome and competitive fun. The thought put into this aspect is also plain to see. The design of the tables, the food choice, and the atmosphere makes this the perfect place for the next role of the dice or grand strategic victory. For large parties and special events, ask about the hidden rooms.

reviews.author: Victoria X.
reviews.description: Super fun board game bar! All boardgame boxes have been replaced by custom wooden boxes.  You can check out one box at a time. They do split the check individually since it's a handheld POS system that they use.  Majority of your party must be there in order to be seated, otherwise you can just wait at the bar. If you choose not to play board games, you can hangout at the bar and they'll give you switch controllers so you can play smash on their projector screen.  I saw that there was 1 hidden room, behind the bookcase, which I can only assume people can rent out for private parties. There is free parking out front in the garage.  -1 star because service was painfully slow.

reviews.author: JR L.
reviews.description: Man what a gem this spot is! If you haven't been, you mos def need to go. From groups of 2 to about 8, you're gonna have a great time from their lengthy list of board games, small and easy plates, plus brewskies or cocktails!
