Came here with three friends on MLK night and it was busy! But we were able to get our gaming in. FYI, at night it's a bit tough to see the store sign, but it's right at the corner/entrance of the apartment complex it's near!  Inside - 5/5 The left side of the spot has long benched tables with booths lining the wall/corner. If you sit in this at area, the staff give you a cool plasma-esque lantern so that you can call them over for food, libations, and games. The back of the left side is a bar with a projector in the behind. But what really sets the inside are the four person tables on the right side that are outfitted for perfect board and card games. Each side of the table has compartments where you can put your personal items, a cup for rolling dice, and a slider for cards. There are swinging sections at each corner to put your drinks or other items. Lastly, each side has a button that turns on a light right above the table to let the staff know you need something! P legit.  Food - 4/5 There are two pretty cool three plate deals you can order for $12 as you partake in the games. So far I've had the tacos, fries, and rolls and they weren't that bad. Nothing to write home to, but would be nice with larger portions. If ya don't do the deal, the  plates a la carte are of course a bit more expensive. Also, they can gluten-free most, if not all options! The beer and cocktail selection is pretty nice. Again, nothing out of this world, but cool you can really spend hours here.  Games - 5/5 The best part of Vigilante is of course the games. As several of the menu photos depict, they have a full menu of categorized games (e.g. adventure, party, cards, board). They also break it down by how difficult the games are to learn, set-up, and play. They of course have your staples - Settlers of Catan, Cards Against Humanity, Exploding Kittens - but there are plenty of more games that you can try with your friends! For example, we tried Sushi Go (a quick card dealing game to get the most points) and it has now become one of our go to games! The fun part is that the games are placed in a protective wooden box, which makes you feel like you're accessing a side quest of some sort.  Tips! Like a night club, it's $5 per person to sit at a table and play! And it's unlimited games all night. Your group can only one game at a time. Sit at the 4 person tables I described above! You won't regret it! You can order per person - the staff have mobile card readers  Overall - 4.5/5 I don't think any place is perfect as I believe it's always fun to continue building and making something better. Nevertheless Vigilante is a must go place for a date, a "night in", or what have you among other game loving fellows. It has everything you need and you're not risking yourself in the crazy scary world out there. Don't do yourself a disservice and go go go (Power Rangers)!

reviews.author: Tim S.
reviews.description: it was nice to get to a vineyard that was hospitable and had darn good wine.  We continued through our drive in the countryside south of Austin to the next vineyard, which was Driftwood.  after pulling in and walking down the trail to the main house we got in line to do a tasting.  actually my gal got a tasting, was happy to try a full pour of the Cabernet they have.   While we waited I took in the rooms that we were in.  It was a homey vibe with lots of small things to buy and others to just look at. The tasting was pretty good, but I took my glass of wine outside to the edge of what seemed the property as it dropped off sharply down a hill. There was some chairs there to sit and look out over the valley and that's just what I did.  it is a beautiful spot to appreciate the views of the wine valley here.  I could see the vineyards crawling over the hills on the other side.   There was a gazebo a ways to my right with a couple people people enjoying there wine there.  They had some classic rock songs going on the sound system which added to the relaxed vibe. I would definitely recommend going, and for sure enjoy the view out back.

reviews.author: Brien M.
reviews.description: OMG. Yes. Really. OMG  The wines are really well made, and although I favored some over others, I see why they win so many medals.  The tasting isn't inexpensive but the pours are generous and the quality is superior to many other wineries.  The staff was knowledgeable and friendly. The terrace view is panoramic and spectacular. I'm so glad I stumbled upon this winery again when avoiding I-35 back to Austin from San Marcos.

reviews.author: Katie R.
reviews.description: Absolutely horrible experience this afternoon. My review is similar to those before me. There is a long list of rules and policies posted at the front. The one policy not listed is one you will be yelled at for violiting and practically chased out of the building for. We went in with the intention or purchasing a wine tasting experience. The woman behind the bar was rude, as others have mentioned, and did not tell us anything about the rules. We received our pour and stepped away to sit outside since, while the website boasts table tastings, there aren't any tables inside. We were yelled at in an absolutely abrasive manner by two woman behind the bar. We were then informed that we were not allowed to take our tastings outside and come back inside for the remaining pours. They stated: "it's just too busy to allow that on the weekends". There were four other people inside. Busy? I think not. There isn't a sign anywhere stating you must remain inside for the duration of the tasting. The women were so incredibly rude when referencing a policy that isn't stated anywhere and that we were completely unaware of. It was humiliating and aggressive. So many other wineries allow you to taste at your pace and sit wherever you'd like. This was not the case. We were so thrown off by such atrocious customer service that we settled on a bottle just to get out of the building.   Hours later I saw one of the same woman chase a woman out of the building while yelling "excuse me, excuse me" because the woman had violated some other unstated policy. Chasing after and yelling at paying customers does not invite a relaxing winery experience.   We are local to the area and are members of two other wineries. We would have been back but my opinion of this "estate" winery has been permanently soured. Don't aggressively yell at customers in front of other guests and certainly don't chase them around your property. We'll stick to welcoming wineries with better tasting wine like Duchman, Bell Springs, Wimberely Valley, and Fall Creek. If you're looking for a great Texas winery skip this place and head elsewhere.

reviews.author: Aneesa K.
reviews.description: Carol was our wine tasting experience .  Super friendly, it was a Tuesday so we had the place to ourselves pretty much.  Beautiful area you can see the vineyard from up top.  Dogs welcome, to s of land outside for the doggies yo play in.   We tasted award winning wine from TEXAS grapes!  I'll just bet that when the temperature is a bit WARMER, and the sunshine's one would have a memorable time relaxing and enjoying a bottle or two  Some nibbles you can purchase, not a whole lot the time we were there, remember it was TUESDAY

reviews.author: Mary Ann C.
reviews.description: We made a quick stop at this winery and enjoyed the view while having a glass of wine.  I chose a jammy Cabernet called Lone Star Cab that was perfect. They do wine tasting but I just opted for a glass of what I knew that I would enjoy.    The cafe was not open but they had items that paired well with wine.  I'm sure it is busy in the weekend.  The Cafe is small so get your food to go and enjoy one of the many cozy spots to view the vineyards.   The staff were very friendly and the store was very clean.  They have gifts as well.  If we were in town longer, We would have come back for lunch.    The road to the vineyard is gravel so drive slow.  Parking is free and plentiful.  Follow the signs as the vineyard is about a mile up from the main road.

reviews.author: Katie B.
reviews.description: Gorgeous property...Hill Country vistas at their finest.  Lovely people running the place, too. The wine was fine but definitely not the sole reason to visit, so make sure you have a couple places you're bopping around to in the area. Cute little tasting glasses and there's a shop for kitschy items featuring a lot of wine puns.    I do think the crowd skews a bit older, so better suited for entertaining folks than a bach party!

reviews.author: Hunter P.
reviews.description: No infant, children or teens? Seems like a great way to lose business... for sure won't be back here.

reviews.author: Anna Q.
reviews.description: Beautiful winery 25 minutes from Wimberly! We stopped by during 4th of July and was surprised there wasn't more of a crowd. Strict 21+ policy (many signs warning you to turn back if you aren't 21!) but the servers were so nice and kind. We did a wine tasting which was $20 for 6 samples of white, red, and sweet wine. You can also split the sampling between people, which I shared with a friend. Server (I think her name was Julie) was so sweet and knowledgeable about the wine flavors and gave us recommendations and some history of the flavors. Our favorite was the Starry Night, or the Orange Muscat wine! A bit disappointed they didn't give chocolates or nuts during a wine tasting and overall felt a bit rushed through the process as more people showed up, but it was still a unique experience.   The patio has a beautiful view of the orchard, which is why we came here versus other wineries in the area. Outdoor seating is plentiful, many round tables for larger groups too. Definitely would've spent a good half of day out here sipping wine if it wasn't for the rain. The Bistro (food/restaurant area) was closed because of Covid so eat before you arrive so you don't get hangry or wine drunk! ;)

reviews.author: Keith W.
reviews.description: We were recommended this place by a friend so we decided to check it out. It is in a very remote area which makes it nice. They are on a hill so that the outdoor seating has a great view.  We got 2 tastings and for the most part I enjoyed all of their wines. The Alamo Red was great and so was the Longhorn Red. My wife enjoyed the Chardonnay as well. The servers were very helpful and help guide us to their more popular wines.   We ended up buying a couple of bottles and really enjoyed the experience and the view. We plan on coming here again soon!

reviews.author: Marty S.
reviews.description: The place is beautiful. They service when you get there is rude.  Showed no interest in serving or helping. From the immediate negativity when you pull up telling you all the tjhongd you can't do. No children no sports no smoking no sports equipment. Then comes unfriendly support staff they have are a trip. It's a shame place has great views.

reviews.author: Bill K.
reviews.description: The wife and I tasted a flight of 6 wines: including the Rose, Cab, Red Blend, Merlot, Sangovese, and Syrah.  They were all simply awful swill. Everyone of the varietals lacked depth, character and complexity.  Everyone of the reds tasted blah, and I mean blah. They all lacked the distinctive aroma and notes that each of the grapes are known for.  The Rose  lacked any minerality that one would expect, and was as bad as the others.  The tasting room experience was as bad as the wines. The server had zero personality or character either.  We came away with the same thoughts as we have from other Hill Country Wineries.  They should not, nor should they be attempting to produce well known wines, and in fact do a terrible version of Cabs, Merlots, and Chards.  They should stick to Italian varietals, as well as a few others that might be better suited to the Texas climate, even though most people have no idea about those varietals. I suppose its just marketing to attract people in to the tasting room, and once they get toasted enough it no longer matters, since once the minds fogs, its just pour me another.

reviews.author: Melissa B.
reviews.description: Visiting in the area for the month and have returned several times for the award winning wines and lovely view. This place is awesome if you want to sit back and relax while taking in the gorgeous scenery. Gary, who works the later afternoon shift was kind, helpful and charming--a big step up from the ladies who we have had over the midday shift.

reviews.author: Nae F.
reviews.description: This was the second stop on our wine tour during our anniversary celebration. The ambiance is fantastic and is worth the visit to just get a bottle and enjoy the panoramic views.   Pro tip: they do not allow children, so know that before you go. I believe most of the poor reviews are about this fact, but if you are prepared beforehand it will help with the planning.

reviews.author: Dana L.
reviews.description: The Napa or Texas! It's totally different I know, I know however it's a sweet little place in Hill Country. Bring a few friends and drink a bottle outside under the tree shade. They have a nice bistro menu to pair with your wine.   Prices are really reasonable $25-50 a bottle. Nice selection of whites, reds, sweets. Enjoy.

reviews.author: Tayo F.
reviews.description: The view. You gotta see the view. Especially as the sun is going down. My picture doesn't so it justice but it it was amazing. There is of course the other great things like the food, the outdoor lights they put on when the sun goes down and the wine is pretty good too but none of that compares to the view. You'll know it when you see it.

reviews.author: Trina G.
reviews.description: What a nice surprise. Wonderful place and wonderful wine. Make sure you stop in for a tasting, glass or a bottle to take home.

reviews.author: Diana G.
reviews.description: Second time coming here and have not been disappointed. There was a small wait for wine tasting due to limited seating inside. They wipe down tables in between people and staff are all wearing mask. Plenty of space outside for proper social distancing and enjoying some wine. We grabbed a bottle and ate at the small restaurant they have there. Would recommend you make reservations if you want a view. Service was great and food was amazing. My favorite was the pizza, don't remember the name of it but it had honey on it and it was the perfect amount of sweetness. Never thought I would like a pizza with honey on it, now I can't wait to go back.

reviews.author: Anielka E.
reviews.description: Driftwood winery was our first stop of wine tasting of the day. The view was what sold me. Perfect for pictures!! They have an outdoor sitting area where you can admire the views and the bottle that you order is brought to you by a server who wears a face shield and gloves.    My group ordered a bottle of the 2017 Newsom Cabernet Sauvignon and we were pleased with our choice. It was not dry like a Merlot but just right. This winery does not allow you to bring outside food only the food offered in their bistro outdoor facility. This was not an issue for us.   Overall, it was a pleasant experience.

reviews.author: Kevin R.
reviews.description: This was the best winery of the 8 1/2 I made it to in Texas. All of the wines had a, well let's just say, flavor I am more accustomed to tasting. Prior to this place, everything I tasted was a mixture of sour fermented grapes. Not knocking Texas wines but they are just not my style. Maybe it needs an ice cube. Every wine here, ones that I tasted, is 100% Texan and done the way I think it is suppose to taste. Also, the view from the estate is beautiful. Very worth a stop for tasting and buying.

reviews.author: Matou P.
reviews.description: We have been club members here in the past, and really loved it. We went an 75 minutes out of our way to stop in for a tasting to see what peaked our interest in their current offerings. We loved that they have so much beautiful outdoor space. That is something that was always a major draw for us at Driftwood.   We called ahead, let them know we had a pup with us, and wanted to do a tasting. They told us to come on in. (It was a Monday and the place was very slow)  Upon arrival they told us they will only to tastings inside? What? In the era of COVID? As for the dog, they said one of us could do a tasting.   Between the lack of customer service, unfriendly attitude, and most importantly lack of outdoor tastings we will never bother to come back. WAY too many options with just as beautiful of grounds, equally great wines, safe tasting environment, and more importantly good customer service.

reviews.author: Danielle D.
reviews.description: Great spot along the brewery trail in dripping springs. Lots of outdoor seating, live music and the beer is pretty good as well. They have food trucks so you can pick up a snack if you're hungry. Definitely a stop if you're in the area.

reviews.author: Teresa B.
reviews.description: This brewery is not like any other. It's a beautiful property with an amazing selection of beverages. We had the Texas Sun (saison), the Hilco (California Common), and the Texas Keeper Cider. All were phenomenal and suited to each of our tastes. The folks working here are the best. Thelma is an absolute sweetheart. (She and her husband own it). We are looking forward to attending the grand opening later this month and watching Ghost Note Brewing mature and prosper into the success we know it will be.

reviews.author: Trina G.
reviews.description: Great out of the way right off the beaten path. It wasn't on our map to go to but did not disappoint.  We revisited and the bartender remembered us from two days prior, even what we drank. This is place is definitely worth the stop. Next trip to town we will be dropping in.

reviews.author: Katie B.
reviews.description: Super chill, super laid back brewery.   They have a stage for music (starts later on the weekends), a food truck slinging burgers, fries, and shishito peppers!  There's also a venue on property to celebrate special occasions.  Beer is good. Flights available so you can try a bunch. Only feature their brews; no guest beers.  Not a ton of shade, so when it gets hot, not sure it's the best place to be exposed to the unrelenting Texas heat!

reviews.author: Kat C.
reviews.description: This was my first visit and it was amazing. The staff is very friendly! The place is very spacious. Very thankful for the staff wearing masks and gloves. There was a sign encouraging people to wear masks when they are not at the area they are sitting. Which is awesome. The beer is delicious. Recommend the Imperial Stout. The food truck that is on site has good food choices! The place is worth a stop if your are in the area.

reviews.author: Tia H.
reviews.description: This is the cutest little place ever!! Absolutely gorgeous. There is so much space- so many little cozy seating areas. Outside heaters for when it's cold, giant industrial fans for when it's hot. I'm so glad we stopped in. The owners were fantastic and great to talk to, and the drinks were equally great. Can't wait to go back for another visit.

reviews.author: Kevin G.
reviews.description: Great beer and an even better atmosphere. Live music on the Sunday we came. Beautiful set up.

reviews.author: Anna T.
reviews.description: Of the local breweries this has the best beer. Recommend the Amber ale and the imperial stout

reviews.author: Matt H.
reviews.description: Love the atmosphere here.  I tried the Pilsner and it was great.   Beautiful grounds and tons of seating.    I just ordered burgers from the food truck

reviews.author: Blade S.
reviews.description: First visit to Ghost Note and was very impressed!  Tasty beer - nice outdoor layout with plenty of properly spaced tables and friendly staff.  Very much appreciated the staff wearing masks while serving customers and sanitizing the tables in between customers.  Tried the 4 beer flight and enjoyed them all.  Reasonably priced beer choices as well which was nice. Will be back!

reviews.author: Rachael T.
reviews.description: Amazing beer and a cool place to hang out.  Big tables with QR code's and window service.  They have a food truck, family and dog friendly.  Fans and heaters depending on the weather, mellow fun music and great service!  Go here before it gets crowded

reviews.author: Amy W.
reviews.description: Tried ghost note for the first time today. I shall be back. Beautiful setting in the hill country outside of dripping Springs. Nice, standard selection of 10 brews. Good service and live music. The "hangry" food truck was outstanding! Try their smash burger, parm truffle fries, blistered shishito peppers and especially the hot dog with bacon and sauerkraut. Delicious!

reviews.author: Dana C.
reviews.description: Good beer selection, good food truck, nice atmosphere, glad they had space heaters. We will be back!

name: The Tigress Pub
accommodations: Best nights on Wednesday, Friday, Saturday

reviews.author: Lizzette R.
reviews.description: The Tigress and their folks are the best in the business of bartending and making drinks as a craft before "craft cocktails" became a thing. Located on North Loop with other special places to shop, drink and eat, Tigress is your place to watch cool classics in the TV whole drinking the classics.   We are truly blessed to have the Tigress in our city.  You will not leave disappointed.

reviews.author: Michelle H.
reviews.description: Quality cocktails. Nice vibe! Great happy hour prices. Best when it's not busy.  Nola Monday  Tropical Tuesday Signature Saturdays $2 off until 8pm

reviews.author: Clint S.
reviews.description: We stopped by our favorite place to for drinks and had an absolutely amazing time as always. Every time we walk into this place, I suddenly feel at home and I'm always looking to make new friends. Jill was behind the bar making some amazing cocktails.

reviews.author: Elida M.
reviews.description: Amazing service. Owner is super friendly and sweet and does an amazing job taking care of her guest. First time here but highly recommend and will be back.

reviews.author: Kristina L.
reviews.description: I came here on my birthday and had the best experience. I was actually really sad, and coming here totally turned things around. Really good atmosphere, great drinks, and friendly bartender. Em. was an absolute joy. She made such wonderful suggestions and was just the best. As a woman drinking alone, I felt like I was in a safe space. I would go back all the time and recommend it to anyone, especially if you are wanting something low key and chill. Will go back. Make sure you tip the bartenders! They works so hard and do an amazing job!

reviews.author: GS P.
reviews.description: Want to thank the friendly, helpful Kelsey and Holly for making our Friday evening special. We stopped in for a to-go order. We got the Moscow Mules and a growler of lager, both of which were excellent.   The big surprise was their special offering due to COVID, their GRILLED CHEESE sandwich!! And what terrific sandwich it was - super crispy, firm, delicious sourdough, and melty, tasty cheese and---no greasy fingers! Pickles were satisfyingly crunchy too!   Thank you Tigress Pub for a delightfully delicious experience tonight. Looking forward to our next visit!

reviews.author: Abraham S.
reviews.description: One of the top 3 cocktail bars in Austin.   I stand by this statement and challagne you to visit and not be blown away. It's literally unpossible.  Bonus! They make a FANTASTIC grilled cheese. And there's bread pudding, allegedly....

reviews.author: Aaron D.
reviews.description: 3.5 stars for the cons, given that other, less refined establishments in town lack these issues entirely.  Pros: Cozy ambiance, intimate atmosphere inside, quaint almost romantic patio in the back that still feels as such even with multiple parties outside. Fit that in with some personable bartenders, and you've got the makings for a really nice date night! The Bartender who hosted us personally was wonderful company for conversation with the rest of my party, and she took the BEST care of us during our visit that she could.  Cons: An arguably limited selection of liquor for a place that seems to focus its pride on craft cocktails. It's understandable that the pandemic had severely limited business as of late to give any benefit of doubt, but combine that with a lack of providing customers with a preference of liquor for classic standard cocktails exacerbates this. The coups de Grace in dissatisfaction came when I was informed that the bar had absolutely no cherries to compliment a cocktail that is typically garnished with one. Other regulars who overheard me went out of their way to mention that it's a decision from the ownership down. If it's a matter of affordability for something as trivial yet pertinent as a jar of Luxardo cherries, then bigger core issues exist elsewhere; if it's a matter of personal opinion as to what constitutes tradition in a drink, that's even worse when any reasonable bartender or connoisseur should know that the "best way" to serve a drink is however the person consuming it wants it dressed.

reviews.author: Eric W.
reviews.description: We ordered several cocktails from here in preparation for the holidays and we were so impressed by the organization and quality. Each cocktail came with garnish, instructions and was so delicious. Also, the price was very reasonable. 10/10 will definitely order from here again.

reviews.author: Allie R.
reviews.description: The Tigress is the  OG of classic cocktail culture in Austin. They opened their doors well before the craft cocktail madness took over the local blogosphere. There are no codewords, no hidden doors, and no over the top marketing gimmicks used to try to make them stand out from the pack. They don't need to. They just offer highly skilled staff serving up classic cocktails the way they were meant to be.   I'm a cocktail enthusiast and admitted "drink snob" with very high expectations of any place that claims to be a "cocktail bar". The Tigress is like a "small batch heaven" located off the beaten path. The rotating menu is carefully curated and the liquor selection, though small, is a blend of unique, local, and masterfully crafted offerings. You won't find mass produced, highly generic, overly commercialized well spirits here. Though the seasonal menus are small, the bartenders are highly skilled and can handle almost any classic cocktail request. In fact, they've even introduced me to a few that I'd not heard of previously, but are now part of my "at home" offerings (The Trinidad Sour is a favorite I didn't know I had previously). From the perfectly selected glassware to the outstanding skill of the folks behind the bar, this place is a must visit for every cocktail conisouer looking for that one special place where you stop in for a drink and leave having had a memorable experience.    Despite having all the right things to lend itself to being a high-end elegant cocktail bar, The Tigress has a casual, local, friendly feel. If you don't fancy yourself a cocktail person, have no fear.The drinks are very reasonably priced and the bartenders are highly skilled at asking about your flavor profile preferences and making the perfect recommendations for both the experienced drinker as well as the cocktail novices of the world. Don't be afraid to ask their advice. I take friends and visitors from out of town here regularly and they've never steered us wrong.   Cheers!

reviews.author: Priyakshi K.
reviews.description: Hmmm!  The interiors of this place are very different - very old / rustic sort of style. They have outdoor seating which can probably seat around 10 ppl - very small tables surrounded by a few chairs.   For drinks we ordered the boys of summer, paper tiger, leash-less and native tongue.  The drinks were very okay, hit or a miss . I liked the boys of summer, wasn't the best drink I've ever had but certainly better than the others.   Our hostess was a little moody for some reason. She asked   Overall- can surely try it out for a drink if you are in the neighborhood.

reviews.author: Neysa K.
reviews.description: The cocktails were undrinkable. We ordered the punch, the negroni and the rum and coke. Also the tables and floor were sticky. Yuck.

reviews.author: Jules F.
reviews.description: This is a fun little bar with good service and a nice selection of alcohol.   The seating offers a variety of options from social to private to belly up to the bar.   The parking here is limited though, not the bar's fault. A biker smashed into my side view mirror as I walked outside and he was screaming obscenities along with "who parks here?" To which I realized that I was parked (along with many other cars) in an extra wide and poorly marked bike lane.

reviews.author: Pax S.
reviews.description: Wow, I never thought I would have a reason to walk two stores down past Workhorse...but my roommate insisted we get out tonight. This place has a great vibe--super casual. The bartender was so great--extraordinarily confident and she knew her shit. Check this place out for happy hour!   Now I have no reason to go to Drink Well.

reviews.author: Kasy S.
reviews.description: What a great experience in a cool space. I had another delicious old fashioned and a proper pint of scotch ale. My wife had the green drink which was a fantastic concoction of fresh herbs and peppers. Highly recommended cocktail as long as you aren't diametrically opposed to cilantro and fresh jalapeos

reviews.author: Alek Z.
reviews.description: Cool little pub, good drinks, a little on the expensive side, but they mix their drinks *well*. A lot of alcohol but you can't hardly taste it. You'll feel it though! They could use more seating. Also they need to start serving their Moscow Mules in copper mugs. But otherwise, it's a cool place.

reviews.author: Yelp Y.
reviews.description: Where the fuck is the 3.5.  This is a strange haunt, bigger than it used to be by opening into the antechamber.  The staff remains like clockwork.  If this were a Western saloon, there'd be a piano player, mopping his damn brow and waiting for higher spirits before smashing out a tune.  (you can even smoke outdoors, and if it's cold enough, no one will come out for a solid hour, guaranteed)  If you are not the type to make friends with every moron at the bar, this is a good place to seek some quiet and forgetfulness on off-hours, which are pretty much all hours not the weekend.  TCM is always on, subbed; Ida Lupino, Fred Macmurray, the Bogart, etc, become regulars to you, and inevitably some doofus pipes out, sure as God, "You know, I think Empire Strikes Back is one of the top ten films on the planet."  Sit long enough, still, like a walking stick; in comes a Bumble date once or twice a week: a leather daddy with a face pitted by acne that got the best of him years ago is making up big time by going to absolute town on some mixed girls, reciting the old lines, sure as Old Faithful, pat and safe and just this shy of rote PUA material; a young guy is meeting a blonde with a bob, discussing schadenfreude, saudade, acentrism, kicking canes out from mobility-disadvantaged Nazis, and everyone works at IBM or Dell.  There is always a gang of strangers who know each other over drinks, stinking of the day; every time you come in, they're here, swigging down Claire's Knees and Plump Perfections.  Some of them probably even had a cookout or two before life got in the way.    Every year they do Tiki Week.  Someone's written them up recently.  One of the top cocktail holes in this wreck of a town.   There is something disgusting in being known. Thank the Lord if you are the type who is able to weave little shrouds and stitches of obscurance around your neck wattle and your denimed shanks.  This is a place to hide, to commiserate with your immoralities.

reviews.author: Julie H.
reviews.description: Tigress was recommended to us, so being in the neighborhood, I thought sure! I was told that cocktails were their specialty so I just wanted to keep it simple and asked for a rum and diet coke.  The bartender immediately replied "we don't carry anything with aspertame in it!!"  Yet I could see regular coke in their cooler, so I think high fructose corn syrup is that much better?  There was no need to make that comment, simply state you don't have DIET. A little attitude, so so drinks.  No wonder at prime time there were only 4 or 5 people in the place.

reviews.author: David D.
reviews.description: Pam is an amazing bartender. Sweet, sincere, knowledgeable...  She makes a mean black old fashion.

reviews.author: Sarah H.
reviews.description: Went for an impromptu drink on a Tuesday night. The place is quaint and charming. Not too big but not too small. Tuesday had maybe 8 other people there.   Dim lighting and wood booths line the place. Funny to say, but they have he most comfortable bar stools I've ever sat on!   The bartender was very friendly, talkative and great at recommending drinks.   First, I had The Green Drink! She said you can only get it 1-2 times a year! Unique and tasty! Never had a drink with cilantro in it. Good balance of fresh herbs, pineapple and citrus.   Second drink, she made a custom cocktail for me. I was in the mood for gin but my favorite drinks are mojitos and vodka presses. She didn't bat an eyelash and whipped up something exactly to what I asked for.   Prices are average for a craft cocktail ($9-10). The green drink was $12 but not crazy for the specialty and freshness.

reviews.author: Desiree G.
reviews.description: Such a cute spot to enjoy the outside, have a drink, and eat some food truck goodness! We got here right when it opened on a Sunday and it quickly filled up. Come early! It was pretty cold, but they had little gas fireplaces all over to keep warm. There is a half indoor area that had heaters. Big area for kids to do their thing. My dogs enjoyed the turf to sun bathe. Beer, wine, and seltzer selection were decent. Unisex restrooms. No TVs! Simply a good spot to chill  Service was great! Can't wait to come back!

reviews.author: Patrick J.
reviews.description: I've probably been to the Good Lot at least 5 times since moving out to the Cedar Park area. It's an awesome beer garden with stellar staff and food trucks that are great for any occasion.   The bar area has tons of local beers that they do let you sample. The staff have typically made some great drink suggestions that I always attempt to look out for when buying larger packs at my nearest liquor store.   At this point, I think I've had food from each of their more permanent  food trucks and will say that you really can't go wrong with what you choose. My top favs are the arepas from Four Brothers and the 50/50 burger from the Oink Mobile...in case you have an issue deciding!

reviews.author: Rich_kids_of_yelp Z.
reviews.description: Always a fun time at TGL. Definitely bring your own chair. If children annoy you, this is not the place for you. Children annoy me so this is not my favorite place ATM, but we'll be back during the school day or later on at night.   Glad to have something like this in CP.   To the owner: please discourage remote control cars and soccer balls. Pretty annoying to have my beer knocked over by some kid who thinks he's at the park. Plus the remote control cars are just obnoxious.

reviews.author: David M.
reviews.description: Great atmosphere, live music that's welcoming for everyone. 10/10 beers on tap. Food trucks offers diverse menu for  any mood you're in. Management and bar staff was great

reviews.author: John S.
reviews.description: Sunday was another really enjoyable afternoon at the good lot with family. Lots of really beautiful, adorable kids with lots of well behaved pets. They have astro turfed the big outdoor area and added more fire pits and tables and it is so freakin beautiful. Another good selection of food trucks , I had shrimp tacos from Redfin and two different draft beers (Again, served in glasses, not paper or plastic. The vibes were very relaxed. I have only one suggestion; Considering the number of little people and the traffic on New Hope, Some sort of a fence along New Hope is in order. I suggest simple metal poles and the green, plastic stuff that comes in rolls that you can get from Lowes or HD. there is a hedge row but there are spaces between. At least until the bushes grow up.

reviews.author: Ted C.
reviews.description: I made the drive up to Cedar Park and my friend was excited to take me here as it had just opened up and seemed to add a streak of cool to my friend's new neighborhood. So, it was midweek around 8pm and while the patio had plenty of folks and there was music going the food trucks were done and they weren't too courteous about letting it be known they were closed or out of food or closing up.   So, the taps were open which allowed me to try out a beer. The staff pouring were definitely friendly, letting me know some of their personal favorites on tap as well as letting me try some out. I did also appreciate that they had some NA options as well and I liked the kombucha they had on tap so much I had two more of those instead of the more adult beverage options they had.  If there was a way to have some of the bar staff cross train with the food truck staff it would make a huge improvement.

reviews.author: Paul R.
reviews.description: The Good Lot is a wonderful addition to the CP area. Bring your kiddos and your hounds sit outside under the shade or on their covered patio.    Cocktails anyone? I was surprised at their expansive craft beer options. Check out their rotating taps at: https://thegoodlotcp.com/beergarden/drinks/  There are wine, seltzer, and non-acholohol options as well.  When we visited there were 3 food truck options; Yard Bird, Oink, and our favorite The Rice is Right.    Be aware on weekends and when there is live music parking will be a challenge. This has been a point of contention with the neighbors and according to the Good Lot, they are looking to expand the parking area.    Pro tip: Don't park in the adjoining neighborhood park 5 minutes away at the Veterans Memorial Park. Stretch your legs on the way there and work off that beer on the way back.

reviews.author: Oak Z.
reviews.description: As far as I can tell, The Good Lot only has 5 star reviews and for good reason.  It is a great beer garden with plenty of non-beer options as well.  I have always passed by the place and noticed how busy it is most weeknights and especially weekends, but I am certainly pleased with what it brings to the community.  Generally it gets pretty busy after 6PM until close, and parking can be difficult to find.  Carpooling or taking a rideshare would be the best way to do it in my opinion as I would hate to park in front of someone else's house in the nice neighborhoods nearby.  Certainly a parking lot expansion is something the owners are considering as that is my only issue with the place especially when it gets busy.  That being said, it is always a great atmosphere with a variety of food and drink options.  There are also always lots of dogs in the grassy area by the patio and it is nice to see how family-friendly the place is.  I will certainly be back and bring some friends in the future!

reviews.author: Julia G.
reviews.description: This is such a cool place! I planned an outing in Cedar Park with a group of my girlfriends. After our outing at the Ecuadorian chocolate factory, we needed a place that could accommodate a fairly large group of friends during lunch time on a Friday (a task that seemed.... yikes). I am very thankful I stumbled across The Good Lot on Yelp! I reached out to make sure The Good Lot could accommodate us, and they said "Of Course" and let me know that all of the trucks would be out on Friday.    When we arrived, we were pleasantly surprised to find several open food trucks and a large building (see, beer bar). People had their dogs outside and everyone seemed to be having a good time.   Between all of us, we tried every food truck. I personally got Four Brothers Venezuelan Kitchen. I am a sucker for good Venezuelan food. I got a Pulled pork Bowl with extra garlic sauce, black beans, avocado, sweet plantains, and all the fixings. I would definitely eat here again. I tried a few samples from other food trucks as well.   Everyone left super happy. This is a great place to go if you have a casual group looking for a quick bite and place to hang out.    The next day (Saturday), I swung by the dog park across the street and stopped by again for lunch on my way home. They have trivia nights, live music over the weekends, and happy hour all day on Monday. Please build another location close to Fort Hood. A copy and paste of exactly what you already created would be great. ;). I promise to stop by weekly.

reviews.author: Joe B.
reviews.description: Jesse is a rude person, don't recommend ever coming here . Waste of time. We had 7 people with us, and he wanted it

reviews.author: john g.
reviews.description: This place is pretty cool.   They have a partial circle of food trucks about 5 or 5.  Various choices of food trucks that all serve really damn good food.  We ordered from 3 of the trucks and everything was awesome. Each trucks menu is limited but they do it well!  Highly recommend.

reviews.author: Melanie B.
reviews.description: What a fun local spot here in the CP! Been wanting to come check out for awhile now and finally drive out last night and closed the place down!!! (sorry guys, we were the last ones to leave)  Parking is nuts so plan ahead and maybe carpool... We drive a jeep so we had no issues ... live music and plenty of smiling faces.. service was great, bathrooms were clean... dogs welcome! Plenty of good beers, wines and ciders... gals were so nice behind the bar.. offered samples and were super sweet... good folks, good music and good grub.... my son joined us and grabbed some food from the food trucks... cauliflower wings, shrimp fried rice and macaroni and cheese... so so good.... bring your chairs/ blanket to sit on because tables and chairs are hard to snag... the lines are long for drinks but they go fast.... We will be back for sure! We feel right at home here. If you like fresh air and freedom... come here.. if you are afraid of fresh air and human contact, probably should go to Austin and be amongst others who feel that way... Merica!

reviews.author: Dane S.
reviews.description: My daughter and I visited The Good Lot yesterday (8/8/21).  It's the new and hot food truck and bar spot in Cedar Park TX (2500 W New Hope). The Good Lot has a main building with a large dining area enclosed by glass garage doors that open and a bar that has numerous beers, ales, ciders, and craft sodas.  It's nestled among the oak trees. There is a nice amount of paved parking and gravel lot parking.   The Good Lot also has dining areas under the oaks along with a game area (corn hole) and a playground for the kids with a large wooden teepee for climbing.  They are dog friendly.   The Good Lot had 4 food trucks.  We chose The Rice Is Right that serves Korean inspired rice boxes and other items.  We ordered the crispy chicken box and the cauliflower box.  Both items were perfectly fried and coated in a sweet and spicy Korean sauce.  Flavor was amazing.  The boxes came with steamed white rice and a purple cabbage slaw.  The portions were large and more than enough food for us. There were other food trucks that served Mediterranean, Pork, and Chicken.  The menus look good and I will explore those in the future.  The Good Lot and The Rice Is Right are on 'My Keepers List'.

reviews.author: Jake H.
reviews.description: The Good Lot is the new spot to hit up in Cedar Park off New Hope. Food trailers here, beer on tap, covered patio, great outdoor seats and space, place for kids and pets. It has only been open for 3 weeks and the word is getting out. As we were leaving tonight, the park lot was pretty full. Great place to relax with buddies after work or with the family with a wooden teepee for the kids to climb and corn hole. Head over to The Good Lot and get some food from The Rice is Right and Oink Mobile.

reviews.author: Rain S.
reviews.description: I really enjoyed this place and plan on visiting more in the future. They have a great beer selection, multiple food trucks and decent amount of seating! I happened to visit on a Tuesday and to my delight, they had trivia. I think this place is a great option if you are hoping to grab a beer and chill!

reviews.author: Nick P.
reviews.description: After we took our dogs to the dog park nearby, we noticed that the Good Lot had finally opened! The beer selection was great, lots of locals including Whitestone, Hedgehog, Red Horn, Family Brewing and (of course) some lovely PHP Jellyfish on tap.  We decided to tried Yaadbird, since we hadn't had any fried chicken in a while. The lemon pepper chicken was on point, crispy, juicy, peppery, a 'lil salty, and everything you need in your fried chicken!  The property is beautiful and well landscaped. The lawn was amazing! It was so fluffy! When we first arrived we just admired the live oak trees and the quality of the grass.. Lawn lovers, you will understand...  The bartenders were very nice and very excited to introduce so many new people to the Good Lot. The owner was all over the bar, pouring drinks, helping staff, and checking with guests, seeming to have time for everyone.  We are looking forward to coming back here and trying the 3 other food trucks, along with the rotating beer menu. Hope they are planning to host more events, as we would love to do an anniversary party here at some point!

reviews.author: Ben F.
reviews.description: Finally, a really great beer garden in Cedar Park. I came on their first "soft public open" day and I'm so glad I did. I've been to about 20 pubs and bars in CP and this one stands head and shoulders above the rest. It's an open air (no AC but there is heat in the winter) with big garage doors that were open and a huge ceiling fan so it was comfortable. There were about 20 taps and 3 of them were not filled yet. I chatted with the owner and she said she was looking for ideas so my friend Greg gave her some. :)  There is plenty of indoor seating. Plus, there is a huge grassy area with picnic tables and even a fire pit. It's family-friendly so no smoking.  There is a playground for the kids and spots for four food trucks although only two were filled.   Beer was about $6 on average so not cheap but not expensive either. $1 off all day on Mondays.   It was an enjoyable experience and a really great ambience. I'll definitely be back!

reviews.author: Lauren R.
reviews.description: I have been dying to go since this place opened and we finally got the chance today. No disappointments here! This place is non-smoking, dog-friendly (leashed) and kid-friendly, with a unique play area, six sets of cornhole, and plenty of shaded grassy area to run around in. Tables are wide and comfortable, and the entire patio was open-air, so social distancing is a breeze. We ate at the Oinkmobile truck (delicious) and grabbed local beers and ciders at the patio desk. We walked the fifteen minutes from our house, but it looks like they have a decent-sized parking lot and are working on creating more space. The only downside is that there's no ramp down to the grass/play area, but hopefully they'll make it more accessible in the future. Staff was super friendly, and I can't wait to come back for open mic night. Because yes, we'll be back!!

reviews.author: Ashley H.
reviews.description: Food trucks are delicious. Wish there was one or two more but that will come with time. The beer selection is great, mimosas as well. Outside area is clean, and safe for kids. Glad this place opened up! It's a little gem!!

reviews.author: Sarah M.
reviews.description: Found out The Good Lot opened last Saturday so we had to head over. We arrived and got in line to get a beer (lots of local options which you love to see!). Once we got a drink, we were lucky enough to snag a table under the fans and the breeze was so nice. They had live music while we were there, which I believe will continue on weekends so that's fun. The lawn looked so nice, chairs to sit in, trees for shade, lawn games for entertainment! There were 4 or 5 food truck options while we were there and while we didn't get any food, all the food we saw coming out looked so good! Definitely recommend stopping by and checking it out!

reviews.author: Marie D.
reviews.description: Austin East has great ciders, and their tasting room offers a wide variety that they don't distribute in cans nationally! (I live in Phoenix and can get a few flavors here, so it was nice to try some of the others). We each got a flight and the bartender was really friendly My favorite that I tried were the Texas Honey and seasonal Spiced Peach

reviews.author: Ang B.
reviews.description: Love this company and location. We were able to score a few more cranberry 6 packs so my month is made.  Lots of open spots to sit, great employees, I love that they focus on flavor and not sweetness.

reviews.author: Mark J.
reviews.description: Great Cider - 5 Star.  Like shooting the bull with the young barkeep BUT the music is total trash. Don't need to hear profanity laced lyrics over and over. It was offensive and I told them that. They dismissed it so we went outside. Won't go back as they don't respect or care about what THEIR customers think.  Atmosphere (Music) - 1 Star.  Shame!

reviews.author: Shelby P.
reviews.description: Came here on a Friday afternoon and loved how quiet and intimate the space was. Inside and outdoor seating were well layed out and loved the concept of the warehouse feel. The bartender was really knowledgeable about the drinks and gave great opinions on what we should try in our flights. My favorite was the imperial cider. Great flavor! All of the ciders had a real depth of flavor to them.   Would love to come here again in a trip and enjoy the food trucks I've heard about that show up.

reviews.author: Yoko C.
reviews.description: It's such a fun place to come and chat with your family and friends (4 star)! We visited them middle of a day when not many people were around to have such an early start lol. We all had a tasting set, which I tried cucumber, blood orange, sangria and spiced peach. They were surprisingly all flavorful and enjoyable! Tried their frozen cucumber drink as well - super refreshing. We also ordered a couple of chips and popcorn. The only thing I wish they'd do differently is to serve a few more snack items. Something you prep by microwave may suffice but not just a few bags of chips... maybe if food tracks around were open, it would be all good?

reviews.author: Cheyenne H.
reviews.description: I went to Austin Eastciders after work for a quick drink, and I was pleasantly surprised. This is the East Austin location and is easy in and out with plenty of parking.   I walked in and immediately loved the interior. There were lights and barrels stacked to the ceiling. I was surprised by the lack of seating for how popular this location is... there were only 10 or so picnic-style tables inside and a few more outside. It also wasn't terribly busy and I arrived around 5pm on a Wednesday.  Not knowing what I liked, I ordered a flight of ciders. They were incredibly sweet, and I mean almost too sweet. I drank most but the Texas Honey and Blood Orange were too much for me to finish (perfect for those with a sweet tooth though!). The staff were helpful though in helping me find some good options!  Overall, I'd try Eastciders again. This is a great happy hour spot for friends, coworkers, date night, etc.

reviews.author: Claudia F.
reviews.description: Great place to visit and sample lots of cider! We visited with our dog and had a great time. We both ordered the flight and were able to try several different ciders that we hadn't had before.  They have games that you can use while you're there and seem to have a rotation of tasty food trucks.  A must stop if visiting Austin!

reviews.author: Tia H.
reviews.description: Been wanting to go here forever! After hiking and swimming at Mckinney Falls we headed this way for some ciders. I'm gluten free and eastciders are my favorite. My boyfriend headed next door for actual beers, and then we sat together outside on the porch as the sun was going down. Met a lot of super friendly people and finally got to drink the brut on tap. 10/10 would recommend.

reviews.author: Cristian V.
reviews.description: "Always look on the bright cider life"   Highlights: *Outdoor and Indoor Seating  *Seasonal Ciders  *Cocktails in a Can   Review: Looking for a chill spot to take your friends out to have a nice cold one? Well look no further Austin EastCiders has a nice outdoor seating area where you can enjoy the beautiful weather or they also have nice indoor seating. They have at least 6 of their ciders on draft yearlong with a couple of seasonal small batches. They're all very smooth, crisp, semisweet and refreshing. You can also get cocktails in a can which is one of their ciders mixed with sake, cream sherry or agave wine. Next visit will be to their Barton Springs location to try out their food and other cocktails.   Rating: 9/10  Cider Flight: Honey, Pineapple, Sangria and Cranberry

reviews.author: Sean C.
reviews.description: We came in on a Tuesday afternoon for my wife's birthday and had a really great time here. We ordered the peach cider for my wife and I ordered the frozen watermelon slush. Both drinks were really good and the outside seating was really cool. The weather was great and there was some dogs on the patio. I will definitely have to come back here again.

reviews.author: Mark J.
reviews.description: Great ciders from Austin. My favorite is the Super Dry since I like lower carb. The watermelon was also great but a little too sweet for me

reviews.author: Scott C.
reviews.description: Fantastic atmosphere - delicious ciders and engaging friendly staff!  We went on a Saturday afternoon and asked for an out of market ice hockey game to be put on the TV - the staff was very engaging and fun and brought up the game. During the game we conversed back and forth on different ciders to try and again the staff were exactly what we could've hoped for. The 4 of us had a great time and will be back with more friends. Would highly recommend for groups or a relaxing afternoon. Thank you!

reviews.author: Dana L.
reviews.description: This place definitely lived up to my expectations. I love their beer so visiting their actual location was a treat!  They just released the Blackberry Cider this week and it was so good. It's a nice fruity, sweet and slightly sour cider. I also tried the Honey Cider. Both excellent !! They sell all their ciders by the packs or the variety pack if you need to stock up before leaving.   The staff was 5-star. The decorations were 5-star. It was just such a nice chill, vibe. Will visit again soon.

reviews.author: Teresa L.
reviews.description: We love coming to this location, it's a cool hand without it being too bougie. Love the indoor warehouse/brewing seating mixed with outdoor patio seating.   Food truck was available if we wanted a bite to eat, and the tasting flight we had was .   Love that we could come here with our kid if we wanted, judging from a few other families present and the casual environment.

reviews.author: Ara A.
reviews.description: Good options for tastings or flights, excellent service and they often have live music. Lots seating area both inside and outside.

reviews.author: Dawn H.
reviews.description: Great service, even better place to hang out. I love cider for summer day drinking, light and easy. I also love that Eastciders has several less-sweet offerings. Now they have seltzer--which is delicious--who knows when that launched but I took a 6-pack home with me.

reviews.author: Paul L.
reviews.description: Back in 2015 I was on a business trip in Oklahoma City. On the last day of my trip I took the time to go into the city and explore as my flight wasn't until the evening. For brunch I stopped into Kitchen No 324 for their eggs Benedict. I noticed a Honey Cider available on the menu and decided to try it. This is the day (even to this day) I discovered my favorite hard cider of all time. Austin East Cider's Honey Cider has such a smooth taste that balances the honey, brown sugar and hard apple cider to give you a complete blueprint of the perfect cider.   Fast forward to today and Austin East Ciders (and the shipping wizards) finally opened up ordering online for shipping and delivery. Amanda noticed this and ordered some as a surprise birthday present. The Honey Cider is as good as I remember it. Definitely recommend trying this product.

reviews.author: Kristin K.
reviews.description: My best friend has a gluten allergy, so Austin Eastciders have been a favorite of ours to order out or buy in a six pack. We were SO excited to come. The atmosphere is very chill, laid back. Great place to hang with friends and catch a game. We didn't try the food. The ciders are delish, as to be expected. Would've gotten 5/5 but their mixed drinks are trash. Don't order them!

reviews.author: Paul V.
reviews.description: Visited Austin Eastciders on a recent vacation to Austin.  I wish I had a copy of it now that I'm back home. They had a large variety of ciders to try (definitely recommend a flight or two to sample them), an outdoor space to enjoy the weather, and a food truck outside if you want a bite to eat.  The ciders range across the spectrum from sweet to dry, fruity, spiced, something for everyone.  Parking was a little tough due to the popularity of the other businesses (as well as Eastciders) right around there.

reviews.author: Jeremiah G.
reviews.description: Really dope place. They have only been open for... 3 weeks(?) now but they definitely have something for everybody; amazing, custom Cider based cocktails. For food we only had the queso and chips but two many cocktails to count. If you are a cider fan and want to support a Cider based Austin group do yourself a favor and stop by. The only thing I would say is, get their early so you don't have to wait for 30+ minutes. But, they validate parking so if you bring a waiting beer you will be fine.

reviews.author: Justin N.
reviews.description: Went here on a whim. Overall i would recommend this place.   I'll start with the food.   We had the fried pickles and the wings (naked). The pickles were very good and the wings were a bit bland. For entrees we have the slider trio and the tacos (mahi and chicken). The slider trio was very very good. The BBQ was delicious, though the brisket was a little fatty. But the turkey and pulled pork with the bread combo were delicious. The tacos were also very good. The mahi was a little more spicy than expected but still good. We also had a few beers off the draft. Wish they had a little bigger selection here, but what they had was ok.   Staff.   They were very friendly. We sat at the bar as it was seat yourself anywhere in the place. Overall it was ok service. Would not say it was the best. Clearly they need more staff but i know how hard staffing is these days due to covid so i will not hold it against them. Though it did make getting food/drinks kind of slow but we were not in a hurry.   Cleanliness.   This is where i take a star. It was ok but the bathrooms men and women were gross and clearly ignored. The overall establishment just felt like it needed a good cleaning. While we were sitting at the bar a couple silver fish ended up crawling on me. Luckily this was at the end of my meal otherwise i have no idea what i might have done during. Cleanliness is important and an indicator of whether i would go back or not. I'll have to put some thought into it.

reviews.author: Mark A.
reviews.description: Never heard of A TX Twinkie before so I had to give it a try; it's basically just a jalapeno popper. I was hoping it was a bit more cooked. I think it was underdone and too hard so it was a bit tough to eat.  The 2 plate bbq dish was good though, especially the brisket (how can you go wrong with brisket?). The "coleslaw" wasn't the best and could have used more seasoning and either a better vinegar or mayo base to give it a better texture.  The drinks are pretty good and their atmosphere is overall nice; would definitely go again and check out their HH menu.

reviews.author: Megan V.
reviews.description: They no longer do bottomless mimosas! I came for that exact reason and was pretty disappointed when I found out they discontinued it. We instead ordered the mimosa carafe for $12. Presentation could have been better. They were just served in normal water glasses which made the mimosas go flat pretty quickly.  We ordered the Whiskey-infused Banana Bread French toast and the Eastside Benedict. Banana bread is on the crunchier side as opposed to fluffy (which I don't mind). My friend liked her benedict and thought the brisket was cooked well!  I was not blown away by any means, but I may come back another time to try out their dinner menu.

reviews.author: Emily N.
reviews.description: I had the bacon cheeseburger and brisket tater tots. Both were delicious and very filling although a bit pricey. The restaurant is great for large groups and handles reservations for 25+. The waiter was very attentive and accommodating. I would come back again!

reviews.author: Elizabeth J.
reviews.description: Loved this place. Low key and fun vibe. Great prices and food options . Everything was yummy. Great service too !

reviews.author: Megan L.
reviews.description: I hate that this is one of the last remaining bottomless mimosa spots in Austin because I would give it lower than one star if I could. The food sucks, and the service is even worse. I came once during July 4thweekend, and it started pouring. Waiters would still bring food on trays that had an inch of water in it, and I was one of those unlucky ones who received food after it started raining. I asked the waiter if it was possible to return my food because it was drenched in rainwater, and he said it was too late because I had already ordered it. Excuse me?? I was genuinely shocked. I went downstairs to ask a manager if I could get a refund, and he said I would have to dispute it with the online ordering system company. Absolutely ridiculous. I couldn't say enough negative things about this establishment. Please, anybody else, do bottomless mimosas because I'm tired of having only this one crappy place be the go-to despite how terrible the service and food is.

reviews.author: Ganina R.
reviews.description: I'm really upset with spending my money here! The food was ok but the service was extremely horrible! Super disappointed with how our server treated us. I work in the culinary industry and was a server before it's not that hard to be a good decent service. I would highly recommend getting you're servers the proper training on how to treat your customers.

reviews.author: Marissa T.
reviews.description: What a vibe here! Natural lighting, lots of seating options, and drinks kept on coming!  There's a small parking lot where I was able to snag a spot so we are off to a good start! Music is good and service was nice and friendly.  Got the smoked wings for an appetizer and bottomless mimosas to start. The wings were good and the homemade bbq sauce was sweet tangy and a hint of spice, *chef kiss. For brunch I got the breakfast taco plate, it was good as well!   Great spot to checkout for bottomless drinks/brunch/bbq

reviews.author: Ariane V.
reviews.description: DON'T WASTE YOUR TIME HERE!  Decided to visit this place as it kept on popping up on TikTok. Service was horrible!  There was a confusion on our table. We asked for an umbrella, the server said she'll go check and when she came back she said they had broke? Then we asked if we could be switched tables and there was a big confusion between the servers. We were blamed for the confusion and on top of that the manager handled the situation really bad! She asked us to pay and box our food and leave, the way she talked to us was very unprofessional. Then the server confronted us and asked who was the one that got her in trouble and lied to the manager that we had cursed her out. LIES LIES LIES. Like really????  Overall POOR MANAGEMENT and HORRIBLE SERVICE.  On top of that the food was nasty!

reviews.author: Edgar R.
reviews.description: Went today during brunch to celebrate my birthday and my experience was probably the worst I've ever had at any restaurant.  I asked the hostess to place us on the waitlist for a table inside and she tells me it'll be about 30 min wait. In the meantime, my party and I decided to sit outside and order a drink while we wait. We never got a text letting us know that a table was ready.   We stayed outside and ordered food. 3 of us ordered the chicken sandwich, one of us ordered the brunch burger, and another friend ordered the Brussel sprouts. Well, everyone got their food except me. I waited a little over an hour, asked 3 different waiters, until I finally got my food. My entire party was already done eating.   I had also ordered the bottomless mimosas, but I never received that either. Everyone at my table kept getting their drinks, while I was still waiting for mine. I got up, went downstairs, and asked the hostess if she could remove the mimosa from my tab since I never received it.   Food is ok, but service is TERRIBLE. Still can't believe how bad of an experience I had.

reviews.author: Janet B.
reviews.description: This was such a fun place! We aren't from Austin, but we were diligently seeking a sports bar to catch the Cowboys wild card playoff game. (Newsflash: they lost.) Anyway, we showed up to this place and we almost left because it was sooooo packed! It was during their famous brunch time, and so we had to get the mimosa carafe. We ended up changing seats when the bar opened up, so we'd have a view of the game. Loved all the ladies working there. They were nice, friendly, funny, and it made it such a fun day! We ate some loaded fries but added their brisket- omg so good! Also had some fried pickles, but forgot to take a photo.

reviews.author: Brandon T.
reviews.description: I was invited to come here by one of my peers and the locations and the views were great. Not to mention the food or the East austin energy I felt while brunching here. Everyone is happy and enjoying the beautiful weather. As I got a chance to look at the menu I only took a glance and new exactly what I wanted. The Trifecta is amazing and it just complements an already near perfect experience at eating here.

reviews.author: Shelbie P.
reviews.description: My friends and I were visiting Austin for a 30th birthday. We were looking for a bottomless mimosa brunch spot so we looked online and found this place. It turns out that they do not do bottomless mimosas they just sell the bottle or glass by their price. So they should really take off their advertisement of $14 bottomless mimosas because we would have went elsewhere. When we were there, the app that they have went down, so everything was chaotic and no organization was there. My friends and I ordered food and drinks, my friends food came out but mine did not and it was a whole ordeal to get my food. I ended up having them box it up because my friends already finished their food because I didn't want them to wait for mine and have their food get cold. I spoke to the manager on shift and she basically was just trying to make excuses for all their mistakes rather than just own up to them and apologize for all the miscommunication going on that day. Katie, the server, who wasn't even our server, was AMAZING. She was the only one who truly cared about our problems going on and she will literally be the only reason we would ever come back to this place. She should be placed in management. If you do visit here, ask for Katie to be your server because then you will have a great experience for sure!

reviews.author: Laura F.
reviews.description: We used to love EastSide Tavern and sitting at the rooftop was our fave thing to do. Today was not the best experience. You have to order and pay through an application which removed the ability to receive our meal in courses. We got appetizers and meal all at once. It took over 45minutes to get our food which was subpar. The cornbread was completely burned. The BLT sandwich literally had one slice of bacon and the queso was lukewarm. This is a foodie town and today's experience was below quality considering citywide options.

reviews.author: Veronika F.
reviews.description: This review is not for our server, Zach, who provided excellent service. This review reflects the nonsensical reservation system that requires one to email (not call... email) 24 hours in advance. I emailed a bit over 24 hours ahead and they said that my requested time wasn't available, which makes no sense if reservations are indeed only taken 24 hours in advance. We were seated outside in the baking sun with no umbrella because they are a "liability." We were told that outside seating with shade was completely reserved which again makes no sense because we again emailed over 24 hours ahead of time. We were also told that there was no inside seating and that they "can't control the weather." It's Texas in April, you need to provide people with some kind of shade. Disappointing as this used to be a favorite bottomless brunch spot. No bottomless, no logical reservation system. Go somewhere else.

reviews.author: Kristi M.
reviews.description: Social distance what? They've never heard of it clearly. I know times are crazy but this felt very pre-covid with how many people were smushed into the restaurant.   We came for brunch and the food was just okay. Nothing special. We got Brussel sprouts, nachos, and the breakfast bowls. We had mimosas but they were out of orange juice?(lol) they had cranberry and grapefruit juice instead.   P.s. Parking lot is like maybe 8 spots so not exactly ideal.

reviews.author: Bill K.
reviews.description: Lousy food and drink served up with an attitude. I ordered a margarita that was made with an artificial mixer, and was not made with dress squeezed limes. I politley told the waitress it did not taste right and seemed artificial. She got all upset when I asked for a Hazy Beer instead, and stormed off, only to return with a Lager instead of the Hazy.  I ordered the 3 meat BBQ plate. All three meats were totally dry, and tasted like nothing. The wife ordered the 2 meat plate; both meats were dry and tasteless.   $85 dollars for lousy food and service.

reviews.author: Kasey M.
reviews.description: This place was amazing. Magically decorated for Christmas! Chill dog friendly patio. Queso was good. Burger and fries were amazing. What really made the experience 5 stars though was our server Katie. All around rock star and kind soul. Will be back to see her again. PS HIGHLY RECOMMEND MARGARITA WITH PINEAPPLE JALAPEO FLOATER + CHAMOY

reviews.author: Amy G.
reviews.description: Adding to my existing reviews with a pro tip - ranch is the best dipping sauce to accompany their garlic parm fries.

reviews.author: Joe S.
reviews.description: I today was my first time eating there I walked in the place smelled great look clean people were friendly but once I wanted it to me played it was the worst brisket I've ever tasted the sausage did not taste like it was either smoked or cooked in a pit brisket clearly was Yesterdays brick brisket just reheated in the oven it had that reheated taste I've been around barbecue all my life I have work in restaurants and you can tell when somethings been reheat it or from the day before will never go there again

name: Red Horn Coffee House and Brewing Company
accommodations: Best nights on Thursday, Friday, Saturday

reviews.author: A.J. T.
reviews.description: Stumbled upon this place while walking the area as my car was being worked on across the way. Walking in gave me comforting coffeeshop vibes, with mostly tables of small parties 2-3 drinking beer and socializing.  Having no idea what to order, staff made some recommendations for a flight that were all fantastic. My favorites were the Cuerno Rojo (lightly carbonated and very smooth) and the Continental Breakfast (heavier stout but tastes just like French Toast and Maple syrup). I had to do a double take that I wasn't just drinking syrup but the flavors were spot on!  I'll be back again with friends/family and hopefully get to enjoy the great coffee I was smelling as well!

reviews.author: Eric N.
reviews.description: Excellent spot! Great beer made in house! Love the new menu items! Very cool vibe. Need a place to enjoy good coffee or beer this is it!

reviews.author: Amberly F.
reviews.description: Met the girls for some high noon drinks. Definitely a busy place. We were excited to actually get a spot to sit with only 4 of us. The options here were so amazing and such a fun mix. I did enjoy that even when I ordered coffee they asked if I wanted to start a tab as if I was at a bar. This place was loud and seemed like a great place to enjoy some fun. They do have outdoor seating with heaters and covered. All in all I'd say I will go back again but maybe not on a weekend next time.

reviews.author: Isac F.
reviews.description: Amazing coffee.  They definitely dont let down here.  Always something solid and bold.  Atmosphere is great for the right person. I wear hearing aids and its a little loud for me.  For some peeps this would be great ambiance.   I recommend this play to anyone looking for a good hangout place.

reviews.author: Corey W.
reviews.description: Solid place to work remote, good coffee, great beer, tasty tacos, and friendly staff. I like to come up here on fridays and work from the bar.

reviews.author: Elissa S.
reviews.description: Nice little spot in Cedar Park! I met up with a friend here; it was my first time. It was surprisingly busy for a Thursday mid-morning but we scored the plushy chairs near the window. Food and drink were both great, as was the customer service. I thought it was interesting that they served both coffee and beer.

reviews.author: Jennifer L.
reviews.description: Fall in love with this hidden gem in Cedar Park. The place is clean, cozy with outstanding services. The hot panini is the bomb.

reviews.author: Crystal Z.
reviews.description: Great atmosphere, you can get work done here, great spot to meet up with friends and have a drink, they do have a good menu  all round chill spot to hang out at. Definitely stop by to check it out with friends or cool remote work / study spot!

reviews.author: David K.
reviews.description: Just wanted to update this one. Red Horn just gets better and better with age and has really turned into a community institution - especially during the pandemic when they switched to "to go" beers that we could all take out to the parking lot and drink while socially distanced. Fortunately those days are past us but I think I will always have a soft spot in my heart for this place that was a little bit of sanity amidst all the insanity.   As for the fare itself? The beers rotate and you can't  go wrong because they will always let you sample (I'm a strawberry pop-tart ravioli fan - and yes that's a beer). Pair that beer (or wine) with a meat and cheese tray or maybe a panini and you have absolutely nothing to complain about. They even have food trucks on most days...  Thanks for being here Red Horn.

reviews.author: Michelle J.
reviews.description: Another great coffee and more place. They serve food and alcoholic. Live music sometimes. Great ambience for working or date night.

reviews.author: Kevin P.
reviews.description: Both locations offer good coffee and craft beer brewed locally. Simple earthy laid back environment great for quick social gatherings or transitional business engagements. This isn't Starbucks or a. ar so adjust your expectations. Unique and fairly priced.

reviews.author: Garrett N.
reviews.description: Love me some Red Horn coffee!   The atmosphere and service are both outstanding.  Any questions I had about coffee were answered, the help was super helpful.  Really appreciate the indoor and outdoor seating.  Really live the tables and decor, rustic hand built feel but comfortable.  Snack food is overpriced but everything else is top notch.

reviews.author: Shari M.
reviews.description: Excellent beer and coffee with friendly service. Nice atmosphere inside and outside. Only complaint is that as someone with dietary restrictions, there is no food on the menu I can eat. But my husband lives the food, so...

reviews.author: Gerald C.
reviews.description: very cool atmosphere with both a brewery and coffee shop vibe mashed together without clashing. I got the Gordon Ramsey coffee and it was obviously made by someone who knows how to craft a latte. I do wish the flavor complimented the espresso more or punched above the espresso. It was too balanced, if that's even a thing. I will definitely return next time i'm in town to see what pieces of coffee art they come up with next!

reviews.author: Milton C.
reviews.description: We chose Red Horn Coffee after perusing local coffee spots for some good coffee. Red Horn was very highly rated and the photos looked like they offered genuine espresso beverages. Red Horn offered a number of non-dairy options so I would not destroy my stomach on my pending road trip. We ordered Americans with a half inch of steamed oat milk. The coffee was very smooth. The espresso taste was still solid enough that I knew I was drinking espresso. I.e. Not watered down at all. All-in-all a great cup of coffee that hit the spot.

reviews.author: LisaK B.
reviews.description: This is a neat place and my friend loves it -- but she likes beer and Ales, and I just -- don't.  There was a choice of 3-4 red wines, and white wine, too. But I don't believe in spending $12 a glass for wine -- especially at a coffee/brew  pub.  While they listed an $8 or $9 red wine (on a menu in front of register), they conveniently only had the $12  wine.  It is a neat place, I "get" that people like it, but I don't plan to return.  I can go across the street, get good food and drinks at happy hour, or lunch.  And not feel ripped off.  (the serving size seemed less than average, too).

reviews.author: Anna C.
reviews.description: Not sure where to fault this place, honestly. First time here and the three beers we tried were excellent: a nitro double IPA, an black ale, and a Czech pilz. The interior ambiance was dark, cozy, and perfect for an intimate convo, remote work, or even games with friends. I have two small children so helped myself to the outdoor covered and heated patio. The kids enjoyed the chips and salsa while we sipped our stellar brews. Excited to try the Leander location that is actually closer to us. 10/10 plan to come back, especially to try the coffee.

reviews.author: Jenny K.
reviews.description: I'll be back soon!! One of the best coffees I've had, so good I had two during my short stay here. It's hard to find decaf that isn't boring and the decaf here is strong and full of flavor! I even purchased a pound of decaf beans to take home.   I pulled up and my first thought was that the vibe was more brewery than coffee shop and I was right, but I was wrong that the coffee would just be an afterthought.
