reviews.description: Pretty good burger on Sixth St!   The place is a fun bar at night, with a big Jackalope Statue you can climb up onto. However, I also came earlier in the night to grab a bite. I had a bacon and Brie burger, but I substituted the patty for an impossible patty. There was plenty of cheese and lots of pickles on it.

reviews.author: Terry P.
reviews.description: Our bartender "Happy Hour" aka Justin, was the bomb. Just enough rough and sparky. Loved him. He also pour a really good cocktail.   Try the fried pickles. They are yummy and hit the spot.

reviews.author: Christine M.
reviews.description: This place was absolutely empty due to the cold weather but the atmosphere was modern and inviting. I loved the jackalope that i was able to climb and sit on the most . I would go back, but on a warmer night !

reviews.author: Christine L.
reviews.description: IF I COULD GIVE THIS PLACE ZERO STARS - I WOULD.   DO NOT COME HERE IF YOU ARE TRYING TO HAVE A GOOD TIME.   We came here during a BACHELORETTE.  I understand circumstances are weird due to COVID-19.  I get that. We ALL get that. We are in Austin visiting for our best friends bachelorette and on our second night here we decided to take the advice from our waiter at Caroline's and go to The Jackalope.  We went there at 9pm just to check it out and our bartender, Bart, gave us complimentary drinks. We were so thankful, we paid for the giant mixed drink and went next door for a few hours and then went back to The Jackalope because the bride requested it. We sat down for 20 minutes even ordered some drinks (which they never brought) and they were playing the jams -- so naturally we started dancing around our table.   Even the other bartender, Dimitrius, was hitting on one of our bridesmaids HEAVILY and hanging around with us while we were dancing - not even one whole song went by before Dimitrius told us we couldn't be dancing and that we needed to be in our seats. We said okay, that sucks but sure. So we sat down and made sure our butts where planted -- next thing you know some random came up to us and started twerking at our table then on jumped on the couch and started twerking and spreading her legs in the air. Again - SHE WAS NOT WITH US. None of us even knew who she was. Immediately, some angry bartender (that clearly needs to get laid) with a ponytail ran over to us being loud and demanding that WE get out meanwhile Twerker conveniently slinks on back to her table    I can understand if we were the ones doing THAT and you wanted to kick us out - FINE.  But that was not the case. No one wanted to even hear us out, one of our bridesmaids does not drink and she was very civil in trying to explain to Ponytail Bartender but he literally was non-stop raising his voice to us. He even yells at Bart to come over - and this fool just straight up decides to "go with his boys on this one" and preceded to gesture us to get out  Ponytail could not WAIT to kick us out, let me tell you. Like there's some underlying issues there  He yelled at us saying "You're not even ordering drinks! You're not even ordering food!!!" NOPE. Wrong again, Ponytail.   We DID order food and drinks but your stubborn hating ass didn't accommodate us  Meanwhile Twerker (aka THE PROBLEM) is still running rampant inside the bar   Also, the pink haired lady was GOD AWFUL. Not helpful whatsoever.  Bart you were the biggest disappointment, and Ponytail -- you just suck. Thank you for ending our night horribly and giving us a HORRIBLE first trip experience.   I do not recommend this place whatsoever for anyone who is looking to actually have a good time.

reviews.author: Tamrynn H.
reviews.description: I used to love this place..the drinks are cheap and the food is good.  It was actually the first bar I went to when I turned 21.  However now, the bald bartender that is on the heavy side is a TOTAL DICK.  HE PRACTICALLY YELLED AT ME!  He seems to always be there too.  I gave a card tk hold and I was going to pay cash at the end...well, during shift change he said he doesn't do that and I need to pay each time.....umm, u have my card, idiot.  I still tipped him but he is an asshat.  I won't go back if he is working.

reviews.author: James R.
reviews.description: Great food, good location, good portions. The only thing that was not great was the bar tender, not the friendliest person. But he didn't ruin the experience and the food

reviews.author: Karla D.
reviews.description: Holy poo this is absolutely hand down, no questions asked my favorite bar in Austin! In fact it's in my top two. That's right, top two.  I just love everything about this place. It's on Sixth and sure it gets the tourists in but it's definitely a hang out for regulars. Because we have family in Austin, we're here often. If it were in Pittsburgh it would definitely be one of my locals.  The beer selection is fabulous and so are the prices. The crowd is cool and fun.  The Mac and Cheese Burger is so freaking good and yummy and big! Definitely shared it with the boyfriend.  My favorite cocktail is The Jezebel. It's tasty and refreshing.   Dive bar personified!

name: The Wheel
accommodations: Best nights on Tuesday, Friday, Saturday

reviews.author: Victor H.
reviews.description: (from June 2021)  One dope ass bar!  The bartenders, ambiance, drink selection, and people make this place a blast.  They have multitude of whiskeys and beers to pick from.  Plus the outdoor seating and dog friendly atmosphere make this a chill spot for mingling with friends or soaking in the awesomeness of the state capital of Texas.  They also sell awesome shirts.  Sadly the Excite Bike shirt I saw the bartender rocking wasn't available so I settled for the blue shirt.  Please get more of those in!  The Wheel, keep on spinning!

reviews.author: Rob P.
reviews.description: Finally got to try The Wheel after a long wait. Moved to the neighborhood almost a year ago and when I tried to come here, they hadn't reopened. Came today to have a celebratory vaccine cocktail. It looks like they used to have a $4 whisky of the day... well, it's now $5 but the winning bet is to make it as a cocktail for $8. An $8 old fashioned? Can't say I'm mad about that. Jenny behind the bar was super friendly and I gotta say it's nice to sit at an actual bar again.

reviews.author: Misha T.
reviews.description: Good bar. Lots of wheels. Indoor and outdoor seating with a solid beer selection. Staff is gruff but responsive. No complaints.

reviews.author: Amanda P.
reviews.description: Wonderful cocktails and beautifully presented! Love the intimate ambience of this place even with covid plexi-glass in place inside. Bar staff was very kind and very knowledgeable which is greatly appreciated. Outdoor and indoor seating options were great. Crowded on a Friday night which is a good sign!

reviews.author: Laurene A.
reviews.description: Update: We left a cash tip for our $66 tab, and after the charge cleared, we just found out they charged us a $15 tip on top of the cash we left. We have spent a month fighting it with the credit card company. It's disappointing because the staff there was great. And the drinks were fantastic, but this kind of behavior is pathetic and makes us question returning.

reviews.author: Alysha M.
reviews.description: Great spot! Super awesome bartenders, very chill vibes. Go have dinner across the street at Sour Duck and then come here for a cocktail :)

reviews.author: Emily J.
reviews.description: Love the dark and divey vibe! Super cool! We live a couple blocks away and I am kicking myself in the ass for never coming here before! Def kinda bar

reviews.author: Melissa H.
reviews.description: I got stood up on a date here but Jenny and the other bar staff turned it into such a fun night! They made me the most delicious Daiquiri and had me laughing almost to the point of tears. My new favorite spot!! Awesome staff, delicious drinks, and guaranteed to cheer you up if you're having a bad night! 10/10!

reviews.author: Aarti P.
reviews.description: Been here a few times, sat outside, sat inside!! It's just one of those solid kind of places that you know you are guaranteed a satisfying drink served up by a friendly and knowledgeable team surrounded by others who like me just want a nice chill environment to sip on their libations.

reviews.author: Winston M.
reviews.description: Big shoutout to the staff at The Wheel for creating a welcoming and responsible environment! They're following all the safety protocols while still offering a relaxed and warm outdoor bar experience. Thank you!!!  Came here yesterday with my housemates to enjoy their cocktails with some ADP. The Layla and Ashley are perfect pairings with the warm weather and ADP's tortas.

reviews.author: Nicholas B.
reviews.description: I really want to like this bar. It's cute, has a nice variety of seating... inside and outside and kinda-dense-in-a-good-way. The bartenders are cool folks with lots of great knowledge. The music isn't too loud - a good volume for talking but still bumping :-)  Unfortunately though... its quite expensive, and the staff isn't super transparent about the pricing. For instance, the whiskey of the day is supposed to be $5. I got it with ice, and was charged an extra dollar. This might be trivial, but it sucks getting charged without warning, especially for something that shouldn't get an upcharge (even if the on-the-rocks pour is slightly more liquid)... kinda like getting charged for napkins. And in general, everything's pretty pricey for a neighborhood bar.  I guess I'm a little too old school for all the new hotness in Austin. But I don't see any reason to visit The Wheel when you have so many other places that are both inexpensive and cool.

reviews.author: Zachary A.
reviews.description: Parking can be troublessome, and space is limited, but easy to have a good time here.  More of a hangout spot than a sports bar.  No TV, limited beer selection that runs out quickly (both IPA kegs tapped out on a random Tuesday night), and no food.  You come here to let the night get away from you and order some strong cocktails.  Lots of outdoor space is cool and bring your own food is actually a plus in my book.  Beer selection 8 on draft, but good prices at $7/ish per big pour.  Everyone is nice and vibe seems 20s-30s clientele. I liked the Wheel for what it is, a good starting point nearby my apartment to begin a drinking night.

reviews.author: Tristan B.
reviews.description: In a town exploding in size and popularity, The Wheel retains a strong neighborhood feel. The bartenders are extremely friendly and seemed genuinely interested in conversation beyond just your tip.   They definitely specialize in cocktails so I would probably look elsewhere if you are looking for a nice draft or bottle of Shiner. I had 2 different specialty cocktails, both of which were good but definitely on the pricier side ($10-$15 each).   They have a large patio space for meeting up with friends and the indoor bar is intimate enough to make it a decent  first date spot worth checking out.

reviews.author: Jeff C. J.
reviews.description: Cool vibe, friendly staff, loud music. Great cocktails! Expertly made with detail, unique bitters, and perfectly balanced.

reviews.author: Leila R.
reviews.description: They redid their patio and it is spectacular! Covered? Check. Heat lamps? Check. Amazing way to spend any giving evening in ATX? Check!  Ok, so this place is just super adorbs in a very approachable, contempo-rustic, "shhhh, don't tell anyone or else the ubiquitous "they" will ruin it for the rest of us" kinda way.   The barkeeps know their stuffs, their cocktails are legend (wait for it) dary without the arrogance or pretension you might expect from a place of this caliber; I think the lack of self-importance this place and the staff exude is one of my favorite things about it!  If you are looking for a low-key place to drink handcrafted, amazing cocktails (the Madison, I'm just saying) in front of a draught-tap water fountain amidst a menagerie of interesting EastSide Austin folk, then come here and enjoy (you can even have ADP delivered!). Just please remember...mum's the word, the password changes daily, and if fratty bros or hipsters catch wind of this place...I will look for you, I will find you, and I will give you the spiciest side-eye of your life!

reviews.author: Amanda S.
reviews.description: Sometimes I need .... A little bit of Madison in my life, a little bit of Molly by my side A little bit of Layla is all I need, a little bit of Ashley is what I see A little bit of Lyllian in the sun, a little bit of Avery all night long  Lou Bega anyone? This place is definitely cool for sure! I love the cocktails and all the ladies names, very cute!  My friend introduced me to this new spot.  It is located off Martin Luther King right next to the Austin daily Press.  The inside bar are is small and quaint.  I love the side patio and this is where I spent a beautiful evening sipping on some cocktails and enjoying a sandwich which was delivered from next door.  I had the Molly and the Layla cocktails and both were excellent, refreshing and went down nice and smooth.  The patio has a gorgeous fountain with tons of beer taps spouting out water ... it was cool and creative feature to the atmosphere.    The bartenders here are super nice and professional!  If you are in the area I would absolutely recommend stopping in here for a Molly or Madison in your life!

reviews.author: Oscar N.
reviews.description: A local gem, with awesome bartenders and affordable drink prices. A highlight is their whiskey of the day 4 dollar wells and 7 dollar cocktails. Great indoor and outdoor season and a great place for a date or meet up.

reviews.author: Kim Z.
reviews.description: I was in Austin for a conference and stumbled on this bar thanks to Yelp. I truly enjoyed every minute of the experience, and my tasty Old Fashioned which was a perfect choice to compliment the atmosphere. The bar tenders are super friendly and the place is eclectic, dark and decorated in a vintage style. They also have the best t-shirts I have ever seen at a bar. I was bummed that the Excite Bike 80s Nintendo themed shirt was sold out in my size because I'd be rocking that all the time. Good vibes, great ambience and a great spot to hang after a long day.

reviews.author: Sarah M.
reviews.description: The Wheel was really well decorated, which set the evening off to a good start. The indoor area is intimate, dimly lit, and has a sort of prohibition-era bar feel with its tin ceiling, newspaper clipping wallpaper, and red lighting. Outside, you'll find a large patio with lots tables, and a great fountain made from beer taps. The drinks... well, my beer was way too expensive for what it was (a fairly generic IPA), and their selection for beers was limited (on draft: 8 taps, 1 IPA). HOWEVER, I know that's mainly due to the fact that The Wheel's specialty is whiskey. If whiskey's your drink of choice, I'm sure you'll love it here. They have $4 daily specials, and a number of specialty cocktails.  I'm glad I gave it a shot, and I'll definitely recommend it to my whiskey drinking friends, but if you're looking for anything besides whiskey (or maybe a nice cocktail) I'd steer you elsewhere.

reviews.author: Jon B.
reviews.description: Went in on a weekday, atmosphere is always dead/quiet. I ordered a few rounds and was surprised to see something in my drink. I think the taps need to be cleaned... on top of that the bartender automatically added the tip to my bill. Oh well, I wont be coming back.

reviews.author: Lilia S.
reviews.description: Great place for a date night or just going with friends, drinks are always delicious and there's plenty of options to try. I started liking mezcal after coming here, definitely try it out -- the place is very intimate! Love it

reviews.author: Jake H.
reviews.description: Techo Mezcaleria and Agave Bar is a great speakeasy on Manor Rd. If you are a fan of mezcal and/or tequila, this is the place for you. Small bar with a patio too (with a heater). Ian is a great bartender and took care of us. You should definitely try the "stuff in a cup" (Ian's favorite mezcal cocktail with passion fruit). The spicy mango mezcal margarita was also enjoyable or you can sip one too. Great spot to to ring in the new year.

reviews.author: Shradha A.
reviews.description: Really cool concept, with mediocre drinks. It was a nice spot that transported one to a LatAm local bar. But the drinks are disappointing. It's a really small space so getting a seat is a coin toss.

reviews.author: lea c.
reviews.description: This place is very confusing on how to actually fine. I thought it was connected to meet Madrid. But it is not. Actually go next-door and then to their backyard and then go up and you are at the spot. It's very small it's almost gives you a speakeasy feel. The bartenders were super cool and we really enjoyed our time there. It was a group of seven of us and we took up most of the bar. Drinks are very good as well. If you're not a tequila fan this is not for you but you should still try to experience it at least once. They have frozen on the rocks and other delicious cocktails.

reviews.author: Laurene A.
reviews.description: LOVE! LOVE! LOVE! I have been driving by Techo everyday for years, and we frequent the area for the other restaurants and bars, but for some dumb reason beyond comprehension, we never gave them a try. We are completely hooked now! The space is cozy, intimate, and inviting. The drinks are just out of this world, and SO strong! The flavors are unique, and even if you aren't a mezcal fan, some of the drinks completely cover up what's even in it! They had a cool nook tucked away next to the bar that we are hoping to sit in once things open back some more, and we would love to hang out inside and enjoy their cool vibe inside! The patio is tucked away upstairs, and even though it's in a busy area right along the street, you don't even notice! They have TONS of misting fans outside that made the 102 degree heat totally tolerable for once!   They had dog bowls out, so I would venture to say they are dog friendly, which we plan to take advantage of very soon!

reviews.author: Alexandra W.
reviews.description: Ambiance is everything here. In an unassuming spot, If like you like mezcal or tequila you won't be disappointed. As an FYI you have to go through school house pub to find this spot

reviews.author: Jennifer L.
reviews.description: Hands down one of the cutest Mezcal bars I've been to. It's not very big, as most mezcal bars seem to be, but such a nice space. Cool little nook that seats about four. Great mezcal recommendations and the cocktails were delish. I highly recommend the Crudo, Ta Cabron, and Tepache.

reviews.author: Keristen B.
reviews.description: I hesitate to write this review because I love that Techo currently feels like a secret, locals only Mezcal bar. But they have my favorite margarita in town, incredible ambiance and authentic tasting experiences - that you just have to KNOW about it. This is the first bar I bring visitors too - usually right when they open, so we can snag seats at the bar and get guided Mezcal tastings from Techo's very knowledgeable and easygoing staff. I never leave without ordering at least one of their Frozen Guava Agave Margaritas with the chili salt rim (do NOT pass on the home-made chili salt, it is the perfect pair for this sweet/tart drink).  Every one of my girlfriends love that drink! My boyfriend also loves that he can get a strong mezcal centered cocktail from their list (which has 10-12 house cocktails that are great). Their Micheladas are also a crowd fave.   When you start to get hungry - walk to Salty Sow for happy hour apps or down to Patrizi's to share some crazy good home-made Italian food from a food truck! You'll have a line at Patrizi's - but it's a great option for your visiting friends, who have probably never had an Italian food truck experience.

reviews.author: Lindsey L.
reviews.description: This has to be one of the cutest mezcal bars I've been to. The vibe is very cozy and intimate, tucked away above Mi Madre. We sat in this little nook that had seating for four, it felt very private from the rest of the bar, we enjoyed it! I had their mezcal margarita and the flavor was so good, I will definitely be back!

reviews.author: Brandon R.
reviews.description: This place is a fantastic hideout. Kind of small but fits the rustic atmosphere.   Bar tenders were very knowledgeable and attentive. Tried my first mezcal margarita there and have a new favorite cocktail (normally prefer an old fashioned).   Fried crickets are a nice add on as well.   Will definitely go back. A date might be more impressed by this than another random brewery!

reviews.author: Alysha M.
reviews.description: Love this place. Perfect date spot. Awesome service, amazing drinks. Very romantic feel, kind of secret and hidden, off the beaten path. Don't even want to post this review because I'm afraid more people will start crowding...

reviews.author: Jacob R.
reviews.description: Awesome mezcal bar, have to go up the stairs. Recommend the Mezcals in the green bottles!

reviews.author: Trish C.
reviews.description: Selfishly I hate to say everything I love about this place because one of the character points is how small and intimate is. But I think the words out because it is really rocking Friday and Saturday night! What I love most... amazing bartenders and mixologist... They enjoy making something to please you if they don't have a line 5 people back. I can go on and on but let's just say if you like Mezcal and tequila this place will not disappoint!

reviews.author: Everett T.
reviews.description: Techo Mezcaleria reminds me of why I still love Austin: the unusual, hidden gems that are tucked away all around the city.  Most other folks already hit the highlights. It's tiny, seats maybe 10, and you enter through the Schoolhouse Pub gate, despite Techo actually being on the second story of Mi Madres. Word of caution: Mezcal ranges from "lightly smoky" to "I'm drinking liquid smoke." Personally it's not something I can have a lot of, we had three sample sized shots and that was plenty between the two of us. Just be forewarned.   Our bartender Ian was awesome, we had a nice, rambling forty minute conversation about mezcal versus tequila versus whisky. Unfortunately, we went on a Saturday when there wasn't a happy hour, so we didn't get a chance to sample the margaritas, but that gives us a great excuse to go back.

reviews.author: Kevin L.
reviews.description: My first time here tonight and it's the day of the dead celebration. Just found my new favorite bar. I'm having a special drink they have only for tonight with mezcal and a touch of absinthe. I'll be back.

reviews.author: Abby M.
reviews.description: Mixed feelings, liked the drinks, liked the overall vibe, but will forever be remembered as that place where a guy in front of us in line told my friend and I we should have a man order drinks for us and continue on in a bizarre manner. I feel everyone gave him the "just a dumb drunk pass" but the more I think about it the more I think if he was drunk like that maybe he shouldn't have been served anymore or asked to leave. Also this was around 6-8pm not your average time for people to be so belligerent. Drink pictured is the violeta.

reviews.author: Michael H.
reviews.description: Awesome selection of tequila and mezcal at this little cute bar found upstairs. Extremely crowded in the evening around 6P, probably due to their happy hour. Enjoyed our drinks though except for the overly sweet frozen margaritas.

reviews.author: Javier R.
reviews.description: Great place if you love mezcal. Micheladas are also very good! Definitely try their crickets.  Bartenders are very knowledgeable and cool!

reviews.author: Pri J.
reviews.description: Nice decor. Horrible service. Make sure you are clear and repeat the order to the bartender or they will make their own interpretation of the drink, refuse to admit that they didn't hear you correctly, and charge you for both the wrong drink and the drink you originally ordered. So disappointed.

reviews.author: Meredith E.
reviews.description: This is an Austin gem and hole-in-the-wall place if you're looking for a unique, romantic spot. They have a good sized drink menu and also offer frozen drinks, which is always a fun addition.   They have a fantastic selection of Mezcal and Tequila and it's a fantastic spot for a date because they have a few nooks inside great for a few to sit. The ambience is also very romantic-very dim inside with lots and lots of candles everywhere. The place itself is upstairs of SchoolHouse (there are stairs outside to the right of the restaurant). It is pretty small, only seating maybe 20 inside and about the same outside.   However, worst case scenario if you arrive and they're packed you can head downstairs to SchoolHouse for a drink!  This is a must visit and will impress others when you introduce them to a what-feels-like hidden gem.

reviews.author: Natalie K.
reviews.description: We happened into this neck of the woods because the red M3P that we've been waiting on from Tesla for a millennium is finally being delivered this week, so we're on the hunt for an excellent Tesla service center (the one next to us up north leaves a bit to be desired), which we have now most definitely found here on St. Elmo (shout out to Sadie and Kyle)! Luckily, it also happens to be right next to this absolute gem of a winery! #winning   Travis, our wine journey guide, was the sweetest, most knowledgeable, and most approachable human being on earth, and we thoroughly enjoyed our Saturday afternoon stop! The bright and airy space, the pitch perfect music, the yummy wine (we had both the Work Horse Red Blend and the Violet Crown Tempranillo. Deliciously dry reds!), and Travis all collaborated to make this a most excellent pit stop!   Thanks, Austin Winery! Thanks, Travis!

reviews.author: Ria G.
reviews.description: I'd give this place 5 stars for the interior and overall vibe, but only 3 stars because we were a bit disappointed with the wine itself.   The atmosphere is lively with board games and great decor inside, and a food truck and lots of picnic tables outside for large groups.   However, my group ordered 2 different red wines and 1 sparkling white wine and felt that the wines were lacking in flavor and very watery. Maybe this is how Austin wine is, but if you're looking for deeper, richer flavored wine, I would go somewhere else.

reviews.author: Ayca U.
reviews.description: Great wines selection to try from, all gluten free.  Friendly service and highly recommend the charcuterie and cheese - great presentation   Clean and well kept Must try

reviews.author: Aditi P.
reviews.description: 10/10 holistically on this place. Everything from wine, environment and experience were on point. We had a group of girls in for a bachelorette and the service did not disappoint. The owners have an amazing story telling ability when it comes to their wine. The ambiance of interiors down to the charcuterie presentation is all thoughtful.

reviews.author: Diana M.
reviews.description: Great selection of wines and a wonderful place to get "away" for an afternoon. A friend and I visited Austin last weekend and found this winery located about 10-15 minutes from downtown. In a area that looks redeveloped from warehouse bays the selection and space is super cute! Would return next time I'm in town!

reviews.author: Stefany W.
reviews.description: Came here on a Sunday afternoon and it was just a nice place to relax, drink some wine and read a book which is exactly what I did. I came with a friend and we enjoyed trying all the various wine they had to offer.   They also apparently had a monthly oyster pop up which was fun. I ended up ordering some and they were delicious! Highly recommend this place.

reviews.author: Diana G.
reviews.description: Ok so I accompanied my boyfriend to the brewery and distillery nearby, so of course we had to stop for the obligatory glass of wine for me.  I was not going to get any snacks, but their cheese and charcuterie board was calling my name.  We both got the tasting. Each of us got different wines. Our favs were the Tempranillo, Grenache and spaghetti western. You can get all your wines at once or one at a time. I suggest getting them all at once because staff can get busy.  The cheese and charcuterie board paired well with our wines and it was definitely the perfect snack. Loved the cheese selection. The bread sprinkled with olive oil made my day cause who doesn't love bread They have inside and outside seating available. Parking is onsite, but shared with other businesses.

reviews.author: Sametra B.
reviews.description: Pretty laid back spot. A nice spot to grab a quick glass of wine with a friend or 2. For a locally ran winery, I'd say it's worth going for sure. The menu selection for cheese variations are subpar. We did try some octopus and squid, which was an interesting discussion over some glasses of wine. You can only imagine how these convos went lol! All in all, I highly recommend stopping in for an interesting glass or two. Cheers to more wine!

reviews.author: Dana L.
reviews.description: Went to Austin for a short solo trip and what a nice surprise. This place was so cool and chill. The service was great, the tables were well spread out, the flight and snacks did not disappoint.   I had the:  Friends with Benefits Opening Ceremony Gerwuz  Vermentino   All a selection of whites and sweets.   I would highly recommend this place to get a taste of Austin and also enjoy a quiet spot.

reviews.author: Krystle U.
reviews.description: My partner and I first found their wine at Travis Heights Wine and Spirits and fell in love w the malbec, so we decided to visit the winery. The first time we came here, they had a private event going on so that was sad. The second time, we got here a few hours early so they hadn't opened - that's our fault. Finally, our third attempt was fruitful!  The service here is super chill and on top of things. We 2 flights so we got to taste a good variety of samples. Great pours. We ended up leaving w one of their best bottles and now we're saving it for a special occasion.   We got (ranked from 'pour me another' to meh): *Violet Crown *Tempranillo Nuevo *Vermentino *Red-Nat *Picpoul *Piquette - this seems to be a star here but we personally hated it - tasted a bit like dilute pickle juice  A bottle we had before coming to this place was their Hill Country Rosso and that's still my favorite.  As far as COVID safety goes, the tables are super spread out, the staff wears masks at all times, and everything seems clean.   This place is super cool and what seems to be a hidden gem.

reviews.author: Jenni N.
reviews.description: Very cute tasting room within an industrial area. You would not think there would be a place like this there. The Yard is the location and they have several business including this winery, a distillery, a brewery, and a few other places. The wine was good and the cheese and charcuterie board was a good size. I'd like to give 5 stars, but we had to ask for napkins, no plates given either. It was also a bit messy inside. Not sure if they were re-organizing or what. But friendly staff, good wine, and cute space! I recommend a stop in!

reviews.author: Amanda K.
reviews.description: I stopped here to enjoy some new wine and some pizza from Lil Nonna's. I made reservations on the way there. During the 'rona, it is recommended to ensure you can get a spot.   My hubby and I did a wine flight a piece. We tried all the reds, the rose, and white wine (Vermentino). We ended up buying a bottle of Malbec to take home which we both had enjoyed. Note, the staff was very knowledgeable and helpful.   I really like the atmosphere of the winery as it is inside a warehouse where they make their own wine and buy their grapes. The winery has a few things to eat or you can buy pizza from Lil Nonna's. The pizza takes awhile but you can always purchase online and set a date. If you are done at the winery you can also bar hope in the area for beer, cocktails, and whiskey.

reviews.author: Rob R.
reviews.description: It's simple, if you're not pretentious and you like natural wine, you'll enjoy this place. Industrial spot located in the Yard, great natural lighting and some benches outside for the big groups. A truly gorgeous selection with some fantastic small plates as well- tinned seafood, quality cheeses and bread, etc. Always an enjoyable time.

reviews.author: Cameron N.
reviews.description: We each ordered flights. The staff was knowledgeable, quick, and polite which made the experience even better!

reviews.author: Jodi H.
reviews.description: Star service and a non-judgmental space. I dig you, Austin Winery!  We decided on Austin Winery after we had plans to go to Spokesman next door for some beers. Unfortunately, Spokesman had an event going on that looked a little noisy and full for our study date, hence the change in venues. The winery was very spacious and lofty--I love that in an industrial winery! We asked if we could move a table (to plug in to their only one outlet--score!) and do some computer work with their wifi. The gal at the tasting room was fantastically wonderful. She gave us a large smile and told us to do whatever we wanted. Wonderful service alone will get me to come back. That's for sure.  We each got a flight of wine to try, and got down to it until they closed. They have a good selection of whites, rose's and reds, so fret not friends. All is provided. They also have some light bites like cheeses and charcuteries, so you can definitely go with that if you're hungry. The tastings were a little pricey compared to what you might get at a wine tasting out in the vineyards (I used to work in the industry), but you're paying for the convenience of being in South Austin and lots of space to hold conversations, play board games and just be with your groups. They have loads of seating and an upstairs area (that a Bachelorette party was using). Restrooms are clean and wifi is strong. We also walked home with some Brose (a hilarious take on rose especially because it was a women-lead winery effort). Clean, classy and airy space.

reviews.author: Alec B.
reviews.description: Awesome winery, love that it's so close to the city. All the staff was super friendly and knowledgeable about the wine selection. They had several really good wines, my favorites were the Violet Crown and GSM.

reviews.author: Mike L.
reviews.description: We really enjoyed our visit here,  the staff is friendly and knowledgeable.  A must visit when near b Austin.

reviews.author: Kan C.
reviews.description: Cute place. Not a huge fan of the wines but the food was great.  Will try again ! Maybe my pallet was off

reviews.author: Hailey W.
reviews.description: Very cool industrial spot. Lots of good wine options and there was a food truck. Good spot to visit during covid due to availability of outdoor seating

reviews.author: Shannon L.
reviews.description: This place has a great vibe and both indoor and outdoor seating.  The staff are friendly and knowledgeable.  Lil' Nonna's pizza truck is right outside of the door and has fantastic pizza - try the VBR!  The bummer is they only have Texas wines and I am not a fan.  I tried 5 different options and truly am not a fan.  I would love if they had other options.

name: Pete's Dueling Piano Bar
accommodations: Best nights on Thursday, Friday, Saturday

reviews.author: Helen E.
reviews.description: I love going there. Music was fantastic.  I loved because  had great atmosphere.  They had audiences  in gaged. Hole time

reviews.author: Heather R.
reviews.description: In the words of Owen Wilson, WOOOOW!   Like most people, I've been to many bars. This piano bar is amazing! I wish I lived closer to it because I'd be taking my friends and family here all the time. It's great for date nights and parties of all age groups (as long as you're fine with the occasional jokes/profanities). The musicians are so incredibly talented and can perform basically any song you give them on piano, drums, guitar...  The entire performance is so engaging and fun (the crowd picks all the songs that are played), and the service is spectacular! Make sure to bring money for the cover and for tips (the performers deserve it!).

reviews.author: Shannon H.
reviews.description: Our go to bar on 6th Street!! Excellent talents and performance all the time.   Everytime our friends came to visit Austin, we bring them here and they always have a good time!

reviews.author: Spencer W.
reviews.description: Super fun place to listen to live music.  The performers are entertaining and hilarious

reviews.author: Cathy O.
reviews.description: Fantastic place for a fun Friday night. I couldn't believe the cash pouring out from patrons wanting special requests. There was a great mix of songs, switching up of musicians, great bar service, and an overall good time. Some bachelorette groups (my own daughter did her trip there in Sept), birthdays, you know...the usual.

reviews.author: Dima G.
reviews.description: It was a really fun time here on Sunday. Seems like the guys playing piano were interactive, fun and extremely accommodating. Extremely talented too. Wow. Amazing.

reviews.author: Frank J.
reviews.description: This was an A+ experience! Having played piano before, I have pretty high expectations for performances. These two performers were so fun and I was very impressed by the wide array of songs they could play, sing, and jive to at the drop of a hat. They interacted with the audience extremely well too, constantly making jokes and keeping the crowd engaged. The engagement with the crowd is very positive as well. I'd highly recommend checking this place out! You won't be disappointed.

reviews.author: Kim D.
reviews.description: This was honestly a cool bar experience, as I've never been to anything like it. The cover fee was $12 (or $3 if you check in on Yelp) and when you enter, you see the two piano guys going head to head having a great time. There were a lot of other people celebrating birthdays and bachelorette parties there and the ambience was very fun and upbeat. I'll admit, some of the songs were a little to country for us, but we had a fun time sipping on our giant cocktail and watching from the floor above!

reviews.author: Luke A.
reviews.description: This was maybe my 20th time coming to Pete's and this guy clearly has absolutely no background in being a bouncer alongside there shitty ass security company they hired. He would not let me in because I was "acting belligerent" towards him, which I was clearly not. I guess if you are a private business you can do whatever you want these days! I would never recommend going to this place nor will I ever go back until there security team is fired along with this dumbass bouncer. Absolutely unreal.

reviews.author: Lisa H.
reviews.description: So much fun! There was 4 of us. We got there at 8:00 stayed till 12:00am  We drank all night, bill was 240.00. I don't think it was too bad considering we really drank. It was hilarious! Entertaining! Joyful  Uber dropped us off in front!  Next time, I will stay to about 10-10:30pm. Then walk to Velvet Taco and have a late night bite.   6th street was a little rough. Did not feel safe. But thank Austin police dept. They were there in heavy presence. It helped.  If think how much a Broadway show is you are doing good!  A must if you are visiting Austin

reviews.author: Jona H.
reviews.description: We came to town and we're looking for somewhere fun for a girls night out. This place seemed perfect. Music Started at 9 we got there early and got several tables. The musicians were amazing !!! They can play anything you request. We danced and sang all night. Beverage service was also fantastic they were on top of it keeping all glasses cleared and refilling when necessary . Perfect spot for a group!

reviews.author: Annabelle L.
reviews.description: Wow, came here on a Sunday night and I highly recommend this place to everyone. It wasn't super busy, but the crowd was large enough for the musicians to engage with. The musicians were absolutely INCREDIBLE. We stayed for several hours and they played song after song seamlessly on piano, drums, harmonica, trumpet. We did request "Complicated" by Avril Lavigne, which did stump them. While one musician did some on-the-spot research, the other one played us a medley of similar songs (Skater boi, Michelle Branch) to keep us entertained. Wish we had one of these in Baltimore, can't wait to come back!

reviews.author: Kori A.
reviews.description: SO much fun, and SO much talent. Great atmosphere, great service, and hospitality. Would def go again! Thanks for the laughs!

reviews.author: Patty R.
reviews.description: We had so much fun at Pete's. All entertainers were very talented. It was continuous entertainment. I am so glad we went. Our server was also spectacular. She was the only server for the entire bar. We were there the night of December 7 of this year. I highly recommend going to Pete's for some fun entertainment with talented musicians.

reviews.author: Natalie M.
reviews.description: This bar greatly disappointed me. I went in anticipation for my brother's 26th (post marathon)! I was greeted at the door by asking what "color of my car is." Weirdly, and as a woman, I didn't want to disclose what color my car was? And was also confused by what the point of this question was. I was refused to enter the bar due to my hesitation despite not having drank the whole night. I wasn't let in even though I was over 21. It looked like a great time behind me, which is why I grant it 1 star. However, poor experience. Get it together! I have never written a Yelp review even in my poorest experiences, but this was worth it. Visiting Austin would've been 10/10 despite this experience!

reviews.author: Aaron V.
reviews.description: Please please please got to this place!!!!! The atmosphere is amazing! Oh and the service 10 out of 10 wish I could give more stars just for the service!!!! Xavier the door guy omg he melted my heart with his hospitality! Our waitress was also so sweet! Can't with to go back! I hope managers are reading this and know they have some gems in their mist!!!!

reviews.author: Peg S.
reviews.description: The most fun I had in Austin.    Just like it says, two pianos and two piano players (and sometimes additional musicians) taking song requests for $ that they'll try to play to the best of their ability while also entertaining the audience.  Beware that if they hear you are celebrating something you might be called up to perform.  The fun and liveliness of the crowd and music are infectious.

reviews.author: Carol S.
reviews.description: Non-stop music and fun. The musicians are very talented and entertaining. Prices are reasonable. Definitely will come back!

reviews.author: Steele E.
reviews.description: This was a fun, upbeat place! Drinks were good and staff was friendly.  This is one of the best places I have found in Austin.

reviews.author: Foster M.
reviews.description: Just want to add, I noticed Luke's review a bit before mine and he has a pic of that bouncer! That's the guy! Management, please get rid of this person who is turning away your customers.

reviews.author: Deya Z.
reviews.description: Staycation report! This was our final stop of brewery tour 2022, after visiting 2 other stops, and it was definitely up there! Small and cozy, the beertender was super friendly. Good selection of beer and a few wines available for the non-beer drinker (but who honestly takes that risk!?)   Not much else to say other than we'll make this drive out any day!

reviews.author: Chris K.
reviews.description: This place is a gem right in downtown Dripping Springs. Great beer, nice atmosphere, friendly staff.

reviews.author: Chris M.
reviews.description: Craft brewing at its finest!  This brewery also has a lot of English style beers.  Since it was close to closing we decided to split a flight.  You can pick any four beers for $10.  They are brewing 12 beers on a 3.5 barrel system here so they are busy bees!  Their Karnstein was the best amber lager I've tasted.  Sooo good!  We got these in the flight #8 Barghest English porter, #9 Kobold black lager, #6 Karnstein amber lager, #11 Hans Trapp Bourbon Barrel Imperial Stout (yum).  They also have pizza you can order but we were full.

reviews.author: Jodi H.
reviews.description: Acopon was still relatively new when we went a few weeks ago.  It's a great space if you're in Dripping and want a microbrewery to stop through. They're dog-friendly (with treats) and have both indoor/outdoor seating. They also had TV that was playing soccer, and strong wifi. I love that they have flight options 4 for $10, as well as pints. It wasn't busy when we stopped through on a Saturday afternoon. They don't have food here, but if you ask the taptender...he'll tell you what food options are nearby.  Service was kind and efficient. Their beers were across the board--good. My favorite was their Aine Hefe! It was floral and super crisp for the warm weather after a long hike. They seem to do a lot of English style ales, which aren't my favorite...but you can definitely find options that suit your taste buds. They also give free stickers upon request. BOOM!

reviews.author: Dolly S.
reviews.description: Good beer selection.   Very knowledgeable staff.  Best part I watched them clean ALL surfaces while I was there

reviews.author: Kat C.
reviews.description: Great brewery in Dripping Springs. The staff is awesome. The choices of beer is amazing. The brewery seems to have a beer choice for everyone. Very people and dog friendly.

reviews.author: Everett T.
reviews.description: Acopon's interior is moody, with a strong occult vibe, and I absolutely love it! I bet they would throw a wild Halloween party. The staff is friendly, prices reasonable, though quite a few of their brews tend towards English styles.   On our visit, I had the Norwegian Juice, Bellibone and the Killiecrankie. Careful with that last one, it's delicious, but at 11.4% ABC, more than one can sneak up on you pretty quickly.   Acopon just had a really great vibe, and the fact that it's dog friendly is icing on the cake.

reviews.author: Christian W.
reviews.description: This place has the coolest logo I have ever seen in regards to the various breweries I've been to. They have a really good beer menu and the prices are more than fair! I was actually surprised to see them so decently priced this far out in the hill country.   They do provide half pours in their standard sized glasses, just make sure to ask for a half pour when you order. I was happy to see they allow food from the outside as well which makes staying easier as you can bring your snacks in haha.  Not on overly crazy amount of seating, but definitely enough for 5-6 medium/large parties. They also seemed to follow the trend of allowing owners to bring their dogs inside which is always cool and fun to see.  They also have merchandise for sale and their shirts are super sick...did I mention their logo absolutely rocks!?

reviews.author: Nina H.
reviews.description: Really cute place, enjoyed their beers (try the Rye one) and their fun flavors of Walker's British crisps.  They had board games and it was kid friendly.  If you are in the Dripping area and enjoy beer, this place is well worth a stop.  Cool names for their beers and explanations behind the names' meanings.

reviews.author: Jens B.
reviews.description: A nice little find.  My bud who is a massive craft beer dude drove us here on the way back from a visit to William Chris Vineyards.  Located in Dripping Springs and in a small space felt right.  On the day we visited they had 4-5 beers on tap I believe.  I'm a larger guy, so a Bellibone was ordered up for me.  Suz got an English Bitter Gaspipes.  I enjoyed my larger, it was crisp and cool. This is a great nod to Emil Christian Hansen and the use of his Saccharomyces Pastorianus, which he first isolated in 1904.  A year before the greatest footy team in the world, Chelsea FC was started.  And he was also a Dane.  Suzie drank her Bitter and coo'ed.  We would of stayed longer, but staring a gigantic Manchester City flag was making me ill.  Just Kidding Dudes, I'm still ill after that 6 goal slacking you gave us this past February.  Drop in, grab a pint.  Bring the pup and stay awhile.

reviews.author: Jeff S.
reviews.description: Mad props to Acopon for allowing my dog to chill inside with me this afternoon! Many places are dog friendly as long as it's on the patio. I walked in thinking the same but was quite surprised to be able to chill inside with my fur-bro. Made for a much better time in this "hotter than average" June we're having this year. I've been here a few times now, have never had a bad time here, and after my experience today I will continue to stop by when in Dripping Springs.

reviews.author: Cindy L.
reviews.description: Very friendly staff enjoyed the beer and conversation of the background of the brewery.

reviews.author: William L.
reviews.description: Nice small spot. Good variety of beer and friendly staff. There isn't much else of a way for me to describe this place.

reviews.author: Mindy H.
reviews.description: The owners of the Barber shop wanted to start brewing something different.  They wanted to focus on creating English ales fresh from the cask. Their goal is to have at least one ale available from a fresh cask each week.  Are English ales their sole focus?  Definitely not! There are a variety quality brew styles.  You will find them here.  Their specialty though will be ales.  Acopon is just a stones throw down the street from the Barber shop in downtown historic Dripping Springs. On the Sunday afternoon I ventured here, this was a quiet and sleepy part of town. The tasting room and production are located in the same small historic building. The tasting room is comfortable, and inviting.  It feels lived in, like a proper English drinking hole should.  A nice change from the hipster modern sleek brewery tasting rooms popping up all over Austin.  The staff member behind the bar was knowledgeable and friendly.  They also have canned mead, cider, and wine options for non beer drinkers.  Outside food is welcomed.  They have some tables available outside to sit at, and are dog friendly.  I enjoyed one of their flights.  All of the beers in my flight were well structured.  I liked some better than others.  The Rowan was a stand out for me.  Good solid beers.

reviews.author: Nowlan T S.
reviews.description: Great brewery in dripping springs. Beer is great and they are super dog (and people) friendly. They always have something different but they do it right. Quality beer and great that I get to enjoy it with my pup inside.

reviews.author: Ajax S.
reviews.description: A short review: The beer was pretty good - but served in plastic cups (unforgivable) - the service was kind of slow. Good prices.  A longer review: We were there during the Songwriters' Festival so this may explain the plastic cups, even so, if you care about your beer you can't serve it in a plastic cup. It defeats the whole purpose. But, looking beyond that, the few beers we tried were good. I particularly liked the porter.  The service was slow with three people behind the bar but it seemed that only one person was really doing the work. (There was a younger lady behind the bar but as far as I could see all she did was stand there and scowl at people.) So, a mixed experience. We'll probably try it again (I suspect the beer really is good) when there isn't a festival going on, and hopefully have a drink in a real glass.

reviews.author: John R.
reviews.description: Owned by the same folks who run The Barbershop a couple of doors down. These folks specialize in British type beers, which I like, but also brew one of the best New England style IPAs I've ever had...but they don't bill it as such. Roomy enough, down home local feel. Always stop here when we're in Dripping Springs.

reviews.author: Mike F.
reviews.description: Went here this past weekend and may I just say WOW!!!   The place is Fantastic.  I instantly felt a kinship with the folks at and behind the bar.  The beer was to put it mildly scrumptious.  The Rat King Double IPA was one of the very best I have ever had the pleasure of drinking.  Beautifuly balanced, malty, and hoppy at the same time, perfect nose.  Just awesome all around.  The Hans Trapp Imperial Stout was a malt bomb of the first order.  Great Beers, Great People, Great Location.  Great Brewery.  Must Go to if you're in Central Texas ...

reviews.author: Jessica J.
reviews.description: I highly recommend this brewery. It's in the heart of downtown Dripping springs, has good beer, and a good atmosphere. There is even a outdoor patio for 18 and older.

reviews.author: Mike M.
reviews.description: Excellent. Seven brews. Wine and cider. Friendly owner. Quiet and extremely pleasant.

reviews.author: Mistra B.
reviews.description: This establishment is owned by a very famous patriot. There are Some excellent online reviews of One Shot Distillery and the owner. Just plug the owners name, Colonel Phil Waldron, into your favorite search engine.   But if you don't have the patience, the owner, colonel Phil Waldron has concocted an amazing and intoxicating drink called the Jan 6th. The description is so funny. Tongue In cheek: Two parts my pillow guy, one part Giuliani, 1 part Trump. Colonel Phil the owner of One Shot then personally stirs it. He is such a funny guy. He really lights up this place!! He has this funny cos-play bit he will perform if you ask. With his horns and fur hat, he imitates the insurrection shaman. He does a great job. Almost like he was there. So funny!!! Love you colonel Phil.

reviews.author: Christopher T.
reviews.description: So Yelp won't let me say what I want to say. But this place is not owned by a patriot. Like the other comments say. Look up the guys name. They also open carry here and not the safest place.

reviews.author: Danielle D.
reviews.description: For my husband's birthday, we spent Saturday trying a few places off Fitzhugh that we hadn't been to. It was nice to have a place to stop that had something other than beer. They had several places to hang indoors, then a big outdoor area which looked like it might have live music events. The cocktails were delicious: I had the Mogadishu Mile - like a blackberry mint mule, and the Big Red which was a vodka, grapefruit with rosemary. We ordered at the bar inside, but quite often the bartenders would come out to see if we needed anything or the owner check on us here and there. Cute spot, we'll be back!

reviews.author: Delia S.
reviews.description: Let me preface my review by saying that I'm not an avid beer drinker and only like non-hoppy varieties. I can't really comment on their beer other than to say, the three I tried were not to my liking, but what I can say is that I love this place!  I've been here twice now, with friends, and with my man and both times have been great!  The place is spacious and covered in tree canopies with a sprinkle of fire pits, Adirondack chairs and picnic tables. The service is good and the mules are divine. I love that they serve cocktails as well as beer so there is something that I like and something for the beer drinkers, like my boo.   We were lucky on both occasions to have great weather and this time around, live music. I've been to several of the breweries and distilleries along Fitzhugh and so far, this is my favorite.

reviews.author: Amanda W.
reviews.description: Great drinks, fun playground for the kids, fast service, Texas-vibe.  The negative reviews surprise me. I disagree with them.

reviews.author: Chris P.
reviews.description: My wife and I have been to One Shot several times, and the atmosphere, setting, staff and drinks are always great. Sitting under the oaks in the Hill Country is perfect by itself, but my wife and I think adding a hurricane and brown ale make it put it over the top!

reviews.author: Matt G.
reviews.description: So long and short. Rock solid 5 stars.   Our waitress Chloe was super sweet and delivered us a round of all 4 rums. The Gold had a little bite to it, but all were delicious.   The wife's hurricane was potent but delicious.   I snagged a raddler which was a little different to a traditional one, but delicious and dangerous as you can probably down 6 before the Lord almighty gets the news.   The brew house and distillery are open and outside seating is abundant.   Bring your 4-legged friends for the ride as they are super dog friendly!!!!  You would have to be drunk and mad to pass this place when visiting Dripping Springs. Wait...they might be able to take care of that for you...responsibly of course.   So. Great drinks? Check. Great staff? Check. Great atmosphere? Check? VETERAN OWNED BUSINESS?!? Affirmative. God Bless y'all for your service.   Rock solid 5 stars.

reviews.author: Tia H.
reviews.description: What a hidden gem!! We stopped in by chance, having never heard of it, and we're so pleasantly surprised. Not only is the owner a super friendly fella, but the alcohol is legit on point. I don't remember the last time I had such a smooth vodka. And the hurricanes- wow. So. Freaking. Good. The place is adorable, by the way. Super super cute. Veteran owned is a huge plus. We'll be going back again and again.

reviews.author: Casey M.
reviews.description: I'm giving them a three star, because I like the location and that there is outdoor seating... And that the staff is attentive. Otherwise I probably would not come back here, the drink I got was literally all syrup and made me extremely sick to where we had to leave... Kind of completely ruined the day. My boyfriend enjoyed the drink he ordered, which I believe was the hurricane. They have a wing food truck that you can order from, unfortunately we didn't get to try it because the drink made me so sick. We plan to go back in try the wings and will review the wing food truck. Great location for the spot, nice and relaxing... Just be careful what you order and avoid anything that has syrup in it.

reviews.author: Thomas C.
reviews.description: Thirst quenching beer. Great cocktails. Superior customer service. Everything is fresh and home-made. Definitely a must visit location. Can't wait for our next visit

reviews.author: Tara S.
reviews.description: Had beverages here this weekend! AMAZING! Excellent service and drinks on point! We had the pirates punch and then a couple of their other cocktails...all were worth it!

reviews.author: Paula M.
reviews.description: Just go!! It is awesome!! For those of us that would prefer vodka over beer but have friends that love beer. This is the place!!

reviews.author: Julie R.
reviews.description: We stopped here after to trying to get into the cluster called Deep Eddies. This was a hit, the cocktails were amazing. We decided to buy a whole bottle of vodka. The atmosphere was amazing, lots of trees, lots of space and delicious wings! Our friends enjoyed the craft cocktails! We highly recommend if you want a wonderful experience! Skip Deep Eddies and spend your time and money here!

reviews.author: Chris W.
reviews.description: Staff, management are super friendly and the big red one salty is the bomb of drinks. Always have great music and love their outdoor setting. A cigar lounge next door, fire pits and food makes this distillery a great venue.

reviews.author: Robert M.
reviews.description: We made our first run to One Shot on a Friday afternoon recently and thoroughly enjoyed it. They are presently distilling rum and vodka and brewing several varieties of beer.  My spouse tried a Big Red One with salt -- a vodka drink -- and a Cuba Libre.  She was pleased with both. I had their amber and liked it so much I had another.  They have a clever solution to social distancing. The two young, friendly order takers are stationed under a canopy at the edge of the parking lot by their outside seating. You place your order with them, and one goes inside to fetch your drinks. There are plenty of shade trees and picnic benches so it's a pleasant experience. The owner , Phil, came out to say hi to a fellow vet (me). Nice, congenial guy.  The Dripping Wings food truck is stationed there now, so I went back for an order for dinner. Excellent wings, particularly the Asian sweet and spicy.  Glad to have a new convenient venue to enjoy.

reviews.author: Amy S.
reviews.description: We decided to get out of the house today and do a little driving. Came across this place in Dripping Springs, and stopped for some drinks. Nice, large, shaded outdoor area with lots of oak trees and picnic tables.  I had the Cuba Libre cocktail that has Star Bullet rum, splash of lime, and coke. Delicious!  Husband loves IPAs and had the Panzer IPA, said it was great.  Inside of distillery and brewery were closed, but they have two food trucks on site. Service was awesome and friendly. Would come back!

reviews.author: Robyn G.
reviews.description: I love hanging out here.  Awesome outside seating and Dripping Wings is also there.  I'm a fan of their amber beer but they make delicious drinks as well!

reviews.author: David H.
reviews.description: This is truly one of a kind! There are so many amazing things to say about One Shot. The owners and staff are so personable! Great drinks and wonderful location! This is one of the most memorable places I have ever been to!

name: Hideout Pub
accommodations: Best nights on Wednesday, Friday, Saturday

reviews.author: Tayo F.
reviews.description: The best burger you'd never expect. I was on my way back down south and needed something to eat desperately so this popped up as the closest location. It's right by the highway so I figured I'd stop by, grab a bite and leave. The wait was longer than expected and the to go box was lighter than expected but when I ate the burger it lit up the light in my eyes

reviews.author: Katherine C.
reviews.description: Some notes for anyone trying to sit outside/be COVID-safe:   They have outdoor seating but to access it you have to go through the indoor bar first. To exit, same thing.  The staff doesn't wear masks (some do but not all) inside.  They do not allow dogs in their outdoor patio.  They have picnic tables spaced out.  You can only order food at the bar; they don't have QR codes on their outdoor tables to allow remote ordering. They do bring out your food to your table, though. If you go during winter, come prepared to bundle up because they have no space heaters in the open-air patio.   TLDR; bring your mask because you're going to have to go inside at some point. Leave Fido at home, bring a jacket.

reviews.author: Joshua T.
reviews.description: Great pull off when coming through or stayin a wee bit.  Wednesday night 10:15 seems chill indoor and out. Barsky pours a decent JamoGing. Bet this place is hopping in the summer. Needs cornhole.

reviews.author: Heather B.
reviews.description: I love that I can come here with a large group and have no problem outside taking over multiple tables.  I have no complaints about prices or service.  This is a good neighborhood bar, and those things will ebb and flow.  Nothing has happened to make me decide to go elsewhere.

reviews.author: Jen S.
reviews.description: The best neighborhood dive bar around, hands down. The bartenders are all friendly and personable and the food and drinks always hit the spot.

reviews.author: Trinity T.
reviews.description: The hideout is my favorite place to get a cheap drink and good food. The burgers are bomb

reviews.author: Trey D.
reviews.description: Used to be good, which is a shame since I used to love coming here over the past few years. It seems to have gone downhill a bit it seems. First noticed the harsh increase in wing prices (before the shortage) a couple years ago. I understand prices increase, inflation blah blah.   But they used to advertise it as wing Wednesday, and they were cheaper that day. And it was fun. Now, the overpriced wings come out with very little sauce, and the sauce tastes/looks different than what it used to?(referring to blazing sauce, my fav.) Meh, guess the crowd is changing.

reviews.author: Jacob M.
reviews.description: When you're here, you're home. Love this place. Cheap drinks and greatest staff in Austin.

reviews.author: Julius A C.
reviews.description: If I could leave zero I would.. , overpriced, if you're looking for a rip off go somewhere fun at least

reviews.author: Brent L.
reviews.description: I finally got a chance to checkout Cat's infamous hideout, and it did not disappoint. It's the typical neighborhood dive bar that I expected it to be, but that's not a bad thing.  Some of the best things happen in a place like this!  TRUST me, it's nothing but fun, fun, fun, with a capital F-U-N!  It's a good place to do some day drinking, or hang out until the wee hours of the morn'.  As Tina R said in her review, lots of interesting characters lurk in this place.  Including "that" guy who likes to butt into your conversation, and then carry the conversation and not give anyone else a chance to talk.  But I won't dock 'em a star for that.  Every neighborhood bar has "that" guy in it.  It's a package deal.  Inside is kind of dark and it takes a minute for your eyeballs to adjust if you enter during the daytime. But after a few minutes, all is well and you'll soon be jamming out to the old school jukebox. You won't find any Touch Tunes here folks - yes, it still uses CDs (who would have imagined CDs would ever be considered old school?).  Here's the most important part of this review before I blather on with all of the interesting factoids:  If you learn nothing else this year, learn this my young Padawans: Many people say it's hard to find, so here's a tip - if you cross the railroad tracks on the access/frontage road, you have just passed it.  Turn right on the last street that you see right BEFORE you get to the tracks, and then take another right turn into the parking lot.  DON'T cross the railroad tracks!  There's a decent outdoor patio with plenty of picnic tables, and a few of them are shaded.  10 dollar minimum for using a credit card (pet peeve of mine).  Wi-Fi password "cheapdr1nks" all in lower case.  12 local and regional craft beers on tap (I counted).  They have about 30 brews in cans and bottles, most of them are from the ATX or at least regional.  The big name brews are only available in bottles and cans, not on tap.  It's a little pricey for a dive bar - pints of Thirsty Goat were 4.50  Full bar - liquor and eraythang!  Six TVs, and a large projector screen (yes I counted).  Yes, they do have food - I didn't partake, but they have tacos, a couple of salads, burgers, sammiches, and the usual bar appetizers.  Every one of the picnic tables on the patio has Cat's name carved in it (she's the current duchess but has fled the city, so it won't last long. Get out there and claim it boys and girls).  Rumor has it that this picnic table vandalism is why she had to leave the ATX, but who knows the real truth?

reviews.author: Nick C.
reviews.description: If you're looking for a great bar in North Austin, this is it. Hideout is spacious and casual, with great drinks and even better food. It's a no frills joint with plenty of room inside and on their patio. Staff are welcoming and the burgers are amazing. Jukebox, TVs, and darts if that's your thing. We'll be making this a regular spot for us!

reviews.author: Tiffany M.
reviews.description: I love wing wednesday! They have great wings and all sorts of flavors. They do charge you for everything, which is quirky. It's not expensive at all, so it's really not upsetting. Just a funny thing I noticed. You're charged for condiments and celery. When you're paying 75 cents for wings and cheap drinks, it's a drop in the bucket.   The patio is great and so lively. It is fairly busy. I would even suggest getting there as early as possible because parking is limited. There is a weird gravelly lot for overflow parking, but I have a little sedan and not a 4-wheeler to get over the ditch that is there.  They do allow smoking outside, so if you're sensitive to that then the patio is not for you. At first it bothered me, but had a great time catching up with friends and eating up those wings!

reviews.author: Amanda K.
reviews.description: I came here for a small get together with my other Yelper friends over the weekend. This place is a dive bar plain and simple. I enjoyed the look and feel of the place and the cheap booze. My only gripe is that it is on the North side of Austin for me.   I will note that my husband and I ordered the nachos here. I wasn't impressed with them but honestly you don't come here for the food. You come here for booze and maybe the people if you are feeling up to it.

reviews.author: Eric B.
reviews.description: Great wings--not soggy in sauce, they hold their crisp--and the patio is great!  Honestly, the wings here are better and bigger than Pluckers, and for me that's a good standard--happy hour isgreat here too.  Fall, Spring, Summer--hangin' here for wings and beer outside is hard to beat.

reviews.author: Sue G.
reviews.description: So we are in Austin for a family holiday because daughter #2 has a home 4x the size of ours (for the same amount of money!) But I digress...  Daughter #1 is here, too. She once lived in in Austin for a minute; but that was five years ago and so much has changed since then.   She asked to go somewhere quintessentially Austin. Not much of that left, especially in the northern parts, but we researched a bit and came up with The Hideout Pub.   Only juke box music during our visit, so not sure if they ever have live music, which we were hoping for. Regardless, the drinks were good and CHEAP. I mean $5.50 for a Moscow Mule cheap. And that's not even Happy Hour price.   We also had burgers. The Austin burger, ($13) with grilled onions, mushrooms and goat cheese, to which I added the sweet and delicious Moonshine BBQ sauce. Big burgers that come with fries, onion rings, tater tots, salad or chips and salsa. I got the onion rings, she ordered the tots. Both delicious. We couldn't finish our meals and brought half of it home.   Atmosphere is strictly dive bar. Love it! But not "biker bar" as I saw it described somewhere. Dark, low lighting, neon, plain seating, wood floors, tv screens all around. There's also an outdoor, multilevel seating area.   Our server was as sweet as pie, with a faint cute accent to boot. Mixed crowd, mostly keeping to themselves.   New neighborhood if this was my permanent neighborhood.

reviews.author: Kimberly G.
reviews.description: Great bar, been here a handful times and the bartenders always seem to be in a great mood at all times(positive vibes) good prices and great burgers!

reviews.author: Diana L.
reviews.description: BURGERSSSS!  These burgers are better than any other burger place I've had in Austin, and that includes P Terry's, Shake Shack, In N Out, Dirty Martins (does that still exist?), and scattered places here and there.  I got the hideout burger, and waffle fries.  Those FRIES!!! My goodness, my mouth is watering at the thought of them again.   This place truly is tucked away - making the name completely fitting.  The turn off the main road is INSANELY sharp, so slowwww down.

reviews.author: Shannon O.
reviews.description: Came here with a coworker to drink some strong cheap dranks and eat some good food. We were NOT disappointed. Its divey dark spot with plenty of room to chill and hang out. The bartenders were cute, funny and poured some very nice drinks. The long island is only 6 bucks and they had a host of cheap drinks but thats what we were drinking. Now...onto the fooood.  The wings...wangs...were delicious! I got the spicy BBQ and my friend got lemon pepper both well done (I hate a soggy wing). The only downside is that for 7 bucks you only get like 5...well damn! However I saw that they have a wing special every wednesday for like 25 cents or something like that so don't quote me.  Will have to come back on a wednesday.

reviews.author: Phillip N.
reviews.description: They have 75cent wings on Wednesdays and they taste great. Their standard wing flavors are solid, and they always have a new weekly special flavor. My personal favorite flavored wings are blazing (not that spicy).

reviews.author: Jennifer M.
reviews.description: This is such a cool spot in Northish austin. The beer is cold and the staff is friendly. I also had a burger that was pretty delicious!! They have an indoor and outdoor space and both have lots of seating. The parking is also very convenient. I will definitely come back when I'm in North Austin.

reviews.author: Dave M.
reviews.description: Spectacular venue.   It's absolutely stunning.  People are great.  Not much else to say.  It's great.

reviews.author: Jen P.
reviews.description: Beer was fantastic, but highly recommend not ordering from the food truck.  $10 pretzel was cold and hard, sausage was ok but we'll be eating before visiting the brewery next time.  Brewery has great propery and enjoyed the shuffle board.  **update - left bells springs and went to Nomadic Brewing in Austin, highly recommend that the food truck at bells spring offering cold hard pretzels for $10 to chat with the pretzel making pretzelista at Nomadic...jalapeo cheddar pretzel was amazing...hot, soft and paired with delicious side of grainy mustard for half the price of bells springs horrible pretzel offering

reviews.author: Yvonne A.
reviews.description: Located in a beautiful area. The space is large and both with winery and beer sections are decorated nicely. Games to play both inside and out. Oh, and their IPA was pretty good too!

reviews.author: Laurie H.
reviews.description: Wow! That is all I have to say. The wine tasting was great, service is outstanding and seating very comfortable. Overall, the environment is very welcoming.  The food truck run by Chef Massaro is a must. My husband and I ordered buffalo chicken, Korean bbq chicken, Cilantro dumplings and waffle fries. The food was beyond what I expected from a lunch truck, it is delicious! My husband and I will definitely be going back to order from Chef Massaro and if you go on Bell Springs Winery website, you will find the food menu and send a text with your order to Chef Massaro ahead  of time.

reviews.author: Jon G.
reviews.description: Great spot great beer.   Great people.  The variety of beer is astonishing for a new place very light and refreshing.  Truly love the cobe

reviews.author: Aneesa K.
reviews.description: Gorgeous property, fabulous restaurant.  Huge outdoor property to sit and enjoy the view.  Dogs welcome!  Big plus.

reviews.author: Ted G.
reviews.description: This winery is so beautiful, I could live there.   The views are breathtaking, and the main house is absolutely impressive, I was so impressed with the property I had to explore it further on my own.   They have been operating since 2004 and turned the former residence into a tasting, event and sales space. The sunroom and patio are perfect for enjoying a tasing or a bottle of wine among friends.   I actually sampled all of the wines on my visit to the vineyard, of course my preference is red, but I found many of the whites quite refreshing. Although the pool is no longer used for swimming, it makes an excellent backdrop, stop in and set a spell! Cheers!

reviews.author: Eric G.
reviews.description: Beautiful location next to an Italian restaurant (they aren't affiliated). We got food from them and ate at a picnic table outside the winery. We tried two whites and a red, fairly inexpensive for a glass of wine. I think I paid $6-$8 per glass.. and they were all delicious! The only struggle is to find a place to sit during a weekend.. took a bit of patience before we got a spot. Dog friendly outside, too :)

reviews.author: Katie B.
reviews.description: I'm a huge fan of the property and how much green space they offer and the nibbles offered are quite tasty (especially the truffle fries). I'm not weeping with joy from any of the wines but they're easy enough to drink.  It's particularly lovely for violet crown sunsets, so save it for your last stop if you're making the rounds in this neck of the woods.  They don't have any ice, which I find supremely odd being that it's Texas and they serve white wine! If you want to keep your wine chilled while sitting outside (they've got plenty of gorgeous trees to provide shade but shade is not a wine bucket!) the only way to do so is to drink it real fast while thinking cold thoughts.

reviews.author: Vanessa T.
reviews.description: This is a must-stop on your wine tour and where we began ours! The architecture alone is a photographer's paradise and the wine is wonderful.   We were a little disappointed to hear that, as of our visit in May, they weren't doing tastings due to Covid because I do think it can be done safely and would've made for a better experience. Otherwise, you either have to buy a full bottle or multiple bottles if you'd like a well-rounded understanding of their wines. We opted for a blend that we absolutely loved, described on the bottle as a "patchwork quilt of grapes." It was honestly worth every penny--so delicious!   We took our bottle and glasses outside onto the expansive lawn which is just perfect for picnics. They have lots of shaded tables under the old growth trees.   Perhaps for safer tastings they could serve them "beer flight" style with the informational flyer and direct you to sit outdoors so that you can still experience a handful of their wines without breaking the bank? That would make it a 5-star experience for me!

reviews.author: Elizabeth D.
reviews.description: Lovely area and great tasting menu. They have lovely picnic tables outside to bring your own snacks or enjoy their pizza or charcuterie boards alongside bought bottles. I just wish they had some music playing it was very quiet like pin drop quiet. I feel as though that might add a more comforting ambience. However we enjoy it very much and the restaurant near by looked spectacular

reviews.author: Tiffany C.
reviews.description: Duchman is one of my favorites around the area. The winery is simple and small but has an European charm.   I've done the tasting before and also just purchased wine by glass. Both are delightful. Tasting is nice for first timers to explore a variety of wines Duchman produces. Because of the tasting, I was able to find my favorite red and white wine of theirs. And for $10/tasting, it is such a steal!! (Price may have changed. This was based off of 2018). After my first visit, I just opt to get a bottle or glass of my favorite red and sip it on the patio taking in good wine, views, and company.   My friends and I always love to end our Hill Country winery trek at Duchman and drive over to Salt Lick after for good ol Texas BBQ.

reviews.author: Natalie G.
reviews.description: Decided to discover wineries on a Tuesday without realizing that most of the wineries in the area are closed. Landed at Duchman's on accident but feel like we found the best one! Kate was friendly and very knowledgeable. She made our experience amazing and we look forward to returning. Took home a bottle of Progression 2!

reviews.author: Lisa L.
