reviews.description: The winery is beautiful and the wine is ok but we didn't find the staff to be very friendly. We ordered two snacks and both left a lot to be desired. The watermelon was soggy and smooshed up. We tossed whether to bring it back or not, and finally I did. The girl brought me another one which was fresh. Why serve me the nasty one first?? Unfortunately our experience wasn't good.

reviews.author: Peyton M.
reviews.description: My friends and I had the pleasure of doing a wine tasting with Andrea. The wines tended to be lighter which was perfect for a hot Texan day in July! Later, we had a ton of fun chatting with Javier and some other staff while enjoying a bottle of their finest. Very fun time here and the entire property is beautiful!   The wine tasting was $17 per person.

reviews.author: Anielka E.
reviews.description: This was actually one of my favorite stops in our Driftwood wine tasting day. This particular winery has outdoor picnics for groups and benches for smaller groups for one to buy a bottle , bring some of your own food and enjoy their wines. During this pandemic time, this is the perfect scenario to drink wine while still practicing social distancing.   They do allow you to use the restroom with mask wearing enforced for you to go inside the building.   Their wine was light and refreshing. We chose  a white wine.   If you go near the end of the day you enjoy a nice sunset followed by lighted trees giving you a Christmas vibe. Up until that day , I never knew that Texas had a winery side like Driftwood but places like Duchman Family Winery proved to me that they do exist and they have really good wine too. Highly recommend you make a stop at this winery.

reviews.author: Ann R.
reviews.description: What a LOVELY VENUE! Absolutely adored our wine!  The staff was knowledgeable.  They aren't doing tastings due to Covid but u can buy a bottle and drink on premises.  We probably would have bought more if we could taste, we usually do.

reviews.author: Ren D.
reviews.description: Before our visit we were so excited to visit this place. It was a nice place out but if we felt ignored. They really have poor customer service. I had a review but it was taken down by yelp for whatever reason, I was so surprise when from rude employee message me on my yelp apologizing personally, and apparently there was a guy anonymously message me regarding my review to be reposted. Eventually found they are working together and engaging me on whatever conflict they have. Thus, proven that they really have poor customer service , very unprofessional.I wont be surprise if they will ask yelp to take my review down again.

reviews.author: Xiaoting X.
reviews.description: Not doing wine tasting due to COVID while others in the region have all started doing it. Even glass options would be good...but you can only buy bottles. Tried the rose and it was good. Made from locally sourced Sangiovese, which was a nice plus.

reviews.author: Afshin D.
reviews.description: I live in California and only an hour away from Napa. I wasn't expecting anything close to what one would experience in Napa. However, I still wasn't fully pleased.   The only way I can imagine that someone would really enjoy it, is to bring your own picnic and use their outdoor seating area. This is of course conditioned on the weather and also whether or not there is gonna be any bachelorette party there during your visit. (We saw two when we visited and they were so loud and they had overtaken all the outdoor seatings)  We tried their tasting. It was only $15 which is relatively cheap. In Napa you pay 2-3x more than that in a good winery. They let you choose your own 5 wines out of their selection or go with their recommendation. The tasting overall was okay, nothing that I disliked and at the same time nothing wowed me. I'm not sure if I'm gonna go back there, but it was worth to try it once.

reviews.author: Ryan R.
reviews.description: Nice stop just outside Austin for a wine tasting! The outside setting is very cool, spacious front lawn and some tables/chairs for hanging out. Dropped into this place for a quick wine tasting, consisting of 6 small pours of wine. The whites we tasted were all very smooth, not overly sweet but just the right amount of smooth and dry. Definitely recommend sampling all the whites if you have time, you won't be disappointed!  We didn't go check out Trattoria next door for food, but have been there in the past and pretty good Italian food, pairs well with the winery.  If you come here and the weather is looking good, you can expect a very scenic, picturesque spot to spend some time at!

reviews.author: Natalie L.
reviews.description: Awful. Went here for my 21st birthday celebration with a small group of friends. We were completely respectful and there for a wine tasting and there were rude remarks made about our age and backhanded comments along with nobody taking us seriously or serving us promptly.

reviews.author: Carol B.
reviews.description: Over priced tasting . $17 tasting for very small pours of 6 wines . No water in tasting room. Had to go get it yourself . No crackers or palate cleansers . If it was a free tasting I wouldn't care as much . When I made reservation I was specific about food and was not given accurate info. You are not able to order food or eat during the tasting. Food only available to purchase after tasting was over. Servers poured wine on top of previous tasting . Missed poured twice . Server changed frequently and not consistent. They obviously are not organized to keep track of what wine we should be on . Huge red wine fan( live in Europe for 6 years ) was not a fan of  any of the reds . Surprisingly liked 2 of the whites, Beautiful atmosphere and building . A shame the tasting experience doesn't match . Could be so much better!!

reviews.author: Ashley K.
reviews.description: Duchman is a great winery to visit near Austin that makes great wines.  I've recently been on a kick to learn more about and try Texas wines.  I've tried wine from several different Texas wineries in the past couple months (all purchased from wine stores) and Duchman is so far my favorite.  I prefer red wines and my favorite Duchman wines are the Aglianico and Sangiovese. Since the winery is so close to Austin, my husband and I decided to visit.  The grounds are beautiful - the perfect place for a picnic.  I appreciate the precautions they've taken due to COVID-19 too.  You can't go into the building (though they will let you in if you need to use the restroom), so they are set up outside selling wine by the bottle and require everyone to wear a mask.  There is plenty of space to picnic and social distance.  They sell some picnic meals on-site, but we brought pizza from Pieous, bought a bottle of wine, and had a lovely time relaxing at a picnic table in the shade.  I highly recommend visiting Duchman.  I'm happy there is a winery that makes great wines so close to Austin.  Even if you can't do a tasting during COVID-19, it is still worth the drive to drink wine in a pretty setting!

reviews.author: Alice R.
reviews.description: Really beautiful property. We wanted to go to Salt Lick and wanted to find some other activities in the area so came here for a tasting before lunch. They do $15 for 6, which is pretty good, and was offering 5% off your total bill for following them on Instagram.   There's some beautiful benches set up outside to go with your glass of wine. It unfortunately seemed to be drought season when we visited so the actual grape plants were pretty bare. Once you step inside, there's a small room where the tastings happen and the shop where they sell bottles and all kinds of souvenirs. There unfortunately wasn't any seating indoors so we had to stand the entire time. If you walk in more, you can see barrels and label making rooms. Wish they had given us more history during our tasting but it was fun nonetheless.   It was pretty easy to get an uber out here from the city but be warned getting an uber out here may take a little while.

name: Mort Subite
accommodations: Best nights on Thursday, Friday, Saturday

reviews.author: Vanessa D.
reviews.description: Tried two beers and settled with Tripel Karmeliet. Delicious. Sat outside. Cool vibe. 11/10 recommend.

reviews.author: Cheryl K.
reviews.description: Found this place walking around Austin.  Great little find.   The bar focuses on Belgian beers, and has an extensive selection.  Bartenders are friendly and knowledgeable of the menu, willing to point you the right direction.  Added bonus, all beers are served in their appropriate glass!! Inside is a little small, but they have a nice patio area in front.   A little pricy compared to other breweries we stopped at, but considering the unusual and hard to find beers they carry, it is worth the price to treat yourself to something from here.

reviews.author: John F.
reviews.description: Quite the find in Austin for just walking by and thinking of a beer.  Great stop and a super-gal bartender who was really knowledgeable of the beers.  Great draft selection, in fact an OUTSTANDING draft selection.  They even have some bottled selection too. I really like that they don't carry the Milwaukee or St Louis brands and are all craft.  My only criticism would be that beer shouldn't be served in a small (almost) wine glass at $9/beer. That's just too rich that it limits me to one.  If it were a pint the value would be better. Four Stars instead of Five.

reviews.author: Plucked P.
reviews.description: A fantastic bar with knowledgeable and kind staff and an exceptional variety of Belgian beer a must Stop for anyone visiting Austin!

reviews.author: Patrick L.
reviews.description: I'm not into Belgian Beers, but I love Mort Subite!  Awesome vibe, amazing selection of beers (not all Belgians) and excellent service.  Not sure what's not to love about Mort Subite?  5 stars!

reviews.author: Brian H.
reviews.description: I would have given this place 5 stars, but they covered up the Tintin mural with a refrigerator.

reviews.author: Don L.
reviews.description: Straight outta Belgium! I love it!  I popped by this place for a beer and found it interesting that I previously and unknowingly walked right past when meeting friends at the TexMex joint next door.  Service here was great during the day - when I stopped in. I presume the guy running the bar was the owner but didn't get into a convo about that. He appeared to have moved from San Francisco a few years back from what I gathered and he was very beer knowledgeable which made for my sour selection.  We spoke of some other sours in the area and such. He was a genuine guy having a genuine conversation. That small chatter right there made me feel like I could call this a regular watering hole in a town usually piled high with trendy pop-ups.  He celebrated 3 yrs just recently and I can see why he's still here. It reminds me of a small establishment I visited in Brussels last year right adjacent to Mannekin Pils (the famous peeing baby statue for those unaware). It had a sense of community and Mort Subite also has that. Maybe it's a Belgium thing but I felt like I was right back there when I sat here.  I really enjoyed myself here and although I had but one drink (i was doing my own beer exploration day), I will be back.

reviews.author: Kim N.
reviews.description: We love this bar! Fabulous draft choices in the proper stemware!! Even an outside patio to bring the dog. Talked to bartender about Chimay, Belgium.

reviews.author: Will S.
reviews.description: Great talk bar with inviting, chill atmosphere and access to the only Belgian beer pipeline in the state, iirc. Like all bars, the bartenders set the standard and, hence, the five star review. Anthony and Piper are a great team and are professional, warm and inviting with customers. The draft beer selection is exceptional and you'd be hard pressed to find an equal rival in the city. Directly across the street from Elephant Room on Congress and 3rd, you get a great mix of residents and tourists, alike. There's outdoor seating both in the front and back (including a solid American fare trailer in the back -- good philly cheesesteak). But I digress, it's all about the ambiance, beer and good people at Mort's.

reviews.author: Peter B.
reviews.description: Worked in Brussels many years ago and the belgian beer selection here is on a par with most of the bars around the Grand Place. Bar tender knew his stuff ... great to see a place that has the correct glass for each beer and takes pride in serving the beer the right way. Will be back.

reviews.author: Max G.
reviews.description: If you like Belgian beer, or if you just want to try Belgian beer, Mort Subite is the place you should go.  This cozy bar features about 30 Belgian beers on draft, and has many more in bottles.  Of course, every beer is served in the brewery's unique glass.  The staff is friendly and helpful.  They also have an Indian food truck behind their outdoor beer garden.  Delicious food that goes surprisingly well with the Belgian beer.

reviews.author: Ryan R.
reviews.description: Very cool Belgian ale bar right in the heart of downtown. Can't believe I haven't seen this place while walking around dt.. a real hidden gem if you're looking for Belgian beers.  They have a nice selection of Belgian ales on tap, most I had never heard of which was nice to be able to try all new things. They also have some higher % beers in the frig which appear to be some of their fancier ones, eager to have a go at these next time.   Real cool spot, good for going in and trying some new Belgians to get an idea for this particular subset of beers, right in the heart of Austin.

reviews.author: Darci F.
reviews.description: Wow...warm beer off the tap 10 minutes and almost undrinkable.But what the choice in music for a belgian bar-Nope it ain't dope.. Learn to pour a good head..this is European beer and they know how to get the beer right.I had Kwak beer in the Netherlands in April it was  great beer out of the bottle this..well I tried it twice at 9 bucks I should have just got a 6 pack

reviews.author: Crystal R.
reviews.description: The only thing good about this place was the variety of Belgian Beer, which is what they're known for. They had 2 of our favorites, 1 of which is incredibly hard to find in Austin, La Trappe. I do appreciate the beers in the proper glass. The front patio gives nice European vibes. However, the service is horrible. I wish I had gotten her name, tall thin woman, medium length blonde hair. Very rude and short with our group, the birthday boy with us had questions and she wasn't happy to help. She told him to stop talking in the middle of their conversation. Then when we went to close our tab the bill was $135 for 4 beers. Four beers, by the glass. Now some of the beers are pricier than others since they're imported but we were aware of that as the prices are listed on the chalk board behind the bar. We also don't mind paying good money for quality beer. We questioned the tab and the person behind the bar investigated and said the tall thin woman, who was short with us earlier, charged us for the two large bottles of some vintage or specialty bottle, which is not what we ordered nor what she served. She eventually fixed the tab but it was a very sketchy 'mistake' and the entire experience was memorable in a terrible way. We will not be back and are disappointed since we went in very excited to try it out. I don't recommend this bar.

reviews.author: Leila R.
reviews.description: I love all beers Belgian so I have been wanting to come here for a while now.  Came in on a cold Wed January evening and my friend and I, save for whom I can only assume was a regular, were the only ones in the bar.  The bartender was very friendly and appreciated that we concurred on beer suggestions for my friend.   I really loved that they serve the beers in their correct respective glassware (especially the Kwak, which is worth ordering for the glass apparatus alone!).  The prices per serving are a bit on the higher-end of the Belgian Beer spectrum from other bars I have had the same beers at, but honestly,  I liken this sitch to the line from "The Prince and Me"..."you can really taste the extra 10 cents".   For a place that's French for 'Sudden Death', it isn't nearly all that intesnse, but when I had my first pour of their Gulden Draak 9000 Quad, I did kinda feel like I'd died and gone to Belgian Beer heaven!

reviews.author: Taylor Z.
reviews.description: Absolutely phenomenal beers! After more than a year of experiencing this place, I have yet to try a beer I didn't like. Yes its on the pricier end but the quality of the beer here is worth its weight.  I wish they could pour the beer a bit better. Most of my beers come out with more than half as foam.

reviews.author: Tim K.
reviews.description: This place gets two-stars because of their selection. Being from Belgium, I enjoy looking up places in America and Mort Subite might be the only Belgian place in Austin.  To my big disappointment, besides the selection they have, there's not much attraction for a native to come here, unless you want a badly poured beer and rude service.  The first time I came to Mort Subite I can no longer remember, probably because it was underwhelming but after a lot of people told me to go there as a Belgian, I figured to give it another chance as I was pretty excited to have a La Chouffe on draft. When I noticed that the bartender was pouring this high ABV beer wrong, I asked him if I could give him some advice on how to pour it better. His answer was simply "no" and walked away while he handed my my check. Completely mesmerized, I still tipped him, and walked away. When I explained to my friend what happened, he said I needed to have given context.  So I went back in, ordered another La Chouffe and as soon as he placed the glass under the tap, not holding or tilting it, I apologized for earlier and asked him again if I could give some advice as a Belgian who has had many years experience working in bars. He immediately stopped the pour and  looked at me. When I explained him to hold the glass, tilt it and pour the beer on the spot where your finger is, and how that technique is very common and necessary to pour high ABV beer, he just stared me dead in the eye and continue to pour as he started, wasting a lot of beer and giving me a shitty poured beer.  I send management an email since I thought that they would love to be aware about this before I put anything online but after almost a two weeks of no response, I feel obligated to share this experience.

reviews.author: Ricardo M.
reviews.description: Please do yourself a favor and come try delicious belgian beer. The place is clean. Service is fast and friendly.  Clean bathrooms and a friendly atmosphere sets this beer garden a step above the rest nearby. Come see what you've been missing! Adam, thank you for the amazing service!! I'll definitely be back!

reviews.author: Zachary A.
reviews.description: Gave Mort Subite another shot as Belgian beer is the one true god of beers and can't stand not going to one of the truly Belgian bars in the country.  Again, takes a long time to get served as each pour is perfect and looks delicate.  Menu doesn't change often on draft and was 90% the same.  However, this is some of the freshest draft Belgians I've ever had, and have some rare varieties that you mainly only see in bottles.  Prices are very high and 150% of any other bar in town, but this is the quality stuff and high abv.  Now that they have a food truck out back with some good looking Indian, Mort Subite might be worth adding to my list of usuals when in that Belgian mood.  You should expect a long wait at the bar, high bill, but overall a great beer pour.

reviews.author: Brian M.
reviews.description: This place is awesome! A Belgian beer bar? In Austin?! Yes please. Awesome rotating selection of Belgian beers. Our bartender Anthony was very friendly and did not hesitate to explain each beer. And he steered to one that we loved. They have a food truck in the back, Indian food, if you are hungry. We did not eat, but I am glad it is there if needed. I will be a regular here. I love Belgian beer, and hate having to hunt for it at local bars, restaurants, or trying to get it delivered online is hard and expensive. THIS IS THE PLACE FOR GREAT BELGIAN BEER!

reviews.author: Devin O.
reviews.description: Man this place was crazy packed!   Friendly but definitely a TGI Friday type vibe, but they did have the ufc fights on. So everyone was cheering and at it.   So interesting night.

reviews.author: Nicole L.
reviews.description: Watched as over a dozen unmasked people were served by an unmasked server. You have to be kidding me.

reviews.author: Bill M.
reviews.description: This place is an okay spot for a beer after work.  Cheap drink specials.  You need to get a table near a fan because the AC does not work well.  Also, be warry if you ask the bar mgr dude to turn a game's sound on.  He might tell you "people like you make it hard to be a manager at a sports bar". Overall, on a scale of das to das, it's a little below das.

reviews.author: DaLila G.
reviews.description: I really like it here. Every time I go there's live music and I legally like sitting on their patio. It's super chill and always clean. Def a great spot in the neighborhood. Will continue to keep visiting

reviews.author: Rachel D.
reviews.description: Typical Lil Woodrow's - lots of beer and sports!   We were here on a Thurs night and it was busy but not crowded. I would give it 5 stars but I can't bc of all the smoking. I smelled like cigarettes when we left after about 2 hours, and no one in my party smoked. This was my first (and unfortunately last) time here, so I was unaware.   Know b4 you go: -Dogs allowed on patio -Smoking allowed -Bring your own food or order from next door   -Great waitstaff   Overall, I won't be back due to the cigs, but that's a personal preference of mine. If you don't mind smoking, this is a good bar.

reviews.author: Gilford S.
reviews.description: They claim to be a neighborhood bar but they treat the real neighbors... those who actually live and work right across the street like utter garbage.  On multiple occasions.  Done with these amateurs.  PS. The drinks are weak as can be and the bartenders are lame.

reviews.author: Casey M.
reviews.description: Great local hangout always playing whatever game we want to watch. Cold beer, nice patio, decent service and, if you're hungry, Brooklyn pie company a couple doors down will deliver to your table.

reviews.author: Shannon O.
reviews.description: I love that this spot is very close...I also enjoy the openness of the joint...they also have decent beers on tap. However..if you want food, you have the option of ordering from a pizza spot a couple of doors down...meh. The biggest thing I don't like is..their mixed drinks are SO watered down!   I've tried at least 4 different ones and the ice and water is the most prominent.   So if you go? Stick to the beer or a shot.

reviews.author: Joshua K.
reviews.description: It's always a joy to come here to drink and socialize. Nothing beats beautiful women, alcohol, and excellent customer service! Except for a lack of delicious bar foods!   Although you can bring food into the restaurant, the selection around the area is a bit lackluster. Your only choices are a mediocre pizza place or Mexican cuisine. Brooklyn's pizza will probably be your go to dish if you do decide on italian. Their appetizers are not enjoyable for the value you'll be paying.   All in all, this place has a wide assortment of beverages and a nice place to unwind after a long day of work.

reviews.author: Kenneth B.
reviews.description: I like this place. But I'd like to talk to mr friends without yelling over the loud music. I'm sure the staff rocks out before patrons come in and don't think to turn it down to a reasonable level.  Bad first date spot which is not a good thing to be in the dating app era.

reviews.author: Christopher S.
reviews.description: Laid back atmosphere. Good beers/drinks. Nothing fancy, doesn't cater to one click or another. This location is new and they have it worked out fairly well. Only minor rub is that the outside patio gets direct sun, which is going to be a bit of bitch in the dead of summer, but for now it's fine. Outdoor bar, plenty of screens.  "Jukebox" (fancy MP3 player is nice). Allows you to bump something that is playing that isn't quite to your liking. Drink prices are fair for sure considering most watering holes are serving watered down and overpriced cough syrup.  This place is clean and seems well kept. The manager is almost constantly walking the place and fixing things. They went out of there way to find me an outlet to charge my phone.   Note: Pet friendly even having a water bowl for your four legged family as needed. Just please mind the leash, one guys dropped his momentarily to grab a beer and his dog tore through the kitchen/bar area, it was hilarious.

reviews.author: Albert G.
reviews.description: The best neighborhood bar in town. Upon walking in, you immediately feel like you're a part of the family. The management is beyond professional and they take time to hear opinions or just causally chat. The bar tenders are courteous and quick to serve. No matter what day it is, you will always feel like it's a Friday a night when you come here.   P.S.  I highly recommend you get in a game of cornhole! Lots of great players!

reviews.author: Eric B.
reviews.description: I LOVE this place...great beer selection and dog-friendly...the outdoor patio is shaded, has mistress, and even the bar extends outside to sit at if you don't want a table.  The staff is also a big reason I keep coming back.  I just finished my first run through the Big 50 Club (50 different drafts) and there is more on tap than just those on that list.  Pretty cool!  They don't have food, but the pizza place next door delivers to your table--a slice, whole pie, salads, fries, chips n queso, wings, chicken fingers, subs, etc...so it's not only pizza.  Outstanding!

reviews.author: Katherine S.
reviews.description: This bar is down the street from our apartment so it's our local hangout on the weekends! It can get pretty packed on Friday/Saturday nights but the staff is quick as lighting! We never have a bad time here and they host loads of events that make it feel like we are apart of a community. Love Little Woodrow's!

reviews.author: Mel B.
reviews.description: Great place to sit and have some beverages.  Spent a lazy Saturday afternoon on the patio...beautiful weather and great people.  It's also a great place to bring your doggies.  Very good beer selection...even had three sours on tap, which is hard to find AND my absolute favorite!

reviews.author: Daniel S.
reviews.description: Gave bartender a 5% tip cause of bad service.  She comes outside to chastise me in front of my wife and friends because she expected more. Told her I expected better service and her response was to cut me off. Hey.. already played my tab!  Much better places to have fun in Austin anyhow.

reviews.author: Pam K.
reviews.description: Our first time visiting this venue to see our friends' band play will be our last. It's sad, too, because it doesn't seem like a bad place.  To the juvenile waitress with an attitude: you're in customer service. That means you serve customers WITHOUT the massive chip on your shoulder. If you don't like your job, find something else to do, but DON'T take your mistakes out on your customers.  The waitress got our order wrong and pitched a massive attitude when we kindly asked her to fix it - it was a DIET COKE!!! Slammed the new drink on the table and didn't speak to us the rest of our stay there.  THEN denied it all when approached by my husband, who had to escalate the situation to a manager. Horrible, horrible, horrible. Grow up.

reviews.author: Alyssa D.
reviews.description: I'm biased cos I've worked with them at Brooklyn Pie next door for over a year (they deliver to LW if you call in and the pizza is great) and currently work with LW now. Heads up, you won't be playing on your phone past your first drink. It may as well be Cheers personified. Customers and staff alike are all so friendly and hilarious, you'll get roped into ridiculous convos and debates. It's inevitable. The staff (myself included) will adopt you as our own. 15/10 would recommend.

reviews.author: Celeste R.
reviews.description: I've been to this location a total of three times now, I've tried to love it! Claims to be a neighborhood bar but they're everything short of it. Bartenders aren't too worried about giving good customer service, and their drinks are pretty lame as well. Could easily get their "cocktails" at the Bombshells down the road, with more of a kick and better attentiveness and service. The only reason I'm not leaving 1 star instead of 2 is because they don't care if you're drunk- they'll keep serving you! Lmao and the board games are a nice touch!

reviews.author: That G.
reviews.description: We love this place!! Especially the bartender, Marilyn. We came new years eve and she wasn't even working and she remembered us. Austin is a great city! We hope to move here. Thank you for a great experience!!

reviews.author: Jenny G.
reviews.description: Amazing owners and interesting setting ranging from rocking camping chairs to couches, ha! It's a bar, gift shop, and lounge in one! There is indoor and outdoor seating, and it's in the square. The owners are big on giving back to the community and also work with Veterans. Support this business!

reviews.author: Jacob C.
reviews.description: We became members here about four months ago. It's perfect because my wife and I will grab two beers to go, drop a tip, and walk the square/walking trail up the street to get our steps in on our Fitbit. It's always exciting because the beers change daily to weekly. We've hung out inside on occasion which is perfect for card games and relaxing. The apparel for sale is typical of a REI/Bass Pro Shop. Expensive but quality.   Bar: rotating beer, wine, white claws  Bonus: Very dog friendly! And one of the only places open late.

reviews.author: Justine R.
reviews.description: I have had mostly positive experiences here. I like the beer selection and the bartenders are always happy to suggest something that fits the profile I want.  I have been here about 5 times and am likely to return.

reviews.author: Adriana L.
reviews.description: So I'm just leaving this place. I tried to exchange a shirt that had a defective snap in button and the owner wouldn't even give me store credit. The sweet girl behind the counter was left to be the "burden of bad news." The owner didn't even bother to come out to apologize. So because I lost the receipt (it had the tags on it) I'm stuck with a defective $40 shirt that I ended up just GIVING back to them because what am I going to do with it?!?! Needless to say, I will not be shopping here again.  Side note: This is where I get my fiancs clothes since they carry Howler (my favorite), Duck Camp, and the lovely Sendero Provisions. I've probably spent over $1,000 in clothing because of the brands they carry, not to mention I spent $300 the day I purchased the shirt. Seriously do better. If your going to carry higher end outdoor gear maybe realize that you're dealing with customers who actually appreciate that.

reviews.author: Kiva C.
reviews.description: This place has a great atmosphere. They are family and dog friendly. The merchandise is high quality (outdoor gear) and they are open late. They usually have sports on their TVs. Whether you're shopping during the day or stopping in for a drink in the evening. The crowd range is vast. The staff is friendly, knowledgeable, and the taps are rotating. They even have water bowls outside for your dog. They serve beer, wine, and select seltzer's in cans. It's a great place to kill a few hours in the heart of downtown Georgetown.

reviews.author: Kacey C.
reviews.description: This place is always SUPER packed on weekends, it can be near impossible to find a seat. Luckily there are a few outdoor tables and chairs for overflow but even the sidewalks get crowded with people just standing around drinking. One evening we managed to make it in and see what all the excitement was about and it's a cute little beer and wine bar/outdoors gear store. Cute merchandise but pretty pricey. The bartender told us occasionally a food truck will park behind their store so you can enjoy yummy eats with your drinks, otherwise no food menu. I liked the atmosphere of this place... cute little date night drink spot on the square. But I am a little confused by why it's so crowded all the time. The beer and wine list is good, but not anything spectacular. I don't get it. I'm sure we'll be back at some point if we can find a place to sit.

reviews.author: Jamie W.
reviews.description: Had a great time here. Beer and atmosphere was great. Would love to come back to shop around sometime.

reviews.author: Thomas C.
reviews.description: I went to this Gastro pub while visiting a friend in the Austin Texas area. I think it's really cool that they have merchandise and a fully running bar and restaurant in the same space. I felt it was very cozy and interesting aesthetically with all of the taxidermy on the walls. I really enjoyed grabbing a drink here with a friend and I would definitely come back to shop or drink in the future.

reviews.author: Mike S.
reviews.description: Always great beer, great service, great people watching outside. A favorite.  Also check out the fine sportswear.

reviews.author: Shannon H.
reviews.description: Awesome little place in the square! Very knowledgeable and friendly staff! They have some great beers on tap, some that I would have otherwise never tried! The Eastciders blood orange is awesome! They also have great apparel and accessories. Also, we got a small hint that they love our military and veterans!

reviews.author: Sarah F.
reviews.description: While many businesses have found ways to make shopping, eating, and drinking safer and in line with state guidelines, there are places that have found their niche catering to the denial or anti-mask crowd. You can make up your own mind based on the trolling I've received from their clientele from my previous review, and the continued crowding on their sidewalk outside with unmasked folks not socially distanced.

reviews.author: John M.
reviews.description: I never feel welcomed at MSO. The workers are borderline rude and  act put out with each order. I'll spend my dough elsewhere.

reviews.author: Mark D.
reviews.description: Good selection of outdoor/fishing clothes combined with a great selection of beer. Live music  on certain nights. Very nice staff.  Excellent place to go on the square.

reviews.author: Archie L.
reviews.description: Spent the Sunday afternoon on the square. This is a must stop when visiting the shops on the square in Georgetown. Great selection of beer, wine, cider. Nice clothing. The selection is somewhat limited but quality. Friendly staff!

reviews.author: Greg W.
reviews.description: Short review time kids!  A close friend and local resident dragged us here and promised we would enjoy ourselves! He was so spot on the get a coveted 5 star review!   Atmosphere is casual, relaxed and inviting. Great selection of beers on tap.  Go for a brew,meet some cool people, and get a shirt before you depart!

reviews.author: John B.
reviews.description: Sunday night in the  square. Strolled in and got a tasty brew and some pimento cheese. Then bought a shirt and some shoes. What a great space and friendly service. Thanks!

reviews.author: Joey G.
reviews.description: Went there on Saturday to watch the UT game. Not a sports bar, but they did have it on one TV. Lots of fans watching, so the atmosphere was great. They have a good selection of draft beer that changes from time to time. Mostly local. I went back the very next day for the Dallas Cowboys game. Very friendly staff. The next day I sat in a comfortable leather chair. They also have a lot of nice clothing for men. A little too pricey for me, but I understand they have some deals from time to time. I will definitely be going there every time I'm in downtown Georgetown.

reviews.author: MICHELE V.
reviews.description: Love this place!! So, for food offerings, you can order online. The dudes 2doors down will deliver. Lots of awesome beers and wine available here. Those of you who  follow the mask rules (which effectiveness is anecdotal at best....and not scientific), you will be comfortable here. High ceilings, fans, etc.  Tables far apart.  Or drink outside. I'm here for the beer. The people are cool and the staff AWESOME!!

reviews.author: Chris W.
reviews.description: Great place in Georgetown TX! Cool old building updated on the square near the courthouse. Nice combination of Shopping, food and beer with the beers being local and always rotating. Great variety complimented by pizzas and snacks for a great experience after before and during shopping. Nice line of outdoor clothing.

reviews.author: Zoe T.
reviews.description: Stopped in yesterday to buy a hat for me and walked out with a hat and two shirts for my teenage sons. I didn't try the beer, so I can't comment on that, but the clothing selection was good. They carry Howler Brothers apparel, which is a company out of Austin that my fisherman husband likes, and Texas Standard clothing, which is a TX-based brand with cool (not kitschy) Texas-themed clothing that gives back to Texas non-profs. They also carry another local brand - Kermode Outdoors - which is new to me, but evidently founded by Georgetown residents. The store has a great vibe and the bar is a place I could see spending a few hours on a Saturday afternoon. Stores like this are what I look for whenever I shop local - a place that sells unique, cool stuff that someone has spent time thinking about.   4 not 5 stars because I didn't try the beer. Next time....

reviews.author: Eric G.
reviews.description: Beautiful winery with plenty of outdoor seating, live music, etc etc, without being too over the top. It's also pretty close to Austin, about 30 min, and very close to downtown dripping springs. Plenty of wine options of course, and a food truck nearby with some tasty snacks/bbq! It's definitely enough to be a dinner if you want that, too.

reviews.author: Megan L.
reviews.description: My friends and I had such a fun time this past Saturday! Wine and beer is well priced, and the space is great to spend a summer day with your friends. I really liked the ros wine, and my friends and I ordered truffle fries from the food truck. The only thing I would change about our experience is that I wish we had made a reservation 24 hours in advance because you can't order charcuterie boards and wine flights without one.   Everyone is really nice, and on a chilly day, they even have blankets. I highly recommend making the trek out here!

reviews.author: Jennifer W.
reviews.description: Such a cute place! Loved the outdoor and indoor areas. Brewery is right next door and you can order from either and pay at one. Wine was good too!

reviews.author: Jaclyn L.
reviews.description: It's beautiful! The rose is perfect for a summer day, there was live music, food truck, axe throwing and an amazing outdoor landscape!   A wonderful summer day spent here!

reviews.author: Jamie P.
reviews.description: We had a great time relaxing in the beautiful sunshine at Bell Springs! There is a winery and a brewery on site so everyone likely has an option they'll like = Best of both worlds. They have plenty of outdoor seating, which you could choose to sit in the sun or under the trees in the shade. We split a glass of rose and their sweet white and I would recommend either one. The sommelier was super sweet and helped us choose our wines. Would definitely recommend a stop here to relax and enjoy nature with a glass of wine in hand!

reviews.author: Ara A.
reviews.description: They have a winery and a brewery which is great when you have a group with people who like different taste. Lots of games and seating areas. You can have a flight or the tasting menu, lots options.

reviews.author: Caroline K.
reviews.description: Loved this winery! Such a quaint and unique place to have a tasting. Unfortunately we went with the weather being 20 degrees, but we still had an absolute blast. They have beautiful outdoor seating and cozy indoor seating in the brewery section of the property. The staff was amazing. Would highly recommend!

reviews.author: Luke P.
reviews.description: Completely unacceptable management. For about 2 hours a group of individuals where shouting at two tables, yelling sexually explicit language, swearing profusely, and were clearly unable to drive. At a place that prides itself in a family atmosphere, where kids are running around playing in the grass and trees, this is completely unacceptable. I am looking forward to management/ownership response to this review. In a region where wineries, breweries and distilleries are a dime a dozen, plenty of opportunities to take my business elsewhere when we come visit.  What should really concern the owners and management about what happened at Bell Springs is the fact that:  1) The Hays County sheriff was called after the incident because it was so egregious. Enough of these reviews and they will be lining up outside the parking lot for DWIs.  2) The staff (7:00 pm on 6/19) did absolutely nothing to cut off a clearly over-intoxicated group that was negatively impacting people around them  3) The staff's response (blonde and burnette hostesses), ver batim, to the vulgar language and rowdiness was "free speech" and "you are the problem - I know those people".  Fantastic - best of luck in your future endeavors . Your stellar response caused one of our group to cancel their wine membership.

reviews.author: Shanita F.
reviews.description: They have three long tables for guests to sit and enjoy the tasting. It snowed the weekend we went, so of course we were inside. However, they do have an outdoor patio, bar and high bar seating. The outdoor seating probably really nice in good weather.   Call ahead or make reservations online. It's very easy and they do allow you to amend reservations over the phone.   They produce really great wine and there's a great selection to choose from. The staff is very knowledgeable about their wines and answered all of our questions. Testing comes with a **small** array of cheeses, nuts and crackers.

reviews.author: Alexa S.
reviews.description: Cute spot and their brewery next door is awesome too! Bell Springs is in a nice location and it is so green! The wine is yummy, tastings are nice sized pours! Only reason I am giving 4 stars is because when you make a reso for wine tasting and charcuterie, don't expect a lot of cheese and meats HA! It was so small, we were cracking up. I would recommend bringing your own snacks and food! Otherwise, awesome spot and I can't wait to go back!

reviews.author: Xiaoting X.
reviews.description: Beautiful winery and relaxing porch. However most wines are sourced from Lubbock and not from Austin.  montepulciano is from the region and pretty bold.

reviews.author: Anthony L.
reviews.description: This is a fun place to hang out with friends!   The wine is pretty good. We shared a bottle of Ros. The real appeal of this place is the setting itself. There is ample outdoor seating under big shade trees! It's a pretty place.  There is also a brewery on site, but I cannot speak to the quality of the beer. We stuck with wine on this trip. I would definitely come back and try other wines and the beers offered!

reviews.author: Jenny S.
reviews.description: This is a beautiful winery. Plenty of tables spread around the grounds under trees. Lots of room for kids to run around out there. We sat up on the patio with our dog and enjoyed a lovely wine tasting. We chose the solo tour which was $15 for 5 generous pours of delicious wine. All the staff we interacted with were very friendly and helpful. The one low point is the food truck. We got the currywurst for $10 which was good, but not a large enough serving for the price. The more upsetting part was the pretzel we got (also $10, which is very expensive). The prestel was small, hard (even though it was supposed to be a soft pretzel), and flavorless. The mustard cheese dip did its best to save it, but it wasn't enough.

reviews.author: Jalise F.
reviews.description: I really enjoyed my visit here. I'm not much of a wine drinker but they were able to answer any questions I had about the wine. Also it was snowing when I went and that made the experience all the better. Will most definitely return on my next trip to Texas!

reviews.author: Anna O.
reviews.description: Nothing  but amazing things to say! We recently hosted our Dripping Springs 10 Year High school reunion at Bell Springs Winery and it was a great experience. Nate and Laura were wonderful to work with and they took care of everything making it super easy for me. The location is perfect and off the main road and the layout of the outdoor and indoor areas are well suited for any size group. Defiantly consider Bell Springs for your next event!

reviews.author: Manuela A.
reviews.description: What a little surprise! I liked their porch and plenty of outdoor seating. They have a great brewery on location so there is something for everyone. They did generous pours of 3 wine tastings for $20. We got a bottle of Cab with grapes from Washington state. No surprise as Texas cab grapes do no yield good wine. We enjoyed our time here!

reviews.author: Anna M.
reviews.description: I have been here numerous times and always had an awesome experience but today was the most unacceptable experience I have ever had ANYWHERE. I was here with my family, parents, and my brothers family with a total of 5 kids (not unusual to see kids here). While here, we became aware of a group that was likely overserved and using foul/vulgar language that we tried to ignore for a long time. Once we heard the phrase "fat c*ck" at a ridiculous volume my husband asked them to please keep it down, which resulted in a huge altercation with various threats/insults from their end. Despite their behavior management still allowed them to stay. What's worth noting is multiple people had already complained about this group and others joined my husband in attempting them to quiet down- so they were affecting loads of people at the winery. Eventually things calmed down and the argument broke, but as we were leaving they said loudly for us to hear "I'm so glad that douchebag is leaving" so I gave them the finger as I was walking away (I will concede this was adding fuel to the fire but I was so fed up at this point) and they screamed to me "FUCK YOU MOM" across the grass. Managements response? Free speech allows them to say whatever they want. Apparently this nice hill country spot is going for the dirty 6th vibe. Save your money and go somewhere with enough pride to expel those who can't keep it together while I use my own right to free speech to notify everyone this place doesn't care about their patrons.

reviews.author: Michael P.
reviews.description: Understaffed.  Cannot manage overserved men and women who are creating bad examples for family customers there as members to enjoy the facilities.  Staff is useless.  Take my membership; we are out.  There are many Other places to enjoy.

reviews.author: Paula P.
reviews.description: I am a resident of Dripping Springs and have been a frequent patron of Bell Springs Winery. I found this family-friendly venue to be welcoming and beautiful. It was for this reason that I suggested that my kids, with their families, join my husband and me for a Father's Day celebration on Saturday evening, June 19th. When we arrived just before 5 pm, we found a good picnic spot in the shade near the bag game. We all noticed, or rather heard, a very boisterous group of 12 to 15 people sitting near the brewery. As the evening progressed, and I am assuming more alcohol was consumed, the group became louder and more profane. We attempted to ignore them, but soon it was impossible due to the volume and the increasingly prevalent and disgusting language. At that point, and because we had 5 young children with us, my son-in-law went over to the group and respectfully asked them to turn down the volume so that my Grandchildren would no longer be exposed to words like "F*ck and C*ck". He was immediately met with a barrage of personal slurs and threats. 2 staff members (2 young ladies, one light-haired and the other dark-haired) working that evening came over to the group, however, incredibly, the inebriated party was allowed to remain on the premises. Shortly after, every family packed up and went home, including our group.  When walking to the parking lot to leave, a particularly vile young woman yelled obscenities at my son-in-law and daughter. I turned around and went over to the group. When I arrived, I was also barraged with a variety of slurs and called a "C*nt". Once again, the 2 female staff members came over to the table to intercede. At this point, the dark-haired staff member shared with me that she "knew the group" of offenders, which helped me understand why these folks had not been asked to leave. If you happen to know staff, you can act like filthy pigs, with the knowledge that your actions will have no repercussion, regardless of the profoundly negative impact on everyone else looking to enjoy wine and food with their families.  To add insult to injury, staff had the unmitigated gall to suggest that I was the problem, not the drunk and vulgar group. When I questioned staff (dark haired young lady) why they permitted such obnoxious behavior from any patron, she suggested that hurling profanity toward others was protected under free speech. Staff continually suggested that our "conversation was over", indicating that they wanted me to leave. Clearly, the privilege of free speech isn't applied equally to all patrons visiting Bell Springs.  In the past 15 months, I have recommended Bell Springs to dozens of family and friends. Now, I plan to exercise my right of free speech in every forum available to tell acquaintances and strangers alike about my experience, advising that Bell Springs is not worthy of anyone's patronage.

reviews.author: Robert R.
reviews.description: The wine was good.  The lawn for tasting was ample.  The amount of things to do was tremendous.  I highly recommend this, but the wine is a little over priced for its taste and quality.

name: Perla's
accommodations: Garage Parking, Street Parking, Validated Parking, Private Lot Parking

reviews.author: Lauren G.
reviews.description: I love Perla's! I have been here a handful of times and every time I go it's a positive experience. This past time I went I got the Halibut - it was buttery, flakey, cooked to perfection. I could have gone without the tomato it came with and would have preferred different garnish. My boyfriend got the pasta dish that has lobster in it (I forget the name) but let me tell you...it's to die for! Best thing by far on the menu. My only complaint is that they only offer it limited times of the year. Perla's is so cute. Their patio is first come first serve. I made a reservation so we were seated inside. I wish if you had a reservation they gave you the option to sit outside. Definitely a great date night place. Be ready to spend some money, it isn't cheap, but the quality is 10/10.  Pros: food and atmosphere   Cons: expensive

reviews.author: Gigi B.
reviews.description: Food was decent, but the parking situation ruined our experience and we likely won't return as a result.   There is a parking garage behind Perlas where they supposedly validate your parking. Apparently there is a new system in place in the parking garage that requires you to scan a QR code to pay for parking then somehow you get it validated at the restaurant. However, when you pull into the garage there is no QR code. So I walked to the restaurant to ask how to validate parking. They gave me the QR code but I had to have my license plate. So I had to walk back to my truck to get license plate. By the time I got back to my truck there was already a parking ticket on my truck!   I reached out to the manger of this parking garage, Travis, to explain the situation, but he refused to waive the parking ticket even though I showed him a copy of my receipt from Perlas which proves that my parking should have been free not to mention the confusing process.

reviews.author: Obed F.
reviews.description: Every time we come to Austin we stop by Perla's no matter if its for Breakfast, Lunch or dinner. This time we stopped in for lunch. We got there an hour before our appt and host was very accommodating and sat us early. Not to mention we had our 4 month old in a stroller. We took the option to sit outside because the weather was great and they have an awesome patio. The waiter was very nice and very knowledgeable on the whole food menu and drinks. We wanted get something light since we have been eating so heavy on our vaca.   We split 3 dishes a ceviche, the lobster bisque and the wedge salad. All the 3 were very light, tasty and delicious!! It was exactly what we were looking for.   I would absolutely recommend this place!

reviews.author: Kimberley R.
reviews.description: The location of this restaurant is just fantastic, located in the heart of South Congress. They have a great deck, the service was very friendly and fast. We went for lunch and had the Ahi tuna tostada, calamari and grilled mahi sandwich. The best thing we ate hands down was the tostada. The tuna was like sashimi and it was packed with flavor from the aioli and topped with Serrano. Absolutely delicious! Our other two dishes were good, not great. The mahi sandwich was a bit of a disappointment, especially given it came highly recommended from our server. I felt like it lacked season and was very bland. Regardless I am intrigued and would like to return for dinner some time.

reviews.author: Fatmis E.
reviews.description: Great ambiance and food. their tuna tostadas were delicious and the cobb salad  with a twist was surprisingly good.

reviews.author: Alysha M.
reviews.description: Had to come back and bring a first timer- I had been hyping the food up so much and thank goodness, everything we ordered was on point. I was just kinda disappointed in the service- we waited really long stretches in between visits from our waitress...it just stands out when your expectations of a spot (and the price point) are so high.

reviews.author: Adrian N.
reviews.description: Calamari was amazing! I would skip on the lobster roll. Although good, it was a little too pricey for how much you get.

reviews.author: Linda H.
reviews.description: Great drinks! Tried the ahi tuna tostada and the ceviche. Loved the tostada...the ceviche was...meh. The ambiance and location were cool. Enjoyed the vibe

reviews.author: Denise D.
reviews.description: I probably go here more than any other place when I'm on or near South Congress.  Great seafood, good service and a lovely patio perfect for people watching.

reviews.author: Amanda D.
reviews.description: Always been a solid spot for oysters. Happy that they allowed my pup to be in with me... In fact, the place's got a wall of pup pictures... one star less because I was so looking forward to the Spanish Octopus dish but it was a tad too salty.

reviews.author: Mel E.
reviews.description: Erin, GM, was amazing from pre-arrival, arrival and departure. What an amazing young lady! Thanks Erin, for the reservation accommodation and delicious bite.  Jacob, my server, was incredible and every dish he recommended was beyond amazing! It was totally worth the flight. This is huge for me because customer service in my opinion, has declined drastically, so when I rave about an experience such as Perla's, it's #facts! This evening I enjoyed some glasses of Chenin Blanc, from South Africa, some delicious oysters (Jacob chose all of them), fried okra, crab cake and the famous potato crusted sea bass and a sea salt dessert! Thanks Perla's for the amazing experience! Thanks for the warm welcome from the staff outside and the lovely hostesses inside. I'll certainly be back and cannot wait! Be safe. Be blessed. Be kind and enjoy good food! Perla's

reviews.author: Mark A.
reviews.description: Been waiting a while to go here, and finally got to make it while it was still nice out; We thought there was supposed to be a happy hour, but it turns out/doesn't seem like there is one anymore unfortunately.  Naturally, we got a few appetizers, oyster shooters and oysters, plus the octopus that came with a savory sauce and potatoes. I'm not a fan of bloody mary's so the shooter wasn't my favorite since that's how they were prepared, and kind of spendy at that. The oysters were a small bit still good; again,  no happy hour pricing.  The octopus was my favorite, grilled perfectly, same as the potatoes, covered in herbs and a butter/mayo sauce that paired nicely.   We both got fish, mine had a bit of spice to it, and the ahi was very nice and fresh; Overall, pleasant meal, more expensive than we would've liked but glad to have tried it. Personally, I think it's better to just get some appetizers/drinks and save the entree for somewhere else; while it's definitely good, I think it's overpriced and could make something comparable for a fraction of the cost.

reviews.author: Brian N.
reviews.description: Dined here on a Saturday night and was lucky to get bar seating without a reservation. The bar tenders served us fairly quickly.  The grilled oysters were excellent, especially with the added Cajun spices.  The fish and chips were nicely battered and very crispy; it also came with a lot of fries.  The portion sizes were big and very filling.

reviews.author: Johanna J.
reviews.description: We stopped by for a birthday brunch and had a great time. We were promptly seated and greeted by our server, Dylan - he was fantastic. We ordered a variety of shareable dishes, cocktails and several carafes of Mimosa. So pleased that everything was spot on. Definitely worth the trip if you're visiting or new to ATX - I do recommend.

reviews.author: Nada S.
reviews.description: Beautiful place .. was visiting Austin for the first time and I was extremely hungry and could not wait for a barbecue place. Stopped by this and it did not disappoint

reviews.author: Kevin M.
reviews.description: Service was professional and prompt. The server, Donovan, was quite excellent at providing suggestions and information without need to go back and consult a chef or manager. What this says is that the restaurant (and chef) ensure the employees taste what they serve so they can provide info to diners. This is one mark of excellence.   The setting is beautiful. Since it was a pleasant autumn day, we opted for outdoor dining and enjoyed our decision. It's hard to write about the vibe but this is closer to a low-key fine dining. It isn't fancy but the food and service make it close.   We had grilled (or broiled) oysters and they were as good as the ones I had at Felix's in the French Quarter. We also had a sampler of oysters in the half-shell and we were guided by Donovan who knew the types of oysters and sources and showed us that by flipping the shell, the underside gives clues as to the waters they originated from.   Tuna Tartare was excellent (I've only had it as good in Aspen, Co for 3x the price).  Then smoked octopus and grilled red snapper. Both of those were outstanding too.   Price is reasonable for the quality but our bill was over $175 (we ate a ton and didn't care) this restaurant is right on price considering the quality on the plate and from the staff. We will definitely go again.

reviews.author: Cameron N.
reviews.description: Perla's is an amazing date night spot for many reasons. The staff is accommodating, the food is tasty, and the environment is welcoming. I would definitely come back!

reviews.author: Chris P.
reviews.description: Amazing oyster selection and great service. Can't wait to come back and try the calamari it looked awesome!

reviews.author: Alan J.
reviews.description: Our first time here for an occasion with my wife's second cousins. Two guests split a dozen oysters and loved them. We split the calamari and it was among the best we've had in Texas. Top two, maybe top five ever. My wife had the redfish on the half shell and loved it. I ordered an oyster Po Boy but was disappointed in the size of the oysters and was very salty. The shoe string fries were fine by my tastes despite what some reviews state. Kind of high price for what we got for lunch but that's what you get now with the CA invasion of Austin. Seafood seemed fresh which is rare in Texas.

reviews.author: Cathy O.
reviews.description: This place was solidly booked for two weeks after we'd be leaving, but when walking by I decided to give it a try, and was surprised to have the hostess take out number was a half hour wait. Unfortunately we got seated exactly when lunch was cut off, so got just a mini menu, but that was enough--as we felt we were (over) eating our way through Austin. So we got drinks, calamari, and a coconut curry clam chowder. The calamari came to the table first, and was hot, seasoned well and came with two yummy sauces. I thought the clam chowder was awesome. The coconut curry base was very tasty. Fresh clams in the shell were very good. Nice chunks of bacon were abundant. The cilantro was the perfect herb for this. The only thing a bit odd were the potatoes. If they'd been cooked in the broth, it would seem that they should have absorbed some of the flavor. They tasted rather plain, and for that reason I wondered if they were from a can and added near the end. They were soft enough to mash up a bit, and that seemed to give them some flavor. Anyway, the soup was unusual and very tasty, so five stars, though the $18 seemed rather high.

reviews.author: Jennifer L.
reviews.description: Colby was AMAZING!!! Ask for her!! Make sure to have her tell you about watching the Austin bats as they come out for the night in the summer. Great bat stories!!

reviews.author: Karley C.
reviews.description: I wish I would have been here for happy hour!  I probably would have tried more drinks/food if I was there during this window of time.  This place is definitely *a vibe*.   The staff were a little sassy though.  If you are in Austin for a girls trip, this place makes sense to add to your itinerary.  Fun fact: It's called P6 because it is an old parking garage.  I had to explain that to the people in my group, so apparently not everyone connects those dots.   Pro tip: Be sure to make your reservations well in advance. We were stuck with a 9pm seating time (on a random Wednesday night) and let me tell you it gets CHILLY up there on a March night.

reviews.author: Greshka P.
reviews.description: We got here on a Sunday afternoon, around 1:30pm.  We were quickly seated outside on a high table.  We would have prefered the lower ones, which looked way more comfortable but were told those were for larger groups, even though some were still open the entire time we were there.  We scanned the code to see the menu and waited and waited (we almost left) for our server to finally arrive to take our order.   The drinks came out looking pretty, nice presentation, but flavor wasn't great.  We looked at the menu again to see if there was something else we might like but debated having to wait again to be served.  Instead, we drank what we got, enjoyed the lake view, and people watching, and when our server finally came around again we asked for our check.  Cute "rooftop" but not on my list to go back to.

reviews.author: Casey T.
reviews.description: GREAT ambiance, but food was incredibly mid.  P6 has great vibes and is a fun place to get drinks, however, it just didn't live up to the hype. The view itself isn't as great as advertised, as the balcony overlooks the roof of the LINE hotel and doesn't have the view of the downtown skyline. The drinks were just OK, and the food just didn't taste as good as it looked. The menu options are extremely limited as well.  If I came here again, I would come just to get drinks and get food elsewhere.

reviews.author: Alice Y.
reviews.description: P6 is an ideal place to take out of towners! It's got a sweeping view of ladybird lake and great for sunsets.  Happy hour is 3-6pm which features a couple of food items marked down $2-3. Glass of red wine is $6. Their regular dinner menu is tapas-style, but full entree prices! Specialty cocktails range $13-16. If you're looking to get full, expect to pay $40-60 per person. Food is average for what you pay for.   Parking- the hotel offers $10 for 3 hour valudation. You can chance street parking which runs $2 per hour. The Mexican American Cultural Center has a moderately sized lot and is a 10 min walk away.   Beware of an automatic 19% gratuity added on, no matter your party size.

reviews.author: Carrie J.
reviews.description: This is my new favorite place! I wish I had known sooner what an amazing tapas menu they have here! We will be bringing our family and friends here!   Cammie was our server. We lucked out to have a girl that was so friendly, quick, and helpful!

reviews.author: Tiffany D.
reviews.description: Hotel restaurant on the side top floor.   Nice lounge and bohemian decor.   I feel like the cuisine is a mix of tapas, Mediterranean and Italian ingredients. Carpaccio was my favorite. Ordered up pasta and hummus dip.   Accommodated our ordered when it was about an hour or less before kitchen closed.   Service was on point.   View of the lake was admirable.

reviews.author: Adrian N.
reviews.description: Cool for the view, the vibe was very chill and relaxed. I suggest to try going during a sunset because you get an amazing view of the river. The staff was very attentive but I probably wouldn't be back for some time because the drinks are very very pricey.

reviews.author: Raychel R.
reviews.description: We came here as soon as the restaurant opened because we knew it would be packed. This place has such beautiful decor and is on the rooftop/patio, so there is a beautiful backdrop of Lady Bird Lake. You will definitely be taking tons of photos here.  We made reservations just in case, but we pretty much had the whole restaurant to ourselves for the first hour P6 was opened. Everything looked delicious, so we ordered quite a bit:  Vegetable Frittata: This was perfect for a light meal. Lots of veggies and the eggs and butter lettuce was perfect.  Shrimp and Grits: Soooo bomb. Every bit of this tasted great. Just wished they would have removed the shrimp tails as most other places do.  Patatas Bravas: The potatoes were great for a side/appetizer.  Sourdough Garlic Bread: I love a good garlic bread, and this totally delivered. And I like that fact that it was pull-apart bread.   Everything tasted amazing and we really enjoyed our time brunching here.

reviews.author: Teah R.
reviews.description: Stop 2 of the night with our group of 9 for a bachelorette party. We made reservations ahead of time and were seated indoors. But we convinced our way out to the patio early in the night which was better (but a little chilly). Why would we want to come to a rooftop bar if we can't be outside, ya know?!  The servers were nice - we had multiple throughout the night. They occasionally came and checked on us. The place was packed on a Friday night.  We all had a lot of fun here and the drinks just kept coming! They were tasty and swanky.  There weren't many parking options other than valet that I saw but I can't remember how much that was. We had to walk through the hotel to get to the rooftop. The hotel looked very nice with mood lighting and modern decor touches.  Overall though, P6 was great - moody and fun!

reviews.author: Desiree D.
reviews.description: Great views overlooking the river and congress bridge. Loved the eclectic furniture and vibe. Food was decent and service was good. You are definitely there for the views.

reviews.author: Dmitri J.
reviews.description: Had a fantastic tic rooftop cocktail here. Great views overlooking the city. We went on a cold night but the heaters were going the space was enclosed and the staff was ready to accommodate. I'd recommend for sure.

reviews.author: Rebecca W.
reviews.description: Visited P6 for happy hour with a friend while visiting Austin and had a good time! We arrived when they were just opening, and luckily we had a reservation - it filled up really quickly after a bit. The space has a great vibe and a great view - even though it's not on the roof, the space offers a lovely view of the city and river and the open concept of the bar makes for a perfect environment to relax and enjoy some sunshine. The space is filled with countless plants and pink decor, which I truly appreciated - it felt quite posh and eclectic yet incredibly put together at the same time.   For drinks, I opted for the ladybird spritz, perfect for a refreshing afternoon cocktail. Featuring rhubarb, aperol, and cava, it was light yet flavorful, really being able to taste the rhubarb throughout the entire drink. Quite good! My friend went for the sundown cobbler, which she also really enjoyed. Since it was happy hour, we snagged some food too. We both split the pita bread with chimichurri and the hummus. We were given a bunch of pita bread, which was much appreciated! The pita was good, but not the best I've ever had (a little dense for my liking). The chimchurri was OK - the ratio of oil to spices was a bit off so it felt like it was swimming in oil. The hummus was quite nice and featured a nice touch of cashews and chili oil. I appreciated the inclusion of various veggies in addition to the pita for a change of pace! The hummus overall was good, but again, not the best I've ever had, but still filling and delicious and balanced our drinks well. While the prices of the cocktails were quite discounted from normal, they were still a bit steep, but to be expected when you consider the ambience of the place.   Overall, we enjoyed our HH at P6! I really enjoyed by spritz and the hummus / chimichurri was a nice balance. The prices are a bit elevated, but to be expected in relation to the space. If you're looking for a nice HH spot for visitors to Austin, I would definitely suggest P6!

reviews.author: Deborah W.
reviews.description: Rating: 3.5 stars  My friend and I decided to stop here for brunch on Sunday. We didn't make a reservation ahead of time but were able to be seated right away indoors. (If you are interested in sitting outdoors - we were told reservations book out 1 week in advance so make sure to plan accordingly)  Even though the indoor space did not have the same ambience as outdoors it was still very nice and well decorated.   Service was very friendly and efficient.  For our brunch we decided to order:  --PATATAS BRAVAS: Well fried with a great flavor. Definitely a great brunch item to order! My only complaint would be they didn't really give us many potatoes since the portion covered less than half of the bowl it came in.   --FRITTATA: Ours was a veggie frittata that was filled with flavor and topped with a great tomato based pure. It did come with a giant handful of lightly coated romaine lettuce which seemed a bit mismatched. Additionally the portion of the frittata was slightly too small for the price.   --PICKLED PEARL ONION HUMMUS: Really good portion of food. The hummus is just bursting in flavor. There was also a ton of bread and veggies it comes with to dip into the hummus. Definitely a solid order!   All in all, a nice brunch option for the weekend if you are staying at The Line.

reviews.author: T N.
reviews.description: Server Colby is awesome!  Bartender Eric needs to be careful of mad muggin' the customers.    Cool place to watch the sunset.

reviews.author: Angela R.
reviews.description: Came here for a bachelorette brunch. The food was SO FRESH and tasted bomb. The views where we sat was also breath taking. The weather was perfect and our waiter was so nice. He gave us tips on what to do and where to go. I've been recommending this place to everyone that visits Austin!

reviews.author: Elizabeth L.
reviews.description: My husband and I stopped by P6 for appetizers and cocktails while we were in town and we had the best time!!  The cute, Instagrammy interior is only topped by the incredible backdrop of the balcony view over the river. We got a shady table by the edge and kicked back with a ros and carpaccio. The plating of the carpaccio was gorgeous, and it had a beautiful mix of salty and fresh flavors. The pita chips that came with it were perfectly crispy too!  This was the best view we were able to get while in Austin, and can't wait to come back! But next time - we'll make it in time for their amazing happy hour deals.

reviews.author: Michelle A.
reviews.description: Really enjoyed brunch the other day here on their patio that overlooks Ladybird Lake. Had a reservation for 6 and the hostess was able to accommodate my request of sitting outside, which I really appreciated. The ambiance is very pretty and totally Instagram worthy with their pink overhangs and colorful couches/decor. They also had semi-large fans for each outdoor table which was much needed in this Texas heat.   The food was really delicious and not too overly priced. For brunch, most of the plates were pretty small so, if you're hungry I would recommend ordering 1-3 plates and sharing if you have the ability to do so. We tried the Greek Yogurt Parfait, Patatas Bravas and Hummus and it was all sooo good! Will definitely be returning here.

reviews.author: Christy V C.
reviews.description: I came here with a couple of friends and we had a blast! The ambiance is incredible and I just loved the view! We came during happy hour, which is literally one hour, 4-5pm, and I ordered the Sundowncobbler and Homemade Pita bread. Im not a huge drinker, but I really enjoyed my drink and loved that there was fruit in it. The pita bread was incredible! I loved how soft and warm the pita was. It was perfect with the chimichurri.  Parking- You can park in the garage for the hotel, but they only validate for the first hour I believe, which is only $5. Luckily we found street parking next to the garage which isn't nearly as expensive.  Payment- I actually really loved that you paid online! It makes it very easy to split the check amongst friends without bothering the servers!

reviews.author: Krista B.
reviews.description: Views are excellent... IF you even get a table anywhere near them. This restaurant is poorly executed in my opinion. They have beautiful views of the river but there is no guarantee that you will even be able to see it from your table (even with reservations) and yet you're still paying "fancy view prices".   My experience: - Arrived at The Line Hotel (which is way cool btw) to find that there are no signs on how to get to P6.  - The elevator is super sketchy and in the back corner without any airflow at all (seemed like an afterthought or service elevator). - Originally was sat at a "table" (their seating are little vignettes of couches/patio furniture that is NOT comfortable AT ALL and really impractical to eat at) nowhere near the view. The tiny view that we did have was completely obstructed by a shade they rolled down. - We asked to be moved to a "table" with a view and were finally re-seated but still had a difficult time seeing the view as we were further back at a SUPER low to the ground vignette.  - The staff was friendly but the drinks and the menu items were overrated. - Stayed for an hour and a half, took some pictures, and went somewhere else to eat more food.  My order: - Sundown Cobbler cocktail - Yummy, but tasted mostly like sprite. - Paper Plane cocktail - Yummy, smooth, easy drinker. - Whipped ricotta - Way more food than we expected but the olives and the nuts were better than the ricotta. It lacked a lot of flavor and mostly just helped to fill me up.  Long story short - NOT worth the hype.

reviews.author: Sarah D.
reviews.description: Owners need to claim their business on Yelp. Hop to it guys! We have been coming to Red Horn since 2015, (Parmer Location). Have been a fan ever since.  And we are loving the new Cedar Park location as well. Grab a great beer, (so many options you can't go wrong), and a taco! Tacos at Cedar Park. (Get the deli salad at the Parmer location. Its simple  but amazing!)  Who doesn't love an amazing taco! Vegan options too! Bring your pooch along and sit outside and enjoy the sunset.

reviews.author: Mariana B.
reviews.description: We came for breakfast. It's a nice and spacious place. They brew coffee and beer. We ordered breakfast tacos, chilaquiles, bowl and croissant. Tacos is good, chilaquiles are very spice, croissant is good and bowl is ok. The latter and the hot chocolate came cold. The coffee was hot is good.

reviews.author: Corey W.
reviews.description: Great locally crafted beers and coffee. I like to come here on Fridays to work remote from my remote office lol. Their tacos and chicken sandwich are worth stopping in for lunch

reviews.author: Bret B.
reviews.description: We tried this location out because we were in the area and we really love the location on 1431 and Parmer. This spot is much larger, has a bigger (and better menu) and great service. We tried the Cali burrito (cuz I'm from California and honestly looking for the perfect Cali Burrito) and it didn't disappoint. Beers were great, bartenders had good advice for certain beer tastes and overall a great experience!

reviews.author: Brian T.
reviews.description: Okay this is my favorite coffee shop in the Austin area period.  I love how big and spacious this new location is, but the coffee is WHERE IT'S AT.  Definitely come here if you're looking for the perfect date spot, study/get work done, or just to enjoy a nice morning coffee and breakfast.  We ordered a hand pour over, a Chemex, and a double espresso.  The double espresso came out first and this one definitely packed a punch - don't let the espresso size cup fool you.  If I was just here for the caffeine content, this one definitely would've done the job alone.   The hand pour over came out next and the presentation was super impressive!  They bring you the entire carafe with the dripper on top, so it's definitely a lot.  Considering this is only $4, you definitely get your money's worth!  This one was so flavorful and the fruity notes definitely stood out while drinking it.  Now the Chemex...just wow.  For $5, they bring the entire Chemex setup to your table and you pour our of it as you drink.  The fact that they trust their patrons with the Chemex really speaks volumes about how much they care about the presentation piece!  Looks aside, this coffee (I believe we got Ethiopian) tasted amazing and on-par with the pour over.  Don't let me forget the breakfast tacos.  This was such a treat.  I got the Migas breakfast taco and this one was stuffed FULL with eggs, tortilla strips, and pico.  It was delicious and filling and for $3, this one definitely hit the spot alongside the coffee.  I also bought one of their coffee beer stouts to take home...I believe it was the House United coffee milk stout.
