If taking home, you either order beer in a Crowler (two pint cans) or a Growler (64 oz).  I can't wait to try their coffee IN THEIR BEER.  But most of all, can't wait to come back here every time I'm in the area!

reviews.author: Thao E.
reviews.description: OH ! High anticipated location! I've been waiting for this location to open since they announced it on their Instagram.   They are having soft openings right now. The space is airy, has high ceilings, and gorgeous.   Being the soft opening, it looks like they are training some new people but they are nice as can be!  They also have Tacomaye on site now for your taco needs. I can't wait to make this my new work spot!  Support your local businesses!

reviews.author: Kim B.
reviews.description: Come for the beer.  Skip the food.   I had high hopes for great tacos and queso to go with my beers.  Unfortunately, the $7 queso was basically Cheez Wiz with some jalapeos, and the beef fajita on my taco was all gristle and had no seasoning.  They could have at least cooked the bell peppers.  The other Red Horn location is much cozier for enjoying a beer.  I'll just go there next time.

reviews.author: Ru L.
reviews.description: The only thing this location doesn't have from the original is the coffee roaster. Other than that the beer is fresh, the coffee is hot, and the food is good. Tacos came fully filled with protein and veggies with two sides of salsa, one green, one red. Two thumbs up.

reviews.author: Sarah H.
reviews.description: This new location is the bomb! Prime selection of craft beer, coffee, tea, fountain sodas too. Plenty of seating, GREAT service, and super delicious food menu -- our favorite so far are the  carne asada loaded nachos -- a must try! Perfect for sharing . The place is really open and bright. Big screen TVs with sports playing. Family friendly. We love coming here for game night, dinner and cold beers.

reviews.author: Amanda S.
reviews.description: This is another place when we come down for a visit we always stop at! The coffee, beer, and food are fantastic! Then there is even dessert coffee.

reviews.author: Shannon A.
reviews.description: They care about their people because they had no kitchen on Independence Day.  The beer flight is great if your fickle or just want to try all the offing's.  It's not on the menu, but it's great.  Also had a London Fog that was absolutely delightful.  Looking forward to coming back for the soft shell crab!

reviews.author: Mark M.
reviews.description: Nice location. Very clean and inviting. Knowledgeable and friendly  staff. Not a beer guy but the coffees and teas are solid.  It's not on the menu board, but they DO offer beer flights.

reviews.author: Kevin G.
reviews.description: Been to this location several times, for both the coffee and the beer. Both are really good. Breakfast tacos are good. The soft shell crab sandwich was also good. The space is great for either socializing with friends or getting a little work done. Staff is friendly. Yeah, this is goi g to be a regular spot for me.

reviews.author: Christy M.
reviews.description: This location is great! Nice open space and a good selection of beer. Haven't tried the food yet, but the coffee is also good.

reviews.author: Sarah S.
reviews.description: Coffee review only. I've tried both locations multiple times hoping each time was a one-off. The coffee here is not good. Like really not good. Service has always been fine. Just really bad coffee.

reviews.author: Teresa M.
reviews.description: 2 stars for the new location - the beer is just as good as the original location and the food isn't bad, but there is zero character and no covered seating  This is Austin - people have dogs. I'm totally ok with sitting outside with my dog since you have a kitchen but man at least buy an awning or umbrellas or something. 4 random picnic tables thrown outside with no shade is an afterthought.

reviews.author: Eric F.
reviews.description: Great decaf coffee and tacos were awesome but be warned the bacon is thicker than normal but still good.

reviews.author: Daniel S.
reviews.description: Food is average at best and the same cashier always gives me an attitude when I order for whatever reason.

reviews.author: Laura N.
reviews.description: I love the new location, closer to my home. The food and drink selection is superb. Service was fast and friendly. It's a big open room - simple but nice. The outside could probably be served better with some decor/ awnings or umbrellas. It's a good vibe inside and I'll be coming back!

reviews.author: Dan S.
reviews.description: Great coffee and amazing area to meet with friends or network on Wednesday mornings.  Stop in and support local.

name: SLAB BBQ and Beer
accommodations: Best nights on Tuesday, Wednesday, Saturday

reviews.author: LaShelle B.
reviews.description: We had AWESOME service at Slab BBQ at Westgate Lane in Austin, TX. After a day of fun with the family tubing in New Braunfels we headed to Austin to try Slab BBQ which we had seen on YouTube and It didn't disappoint!  The staff was amazing we had the nachos, the donk sandwich and ribs ... it was amazing!!! The nachos great amount of cheese and bbq!!! The donk was so good, meat was falling of my bun and I forgot about my table manners and I was picking it up with my hands!! The ribs are so tender and awesome no bbq sauce was needed! and   The staff was so kind they gave us free banana pudding but we all were so full we could only take a bite. I ate my banana pudding for breakfast the next morning and enjoyed it with my coffee, the banana pudding was light and sweet; simple amazing!!  Sorry we didn't take pictures ... the food looked so good we all just dove in an ate our food! (We forgot about our posts and timelines) The food is awesome best first restaurant visit ever! (Even though it is inside a bowling alley)

reviews.author: Gina F.
reviews.description: I've had a lot of bbq after living in Texas for 8 years and this is right up there with the best of them. We actually tried this at BBQ Austin, among many other popular places.   I can be quite picky about brisket and wow this was in my top two of the 10+ we tried. Perfect amount of spice rub, tender, fatty, delicious. Can't wait to go back and have a full plate.

reviews.author: Jordan N.
reviews.description: The sliders were good - some better than others. The place didn't blow me away though. It bills itself as a BBQ joint, but I see this more of a BBQ-between-buns joint.  I wouldn't go out of my way for this type of barbecue, but for those who likes brisket sandwiches and the likes, this is a good place to go to.

reviews.author: Jo R.
reviews.description: Ordinarily, I love SLAB, but the Door Dash order I just received from them was incredibly disappointing. One of the items I ordered was nachos, and the queso wasn't even completely melted. As I was pouring the queso on top of my nachos, two massive chunks of unmelted cheese (at least I hope that's what they were) came plopping out. Also, the brisket wasn't warm, as if it had been recently pulled from a refrigerator but not heated. So disappointing! Do better, SLAB!

reviews.author: Mark K.
reviews.description: This review is based solely on the food of our last visit. Our first experience with Slab was ordering a smoked turkey for Thanksgiving of 2020, and it was one of the best turkey's we've ever had. Smokey, moist, and lovely. But, since turkey is not a regular meat on their menu I am reviewing strictly on our last meal.   While down in S. ATX, I stopped in to give the restaurant a true try. Upon walking in, the menu was posted on the wall, but confusing. All we saw were sandwiches, no mention of meat by the 1/2 pound or pound and no price. Would be cool to know what options we have with a little signage. Is this a sandwich spot or a BBQ joint? Long/short, they did let us do 1/2 pound orders, so got some brisket, a few sides, and some beers.   Sides were solid. Twice baked potato salad and the smoked mac/cheese were both great. The brisket on the other hand was meh. Maybe i'm spoiled with Texas brisket and its smokey, red tinted smoke ring and crust. So it was a little sad to get something that was not that. The meat, while tender, was almost more like a pot roast. Seems like they take inspiration from many different styles (KC, Carolina, TX, etc) with sauces, so maybe this was the point, and I'm sure slathered with sauce and tossed on a bun it's probably pretty good. But if i'm going tit for tat on sliced brisket, elsewhere will allow you to fly closer to the Texas sun.    Not sure we'll be back if we're wanting true BBQ, but if we're in the mood for a BBQ style sando, we may swing by.

reviews.author: Kat M.
reviews.description: Had the Bougie bowl this time and it was quite a disappointment. The Mac n cheese tasted horrible almost like the smell of plastic. Hubby had their Tuesday special pork belly sandwich and there was hardly any meat and mostly fatty pieces.

reviews.author: Amber W.
reviews.description: Back again to our favorite BBQ place. This time I gorged myself on brisket nachos with no onions or jalapeos.  Man oh man. The crispy chips. The tender, flavorful melt in your mouth, slap yo daddy and kick your cat good brisket. Tasty sweet BBQ sauce. Classic queso and what makes the whole plate a hit...chopped up pickles. A little burst of crisp vinegar to cut the richness of the cheese is a bite of what I hope clouds would taste like.   We drive from San Antonio to eat here and you should too. Call up your boo and tell them it's time to get weird and head to Austin.   What are you waiting on? Go on. Austin is calling.

reviews.author: Julia C.
reviews.description: Didn't want a sandwich, so ordered some brisket in a small salad. Yum! Fresh ingredients, flavorful brisket, and some jalapeo dressing with a KICK. The sides were delicious too. Will probably order a larger size if the potatoes...delicious!

reviews.author: Bea T.
reviews.description: What a hidden gem. Would have never known if wasn't for DDD as it's in a bowling alley. BBQ scrumptious and the mustard flavored coleslaw was cherry on top.

reviews.author: Jennifer W.
reviews.description: Phenomenal! Food was so good. Loved the sauces too. The bar side is cute too. Smart idea to have one side more like a bar and one side a small place to eat inside. Didn't care for the plastic barriers but maybe this is required due to covid. I'm stuffed! We even have leftovers for dinner lol

reviews.author: Gretchen P.
reviews.description: The pork rib sandwich is to die for. That's all I've had here, but I've had it 3 times in the past 6 months, and it is great. Sides are just ok. My biggest complaint is that they do not serve wine, the bar keep told me they used to but it wasn't selling. So, that's a drawback for me. I am not a beer drinker.

reviews.author: Brad W.
reviews.description: Great local BBQ place. I had 2 meat sandwiches, pork and brisket with a small BBQ beans. VERY juicy and flavorful. Beans were great but slight on sweat side.

reviews.author: Cari W.
reviews.description: We loved Slab as a stand-alone restaurant.  We are sad that they closed their South Austin location to move into Westgate Lanes Bowling Alley.

reviews.author: Danielle D.
reviews.description: We were looking for a BBQ lunch spot and SLAB delivers! The meats are smoked to perfection and because we couldn't decide on what to try we got two of the best sampler options on the menu - the slider trio (chicken, pork, brisket) and the epic DONK sammich (all the meats - chicken, pork, brisket, sausage and all the sauces). We also tried two of their sides because YOLO - Gouda Mac and the twice baked potato casserole. Legit, UNBELIEVABLY good. My favorite out of the slider trio was the chicken - sauces were on point, chicken was tender and juicy. The Mac and cheese was EPIC - it's a wet Mac which I love. Super creamy, smoked Gouda is just divine. Twice baked tots were also good (but my heart belongs to the Mac). If you're here for epic then go with the DONK. Single portion was HUGE but it delivers on flavor! Stacked high with meats it's also smothered in delicious sauces, crunchy onions and jalapeos. Honestly, will come back for that! Beer selection is fantastic. Get you some SLAB!

reviews.author: Rosalind C.
reviews.description: I tried the other location and decided to try this one when I came into town. Long story short, it's really good. The service and the food. I got the slider trio and it was good, everything tasted fresh. My only issue, which is a personal preference is they didn't have enough bbq sauce. Overall I would highly recommend.

reviews.author: Jin L.
reviews.description: It was my first time having SLAB so I wanted to try the trio to get a taste of the most popular sandwiches. Let's just say that it did not disappoint!  The portion sizes are HUGE, which is always a plus for me. The trio comes with the Texas O.G., Notorious P.I.G., and the Chicken W.A. All of the sliders were amazing, but my favorite has to go to the Chicken W.A.! Their dank white sauce is addicting!!!   For COVID-19, they are currently doing curbside takeout and limited dine in and patio service

reviews.author: Brianna E.
reviews.description: This place is pure heaven, every single time. The sink sandwich is AMAZING and huge! I also love the slider trio. Mac and cheese is great, and so is the potato salad. I haven't tried anything other than those items because they are just so good every time. They make their own bbq sauces which are for sale I believe, my favorite is the dank white!

reviews.author: Stan V.
reviews.description: I've been a long time Patron of Slab off of the Burnett Location and this New Location doesn't disappoint.   Sometimes when there's a new location, there's a drop in quality, but not here.   Its actually 2x bigger, nice and bright, just missing the Hip Hop Feel of the original location.   If you like BBQ or BBQ sandwiches, then this is the spot for you.   They gots a variety of meats for your meat eaters, sorry, I'm not a vegetarian so I don't know what they got for folks here.   The Nachos are awesome, prob best to share than eat alone.  If you don't know what you like, give the Trio Sampler a try, its a very nice place to start.   All the other sandwiches are massive (and good), and will prob put me in the hospital if I eats them again, so my goto sandwich is the McDowell, oh man, puts the McRib or any Pork Rib to shame, its executed so well.  Always tender fall off the bone rib mean between your choice of bun, bbq sauce, and pickles, so good.   The Sides are ok, but the Desert is the best, the OG cookie is so drip!   Give this place a try, its great!

reviews.author: Ali R.
reviews.description: Omg so yum! We got brisket nachos, the slider trio and we had to try the potato casserole. Definitely appreciate the queso coming on the side for to go orders. The nachos were big. Between the two of us, we had 1 slider each and about 1/4 of the nachos each. I didn't even have enough room to try the casserole... tomorrow's lunch for sure.   We'll definitely order from SLAB again!

reviews.author: Will C.
reviews.description: Got there early and thankful we did. Fills up even on Memorial Day. Brisket pork and chicken all cooked perfectly. We forgot to add any extra sauce as soon as we started eating

reviews.author: Nicole B.
reviews.description: This place is great for a group or to catch up with a friend or two. It's not super crowded during the day, which makes a 2 p.m. Friday meeting perfect. They have a full kitchen; the fries were frozen-type but tasty for a snack and the BBQ taco I must admit was huge but not really doing it for me. Don't come here for the food. Come for the huge patio, outdoor spaces, dog-friendliness, parking lot, easy street parking and proximity to downtown and all it has to offer.

reviews.author: Christina H.
reviews.description: I enjoy this Lustre Pearl location because of the SPACE! Amazing for large parties, easy to find parking, and super dog-friendly, but my only complaint... one bar?! Lustre Pearl should have at least 2, one in the front and one in the back.  Drinks are basic, but that seems to be the common theme for Austin bars.

reviews.author: David B.
reviews.description: As the spectre of being hospitalized by COVID continues to ease, I've enjoyed revisiting my favorite Austin hangouts; especially those with outdoor spaces. The Geeks Who Drink trivia night on Tuesdays at Lustre Pearl promises a fun time, yummy food, and tasty drinks.   What my group of friends didn't count on this past Tuesday was a female bartender's phone number scrawled on the receipt belonging to a married member of our party who had ordered food and drinks with his wife at his side. We also sat in plain view of bar staff for about 2 of hours and, although the married couple weren't all over one another like a couple of teenagers, the casual onlooker would easily see that they were together.  I love that Austin is very Texas friendly, and, who doesn't enjoy the flattery of getting the phone number of a young, attractive admirer?  However, as a person working behind the bar, I figure this bartender also has to be observant and gauge many things about a customer: their age, sobriety level, with whom are they sitting, etc. The bar area wasn't very crowded this past Tuesday, so we can't attribute this paper proposition to a simple misunderstanding.   So, couples beware. You might be forced to have that awkward conversation with your partner a few days after one of you is handed a phone number by the person you bought drinks from at Lustre Pearl.  The recipient of the phone number wanted to avoid creating a scene on Tuesday night (his wife would have likely had words with the female bartender), so had to hold his tongue for a few days before sharing his experience.  Lustre Pearl: please talk to your staff about being more aware of your client's relationship status, or at least being respectful of it... especially if they're gonna jot their number down on a receipt.  Plus 4 stars for food and atmosphere; minus 3 for lack of awareness and creating an awkward situation.

reviews.author: Cheyenne H.
reviews.description: This is my favorite bar in East Austin by a long shot.   I joined a cornhole league that played at Lustre Pearl East and it was the perfect outdoor bar setting. There are tons of murals around this bar (perfect for picture taking!) and picnic style tables outside. Most of the seating is outside with 4-5 tables inside, so definitely come on a nice sunny day. Lustre Pearl East also has a private event space that can be reserved. Parking is free and mostly along the street.  As for food, there are quite a few beers on draft and great food options. I order the brussels religiously and have never been disappointed... they're mixed with pretzels and topped with a savory sauce and beer cheese. Best brussels in Austin, and all for $7. I've had their wings and tacos too and both were delicious.  Of course I have to give a shout-out to the AMAZING bartenders at Lustre Pearl. They always remembered my order and welcomed me with a smile. Great people and great environment... definitely check out this bar if you're in the area.

reviews.author: Jack G.
reviews.description: I've been a regular at Lustre Pearl Tuesday trivia nights for a couple months now. First off, five stars to the hosts. I've been to many Geeks Who Drink nights at bars around Austin and the folks who run the show here have the right combination of humor, expediency, and most importantly music taste.  As far as Lustre Pearl itself - the bar food is nothing to write home about. The tacos are nice enough but they have off nights and on nights and for $5 a taco you can do much better elsewhere. The drinks are not terribly priced but just keep in mind this is a nicer bar in East Austin so you more or less know what you're in for. As far as the space itself, it would be nice to have more places to beat the heat but the outdoor space is quite nice - just make sure you grab some bug spray before you head out the door.  Overall, this is a solid bar and a great place to hang out on a week night. Check it out!

reviews.author: Amy G.
reviews.description: Lustre Pearl has a great location but everything else is forgettable at best. When I was craving a club sandwich, I eventually remembered seeing a club on their menu, so I biked over to try it. I'd been there a few times before, but like I said, it hadn't made much of an impression on me. Unfortunately, the club was a waste of money and a dinner. The menu didn't say it had mayo, but it was drenched in mayo. The bread was limp. The other fillings were fine, but the bread and the mayo ruined the rest of it for me.

reviews.author: Anthony M.
reviews.description: As summer rolls around and you find yourself wanting to enjoy the weather at an outside bar, one place to consider is Lustre Pearl.  I recently came by for a happy hour with co-workers and got to try a couple of their snacks off the menu as well as a drink such as the:  - Loaded Tots: these are topped with brisket, avocado, cilantro, sriracha, goat cheese, and chipotle aioli - I mean, look at my picture. I don't have to explain how good it was. You got to try this one!  - 6 Chicken Wings: we went with Garlic Rosemary and that was nice since I haven't had a flavor like that on wings before. I like the strong herbal flavor in that one.  - Adult Chicken Nuggets: we went with the Ranch Rub on this and I liked how different it was to the garlic rosemary flavor. This one is stronger and richer, a must try for any ranch lover.  - House Sweet Potato Fries: some sweet potato fries are hit or miss, and this was a hit. The spicy miso aioli that comes with it is a good pairing!  - Lustre Lemonade: as a sweet drinker who's favorite fruit is Strawberry, this is all I could want: vodka, strawberry syrup, lemon juice, and soda water. Great refreshing drink for a hot day.  All in all, I give them an 4/5 since I had a great time! Good food selection, good drink selection, various specials throughout the week, and fun atmosphere to come with friends. I suggest y'all come try them out!

reviews.author: Tipsy G.
reviews.description: Great interior, impressive open area. Space fills quickly for games and events. It's a great place close to downtown that is in my groups regular list.

reviews.author: Kat S.
reviews.description: I've been to LP twice now, once for lunch (pandemic-ending period) and once post pandemic for happy hour. Both visits were good! Plenty of outdoor seating, I've never seen that they have indoor seating but didn't explore too much. There is a house on the property that may have seating inside. I've had the loaded tots and the cheeseburger and both were excellent. Music is playing over the loudspeakers but not too loud. Gravel and cement flooring. Plenty of free street parking. Definitely worth a visit if you're in the area.

reviews.author: Carl-andre R.
reviews.description: Love this place. Great ambiance and bar food / snacks are awesome. I recommend the loaded tots.

reviews.author: Jennifer M.
reviews.description: This place is definitely stepping up their game! I came back here for a birthday gathering and was very happy with the choice. The loaded tots were probably some of the best I've had, the bar tenders were funny's and personable, the house drinks were great, and the designated corn hole area was a hit. Can't say enough good things about this place!

reviews.author: Laurie P.
reviews.description: Came here before and had a pretty good experience despite it being super busy. Here tonight and one of the bartenders doesn't give a fuck. He shook my margarita twice before serving it, not proper or tasty. I'll be sticking with something canned if I get another.

reviews.author: April J.
reviews.description: Just go to High Noon, instead. You're welcome.  I rarely leave reviews, but I still can't get over our experience here...  Generally: Vibe was very bro-y (very San Fran). Drinks were subpar. Music was all over the place. Service was disappointing (I'll get into that later). The only thing it seemed to have going for it was the outdoor space. It was nice, esp with right weather. Tho some of the tall tables were awkwardly big, I wondered if they were built during covid to have people 6 ft apart? Either way, we were already looking up a different spot because the atmosphere was quite dull and boring.   Personally: I really dislike being treated poorly, when the alternative is so simple.... so thought I'd share here because it all happened so suddenly I barely processed it.  My 2 friends and I had been there for less than an hour, talking and sitting at the giant table minding our business. Two of us were still sipping on the first drinks we ordered, my other friend had a soda.... When out of nowhere this short rando interrupts us by loudly tapping his bottle opener on the table and just says "YOU GOTTA GO". We look at him, annoyed, waiting for the punchline.  He must have realized we were confused, because only then did he decide to explain himself (in a rude accusatory tone, at that) "you can't stay here if your friend is throwing up in the bathroom". More confused, I instantly checked in with my friend who used the bathroom, to ask if she was feeling okay, because she wasn't even drinking (she literally asked for a coke at the bar). The bro just stared at us, until he walked away..  First off, There's a better way to approach people. Period. Use your words. Treat people with respect. It's really pretty simple.   Allow me to share some tips, for the wyt bro from last night: - Rather than tapping something loudly on the table like a child, an "Im sorry to interrupt you all." Or even an "Excuse me" as you're interrupting a conversation, would suffice.  - Rather than "YOU GOTTA GO" outta nowhere with zero explanation. Maybe an "I'm sorry, to have to do this. It's been suggested that your friend was throwing up in the bathroom, and as part of our policy, we're going to have to ask your group to leave". Use your words. - Or, you could actually do a decent job of assessing the situation and use your skills to read the room and recognize that the person you accused was not displaying any OTHER signs of intoxication because they were not drunk (or even drinking at your establishment). A check-in with our group could have also informed you to make a better decision. You could have also given a warning. There are actually several alternatives than following your ego trip.  But really, how clich, another wyt bro doing the bare minimum, knowing he could go on in life giving zero effort to be decent. How original...  Secondly, We weren't some blacking out college students barely able to stand on 6th (who, by the way, also wouldn't deserve such a shitty response). We were sitting, chatting, coherent, physically functioning, PAYING patrons, sipping on meh drinks at your boring establishment.  None of us were making a scene. None of us showing signs of being affected by alcohol. My accused friend did NOT even order a drink there. She didn't have to be embarrassed by that bro - she hadn't even shared with us that her stomach was upset, yet. AND she had just shared that there was literally people hooking up in the other stall, like lol what kinda place are yall running?   Also, you do know there are other reasons why grown ass women (who aren't drinking) would gag in bathroom, right? Did you ever think about that? We had just walked over after having a 5 course meal at Intero. She said she was feeling odd and that all she did was gag in the bathroom. Like use your best judgment, vato. Read a book.  Third of all, we are literally sitting there checking out the new Lustre with my friend who is part owner of a bar on Cesar Chvez. We know the law. This was all so poorly handled. We didn't get into it then, because it wasn't worth the energy. But there's a reason there are other MULTIPLE signs listed for bartenders to be trained to spot intoxication: * Slurred speech * Confusion or disorientation * Loss of coordination * Delayed reflexes * Slow, irregular breathing * Unresponsiveness * Nausea and vomiting And, if as a bartender, you're still compelled to ask a group to leave because their non drinking friend gagged, then at the very least approach people with respect.   Do better.

reviews.author: Alex R.
reviews.description: This place's scenery and outdoor seating were so nice and comfortable. Felt super safe. Their daily happy hour deals are also so good and such a good deal! My friends and I loved it here. I would highly recommend this place to anyone looking for a nice, chill atmosphere to grab appetizers and drinks!

reviews.author: Tony R.
reviews.description: Went here for lunch and didn't have a great experience. Bearded guy behind the register almost looked put out I came in to order something. Weird. When I got my food I went to get the utensils, loads of dirty knives and forks. I washed my own using their hand sanitizer on the side. Food was ok, had some weird strand of fluff or hair in my salad. Couldn't pinpoint exactly what it was but you have to step up the hygiene factor either way. I'll give them the benefit of the doubt and come back again and hope for a better experience. Maybe that guy is usually more engaging and maybe their hygiene is usually better.

reviews.author: Thep T.
reviews.description: Great spot to kick it with friends. Low key, casual, and decent food too! The wings are some of the tastiest around.

reviews.author: Caitlin R.
reviews.description: Loved the atmosphere, staff, food and especially drinks. I brought my dog with me and she had a great time. The drinks here are made very well - not too sweet or overtly strong. My table ordered the adult nuggets, tots, sweet potato fries, and the chopped beef sandwich (which is brisket). The tots were definitely my favorite and easily shareable. I had the chopped beef sandwich and it was pretty good - wish it came with a side for the price you pay. This is definitely a great place to hangout or on a weekday - " work from home "

reviews.author: Max W.
reviews.description: We came to this place because of a recommendation from a friend. As soon as we arrive, we sit down at a table, there are no heaters or service. So we are slowly freezing to death in the cold. But hey, it could get better, maybe we can order some whiskey to warm us up right? WRONG! As soon as I leave my seat, to go order drinks for our group, I immediately get harassed by four power hungry servers/bartenders that tell me to put a mask on even after governor Abbot  stated that no more businesses require customers to wear masks. The main reason I'm giving a one star is because we were the only customers in the bar and there were no heaters in the blistering cold, service sucked, and the staff were extremely rude when they definitely could have handled it more professionally. Just be polite next time! Unfortunately we won't be coming back. Cheers.

reviews.author: Michael E.
reviews.description: Fun restaurant/bar located in East Austin. The original house which was on Rainey Street is there and open for business, which is fun.  Ambiance: Good selection of outdoor games and music playing. Nice indoor area as well as a lot of outdoor area. Dog friendly.  Service: The service staff is relatively friendly. I have been here quite a few times and most of the time it is good, but I have had poor service as well  Food/Drinks: I wish they had a better selection of beer to my liking, but they do have quite a few taps to choose from. Their food for a bar is actually really good. Their wings, a little salty, and pretty tasty along with their burgers and tots.  Definitely worth checking out

reviews.author: Randee D.
reviews.description: I really love this bar... the drinks are great, the staff is attentive... but I went in there today and it was FREEZING! I guess their heater's broken or something?? Well... THIS Texan ain't going back till the heat gets fixed! And I love it there, too. BOO!

reviews.author: Erik A.
reviews.description: Can't say much about the sodas they're good not going to lie but my main go to is the lemonade five stars all day son

reviews.author: Ronnie W.
reviews.description: Maine Root Root Beer has a nice smooth flavor. It tends to be a little more on the spice side meaning the wintergreen and anise really come through when tasting it. Not too strong on the carbonation like some of the mass produced ones can be.  It is an all natural soda using Fair Trade ingredients. Of all the root beers I have tasted and reviewed, this one is at the top of my list.

reviews.author: Dan M.
reviews.description: :::MAINE ROOT ROOT BEER::: Ok... so it's "Fair Trade" Certified with "Organic Cane Juice..." and like most things I've had with those big label stamps... it's not so good...  Oh well... NEXT!!!

reviews.author: Puppet M.
reviews.description: Chicken Bacon ranch pizza was awesome and Derrick and the crew were very friendly and helpful! Be back next week!

reviews.author: Karine S.
reviews.description: Great pizza and wonderful choice of local beer... Shout out to Chris who helped me decide, after few samples ,lol, what beer I wanted . Loved #23.... reminded me of home, Milwaukee and the place I go to, Vennture... for great beer.. Thank you Chris for your hospitality and knowledge.

reviews.author: Bruno S.
reviews.description: We had a work meet and greet here for lunch , so unfortunately I wasn't able to taste their craft beer but it looked so good I felt like I was drooling on the inside.   Really nice place with both indoor and outdoor seating. Bench style seating.   I was able to order everything from my phone after scanning the QR code.   I ordered a chicken bacon ranch which is what I normally get when eating California style pizza. It was very good. Although, everyone else ordered the South Austin and it looked really good, they all loved it, but The salad on a pizza just ain't for me.   I am not from Austin so I don't know what to compare to, but I will definitely be back to try another pizza and definitely the Hazy IPA.   They also have dessert pizza which I brought home and it didn't last 20 minutes.

reviews.author: Sierra R.
reviews.description: This was not where I planned on going on the night I visited, but it was still an enjoyable experience. The beer selection is pretty good and the pizza was yummy (but not blow-your-mind level yummy). I will say my boyfriend's pizza, The Flying Garlic, was amazing and so flavorful  The service was the best part for sure; I felt comfortable and taken care of during my meal. I'll probably try to visit their Parmer Ln location in the future!

reviews.author: Sean Matthew L.
reviews.description: Aviator Pizza was solid, not amazing, but okay. We grabbed togo and picked it up on our way home from the gym so we could just collapse and eat some pizza. We got one white pie with arugula on top. It tasted like the greens weren't washed, and they were all wilted and slimy by the time the pizza got home 10 minutes later.   The other pizza was better with a variety of meats and veg on top. But overall the dough felt a little undercooked on both and generally was a bit chewy.   I'd be willing to try this spot again and likely sit down to eat it in person and hope that it's better right out of the oven, maybe it just doesn't travel well? But pizza is a notoriously delivered food item, so I would hope that's not the case.   All in all, i'm not that impressed but willing to give them another go.

reviews.author: Holmes O.
reviews.description: Born and Raised in Austin and I can say this is the best best place in town. Not only was the Pizza amazing, but you don't get the heavy, groggy feeling after eating. Derek provided an amazing customer experience and I can't wait to be back!

reviews.author: May C.
reviews.description: Shout out to Chris! Great customer service and very knowledgable in beer and wine taste! Love this place!

reviews.author: Luna J.
reviews.description: The dough need a little more salt but overall there are good pizzas!!!  A little to bright inside. They should dimmer the lights a little.   Great for take out!

reviews.author: Mariah F.
reviews.description: Love Aviator pizza! It's a really chill place to grab a drink and meal with family or friends. Service is always really good. The buffalo pizza is my go to. I also love the cinnamon pecan dessert! They have a wide selection of local beers and are constantly rotating them. 10/10 recommend!

reviews.author: Laura W.
reviews.description: Like the pizza here, it is one of my go to pizza places in town. The cheese bread should be illegal and the flying garlic pizza is dreamy. The quality has been consistnet and then it wasn't. This last visit, they came up a little short of the runway.  The dough was not cooked all the way and one of the  9 inch pizzas was 7 inches.  Emailed them about the short order about a week ago and have not heard back. I am disappointed and it just makes me wonder about quality control in general.  How could they not notice the pizza was almost 2 inches smaller than ordered or do they just not care? The lack of response indicates the later.

reviews.author: Dan M.
reviews.description: So ... views of photos over past 90 days at record high: 197k, but views of reviews down to 10.5k from 32k over past 90 days. I think this means I should write about pimps and gangsters in purple Cadillacs.   No ... there were no purple Cadillacs here. Sorry! And I was the only one there. But I got me a pizza and a salad (no beer). Then went next door and dropped $300 in a cash game at Shuffle 512 because a Facebook friend/fan sat right next to me and we were having fun and gambling.   If I had gone in to Shuffle 512 first, I might have won. Therefore, theoretically, this was a $300 pizza and salad. I'd leave a woah emoji, but not sure if it will show up on Yelp. I mean, the emoji comes up but I have tried it before and it was just a weird space. And I don't want you to associate me with pimps, gangsters, and weird spaces (purple Cadillac okay).   As far as the pizza goes, traditional bar pizza. Good not great. Salad pretty solid. Atmosphere very good but I was there early so not 100% sure.   Overall, recommended as a feeler to see if it's for you.

reviews.author: Raquel C.
reviews.description: Absolutely love this place! Variety of pizza choices. All are delicious! Plus beer  Service is friendly. Great date night.

reviews.author: Lyndsey D.
reviews.description: Whenever I'm craving pizza and beer, this is my place. It's laid back, very friendly service, and the beer selection has something for everyone. And of course the pizza is delightful! Last time we went, we got something with arugula on top and my fianc didn't love the amount (how often does one complain of too much of something?!?) but I loved the flavor combo, plus I felt like I got my greens in. Speaking of which, the salads are great, too!

reviews.author: Dayna M.
reviews.description: First time here recently; we had planned on 'waiting' here while our daughter got a haircut next door but it turned out we were hungry so we ordered ceasar salads and a large meaty pizza.  I ordered Dem Berries beer and my honey ordered a mic ultra.  The pizza was a-m-a-z-i-n-g!!!!! The bread was out of this world.  The toppings were fresh and had delicious flavors.  The staff were nice however we asked for her to change the TV to the TX/OU game but she kept forgetting.  We asked her again and finally tried to locate it however the cable they had didn't allow the game so we had to watch it on our phone.  We wished they offered nicer plates and flatware; they gave us paper plates and plastic forks but we aren't fancy people so it was all good.  The place was super clean and relaxing.  I would definitely recommend this venue.

reviews.author: Mary M.
reviews.description: I am not a thin crust person. I'm just not. Aviator's pizza crust is the perfect thickness to me, where you can enjoy the bread as well as the toppings. Their garlic pizza is one of my favorites, but the cheese burger and south Austin are also solid choice.   We always have to get their mozzarella bread because the cheese/garlic/butter/crust combination makes it one of the best things on the menu.   They have a huge rotating beer selection and plenty of seating if you're wanting to eat there. I've taken pizza to go a few times too and it transports well.

reviews.author: Avery S.
reviews.description: The food was great!! Had great customer service from our waiter Chris! Very nice place to come and visit!

reviews.author: Lauren B.
reviews.description: I mean their pizza is amazing!! Chicken bacon ranch! The el nacho Mexican pizza too omg my favorite. Everyone at our table kept wanting a piece of it. It was that good!  We also got the South Austin, the one with prosciutto and arugula which was good but next to the chicken bacon ranch and the El Nacho... it's was just good not GREAT

reviews.author: Sergio V.
reviews.description: Saw $3pints 7-9PM Tuesdays, on their online menu.. the bartender said that wasn't a thing. When I asked available deals, he also said happy hour ends at 6, when the menu also said 7-9PM. I ordered a 12in/ 3 topping and 2 beers, $30. I saw the tip auto generated to $12, so I lowered it due to false information and frustration w the employees. Today my Aviator transaction is $50 for a 12in and 2beers Definitely felt ripped off.

reviews.author: William W.
reviews.description: Ate here with my sister and nephew. First off the pizza is great and love the beer selection BUT after ordering I used the restroom and there was a crew member that used the restroom at the same time and didn't wash their hands. I brought this up in comments about how they were doing when I had my receipt emailed. It seems whoever answered back did a half ass apology by saying maybe they were washing their hands in a different sink or were intending to wear gloves. I'm sorry but I don't wanna eat at somewhere where a higher up thinks it's appropriate for a worker to use the restroom not wash their hands put on gloves and touch my food.

reviews.author: Eric E.
reviews.description: We just arrived in town on Sunday night and needed dinner. We called and ordered a specialty pizza for pickup. It was ready super fast. The price was reasonable. The staff definitely appeared to be on top of COVID precautions.   The pizza was so so. The crust didn't impress. Sort of like a grocery store premade crust from a bag. The toppings were just kinda blah. The pizza didn't feel incredibly hot for being just out of the oven.   There was nothing wrong. It just wasn't all that. Maybe it was an off day.

reviews.author: Alex P.
reviews.description: Jake, Holliday, and Robbie were superb. Absolute blast to have tending bar. They made me feel welcome, were supernknowledge about drinks and made me want to stay  forever. Such a great experience.

reviews.author: Zach Y.
reviews.description: Came to this spot right before an Austin FC game! Grabbed a beer and the service was great! This is a really great spot to pre game before the GAME   It also seemed like the food looked amazing!

reviews.author: Amy G.
reviews.description: I was impressed at first but then things went downhill. I don't have time for an eloquent review, so here's the quick and dirty...  The good:  Happy Hour deals. The hh burger was good for $7 in my opinion.  Good atmosphere, in and out.  Friendly service.  Live music.  Wide menu.  Kid-friendly until 9. Close parking.  Good place to stay for hours and hours.  Generous cheap side salads.  Pretzel appetizer.   Cookie skillet with ice cream.   The bad: Poisoned my friend by serving her a known allergen.  Forgetful service.  Mushy fries. Did they boil them?! Bland house-made tater tots. Frozen tots would have been better.  Ruined my salad by drenching it with dressing.  Other friends didn't like the burger.  Added things to the wrong tab.

reviews.author: Ruth Y.
reviews.description: My fianc and I were looking to have lunch at the Domain and happened to see this place close to where we parked. The main reason he wanted to try it was to watch hockey.  We were immediately greeted and told to take a seat anywhere we wanted, a precursor to the excellent service that we received the entire time we were there.  The place is very spacious with a bunch of tables and bar seating, as well as plenty of outdoor seating, and a bunch of TVs. There is also what appears to be a stage space, most likely for their events like trivia and bingo. We sat at the bar and ordered drinks. It was a Sunday early afternoon so it was pretty quiet. We ordered a side of Buffalo roasted cauliflower per recommendation. My fianc got the impossible burger with a side Caesar salad and I got the smoked pork quesadilla also with a side Caesar salad.  All the food came out relatively quickly and pretty much all at once. I obviously was too excited for the food because I forgot to take pictures of them! The portions were the perfect size and the side salads were not sad like some other watery small portions that you might get elsewhere. My fianc enjoyed his burger and my quesadilla had a great texture and came with pickled onions, sour cream, jalapeo slices, and shredded lettuce.  Shout out to the service for being extremely friendly and fast, constantly checking in on us. We definitely want to come back to this place!

reviews.author: Scott T.
reviews.description: Just can't get beyond these pretzel bites SOAKED in oil. Squishy.... you could pinch them and drip the oil out. I'm at a loss for words in regard to the preparation of this. Check the oil pools in the pictures. I wouldn't recommend this appetizer at all.   - PRETZELS - $10 Fresh baked pieces with white queso and spicy brown mustard (680 CAL.) -   Sooo..... Baked and then dipped in Oil? Also, avoid that queso. As far as ambiance... It was noticeably hard to ignore a certain mildew type odor while sitting. Sit outside if you must! But, plenty of other places you can go instead in that area.

reviews.author: Michaela P.
reviews.description: With a large group. Spot on service - Sam did a great job managing our rambunctious crew! Great selection of beer, full bar. Management should spend a couple bucks to update the menus. Food was okay but not the primary reason we were here.

reviews.author: Bryan D.
reviews.description: For our anniversary we were excited about the other Yelp! Reviews. The queso looked amazing in the pictures.   First off, the service was nice and attentive.  The chips were warm and the queso was fine but not the start we expected. Disappointing.  We were hoping to try several of their beers but since the appetizer was less than average, we had a beer each. The Lagunitas Sumpin Sumpin was nice and the 512 IPA was wonderful.   One of the best IPAs hands down.   We each had a beverage, ate our chips and moved on.

reviews.author: Jamie P.
reviews.description: My girlfriend and I stopped by the Brass Tap on a Wednesday night after getting our nails done across the street. Cool vibe, big tables, seat yourself social distancing, and quite a few TVs. Servers kind of rotate between tables to make sure everyone is taken care of so they're super attentive. We had one main server though and she was sweet and personable. They had three different menus, which was kind of confusing, but we realized one was their main menu, the second was someone they partnered with, and the third was for their Smokehouse BBQ only served on Wednesday nights.   Go for the bbq! I was pleasantly surprised how delicious the bbq was. I got the two meat plate that came with two sides. The sweet potato fries and brussel sprouts were both delicious. My friend got the loaded sweet potatoes and really enjoyed it. Overall, we had a good time with some good eats! Would definitely go back again!

reviews.author: Susan W.
reviews.description: This is a difficult review of the Brass Tap Beer and Food restaurant at the Domain. Why you say?  I am getting out more and the Domain is one of my favorite places to shop(carefully), eat and people watch! Sunday I met my two adult grandchildren at the awesome Domain Shopping Center. After completing our initial agenda of a haircut and some shopping we were starving. When the three of us get together and we're going to eat 99% of the time we choose a place we haven't tried before.  There sat the Brass Tap Tavern.  As always, I took a look at yelp for reviews and the majority were very positive-always a good sign! We've gone to a small handful of restaurants that are available at the Domain but in the spirit of adventure we decided to try The Brass Tap.  It was a Sunday afternoon around 430 ... so absolutely not what I would consider prime time for eating. The Decor was beautiful. The interior huge, lots of brass which is beautiful, and a very smart, but earthy feel. A large screen TV on the wall which is standard these days but often takes away from the beauty of an establishment. They also have a decent size patio available and since the tavern is on a corner it wraps around it. At that time of the day on a Sunday there was one table inside that was occupied, and probably about eight tables occupied outside where we sat down. It took us a bit to see our waiter approaching with a huge front and back beer menu, along with a very cool looking food menu. It was obvious that he was feeling rushed however he did take the time to answer a couple of questions we had about the beer menu and he took our order. I let him know we would be eating also as he was already rushing off and said he would be right back to take it. 20+ minutes later he stopped back after delivering beer to at least two tables on that trip. We decided to order an appetizer to share. Due to our elevated hunger level everything sounded delicious so we opted to get the combo platter. It consisted of Boom Boom Shrimp, House-Made Tots with beer cheese or jalapeo beer cheese and Chicken Tenders with BBQ sauce on a bed of House-Made Angry Onion Straws - $15 this was an average size appetizer. I personally ate a couple tater tot's and some onion strings. There were also three different dipping sauces, one a barbecue sauce, one a queso cheese sauce and one that was kind of tangy with a little bit of heat. My grands polished off everything else that was on the platter. Our main dishes arrived shortly after we had gotten our appetizer. My grandson ordered a half pound Angus burger called The Pub it was  Jalapeo cream cheese, smoked Gouda, Applewood bacon, lettuce, tomato, cowboy sauce on a butter brioche bun - 11it came with french fries. The fries looked great as was the construction of the burger and toppings. Sadly the burger was requested medium rare and arrived medium to well done. After waiting on our food over 1/2 hr. the grandson decided not to request it be redone. My granddaughter ordered the PERI PERI GRILLED CHICKEN PANINI with Goat cheese, hummus on grilled Ciabatta bread - 10. It also came with fries. It looked good and my granddaughter really enjoyed it. When I asked her what "Peri Peri sauce was She couldn't explain. Since I didn't want something that heavy(The Panini) but I wanted to know what that sauce was I ordered  the 3 BEER BATTERED COD  Tacos. They were dressed with lettuce , cheddar jack and pepper jack cheeses, Peppadew peppers and drizzled with Peri Peri aioli - 8.5 ,my tacos were served with some chips and tiny salsa on the side. I was glad the Peri Peri was only drizzled over my fish tacos as I didn't care for it. To each his own! So our tab for our appetizer,meal, one nonalcoholic bottled beer one draft beer and one beer described as more like wine was $61.86. For us the food rang out at about a 3.9 (out of 5.0), the beverages, we really didn't think my granddaughter would like the nonalcoholic beer but she tried it and as it turns out she doesn't like it. I ordered what was described to me as NOT tasting like a beer at all but like a sweet wine (I guess I must've missed the wine list because the website says they offer it)-after two sips that was enough of that. This is definitely not the Brass Taps fault as I am not a beer drinker but since I said that out loud before ordering off a two sided menu that looks like all beer I would've wished our waiter would have advised me that they did serve wine. All  of us rated the service a 1.5 out of 5.0.    I am not mentioning the name of the server purposefully. Although he could have told me they had wine that really is all I can say related to him.  The major faux pas for us was how long it took to get anything to eat or drink.

reviews.author: Diego M.
reviews.description: I wanted to grab a quick brew with my boy from college and this place was the perfect spot for that.   The beer here was really good! Come during happy hour where flights are $7. You really can't beat that since they're heavy pours. I'd highly recommend the Texas flight.  The atmosphere and vibe was dope. They had live music and she sang EVERYTHING under the sun.. from 70s to Michael Jackson to The Weeknd. Definitely made the place awesome.   Our server was great too! Highly recommend to stop by and grab a beer.

reviews.author: Tristn .
reviews.description: Aka for Matt.   Came in at 11:30pm on a Saturday night, server Matt was a real f*** boss. Extra cool, hard worker, and sickest service I've had. This is coming from a Californian. Screw downtown Austin pop into Brass Tap w/MATT as ur server n you'll be ready to crush the night.   Ps: most beer ive ever seen available in my life, breweries suck,  Brass Tap the future bb.

reviews.author: Aleta N.
reviews.description: I have come here a couple times now and I absolutely love it here! Good drinks and great service.   The patio is really nice and well lit. Good amount of tables and social distancing is very easy on the patio.   I love the servers here. In particular Janson was great! Super kind and approachable, very attentive. Super great service.   The food is good I've gotten the jalapeo poppers and the fried pickles. Both were really good  The drinks are phenomenal and I love how much variety there is with the beer.   Overall a great time.

reviews.author: Ron M.
reviews.description: I've been sitting here for 30 minutes with only getting my beer. The service sucks. It's terrible because they have a fantastic beer selection and they lost my business

reviews.author: Andrew Y.
reviews.description: We chose to celebrate our New Year's Eve at the Brass Tap after snagging a few tickets for the 'Silent Rave' being hosted there that night. Since it was our first time attending such an event, going into it we thought things were going to be awkward, when in fact it was the complete opposite. Everyone had their headphones on, singing and dancing to one of three DJ's that were playing simultaneously on different radio channels. Even on this special night, the drinks were priced normally so kudos to that. This event turned out to be a very social affair.   If you're planning on going to an event like this, especially at the Brass Tap (Domain), I would recommend coming earlier than most to 1) grab a table to have a place to set drinks, otherwise how are you going to dance the way you want to dance? and 2) the line to get event headphones gets decently long and checking out the devices isn't a quick process.   5/5 for a fun organized event, clean venue, friendly bartenders, and a great night out.

reviews.author: Don R.
reviews.description: So beer is good but you can get that anywhere. We had the pretzel bites. Worst thing ever. Love pretzels but they seemed to be from the freezer to being cut up and dipped in oil. Inside was mush we told the server and he just let us know how much he loved them. Although we did not eat but 3 still charged.  Bartenders behind bar vaping, not professional.  I would avoid this spot.

reviews.author: E H.
reviews.description: Good variety of beers. I wouldn't bother much with the food. I ordered the appetizer combo, it was overpriced and underwhelming.

reviews.author: Jason B.
reviews.description: Great service and a great selection of beers. Rotating taps so there is always something new week to week. I've been frequenting this location every Monday evening for the last 6 months and has yet to be disappointed. Great environment

reviews.author: Ivan C.
reviews.description: This bar has the best hospitality. Matt, Jake, and Chystan have the best recommendations when it comes to any beer. These people deliver superior hospitality and best service in The Domain. They are stellar. Come visit them for good eats and drinks.

reviews.author: Josue V.
reviews.description: Love the staff here!!! Very attentive. Morning or evening service is  on point. Karaoke lady on Wednesday not so friendly.. I'm not asking for a special treatment but known your regulars. Besides that this place rocks!!!! Go Austin FC

reviews.author: A. N.
reviews.description: Came in on a Sunday night as we're staying at the Domain. Place was empty. Two dozen big screens showing the Simpsons. Ordered an app and a flight with the intention of having dinner and watching the NFL game. Asked if the football game would be on and the server said sure. A few minutes later the screens tuned to a soccer game. Funny. We didn't stay. Upside - they had all the beers in the flight.

name: Knomad Bar
accommodations: Best nights on Thursday, Friday, Saturday

reviews.author: Christopher R.
reviews.description: I really liked this bar. No thrills, no frills, just a good hole in the wall bar. They've got a nice covered patio and a large smoking section. Lots of tables and a friendly bartender. As of today, they have Pappys whiskey! It's competitively priced, too! Nice spot for any refreshments. I'll be back to see them for sure. Small game room has darts and pinball. There's also Touchtunes box for the patron DJs...

reviews.author: Mariana M.
reviews.description: Best local bar/lounge in East Austin, love coming here!!! Such a smooth environment with the best margaritas and good music

reviews.author: Laurene A.
reviews.description: I've been coming to Knomad now for a few years, and while it's location may be deceiving, the inability to find parking outside should be a good indicator! It's definitely our "go-to" local bar, and we pop in and out usually at least once a week, even it's for just for a quick drink. The management is the NICEST, most gracious bunch you could ask for, and they are almost always present, making sure everyone is happy and tended to. The bar staff is all phenomenal, no matter what time you go in. The have a game room, several TV's/projectors, and even have live music on certain nights. They have a great Sunday brunch deal that really can't be beat. They pour a great drink, and have a nice pizza menu to order from as well!   They have an awesome, very large, dog-friendly patio with tv's, heaters, and misters. They have plenty of dog bowls for your pup, and a water cooler inside for you to use. They have a great sense of community too, and often have events going on that are open to everyone. Huge thanks to Miguel, Tammy, Jordan, and Audrey for always being the best bar staff in town!

reviews.author: Stephanie G.
reviews.description: So here's the thing, we were coming to Knomad back when it was Nomad.  We lived walking distance away in the Windsor Park neighborhood about 3 years ago before moving further north.  This was before kids, a mortgage, and all the other amazing perks of adulthood.  We were just 2 kids in love hanging out at the bar with friends.  But then we thought we'd get married and the very next day had brunch at Nomad.  When we got our first pup together we brought him to Nomad.  Even when I was pregnant Nomad owner stopped by to congratulate us.  So see, Nomad is more than a bar to us.  It's where where our roads crossed, it's where we made friends and created a family.  We don't get to make it there often these days, but Nomad will always be home!

reviews.author: Jaxon E.
reviews.description: Best local bar for this neighborhood, owner is cool and friendly. Lauren the bartender made me the best long island iced tea i ever had. I even go there alone just to soak up the vibes and atmosphere. Overall great place

reviews.author: Tisha T.
reviews.description: 4/9 update--- Hey there Miguel, clearly this is still fresh in your mind, since you're leaving messages on here at 4AM nearly two weeks later. I've let this go, and it would be in your best interest to do the same, this isn't a good look from a PR standpoint. Yes, I originally had fun in your establishment nearly two years ago, I wrote an honest review then, just as I wrote an honest review of what happened in your place last month. Let's not continue to rehash this, ok? You refuse to apologize for the behavior of your employee, and I refuse to return to your place, so let's call this square.  Never contact me again.

reviews.author: Leila R.
reviews.description: Update: Since posting my experience here I have received an intimidating Personal Message from one of the "regulars" here that basically said I misinterpreted my experience here as racism because the owner is a minority and that there are sometimes bartenders of color that work here. First off, what I witnessed was racism, plain and simple. And, for someone to try and brush it off as me "misinterpreting" it as "some other reason for your friend not getting service as fast as she would like", just goes to show the type of patronage here.  I also received a comment from the owner about not calling his bar "overtly racist" when it isn't. I am sorry to say I will not be removing that statement from my review as it was my initial experience there. That is the beauty of capitalism, freedom of choice, and having a review site to state your experiences openly and truthfully. I had absolutely no idea of this place before coming here, so there is no ill will or underhanded plot. However, when my friend and I experience something like that, especially in this day and age, I take the "see something, say something approach".   Respectfully, sir, if you don't want your establishment viewed in this light, then do not have employees who selectively treat patrons, especially new ones, in such a manner and then when confronted be a complete jerk about it. This all could have gone a completely different way had your bartender just apologized for ignoring my friend and served her. But, instead, he was the one who chose to escalate it and make race an issue. As a compassionate human person and a productive member of society, I chose the most vocal platform I had access to to bring this to the Community's, which you also reference in your reply, attention to ensure it is addressed and hopefully does not happen again. It is your customer's choice to read and heed my review and if it does have an affect on your patronage, you may need to ask instead of pointing blame outward, to look in-house.  Also, in response to my claim of racism in regards to our treatment here "being a dangerous road to go down", it absolutely is, but not because of the "mob mentality" of me and my fellow Yelpers voicing our experience. It is a dangerous road to go down to think that is in any way acceptable treatment of a customer, regardless of race, and especially because of it! It is a dangerous road to go down to not say anything and to be intimidated or guilted by having that behavior justified or brushed off. Casual racism is not ok and being vocal about it should never be called out as going down "a dangerous road". The danger lies in the complacency, not the action.  As for the $1.75 "honest mistake", please keep the offer of a refund. If that is how you define "honesty", yet another reason I will not be returning to this establishment.  *To clarify, I am straight out saying the bartender that served me and was a disrespectful ass to my friend behavior was racist, and since receiving an intimidating message from a regular here, by proxy the establishment, since this sort of conduct is not only acceptable here, but defensible by the regular patrons.

reviews.author: Scott T.
reviews.description: Review of service*  Holy Racism, Batman.   You figure a guy that majored in cultural anthropology would have a little more of an open mind when it comes to hiring staff for his bar...  Hey Bartender... here's the best part... I'M THE GUY YOU KEPT SERVING OVER MY FRIEND who was standing right next to me. I literally walked up, not knowing if she ordered or was waiting, and within 3 seconds you asked what I wanted for a drink. This happened multiple times, we brought a group of 15 people to your filthy establishment, and sadly... the service and negative/racist mindset of the employee's shine through.   Granted... the owner of Nomad made the news a couple of months ago because he's in business with someone who attacked a guy with a Japanese sword and stabbed him with a dagger... but that's neither here nor there, or is that fact that The Department of Justice recently filed a civil rights lawsuit against the owners of many bars throughout the United States, accusing them of discriminating against non-white patrons. Would be a shame if this happened to Nomad.   The fact that I witnessed such blatant discrimination made me sick to my core, maybe the Austin Human Rights Commission should force your staff to undergo anti-discrimination training. Yes, that can happen (at your expense)   Anyways.... 1 star is 1 star tooooo many  - maybe come here if you support the KKK? I don't know.   "No human race is superior; no religious faith is inferior. All collective judgments are wrong. Only racists make them"   Elie Wiesel

reviews.author: Jeannette L.
reviews.description: FIVE STAR DIVE BAR!!  About two weeks ago, I checked out Surf by Surf East, which is an annual surf rock music fest, at Nomad Bar. King Pelican was the headliner. I saw them in San Antonio the last time I went to Texas, and knew this would be a great show.   Because I was staying downtown, I took a Fasten to the club.  Nomad Bar is in a mini strip mall near the Target by I-35. I saw a bus stop station nearby, but I went with ride share since I wasn't familiar with the area.   Nomad Bar has an outdoor patio area that's accessible only from the inside of the bar. I checked it out for a bit because it was such a nice night out, but went back indoors. The stage where the bands played is inside. Behind the stage is a projection screen. Most of the acts that night had YouTube videos looping in the background. The sound in Nomad is good for acts. Got some really good recordings inside.   I sat mostly at the high tables towards the front by the entrance. I split a pizza pie, which was tasty (an independent business does the food at Nomad). Drink prices were pretty good here; I stuck mostly to Dos XX. In between acts, I checked out the game room, where there are darts and an arcade game. The game room is well-lit, which is in contrast to the main bar/indoor area that's dark and dive-y (in a good way).   King Pelican were awesome that night (as expected). I would come back to Nomad the next time I'm in Austin. You should check it out.

reviews.author: Stephanie S.
reviews.description: I went here last night with a large party of coworkers and sat at a big table in the back. I was hungry so I ordered a pizza. We demolished it and ordered 2 more, each different. I'd go back just for the pizza!  I like the cozy feel to the place and that they have indoor and outdoor service. I also never had to wait long to order, which is rare and fabulous.

reviews.author: Rawhide W.
reviews.description: Is this Dive bar with patio and small game room overtly racist? ..... perhaps. But what is racism?  Oxford states - "Prejudice, discrimination, or antagonism directed against someone of a different race"...... The ironic thing is that the incompetent owner (Miguel) has just committed a racist act as clearly identified in his posts.  The blatant example being, the lack of communication to any of the three African American's that have left negative reviews in regard to this past Saturday's event.  Don't be too surprised, as it appears to be inline with his poorly managed business. Considering I've been phoning the establishment for two days now, only to be greeted with a recording of "the mailbox of the person you're trying to reach is full and no new messages are being accepted, please try your call again later"......... Well Miguel, I've tried my call again for several hours now. Perhaps you should place that book of Mein Kamph down and clear your voicemail.  What has sparked all of the recent one star reviews one may ask?  This past Saturday several friends of mine ventured into Nomad to enjoy a few drinks. Jordan, one of the bartenders seemed to be a little "weathered". I'm not sure if he had too many shots as I've seen him do in the past or what, but he apparently wasn't taking to kindly to the ethnicities standing in front of him, awaiting service. Instead he helped many "whites" and I use this term loosely, prior to them, even though they were positioned first in line. This wasn't an isolated incident. It happened more than once that evening, to more than one African American in our group.  Jordan has waited on me several times in the past, so I approached him and asked what prompted him to threaten one of my friends with being ejected from the bar.  When I mentioned that I've got too many witnesses that have the same recount he replied "this isn't a court room, I don't care about witnesses". Needless to say he was irrationally defensive and had no intention of calming the situation down.   The sad part is that I've visited this location several times for about a year. I initially noticed on my first visit that the establishment carried a slight Riff Raff tone and wasn't an example of "class". As I continued to patronize the location, I'd see female patrons wearing sandals reflecting heels that are in need of major pedicures, customers with dogs inside the bar area which appeared to frustrate some patrons, heck, even the Owner Miguel, was overly tipsy celebrating his birthday recently at the bar, and my girlfriend and I witnessed him acting belligerent and was showing butt crack, while cranking up the music more than once to the point it was annoying.  So Miguel, stop the PR nonsense and clean up your mess. As I look back through Yelp, you've been slapped with one star reviews about racism and poor service in the past. The fact it's still continuing leans more towards condoning your staff's behavior or cementing the fact you're an incompetent manager. Either way, you shall never see me cross your doors again.

reviews.author: Richard A.
reviews.description: I'm sorry but I have to give Nomad 1 star for customer relations and satisfaction.   After an awesome UYE, (Unofficial Yelp Event), nearby with 31 in attendance. I suggested to 15 that we continue the festivities at Nomad, a bar/lounge that I thought would be a great choice especially since to me, they craft the best caipirinhas in town. When I first visited Nomad, Jordan crafted the perfect caipirinha, using a top shelf cachaa, gaining my respect. Last evening, I immediately realized that he was not in good form when he began using lemon instead of lime for my caipirihna, he corrected his mistake and said, "It's been a long day",  and I accepted that but what was unacceptable, was disrepecting a member of my group. It's going to be difficult returning to this venue.

reviews.author: Paul R.
reviews.description: If there was a 0 star option I would gladly give it to the Nomad bar. Let me set the stage regarding why I have such little respect for this bar.   I attended a post Unofficial Yelp Event event at the Nomad. I noticed one of my friends ( a black woman) abruptly leave the venue with her sister. I was told that she had a confrontation with the bartender over not serving her. I later witnessed my Hispanic friend stand by an empty bar not receiving service even though 3 bartenders looked directly at him, yes they made eye contact. A Caucasian person walked up to the bar not 5 feet from my friend and he was immediately served. After speaking with my friend to validate what I witnessed I was disgusted by this behavior and left the bar.  Please note, as a Caucasian male, I had no issues ordering drinks. I also have a complaint regarding their drinks. If you are a regular you receive a healthy pour if you are a non-regular it's a pretty lite pour. Yes I was a bartender and know the count.  The important fact is that I witnessed discrimination against my friends of color. I really don't give a flying hoot about lite pours for non-regulars.  If you read the other reviews there is a pattern here and you can draw your own conclusions. I Paul Russo will never ever step foot in this bar again.

reviews.author: Cathryn C.
reviews.description: Knomad's Bar-  a travelers oasis of good vibes and no pretense.  Love the drink menu and the Sunday Brunch. Bar staff is genuinely friendly and knows their craft. Well done ya all!  Thanks for making me my favorite Czech drink, a BETON.

reviews.author: Donnie F.
reviews.description: Solid tavern style bar. Parking is a little bit of a challenge., but worth it. The thing that saves this place as a really good bar is the customer service, and really well made drinks. Plenty of sitting, with inside and outside sitting. I would definitely go back with friends! Side Note: Area is a little sketchy, so be situationally aware of your surroundings. I guess you could say that about a lot of places, though. I recommend this Bar!

reviews.author: Ryn B.
reviews.description: I really like this place... yet another bar I've visited only because of trivia. I don't even know why I like it so much.  I shall describe. It is dive-y and in a really unremarkable neighborhood. There are flyers and posters all over the walls. The inside is kind of cramped and doesn't have a lot of seating; outside can be better although still cramped, but there are heat lamps! Roast like meat under red lights.  The pizza is like really good... again, no idea why. I think of it and dream of fluffy crust, the ideal amount of toppings, and wholesome flavor. They have twice now screwed up our order and brought the wrong pizza out - late and without apology - but I'll keep ordering it.  Dim, not overly friendly, and a little crowded... but good vibes. And good pizza, if you get what you want.  Well, the only thing is - I think they used to be the Nomad Bar and have no idea why they added the "k."

reviews.author: Matthew C.
reviews.description: Ummmm no. I was told their weekend brunch was worth a try. It was not. Very disappointing. It's a neighborhood bar that's popular with the locals. It's in a strip center and has no character. Meh.

reviews.author: Katherine F.
reviews.description: Nomad bar is a decent, tucked away, fairly average bar. It's average bar size for Austin, average pricing (maybe cheap) for Austin, average looking for Austin, and hires average staff for Austin.  The main problem this place has, is it's pretty much interchangeable with any other bar in this city. I guess they have an international theme, but they don't take it particularly far. The place comes across as a dive.  It's also not the largest place in the world, so you tend to feel cramped pretty quickly. This isn't a problem, though, as people seem to be generally polite and courteous.  The neighborhood is also not the best, so I would recommend only parking in the small parking lot out front, instead of parking on side streets.

reviews.author: Mary Mac J.
reviews.description: Knomad is one of my favorites! Great pours and nice, unpretentious people. They have everything you could want in a bar: good prices, pizza, a little sportiness, a little diviness, and live music sometimes. Its a very comfortable and welcoming place to hang out.

reviews.author: Paul K.
reviews.description: Bartenders are friendly, but this is supposed to be a dive bar, this is a yuppie dive bar, lowest beer on tap is Pacifico..where is Bud? Or some working class beer, this is not a "dive" bar

name: Icenhauer's
accommodations: Best nights on Friday, Saturday, Sunday

reviews.author: Ted G.
reviews.description: Another great Rainey Street bar!  Great drinks and great live music, at the time their selection of entertainment is what drew us in.   They also have a great food trailer in the front yard, at the time it seemed quite popular.  Cheers!

reviews.author: Rini S.
reviews.description: This place used to be so much better but times have changed. :/ The bouncers are unnecessarily rude and the bartenders serve in the order they prefer versus how long someone has been waiting (no it's not because it's too crowded - I'm talking about situations where there are less than 10 people inside).   Does not pass the vibe check anymore.

reviews.author: Adam G.
reviews.description: Okay y'all this place is sweet. I stop by every time I visit Austin, and have never been disappointed. They have live music on the weekends, and the bartenders are fantastic. There's a front patio area and also a big one in the back with a round seating area and also some tables that they set up during the evening. Their specialty is sangria so make sure you check out the different kinds they offer. In addition, there's a food truck in the front called "Gobble Gobble" that serves up farm to table burgers and other great options

reviews.author: Joe S.
reviews.description: Just know that Icenhauer's is completely okay and complicit with undercover police men patrolling the bar like it's the mezzanine of a football stadium. I'm proud that I found the guys out but it's still disturbing that there's cops judging your every move. I don't hate it. It's just weird. Watch your back when you're there.

reviews.author: Justin A.
reviews.description: Horrible experience. Cameron is a thief. Had a drink made that was horrible. Asked Cameron to remake it and then he charged us and he kept our change. On top of that he lied to a co worker about keeping our $$$$   We will never return and escalate this to management.

reviews.author: Mylon K.
reviews.description: While standing at the bar, I literally had this white guy put his hand on me and push me back to say, "there is a line, and you need to wait." I told him, "dude I'm not cutting the line, I'm talking to my friend."  He then proceeded to continue talking crazy.  What was the bar tender's response, who was also white, "if you can't let it go, I'm not gonna serve you."  I was shocked.  I explained to her what happened, and she said, "just deal with it"  Meanwhile, she is serving the guy who did it and saying nothing to him.  I can't believe I experienced this on a random Sunday in Austin.  Times haven't changed.  So disappointed in this bar and it's staff for how they handled a clearly prejudiced incident.

reviews.author: Maya W.
reviews.description: Worst service I've ever experienced! The staff was rude and would ignore my friends and I before when we were waiting to served over other people who hadn't been there as long as us (even though there weren't many people in the bar). When we finally got served, the bartender made the wrong drinks and got an attitude when we told her (after already waiting a long time to be served in the slowest bar on earth for some reason). One of the worst bar experiences I've been through on Rainey ever. Don't waste your time or money.

reviews.author: Odalys  G.
