reviews.description: Honestly go anywhere else on Rainey, BUT Icenhauer's. They literally gave me and my bestfriend the WORST night. It was so humiliating and disgusting. They called the cops on us just for sticking up for ourselves. The bartender (some blonde girl about 5'4) got involved with a minor altercation because this man (another customer) was cussing me and my friend out over us just making conversation. I wasn't able to get the name of the bar tender, but I know Gus and Tony were the bouncers and just made things worse by also getting involved and blowing things out of proportion. They get one star because the green tea shots are actually really good (plus I can't even give less than 1 star lol), but other than that the service is terrible, and the music is garbage. The place is never really poppin anyways so honestly go somewhere else for better service, better music, and a better environment.

reviews.author: Michelle C.
reviews.description: The bouncer shoved my friend, will never come here again. POC and girls beware of this bar, it is not safe for us.

reviews.author: Akasha J.
reviews.description: Such a great atmosphere for our first time in Austin, there isn't much open on a Monday but this place is and it has a great atmosphere and great drinks!! I recommend the Emily if you're a mojito fan and a strawberry fan

reviews.author: Robin C.
reviews.description: Very charming Rainey Street bar!  Great drinks, great service and a hip place. Loved it!

reviews.author: Sheri S.
reviews.description: If you read the previous reviews, this will just continue the crappy treatment of customers. We walked up at 11:45pm on a Monday night and the bouncer started yelling at us that they are closed and "that is why the gate is closed". No, the gate wasn't closed or we would not have walked in.  At any rate, spend your money at the many other bars close by. You won't be disappointed to skip the disrespect at this crappy bar.

reviews.author: Tanya L.
reviews.description: I would give it 0 rating.. It was awful!! Tried to go in at 1.15 on Saturday (they said they work till 2am), but was never allowed to come in really??? What was the reason?? Just laziness or other color???

reviews.author: Rob J.
reviews.description: Super friendly. Yummy drinks and great atmosphere! Surprising for a Monday night next to our hotel, going to be coming back every night! Food options out front and right on Rainey street!

reviews.author: Charles C.
reviews.description: My wife and I stopped in here for a quick drink on our Rainey Street tour and had a fun time.  Thao was our bartender and she was really cool.  Very engaging and fun.    My wife had a White Claw seltzer and I had a local Pilsner.  Both did the trick and we all laughed at the drunk douchebag next to us who ordered 5 "Water Shots," for his party trying to be funny.  He didn't realize that even his own group thought he was too thirsty for attention.  It made for some comedic relief though.  Fun little place.

reviews.author: Andrew F.
reviews.description: Icenhauer's used to be my favorite place on Rainey Street. Unfortunately as Rainey Street has become more and more a college student place Icenhauer's has gone waaaaay downhill. Now there are long waits for drinks, extremely drunk people everywhere and in general a lack of a positive vibe.  We went in -- waited 30 minutes and never even got to the bar to order a drink while college kids pushed us aside. It's a shame as five years ago Icenhauer's was my favorite bar in town.  All things change, and unfortunately Icenhauer's has changed for the far worse.

reviews.author: Isha S.
reviews.description: blonde bartender working here literally ruined our night. super rude, making nasty comments for no reason. she saw me looking thru my purse to find my credit card to pay her and still had the nerve to tell me to hurry up and pay her because she had other drinks to make. she made my friend cry and when i came back in to talk to her she started shoving me multiple times and grabbed my arms so i couldn't do anything??? we understand that bars have the right to tell us to leave, but physical assault with no explanation??? this girl, olivia, needs to be fired asap. don't go here

reviews.author: Andrew F.
reviews.description: This bar is awful. Do not even try to go. They will not let you in if they think you have a big party. The bouncer was rude and would not let us in. Have fun losing business. Even if one person wanted to go in, they said no even though they were not at capacity.

reviews.author: Sean E.
reviews.description: This place has gone down hill since the night owls left. They kicked an honest man out for checking on  his sick girlfriend in the bathroom.

reviews.author: Julia O.
reviews.description: Bartenders are asshats, slow, and untalented. Hire an 18 year old from a college bar honestly they'll do better

reviews.author: John S.
reviews.description: Love this place. Good pizza and always friendly staff. Love that you can order online and pick up in their drive thru. Nice menu with multiple items to choose from.

reviews.author: Mariano M.
reviews.description: Pizza was very good. Services mid grade could use a perk. All but the tables were clean.

reviews.author: Jennifer M.
reviews.description: Must try pizza place  Food: At first you think is a regular pizza but when you try the sauce and cheese they got it right. I got a margarita personal one and I love it! The only thing is that if you want crunchy Dough, let them know. I have my days that I want that.  Price: very reasonable.  Environment: people know each other a d it looks they are repetitive clients. As soon as I got there I felt very comfortable. It is a layback place, perfect for Family, Sports, Pizza time with the friends and music is super classic. They were playing the 3 Musketeers and II was just great to be there during lunch time.  Service: The server or manager made sure I like and enjoy pizza. I noticed that he will ask the clients on how was everything and he was really interested in knowing.

reviews.author: Scarlett T.
reviews.description: First time ordering here and the pizza is amazing here!!! I ordered the 9" Meat Almighty pizza and BBQ Pizza. The pizza named Meat Almighty say exactly that! It's loaded with all the meat toppings! The sage sausage have a kick and it's such a quality pizza for what your pay for! The crust is crispy on the edges but fluffy and  chewy in the inside. I usually get thin pizza but decided to get regular crust and I am so glad I did! The texture is indescribable good! The bbq chicken pizza is equally amazing! It's unique and the bbq sauce is perfect balance with the feta cheese, chicken, and toppings! This place is a must try! I am so happy this pizza place exists in Elgin! I am excited to try the other pizzas on there menu! Order and pay online was super easy. Pick up time was on point and the pizza was still hot when we got home.

reviews.author: Riley B.
reviews.description: Super convenient for us! The make great pizzas, salads, calzones and serve good drinks!

reviews.author: Milton C.
reviews.description: My wife and I were driving home from Austin on Father's day looking for something to eat. I was craving pizza, so she lit up when she saw a sign for some outstanding pizza from Aviator Pizza coming up in two exits.  We decided on an 18" to share and went with the pepperoni and basil with black olives. The cashier, and sole employee on the front side, was very friendly and humored us as we decided through the menu. Nothing really special there, but not everyone handles our humor or weirdness, so props to her. The pizza arrived shortly (plus for time) and we dug in. It was very tasty and the crust was very satisfying. I can't quite pin the taste, but it seemed like a home-made or high end dough because the taste lingered, and in a good way. It was one of my favorite crusts. The rest of the pizza was great as well and ranks up there with the best. Aviator Pizza is nowhere close to where I live, but if I take a road trip to Austin again, I will certainly make it a point to stop in. I'd go so far to say it would be worth leaving the city limits to get some better pizza.

reviews.author: Keira A.
reviews.description: 10/10 recommend Aviators! Their Buffalo Chicken Pizza is out of this world! They cook their pizzas perfectly, and have their own sodas in the fountains. Also local brewery for those who like to drink local!

reviews.author: Diana N.
reviews.description: 4.5 stars. Quick, yummy, affordable pizza on the way to Austin! Drive-thru window made it super convenient. Love how you can get 2 different toppings on a 9" personal pizza. Maybe not the best pizza ever (I like Via 313), but definitely good for the price.  FLYING GARLIC (garlic butter base, chicken, garlic, spinach, feta, spinach, crushed red peppers) $9.95 for 9" - slightly preferred over the Brussels sprouts pizza bc I loved the garlic and feta. Only complaint is that there was hardly any chicken, mostly garlic cloves.  SRIRACHA BRUSSELS SPROUTS and GOAT CHEESE (red sauce base, Brussels, goat cheese, honey sriracha, mozzarella) $9.95 for 9" - the goat cheese was the predominant flavor which I enjoyed. Not much Brussels sprouts. Maybe this would be better on a white base rather than red sauce? Still good.  9" pizza comes w/ 6 slices. I probably would've been satisfied after 3-4, but I'm fat and ate the whole thing. Shareable if you're not a big eater. Crust is thicker than MOD Pizza, I love bread!  CINNAMON PECAN DESSERT $7- basically the size of a 9" pizza so it's worth the price. It was yummy! However, I wish there was more icing and pecans on it (compared to other pics), but I have a huge sweet tooth. Plain cinnamon dessert is $5.50  Picnic tables in front if you want outdoor dining. Connected to the gas station (sign is easy to miss). Plenty of parking.

reviews.author: Mark Obed B.
reviews.description: The pizza is so good ! I ordered a good Hawaiian pizza, and man it was so delicious, what I don't like about this pizzeria is that they take so long to make it, we waited for 50 min but it was worth it.

reviews.author: Malory S.
reviews.description: We visit Aviator's at least once a week! Fresh pizzas and grinders and pasta and SALADS!!! Ahh we love so much about this place. Their beer selection is on point too!

reviews.author: Julia C.
reviews.description: Best place, within 10 min of Manor, to get a pizza/salad and refill your growler! Never let me down.

reviews.author: Jeff C.
reviews.description: Love the pizza joint, the pepperoni and cheese calzone was really really good. Just to sit and talk and not be rush was great I really enjoy this place and look forward to coming back.

reviews.author: Jessica M.
reviews.description: We enjoyed our food. The girls in the front really made our experience memorable, they helped with everything  from the choice of local beer with tastings and the food which was amazing. We got the Italian sandwich and the calzone pepperoni and sausage. Both were really good, and recommended. So happy we stopped here. Will be back again.

reviews.author: Denise W.
reviews.description: This pizza was amazing. Paired with a nice cold tap I was so happy. I got the flying garlic small which I thought would be too small but nope it was perfect.

reviews.author: Pete A.
reviews.description: The food is decent but very overpriced. IDK if it's Elgin or what the deal is. You can never get a hold of the owners if there's an issue. The staff says they live out of State. Been there several times trying to give the mm biz as there's not a lot out here. Don't recommend unless you hope for the best and get decent service or food.

reviews.author: Ivy L.
reviews.description: Was driving back from Austin and decided to grab some pizza to-go for dinner! I called in our order - pretty funny recording (like a captain getting ready for take-off to fit the aviator theme).. nice sticking to the character of its name! We placed the order easily and were told it'll be ready within 20ish mins. It was ready for pickup and packaged when we arrived. The place was pretty large, modern, and clean for when we re-open for dine in. But there were a few picnic tables out front and no one around so we decided to hang out and eat outside. Thick good quality paper plates provided!   The pizza was decently priced and we got the large 18" - half Hawaiian and half Margherita. Can't say I like the flavors - the toppings were alright but the pizza crust was just bland.. zero flavors and maybe taken out of the oven too early cause it was soft and not so crispy along the edges. They do load the pizza with lots of toppings though. Can't say it's the best pizza I've had - not even close - but it filled us up and it was quick. Don't think we'll be making a return unfortunately.

reviews.author: Sara N.
reviews.description: This was our first trip to an Aviator.  We went with high hopes because of the "gluten free" option. Well. It's pretty unfair to paint a restaurant as a good option for gluten free food with just ONE option. A GF crust. But. It really isn't. If you are gluten INTOLERANT,  this is NOT your place. It's really not much of a choice at all. Red sauce or pesto. Thats it. So you can have red sauce on a cracker. That's how the GF crust is. A dried cracker. Burnt crisp.  The other pizza crust... is like one size fits all. They take a single amount of pizza dough for all 3 sizes of pizza. I had a 9 inch pizza and it could have been a calzone. Its was WAY too much dough. I added portobello mushrooms as a topping and got about 10 small pieces. It just wasn't good.   In fact about all I can say that is positive is the Cream Soda. Everything else was just, meh.

reviews.author: Michaela P.
reviews.description: Annual trek to Elgin for a Christmas Tree. I guess we're making this a habit. Stopped in for pizza after finding the perfect cat fir...  Pizza was great, as usual, and the beer was refreshingly cold - awesome on a warmer than average day.   We've now visited two Aviator locations a couple of times each and always been pleased. Keep up the good work!

reviews.author: Jordany S.
reviews.description: Visited this restaurant for dinner today and the  scenery/environment is beautiful for a restaurant next to a gas station on a highway. The pizza was freshly made and was very good. It wasn't amazing but it was good. I may go back but not sure. I had the Flying Garlic Pizza I think there was not enough chicken and the garlic was everywhere a little too much.

reviews.author: Scott T.
reviews.description: What can I say. Everything here is insane! The home crafted beers, the home crafted soda, the pizza, the potato salad absolutely crazy. Kelsi W, was wonderful. She made some awesome suggestions and they were worth it. I highly recommend this place. You will not be disappointed!

reviews.author: E R.
reviews.description: Good pours, tasty rum, a lovely shaded deck to sit out on, and congenial staff. Perfect spot for a quick cocktail or a wind down and a nice chat.

reviews.author: Pam S.
reviews.description: Great spot to enjoy a drink and relax! We arrived on a Thursday afternoon. Bartender greeted us warmly and talked to us about the rums are made. I appreciated feeling welcomed in spite of the lack of traffic in the out there location. We ordered drinks and sat among the trees on their awesome deck for a bit. My husband bought all three varieties when we left. Worth a visit!

reviews.author: Raymond J.
reviews.description: Been here twice now and really just stopped this time to get their bourbon filled chocolates for my guests on our drive by.  Great place to seat and enjoy the outdoor country view and have a drink.  Sample their Bourbon and have some chocolate filled Bourbon.  Come visit this place when you are near by

reviews.author: James F.
reviews.description: During a recent car club event, I called Cypress Creek from a restaurant in Wimberley to tell them our arrival was eminent. The lady on the other end of the call was quite nice suggesting they had PLENTY of space for our cars to park.  Well, they weren't wrong. Quite possibly the best photo opportunity of the entire weekend. Our attendees overlooking 24 cars perched in the beautiful trees of Hays County overlooking some of Mazda's genius. Free samples of crafted rum too?   I'd call that a win! Owners were quite attentive as soon as we arrived. Telling us the story of the brand; walking us through each tasting. Some drinks were ordered; maybe a bottle or two bought. Not sure we were the most receptive group being on a car tour in the Hill Country. Service was excellent!

reviews.author: Jazz C.
reviews.description: The rum was delicious! The guy behind the bar was so nice and welcoming. It's a great place to relax and enjoy a delicious drink! There's lots of outdoor space perfect for social distancing.

reviews.author: Dolly S.
reviews.description: Such a nice staff.  We were i Impressed by his knowledge.  He was very compliant the tasting was good they serve 3 different varieties we enjoyed the vanilla. The gentleman was very helpful for other things to do in the area.

reviews.author: Dustin C.
reviews.description: Tucked away behind Wimberely mear Jacobs Well stands a small distillery with a small bar and large patio.   They offer free samples of the three different whiskeys with one of them being bourbon barrel aged using Rebecca Creek barrels.   The staff was friendly and well informed on the products. Currently they are distributing to smaller local stores and will start distributing to more stores in the future.   As it is August right now we couldn't tour the distillery because it was too hot but we were informed that the tours would start in October when it cools off.   The bottles are decently priced for hand crafted rum like this.   There are plenty of tables and chairs for groups, drink cocktails were decently priced, and property is a great change from the city.

reviews.author: Diana G.
reviews.description: We found this place on our way to Jacobs well. This place has great drinks and a great atmosphere. The rum is  very good. We did not take the tour, but it is offered. They have a food truck on site. Their mojito was refreshing. They even let me be part of the cocktail making process. The owners were super friendly. For those that want to taste before buying, they offer free rum tastings.

reviews.author: Rach C.
reviews.description: We made lots of stops in the area and this was by far my favorite! We made it about an hour before they closed and the guy at the bar was so nice and welcoming. The patio area in the trees was beautiful and they had this nice swing. I had the drink with the pineapple and vanilla rum.....sooooo good! It was so good my husband grabbed a bottle so we can drink it at home. If you're touring the area i would recommend coming here early and just enjoying the scenery and the lovely conversation with the guy at the bar!

reviews.author: Mike G.
reviews.description: I cant' say enough good things about this place. It is in the middle of Hill Country, and it was our last stop before heading home.   Personally, I'm not a big rum drinker, it is too sweet for me, but it tastes great in mix drinks, and they have some  great and fancy mix drinks here.   Swing by and hang out on their patio, it will be great!

reviews.author: Samuel V.
reviews.description: This place is awesome. Not only do you get to enjoy some very delicious rum, but the scenery is beautiful. My fiance and I really enjoyed getting to hang out on the raised deck and just relax for a little while. The guy at the bar was really polite and knowledgeable. Will definitely come back.

reviews.author: Kelsey D.
reviews.description: Give these hard working folks your money! The rum is delicious, affordable and local. The owner gave us a quick, free tasting so we could decide what kind of rum we wanted in our cocktails. Do yourself a favor and spend an hour or two sitting on the gorgeous upper deck catching the breeze and catching a buzz!

reviews.author: Mallory M.
reviews.description: Family run rum distillery. We visited on a weekday and were the only ones there. Great customer service! If you like rum, then this is definitely worth checking out for a tasting!

reviews.author: Amber N.
reviews.description: The vanilla rum is fantastic. Perfect place to spend the afternoon to relax and have a drink. Patio sitting is great. Lots of shade

reviews.author: Carly C.
reviews.description: Laura guided my boyfriend and my tour through the distillery.  She tries to schedule them so each party has a separate tour.  It's a really nice touch, because it shows they aren't trying to blow through tours by combining as many people as they can into one group.  The tours are $5.  We emailed her to set ours up.  We started with a tasting.  Laura had bartended for several years before the business started, so she made us a Vanilla Rum mixed drink in a sample cup.  It was nothing short of delicious.  Absolutely fantastic drink.  Atfer that, the tour started.  Laura explained how the business started up, showed us the distillery and explained all the functions, and then showed us the bottling room.  She answered all of our questions and was very personable.    We concluded the tour with 1 more sampling of their normal rum combined with a mixer.  Again, a totally refreshing drink.  We stayed and talked to Laura for about 20 minutes after and were on our way.  This was a great experience.  It's a humble distillery with a growing presence.  They've won a couple of major awards and you can definitely they definitely love what they do.  Makes for a really enjoyable tour.

reviews.author: Katy B.
reviews.description: This place is the cutest, most quaint little gem.  If there's a local distillery, I always want to try out their goods.  I didn't expect it to be at someone's home, though!  Not that it's a bad thing.  Rum, for me, is a take it or leave it type spirit.  I typically use it only in cocktails.  I don't think I've ever wanted to sit down with a glass of rum.  Now bourbon?  That's a different story.    On arrival, I just expected a tasting only, but they actually make cocktails.  They have a small menu, or you can request whatever you want from the mixers they have.  Mojito?  Of course.  Want to go dive with a great rum and just some Coke?  They won't judge you for that, either.  They make their own version of Rumchata in house and it was SO DELICIOUS.  For real.  And they'll give you the recipe.    Pick your favorite of the three varieties: Crystal, Gold, Vanilla and buy a bottle.  Then pick up a bottle of vanilla extract.  If you don't cook, make your mom very happy.  That stuff is fantastic.  In the hotter months, don't be a jerk and demand a tour of the actual distilling barn.  We all know how distilling works.  If not, the internet is your friend.  They don't want to be in the high temperatures, and neither do you.  Let them explain the process to you while you sip a nice, cool drink instead.

reviews.author: Lindsey C.
reviews.description: Stumbled upon this little gem by accident when we were looking for a winery, it was a happy find! Friendly people, good rum, and a good deck! It was a little expensive and no tours are offered but the tastings are free which is a nice change to the other places we have been.   Make sure you try the vanilla rum and take a turn on the tree swing! My nephew loved it.   Wish they would have more signs.... the first was easy, then we were feeling lost.

reviews.author: Michele G.
reviews.description: The best part of this distillery is the location...a country vibe that is beautiful. Now for the bad news...The rum is a strange flavor. I have been to other rum distilleries and have never stumbled upon such a "harsh" flavor that could never be drank alone. That being written we decided to have a drink on the patio...I'm glad alcohol kills germs because the guy serving us had the dirtiest hands and fingernails I have ever seen in my life and I have children. For example when he grabbed our glasses from the cabinet it left a dirty grip mark. I was pretty much grossed out. It's too bad because again the location is great.

reviews.author: Deji M.
reviews.description: How sweet is David, distiller, maker, and bottler of Cypress Creek Reserve? Let's examine the facts:. -- He led us through a tour of his small but highly functional distillery. -- He answered all of our questions about the process he uses, and even showed us some of the machine parts he's made. -- His wife made us two (nicely sized) tasters: a mojito, and another thing I drank even faster than the mojito that tasted like a lemon drop.  $5 each later, we skipped right down to Wimberley Valley Spirits to get ourselves a bottle, because the law is mean and David can't sell any of the goods on the premises.  Stupid Republicans, or something.  Now we check out our unopened souvenir, plotting and planning, totally giddy that we pulled into that questionable-looking lot with the signage for rum. Who were we to say no?

reviews.author: Eric S.
reviews.description: This last Friday I went to the distillery to taste their rum. All three of their rums are VERY tasty. I purchased a bottle of the aged rum. The owner's daughter-in-law (I can't remember her name) was very friendly and very knowledgeable on the rum. She made the tasting fun, and I highly recommend anyone in area to go visit. I know I'll be back!

name: Black Sheep Lodge
accommodations: Good for Lunch, Dinner, Late Night
Best nights on Wednesday, Friday, Saturday

reviews.author: Chaitanya N.
reviews.description: Pros: Open for games even early in the Morning   We waitress are good, cheerful  and attentive.   Cons: Not many to mention - can have a better ambience

reviews.author: Makenzie M.
reviews.description: I hate being this person that leaves bad reviews, but I just can't help but share my experience at Black Sheep Lodge in hopes it can help in the future.  I recently went to BSL to watch a football game and have some fun on a Saturday night. The atmosphere upon arriving seemed... overwhelming but rather cheery. It's a hole in the wall sports bar and I was hopping for a fun night.  Beware, if this is your first time to BSL, like it was for me, just know that NOBODY will help you. I had to ask other customers about seating and how to grab the attention of waiters. To start off, once my friends and I snatched a table, we waited 30 minutes and bothered 3 waiters on ordering drinks... all answering that they would let another waiter know. I finally got fed up and went to the bar to get myself the drinks and then was told, they would send a waiter over to the table to get our drink orders. It seemed to be a losing battle. We finally just asked for the drinks at the bar again and by the time we FINALLY got our waiters attention, we were hoping the service would get better.  After ordering and getting chips and dip, we were all done with our first drinks and trying to get the attention of our waiter for the second round. I kid you not, after 30 minutes of not getting our drinks, I went back up the bar and saw our order of drinks waiting to be picked up and just grabbed them instead of waiting any longer. After grabbing our drinks, the waiter came over asking if we needed anything else and we simply requested 1 water and 1 coke. You would think that would be simple and be done quickly... well you are sorely mistaken. We never received the drinks after reminding the waiter THREE TIMES. THREE DIFFERENT TIMES FOR ONE SIMPLE WATER AND ONE SIMPLE COKE. You couldn't even get drunk if you tried at this place.  I ordered the boneless wings in Buffalo garlic sauce and I thought the vinegar was going to create a hole in my stomach that the water I ordered three times could help.  Granted, they were busy and I feel bad if they were stretched thin. But it didn't help that one of the waiters that we requested help from would pause at the table next to us and sit with the group of people, acting like he wasn't working?  I hate to say that this sports bar is one I'll never care to go to again in my life, even if they paid me too. Which is sad because they have soooo many classic bar games that I wanted to play but never got to because of the fear of our table being stolen (meaning it was pure chaos on how nobody cared about seating).  I wish I could give the entirety of the experience in a shorter version but this is the shortest I can make it for the sake of making a point.

reviews.author: Carrie B.
reviews.description: I do love my local Austin Bars! And Black Sheep has given me so many great memories.... Looking for a "unicorn?" you'll find plenty of natives here!  I was a huge fan when they first opened. Music. Community. Meeting new friends! It was great!  I have to say, I'm not a sports fan. And I really don't think we need another sports bar. But I know I'm a minority in this.  Playing important games here and there sure!  But when the TVs came, the Music died so much! The table sharing was less.  But you know what? I still feel like I'm "home" when I come here. And you can NOT beat the cheese curds!  So stuff your face, play some darts, and enjoy the locals! Because here we are!  Only gripe.... Plz play less sports! I don't need 15 TVs! I leave the house to not watch TV. Just saying:)  But I can't help but love them.

reviews.author: S M.
reviews.description: Crawfish time at Black sheep was terrible this year! I hope everyone else got a better batch then I did! And what was this thing smashed into my potatoes?

reviews.author: Mary B.
reviews.description: 3 1/2 stars. This bar is in my neighborhood and I come here ALL the time. I'm shocked that I've never thought to write a review. They have drink specials every day and I really enjoy their burger and tater tots or their wings. The service is usually pretty good, though I very rarely see any familiar faces. This is a big bar with plenty of TVs and plenty of outside seating. I love watching sports here.

reviews.author: Eric P.
reviews.description: Great burgers, great selection of local beers and the fried pickles were awesome! Good service, great people, friendly vibe! From Cali but I'll definitely be back next time in town!

reviews.author: Lori M.
reviews.description: I was surprised to see some 1-star reviews. I've been going to BSL on and off for about 12 years. Honestly, I forget about it from time to time. I was thrilled to find on my last visit they still have great food, a great vibe, and above all excellent service. The bartenders, my server, the droppers, essentially the entire staff were incredibly helpful... on a bustling Saturday night no less. However, there were a few rude customers. So if you're the type of person who respects people in the service industry you should definitely come by. I highly recommend it.

reviews.author: Melissa G.
reviews.description: Everyday Black Sheep Lodge has a special on drinks which is always appreciated for a gal like me who loves to throw them beers back whether it be daytime or nighttime. I really like their Trashcan Tuesdays (all Texas canned beers are $3!) to pair with my very own basket of cheese curds, a plate of burger sliders, and some crispy sweet potato fries! Sorry but I don't share my cheese curds when I come here.  Parking can be a thing but do know that there are about a dozen spots reserved for just BSL in the back behind Cindy's (go around back around the corner). There are also a few spots directly in front by the patio area. Otherwise I would suggest ridesharing to BSL if you got a group of folks who you plan on meeting up with.  This is a place where you can bring large groups for sure as there is plenty of space in the game room area AND inside area. I love the bar area too but it can be get crowded with regulars - which isn't a bad thing but something to note.  Service is fast and quick here every time I come even during peak or major game watching. I have never had an issue with being there to meet friends, having my own separate tab, lack of service etc. Only positive experiences here for me which is what keeps me coming back!

reviews.author: Robin A.
reviews.description: Worst place ever. Horrible service! They keep your credit card when you open a tap and when you close out they still keep it! Absolutely won't be back!

reviews.author: Nancy P.
reviews.description: Black Sheep? I feel a better name might be Counting Sheep. You see you will have plenty of time from when you place your order until you receive it for a nice long nap. It wasn't crowded and we certainly did not have a complicated order. We ordered two Chicago dogs and one Chili dog. There were no other tables outside and i counted 12 people inside, all at different stages of eating. I guess it's a global pandemic and the water was shut off in Austin so I guess there is a reason....but the hotdogs aren't boiled (I hope)--well I don't think I'm being very helpful unless you'd like to review the restaurant operations... And i really don't want to know all the details of how the sausage, errr hotdogs are made. I just want to eat them. It was kind of a Chicago dog. The mustard was served in a tiny package on the side and that seemed strange. The bun didn't have poppy seeds and it was kind of dry. Other than that it was tasty. I took a bite of the chili cheese dog and that was fine too. I guess if you're in the hood and you have the time (plan on extra time) it's worth a stop. At least one time. Then you can decide for yourself if you will return. I will not!

reviews.author: Tyler W.
reviews.description: On a week night we watched a hockey game, which lasts maybe 3 hours got kicked out of this place. We ordered food, 4 pitchers and got kicked out. 3 people, 3 hours , 4 pitchers and were actually forced to leave. While ordering the food and drinks we were given poor service but who cares at a sports bar. But after they got the orders we were kicked out for tabc. If you look up tabc rules on our tab we were in line, even if we were close it's a sports bar grow up. Games over and we want to watch the last 1.5 minute of a nba game, and we were actually forced to leave. I get following rules, but when you follow rules you don't know anything about, then you're just out of line

reviews.author: Havalah W.
reviews.description: I am always surprised by this place. Service is always pretty good, and the food is consistent and delicious! The wings are quickly becoming our favorite, and the mimosas are really really well balanced! Honestly that's hard to find for me... there's always too much juice or the bubbles are flat... not here! I like the spring salad w chicken.. not too unhealthy and V-tasty!! Also bringing the pups are an option on the outside patio!!

reviews.author: Sammy C.
reviews.description: This is a friendly neighborhood bar with a fun relaxed vibe. I find the servers to be very welcoming and helpful, and the food is seriously great! This is not your run of the mill bar food; the tenders and wings are some of the best I've ever eaten, no joke. The fried pickles and cheese curds are delicious. The onion rings are absolutely perfect -- hot and crispy, not greasy-- and it's always worth it to get the full basket. The Chicago Dog is one of my favorites too. I haven't tried the burgers yet, but I can't imagine I'd be disappointed in the least. Very highly recommended!

reviews.author: Jordan W.
reviews.description: Not a bad location if you're trying to just go watch a game, chill with friends, or just kick back and let the Austin traffic die down. Lots of TVs so during football season I'm sure it's a full house. The drink choices and food are good, but there are a few minor complaints I have.  There are daily specials on select Texas drafts, cocktails, and other drinks. However, I wish there would be more choices of drafts because it didn't seem like they have any. But I really like the choices I tried, and they even have some others from different breweries. They also have select drinks in cans and bottles.  The food is good, but it wasn't really what I expected. I just had 8 wings to watch a basketball game. The Buffalo medium sauce was excellent, but the lemon pepper dry rub had a little too much of the powder on it, decreasing the integrity of the taste. But I must say the Buffalo sauce and the taste of the chicken wings were pretty good. Maybe a burger or something next time.  I think I'll be back during football for some games, or another time whenever I want to bring a friend. Go try it out and maybe you'll like it. Parking is available in the back by Cindie's, but get there early as spaces run out quick.

reviews.author: Matt P.
reviews.description: Wow...had the most egregious experience in here last night. Lady bartender treated me like a dog that just shit on the floor. They then proceeded to serve me cold chili. When I asked if they usually microwave each serving or keep a whole batch hot, she said they keep it hot. This tells me they dropped the ball and risked my wellness. They'll be receiving a visit from the health department soon.

reviews.author: Megan L.
reviews.description: This place has gone to hell. Burgers used to be great they suck now  Service has gone from "it's a dive bar" to "why am I being treated like I killed this persons family?" When asking for Anything. Yes everyone is short staffed but if ownership isn't doing anything to help their staff enough that they're not total a~holes probably not a place I'd go anymore.

reviews.author: Shradha A.
reviews.description: Best tater tots ever! Worst mixed drinks! Stick to beer, enjoy your burger, don't forget to order the tater tots - I promise you!

reviews.author: Kate C.
reviews.description: Black Sheep Lodge is one of my local favorites for when I'm wanting to watch a game, have a cool drink, and eat food that is going to do some damage to my stomach later.  Definitely like any other bar, but drink specials are unbeatable and, as I stated above, they have amazing food for a bar but it will make you say "diet starts tomorrow" every bite.  Dog friendly outside, but only downsides are the tables can fill up quickly and parking isn't ideal.

reviews.author: Keilon L.
reviews.description: This is a solid bar with plenty of options.  They have a mildly exhaustive beer selection which will please any palate, discerning or otherwise.  I plan to visit more and scroll through the list of options again.  There's also a number of daily food and drink specials and I believe there is a happy hour offered as well.  I typically come to here to watch [European] football  (soccer) with a cold beer and standard American bar fare.  My one gripe is that they have a pretty good burger that they just don't know how to cook at medium temperature. I've ordered it twice and reiterated that I'd like it medium and it comes out well done each time.  That's mad annoying but I'm still holding out faith that they'll get it right one day. The fries are pretty top notch.  Again, you can't loose coming here just on the strength of the beer selection alone.  I'll be back for a better burger experience soon.

reviews.author: Kip S.
reviews.description: I've been going to Black Sheep Lodge off and on for a number of years. For a bar the food is generally solid, but the service can be excruciatingly subpar. The porch is chill and dog friendly though, so there's that. If you've got tons of time and don't mind being ignored and overlooked, it's worth a look. That said, you'd likely being doing yourself a favor by going to either ABGB or Loro, both of which are within walking distance.

name: Doc B's Restaurant + Bar
accommodations: Good for Brunch, Lunch, Dinner, Dessert

reviews.author: Sharo R.
reviews.description: We love it here!  The very first time we went, I was like "well, it was a good chicken sandwich, but kinda expensive" and my husband was like "well, my filet mignon was amazing" and the following time I ordered the chicken lo main and it was AMAZING, that is my order every time. It is pricy, but you get way more what you pay for. The food is 10/10, the service and staff 20/10!  We've been here once a week since we arrived to Austin. We love it!

reviews.author: Liz M.
reviews.description: This was my first time ever going to Doc B's and let me just say they did not disappoint. The atmosphere is laid back. Lighting could be a little better but it sets the mood. Our waitress Graziella was amazing!!! Super friendly and just down to earth! She's gives all the good vibes. The food is to the tee. I had the Carnitas burger and it is a must, not to mention The Wedge burger. I requested a drink that wasn't on the menu and not only did they make it for me but they put their twist on it and made it better! Let's just say after my party tasted my drink we had to order a round for the table! Thanks again Josh!! The Key Lime will make you think someone's aunt is back there making it with love  and the home made Oreo Ice Cream is something to talk about. We will definitely be seeing you guys again. Btw I won't be upset if you decided to put that drink on the menu...

reviews.author: Drew T.
reviews.description: Great expensive food! They make everything from scratch so be prepared to wait. It's a fun place to bring your friends or coworkers if you aren't in a hurry and aren't afraid to spend a bunch on appetizers. The meals range from $15-$30. I've never been disappointed. The fish and chips are currently my favorite.   Some nights it can get really loud outside, so be prepared for that. It's almost always busy, so if you want to give it a try be safe and make reservations.

reviews.author: Luis G.
reviews.description: This spot is amazing!   The location is perfect, the service was great and the "food" was fantastic lol.  Reason for my quotation marks is because my gf and I came to hang with one of her friends and they wanted to have a "cake and wine" type of night so that's exactly what we did. The menu did not look disappointing so I'll definitely have to come back to try a plate.   The cheesecake I believe it was, was absolutely amazing! Definitely has a very sweet taste but I mean, if you're looking for dessert you should look no further.   We also had a couple of glasses of wine and cocktails. All fantastic. My gf ordered the fantastic beautiful and it was delicious!   If you're in the area and looking for some food or just a place to grab a couple of drinks while chit chatting, this is definitely the spot to hit up at the domain. Not loud but not too quiet, dim lighting to set the mood, and a very laid back atmosphere

reviews.author: Sunita G.
reviews.description: I came here with my coworkers one afternoon for lunch. For the table, we started off with the house made Guacamole and grilled Artichokes. The Guacamole came with sweet potato chips and I ordered the number six chicken sandwich with kale slaw for the main entree. The chicken sandwich had the right amount of cajun seasoning. The burger and sandwiches here come with french fries or slaw. I feel I definitely did good by ordering the kale slaw instead of the fries because the kale slaw was out of this world. It was very good and fresh. Yum!! Highly recommend it.   Service and ambiance was outstanding.

reviews.author: Callie M.
reviews.description: Currently writing with one button of my jeans undone - Doc B's food has me full to the brim.   Not usually a big American-food person but I was curious why this place was so well-rated and wanted to try it for myself.   I asked the server to let me know what are the best things on the menu. She was very familiar with the restaurants' offerings and she killed it with her recommendations. Here's what we got:   For appetizers, Housemade Guac and Oven-roasted Wings are must-gets. The Guac is great because the chips are unique: baked sweet potato chips! I could munch on these all night. Thankfully, the Oven-Roasted Wings stole my attention as soon as it landed on my table. Best. Wings. The Chimichurri sauce is addicting!   For mains, our server mentioned that the West Coast Steak Sandwich is the best. One bite in, I wholeheartedly trusted her. It's cooked to perfection and the bed of greens helps to cut the fattiness of the meat. The Chimichurri Steak was also pretty good but the steak on the West Coast Steak Sandwich was better. The fries were well-seasoned, perfectly thin, and crispy. Oh, we also threw in a Brussel Sprouts Salad, which was needed to balance the heavy meal.   - Our server was knowledgeable about the menu (+1) - Everything came out so quickly, I think in less than 20 minutes (+1) - Our server's recommendations were spot on and the food was great (+1, +1) - Very reasonably-priced for how good this restaurant is (+1)   That's a solid 5-stars in my books. Highly recommend!  p.s. I dined at the bar to skip the wait, which was going to be 45 minutes (7:30 PM on a Wednesday night). Reservations are probably needed because of how busy the Domain gets.

reviews.author: Ronald l.
reviews.description: Place is very nice looking and food was very tasty. We ordered the 1lb angry meatball with rigatoni. First one we got was a little cold but we tasted it and was really nice taste manager took and brought us a new hot one right away.  Meatball was melt in your mouth but red pepper spicy be prepared with drinks.

reviews.author: Jake H.
reviews.description: Doc B's Restaurant + Bar in The Domain had good dishes. They received 4 stars because the prices were higher than I'd expect for this food. Even the apps were pricey. They have a good bar and patio with TVs for the big games. The server was clearly new to serving based on his awkward interactions with us. I ordered the Chicken Paillard (arugula, tomatoes, pickled red onion, and shaved reggiano with gold coast vinaigrette). I had to really dig for the chicken under the mound of arugula but it did have good flavors, just way too much rabbit food on top. The buttermilk fried chicken looked good so if I go back, I may have to try that.

reviews.author: Vickie H.
reviews.description: my boyfriend and I had dinner at a very busy time and did not have to wait at all. At first we choose this place because most of the other restaurants had a very long wait time. We were both glad we choose to eat here. I don't remember our servers name but so many other servers including ours were very attentive and kept checking on us. What made our experience over the top was when  the manager, josh stopped to talk to us about the restaurant(history with the restaurant), different recommendations around the area. We were very appreciative of the conversations with Josh during a busy dinner time.  I had the chicken parm. it was very flavorful and the right portion of pasta for the chicken. my boyfriend had the filet and he said it was great. the Potatoes that come with are delicious as well. I had a few to try!  We definitely will be back!

reviews.author: Alexander K.
reviews.description: Great food and staff, typical Domain parking, just plan on parking in a garage, which is very close. Pleasant environment.

reviews.author: Trevor L.
reviews.description: Pretty good experience. Decided to sit outdoors because inside was freezing. Server was pretty friendly and didn't have any problems with the food. I wouldn't call the Cajun turkey sandwich Cajun because nothing about it really tasted Cajun.    Overall, food came out hot and tasty, drinks were great (if you know what I mean), and overall good interaction with everyone.

reviews.author: Veronica R.
reviews.description: Omg, I am a picky eater and decided to step out of my zone and choose the homemade guacamole and sweet potato chips.  Absolutely Devine. So much to the point I bought sweet potatoes to try and recreate. Lol  Next was the chicken kebabs and cucumber and feta salad. Can you say I almost licked the plate!   If you have not eaten here then it's a must. I stretched my neck out for what others were ordering and it all looked so yummy. I'll be a repeat customer for sure.

reviews.author: Justin M.
reviews.description: Nice place, good service, but food was disappointing and pricey. $17 for guac?? Serving was big but no flavor other than avocado. Chips didn't go well with it. Had the wok bowl and wow no seasoning or flavor in the steak. The teriyaki was mildish which was nice to not be overpowering. Still just everything was not worth it and mediocre and not up to its ambiance feel.

reviews.author: Michelle W.
reviews.description: I fell in love with candied bacon. There I said it. It had the perfect kick to it.   I tried the udon noodles which were great. The server even brought extra sauce without prompting.   My friend had the Cobb salad which looked amazing. Considering she wanted to go mainly for that I'd say it must be good.   We went on a week night which went decently without too much of a crowd.

reviews.author: Andy N.
reviews.description: I came here with some friends, and they surprisingly took us in with mo wait time on a busy Friday night. The food was delicious. It was what I expected, and the service was superb. Although, the small portions with the high prices is something to note. While many of the items were a bit high, the portions were lacking. Besides pricing and portion, the food is what you expect and good.

reviews.author: Greg H.
reviews.description: One of the places we went for my wife's birthday week. She had been hearing good things and saw great reviews, we went with another friend who also has a birthday in June.  The place was very nice, you had indoor and outdoor seating, the staff wore masks. We sat inside as it was hot, there is a parking garage, the purple one, right across the street so that was nice.  Service was great and fast. We started with some drinks and candied bacon and chips and Guac. The bacon was very good, agreed on by all three of us. The water did not come with ice which I found rather weird but maybe it's not but they keep it filled.  Our friend has the Cobb salad, Shana had the Turkey Burger, and I had Chicken. They both liked theirs, my fries were really good but unless you dipped the chicken in one of the sauces they brought it was pretty dry. Good flavor but dry.  The food was good, they raved about the chips but the guac was not as great as they were hoping. Overall it was good but not as good as many review make it sound, I admit I expect more when the food it more expensive and two of the three meals being good is great but while I am glad we went, not going to be on my normal rotation of places to go on date nights.

reviews.author: Kelly L.
reviews.description: my friends and I were in the area and wanted to grab lunch. we wanted to come here because they have a dog friendly patio! huge  plus! they're also conveniently located by two parking garages and very close to many other stores in the domain.   the food was very average though in my opinion for the price we paid. the angry meatball was HUGE but tasted very unimpressive after you get through the initial outer crust that is covered in the sauce. the chimichurri steak lacked flavor and seasoning. the only good part I enjoyed was the fries.   service was a little slow but it was also sunday lunch so understandable.

reviews.author: Allen P.
reviews.description: Great place and the service was wonderful! Staff was attentive, the food was perfect and the drinks complemented it just right.

reviews.author: Dip D.
reviews.description: Been here for lunch a couple of times. Excellent service and food each time. I usually get salads but the apps looked good and the burgers were good too.

reviews.author: Josolyn N.
reviews.description: Our new favorite restaurant! The food was amazing along with the service. Josh, the manager and Tony, our waiter were great! The oven roasted wings, knife and fork cobb salad and marinated filet mignon wok out bowl were perfect. Highly recommend for a wonderful dining experience!

name: Loro
accommodations: Best nights on Monday, Tuesday, Saturday

reviews.author: Sarah M.
reviews.description: Highly recommend Loro for both Austinites and visitors alike. Fusion between the owners of a popular BBQ spot and a high-end sushi restaurant, It's a great representation of the Austin food scene, with creative dishes consisting of both BBQ and Asian flavors. The patio has great vibes.   Get the potatoes, you won't regret it.

reviews.author: Dean L.
reviews.description: Food is awesome, but the system sucks. On a Monday at 1pm, we ordered a brisket sandwich, two salads, and a zucchini dish. The salads came to the table after 10 minutes about 10 minutes apart. Then the sandwich came about 5 minutes after that. After another 20 min, and we finally flagged down an employee who implied that the server probably gave up because of where we're sitting (which is out back with everyone else). She came back to tell us that we weren't charged for it, and would bring it out anyway. She did, promptly, and it was delicious.  The Mandarin margaritas are rockin', though small.

reviews.author: Melanie Y.
reviews.description: One of Austin's most famous restaurants - created by the owner of Franklin BBQ and sushi chef of Uchi!  Perfect for large groups and almost always packed, Loro creates their dishes with a bit of an East Asian inspired twist and Texan BBQ spirit! The rice bowls come with a fish sauce that's really delicious, and pair well with the small portions of meat.   The shrimp was flavorful and the smoked prime bavette was incredibly tender - you won't overeat here with the portion sizes, but it's a great experience to try out with a group or on a date! The boozy mango slush was also SO yummy and definitely boozy.  - Crispy Potatoes ($6.25) - Chicken Karaage ($10.50) - Texas Sweet Corn ($6) - Sesame Rice Noodles ($5.25) - Curry Marinated Shrimp Rice Bowl ($14.50) - Smoked Prime Bavette Rice Bowl ($14.50) - Mango Boozy Slush

reviews.author: Emmett T.
reviews.description: What a clever idea to pair concepts from two of the more recognizable Austin eateries in Franklin Barbecue and Uchi. The result is an Asian fusion smokehouse serving unique takes on some classic items. We called in a fairly large to-go order and then drove over to the location in the South Lamar District to pick up the food. The place was half full for a Monday evening so it wasn't overly busy. There were a couple of outside patios with seating along with a spacious interior dining area that had booths, high-top tables, and picnic style tables along with a bar.  Bar Food, Snacks and Veggies, Meats, Sandwiches, Rice Bowls, and Sweets were the menu categories. Our picks were the following... * Crunchy Sweet Corn Fritters (served with sriracha aioli and cilantro) * Crunchy Cabbage Salad (served with cashew-ginger vinaigrette, cucumber, and lemon zest) * Coconut Scented Rice (seasoned with lime leaves and lemongrass) * Tomato and Cucumber Salad (served with cantaloupe, cilantro oil, lemon zest, and mint) * Sesame Rice Noodles (seasoned with chili vinaigrette, black sesame, and green onion) * Malaysian Chicken Bo Ssam (marinated with yellow-curry yuzu vinaigrette and Thai basil) * Char Siew Pork Belly (marinated with hoisin sauce and celery) * Smoked Turkey Breast (served with apricot chutney and chicken skin) * Smoked Beef Brisket (seasoned with chili gastrique and Thai herbs)  The standouts to me were the fritters, pork belly, and turkey breast. The sweetness of the fritters was contrasted with the spicy aioli. The pork belly was sliced into small square pieces and coated with the familiar flavor of hoisin. The fruitiness from the chutney and the crispiness of the chicken skin gave a citrus tone and texture, respectively, to enhance the smoked turkey.  I do think the meat servings were small for the charged prices. For example, there was maybe a half pound of smoked beef which cost nearly $20. The quality of the meats was good, but I think the brisket was not quite up to the Franklin standard. There had been a buzz about Loro when it first opened in 2018. It has been on my to-do list for Austin, and I was happy to be able to sample a variety of offerings.

reviews.author: Andrew W.
reviews.description: I love Loro! I've been to their location in Dallas before, but the OG Austin location probably has an even better setup with a larger partially-covered outdoor patio area.  I really enjoy casual counter-serve type places like Loro where you just order everything at the bar - easier for big parties like we had too. Loro's draft list and drink options are expansive and fantastic, and you can't stop by here without trying their boozy mango or coffee slushie (they sadly ran out of the coffee slushies when we went ).  The food at Loro is some of the best food pairing for casual weekend drinking that I've ever had. Szechuan spiced karaage - just get multiple orders of this for the table and thank me later. The brisket is smoked onsite under Aaron Franklin's supervision, and is absolutely fantastic in a fusion pairing with pickled onions, chili gastrique, and Thai herbs.

reviews.author: James R.
reviews.description: A culinary delight pulled off without pretentiousness. Everything was just perfect. Tomato and Cucumber Salad (cantaloupe, cilantro oil, lemon zest, mint), Char Siew Pork Belly (house hoisin sauce, celery), Smoked Prime Bavette (shishito salsa verde, cilantro, pickled onion), Oak Smoked Salmon(cucumber-yuzu broth, parsley, lemon), Coconut Scented Rice (lime leaves, lemongrass), Oak Grilled Zucchini (cashew sambal, walnut bagna cauda, lemon), And Smoked Beef Brisket (chili gastrique, thai herbs).   It should be noted that the brisket id only available until 4pm! This brisket is amazing and worth the wait.

reviews.author: Kerri M.
reviews.description: Loro is a must if you live in or are visiting Austin! While they don't take reservations, waiting isn't too bad there. We got there around 6 on a Saturday night and were told it would be a 30 minute wait for 2 people. They have outdoor seating and a bar outside so you can hang out and have a drink while you wait. We ended up getting seated 15 minutes later (I think we just got lucky).  Once you get seated, you have to go to the front and order and then they bring it out. It gets pretty crowded at the front, so not quite ideal if you are planning on having multiple drinks or ordering more food, so it might be easiest to order all of them at once.  I ended up getting the Typhoon and frozen gin and tonic to drink and then shared the crispy potatoes, brisket, brisket rice bowl, and rice noodles. The food came out super quick, but unfortunately, the brisket was cold. All of the other food was great and even the brisket in the rice bowl was warm, it was just the brisket by itself.  Overall, I was really impressed by the uniqueness and flavor of all of the food and drinks! They also have a decent amount of meatless options too if you are vegetairan! I will definitely be back!

reviews.author: Rolando N.
reviews.description: Very interesting fusion of Asian and smoked BBQ. Executed perfectly and boy does it work.   Do yourself a favor and sample the different appetizers. Crispy potatoes, chicken karranga, grilled snap peas and the wonton chips and salsa were delicious. Very unique and interesting flavors that blend well together.   The pork belly and tofu bowls were well portioned and equally delicious.   Crispy chicken and brisket sandwiches were also hits at the table.   Service was prompt and friendly.   We will be back.

reviews.author: Frank P.
reviews.description: Stop everything you are doing in Austin Texas.  If you are a fan of Franklin BBQ..... and ....., Uchi Japanese restaurant s.... Go to LORO!!!  It is the fusion of both of these fantastic restaurants!!!  I couldn't believe the great food and beverages we had here at LORO!  We started with the Heifenweis beer on tap which was very good.  We sat at the bar and the bartender suggested the flank steak Meat plate along with the pork belly rice bowl, snap peas and sesame noodles.  I don't know what made me agree to order this mess of food but when it came out I was sure happy I did!!   Our bartender's name was Huy and he sure knew his stuff!  The sesame noodles were fantastic!!  Kind of Pho like noodles but with Al dente texture served fried with sesame oil!  FAntastic!!!  Then the flank steak served with pickled radishes and cilantro!!  Really good!!  The snap peas with Kimchi sauce was super tasty but the pork belly rice bowl was the best of the lot.  If you come to LORO'a you should get this dish.  It's hard to explain but it's a fusion of thick bacon, rice, some sort of veggies and a  ginger soy sauce that would make you smack yourself in the head if you'd forgotten to mix it in.  It's simply magic.  It's ridiculous.  You gotta have it.    We paired it up with an Argentine wine "Trento Negro" which was again fantastic!!     We finished with a cookie that was kinda chocolate chip and kinda macadamia nut mix.... Served with a coffee slush that knocked our socks off!!!  Ambiance was Asian smokehouse cool vibes.  Staff was friendly and unbelievably helpful to midwesterners like  us.  Bathrooms were clean and prices were reasonable.    This is 5 star food served in a super cool atmosphere with great prices.  Do not go to Austin without trying this place.   It should be at the top of your list!!

reviews.author: Jazel M.
reviews.description: To be very clear, I am a total snob about Asian food. I am like why ruin a good thing by fusing it with other things?? ITS GREAT THE WAY IT IS!   HOWEVER! Loro did a great job. I loved the corn fritters and I got the cabbage salad and added grilled shrimp. Everything tasted amazing! I love the atmosphere and I currently work close enough to walk there. Perfect outside seating for the weather when I went. I will have to go back for happy hour. Food came quickly but there were a TON of people so if you are still COVID paranoid, probably just try to take out! Good luck!

reviews.author: Chris L.
reviews.description: Loro is so very popular, but they make waiting fun with a cute waiting area.  They have an extended parking which makes it less stressful.  I love ordering at the counter, but you have to be pretty strategic.  Look at the menu while wait and send someone to order immediately so that you can get that food!  We usually order a lot so that we can try everything.  Below is what I remembered from my trip:  My partner loved the Brisket Sandwich especially the sauce that came with it.  The Turkey was good, but odd.  It comes with mandarin oranges so it's kinda like have cranberries on Turkey near during thanksgiving   Their version of karage was surprisingly great!  Char Siew Pork Belly - pieces were great.  They were sweet and soft and came with hoisin,  Coconut Rice  had perfect flavor  Corn Fritters were hyped for me.  It was more about the sauce that made them interesting and you have to eat them right away.  Letting them sit for more than 5 minutes ruins the texture.  Smoked Beef Brisket was soft and amazing   Wonton Chips were also a bit hyped for me and they are VERY oily.  Potatoes were basic, but parents enjoyed them.  Singapore noodles are a solid crowd pleasure.  It's definitely a unique space with a kitchen that tries to be innovative.  It's definitely worth a shot.  Not all dishes are winners, but if you order enough you'll find something you like!

reviews.author: Paul D.
reviews.description: Cultural Culinary   The quick review is the food was excellent, craft beer ambiance, and dog friendly with outdoor seating.  I have driven along South Lamar for a long time but never stopped by.  My impression was it was too Asian for my wife where she may not like the taste.  After talking to my niece who ate there said we would definitely love it, so in looking for a new place to try Loro was on top of the list.  Built under huge oak trees Loro provides many seating options from bar, indoor, patio, and outdoor seating. It was a bit chilly so decided to sit at the bar noticing some sat outside under large heaters.  First you find your place to sit and then order at the bar.  It seemed to work well and gives that country bbq feel.   Taps of local brews were in front of me with decorations along the wall perhaps from a garage sale adding to the ambiance of Austin coolness. The menu was on a peg wood wall with old school lettering or scan the QR code using your phone. I ordered the Oak Smoked Salmon with Coconut Scented Rice. The bartender noted to return on either Sunday or Monday to try the Smoked Baby Back Duroc Pork Ribs where you will sing about it they next day.   We dressed Austin casual so not need for business attire or bow ties, and there seems to be quite a bit of parking even though saw a few arrive on e-scooters. The average age here is 20-30s which made me feel young here.   Looks like it's a place where the food is brought to you when ready, not sitting under a heat lamp. A side bowl was placed in front of me with a delicious looking piece of salmon in a puddle of some juice.  The rice was in a white takeout box. The salmon was extremely good and went along fine with my Live Oak Hefeweizen draft beer.  I was so tuned into my fish I forgot about the rice. I opened the little box and tasted it where it was very good too with a buttery taste. Forgot to ask for chopsticks but again lost all consciousness on enjoying my salmon. As for my wife she enjoyed the Oak Smoked Beef Brisket Sandwich where said the best she had tasted in a long while perhaps on our Texas Monthly BBQ tour.  Definitely added a pin on this place to my restaurant regular rotation where there are a few other menu items I need to try.

reviews.author: Tracey Z.
reviews.description: While the vibe of this place is really dope, I do think it's slightly overrated.   Yes the food is very high quality and is well sourced and prepared, however, I think that this restaurant has been so talked about and so highly regarded, I expected a lot more.  I got the smoked salmon rice bowl - the salmon didn't even taste like salmon, I felt like i was just eating smoked meat. The coconut rice is definitely a hit - I really like the nice sweetness to it. The rest of the bowl was a LOT of cilantro and pickled vegetables that didn't add much except take up space.

reviews.author: Candice N.
reviews.description: Came to Loro for the first time and had a great experience. We ordered the house pickles and the pickled cauliflower in this dish were SO good. We also had the corn fritters and shared the chicken karaage (unfortunately not pictured because we devoured it) both equally great.   It was pretty chilly outside (Texas weather!) but the staff was working tirelessly to make sure the heaters were on for those of us waiting for a table. Such a great evening at Loro; we will be back!

reviews.author: Ruchi J.
reviews.description: The vibe of this place was great but we were really confused about the service/organization of things.   We came on a weekend evening and there were tons of people here. The parking situation was a bit confusing but we figured it out (there's WAY more parking than we thought there was). When we got to the line to check in, we got a buzzer so we could sit outside. We were told to not sit at any of the tables outside so we got some drinks at the bar outside and hung out outside on some chairs not near any of the tables. When our buzzer came, we went back inside only to be led outside to the tables and then told to order "at the bar". We were really confused if that meant the outdoor bar or the indoor bar and other people outside were confused as well. Turns out indoor bar was the right answer!  We ordered inside then came back out and awaited our food. We got everything except the corn fritters and had to remind the host about them. Overall, the food was good, but the chaos around the service didn't make the food worth it.   We liked the kale salad and the string beans. The corn fritters was a little too heavy for me (after all that waiting!)

reviews.author: Kathy C.
reviews.description: Came here for happy hour and it was such a treat. My friend and I ordered a couple of their plates from the HH menu to split and also two of their alcoholic slushee drinks.   What we got:  - corn fritters: in my opinion, the star of the show. They were so crispy on the outside and the inside was more chewy and had a nice bite.  - chicken burger: to be honest, I wasn't a fan of the seasoning on the chicken but my friend enjoyed it. - karage: these little fried chicken bites were crispy and yet still juicy. The cilantro topper helped provide a refreshing bite. - mango slushee: I believed this was mixed with sake but you really wouldn't be able to tell. Tasted like juice! - coffee slushee: this was the exact opposite of the mango one, the alcohol taste was strong but the coffee flavor was goo

reviews.author: Jennifer Y.
reviews.description: A hit Loro was with my out of town family visit. Always happy I am when making the right choice. Nice and easy atmosphere. A taste of this and that with our family style lunch spread.   Each dish was popping with flavors, including their tantalizing "Cucumber and Tomato Salad"; beautifully spiced "Malaysian Chicken Bo Ssam"; and, scrumptious "Loro Cheeseburger". A lunch my family will long remember!  CHEERS!

reviews.author: Emma S.
reviews.description: Went here for lunch on a Saturday afternoon. It was pretty busy! For lunch you choose your own table and then order up at the bar. My friend and I shared the tomato, cantaloupe, cucumber salad, and the Malaysian curry chicken rice bowl. Both were fantastic! The coconut rice is so flavorful and the chicken was very tender!

reviews.author: Victoria K.
reviews.description: Happy I finally took the opportunity to stop by! A few co-workers of mine suggested Loro's when I first moved to Austin, and after dining here - I can see why!  My sister and I both ordered a chicken sandwich, and crispy potatoes! Wow, we were not disappointed. Both the sandwich and potatoes were delicious. We will back very soon to try more!

reviews.author: Leah S.
reviews.description: TL;DR; Really quality food; cocktails are solid; service is nice with an interesting concept; cool vibes. Get the chicken karaage.  My husband and I came here for a date night on Saturday and had a great time. Seating was surprisingly easy (we got there around 6:30pm? We're seated at the bar within 5 minutes). We sat at the bar, which was nice because we didn't have to go up and order food/drinks (which is what you'd have to do if you are seated at a table). Bartender and service was nice and attentive, host was friendly but not annoying.   Originally, we came for drinks and try a few dishes to share, but everything sounded so go that we stuffed ourselves with too food to get to the drinks. I did try the Typhoon, which was pretty good. The frozen drinks looked good, but was too full of food to get one.  Would DEFINITELY come back for the food. We both got rice bowls (husband got the chopped smoked brisket and I got the char siew pork belly), the corn fritters, and chicken karaage. DO NOT SLEEP ON THE KARAAGE. So delicious--the sauce they drizzle on top is *chef's kiss*, the jalapeo aioli was a perfect pair, and it was super tender, juicy, and crisp all at the same time.  Corn fritters tasted great, only critique is that the sweet corn was SUPER sticky/gummy (stick to your teeth in every aspect).

reviews.author: Elizabeth W.
reviews.description: I arrived in Austin, TX on 10/18/18 with no plans until the following day and thought a tour was a good idea. However all the traditional tours appeared to be booked. I stumbled upon the Austin Brewery Tours' website while searching on Yelp for ideas.   I had an awesome time exploring Austin's growing beer scene. I also had a great time meeting and making friends the other tourists on our tour.   I enjoyed all of the 3 breweries but the behind the scene tour at Independence Brewing Co. made it my favorite.   The price is very fair when you consider it includes your tastings and tips for your severs.   In a nutshell, a good alternative tour for those interested in the Austin craft beer scene.

reviews.author: Greshka P.
reviews.description: Apparently it's become a tradition that we do a brewery tour when we travel. One of the breweries I was told I MUST visit, while in Austin, was Jester King. Searched online for brewery tours that included this and finally decided on Austin Brewery Tours.  Almost daily tours, online booking was so easy, and we got a reminder, a couple of days earlier to our tour, via email.  Tour starts at noon.  Meetup time was 11:30am. At around 11:25am the van was there.  Out comes Shane, owner and tour guide. He immediately introduced himself, thanked us for being on time and proceeded to ask us our names and where we were from. Once the other people taking the tour arrived, we were all introduced and in the van we went.  During the time we were driving, he would ask us questions to get to know us better, and see the style of beers we liked. He also gave us an intro of each of the breweries we would visit. He made the time driving pass by fast and welcomed all questions we could have.  At each of the breweries, he explained the process and what we had included in the price of the tour. At Jester King, they even had a special release and he bought a sample of each (which was not included in the price but he gifted us with it) making sure we had the complete experience.    You can tell he enjoys doing these tours and meeting the people.   He even took us to Revolution - which was in front of one of the breweries we visited - to try locally made flavored gin.   So greateful he allowed us to do this quick stop - this was delicious, and gave me the opportunity to talk more with one of the ladies on the tour, exchanging ideas on recipes with the gin we had just tried.    Shane is grate at incorporating everyone in the tour and conversations.  He allows you plenty of time to enjoy each brewery and every beer you choose.   He is now friends with the staff at each of these breweries, which works on the advantage of everyone in the tour since we got excellent/ friendly service at each stop.  Best part of this all, is you meet new people, get to enjoy all the beer you can drink, and don't have to drive. Great way to spend a day in Austin.  If looking for a beer tour, look no further, this is it!

reviews.author: Talia H.
reviews.description: We had a great time on our tour. Our guide James was very informative and friendly. No one In our group lived in Austin so it was good to get some info about the city and neighborhoods. The 3 breweries we stopped at were all unique from each other in size, atmosphere, and beers. At each stop you choose two beers to try which is great. We've been on other tours where you do not pick. We were given about an hour at each stop which was ample time. I would highly recommend this tour company!

reviews.author: Zachary D.
reviews.description: So the scene is a bunch of guys down to Austin from NJ/NY for our buddies bachelor party. Of all the awesome people we met and food we ate, our guide Shane as well as the guys at the Lotus Joint food truck were freakin awesome!  SXSW had Austin jammed with a lot to do but Shane made sure we got to see Austin and its beer community like the locals do. He was insanely knowledgeable not just about beer but also about Texas. When you've solo traveled the world like he has, you gain a perspective that makes you far more relatable too which made him an all around cool guy to hangout with.  Most important.. The beers were phenomenal! (Try the goat tacos at Lotus also!)  In town for a day, a week, or a life time - Hands down recommend this for anyone in Austin!

reviews.author: Myriam C.
reviews.description: Best tour ! The people we met were so friendly. Our tour guide Alex was the best . She was very knowledgeable and very welcoming.  She is very passionate about beer . She made the tour very enjoyable. All breweries were great . We got to meet the owner of Independence and the owner of Nomadic. Their stories are very motivating  . I would do this tour again with Alex . She was the highlight of the tour. Alex thank you for your hospitality !

reviews.author: Chloe F.
reviews.description: Took a group of 14 on this tour for my birthday and had an absolute blast! The customer service from when I first booked through the entire tour was top notch. They made it so easy to have a fun day planned. Our tour guide, James, was the best! Great driver, super cool guy, and made sure we had the best experience possible at each brewery. He made the day so fun, stress-free, and kept us all on track.  We stopped at a mix of well known and off the beaten path breweries. If you're visiting from out of town, this is one of the best tours to see the heart of Austin craft brewing. I can't recommend them highly enough.

reviews.author: Leslie B.
reviews.description: Thank you, Shane for the awesome tour!!! Knowledgeable, fun and an all around good time. Will definitely be back.

reviews.author: Barry F.
reviews.description: I was in Austin for meetings but had some free time prior. I like to visit breweries (who doesn't?) and saw this tour. I was so pleased with the entire tour: Shane is an amazing host who took us around, shared lots of information about the area, along with the breweries. He was very friendly and ensured we had a good time. Even though it was about 1000 degrees outside, he kept the van cool and ensured we were cared for.  We had opportunities to not only sample excellent beers, but also visit several food trucks in the area. His rapport with the brewery owners gave us extra attention and really made us feel special.  I would absolutely do this tour again!  Highly recommended.

reviews.author: Deena C.
reviews.description: My husband and I had a great time celebrating his 40th birthday with a private tour. Shane was great with his knowledge of the breweries and he was very personable. He even made a pit stop for a picture at the "I love you so much" mural for us. It was a great experience and we would totally do it again.

reviews.author: Kyle A.
reviews.description: Absolutely loved it, had a blast.  Took my dad and step mom on a tour.  Our first time in Austin, rather than just passing thru on I-35.  We went to 3 different breweries, learned alot.  Our driver was very informative and friendly.  Answered all of our questions.  The folks working at the breweries were very nice too.  Lots of fun and great beer.  Highly recommend going on a tour.

reviews.author: Greg L.
reviews.description: We went on this tour the Sunday before Christmas to celebrate my son's 22 B-day... Everything was absolutely flawless and we had the good fortune of having James as our tour guide... I must say this trip was to be excellent to begin with, but James made it SPECTACULAR!!! His knowledge of beer in general along with his totally chill attitude and attention to every little detail ( making sure we had water along with our tastings to matching our individual tastes in selecting what we should explore ) was over the top customer experience!!! We're looking to do another tour in early 2019 and would NOT HESITATE to use Austin Brewery Tours again!

reviews.author: Victoria E.
reviews.description: Austin Brewery Tours was awesome! This was a Christmas gift for my husband and we both had a great time. Brooke was a wonderful tour guide, and she made good beer recommendations (especially considering that I'm not much of a beer drinker).
