We did the Hill Country Tour and visited Jester King, Last Stand, and Skull Mechanix. Each tour had a tasting option (one where we all tasted beers as a group and the others where we each got to pick our own beers to try). After selecting beer to taste, we got to explore each brewery on our own before moving onto the next location. We had enough time to eat (plan on eating at Jester King. The food is awesome and we spent the most time there) and to drink at every place, while still getting to individually wander and see all that these breweries had to offer. We also got to take the Jester King tour, which is really cool.   I'd highly recommend an afternoon with Austin Brewery Tours!! Thank you Brooke for a great day!

reviews.author: Samantha E.
reviews.description: My friend booked this for her birthday and it was a blast! Our driver James way friendly, informative, and kept us on schedule! I would highly recommend! He also took us to a brewery I've never heard of and was great!

reviews.author: Aaron W.
reviews.description: Highly recommend this tour. Our group had an awesome time getting to check out the Austin Craft Beer scene. 3 breweries in 3 hours is perfect. Our guide Shane was so knowledgeable with suggestions.

reviews.author: Michael B.
reviews.description: Shane took the 10 of us to Southern Heights, Live Oak, and Independence breweries. We were on a bachelor party where everyone loved craft beer, and wanted to find out what Austin has to offer. The breweries we visited were perfect since they offered a wide variety of options, and Shane kept us on time without rushing us.  It was truly a fun and professional experience. I'll be recommending ABT to others who inquire about brewery tours in Austin.

reviews.author: Carl R.
reviews.description: I was in town for a bachelor party and the Brew Tour was the concessions highlight of the weekend. Shane (the owner) made the planning process a breeze. He was extremely helpful and prompt in all of our communications. Also, the van we took was clean and very comfortable.   The tour itself was AMAZING and huge shout-out to our guide Brooke, you killed it! Tremendous job moving us from location to location while never making us feel rushed, so glad it wasn't on me to wrangle the guys when it was time to go :). Also, your beer recommendations were spot on! Same with your suggestions for things to do for the rest of the weekend.   I have been on similar tours in other cities and Austin Brewery Tours is the gold standard now. I have already recommended them to a few people planning trips to Austin and I know others in our group have as well.   Thanks Shane and Brooke!

reviews.author: James W.
reviews.description: October 2018. 5 out of 5. We decided to take a brewery tour while we visited Austin. This ended up being a great decision. The tour is structured well. We did three stops which gave us a good opportunity to try three different breweries without having to worry about driving, parking, or any of the attendant Logistics. The tour covers all expenses including tips which is a nice touch. You can tell that the tour is well organized and that the breweries appreciate the business. That means you end up getting much better service at all of the breweries than you sometimes get with such packages. The tour guide also is able to make excellent suggestions so if you don't have a lot of experience with craft beer this is a great way to learn. If you have any interest in a brewery tour while in Austin I highly recommend this tour.

reviews.author: Leyla W.
reviews.description: This was a super fun beer tour for those who like breweries. Shane, the owner was very knowledgeable about the three places we stopped and knew his beer styles well. He was great at mingling with all the different groups within our group (there were 6 groups!) and was a great tour guide in general. He mixes up which breweries he goes to which makes it exciting if you do this several times. It's definitely well worth the money to get a fun, convenient way to enjoy beers of Austin.

reviews.author: Lauren H.
reviews.description: We used Austin Brewery Tours for a private group tour during my sister's bachelorette party and it couldn't have been more perfect. Shane was very easy to work with, and very responsive to all of my questions prior to getting this booked. We had 2 large vans for a group of 25 girls and it worked out perfectly. Shane picked out 3 wonderful breweries for our group with a wide variety of beers (and some with other options like ciders) - all locations had plenty of space for our large group, delicious beers, and food trucks available when the group got hungry. Overall, our group had a wonderful time. I highly recommend Austin Brewery Tours!

reviews.author: Sarah S.
reviews.description: My husband and I had a great time today celebrating our 1 year anniversary! Shane was super personable and took us to breweries specific to what we like! We had a fabulous time and enjoyed every minute of it. I strongly recommend Shane and Austin Brewery Tours!

name: El Monumento
accommodations: Garage Parking, Street Parking, Private Lot Parking
Best nights on Monday, Friday, Saturday

reviews.author: Jody D.
reviews.description: Another wonderful and flavorful dinner at El Monumento!  This has become our favorite place.  Their food is just straight up delicious- always. Had the enchilada trio in the suizas sauce; all of them excellent. And the beans cooked with bacon??  Holy hell- AMAZING.  Great sangria- get the carafe- makes sense and you will finish it.   Trevor was our waiter- what a fun guy.  Helpful, attentive and funny - loved him. Also- do yourself a favor and get the chocolate cream pie

reviews.author: Phoebe O.
reviews.description: I decided to come to Texas to visit two very dear friends of mine and they suggested this restaurant they're regulars at to have a good Mexican meal. To our dismay we had an awful experience dining here and had to cut it short. Before sitting to eat we had asked the hostess ahead of time if it was okay to sit on the patio with 2 service dogs. She said it was okay and sat us outside. A few minutes later a server came up to clarify and ask that the dogs were indeed service animals otherwise we'd have to leave and we confirmed they were. Then lastly we were approached by the general manager who came up to our table in the worst behavior out of everyone. She immediately spoke to us in a very rude manner and harshly said we have to leave immediately because of our dogs - after we had already ordered 3 drinks and just gotten our appetizers. We were very taken aback at her demeanor when she came up to us because there was no apology for the miscommunication, or spending $58 on food and drinks just to be kicked out, and wasting our time dining there for 30 minutes already and now needing to go drive somewhere else to have a proper meal. We had tried communicating with her how disruptive this was to our plans after multiple members of her staff had expressed the dogs were okay being there, but she wouldn't allow us a chance to speak and just talked over us stating that it didn't matter what any of the employees say and it is up to her. We still had our full drinks and asked if at least we could finish those first and wait for our food to be boxed to go, but she refused and said we had to exit the premises immediately with our dogs there. Keep in mind, I never go out of my way to leave negative reviews but this encounter was such an awful experience that I wanted future customers to be aware of the treatment from the management here, because I personally wouldn't want to support a company that doesn't care for their guests like we experienced.   P.S.  As we exited the restaurant we came across this sign up front of the entry door stating that no pets were allowed but service animals trained to aid disabled persons are ok? If service dogs are not allowed this sign should have been removed because it is very misleading.

reviews.author: Ryan R.
reviews.description: Dropped in for some frozen margaritas and some apps. From the outside the place looks pretty appealing, nice outdoor patio and courtyard area and with a slightly rustic feel.  Ordered some frozen margs and was more like a marg with crushed ice on the top, not exactly frozen.  Apps/quesadilla was alright, nothing to write home about but did the job.  Could see myself dropping in to see if the experience or foods and drinks change at all. First impression is it looks like it has potential but doesn't deliver.

reviews.author: Mark C.
reviews.description: Second time coming here and it's a bit of a mixed bag. The staff is excellent, we were seated quickly and chips and two salsas brought out promptly.  I ordered a specialty margarita on the rocks and it was just ok.  The table ordered the chicken fajitas, enchiladas and carnitas plate. The fajitas were overcooked and dry. The edges were burnt and the onions and peppers were sliced way too thin and were over cooked as well. The portion was very small from my last visit, but shrinkflation huh?? The enchiladas were very good and the carnitas were the favorite. The charro beans were awesome. The rice was bland and one dimensional and the street corn was overly sweet. The salsa was flavorful but at least one needs a little more heat. The restaurant itself is really cool and clean. I will definitely go back but on a different night maybe try a different dish and drink

reviews.author: Diana V.
reviews.description: The food I got was not good, and borderline just plain bad. Beans watery, sour cream sauce slimy, rice tasted like cardboard. I liked the Brussels sprouts and the chocolate cake, but why would I go to a Mexican restaurant for those?  I liked our waitress a lot, as we were a big party and she did her best. But I just can't stand it when water isn't refilled timely, especially since I needed to wash down the nasty flavors I was consuming.

reviews.author: Jason D.
reviews.description: We ate at El Monumento last night.  The venue is really nice, but the quality of the food doesn't match the way the place looks.  My wife had the shrimp asada and I had the beef asada and neither was very good.  The beef was really dry and overcooked.  I would have returned it, but the service was so slow and sporadic that I didn't know if I would get it back before everyone was ready to leave.  Cocktails were the best part of the experience, but not enough of a reason to go back.  This place isn't cheap either...they need to drastically improve food quality.  A Mexican restaurant in Texas that can't cook carne asada should make some serious changes asap.

reviews.author: Sydney S.
reviews.description: My husband and I are from the DFW area in North Texas and decided to visit here while leaving our Airbnb in Georgetown. We found out the place did not open until 3pm on a Sunday so we waited 10 mins in the parking lot. We noticed a large amount of cars and people started pulling in and waiting in line at the door! We thought that we needed to get out then and wait too. Right at 3pm, the doors opened, and waiters were lined up waiting to seat everyone. We snagged a great spot on the patio by the river. We only came for drinks and appetizers. We were happy to learn that happy hour was taking place from 3-6pm. Happy hour means you take $2 off most drinks and appetizers. It is a little disappointing you have to purchase chips and salsa, but it was only $1.50 with their happy hour special. The margaritas are very strong! The chicken flautas were so crispy and yummy. There is a type of cabbage slaw/salad that is served on top that adds extra flavor. The chips were extremely golden and crunchy, cooker to perfection. Their salsa is OK but you have two different once's (a red and green avocado). Overall the scenery is beautiful inside and out. Service overall is fantastic. I would visit here frequently if I was a local!

reviews.author: Tiffany P.
reviews.description: Come for the drinks and ambiance but pass on the food. It's too bad that the food is terrible because it's a great restaurant with excellent ambience. From now on I'll just get the chips and salsa and drinks. I had the chicken asada (basically fajitas) and the chicken was dry and had no flavor.

reviews.author: David T.
reviews.description: Passed this place a handful of times and decided to try it out. There's plenty of street parking nearby if the lot is full. Seating was quick for a party of three on a Wednesday night. They do take reservations so keep that in mind if you have a larger party.    ORDER  Chicken Flautas (start) Nachos (cut) Chips and Salsa (bench) Tres Leches   Food Flautas were good as were the chips and salsa. Nachos were surprising as the toppings were added to the chips and they're not the style where you can dip the chips. Not the style I'm used to but could be good for anyone trying to portion control.   Overall This would be a great place to take your out-of-town visitors because the service is good and the setting. I'd come back again and check out the bar area.

reviews.author: Milannie C.
reviews.description: Figured it was about time that I reviewed El Monumento. I went there for the first time a few months ago and it instantly became one of my favorite places to go for happy hour. I often try to switch it up and I pride myself in trying new fun places, but I'm a sucker for a nice patio and tasty drinks and El Monumento has both.  They also accept reservations and they have plenty of parking, so two thumbs up. We always order the queso flameado, the chicken flautas, the barbacoa street tacos and the quesadillas. Their tres leches is absolutely amazing so make sure you save room for dessert. I've liked all the drinks that I've tried and their monthly special drinks are always fun and innovative. The service has been decent every time we've been there. Nothing special, but nothing to complain about either.

reviews.author: Sassy P.
reviews.description: Great atmosphere but the insides of our cheese enchiladas were just hunks of cheese (not melted), our server was rude until it was time to pay the bill and then he got all giddy to pump up the tip (which has the reverse effect for me). I still tipped adequately because I know how it can be, but I will probably never go back.

reviews.author: Shirlie F.
reviews.description: El disappointo! Second time here. First time was meh. This time I got chicken fajitas. Came with a dollop of sour cream, a teaspoon of guacamole and some watery pico de gallo. Also the bell peppers and onions were barely there, and the chicken was burnt!!! All this for $20. What a deal! We probably won't go back.

reviews.author: Gregg M.
reviews.description: Haven't had a chance to return to El Monumento since Covid and didn't know what to expect but the four of us may have had our best meal there ever. We got a reservation a little earlier than normal so we could take in the Christmas lights on the nearby Georgetown square.  Paige was our server and she did a great job. She was very attentive but didn't rush us. We started with chips and salsa, followed closely by the queso flameato, gooey and yummy .  Our meals included tortilla soup, shrimp chili relleno, street tacos and one of the special plates. Needless to say we waddled out... Our experiences in the past were a little inconsistent but this time they were right on point. Looked like there were enough employees to take care of the good crowd they had. It was fairly noisy though. Lots of families and groups.  Thanks Paige, keep up the good work! As I'm prone to say when it's appropriate, this is a repeater! Happy Holidays fellow Yelpers!

reviews.author: Elise M.
reviews.description: El Monumento is always a solid choice for Mexican food and drinks in Georgetown. I love the decor and the beautiful view from the patio. The queso and guacamole are delicious and I've always enjoyed the margaritas. The hours of operation are a little unusual. They open at 3 pm on Sunday and there is normally a line of people waiting to get in so I would recommend getting  reservation.

reviews.author: Trevor D.
reviews.description: We had a party of 20 show up. It was pure and utter chaos for our server Eric, but professional and never forgetful was he. I have spent two birthday parties here and these guys and gals nail it every time. I can't begin to describe how awesome and on their A game they were for us. My hat goes off to y'all, thank you for a memorable experience, we will be back.

reviews.author: Stacey U.
reviews.description: The service here is not what it used to be. We have had some unfortunate experiences with the wait staff. The food is ok, but the patios is outstanding!

reviews.author: Olivia O.
reviews.description: Great atmosphere. Food was good. Excellent service. Very busy... food was served in a timely manner. Highly recommend

reviews.author: Kyle G.
reviews.description: Excellent atmosphere- excellent food and great service. Will be back many more times! Hard to believe this place doesn't already have 5 star reviews all the way across the board!

reviews.author: Kasie M.
reviews.description: I can not believe I haven't reviewed this place yet, we used to be frequent flyers here pre covid.   My favorite part about this restaurant is the outdoor seating and ambiance. It's relaxing, quiet shaded, and you can see the water below.   The service has always been pretty good, no complaints there.   The food is very good and the drinks too, their cucumber/jalapeno margaritas are perrrrfecccct.   I agree with many of the other reviews, it's much pricier than its competitors for very comparable tasting food. Post covid, you even have to pay for chips and salsa- which is unusual at a mexican restaurant.

reviews.author: Heather L.
reviews.description: Just wanted to add another amazing experience. Took my hubby here for the first time the other night and he loved it as much as I did. The food quality was perfection and our waiter Phillip was very considerate of my need to avoid wheat and talked to the kitchen to help me decide on what to eat. Wonderful service. Wonderful food.

reviews.author: Tim L.
reviews.description: We took the Austin Steam Train up to Burnet and absolutely loved it! We had both never been on a train before other than the metro and weren't sure what to expect.  The train had plenty of free snacks and we had our open table to play cards on the way up and back.  The Crew Chief even stopped by to give us some history on the different train cars which we really enjoyed.  It was a cold, rainy day but we still enjoyed the views on the way up and back and had a ton of fun exploring Burnet. We stopped by the Warehouse BBQ for lunch and also grabbed a coffee in town as well!  Well worth the trip and an overall fun experience!

reviews.author: Jessica L.
reviews.description: So I have very mixed feelings when it comes to our mini trip on this train.  I booked that groupon for the North Flyer as my kids are in love with trains so this would be a nice treat for them.  They enjoyed Santa and the hot chocolate, I didn't mind the scenery as it was pretty.  Santa, Mrs. Claus, and the story telling was only for a few minutes of the 2 hour ride.    The biggest issue is, I really thought the ride will be in motion for the most part.  I know there are stops but it really felt like we moved for 30 minutes and sat still for the rest o the trip.  It was really annoying and boring to just be sitting for most of the two hours on the train.  In fact, I believe you don't even leave the small town of where the train first left.    They should consider playing Christmas music (I saw speakers on the train) to keep people entertained if we are going to be sitting for 90% of the time.  Overall this trip didn't feel worth it for the price we paid.  2 stars~

reviews.author: Annie T.
reviews.description: My family rode the North Pole Flyer, not so much for the Santa stuff since we have no children under 10, it was more for family fun. And it was a fantastic experience. The train was actually pretty cool, I've never been in a proper train before, I mean, it was old fashioned but still just a really really cool experience. We paid for the private suite and it was worth it, we also walked throughout the train which was a bit old west feeling. My favorite part was walking between cars to see the view unencumbered by windows.   We walked through all the cars (like most people on the train did) to see what the other cars were like. The giftshop car was the nicestest with big windows and plenty of room to walk around while balancing yourself on a rocking and rolling moving train.   Some of the private rooms give you an idea of what is was really like to ride a train across country with a sleeper car, teeny tiny shower, and narrow hallways. It was such a great experience.   Not sure why people complain about the views because mine were fantastic! I mean, c'mon. We live in Texas not Denver. I know what the hill country looks like. There's no mountains but where the hills meet the sky is expansive. It was beautiful.

reviews.author: Frankie M.
reviews.description: Easy to book your tickets online. Usually depart on time. Cart sections depends on price range. Very family friendly.  You pick up tickets on a building near by (about 25 meters). You just give your name and how many in your party and you'll get your tickets. Once you get your tickets, you'll walk to where the train is located, show your tickets and they will direct you to your cart. Once you find your seat/section...relax and enjoy the ride! The view to Borne is very relaxing and enjoyable. The train does provide drinks and snacks and some alcohol. Mask as of Jan 22, 2022 is required during the train ride. Bathrooms are located throughout various train carts.

reviews.author: Cynthia V.
reviews.description: Full disclosure - I love trains, so I may be a bit biased around this experience. Having taken lots of scenic trains in Colorado/the West, I can see where some would be disappointed by the views provided on this ride - the route follows a state highway and what was probably pastures 20+ years ago is now developed as Austin sprawls outwards. The main selling point on this train is just getting to enjoy the most fun mode of transportation out there - a train! We don't often find ourselves in situations where we get to relax and enjoy a train ride, so any opportunity to do so is a winner in my book. However, there are some small improvements that could be made to the train cars/experience that I think would help overall: clean the windows both inside and out, re-upholster the seats, and add in PA voice-over announcements to give some brief history of the train line/cars instead of the volunteer attendant trying to yell it at a busy car. The time in Burnet is fine, we packed a picnic and enjoyed it at a park nearby the town square. Overall, I am glad to have done the Hill Country Flyer experience from Cedar Park to Burnet, but would say to manage expectations in terms of scenery.

reviews.author: Sophia G.
reviews.description: I liked my visit! I paid for the Cedar Park to Burnett ride. It's about 6.5 hours including a 2 hour stop in Burnett. I paid $60 per person for one of the more expensive carts the Rippling Stream one of the Adults Only lounges. And I'm glad I did. My cart had a lot of complimentary refreshments to choose from. And since we only had 10 people in my cart we pretty much had as many drinks as we wanted. I will admit we were the youngest people in our cart. So our fellow ride goers had higher expectations and were pretty disappointed with the look and feel of the train. But my boyfriend and I haven't experienced something like this before so we were excited and happy for the ride. So everything was new and great. I feel we're prepared for longer, faster train rides now. I really liked being in a cart with less people. We got to know almost everyone and we had great conversations. Daniel was absolutely amazing. His love for trains showed. And he was great to have conversations with. Great guy who answered everyone's questions and concerns.  We toured the entire train and it's nice seeing the other carts. There are definitely way more seats in the others. And they're nice too. My picture below was taken in one of the carts I toured in. (I only have videos of the one I was actually in). I will admit the city of Burnett didn't have much to see or do. I purposely brought my own food. After researching some menus I gave up on vegan options. Which is normal in small towns. It's a VERY small town. The best part was the little show the city of Burnett put on for us. The actors were great, friendly, and funny. A really great crew and was happy to watch their show. We were very tired by the time we had to get back on the train. We board at 8:15 and start the ride at 9. Because of waking up early and walking around the small town we pretty much fell asleep when the excitement died down. If you've been on a train before you might have high expectations. But if not and love new experiences and trying new things I think you'll really like this trip. I really enjoyed it. Thank you to all the volunteers for making this trip absolutely amazing.

reviews.author: Ronald W.
reviews.description: I rode this train out of austin many years ago behind the 442 on one of the short runs and had a blast, yesterday we took the long trip to Burnett and back. I was disappointed in the destination but not the ride.   The silver pine car was very clean and the seats were very comfortable, Noah who was in charge of our car was very friendly and had a good sense humor, even offered to get me a sign up sheet when I showed interest in volunteering.

reviews.author: Christina O.
reviews.description: Booked a sunset train ride for my husband and I and it was such a fun experience! We loved all the fun facts the volunteers had to share about the train cars and lifestyles of some of the riders back 100+ years. The sunset was magical and the night portion of the ride was really neat, having the moonlight illuminate the tracks in front of us. One of the cars is a dedicated gift shop/concession stand with a variety of alcoholic and non-alcoholic beverages to choose from. Everyone we came in contact with was so kind and made the experience that much more memorable. Overall such a great time - we would definitely book this experience again!

reviews.author: Candice D.
reviews.description: We had a great time on the Beer Train last night that was advertised as a sunset tour that was 2.5 hours long.  Note that you have about 45 mins moving time, then 40 mins stopped for the engine to be brought from the back to the front and then 45 mins back again. You don't really see much of the sunset, and you aren't moving for 2.5 hours. They also assign seats ahead of time, some of the cars were nicer and louder than others, so just depends what you're looking for. The association was responsive on social media when I had questions, staff and crew on board were all very friendly. They dont really follow any of their own posted rules about masks, no personal coolers, etc. so just something to be aware of- but I think this also varied by car. Overall we had a great time and would go again!

reviews.author: Roman H.
reviews.description: Their North Pole Flyer is like a joke. Don't waste your time and money, it is not worth it. Dirty cars, dirty seats, dirty windows with bleak scenery outside and Santa who gives a broken whistle. That is all for 2 hours trip. Even an obsessed with trains 4 years old was bored.  If you decide to go don't forget to take a mask or a respirator, it's hard to breathe inside because of dust.

reviews.author: Daniel P.
reviews.description: I'm pretty sure this is the tourism equivalent of chicken-and-waffles: another empty promise meant to separate me from my hard earned monies. Fortunately for me the plague was in top form. Was in the area looking for sustenance and 'Steam Train Association' showed on the map so I figured to pop in for a quick viddy before lunch. pulled up on a nearly empty lot, a shackled gate, and a locked door, the sign had the now common 'Closed for Plague' message which softened the blow of discovering "...that the train and rail yard are not open for public tours or photography" which meant the entirety of the museum was contained in the double-wide corner space in the strip. There's nothing inherently wrong with scenic train rides on vintage rolling stock, I've done it before and it's OK but that's just not my cup of meat. I was here for a bit of museuming but there was no museum to be had - nor postcarding nor touchable cars nor engines :-( sad face

reviews.author: Krystal S.
reviews.description: My husband and I went on the Hill Country Flyer for our anniversary weekend and we were in the "Rippling Stream" train car. The Train itself is quite impressive and was my first time on a real train not subway. The First Class Coach option was really nice and the seats were spread out along with social distancing, we felt really comfortable. My only complaint was it was VERY cold outside and though they are climate controlled, it was really cold the first half of the ride - coming back was much more comfortable. I also wished the lay over time perhaps had been 3 hours to provide a little more browsing time in Burnet. It would be cute to do music in each train car from the era the train was made. Ours was built in the late 30's so it would be a nice little touch that's simple to do! They had complimentary snacks and drinks which was a plus. Can't wait to do it again in a private suite!

reviews.author: Rebecca O.
reviews.description: Was a waste of money from Cedar Park to Burnet....was suppose to be Hill Country Flyer...saw no Hill Country...just a lot of brush blocking scenery....but not much of that either...Burnet was quaint...but will drive next time...big disappointment..

reviews.author: Allegre N.
reviews.description: This was an excellent experience. We took the train from Bertram to Burnet for one of the special events (Wedding Oaks wine trip). The staff was friendly and seemed very knowledgeable about the history of each train car. If you have a chance to walk to the very last car and look out the back, I definitely recommend taking in that view. I would have loved to take a longer trip and will look for other chances to ride.  The website is a little hard to use. We would have really liked a private cabin for our trip but didn't see how to book that on the website.   I wish the volunteer in our car would have been a little less Chatty Cathy when we weren't talking about the ride. It was a bit of a distraction from our enjoyment of the ride. Also, riding during COVID was a bit out of our comfort zone already so we were sad to see at least two volunteers wearing their masks covering only their mouth, not their mouth and nose. The website goes into great detail about precautions and that is a basic one not being taken. (That being said, they did a great job with social distancing and I felt like the train was very clean.)

reviews.author: Mike H.
reviews.description: Enjoyed my first ASTA experience today.  Here's my recap:  - Purchased a First Class Lounge ticket so I had my own room in Rippling Stream  - Train left the station on time, arrived at Burnet on time, and left for Cedar Park on time.   We were only an hour late reaching Cedar Park because a car thought it could outrun the train, but it could not.  Once the accident reporting was complete the train resumed.   - Personal note:  I am a train nerd and love riding trains, so my threshold of being annoyed on a train is higher than most.  This will affect my review below.    THE GOOD:  - clean cars, fun to walk in between them, and if you're without children, the adults only first class cars are a must - Rippling Stream and Nambe.   Otherwise with kids, I would recommend the Maurice Beckham or Eagle Cliff.    - the trip itself is smooth and the volunteers are friendly and helpful.  You can tell they enjoy being there, informing and helping others.     - Burnet has an abundance of antique shops if that's you're thing.  Also the soups at the downtown coffee shop are wonderful.     - The shootout show in Burnet, while not having a worry about winning any acting awards, is fun for the kids and has a good ending.  They could trim some of the fat from it, and make it a more concise / engaging story - there were a few too many awkward pauses.  But I applaud the folks who are likely doing this for free.  And the kids loved it.     THE NOT SO GOOD  - The scenic ride - if you're from the area this should not come as a shocker - is not that scenic.  There's a great bridge over the San Gab river but otherwise it's unremarkable trees, backyards, roads, and strip malls.    But again, none of this bothers me that much because I'm on a train relaxing.    - Burnet:  This is a sleepy, very conservative town.  One sign to deter thieves in a store said, "We got an alarm.  We got video.  We got guns.  DON'T BE DUMB."    While the downtown is a short walk from the train station, 2.5 hours here is way too much time unless you love antiques.   There isn't much else.   And as far as lunch goes, I highly recommend walking a bit farther past the first couple restaurants or else you'll have long wait times.   I went to a deli just a couple blocks away and it had no line.      - Announcements:  there are few.  Nothing along the way to alert you to landmarks or scenic opportunities (there is really just one, the bridge over the river).   But it would be nice to hear more than the pre recorded departure / arrival ones.    - The warm soft drinks:  no one wants green tea or apple juice at room temp.  There was literally an ice bucket next to these (but for scoping ice).  A second one to put these beverages on ice would go a long way.    - Lack of variety in snacks:  for a first class experience, at least more than the mini lemon cakes and mini cinnamon rolls would be nice.  Some savory, perhaps?   - chairs in the RS lounge car are what you'd find at your local dentist's waiting room.  I expected something that would at least remain comfy for 1.5 hours at a time.      OVERALL. - for the price I paid, it's 4/5 stars.  I knew the scenery wasn't going to awe, so most of my ranking is based on the train experience inside.  The quibbles above are all minor; chill the drinks, add some pretzels, get someone to donate an old leather chair or 2, and be a bit more chatty with us.    Those who really ranked their train ride low usually fall into the following categories, so please take them with a grain of salt:  - a/c sucked because it was Austin in the summer (hopefully fixable but not all that surprising) - solution is to go when it's not hot, the 60 days out of the year it's under 99 degrees.  I also think they have ironed out most of the a/c issues by now.    - Burnet was terrible, Burnet food was terrible, etc.  It's Burnet.  There's a reason it's not as well known as Fredericksburg.  You walk a bit father to get away from the crowds, you cross check their list of lunch spots they give you when you board  with a quick glance of Yelp reviews and you roll the dice.    - scenery sucked, super ghetto, etc.   Maybe because I grew up in St Louis, but using the word ghetto here is laughable at best.  It's junky, yes.  Unkempt, sure.   And truly, if you live in the region, you should know better than to expect breathtaking views.  You've driven on 183 east of 35?.  Same views.   If you're from out of town I could see valid point here since the website pushes it hard that it's scenic - but us locals know how much lipstick you can put on this pig.   So go check it out!  But go First Class if possible.  And be flexible about being home on time; like with any train, delays can happen.

reviews.author: Lori Ann L.
reviews.description: We rode the Hill Country Flyer which departs from the Cedar Park station and goes to Burnet, Texas,  where there is a two-hour layover so that passengers can disembark, do some shopping or grab some lunch or both.   Before leaving, the Burnet Gunfighters put on a show which is free to passengers, although they do accept donations.   The scenery leaves a lot to be desired, however that is not something that the Steam Train Foundation can control, they have a designated track and can not control who builds subdivisions or places gravel pits along the route.   If you are looking for a beautiful scenic ride, this probably isn't for you.  However, if you want to experience riding on a passenger train, and learning about the history of the railroads, it is a great experience.     They are very careful with social distancing and we felt completely safe riding the train.  I spoke with a couple of families that had young children and they loved it!   All in all, I would recommend it as a very enjoyable way to spend the day.

reviews.author: Peter D.
reviews.description: I rode the Sunset Express on 5-29-21 with my family, while on a trip to visit Austin. I'm from Southern California (this is important later). The scenery was certainly nice in some spots, but not enough. The sunset was awesome, but the experience wasn't that great. We paid for first class and rode aboard Eagle Cliff. Some basic drinks and snacks were provided, but the train was understaffed. No attendant for our car. One very sweet elderly volunteer was doing her best to handle two cars at once. I decided to offer to help, which she was very appreciative of. She said it was great that I wanted to help and so I did. I helped stock drinks and snacks as well as stocked ice to keep the drinks cold. Later on, a female volunteer who looked to be in her 40s came up to the counter said "Sir, you cannot be back there, what do you need?" I explained the situation, and she kind of had an attitude. I was informed in a rude tone that I had to be a member to help, and was given no thank you. Being that I live in Southern California, there's no way I could really be a member. While all this was happening, the AC in the car was doing a very poor job at keeping the car cold. It was unbearably hot in there, and everyone in the car was complaining. The excuse given was that the car is vintage and has a lot of runtime. The car was very original, and you could tell. That roughly translates to "we don't have the money or people to keep this car in tip top shape, and we don't have the money to upgrade it".  Eventually, my family was re-seated to the Rippling Stream. That was much better, but it didn't change the overall experience. Cherry on top was we were over an hour late returning to the Cedar Park station.   Not worth the money.

reviews.author: john g.
reviews.description: We also did the Xmas Polar Express train ride. Tickets were about $50 each. We also went with a friend and their kids too.   I'll give this train ride 4 stars. The kids were excited to see Santa and the ride was slow at times.   To start, one of the first things was a balloon guy. Ours was awesome. He was funny and overall entertaining. He had me laughing my @ss off.   Next came hot chocolate... it's hot chocolate.   After that was, singing Christmas Carols. They had 2 girls from McNeil high school. I felt sorry for them. They were nice, but they couldn't just get our car interested in singing.  A few of us sang, but overall it was a failure. I'm sure adult beverages if allowed/served would help the spirit. Great job to them but our car was mostly interested. It probably didn't help that they gave us a cookie just before they arrived so everyone was stuffing their face.   After that was story time, the lady reading the Story was animated and funny. Kudos to her.   She visited just before Santa.   Then Santa came. We were in one of the last cars so his visit was a bit rushed. He was nice and gave everyone a wooden train whistle.   ***********The entire operation is run by volunteers. So I'd like to thank all of them for their time!*******  This was he first time my son was not afraid of Santa:-)

reviews.author: John M.
reviews.description: This was a great little adventure from Cedar Park to Burnet Texas. Super We stayed in the Turquoise Room, which consisted of 2 tables, 8 chairs and two smaller windows. Staff was super friendly and knowledgeable...Once the train started the conductor came in to room to announce that there we several open seats in the main car...everyone got up and left leaving the wife and I in peace...Not that we are anti social, but it was peaceful to say the least...Good to catch up with each other, as we both work different hours...Truly not much to see on the way up...but it was a great ride....AC did work, not great but tolerable...I see in other reviews there were issues...You have freedom to roam Car to Car once the train gets rolling...and the train does turn around in Burnet...hard to explain, but it does...and we were able to see the other side of the tracks on the way home...Plenty to see and eat in Burnet...Our Car/cabin also came with free snacks and drinks...which is a great perk..as the snacks in the concession stand were quit expensive...The trip was worth it for us and will do it again next year with the granddaughter..

reviews.author: Liz I.
reviews.description: This review is based on my customer service experience with Zena, not the train ride itself (although I may come back and give an update!)  Zena is a lifesaver. Not literally, but she has made my train experience 2x as good. I bought a Groupon because I didn't even realize there was a train experience in Austin. After the headache of scheduling, our trip got canceled. Zena came in to save the day. She mailed me another gift certificate that expired in a year (vs the next week per my Groupon) AND she gifted us a little extra!  Sounds great, right? Unfortunately, the GC could not be redeemed online. After multiple tries of calling in (and getting a forever ring - no pick up), I was getting irritated.   I emailed Zena back asking for her advice. She wrote back in 24 hours and apologized for their phone service. She even offered to reserve me herself. After a few back-and-forth emails, she answered all my questions and got us all squared away.  Our train ride happens this weekend and I can only hope that the experience is similar to Zena's customer service.

reviews.author: James F.
reviews.description: You never know where your gonna find a distillery and or brewery these days. Yep folks, it's another #carclublife post. The club along with friends from Dallas and San Antonio headed east after the Texas Independence Day Parade. Libation education started at Derelict Airship AKA Violet Crown Spirits just west of Bastrop.   You've hear of strip mall chic? Think business park chic! Quite similar to my friends over at Desert Door in Driftwood. Matt was an excellent host explaining the history behind each of their offerings. Let's start with Absinthe. Banned for many years in the US and parts of Europe, small batch distilleries have been popping up in the US since 2007.   The anise flavor is quite strong and it's recommended you cut it with water. I've heard sugar cubes are common as well. Other in house offerings include an Elderflower and Jasmine Liqueur. Girlfriend and I's personal favorite was the Jasmine and we took home a bottle to pair up with other local spirits. A top notch experience from start to finish. Our group is excited to see this company grow. See y'all soon!

reviews.author: Jaime G.
reviews.description: Jessica was amazing! We stopped in during a trip to Bastrop and were so impressed with their service and products. We were able to sample the whole line of products and learned a lot about their process and the history behind absinthe and the Violet Crown Spirits. Worth a trip if you're in Bastrop or driving through!

reviews.author: Erin C.
reviews.description: Big thank you for the hand sanitizer from Carl R Darnall Army Medical Center! We appreciate you!!!

reviews.author: Carolyn S.
reviews.description: Best little brewer in Texas!  Might be small but big on flavor and specialty brews!  Great place to visit if you're around Austin!!

name: Stories
address: 575 Hyatt Lost Pines RdHyatt Lost Pines Resort

reviews.author: Christine H.
reviews.description: Our first time dining here.  We were impressed with the food. The ingredients were very fresh.  Although the restaurant says classy attire don't let that deter you from trying it out. It's in a resort so resort wear is appropriate. Some people even wore jeans and shorts. Would we come back to this restaurant during our next stay at Lost Pines? Yes!  Appetizer: baked brie (7/10) with candied pecans   Entree:  Kid's filet with Mac and cheese- 8/10. The filet was perfectly seasoned and perfectly cooked.   Chilean Seabass with Duck and Brussels sprout leaves - 8/10  Waygu ribeye with truffle butter - 8/10. Steak was pretty good and perfectly cooked.   Dessert:   Kid's chocolate gelato - 5/10 slightly icy and had orange rinds in there I think. My daughter didn't want fancy ice cream and didn't like the taste  Banana's foster cheesecake - 7/10

reviews.author: Sandra S.
reviews.description: Worst steak of my life. I'm not kidding. I have blood pressure issues and am not used to salt, so I rarely think something is under-seasoned. This was by far the most bland under-seasoned steak I've ever had. It also has zero sear. It truly was like eating a boiled steak. I'm so mad at myself for not sending it back, but there is always the fear you will get your food spit in. So disappointing because it was my friend's birthday dinner and her snapper was also bland. Do better Stories! A steak that had zero sear shouldn't have left the kitchen when it costs $68!

reviews.author: Bailey C.
reviews.description: Over priced but doesn't surprise me because it's a restaurant at a hotel. Ordered the Chilean sea bass $45 a la carte and it was served on top of this cherry or raspberry sweet sauce, omg horrible! Those two flavors don't go together. The sea bass was cooked perfect and very tasty!   Tuna appetizer was good. The shrimp cocktail still had some of the shell on it, very disappointing!   Jason ordered the filet and he said it was pretty good.   Loved the mushrooms.   Good wine list but way over priced.  Creme brle: no vanilla so it's tasteless. The custard part is too thick and not creamy and smooth like a custard.

reviews.author: Janice J.
reviews.description: We got a set menu that came with a salad appetizer, entree, shared sides and a dessert. The salad was a simple green salad with blackberries and corn bread croutons. There was too much dressing though. The salad was pretty standard but the corn bread croutons was a nice twist. The salmon was amazing. I believe it was partially broiled because it was unbelievably moist but the skin was crisp. This was probably my favorite part of the meal. The dessert was a chocolate bomb with peanut butter mousse inside. It was rich and decadent, and delicious. The food was really good, but my major complaint was the service. It was a slow and they mixed up our orders and forgot my cocktail. If you have the time to relax then that might not be too bad but this three course meal was spread over almost three hours.

reviews.author: Jorge G.
reviews.description: This overpriced place deserves no stars. I don't mind overpriced "fine dinning" restaurants, but the food here is a joke. We had salmon, "risotto" (yes, in quotes), and chicken. All horrible. We left in disappointment and went downstairs to the bar hopping that a good Old Fashion would make us forget the bad experience. I'm sad to report, they have no clue how to make an Old Fashion either.  We are wishing we didn't come to this overprice, low standards place.   Save your money, go eat somewhere else.  UPDATE:  The bartender Justin downstairs was very nice about the Old Fashion and asked for feedback. He surprised us all when he came back with a much improved version after Googling the recipe. Great Job Justin!! Thanks for getting our drinks right!!

reviews.author: Christine R.
reviews.description: I ordered a bone in steak well done, but it came out medium. So I sent it back to the kitchen, and it came back almost the same. So, I sent it back for the third time and came out medium well though I wanted it well done. Also, the sides we ordered were cold and they took it back to the kitchen and re-heated it up. Who does that? Ive been to many steak houses and this is the first place that's done that. Not happy with the food and service here.

reviews.author: Heather B.
reviews.description: We have eaten at the fine dining restaurant at the Hyatt Hill Country in San Antonio and were blown away with the service, atmosphere and food most of all. We came to this restaurant with expectations that it would be as good or better and were very disappointed. The service was slow and the food was mediocre. For $50 plates that don't come with sides, I feel like I should be impressed. My sea bass was cooked nicely, but lacking any flavor. The Brussels spouts that accompanied it were burnt. My husband's chicken was overcooked. We will stick with the food truck next time as their tacos are $4.50 each and AMAZING!

reviews.author: Leslie G.
reviews.description: We stayed at Lost Pines this weekend and had reservations for dinner at Stories Fine Dining at 8:15pm which we had tried to move up a little earlier but were told that they were fully booked. We walked over a little earlier just to stay nearby and checked in with the hostess. She was very nice and even walked over to us and said our table was ready so we were able to be seated at 8pm. Upon walking in, only half of the restaurant had guests seated. The other half of the tables were empty...but we couldn't move up our reservation? Ok. We were seated and greeted shortly by our server who was very friendly as well. She took our drink and appetizer order which came out promptly however my husband ordered a bottle of wine and somehow that took about 15 minutes to arrive as well. We were seated next to a table of 4 who was very "vocal" which kind of ruined the atmosphere (this isn't the restaurant's fault however it did affect our experience) so I will refer to the as the "vocals". Finally, we were able to order our entrees. Once ordered, our bread basket came out at the same time as our appetizer and the food runners were pretty attentive and quick as well with refilling water, asking if we'd like more bread, etc. We nibbled on our appetizers and got lost in conversation until we realized our food had not arrived yet. Checked the time, 9:15pm. "Vocal" table next to us had already complained loudly about the A/C in the restaurant and at this point had started to complain about the service and why their food had not come out yet either. (Let me just also emphasize that when I say "vocal", I mean obnoxiously loud enough that the guests from across the restaurant turned their heads in attention). They complained about the service to the manager on duty as well who was apologetic and served them with comp'd cocktails and who knows what else. Needless to say, their entrees quickly came out. Meanwhile at our table, our bread plates had been stacked up, empty bread baskets were on the table and still no entrees. Time check: 9:30pm. At this point, the kids are getting restless and still have not eaten and no one had checked on us in over 30 minutes so we asked if they could at least check on the kids' food. They said they would and disappeared once again. Servers continue to walk by without having cleared our table and running food to other tables. One of the guys from the "vocals" has now stood up and beckoned the manager one more time to announce that his food was cooked incorrectly. One more time check for kicks: 9:50pm. Still no updates from the staff on the hold up. We have been seated for almost 2 hours with no entres. At this point,  with strong understanding and empathy for the staff who has had to deal with the drama at the table next door, we quietly called over the manager and server to ask if we can just cancel our food. The kids needed to be fed, my in-laws were exhausted and we were all losing our appetite with the lack of service. The manager apologized for the delay and asked if he could pack up our food for us and we kindly declined and said we would just pay for what we actually ate/drank. He turned to the server and said, "Take their card." Then walked away. That was the last we heard from his that evening. With heads down in disappointment, we quietly packed up our troops just in time for the "vocals" to turn their heads and complain about something new.   We walked down to McDade's where we knew food was ready to serve and we could quickly buy something for the kids. I'm baffled by the experience we had at Stories considering it's supposed to be a Fine Dining experience and hope that this evening was addressed within their staff as a learning experience to find some improvement in service and management.

reviews.author: C R.
reviews.description: Reading some of the reviews, I honestly think management took the critiques to heart and did some great changes.  I've eaten at some nice restaurants (see other reviews) so I know what good service and food is.  From the lobster bisque and wagu steak to the dessert, it was fantastic.  Great drinks and service was great!    And equally nice, the place is too pricey for families with screaming kids to dine at, usually, so it's a GREAT respite from the zoo this place turns in to in the summer.  Not a bad thing (all the families), but a break from the noise is a nice change.  Would be really nice if it was cooler to sit on the outside deck.  Will try that out when back here in the fall.

reviews.author: Sandra A.
reviews.description: If I could give this place zero stars based on the rudeness and attitude of the two young girls at hostess station I would.  We arrived 15 minutes early and were spoken to so rudely.  There was even a comment made about closed toe shoes.  WTH.  This is a vacation resort.  They obviously were trying to pass off the restaurant as some over the top fancy place and treated us like barefoot peasants.  This should never happen in the service industry at an upscale resort.

reviews.author: Jorge T.
reviews.description: Incredible experience. Great staff and ambience in a small dining room. My wife had the Caesar Salad and Skuna Bay Salmon with the Thyme Horseradish Crme Frache. I had the Stories Baby Greens and Prime Filet (8 oz) with Barnaise sauce. Both were cooked perfectly.  We then split the Chocolate Peanut Bomb. The presentation was almost as good as it tasted. A must go!

reviews.author: Tina B.
reviews.description: I'm shocked this place has such a high star rating. I've been coming to Lost Pines for years and finally decided to try the Fine Dining restaurant since our kiddo is a teenager, but we quickly wished we had eaten at Shellers. The atmosphere is generic hotel/airport restaurant blandness. We ordered drinks which took a good 20 minutes. After we ordered entrees they brought bread and the chef sent out an amuse bouche which turned out to be the best of our choices. Our food took another 45 minutes which was so long considering we had an 8pm reservation. My son ordered the buffalo steak which came out cold. He had eaten several bites when I tried it and was surprised at the temperature. Yikes! Cold steak is not good. I ordered the risotto and I saw it had vegetables but it was literally dripping with vegetables and beets on top which made it a red color after a few bites. Not sure who thought that was a good idea. Risotto should be light and fluffy and not soggy. My husband had a salad and the lobster bisque but the bisque had a weird scorched flavor and he didn't eat that either. We were just ready to go by then because it was so late and I was still hungry. The waiter was nice enough but didn't even acknowledge the fact that we didn't eat our food. I cannot recommend this restaurant except if you're just trying to escape the loud atmosphere at Shellers or Firewheel. But for the price I'd rather eat at Shellers and keep an extra $100 for myself. Hyatt could do much better!

reviews.author: Patrick F.
reviews.description: Perfect date night.   This was a bit of a last minute idea so we did not make reservations...no problem. Excellent table with a view. Staff was wonderful and amazingly attentive. More about them later...  Drink and wine menu was not necessarily large but plenty of good choices at all price ranges. Staff very knowledgable as well.  Menu is limited but more than enough choices for every taste. I much prefer this than those over the top menus that offer everything under the sun.   Deconstructed Cesar salad was very good and light, great start. Chef sent over and delightful Amuse that was very tasty as well. Breads were great.   For proteins both my wife and I went for fish, Scottish salmon and poached halibut. Excellent on both counts, moist and tender, seasoned great. Blue corn grits was VERY tasty.   Desserts were spot on as well.   Back to the staff now...they could not have done a better job.  The attention to their customers throughout the restaurant was fun to watch. Always there when needed, and always with a smile. I wish more high end restaurants would follow this model.

reviews.author: C V.
reviews.description: This is a great place to get that fine dining without having to dress to the nines. Beautiful balcony with awesome views of the pine forest.   The staff are awesome and Chef Ted took great care of us. Will certainly be back.

reviews.author: Wayne W.
reviews.description: WOW!  I have been to many four and five star restaurants over the years and Stories stacks up with some of the best.  The service was great, the atmosphere was soothing and the food was amazing! I had the filet topped with crab and an amazing sauce, potatoes and a sweet tomato salad.     I would drive 2 hours to have dinner here again...what a great experience.

reviews.author: Heath C.
reviews.description: This place is top of it's class, in my opinion.  You won't feel like you're eating in a hotel, with such superb service, perfectly prepared entrees and wonderful ambiance.  There's at least one steak, seafood, lamb and chicken dish available every night.  Not only are the dishes beautiful and delicious, you will also get full.  I must also mention, I thoroughly enjoyed their gellato.  The staff is knowledgeable and bring plenty of hospitality.  $25-$40 per person is reasonable for what you get here.

reviews.author: Kelly C.
reviews.description: It took over an hour for our steaks to arrive after our appetizers so clearly our ticket was lost or something. The waiter never said anything but a gnocchi was delivered to our table at 45 minutes with a "sorry" but neither of us like cream based dishes so I would have preferred they ask us if there was something we wanted while we waited and it would have been nice to receive it at minute 25, not minute 45. My boyfriend's steak was definitely medium rare when he asked for medium but we didn't send it back as we were worried it would take another hour. $16 for 3 shrimp in a shrimp cocktail!  The dessert menu is laughable with 3 items. So a 2 1/2 hour dinner that should have taken 1 1/2 and a $220 bill. I'm giving it a 2 as the hamachi appetizer was wonderful and my filet (although significantly late) was delicious.

reviews.author: Jonathan B.
reviews.description: Service - Awesome. Everything I would expect from a fine dining establishment.  Setting - Nice, quiet and relaxed.  Food - Good to fair. Nothing was bad, but when compared to other top notch restaurants in Austin, such as Uchiko, the flavor was a bit wanting.  Value - Overpriced, especially for very small quantities.

reviews.author: Daniel H.
reviews.description: Well done. Hotel restaurants can be so hit-or-miss. From my experience, those with fancy good reputations are usually the miss, while those that are unassuming and quaint are hit.   Stories at Hyatt Lost Pines resort is hit. From the decor, to the menu, to the presentation, everything here is top notch.  The chef has many creative options on the menu, but the veal chop was my choice. Perfect.  We also ordered red velvet cake that was imprisoned behind a ghastly cage of chocolate. Also, perfect.    If you stay here you must go, and if you live around the area, I'd highly recommend checking this place out.

reviews.author: Tara M.
reviews.description: This restaurant is located in the Hyatt Lost Pines Resort in Bastrop just east of the Airport off 71. I highly recommend this place for a special occasion diner and since it is located in a 5 star resort plan on spending the night..  The ambiance is very elegant with a vaulted ceiling and wood tables  spaced far apart for privacy.  The servers were always there but not not close enough to eavesdrop..  And the food oh the food is out of this world goodness.  We tried several dishes but my favorites were the Salmon with Horseradish crust, Truffled mashed Potatoes and my glass of Frogs Leap Merlot.  Guys if you want to get lucky on the first date I highly recommend this place -  restaurant + beds = great fun!

reviews.author: Kaitlin V.
reviews.description: I get the same thing every time: caramel latte with oat milk. I never drink coffee as fast as I do here and it's because I can't put it down. It's always clean and a friendly atmosphere as well, great for working on homework or projects. Will always come back for more!

reviews.author: Raquel D.
reviews.description: Caf late was super strong but not bad.  1/4 cup of chia pudding was $5!  thats way over priced for chia seeds + almond milk in a plastic cup IMO

reviews.author: Jordan N.
reviews.description: If you're looking for both coffee and beer, this place has it.  Limited pastries. Coffee is okay - I find it a bit too burnt for my liking. Beer selection is good - lots of craft beer and good options from tap.  Communal space is great for working, studying, and hanging out - although not much space outdoors (it fronts a highway anyways).

reviews.author: Julia G.
reviews.description: Great little hangout in an unassuming area.... with great coffee and beer! I was a little surprised when we pulled up here. The building was nice, but wasn't what I was expecting.   The vibe here is great. A lot of young professionals clearly "working from home" but needed to get out of the house for a few hours. Very friendly customers and staff.   I ordered a vanilla latte and it came out wonderful. They had an awesome selection of beers on tap if that's your thing.   If I am in the area I will definitely be back for a visit.

reviews.author: Krista H.
reviews.description: I came in on a Saturday afternoon and the whole outdoor patio was occupied so I was expecting there to be a line inside. I was pleasantly surprised when I was able to order right away! I got an iced cinnamon sugar latte with almond milk which came out to about $6.25. The price is a little steep, but the flavor and milk substitute added about $2.   The coffee came out relatively fast and was pretty good! The cinnamon was subtle, but the coffee was smooth and rich. My fianc and I both enjoyed it! I don't know if I would come out of my way for this coffee, but if I was in the area I would definitely stop by again!   The location is convenient and there are other businesses on the same strip to try out as well. I would recommend coming here and getting some coffee to go!

reviews.author: Shashikala P.
reviews.description: We went to stouthaus on Friday early afternoon, they have few tables outside and few inside with socially distanced, lady who took our order was kinda robotic.  we ordered cappuccino, coffee and cinnamon roll, post covid we are mostly doing takeouts but while we were waiting for the order we saw staff sanitizing table and chairs in between each customers so we felt comfortable to sit and enjoy the coffee there itself.  Cappuccino was good but little thin, coffee was pretty good, cinnamon roll was just ok.  Overall, definitely worth a visit and really appreciate the way they're handling the business in pandemic!

reviews.author: Lilan N.
reviews.description: Love this coffee bar. Going here on a lunch break is the best! There's plenty of seating indoors and outdoors. It's a great place to go get some work done. The drinks are delicious too, I've gotten the Mexican spice mocha latte and it was so good! I want to go back and try the cold brew. The workers are sweet and there is plenty of parking!!

reviews.author: Taylor S.
reviews.description: Great spot to grab a good coffee and get a little work done.  The coffee is legit good and they have beer on tap if you splurge toward the end of the day.  Parking is ample as well.  This is my go-to spot to meet my local rep while working in Austin.

reviews.author: Karen D.
reviews.description: Came here on a weekend afternoon and tried a local hefeweizen, the rose latte, and a brownie. The beer was tasty, and the rose latte was super smooth. The brownie was decadent and rich, with a crisp exterior and chewy interior. I like their patio space, but their inside space could do with more comfortable seating. Overall, service was good.

reviews.author: Magen D.
reviews.description: Stouthaus is such a cute spot! The vibe is very relaxed. The coffee and pastries are above average in taste, the staff were incredibly kind, and they had a ton of seating (indoor and outdoor). There were a lot of people, but it didn't feel overly crowded because of how large the space is.  They followed Covid protocols and everything was very clean!

reviews.author: Cyril G.
reviews.description: Cute coffee shop with plenty of places to sit and work. I got their coconut cold brew which was really good and not too sweet. They have some food options too but I wasn't hungry so I didn't get anything. Would recommend!

reviews.author: Kate Z.
reviews.description: A nice open cafe by the highway.  There's a number of seats with surprisingly heavy chairs. The outdoor seating is very spacious but it's pretty loud with the cars zooming past us.   The pumpkin spice latte was okay. Not amazing. My friend says her cappuccino is just like any other.  The WiFi is solid. There are real and fake outlets (literally a sticker on the wall lol). It's a nice place to work or study. I like the temperature and the music is an okay volume.   I'd come back!

reviews.author: Olivia V.
reviews.description: Not a fan of leaving a bad review for a nice place, but I think I may have been served slightly off dairy milk here today (I'm not sick, but the taste was bad). I've been here a few times over the past years and it's a really cute, quiet spot for working. Today however I was served a matcha latte with a really funky taste to it. It seemed like the matcha powder used just sat in a thick later on top of the (1%) milk, without being well combined, and the milk tasted a little off to be honest. I regret not saying something but I think I attributed the taste to the matcha mixing issue at the time. The person I went with had a coffee which tasted fine, but used a different (dairy) milk from mine. Really a shame since my drink was so bad from the first sip, we just ended up leaving. Sorry stouthaus!

reviews.author: L P.
reviews.description: This is just the best lowkey coffee shop/hangout place. Every single staff member I've interacted with there is kind and accommodating and seems to genuinely like what they're doing. I'm not usually a flavored coffee drinker but they have a homemade cinnamon sugar syrup that is SO GOOD. I wake up craving it, lol. The golden milk latte is also a favorite of mine, and great for having later in the day when I don't want caffeine.

reviews.author: Bobbie L.
reviews.description: Cute little spot where you can drink coffee and beer. I would recommend the nitro coffee/iced latte. I wish there were more seating indoors and outside.

reviews.author: Megan L.
reviews.description: I know Stouthaus is an Austin favorite, but I was pretty disappointed by my experience. They don't have a ton of seating indoors, but they do have a nice outdoor patio area. My friend and I both ordered an iced vanilla latte, and it was pretty meh. Nothing to come back for.

reviews.author: Elizabeth V.
reviews.description: Delicious coffee, friendly service, dog- and work-friendly patio seating. Pro-tip: Stop circling the crowded first parking lot in the daytime, and head past the front of the building to the wide-open north lot! *Masks required for ordering inside as of 9/2021, and there's a box inside the door if you need one.

reviews.author: Westin P.
reviews.description: I had to actually spit out my coffee. It was a simple cold brew. Wife also trashed her vanilla latte.

reviews.author: Warren D.
reviews.description: Covid and Snowvid had me feeling creatively tapped. Coffeeshops have always been good to me but there are very few open for staying inside. Stouthaus was my muse! The coffee is really great and if I'm able to get some good work done I'll have a beer. The selections are priced right and curated well. The views aren't spectacular but that helps me focus on work for a little while. The staff and ownership seem to care about the work they are doing.

reviews.author: Jessica M.
reviews.description: I dig what Stouthaus is trying to do, it's a hip little joint that has coffee and beer which are both things I like.   It's pretty small inside, so if it's cold outside I wouldn't plan on finding a seat, but their patio is a nice addition with a beer garden feel. It is right off the highway though so don't go expecting a nice view of trees, but with the right company I don't think that really matters.  When I went the coffee didn't blow my mind, and they also didn't have any brewed at 1pm on a Thursday which was kind of strange to me for a coffeehouse so I had to wait. But that did mean it was fresh which is always nice.   They have fake outlets (they're stickers) which is kind of funny I guess but wasn't funny to me when I found a seat and my laptop died... they also have real ones though so don't worry.   All in all a cute little place and worth checking out if you're in the mood for a new local coffee shop. Or a low key place for a beer.

reviews.author: Natalia L.
reviews.description: What an incredible winery  with such knowledgeable personable staff. Located on such an extraordinary piece of land. Me and my husband each did a wine  flight and picked our favorite sips and ordered a glass each which we enjoyed on the fabulous patio.  I love that with every flight purchase included is a souvenir wine  glass. Flights and by the glass were very reasonable given the type of wine  served.  We ended up enjoying our time so much that we came back an additional day.  I highly recommend this place to anyone looking to sip on some delicious wine .

reviews.author: Marlen G.
reviews.description: Went on a day out with my husband and was so pleased with this Wimberly Winery. We had to wait about an hour for their food and in the meantime we had a glass of Astoria Moscato and watermelon wine on the porch. The weather was perfect and this created a whole mood. We then proceeded to their wine tasting room and tried some of their best wines. I've got to say the Astoria Moscato was their best. At least for those who like sweet wine. My husband liked many of their dry wines as well. Definitely going back with the kids so they can pet the donkeys in the neighboring pastures.

reviews.author: Shirley R.
reviews.description: This place is so beautiful! Heads up though, make sure you make rezzies for the tastings, we didn't and were unable to since they were fully booked that day.  However, do not fret if you didn't, because the grounds are stunning. You can order a glass or a bottle, no judgment ;), from their double decker bus, that gave me some serious harry potter vibes. Then take it and enjoy the view. There is ample sitting. I would love to come back with reservations of course, and try a flight in their beautiful tasting room.

reviews.author: Andrew Y.
reviews.description: Had such a wonderful time here, we went on Tuesday via reservation and were the only ones there until noon. Plenty of outdoor space to social distance along with animals to interact with: donkies, goats and miniature horses! A decent selection of wines with one standing out in particular to our taste-buds, can't remember the name specifically but it was red wine cherry blend, maybe seasonal?   The staff is friendly, place was very easy to find, there is a bit of construction going on in and around the place but it's not too big of an annoyance to take away from the overall great experience.

reviews.author: Nae F.
reviews.description: I truly enjoyed my visit to Wimberley Valley Winery. This was the first stop on my wine tour for my anniversary weekend. The tasting reservation process was pretty easy. The tasting price is very fair (5 glasses for $18) and the pours were generous. The wines were very good. I left with a couple of bottles. I definitely recommend the Christmas Cuve and the Sangria wine. Once you finish your tasting, there is plenty of space outside on the patio or other areas to just sip more wine and just be.  A lovely experience.

reviews.author: Kasper L.
reviews.description: This is a cool place! I'm glad I had the opportunity to visit here. I'd like to come back and try the tasting.   The outdoor seating area was nice and very spacious. I did like the outdoor patio and the arrangement of all the things. I enjoyed the red wines that they had. I really liked the season fruit wines--tasted like juice with how fruity they were (I mean that in a good way).   The food truck also served some pretty solid food. Really enjoyed the chili and cheese tator tots. The pizza was good too! The burger was a little disappointing though.   All in all, nice place to visit! Come check it out!

reviews.author: Kelli N.
reviews.description: Visited this winery today and enjoyed everything about it! The wines were better than expected and the ambiance was terrific. What I really didn't expect was the fantastic food. Finding something a gluten free vegetarian could safely eat and enjoy was beyond my expectations but wow did they surprise. Best gluten free veggie I've ever had! Lovely afternoon here, we'll definitely visit again.

reviews.author: Erica C.
reviews.description: I was looking for something Covid safe to do outside and to get out of the house. This winery has plenty of space on the grounds to distance safely from others. We made a reservation for a tasting. Well worth it to learn about the types of wine. The staff is knowledgeable and nice. It is a comfortable environment and you can ask many questions. After the tasting we ordered a glass each and went outside. We ordered a pizza from the mobile kitchen. It was wonderful!  I suggest going on a beautiful day and enjoy wine, good food and sunshine!

reviews.author: Eric W.
reviews.description: We went wine tasting with a group of 5. The collection was big and the server was very inquisitive, informative, and kind. After our hour of tasting 5 wines, we bought two bottles and went out to the property to enjoy the day and the live music. We had a perfect spot beside the musicians (who were very very good) and had an amazing view of the property. I was at peace with all the elements in place. I will be back, bringing family, and enjoying a bottle here and there.

reviews.author: Mahwish S.
reviews.description: This is my second time visiting this winery. I loved it the first time and it left an impression on me to go back. Because of Covid, they are doing tastings by reservations only so that they can control number of people and properly space out in their tasting room. I'm sure you'll love a bottle to buy and you'll have ample time and space to enjoy it on their deck or yard after your tasting. Our tasting guide, Robert, was very knowledgeable about the different wines and a joy to converse with! They do have a good truck on their premises that bakes wood fire pizzas. I didn't try any this time because we already had brunch before coming. The port was my favorite wine. You've got to try it for yourself!

reviews.author: Gloria G.
reviews.description: This place is beautiful. Our first time in wimberly. We had such a great time, so peaceful. The live music was great. She kept it PG for the babies. The manager was walking around greeting everyone. The employees gave us suggestions on where to stay. Over all great experience.

reviews.author: Karen D.
reviews.description: Made a rez (required) a day in advance and was prompted seated for my 45min tasting! I decided to go with 5 TX wines to try, and they did not disappoint! My server gave super generous pours and timed it accordingly. Because I'm a slow drinking, I had the last 2 to enjoy in the spacious courtyard area. Highly recommend!

reviews.author: Brittany D.
reviews.description: What a great find!! I recommend the wine slushies! Watermelon was my favorite however the red reserve one was not bad either (more dry). They have a food truck on-site which has delicious thin crust woodfire pizza. We got the Lexus of Lactose. Atmosphere was great and relaxing. Definitely will be back.

reviews.author: Betty O.
reviews.description: The Host was friendly, knowledgeable. Bathrooms clean. Beautiful building. Food Truck available. Need good GPS.

reviews.author: Christian W.
reviews.description: We just moved to the area and recently took our out of town guests to this charming winery...what a treat! The wine was pretty good ( i mean it's not Napa, y'all) but the ambiance, scenery and people are amazing! The tasting was very reasonably priced and the tasting room is full of gorgeous local art. The grounds are stunning with mini horses to pet and love on and plenty of photo ops. Definitely put this place on your Austin wi

reviews.author: Brett J.
reviews.description: A year later and Wimberly Valley Winery is just getting better!  Our friends are members here and we joined them to go out and pick up their wine. While we were there we had a tasting.  They now have a full line up of "fruit" wines like Blackberry, Cherry and cinnamon, honey crisp apple, and others. They are on the sweeter side but for me were seriously tasty! I loved the cherry and the blackberry.  However at this time of year it is the mulled wine that truly wins the day for me! If you haven't had mulled wine I suggest you get off your butt, drive the distance, and sample some right now! It is so worth it!  A hearty and loud Ooooh my Goddie toooo Hottie to this wonderful glass of spiced wine that is served hot! It brings flashes of warm fire places, deep snow, thick sweaters and holiday cheer with every sip. It is my absolute favorite!  They are adding more structures to the location, the outside area is a divine place to grab a bottle and just sit and soak up the outdoors while enjoying a good sip with friends, and the inside is a great lush environment of comfy lodge like decor.  It is a great location with good people and a great selection of wines... not only theirs but a plethora of other wines as well. We always enjoy our time here!   One last note.... try the mulled wine! It is the holiday season in a bottle!

reviews.author: Krystal S.
reviews.description: This place was definitely a one and done. There wasn't anything bad about our visit but there wasn't anything great about it either.
