They don't even use Texas grapes so these are all from out of state and only a handful are barrel aged. They were basic and not anything special. We came for a tasting so we tried a total of 5 different wines each (10 between the two of us.) They even serve store bought wines here!!! I've NEVER been to a winery that serves what I can buy myself at HEB. They didn't tell you anything about the wines other than "this is dry and fruit forward," no explanation of the grapes used, how long its aged, etc that we've become used to at other wineries. Also the alcohol content must be very low in thier wines, we went on empty stomachs and neither of us felt a thing which is not the case at other wineries we've been to. I'd give it a try if you're in the area, but don't expect much. The grounds are nice and they have a cute double decker bus they converted but for us one visit was plenty.

reviews.author: Tiffany C.
reviews.description: One of my favorite places EVER!  I'm a member so I go as often as I can, their member benefits are amazing. My niece and nephew love taking carrots for the horses and donkeys and kicking the soccer ball around. The venue is just beautiful and even when their are tons of people there it just doesn't feel crowded, the layout is perfect.    The wine is top notch. I  like sweeter wines so most on the menu suits me but they have some dry wine as well for folks who love a dry red or white.  Slushes in the summer, warm spiced wine in the winter, fruit wines in the fall ... this place has it figured out!  Grab a Cheese tray and hang out for an hour or stay all day!

reviews.author: Amanda R.
reviews.description: We came here for our anniversary and we loved it! We'd never done anything like it before, and we were not disappointed! And honestly how often do you see blue wine???

reviews.author: Carly H.
reviews.description: Drinks were good but service was poor. Server Gabriel said we had a bad experience because he works for his ex and that we could leave a review about our "shitty experience" on Yelp. Welllll, here I am. When we walked out we got to speak to the owner and realized our tasting came with a complimentary wine glass that the server didn't provide. Owner brought it out, thankfully. Place is beautiful but had a better experience at other wineries because of service.

reviews.author: Taylor B.
reviews.description: Came here for a Bachelorette Party and it was awesome!!! Colt Wayne gave us the best tour and was so fun to be around! Super informative and fun! The beer was great too!

reviews.author: Emilee W.
reviews.description: This was amazing! Our guide Trey, was awesome!  Way more drinks than we expected and was the perfect blend of information, alcohol and sights! We will be back next time we're in town!!! The price was GREAT for the tour and amount of beverages we got. We even had a last minute change in our tour, due to some bar hours changing due to COVID, and the team just picked it up, made it happen for us and got us a partial refund. 12/10 would recommend them again!

reviews.author: Elizabeth L.
reviews.description: Great tours, great guides and stops. We have done two tours with them and both were awesome. Trace and Colt both very personable and funny. The ride is fun and not hard. Got to see a lot of the city. Very reasonably priced.

reviews.author: G F.
reviews.description: If I could give Adam and Bike and Brews 6 stars, I would!!! He was very accommodating and knowledgeable about Austin's history. The tour was great to start the weekend in Austin- Adam had many tips for where to go and how to plan our weekend. He was personal guide for Austin's must-see spots. If you are ever in Austin, we highly recommend going to bike and brews or other tours offered through Adam's company (Austin Bike Tours and Rentals).

reviews.author: Sarah S.
reviews.description: We did the 3 mile tour with Trace and had a blast!  He is passionate about the culture, beer and history of Austin and it definitely shines through in his guided tour!  I would definitely recommend booking this tour if you're looking to see the less touristy and more of the "hidden gems" (as Trace puts it) along the east side of Austin.   Thanks Trace - we had a great time!

reviews.author: Molly H.
reviews.description: Friends and I an amazing day with this company! Colt was great on the tour and Adam was fantastic to work with for booking. He even gave us some great food recommendations for us to stop and get food before our tour. Colt was super knowledgeable of Austin and took us on an amazing ride around town. At each spot he helped us get set up with our tastings and allowed us to take our time at each brewery. Highly recommend!

reviews.author: Tom P.
reviews.description: If you're looking to experience east Austin and enjoy a few beers along the way, Bike and Brew ATX is the way to do it. Trace, our tour guide, showed us around town and offered up some history about the area. The hills are tough but the beer goes down easy. 5/5 experience. Thanks Trace!

reviews.author: Seth F.
reviews.description: Absolutely phenomenal day with Adam on this tour. Bruce is selected at killer beers, he had great information about the city, and the food that we ate was all outstanding. Highly recommend this to her!

reviews.author: Andrew R.
reviews.description: Had a great tome. Pretty good value; about 5-6 alcoholic drinks and three food items. Trace, our guide, was incredible. Knowledgeable and personable. He had connections all over town that provided us with a unique experience we will not forget.   GET THE SECRET BEER

reviews.author: Eva R.
reviews.description: My boyfriend and I did the half heart tour in east Austin and it was a great way to explore the area. Adam was an awesome tour guide! He not only showed us some great breweries but also told us some history about Austin and Texas. Really fun tour, definitely recommend it - whether you just moved to Austin, are visiting, or have been here a while!

reviews.author: Nikki B.
reviews.description: Amazingly fun! Colt was the best guide! So much fun...and he's super hot! ;) so all you bachelorettes book Colt NOW!

reviews.author: Sonia R.
reviews.description: This is an extremely late review- a friend and I did this bike tour with Adam on a cold, rainy day and it was so much fun! Learned a bit about Austin's history, drank delicious beers, and made a new friend. Thank you Adam for a lovely and memorable experience!

reviews.author: Claire M.
reviews.description: This is our favorite thing to do while in Austin! Its the perfect mix of sight seeing, drinking, and socializing! We have done two tours with this group and all of our tour guides were so easy going and knowledgeable. They provide you with a huge list of things to do while in Austin so its a great tour to sign up for early in your trip if you can!

reviews.author: Christa S.
reviews.description: We had an amazing time! Trace was an amazing tour guide. He was very knowledgeable.  I highly reccomend this tour!

reviews.author: Shannon N.
reviews.description: Trace was our guide and boy was he awesome! My brother wants to move to ATX after he graduates, which was the whole premise for our visit, and Trace asked him about what he wanted to do and why he wanted to transplant to Austin. This made our biking ride (though cold) feel very personable. We had an amazing time riding, chatting and drinking. Trace was super knowledgeable and even gave us some local recommendations that weren't on the East side map. 100% would recommend to a local or visitor. Bikes and brew are passionate about what they do and it shows!

reviews.author: Casey M.
reviews.description: My friends coordinated the Bike and Brew + Tacos tour for my bachelorette and it was absolutely fantastic. Adam had the whole day mapped perfectly, an awesome balance of sight seeing/neighborhood history as well as delicious beers and mouth-watering tacos. This was a great way to spend the daytime hours with friends while checking a lot of "You're in Austin! You have to eat tacos/BBQ/drink local beer/have an Armadillo" check boxes.  There's no need to be a cyclist to do this activity, it is very approachable for people of all cycling comforts. Not a beer fan? They also have wine options and coffee!

reviews.author: Sarah H.
reviews.description: A must-do in Austin! 3 breweries, all tastings included, with the added bonus of biking around town. Colt was a fantastic guide-- we felt safe (no easy feat to corral our large group of ladies), learned some history, and drank great beer. Highly recommend.

reviews.author: Belinda F.
reviews.description: My husband and I did the Austin's Gem tour today. Adam was our guide, and although we are native to the area, we enjoyed learning some new tidbits about our beloved city and enjoyed exploring breweries we had not visited. Adam even adjusted our stops to visit some breweries with cider and wine to accommodate different preferences. Biking on the east side was a blast, not too hard, Adam preps you for the hills, seeks out shade and hydrates you at the breweries. Great time!

reviews.author: Ashley R.
reviews.description: We took the Bike and Brew tour at my bachelorette party, and I'm so glad we did! Trace, our tour guide, was SO much fun and very knowledgeable about Austin history/things to do. We had an awesome time joking around, biking at a leisurely pace, and, of course, drinking. Definitely one of the high points of the weekend, and I highly recommend it to anyone visiting Austin!

reviews.author: Morgan V.
reviews.description: Awesome spot to grab a coffee, do some homework and buy a bike. Atmosphere was super chill and laid back. In a hopping part of town so once your done with the coffee study biking you've got the city hotspots a few steps away!

reviews.author: Chloe H.
reviews.description: Good cocktails at a good price! The wrap around patio is fantastic. I could sit out here for hours with a book or drink the day away with some friends! Worth the stop

reviews.author: Amrita J.
reviews.description: Great stop on your trip to Dripping Springs. A family owned and run business. The owners are super friendly, and it's such a relaxing atmosphere. I had the blackberry smash with vodka and it was so good. They have the option of vodka or gin in your cocktail depending on your preference.   Definitely a great way to spend a day!

reviews.author: Dave M.
reviews.description: We spent the weekend visiting distilleries and this was very disappointing.   It's not busy at all but they still gave us gin instead of vodka.  It would be okay to play some music as it's awkwardly quiet due to the lack of patrons.  Finally, the people at the counter seemed annoyed with people overall.  Another couple in  the parking lot stopped us and asked if we had the same bad experience so it was not just us.

reviews.author: Amy S.
reviews.description: Had a great stop here. The blackberry smash was amazing. The Helen's were amazing too. They are very eco friendly, affordable and yummy. And the people were friendly. Win win win trifecta! We left with four bottles.

reviews.author: Jeff P.
reviews.description: Family owned and operated distillery makes for a welcoming experience.  Not like other local "corporate" locations.   Patio is large with plenty of comfortable chairs.   Vodka and Gin are amazing.   My wife enjoyed the Gin sample which was truly surprising.   She a vodka gal.   This is a must stop.  Bypass the corporate spots and come here first.

reviews.author: Christian W.
reviews.description: Definitely a hidden place with a great view! Glad we stopped at this place after seeing a sign off the side of the road and following a winding path down to see this gem.  Very homey vibes with a great patio for outdoor seeing that just has a fantastic view of the hill country. Decently priced drinks consisting of either gin or vodka.  Seating is pretty limited inside, but the outdoor space is just amazing and honestly makes the experience really that much better. I'd highly recommend 'The Bullfrog' with vodka. Tasty drink, but not overpowering and has a nice kick (smooth vodka that doesn't burn like gasoline).  P.S. They have some cool looking merch! Make sure to take a look at their terrariums...they are wicked!

reviews.author: Mindy H.
reviews.description: Frog Pond Distillery was a pleasant surprise.  I have been wanting to come here for a while now, but always drive-by, and don't get a chance to turn around.  However, this time I made a trip purposefully to stop in.  I am glad I did.  Frog Pond is a family-owned business and passion project. The entire family was behind the bar the day my friend and I stopped in except for mom and I think a daughter.  The family owns the land and has slowly overtime built the tasting room and production area themselves.  They currently make a vodka and gin.  They offered us a free sip of each to determine which we would prefer in one of their handcrafted cocktails.  Both had a nice flavor profile that blends well in cocktails.  Their cocktails were creative and they mentioned the family came up with the recipes together.  The cocktails were delicious and very reasonably priced.  Their space has a fun modern 50's theme.  They have an outdoor patio you can sit back and relax on a nice day.

reviews.author: Rachel A.
reviews.description: This is a family run business, which is a major plus!   Love supporting local, small family operated businesses. Their vodka is top notch and their featured cocktails are great.  The views from the porch are amazing and so serene. Definitely coming back for another round.

reviews.author: Anastacia R.
reviews.description: My friends and I were doing distillery/brewery tours in Dripping Springs for a cute birthday celebration. We tried Deep Eddy's but they were closed so we decided to give Frog Pong a try and we were not disappointed! The guys at the front were helpful and kind. The drinks were so affordable and flavorful, I will definitely be back.

reviews.author: Christina M.
reviews.description: What a nice change of pace from the better known distillery down the road. Instead of an overcrowded atmosphere with way overpriced drinks, this place is relaxing and affordable. There's a great wrap around porch to take in the landscape around you, while sipping a delicious cocktail. I definitely recommend stopping in if you're in the area!

reviews.author: Glenn R.
reviews.description: What a beautiful facility!  Stopped in for their grand opening and was amazed at such a sparkling clean, friendly place.  It's very obvious that a lot of careful thought has gone into this place. The actual distillery is incredible. The whole place is just beautiful. Even on a scorching Texas Summer day, there's a strong breeze out on the porch.  It's a very "Austin-esque" type place, down-home and friendly. Although I don't drink, my wife enjoyed a cocktail very much and we bought a bottle to take home. They had some nice lemonade and infused water for me too.  Great design of the logo, bottles and everything. Really worth stopping in if you're in the area or just feel like a nice drive from Austin.

reviews.author: Arko G.
reviews.description: On our way to a wedding, we stopped by for a cocktail, and this was the perfect spot. We were debating between here and Deep Eddy, and we picked here for a more off the beaten path option and chill atmosphere. And we were definitely not disappointed. The staff were very helpful and welcoming and knowledgeable about their product. Outdoor seating is spacious with impressive views. Cocktails were highly affordable and very tasty. Unfortunately, tours were closed due to COVID, but we hope we can come back for tours some time soon!

reviews.author: Lauren G.
reviews.description: While driving into Dripping Springs for an anniversary get away we spotted this beautiful building set near 290, decided to turn in and see what it was. We weren't disappointed, Super cute place, nice patio to hang out on while sipping lovely cocktails. Really reasonably priced drinks (mixed drinks either $5 or $6 depending on choice). Has an area to play games out front, and indoor and outdoor seating.

reviews.author: Christiana F.
reviews.description: I stopped by after a recommendation from one of the wineries in the area. The owners were very welcoming and their drinks were fantastic! I ended up buying a bottle of gin on the way out. It was chilly and the sun was going down so we weren't able to sit outside but the view was great and seems like a fun spot during the summer.

reviews.author: Lochness P.
reviews.description: Delicious drinks! Vodka is super smooth. I recommend the Helen! And the patio with the view is beautiful!

reviews.author: Wanida S.
reviews.description: I've always wanted to stop in and check this place out. It's got a great view and their vodka and gins were tasty. They weren't overpriced and had great service. **only open on the weekends.

reviews.author: Claire K.
reviews.description: Walked in was greeted and made to feel like I was in my own home. If my home was a sweet Distillery like the Frog Pond. Patio and chair were peace on Earth. With a amazing Texas Breeze. And the Gin and Tonic was just perfect. My sister got the cocktail of the day with lavender and gin and it was amazing. Color and all. I highly recommend a stop to this Local Distillery. They are A must try.

reviews.author: Steve T.
reviews.description: They put advertising stickers on your car without permission, which is astonishing. I left the one on my trunk and added a sticker that says "sucks" under it. Unbelievable that they would do this.

reviews.author: Carey D.
reviews.description: What a hidden gem. We started off at another well known distillery down the road and googled what else was close by and found this awesome little spot with a great view. They make small batches of vodka and gin at the distillery and make a few different drinks to try. Their porch was a great place to hang out while playing giant jenga and relaxing. I noticed cornhole as we walked in as well. We watched deer randomly wandering in the distance. The drink I had was great, a cranberry vodka fizz, so I had another. The indoor space is fairly small and the patio could fit maybe 30 people comfortably. It was not crowded at all when we were there on a Sunday afternoon. We'll go again next time we're in Austin!

reviews.author: Devin C.
reviews.description: I am very new to the Gin world, but I was truly in need of an alternative to Dark liquors. I heard about this place from a coworker and decided to take a chance. I am very happy to say that the product that they are offering, not only the liquor, is amazing. They couldn't have picked a better location to place their distillery. The hills of Texas, day or night, make relaxing on the patio with the variety of gin and vodka cocktails that much more relaxing. The bright pops of color when you venture inside of the distillery are such a delight and really made my girlfriend and I feel happy to be in such a welcoming place.   The gin was delicious and I plan to buy more bottles very soon. Don't think that my lack of praise for the vodka means that it isn't good (I am just not a fan of vodka..rough nights in college) but I definitely suggesting venturing out to this family run, local organization. You will not be disappointed.

reviews.author: Paula A.
reviews.description: First time coming to this spot ,  very friendly staff ! Came 30 mins before closing and the lady said it was fine no rush , enjoy your meal that also came out in less than 10 min !!! . Overall chill spot and the brisket was so Good . Will be back soon

reviews.author: Randy L.
reviews.description: Delicious! The brisket and the pork belly were melt-in-your-mouth meat candy, exploding with smokey flavor. Yum!  The sausage was really good too, though I prefer more of a loose sausage like you'll get in some other central Texas BBQ joints. This was more firm but really good flavor.  I requested (fresh) jalapeos and sriracha in addition to the regular garnish of pickles, onions, and bbq sauce. The veggies were thick slices and the sauces flavorful. Plus two thick slices of white bread.  It was pricey, but any BBQ in Central Texas is. The differentiator here is the Vietnamese touches in the flavors and sauces. Two people in my party had banh mi and one had the King plate and they looked delicious too. Everyone in our party gave 5 stars for flavor, portion, and service.  Other notes: Decent parking. Good indoor seating, lots more outdoor seating. BBQ joint/bar vibe indoors, with notes of Vietnamese flair. Service was attentive and food came out quick.   Go visit Smoking Beauty and have a great meal.

reviews.author: Sean D.
reviews.description: Food is pretty delicious but damn do they only give you appetizer portions. We bought two bbq plates and there was hardly any food on it and it was $20.00 for each of them. Very ilu underwhelming in that regard. Id say a bbq plate is worth $10.00.   The atmosphere is like any typical bbq joint. Service was very nice.  I wouldn't come back though since the portions are a scam.

reviews.author: Courtney B.
reviews.description: I came in last Saturday with one of my Yelp peeps to get the weekend started before going to see a little bit of comedy. We ordered drinks only.  The atmosphere of this establishment has a real ATX vibe as it blends central TX spirit with traditional Vietnamese cuisine. The mode last Saturday night was chill and as we walked in and were given a nod by the bartender. My companion ordered  a bozzy bobba shoot and another adult libation. I ordered a spiked tea cause "baby, it's cold outside". The drinks came out quick and were done right.   This is the type of place that is solid for good eats, a good time, a date night,  or to start off an evening of disorderly conduct.  #supportlocal

reviews.author: Rello R.
reviews.description: Not bad at all. It was a nice vibe they have outdoor and indoor seating. They have an app that you order off of and pay on. They bring the food to you so you can't pay with cash. Went for lunch with the guys. The brisket was good. With the 3 meat you only get 1 slice of brisket. You get 1 jalapeo and cheese sausage. And some pork belly. I wasn't a fan of the pork belly. The sausage was good though. I can't lie. The moist in the brisket was tasty! The lean was good too. They got Mexican Coke was good too!

reviews.author: Stephanie A.
reviews.description: The staff always gives a warm welcome when we stop here to eat. There is outside (dogs welcomed) and inside seating.   We have been here a few times and love their food.    My favorite so far is the brisket banh mi and their potato salad. The brisket is smoked perfectly and the bread texture compliments the heartiness of the brisket well.  I love the fresh veggies they put in this!  The potato salad is hands down the best potato salad I have ever had at a restaurant. You have got to try this!!  We have ordered a few drinks in the past - they have a great Happy Hour.  You cant miss it - follow your nose to North Lamar and treat yourself.

reviews.author: Kelsi D.
reviews.description: I really wanted this to be a revolutionary experience. The concept is so cool, but their menu is a little repetitive and the food was just good. Not saying that this wasn't an awesome meal, but I really wanted it to be something to write home about. And it just wasn't.   The banh mi sandwiches were very dry but the meat was insanely tender, though   lacking a lot of flavor. The cost is a little higher but the portion sizes are large and generous.   The real show stopper here though, is the bbq sauce. It's the right mix of Asian flavors and classic bbq sweetness.   It's worth the visit to see this take on two fairly different cuisines mashed together. But don't expect to be wowed away. It doesn't scream fusion to me, it just seems like they took some of the most popular parts of each cuisine and put them separately on the plate.

reviews.author: Kimberly M.
reviews.description: This place was everything I had hoped it would be. Now I just wish there was another one in Houston!  This Texas Tower looks intimidating but just roll up your sleeves, topple that thing over, and dive right in. The jalapeo sausage has some sneaky heat. Perfectly crispy hashbrowns with beautifully salted pork belly. Loved every bite.  We also shared the pork belly and brisket banh mi's and smokin fries. Most banh mi places we are quick to grab the Sriracha and Maggie's Sauce but not this time. It didn't even cross my mind until days after.  The brisket has the most amazing flavor and so moist. Almost a shame to lose it into anything else. But a perfect addition to any menu item.  Such warm and friendly owners and staff.   Parking was easy on a Sunday afternoon.  CAN'T WAIT TO GO BACK FOR MORE!!!

reviews.author: Gus H.
reviews.description: A much needed spot in the 'hood. We've been frequenting them since opening and it's only getting better. Great vibe, great food, live music, local owners. Consistent bbq (that ain't easy). What else could we ask for?!

reviews.author: Alan H.
reviews.description: They changed the garnish for their banh mi. Gone are the traditional Vietnamese pickles and garnishes. It is literally BBQ brisket with coleslaw on French bread, it just a weird combo hardly Asian Fusion anymore.

reviews.author: Carly C.
reviews.description: I have had a hankering for this place for almost a year. I had seen it on the Food or Travel network, and it looked awesome. It seems like they have some sort of little drink or food special every day. On Wednesday, it was Whiskey and Wine Wednesday, with $2 off either beverage. My friend and I sat at the bar. The co-owner was bartending, and she is super friendly. She helped us with a couple of beer choices, as well as which Bahn Mi I was going to go with. We got the Smokin' Fries, the Brisket Bahn Mi, and the Smoked Pork Belly Bahn Mi. All of the food was amazing. Even after I felt like I couldn't eat another bite, I kept snacking away on those fries. This place has a great vibe, they are trying to work on managing the temperatures of outdoor seating for customers, and they have lots of little activities, like trivia and swing night, throughout the week. I will absolutely be back for brunch; I got to get my hands on that Leaning Tower of Texas.

reviews.author: Heather A.
reviews.description: The high ratings for Smoking Beauty are well earned. Large portions of delicious, creative, well presented food; a variety of alcoholic and non-alcoholic beverages; the choice of indoor or outdoor seating with two separate outdoor areas, one covered and one open; varying table heights; great music played at a level to be noticeable without being intrusive, and attentive, friendly staff.  On my first of what will surely be many visits I came on a Saturday with my husband for a late lunch. There were a good number of people there including a small birthday celebration but with two outdoor areas and inside seating to choose from we were able to sit off on our own at a lovely table outside in front of the restaurant.  Having not had enough caffeine yet I was delighted by the Vietnamese drop coffee and was impressed that they accommodated my husband's order of part Coke and part carbonated water. He was clearly hungry and/or unprepared for the quantity of food and order both Bahn Mi and loaded fries. I chose the brisket hash off of the brunch menu which was so good I ate way too much of the generous serving. Several days later I am still thinking about how perfect the sweet potatoes and brussel sprouts were in particular.  I am looking forward to going back again later and trying one of their cocktails with my meal which are rumored to be too notch.

reviews.author: Yuli M.
reviews.description: First time while I was visiting Austin, atmosphere was really nice! Started off with the spinach dip which was SO DELICIOUS! Then ordered the brisket banh mi, it was a really interesting taste lol... it just tastes like a banh mi with brisket slapped inside. It was pretty decent, pretty pricey though for what it is ($12). Make sure to order the green and bbq sauce for the banh mi! It gives it a little more flavor.

reviews.author: Karen Q.
reviews.description: Smokin Beauty is a fusion restaurant that combines Vietnamese and BBQ cuisine. They have lots of indoor and outdoor seating. They even have live music on some weeknights. You order at the bar counter and take your number to the table, and they bring out your food out to you. We sat outside, but the service was slightly lacking as we had go back into the restaurant for multiple items like silverware and napkins. The meat tasted good, I would favor the pork belly over the brisket- the bread was hard and crispy for banh mi. I definitely would view them more as a BBQ joint versus Vietnamese, although they do have some interesting drinks with Viet twists. Overall, a good place to go especially if looking for late night food. They have they own private parking lot as well.

reviews.author: Mike R.
reviews.description: Came by on a Friday night to see a friend's band, the Lone Star Debonairs.  Also wanted dinner... and this is the second BBQ place I've been to in less than a week!  Smokin Beauty is in the Vietnamese area of North Austin, and is a Vietnamese/BBQ hybrid.  They're a small place but have good outdoor seating and parking, and the weather this Friday night was perfect for eating and dancing.  The food: I ordered their brisket and pork belly salad with a creamy cilantro dressing.  The brisket had nice smoke and a good bark, and the pork belly was soft without being mushy or all fat, and really lightly flavored, showing off the meat.  Fresh, crisp veggies made it perfect  They also have Banh Mi on the menu, and a Viet BBQ plate with Texas BBQ and Viet vegetables.

reviews.author: Joel M.
reviews.description: Smokin Beauty fuses Texas barbecue with Vietnamese cuisine. I popped in for the Double Fantasy Bahn Mi (brisket and pork belly). Served on a crunchy, fresh baguette, the meats were perfectly smoked and flavorful, and the pickled vegetables were crisp and colorful. If you prefer a bit of added heat, ask for jalapeos and sriracha. I also tried the slaw which was fresh and bright with Asian flavors.  There is plenty of seating outside. The decor inside is plenty nice with dark wood decor. The restaurant sports a full bar. This is such a great little neighborhood spot.

reviews.author: Pax S.
reviews.description: My postal colleague and I stopped here on Mother's Day and I cannot even begin to explain the positive energy Tao had upon arrival. I told her we always carry mail past the pits and always wanted to try it. I ordered the brisket banh mi with potato salad as well as an happy hour cocktail. My friend got a two meat plate with slaw and potato salad. The salad was incredible, we both agreed. He loved the pork belly so much!  For the price point, it was absolutely worth it! Discussing the passion Matt and Tao have for opening this business during a pandemic is inspiring nonetheless. Stop on by!

reviews.author: Anthony M.
reviews.description: Smokin Beauty takes the best of both worlds by combining traditional Viet style of cooking with American BBQ to give you a fusion you didn't know you needed... until now. You can find items such as the:  - Brisket Bnh M: I enjoy the twist of smokey, fatty flavors from the brisket as well as the creamy cilantro and soy sauce that it comes with. The fries are amazing, too! $13.95 (4.5/5)  - Leaning Tower of Texas: a brunch special that is a stack of 3 hash browns, brisket, jalapeo cheddar sausage, pork belly, sambal hollandaise (sambal is like chile peppers), and bnh m veggies - this is a lot more filling than it looks, I definitely would suggest you share it. I thought it was pretty good. $23.75 (4/5)  - Pho Queso: you read that right, they take veggie pho broth and mix it in with melted cheese to give you a unique take on queso. The pro here is that it's vegetarian friendly, but the con is that the flavor is a bit faint and I wish they would use a beef pho base instead. It's still good however! $7 (3.5/5)  Overall, this is a great spot to visit if you're craving BBQ, but also want to try something different. They have an outdoor patio if you prefer to sit outside. They also have awesome customer service and the prices are good too. With that said, I give them a 4.25/5.

reviews.author: A E.
reviews.description: Place is solid for a fusion spot! Brisket bahn mi was really good and brisket fries (pictured) were worth the trip in itself for sure, by far some of the best fires ive had in a while.  Burger wasn't the greatest, since the patties seemed almost the frozen style... but i think thats just how it should be. Stick to the bbq!

reviews.author: Chris B.
reviews.description: Brisket Banh Mi, creamed spinach, and chips + pho queso were delicious! Definitely recommendand can't wait to come back

reviews.author: Candice N.
reviews.description: We went to Koko's on Saturday and had a great time! The staff is so friendly; I'm so excited to see another family friendly joint on the east side.   We ordered the pretzel and the sweet and spicy pickles. Both so good! Shared some flights and ordered the currywurst, bratwurst, and duckwurst. The duckwurst was great, but the sauerkraut was a little dry. The currywurst smelled amazing but we thought that, and the regular brat, were a little underwhelming and lacking a little flavor.   We will still return! Such a cool vibe and patio. Plenty of parking, too!

reviews.author: Laura P.
reviews.description: Very welcoming Biergarten and cool Austinized Herman food await you here at Koko's Bavarian. We say Austinized because they dredge their schnitzel in red Chile rub before dipping it in a red-chile seasoned batter. While this was DELICIOUS - our autistic person (VERY sensitive to spice) who wanted schnitzel could not eat it.    The rest of us ate the schnitzel and loved it. So just a heads-up for the spice averse.   I got the Rabbit- Rattlesnake brat which was delicious - lots of wood-smoke from the grill and mine came with a side of Chef's secret spicy German mustard (diced jalapeo) that I loved!!  Others in our party got the schnitzel with potato pancakes subbed for the German potato salad, the Antelope Brat, and we split 2 orders of fries.  Fries are awesome here - definitely get them! Made from fresh potatoes thy are thick cut of crispy on the outside, fluffy on the inside. One order is enough for 2 to share.   VERY dog-friendly, bring your pooches who can handle the music and busy-ness of this Biergarten.   5 awesome food and atmosphere stars

reviews.author: Michaela P.
reviews.description: I guess everyone is recovering from SXSW...an hour after opening and we're the first customers? Usually that's not a good sign.   Kitschy Bavarian interior with a few high top tables and some bar space. Lots of picnic tables outside. Plenty of parking. Dog friendly.   We did a flight of Koko's beer. All pretty good. Food is good. A variety of wurst and a few other German items - all slightly overpriced.   Friendly service. We'll stop in again if in the area.

reviews.author: Erica N.
reviews.description: Finally tried this place yesterday and I was not disappointed.  Firstly, they don't just have beer but a full bar! The inside has a decent number of tables, and the outdoor area is pretty big.  We got a lot of food so here's the rundown: - Pretzel = AMAZING. So perfectly soft and doughy and even better with the queso side. We ordered 2.  - Belgian Fries = crispy and hot and perfectly seasoned!  - Venison Brat = so good!  - Elk Brat = wayyyy too much whole grain mustard on top so I hated that part but the actual brat was good but the venison one was just so tasty.  - Potato Pancakes = soooo good! Comes 3 to an order but they're a fairly big size so easily shareable. Served with sour cream and apple sauce.   Will definitely be back!

reviews.author: Don L.
reviews.description: Awesome! A real deal Biergarten. It's near Central Machine so I can partake in both at once!  Amazing food, better beer! The pretzels are soft and the bratwursts are amaze!  Ich liebe es!

reviews.author: Hope F.
reviews.description: I'm pretty sure a literal prince owns this place, but super unlikely that he'd be hauling himself over the host stand to figure out how to get a check... to pay... to leave.   The prince may also not understand the going rate for schnapps these days. I was interested to see what $8 of schnapps gets you. The answer is a single shot of schnapps. I'm from NYC, so I hate when people complain about prices - but that one really cut me deep.   I'd recommend kokos maybe if you're with work colleagues in a large group and just kind of need a place to sit, and at some point may get a beer.

reviews.author: Julie Z.
reviews.description: Came here on a Saturday around lunch, super nice weather to be outside and many people taking advantage. This is really the right place to come and grab a beer (or a flight) with friends. There's a ton of space, so would work well for events too. Service was great, my schnitzel was over salted and the server graciously took it off the bill. I really liked everything else though!

reviews.author: Kristi M.
reviews.description: Oof - I totally understand when a place opens it takes a while to get all the things running smoothly. The wait staff was extremely nice! Unfortunately, it was hard to try any of the menu as they were out of what seemed to be everything including the beers. I will be back to give it another try but the first time wasn't a hit sadly.  (P.s. they have a parking lot which is always great esp in Austin)

reviews.author: Robert H.
reviews.description: East Austin is quite the canvas for places looking to offer different or newer experiences. While a lot has already been done in the area, there's an opportunity to, as they say, "use the landscape to your benefit" and add to it in ways that can compliment.  Koko's Bavarian is located in a general swath of the far East Side once reserved for industrial purposes. The area was known for a certain grit and was never to be confused for being family friendly.   Which is why, in this new world of viewing the same concepts with a different  perspective...it feels perfectly natural!   And the plenty of parking is an added bonus.   We dared to brave the amazing "chilly" Austin weather, 50 and sunny, as it made for a perfect set up to what Koko's offers.  Their beer selection was extremely diverse, which is a welcomed feature, especially if you've been making the brewery rounds...  The weinerschnitzel was great, although I will not purport to be a German fare expert. The Belgian fries were exceptionally crispy and, I don't care, you don't have to be an expert to know those potato pancakes were absolutely amazing.  The bee sting cake was beloved by everyone in our nine people party, me being the least impressed. All of this to say, eight out of nine loved it, so chances are you will too. The quark tart was definitely something to write home about  (even if home is in Germany...), a resounding 9 out of 9!  All in all, a great experience worthy of multiple visits and five stars.

reviews.author: Allison M.
reviews.description: Super atmosphere and the food is delicious. We had the rabbit rattlesnake sausage, fries and pretzel. All delicious. They have really good beers. Favorites were Pils, IPA, dunkel.  Definitely recommend. The people were really great as well.

reviews.author: Kendal Ann M.
reviews.description: Koko's is a lot bigger than I expected. You see the outside host for seating, and there's plenty of if. If you go on a colder day, there is a fire and heat lamps.  Beverages A pretty large selection, and you'll have options for anyone from beer lovers to cider, wine, and schnapps, too.  Food  Sausages, schnitzel, potato salad, and fried pickles -- it's not a huge menu, but you're coming here for some German food, so it's to be expected to be a smaller range of options.  Seating and vibe  Great place for all ages. We had people with dogs and kids surrounding us, and everyone was very respectful, not letting their kids or dogs run around. It looks like there are seating options inside but more outside.   I'm giving four stars because we didn't dive into the food menu this time. We ordered the Belgium fries and beverages, which were excellent. We had quick service and loved the atmosphere outside. We will be back to enjoy more.

reviews.author: Gavin B.
reviews.description: I hate giving a restaurant a poor review in a Covid world, and this may be my first in years.  I also have to say I really like Tim Love concepts, but I don't think his team helped with the food.   To start, this is the worst German food restaurant we've ever been to.  The vibe was weird, the staff was not attentive and forgot half our order, and the food we got was awful.    The brat was far and away the worst sausage and brat we've all had anywhere.  The brat also came with onions over sauerkraut which is odd.  What's bad is that the sausage was better than the burnt chicken that came out cold on the inside.   The only win for this restaurant is their fries. The fries are good, and the sauces for the fries pair perfectly.

reviews.author: Drew T.
reviews.description: I met a friend here for dinner one night and had a fantastic time! The ambiance was great, and on a nice spring day it was refreshing to be outside. I had the schnitzel and the second it hit my mouth I yelped... "mmmmh!!"... which then caused me to briefly choke, but it was worth it. The potato salad was also delicious, which is saying something because I normally don't like potato salad.   I took off a star because I think a $22 meal should fill you up, but I went home and decided to heat up a few slices of pizza because I was still hungry. Next time I'll get an appetizer or brot to go with it, but it was still a little disappointing... maybe it was just so tasty my stomach wasn't ready to quit.

reviews.author: Rob P.
reviews.description: Yikes, this place is not ready for primetime.  Went with a pretty big group of about 20 people. We were all paying for our own food and drinks, which should be a pretty normal thing, but it absolutely wasn't. But I'll get to that.  I arrived late and our server was very quick to learn my name and take my order, so props to him. He helped me pick a beer to order and it came out pretty quickly. Unfortunately, someone else brought the beer and was going around the other end of the table asking who had this beer. When he got to me, I told him I didn't know if it was even my beer because the server picked for me. Not a great start.  I was hungry but thought $9 was pretty ridiculous for a braut. But my friend was enjoying his and he had it within minutes of ordering, so I said what the hell, I'll try it. 20-30 minutes later it still hadn't arrived, so I told the server to cancel the order and just close me out. Then it got worse.  "What did you have?" I don't know man, just the one beer you picked. He told me he had no idea how to split tabs which is just insane for this sort of a place. After a few minutes of him staring at his POS, I told him I'll just figure out who's paying and I'll Venmo then. Then I watched each person from our party ask the same question as they wanted to close out.  I also watched various staff come out with different food and drink items and constantly not know who was supposed to be receiving it. And not just within our large group... sometimes they brought food to our table that was for a different table. Just complete confusion on where things go. You know, what should be very basic for food service before you open.  I know it's a new place, and I did enjoy the vibe, but geez it was way too stressful to deal with everything that I won't be going back unless I hear they've properly trained their staff.

reviews.author: Andrew B.
reviews.description: I can absolutely see this restaurant being a hit for people who live downtown. The beer brewed in-house is priced fairly and tastes delicious. The location itself is cute and Instagram-worthy. The fries were awesome. As a casual place to grab a quick beer, munch on some appetizers and taste some interesting sausages, and then move on to the next venue, I think Koko's works great. For yuppie trash from suburbia who want a filling meal (points at self), however, it's hard to justify the trip due to the small portions, high prices, and spotty service.  First off, I'm almost certain that my server was high. I personally have no objections to anyone doing what they need to in order to get through their day, but from completely forgetting our orders immediately after taking our orders, to sending our our apps, entrees, and desserts to the wrong table each time, his vibing unfortunately kinda killed ours.  And I'd probably excuse all that if the schnitzels and bee sting cakes slapped, but they were pretty unremarkable in all ways except price. $22 for a small-end-of-medium plain pork schnitzel and a small scoop of potato salad and $10 for a tiny slice of bee sting cake that just did not hit. I've had bee sting cake before, and this one was quite dry, had less cream in the middle, and had nearly no honey-nut topping on top. Not a great way to end the meal.  Some of my complaints will probably be resolved as the restaurant settles and finds its groove, but man I don't know about those prices. Maybe $22 for Jgerschnitzel with sauerkraut and ksesptzle, but not for plain schnitzel served at street food portions.  Again, I think Koko's fills a niche as a great place to grab a pint/liter of delicious German beer while snacking on fries and just vibe, but as a restaurant, I don't think it offers enough value to be worth it. Especially not if you're a German food fan who lives over 30 minutes away.

reviews.author: Oli J.
reviews.description: Glad to see another restaurant on the Far Eastside, we got a table right away, and the host was very friendly. Our server was great too, she was very personable!   We had their in-house beers, the lager and pilsner, both good, the other is a dunkel which we didn't get to since they serve the beers in a 32 oz mug, for $11, great deal.  We had the currywurst, antelope, and duck sausages, the currywurt came on fries instead of a bun and was my favorite but the duck was soooo good, sweet and juicy.  We'll definitely come back, the atmosphere is friendly and the beer is tasty. Next time I'll try a schnitzel!

reviews.author: Nick M.
reviews.description: Solid pretzels, but everything else was pretty mediocre.  The latkes were lukewarm and not crunchy at all.  German potato salad was bland.  Currywurst was dry and cold, with mushy fries.  I was bummed.

reviews.author: Rachel H.
reviews.description: Best sausages and soft pretzel I've ever had. Definitely try the rabbit rattlesnake sausage when you come in. This is hands down the best restaurant in Austin!

reviews.author: Janek N.
reviews.description: We visited with a group of 4 adults and 3 hungry kids on a Saturday afternoon. Unfortunately you cannot order any food unless you have a table... and that is where is problem starts. We waited for 30 minutes for a table, but never received a notification even though there were 3 tables available (+ 6 tables marked as "reserved"). No other group waited to be seated (i.e. not crowded). One patron told us to just grab a table and not wait for a notification since "This is the only way you will ever get a table". When we tried that the waiter appeared to tell us that we could not do that but had to put ourselves on the waitlist (which we already did). When I asked him wether we would have had to make a reservation online ahead of time he told me that he doesn't want to talk to me. Really?!  We walked next door to Central Machine Works where they had plenty of space.  Look, I understand that the place just opened and might not run smoothly just yet. So I hope you make something out of this feedback:  (1) if your tables are freely accessible it does not make sense to have a waitlist since people can just skip the line. (2) If you do not have enough staff to service everyone close down some tables (3) Let people know what the wait time might be. (We we're told 15 minutes. After 30 minutes we were told it's another 30.) (4) If a customer asks a question at least try to answer.  Lastly: The House Lager tasted pretty decent and the food menu looks interesting. Wish we could have tried it. (Or that the kids could have had a pretzel while waiting.)

reviews.author: Knox H.
reviews.description: Really slow service. Over an hour for 2 sausages and hard to get beers. Probably won't go back.

name: The League Kitchen and Tavern
accommodations: Best nights on Monday, Friday, Saturday

reviews.author: Ali V.
reviews.description: In a world where work (regular or enjoyable) in the hospitality industry is hard AF to come by, this place exceeds expectations! It's truly a Cheers-esque environment where everyone feels welcome and everyone knows your name (and drink)! Marissa, Kiyani, Sophia and Aaron all make everyone feel welcomed and valued. We've lived here (6 minutes away) for 10 years and this is BY FAR the best regular crew they've ever had! Management is a revolving door, though, and there have been some great ones along with dozens of others (good and bad) who are no longer at this location or with the company. Drew, who is newish, though, is awesome and one of the best to ever grace this location's presence.  All I can say is, if you're local and haven't been but are considering stopping in - go here. If you're out of town and visiting - go here. If you're a regular - write a review. You know the folks here who make this your regular spot deserve the shout out. I, personally, feel bad it's taken me so long to give them a public shout out!  Management - you're lucky to have a team like this during this time. Treat them as the valued people that they are!  Thanks y'all!

reviews.author: Liz F.
reviews.description: I've lived in Cedar Park for years and I can't believe I've never been here! Went tonight finally to get some fare on patio since it was such a nice evening, and omg, we were blown away.  Stated with the fried pickles, I don't even care for pickles, but with the Buffalo sauce! Uhmmm yass these were amazing! Perfectly crispy, crunch of the pickle, and the zip of the sauce, it was pretty darn good!  I had the spicy passion fruit margarita, it was more sweet than spicy, but still tasty. I liked the blood orange Bellini a little better, and the house margarita was also good.   I got the coconut shrimp for dinner, again, perfectly fried, with a nice crunch. The coconut was subtle but I really enjoyed the chile sauce with it. I got a "side" of fries to go with it, the fries could have been my meal. Super generous portion, and do yourself a favor, add the truffle, Holy moly!    Our waitress was great, as long as every other member of the wait staff that touched our table. We came on the recommendation of friend and I feel I have to spread the love. This place is a must try, and I can't wait to come back!

reviews.author: Kat B.
reviews.description: Great spot with a very relaxed vibe. Our server was Priscilla I believe. She was great and did an awesome job.  My husband and I both got the southern burger and we both really enjoyed it. The homemade fries were great as well. My brother in law had the dip and said it was really good also. I liked the ambiance of the restaurant as it was sort of an upscale sports bar. It was clean and the staff we encountered were all very pleasant and friendly.

reviews.author: Justin M.
reviews.description: Very unassuming from the outside but walk in and you find a upscale gastropub style restaurant. We came at lunch and though I was initially hesitant to bring in kids, there ended up being plenty off other families in there. The menu was upscale American. Given it was lunch time, we went with hamburgers and sandwiches. The main dishes were all really good and a decent portion (not too big, not too small). The sides we got were a bit under seasoned though. Lastly, there should really be a hamburger on the kids menu.   Overall, really enjoyed this place. Will come back for dinner to try more of the menu.

reviews.author: Mainer D.
reviews.description: My boyfriend and I loved this place. It was our first time coming and we will definitely be back. The food was amazing and so was the service. If you guys are looking for a restaurant to try out I highly recommend this place. Our server name was Aaron and he was very knowledgeable on the food menu and drink menu. He was very friendly on top of his great service. Plus the manager Zach came out and greeted us with a free dessert after finding out this was our first time here. He also was very friendly and nice. Overall one of the best experiences we've had in a long time.

reviews.author: Ken D.
reviews.description: The League is part neighborhood bar, part gastro-pub and I love both parts!    The bar and dinning areas are separated.  Despite both being relatively small, there's plenty of seating.  Choose from high-tops to semi-circular booths to high-back swivel bar stools.  And they have an outdoor patio as well, but not much of a view.   The League is a great place to meet a friend for drinks, a casual date, weekend brunch, watch Sunday football, or to just to ride the bar solo.    Excellent food with new, weekly specials, including a burger-of-the-week. On Mondays they have 2-for-1 burgers for dine in - can't beat that!  They also have cocktail specials to go along with their food specials (in addition to their menu and drink standards).  I wish they had a bigger beer wall, but the selection is serviceable.   The League is one on my regular spots and I've yet to be disappointed with their food, drinks, or service.

reviews.author: Vincent W.
reviews.description: If you are in the mood for elevated bar food in Cedar Park, this is a good choice.    Good food and good service.  Half bar half restaurant menu.  Fairly new facilities.

reviews.author: Jake H.
reviews.description: The League Kitchen and Tavern does not disappoint when I'm craving elevated bar food. The burgers are excellent as are the drinks and I don't go enough. This time we ordered the Pappardelle Bolognese and the Jamaican Jerk Mahi Mahi. Probably won't get these again but they weren't bad. I just will try something else. Always great service here.

reviews.author: Elise M.
reviews.description: I was so pleasantly surprised when we stopped here for a quick lunch. Friendly service and helpful staff members greeted us at the door and I loved the Prohibition era style and decor. Lots of variety on the menu. I tried the Society burger which was tasty and my husband had the club sandwich. $3 mimosas and they sent us home with a complimentary dessert- can't beat that.

reviews.author: Michael Q.
reviews.description: Came here for lunch with a few of my coworkers and it was pretty good.  Lunch was solid service was good but I think that was partially because there were only 4 tables occupied when we were there but the service was attentive.  Menu is pretty large and has breakfast items during lunch so no complaints there because I do love me some breakfast for lunch or dinner.  Overall solid place would come back if I'm in the area not making a special trip here but if I'm here I definitely would come back.

reviews.author: Carl H.
reviews.description: 7/4/21 1st visit.  Already a crowd at opening.   Waitress : Kenza - very attentive, paying attention to details. ( even asked about allergies ) There's definitely a spirit of cooperation- every employee was eager to help out.  Drinks : Bloody Mary's delicious and at $3.00 a bargain. Arron the bartender jumps in to help out in the dining area. Great guy !! Food : Pot pie (basically a biscuit with gravy with a fried egg on top - WOW filling and Delicious!! Wife had the steak salad - steak cooked exactly as she ordered it.  Mother in Law had a breakfast anytime.  All of our food was delicious!!  All and All we had a GREAT experience!! Definitely will come again.  A quality restaurant ! Absolutely nothing negative to report.  As a treat on your 1st visit - we'll show up and ask about it.  Prices were VERY REASONABLE!!

reviews.author: Eva Maria T.
reviews.description: We have been going to The League for a couple of years now. I get my hair done around the corner so it's convenient for my husband to hang at the bar. Sometimes we eat here and sometimes not.   Upside; Bartenders are always friendly and welcoming, they have great happy hour prices on drinks and apps. Also weekly food specials.   Food can be hit or miss. Between the two of us we've had everything on the menu. Club sandwich is always as hit and so is the spinach artichoke dip. Burgers sometimes a bit dry. The salmon is usually perfectly cooked. Fish and chips over battered and greasy. Prime rib sandwich is hit or miss.  Burger of the week this visit was Frito Pie Burger. I had the garlic butter grouper, which was a huge portion, but lacked seasoning on both the fish and couscous. Garlic butter was on the side, but was just melted butter with a chopped garlic at the bottom. No other seasonings.   We will continue to come hang at the bar and eat here occasionally.

reviews.author: Lyla A.
reviews.description: 5 stars for service and 2.75 stars for food. My 4 stars are on the generous side.  We dined here this afternoon. The server was very nice and took care of us. I'd give her service 5 stars.   For our food we ordered the chicken fried pork chop, the full rack of ribs, the southern burger, and the kids Mac and cheese.   Our little guy loved the Mac snd cheese. It was decent and definitely not out of a box. It didn't come with anything else but was only $5.   Hubby had the Southern burger with truffle fries ($2 up charge). The burger was solid. It could have been a slight bit juicer but it was a good burger. The "truffle" fries were not. The fries were limp and soggy and sprinkled with Parmesan but had no truffle flavor at all. Actually when you picked up a fry the cheese all fell off too. Pretty bad fries to be honest.   Older son ordered the baby back ribs and enjoyed them. They were your standard fair. Similar to what you'd find at Chili's but they cost $30 and come with a side of mashed potatoes.  I had the  chicken fried pork chop. It was very over cooked and dry and was topped with jalapeo gravy but there was no heat or jalapeo flavor at all. The gravy made the pork chop less dry though. I subbed Brussels sprouts instead of mashed potatoes ($2). They lacked seasoning or flavor. I like the taste of Brussels sprouts so I ate them but they had no other seasoning that I could detect.   The food was all fine. Not bad but at their prices I would definitely not run back.

reviews.author: Gail M.
reviews.description: Tonight I met a friend to taste their Prime and Wine deal. Half price bottles of wine and two sizes of Prime Rib. The beef was perfectly cooked, nicely seasoned and fork tender. The mushrooms cooked in a savory salty balsamic sauce were the perfect accompaniment to the prime rib. I asked for fries rather than the Yukon mashed because I know their fries are fresh and hand cut. Some people complain about soggy fries. Well, if you put them in a cardboard box to take home, they WILL steam in the box and get soggy. Duh! But ours were nice and crispy. The cut of beef was thick which I really appreciated as opposed to a wide thin-cut slice. I think it was maybe 3/4 of an inch thick? Maybe more. I'm posting a pick but I had already dug in when I remembered to take a photo. Sorry. I like The league a lot. Even the Mgr came by to ensure we were happy. Nice young man was our waiter. This was all good!

reviews.author: Amanda M.
reviews.description: Overpriced bar food.  Fries were soggy. Burger needed basic salt and pepper to give it flavor. It was medium rare.

reviews.author: Kasti K.
reviews.description: This place wildly exceeded my expectations.   We are in from out of town, it's a perfect Sunday spot for lunch and to watch football. The Sunday crew in the bar was super fun, our server Aaron was really kind   Their Sunday drink special is $3 mimosa and bloody Mary's.   Their gluten free bun is the best I've had at a restaurant, it is nice and chewy and stays together.   The chicken sandwich was great, a huge chicken breast with lots of bacon and avocado. They do a "first timer" complimentary dessert of their chocolate dump cake, my husband said it was great!

reviews.author: J K.
reviews.description: I ordered the "elevated" or perhaps called "adult" grilled cheese and tomato soup. The soup was very tasty and I would order that again.  The sandwich was not an adult version and not elevated. Cold congealed cheese on what looked like white bread. No spreads or bacon jam or fig or combination of cheeses.. nothing to elevate this sandwich to justify the $13.00 price tag.  I make 'em better at home.

reviews.author: John S.
reviews.description: This place is our most visited restaurant since moving here thirteen years ago. As a former restaurant owner / operator, I appreciate the consistency and quality of the menu offerings. The facility is always clean and tables are cleared immediately when a party leaves. They have some really good deals, like burger Monday where you buy one and get one free. They also have a mouth watering prime rib special on Thursday that we can't wait to try.  One more attraction is , if you are into science or astronomy, you might be waited on by Galileo.

reviews.author: Chantel C.
reviews.description: We WILL be back! So, tonight my little family and I discovered this hidden gem. We had no clue about this place until tonight when I was looking for a family friendly restaurant, Little did we know it's only 10 minutes away from our house that we lived at for over two years. We were greeted as soon as we came in, it looked upscale and as soon as we sat down my husband said "are you sure this is kid friendly"  it ABSOLUTELY is. The food was amazing from the appetizers, main course and dessert. The customer service here was outstanding, I've waitressed myself for many years and have been to many restaurants and have never had service like this. Sam took care of us tonight and was so accommodating to us and our 1 year sassy daughter. Zach the manager on duty was also outstanding as well, he took care of us well for it being our first time there, We left in disbelief with the service we received... thanks yall! We look forward to many more dinners here.   Plus I got a nice tote for the to go food

reviews.author: Justyn D.
reviews.description: This place is absolutely phenomenal!! From the host stand to service to manager interaction! Our server recommended so many wonderful options that were stellar...everything was incredible! We ordered drinks which were super fast, apps that came out piping hot and delicious! But the entrees .... OHHHHHHH WEEEEEEE !!! Spot ok and taste profile was out of this world!! After we created a perfect check and ordered all deserts!! The dump cake was a table favorite as well as the butter cake which was a special and then complemented it with the banana pudding!! The Mules and El Guapo Shandy were on point !! Thanks team for an incredible family dinning experience!!

name: Lenoir
accommodations: Best nights on Wednesday, Thursday, Saturday

reviews.author: Jim R.
reviews.description: Came here for my wife's birthday with some friends and we all agreed it was probably the best meal of our lives. The courses all featured spice in very well balanced dishes, and as a person who doesn't normally search out spicy food I had no regrets after this experience. The crab fingers were a fun and light way to start things off, just enough to whet the appetite without being heavy. I loved the curry sauce and the chili oil was enough to feel it but not enough to overwhelm the crab or curry. Next was a tuna tartare with more spice, this was really good but probably my least favorite of all the dishes. The biggest surprise for me was the charred cabbage. It was marinated lightly and then seared over flame, and the combination of those two steps made it extremely flavorful and easy to eat. I don't normally think of cabbage as something exciting, but combined with the spices and furikake mushroom curry sauce I'd go back just for this! Absolutely floored my whole party. The main course of pork three ways over dirty rice and greens was a hit, with a lightly tangy mustard sauce and simple, excellent flavors all around. Finally, dessert was a delicious cake with I believe a pumpkin sauce topped with a heavy cream and pumpkin seeds. I'd punch a child just to have that sauce alone, the rest was a bonus.   Most of my group did the wine course, allergies had me under the weather so I had only one glass and a few samples. Everyone agreed the wines paired really well, although feelings were mixed on the necessity of the dessert wine given the dessert was sweet enough. That being said, no one had complaints after the trip and we are eagerly planning our next outing.   The staff was amazing and we felt very well taken care of all night long. My compliments to Lenoir for a wonderful evening!

reviews.author: Jeff C.
reviews.description: Recently went here with a friend for dinner as a visitor to Austin and while the food was good, probably  4/5, I cannot recommend this business as I lost my wallet in between this dinner and a direct drive back to where I was staying.   After retracing our steps and turning the place and car inside out, my wallet could not be found and two days later, none of my cards had been used. However, I did have $300 in cash and a $200 rewards debit card that was in there. Lenoir refused to pick up after multiple calls and messages, which they also refused to return. Once we finally got through, employees denied having it, despite there being only one logical place it could possibly be. So while I had a decent meal, I'm now out almost $800 with the added bonus of having to replace my REAL ID and cards

reviews.author: Lono _.
reviews.description: Our dinner at Lenoir was magical.   We sat outside under a gorgeous tree, adorned with beautiful glass lanterns on a cool, moonlit night drinking bottles of wine and feasting on the chef's choice menu option, while trying not to fill up on one of the best bread plates you will ever experience. Each course was a bonafide gastronomical treat, coupled with unique and delicious wine pairings and curated by an exceptional staff with a level of fine dining service you are unlikely to ever experience in an environment as laid back as Lenoir.   And the desserts were incredible. We ordered them all.  Highly, highly recommend.   We loved it, think of it often and can not wait to return.

reviews.author: Leslie K.
reviews.description: Super cute dining area outside. Very limited parking- we parked off of W Annie St.   We were a party of 6. Only offered the chef's choice menu. There were good and less memorable dishes, but we really enjoyed the atmosphere.

reviews.author: Thomas S.
reviews.description: This place is such a gem. Service is always on point, knowledgeable servers on the wine, pretty solid wine list, limited glass selections tho, but I hate to say it but I recall when the food was equally as good... maybe it's the seasonal menu but it was a bit salty and generally underwhelming... I've had much better at Lenoir. Hoping to see a return of great food... quality of ingredients were on point I think it's the cooks... will still be back. Love y'all

reviews.author: Lauren P.
reviews.description: The outside patio is so cute would recommend going at night for a really romantic vibe. Staff is nice and brings out plates in a timely manner as not to overcrowded the table. My favorite dishes were the crab legs and the yellowfin tartare.

reviews.author: Jennifer L.
reviews.description: We did the prefix menu and it didn't disappoint. The staff are amazing and ambiance outside is charming. Our dishes flowed well and tasted even.

reviews.author: Carmen G.
reviews.description: Lenoir is a cozy outdoor space with delicious food. We came in with 14 people and they accommodated us in the back. We arrived on time and got seated promptly. We had a 5 course meal and only one wasn't to my liking. The char shui was moist and flavored well. I was a little skeptical at first glance but it turned out delicious.   My only gripe was that dinner took 2.5 hours. It cut into our other plans that we had that night. So, if you have a big party, plan accordingly.   PS - Because it's near a creek, please careful of water bugs... As I was cutting the char shui, one crawled across my lap napkin. Imagine a screaming woman frantically waving her knife around as her first initial reaction. Yep, that was me. *Raise hand* I almost stabbed my friend while trying to get it off me.

reviews.author: Justin M.
reviews.description: As I drove up, I was unsure of parking and which building to go to! After I was pointed to the correct destination I found the ambiance to be quaint and inviting with a nice hint of sophistication. A semi-open kitchen with a trendy bar area invited me to relax and enjoy the evening on Lenoirs terms.    I'm a former chef, however when I order beverages, I prefer to tell the staff my interests and let them suggest my vino(s) of the night. My waiter proved to be worth his salt as my 'pearl snap' which was perfect. I'm not a fan of IPAs so this suited my palate. As for the wine, I opted for the matthieu barret from Rhone. I told the waiter I prefer French wines, especially being at a French restaurant and this beverage didn't disappoint. It was a light bodied wine with a great bouquet that kept me guessing what flavors were prominent. The Syrah/Shiraz seemed to have hints of oak and cherries while other flavors I couldn't pick out but in a fun way. Our evening started with the "crab fingers". The crab was cooked perfectly however I there wasn't much meat on them and picking at the claw proved tedious and the chili oil was a bit hot. That said the curry leafe leche was a true delight. We also opted for the tuna tartare which was fresh but the salsa macha again seemed to be aped up on heat. More on the heat aspects later.    As for dinner my date and I both opted for the oxtail tagliatelle. Again, heat was the star of the dish. I then asked the waiter why every dish had such a heat signature and they said it's fusion to the local vibe. To me I can't take heat so it brings the occasion down. That said, there's a true skill in the dish as the oxtail was cooked to perfection. Tender and flavorful while the kale provided a nice flavor contract being sharp to cut the fat from the oxtail. The pasta was al dente and married well with the sauce. Besides the heat, this dish was outstanding! The waiter suggested a desert wine of Malvasia-trebbiano. I wasn't a fan but my date loved it. Also it paired wonderfully with the coffee semifreddo. This desert was classy, filling, not to sweet and a wonderful capper to the evening.   All said, I really enjoyed my experience at Lenoirs and I suggest this establishment to anyone that wants to add flair to a first date while not being pretentious. The food is skillfully crafted, the wait staff knows their restaurant and the ambiance is romantic. An inviting experience not to be missed.

reviews.author: Christine L.
reviews.description: Wow only outdoor seating at this time and food was 4.5 but the ambiance and friendly service bump to a 5 star experience. Go for the HH for 1/2 bottle robes and great mixed drinks the watermelon chiller was pretty and refreshing.  We got the cab franc bottle and was light and paired well with our meals. - HH bread with pimiento was interesting  -HH shrimp boil was different with fresh shrimp and okra and corn and something crunchy on top  - lamb vindaloo was not spicy but tasty and oddly accompanied very well with the sliced watermelon  - mp bass with Goan crab curry was delightful and complex flavors to create a light main entree  Service was so friendly and just stellar and we enjoyed our culinary experience for 2 hours on a Thursday night and in no way felt rushed  Romantic and fun place to be.  Highly recommended!

reviews.author: Shannon H.
reviews.description: The best meal we've had in Austin. We ordered the tasting menu ($58) and 2 bottles of wine.   The tasting menu kept us excited and pleased the whole way through. The opening items (an Amuse bouche of falafel-like crisps with a lovely sauce and a sashimi with a tangy sauce) were so good. Blew us away.   Personally, the third item, gnocchi, was not my favorite. It is made from corn flour, not potato, which is slightly off putting. My friend described it as enchilada in bite form. I liked the spinach.   The steak was amazing. I liked the texture and the taste. It had a lovely chimichurri like sauce with leeks. The cucumber salad bopped too.   Finally, the dessert -- light and pleasing. Highly recommend trying the tasting menu if you come.

reviews.author: Greg K.
reviews.description: While visiting Austin, I chose Lenoir for a romantic vibe with a setting that felt uniquely "Austin." We went with the chef's tasting menu and didn't look back. We received a selection of 5 dishes that we mostly would not have ordered on our own, and we loved each one. Each dish was full of pleasantly surprising flavors and they were all beautifully presented. The tasting menu also left us happily full without being overstuffed.   To go with our meal, we chose a bottle of wine from their ample selection. They also offer a few cocktails, beers, and some wine by the glass, but getting a bottle seems to be the way to go.    Our server, Dustin, was fantastic. He was very willing to hear any and all dietary restrictions or quirks, and was happy to work with the the couple that I mentioned. He was clearly passionate about everything on the menu and his excitement for what we chose showed. He even gave us great tips on places to check out in Austin later that night.   Dining at Lenoir was a highlight during the few days we spent in Austin, the food was phenomenal and the atmosphere was wonderful.

reviews.author: Sharon L.
reviews.description: The tasting menu was really good-- a lovely birthday dinner evening in a beautiful space (located right by a creek, so lots of mosquitos unfortunately).   FOOD: Delicious and thoughtful menu. We did the tasting menu for a birthday, and it took about 2 hours (we're quick eaters, too). They asked very intentionally at the beginning if we had any allergies and dietary restrictions, which was really thoughtful. Slight side note that the plates and serving ware was quite cute, which is just an ancillary sort of plus.  SERVERS: Speedy and really quite nice. They had recommendations, provided bug spray, were knowledgeable about the beverages. No complaints.  AMBIENCE: Currently (Oct 2021) only outdoor seating. It was well-lit and covered overhead. Quite good dinner date spot.   BATHROOMS: Gender neutral bathrooms indoors. It's may be a 50-ft walk to the bathrooms? Two single-person bathrooms. Clean, stocked. No complaints.  PARKING: A few (Like 10ish?) parking spots in a lot, otherwise I think it's street parking.

reviews.author: Katie B.
reviews.description: Noticed they were doing their Chef's Tasting menu (five courses) for only $29 during January so booked a table the last weekend of the special.  The wine patio was a perfect happy hour spot pre-COVID, and so it's no shock that with a few finishing touches like a tent and heaters, it would make for a wonderful dinner experience, too.  Anthony was our server and he was so on top of it all night long. In addition to taking care of the dietary restrictions of some of the group, he also was very generous with the wine pours!  I can thankfully eat everything, but just want to give a hats off to the kitchen for accommodating the two gluten-free diners. They even made a special dessert for a friend that is allergic to eggs!  The menu was pretty stacked with seafood options which made it light but satisfying. I am not a huge oyster fan, but Sweet Home Alabama were theirs tasty! The tuna pappardelle was interesting...someone's hot take was that it reminded them of a more sophisticated tuna casserole. Impressive there was no dairy in the dish but it had a creamy, cheesy texture. My favorite was the seafood stew-esque dish with the delightful bread for dipping.   The $40 wine pairing was a steal! Not only were the pours accompanying each dish full (not a sissy tasting pour), but Anthony would just magically top off our glasses like a vino ninja, so I felt as if I had prob consumed an entire bottle by the end. And, definitely not mad at that!  While the half off special may not be a thing any longer, I still recommend visiting Lenoir for a nice dinner out, with all the precautions in place/being observed.

reviews.author: Jennifer K.
reviews.description: Wow. I wasn't expecting to love this place so much but it was a fantastic experience all around.  The outdoor gravel patio is like sitting in someone's backyard under huge oak trees. They have simple lanterns strung from the tree branches and umbrellas all around. I loved the ambiance.   We ordered the tasting menu and the wine flight. The wine pairings were one of the best I've ever had. I'm not a fan of white wine but the owner picked the best French wines that paired perfectly with each course.   The first course was a hamachi crudo- perfectly light with subtle flavor.  Second course was a green bean salad- this was my favorite of the night. The beans were lightly pickled then charred and served on a yogurt queso fresco sauce- HEAVENLY. I make a mean green bean but theirs was the best I've ever had.  Third course was shrimp and vegetables. This was my least favorite, and it was still amazing.  Fourth course was the char siu and watermelon. Perfectly cooked and the balance of flavors was delicious. I was so full at this point but I still soldiered on.  Last course was ice cream with almond crumble. I'm not a fan of ice cream but this was really good.  Our server Quentin made our experience an unforgettable one. We'll be back for sure.

reviews.author: Leila L.
reviews.description: Partner and I went to Lenoir for a date night. It's been a long time since I've dined here and didn't realize they had this nice spacious beer garden! They are offering 50% off their chef's tasting which is a 5 course tasting. They serve things family style and had an upgrade to a fish dish for an additional $25. Overall the dishes were good, though the beginning dishes were a little spicy and acidic. I very much enjoyed the whole fish that they mostly deboned. Dessert was a flan and churro-esque cookie that was a light way to end the meal.   During COVID it felt safe dining as it was outside and it was well spaced. They do have a covered area which unfortunately we didn't get to sit under. There was some light rain during the meal which they provided umbrellas for, but awkwardly we had to hold it up ourselves. Most tables had an umbrella but ours didn't.

reviews.author: Karen S.
reviews.description: We were so disappointed in this restaurant. No cocktails, only beer and wine. We did the tasting menu and it was awful. One dish was just cabbage.
