Nothing else....a 1/4 head of cabbage. The sauce with it was good but who wants to eat just cabbage for a dish? The wine was so bad - even on its own but none of it paired with the dishes. We're coming from SF so we're spoiled but at least match the wine with the flavors of the dishes. We were still hungry after the tasting menu and ordered the tagliatelle - which was amazing. All in all, it was a letdown and we will not be back.

reviews.author: Mark A.
reviews.description: Service: 5 Atmosphere: 4 Food: 3.5  Came for the January chef's tasting menu ($29) outside. Been wanting to try this place for some time so there were definitely some expectations after having seen and heard about it. Overall it was a good experience, but the food was not as great as expected.   Started with an oyster on the half shell - how can you go wrong with that? They did it perfectly.   Next up was a winter salad, which had beets, roasted butternut squash, some tomatoes, and beer infused peanuts; the peanuts were delicious, and the squash was nice; I didn't care too much for the texture but the flavor overall was decent and fresh.   A cooked "salad" was next with roasted broccoli, mushrooms, walnuts, and grapefruit, with melted taleggio cheese on the bottom. Interesting mix of flavors and textures, saltiness of the cheese and bitterness of the grapefruit were different, but the broccoli were very large pieces. Nice to try but probably not something I'd eat often.   The main dish was a baked fish with shrimp, arugula, and sliced radish in a tomato soup. TBH it was kind of underwhelming for the main dish and a bit too bitter and salty for my taste. The shrimp and fish were nicely cooked but not my favorite on flavor.   For dessert was a coconut cake, and a rice pudding. I didn't try the cake, and I know that rice pudding should be al dente, but this was a bit undercooked. It was nice of them to whip it up since I couldn't have the cake due to gluten, but it just wasn't that great unfortunately.

reviews.author: Siia K.
reviews.description: This is a nice place with date vibes. The food was great , me and my partner decided to do chefs menu, pescatarian version. Started with hush puppies, strawberry aguachile, avocado tostada, large crab stuffed fish and citron cake.   One thing I'm confused about still is if we got one order of each or was it two servings as everything came in 1 plate for 2 people to share.   We additionally had Pullman bread and peach, strawberry cocktails. Everything was great.   Advice: ask if you opt for chef menu do you get 1 or 2 serving of the item when 2 people are eating. I believe we got only 1 per item to share in which case you are better off ordering from menu yourself rather than chefs choice.

reviews.author: Shari D.
reviews.description: Wow! We had such a lovely time at Lenoir! I was slightly worried when we arrived when the host told us that our table was not available and it might be 30 minutes. I realize they can't remove patrons! But, we didn't have to wait that long and they seated us in a little area while we waited and gave us a pitcher of water (and two glasses!).  We opted for the the chef's menu and wine pairing. We really, really enjoyed it. the ambiance was specular, outside under the Live Oak trees and lanterns. The servers were excellent. We will be back to try other items on the menu. Honestly, we felt like we were on vacation.

name: Cover 2
accommodations: Best nights on Monday, Tuesday, Friday

reviews.author: Charlotte B.
reviews.description: We had a great time here with friends! Great waiter! We enjoyed our 2-22-22 at Cover 2!!

reviews.author: Steve B.
reviews.description: When Chief was here bar service was stellar. I have been coming here since it opened. Now bar service is lackadaisical, inattentive, distracted and sub standard.   I like this place. The food is good the beer selection is passable and I can watch any sporting event live or read a book or both. But these two are killing the place for me. Ordered a beer and sat for 20 minutes with no one asking me if I might like to order food. Had to literally flag someone down to order a meal. That is not how this business works.   Wearing a mask under your chin until you walk up to a customer is not how this works either. And the tall one did that all night long. Now looking for a different place to spend an evening eating a meal and enjoying a beer.

reviews.author: Mark H.
reviews.description: Horrible service today.  Sat in a booth for over 15 minutes while others came in after me and got their orders taken. Person who had seated me brought me a drink then nothing. Though a minimum of 5 different servers were standing right next to my booth.  I understand a restaurant may be short staffed but limit your seating if you cannot handle it.  I've had the similar experience here multiple times.  Last time I patron any of the restaurants in this local chain.  And "the remedy" after speaking to a manager when I asked for the check for my half drank coke...oh no need to pay for the coke.  FAIL ALL AROUND!

reviews.author: Asha T.
reviews.description: Literally the first visit we had and this last visit were like night and day.   If I EVER come back here it's gonna have to be at the bar. Apparently you get service that way.   Literally just walked in and got sat, was busy due to a UT game no problem. And then we just sit and wait and wait and wait. The supposed waiter for our area literally helped everyone around us and kept skipping us. Idk if it was because we didn't have UT gear on or I was basically the only black person there at the time but ppl that just walked in the door got greeted before we did.   We just got up and left. There's no way the dude in the area didn't know we had not been helped as he purposely kept ignoring the table and was serving EVERYONE around us.   Terrible service.

reviews.author: Missy J.
reviews.description: Love this place! They are so accommodating, even in football Sunday!!! The servers are polite and the manger runs around and works just as hard (love seeing that) all the food I've had is amazing. Great specials daily and weekly, worth a stop anytime but especially for football!  Not pictured but worth it: chili and eggs, giant pretzels, wings and shrimp pasta!!!

reviews.author: Sabrina I.
reviews.description: Not usually a Sports Bar fan but as they go this place was nice. The service was great, tables clean and wings were tasty.

reviews.author: Chantel C.
reviews.description: We've lived by cover 2 going on 2 years now and decided Saturday to finally check it out. (Previously came here and was seated but waitress seemed like she was just so busy she couldnt get to us and the vibe was just off? so we walked out) but let me tell you I sure am glad we gave it a second shot because the food was absolutely amazing and service was even better! Can't remember our waiters name but he was above and beyond. Everything came out quickly and tasted perfect... the environment was a plus! We willl back yall :)

reviews.author: David A.
reviews.description: Had dinner with my son Tuesday night. The service was incredible and I wish I remembered the servers name to give her kudos .  We ordered the trilogy appetizers and it's always good. We split the chopped chicken salad and brick chicken sandwich.  Way too much food and delicious! The Salas came out late, so they discounted the bill. Will be going back for March madness!

reviews.author: Bonsai B.
reviews.description: If I could do 0 stars I would... Sunday at 1500 and it's not too busy.. not sure who out waiters name was because he didn't introduce himself, so we will call him island boy.. black island boy hair cut doesn't give a care in the world...He ignores the tables, continually walking by spaced out.. didn't get any service unless i asked. I even had to ask for the check! Why does he even work, just go home and live off unemployment.. he is the face of this bar/restaurant and I won't be back.. good riddance!

reviews.author: Caryn C.
reviews.description: Horrible service and even worse food. The only thing half way decent were the fries and they were cold. The hostess was condescending and sat us in a high traffic area in front on a tv that a group of 6 were watching and yelling. We had to ask to be moved. We had to ask for our waiter to serve us. We went at a time that was not considered busy or I would've understood. We had to ask multiple times for drink refills. We will not be back.

reviews.author: David C.
reviews.description: Goofy loser waiter ignored us because he's racist. Type who says "canadians". You're black and racist toward other black people. Living like that's not good for your soul you rotten little jerk.  Decent game bar if you sit at the bar. Wings were aight

reviews.author: Colette B.
reviews.description: I never thought I would describe a restaurant as "disgusting", I have a lot of respect for food .... But our experience was just that! We fancied burgers and thought that a sports bar would serve delicious burgers! What a mistaken idea!! We started with a cup of onion soup: it was edible, not delicious, a little strong on the acid side, but ok. Then came the burgers: a 3mm leather sole burnt to death!! Awful! Horrible!! My husband had to leave the restaurant and was sick in the car park!! The fries were smothered in fat... yak! The waiter on the other hand was a sweetheart!! VERY professional! When I mentioned it wasn't good, he immediately offered to comp them, which he did! I am tempted to say that he had been through a similar situation before, maybe several times!!! He didn't hesitate and didn't offer an alternative: he KNEW the food was bad! Shame on management to allow this to happen! It's a Burger after all, and we are in Texas!! Land of Beef!! Cover 2, I'm afraid you will not see us again!!

reviews.author: Robert F.
reviews.description: Cover 2 off research always hits the spot it's got the best shoe string fries I can't seem to find anywhere else in Austin . Even though they may just be French fries and not a main course there is something so satisfying about them . My favorite dish is the buffalo chicken sliders , I personally get the blue cheese on the side with ranch to dip . These are amazing and have the perfect thin not to thick cut of chicken that's battered nice and crispy but stays juicy tossed in tangy but not spicy buffalo sauce. The bread doesn't take over the sandwich so that's not all you get full on and is super soft . They also have a buffalo chicken salad that has a good amount of chicken if your not wanting a sandwich but need to cure that buffalo craving . I've only had the burgers other than that and they are equally delicious again especially with those shoe string fries that are always crispy .  This place is relaxed and a good place to have a beer while you cool off after a long day or just dining with the family.  The staff is pleasant and the deserts are huge . Well at least the brownie is . If you like bars and burgers are in the area and don't know what to eat stop in and try the buffalo sandwich it's my go to and recommendation for cover 2 . If not that than at least grab a beer and some shoe string fries and relax a minute .

reviews.author: Ashley N.
reviews.description: My husband and I go here pretty often as it is super close to our place and we love their food! They have a great menu and our favorite thing is the fried pickles! They have rotating specials, soups and flatbreads. The servers and staff are all very friendly and hard workers. I also bring friends here and they have all loved it as well! They have great deals on their happy hour and a good variety of beers and wine that are not crazy overpriced. I have loved everything I have ordered and they have great portion sizes! We usually come for lunch or dinner, but we recently had brunch which was also fabulous. I had the chilaquiles and they were amazing! The portions are also super generous so I've left with leftovers multiple times. If you're a sports person, they have a ton of really nice TVs and always have games on. I am honestly so happy this place is close by and will continue giving them my business! I would also like to add that like many places these days, they have also experienced shortages with staff and when that happens, we have seen the managers out on the floor helping out and also working their butte off! This restaurant has amazing food, service and is such a great place to have a nice dinner, go hang with friends or just pop by for a drink! Thanks for rocking it Cover 2! Oh and the Round Rock location is also awesome as I went their with a group of work friends once they also had excellent service and the food was equally as delicious!!!

reviews.author: Shelby L.
reviews.description: We always have a good time here, especially during football season. The food is above average. Bar seating can be limited since everyone wants to sit up there.

reviews.author: Andrew M.
reviews.description: So today was my first day in Austin. I searched Yelp. I drove by a number of joints. I even walked through Whole Foods. Alas nothing struck my fancy. Heading back, I swung into Cover2. I'm glad I did.  The greeting, Silvana as server, and the whole support staff weekend terrific.  I started with a cup of French onion soup. It was just a tad too sweet for my taste. I'm also a purist in looking for a single crouton under the  hood (of cheese).   The fries and prime rib sandwich were a pleasant surprise. I will typically keg wrestle you to keep the horseradish sauce off the plate. The sauce here actually was mellowed very nicely and didn't fight the meat. The fries were great! Nothing more need be said.   This was a terrific first meal in a new town. This might become my extended kitchen it was that solid of aa performance!

reviews.author: Robby T.
reviews.description: Normally this place is one of my favorites.   Today come I. At 220pm.  Semi full, wait up front for 5 mins to be greeted.    Then wait 15 mins for a drink.   Only ordered 2 appetizers and wait 35 mins for those.   Mention this to the server and she has a near come apart about being short staffed and it is what it is.     Very disappointing, until manager comes by.   Would give Miranda a raise.   Very nice and helpful.

reviews.author: Mia L.
reviews.description: My boyfriend and I visit this place the other day and wow! It was so good- we got the giant pretzel to start. When they say giant- boy do they mean it. They're drinks are also very very good and the server was very polite as well.

reviews.author: Pamela M.
reviews.description: Would have been nice to actually eat. Ordered our drinks then watched as our server waited on everyone (even those seated after us) without taking our order. I try to give servers the benefit of the doubt cause maybe they're short staffed but after multiple issues with the same server and seeing tables sat after us putting their orders in and getting their food, I'm getting disappointed with the downhill service at Cover 2.   We received our drinks at 6:45 pm. Left money on the table for the drinks and left the establishment at 7:20 pm after our server ghosted us with empty drinks and no food order placed.

reviews.author: Matt S.
reviews.description: Great place to come watch sports, drink, and eat some food.  Staff here was nice and friendly. food was hot and fresh, I had the franks red hot chicken sliders that they had as a special and was good.  Flatbreads were split between the table and were good as well.   Drink prices are not that bad.  Nice walk to our room from here and was convenient.

reviews.author: Janet B.
reviews.description: We had such a good time at this place! It feels like a neighborhood pub filled with friends. The staff is incredibly friendly and so attentive. We never had an empty water (or beer) glass, and they were just plain nice. With so many restaurants struggling with staff and service, it was a welcome change. The food was top notch as well! I had the brunch burger and my hubby had the mango habanero wings, and we split the queso and chips. (And by the way, their queso was hella good, especially considering they aren't a Tex-mex restaurant!)

reviews.author: Carole H.
reviews.description: Good food and beer galore on tap, a must for Austinites and newcomers.

reviews.author: Cory O.
reviews.description: This was a nice place to stop on my way home from work. They has a ton of beers on tap and the bartenders were really nice about letting me try different ones before I ordered. Never had the food, but the atmosphere and staff is great!

reviews.author: Juliet J.
reviews.description: Me and my 3 year old were feeling hangry on a Sunday. I didn't want to cook, so we ordered for pick up from Chow Hound. I know there is a no children policy on the weekend. Waitress gave us water while we waited outside. Food was absolutely delicious and worth the extra 10 minute wait. We got the chicken and waffles and sunny side up eggs and home fries.

reviews.author: Joe D.
reviews.description: this has been my neighborhood to go place. My review would have been 4 star originally. I dined there yesterday after not visiting for maybe 2 weeks.    One reason i loved the place was their unique 'curly' french fries. Yesterday, i was quite surprised to see they switched the curly fries to the scoop shape that their sister pub, Brick, serves. Meh. Friends from north Austin would often ask when I was going to Vincent because they liked the curly fries. My friend with me yesterday, said the same thing, whaddup?  i know it's not earth shaking but it made Vincent stand out for me. BUMMER

reviews.author: Laura F.
reviews.description: Today we wandered into this pub while waiting for an appointment. It was lively with good cocktails and snacks. Their frozen margaritas were smooth and well-blended. I had two different vodka specialty cocktails that were well-crafted. We also ordered the. Shrimp and Poblano Quesadillas which were smoky, spicy and hit the spot.

reviews.author: Dayna M.
reviews.description: Recently visited this venue for the 1st time - we are always happy to support bartenders or servers during this pandemic. As always we left 25%. The young lady was super nice, kind, helpful and provided info about the menu and venue. We will definitely return!

reviews.author: Jennifer M.
reviews.description: If you're looking for a chill spot with better then average base food.... this is your place. It's a very casual vibe with a great drink selection. The only downfall is the lack of seating. This is not a big place and it stays pretty crowded. The food I've had so far has been pretty good for bar food. It's definitely a step up!

reviews.author: Steve A.
reviews.description: I like this place because of the proximity. The service is slow, but seems to have gotten better. They have a limited menu unfortunately, but nevertheless the food good. The wings are delicious. They were tender and well sauced. Nachos are  crispy and put together. All in all, this place is alright

reviews.author: Glen L.
reviews.description: Been several times. Service is normally slow, although today was a bit better. Overcharged on tab today because waitress lost track of tabs. Got cut off because we were a large group that had a large tab even though no one showed signs of having been over served. Don't plan on returning at this point. Wish something close had a late kitchen, but at this point I'd rather have Top Ramen than go here to get food after 10. Slow service and management that pretends to have people's best interests makes it a no. Food is good, but management that seems judgy makes it a no.

reviews.author: Deanna R.
reviews.description: Loved the vibe of this place. Had their Brodie Smash and Sierra Shandy -- Both great. Bartenders amazing and all ages present.

reviews.author: Brandon K.
reviews.description: Obviously, this is a sports bar--they have a terrific selection of brews and the atmosphere is fun. Service is hit or miss; the first time I came here and asked for a booth, the bartender became extremely frustrated when explaining their seating policy. They were busy, but still.  The food. It's good but not great--also, it's a sports bar, so it's on par with that cuisine. It's close to our house and nice enough, so we'll keep coming back for a beer and a game.

reviews.author: Michael L.
reviews.description: Total dump. Food was average at best. Added bonus: regulars who do not want  you there, and who are pretty clear about that.

reviews.author: Myra E.
reviews.description: This bar has the best food ever!  The drinks are so tasty, very comfy place, but the menu is really good. Highly recommend. Nice wait staff too and prices are great. Love this place.

reviews.author: Kevin H.
reviews.description: So it's been 6 months or so since this place opened, I've been a handful of times since and thought I'd write a quick update. My first review came shortly after opening and we all know it takes time to get things in a good rhythm and sorted out, especially in the restaurant business.  The menu was a little odd to me when opening but has since won me over. They often have specials and have even opened up for lunch. Last weekend they had a crawfish boil at a very reasonable $7 lbs. The beer selection seems to be somewhat static, fortunately they have several to choose from, but it would be nice to have several rotating handles, given we are in one of the best craft beer markets around. I was a bit surprised to learn a local Pinthouse beer was $7. It's only a dollar more than at the brewery, but still, this isn't LA.  All and all, I like the direction this place is going, nice outdoor, dog friendly patio, food specials and hopefully some new local beers on my next visit.

reviews.author: Harley D.
reviews.description: Food was good. Staff nice. However my waitress was more concerned with flirting with the boys next to me than serving. Ended up closing my tab with her and just opening at the bar. I think maybe the manager saw it and called her out but still. Service is what sets a place apart. My service here was definitely not up to par at this night.

reviews.author: Kiara D.
reviews.description: This place feels like home to me! Cozy bar, with tasty food and always great company.

reviews.author: Alysha M.
reviews.description: Decent food, great beer and wine selection. My only complaint honestly? Both times I've been there wasn't much seating available! It gets super packed! I guess because we've been wanting a bar in this area for a long time, people are really excited ha ha but I wish there was more seating!

reviews.author: Billy V.
reviews.description: I have been having a tough time finding a place to enjoy an adult beverage and watch sporting events in Austin. Most places are these large indoor/outdoor spaces with music and food trucks. Or located downtown. Or you have to drive 30 plus minutes.  Vincent's Sports Pub is just down the road from home. It has plenty of TVs. I mean plenty. You can stand or sit anywhere in this pub and watch your game. AWESOME. A lot of thought was done here with the placement of TVs.  Service outstanding. A very friendly and nice Team. You like beer. You have choices. Lots of drafts and bottled beer choices. Great feel. Very welcoming pub. Plenty of tables. Great looking bar. Nice crowd. No jerks or muscle beer dudes. I judge a place if my wife would feel comfortable alone. Vincent's Sports Pub passes with high marks.  The food is very tasty. I had most of the apps and was very happy. Tasty. Great to share. Shrimp dish very good. Crispy. Wings have some pull and good. Nice pub menu. A scratch kitchen. I did not feel or taste it was a frozen product.  Vincent's Sports Pub will definitely be my go-to pub for drinks and sports on TV. It has a nice welcoming feel. Combination of design of the restaurant, the bar placement, the tables, food and most importantly the staff.  Plenty of parking. CC friendly. Union payment option.

reviews.author: Amanda K.
reviews.description: I met my friend here for a HH and to catch up on life. Vincent's sports pub just opened recently inside a small shopping center that includes a nail place, a dental office, and a cosmetic store.   We met up on Wednesday around 4ish and the place was quite busy. I found a table near the bar and my friend showed up shortly after. The waitress handed us the drinks and cocktail menu for our viewing pleasure. The drink menu on the back included 31 drinks on tap to include cider options.  My friend and I ordered our drinks and those were a little slow coming out to us both times. My friend had a cocktail so that is more than likely the reason plus it was busy inside the bar. We didn't order any food but what I saw did look pretty good.   Overall I really liked this place and reminded me of place that I have been to down in Buda. Everyone seemed friendly and it was a down to earth bar. I foresee myself coming here again in the future.

name: Billy's on Burnet
accommodations: Best nights on Monday, Friday, Saturday

reviews.author: Tim D.
reviews.description: Great place with some really delicious food! We found this on a list of best burgers in Austin so put it on our radar. My wife isn't the biggest burger lover, she has to be in a very specific mood so it surprised me when she said she wanted to go give it a try.  The inside is pretty dark (it is a bar though so can't really fault them for that.) Have a small patio outside which is dog friendly. Though it is right off Burnet, the parking lot is a bit tricky and can easily be missed, especially during high traffic times.  The guy behind the bar was pretty friendly, especially when we told him how we found out about the place. We went during lunch so we kept it simple. Order of cheese curds and I got the Cobra burger and my wife got a basic beacon cheese burger.  First, these are by FAR my favorite cheese curds in town. The breading has a bit of a spicy kick to it that really makes them even more delicious. The burgers come with fries and a pickle spear. It was juicy and perfectly cooked. Great flavor and the Cobra burger has a good kick to it. My wife has literally been asking me to go back for the last 2 weeks so we went again today and it was all just as good as the first time. So check them out, just be cautious about the parking.

reviews.author: C C.
reviews.description: Love this place.  We were looking for a place to watch the UT game and have a bite to eat Saturday morning and stumbled into Billy's. Great beer selection included our current go-to Electric Jellyfish.   For food we started with the cheese curds. Incredibly crispy. I'd put theirs up against Any I've had in Wisconsin.  Finished up with a cheeseburger and fries. Both were Shockingly good. Not just good for a dive bar, flat out legit.   Can't wait to go back.

reviews.author: Mark F.
reviews.description: In the past we haven't had the greatest of experiences here but we decided to give them another try. It was  a very different experience this time and one that will keep us coming back. Our bartendereress, Mikey, was the sweetest person we've met in ages. She was extremely cheerful, very accommodating, and always kept a good close eye on this. We watched her interaction with other customers as well, and she always took such good care of everyone as if she had known them for a hundred years. The food menu is quite extensive, and everything we've had in the last few trips has been really good. Good Old Pub grub! The beer selection doesn't change as often as we'd like but at least they do keep some really good local or Regional beers on tap. Would like to see a few more selections switching in and out occasionally now they were hooked. Tonight we came in we weren't really too hungry but we needed to eat something so she suggested the chicken Philly which she was able to have split for us. It was actually very very good. We will definitely be regulars here. It's amazing what a bartender can do to bring business in, our last battle experience there was a bartender who seem to have a  snarky attitude, very opposite from Mikey!

reviews.author: Roland D.
reviews.description: Review for Billy's on Burnett  TLDR: a perfectly above average dive bar  For the food: I ordered Billy's "The Shults" burger. The wait time for the food was perfectly reasonable. The burger was well seasoned and well constructed. The only real complaint was the pickle on top was rather small and lackluster. The fries were fresh and crisp, and also well seasoned.   For the drinks: Billy's offers a more than ample beer menu with the common stock, as well as a decent selection of local breweries.   For the atmosphere: Billy's certainly fronts the image of a dive bar, and does so very well. Dimly lit, slightly crowded, and a prominent bar situated directly across the entrance all help establish the environment they want. The patio in the side is well shaded, and has much less road noise than I initially expected. The only complaint is the flies on the patio are out of control.   For the value: Given the location, I can't really blame Billy's for the prices. I feel like I payed a bit more than what I would have wanted for what I got, however, that feeling isn't uncommon in Austin in general, and especially Burnet.   Everything else: there's virtually no parking at Billy's, however there is some street parking within easy walking distance. And yet again, the flies on the patio are on another level.

reviews.author: Susie H.
reviews.description: Good food, quick service, but only have beer and wine. We didn't stay to see what it was a good packer crowd. Lots of packer ppl probably coming but we left because of drink choices.

reviews.author: Jason B.
reviews.description: Really good burgers and sammich's.  Need a beer and a burger then look no further. Support local!!

reviews.author: Mike C.
reviews.description: Austin is at Stage 5 (the highest stage for contracting Covid-19) and Billy's continues to get my order RIGHT!!! They offer curbside delivery and walked my order out to me at my pickup time.  Once I got home I discovered they did everything I asked... Grilled onions-yes Lettuce, tomato, and Mayo on side-yes Burger cut in half-yes  The folks at Billy's pay attention to detail and have earned 5 stars and I will absolutely keep going back!  Thank you to the staff at Billy's for getting it RIGHT!

reviews.author: Bill M.
reviews.description: Billy likes Billy's on Burnet. It's a dark, divy beer bar with a solid food menu including many fried appetizers, from wings to okra, and myriad burger and sandwich options, even hot dogs and an entire column of veg-head choices. I myself enjoy the indulgence of a cobra burger w/fries and a fine Texas craft beer, of which there are many. The burgers are pretty darn good and the beer is cold, so what else do you need? Entertainment? Billy's has you covered with a pool table, darts, several TVs and some arcade games in the back. Other notes: there is a patio and a small parking lot, but there is street parking nearby.

reviews.author: Tom P.
reviews.description: Aaron Franklin has long touted Billy's on Burnet as a superior restaurant for the best in burgers, and once again, he is correct about food.  The folks at Billy's did confirm that the James Beard Award winner is a regular.  The menu's, order source and pickup is at the bar.  We were clearly the only "non-regulars" there that day.  But, we were warmly greeted and walked through the extensive menu of burgers, sandwiches, and yes, beer options.  We will definitely be backed to try many of the other options.  The prices were very reasonable as fries come with the burgers.  The burgers were delicious, juicy and HUGE.  The burgers are served open faced.  If you like to cut your sandwich in half, the basket makes this a bit difficult.  The only downside, I gained a pound.  There is plenty of parking, the inside is much larger than we expected, and yes, it is a classic dive.

reviews.author: Auntie P.
reviews.description: Very disappointed by our experience for takeout tonight. My husband wanted a patty melt and I wanted a club sandwich. The online ordering and curbside pickup were easy and user friendly. The food, specifically my club was a big let down. I was expecting a traditional triple decker on toast style club. It was on a hoagie and even worse, there was a dark hair in the lettuce on my sandwich. Needless to say, lost my appetite after that, I tossed it. I added, in advance a 25% gratuity because that's how it works ordering curbside and during COVID19 I've been wanting to support local businesses and their staff. Won't be ordering takeout again.

reviews.author: Benson C.
reviews.description: I went to Billy's for the first and last time on Sunday afternoon. They said they allowed dogs on their patio, so I figured I'd bring my well trained 3 year old pit/bulldog mix. Everything was great for 45 minutes. My dog met 3 other dogs and got some puppy rubs from about 5 patrons on the patio, and then everything changed in the blink of an eye.   An intoxicated man holding his toy dog stepped up onto the patio and immediately zoned in on mine. His dog growled at mine while my dog whined and wagged her tail because she just wanted to meet another dog. The intoxicated man sternly asked me if she was a rescue to which I replied "no, I've had her since she was six weeks old." To which he replied "Your dog is aggressive." I told him he was aggressive and he went all in and said "if yOur dog touches my dog, I will slit it's throat." This quickly turned into a heated altercation where I knew something bad was going to happen if I stayed, so I removed myself from the situation.  I went into the bar to let them know that there was a disgruntled patron out on the patio that threatened to slit my dog's throat and the bartender asked who it was. I pointed him out through the window and she said "Oh. He's a regular, that's so weird, he never acts like that....." and just shrugged.  As soon as I took one step out the door, this regular of yours, Stefan, got right back in my face, chest bumping  me, trying to rile me up by calling me insults and slurs. He went over the top and came out with the statement "I can't wait for you to throw the first punch, so I can sue the shit out of you."  I'm a General Manager of another local restaurant and I understand the value of a regular customer, but sometimes if a regular oversteps their boundaries they need to be handled. Y'all are an establishment that's main priority is providing a safe environment for ALL of your customers, not just your regulars. Y'all could have prevented this whole situation from escalating and chose not to. I'm honestly more disappointed in your staff than I am with the situation with Stefan.  Out of my four years here, this was the worst Austin experience I've ever had. You guaranteed the fact that my friend and I will never return to be a potential regular for you because we shouldn't have to question our safety.

reviews.author: Laura O.
reviews.description: You will not regret this burger at all! I hadn't been here in a long time, and it was sooo good. The burger was juicy, and just the right size. The bun was soft and fresh. The burger and fries were piping hot. Fries were well seasoned. I feel like I've found an Austin treasure!

reviews.author: Ashley V.
reviews.description: I was very let down by my experience here. My friends raved how good this place was.   I walked up to the bar and explained it was my first time here and how did it work. The two people behind the bar, a heavily tattooed dude and a middle aged lady, were less than hospitable. I forget his exact words but something along the lines of what you see is what you get. I was waiting for my friend and just wanted to get a starter while I waited. I ordered the chili cheese fries. Lady says no, we don't have that bc of the water boil issue. I said ok. I asked if they just weren't doing appetizers. She said they were only doing fried things. (Correct me if I'm wrong but fries are fried, right?)  I said can I get queso and chips? - no.  Mmm ok can I get a blue moon- no.  I made a joke at this point bc it was awkward and like what the hell. I said I'm really striking out here. She said they had something similar and went to get it. Then this guy standing next to me orders chips and queso from the dude bartender. When the lady brought me my beer back I mentioned this and she freaked out on the dude bartender. I ruined the other guys opportunity to get queso and they made him order something else. Oops. Then I hesitantly asked if I could get frito pie. Finally I got a yes. But that yes makes no sense. I couldn't get chili cheese fries but I could get chili and cheese on Fritos? I walked away confused and put off.   My friend showed up and we decided to split a burger, we didn't even want to ask the employees what they recommended because of their foul, unhelpful, annoyed attitudes. Even my friend was like what the actual F. They were straight rude. We ordered a burger. The bun was soft and that's about it. Nothing special at all. Food was a 2, service was a 0 so as much as I hate to leave reviews like these, they get an overall 1.   Customer service, a smile, a friendly demeanor go a LONG way. Won't be giving this place a 2nd Chance.

reviews.author: Dao T.
reviews.description: This is a little hole in the wall bar/ restaurant but I love it! They have an outdoor patio if you want to bring your fur baby. We ordered the Uptown Burgers and it was delicious. The size and the fixings was perfect for the price and was reasonable. A sweet marmalade, avocados and bleu cheese - #nomnomnom  If you're looking for great burgers and beers, I recommend visiting Billy's!

reviews.author: Melissa D.
reviews.description: This is a good spot for trivia and food. Limited parking, so navigate yourself to Lynnwood to find a street spot. Service was really fast, even when all the trivia people arrived/ ordered all at once. If you are coming for trivia/ an event, you need to get there really early for a table. If you are coming to just hang out, double check that there is not trivia/ an event that day. A few folks walked in, saw all of the tables packed and left.   Food reviews!  -Veggie burger: solid patty, hefty amount of avocado. Not the most interesting veggie burger, but definitely solid.  -Turkey Rueben: yum, devoured quickly -Chili cheese fries: Also yum, also devoured quickly. An excellent topping to fry ratio.  -Roast beef sandwich: The person who ordered this said it was good, but wasn't going to order it again. Said it was a little too greasy/ soggy.  - Fries: They are really well seasoned but they are also really unevenly cooked. One fry is perfect, the next one seemed almost raw.

reviews.author: Cassie C.
reviews.description: Had always wanted to try this place and I'm so glad we did. Burger was amazing and the fries were too!

reviews.author: Danny B.
reviews.description: My favorite neighborhood bar, grille. Excellent food, wings, burgers, especially the ruben

reviews.author: Paul R.
reviews.description: Why Billy's? Let us count the ways; great burgers, daily drink specials, a pool table, cool patio, eclectic music selection (blues to beach boys), and TVs for sports. How bout two bucks off any Real Ale draft on Thursdays. Here take your 4 stars Billy. Minus one star for being a Green Bay Packer Bar (kidding).   Billy's is a chill neighborhood bar to grab a bite and have a beer or two. Their draft selection is awesome with all your favorites plus a few that will surprise you. Checkout their burger menu it's pretty extensive. I opted for a boring cheeseburger with fries. Burger was cooked perfectly and served on a bed of spiced up fries and it paired perfectly with my pint of Real Ale amber. Will definitely return but not on a Packer game day (Go Pats!).

reviews.author: Cynthia N.
reviews.description: So I know this place is supposed to be about beer and a good pub to come watch sports or something but I don't care about beer or sports. What I do care about is The Uptown Burger.  Have you ever watched that one How I Met Your Mother episode where Marshall spends the whole episode looking for that one spot where he had the best burger of his life? Well, The Uptown Burger is that burger for me. LOL I came here on a whim just to meet up with my cousin and I was hungry so I ordered a burger at this lowkey spot not expecting much however, this burger blew my mind! I forgot what this place was called so I can have that burger again and just found it. I don't really love the other burgers here but I'm telling you, ORDER THE UPTOWN BURGER

reviews.author: Patricia W.
reviews.description: This is my place. 1.8 miles from my house. Burgers are good and they have food for a vegetarian too! Beer is always cold. Service is friendly. It's a little dive burger and beer bar with charm. What more could you ask for? It's a meet up after work on a weekday joint. It's a watch the game together joint. It's a just wanna eat fried food a chill with a beer type of place. It's not fancy. If you want fancy then don't head to Billy's. Billy's is keeping it real!

name: Salt Traders Coastal Cooking
accommodations: Best nights on Monday, Thursday, Saturday

reviews.author: Gill S.
reviews.description: Round Rock struck gold with having this place open their second location here. In a sea of mediocrity surrounding this business ground, lies a place that offers not only fresh seafood, but actually chef driven concoctions that taste good! The environment has the ability to feel casual and formal at the same time. We couldn't score a table as a walk in, but they do have community tables which we ended up having to ourselves as a group of four. Our server had the memory of an elephant and had a way of elegantly displaying all the ingredients and preparations of any dish in question without feeling like he's reading a script. I ordered quite a bit and got to sample a generous variety of items.   They have a modest selection of raw oysters, with almost all of them being from the east coast and residing from PEI. I imagine this has to do more with what their distributors can get their hands on, but I'm gonna guess they mostly stick to east coast oysters.   The crab fried rice doesn't look like anything special, but goddamn is this good! They use huge chunks of crab meat! The rice was fluffy, buttery, and the black garlic was a nice touch. I like that this isnt a mountain of a dish but rather an appetizer. Absolutely worth getting.   The Tuna tartare stack was much better than anything I imagined! Avocado slices on the bottom are aesthetically pleasing, but are an annoyance when your sharing among friends and don't want to destroy the structure of the stack to divide up the slices.  The peel and eat shrimp were my least favorite part of the meal. I really couldn't taste much of a shrimp flavor. You had to use the cocktail sauce in order to taste anything. Perhaps they didn't get the best batch in from their distributor, but I expect fresh shrimp to have more flavor than my ice water.   The Snapper collard was not exactly what I was expecting, so removing my expectations, it was good for what it was. I thought I was getting Hamachi Kama. What they serve is the whole collar of a snapper, breaded and deep fried. The meat off the jowls (if you can classify it as that) was flaky soft and juicy. The breading is reminiscing of a typical fish fry. It was good, but for my personal preference, its not something Id go out of my way to order.  They offer some good guacamole. They give you what seems like three whole avocados worth in the bowl. The chips they provide do taste good, but they have terrible structure for the thick guacamole you're attempting to scoop up. I ended up having to use a spoon to distribute the guac on any chip I ate.   Bbq shrimp was not at all what I was expecting. Yes the shrimp itself was good, but the sauce they use in it was a umami explosion of flavor. I could drank a gallon of that stuff. I keep the plate and sopped up as much sauce as I could with the grilled bread they provided.   Ceviche tostada was excellent. Well dressed, plenty of meat, plenty of veggies, and full of flavor. They give you two small tostadas, rather than one large chip.    The bread and butter was ok, but I personally think the bread was a little tough. I do like that it was sourdough and could smell it. The whipped butter is standard and nothing to comment on.   I didn't order any of their cocktails, since none of them interested me, but my friends told me they make well concocted drinks.  While the experience itself had some tiny missteps, it would be a misrepresentation not to give this place glowing accolades, especially considering the other options nearby.

reviews.author: Patrick J.
reviews.description: I came across Salt Traders while looking for some good eats in the Round Rock area and after eating there I felt the experience was underwhelming. The food wasn't bad, but not as good as I was expecting. My fish and shrimp platter had pretty decent flavor but barely had much shrimp or fries.   The grilled oysters were the biggest highlight of my experience here. I enjoyed those more than I thought I would and would recommend ordering them as a starter. I am assuming they don't use the gulf oysters that they serve for these because the texture, size, and flavor felt pretty different.

reviews.author: Priscila M.
reviews.description: We were headed to IKEA and decided to have lunch nearby. I was able to convince my husband to try something new and he is very thankful for that  It was past 1pm on a Friday and this place was already packed. The decor is pretty nice. It has this coastal vibe that immediately transports you to the shore.  I asked for a gluten free menu and they do have one! Win!  Right away our server brought us the smoked salmon sampler. For my husband with chips, for me with a cucumber as I'm gf. I ordered the clam chowda and it was simply AMAZING. The best one I have eva had! It is very creamy, a bit on the salty side which is never a problem for me, the clam wasn't chewy and the bacon was a great addition. The leeks just added a bit more flavor to that. It's perfect. I would highly recommend you try it.  For mains my husband went with the fried shrimp , fish and fries and he said it was phenomenal. I could only take a picture when he had already had all the shrimp. As you can see the fish fillet is very thick, therefore it's really moist inside. He also said the tartar sauce was outstanding with the perfect addition of lime to break the fat of the mayo.  I had the pan seared scallops with butternut squash pure, roasted sweet corn and bacon bits. The flavor profile was really interesting. Scallops were very fresh and with that awesome sear on the outside, but still very moist on the inside. The butternut squash brings some sweetness to play which goes very well with the corn and we have the crispy bacon to add some saltiness and also some more texture to the plate. Just wish there was a bit more food.  For dessert we had the flourless chocolate cherry pie. Thank God for gf options!!! And also some decaf coffee. The towelettes just add that additional care to the whole service and more charm to the place.  I highly recommend this place!

reviews.author: Lakisha T.
reviews.description: Each time I come here, it's always pretty busy and crowded. Today, it was quite the opposite. I guess Texas folks ain't about this cold life (me either, truth be told). Anyways, we had reservations for 3:30 but arrived like 2:45 and was seated immediately. If you know me, then you know I love my seafood. And I literally come and binge on the appetizers.   Well nothing have changed, seafood is still amazing, drinks are great and services is outstanding!

reviews.author: Jake H.
reviews.description: Salt Traders Coastal Cooking is so good! I don't know why I haven't written a review since now. I love this place. This time I got the lobster Mac n Cheese and asparagus with ceviche tostadas as an app. I've never had something I didn't like. If you haven't been, now is the time. There is a Round Rock and Zilker location. Yum.

reviews.author: Krasti Q.
reviews.description: This restaurant is a 5 out of 5 for me. I absolutely enjoy eating here. The raw oysters are always my favorite to snack on (tip: on Mondays, their gulf oysters are only $1). I've also tried their chowda fries which are delicious. It's everything you would expect with chowder but better because you also get fries (this dish itself can be heavy and filling). Definitely one to try if you're looking for something to warm your soul. Their lobster roll is good too. I love the lobster meat but I wish they served it as a warm, hot sandwich rather than the chilled one. Nonetheless, still delicious!   Now don't get me started on their dessert which is also worth noting here. All their desserts are made in-house but there is one that really hits the spot. This dessert has a warm chocolate brownie topped with a scoop of Vanilla ice cream and drizzled with caramel. If heaven was a dish, that would be it because it just transports you into another world. Worth saving some room in your stomach for!

reviews.author: Brian O.
reviews.description: We've been a fan of Salt Trader's Costal Cooking in RR since their opening five years ago and not surprisingly we dine there 2-1 over Jack Allen's, our previous go-to place. We've never had a less than wonderful experience there with the diverse menu and bold bright flavors and textures of amazingly prepared seafood and American cuisine and wonderful drinks.  The newly transformed Flat Top Fish Tacos are unbelievably good as the two hearty tacos are prepared Birria style with caramelized cheese crust on the flour tortilla and with substantial amount of grilled black drum with a street corn filling along with the cup of aromatic tomato-shrimp soppin broth and tomatillo-lime rice with pickled chilis.   Other favorites include Grilled Oysters and Fried Oyster Lettuce Wraps for Starters and the  Fish Enchiladas and of course fresh Oysters and Daily Specials and Seasonal Deserts.  FLAT TOP FISH TACOS 17 crispy cheese flour tortilla, street corn,  tomatillo lime rice, pickled chilis,  charred tomato-shrimp soppin' broth

reviews.author: Jacob C.
reviews.description: We've now been here a few times, even brought friends and family and have never been disappointed. Tonight, Jacob was our server and he brought all the positive vibes this places gives off. Food was great, drinks were A+, and we appreciate this chain and the owner more and more every-time we come. Can't go wrong stopping by and exploring this place.

reviews.author: Shauna S.
reviews.description: Sliding into this spot we had no clue what to expect. We loved everything we had. From the yummy and yes ma'am potent Margaritas to the apps we all shared. The service was on point and the food was plated beautifully. It felt very decadent and I don't even care for seafood. I personally recommend the hush puppies. The dessert pictured was coconut mousse with a pineapple sorbet. Everything we ate left us happy and ready to head in back here ASAP. Yes please and thank you...

reviews.author: Edgar S.
reviews.description: This restaurant has been on my todo list since it opened. I stopped by a few times before but it was just too busy and I didn't want to wait. Finally I decided to get smart and make a reservation. Arrived and was seated almost immediately. The waiter (Skylar) was very professional and made good recommendations. He stopped by often to make sure we were ok. The food is amazing and is not over seasoned.

reviews.author: Jill L.
reviews.description: Consistent, excellent service and food. I've eaten here probably a dozen times, sometimes with a group and other times with my husband, at busy times and relaxed times, weekends and during the week. My favorite dishes are: ceviche, lobster roll, and for a lighter day, the trout waldorf salad. Cocktails are exceptional and this place is always spotless.

reviews.author: Amanda D.
reviews.description: The poached shrimp is majestic. Smoked salmon dip. Oysters and champagne! I loved they closed one eye on my bringing my pup in a bag.

reviews.author: Lydia P.
reviews.description: Solid seafood place. We ordered a couple of apps and oysters, and they were good. The oysters were fresh but nothing outstanding. I also wish they had a stronger horseradish. Their horseradish came shredded instead of as a sauce, and it barely had a taste. The ceviche was great and so were the hush puppies, but I personally wish the hush puppies had more corn. We also ordered drinks- The Rum Around and Frozen Grapefruit Rita- which were really good and strong.

reviews.author: Teresa K.
reviews.description: Yum!!! This place is awesome and I'll definitely be back. Loved the lobster roll..check it out!

reviews.author: Jim N.
reviews.description: We found ourselves in Round Rock, TX on a recent Saturday, early evening, so we decided to stop by Salt Traders Costal Cooking on IH 35.  We found a couple of open seats at the bar.  Our first orders were a couple of craft cocktails, the Gin and Housemaid Tonic and The Rum Around.  Both were good, but upon reflection, for the price, regular cocktails would have sufficed.    We kind of went crazy on appetizers, having Gulf oysters, grilled oysters, crab fingers, and the crudo plate, which was yellowfin.  All of those dishes were "off the chart" crazy good, with the exception of the crudo ... the white sauce used was way too sweet for the awesome fish.    When we finally ended up at the main section of the menu, we ordered the fried oyster lettuce wraps and the simply grilled fish of the day, which was redfish.  The tartar sauce served with the lettuce wraps was delicious, but a bit too much was slathered on the wraps.  IMHO put a dash on the lettuce leaves and let the patron add as desired from the small cup of tartar sauce that comes with the dish.  The redfish was terrific, but no one knew why the place would have farm-raised redfish from the Indian Ocean when we have fresh redfish 200 miles away in the Gulf of Mexico?    Keeping it local, we ordered the Becker Vineyard Reserve Viognier, and it was delicious.  In closing, a special shout out to our waiter Nathan behind the bar, service was attentive but not intrusive, so nice to have a great waiter with a great attitude!

reviews.author: Mildred A.
reviews.description: Hannah made my experience great! She went above and beyond to make sure I was satisfied during my time here!  Parking: there is a parking lot Reservations: im not sure if you can make reservations but I would suggest it. Although, the wait isn't too bad  Food: I got a very basic meal( lol), I got the the fried fish and shrimp and was not disappointed  Honorable mention: tried the New Orleans bbq shrimp and the pasta- i wasn't a huge fan- my taste buds said it was too salty foe me- but my friend enjoyed them  Drinks: i really wanted a spicy margarita and Hannah made sure that she got it to my liking, which I truly appreciated!

reviews.author: Dylan K.
reviews.description: Really high end modern cuisine in an unexpected area. North Round Rock really isn't the place you'd think of for high quality seafood and a great classy bar scene, but that's exactly what this place had.  My wife had the scallops and they were seared perfectly and tender in the middle. Couldn't ask for better.  I had a fish sandwich, but I'm picky so I did it without the slaw, which was a mistake because it needed the crunch and the sauce. I'm sure it would be a 10/10 with that.  Definitely go to this place. We were treated like gold and the food was excellent!

reviews.author: Jennifer M.
reviews.description: We love everything about Salt Trader's.  First and foremost the 512 Cocktail. It is perfection. Sometimes I crave it and we go just so I can grab that drink. Haha! The food is outstanding. Every single thing. We've never made a bad selection. Their crudo of the day is always a favorite.  Dang now I'm craving Salt Trader's again. Haha!

reviews.author: Angela M.
reviews.description: Always a great visit! The chowda fries are one of my favorite things on the menu. That has a crispy shrimp bowl as a special and I hope they bring it back! The shrimp were luscious and delicious and it was a huge portion. Service is always amazing and they've upgraded their HVAC system so I feel comfortable dining here.

reviews.author: Susan E.
reviews.description: For my birthday, I chose to visit Salt Traders. We hadn't been there in a little while, and good seafood is always a treat.   My husband and I arrived in the early side, during happy hour (3:30-6:30 on a Thursday), so we could enjoy a leisurely meal. We started with drinks. I had the frozen grapefruit margarita, which tasted like a regular margarita. I loved that the salt on the glass also had citrus peel.  Our appetizer ($5 off during happy hour) was pot stickers. They were excellent, and the portion size (6) just right for sharing. The sauce was wonderful.   I ordered one of the day's specials for dinner, seared monkfish. It was served over fingerling potatoes and topped with a great salsa. The monkfish was tasty  but a bit on the chewy side... and the potatoes were barely undercooked. My husband had fish and chips, always a good choice at Salt Traders.  Dessert was vanilla creme brulee topped with peach sorbet. Excellent!   Service was excellent. We enjoyed Patrick's sense of humor and the stories he told.   We will be back again, without a doubt!

reviews.author: Curt C.
reviews.description: Idle Hands are the Devil's playthings!  This Rainey Street Bar is a cool place to lounge out, relax with some Cuban drinks, and enjoy some live music! They've got a small stage set up in the front, to entice people to join them on their elevated patio, which is covered in astroturf. I'm not sure that the place is handicapped accessible, since you have to climb stairs to get in.  The interior looks like some sort of coffee shop. There's a bar where they're pouring imaginative drinks. In the rear, there's an outdoor patio that's a bit more intimate than the front patio. The place is clean, and well lit.  It's a fun place to hang out under the shade of their big oak tree and relax in the sunlight. The vibe here is always relaxed and chill. They serve bar food here, but I didn't opt for any when I came. Think Cuban fare, with burgers and fries.

reviews.author: Karol M.
reviews.description: We visited for the first time during SXSW week, due to the bands they had booked for their outdoor stage. Several of these were bands that draw a sizable crowd (think festivals or medium sized halls), and unfortunately Idle Hands isn't set up for that kind of crowd. Not even close. People were lined up waiting to get in and they were at capacity.   The open patio is out front, shaded by oaks, and covered with astroturf. It's not big, by any means. The stage is a small dugout box that instead of being raised, seems to be sunken down below patio level. So if there's a sizable crowd, you may be able to see the tops of the band members' heads onstage, unless you are 6'5". Maybe. This might be okay for a sparse crowd, but these weren't sparse crowds, and I have a feeling that Rainey Street often draws crowds.  That particular day, there were giant costumed sports characters trying to make their way through the wall-to-wall crowd. They couldn't really see through their costumes, so they knocked over some things and bumped into people who were trying to watch the bands. It isn't a kid venue, so it wasn't clear why they were there. They may have been wondering the same thing.   The indoor area looks like a modern coffee shop cafe, and they have a full bar. We did not try the food. Our mixed drinks were well balanced and tasty. Some staff were friendly, others were just not, to the point that it left a fairly negative impression of the place.   This week at Idle Hands for us was a two star experience. Others have had a better time when visiting on less busy times and for reasons other than seeing live music shows that draw a crowd. So keep in mind that your mileage may vary, depending on the day and your goals for your visit.   Rainey Street has a lot to offer within a couple of blocks, much like the West 6th Street of old, before the live music scene moved east of I-35. So if you don't find what you want here, you might find it close by.

reviews.author: Sapna D.
reviews.description: Love the live music, outdoor area, and they make a fantastic espresso martini! We will be back!

reviews.author: Chad R.
reviews.description: We booked the backyard of Idle Hands for our private event.  It was our first choice venue after looking at he photos online.  When we walked in, everything felt perfect so we booked it on the spot.    We had some random requests like being able to adjust the music volume, film in the space, have dedicated security, and have a custom drink and glass (photo attached).  Idle Hands was able to accommodate everything (thanks Matt!).  During the event, Gabriel from Idle Hands helped ensure all of our guests were well-attended to.  Everything went super smooth, if you're considering a private event, you're in good hands with Idle Hands :)

reviews.author: Carl H.
reviews.description: Love the drinks, menu and staff. Very friendly service and with the bar being mostly outside, a safe space to enjoy a cocktail or a bite to eat. And as a bonus they have live music almost every night!!    My faves: The Painkiller - it goes down way too easy.  The Lover Boy - a killer chorizo-infused burger that will make your mouth water.   Lots of great staff and be sure to save room for the dessert! Tyler is an amazing baker who makes all the desserts for this place. The cheesecake was incredible!!   A few words about Covid restrictions - I've seen most of the bars on Rainey - almost none of them are following the protocols. I feel like this place is the exception. No lines or large groups gathering on top of each other inside. Outside seating spaced well. Staff all have on masks. That plus the food, drinks and service mean I'll be back many more times. The menu evolves some too, always like a place willing to add and try new things while keeping some of the faves on the menu.  Thank you Idle Hands - finally something good out of 2020!

reviews.author: Sirio B.
reviews.description: Nice joint on Rainey which punches above its weight in terms of drinks and food. Rainey in general is a bit of a mixed bag but this place was surprisingly good.   They have a Cuban food focus and use an interesting ticket system with every drink you get that you can redeem for food (probably to ensure enough food sales to stay open during Covid). I had about 4 Painkillers, a properly dangerous pineapple/coconut/orange and rum drink that was delicious. Summery is the best way to describe a lot of their cocktails.   Had some of the best fried plantain chips I've ever had with guacamole and ceviche. My only complaint was I wish they had comfier seating for hanging out and it ended up shortening our time we spent there (lots of high chairs and hard back seats). They dont have a decent back deck like a lot of Rainey places do so the seating was mainly up front where speakers were blasting, including the neighboring businesses music. So it ended up being a little chaotic.   Either way its a nice spot. Service, drinks and food were great so I think we'll drop by again.

reviews.author: Rob P.
reviews.description: Didn't go into the bar so keep that in mind. Only did delivery for their burger and fries. The burger was just OK. Read all these reviews raving about it and thought it'd be better. I guess y'all were smashed from the fancy cocktails lol. It wasn't bad, just didn't really standout and for $12 for a burger and fries, I think there's better options in town. My fault for expecting culinary excellence from what I assume is a bar kitchen.

reviews.author: Mike S.
reviews.description: Great place, good drinks, people instantly seemed friendlier as I was there alone and hung out with like 3 different groups. Highly recommend. Oh, and it was very clean, constantly wiping down tables and grabbing empties

reviews.author: Patricia S.
reviews.description: LADIES, if you want to feel uncomfortable, if you want to be harassed, assaulted and invalidated this is the place to go! The manager Tyler is incompetent and does not care about the well being of his customers.   Never going back to this bar again and I suggest you don't either.   Been coming to this bar for years with no issues, ever and have spent SO much money here (I live on Rainey). The staff have always been great until...  Tonight I had a group of young girls create a conflict with my group of friends for no reason. They swarmed our table and harassed us - pulled my friends hair, STOLE MY FRIENDS PHONE and, on top of that, a man that was part of this group forcefully grabbed my arms. The bouncers did nothing to get our phone returned nor remove a girl who pulled my friends hair and was cursing me out and flipping me off. They made me sound crazy when I asked for help. My voice did not matter. I asked to see the cameras and conveniently there are no cameras located in the front (which is absurd given that this is where all the tables and chairs are). It is one thing that these mean girls tried to start conflict with me and my friends for no reason, but this man grabbed my wrists so hard that I could not move and I had to front kick him in the stomach to get away. This is not okay under any circumstance and the fact that the bouncer and manager turned a blind eye is disgusting.  I wish there were cameras because I would press charges. This is so incredibly degrading as a woman and I am still shook that appropriate action was not taken.

reviews.author: Tara V.
reviews.description: This is a generous two star offering. Love the location, the great local talent playing on the porch and our drinks were very tasty.   Big however...  The food was pitiful. The black bean burger was an oversized sopping, crumbly mess with zero flavor and the fries were cold and uneventful. The ranch may as well been runny, salty mayo. My lady pal got the plantain chips with guacamole. They gave us tortilla chips with guacamole. My guy friend went in to ask for the plantain chips that they were supposed to come with. He took a photo with his phone of the chips and dip to show the bartender and he practically laughed in my buddies face and mocked his photo taking as a means to justify his request (he's in production and art, okay? Let the guy make art and an example of your crappy food).   The man brought us the plantain chips out a few moments later to go with the guacamole. Which was the worst guacamole I've had. Del Taco makes better guacamole. Salt? Lime? Heat? Maybe just try to make it flavorful...  Oh and the quinoa bowl-- that one veggie thing. What the heck even was that? It had no sauce; oil or spices to bind together what was basically a sad bowl of vegetables and bitter arugula.   Way off the mark with the food, guys. Good thing the music was kickin' and the mezcal ritas were nice n' zesty.   Get drinks and an earful or music and skip the food. All 3 of our dishes were very weak.

reviews.author: Sarah K.
reviews.description: Best bar on Rainey by far. My roommate and I came from SF, CA, and on our second night we randomly stopped here because of the live music - who actually was a contestant on the voice!! WOW!!!! We ordered "That One Healthy Thing" and some very specific drinks made by Brennan. He is an amazing bartender! I hope if the owner sees this, he/she gives him a fat raise. Thanks Idle Hands for making our first trip to Austin above and beyond our wildest dreams!

reviews.author: Angel A.
reviews.description: This is a wonderful addition to Rainey St. Its a casual, modern Tiki spot with great service, drinks and music. Visited two times since they've opened and it's been a great experience each time.   I'd recommend the Mai Tai for sure!

reviews.author: Santiago R.
reviews.description: Cool spot on Rainey, There's a good amount of seating as well as room to stand, and they have a good variety of beers on tap to choose from.

reviews.author: Israel C.
reviews.description: Staff is very friendly and they have wonderful cocktails! We've been here twice and felt very safe during COVID time.

reviews.author: Kenya R.
reviews.description: We stopped in for snacks and drinks. It was one of the few places that wasn't crowded, so we thought it was a win for us. Ummm no, we get there and they are doing contactless payment. The guy said that the app only works on iPhone. I think it was a bad business move to use a payment app that only works on iPhones.

reviews.author: Nicole H.
reviews.description: Great service and amazing drinks! The atmosphere was cool and the staff was super friendly. One of the only places that was open during the ice storm, thank you!

reviews.author: Argenis T.
reviews.description: Love the vibe and crew. The atmosphere was probably the best we've experienced while in Austin.

reviews.author: Tommy B.
reviews.description: Don't get a $14 draft cocktail here with the auto 20% gratuity. Walk a half block down to the Tipsy Alchemist, they're $15 -- not only are they twice as big, but also made to order!

reviews.author: Savannah S.
reviews.description: This bar was the highlight of our night! We had a big group of people for my birthday and the bouncer made sure everything was set up for us, he even put our table right next to the live music!   The servers were all so kind and helpful! Someone at our table spilled a cocktail and they replaced it quickly and for free!  One cool thing about this bar is that they give you tickets every time you order a drink, and tickets add up to be free food items! Their fries and chips/queso were good. The cocktails were very strong too! Would definitely come here again!

reviews.author: Dave B.
reviews.description: This place was really cool. Awesome patio and unbelievable live music by a guy named Josh Klaus. So so fun!

name: The Waypoint ATX Food Truck Park

reviews.author: Jonathan H.
reviews.description: This place is a hidden treasure, apparently!!  Came here with the kiddos and it has everything you'd want.  Kids had yummy chx fingers and grilled cheese and the wifey and I had AMAZING Bison Filet and Brussel Sprouts... all complemented with some hot fries that were sooooo good!!  Oh, and a yummy herbal soda to wash it all down while the kids played on the play set.   I have no idea how this place only has 3 reviews at the time of writing this.  If you are near Lake Travis/Lakeway, this is a must stop!!

reviews.author: Mousumi Q.
reviews.description: We visited the Waypoint food truck park this weekend and really enjoyed ourselves. We had some great beers at infamous beer co and amazing food from R19 Taqueria! Next time we will try yardbirds and the Italian ice place. Can't wait to see what else is in store. So exited to have this down the street from us.

reviews.author: Ross H.
reviews.description: Incredible food, with different options available, and a place for my dog to run around and play. They have a playground if you have kids, and pleanty of trees for shade. Connected to a brewery which is awesome!

reviews.author: Blaire C.
reviews.description: Great family-friendly atmosphere and delicious food options....and right next door to Infamous so you can grab some craft beers and enjoy the live music on weekends!

name: Workhorse Bar
accommodations: Best nights on Thursday, Friday, Saturday

reviews.author: Junus A.
reviews.description: This place is STILL GREAT. Only ever had one bad burger here (was a bit dry).   I am just going to affirm that this is my favorite bar in Austin. I have lots of drinking experience in Austin. Workhorse nails it. Anyone can come here, feel comfortable, enjoy super-solid food, a great beer selection, and walk away with an affordable tab. It's just perfect..  LOVE the new COVID sidewalk space. PLEASE keep it. Probably 90% of the patrons here smoke cigarettes and the back patio only barely sufficed.

reviews.author: Will C.
reviews.description: I can't comment on the bar itself since I didn't get the chance to drink there, but it's decent burger at a great price.  The burger itself was overcooked and dry; I don't know if this is normal, if the kitchen was having a bad series, or if the customer can request medium-rare.  Something to consider for next time.  And there should be a next time too, because this is still a great deal: burger + side for under $10.  Sure, it'd be nice if cheese wasn't an upcharge, but that's really a minor quibble.  Inside, the dcor is funky and vibey, much like the other restaurants and shops in this North Loop neighborhood.  What stands out most inside is the massive album art print from Stone Temple Pilots's Purple.  Thanks to this, I haven't been able to get "Interstate Love Song" out of my head for the past four days.

reviews.author: Veronica R.
reviews.description: Nice and friendly staff. Willing to make a drink off the menu. Good local crowd. Parking is a little hard but i can walk. Lol

reviews.author: Henry Y.
reviews.description: Came here with the coworkers on a Friday right after work. This is a great spot with an outdoor seating area in BOTH the front and the back (which I didn't know at first).  Their drinks are pre-California exodus cheap, so grab a beer or two or three. They also have grub. There's plenty of burgers to choose from, a coworker said their portobello burger is bomb. I got the burger special, which was arugula and blue cheese. My burger was slightly overcooked and a coworker's was well-done, so you'll have to be mindful of that; if you like yours med-rare or medium, I would call it out. I thought they were pretty generous with the blue cheese, but the burger itself could have been slightly larger; they're thick but relatively tiny. Buns are toasted. I think next time I'd go with one of the classic burgers since I felt the burger special was really heavy, the arugula doesn't bring enough balance for the funkiness of the blue cheese. The parmesian fries were alright, a tad too salty for me.  The guys behind the bar were nice, a bee got stuck in my bottle and they kindly replaced it.  PARKING: there's a few spots out front, but there's plenty of parking around the corner in the residential area.  Come for the drinks, stay for vibes.

reviews.author: Clint S.
reviews.description: When we went earlier today for lunch and cocktails, we were, as always, welcomed by the same amazing team. We had a Bastrop Burger, a BL sandwich, both with Parmesan fries, some margaritas, a Paloma and a Pimm's Cup. Everyone and everything keeps us coming back.

reviews.author: Andrew J.
reviews.description: It's a good dive, with tons of beer on tap and surprisingly good food. Lots of vegetarian options too. Service is pretty decent considering how grungy the place is.   However: I definitely got at least one drink in a dirty ass glass, and the kitchen staff is, shall we say, pretty casual about food hygiene. And yet I still liked it somehow. Maybe because so many other places in present-day Austin are just gentrification normie hellscapes-- this is a nice change of pace.

reviews.author: Shannon L.
reviews.description: Great bar and grill across from vintage row. BLT and fries were great. Good music too not to mention a lot of beer on draft to pick from  we will be back

reviews.author: Katie N.
reviews.description: Try the pretzels, you'll thank me. Great neighborhood spot for beers and burgers on the outdoor patio out back.

reviews.author: Mason M.
reviews.description: Amazing food. Definitely get a burger and the Parmesan fries! Tables and atmosphere are a little awkward if you aren't there for the bar part. I would highly recommend it as a bar/burger place.

reviews.author: Katie B.
reviews.description: Was I just transported to a mountain town where everyone just got off their shift on the slopes? Oh, nope. Still in Austin.   This is a cozy, neighborhood bar. The seating is a bit hodge podge cabin lodge so you might find yourself standing if it's crowded, but as is the case anywhere that's solid. All the drinking options for all the drinking types. The burgers look legit, but I didn't have one.  Bundle up and throw 'em back.

reviews.author: Endy L.
reviews.description: Quick service, food, drinks, price. Only thing is merch designs seem lazy. Will be back!

reviews.author: Shawn M.
reviews.description: The place is a cool dive and seating outside but the drinks aren't dive bar prices and the cooks never wash their hands before preparing your meal.  I guess they don't care about this pandemic at all.  I watched the cook scratch his head, grab his phone and text then started to assemble a burger without a care in the world or concern for cleanliness.  So if I were you I would eat before I go to this establishment.

reviews.author: Kayla H.
reviews.description: Good food. Not great service.  I was excited by all the vegetarian options on the menu. My mac n cheese was good. The fried pickles were soooo good. Definitely recommend those.  We came midday, and I'd have preferred there be a few more non-alcoholic beverages. It seemed there were usually quite a few choices, but they were out of most things. Not sure why.  We'd come again.

reviews.author: Kelly N.
reviews.description: This is a great bar! The food is really delicious and there's a lot of different options for everyone. You can order everything from burgers to mac and cheese to sandwiches. There's even veggie options for those of you who are vegetarian! The fries are great. The beers are awesome and there's a big selection.  It is pretty hot here here though, especially outside during the summer. I love the location and sometimes it's hard to find parking but it's a great spot for a beer and some food. It does get crowded but the service was still quick.

reviews.author: Jenny L.
reviews.description: this used to be a hipster bearded ax throwing dude bar.   it's now a whitewashed college kid bar, and packed af.

reviews.author: Sylvain B.
reviews.description: It's a dive bar so I'll keep my review short: - extremely cheap beers: down to $1 a bottle and $3 a pint of draft beer - amazing selection of great (local and non-) beers - super friendly bartender who knows his products and gives great advice on the beers to choose form. - great ambiance, nice patron, fun atmosphere and great music.  So it goes in the 4 stars dive bars!  Note: They have an outdoor patio in the back.

reviews.author: Nickie B.
reviews.description: I have been to the Workhorse Bar three times before yesterday, and those experiences were all 3-4 stars.  But this most recent visit was teetering on between 2-3 stars.    I ordered the White Manhattan, which has always been awesome!  This visit it tasted like they poured me a glass of watered down Moonshine and added a twist of Orange.  I ordered a second one just to make sure it was just not a bad pour.  Nope the second one was as bad as the first. The odd thing is they bartender who made them both, was the same bartender who has made them for me on my prior visits.     We were also quite bothered by the loud group behind us slamming their cards on the table as they played some unknown card game.  They were overly loud and obnoxious.
