We were not the only customers who were annoyed.  The other pet peeve I have is when large groups of people stand at the front door of an entrance to smoke cigarettes.  On this visit there was always a group of 3-7 people puffing away well within 15 feet of the front door.  People...please go smoke out back on the patio.  The upside of this visit was the music from the jukebox.  For $2 we were able to select 8 tunes.  Music selection is random, but good.

reviews.author: Tina M.
reviews.description: Workhorse is the perfect little neighborhood bar. It has a fairly large and very affordable selection of drinks, an all-around-the-clock "happy hour", great bar food and a nice staff! They also have a jukebox (select 4 songs for a dollar) and a patio in the back.   In the food department, they've got a good selection of sides and appetizers, as well as burgers, salads and fries. Vegetarians will be pleased to find out they have several veggie options, including two types of veggie burgers and many sides. The food is cheap and tasty. I don't know about you, but for me that's getting pretty close to my definition of heaven!   If you want available seating space for the duration of your stay, I recommend visiting between Monday and Thursday. Friday and weekends are very popular nights and you might not be able to find a cozy spot to sit, although that goes for most bars.  If you pass by the North Loop strip one evening, you should definitely drop by and have a taste of Workhorse.

reviews.author: Bill G.
reviews.description: This is a great neighborhood bar. I don't live in the neighborhood but I do love this hangout. Friendly staff and patrons, genuinely Austin. Food and drinks are definitely in the affordable range. Cool art on the walls and an awesome jukebox. Enjoy!

reviews.author: Sarah H.
reviews.description: We visited this place last week and are so sad that it hasn't been our go-to all along. It's located in such a chill part of Austin, so it's perfect when you feel like going out, but not going out (if you know what I mean)! They have a ton of beers on tap and handful of yummy sounding cocktails. We didn't eat here, but when we saw their blue cheese bacon burger with huge azzz onion rings on the side we were wishing we did! It was totally embarrassing, but my husband accidentally spilled his first beer on the bar and the bar tender did a great job at not acting completely annoyed at him, although he was. He even poured him another which we were not expecting at all, so that added to our great experience here! Highly recommend, but only if you're not a high-maintenance little princess because it definitely has some grunginess to it ;)

name: Barley Swine
accommodations: Best nights on Thursday, Friday, Saturday

reviews.author: Leopres F.
reviews.description: So this was our last stop in Texas and WOW! I am so glad that we had our anniversary dinner here. Yes, it is reservations with a deposit. I am not aware of whether or not they accept walk-ins. However, they were accommodating when I had to make a sudden time change that very day. They were able to make it work with our new time-frame with even better seating. So I take that as a win-win.   It was a set tasting menu of 10 courses with 2 of them being dessert dishes. We did not do the wine pairings because we were enjoying the cocktails. You can add a couple of supplements if you do not think that the 8 other plates will fill you up. Some of them were small (bite-size) plates. We did order two supplements with our dishes and I think that was honestly the perfect course.   Food was amazing, I cannot explain how delicious and how different everything was. But it all flowed together. Even our supplements, they made sure to give them to us at the perfect time.   Service was great. We were lucky enough to sit at the bar area so it felt like we had someone there for us at all times. They made sure to explain every course to us and even gave us some background to our drinks and the restaurant itself.   Yes, it is very pretty pricey. You need a $50 deposit per person and the supplements and cocktails are not part of the meals. The wine pairing is also an additional cost.  However if you're looking for a nice, and delicious place to possibly celebrate a special occasion this is the place to do that.

reviews.author: Josh M.
reviews.description: Great experience, great service. I've never had a tasting menu before and didn't realize how fun it is to drink cocktails and snack for a few hours, haha.   Expensive, though. For two people, it was $330 (includes $50 tip) I've never spent that much on dinner for two before. (Eberly in South Lamar was previously my most expensive meal.)  I'd definitely go back, but likely only for special occasions. They said menu changes up for the seasons, so maybe we'll see them again in the summer.   FYI: $100 deposit for reservation gets deducted from total.

reviews.author: Alan H.
reviews.description: Barley Swine really know how to keep you guessing! Their technique and execution of dishes are pretty unique to what you typically expect from a nice restaurant.  Highlighting the top three dishes from the prefix menu, which they only do now since COVID.  Tostada has a nice crunch and the fish was fresh with a pop of acid!  The duck was so juicy and prepared how duck should be rare with the fat of the skin rendered out a bit. Never had chili oil with duck and it was incredible! It gave it an Asian like vibe to the dish.  The mushroom dumplings are an add on and are worth it if you love mushrooms! The umami bomb in these unique rectangular dumplings was unexpected! And the  baby spatula to scoop the sauce over them was something I never experienced before.  Overall head to Barley Swine for a nice meal that won't completely empty your bank account!

reviews.author: Gracie X.
reviews.description: Haven't been here since the pandemic. The past Sunday evening we spent our 7-year anniversary here and the chef tasting was still amazing. Love the food, the service and the view of beautiful patio.

reviews.author: Kimberley R.
reviews.description: We've been wanting to try this place for a long time. We are a big fan of Odd Duck, it's sister restaurant, so our expectation going in was pretty high. It did not disappoint! The tasting menu flow was perfect. We started our evening with some delicious small bites. Our fav main course dishes of the night were the tostada, Muscovy duck and dry aged Akaushi ribeye. Duck is usually not my fav thing on a menu but their Muscovy duck with sweet potatoes was my fav dish of the night. I was literally licking the plate clean. Service was outstanding, they were constantly prepping for the next dish. It really was an experience like no other. If I had to pick on something, it would be the desserts. I was not a fan and for me, dessert is an important finish to a meal. I highly recommend this restaurant!

reviews.author: Jorge G.
reviews.description: Highly recommend!  I've been to a majority of the coveted top restaurants in Austin and this is definitely one of the best! There is a reason people love this place.   It is very well managed--huge shout to the Manager Stefan who guided us through the menu and went above and beyond to make our experience a special one.  Their tasting menu is so good and well curated - every plate was perfection and no detail was overlooked.  The tasting menu comprised of the following:  Appetizers:  2 year aged country ham on mini pancakes (yes mini pancakes), Deviled Egg, Tamale and Spicy Beef. The Tamale is like no tamale I've ever had!  Main Course: tostada crudo, black cod, muscovy duck, Dry aged Akaushi ribeye/donut. Everything was delicious but the ribeye/donut is out of this world! Probably one of the best plates I've ever had.   Desert: Caramelized fennel ice cream/caraway/ orange and Butternut cake/curry spice.   Not only is the food outstanding, the ambiance was very thoughtfully curated (lighting, sound and architecture).  We are lucky to have such an incredible restaurant in Austin.

reviews.author: Jay L.
reviews.description: Wow what a disappointment!   My wife and I have been eager to try barley swine for some time now.  Since it was her bday we decided to take the leap and go for it!    We were not at all impressed by the food. The atmosphere was nice and the bar tender we had was amazing. To add to that the cocktails were refreshing. So we were excited to dive into the food.  Fast forward to our first serving  My wife threw up the mussels and then after that she just wasn't pleased.  Being a foodie I was shocked that she was so let down.   I was expecting to have a bomb of flavor explode in my mouth.  The duck and rib eye were chewy and she left more than half the food on her plate each time.  The bartender noticed and asked to box it for us.  Needless to say our dog enjoyed it.    Not worth the time nor the money.  We won't be back and will spread the word

reviews.author: Mel E.
reviews.description: Excellent tasting experience!  Sat at the bar with Eric and Savannah (the amazing bartenders) vs sitting at the chef's table and I'm very glad that I did! They were incredible and the bonus was getting a view of the amazing kitchen and the crew! This experience was truly remarkable and the price points were perfect! They were warm, welcoming and listened to my likes and dislikes and accommodated accordingly. Barley swine would certainly be one of the key reasons why I would move here. The food was exquisite; an experience worth having at least once a month. Enjoy!

reviews.author: Andrew B.
reviews.description: Currently my favorite restaurant in Austin, Barley Swine offers a tasting menu that beautifully combines Texas flavors with upscale plating and technique. If you want to impress an out-of-towner with a nice meal while also showing giving them an accurate and varied taste of Texas, this is the place.  There are so many dishes with lots of components, and so it's difficult to break down every dish (particularly because the menu changes often enough that any specifics will likely be obsolete by the time you end up eating here), but I can say that in the multiple times I've been here, I've had some iteration of a tamale in the small bites, a fish course, a duck course, and Akaushi steak for the final savory course. Some tasting menus have highs and lows, but Barley Swine's seems to get gradually better with every course.   If you can afford to do so, I highly recommend adding their shiitake dumplings with soft scrambled eggs. It sounds like a strange combination, but it's a shockingly good umami bomb that should be experienced at least once. While the menu changes throughout this year, this dish has become something of a signature for them, and once you try it, you'll know why.  The service here is extremely unpretentious considering the caliber of food they're serving. Servers don't even have set uniforms. Everyone just looks and acts like Austin foodies who are happy talk about and share food with you, and I love that.   If you're as comfortable having wine as you are sipping on cocktails, then the choice between the wine pairing or having their house cocktails is an extremely difficult choice. Both options are awesome, but unless you're looking to get messy drunk in an upscale restaurant, one option precludes the others. Gun to my head, I'd probably opt for the wine pairing, if only because it potentially gives you access to 20+ year old bottles that you'd have a hard time finding. But I'll be damned if their "Follow the Leader" (a corn infused mezcal cocktail) isn't one of the most intriguing drinks I've had in this city.  While the snobs at Michelin don't think Austin is worth considering, I wholly believe that Barley Swine is as good as a lauded place like Gramercy Tavern in NYC, and it easily beats the shit out of some of the formerly Michelin starred restaurants in Las Vegas (stares shadily at Picasso). The atmosphere is inviting; the food is exciting; and the flavors are quintessentially Texan.

reviews.author: Jamie S.
reviews.description: Truly an amazing experience. We sat at the chef's table which I definitely recommend. The menu was perfect and the details were on point. The food was so tasty. Definitely recommend.

reviews.author: Brooke B.
reviews.description: My husband and I have been watching way too much Top Chef, so we wanted to treat ourselves to a special meal. I'm so glad we chose Barley Swine!   I'll start with the service, which is top-notch. When we arrived, we were warmly welcomed by the crew and shown to our bar seats. I wanted to sit there because you get to see into the kitchen. It was really fun being able to watch the chefs in action. Our servers were both very attentive and knowledgeable about the wine and food. You feel like it's all very personalized just for you which makes it feel all the more special.   As for the food, they're only serving the tasting menu right now, but that's definitely the way to go. It allowed us to try a bunch of different flavors, and it was nice not having to think about what to order. They start you off with four amuse-bouche dishes. My favorite was the (raw) spicy beef over a kerupuk style beef cracker. Then you get a crudo and fish course. The crudo was great but honestly the fish was over cooked. That said, their sauces are bomb so I still enjoyed it. Some of the other dishes that were particularly tasty was their beef and donut combo and the sorbet. The whole meal was nicely paced and flavors were complementary.   Definitely do yourself the favor and enjoy a meal here soon.

reviews.author: Michelle S.
reviews.description: OMG - flavor bomb!!!   We had the tasting menu of 9 courses (some one bite) and wine pairings.  First of all, fantastic pairings.  Each and every course was so creative, excellent style in how they present food but the flavor was outstanding.  I can't stop thinking about it.   House made salumi on masa cakes with cocoa nibs,  shishito pepper with a tempura batter stuffed; deviled egg filling on a nut cracker with trout roe and pickled green beans, Tostada crudo, beef tartare on mushrooms; black cod/mushroom/hatch chile dashi and smoked kale; muscovy duck/sweet potato; dry aged ribeye served with a savory donut with a brie like thing in the center; carmelized fennel ice cream, butternut squash cake with curry spice ice cream was to die for.  We also opted for the supplemental beef dumplings in a truffle sauce with freshly slides truffles and pea shoots.  We sat in the bar area and the service was outstanding by both bartenders!

reviews.author: Sarah C.
reviews.description: This was the most amazing dinner I've ever had. Valerie is incredible, the wine was perfect, I definitely recommend the wine pairing. I cannot wait to come back!

reviews.author: Joseph Y.
reviews.description: Perhaps the most consistent kitchen in Austin, Barley Swine never disappoints. It's all about the details here and they have it down to a science. Always recommend grabbing a couple seats at the chef's table to watch the magic happen. Menu is ever changing but we really enjoyed the duck and wagyu this go round. Sit back, sip a fantastic cocktail and let the masters do their thing!

reviews.author: Geneva C.
reviews.description: Came here on a late weekday afternoon! The tasting menu was amazing! The smoked Kohlrabi and the crudo stood out to me the most. Flavorful, with the different textures coming together in a way that was fun to eat. We also got the Kanpachi ribs and collar add on which was totally worth it! Service was great - prompt and our server described each dish really well before they came out. We sat right out front in a cozy spot next to the window! The decor was rustic and whimsical. It was my birthday so they provided a champagne toast for my date and I!

reviews.author: Cassandra S.
reviews.description: On a recent trip to Austin, I tried this place based on recommendations from Austinites.   I strongly suggest you make a reservation. We arrived about 15 minutes late, called to let them know, but we were still unable to get the type of table we had originally requested. You should also know, when making reservations they request a $50 per person reservation fee that is later taken off your total bill. For two tasting menus, one wine pairing, and three cocktails, the bill was $500.  This establishment is known for seasonal tasting menus that are in constant flux. They had two (usually there were three but they had run out of one) additional dishes that could be ordered on top of the tasting menu; but to be honest, the richness of the plates was sufficient enough to curb your hunger and make you feel full. The dishes were very creative. My absolute favorite were the small bites. They consisted of pierogi, radish bagel, tamale, and spicy beef. The texture of the pierogi was perfect, and the flavor was perfectly pickled. The radish bagel was fresh, light, and crisp. The tamale was a perfect fusion of Japanese and Latin all in one little bite. I could have used way more than one! My least favorite dish was the halibut, but the wine pairing made it more palatable. The duck was perfectly cooked, but when they mentioned that it was cooked with a sous vide for 48 hours, then seared over the grill, it made much more sense of how perfect it was!! The ribeye was a over cooked, chew, and tough to break down for my taste. It was served more medium that medium rare. My absolute favorite dish of the night was the poblano Texas sheet cake!! It was served with a peach sorbet (if I remember correctly), topped with chamoy, and garnished with sunflower seeds!! This was such a creative dish! And again, I could have eaten three of these!!   Overall, this was a great experience. The servers were attentive, knowledgeable, and friendly. I was thoroughly impressed with creativity behind each dish. I also LOVED that the restaurant is ZeroFoodPrint and Carbon neutral. I highly recommend this restaurant!

reviews.author: Stacie H.
reviews.description: Really nice tasting menu experience! The restaurant called prior to my visit and checked for any dietary restrictions. They were gracious and willing to accommodate my preferences.  Once seated, we received a personalized menu with dietary notes and individual mask holders which I thought were nice extra touches.  We chose to add on the shiitake dumplings and were so glad we did. Definitely one of the standouts of the night. The scallop dish was also a hands down winner!  Recommend for a special evening out!

reviews.author: Leah H.
reviews.description: I have been wanting to experience the chefs tasting for years and finally had a chance for our anniversary. They did bring Champaign for an anniversary gift. However, the f was good, but not phenomenal, for the cost. We sat for 3 hours, which is about 1.5 hours longer than expected. I honestly don't think I would go back and 100% prefer Odd Duck. I wish I could rate this 3.5 stars.

reviews.author: Kiana N.
reviews.description: Love love loved my experience at Barley Swine! Whenever my boyfriend and I visit a new city, we like to do at least 1 tasting menu and this one was great! In comparison to other big cities, this tasting menu is pretty affordable but still a great experience. The tasting comes with 10 courses with optional add-ons you can choose for about $10-$15 each. Including the add-on's we had a total of 12 dishes: 1. Shrimp Dumpling: Plated very nicely and also extremely flavorful. One of my favorites 2. Radish bagel: The concept of this dish is not very unique but it still tasted SO good, I loved it. Basically a bagel, cream cheese, and a pickled cucumber on top lol. 3. Smoked kohlrabi: small but tasty 4. Spicy beef: Beef tartare served on a rice cracker. Really unique flavors and textures. I didn't expect to like this one (not a huge fan of beef tartare) but this was great! 5. Crudo with Fruit Vinegar: Raw fish with smoked watermelon. The tastes in this dish were so unique and flavorful. I'd never imagine biting into a watermelon and getting that smoky flavor but it worked so well with the fish. 6. Halibut with Green Beans and Pecan: I must say this was my least favorite of the dishes but it was still not bad. The halibut just wasn't too flavorful 7. Muscovy Duck/Cured Leg: This course comes with 2 duck dishes. One is a plated piece of duck, the other is cured duck on a cracker. Both were so tasty! 8. Dry Aged Alaska Ribeye + Donut: This course also comes with 2 dishes. For one, a piece of ribeye which was small but so juicy. It also comes with a donut topped with some chopped pieces of beef which tasted great too! 9. Carrot rainbow sherbet: The first of 2 dessert courses, very unique and yummy 10. Chamomile buttermilk pie + Dewberry: I loved this dessert! Plated nicely and also so tasty Optional Add-Ons: 11. I HIGHLY recommend adding on the Shiitake Dumpling. This was recommended by our waitress as it's one of their classic dishes and I'm so glad we listened to her. I don't want to spoil anything for you because this dish has a nice surprise. Just trust me and get it ;) 12. Dry Aged Akaushi Beef Rib: This dish was tasty as well but nothing too special or fancy. I was already full with the initial 10 + Shiitake Dumpling Add-On so this wasn't necessary for us. If you're super hungry then maybe add it on.  For cocktails, we ordered the Peach Whiskey Smash, Acapulco Gold, and Barrel White Aged Negroni - all great!  In terms of ambiance and service, I'd also give 5 stars. The kitchen is open so you can see all the fun going on behind the scenes. We had several waiters serving each course, giving a great description of each, and answering any questions we had. Halfway through our meal, apparently there was some difficulty with the customers sitting next to us - which we honestly did not notice - but because of this, one of the waitresses gave us a free wine pairing with the halibut dish. I greatly appreciated that they went out of their way to make sure we were having a good experience.  Will definitely come back next time we're in Austin! 10/10

reviews.author: Yossef A.
reviews.description: First time trying this restaurant. My family and I went for a special occasion and had the chefs tasting menu.  The decor was great and inviting, they have a theme of pickling everything so a lot of jars around, it looks cool with the lighting.   Staff was very cheerful and pleasure to be around, they were still following Covid distance protocols regardless of the full capacity mandate now. My family and I truly appreciated that.   The tasting menu was delicious, I'd highly recommend if your want to try and not of everything on the menu, the donuts and the braised ribs were by far the star dishes. I would highly recommend this establishment.   Enjoy!

name: Shiner's Saloon
accommodations: Best nights on Wednesday, Friday, Saturday

reviews.author: Marc S.
reviews.description: Had a nice couple beers and flatbread pizza here on a sleepy Sunday evening.  Pretty empty for a while, bartender super friendly explaining the ins and out of the Shiner varieties which I had no idea there were many.  The pizza was surprisingly good.  No live music this evening, but the juke box selection was good.

reviews.author: Darcy D.
reviews.description: The bartender is a jerk. They were out of limes so they put "extra Fresca" in my Paloma. The drink tasted like pure soda water. I spent $10 on soda water that I couldn't even drink. If I could give 0 stars, I would.

reviews.author: Kimberly T.
reviews.description: Spent our last night in Texas here.  Patrick and Baccari (sp?) we're fantastic. Loved the rooftop bar, played some corn hole. Great atmosphere and music. Will definitely visit again.

reviews.author: Carlos B.
reviews.description: Not our first choice for rooftop bars, but it was the first place we started our last evening in Texas! The other place closed it's roof deck on Monday's.   When in Texas first beer choice should be Shiner ... it's what you do. I love Shiner regardless of the obligation. We played a round of Connect Four.   We killed one beer each only to bounce to the next stop on our self-guided tour of Austin's rooftop bars.  Service was friendly, and we didn't use as much as we could've.

reviews.author: Kerry G.
reviews.description: A necessary stop for tourists and locals alike. The food and drink selection is great, but what sets this establishment apart from any other is the atmosphere and service. All the bartenders were incredibly kind, funny, and knowledgeable. The inside of the bar has a campy western feel, and the rooftop patio has lots of games and beautiful views. A perfect destination for quick drinks, date night, or relaxing with friends.

reviews.author: Sabrina T.
reviews.description: Super chill vibes with friendly faces and great drinks. Go see Trevor and he will take care of you!

reviews.author: Heins G.
reviews.description: I love Shiner's saloon. I had my best night in Austin at this bar. Great live country music and wonderful bartenders! Will definitely be returning soon!!

reviews.author: Andrew L.
reviews.description: Love how I was yelled at for "sleeping" at the bar while I was literally looking at my phone. The bartender never even apologized, and even though I ordered multiple items, I had to wait long for a cup of water, until I asked again. Then I had to wait super long for my check, had to ask again, and they were hesitant to give me the industry discount. Dude, I'm a server and my gf is a bartender. Y'all are terrible at your job, get it together. Giving attitude for no reason.

reviews.author: Emily P.
reviews.description: This bar was an awesome place to stop into (and which we ended up staying at for quite a while)! Staff was friendly, beers were great, and we loved the games on the rooftop. A very underrated spot in downtown Austin that felt like home.

reviews.author: Wilson S.
reviews.description: This place has horrible customer service  and is  disgusting , the bartender knocked a drink off the table (beer splashed all over me) and let a cumstomer suck liquor out of his belly button while other bartenders watched. Bartender wasn't wearing a mask and lots of patrons were not wearing mask. I asked how long until my order was ready and the bartender said I dont know and walked off.

reviews.author: Wynona V.
reviews.description: Thank you Ashley for amazing service, great conversation, and most of all - for your kitchen being open  We were starving and were told by 6 different places that their kitchens were closed already. Finally happened upon this gem.

reviews.author: A D.
reviews.description: Amazing place! Live music sunday afternoons. Great bartender. So nice to hear live music again! I think the band was called "horses and hand grenades" super talented with the harmonica and trumpet! Cheers!

reviews.author: Dolores S.
reviews.description: Amazing place to have a great time!! Trevor the bartender is awesome!! Do yourself a favor and visit if you are in town.

reviews.author: Adnan M.
reviews.description: Great casual spot. They have live performances. Reminds of old school bars on the country side. Great place to chill.

reviews.author: Elizabeth H.
reviews.description: Shiners is always my go to spot in Austin. Love the staff, the dive bar vibe, price, and the rooftop patio is the best. 4years of happy memories coming here. Also their nachos are life.

reviews.author: Kristy R.
reviews.description: If you're a fan of Shiner beer (like me) you will love this place. Tons of Shiner varieties to choose from, including most that are not available in NY. The entire bar is outdoors but the bar area itself is relatively covered in case it begins to rain. It's also a rooftop setting which gives it an awesome ambiance and makes you want to stick around for a while.  Our bartender (I believe his name was Brandon) was super nice and chatted with us. They have a giant Operation game that actually works, as well as giant Connect 4 and giant Jenga. A few TVs are behind the bar showing sports. They have an old cigarette machine once you reach the top of the stairs and I'm pretty sure it still works.   The entrance is on the sketchy side especially when you're 4 females walking in around midnight on a Wednesday. The sign outside on ground level is tiny and only says Shiner. Inside the door is an ATM machine. Then it's a loft-style staircase all the way up to the roof/bar. Once you climb the stairs it's like Disney World. I definitely would have spent another evening here if we were in Austin longer.

reviews.author: Austin G.
reviews.description: No one will write home about Shiner's Saloon's food, but they may about their rooftop. It's downtown Austin with a great view of the city. When the weather is nice, it's the perfect spot to kick back and be urban cool. They also have a large beer list that includes a few hard ciders too. However, if you want food, go to another top rated a BBQ spot and then head here for the rooftop.

reviews.author: Michael S.
reviews.description: I've never written a negative review before as I typically find them to be petty. I this case it's well warranted.  My bandmates and I played a SXSW show here on 3/16/19. When loading in, the entrance was unstaffed and we simply loaded our gear up the stairs. No problem.  Loading out was entirely different. As I'm coming down the stairs, clearly loading out with gear in hand, I witness a door person yelling at my bandmate "Get the f*** out! Get the f*** out!" and aggressively walking towards him. His tirade did not end there. Keep in mind, it's obvious that we're loading out as we're leaving the establish with guitars, amps and various other gear. And we're doing so directly in front of the door person. He knows very well who we are.  As I'm walking back in, the bar manager is coming down and I calmly tell him that the door person is being needlessly aggressive. Instead of attempting to de-escalate the situation, he begins arguing with us, claiming that we hadn't been ID'd. First, they weren't ID'ing at 4:30 when we arrived. Second, even if you believe him, there's no excuse to respond by yelling, screaming, cursing and intimidation.  What he failed to realize is that under no circumstance is it necessary or appropriate to react in that way. Period.   This place, at least on this occasion, is staffed and managed by people that can only be described as unprofessional and unhinged, and in absence of even the smallest amount of self discipline, potentially dangerous.  There are better places to see shows. There are better places to get a drink. There are better humans at virtually any other establishment.  Don't waste your money here.

reviews.author: Rob P.
reviews.description: Flew into Austin on a Wednesday and got a tip that there's a bar that does Whiskey Wednesdays... it turns out it was Shiner's Saloon! The good: a friendly enough bartender that served us $1 whiskey and soda's. I mean come on, that's a great deal. But I was left really disappointed with the brisket nachos. This is a BBQ town right, so where was the brisket? I could barely find it in my plate of chips and cheese. It was good enough for bar food, but I really expected better. Then again, they did have free live music. This place is smack dab inbetween a 3* and 4* review, but the subpar nachos sways me today to give them a 3*.

reviews.author: Bill M.
reviews.description: Disappointed with the Steelers bar.  Plenty of fans but kinda dead.     I understand not having items on the menu on a Sunday afternoon.  They were out of sliders and pepperoni rolls. The tacos were OK but not great.  Beer selection was good.   We came for the atmosphere and were underwhelmed.   Win or lose a Steelers bar should be rocking.   Cheers for the turnovers, but no encouragement or even yelling at the TVs.

reviews.author: John S.
reviews.description: This is a place that has been on my bucket list for a few years and we finally tried it and will be back again. The facility is pretty cool as far as decor. Clearly, an architect was involved in the design with ample seating in dining areas, bar and outside. The staff is young and enthusiastic. Our server whose name is pm b (Kinda funny name) was particularly nice and accommodating . My wife ordered the Ruben and I got the pimento burger and both were quite satisfying. Being a former restaurant owner/operator, I appreciated our server's knowledge of the menu. They use a team system here which I love so when your food is ready, it is delivered immediately.  I have only two suggestions that could make for a better experience: 1. people working the bar; Don't throw the empty liquor bottles in the trash. The loud crash is unsetteling. 2. Management, dont let your modern attractive facility get seedy. Our seat cushions in the bar area should have been repaired long ago. This isn't a big expense. and look for other signs of wear around the interior.  Clearly, this is a popular place and we will be back.

reviews.author: Blake B.
reviews.description: Maybe I caught them on the wrong day. Maybe they caught me on the wrong day. That was a rough experience. And I don't want it to be. I live in the area and I do want this place to thrive. We are lacking in places like this. I'd like to chalk it up to staffing but I have been to dozens of restaurants in the past two years that have surely have had staffing issues and this is the first one I've written about on this medium.   The food is great, the drinks are great but I really got turned off on the service here. I just sat at the bar for a couple drinks and a small meal. The bartender was horrible. Not with the efficiency, but wow, it was all about her. I heard her say the following things to other staffers: "welcome to hell". "If he's not here, I'll walk out". Constantly criticizing the bar setup from a previous shift (which I'm sure was a result of similar staffing issues she was facing).   I asked her name and I think she said "heather" but she just mumbled that and walked away. So quickly that I knew she was just pissed at the world. While she was so obviously busy by the account of her commentary, she definitely had time to shake drinks in a mixer so loudly around the entire bar in a rhythmic fashion to get everyone to look at her. It was the "heather" show.   Couldn't handle it.

reviews.author: Desiree G.
reviews.description: Service here was good and loved the bar area. Brunch cocktail selection was above average. The Vietnamese espresso drink and Bloody Mary were great.   Food is what knocks this down a bit. I got the biscuits and gravy which was wayyyy to much biscuit for the amount of gravy given. Getting the chicken added is a must.   The carnitas poutine was super salty. I get that both things are meant to be like that, but this was just too much. I wish there was more pickled onions and jalapeos to balance it out.   The happy hour menu and times looked pretty good, so I'd definitely return to try that out.

reviews.author: Lauren F.
reviews.description: Great place! I love how they have seasonal items on the menu and an option of outdoor seating for 21+

reviews.author: Kris U.
reviews.description: | Food |  Excellent!  I had the rainbow trout with brussels sprouts and that is some of the best trout I've had in a long while!  It was perfectly done.  The brussels spouts were tasty too.  My friend had the pastrami sandwich and she kept raving about it; the pastrami was high quality.    | Cocktails |  Again, a big win.  They were doing a bartender drink contest with several whiskey cocktails and I went for the Peach Tree.  Although petite it packs in taste and was not light on the whiskey!  | Atmosphere |  The patio is typical strip mall-ish.  It's nice that it is dog friendly.

reviews.author: Christy G.
reviews.description: First time and first time take out from Oasthouse.  Ordered Meatloaf, cheeseburger, and fish and chips with pretzel appetizer.  Initially thought a little pricey but then OMG... the quality of the entres and portions were amazing.  Definitely looking forward to dining in soon and will definitely order again.  Must have fish and chips for lovers of fish and chips.    And cheeseburger was huge win with husband and teenager.  Meatloaf was awesome but eclipsed by fish and chips and burger.

reviews.author: Nanner T.
reviews.description: My husband and I stopped by for date night. I had to force myself not to order the fish and chips because it is so good here. I needed to try something different. I had the wagyu steak and fritz. It was amazing and cooked perfectly. The fritz I could not leave alone. Our server Paige was such a delight. We weren't sure exactly what we wanted to try but she had lots of suggestions for food and drinks! She explained what was in everything and you could tell she really wanted us to enjoy everything we ordered. We ended up staying for quite a while because we were enjoying the atmosphere, service and drinks so much.

reviews.author: Tim M.
reviews.description: Superior food in a convenient location. The innovated recipes served at this beautiful restaurant, are thoughtful and rooted in just damn good flavors. Ousthouse is consistent and you will never have a bad time. Recently had their Shepards Pie. Rarely have I... fantasized... about a dish; reminisced about their unique take on a classic. My wife, who lives abroad for a time, even stated that it was made better here than by our friends across the pond. We are excited to see this business grow and adapt their dishes more. As we are a multicultural household, we would love to see more Persian Cuisine take center stage on the menu. My only critique is that the cocktails could us a refresh.

reviews.author: Michelle J.
reviews.description: We've tried this place three times and each time less impressed than the first. Food is just okay. It's too dark and cave-like in there. It's trying to be too many things but not one thing really well.

reviews.author: Andrew C.
reviews.description: Wife and I decided to try this place out for late afternoon brunch on the patio. We had the Bacon Beignets, Reuben, and Pimento Burger. We had a little difficulty finding good selections on the menu. Citrus pancakes sounded good, but they were out of them. The Bacon Beignets were the highlight, warm, freshly made and tasty. Reuben was good, with nicely salted corned beef and delicious German slaw. Pimento burger was too rich for my taste. Service was good. Overall experience was good. Would be 5 stars, but menu was not great for us. If you find things you like on the menu, then you should try it out.

reviews.author: Steve A.
reviews.description: Cocktails and dinner were great! Awesome plane to hang out on the weekend with friends!

reviews.author: Sandra B.
reviews.description: Went to brunch here with some friends. This was a great atmosphere for brunch. I have been for Dinner which is lovely as well. However, it's laid back, chill atmosphere, and modern feel makes it a great spot for almost any occasion.  The food was pretty good. I did get something i could make at home. However everything was cooked nicely apart from the bacon. It was a little bit too charred for my taste. Potatoes were tasty, eggs standard, and the rye bread tasted more like a sour dough. But still good.   Mimosas were a good deal as well!   Overall we had a great time and most likely will return again!

reviews.author: Ashley N.
reviews.description: My hubby and I came here tonight. We were originally just going for pizza and beer at Little Woodrow's but their patio was full and we had our dog with us. We were searching for some dog friendly spots and came across this gem! We sat on the front patio but when we left, we saw there was also a back patio that was a bit more lively! I also took a stroll around the inside and it has a super cool looking bar, great lighting and lots of seating. We loved our cocktails, apps and entrees. We had a Manhattan, Old Fashioned, and Pom of Your Hand and they were all delicious! We also had the shishito peppers as an app and I had their seasonal soup which was served in a nice cast iron bowl. My husband had the Shepard's Pie and was super impressed! I had the falafel burger and fries and it was super tasty and filling! Our server was very friendly and attentive and my husband thought it was great that she said "awesome blossom" since he said that's only the second person he has ever heard say that aside from me (where has he been?). Anyway, we want to come back soon and check out some more of the menu options and drinks! We highly recommend this spot that is dog, family, and happy people friendly!!!

reviews.author: Juliana S.
reviews.description: Can't believe it's been a while since someone gave this place a review.   We came here because we found some good reviews on Yelp, but have to say I was a bit apprehensive about how long it's been since the last review posted for this place.   This restaurant seems to be a family go to place where people just eat and never care to leave a review.   This place a gem! We came in for an early dinner and were surprised by how good their food and drinks are.   I wasn't really found of the butternut squash soup but we were in the mood for trying so we did it.   I do recommend this place for anyone.  Specially if you are looking for food away from Downtown like us.   Enjoy!

reviews.author: Keilon L.
reviews.description: The meal was much more attractive than it was delicious. Everything was fresh but lacked flair in the flavor department. This is the kind of place I would come to for dinner but I wouldn't bring anyone here to impress them or to treat them. I only say that because the impression of this place I got from the ambiance and the menu was that I would be in for a stellar meal. I ordered the Brie Burger believing the brie and the flavor profile would offer pizzaz but I was not razzle dazzled. It was just the feel of eating a better than average burger.  The carnitas poutine got me a little eager to taste more flavors as I had that to start.  It could have rivaled a couple of poutine offerings that I've had in Montral aka the poutine capital of the world (sorry Quebec City).  I am happy that all the greens were fresh to round out the meals well.  I felt like portions and servings were well balanced.  If I lived in the area, I'd dine here again.

reviews.author: Flora T.
reviews.description: A hidden gem! Great food, interesting drinks and friendly and attentive staff. We loved everything we ordered. Food is fresh and tasty. Good atmosphere for either friends' hangout or romantic outing. We had a great time there and will definitely recommend it! We arrived after 9 and could take advantage of their reverse happy hour. We were surprised how small our check was!

reviews.author: Carrie T.
reviews.description: Came here for brunch after church on Sunday. I must shout out Henry because his service was awesome. He was personable, friendly and efficient. His service gets 5 stars (and we made sure his tip showed it). We started with the bacon beignets which were not really like beignets. They were crispy on the outside and more like cake donuts on the inside. Only got like two pieces of bacon in the whole serving.  The food came to the table very room temperature. My father had to send his biscuits and gravy back to reheat (no one wants congealed gravy). My mom and I got the boring breakfast plate. I asked for my eggs over medium and they definitely came fried hard. Also the house cured bacon was bland and extremely dry. My Aunt's chicken cacciatore pasta tasted good and we liked the strawberry pancake we ordered for the table a lot.  Overall, service was the highlight but the brunch options are not worth a second visit.

reviews.author: William Z.
reviews.description: Stopped by last night wi5h friends. After putting in our name we sat in the bar and ordered beers while waiting for a table. We were in no hurry so we had another beer and looked over the menu.  It was obvious that Oast was short staffed and everyone was doing double duty. Thank the pandemic!  Nevertheless, tHe staff was very friendly and the service was adequate.  However our burgers were not very hot and my pretzel bun was stale. The fries were very good. In better times, this will probably be a very nice dinner option.

reviews.author: Aaron G.
reviews.description: First, this place is perfectly nice and probably worth going to again if I am back in the area but would easily be convinced to try something else.  My evening began with the Ancho Margarita.   Unlike some places this chili inspired drink isn't like drinking hot pepper juice and is delicious.    The fried cheese curds with ranch dressing were tasty but nothing particularly gourmet as a novice home cook could prepare this with the same results.     The disappointment came with the main meal.  The French fries were cold.   From our vantage point we could watch the kitchen workers.  They kept a big bowl of French fries that the kitchen leader would use to place portions on out going plates.   They rarely sitting it under a heat lamp, so they were cold and unmemorable.   This is probably the easiest and cheapest thing on the menu to prepare well.  The rest of the meal was perfectly ok, but noting that stuck out as particularly special.    The ambiance is nice, but extremely loud when there's a full house so you have to raise your voice to be heard across the table.

reviews.author: Brittany E.
reviews.description: Great spot for fish and chips for a good price! Their poutine is also very good - different than the typical but delish.

name: The Grackle
accommodations: Best nights on Wednesday, Friday, Saturday

reviews.author: Sean H.
reviews.description: Great bar! I was visiting from California for a bachelor party. An Austin friend highly recommended we check out The Grackle. We did and had a fun time. Darts, friendly staff and patrons, and a wonderful outdoor space. AND I accidentally left my wallet at the bar and the staff reached out to me via Facebook and mailed it back to me! Amazing! Will definitely come back to The Grackle on my next trip. Cheers!

reviews.author: Diane W.
reviews.description: Bar tender was condescending.   We randomly walked in because we saw it walking by. Probably won't be back considering our experience. Not the worst place I've ever been but there are so many nice places in east austin... so ehh.

reviews.author: Amanda K.
reviews.description: Hmmm.. okay here is my truth. I came here with my husband and another Yelper. We were told the place shuts down at 10 pm so we had a few hours that we can stay here. I guess the 'Rona comes out at 10:01?  We found a table and ordered a counter near the front. When our drinks were brought out, we were instructed to take them off the tray ourselves. There was a slight confusion over two drinks (which one was which) and I watched the server shuffle both drinks around.  Even though we were supposed to be the ones touching them? Got it.   I did like the large selection of drinks and there was a food truck on the property. I didn't try anything so can't comment on the food.   Overall, I would come back maybe when the 'Rona is done. Some of the staff on site were not the friendliest. Also, be careful if you have to use the restroom, only 1 person is allowed in at a time. I was glad I didn't have an IBS flare up while there because that could have equaled a danger zone.

reviews.author: Annie W.
reviews.description: All the 3-star, 2-star and 1-star reviews made me want to go there! Even more. I mean, I've been before, but like go tonight! Again! Forever!   To Each His Own.  Some of us like to sit at a bar, NOT make small talk with the owner, get served up professionally and just chill. The outdoor patio is great for my smoking friends and it's covered against rain and the hot ass Texas sun. Pool is cool, bathrooms are decent.   What else do you want?  Also, I heard they have a rotation of pretty sick DJs that come through. I plan on going this week!

reviews.author: David D.
reviews.description: Don't skip the reviews on this one. Not going to beat a dead horse.Other yelpers have said it best. The one and only  positive is they had an umbrella to keep us out of the rain. And if you are hunting for a dark depressing indoor hole to slit your wrists at while listening to your least favorite emo playlist...you've found your gem. Best of luck during the pandemic.

reviews.author: Jen P.
reviews.description: 7 years later, I stand by my previous assessment.  Tim dealt with my shenanigans as the pro that he is and set the tone for a great night.  I also really appreciated the opportunity to try a few of the new sours on tap - thank you!!

reviews.author: Erin L.
reviews.description: First off the owner was super rude the second I walked in. He had zero knowledge of the menu and ended up suggesting a drink that was awful. When I asked for a different drink and said I would pay the difference he yelled at me and called me petty. I have never been so offended by someone's attitude in my life. There are PLENTY of way better bars surrounding this one.

reviews.author: Brooke B.
reviews.description: Poor service, poor experience. Trying to support small businesses during this time but stay away from this place at all costs.

reviews.author: Lester M.
reviews.description: Not happy to be in service industry  No coke  No Roy Rogers  Handlebar stache  Hot inside  Lots of foam

reviews.author: Lee M.
reviews.description: Love the darts and vibe here, i will be a regular now that i moved in the area. the music is PERFECT for the atmosphere. i can legit play darts here all day and never get sick of this place. i tip my hat off to you grackle!!

reviews.author: Rob P.
reviews.description: Nothing particularly wrong with The Grackle, it's just not my kind of bar. Good food truck out front and a decent selection of whiskeys along with a pool table or two. But it was empty when we went in, and I think we were there on a weekend. It just seemed a tad on the depressing side. I'm sure I'll end up back here sooner or later and can give them a second chance to see if I can change my tune.

reviews.author: Tim O.
reviews.description: Great whiskey selection. Cheap drinks. Free darts. Three cork dartboards. Three cork dartboards. Three cork dartboards. Cricket boards and chalk. This establishment in Austin, Texas has cork dartboards and provides steel-tipped darts for you to throw at the dartboards.

reviews.author: Dru M.
reviews.description: This is a kitschy place. I agree with other yelper's though when it comes to friendliness of the bartender. Her personality matched the overall ambience - Dark.  We had one drink and left. In the scheme of dark, dank, and dirty bars, the Grackle is a contender. I'm thinking that public health in Austin doesn't inspect businesses that don't serve food. The Grackle isn't alone in the shithole bar, pub, concept. It wasn't the worst I've seen but it's close. We were expecting a dive bar vibe but this was not even fun.

reviews.author: Jacob O.
reviews.description: Another bar in Austin run by a rude and arrogant asshole.  I haven't had such bad service since GandS Lounge had that crazy dude bartending. I ordered 4 drinks for some coworkers. The jerkoff that owns the bar playing bartender was very rude and had no customer service. I didn't order the drinks as fast as he wanted so he was rude. He was understaffed and didn't have the intellect or maturity not to take it out on his customer.  There are many options in Austin with good customer service. Don't waste your time with a shitty beer selection and rude arrogant bar owner.  I from Austin and been here for 40 years. I don't need more shitty people ruining my town. Time for the Grackle bird and its owner to leave town.  I will never go to this bar again. Go to the many great bars on East 6th. Avoid this place like the plague.

reviews.author: Mary S.
reviews.description: DO NOT GO HERE. This place has the WORST customer service I've ever seen. Whoever is running this establishment needs to make some serious changes if they want to survive. There are far better options out there with much better service you are not special and that's why we are taking our business literally anywhere else. To the lady in the glasses, bad day or not, you need to learn to not let that interfere with how you're treating people. We take our hard earned money for you to serve us (we were very friendly to you so there's not reason for you to have treated us so terribly) fuck you lady.

reviews.author: Dan W.
reviews.description: It's a pity that the bartender tonight couldn't be bothered to be helpful or friendly.  Perhaps he was too busy?  There were two people seated at the bar including myself...  the patio had few guests... a couple were playing darts... Whats this?  A girl breezes in followed by her entourage.  "He knows what I want!" she boasts.  At last! The serving action will commence as the bartender shuffles off his brooding reverie and we'll ALL be deep in our cups!  Nay nay!  Only those who know this gentleman can immediately get drinks for themselves AND their friends.  Sure is nice to have friends in low places and you'd be hard pressed to find lower. So, I left.  Ignore me if you're busy but rudeness will not compel me to place my ducats in your buckets...  Good bye Grackle, I'm sure Austin will sweep you away soon enough, thrive or die, it's the Austin way.

reviews.author: Eugene A.
reviews.description: We came by for a birthday celebration for a couple of people. One of them had a bottle of booze in a gift bag. We had been there for about half an hour before someone came up and told us there was no outside booze allowed in the bar. We said, okay it's a gift, no one is drinking it, out car is miles away we took a Lyft. Within 30 seconds the conversation went from, we can't have outside alcohol in the bar, to, literally, "I don't give a fuck get the fuck out". That's literally how the bar guy spoke to us. After a 30 second conversation. I can't even believe that that's how they spoke to us within 30 seconds of saying that you can't have a bottle of booze that's a gift in a bag to get us to leave.  Of all the times I've been kicked out of a bar, that was the lamest, most stupid reason ever. If that guy is reading this, you're a fucking douchebag and a fucking idiot. To not even attempt to find a solution to the situation is absolutely pathetic. Put the bag behind the bar. We'll grab it on the way out.  Literally go somewhere else for drinks. The guys that run this place are fucking dicks. What a pathetic experience at a bar on a Friday night.

reviews.author: Itsabout T.
reviews.description: Grackle, it declares dive-bar from the start.  Single bar, single pool table and only a few seats.  The bar is stocked and fully. But guess what?  The house bourbon is Buffalo Trace. Seriously it's on the rail at the rail price. Drink up!  I like the place and really enjoyed my visit but I had to leave to visit all of their neighbors.

reviews.author: Casey M.
reviews.description: Second time here and just as good as I remember from last year. Good sized covered patio when you reach the bar. Pool table, darts and a table top pac man/galaga combo to play. Not a ton of seating inside but enough outside if it's not too hot. About 10ish beers on tap, typically a couple sours which I like! Worth going to.

reviews.author: Catherine M.
reviews.description: A real true grungy dive bars, no frills about. Some place to come shoot pool, smoke cigs, and drink unpretentious beers. I recommend sitting in the patio area unless you like smelling like second hand stale smoke. Also, kinda confused on why the bartender through glasses into the trash, causing them to shatter. OK place, would most likely come back for a cheap brew.

name: Tony C's Pizza and Beer Garden

reviews.author: Haley Z.
reviews.description: Great place to watch sporting events! Lots of places to sit and be able to view the many televisions. The area inside is very open and spacious. Outside there are a few tables around the side of the building. We are transplants from WI and we asked for a tv to be changed to a Packer game and the beer tenders were happy to oblige. Wonderful, attentive service and conversation. All staff keeps busy even on slow days and makes sure everything looks spotless and that everyone is helped.   Decent craft beer selections on draft and they run affordable specials. Food is fairly average in flavor, but comes out hot and fresh. The atmosphere, service, and prices have us coming back often.

reviews.author: Andrew Y.
reviews.description: First of all, we like the location of this restaurant, it's close by to us and we see ourselves coming in to grab a quick bite and drink at the bar area. They have a small but decent selection of beer on tap that we're bound to revisit.   All the food we ordered was very average -  we could find better pizza, fries, fried mushrooms,10 minutes in any direction. However, it's very spacious inside and even during lunch time on a weekend, the mood felt pretty relaxed (maybe it was an off-day?). A good spot to bring friends for having a few drinks and a conversation.

reviews.author: James M.
reviews.description: Strike 1 - Maybe I have a donato pizza, sub olives add jalapeos. Cashier: There is an up charge to sub ingredients. Me: Do you subtract the cost if I remove an ingredient . Cashier : no.   Me: whatever let me get jalapeos  Cashier : we don't have jalapeos EVER.  Me: walks out.

reviews.author: James W.
reviews.description: First timer and I was not impressed at all. First of all they don't offer jalapeos on their pizzas which is a unpardonable sin in Texas, and an instant turn off for me. I guess they do realize they're doing business in Texas ?!?! I had the Carnivore which was alright at best. It has Salami, Pepperoni, Sausage, Meatballs, Pizza Sauce, Mozzarella, and Calabrian Peppers. I did add several shakes of the red pepper flakes to at least give it some kick. The fried mushrooms were good as was the Hefeweizen. My son had the Bianco which has Cream, Olive Oil, Fresh Mozzarella, Ricotta, Roasted Garlic, and Basil. He said it was very good. He also had the Sublimely Self-Righteous beer. They offer several menu choices for food as well as several beers. The staff was very friendly and the place was very clean. We might return but it won't be anytime soon as we won't be rushing to return.

reviews.author: Shauna S.
reviews.description: Rather underwhelmed with today's order. Do better guys...  It was on time and I appreciated that

reviews.author: Paulo C.
reviews.description: Go Tony go go Go Tony go go Tony C Goode  He used to carry his flour in a gunny sack To bake his favorit garlic knot snack  The customers would come to eat the pizza he made Delighting with the flavor that deserves a parade  The people passing by they would stop and say "oh my this pizza is all I want for my birthday"   Go go Go Tony go go Go Tony go go Tony C. Goode

reviews.author: Keith P.
reviews.description: This place is pretty good. The pizza has decent pull and taste. We got cheese pizza, a muffuletta pizza, and a garlic knots. I would say I preferred the cheese pizza. The specialty was a bit salty from the tapenade. The knots were wrapped like cinnamon rolls... cute! The were just a bit tough though. The marinara that came with it was good too. I am gonna try the margherita next time.

reviews.author: Eva Maria T.
reviews.description: We have eaten here a few times and always an excellent dining experience at Tony C's Pizza and Beer Garden. Super friendly staff, fresh ingredients, and all public areas are spotlessly clean! This visit The Mr. ordered a small house side salad, which was was a very generous size. He ordered Build Your Own Pizza: pepperoni, salami, mushrooms, and red onions. I ordered the meat lasagna...large enough portion to feed two people. Love the marinara used in the lasagna. It was very light, fresh, and not sweet. (Some places add a lot of sugar to their pasta sauce not Tony C's). Not ordered this visit, but make sure you get the mozzarella sticks, made fresh in house, not Sysco Foods frozen. Photos of those beauties are in my previous review.

reviews.author: Rey B.
reviews.description: Pizza is not easy to get right. Sure, you will always enjoy a pizza because it's freakin pizza. But getting that right formula that keeps you coming back is rare. That's why, up until now, I only have two favorite pizza places (Home Slice and Slap box). But now Tony C's is added to that very small list.   Really good pizza slices with the right balance of meat, cheese and crust. And really great flavor throughout.   Sorry I haven't tried the other menu items ( I'll get to them eventually) but the pizza is so damn good, that it's hard to deviate.   The Round Rock locations is huge with plenty of places to sit and a nice bar area. Highly recommended to pizza lovers.   Oh, and I cleared out an entire Cesar salad. Which is saying a lot for me.

reviews.author: Lyla A.
reviews.description: We used Door Dash. I added a note to modify my order and they did it exactly the way I asked. Excellent customer service.   The pizza was very different than anything I've had in Austin. Excellent crust, quality toppings and definitely all fresh ingredients. The Carnivore was just spicy enough to make you want to keep going back for more and the Truffle was not your average fake truffle oil flavored pizza. The mild hints of blue cheese and fontina took this over the top!    Support local and eat their pizza - it's delicious!

reviews.author: Desiree G.
reviews.description: This place is a ton bigger than I expected! Picnic style seating on the inside and a great, comfortable bar area. There's TVs all around the restaurant, so you can catch all the football games! Beer selection covers something for everyone and they had frozen wine drinks that looked good. Half off beer pitchers on Thursday's and half off sangria on sundays.   I've never been one to rave about a salad, but omg the dressing on the Greek salad was out of this world. Even my man was in love and ended up hogging it from me.   I was there to kill time before a baseball, but will most definitely be back for pizza and game watching!

reviews.author: Angie M.
reviews.description: Loved popping in to this spot for a quick drink at the bar while we waited for out of town family to arrive. We're from Houston, but have been here to visit several times and...THEIR PIZZA IS BOMB!   Great family place-covers all bases and tastes. Friendly, fun atmosphere with 50's and 69's music playing often. Pizza is even good for takeout, which is quite popular, as well! They also offer salads and LASAGNA! (Marinara or Alfredo sauces) - see my photo of the menu for details!  TONS of seating - long tables for large groups. Nearby, newly-opened LaQuinta Hotel's guests , including sports teams, families, conference attendees, and other large parties, will love coming here, not just for the seating and atmosphere, BUT FOR THE PIZZA!!!  We visit Austin regularly, and always make it a point to visit-whether we dine in, or bring it back with us-that is, provided it makes it back...whole, lol.

reviews.author: Ambie S.
reviews.description: Service is always great and if there is a delay for any reason, they are apologetic and have great attitudes about it. Great experience and we've been here many times.

reviews.author: Oscar R.
reviews.description: Absolutely phenomenal pizza!!! The wifey and I arrived 30 minutes after they opened, we were the second customers there. We ordered the chicken Parmesan pizza as recommended by our cashier and an order of garlic knots. It was a great recommendation.   The garlic knots came out first. They were so warm, soft and garlic buttery! They came with their house made marinara, which was sooo good! Those poor garlic knots were gone just as quick as they arrived.  When the pizza came out, it looked amazing but I was a little concerned the chicken Parmesan might be a bit dry because it kind of looked that way. Let me tell you, the pizza was spot on! The chicken was well seasoned and cooked, definitely not dry. The crust on the pizza was amazing!!! I'm craving it again as I write this review!  The atmosphere was also laid back. They had beautiful wood bench seating, which could accommodate a large party/gathering if the place is not to busy. Service was also excellent.  Honestly, the best pizza I've had in a while! I highly recommend this place if you're in the mood for delicious pizza!

reviews.author: Michelle W.
reviews.description: Delicious!!! We finally got a chance to try this place out. It definitely looks nice from the outside. Beer garden in Round Rock? Yes please! Ordering online and pick up is easy! I scheduled my pick up order in advance so I wouldn't forget.  Food was delicious. No complaints. Really enjoyed the sauce that came with the garlic knots and calamari. Gelato was satisfying. Looking forward to trying another pizza soon!

reviews.author: Ciera D.
reviews.description: Every single person that I encountered was extremely kind and courteous, they treated me very well! They made me feel valued at every turn,  I knew that they wanted me to be there, and that it was a pleasure to serve me. The food was very fresh and flavorful, I'm excited to return!

reviews.author: Elizabeth B.
reviews.description: The garlic rolls were burnt. I threw the Pizza away it was RAW!  Called manager for a refund she said I had to deal with Uber Eats.  It's was Tony's Pizza that burnt the rolls ( tasted like rubber) and served up raw Pizza.   Will never go back!!!

reviews.author: Rhea S.
reviews.description: We were starving so the pizza isn't full and a picture of the fried ravioli is absent. My boyfriend and I had a great time at the the new local pizza joint. We shared the largest size pizza, split a fried ravioli app, and gelato. We also enjoyed a few drinks on HH.  We usually go to slapbox for local pizza, but dare I say it, this place has better pizza in my opinion! Not as greasy and it's closer to us. Their HH runs from 5-7. My boyfriend got 2 October fest beers and I had a glass of PG, a frozen bellini and a sangria, which were all $2-3 off depending on the drink. The frozen bellini was very good and I don't normally drink frozen drinks. I did not care for the sangria at all, though.   Everyone was very friendly. In regards to COVID, everything was very clean from what I saw.   Shoutout to the manager, Catalina! She was very genuine in her table checks and we both believe she's a great asset to their team in QC.

reviews.author: Justin M.
reviews.description: Stopped for lunch here today. This has kind of a Pinthouse Pizza vibe (but more sterile/family oriented and less Austin-ie). Service was great, place was clean, and they seem to be taking COVID restrictions seriously.   The pizza was pretty good. Not as good as Slapbox/600 Degrees but just a notch below (on par with Pinthouse). Came out quick and was hot. Beer selection was pretty good - had a local brewery Oktoberfest.   All in all, worth returning and will try to nudge my kids into agreeing to go here instead of Hat Creek next door.

reviews.author: Sarah M.
reviews.description: Made our way in last weekend to give this place a try. The restaurant was extremely clean and nicely decorated.   Food: we tried the toasted ravioli, garlic knots, Italian chopped salad and pizza. The food came out quickly and was very tasty. While the prices were not cheap, I do think you get a good value for what you pay for.   The only improvement we'd suggest is letting customers open a tab and be able to order both food and drinks on it. We were told they're already working on this though!

name: The Dig Pub
accommodations: Best nights on Thursday, Friday, Saturday

reviews.author: Carlie M.
reviews.description: This has been one of our favorite local places for years now. The new owner, who previously worked here, is a real stand-up guy and has been nothing but awesome towards us. He has taken on a lot more than being an owner; he actually works his business and takes serious pride in the place. Having taken over just before the pandemic, and knowing what that did to restaurants all over, it is hard to see people leave such horrible reviews. You can tell some of the reviews might reflect the person leaving them and not the place itself. Do not let those deter you from trying this place. You will not regret it. The area outside was a great addition for the dogs and kids run around. We have favorites but like try something new from the menu when we go and have yet to be disappointed. Also, pretzels and beer cheese with beers...mmmm!!! My husband likes big beers and I like Kolsch. Want wine? They have that too. They always have something that makes us both happy and that is what keeps us going back for more. Every time we have friends or family in town, this is always on the list to take them. Help keep this local gem afloat! They deserve it! And remember, the more we go now, means the better the place will be in the future. He has plans up his sleeve but that takes revenue :) Keep it up, Dig Pub!

reviews.author: Justin S.
reviews.description: Not too much to say.  The workers are very friendly and the beer selection is okay. It's a strip mall, suburban kind of bar.   The manager told us she was the manager like 50 times so we'll never forget that she's the manager.    "I'm the manager". "So I'm the manager and I can add beer to our menu if you like". "I'm the manager, so I make decisions". "So I'm the new manager here and I can make things happen".   It was definitely a laughable but enjoyable experience. Nothing to special.  Just convenient because it's located nearby.   The guests were mostly old white people. The outdoor area is nice.  At least they have that, so you're not cooped up inside a small space with die hard Trumpers who hate everyone and everything different than them.  .

reviews.author: Ted C.
reviews.description: Evening in the suburbs and the dining options were dwindling. I was getting hungry and being out with my buddy meant that I'd have at least one more beer. My friend went through his mental list of places and came up with The Dig.   We arrived there and fortunately got there in time, it was a slow night and the kitchen was about to close so we quickly made our choices. I saw that they had Scotch Eggs and I'm a sucker for Scotch eggs, but unless you're a vegetarian/vegan what's not to like about an egg wrapped in sausage that's then deep fried?  I also ended up getting their Buffalo Chicken Sandwich because...actually why do you need a reason?  The egg was good, a little thin on the sausage side but the mustard dip added a little more savory. The sandwich had a good amount of spice but the sauce was pretty runny so it was messy but otherwise good.  They do have a lot of taps and I appreciate that they try to have a little bit of everything and focus on locals. I get that they have to strike a balance between locals who want a beer that's cold, yellow, fizzy and domestic and crazy whale chasing beer nerds that are into barrel aged, wild/lacto, hopheads but for my visit it was a little more on the tame side. I had a sour from Prairie and a local mead which was great and at the time, that was about it.

reviews.author: Jeff B.
reviews.description: Drove by here today and thought I would check it out and I liked it! I ordered a Peacemaker Beer, an ale that tasted good. The next time I want to try the Blackberry beer. The name itself is appealing. Since it was close to dinner I figured I should order food instead of going home and cooking. I got the fish and chips. You can order the 2 piece or 4. I got the 2 piece with cut fries. It was cooked good. The fish was flaky and not oily. The pubs tarter sauce was good.. the fries were very good too..   The service was very good. There was a sign to sit yourself which I did and within 1 or 2 minutes my server stopped by to get me started. She showed me the ropes and got my beer and food quickly. I was really surprised at how fast my food came out. I can say it was just under 10 minutes but I was still surprised at the promptness. There was quite a few customers but the servers were on top of it. They talked to the customers as if they were family.   The place was clean and there was good parking. The beer menu had several types of craft and IPA beers. I'm  pretty sure I will return when I have time. My total cost including the food and beer was only $14, amazing! Thank you Dig Pub for being in Cedar Park and giving up another place to get a beer and some grub in a friendly way!

reviews.author: Michael R.
reviews.description: There are lots of reasons to come in: Erick the bartender, the local beer options, the chill vibe, Erick the bartender, the buffalo chicken sandwich, Erik the bartender, and the whole staff is super cool. Never miss a chance to swing in on Tuesday or Sunday when I'm free. Welcoming, unassuming, the regulars are tons of fun, and overall a good time.

reviews.author: Nicki T.
reviews.description: The Dig Pub--new manager, new owner, now a new chef, things are really looking up, Cedar Park, Texas! The Sunday brunch is fabulous and should be famous, and the hollandaise sauce is definitely the best I've ever had. Topped off by Guinness and fried pickles, brunch was a hit. The chef hinted at more things in the works, like beer pairings and monthly specials, so we can't wait! Way to rock the craft beer, and now the food is being perfected by the chef, formerly of Snooze, Loro, and now the Dig! Awesome, mate.

reviews.author: Krista L.
reviews.description: In their left side room with 2 booths, the first booth was propped up to look like it was stable, but it collapsed when I sat down ...  my butt literally hit the floor! And I've broken my tailbone twice while playing sports. My wife and I reported this to several staff and received shrugs!! We stayed long enough to finish our beers and while we were drinking, staff propped the booth bench back together. I disassembled it twice but they kept putting it back. This place is just begging for a customer to get hurt and get a lawsuit!  If someone does, then I'm willing to testify.   I've posted photos of the bench c

reviews.author: Adrienne S.
reviews.description: Great atmosphere and service. Food is typical bar/pub food but definitely a great place to grab a beer.

reviews.author: Lucky N.
reviews.description: This place is interesting. The right side of the restaurant looks pretty nice and lively and the left side of the restaurant looks like they gave up or ran out of money on decorating and just put a few tables out. They also have an outdoor area but no shade so I didn't want to sit out there unprotected, otherwise, it would have been nice because I had my dog. It was a bit busy so unfortunately had to sit on the left side (maybe everyone else there agrees the right side is better and that's why they all preferred to sit there). It didn't look or feel particularly clean and I'm a clean freak so I didn't particularly enjoy sitting there.   The service was fine; the waitress was nice. The food was pretty decent, but nothing outstanding or memorable where I feel I have to come back again. It was fresh though and I appreciate that for comfort food, it wasn't soaked in oil. I think the ambiance had already turned me off so I didn't enjoy my food as much as I would have it was clean.   They are known for their beer but I don't drink beer so take my review with a grain of salt. Clearly I'm not a dive bar kind of girl (unless it's out for drinks and bar hopping) but plenty of people are fine/really like those types of places so if you do, you'll enjoy this place. I'm not knocking this place and I would come back if friends wanted to go but I like more of an ambiance when I go out to eat.

reviews.author: Eric G.
reviews.description: Not only did the owner private message me after my last comment, he accused my wife of being in the way, while sitting at the bar top...  this place is a joke a JOKE What an ignorantly run, managed facility. Then he accused us of throwing things, If I had known this was coming I would of thrown half of my plate at the server, maybe then she would of gotten her tongue out of her boy friends mouth and actually gotten our order correct!

reviews.author: Kelsea K.
reviews.description: Good selection of various beers! Lots of tap options. Grilled cheese might have well been on the kids menu, pretty flat and boring... but my 5 year old liked it!  The adults got the Thor's Hammer and BLTA with fries and the table shared scotch eggs and pickle chips for apps. Sandwiches were straightforward and tasty and the fries were thick but crispy outside and soft inside.   Scotch eggs were better than Renaissance festival... but could have more sausage.  Pickle chips were average bar food. Overall, good meal and fair prices!

reviews.author: Rainey B.
reviews.description: So...for those who believe that The Dig is run by snotty brats, perhaps you should have some consideration for the amazing service industry folks who have gotten us through the last almost 2 years of Covid he!!. Erik, Sage, Miles, Kayla and the rest of the crew have been considerate and friendly throughout and the food quality has always been outstanding. The beer selection now is better than it has ever been (coming from an Austin beer snob who used to live on Rainey). Don't pass this place by if it is on your radar!

reviews.author: Sara J.
reviews.description: What a great evening at the Dig Pub! We took our dog and enjoyed sitting outside in the casual picnic area. Ben and Ashley provided the best service we've had in quite a long time. The food was fresh and quite tasty. Many choices for beer on tap...wine and cider, too. We will be back soon!

reviews.author: Chris R.
reviews.description: Knowledgeable staff about beer options. Friendly staff. Good food. Plenty of indoor and outdoor sitting.

reviews.author: Will S.
reviews.description: The Dig is a great local place in Cedar Park to meet friends and try out some really tasty brews, or wine if you prefer.  Lots of good seating both inside and out for  those who want a more open environment. Their pub grub is excellent, Scotch eggs to die for and some really tasty cheese offerings as well as some standard fare. The whole staff is friendly, honestly, never had a grumpy server and I really like sitting on a couch...one of the seating options depending on where in the pub you are. Check this place out, you might find that you....DIG it too.

reviews.author: Diana S.
reviews.description: Food - Acceptable Service - So-so Friendliness - Poor Chance of a return visit - Zero, mostly due to the unfriendliness of the waitress. Perhaps some training in the area of making your guests feel welcome in your establishment would help alleviate this problem.

reviews.author: Howdy B.
reviews.description: Nice place with relaxed environment. I'm not a beer drinker but I saw lots on tap. It's dog-friendly and the food is yummy. Alexander was super friendly and accommodating. We will be back!

reviews.author: Jim O.
reviews.description: The place to go in Cedar Park for a brew. Wife and I went for our anniversary night out to grab a bite and a brew. We had a blast. Service was exceptional with four different staff asking if we were good or needed anything. They were prompt and courteous and just plain nice. Food was served quickly and was delicious.
