Wife had the patty melt and I had the monte cristo; both were exceptional. The poutine as an appetizer is also on the to do list. We will be back.

reviews.author: Brian M.
reviews.description: We have been craving some loaded fries so we did a search and found this place. Recently they started offering delivery so we decided to order loaded fries, fried pickles, and a few beverages. The order was done fast and delivery was fast as well. Delicious food for a decent price. Support your local restaurants!

reviews.author: Steve W.
reviews.description: Very good food. Wings on Tuesday, fish and chips on Friday. Erik does a REALLY GOOD job. Good beer selection too.

name: Clive Bar
accommodations: Best nights on Thursday, Friday, Saturday

reviews.author: L. W.
reviews.description: Great bar! Great vibe for my most recent sxsw trip! The staff were beyond lovely and great energy. This is a must stop when you wanna meet amazing energetic people. Austin was the best! Made us feel welcome :) love from some Cali kids!

reviews.author: Brendon G.
reviews.description: This an awesome bar to go hang out get drinks and get crazy. Great vibe for the bachelor party this past weekend. Staff is friendly and bar tenders are excellent at serving you drinks and not making you wait 20 min. Highly recommend.

reviews.author: Sheree S.
reviews.description: I feel like I walked into the movie idiocracy. That's the type of people they're attracting now.

reviews.author: Kristin P.
reviews.description: love -almost- everything about this bar!  really great vibes all around except for one of the female bartenders on the top floor randomly yelled at me to calm down when I was waiting for her to take my drink order. I was taken aback because I didn't say a word to her and was smiling in my own little world so I thought her negative energy towards me was unwarranted.

reviews.author: Charlie T.
reviews.description: This bar is located on the popular Rainey Street. My visit here was to check out Bar Ilegal, a small mezcal based bar that is located in a small shed-like building in the back.  Both bars were popular as there were a good amount of people hanging out in the area. I ordered a Mexucan Mule and it was great. I liked the bite that it had in the drink. The bartender was super friendly and also suggested a couple of other bars that I should check out.

reviews.author: Jim R.
reviews.description: Fun place! Great live music and a lot of people played Corn Hole.  The place wasn't obnoxiously loud.

reviews.author: Tim D.
reviews.description: Clive bar is nice, but it's really a front for Bar Illegal, which is a private bar for bikers and vampires.   About midnight,  the queen of the damned will come out and dance with a python and if you are lucky she will allow you to drink mezcal off her.  Backroom access requires one must know the secret knock before the peephole opens and challenge  password ensues.  Dont even try without the invitation, but fortune favors the bold.  Should you go crossing the silvery brook, it's best to leap before you look.

reviews.author: Ryan R.
reviews.description: Been to Clive Bar several times, and is usually one of my first go-to's if I'm in the Rainey area. Their bar itself is not one of the biggest bars there is but the overall atmosphere seems to be a mix of chill and lively without being too much at times. Located just a stone's throw away is the elusive Bar Ilegal, which used to be a really subtle and unnoticed mezcal bar before Rainey became what it is today. Overall Clive Bar is a great place to warmup for a night out on Rainey, esp with Container Bar just across the street.

reviews.author: Wendy G.
reviews.description: Oh Rainey Street what can I say about you.......  To be honest, I was wandering down Rainey Street on a Saturday night, with certain bars with lines wrapping the block. Clive Bar though, seemed chill with no line and a decent amount of people where I could still have my own personal space.   Quickly got in and into the bar, bartenders were easily accessible which is a big bonus. 2 specialty cocktails for $20, I'm not complaining. Both drinks were made with love and a little heavy hand but you'll never hear me complain about it.   Another bonus, I was able to snag a table for our group and we were set for the evening. They had an awesome DJ playing 90s + 00s hip hop and RandB. Super dope bar with a cool outside space (Cornhole available) with a mezcal speakeasy as well.   For all the lines and drunk people, I'd come back here for a chill, lowkey night.

reviews.author: Kristen B.
reviews.description: Neat spot - good music, good drinks, lots of space and a speakeasy {Bar Ilegal) to boot! I only visited once while staying in Austin for a week but would definitely come back.

reviews.author: Maria W.
reviews.description: I have some mixed emotions about this place. I went at 2pm on a Sunday afternoon and had a great time drinking and watching the game on the patio with my friend. Well if I'm honest, she was watching the game, I was people watching!  The location is great. It's on a corner and has a good view of the street below. The rustic vibes and good music made for a nice time. The bartenders were all very kind and worked quickly. The drinks were made very very well. I had their signature Mule and my friend had a Strawberry Fizz. They were $10 each and I felt worth every penny. Now by 4:00 a younger rowdy crowd came in and the relaxed vibe changed. They stood in front of the tv and those of us watching the game quickly decided to leave. I am not taking away any stars for this because  I had a really good time and the bar itself cannot be held responsible for the how people act. Just go early

reviews.author: Thomas N.
reviews.description: The Clive Bar is a really fun place to meet with friends when venturing out on Rainey Street. Attentive wait staff, good drinks and music. Also don't miss checking out the Mezcal Bar in the back area. The bar tender knows her mezcal and can create some magic for you.

reviews.author: Muriel S.
reviews.description: Can we talk about the illegal mezcal house outside? Take a step into history into this little stable that is now used as a bar. The bartender told us all about how the building was used and he had a Hiiii he variety of mezcal and tequila. This was truly something out of a movie.

reviews.author: Amanda S.
reviews.description: Clive Bar holds a special place in my heart and is probably my favorite bar on Rainey Street.  When my husband and I started dating in 2011 it was where we would go often.  It was a different Rainey Street all together back then.  There were only like 3 bars in the area at the time.   Clive Bar used to have the frozen peach teas that were amazing!  I still think back to those and wish they still had them.  I usually ask every summer if they will bring them back - I really really wish they would.  All the bartenders here are amazing and super nice!  I love their drink menu and they have a nice selection of beer on tap as well.  They have some infused liquors too that change out every now and then.  Honestly if you don't know what you want just ask the bartenders what they recommend and tell them the flavors you like and they might be able to whip something up for you.    I also love the openness and atmosphere at Clive.  No matter the season it is always good.  They also have a Mezcal bar that is open on the weekends in the back.  If you have never experienced this I would highly recommend trying a flight to taste.    So if you are on Rainey Street - don't skip Clive Bar - it is a must stop for sure!

reviews.author: William T.
reviews.description: Came here a couple of times recently and definitely enjoyed myself.  First, the bar has both an inside and outside area - the outside area is reasonably large, so that's where we spent most of our time. One point I want to make is that the bartenders were really nice throughout our visits there. They were friendly, remembered my name, and just did a great job in general.  One fun thing about this bar is that they have cornhole outside. Of course, it's only one set of boards, and you'll have plenty of other people wanting to play, so you can pretty much play a few games max. But a few games of cornhole is better than no games at all! One small negative about the place is that they had some pretty subpar BBQ restaurant serving food there (on a Thursday). Granted, it's not like the bar itself is serving the food, but I would have preferred they allowed a better restaurant to take up real estate.  Overall, I definitely recommend people come here and have a drink. And if you don't like it, you can go to one of the other many bars on Rainey St. :)

reviews.author: Kevin W.
reviews.description: My review will focus on Bar Illegal. My friends and I were on the hunt to find speakeasies in Austin, and Bar Illegal is one of the easier ones to get to. It is visible from outside Clive Bar, but to get to Bar Illegal, you must walk through Clive Bar's outside area and into the small building that is roughly the size of a shed. The small structure seemed to be made of stones, and it had many cultural items representing Mexico that were spread around: religious paintings, prayer candles, skulls, and other decorations. There were only four other people not including the bartender and my group of three. I would approximate the 'comfortable limit' would be 10 people. The bartender was well educated on the topic mezcal! He got a sense of what we individually liked to drink, and he selected a different type of mezcal for each of us. I drank my mezcal as a shot since it's a little too strong for me, but the bartender suggested drinking it slowly. The prices of the mezcal were all under $10 for shot glass sized servings. The bartender was also awesome enough to suggest other speakeasies and tell us 'passwords' for one.

reviews.author: Stephanie Q.
reviews.description: Clive bar is a real chill bar. We sat outdoors and played cornhole. There are also lots of TV screens for you to watch your favorite sports teams!

reviews.author: Adam F.
reviews.description: I'm a huge fan of mezcal, so when I heard a bar had a speakeasy-ish room in the back that specialized in it, clearly I had to pop in and check it out. I do feel like it would make more sense for it to be its own yelp page, as while it is owned jointly and running under the same liquor license, the purpose (tasting high quality mezcal) and menu (just a long list of mezcals) are totally different from the main bar. I didn't visit the main bar, just Bar Ilegal.   Anyway, unsurprisingly, it's tiny (could fit maybe a dozen people before it'd start to get uncomfortable), but when we were there, around 9 PM on a Saturday, it only had about 6 people in it - I suppose a bar for just tasting mezcal is pretty niche (they do have 4 mezcal cocktails as well, but they honestly didn't look like anything particularly spectacular). The bartender clearly knew his mezcal very well, and prices are actually surprisingly reasonable for a spirit-focused bar. I asked to try the smokiest reasonably-priced mezcal he had, and got one - Del Maguey's San Luis del Rio - that I absolutely loved, a half-pour for $6.50 (I also love that they do half-pours, for if your primary motivation is "sample new mezcals" rather than "get crunk"). Based on previous experience with places like this, I assumed it was a truly ludicrous markup and that I had just found my new favorite affordable mezcal, but nope! It's a 70 dollar mezcal. So, happy that I got to try a 70 dollar mezcal (it was delicious), but also a little sad because now I'm still looking for my "can always keep a bottle at home" affordable type mezcal. Oh well.   But anyway, yeah, if you like mezcal, you have to check out Bar Ilegal. Really wish my favorite mezcal bar locally would do mezcal samplings like this one does.

reviews.author: Michele L.
reviews.description: My favorite bar from the whole area from 6th street to Congress to Rainey.  It's located on the corner with plenty of front and side outdoor seating. The interior is dark with leather studded bar stools and a few tables at the bar. The bartenders were friendly and attentive with good pours on our Maker's for $7 each and specialty bourbon drinks for $10 each.  They have an awesome Rock band that plays each Sunday afternoon. Really good set-list, front man, and rockin' guitar jams.

reviews.author: Brian S.
reviews.description: During our first night in Austin last week, we ate at Emmer and Rye and then walked up Rainey looking to get the full experience so we tried out a handful of places. Clive really stood out to me as having the full package.   The inside space is cozy and lodge-y. Coming from MKE, we felt right at home. The outside deck and patio space is huge. Plenty of room for everyone to spread out and still keep a game of Bag Toss going.   Later in the week, we were with a bunch of our KW coworkers and one of our party members thought it would be a good idea to try out Container Bar. Wrong. It was a like an undergrad frat house in there. SO loud, SO sweaty, SO many college kids. No offense if that's your thing. Clive Bar SAVED THE DAY.   Get the Matthew Pecan-aughey.

reviews.author: Josh F.
reviews.description: Deepa made planning a rehearsal dinner from almost 5 hours away a breeze; helping me find a caterer and having the whole event go off without a hitch. Karen and Neil were extremely attentive and made everyone feel right at home. The wide variety of Texas craft beers, wines, and meads absolutely blew everyone in attendance away and we can't wait to go back to try the beverages we missed.

reviews.author: April S.
reviews.description: Who knew there was such a thing as mead but the wonderful girl behind the counter helped us with choices and filled us with lots of knowledge.  My parents were staying at the cabins at onion creek right behind this place and when we stopped I saw a dog inside so I called my parents and said meet us up here and told my husband whoa we gotta pet that dog!  I enjoyed the bead as I had never had it before and loved the inside decor and how the place is set up.  Cozy if you want it, outside on the patio ( not for us since it was raining) up at the bar or in large tables.  If you're in the area its definitely a must.

reviews.author: Liana W.
reviews.description: I definitely recommend this tasting room!! It's right around the corner from Salt Lick and Duchman winery and definitely worth a stop!   We got a cider/mead/wine/beer flight (4 tastings, one of each).  Very cool interior design. A hidden gem- I hope you all try this place!

reviews.author: Lauren B.
reviews.description: This place was ok. Didn't love it. Didn't hate it. My husband and I stopped in on a random day date through hill country on the way from Desert Door (excellent).

reviews.author: Robert M.
reviews.description: Been here twice  and both times have been impressed with the variety and quality of their choices for wines and beers. Staff have been knowledgeable and friendly. Prices reasonable.  Met the owner tonight - really earnest, smart and nice guy. Only downer- Geeks who drink trivia. Absolutely despise it. Awkward format, unintelligible announcer, questions relevant only to the very young.  Won't be back for that.

reviews.author: David G.
reviews.description: Big ups to our new friend Jamie and his new place Hill country.  Very quaint place with two stories and plenty of samples for the beer drinker or wine drinker.  Your husband doesn't like wine?  No problem.   They got beer.  And plenty of it.   IPA's and Hefeweizen's will greet you at the door.   Family and pet friendly place. We will be back for sure.  Thank you for the awesome graciousness.

reviews.author: Kami C.
reviews.description: This is a great little place for wine or beer. They have a nice selection of great Texas wine and beer and the owner is a really nice guy.

reviews.author: Tracey N.
reviews.description: We are from the area and stumbled upon this gem.  The owner/bartender was outstanding and the place is out of a Pinterest page.  We bought a few bottles and hung out for a few hours.  We will be back and recommend this spot to anyone in the area.

reviews.author: Trent W.
reviews.description: Big fan of this place. Brand new building and very well cleaned and kept. We were greeted with great hospitality by our bartender. I had never tried mead before and was offered a tasting of it. We ended up having beer flights from their great selection. Perfectly located, close by to Salt Lick BBQ. Come to this place and try for yourself!

reviews.author: Cathy R.
reviews.description: We had my husband's 50th birthday party at Hill Country Tasting Room. Deepa was so helpful with coordinating all of the details. We met beforehand to plan where to place the food, decorations, and talk about special drink offerings. The staff was super friendly, went out of their way to make us feel welcome, and made it a very special night. We had a party of about 25 and the space was perfect! Would highly recommend and will definitely visit again.

reviews.author: Kevin H.
reviews.description: An oasis on RM150. Sort of in the middle of nowhere (for now), this place is a welcome sight for the people in Hill Country who like to drink. Beer, wine and mead only in a warm industrial space. The service was very accommodating, however not as knowledgeable as I had hoped, given the selection and the many questions several of us had as we tried mead for the first time. Prices seem to be a bit high considering we aren't in downtown, but it's a place we'll visit again.

reviews.author: Coby C.
reviews.description: Great selection of beer, wine and mead. The staff is very friendly. The environment is nice. We will be back next time we are in town. Thanks!

reviews.author: Lisa P.
reviews.description: I loved the staff but they clearly don't want to pay for air conditioning!  Otherwise I would come back in a heartbeat!  Wine is great. They also offer beer, ciders and Mead!  If they don't realize that AC is important they won't be in business long!

reviews.author: Nicole G.
reviews.description: Came out to Driftwood Tasting Room while we were on our winery "date day". We met the owner Lindsey and she was so sweet and knowledgeable. The venue is right of FM 150 in an industrial space with a great atmosphere. I highly recommend it for a date day, couples trip, or any kind of party. Locally owned and all products are sourced from Texas! Total perk -- super dog friendly!!

reviews.author: Susan D.
reviews.description: Hill Country Tasting Room is a wonderful find - I strongly recommend it! We rented out the entire venue for our rehearsal dinner, and it was absolutely perfect. We had ~50 people with an outside catered buffet dinner, and the venue was the perfect size - it still felt intimate during the speeches, but there was enough room for everyone to sit, eat, and mingle. The layout worked really well for us - for dinner, people could sit and eat on both the ground floor and mezzanine, and for speeches people mingled on the ground floor while the speeches were held on the landing. We love the atmosphere there - a combination of industrial, rustic, and chic that totally matched the vibe we were going for!  Planning was a breeze too - first Lindsey and then Deepa were both so accommodating and answered all our questions. Especially compared to some of the other venues I was talking to, Hill Country Tasting Room responded so quickly, kindly, and didn't mind when I asked a bunch of questions! I would definitely recommend them for hosting an event.  The drinks themselves were also amazing. We loved that it was all Texas beverages, and there were so many options! We were so glad to find a place that offered such a wide variety.  On the actual night of the rehearsal dinner, the bartenders were so helpful - I even got comments back from a couple of guests stating how nice they were! I can't wait until our next visit to the Dripping Springs area - we are definitely going back!

reviews.author: Joseph F.
reviews.description: Driftwood Tasting Room is tucked away in Driftwood, an oasis, but was a great stop! The staff were very friendly and knowledgeable about the selections they were carrying and they were able to make great recommendations based on our tastes. They have reasonable prices, they were in line with the other tasting rooms we had visited during the day. Their concept was awesome! Their selection is from local craft breweries and wineries and rotates between different companies. They also had the beverages available to take home if you found one, or more, you enjoyed.

reviews.author: E. A.
reviews.description: Two friends and I went to Driftwood Tasting Room and asked to do a wine tasting. The only employee there, Antonio, said the tasting would be $8 for four tastings. The menu had a long list of beer, mead, and cider as well as wine. We asked if we could mix and match the tastings between these drinks, and the employee said yes. We then asked, several times, if this would still be $8 for the tasting. He again said yes. When we went to pay, we discovered that our bill came out to more than twice that amount. Apparently, the tasting was not $8. He told my friends that we received full pours, and that's why it was more. Here's the thing, WE DIDNT ASK FOR FULL POURS; we asked for a tasting. The employee took it upon himself to give us the full pours, which we did not ask for and shouldn't have had to pay for. We left upset and confused as to what happened. One of my friends went back into the establishment to discuss a refund. We didn't want to all three go in and cause a scene, since the man was kind to us, we just wanted to remedy the situation. Apparently, he reexplained the full pours THAT WE DIDNT ASK FOR and then offered my friend $10 out of his pocket. She felt guilty about this and didn't ask for compensation for the other two of us that did a tasting. I repeat, tasting and not full pour. I'm not sure why he would offer us his own money instead of trying to correct the problem initially. Maybe he knew he was wrong? Or maybe he just wanted us to go away and not complain? I really don't know why he would do that. We discussed it more and felt upset about the whole situation and how it was awkwardly handled. It was a damper on what was supposed to be a nice day out. I decided to contact management through the Driftwood Tasting Room's Facebook page the next day to see if we could be fully refunded for the employee's mistake. I explained everything to the manager, Lindsey Pierce, who, of course defended the employee. I understand this, and I have nothing against the employee, but a mistake was made and I wanted it corrected. I didn't mention the $10, since it went to my friend who spoke to the employee. Apparently, this gave the manager reason to believe that I was lying. She said that my friends could contact her for a refund and I could get one after I returned the $10 cash, which I didn't even get, but ok. I mentioned how she was treating me like I was lying and like I was a criminal for complaining about what happened. Lindsey Pierce then THREATENED to take me to SMALL CLAIMS COURT for SLANDER for writing this negative review. All I tried to do was express my dissatisfaction and try to get a refund, and the manager treated me so impolitely and with such disrespect. I would never want to go to a place where the management treats a customer so rudely. There are better places down the road where the servers charge you what you expect to be charged and the managers are polite and genuinely care about your experience at the winery. I'd avoid this place at all costs simply because of how the management treated me when I tried to explain what happened.

reviews.author: Erika B.
reviews.description: Great place! Just a short, scenic drive out in Driftwood. Owners are friendly, knowledgeable, and welcoming. A great selection of local craft beer and wine that you cant find anywhere else in the area. We will definitely be back and highly recommend to anyone. Must try the Oocheenama Ale or the Mads Red Wine.

reviews.author: Marcy R.
reviews.description: This place is a hidden gem and definitely a much needed place for the growing area. It has huge potential and I hope they get enough business to stay in business! I live nearby and it's a nice place to grab a drink. Beautiful interior! The glasses of wine were a little pricey compared to the nearby vineyards but everything else seemed reasonable. The guy serving my friend and I was super friendly and helpful I hope they continue to have great service. The only things I would recommend would be to maybe add a couple TVs without sound on to keep some of the guys happy should there be UT games or golf on. The bar is a beautiful spot to hang out. I'd also recommend having some nice big glass jars with some pub mix or nuts in that folks could purchase by the scoop and maybe even a cheese/meat plate or some olives. It's a great hidden gem for us who live nearby to be able to have an upscale bar with great local beer and wines. And sometimes someone in a group doesn't want wine so it's nice to have the options! Something for everyone. Hopefully eventually a food truck or some dinner pairing event would be fun. I have seen some really cool events advertised on fb but haven't had a Chance to make it in to one yet. I will add as I have two kids I wouldn't recommend this a place for kids as there isn't really an outdoor space. A great date spot or place to meet friends for a small birthday. Bonus would be to add a happy hour or special pricing for driftwood locals!!

reviews.author: Bijal P.
reviews.description: First time here and am impressed we were sat down right away considering it was really busy.  The restaurant itself is pretty new they have a really simple menu and a great selection of beer on tap I should mention margarita on tap so good really craving one of those right now  Our server Ethan was very friendly gave us really great service.  We ordered a few drink I really liked my old fashion is was really good.  We really enjoyed our good everything was perfect especially my steak it was cooked to perfection. My husband also enjoyed his burger he said it was the best burger he's had.  I am definitely coming back to try something else thank you for the great service and being so hospitable

reviews.author: Kat B.
reviews.description: What a great restaurant! I was in town visiting my brother in law and he said he really enjoys this place so we went. Our waiter was friendly and patient. We started with the chips and queso, which were absolutely fantastic. We grabbed more chips because they're delicious and homemade. Highly recommend them. My husband and BiL got the patty melt and I ordered the chicken sandwich. I was very pleased with my sandwich and tots as were the boys.  My BiL and I both got the sangria-rita our waiter recommended and I loved it. Wish it was bigger, but absolutely no other complaints.

reviews.author: Jerry E.
reviews.description: We came during peak time on a Saturday evening. This means we are seeing them at their most challenged time. And I was a little "hangey" having to wait a half hour to be seated. But it was worth it. The waiter checked back with us every few minutes (mandatory for a good restaurant). And our order was delivered hot and fresh in a reasonable amount of time (a little slow because they were very busy - but in a reasonable amount of time).  We had chips and queso as an appetizer. The chips were the thick, homemade type. And the queso was their own recipe with ancho cili drizzle, crema, some sort of pico de gallo, etc. Really good - exceptional.  I had a chicken sandwich. It had a lot going on (in a good way). It was not just a run of the mill chicken sandwich. And the sidewinder fries are fresh and homemade.   My wife had the watermelon, which she also said was really good.  Overall, some creative foods that were well executed, and on point service  Definitely give this place a try.

reviews.author: Nick D.
reviews.description: Seriously, the best Sunday brunch north of Austin! And quite an impressive bourbon collection.

reviews.author: Linda P.
reviews.description: First visit. Very impressed. Quick service at the bar. Beer served in ice cold glass and well made mixed drink. Friendly server. We ordered Texas on Horseback, Queso Blanco, and The Republic Rustler. All so delicious! Great atmosphere. County music playing. Family friendly crowd. We'll be back.

reviews.author: Vandesha L.
reviews.description: I've had take out and dine in. After 3 consistent visits I can truly say this is my new favorite neighborhood bar. Eliana has been my bartender every time. She is amazing at referring a menu item or drink. All of the staff are pleasant and the vibe is definitely upbeat and happy. They are inclusive and go above and beyond to make sure each guest has a pleasant experience. I hade a Hell or High Water cocktail followed by a Pineapple Express. The drinks are fairly priced and worth the price. For food I had a Wrangler Patty Melt that knocked my socks off. I did substitute the Texas Toast for a regular toasted bun. The Jalapeo mousse gives me all of the feels and the carmelized onion gave the burger a sweet smokey taste. I'm not a french fry fan so I opted for the Mesquite-Sriracha Tater Tots. All I can say is ORDER THE TOTS! Even the side house salad was delicious. They toss the salad in a sweet and tangy dressing that's just enough. I love that this place is so close to home and does takeout. I will become a regular!

reviews.author: Jeff B.
reviews.description: Sorry this is a little late but I wanted to give a review. I stopped by here a couple weeks ago for dinner. The place was full, but they squeezed me in at the bar. I asked for a menu and a beer. The bar tender let me sample one of the beers on tap. I liked it so I ordered one to drink. I also ordered a patty melt with tater tots. The burger was think and made to order. I had to cut the burger because I did not want a big mess from trying to get a bite into my mouth. The burger was juicy since I ordered it medium and very tasty. I can say it filled me up. The beer was cold, nothing better than a cold beer, well almost nothing.  The atmosphere was as most sports bars are, a little noisy but people seems to know each other and they were friendly. The bartenders were busy but kept getting those drinks. The servers were also busy taking food and refilling cups of the patrons. There is outdoor seating but it was one of those HOT Days so I was glad I was inside. The parking is decent but they share with several other businesses. It was not too far away from the entrance so no need to wear the sneakers unless you want to.  Thank you Republic Kitchen + Bar for being a good neighbor and giving us another option to dine in Leander, Texas.

reviews.author: Polina W.
reviews.description: It was easy to grab a spot indoors. I had the salmon dish- it was spicy and salty for my tastebuds. I must not have read the description very well.  The Kids corn dog was tasty. The chicken steak dish was devoured, as was the watermelon salad.  All in all it was a good afternoon lunch.

reviews.author: Meagan H.
reviews.description: My family and I ate here on Friday. The food was good. I had the special which was a fish. My husband had a shrimp po boy. The kids had chicken strips and mac n cheese. The beers were good and cold. I love how they bring the beer in icy glasses.   We chose to sit outside but soon discovered the flies were way too many to be able to eat in peace. We couldn't stop waving our hands or the flies would land on the food. I'll go back, but sit inside next time.

reviews.author: Sasha R.
reviews.description: Decided to try a new place tonight, and glad we did! I had the patty melt, it was good. The only complaint I have about it is that they put the bread on the grill to get grill marks, but all I tasted was burnt toast. They do the top if the burger bun the same but it's not as grill marked. So next time I will ask for them not to do that, I hate black charred burnt toast. My husbands burger was good as well and both the tots and fries were tasty and perfect portion. They have a big bar with a good variety. I had a Hell or High Water to drink, and will definitely order that again. Delish! And last but def not least the service was great! Our server Kelsey was attentive and very sweet. Definitely looking forward to the next visit...word is they have a good weekend brunch, so we'll be checking that out.

reviews.author: Kate R.
reviews.description: Great food, great service, great atmosphere, love this place! Been here many times and have never once been disappointed. Great outdoor and indoor seating. Love sitting at the bar!  One recommendation only: maybe put chive tv or something else on just one (of 7'ish) tv instead of just sports

reviews.author: Ashley R.
reviews.description: The chicken fried steak needs seasoning. It was missing some salt and the sauce over it was so much it took off the breading. But the mash and veggies had great flavor and tasted good!  Texas Smash is good if you like a honey whiskey, I don't.  But the old fashion was just how I like it!  Overall good place to try, the service was good. They have tvs on but I'd recommend that they put subtitles on all of them so since we can't hear them we can at least read and know what is going on.

reviews.author: Jacque M.
reviews.description: Ordered the chicken sandwich and honestly it was great until I got to the bottom of the second piece of chicken and it was completely raw. I almost threw up because I was worried how much raw chicken I had eaten. I wish I would've take a picture but I got so grossed out I tossed it immediately. I understand sometimes cooks can be rushed and I'm sure this rarely ever happens. Everything else was great but I couldn't get over the meat being raw.

reviews.author: Elise M.
reviews.description: Great food. Great drinks. What more do you need? I absolutely love the barnyard fowl chicken sandwich. It's seriously delicious. All of the drinks I've tried are solid and they have a great beer and wine selection. Republic is a great option for anyone in the Leander area looking for a nice, trendy restaurant without driving all the way in to Austin. They also have a solid kids menu. We'll definitely be back.

reviews.author: Tara M.
reviews.description: The atmosphere here is great. Everything seemed good at the start. Then we went to order food. Out of steak. Out of salmon. Out of wings. Out of shrimp. Out of some Cabernets. They were out of everything we went to order. The server could not have been more kind and sweet. She said it was because they run out of a lot of things on Saturday nights so Sundays they're just out. Well, I did a quick review of the comments on this restaurant and this is apparently a running theme. 1. Shame on me for not checking the comments before we came, 2. Shame on them for not resolving this clearly on-going issue. I know times are tough, but just close on Sunday nights if you cannot have more product delivered. We finished our drinks and left without ordering dinner at all.

reviews.author: Andrew S.
reviews.description: First time visiting. The drinks and location drew us in. The 3 okra dish ( it's Okra prepared 3 ways) was an instant hit. This was a quick first review and I want to come back for a meal. The Drinks are interesting and a good mix.  Pro tip - parking can get challenging in the evening. This strip mall has a lot of customers, early helps or enjoy the walk :-)

reviews.author: Lora O.
reviews.description: First time here. Ethan, our server, was excellent. He did the best he could with working with so many items out of stock. I mean you're  out of Jack Daniels? And steak? And Salmon? Yikes! We had chicken fried steak and the chicken sandwich. Both very good! Pictured is a yummy dessert! A brownie on top of graham cracker crumbs topped with a toasted marshmallow. Along side comes vanilla ice cream drizzled with caramel and dark chocolate with a drizzle of raspberry coulis and fresh raspberries.  We will try you again.

reviews.author: Leena N.
reviews.description: I didn't love this place. I totally understand that with COVID, many restaurants have had to cut back their menus.   With that being said, it seemed like breakfast-y food definitely prevailed during our Sunday afternoon visit. Seeing that they do a Sunday brunch, I get it, but always pictured that included a few other options not focused around eggs or waffles.   My husband ended up ordering their burger (which isn't even obviously advertised as a burger), and said it wasn't anything to write home about. My mother-in-law had their chicken sandwich and seemed to be okay with it. Not much fanfare from my husband's stepfather or his girls.  I ended up ordering the chili and didn't have any major complaints. I would've loved to see more in the "siesta" part of the menu that wasn't a salad.   My other complaint was the noise. The music was so loud that we could barely hear each other across the table, which pretty much awkwardly split our party in half. At first, we tried to get past it by borderline yelling, but that got old.   In between waiting for condiments, I asked our waitress if there was any way to knock the volume down by a click or two. She mentioned that she would see what she could do, but that it wasn't guaranteed since "people pay for it". My brother in law ended up seeing the jukebox in the corner, and while that's fantastic, I don't think it's too much to ask to keep music at a reasonable level in a place where you'd expect your guests to socialize at their table.

reviews.author: T N.
reviews.description: Came here for the first time and was ecstatic about visit. Ordered a salad and asked for ranch. Said salad arrived drenched in something I thought was ranch. Tasted said salad and immediately my mouth was on fire. Asked waitress to verify if it was ranch and she says... "oh we don't have regular ranch, just a spicy one..." that would've been nice to know. I CANT EAT SPICY FOOD!! She proceeded to suggest I use another dressing to bring down the heat. Word of advice to owner... put the dressing on the side. I was sick all day from this incident.   Partner got French toast and it was amazing. Sadly we won't be back..

reviews.author: Donna C.
reviews.description: This was one of the worst experiences we've had in a restaurant in a long time.  The server was rude, the manager condescending (strangely, I don't remember him being so rude at Texican) and the place was dirty.  The table was sticky, and they knew it, even said there was nothing they could do about it because it was "resin"...it wasn't.  We ordered four entrees, and they came out in stages. The first ones to hit the table were cold.  The third followed five minutes later, and mine didn't show up for another five minutes, at which time I told them to just keep it.  The "hash" was runny and not at all hash, the scrambled eggs cold, bacon underdone, and no condiments available; when we asked for them, they acted like it was an imposition.    $92 worth of bad food and crap service.  Very disappointing considering the executive chef was wearing a Fox Hole chef's coat, and Fox Hole is one of my favorite places in this area; I assumed from the get it would be extraordinary after seeing that...I guess not.  Oh, and word of caution, when the server handed my fianc the mobile payment device, she selected the 20% tip option.  Make sure you watch out for that...there is no signage indicating there is an automatic gratuity so the servers have NO business choosing their own tip amount.  Update: while we were out of town, we discovered my fianc's debit card had been hacked.  Oddly, the odd charges started AFTER using the mobile payment device, which was WiFi powered.  I cannot stress this enough...BEWARE!

name: Main Streat Food Hall By H-E-B

reviews.author: Wes O.
reviews.description: Probably closer to 3 1/2, but I'm feeling semi-generous.  Think mall or airport food court, but with better quality and execution.  The hard part for our first visit was deciding which restaurant to try.  I ended up trying their Japanese restaurant and my dining companion tried the grilled cheese restaurant.  First and foremost, this is not a user friendly experience.  Every one of the restaurants is a self serve counter where you use a keypad to order.  The format of the keypad/menu isn't easy to follow.  More than one diner (besides me and my companion) needed to figure out how to order a drink.  (FYI, you order the drink from the keypad, then you get your cup when they call you up for your food.) Additionally, customizing an order can be a bit of a challenge. A lot of the online ordering platforms have customization options, but Main Streat has a space to enter your requests with the on-screen keyboard. Fortunately, the kitchen staff does a great job of reading and accommodating special requests.  I had the pork potstickers, which are some of the best in town.  They're crispy, but not deep fried and the sauce has a good flavor.  I also liked my noodles with the beef skewers.  The beef was high quality, but it would've benefitted from being flipped on the grill as one side had grill marks and the other side was just grey meat.  My dining companion had one of the grilled cheese sandwiches, which she described as good.  Once you figure out that you need to order the drinks at the same time you place your food order, you'll find the drinks in the limited seating area by the bar.  HEB has its own version of the Coca-Cola Freestyle machine which offers products from Coke, Pepsi, and Maine Root.  They also have sweet and unsweet tea as well as lemonade and strawberry lemonade.  The food is high quality and there are a lot of options available (surprisingly no burger or Italian options, though).   The awkwardness of ordering and very limited dine-in seating means that Main Streat will be someplace that I'd only stop by when in the area and probably during off hours.

reviews.author: Amanda K.
reviews.description: My husband and I stopped in for a small bite to eat and something to drink. There is a full bar but was a little surprised to learn that there is no cider on draft. Okay, what about cans? Nope, all out even after checking in the pack. FYI, this is attached to a grocery store. I can not have beer due to a barley allergy and I am gluten intolerant. I settled on a red wine blend which came from tap. We live in Austin, it would definitely benefit this place to add cider options.   The overall setup was great and enjoyed a drink and a small bite here with my husband. I can't wait until the weather is better and people move on from the 'rona so they can maybe have some live music or events where people can hang out.  They have a whiskey Thursdays that offers some discounts. If I was a whiskey fan I would probably check that out.

reviews.author: Romy G.
reviews.description: I'm going to start this by contradicting the haters who compare this to HMart and space that was otherwise not making money for HEB. When this store opened, this space was "cafe mueller," heb's first bar/restaurant, and I miss it! They had the best burger in town and really good brisket.  They had an outdoor play yard for kids. A lot of the outdoor seating area was sacrificed to add the Curbside buildout during COVID.   The food hall concept also opened during COVID, and conveniently has you order at a kiosk for each vendor. Very safe. All the seating is in the (very dark and cold) bar or outdoors, and there is less of it than there used to be. Also, I don't think any of the vendors have kids portions, and half the seating is bar height, so I'm no longer interested in bringing my kids here - total bummer, as we all loved cafe mueller. With the kiosks and separate bar, I am definitely not inclined to drag my kids here - I'd have to herd them through all the kiosks and the bar to get everyone's order in, and then pick everything up by vendor, and would be unable to have eyes on my kids at the table while doing so. You now need to go into the bar for drink refills, where I wouldn't sit with my kids because of the bar-height tables.   The pickup part is what makes the food court feel like an airport - everyone is just kind of waiting around. There are no lines, unlike cafe mueller, which always had a line, but the standing around makes it feel depressing.   The food is ok. I like some of the vendors more than others. My favorite is Calle Taqueria. It's a good place to pick up lunch to go midday, or for ordering from Favor.   The one advantage to Main Streat is that it tends to have no delivery fee on Favor, since it's at HEB. However, if you order from more than one place, you get more than one runner, since every vendor is a separate order. I suppose you can make one order at one vendor, and contact the runner to go to other vendors on the same run.   HEB, if you're reading this, I know you're collecting data. Windsor Park and Mueller has lots of families. Is there a way you could once again make this space friendly to families with small kids who want to get a bite to eat while doing the grocery shopping? And more of a community gathering space, with more seating? I used to meet up with a cyclist group here, and I don't think we could do that in the current configuration, nor will I visit with my kids for the reasons described above.

reviews.author: Samuel C.
reviews.description: Main Streat is the Food Court inside the Mueller HEB.  For a supermarket food court, it is not great.  The gold standard for supermarket food courts in Austin is Hmart.  They have a huge roomy pleasant space.  They have six-eight magnificent restaurants each of which would be in the top third of their category in Austin.  They are all Asian but different kinds of Asian.  Restaurants that fail at Hmart Food Court are typically still better than most of the other restaurants in Austin.  That tells you how good the successes are.  At Hmart, you can get really good drinks from two nearby vendors and the TV has fun things to watch.  At Mueller, Main Streat is jammed into a leftover hallway that was not earning any other kind of money for HEB.  The stands are small because there is no room.  The cramped hallway food court is an unpleasant place to be.   You are not drawn to it to fantasize about the wonderful dishes you could be ordering.  You are supposed to eat next door in the bar or in the patio beyond that.   The bar feels like a garage. It has high chairs so you do not sit too long. It is not a nice place to linger.   The patio is okay.  The selection of restaurants is not great.   My Asian food loving vegetarian wife found nothing to love in the one Asian stall.   HEB's barbecue is functional at best.   (The gold standard in supermarket barbecue is Whole Foods. Bowie BBQ is in the top third of the city.)   The Mexican stand is ho-hum.  So the duck-fat fried chicken place would have to be amazing to make Main Streat any kind of destination.  If you are at HEB Mueller anyway and you need lunch or a drink, you could make this work.  It is not a destination draw.

reviews.author: W C.
reviews.description: OK, whoever named this place "Main Streat" should be fired. Please, go word vomit on yourself and leave the rest of us out of it. Other than that, we had a mostly wonderful experience here on Saturday afternoon when we took our daughter here as a TREAT after she got her stitches out at Dell.  We're doing an overall review since we ordered from two places: Roots Chicken Shak (yet another idiotic spelling; why is grammar so uncool these days??) and Calle Taqueria.  We'll start with Roots: --Kale salad: tasty; did NOT appreciate so many breadcrumbs and definitely was appalled to see two whole anchovies on the top (that's a pretty baller move). --Fried chicken strips: Fine. The whole duck fat thing is a gimmick though because we have pretty discerning palates and you absolutely 100% cannot taste the difference. --Original fried chicken sandwich: Amazing, definitely one of the best ones we've ever had. Loved the sweet potato bun and the kale slaw.   Calle Taqueria: We're considering this place one of Austin's best-kept secrets right now because the food was some of the best that we've had in town, especially considering the price point. --Smoked brisket Quesadilla: incredible. Bursting with flavor, loved the cheesy underside. Sooooooo good. Superior in every way to the one that we've had in this style from Vaquero Taquero. --Al Pastor taco: see above word-for-word. DELISH. The only bummer here were the sides. We loved the street corn but the corn itself was limp and sad-looking. The refried beans were also...just weird. Something tasted pretty off in them.  As for the space, it's more like a little hallway than an actual food hall. It was clean and spacious and there's plenty of indoor and outdoor seating. A couple things that aren't intuitive are cups for water (you need to get them from the restaurant vendors) and that the loudspeaker doesn't extend to the outside for when your order is up (which is really dumb considering that's where most people will want to sit during Covid). BUT THEY HAVE NORMAL COMPOSTABLE STRAWS HALLELUJAH!!!!! Thank you!!! And all the silverware is individually wrapped as well. Those small touches did not go unnoticed or unappreciated. We will absolutely be back again.

reviews.author: Jena L.
reviews.description: First time visitor and I have to say the kids portion at the  Yumai Japanese grill was more than enough. I got the chicken fried rice and I could tell they used quality ingredients because the food was fresh and tasty. The rice wasn't heavily over soy sauced either. The pay/self ordering stations were a pretty cool touch, too. Would return to try the other restaurants and even the bar. Docked 1 star because it wasn't anything to rave about but very delicious. Especially before you have to grocery shop (never shop hungry)

reviews.author: Rain S.
reviews.description: I love HEB, but this food court and bar has really taken it to the next level. You get a choice of 5 vendors- bbq, Japanese, fried chicken, grilled cheese, and tacos. There also a bar where you can order drinks if you're in the mood. Another bonus- there are tables where you can dine in or sit outside, so you don't have to get it "to go". So far I've only had the bbq and the Japanese food, and they were both very good! I'm looking forward to my next trip back where I can give the others a try. Definitely check it out if you are in the area and want to get a quick bite to eat.

reviews.author: Abhra B.
reviews.description: First time visitor to the Main Streat, it is nice to have some solid meal options at this HEB now. I had the chopped BBQ sandwich and loaded baked potato, plenty of quantity with great taste. Robert was super helpful making sure we were taken care of. Looking forward to trying the Japanese and melted cheese spots on my next grocery stop.

reviews.author: Carter F.
reviews.description: Nice new setup. Instead of having the one "H-E-B Restaurant" now it's a actual food court with different vendors. I haven't tried all of them yet so can't speak for the food but I will update my review once I have. The BBQ is still HEB's bbq which is amazing!

reviews.author: Michael T.
reviews.description: I've walked past this place so many times and never walked in.  Tonight I went in there for a comedy night on a quiet Monday and ALL KILLERS it was the funniest lineup I have ever seen in my life.   This place knows what I want, but who's to say if I'm right.. you'll neeed to decide yourself bro

reviews.author: Steven C.
reviews.description: I came to this place with no expectations, just meeting a few friends for some live music and a couple drinks. I showed up before my friends and chose to sit at the bar rail and order an old fashioned. The bartender who I believe to have been the manager was wearing a Clemson University quarter zip. Idk if this guy was just having a bad day or what but boy did he make it obvious.   This guy was rude from the jump. Extremely short mannered, made the worst old fashioned just dumping simple syrup all over the outside of the glass and just tasted bad and left me with sticky hands. I asked what wines were available and was told they had mini bottles (2 glasses each) for $40+ no thank you.   In my opinion a bartender or waitstaff should make you feel welcome, make you feel appreciated for your service especially with Bars having been shutdown for almost 2 years with a hundred other options in a 4 block radius. I felt like I was doing him a disservice by showing up with a few friends and ordering drinks. The bar had maybe 10 people in it at the time so staffing was not the issue.   My advice, get out of the industry. Go find a job sitting behind a computer. Wouldn't recommend if it was the only bar open in town.

reviews.author: Bobby H.
reviews.description: Best dive on Red River. Low key and clean. Exactly where you need to hang when you want to be able to hear your friends instead of screaming over loud music. True locals spot. Come for the comedy, stay because you're shit faced.

reviews.author: Colleen C.
reviews.description: I love this bar and hope more people come out to it. Beautiful space, good drinks and music of course. Really hope business picks up here because it's a great spot.

reviews.author: john g.
reviews.description: This place is awesome and maybe a little too family friendly.   So 5 soul owns all the property that the brewery is also on. When we went there, they had 2 food trucks. One did pizza and salads and the other hamburgers and other food.   Inside of 5 souls is wicked cool.  We tried many of the red wine and they were alright.    The staff is super friendly and patient.  They also have non alcoholic  daiquiri  for the kids. Just a few flavors, but the kids enjoyed them. Of course they did they are just like smaller but more expensive Slushies.   The wine itself is pretty good and a tad on the pricey side IMO. $12/glass or $36 per bottle. But the atmosphere is so darn cool. It's probably one our favorite places to go to right now. Unfortunately or maybe fortunately they are an hour away.

reviews.author: Curt C.
reviews.description: Not 5 Souls, but 5 Soul.  This isn't really a winery, the grapes come from far, far away, from the land of California. This wine bar seems to be the alternative to the brewery across the lawn. This is part of a larger complex of pickle ball courts, disc golf course, brewery, and artificially turfed biergarten. This is a very family friendly place. Like one other yelper said, maybe too family friendly. "Mommy! That's your fourth drink already!" Don't mind screaming babies? Love having kids come and interrupt your drinking to ask questions? This is the place. Children are largely unattended here- you're drinking in a big play area. In fact, you can rent the wine bar for your tyke's birthday party! There's plenty of things for them to do. Whoever thinks it's appropriate to bring their children to a brewery and get upset when you curse ?  They serve up charcuterie plates that are prepackaged. They're in the fridge. The wine comes in pretty bottles. Based on the price points, it's encouraged to just get a bottle instead of going glass by glass. My favorite thing about this place is that they have (G-Rated) games to play, so everyone can play!  Parking was a bit of a challenge, but the place is clean, well lit and easily accesible.

reviews.author: Lee M.
reviews.description: 5 Soul is easily one of the coolest wine bars and tasting rooms I have ever been to. Co-located at the same address on Bob Wire Road as Frontyard Brewing, this facility is an impressive one. Their tasting room had lots of space - both indoors and out.   The indoor space was open and airy with tons of natural light from floor to ceiling windows and a modern interior. The service here is also a highlight as we noticed that everyone = the servers, bar managers and the owners were ALL making sure that everyone's experience was top notch. We found them to all be very friendly and personable - like those cool neighbors that you REALLY want to hang out with. One thing I liked is that this tasting room also had great energy to it - something that is missing from a LOT of tasting rooms and even some breweries.   Outside, the covered patio is large with plenty of seating for friends, families. The yard is extensive - an amazing space to bring your kiddos and just let them play and have fun.  This really is the kind of place that you wish was only 5 minutes (and not 45) from your house - so check them out.

reviews.author: Suzanne H.
reviews.description: We went here for a tasting on a sunny Saturday afternoon. It was amazing. The wines are to die for so juicy and well structured with great stories behind each wine and the winemaker. We were lucky enough to be there on a day that Brooke and Randy were there, they came over and chatted such an amazing couple.  Would definitely recommend and can't wait to go back but we took wine home to keep us going until next time!

reviews.author: Jason B.
reviews.description: Outing with friends and what a wonderful friendly place we found! Beautiful set up inside and out. Sharing local wines of all ranges! Group of 7 and we were well taken care of knowledgeable and fun! Great flight options or by the glass. See you again.....

reviews.author: Michaela P.
reviews.description: Happy to find this little gem of a tasting room! We've enjoyed CL Butaud wines for a couple of years after discovering it at Antonelli's Cheese Shop. It's a shared space with Wine for the People, just off Fitzhugh Road, which is quickly becoming a brewery/distellery/winery Mecca.   Whether you like white, ros, or red, CL Butaud has what you want. Light and clean white wines. Crisp, but not sweet ross. Love the BIG, BOLD reds. The Grenache and Tempranillo are both awesome! My favorite is the Cease and Desist, a 50/50 blend of Syrah and Tempranillo.   We've been tasting wine for years near and far. This is the way it should be done. Best experience ever. Reservations encouraged. Get your own picnic table outside and enjoy your stay. The sommeliers are friendly and knowledgeable. The winemaker, Randy Hester, will likely visit with you and share his philosophy and insight into the process. 100% Texas grown grapes.   Dog friendly. Outdoor games and food trucks forthcoming. Did I mention I'm so happy they've opened a tasting room!

reviews.author: Ashley K.
reviews.description: I soooo enjoyed my wine tasting at Texas AVA, which is a shared tasting room with CL Butaud and Wine for the People.    First, the outdoor space is great.  There are about nine picnic benches, well distanced, and most of them are covered/in the shade so you aren't baking in the Texas sun.  There were also nice design touches and little decorations, such as  tablecloths and flowers on the table, so the space felt very picturesque.  Next, there are three options for tasting: all CL Butaud wines, all Wine for the People wines, or a "duo flight" so you can try wines from both winemakers.  I brought my mother with me to the tasting and we decided to both get the duo flight.  I enjoyed all the wines we tasted, but my favorites were the Sparkling Chenin Blanc (Wine For The People), the Pa Pa French Rose (CL Butaud), and the Carbonic Petite Sirah (Wine For The People) (we added that last one on to our wine tasting, even though it wasn't included in the flight we chose).  What made the tasting even more special, beyond the outdoor space and the wines themselves, is that both winemakers were on site and pouring the wines.  We had the opportunity to talk to each of them, which made our afternoon feel like a very special experience.  You can tell they both have such passion for their wines and their passion is infectious.  We ended up buying five bottles of wine and I'm seriously considering joining one or both of their wine clubs.  If you are looking for a spot to hang out with friends and family and taste great Texas wines, I highly recommend visiting the Texas AVA tasting room.  I've already told my friends about it and I am planning another visit very soon!

reviews.author: Jeff M.
reviews.description: The best tasting experience in the hill country!  You speak with the winemakers/owners who are totally great people.  The wines are second to none and the food truck is at the gourmet level.

reviews.author: Nina T.
reviews.description: Seriously cannot say enough great things about C.L. And the TX AVA tasting room. The ambience inside their building was beautiful and intimate. We tried both CL and Wine for the People and there was not a bad wine to be had. We organized a large group to celebrate a birthday and they took great care of us. We were impressed by both the wine and the service. Thank you so much to the lovely staff and wine makers there!

name: Colleen's Kitchen
accommodations: Good for Brunch, Lunch, Dinner, Dessert
Garage Parking, Street Parking, Validated Parking

reviews.author: Samantha H.
reviews.description: Came to try out the mac n' cheese! My three year old had no complaints, so I assume it was good They have two versions: a baked one that comes in a very hot souffl dish and a kids version, and we got the kids' version (our waiter, Colin, recommended it on account of it not being baked so my kiddo didn't burn herself).   I had the Green Goddess salad, which was excellent, though I may ask for the dressing on the side next time (it got a little soupy towards the end there), and a Colleen's Coffee (bartender was great, but it's basically an Irish coffee and I wasn't very impressed with the quality of the coffee used but that may just be because I am spoiled these; it's basically what you'd expect from restaurant coffee)  The atmosphere was quiet first thing in the morning, and Princess Bride was playing on the TV above the bar. Fantastic!

reviews.author: Simone H.
reviews.description: Colleen's is extremely cute and in a cute little part of town in Mueller so we were excited to peak in and try the food!  In short, the service was slow and the food was not seasoned.   -Biscuits with honey butter and tomato jam: amazing! To die for! -Deviled eggs: bland but beautiful -Mac and cheese: it was good but missing something  -mashed potatoes: amazing! -shrimp and grits: amazing! -my friend really didn't like her cocktail. I wish I remembered which it was -the punch was great  We waited a while to get our order taken, but once it was taken the food came quick! Getting the check and having it paid for was a pretty long wait--all while seeing our server walking around and not working on the payment.   I'm not sure I'll be back, honestly

reviews.author: Tiffany J.
reviews.description: My mom and I were looking for a place to have dinner. I checked for nearby restaurants on Yelp and came across Colleen's (which I had bookmarked and forgot lol). Colleen's is located in Mueller. When I was a kid, Mueller was the site of the old airport. I cannot believe how much this development has grown! There's tons of shops and restaurants. We parked in the garage which is $1/hour. There's also street parking (paid). The garage was a short walk from Colleen's (less than 5 minutes).   The dcor of this restaurant is so cute! I love the disco ball hanging over the front door. They have a small bar and a nice patio out front. The staff was super friendly and our server Shelby was awesome as well as the other servers that brought out our food and cleared the table.   Food and Drink:  Pretty as a Peach - gin based cocktail. Really refreshing and delicious!   Deviled Eggs - I love deviled eggs and these were on point! I loved the flavor from the mustard seed and the bacon and chives gave it a nice crunch and saltiness.  Biscuits - we had no intention of ordering these, but a couple at the bar ordered them and when we saw them brought out, we asked Shelby for an order lol. Three hot fluffy biscuits that came with whipped honey butter topped with a sprinkle of sea salt. It also came with tomato jam. The jam was really good and we didn't realize it was tomato until our server told us. I would have been satisfied with just the biscuits lol. Yummy!  Brussel Sprouts - We ordered this as a side to our entre. They were roasted perfectly and had an herbed date vinaigrette which gave it a nice sweetness to compliment the savory flavors.    Pan Roasted Redifsh - the fish was really good. The filet was a bit smaller than I was expecting, but it had a nice crispiness on the outside. It came with corn, red bell peppers, and lima beans in an onion sauce (soubise). The description on the menu also lists okra (which is one of my favorite veggies), but it wasn't in our dish. We didn't realize it until after the fact.   When Shelby brought our check, she explained that the bill has a 20% service charge included which helps front of house as well as back of house staff. On the site, it also mentions the 20% service charge. She also explained that tipping on top of the service charge is appreciated, but not mandatory. So with the fee plus tip, our bill was pretty pricey for two people, but the food was absolutely wonderful and the service was exceptional.

reviews.author: Jeff B.
reviews.description: I really liked this place. The food was delicious and service was very nice. The astetics make this place very nice. It is a small restaurant packed with many tables and chairs. I do think you could easily take a romantic date here and feel satisfied.  The menu is set up for the southern taste, with fried chicken and collard greens, shrimp and grits and even a cheeseburger. I actually had a crab soup and cobb salad while my adult kids had the former. We all enjoyed our meals, feeling full but not stuffed afterwards.   The restaurant is located in a nice area away from the hustle of downtown and the Domain. There is a large parking garage behind the restaurant to park your car. It is a paid parking lot at $1 an hour but Colleen's validates you for 3 hours, so no issue. If you are looking for something different, check out Colleen's, I think you might like it. I did!

reviews.author: Mira D.
reviews.description: We ate here for New Years Eve and I was blown away! I saw that it has good reviewes but I am vegetarian so I wasn't sure if it would actually be good for vegetarians. It is. There were vegetarian options on the menu which was nice. We got the fried green tomatoes for an appetizer, I had the roasted butternut squash as an entree and we shared the hummingbird cake for desert. All three items were exceptionally good. My husband had the pork rib and he liked his dish too.   I was really surprised at how much I liked the butternut squash. When I saw it as the only vegetarian option I assumed it would be mediocre. It was actually SO GOOD. The goat cheese melted perfectly with the grits and the semi-sweet butternut squash worked well with the rest of the dish being savory. I also really liked the crunchy pecans and the buttercream icing for the hummingbird cake. It was delicious! I would go here again.... the only problem is they only have ONE vegetarian entree! Also, if you are vegan I would not suggest this place because I did not really see many vegan options on the menu.    If the chef or owner sees this review I have one suggestion for them. They should add chicken fried oyster mushrooms to their menu! It would be so perfect for the southern style theme of the restaurant and it would be a great vegan option for anyone that has a strict vegan diet. Iv had chicken fried oyster mushrooms at honeymoon spirit lounge and it was SO good and I think a spin off of that dish would work well here too.

reviews.author: Valerie J.
reviews.description: Really wanted to love this place but Was a bit disappointed.   Service 10/10- We came here on a Sunday around 1:30p and got seated right away. Service was good. No complaints there. The decoration does give me cute southern vibes.   Food- 7/10- my waffles were so hard. It seems as if they had been sitting out for a while and got hard and they were just warm. I didn't finish the waffles because the were that hard. The chicken was way over seasoned and dry. My bf ordered a bagel and said it was ok not the best but ok.   Restrooms are gender neutral- not an issues.  If you come during 11a-2p on Sunday they charge you automatically 20% service charge on your bill. Considering if you are coming with a big group it could get pricey including 20% gratuity.

reviews.author: Michelle L.
reviews.description: I've been to Colleen's for both brunch, dinner, and take-out (you can even order to-go cocktails at the small window on the side of the restaurant!), and don't think I've ever had anything that I didn't enjoy. I find myself craving their Colleen's Cobb salad, which--with the addition of Deviled eggs--might be my favorite take on the classic Cobb salad that I can remember having. Their cocktails are also tasty (and strong). One of the added perks is that it's within walking distance of where I live in Mueller, but the convenience is just one of the many things that keep me coming back :)

reviews.author: T H.
reviews.description: When you want some home cooking I would go here. Just skip the pork chop during inflation nation bc it's dry, all bone. Everything else is bomb!

reviews.author: Andoni S.
reviews.description: I found the food and service at Colleen's to be as pleasant as the ambience and indoor setting. They have multiple hot sauce options (one of which, as someone who loves spice, was actually spicy!), and it complemented the potato hash well. Their take on deviled eggs was an interesting one, and though I only sampled a few of their menu items, the ones that I did were of high quality.  I did find it slightly undesirable, however, that an automatic tip of 20% was priced into the bill, and a separate line for tip was present for the customer to tip onto the amount that already had tip included. Had I not been paying attention, I might have tipped twice. I personally had a good experience with the service, however considering the volume of reviewers that have mentioned the service, I find it an interesting option to strip the customer of the option to tip how they see fit.

reviews.author: Winfred S.
reviews.description: I will give this place 4 star rating based on the quality of the food.  But, we waited almost an hour for our food.  We were visiting the local children's museum and decided to come here for lunch.  We came at 2 pm on a Sunday so it was packed.    After a 30 minute wait,  we ordered our food at 2:30.     It seemed like the might there might have been a shift change and we got lost in the hustle.   Our waiter and the manager seemed to avoid eye contact.    When we finally talked to our waiter, he apologized.    When got our good at 3:30,  the food was tasty.   We ordered the deviled eggs which were tasty and one of my favorite items in the menu.   The biscuits were warm and flaky.     We were eating relatively healthy which I don't recommend at this home cooking restaurant.  The Caesar Salad with Grilled Chicken and Cobb Salad with Grilled Chicken was also tasty.   The Colleen's Brunch Burger was not too large but overflowed with great flavors.  The Four Cheese Mac and Salad was one of the best I have had.   I even snuck in some Fried Chicken from my son's Chicken Nuggets and they were delicious.    They were kind enough to take off 2 appetizers from our bill.  But like previous reviewers, I was cut off guard with the added on 20% service tip.  I was a little surprised with the service that we got.  The waiter did tell us about the "livable wage" and I felt that he repeated to other customers in the past.  I do support the restaurant industry during the COVID 19 crisis.   I do understand the cost of food and labor has gone up.  I  was also planning on leaving a 20% tip.   However, I think customers may balk at the required tip.   That being said, this is common practice in places like Miami were people don't tip.  I would return when they are not as busy because the food was tasty.  Don't be caught off hard with the required service tip.

reviews.author: Kristy W.
reviews.description: I've only ordered through Uber Eats and haven't visited the restaurant so this review is based on delivery only. Everything was packaged with meticulous care. Each item fit three packages and the packages for into the bag without taking over. Not too much packaging and not too little.  I ordered a Cobb Salad, which I thought would have egg crumbles but there were 3 hard boiled egg halves. That was a good surprise even though I ordered deviled eggs too. All shall be eaten in time. I asked to sub dressing and they did. Thank you.  Not many places makes collard greens and it's always different. I don't have a favorite but some address definitely better than others. These were not spicy, not vinegary, not salty (all reasons why I don't like some places' greens). They were maybe a touch sweet butt well-balanced. The biscuits were soft and not dry at all.  I wish you could tip the restaurant, especially BOH, fire such great food. Yeah, I just ordered a salad as the main but everything was MADE by hand, not just prepped. The biscuits, salad dressing, deviled eggs, greens, tomato jam.   Thanks to the staff here! Your food is great!

reviews.author: Lisa B.
reviews.description: The food was ok. The wait was long probably related to a small number of wait staff available. Which was fine as I got to walk around the area to check out other restaurants.   We had the cornbread, fried green tomatoes, buttermilk fried chicken and shrimp and grits. I enjoyed the cornbread but the others were ok. I felt like there was something missing when I was eating and so sorry, I had to ask for hot sauce. The food was a little bland in my opinion.    Place is cute and staff was nice, food is ok.

reviews.author: Mara M.
reviews.description: This is in my top five fried chicken joints in Austin--and might even be my top. Hear me out.  They have a boneless fried chicken breast, friends. Not chicken tenders, but an actual adult person sized piece of fried chicken. It is sooo hard to find this in ATX, I've tried. They also have a thigh, for those of you like my mom who prefer dark meat. And they are both super tasty!  I wouldn't say I tried it and was like "this is the best fried chicken I've ever had", but I've been here twice, and both times it was solid. Also, the biscuits are among the best I've had. Again, nothing fancy about them, just a good, soft biscuit. I'm not crazy about the mac and cheese, but I am vrrrry picky about mac. If you like it creamy you might enjoy this (I prefer it casseroley.)  Our server was great. I was prepared for the mandatory 20% gratuity, and it didn't bother me none.

reviews.author: Sabrina B.
reviews.description: Everything here is a BANGER! Great food. Great location. Great vibes. Able to get a relatively last minute reservation in.  Came here for a Sunday brunch and it's now my favorite brunch spot in Austin. I am thrilled I settled on the fried chicken and fried green tomato. They both came in a sort of biscuit slider fashion and were absolutely amazing. Didn't expect them to be so good, even on the second day. I appreciated the pickles to be a sweeter cornichon. The best side is the Mac and cheese. This is a true southern side dish styled Mac. Went great with the fried chicken. They have a section of brunch drinks as well, and the cocktails I tried felt like a sweeter aperitif, perfect for brunch. If you're having trouble picking something off the menu, I would recommend just copy into my order!  Our waiter was a bit slow, but it was a busy Sunday morning, so no worries there! Overall, 5/5 would recommend to anyone local or visiting!

reviews.author: Shawna B.
reviews.description: We were leaving Austin on our way back to Dallas and found this incredible spot through yelp - thank God! It was freaking DELICIOUS. To try several things, we ordered the fried chicken dish with gravy n mashed potatoes, baked mac n cheese, and tomato basil soup. OMG - I could eat here every single week. The food and drinks are presented beautifully and tastes very homemade.   The restaurant itself is super cute and totally Austin appropriate. Keep in mind they include a 20% automatic gratuity to the bill, which we were happy to pay to our server Rose, who was very kind and delivered exceptional service. We will be back next time we're in town no doubt.

reviews.author: Briana N.
reviews.description: Colleen's kitchen is a super cute restaurant in a newly developing area which I can tell is going to be a great area to visit.   The food was super delicious. The chicken pot pie crust was so flaky and the insides weren't too liquidy, but it was just very homey overall. The shrimp and grits were also really flavorful. I kind of wish the portion sizes were bigger but it's the perfect amount if you want room for dessert there or somewhere else in the plaza.  I visited for dinner and was able to grab the last chicken pot pie, but I feel like this restaurant has more of a lunch vibe, so I would definitely visit again then to really get the full experience.   The servers were super nice in checking up on us, recommending which drinks were in season, and just chatting in general.   And a plus: they validate parking for the garage behind them!

reviews.author: Wayne N.
reviews.description: Southern cooking with an expert hand, Colleen's kitchen has been somewhere I've been wanting to try for a really long time, but somehow never made it over until end of the year team lunch. And ya, it's not the world's lightest lunch, but it will definitely bring a lot of joy to you and leave your belly nice and warm and [a little too] full :).  Don't sleep on the starters. The bacon wrapped dates are flavor grenades of salty, pork, fatty, crispy, sweet flavor. They play very well together and other than wishing there were more dates per order, it's very good. The fried green tomatoes are also excellent with some comeback sauce with a kick.  Entree wise, I got my southern standard fried chicken. It's got excellent crunch and is deboned, so double win right there but it's also very well flavored, with hints of cayenne undergirding the bird. The potatoes are rich and just chunky enough and pair amazingly with the gravy. Collard greens have just enough bitterness to cut through the rich heft. The shrimp and grits looked really good too and my coworkers who did get it all raved about it.  All in all, thoroughly impressed and a great place for a meal if you're in the Mueller area.

reviews.author: Michael E.
reviews.description: A great spot to grab brunch in Mueller. We had both the chicken and waffles as well as the shrimp and grits and both were very well done. The ambiance is really nice and feels very comfortable when you are in there. The staff is very accommodating and friendly   really nice brunch spot in the Mueller area

reviews.author: Jeremie T.
reviews.description: Chicken and waffles were descent. But a 10.00 fee just to eat indoors is non sense. Atmosphere and location is everything...

reviews.author: Kim H.
reviews.description: First time here. It's very cute on the inside with great cocktails. We started off with the fried green tomatoes. Personal preference I've had better.
