They lacked a lot of flavor but the sauce made up for it. They are great portion to share. I ordered the buttermilk fried chicken dinner with the green beans, mashed potato's and biscuit. Portion is huge enough for 2 meals. Can't go wrong with any of the above but I'm dreaming about the biscuit. The hubs ordered the pork chop, also very tasty. Will eventually make it back in for brunch.   Covid-Indoor/outdoor dining, tables spaced out far enough, all staff wearing masks and guests required to wear masks anytime not seated at the table. They did start adding an automatic 20% gratuity which is stated on the menu and our server told us it's  "so the front and back of house staff could earn a livable wage"

reviews.author: Jen H.
reviews.description: If you go there, don't join the wine club.  They are only open on Friday, Saturday and Sunday and they never answer the phone.  If you ask to cancel, they won't cancel your subscription... or they say they will and continue charging you.  I don't understand why they don't listen to their customers...

reviews.author: Devin R.
reviews.description: How come this place doesn't have more reviews?! Susan and her staff are absolutely phenomenal!! They're absolutely the sweetest people you'll meet in town  This place is a must stop while your in town. Also, check out the groupon for the wine and beer tasting with the brewery next door. The pizza is pretty legit too, being all organic and all. Cheers!

reviews.author: Keaton K.
reviews.description: Susan was great.  Cute little place in Taylor,  when my gf said we were using a Groupon for wine tasting I kind of sighed and accepted that my night wouldn't be all that interesting but to be honest I had a good time, it was very relaxing.  Thank you Susan.

reviews.author: Tracy C.
reviews.description: Loved this small wine tasting room. Very intimate and comfortable ambiance, and The people here are so nice and welcoming. Live music and great wine! I definitely look forward to coming back!

reviews.author: O B.
reviews.description: I had been here before with my wife for a glass of wine, but last night's experience gave us a bit of a "bad taste", and we likely won't be going back.  There was no menu with the prices/wine choices listed, and only one red wine available.  We were served a taste, and it admittedly was not the best red wine we've ever tasted, but decided to go for a glass since that was all they had.  When we were told our total was $27 for 2 glasses of wine, I almost hit the floor.  A bit on the spot, as we had already been served and did't want to be rude, we reluctantly paid for it,  however we did not enjoy the wine nor time there because we felt like we had been seriously ripped off.   She was apologetic while ringing us up, but it would have been nice to have been informed the price, or at least charge us for a "normal" glass of wine seeing that was the only option for red.  In looking at the photo of the menu on this page, there isn't even a glass over $12, so wondering what we were served?!?!

reviews.author: N R.
reviews.description: What a gem!  Wonderful Texas wines in a casual and classy environment in the heart of downtown Taylor.

reviews.author: Anthony T.
reviews.description: Chain pizza spot in Austin! Decided to check out their other location since it was actually closer to us vs the one on Burnet rd!  This place is so beautiful and spacious inside! Was pretty crowded since I went during rush hour. Also, parking was a bit difficult to get. There are 3 other big restaurants near by and it gets packed to where people park on the sides.   Same exact menu as what I could remember from the one on Burnet rd. Their service was pretty fast for all the food we got. Started off with the appetizer - Beer mates, basically a cheesy bread. Nothing too special but a good starter if everyone wants more food. Had two medium sized pizza for the 3 of us. Ordered "The Works" "Ohh Lala". The works is basically their deluxe pizza, can't go wrong with that! The Ohh lala was on the sweeter side with the delicious arugula.   There were plenty of beer choices to choose from. Grabbed an IPA (completely forgot the name). Would definitely come back again! ;)

reviews.author: Kevin W.
reviews.description: This place is FANTASTIC!    I had a Caesar salad to start and the dressing was very good.   My choice of pizza was the Honey Pear!  DELICIOUS!!  The crust was a thinner hand tossed/rolled and then topped with:  Extra virgin olive oil, house cheese blend, sliced pears, caramelized onions, prosciutto, basil and local honey. (I had them leave the blue cheese off).   The BEST pizza I've have in ages!!!

reviews.author: Paula P.
reviews.description: Always a go-to for great pizza and microbrew.  Lunch special has some excellent choices to try out different pizzas/salad/pizza roll combinations.  Expect a bit of an adventure trying to find a seat at this location during busy hours. It's a chill place to sit, eat and watch sports or hang out with friends and have a couple of drinks.   Long bench style seating will make it so you may have to sit closer to another group than you may be comfortable with if you are trying to social distance.  Place gets sort of loud so don't expect to be able to have the deep meaningful conversation here.

reviews.author: Hima V.
reviews.description: Loved their pizza! I went to pick up pizza here on my birthday. I ordered the 14' Texas ranch and Margherita and loved the former. Unfortunately, I felt the Margherita was a lil underwhelming. I also noticed how the portion felt smaller than it should be. However, I would recommend to check out this spot for sure.

reviews.author: Doretta W.
reviews.description: Door is around the side towards the back. It is a very convenient walk from several hotels in the area.  If you want to eat... Walk in and turn left to place your order at the counter.  If you want to drink .. walk in and go straight to the bar.  They have salads, apps and several speciality pizzas ... sized from individual to family. You get soda from the fountain (cherry, cream, cola, etc) or beer from the tap (too many to cover here).   There are a few booths and tables but mainly it is community seating at 20' long tables. Kind of cool I think.  TVs everywhere ... watched baseball and ESPN. I bet this place is lit on Sat and Sun for football.  So the food? I really liked the beer mates .. garlic cheese bread. Good size and flavor for just $5. I had the pear honey pizza .. add blue cheese, basil and pancetta. I really liked the way the flavors all stuck out .. sweet, herby, salty ... love it!!

reviews.author: Rosalind A.
reviews.description: Amazing and Fresh!! The taste is pretty close to perfect from the sauce, ingredients, to the bread! First time here, and it's so Delicious! Friendly staff, and great customer service! Yuuuummmmmeeeee!

reviews.author: Susan S.
reviews.description: Very disappointing with the management and owner.  During my visit there, there were two separate tabs so that each of us could use a token. We paid separate bills. The bartender, without my consent, reversed those charges and put them all on a new single charge. Without honoring our tokens. I saw all this once I had gone home and saw my bank account. I only asked to either give us two tokens or refund us the price of two drinks. I reached out twice to management with hearing only crickets. At this point my entire tab should be refunded for lack of consideration and loyalty of a company.

reviews.author: Heather D.
reviews.description: Phenomenal!   The pizza is crafted with fresh ingredients, made quick to order, and absolutely delicious! There is an excellent beer selection, and the staff is super friendly and very helpful. We had a couple of pizzas, garlic cheese bread, a side Caesar salad and 2 beers. Great atmosphere for all ages. Zero complaints. They know what they're doing. We will be back!

reviews.author: Edgar S.
reviews.description: I have ordered pizza for carry out a few times from here and sprinkle in a couple of times eating pizza at their bar with a beer. The pizza is the only thing I have had from here besides beer and I enjoyed it. It has a large dining area and a roomy bar.  The only service I can vouch for is the bar service which was excellent.

reviews.author: Beth R.
reviews.description: The best pizza ever. Pepperoni w/Basil and of course The Armadillo  The salads are fresh and well made; and the BEER! Try the place, you'll see. The service for to-go and eat-in is consistently great. The people that work at the RR location look like they love being there. That's refreshing.

reviews.author: Bob F.
reviews.description: We had a great lunch at Pinthouse Pizza in Round Rock. The pizza was seasoned to perfection and served piping hot. I tried their Electric Jellyfish Beer and recommend it highly. My wife ordered the gluten free crust and said it was the best gluten free pizza she has had. If you are retired and looking for a great place for a long lunch go after 1:30 to avoid the  lunch crowd.

reviews.author: Kim O.
reviews.description: Pinthouse Pizza is the BEST!! Fresh salads, yummy pizza and the best ranch dressing I've ever eaten. Give it a try!

reviews.author: James W.
reviews.description: Best pizza dough period.  Wings are really good also.  Great selection of beer and you can get them to go if you choose.

reviews.author: Victor D.
reviews.description: Cool spot with lot of choices ! I go here if I want to go with my boys and order my food -  You definitely need to plan ahead for TNF and MNF -/

reviews.author: Lauren T.
reviews.description: Cool pizza and beer spot (they also have wine too).   Very urban vibes and very popular.  You order your food and drinks at the window and then it is brought to your table. The pizzas are unique and HUGE!   The armadillo was our favorite - sausage and goat cheese?! Yes please!

reviews.author: Adam L.
reviews.description: How can I possibly express how awesome this place is.  The food is outstanding and the crew is such a wonderful family.  Every time we stop in we are welcomed like regulars even tho we are (currently) new.  The cannonball is dope!  The tap selection is on point.    Please don't go tho, it's already so popular I can't find a seat at the bar! :)  J/k. I wouldn't belong in the family if I didn't welcome y'all in to join too!

reviews.author: Diana B.
reviews.description: I'm staying at a hotel next door and ordered take out from here. They have vegan and gluten free options which is great for me! I got a large pint house salad and a small gf cheese. Both were tasty. Customer service was good!

reviews.author: Cynthia V.
reviews.description: This is a good spot to come hang and catch a game on the TV while you enjoy some craft pizzas and beers. You order the food and beer separately, food from a walkup counter and beer from the bar in the middle of the restaurant. You get a buzzer puck when you order food so the servers can locate you and bring it to your table. We ordered the Beer Mates and Pizza Roll appetizers to start and two pizzas, the Oo La La and the Shroomin' Goat. Food timing was staggered and the only real hiccup was that the Beer Mates appetizer order seemed to have gotten lost because we had to ask for it after all the rest of our order had trickled out, and it then took about 15min more for it to finally arrive. But, when it did, it was piping hot and fresh, so that's good. Food quality was very good and we enjoyed everything we ordered.

reviews.author: Pedro R.
reviews.description: Solid Brewery with good pizzas, plenty of options on tap and a new can release every week.

reviews.author: Jonathon S.
reviews.description: I thought the name referred to the beers they serve and while that is probably the inspiration, I find it sad that it also refers to the amount of grease in their pizza (about a pint).  If you love pepperoni or sausage  grease then this is the place for you.   If you don't then don't get these meats on your pizza.  I hope the kitchen learns about skimming  fat off their more flavor proteins to prevent the crust from being a fatty sponge.  Happy Sunday everyone.

reviews.author: Ray R.
reviews.description: Local watering hole with 20 or so taps and other bottles/cans/wine. Everything you can want in TX feeling and charm. One of the core businesses giving Dripping Springs a soul.

reviews.author: Jeff W.
reviews.description: If you're new to Dripping Springs or just passing through, The Barber Shop is a cool little beer bar located in the historic downtown area of DSpgs. They've got a smaller indoor area to sit and enjoy the AC, or the backyard patio has plenty of room with long picnic tables. Many a live music to enjoy the afternoons with. The staff and the customers are a friendly bunch so stop in, enjoy a cold one and enjoy the good vibes.

reviews.author: Everett T.
reviews.description: So it's called The Barber Shop, but it's really a dive bar that's located in an old gas station. Confused yet? Great, glad we cleared that up.  From the moment you walk in, it's clear this spot is beloved by the locals. The crowd was a solid mix of tourists, cowboys, retirees, and working stiffs.  The tap selection is small, but they go out of their way represent Texas brews, even hosting a tap from Acopon, which is literally about 20 ft away. It's dog friendly, with a patio and a small performing space for musicians. This place just oozes history, it's definitely worth a look if you find yourself in Dripping.

reviews.author: Chris S.
reviews.description: Don't come here you'll ruin it. Perfect the way it is. Don't want to many new people ruining it.

reviews.author: April S.
reviews.description: We popped into this local bar to watch the Masters.  What great place.  When I saw someone at the bar with two dogs I said to myself this is the place. We ordered from the bar and then hung out for about an hour.  If i was in the area again i would seek it out for sure.

reviews.author: James F.
reviews.description: This Dripping Springs spot is stellar for many reasons. Low key, 99.9% percent locals hanging out in the evening. Excellent bartenders over the years. Super cool owner too who I obviously know because of my tenure in this town.   The Barber Shop is so cool in fact that my wife and I chose to renew our vows there for our 10 year anniversary. Complete with a hail storm, cake balls from nearby Well Yeah Cakes, and a Elvis impersonator in his second ever appearance.   Beer is always cold; wine list is tragically minimal to the regret of my wife (think tiny bottles like near the airport). Yet, it's charms outweigh it's negative aspects. Heard these days there is a sammich outlet on site for food instead of ordering from nearby Pizza Cave or the shi*ty fried chicken at the gas station.   Biggest note here: It's little Rooster's favorite bar :)

reviews.author: Paul R.
reviews.description: Visited the Barber Shop after a full day of hiking as we needed to replenish our Carbs. Sat was their 6th anniversary so the shop was packed with live music out back and a special cask beer being offered.  I have been coming to the Barber Shop for years as a good friend of mine lives in the Springs and we always seem to default here. Take note this is a beer and wine bar only. Yes, they have soft drinks and water as well. This is a dive bar extraordinaire so there is no need to get all decked out to hang out. There are plenty of draft and bottle beers with all the usual craft suspects and always a few surprises as well. The venue is dog and kid friendly so don't step on Fido and keep your cussin to a minimum.  Friendly patrons, good service, and a great beer selection that's the trifecta. Stop by when you are in the area. Lastly don't be shamed by asking for a haircut....

reviews.author: Kacie H.
reviews.description: Excellent beer bar for a small town. Perfect quaint atmosphere and the picnic tables make it easy to get to know new friends.

reviews.author: Diron K.
reviews.description: Great beer selection and very friendly people. The added bonus is that the smokers have a section for themselves outside. We meet here every month or so for good beers and a good time.

reviews.author: Jon B.
reviews.description: I live in Seattle and have relatives in Dripping Springs -- "Dripping" -- to the locals, and have been coming here for years. In the early, early, early, early days it was a gas station and my dad told me they'd stop here for gas when traveling cross country in the 50's. I love this place because it's got a great history, the building rocks (pun intended), and the beer selection should satisfy most any beer drinker; lots of variation. They also serve wine and some non-alcoholic drinks. Children are tolerated until 9 pm. There's an area out front to gather and stand, an inside area to order and sit down, and a backyard area -- some covered, some not -- with picnic tables and chairs. There's music on some nights, a great after-work vibe, and friendly atmosphere throughout. Easy Texan drinkin' and relaxin' all the way. Stop by if you're in the area.

reviews.author: Jordana G.
reviews.description: I can't believe I've never reviewed the Barbershop. It's the quintessential neighborhood bar. Have a beer with friends (or soon to be friends) and enjoy the Texas casual ambiance. They also offer ciders and the wine selections, while not vast, are good quality choices for the major wine categories. The beer offerings are superb. I've been coming here since they opened (5 years ago?), remains one of my favorite bars.

reviews.author: Marshall O.
reviews.description: This place deserves a five star review; it has a great selection of beers in a small town. The beer is cold, cheap, and the bar has a great atmosphere.   I went in last night (Tuesday/Halloween)for the first time in a long time. The World Series was on and I decided to grab a beer and hopefully see the Astros win with other Texans but... they lost. The crowd was small and friendly but I did feel like a party crasher because they all knew each other and were passing the guitar around. I hope this place hasn't turned into a towny bar because it never was in the past.   I'm going to have to go again to make sure or at least that's my excuse to go get good and affordable craft beer.

reviews.author: Christine G.
reviews.description: One of my favorite places in Dripping!   Love to go when they have the pickers circle on Sunday.  So much fun and great local musicians.   Love the beer specials too!

reviews.author: Steve D.
reviews.description: Not anybody but locals know about this place, they prefer to keep it that way. Don't expect fancy artwork, foo foo drinks or any food. Beer, Beer, Beer, oh yeah, wine also (limited selection, tho). A small town converted garage and plenty of oddball thimgs on the walls. Be sure you have a couple of hours and a driver, it's not right around the corner.

reviews.author: Andy H.
reviews.description: This is the best place in town for a beer and some friendly faces.... they treat locals and visitors with the same respect and it's a great pub... this is coming from a "local" Englishman :-)

reviews.author: Dave T.
reviews.description: Taking a side trip out of Austin, we stopped in to visit this establishment mentioned in various travel sites' recommendations. We were not disappointed! The manner in which they've decorated the inside and out provided a cozy, intriguing, and welcoming atmosphere.  There was an impressive selection of craft brews on tap which was explained and served by our courteous server. I will definitely make a point to stop by again on my next trip to The Lone Star State! Thanks, guys!

reviews.author: Matthew S.
reviews.description: Still a great menu of brews, I love the atmosphere, I love this place.

reviews.author: Sage R.
reviews.description: I'm hesitating to post this; because secretly I want to keep this little gem to myself. I'm kinda new to dripping springs, but as soon as I stepped foot in this place, I felt like home. You'll never meet a nicer group of comrades all grabbing a beer at the end of the day. Tip well! These bartenders deserve it.

reviews.author: Deana S.
reviews.description: Rude bartender they think because they have a small town they can be rude to people because they have a place in dripping springs bad customer service leads to shut down of a business let's see where you are in one year asshole!!!!

reviews.author: Marco L.
reviews.description: After attempting to stay local and having cover charge at two other places on Mercer. The barbershop was a place for us!  Great cold beer plenty of tables good service

name: Toss Pizzeria and Pub
accommodations: Best nights on Monday, Wednesday, Friday

reviews.author: Meredith L.
reviews.description: This spot is great for dinner during the week or for a weekend brunch with friends to watch a game! They've got space and seating for every type of group: Artificial lawn outside with corn hole and lawn chairs (we saw families congregating in this area); outside "bar seating" with view of multiple TVs (we sat here); tables next to heaters outside as well with view of the TVS (good for larger friend groups); seats inside for the faint of heart.  They offer pizza by the slice, half, and whole, which I thought was pretty unique.  We got the half pulled pork carbonara...chef's kiss! Very mild, comforting flavors. The runny egg yolks and perfectly cooked pork made this dish.

reviews.author: Christina H.
reviews.description: Toss serves New York styled pizza, Texan style that either comes in a slice, half or full pie. The half serves 4 hearty slices, which is an easy share (or not). I ordered the Spinach Artichoke pizza, which was a half pie topped with romano cream sauce, chicken, spinach, artichoke, and mozzarella (also typically served with bacon, but I'm particular about bacon). Surprisingly, the Spinach Artichoke pizza was not as creamy or savory as expected. The chicken was dry, and you definitely need to add a dash of salt to this.   We also ordered 12 wings, half in the Sambal Glaze and the other half in Sesame. The wings were crispy, but needed more sauce. I would advice to ask for a side of both sauces to slather on top. My personal favorite of the two was the Sambal Glaze, as this was sweet and spicy.

reviews.author: Anthony M.
reviews.description: Came out here on a Friday night with a crew of 10 and had a pretty decent experience. Parking can be tough here, just heads up.  The table was ready right away and we sat a table the style of a picnic table. The menu had a pretty good amount of options with gluten and dairy free options available. The server was pretty cool and very thorough in ensuring that everything came out correct.  The pizzas are huge so the half pizza is good for most people with a regular size appetite and if you get the full pizza it's plenty big to share. The pizza itself was decent. Crust was a little on the harder so left the crust at the end. I had vegan cheese and mozzarella cheese and one of them just was not good at all. I believe probably the vegan cheese, was trying to avoid excess saturated fats and in turn kind of ruined the pizza.  It was a pretty decent experience, but would go to Pinthouse before I were to come back here. Most everyone else in my party enjoyed there food so my situation may have just been what I ordered. None the less, I would give this place a try if you haven't already and see for yourself!

reviews.author: Akiko R.
reviews.description: The Brussels with pulled pork was good! I also ordered a pepperoni pizza, they have good thin crust but the pepperoni pieces were small. I order contact-less delivery pick up outside but was going to order a quick to go beverage- but decided not to due to being shooed away so quickly. The guy who grabbed my food I'm assuming "manager", I could tell was in a bad mood. Asked me my name - which by the way is unique found my order and then asked for my full name. (What are the chances out of 4 orders) briskly gave me my food in a huff and went back to were the female workers who were behind the bar as if I couldn't hear him go on to complain about a gal whom was fired. Bummer manager guy- you shouldn't bring your 'tude into a customer interaction. The food was better then the 1min service. I'm thirsty.

reviews.author: Lazar V.
reviews.description: One thing that Austin lacks food wise is a good pizza shop. This is one of the ones I would recommend checking out if you're in the area. The pizza is fresh and crispy, large slices and really easy to eat. Stopped in on a Sunday evening to watch some football and eat food pizza. There are plenty of beers on tap and a selective cocktail menu. There is some seating inside with plenty of seating outside.

reviews.author: Elizabeth M.
reviews.description: I've been to Toss a few times now and I have to say, I think this place is super underrated. With names like Home Slice in the area, I understand that people may forget to check out other pizza places, but if you haven't tried Toss yet, you're MISSING OUT. I've been for dinner before but the breakfast pizza has my heart. The crust is the perfect balance of crispy and soft, the topping options are endless, and there's a $15 mimosa deal (a full bottle of champagne) to wash it all down. Also, if you're a fan of ranch on pizza, their homemade ranch is unmatched.   Not only is their food good, but I am also always so impressed with the service. One time when we were in for brunch, there was also a large group that had rented out the entire outside seating area. I'm sure the team felt swamped but we couldn't even tell because we still felt like they were paying us more than enough attention. Regardless, our waitress continued to apologize for the "slower" service and even discounted some of our meal.   COVID Precautions: All employees and guests are required to wear masks when not seated. Seating is limited and hand sanitizer is provided.

reviews.author: Allie R.
reviews.description: One of my new favorite pizza places in town! The pizza literally was so fresh and flavorful. The crust was also done perfectly. Be sure to check their happy hour deals before going too because they have a lot of amazing offerings. Great casual environment or perfect for takeout. The indoor dinning is a little small, so if you want a table maybe make a reservation or go early. I will definitely be dining here again soon.

reviews.author: Jenelle R.
reviews.description: Yes, I am that person that came to a pizza joint and ordered a brussel sprout salad. But hear me out. 10/10! So often, I find sides of crispy brussel sprouts to be underwhelming. Not this one! I was absolutely wowed and Toss nailed it! Big fat brussel sprouts that were perfectly crispy + goat cheese, beets, and walnuts. Yum! Also have to give a shout-out to our server Emily. She's the only one who showed up for her shift last night, and you would have never known they were understaffed. Her boss was helping out, but even still, Emily was on top of it. Also, as far as the wings go, my fianc gave them an 8/10. We had a great experience and will definitely be back for more wings, sprouts, and hopefully pizza too!

reviews.author: Mary B.
reviews.description: Ohhhh I love this place! Full bar with an outside patio and a great menu. I'm embarrassed to admit how many times I've been to this place within the last year. I love the pizza, but everything else is good too. I enjoy the wings and the meatballs, but I also love the wedge salad. Great service and great location.

reviews.author: Ashley B.
reviews.description: Not worth it.  I regret getting a 20 inch pepperoni pizza because it was a big pie that was hard to eat.  Pizza arrived cold and even on the reheat was worse than frozen pizzas from the grocery store.  I'm pretty sure it was not fresh and had been sitting out for awhile.  Minimal sauce and chewy crust.  Should have went with Digiorno.

reviews.author: Mahesh N.
reviews.description: Great pizza and fantastic outdoor setup that allows for a casual time to eat and watch some games. If you want a fun time with friends and family, come here.   Texas BBQ Brisket Pizza is a good pick. Brisket was tender, but a tad dry. Sauce was sufficient without being over sauced.  Tasted like a sliced BBQ sandwich with pickles and onions.  Yummy.  The margarita was solid. Good sauce.   The roasted veggie did not have enough goat cheese. Also the artichoke didn't go well with the rest of the vegetables. Recommend to hold that.   Only real recommendation, improve the parking. You don't really need 6 curbside pizza pickups?  Neighborhood has parking restrictions.

reviews.author: Imari W.
reviews.description: Okay the pizza was bomb af!!! I'm a picky eater, I like what I like and if I don't I'm not gonna fake like I do , I've had nasty pizza before so it's possible to mess up a pizza but I played it safe with a regular pepperoni and 10/10  baby I even ate the crust (not much of a crust eater ) I got half pie which was 4 slices  (should have got the whole ) I also had a Cesar salad that was really good to the dressing was creamy not watery $8 for a serving great for one or you can split in two like an appetizer which is what I did everyone at my table enjoyed their pizza as well there were no complaints from anybody  Now however I did not order drinks because I'm pregnant so I can't tell you but my husband  got a house margarita and he actually got two so I guess it was good   now if you want to sit on the patio be prepared to share the space with dogs and smokers I feel they should have a designated area for the smokers on the patio it sucks for us that like to eat outside but also have to endure that smoke very inconvenient for us pregnant women as well but everything was perfect  We also got to chat with Logan he wasn't really our server but he jumped in in times as if he was he has awesome customer service he suggested beers for my father in law let him try to make sure he was satisfied my father in law even went to purchase the beer Logan introduced him to from the next door store thank you Logan for your great hospitality!

reviews.author: Stephen B.
reviews.description: Lower than mediocre food, "patio" is uncovered and blasted by the 100 degree Texas sun.   Inside no better luck as bartenders will not change channels if the Cowboys are on, even with screens not being watched by anyone at all.   Pretty horrific overall.

reviews.author: Anthony M.
reviews.description: Toss has recently became a top contender for me when considering where I should go for pizza.  The main thing here is they have a wide variety to choose from. For example, I got:  - Texas BBQ Brisket Pizza: what's interesting here is that their full pizzas are 20"!! So, getting a half pie ain't no joke because it's still quite big. Smoked brisket, pickles, onions, and bbq sauce base? Yes please!  - Margherita: they allow you to do Cauliflower Crust for $3 more, so I went with that for a healthier, lighter contrast to the pizza I mentioned above.  - Hand TOSSed Wings: I was very surprised to see that they have 11 flavors to choose from. I got their Toss Sauce which is your classic "buffalo medium" as well as a side of their Spicy Toss Sauce to try out which has ghost peppers in them (warning: they are SPICY!). For the second flavor I got the Bacon Ranch dry rub which takes grounded bacon and mixes it with ranch seasoning - too good!   - Stuffed Pretzel: I got this as an appetizer before all the food came out and it was a great way to dive right in. It's stuffed with pepperoni and cheese. To dip, I suggest you get marinara and queso for the best of both worlds of saucey and creamy.  - Warm Brussels Sprout Salad: now you may be thinking... why go to a pizza place for a salad? I don't blame you for thinking that, however, let me put you on: this was phenomenal. It had no business being this good! Brussels, beets, goat cheese, candied walnuts, and a balsamic dressing? Phew. A MUST try!  - Smores: I wanted to get the cinnamon donut holes originally, but they ran out of cinnamon so by default I got this. They were fine, but I felt this was something I could have just made at home.  - Watermelon Press: I got this because I was looking for something refreshing. I am not big on watermelon, so I wasn't the biggest fan - but if you are, this is something you'd enjoy.  Overall, I enjoyed everything I got. The prices are fair, there's a lot of items on the menu, and the service was good. I also got to see a self-driving delivery robot come by! I had a great time and give them a strong 4/5!

reviews.author: Cecilia H.
reviews.description: This pizza joint is awesome with it's fun atmosphere, very cool patio and great eats.  We usually share extra crispy sesame wings, a Cesar salad and pepperoni pizza and have some for the next day. Great portions, tasty food, can't go wrong with a meal from Toss.

reviews.author: Justice R.
reviews.description: A great atmosphere to just chill out and watch the game or just to grab a bite to eat. Love their outside seating area and it's dog friendly.   The Texas BBQ Brisket pizza is bombbbbbb!!! I'm not a pizza gal at all but I can eat this everyday. Not a fan of their chips and queso.

reviews.author: Brianna E.
reviews.description: Went here the other night. We had Brussels sprouts for an appetizer and ordered a pizza. The sprouts were good, but the pizza took OVER an hour to come out. Idk if the kitchen lost the ticket or what, but over an hour?? They weren't busy so I really don't know why that happened.

reviews.author: Sarah S.
reviews.description: Tried toss for the first time last night after great reviews from friends. Got half pepperoni half spinach/artichoke and the garlic knots. Flavors are good but everything was so burned!! So frustrating to have a burned taste with every bite and unable to eat the crust!

reviews.author: Andy Y.
reviews.description: Stars for having a big screen tv...only. Everything else was ok. Service was poor. Potential is there...  Next...

reviews.author: Jessika F.
reviews.description: This has become one of our regular, weekly spots for dinner! I really love the atmosphere and all of the servers are SO friendly, they all deserve extra kudos. Their social media game is strong, they post specials on Instagram that are so delicious looking that I have to come right in. The weekends can get very busy with a super long wait, but they take reservations via OpenTable. Make sure to reserve at least a day in advance if you're trying to visit on a Friday or Saturday.  I love sitting outdoors because they have fans when it's hot and heaters when it's cold. And of course, I love looking at all of the patio dogs. The food and drinks are great! Oh the desserts have been fantastic as well. We look forward to being "regulars" here for a long time to come.

reviews.author: Lukas S.
reviews.description: We spent a weekend at Lucky Arrow for a friend's wedding. It was such a great experience!  Space: There was so much space that we never felt like we were on top of each other. Everything was kept neat and clean, too.   Staff: The staff were all so friendly and accommodating with requests for more fire wood and such.  Amenities/Rooms: SUCH nice bedding with ample room in the courtyard cabins. Loved having the hot tubs too!

reviews.author: Mandy B.
reviews.description: Sadly was not what we expected.   Nice place, poorly managed. Checking in was chaotic as I prepared for a wedding and we we left with no breakfast or coffee like we were told.

reviews.author: Eva Z.
reviews.description: PRO: Good interior decoration.  CONS:  Poor management, poor service and communication, unpleasant noise from Air Conditioning.   We booked a Lucky Arrow cabin via Trip.com.  Shortly after the completion of payment, we received a confirmation email from Trip.com with a receipt attached.  "Please show your confirmation number and PIN number to the reception." " Check-in after 16:00."  " 2- person breakfast included." We later found out that none of this information was correct.   (1) When we arrived at Lucky Arrow Retreat around 7pm, there was no reception to be found and we were trapped outside a closed gate. We tried the PIN number from the email, it turned out to be incorrect. I called Lucky Arrow a total of 8 times and sent a message to an "assistance number" printed on the lock of the gate. No one answered the phone. We were stuck outside the gate for 20 minutes and very frustrated. While we waited, there was no reply back from Lucky Arrow. We almost drove to Austin to find somewhere else to stay. We eventually got a text message back asking our names and gave us the instruction of how to unlock the main gate and our reserved cabin.    After we got past the main gate, we found there was literally nobody managing the property. We did not feel safe staying here due to the lack of any assistance from them if there is any emergency going on during our stay.   (2) There was no breakfast despite what was advertised.   (3) The exit gate remained OPEN when we were leaving after self check-out. It appears that anyone can drive in from that exit gate which gives the guests no privacy and makes the place unsafe.   The Lucky Arrow Retreat needs a lot of improvement in communication, as we did not receive any information regarding the check-in procedure and it was difficult to contact any staff during our stay.

reviews.author: Joshua A.
reviews.description: If you plan on using this venue to having your wedding at then GET A LAWYER and make them sign a contract. Otherwise, you'll spend $10000 and not have a private space for you and your love ones. You will have strangers at the pool in you space and drinking your beer. The venue might say this and that like they did to us but in the end they didn't do anything and we didn't have a contract to follow up on them so if you want to rent this place hire a lawyer first.

reviews.author: Brittney H.
reviews.description: Wow, what a great stay! The yurt that I stayed in was spacious and spotless, the bath house was always clean, and the entire place is well maintained. The staff is amazing; welcoming and very tentative when needed. If you're looking for a peaceful getaway outside the Austin area, this is the spot and worth the price!

reviews.author: Alida R.
reviews.description: I had a lovely few nights stay at Lucky Arrow. We traveled with friends - 3 other couples and their kids - and stayed in a cluster of four cabins. It was the perfect pandemic vacation: we were able to socialize with our friends and still have our own spaces, without being indoors together. I don't think I'd have enjoyed it as much with strangers staying in the cabin cluster with me, especially since each pair of cabins shares a hot tub (which was delightful to relax in!) and all four cabins share a fire pit.  The rooms were clean and modern looking, the beds comfortable, and the air conditioning great. They have basic toiletries and good towels. There's very weak and unreliable wifi at the cabins; I recommend you come here to disconnect. I had good cell phone service with Verizon. The cabins have mini fridges but no kitchens; if you want to cook, you'll have to grill outside. Bring your own charcoal and lighter fluid!  For shared amenities, there's a lovely outdoor pool, and a big space with a large fire pit, grills, and picnic area with tables and swings (and some covered seating if you need shade). The pool has a 1-foot area with lounge seats, and lots of nice floats. We visited during the week, and it wasn't very busy; our group spent a lot of time at the pool and were often there by ourselves. There's a small walking trail, too.  It is quite pricey; I don't normally spend this much on a hotel. I'm not sure if I'd stay again if I weren't going on a group trip (with pandemic friendly housing.) If you're going with a group, call and see if they'll give you group pricing.  Warning for those who are planning to spend most of their time in Dripping Springs drinking: if you visit on a Monday - Tuesday, as I did, most of the wineries and breweries (including Bell Springs, which is attached to the resort) are closed.

reviews.author: Gina L.
reviews.description: Phenomenal! Stayed overnight. Happen to book thru Hotels.com. No issues at all. We stayed in courtyard cabin. My two children my husband and I had a great time hiking, relaxing, hot tub,fire pit and more. Already wondering when I can get more time to go again.

reviews.author: Felix G.
reviews.description: Exceeded expectations. I love being outdoors, my wife loves luxury hotels. We stayed in one of the cabins and we both got what we wanted. The grounds are really nice and accommodating to friendly conversation with other guests. The cabins are modern and feel like an upscale hotel room. I appreciated the contactless check in and check out process. We look forward to returning.

reviews.author: Adam D.
reviews.description: Very little privacy and poor management. Had a grounds keeper hop, that's right hop, on to our patio while my wife and I were changing. Wife was and is still pretty traumatized.  Took us forever to find management to let them know we are out and they told us they would pay for our room at the holiday inn. They did not.  Recommendation to LAR:  If you are going to run a wedding at your retreat, maybe consider additional help managing the facility. Only having 1 worker who is trying to run a wedding at your grounds isn't going to cut it.  * to managements response:  You want me to call you again? I'm sorry, but your response to my review makes it sound like this is the first you have heard about this incident. Is this correct? If so, this is disappointing because that tells me you have not taken steps forward to improve.

reviews.author: Erika F.
reviews.description: Great retreat close to Austin. Connected to a peaceful winery and minutes away from distilleries. Great staff and beautiful cabins.

reviews.author: Liz K.
reviews.description: Came here for a mid-week staycation. We had the place almost all to ourselves since it was mid-week in September. The weather was amazing! We rented one of the breezeway cabins with views+hot tub+fire pit. There was firewood at the cabin when we checked in. We had a fire and hung out in the hot tub to look at the night sky both nights. It was so quiet and relaxing, exactly what we were looking for. The breezeway cabins are beautiful and fun! The pillows, sheets, and bedding were comfy. The breezeway two-seater swing was cute to sit in while sipping coffee. It would be nice if the room with the couch and wet bar also had soap and a couple dish towels by the sink.

reviews.author: Mandy L.
reviews.description: I just stayed for an incredible weekend at Lucky Arrow.  Not only was the resort gorgeous, it was super clean and the staff was incredibly friendly.  This was the perfect place to unwind and still feel safe during all this Covid madness.  The check in process was all online, so we didn't have to worry about social distancing.    The rooms were so adorable and you could tell they really put time into every single detail to make sure you have an amazing experience.  We were able to sit around the fire pit, have smores and enjoy the quiet starry night with no city noise or much light pollution.    The location was beyond perfect.  It's just far enough away from town that you feel like you are truly on vacation, but there was still an HEB and tons of food options within a few minutes drive.  The gated access to the winery next door was a wonderful perk.  Highly highly recommend staying here!

reviews.author: Jessica N.
reviews.description: Had a great time staying in lucky arrow! We stayed in Yurt 3, which was great. Only complaints were that there was no map provided, nor customer service available, so we had to drive around and try to find outlet yurt at 10pm. Which was fine - we found it fairly quickly. Other complaint is that it looks like the person cleaning might of got distracted and left the room, without putting the ac back together or bringing her cleaning towel. Also not a huge issue. Will definitely be back!

reviews.author: April C.
reviews.description: My husband and I chose Lucky Arrow for our anniversary getaway and it exceeded our expectations. The yurt was perfection and beautifully decorated. Even the shared bath house was nice! The complimentary beer and wine tasting was great and the crepe food truck on site was an added bonus. We'll definitely be back!

reviews.author: Yerlan S.
reviews.description: Great location, great infrastructure, everything is new and well maintained. A lot of activities to do within an hour range. Hot tubs, hot pool, hot showers. Great breakfast variety w wine n beer tastings. Amazing staff.  Will come again, great place for a grate value.   P.S. A/C in yurts was nice, Operational Manager George is a great dude.

reviews.author: Marisa V.
reviews.description: I have finally fulfilled my lifelong dream of glamping in a yurt!    This place was such a cool experience. I had everything I could ever want. A pool, beer garden, campfires conversations with s'mores, and even a complimentary wine tasting at the Bell Springs Winery located right next door.   As for the staff, a big thanks to Mike, Michelle and Zach! They were all amazingly friendly, kind, funny, and helpful. Your hospitality was greatly appreciated.   This place is perfect for events or a staycation. Either way, I recommend visiting!

reviews.author: Trey E.
reviews.description: Lovely glamping space close to the Hill Country and within an hour of Austin, but ludicrous pricing policies will prevent a repeat visit. This spartan campsite with tiny houses and yurts (with a bathroom space shared with pool guests) offers a close to the city getaway with minimal amenities. But with a per pet fee of $150 PER ANIMAL plus a nightly fee, they don't seem to understand how out of touch they are with pricing policies of similar establishments. With two dogs under 20lbs, you're looking at $350 just in pet fees prior to any rental rates for just two nights, and therefore Lucky Arrow won't be getting any repeat visits from us.

reviews.author: Kate A.
reviews.description: There are few things more excellent than Texas Spring, and we were delighted to spend a weekend of the best time of year out in the hill country at Lucky Arrow during their opening weekend.  There is a central event space and bar / pool area at the top of the hill with yurts as well as more conventional accommodation tucked into the trees below. We stayed in a 'courtyard cabin' one of four arranged around a fire pit with a hot tub. Which was bright and airy with the squishiest mattress, soft sheets and plenty of space to set up our travel crib for our three month old son (they also have them there if you're coming from further afield and need to borrow one)  We spent the weekend listening to live music and sipping cocktails by the pool, wandering the shady trails, admiring the view and toasting s'mores on the fire pit.   Close enough to Dripping Springs if you want supper /HEB - but far enough out that the stars are super bright and the night is gloriously quiet. They're well-behaved dog friendly, so we'll be back with our (only moderately well behaved) hound. And for a yurt, I only peeked my head inside one but I'm desperate to stay in one soon!

reviews.author: Brittany W.
reviews.description: I will definitely be back here! My group of 6 reserved 3 porch houses and they were lovely! On the inside, they are totally modern and beautiful. There are no TVs which is perfect for a weekend getaway from the world.   The check in and out process is nice, you're provided with a code to a lockbox so there is no need to wait for someone!   There is a communal area with darts, Jenga, connect four, and more by the pool and firepit area. The staff left out snacks, drinks and smore's fixings for us!   This is a peaceful place that I can't wait to return to!

reviews.author: Allie W.
reviews.description: Beware of the cancellation policy.  Extremely deceiving.  The first sentence on the website says they have a 10 day cancellation policy but you actually can't get a refund at all.

name: Hi Hat Public House
accommodations: Best nights on Tuesday, Thursday, Friday

reviews.author: Julia C.
reviews.description: Pros: The food is delicious, the service was friendly and great, the venue is small and cozy.   Cons: We didn't experience any negatives...but I could imagine there being a long wait during peak hours.   We loved the tar tar, the burgers, the Mac and cheese, and spicy Brussels sprouts. Yum!

reviews.author: Chelsea M.
reviews.description: I cannot wait for this place to come back! They have an amazing, mouth-watering burger that's the perfect size to leave you satisfied but not stuffed.

reviews.author: Don L.
reviews.description: On the corner across from Livestrong you'll find Hi Hat - an establishment that knows what it's doing.  I stopped in during the week with no preconceived notions or ideas of what to expect. So what did I learn? Its a cool little craft beer bar with some great food items.  The night we came in they had a distributor there handing out all kinds of marketing swag, stickers and such. It wasn't pushy at all it was just laid back and I loved it.  The beer list now that is a headache - there's so many choices! OMG :)  It's around the corner for me and I have already stopped in about 3 times. Each visit has been the same for me - just perfect.  So far it isn't log jammed with crowds of people which I enjoy being able to sit without the typical ATX line w/a 20 min or more wait. Let's hope they are busy enough to stay around but not too much that I can't sit right away! ;)  Thanks for the great local vibe you put on guys. I love it!

reviews.author: Amy G.
reviews.description: Came back to try a few more things that had been calling my name from the menu. I realllllly wanted to try the soft pretzel because reviews were good and it looked amazing! The first few bites while it was hot were so good, but as it cooled off and I became satiated, it was just alright. I wouldn't be surprised if the cheese sauce that came with it was the same as the sauce on their macaroni and cheese. I think it tasted familiar. I gave the tomato soup another try, and it was just alright too. It's got a funny tangy metallic aftertaste. House pickles were fresh and interesting but I could only eat so much before they became overpowering. This time they included beets, green beans, and okra. I checked on their spiciness and was told they had a kick, but it wasn't too bad for me. I hate to say that the best thing I had was a free piece of Halloween candy from the bar. I really want to like this place. The owner was there most evenings and is friendly. However the food never meets expectations and is a little pricier than I'd consider appropriate.

reviews.author: Rob P.
reviews.description: Popped by Hi Hat Public House on Saturday night due to the amazing reviews on Yelp. Have to admit it, I was kind of underwhelmed. The bar was sparsley populated for a Saturday night, though they did have a live band playing.  I got a Founders Solid Gold beer for $5.50 and ordered the pork belly hoagie for $12. The food came out pretty quick, but it felt like the kitchen staff wanted to get ouf of there and kind of rushed it together. It was just OK, not the kind of food I'd expect from a 4.5* establishment.  Nothing really wrong with the place, but I don't see how the ratings are so high. Perhaps there's people living in the building and they're just pleased to have a better than average bar in their building? I don't live here, so I don't know if I'll ever make it back in.  Bottom line: good bar, but so many bars in Austin, it didn't grab me as anything amazing.

reviews.author: Kat S.
reviews.description: Stopped by after work today, not too busy and I got a spot at the bar. They had a huge beer selection and they also had wine.  I had a beer and the special of the day burger, it was cooked perfectly and delicious, just the right size. I opted for Mac and cheese and that was delicious too, I had a big enough portion that I took half home.  I'd come by again. It was worth the trip.

reviews.author: Janny T.
reviews.description: So happy that the Hi Hat is back open. They're doing a great job disinfecting everything and keeping everything tidy. The food is delicious and so are the drinks. For vegetarians, they have the best avocado toast I've ever had and that's coming from someone in LA where we are as basic as it gets. I've also had their shrimp benedict that is not currently on their menu which is so yummy. Lastly, I usually don't like micheladas but they make the best!! The mix is homemade and it taste like perfection with the new Zilker rice beer. Thank you!

reviews.author: Jamel O.
reviews.description: On a recent visit to Hi Hat, our group sat at the bar while a band played music.  I got chicken wings.  They were not your normal fried wings, they seemed like a flavorful baked wings hybrid.  Different but not bad, because I was hungry and they had the kitchen open late.  There is outdoor seating as well.

reviews.author: Leah S.
reviews.description: Cool spot, with good food and drinks. More low key than expected, but still cool vibes. Parking may be harder to find than some places (street parking).

reviews.author: Zain R.
reviews.description: We were walking around on what was quite possibly the rainiest weekend this year so far and went to another place which had a 30-45 minute wait time. We walked around thinking we'll have to go back to our friend's apartment and drive somewhere when we ended up at this place purely by happenstance.   The good, the bad, and the ugly:  The good: The presentation of the food is so pleasing to the senses. Just as pleasing as it is to look at it, it is equally pleasing to your taste buds. I substituted my chips for the beets and oh boy, what a great a choice that was! The guy taking the order (Oh, btw, you have to order at the bar) told me that some people don't like them because they taste too earthy. I have never understood how people cannot enjoy eating beets. The highlight of the entree was supposed to be the portobello mushroom burger served on a bed of creams with some guacamole and aioli but the side of beets totally took the center stage. The vinaigerette they were sitting in when mixed with the cheese totally elevated the dish and give it so much dimension once you really mix it in together. You really want to take pictures and tell your food that this one is for the gram. I'll let the photos speak for themselves  The bad: Portions are a little bit on the smaller side but that could possibly be because we have huge portions in Houston. Or that I have a food addiction. No one else seemed to have that problem so you can just ignore the last statement. But, the service was a little lacking even though the restaurant was pretty empty.   The ugly: This does not necessarily apply to me but my friend is a vegan and they don't carry soy milk. Their reasoning, we put it out but no one used it and we were throwing it away. Solution could be, just give it to people who ask for it?!  I think, overall, we had a really good time over here. The food was great. On Sundays, they have live music where we were told that the music doesn't get so loud that you are not able to hold a normal conversation.

reviews.author: Leila R.
reviews.description: Rolled in here for the first time on Saturday afternoon and had my eye on their reuben. I was NOT disappointed! They brine their corned beef for 11days and it is juicy, crumbly perfection! The kraut they use is actually on par as well, w/the perfect balance of sweet and sour.  I am not gonna lie, the reuben here might just hold a candle to my all-time ATX fav at Waller. They are different stylistically, but both hold their own.  While I was here Saturday, I did their little sampler pour of one of my fav high abv beers, Wake up Dead on nitro by Left Hand. It was just what I wanted. At 10.2%, doing a full pour is a bit much, but their little $3 sampler was perfection.   I also discovered their "Wine Wednesdays" during my Saturday visit and after the gracious bartender Phil (who I have affectionately nicknamed "GreenBay") let me sample their 1000 Stories Bourbon Barrel Aged Zin. I was smitten from first whiff and in full lust after the first sip. I knew I had to return to make a half price $44 btl mine!  As luck would have it, my schedule allowed me to come in on the following Wed. I am not going to lie, I was so looking forward to doing damage to a bottle of a 1000 Stories all by my lonesome. However, because my "luck" has always been spelled w/a capital "F", they had just sold their last btl of 1KStories when I walked in. I was heartbroken. But, the wonderfully empathetic staff here not only let me sample the Substance Cab (it was a lovely cab, but I had my heart set on the BB-aged Zin!) before offering me a glass from the last open btl at HH pricing. GreenBay even let me kill what little remained at the end of the night. Great service will always make or break any experience, in my opinion.  It was busier than usual due to it being ATX Beer Week, but even the patrons at this place were gracious. There was not a seat to be had in the house and this kind man at the bar let me have the very tightly squeezed-in seat next to him.  BTW, the reuben here is so nice I had to have it twice! It was just as perfectly delicious the 2nd time as it was the first.  I will definitely be back the next chance I get for another attempt at Wine Wednesday and anytime I need an old school reuben fix. So glad I discovered this place, its vibe, and wonderful staff!

reviews.author: Jennifer M.
reviews.description: This is definitely not what I expected when walking up. It is more of a hole in the wall type bar nestled in definitely austin. Parking is hard to find so be prepared. The food was just okay and the service was eh. They do have a large selection of beers though. The place is very small inside a d the bathroom are somewhat outside....sucks in a cold night. It's definitely an interesting little find. Not one of my favorites though.

reviews.author: Zachary A.
reviews.description: Came only for the beer. 2 dozen taps and although mostly local, they hit all the types. Packed inside but nice patio that's extremely dog friendly. Parking is street and WiFi available. Free music co Stanton with a stage literally in the corner ready to go on short notice. Specials daily and happy hour until 7pm on Tuesday through Thursday. Food looked good but I was here for the beer. Fresh draft line makes me happy so no complaints here. One TV and friendly service. Floor and tables clean and although loud it's not in your head intrusive. Really can't ask for much more from a neighborhood bar.

reviews.author: Jannifer K.
reviews.description: Love, laughter, and happiness. That's what I feel when I come to Hi-Hat. I visited not too long ago and had their eggs benedict for Sunday brunch which was nothing short of amazing. He ordered the Hi-Hat plate which he also enjoyed. We ate and marveled at the talented jazz band that was finishing up their set. This place is cozy, has an enormous selection of beer, and a knockout menu for you to explore (with daily specials). I would come here again and again.  10/10 would recommend this place to others.

reviews.author: Shannon L.
reviews.description: Wow!  I just love this place ... small menu and all items cooked to perfection!  Weekends include brunch until 4:30 and Sunday comes with live jazz!  Standout items include the veggie taco and steak and eggs!

reviews.author: Casey M.
reviews.description: First off, we wasn't planning to come here but looked what was in the area and this place popped up. When you go in, the area is a bit small. You can grab a menu off the wall and then order from the bar. They have a few chairs for bar seating and about 6 tables inside varying from a two seater to a six seater, and there are about 3-4 tables outside and then a bar top around the patio. If it is pretty warm, I would definitely recommend sitting inside. They said that this was the busiest they'd been so food took longer to come out than usual 30 min-1 hour. It was definitely worth the wait! I ordered the eggs Benedict with a cilantro sauce on top and it had chorizo as well! It was greatly prepared and was the perfect amount of food. The biscuits and gravy are also pretty darn good! You can pick how you want your eggs with it, and it also comes with bacon. We only did self serve water, but our total was $26...in the halfway mark price range. WORTH IT THOUGH! The staff are polite and try to do everything to accommodate you and keep up with other customers/work. The only reason I knocked off a star is due to the seating inside, making it hard to fit everyone!

reviews.author: Lucy L.
reviews.description: The people here are cool. And the food is good. I like the vibe of this joint. We ordered some beer, eggs benedict, Mac n cheese, and spicy brussel sprouts. Can't say that I've ever had chorizo in my Egga Benedict so that was interesting. I'm not sure if I love it but it's def decent. I'll have to say the mac n cheese stole the show hands down. I added it to my order after the bartender and another customer both recommended it. I don't normally eat mac n cheese but I'd def order theirs again!

reviews.author: Meagan W.
reviews.description: We rented an Airbnb within walking distance of the Hi Hat. We came for appetizers and beer before an evening tour we had scheduled. The owner greeted us and came over to chat...really nice guy with a lot of well deserved pride in his establishment. We ordered 4 appetizers as a meal. THEY WERE HUGE!!! Easily could have just had two! Everything was delicious. Their pretzels are the best I've ever had, taco was amazing... it was all great. Excellent beer selection on tap, and good live music too!

reviews.author: Rob G.
reviews.description: They had a great 3-man band playing classic tunes. The crispy bacon burgers were delicious and served with rippled potato chips.The beer selection is robust and broad enough for a craft enthusiast. There's decent wine as well. The dessert menu is limited, but that bread pudding though!

reviews.author: Ryen B.
reviews.description: Lunch on the patio while in the area for work. The roasted mushroom sammy with avo spread, roasted tomatoes, and pickles was great. The buttery brioche roll- yum! The side of roasted brussels were also tasty, the serving too big for one person. I'm not typically a sandwich fan, but if you are, this place is a good option.

reviews.author: Robin S.
reviews.description: BBQ is dang delicious. Nom nom nom. Ready to go and all the fringe choices you expect from a convenience store.

reviews.author: Jules C.
reviews.description: I love this place. They have a top notch selection of wine and beer, as well as other non-alcoholic beverages (I Buy my Yerba Mate Tea from them in bulk!). They have your standard corner store snacks but they also have some really unique items, like different types of chocolate and local cookies. The place is always clean and the people who work there are very kind and friendly. Plus they sell Lula Mae's BBQ M-Sat 11am to 8pm and they have a delicious taco truck out front!!

reviews.author: Becky M.
reviews.description: We moved into the neighborhood and we were excited to be able to walk to Brew Market and Cafe. Over the weekend I went in for a late. I ordered the "12 oz" late. When I was handed my late I was shocked at the small size. I asked the guy working if that was really 12 oz and he reassured me that it was. Once I got home I measured the cup because I was certain that it couldn't hold that much. I was correct, it could only hold 8 oz.

reviews.author: Asink A.
reviews.description: Don't be deceive by the outside look. The place looks awesome from inside and has a clean bathroom! I stop here before heading to Houston and got to try some cool Austin beverages and panini.

reviews.author: Laura C.
reviews.description: Nice guys. Gas is usually a decent price for the most part. Just a quick stop and go place.

reviews.author: Alexa S.
reviews.description: Alex is kewl. Ask for Alex!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! He is fun and gives us good vibes. 10/10

reviews.author: Yeni M.
reviews.description: Alex was the best! He gave great recommendations and was a trooper taking pictures of our group the whole time.

reviews.author: Kristen L.
reviews.description: Alex is the best!!!!!!!!! So much fun!!! He tailored the stops to whatever we wanted to do and we had a great time!

reviews.author: Stephanie A.
reviews.description: Alex was awesome! Grrreat experienceeee!! My gals and I had the best time. You get to have stops at multiple bars!!

reviews.author: Stacie H.
reviews.description: Hipside Peddler was way more fun than anticipated! I went on the East Side Ride with a group of friends and Max really took care of us. He was very personable, patient and flexible with how we spent the allotted time. It was a great outing and a very different experience!  On the evening I went it was just our smaller group on the tour so we had full control of the jams, cooler and schedule. We definitely held up traffic a bit when on some of the main roads but the motorists and bystanders we came across waved and cheered us on. Thankfully there is a motor on board so it's not necessary to be fully exerting yourself peddling.  Recommend for a fun activity. Ask for Max!

reviews.author: Nina M.
reviews.description: Alex was the best! Thank you for the great time!! Will for sure do this again the next time I'm in Austin!

reviews.author: Alisha J.
reviews.description: Omg!! Service was the best! The bike was on time and the driver was very informative thanks so much Alex!! He is the best. The vibes were very good! Definitely recommend if your in Austin,TX

reviews.author: Melody Rose R.
reviews.description: I'm still laughing at the amazing time we had with the amazing Alex at Hipside Peddler! 100% worth every penny. It's byob and you can custom your trip with all your favorite breweries. We have the best photos thanks to Alex too! Pro tip: make a playlist and bring it on the ride!

reviews.author: Rebecca R.
reviews.description: Hipside Peddler is such a FUN thing to do because it is not every day that we get to ride around Austin on an electric assisted bar on wheels, while sippin' on an alcoholic beverage that makes you feel a little bit prettier and blasting your favorite music so loud, that you think you're at the club!! ;))   Sounds fun, right?! :))   Trust me, you WILL for sure get points for creativity if you book a tour w/ Hipside Peddler to celebrate a special occasion.   We booked the "Eastside tour" w/ Hipside Peddler on Saturday, 11/14/2020 to celebrate my friends 40th birthday and we had so much FUN! This was my 1st time so I had no idea what to expect but I can say that I am so glad that we were able to safely celebrate my friend's milestone birthday during this time of pandemic craziness.   Since sharing is caring here are a few of my "Helpful Tips", "FYIs", and "Likes"...  FYI:  *You will be peddling the same way you would if riding a bike so be mindful of your foot wear and you will be getting a mini workout while peddling.    *There are mini fans above each seat that you can turn on, if needed.   *The peddle boat driver does have a plexiglass barrier between him and the passengers as a COVID safety precaution and the peddle boat itself is all open w/out any walls.   *You can tip your peddling boat driver in cash and via Venmo.   *The "Eastside" tour is 2 hours long and we made 3 separate stops at different local bars for 15-20 mins each so you can use the restroom, cool off, take a few pictures w/ your peeps and/or buy a drink while relaxing at each bar.   Our awesome peddle boat driver was Matt and he also made a 4th stop at an Italian ice truck.   *Each passenger must submit a liability waiver and you can do it electronically. Once your tour has been booked, you will get the waiver emailed to you.   Helpful Tip(s): *BEVERAGES~I recommend that you bring your own ice chest already filled w/ ice and beverages (no glass containers are allowed) and there is an open area in the middle of the peddle boat for ice chest storage.  *FOOD~only snacks are allowed and I suggest you bring snacks that are easy to munch on since you will be peddling while eating them. ( ex: mini bags of pretzels, individually wrapped cookies)  *MUSIC~The peddle boat does have a stereo system that is very loud and has a usb that you can connect your phone to for music. I highly recommend that you create a music playlist of songs that help set the vibe that you're going for.   I made a playlist using Spotify of all the songs I wanted to play.   Lastly, I just wanted to give a huge shout out to Matt, who was our p.d driver because he really did a GREAT job of explaining "all things peddle boat" :) and putting us at ease so we could fully enjoy ourselves. This was so appreciated because each of us were newbie peddle boat passengers.   Stay AWESOME Hipside Peddler and for sure I'll be seeing you again very soon!   ~Rebecca out

reviews.author: Ashlee P.
reviews.description: ALEX is the BEST cycler leader u could get... He is accommodating... I dropped my hat mid cycle and he stopped so that I could get it.... He took us to the best bars in Austin, TX.. there was one other shrimp and rice that was GREAT!!! He kept our drinks cool and our pussy popping!!! DA BEST!!!

reviews.author: Nicole S.
reviews.description: Banger. We had the best time - love Alex!! Definitely do this if you're in Austin yeeeehawwwwww

reviews.author: Don P.
reviews.description: Did it for a friends birthday. Easy Peddling which is key. Eastside is the best side. Ask for Alex.

reviews.author: Rachel C.
reviews.description: The hipside peddler was the perfect activity for our bachelorette party. Alex was amazing and gave us the 411 on all the great bars. We had such a great time and highly recommend at all parties!

reviews.author: Alexandra H.
reviews.description: Alex was such a badass tour guide! Really made our experience worth while celebrating my friends birthday! If you haven't done this yet, DO IT AND REQUEST ALEX!!!!!

reviews.author: Yee S.
reviews.description: Had so much fun with Alex! The bike was super easy to peddle and everything was so much fun. Definitely recommend!

reviews.author: Jesse K.
reviews.description: Fabulous Bachlorette party idea! they're so accommodating our party had the BEST time.

reviews.author: Leo H.
reviews.description: Hipside peddler is a great time when you have your closest friends and family enjoying the ride! Alex was a great host and showed us the trendiest breweries in Austin!

reviews.author: Georgie C.
reviews.description: ALEX IS 11/10. This is the most fun I've ever had. He's amazing, definitely book with hipside.

reviews.author: Melissa B.
reviews.description: Alex was an amazing host for our mother's day shenanigans!!! Highly recommend!!!

reviews.author: Delaney J.
reviews.description: Easily the best bar bike tour in Austin. Our guide, Matt was so friendly and accommodating. I've had a negative experience with a different bar bike company in Austin, so was worried to  try it again. I'm so glad I did! Would definitely go again! Ask for Matt if he is available!!!

reviews.author: Jules J.
reviews.description: Made our 1st trip to Mueller Farmers Market on 8/23/18 It was over 100 degrees outside and we were all ready for a cool refreshment (my 5 year old twins, 3 year old, husband, and myself). We arrived right at opening and found SoCo Gingerbeer. The girl (maybe late 20's early 30's) did not acknowledge our presence as we were the first and only potential customers. She was also extremely unprepared. After a couple minutes standing there waiting on her (she was adding ice into the large containers) she FINALLY spoke to us. "It will be a few minutes" she said brashly. No smile , no welcome, it was as if we were inconveniencing her.   I felt uncomfortable and completely unwelcome but we stayed because our littles were thirsty.   Finally, after 10 minutes after opening, this gal was ready for us and she gave us samples upon our request. Also, zero empathy or apology for making us wait on her.   The samples were as hot or hotter than the temperature outside and really off putting. She sampled some hot ginger beer herself and remarked to herself in a gloating manner how great it was. It was a joke. She had a huge chip on her shoulder. Perhaps having a bad day, but I have worked years of customer service and you NEVER take it out on your customers. So unprofessional.  The customers thereafter us (a mom with two young girls) were also waiting on this chic and not treated with a welcome as well, unfortunately. The entire time, actually, this employee never cracked a smile or had any intentions of carrying out at the least, mediocre customer service. It was appalling and quite bothersome.   Suffice to say, we left. And I wonder how many others she has turned away.

reviews.author: Kati K.
reviews.description: I have never tried ginger beer and liked it before. This ginger beer is amazing! I went to the Lakeline Farmers Market on a hot day and was very pleasantly surprised how refreshing and delicious the Beet Ginger Beer was great. It would be wonderful as a mixer but I find it just as refreshing as a cool down cocktail. I got an inside word from the young lady Elaine at the booth that they are going to serve a prickly pear flavor next weekend. This time I'm going to pick up two bottles. If you reuse your bottles you get a discount that's so great too!

reviews.author: Will G.
reviews.description: I tried this at the Cedar Park farmers market and instantly got hooked. Now I buy 3 bottles a week. This makes a good mixer with whiskey, specifically Woodford Reserve.

reviews.author: Ann L.
reviews.description: It's very light and refreshing drink- cooled me down on a hot day in Austin! Go for the Extra if you don't like something super sweet and enjoys a ginger flavour.

reviews.author: Rachel S.
reviews.description: Passed by this stand at the mueller farmers market and I LOVE ginger beer. And I LOVE hibiscus. Enter hibiscus ginger beer. Soooo freaking delicious. We got a cup, and tried the other on tap, jalapeo lime and the extra ginger- all good (though I don't like the flavor of sweet jalapeos) but hibiscus was my favorite. After downing it we went to the car and got our growler and went back to get some to go. Hibiscus was sold out so we did the extra ginger and it was soooo spicy and good. Kudos to them, they're doing good work in their ginger beer.

reviews.author: Larissa S.
reviews.description: Adorable. Great cigar selection, and so thankful they have wine and beer to sip with it. The friendliness and familiarity between the regulars and staff, which they'll warmly welcome you in on, is what really makes this place special.

reviews.author: Jared P.
reviews.description: Awesome cigar lounge. A group of our friends ventured out to Smokey's this past weekend and we had a great time. Great boutique selection of cigars, nice open floorplan with great service. We'll be back again.

reviews.author: James F.
reviews.description: I really wanted to like this place - as I need a local cigar shop- but you cannot overlook their blatant disregard for local COVID requirements.   First, the shop is quaint and located in a very cool shopping area off of HWY 12. They also have a decent selection of classic and unique cigars. That is the positive.   However, they are selfishly thumbing their nose at COVID regulations. The staff does not wear masks or require patrons to wear them when they are up and about. There is absolutely no social distancing and it is usually packed to overflowing on weekends.   When a business refuses to abide by local and state guidelines in something as serious and life-threatening as COVID, it makes you question where else they ignore health and safety protocols. I do not trust that they keep their shop or the tobacco products safe and sanitary if they are unwilling to adhere to these basic guidelines. This should be a MASSIVE red flag for anyone thinking of shopping here.   I do not trust an establishment with this mindset, nor the local authorities that refuse to enforce these rules. It is shameful.

reviews.author: Dan R.
reviews.description: Great selection of my favorite stinkers...offers of firewater to those so predisposed. Canine friendly, ashHole suppresion available when necessary.

reviews.author: Levi E.
reviews.description: I love Smokey's Cigar Lounge. Nice people, great owner. I disagree with the reviewer who knocked the location due to COVID protocols. We quarantined with each other for months. We stayed 6 feet away from one another. I know; I was there nearly every day. It's difficult for any business who had to navigate the tricky waters of early 2020's pandemic onslaught. It was new territory for everyone and significantly different messages coming from authorities in the "know".  And with all that being said, you have a fairly recently opened small business trying to survive.  IMHO, anyone hating on this establishment is welcome to stay away.    Great cigars, great beverages, great community support. Don't change a thing.  Levi

reviews.author: Adam B.
reviews.description: Great cigar selection and super helpful and friendly staff to a novice cigar smoker like myself.

reviews.author: Paul R.
reviews.description: My wingman and I were chilling out at Treaty Oak Distillery having a few cocktails and enjoying watching round 3 of the Masters. When by pure coincidence I met a couple who I have not seen in years. We mentioned that we had cigars but it was too windy to smoke em. They said there was a chill cigar bar right up the street. We watched Tiger make a par on 18 and off we went.  We were greeted immediately by Allison, the manager, and given a quick tour of the venue. There are comfy seats and a small bar area that serves beer, wine, and water. The humidor is laid out very well and their cigars are stored perfectly. Allison patiently explained that there are two sections in the humidor the usual favorites and "her" boutique cigars. I selected a beautiful light Nicaraguan rolled cigar. This baby smoked smooth right down to the label.   The lounge itself is ventilated nicely so you are not smoking in a haze or smoking your cigar and other guys cigar as well. There was also a good beer selection. We had a blonde ale from Two Wheel Brewery in Buda. Good choice.   Smokey's is a chill venue, friendly patrons, and professional knowledgeable staff equal 5 stars all day!

reviews.author: Laura P.
reviews.description: Great cigars! And fabulous owner Chris!  So knowledgeable of cigars and pairing with certain alcoholic beverages.

reviews.author: Jessica G.
reviews.description: My boyfriend and I enjoyed this place so much. It was quaint and comfortable to relax and try cigars and drinks. My only feedback is for more variety in cigars - they had a lot of local brands which isn't bad but not a strong selection and to choose from. The service was excellent and the place was clean.

reviews.author: Chase C.
reviews.description: This place is a hidden gem. Allison is a cigar guru, you give her two cigars you like, she will show you three others to suit your palette.
