Prices are great, and the beer selection is fantastic. (Try the maduro) And if you like a little adventure, try the port with your next stick, a great pairing!

reviews.author: Lyndsey S.
reviews.description: I'm so glad we finally got a cigar lounge in Drip and Smokey's doesn't disappoint. I didn't get to sit and smoke but I saw how relaxed everyone was. I love that many of the cigars in the humidor are made by guys in Texas, especially the ones by a veteran who lives nearby. How cool is that? Make sure you talk to Allison too. She gives you the low down of every cigar and helps you find the perfect one for you. She's really nice and very helpful in her descriptions. My husband and I are looking forward to a date night at Smokey's.

reviews.author: Dino S.
reviews.description: Great spot for cigars, relaxing, and good conversation. Owner is super nice and everyone inside is friendly.

reviews.author: Henry W.
reviews.description: Best cigar bar and lounge I have been to! Great casual ambiance, super broad cigar selection in humidor, friendly staff, cold beer, fine wine. Music, indoor/outdoor seating, and all the amenities (big screen TV, lounge chairs, cutters/lighters, hand sanitizer, more). Meet you there June 13th from 6:00PM for live music!!!

reviews.author: David S.
reviews.description: If you haven't been, you don't know what you are missing. Locally owned and operated, this place has it all.  Great selection of cigars - my head was spinning with how many options but not to worry -  Allison was there with all of my questions. I'm def not a cigar aficionado but with the staff's help I was able to find a great smoke. I was impressed that they support local cigar companies and go the extra mile to make the everyone feel at home.  Can't recommend this place enough.

reviews.author: Amanda L.
reviews.description: I had the pleasure of meeting Chris while he was at Treaty Oak Distillery.  He is so kind has has a wonderful comfortable and just flat out super neat airstream! It was roomy, place to cut and dust off your cigar, a TV for viewing.  It was such a unique find! I would totally have had this at my wedding years ago if I knew him back then!

reviews.author: Jim P.
reviews.description: Excellent service and selection!  Comfortable lounge chairs, friendly atmosphere.  Indeed a hidden gem!  A great place to relax and have a good smoke.

reviews.author: Chanel L.
reviews.description: I was lucky enough to find Chris for my wedding. We thought their airstream would be a fun "man cave" addition to an otherwise very feminine wedding...boy were we misguided! Half the bridal party and many of our female guests ended up checking out the cigar bar and loved it! As a woman, I feel like creating a space where women feel welcome in what is traditionally considered a masculine space is a clear indicator of the quality and professionalism of their business.  Not only was Chris helpful, very communicative and and priced well - he and his wife were so much fun to be around! They both made our day special and unique and I highly recommend them for events. They definitely went above and beyond to ensure the day was special and went smoothly.   The airstream itself is luxuriously appointed and classy. Their cigar storage and bar amenities were top notch and I'm sure their huge tv would be great for sports games and such. Definitely a fantastic addition to my big day and I'd highly recommend them!

reviews.author: kelsey w.
reviews.description: Legit will be craving this Cleopatra sammich for the rest of my life. Nice and light with delish pickled veggies on the side. Fianc has the Orgy and he loved it. Dig the laid back vibe and easy parking.

reviews.author: Tim L.
reviews.description: Went here on St. Patrick's Day to grab a Reuben with my girlfriend.  The pub is dark and divey, but it also has a nice outdoor patio area, that is dog friendly. There was plenty of parking when we showed up which was nice - it can be a challenge in their area.  The sandwich itself was fantastic. Rye bread, warm corned beef, melted Swiss, sauerkraut, and the cherry peppers I added were all perfectly complimented by the orgy sauce the sandwich was smothered in.  Honestly, the only thing disappointing was the chips. They were ice cold, unsalted, and relatively flavorless. I put on some Yellowbird Serrano to give it some flavor and used them to scoop up what had fallen out of my sandwich. I just can't help but think how much better they would have been fresh!

reviews.author: TJ H.
reviews.description: On a recent trip to Austin upon arriving around lunch time we checked into our AirBnB and were in need of some lunch quickly!  Our AirBnB host recommended Gourmands as a good local spot.  We headed over and found there was plenty of parking and it was very quiet on a random weekday around lunchtime.  I like their system of scanning the menu and just ordering from the table, however it was sort of odd to not interact with anyone upon entering.  The only real greeting we received was from someone poking their head out of kitchen to let us know we could sit anywhere and order with the QR code. I imagine that would be a but different when the restaurant is more crowded though. We ordered some soup in a bread bowl and a couple sandwiches.  The food was promptly brought to us.  The bread bowl was awesome, along with the chili.  The sandwiches were also good, high quality bread and everything on the sandwich tasted very fresh!  Gourmands was a solid place to get some fresh food quickly without having to wrestle with parking and lines in some of the more populated areas of Austin. Good lunch spot!

reviews.author: Terran O.
reviews.description: Gourmands is one of my favorite takeout places in Austin. I usually get the Second Deadly Sin with fresh avocados. The salads can be weird, and I'm not a fan of the soup+bread bowls, but conceptually they are interesting.   Eating in at Gourmands is more fun if you go alone. The atmosphere is very traditional pub, so if you're seated at the bar having a meal and your drink, you'll almost always find good conversation. It's less fun to go with someone for a sit down meal, as it really is more of a bar than a restaurant, even though the food is pretty good. Quirky's not exactly the right word. It's idiosyncratic, and kind of addicting?   After Thoughts for Advanced Listeners: I want to be at a place in my journey where I can eat a Cleopatra and not feel I'm missing out on meat.

reviews.author: Janet S.
reviews.description: I have gone to Gourmands for years and I was so excited to take my out of town friend there for the delicious soup served in the bread bowl.  But when it was delivered to our table it was just in a regular bowl. When I asked they said well yea they were out of the bread.  I understand being out and that is cool but if they would of told me that when we ordered we would of ordered something else.  Our server asked if we wanted anything else. But never mind.  Bummer.

reviews.author: Jason B.
reviews.description: First, I have to say the ambiance of this place is pretty awesome. Very chill and there isn't loud music. The staff are friendly and the food is even more amazing! I got the Po-Po. This was basically a BLT but they put an amazing garlic mayo spread on it. I think the best combination is to have it on wheat bread. It was so stellar that as I finished and looked up, my bf and two friends were only halfway done eating! Definitely going back to this place!  Street parking, outside patio, bar inside with seating as well.

reviews.author: Megan L.
reviews.description: I really wish I loved this place more because I was so excited to bread bowls, but it fell really short of my expectations. My friend and I sat in the outdoor patio area, and there were so many empty tables with eaten food left on the tables that hadn't been cleared yet. Summer is coming, so there were a ton of flies that were attracted to the food that eventually came to bother us when our food arrived.   My friend and I ordered spinach and artichoke dip to share, and I had the clam chowder and Deadly Sin sandwich combo. Firstly, the spinach and artichoke dip had so much cream cheese in it that it didn't taste like artichoke or spinach. It was really thick and gloppy, and I felt heavy just eating it. My clam chowder was really lacking in the clam flavor, and it also wasn't that good. The sandwich was okay. Nothing special about it.   I am pretty sad that I didn't love this place because prices aren't terrible, and the concept of soup in bread bowls is awesome. Not many places in Austin serve that. However, they seem really understaffed and the food itself isn't good enough to warrant a second trip.

reviews.author: Amy G.
reviews.description: I tried the Broccoli Cheese Soup again and realized the funny aftertaste is probably not from the cheese, but from the beer in it. As a non-drinker my tastebuds didn't compute this right on the first try. The soup and bread bowls are delicious but of course they leave you feeling extremely full! I'd been craving a chicken salad sandwich, so the Foghorn Leghorn hit the spot.

reviews.author: Amanda P.
reviews.description: Sandwiches are amazingly good. I get the Cleopatra on rye and it's superb. I love their pickled sides and veggies too. Their soups and salads are fantastic too. Their delivery system is a bit cumbersome and has glitches but they're aware and make it right when it messes up. In person, this place has awesome ping pong table set up as well as a great outdoor space. It's a great hangout. Chill and has great food - the two best things you want in a gastro-pub.

reviews.author: Katrina B.
reviews.description: I love Gourmands! Great spacious patio, plenty of seating inside, relaxed divey vibes, a game room, and parking is pretty easy. The sandwiches are beyond incredible and can't come recommended enough! Right now, you seat yourself and order from your phone at your table via a QR code.   We got the Second Deadly Sin and Chili, and both came out delicious and served with house made pickles and chips. The Black Bean soups is in incredible vegan option I've had multiple times.   Bring your pup when you go to the patio!

reviews.author: Mayra A.
reviews.description: Great food and awesome vibe. This place feels like classic Austin 15 years ago . The sandwiches and soup are fantastic and they even serve 32 oz beers. Highly recommended

reviews.author: Kirsten G.
reviews.description: Super fun place with a very roomy outdoor patio.  The staff wears mask and your order drinks/food via QR Code at the table.  The atmosphere here is relaxed and you can bring your dog on the patio.    I had a Philly Cheesesteak it was super tasty and they have options if you don't drink or want to try something else.  They have a great tasting  Prickly Pear Lemonade.  The rest of the people in my party had great looking food come out too.    And they have a parking lot, but there is also easy street parking too.  And the staff was super friendly!!

reviews.author: Katie B.
reviews.description: A combo lunch that doesn't skimp on portions for only $10?!? Hot dog! Well, more like hot soup and sandwich or salad (no hot dogs on the menu).   The soup is served in a bread bowl (French bread, not sourdough!) and they have four or five options. I went with the broccoli and cheese which was more like queso with a few chunks of broccoli in it, but heck, maybe Gourmands knows me better than I know myself, as that's probably what I really wanted anyhow! I scarfed it down and had to stop myself from eating the entire bowl of bread. The chicken salad sandwich was lovely, but because I went full hungry girl on the soup (and homemade chips), I didn't eat it until the next day for lunch. Again, a lot of combo for your buck!  The place definitely blends in with the neighborhood, it's dive-y looking on the inside with a bunch of cheerful regulars at the bar (also the type of establishment you'd see a baby on a hip and a beer in hand), a TON of tables and booths for groups, and ping pong and skee-ball in the back. They've got a small parking lot, too.

reviews.author: Keay A.
reviews.description: This place has a great atmosphere with an equally amazing staff. The inside is a pretty good size, but it also has a big patio which is honestly my favorite.   I was pleasantly surprised by how bomb the sandwiches are here; I think the chips are homemade too , which is a big plus.   My group of friends started coming here pretty frequently and it's definitely a good place to chill; they have ping pong, ski ball, arcade games...it's everything someone would want in a bar experience!

reviews.author: Don E.
reviews.description: Had a soup and sandwich. The portions are a good size and the food is priced fair.   I had the orgy which is a hot peppered pastrami, Swiss cheese, coleslaw, and house-made Thousand Island dressing. Served on pumpernickel rye bread. With a broccoli beer cheese soup. The sand which was ok not great. Bread was a little hard and the soup was a bit too watery.

reviews.author: Matthew C.
reviews.description: This place is really gone downhill here right after work on a Tuesday and the bartender seems like half asleep and attentive and pouring very weak weak drinks I do not recommend this place unless you're here they're in or one of his friends in order to get attention

reviews.author: Meg B.
reviews.description: I'm so glad that Gourmands is open and has an amazing patio bar to enjoy during these unique times. Their food is outstanding house made....well just about everything! Their bread bowls and soup are so tasty. Sandos even the boys of letterkenny would crush. Plus friendly staff. 11/10 recommend.

reviews.author: Anna K.
reviews.description: You guys i've been going to gourmands for years and I finally went back since they reopened and it was...awful. We ordered the spinach and artichoke dip which we always do and it was literally milk with artichokes it was pretty gross. Then it took over an hour to get our soups and sandwiches. THEN on top of that i ordered the royal and they gave me mushrooms instead of meat (which I didn't order). I did tell the waiter and all he said was sorry(didn't offer to fix it). It sucks but i don't think i'll be returning there which is a shame bc i tell all my friends and always speak so highly about it.

reviews.author: Frances H.
reviews.description: I am a person who loves a good pub. Dark inside with regulars bellied up to the bar and not a high turnover rate within the wait staff. That's this kind of place.   I can see this place being an awesome, standard spot to grab a drink with regulars on any given day or night, but what we came in for was their highly-rated bread bowl soups and dang - they don't disappoint. The bread was soft and the perfect consistency - sturdy yet edible, which I feel is hard to come by with bread bowls. They offer a lot of great lunch options, like a soup and salad, sandwich and salad, or salad and soup. I went with the cobb salad and their black bean soup. To be fair, the server did warn me the soup was spicy, but I was definitely sweating a bit while sipping this delicious soup. The bread was a wonderful compliment to the spice and really soaked it up so I could keep going back for more!  On the way out, we noticed a room in the back with skee ball. Yep, we will be back for sure.

reviews.author: Callie M.
reviews.description: The Bucchus was really good, but everything else was average. The Spinach and Artichoke dip was a lot thicker than I had expected, but I did like that it came in a bread bowl (maxed out on carbs this day). The sandwich we ordered was just okay.  The food came out super fast and everything is relatively cheap!

reviews.author: Leila R.
reviews.description: I had come across the Beer Museum via a local blog I follow and I initially thought it was going to be one of those lame things that Austin tries to make sound cool and innovative, but turns out to be an overhyped hipster disappointment. I was so glad I was so wrong!  First off, the idea of the Beer Museum is just fantastic! A friend who is adverse to anything museum related actually enjoyed the lil displays and info-snippets when we got to experience the Beer Museum at WhichCraft. So, if you are a beer nerd, then this is the kinda thing that will capture your interest.  Second, there is not a brick n mortar location as of yet (however, you can help make that a reality by donating on the website), so as of now, this place is completely mobile. You can see where their next location will be on their website as well.  Third, Matt and Virginia, the founders and curators of this beertastic brainchild are two of the nicest people you will meet and it was great talking beer with them. Some of the beer memorabilia they had on display was just awesome!  Fourth, you can purchase Beer Museum gear and spread the gospel. Since purchasing and sporting my Beer Museum shirt, I have gotten stopped and asked about it more times than someone wearing a tshirt probably should.  So yeah, check them out and support a beer cause!

name: Aviator Pizza and Drafthouse- Parmer Lane

reviews.author: Jennifer N.
reviews.description: Such a great addition to the neighborhood! Perfect place for family night. Who doesn't love pizza. There is great outdoor seating and has a playscape for the kids. The pizza is good as well, there is a combination for someone. There is plenty of seating inside too. The lunch deals are such a good deal. The staff is friendly, we like to do the curbside orders on nights when we are too lazy to cook. It's fast and easy, plus there is so many options you don't feel like you are eating the same thing over and over even if you come here weekly.   The new COVID ordering is nice though you don't have to leave your table and you can split the check among who orders what. It is annoying for those who haven't had it set up on their phones already but otherwise it's super easy after the initial set up.

reviews.author: Kara M.
reviews.description: My fianc and I have been here 3 times now, and we enjoy our visit every time. The pizza is good, the selection of beers and ciders on tap is pretty phenomenal, the soda selection is great as well, and the vibe of the place (Parmer Lane location) is family-friendly and fun!  This time, we ordered The Lazy Goat and the Buffalo Chicken pizzas. The Lazy Goat gets a 5/5 - it was perfectly balanced, and I loved the artichokes and goat cheese with red sauce. The Buffalo Chicken was just okay, I'd give it a 3/5 - it was as expected but left you wanting something more.  In the past, we've tried the Chicken Bacon Ranch (3/5), Ground Control (4/5), and The South Austin (4/5). The focaccia bread sticks are also good!   Overall, it's a nice place to drop in after work or to get Friday night pizzas from. When the weather is nice, it's fun to sit outside - though I can't recommend the high top table chairs, as they are quite uncomfortable. We will definitely be visiting again!

reviews.author: Shauna S.
reviews.description: Just back from vacation and had zero desire to cook. And a major desire to have someone bring me food. The cheese focaccia bread was rather tasty.. the pizza was good. I especially like the unique and earthy flavor of the cheese.  The bonus was they delivered a growler which I'll check out later...(it's later and yummy Pilsner) Will I order it again!?! Probably not. But it was a solid meal nonetheless.

reviews.author: Amanda S.
reviews.description: I met up with a group and was definitely impressed with the spot. I loved the outdoor seating area and the playground. My little one was occupied the entire time and barely took time to eat because she didn't want to stop playing! The pizza was delicious. We shared a simple pepperoni pizza and cheese focaccia bread. I liked that the crust held up well. It wasn't too think or thin - just right! My kid finally up ate 3 pieces when she sat down from playing. If you are a parent and looking to have a cold beer and relax then this is definitely the spot for you. They have tons of beers on tap! Beer, playground and pizza - how can you not be a fan of that?!

reviews.author: Ian P.
reviews.description: Awesome job on the charcuterie board to the Aviator PizzaandDrafthouse Team! It taste as good as it looks! Highly recommend for a family night out in North Austin

reviews.author: Esther A.
reviews.description: Super family friendly with outside play area for kids.  Lines were a little confusing. I ordered the major tom, pepperoni was very crispy but the veggies were a little undercooked would've preffered them a bit more cooked.  The meat almighty was better, pepperoni was crispy and the cooked ham was very tasty (i dont usually like ham that much!) The dough was doughy, and floppy.

reviews.author: Amanda M.
reviews.description: Pizza dough was undercooked.   Hefty toppings  $10 for a large sized personal pan pizza  You order straight from your table via your cell phone.   Nothing special worth returning.

reviews.author: Lisa C.
reviews.description: This is the worst experience I have had in awhile with management. To begin, with follow my pics.. I ordered a major tom (supreme pizza) with EXTRA sauce thru door dash. At 7:55 within a few min I received notification it was being picked up.  I call store to inquire how is that possible if it was freshly made. The store hung up on me. So, I worked w door dash who asked me to wait for delivery to see if there is a quality issue. I did just that, only to receive a pizza that was warm but based on the cheese amount, semi chilled veggies I knew I wasn't too off base when I had my reservations about it to begin with.  I call store - ask for manager, even though I know door dash will ultimately handle. However, I just wanted to know how you can make a pizza in 5 min and say its fresh. Manager says sorry for the hang up like she's singing to a tune of a tiny violin; then tells me they don't have base pizzas sitting around (kind of like Villa in the mall that adds toppings when u order). I ask why is there so much cheese then and no sauce. Clearly cheese is added and is already rubbered up. Short answer and ultimate answer from her was another unbelivable sorry and to work with door dash.   What's sad here..Villa Pizza (mall pizza) is better than this any day. And I'm kicking myself for not going with Salvation pizza instead. Aviator down south was awesome but this Parmer Lane site is lacking customer skills and good pizza.

reviews.author: Steffie S.
reviews.description: 2nd favorite pizza in Austin!  I love pizza. If I were choosing my last meal it would be a toss up between pizza and beer or filet mignon and merlot (or Shiraz). I digress...pizza...it must have a great crust-never EVER soggy, a well-balanced sauce, and just the right amount of cheese. Lastly, the maker must not skimp on the chosen toppings.  Well done, Aviator! My friend and I shared the "pizza of the day", and it was fabulous (though I don't remember the name of it). The crust had that initial crunch followed by the perfect chewiness. We each had a light beer with hints of blueberry-um...yummy!  Aviator is new to this location, and still getting established, so it was dead inside. I suspect this will be a popular lunch place for nearby companies such as Apple, Oracle, etc. There is a huge outside play area for those of you who have kiddos-great for birthday parties.  I prefer quieter places, so it misses the mark for me regarding atmosphere. You can see the pizza makers through a glass window, and the kitchen appeared clean. There are ample choices of beer and lots of great food options too. I've been twice and suspect it will be a fav of mine. Give it a try. Let me know what you think.

reviews.author: Missy J.
reviews.description: Great pizza, good selection of beer, staff is always friendly! Clean inside and always plenty of seating!!

reviews.author: Raquel C.
reviews.description: Absolutely love their pizza! Usually get it to go. I've been at other locations in Austin, and they are all good.

reviews.author: Blair V.
reviews.description: First time I ordered from here was through Door Dash and we enjoyed very bite of our order. Second visit we decided to dine in. It was crazy packed on a Friday evening but they had plenty of seating indoors and outdoors!  We ordered the Foccacio cheese sticks (basil, mozzarella and goat cheese) - a hit for us when we ordered to go previously. We also tried something different which was the Monty. We also ordered a Caesar salad- pricey for a salad in my opinion but this is a good option if you feel like you need that balanced meal!  The Monty was the least of my favorite. We have stuck to ordering the Flying Garlic Pizza after our first visit and it never disappoints. It has become a must order for us and will continue to stay that way!

reviews.author: Shaun S.
reviews.description: Great pizza. I get the thin crust bbq chicken pizza and the Hawaiian. The bbq chicken pizza is the best.

reviews.author: Ashley L.
reviews.description: Great pizza with even better beer selection. We tried the garlic pizza and it was delicious. My friends got the vegan option and it looked fantastic. We will be back

reviews.author: Ken P.
reviews.description: As another reviewer said, they should change the order to list Drafthouse in front of Pizza.  This place has an AMAZING tap selection, even better than Pinthouse.  They also have a great outdoor area and sometimes they have live music.  The pizza looks amazing and the ingredients are fresh but the dough has no taste.  Pinthouse on the other hand has an amazing crust and severely limited outdoor seating.    I really hope the crust changes because the outdoor area and taps would keep me coming back.  However I can't see going here over Pinthouse.    If they nailed the dough I would absolutely chose this place

reviews.author: Courtney B.
reviews.description: Today, I ordered a to-go order for pick-up so I could do yet ANOTHER lunch and learn... how much learning do I really need to do?????? I ordered two items: the caprese salad and the black olive and caprese pesto grinder.   Caprese-  Caprese salad is a simple Italian salad, made of sliced fresh  mozzarella, tomatoes, and sweet basil, seasoned with salt, olive oil, or  balsamic vinaigrette. This is a menu item that really can't be 'messed up'. It is simple and to the point. This caprese was accompanied by a side of vinaigrette.  Black Olive and caprese pesto grinder-  This item was unexpectedly good. This meatless Monday treat contained black olives, mozzarella, red onions, baby spinach, and a Roma tomato pesto base. This sandwich provided a balanced mixture of sweet (from the tomatoes and red onions) slightly sour (from the mozzarella) and earthy (from the pesto) bites. Although hearty in its contents, this sandwich was actually very light on the palate.   #supportlocal

reviews.author: Andrew C.
reviews.description: Currently writing this updated review in my car because for the 2nd time, my curbside pickup was messed up. My pickup time was 6:20 pm, and it's now 6:50 pm.  The 1st time I wrote off because I thought it was a fluke. Also, I know the staff is busy on a Saturday night and it's tough to find staffing these days during COVID. Maybe I'll try eating in store next time.   But cmon now, my wife is pissed off because I convinced her to get Aviator over another pizza shop. Well, whenever I get my order, I'll eat it in the doghouse when I get back.

reviews.author: Kasper L.
reviews.description: Yay, more pizza! I love pizza, and I feel like there's a lot of pizza places popping up in Austin over the years. So many options but I'm not sure if this will be high in my rotation of pizza places.   I do like the restaurant space. The outdoor area is nice and kid friendly with the playground. Aviator has a wide selection of beers (at least from what I could tell). I think the pizza is good but unfortunately I think there are better places for pizza. Weirdly, I think their normal pies (with red sauce) are kind of lackluster. I did enjoy their non-traditional pies. The chicken bacon ranch and the taco pizza were pretty great!

reviews.author: Natalie K.
reviews.description: On this deliciously lazy Sunday, the darling husband and I knew that pizza was just the only thing that would do. Jersey Giant Pizza, he suggested? Quick, easy, cheap, and reliably tasty. Closed on Sundays, I lamented. DeSano's, I countered? His eyes lit up, but then I remembered that, although we adore DeSano Pizzeria Napoletana to bloody distraction, we should probably try something brand-new for a little variety...and for me to review! Why not? Enter Aviator Pizza and Drafthouse!  Local? Check! Solid reviews? Check. Hubby's a helicopter pilot and trying out this place is, therefore, too hard to resist? Check. Cute pizza names? Check. Yummy pictures? Check. Let's do this!   (Note: all three are takeout 9-inch pies with no mods, except for hubby's deletion of the green peppers on his Ground Control.)  The Greek: this one was my flavor profile to an ABSOLUTE T! It reminded me a bit of Joe's Pizza at Star Pizza in Houston, but better! A riotous feta, pesto, artichoke, basil, mushroom, and kalamata olive party on a crust! Hugely flavorful! This goes on the culinary Rolodex post-haste!    The Flying Garlic: very garlicky! Shocker, right? Lol! Well, we are garlic people, so we endorse this pie whole-heartedly! The buttery crust, the garlic cloves, and the feta were just unctuous!   Ground Control (minus green peppers): Hubby liked this, but he didn't super-love it. He kept snagging pieces of the Greek and the Flying Garlic. I asked him what his least favorite part was, and he said that it really wasn't fair to judge it on such a small pie. He wants to give it one more shot with a larger pizza! His theory is that small pizzas make the fillings hard to shine. Makes sense!   As I write this, though, he's literally humming Ground Control to Major Tom as he kicks back on the couch playing Call of Duty: Cold War with a warm and happy belly, so I consider this a solid win. We'll definitely be back soon to dine in! Thanks, Aviator!

reviews.author: Cheyenne H.
reviews.description: I've passed by Aviator several times and finally decided to try it with a friend.  We came at 8pm and the place was fairly busy. Unfortunately, the ordering process itself was very confusing. You can either follow a bunch of arrows to the counter and order (with few menus available), or you can seat yourself and order through a QR code and have someone bring your food to you.  We chose to go to the counter and ordered two Bear King beers that had great flavor- we were allowed to sample before ordering which was a plus. There were 50+ beers/wines to choose from so endless options... you can opt for a flight too. We also ordered two small pizzas (BBQ Chicken and Spinach and Artichoke) that came out in ~10 minutes. The pizzas had a thicker crust and were DELICIOUS! I'd definitely order again.   There were plenty of picnic style tables inside and out, and the outdoor patio had beautiful string lights, a playground, umbrellas, and lots of open space. Parking is easy in and easy out, and the staff were friendly.  Overall, I'd recommend Aviator. Great quality pizza in North Austin.

reviews.author: Michael B.
reviews.description: Great experience there for lunch the other day.  Food was fast and our bombshell was ASHTYN. She did an outstanding job. Management came by to check on our table also.  Definitely a great experience and we will be back.

reviews.author: Sarah J.
reviews.description: Soooo the waitress was nice and super helpful.  The food was what I remember.. haven't been here in over a year. HOWEVER... I spent $179 overall... bought a few drinks and.... I'm pretty sure the alcoholic drinks I ordered.. were watered down. I normally can finish two margaritas and I'm pretty tipsy.  I'm disappointed in the bartender working here tonight. I feel swindle. The vibe is definitely different now. Dayum

reviews.author: Ken S.
reviews.description: Being a veteran of the armed forces this place has just a cool connection with my vibes...being able to sit down and have decor to commemorate the Armed Forces is such a treat for me. I just love an establishment that recognizes the armed forces, it has special meaning to me.   The menu is filled with military jargon which is pretty cool when you order.

reviews.author: Lakeria S.
reviews.description: My boyfriend and I visited Bombshells on St. Patrick's Day evening in pursuit of having a few drinks and something good to eat. Upon arrival, the parking lot was packed so we thought that was a sign we would have a good time. The hostess told us it would be a 30-35 minute wait. We were seated in a booth after 20-30 minutes. I ordered the Pearl Harbor per the waitress's recommendation and he ordered an Old Fashion. Our drinks took a while because apparently they only had one bar back helping the bartenders. After taking a few sips of my drink, I noticed all I tasted was pineapple juice. I'm not a heavy drinker, but I do want liquor in my cocktail when I order one; it tasted like straight juice. Also, my boyfriend's drink was DISGUSTING. It tasted horribly bitter, not at all smooth and tasty like the Old Fashions he usually gets elsewhere. Regarding food, we ordered chips and queso that tasted stale and the salsa that came with it was watery AS HELL. I was so unimpressed with their menu that I didn't even order anything else. My boyfriend ordered wings and fries for us to share. By the time that came out, the waitress had brought us someone else's wings so she had to take it back and bring the correct one. Like everything else, the wings were nothing to be desired. I don't even think I ate any fries; I was just ready to leave. We barely ate the wings and didn't even take them to go. I guess they didn't have any bussers because there were so many empty, dirty tables around and people steadily coming in to be seated. The best thing Bombshells had going for it was the music. It was also a very diverse crowd: old, young, Black, white, Hispanic, gay, straight, couples, singles, friends, families, everybody. Hence the 2 stars. It's a shame because the vibe is there and the space of the place is really nice but our first impression of it left us feeling like we wasted our time and money. Therefore, we don't recommend it and won't be returning.

reviews.author: Bailey I.
reviews.description: I felt a little uncomfortable tonight as there was a girl walking around and asking people to buy cookies for $10 and when I said no thank you she suggested I make a donation instead. I'm not sure if she was family of someone working there, but it was awkward that they let her ask for money and since she never left the table we felt pressured to donate money to her with no idea who she was or if she was actually using the money for the purpose she said. Other than that, everything was great!

reviews.author: Elyssa C.
reviews.description: Service was not great :( it wasn't very busy but we were kept waiting a very long time for items even after asking a few times. The food was yummy though! The shrimp tacos were good, the accompanying sauce is great!!

reviews.author: Chris M.
reviews.description: Waitress brang me the wrong beer, asked for Miller Lite and was brought Bud Lite. Proceeded to ask what our waitress recommended as an appetizer and she said she didn't recommend anything on the menu. Poor attitude, customer service was bad from the moment my waitress began interacting. Seemed like she didn't want to be there at all. Overall would not recommend this spot if you want a good environment while drinking your cold brew.

reviews.author: Angel B.
reviews.description: I see why they only have 2 1/2 stars! We walked in at 3. 3 tables and 3 at the bar. We waited 5 minutes to be seated. (Waitresses having a conversation.) We we're seated finally. Then after about 10 min with no drink order taken from us, a waitress goes to a table where a gentleman was just seated, sat down with him and started taking his order. He wa seated righ next to us. We got up to leave and let the manager know why we were leaving and she acted like she could care less. Have never tried the restaurant out and I can assure you we never will. Good luck with business. You're gonna need it with the staff you have. Sorry I can't rate the food.

reviews.author: jaimie L.
reviews.description: Ordered through doordash. Missing cheesecake.  Chicken fried steak had the breading completely separated from the steak and although the breading was good, the steak was tough!  Fries overly salty while Mac n cheese had 0 salt. Best thing was the fried hot Cheeto torpedos. Would not return or recommend.

reviews.author: Cashdoll C.
reviews.description: Would only recommend this location through the week and daytime . I went on Saturday at about 11:00 this place had about 10 girls 2 at the front talking while I'm waiting to get seated , which took (5 min) for the girls to even come back from where they were at . So I finally got to the both still not being serviced properly. I waited 30 minutes before I got up and went to the front and asked " So IS ANYBODY GOING TO SERVICE ME" ? Like why come to work if you're not going to work .  I usually come to this place every time I'm in town but tonight was my last .

reviews.author: Geraldo H.
reviews.description: It was a pretty pleasant Sunday evening for me. I got out of work after being positively complimented throughout the day, just feeling pretty damn fucking good today. I decided to take a nap, then of course decided to get food to celebrate my day. I went on to take a nice hot shower, freshened myself up, and went out for food.   Initially, I was planning on going to Cheddar's but that wait time there was way too long. We're talking 45 minutes. I haven't eaten all day by the way. You know what was close by though? Bombshells. What was the wait time? 5-10 minutes. I wondered why but I didn't question it. It's kind of like when you need to take a shit, and you're just hoping to go to a nice restroom. Anyway, I was pretty surprised.  There was a younger woman who was the waitress our table. First thing she asked was the drinks we wanted. "Three waters please." I was then asked for my card right away which was fucking weird as shit as I didn't receive any food yet, nor did I get an order placed for food. I just sat there and started to ponder a bit. We get the waters but no offering of a straw for our waters, which I also thought was odd. Not really working out the way I'd like for my first time actually dining in.   NASCAR was on for a bit on the TV monitor screen, and then it changed to Women's soccer for the Summer Series (GO USA!). We finally get an order in. I ordered the Grilled Tilapia entree with Alfredo sauce smothered on, steamed broccoli, and Spicy Mac 'n' Cheese. The thing was that the poor waitress didn't even know that there was an option to top the tilapia with Alfredo sauce and shrimp. She mistook it that I wanted to do two different dishes. I'm just like, "I can guarantee something will be wrong." I kept quiet for a bit because I was pretty annoyed.  The food comes out. No shrimp on my dish. Eh, fine. I proceeded to eat the food and it was pretty decent. I liked the Alfredo sauce a lot. The Spicy Mac 'n' Cheese was okay at best. The steamed broccoli was good. I noticed one thing the entire hour being there--I've never once was asked for a refill on my drink, nor were we properly catered to with the courtesy of asking how everything was during the feasting of the food. I'm now really annoyed and frustrated.   The more I noticed things, I observed other tables and waitresses actually having an interaction with each other. The waitress at my table could have given two fucks about my guests and I. Cold shoulder was given to us several times, with the same waitress kissing the asses of the table served behind me to patrons that came in after we did. She was also missing for extended periods of time.  Little did she know, I actually am a frequent high-tipping gentleman with a whole lot of damn money to blow. Sadly though, she dropped the ball highly. I guess it could have been the way I looked or the stereotype that I may not be worth the time to serve--who the hell knows? What I do know is that I was still nice enough to offer a 15% tip even after all of the shitty service provided. I was thinking about stiffing her but thought to myself, "I think she is new, and they've probably thrown her to the wolves." Mind you, we had to let her know that the ticket was wrong. That shouldn't be something on our end to do but we did because we knew something was already wrong to begin with. First impressions are EVERYTHING, baby.  I'll make it known that having a pretty face ain't going to cut it in a face-to-face customer service field. That has to be backed up with a great demeanor, capability, efficiency, eagerness to perform on the job, and always a solid first impression. This young lady needs to be trained more, and I think it's at the fault of the actual restaurant not properly training staff that I'm seeing all of these shit reviews about the service alone. My ass got to experience that instead of the positive side.   I'm extremely disappointed and just hope Bombshells fixes their BS quickly. This restaurant can be more than just the typical chain, especially if it was better ran with its employees. I don't fault the waitress for not knowing better because for all I know--this can be her first serving gig. However, this spot missed the mark highly. Easily, I'm a customer that can bring numerous guests with me, ordering items on tickets of several hundreds of dollars a sitting quite easily. Not going to happen now after all of the mishaps this evening. I'd rather drink bleach.  .5 stars/5 Stars: Absolute abomination. I certainly doubt that I would ever come back to this spot. I would rather serve life in prison in Angola than come back to this spot.

reviews.author: Shawn M.
reviews.description: This place is sooooo damn underwhelming it hurts.  First of all I guess they didn't get the memo that we are in a pandemic since the rent a cops weren't wearing mask or enforcing the rule to   customers coming in and out of the establishment.  They were to worried about flirting with the waitresses.  I get it..they are kind of cute but come on..do your job!  Also there were about 9 of them working last night and only three were wearing their mask correct or even at all.  The bartender had hers around her neck the whole time while breathing directly over your food...smh..very disappointing. The wings themselves were okay but nothing to go back for.  I will be going to a place that the employees know how to actually wear a damn mask.

reviews.author: Shana J.
reviews.description: This restaurant may have been the worst tasting food I've had all year. I don't know whose idea it was for the fried pickles to be spears but that's a terrible idea. Also the batter that the pickles were fried in was pretty gross. The chicken wings tasted like they were barely seasoned. Drea our server was awesome and had a lot of patience because I know the group I was with was definitely annoying. The bartender was also cool. The drinks snuck up on everyone because at first everybody thought they tasted watered down and then all of a sudden they felt it (lol). Overall we definitely would not go back it just wasn't worth it.

reviews.author: Markiesa B.
reviews.description: If I could give it zero stars I would .I'll start by saying we had to wait 5 minutes for a table remind you this was a Monday night around 950. Got seated and literally waited there for 15 minutes and still no server. I walked down to where the kitchen was, poked my head in and said hey can we get a server for our table. A girl came by afterwards and asked did she(the unknown server) come by yet we said no. Five more minutes went by and my brother had to yell at a server to come over and serve us. She was nice enough to do it considering she wasn't are Initial server. We order all our stuff drinks and food at the same time. Btw the drinks were very weak tasted like juice and syrup. I ordered the Philly cheesesteak which was nothing to brag about. My brother told the server it was my moms birthday so she offered to buy her a shot. When it was bill time my brother asked for the manager to come over to explain why we had to wait so long and to at least cut the bill down for waiting so long. She said the birthday shot was considered the "freebie" and that she talked to the server and that was it. No apology no nothing . I will never visit this place again. They didn't deserve my money or time !

reviews.author: Kerri B.
reviews.description: Good food, good service and excellent DJ's. I love to come on the days that DJ Roger works and DJ Kavika are djing. They are the best DJ's ever.

reviews.author: Bradley B.
reviews.description: Good food and service. A little pricey for a wing place, but very good. Will definitely go back.

reviews.author: Brittney H.
reviews.description: Literally had the worst experience here on Friday evening. First of all the service was terrible, it took about 30 minutes after we sat down to get someone to take our order. We had to go to the front and ask for a server because no one was attending to us. After that, it took another 15 minutes to get our drinks. After we ordered our food, that took another 30 minutes to come out and when it did come out, my food was missing. The waitress didn't say anything so I figured that they were still making it. Only after 15 more minutes passed by and the waitress finally came back did she ask where my food was to which I responded that I had no idea. She then went back to the kitchen and after about 15 more minutes, my food came out. While everyone was eating, they found that my nephews chicken was raw and we had to bring up that issue as well.   The manager ended up coming out and taking my food and my nephews food off the ticket but it was still a very terrible experience. I wouldn't recommend going here to anyone.

reviews.author: Anastasia R.
reviews.description: The service here is definitely not the best, it was very slow and yet there were so many waitress walking around talking to other staff... The food was decent and space was comfy.

reviews.author: Captain C.
reviews.description: I don't know what the problems people have with place this are. When I was there, the food was good, the help was friendly and helpful, the girls were scantily clad of course... But aside from feeling ambivalent about that soft-core strip-club feel, it was great!

reviews.author: Chris M.
reviews.description: Place has lost their way. Everything about it has slipped down to poor status. Cleanliness, staff, food everything. Shame too because I used to like it.

name: The Park on South Lamar
accommodations: Good for Brunch, Lunch, Late Night
Best nights on Friday, Saturday, Sunday

reviews.author: Paul D.
reviews.description: A Special Wing Outing   In searching for a new place to enjoy chicken wings there was one place I have not been to in a long while, The Park. At first I thought I should have made reservations where the place was packed but luckily there was a table available. The place felt like an upscale sports bar and great place to hang out.  TV monitors were all around showing various sports programming. The place was a bit loud but if you want a quieter atmosphere then suggest sitting in the partially outdoor bar area. Plus the patio area would been a good spot for those still cautious where patrons were seated really close together.  I ordered the 5 Garlic Ranch Rub Farm Fresh Wings along with a draft beer.  The wings were really good having a unique flavor among other restaurants. From my experience chicken wings tend to taste better from restaurants than wing places. They tasted like were slow cooked with nice spices on them. It had a side of ranch sauce to dip them in.   We had a great time here and be back for more.

reviews.author: George A.
reviews.description: Ugh! I guess their MB sales out perform their food sales, because this place was really not that good.  But it's always busy. It only goes to show that people follow the crowd and not their tastebuds.   Beer - barely cold Michelada - no flavor Mexican Martini - There MIGHT have been alcohol in it; at $10 Chicken carbonara -Rago and noodles NO FLAVOR; this is why I cook at home Wings - must have a had a sale a my Sam's for Tyson Buffalo Chicken Wings  The Oasis is know for their atmosphere and horrible food. The Park falls into that category.  Maybe they have a different menu for weekend brunch, but their regular lunch is not good.

reviews.author: Ashleigh J.
reviews.description: It was exactly what we were looking for! Decided to stop here since I was in the area- we were sat quickly and there was plenty of space inside and out. We just missed happy hour but we grabbed a few drinks and food anyways. I decided to get a burger and it was delicious! Bun was soft, meat was seasoned well and tasted great with the fresh jalapeo! It's a great place to grab food, chill for a bit, watch a game and have a michelada!

reviews.author: Armando W.
reviews.description: I came here with my friends to get some dinner and the waiter was extremely rude and unhelpful. At one point he let us know one of the drinks we ordered was not available and then walked away without waiting for us to order something else. As soon as we got our food he asked us how the check would be split and shortly after brought us the bill. It was not a great experience and will think twice about coming back here again.

reviews.author: Michele H.
reviews.description: I went out here last night with an old friend. It was a well established business and the food was amazing and the drinks were good too. I love how they allow pets to come here!

reviews.author: Julia V.
reviews.description: Food was great!! Hits the spot and the jalapeo ranch is so good! Unfortunately the service wasn't good. We waited 40 minutes to get any service and had only 10 minutes to order happy hour.

reviews.author: Gerardo D.
reviews.description: I was surprised about this place. The food is quite delicious. Whether you go for chicken fried chicken, a burger, or the mac and cheese, The Park delivers. Their menu is quite broad, with many good options.   Good selection of beers, a very large covered patio, and good service. Recommended.

reviews.author: Allyson L.
reviews.description: Overall, a good place for a large group to grab drinks. I went to happy hour here with 8 of my coworkers and the outdoor seating was really spacious and well distanced from other tables.   Highlights: Their frozen margaritas (pretty strong especially for my low alcohol tolerance lol), the free tequila sampler my group received (:, the service, and the fact that they are really flexible with splitting checks for large groups!  Needs to be improved: The food was way too greasy and there weren't any plant based options for my vegan coworker. It would be nice if they had a smaller selection of dishes that were better quality and with half the oil added.

reviews.author: Kristi M.
reviews.description: Let me tell you what- those sliders were amazing and the $5 frozen mojito's on the happy hour menu HIT and did not miss. It was the perfect late afternoon snack to unwind from the day. We had the sweetest waitress that gave us great customer service.   P.S. there's plenty of parking :)

reviews.author: Rose D.
reviews.description: A great, always reliable spot! They have a ton of outdoor seating with lots of shade, and excellent deals on drinks + food. Definitely a sports bar vibe, with lots of TVs, but never gets too loud (at least when I've been there) as it's really spread out. They seem to have a nice separate outdoor space that people sometimes use for private events, which I love!  The food is good -- typical burgers, sandwiches, salad, tacos. I love that they have the option to get any time of burger/sandwich on a gluten free bun or a lettuce wrap. Their lettuce wraps are huge and keep everything together! I got the Hippie with grilled chicken and loved it -- the chicken was blackened and spicy - yum! My boyfriend got the Fat Chick (not what he ordered..whoops, but still was delicious). Fried chicken with gravy, mashed potatoes, and sauted veggies. They have a "Hot" (adobo) and "Skinny" (grilled) version of this. Nice to see some healthy and more indulgent options.   Definitely recommend if you're looking for good food, strong drinks (and some fun cocktails), and a nice place to hang with a friend or a group!

reviews.author: Jeremiah G.
reviews.description: Actually really good, chill spot. At first, I was thinking I was going to be walking into an Applebee's and I don't think I was that wrong but where The Park separates from Applebee's is the fact that The Park is actually has good food. Well at least their burger was amazing.   Friendly staff. Good, really good, drink happy hour. We sat outside and while a normal outside sitting decision is dangerous in Texas heat The Park actually made the sitting experience enjoyable.   If you are confused on what to get, as I was, may I suggest The Rebel burger. A good sized, well done, burger with fried pickle chips on it. My thinking is this. I'm going to get pickles anyways, I might as well get them fried as well.

reviews.author: Violet F.
reviews.description: This place was awesome, great music and door spinach artichoke dip: the thing that really made this place stand out though was the awesome bartender, Alexis. She knew the menu like the back of her hand and was really delightful to talk to; can't wait to come back!

reviews.author: Courtney K.
reviews.description: Ordered the southwest egg rolls and my order was delivered to the wrong table. The waitress handled it all really well and apologized, the manager came out to tell me it was on the house and again apologized for the delay. I think it says something about the establishment when they handle mistakes with integrity and is 100% a place  I would go back to!

reviews.author: Kathryn A.
reviews.description: I ordered the calamari as an appetizer and they gave such a big portion that I almost felt like I didn't need an entree, lol. It was super good! I would definitely recommend. The atmosphere was very chill and the service was good as well. Definitely going to come back

reviews.author: Robin W.
reviews.description: We went there today, just because so that you could actually sit and enjoy your food instead of it being all to go!   The service was very friendly and she gave a great suggestion on the mushroom burger.  The fries were perfectly crispy and not to large of a serving that I was overly stuffed.  I love that their burgers don't come with mustard and mayo and will only add them if you request it.   The hubby had the park burger with onion rings, which he enjoyed buy nothing extravagant.      I did like that they were playing old music videos.

reviews.author: Crystal Y.
reviews.description: Really amazing waitress, great service, yummy food, huge screens for watching baseball.  Very good sports bar. Tons of outdoor seating. Stick to the burgers here, y'all. I got the veggie, which had a delicious flavor and texture, it was black bean. My bf got the grilled chicken. We both loved out burgers and they have great topping choices too. Huge drink menu. Great mac and cheese and sweet potato fries too. Waitress was the nicest person.

reviews.author: Marcie M.
reviews.description: July was awesome and very attentive. Corn Flake Chicken Tacos were the bomb.com! Yum! Rice and beans on point. They were like home.

reviews.author: Brandon T.
reviews.description: The Park Has always been my go to spot to get a great food and great service. I love the Sunday Brunch it's amazing and the service is always good big thank you to our server who was amazing. The food was cooked fresh and also prepared well. If you ever come to Austin please stop by.

reviews.author: Elizabeth D.
reviews.description: After going to the domain location for the first time in January of 2022, a friend invited me to the location on slaughter and I was excited to go do the brunch special that's $16 because it was amazing at the domain. All the the food was old and just sitting there, we were there for about 2 hours and not one did they change anything out. My favorite thing to get is max and cheese and I checked 4-5 times to see if they changed it out. I didn't want to be rude and ask someone to change it out to I asked our waitress for a side of max And cheese (already $5 extra even though it's included in a $16 buffet) so she brought me the photo of the Mac and cheese in the smaller plate which looked like they scooped it out of the Mac and cheese that had already been sitting there. It was dry and barely tasted like cheese. This place doesn't even deserve 1 star! I was super disappointed. We ended up having to order food on top of our brunch special because the food was so old and nobody would replace it for TWO HOURS. The domain location is the one I would recommend instead.

reviews.author: Bo B.
reviews.description: Came here for the Happy Hour menu. I had the Mahi mahi tacos with broccoli and sweet potato fries that were delicious. The works pizza was also very good.

reviews.author: Derek Y.
reviews.description: ordered: -burrata -steak frites  the burrata is more or less standard fare-- about what you'd expect. but the rest of the dish are what elevate it. the burrata is nestled in a bed of spring mix with a bright green pesto topped and confited tomato. the dish is served with thickly sliced and buttered bread that the menu calls focaccia. aside from the rosemary in the bread, it was much thicker and fluffier than any focaccia i'd had before-- reminiscent of a texas toast. the sunflower pesto was a pleasant surprise. the sunflower stood in nicely for pine nut and was a nice textural foil to the burrata by adding a subtle crunch that is not typical of pesto. while still rich, the sunflower made the pesto a bit lighter than your standard pesto--which again paired nicely with the richness of the burrata.   the hanger steak was well seasoned and had a nice crust on it. the flavor of the meat itself was buttery with a very even gradient of pinkness throughout. the fries however were nothing special. the flavor of the tallow wasn't especially noticeable and i noticed the size and shape each fry was cut to was uneven-- though this didn't seem to affect the texture of the product much.

reviews.author: Kolby G.
reviews.description: I really wanted to like this restaurant. There seems to be mix reviews here on Yelp. BUT from my own experience, it was awful. The service was good and the servers were super nice. Unfortunately, this particular evening I got food poisoning from whatever I ate.   Mocktails - 5/5  Starters:  Crispy Brussels Sprouts - 1/5 Odd Bits - 1/5  Pasta:  Bigoli alla Carbonara - 4/5  Meats and Mains:  Wagyu Coulotte - 1/5 Wagyu Bavette - 1/5 Sirloin - 4/5  Sides:  Charred Broccolini - 1/5  The servers and service was fantastic. The mocktail they came up with was super tasty. Their pasta was really good. That's where the positives end. Both Wagyu steaks were way under cooked and raw. Very little flavor and not a good Wagyu at all. The odd bits I ordered, were chicken hearts. I'm going out on a limb, and thinking since they were also under cooked, that's where I went wrong. The sides were not good at all. Bland, flavorless.  I left the restaurant and headed home, not knowing the fresh hell that awaits me on my trip there. Within 10 minutes on the road, I was forced to pull over on the side of 290, projectile vomiting for almost an hour. I felt absolutely terrible for about two days. Sad, I really wanted to try this place.

reviews.author: Amanda M.
reviews.description: The food here is simple and delicious.  We had the half chicken which was fried in beef fat but no batter. Very crispy skin but tender on the inside. The spinach and mushrooms were well seasoned and delicious.  The Caesar salad was amazing. The dressing was delicious and the chicken on top was perfectly grilled. The flavor tasted like it has been brined for a while--perfectly salty and tender.  The brown butter cake was not very good and the fries were just alright.  Overall, food: 4.5/5 Service: 4/5  Very pricey but you pay for high quality ingredients.

reviews.author: Maddie B.
reviews.description: I was seriously disappointed by my experience here at salt and time which had been highly recommended to me by a friend. They missed pretty much every mark in terms of a good dinner experience. Let me elaborate.  We got there an hour before closing around 8pm, and were going to try to get in and out quick and didn't want to make them stay too late after closing. Well, we didn't have a choice because right off the bat we had to wait for menus for probably five minutes, waited another 10 for the waiter to come take our order, and when we finally placed our order probably 20 minutes had gone by so we put our whole order in at once.  We ordered the little gem Caesar-type salad, a ribeye (MR) and Teres Major (mr).  We waited (literally) 45 minutes for our salad!!! Waiter kept telling us it was coming and at the 40-min mark he asked "you guys still haven't gotten your salad?" Seriously!!!? It's your job to bring it to us and we've asked you about it three times now!  Keep in mind the restaurant was nearly empty by now. When we finally got it there was minimal apology and he seemed very nonchalant like it wasn't a big deal and turns out it wasn't even little gems. I grow little gems and serve them at the restaurant where I work and was super excited for them but this was just a regular iceberg wedge. After 1.5hrs of waiting at this point, steaks came out. Sauces were all wrong and not what we ordered and my steak was over cooked! Clearly medium and not medium rare since my partners was cooked correctly, there was an obvious difference. But at this point, being checked on by our waiter was a ten minute affair so we just shut up and ate it because it was getting late. There were no apologies, no comps, and the waiter kept trying to push us on dessert when we clearly were ready to leave. Dropped the check and proceeded to say "there's no rush!" ... yeah no sh*t I can tell that's definitely a motto here. And on top of that there was automatic 20% gratuity. I usually don't mind that, because most restaurant that do auto-grat have good service where I would've tipped 20% anyways. but it should not be a motivator for the servers to not give a crap about their tables like it is here.   The steaks tasted good but for the price, the horrible service and the inability to get orders right, this place was a total wash. You can get better steaks elsewhere for a cheaper price, where you actually enjoy your dining experience. Maybe in the future if they got new staff or management this place could be a really nice restaurant but for now, I can't recommend it.

reviews.author: Arunima M.
reviews.description: I'm shocked the ratings for this place are so low. Definitely one of my favorite restaurants of all time. Absolutely amazing quality meat with breathtaking dishes. Best burger of my life. Amazing pasta. One of my favorite things they do is the odd bits, where they use leftover meat and make a dish with it. Beautiful concept and it's usually my favorite part!

reviews.author: Jinhyung K.
reviews.description: Came here on a burger recommendation. It was a nice little place for brunch. I don't if I was just bad at finding it, but apparently they only have the brunch and dinner menu on the weekend. The lunch menu is only offered on weekdays so if you're wanting to come here for the lunch menu on the weekend, you are out of luck.   But their brunch menu still does offer a burger, the Butcher's Breakfast burger to be exact. It's pretty much the normal Butcher burger but with eggs and bacon added on, and i think cheaper too. I got it medium and it was a nice, hearty burger. It was a juicy, steak-y patty and the brioche bun was quite soft. I probably should've just taken the bacon and eggs out and eaten it separately though. It got a little to big for me.   Beef fat fries are a must try though. Nice soft potato filling, with a slight crisp. I might be wrong, but I tasted a hint of cinnamon and it had a quiet deep fried donut flavor that I am all too familiar with. Very addicting.   Came here on a 1PM Saturday and there was no wait, but I do here it does get crazy busy during dinner times so make sure you have a reservation. Our server was really sweet. The place overall had a calm and chill atmosphere and felt very clean.

reviews.author: Wayne N.
reviews.description: Best burger in town without a doubt. My friend was singing it's praises for a while and so a group of us showed up all ordering it. Go figure. But it lives up to the hype for sure. It's basically made from trimmings from the butcher shop, so it's ground pretty fresh, seasoned well and honestly tastes almost steak like from the cuts, so highly recommend medium rare or medium on the burger. It's also massive, so no chance you'll leave hungry. Some fresh veg and a nicely toasted bun round off the sandwich. I would also recommend adding some bacon at least to your burger, as it's crisp contrast and who doesn't like bacon.  As if that's not enough, the sides there are also A+. The beef fat fries have a lot of flavor, but also thick enough that you can appreciate the pillowy potato inside. The what I assume house made ketchup adds some needed acidity to all the food but jives well with everything. The shishito pepper app is also really good if you can tolerate a little bit of burn.  Service is a bit on the slow side at the restaurant, so I would definitely recommend getting a reservation if you can but also being patient and just enjoy the decor and conversations with people. The appetizers came out same time as the food too, so waiting an hour for food at 1pm on a Monday afternoon sounds a bit long, but good thing we had good company at least.

reviews.author: Jesus Y.
reviews.description: Two stars cause food taste good, my experience the place takes advantage and price everything possible, they charge me in my burger the tomatoes the lettuce, the ice tea 3 dollars and the refill 3 dollars and the small glass of no more then 12 oz has 60% ice .... They charge me the fries and they add a service fee of around 20% on a 2 person 2 meals .  I feel sorry for the waitress I can see she was hesitant about bringing stuff to the table probably cause she knows they charge for everything.... Btw the lobby is close and we had to eat outside with tons flies joining us

reviews.author: Brad G.
reviews.description: They served me a sirloin instead of a ribeye. Lol. Having worked in the industry I politely asked two people if I had been given a sirloin by mistake and they both said no. OMG.  All the servers were in a bad mood ... probably because of something happening with the restaurant. I thought outside would be charming, but it was full of flies.  The catchup was great, though.

reviews.author: Ken K.
reviews.description: Great pitcher shop as well as restaurant. Service is a little slow but worth the wait. The burger meat is fantastic. A perfect blend of fat and meat. It is incredibly flavorful. The fries they have are also wonderful. Super crunchy and yummy.

reviews.author: Milannie C.
reviews.description: This was my second time at Salt and Time. I figured that if I picked a non peak hour reservation I would have a better experience that the first time but I was wrong. We ordered the burrata to share since it was one of the things that I tried to order last time I was there but they did had ran out. I ordered the steak and frites and a glass of Pinot Noir. The entrees came out but the burrata was nowhere in sight. We asked the server and he said he had forgotten but would put the order in and comp it. Not ideal, but we were looking forward to it and said okay. The hanger steak was inconsistently cooked (some parts were medium, others medium rare and there was a tiny part that was definitely rare). I did not mind cause it was delicious anyway. The showstopper was the chimichurri... very bold flavors. The burrata was worth the wait although I would have still preferred it as a starter. When we got the check, we noticed we were charged $2 extra for each one of my husband's beers. We let the server know and he promptly took care of it. However, another employee (perhaps the manager) seemed upset about it and kept saying pretty close to our table that the price for the beer should be $10 instead of $8 like it says on the menu and that he had requested that correction in the menus he had printed. I understand they should have been corrected to reflect the price increase but that is in no way our fault. Good meal though, but wish we had gone somewhere else.

reviews.author: Steven X.
reviews.description: Absolutely loved our meal at Salt and Time. I got their burger and it was fantastic. Cooked perfectly medium rare, juicy as can be, and with a bun that really held up. The reviews don't lie. GET THE BURGER. Oh and the fries were bomb too.   My wife got the BBLT (beef bacon), and I have to say, it was the best BLT I've ever had. On top of favor, the portion was ginormous. Though, it didn't hold up as well as a leftover.   All in all, highly highly recommend, especially once they open dine in. The patio seating is nice but way too hot during the summer

reviews.author: Keith C.
reviews.description: Pretty miserable experience. There were at least 5 open tables when we sat down so they were not busy. It took 10 minutes for the waitress to give us a menu and immediately ask for our drink orders. 20 minutes later we get them. We've been here for 30 minutes and haven't gotten to place our order yet.   I order the $52 filet as did my friend. I ordered mine medium rare, he ordered his medium. His looked well done but he likes his meat well done so he didn't care. Mine however was completely raw on the inside. Not "cooked rare" raw. This thing was seared for maybe 10 seconds. It was also very tough. The waitress just dropped off our food and we were waiting for steak knives for 10 minutes until I walked to the hostess and asked for them.   I sent the steak back and it took at least 25 minutes to get it back. At this point so did not want to pay $52 for a reheated steak so I asked another waitress to grab me a burger instead so I could get the hell out of here. They come back with my steak, which was missing a piece, that had clearly been thrown into an oven or microwave to increase the internal temperature.   If you're coming here expecting an artisan or holistic steakhouse experience, go somewhere else. If you're looking for some $15 cocktails to drink in a gentrified strip mall butcher shop, this is the place for you!   My experience was so bad that I considered contacting my credit card for a refund. It was that bad.

reviews.author: Mary Jane C.
reviews.description: I love look and feel of this place. It's very welcoming. I ordered the butcher's burger with fries and Swiss cheese. The first bite I almost fainted! The flavor was amazing! Wow! I have a favorite burger place in Hawaii called Teddy's and so far I haven't had anything tipped that until today. I normally don't get my burger med rare but damn it was good! From the ketchup and the fries to the burger! I loved it! My first experience was great! Too bad I'm an out of towner! I'd make this a regular spot!

reviews.author: Tatiana T.
reviews.description: Went last night for quick dinner and was absolutely blown away. First and foremost the Beef Tartare is probably one of the best beef tartares I have ever eaten in my life - the mix of flavor was just incredible, and the steak was perfectly diced! I could eat this everyday. Absolutely superb.  We also got the Cesar salad to start which was another hit. For the main we shared the Wagyu NY Strip, side of fries and broccolini, and the sweet corn agnolotti. My ONLY complaint was that there wasn't a larger portion of the agnolotti, delicious stuffed pillows of creamy sweet corn. Service was friendly and hospitable, will definitely be back!

reviews.author: Abby A.
reviews.description: Best butcher shop in town! If you're looking for a specialty cut of meat, give this place a look. They'll likely have it or be able to source it for you, with enough notice. Whenever I'm craving a wagyu ribeye or NY strip, this is my first stop.

reviews.author: Kelly F.
reviews.description: Great Prime Rib for Christmas, we selected the Wagyu beef and it was amazing! Easy ordering system and our order was ready right on time, easy pickup.  We get a little credit for the rosemary and salt rub but honestly you need the top quality beef to start. Thank you and we will be back.

reviews.author: April T.
reviews.description: Went here last night and it was the best dinner I've had in a while.  I was a little hesitant based off other's reviews regarding how slow the service was.  This was definitely not my experience.  Our server was awesome and the food was amazing.  We ordered the charcuterie + cheese board, carpaccio, salads, pasta and steak.  The steak was well worth it- I could use my butter knife to cut it.  Also, I love that you can buy groceries and products there too at the butcher shop which is connected to the restaurant!

reviews.author: Barbara P.
reviews.description: Salt and Time, in east Austin, is a wonderful butcher shop, as well as a great restaurant.  Covid brought the addition of the upscale butcher shop, complete with many house-made items, terrines and fine meats...very impressive selections.   During Covid they also expanded into a new patio for dining, complete with large overhead fans, which made a very pleasant setting on a warm evening.   My daughter and I enjoyed a really great Charcuterie Board, that included 4 wonderful house-made meats, accoutrements and sauces. We shared it and both loved it.  We also shared their absolutely delicious Butcher Burger, made from steak trimmings. It was cooked perfectly and served on a brioche bun with all the trimmings, and the best French fries we've had in a long time.    We will definitely return to this east side neighborhood gem!!

reviews.author: Amy G.
reviews.description: Brunch today allowed me to check another big name off my list. I heard their Butcher's Burger is the best in Austin, so with nothing else calling to me off the menu, I had to try it. It was ok, I think? It was so tall and hard to eat that it was hard to really process and appreciate the flavor. They cooked it right, but the runny egg made the bun slide everywhere and mayo seemed like overkill. The Beef Fat Fries were pretty good, but not so good that I felt compelled to eat the whole serving. My favorite thing was the Charcuterie Plate that we split before the meal, especially the summer sausage, mortadella, and unidentifiable pink pickles. My friends loved their Steak and Eggs. I tried a bite of a friend's French Toast and would have gladly eaten more! While we were waiting for our food, browsing the butcher shop was interesting, and I liked seeing what products exist even if I wasn't in the market to buy anything. Service was attentive. I'm already planning on coming back again sometime because I know other carnivorous friends will love it. But now it's time for an afternoon nap!

reviews.author: Ian B.
reviews.description: I wanted to highlight that the hospitality of the General Manager, Jack Beckett, was outstanding on my visit and really made the experience.  The restaurant made a mistake on a dietary restriction, and while the server was defensive and tried to minimize the issue, Jack stepped in and offered an incredibly humble apology and took care of us.  Mistakes happen at even the nicest restaurants, but what stands out to me is how the restaurant handles it, and in this case Jack saved our experience and ensured we would return.  The food is fantastic - the biscuits are to die for, the grits are delicious and somehow they cook their brussels sprouts to melt in your mouth.  Highly recommend Fixe!

reviews.author: Lisa S.
reviews.description: We came in recently for a date night and everything was perfect. Warm knowledgeable service, beautiful ambiance and everything we ate was lovely and well executed. Both of our signature cocktails were a bit sweet for my taste (but I find most mixed drinks to be too sweet, so that's probably a me thing!) and the server immediately helped me with a lovely glass of wine instead.   We will absolutely come back.

reviews.author: Jim S.
reviews.description: Only one word needs to be said:  BISCUITS!!!  They are made to order and come out piping hot with honey, homemade jam, and whipped butter. I'm from Georgia and these are still the best biscuits I've ever had. They take about 10 minutes to make so order them right when you sit down.   Other than biscuits everything else was good too. The fried chicken was probably the highlight though.   The biscuits alone are worth a visit though. Yum!

reviews.author: Lauren G.
reviews.description: Great for large parties. Super nice in the inside. Very clean. Gives off the vibes of a nice steakhouse. Service was on point and fast. Nice workers. Food was average. We went for brunch. The best part of brunch was the menu's pricing. Very affordable for downtown Austin which you don't see very often. I got the burger, it was good. But a little dry and lacking in flavor. Fries and French toast were good. If I was to go back I would try their biscuit breakfast sandwich. The party I was with said their biscuits were delicious. We will definitely be back to try dinner next time.  Pros: price, service, cleanliness, and ambiance   Cons: improve on flavor in dishes

reviews.author: Stephanie H.
reviews.description: Highly recommend! It's my birthday week and the girls and I motored up to Austin for wine tasting and fun! We ALWAYS do Sunday brunch so we had to do it in Austin. This place is great for large parties and it's beautifully decorated.  I had the CIDE-car, their apple cider version of a side car... Very tasty and STRONG! Biscuits were big, fluffy and flaky like they came from biscuit heaven and your great grandmomma was the one making them. The deviled eggs were DELICIOUS and I'd like to think of myself as a deviled egg connoisseur. Cinnamon roll. Better than ANY cinnamon roll you've ever had the pleasure of stuffing in your mouth. ABSOLUTELY DIVINE!!! And the chicken fried ribeye with white gravy and collards..... All I can say is babyyyyyyyyyy this was definitely the definition of Southern cooking and hospitality. Our server Katie was ABSOLUTELY WONDERFUL!!  Here is what the others in my party had to say:  To start I had a Cide Car to drink, deviled eggs, and a mouthwatering buttermilk biscuit. My entree was the Chicken Fried Ribeye, served with a side of braised collard greens! I finished my meal off with a hot and fresh cinnamon roll! Everything was delicious! I cleared my entire plate! The service was amazing! Katie went above and beyond to build a strong connection! I definitely give everything a solid 5!  It was an amazing experience from the front door to the table.
