reviews.description: Slap Box is an interesting name for a Pizzaria with an included drafthouse. I stumbled upon this spot after Google searching "pizza near me". I was sawyer by the 4 star Yelp reviews, I had detour from my original plan to visit Pinthouse Pizza.   There's plenty of parking in fact there's an indoor covered parking lot on the same block around the corner. Upon entry the ambiance is well wonderful. There's enough tables and an ample amount of TV's to watch any of your heart's desire for sports.  I proceeded directly to the bar to order my pizza and beer to go.  When I sat down at the bar I ordered a pepperoni pizza and some water. After the pizza arrived after about 15 minutes or so I decided to sample a couple of ciders. I tried the Meridian Hive Cherry and the Meridian Hive Rhapsody. I ended up buying the Meridian Hive Cherry. It was on the sweeter side think like a wine.  When I finally tried the pizza it was pretty good. It was above average and I would try it again. The wings were really good. The sauce was flavorful and robust. The chicken was very good too. I definitely recommend Slap Box!

reviews.author: Glenn L.
reviews.description: Everything was great, the service was top notch - honestly the waitstaff was on top of their game!  First time in and can't wait to go back to try some different t combinations. We had the hot wings, by the slice and the garlic parmesan fries.

reviews.author: Lauren M.
reviews.description: Located in downtown Round Rock, this pizza place is right next to the Main Street plaza.  During CoVid times, we ordered to-go and ate in the plaza next door since it was a lovely afternoon.   Be forewarned, if you get a slice... it is a BIG slice!  See the La Jolla slice picture. It's huge!  The kids loved their pizza. Not a surprise there since it was your typical pepperoni.   I had a GF, vegan pizza for the first time and it was pretty good. I'm so glad they had this option on the menu so I didn't have to order a salad.   They had lots of beer options on tap but we didn't partake this time. Next time, we will. Give them a try!

reviews.author: Natalie R.
reviews.description: The pizza is delicious and my husband agrees. The parking is awful. One time we ordered it for delivery and were charged mega bucks by the delivery service, so we'll never do that again.  Another time I placed an order over the phone to go and had to wait outside for about 15-20 minutes past the pickup time because there were so many people in line.

reviews.author: Grey P.
reviews.description: Elijah was fantastic. One of the best service I've ever had. Put the customers first, be on his own recompense. We will be coming again because of Elijah. 10/10

reviews.author: Diana L.
reviews.description: Hands down the best pizza I've had. The Pirate pizza is a family favorite in our house! We also enjoy the chicken wings.

reviews.author: Tracy N.
reviews.description: Awesome place to hang out and enjoy delicious pizza! The slices are HUGE! We had a great experience and our server was awesome!

reviews.author: Elise M.
reviews.description: One of the best pizza restaurants around. I've been to Slapbox a number of times and it never disappoints. The menu is basically the same as 600 degrees in Georgetown. HUGE slices! Lots of variety and interesting toppings. AND this is a pizza restaurant but do not overlook the wings. They are sooo good. I love the dry rub ranch and recently tried the bourbon glaze which was super tasty. They have a great variety of beers on tap and attentive service. Also, a great place for take away. Slapbox is a fantastic addition to downtown Round Rock.

reviews.author: Matt M.
reviews.description: Good spot for a slice of pizza, drinks, watch a game, with a cool sports bar atmosphere. This joint is family friendly too. I ordered a slice of Canadian bacon and pineapple. This slice was huge!!! Good chew and flavor in the crust. The toppings, cheese, and sauce were good. I like a little more sauce but it is good pizza. I recommend stopping by this joint for some good pizza.

reviews.author: Mallori B.
reviews.description: Seems like a neat place to hang out. Pretty good pizza... which is HUGE by the way. 2 people could definitely eat on one slice! Service was fast and friendly. Pizza could've had more toppings and cheese. Cheese bread was good. Ranch was homemade and very good.

reviews.author: Shashikala P.
reviews.description: We like 600 degrees pizza at Georgetown but until recently we dint know slap box too belongs to them. We ordered garlic knots and cheese pizza with pesto. Ordering online was easy, we reached there early before the specified time but still our order was done already. Garlic knots was not good, no flavors, it dint even feel fresh, could taste garlic but not even a hint of butter but the sauce it came with was so good. Pesto cheese pizza was awesome, pesto was so fresh and flavorful. crust, cheese, everything was just delicious. Will be back again soon for more pizza!

reviews.author: Justin M.
reviews.description: Same menu/food as 600 degrees in Georgetown. This is some of the best pizza in the area. The wings are also legit and there's an extensive beer selection. What's not to like?

reviews.author: B T.
reviews.description: Don't ever order delivery pizza from Slap box. Great in the restaurant, terrible delivered. 45 min delivery became 2 hours.

reviews.author: Justin M.
reviews.description: What a venue for a movie! The visuals have Sony 4k projectors and great accompanying sound (not sure if Atmos). The draft beers were "hoppy" and the food tasty. Great place for the family or a date!

reviews.author: Brieanna G.
reviews.description: ***PREFACE: IF YOU ARE PLUS-SIZED OR WELL-ENDOWED ON THE BACKSIDE, CONSIDER GOING TO ANOTHER LOCATION OR THEATRE***  I called a little while ago and spoke with the Manager on Shift named D about some feedback I had, but wanted to provide it in writing in the hopes that it will assist in improving your overall customer experience -   I'm a plus-sized woman and haven't been out to an Alamo Drafthouse since before the Pandemic began. I was extremely excited to see "The Batman" film and upon entering the theatre for our 2:30PM showing, was immediately concerned with the way the seating is now designed in the theatres at the Slaughter Lane (and possibly other) locations.   The seats are extremely cramped, the tables so close together that an individual that is either plus-sized like myself or well-endowed on their backside have trouble getting into, but more so, out of the seats. While I appreciate the change over to nice loungers with elevated leg-rests, but the spacing is incredibly tight. Once our movie was over, I had an extremely difficult time getting out of my seat and I hurt my back as a result. I don't know about you, but I don't exactly expect to go see a movie at a theatre with the expectation that if I'm bigger than other people, I'll be hurting myself in the process to get in and out.  Manager D told me that there've been several complaints about this from other people, but this is a concern for anyone larger like myself. Had I known that the the seating situation would be so difficult to get in and out of, I would have sought out another theatre to go to. While it is possible to select a seat from the handicap area to better accommodate my larger existence, if I went to see a film with a group of friends of my partner (both of which I did today), doing so would force me to be apart from my group and likely take away from the overall experience.  I know that it's no one's problem that I'm fat, but I know for a fact I'm not the first - nor last - fat, plus-sized individual who will enter your theatre. When it's time to remodel your location (or others), I hope that you will take into consideration that larger people deserve to be comfortable and enjoy their movie-going experience without risk of embarrassment or injury in trying to get out of their seats.  Please take people of all sizes into consideration when remodeling and arranging your seating - it's already difficult being larger if a person has medical issues that contribute to their weight-struggle, and it's even more difficult for some of us to find the courage to go out with people and not feel like you stand out like a sore thumb for your size and the space you take up. We plus-sized folks want to go see a movie sometimes, too - please remember us when making seating arrangement considerations in the future.  Thank you for your time, and I hope this isn't something that gets overlooked.

reviews.author: Josh M.
reviews.description: Feels more like an AMC than an Alamo. In general, I've been disappointed with vibe of Alamo Drafthouses here in Austin. They just aren't quirky, fun, or lively compared to those I've visited in San Francisco and Los Angeles.   Cocktails are always disappointing.   Good chocolate chip cookies.

reviews.author: Mimi D.
reviews.description: Alamo, what happened?? Tonight was the worst experience.   My server forgot my food order. No one came by to take my card and get refills.  We waited (the entire theater) for 15 minutes AFTER the movie was over to get our checks.  Complete chaos Tonight.  Very dissapointing!!

reviews.author: Mateo G.
reviews.description: This was my first experience back to the movie theaters during the pandemic and boy oh boy was this the perfect place to go and do that. I saw Fire Walk With Me, and it was just so great to be back in the cinema and watch something. The overall experience was fantastic. Alamo is a great theater and general and has pretty good food selection. The movies are always broad so it's easy to find something to enjoy any day of the week. Highly recommend.

reviews.author: Richard W.
reviews.description: OMG the food! So good!! I wasn't expecting such high quality meals that were better than most restaurants. This isn't a dine-in theater, it's a restaurant that shows movies in a super comfortable environment. It was an awesome experience. Easy to buy tickets online and find seats, service was great, seats were comfy. We will definitely be back!!   I love dine-in theaters and was so disappointed when AMC lowered the quality of their food and seemed to stop showing certain types of movies, or too releases. So it was really refreshing to go to Alamo Drafthouse for the first time. Now I can't wait for the second time, and third time, and many more.

reviews.author: Larissa R.
reviews.description: I am so upset and frustrated I went to go see the Spiderman movie a few days ago with my fianc and we were charged for two food orders. I was told it would be resolved on their end. After a few days I noticed both charges went through and when I called I was told there was nothing They could do. Now I have had to go through an hour long phone call with my bank and I am still waiting to hear IF I will get my money back. We were not even compensated for our time and stress in any way! No customer loyalty!!

reviews.author: Kim C.
reviews.description: The theater was too warm, the staff does not prevent phone usage in the theater, and the food was warmed from frozen.

reviews.author: Patricia C.
reviews.description: This is our "go to spot" for movies.  The food and service are great.  The specials change enough to provide variety while the regular menu has some great old standbys.  I love having the "No talking or cell phone" rules!  They make sure the movie is enjoyable for everyone by having kid friendly showings.

reviews.author: Krystel L.
reviews.description: From customer service to ambiance, I thoroughly enjoyed my visit to this theater. This particular theater has reclining seats and personal desk tables rather than the high bar table at other Alamo Drafthouses. I got the pizza with Brussels sprouts and goat cheese -- delicious! The fried pickles were good too. Don't expect the fried pickles to be chips, they're spear shaped... if that matters.   If there's one negative critique, it's how loud the speakers were. It seemed insanely loud. I consider myself more on the hard of hearing side... and I thought the sound level was ridiculous. It was a good thing I wasn't watching an action movie, I don't know if I would have been able to handle it the whole time.   All in all, a good experience and if in the area, I'd go again.

reviews.author: Norah E.
reviews.description: Absolutely my most favorite date night place EVER! Everyone is so sweet and professional. I haven't been since February 2020 but I came back on November after thanksgiving (figured everyone would be out shopping not at the movies). Was right! Kids got to see croods 2 and loved every minute of the pizza and bottomless popcorn.

reviews.author: Rob S.
reviews.description: Alamo Drafthouse is a treasure and having one in South Austin is a gift. This is place for people who love movies run by people who love movies. Grab a drink, some awesome food, and enjoy an incredible film. I see every movie I can here because they a treat a movie like an event. Thank you, Alamo!

reviews.author: Jillian C.
reviews.description: Love this place!  Great staff, and a super sweet spot to check out a movie and enjoy a beer and some cauliflower Buffalo wings.  Their popcorn is legit too!  It felt super safe with people socially distanced and was a real treat to go back to the theater after many months away.

reviews.author: Craig C.
reviews.description: This afternoon we took our 4 grandchildren 3 four year olds and 1 seven you old with moms and my wife and I. It was a Special Christmas Polar Express movie on the big screen, along with the price of the movie everyone received a train whistle, Santa hats, bell necklace, Golden ticket, and popper. 2 cast members came out before the feature with one dressed up as a train conductor and explained how to use the props. The kids food menu was perfect and let we grandparents order from it also. The food was warm good flavor and perfect size. The chocolate milk shakes with whipped cream topping was wonderful.  Service was great fast correct orders for all of us. I know Polar express is not new but we grandparents haven't seen and it was really good. The place has new seats and updated tables. A wonderful place to go, try it out

reviews.author: Justin N.
reviews.description: Love the atmosphere of a draft house, of course the draf of the drafthouse and the fact that you can see an array of films that are not just current.   The disappointment is the food and sometimes the wait staff. I have tried an array of things on the menu and they are honestly the equivalent of a cheap diner lacking in flavor. And for that quality of food, way over priced.   The staff is not unfriendly, but about every order i have made, if i edited, it was ignored. Not sure why this is. More than anything else it is just annoying.   If anything, i will not come here hungry and just enjoy the films.

reviews.author: Liam J.
reviews.description: I love the idea of the Alamo Drafthouse has for a movie lover. But the servers walking through and runners delivering food throughout the movie is a tad bothersome.  I saw adults having to place their food items on another individual's tray, in order to get up..  PLEASE make the trays adjustable or remove. It takes away from the comfortable recliner chairs you have.

reviews.author: Brandy W.
reviews.description: Great place to watch a movie. They have comfortable reclining seats. Staff is very friendly. Highly recommend.

reviews.author: H A.
reviews.description: Love the drafthouse and this particular location is a much cleaner theater and smoother experience than at S. Lamar.

reviews.author: Jason D.
reviews.description: Alamo fan. Love the no cell phone rule. Love the loyalty program... BUT this experience last night was rough. The seats at this location are not comfortable. It was so hot in there I was sweating. And the service wasn't good. I asked for a refill 2x and waited nearly an hour to get it after the second time. The seats leave your get hanging and they fall down on their own, so we had to keep pushing the button to raising them up... They are narrow too... Food was good but 3 hours in the heat with an uncomfortable seat did not leave us feeling the love for Alamo Slaughter Lane...  I don't know what's going on but 2 stars instead of 1 because the guy that did our tickets was nice and took care of us.   Needless to say we won't be back.  Alamo pet peeve... Everyone location is different. You don't know what you're going to get. Recliners, old time theater seats, non recliners, only recline on the front row...Small tables, high tables, a long table...  It's an inconsistent experience.

reviews.author: Courtney S.
reviews.description: This was my boyfriends first time going to a movie theatre that offers bar and dining options. He was very impressed with the options, and we were both impressed with the atmosphere. We really enjoyed the nostalgic movie posters and almost carnival like vibe. The staff was also very friendly and helpful, so this was a great way for us to spend our time while waiting for a flight.

name: Little Woodrow's Southpark Meadows
accommodations: Best nights on Thursday, Friday, Saturday

reviews.author: Jamie P.
reviews.description: We really enjoy going to Little Woodrow's to watch NFL Sunday! They have 16 TVs spread out around the room. There's a mix between high tops and low tables, plus a large U-shaped bar in the back. They also have a front and back patio with additional TVs.  This location is strictly drinks so we usually bring food in with us we pick up on the way. The vibe is fun on Sunday's and if you want to mix it up, they have ping pong and beer pong out on the patios free to play.

reviews.author: Kayla A.
reviews.description: Honestly, this place is such an underrated gem in South Austin. The layout and vibe of the bar is amazing with great indoor/outdoor flow for those days when the weather is not our friend. Their back patio is tucked away and offers some peach and quiet while still being able to enjoy the game. We have hosted a few UCLA Alumni events here and the manager, Casey, is always very helpful! They share a kitchen with the pizza joint next door. Though I can't recommend the pizza the wings are phenomenal.

reviews.author: Maddy C.
reviews.description: I've been coming to this location for a few months and am finally moved to leave a review. The GM Sam is extremely hospitable and really impacted our experience. Top tier service. Ask for her!! We will be back!

reviews.author: Voltaire L.
reviews.description: This place is horrible! They over charge you and then supplement the charges buy saying you order "FREE NACHOS SALSA" if you so happen to not want the free salsa and chips they and leave on the table unopened!!! Yup you guessed it they!! Wipe the table downs and recycle the chips and salsa! I wrote a review on this "RACIST" place on yelp for another HORRIBLE experience! But my buddy wanted to go yo local place and he duped me Into coming here on a fight night!   I wrote this review already and I think they got it removed because it was so damaging to what they call "business motto"!  I WILL MAKE THIS SIMPLE!  I went to this place to watch a fight with a buddy!  I am not a big drinker!! I ordered one drink!! JUST ONE! My buddy had two drinks I believe and he also happened to also not order free bag of chips and salsa! But they made they way from behind the bar to our table! SPLENDID!!!!! Fight is over and i want to pay my bill will honor and dignity!! NOPE NOT TODAY!!   The waitress brings the bills, my bill is over charged! So i asked her why am i being charged for chips and salsa! "Hold on lemme get the manager!"   This Sorry excuse of a manager walks to our table and requested the issue! As I explained to him that you are over charging customers, he states "i do it to everyone and no one has a issue but you!"   Ok, Manager today you will not over charge me and you will correctly charge me so i can be on my way!!   He violently yells at me and tells me to get out but then remembers he has to get rid of the evidence so he voids my transaction!  Charges My friend because he paid before me and DIDNT notice the over charge!   THIS PLACE IS RACIST!! THE way that Manager treated me as if we meet him before! I am a minority!! Why would he treat me as if i am hanging around this place! I was a patron and he treat me less then human after I discovered they COVID Gorging secret!! If allowed i will add pictures of receipt! Second bad experience i was in where i found myself being yelled at by a WOODROW employee while trying to pay!! I HAD TO WRITE ANOTHER REVIEW because they may have removed my other one!! I just want an explanation on why are you doing this to customers and why are you so aggressive with black customers! He was emotionally violent and it scared me so i walked away!  I just want clarity and a non aggressive place to have a beer or watch a fight in SOUTH AUSTIN while being BLACK!! Nothing much!

reviews.author: Kristina H.
reviews.description: Loved this little place , had good atmosphere and some comedy . Food truck burgers were so good

reviews.author: Dmitri J.
reviews.description: I like this location although the building could use a massive upgrade at this stage. The staff is attentive, the beer selection is dope, and having a traditional low key sports bar on the south side has been great. The food trucks that are adjacent never seem to be open when I come but the walk up Brooklyn Pie Co. is a game changer. All in all if you are a south sided looking for sports and cools beer with friendly service Little Woodrow's south is a safe bet. Just don't expect Bella and whistles. That's not what they do.

reviews.author: Clarity A.
reviews.description: This is a great place to get drinks and watch sports. However on a day when the temperature is 30 degrees, I wish they would close the door. We might as well be sitting outside. Looks like a ski lodge with everyone bundled up. Not to mention covid and cedar are both high right now. Furthermore if I was running this establishment I think people would be more inclined to drink more if they weren't freezing their asses off. Anyways it's a great place just seems like a no brainer to close the door on a below freezing day so your customers are more comfortable.

reviews.author: Kylee K.
reviews.description: Such a cool place to hangout at! Weekend or weekday!   We went on a Friday night. $5.50 fireballs and $4.50 big mugs!   They have indoor and outdoor seating, a fire pit, TVs,  swings and bochee ball.   They are located right next to Brooklyn Pie Co. and they also have a Mexican food truck on site!   Dog friendly is always a plus!   21+ after 5pm.

reviews.author: Gail H.
reviews.description: Near the end of the day I had to take my mother to the emergency room (never fun).  The outcome was a good one, but the day was long.  My son and I decided to wind down at Little Woodrow's. Temp was in the 30s that night, but they have a really big and nice fire pit outside.    We arrived around midnight:30 on a Monday and the crowd was light and fairly quiet.We sat in a booth not far from the door (but also not far from the bar).  Only one bartender that night so the wait seemed a little long, but there was really no reason for them to staff two bartenders on a Monday evening.    Drinks were good, conversation was easy (no need to yell at each other because the crowd wasn't loud), and the place was nice and clean (restrooms too).  This was my first visit to Little Woodrow's, but I'd go back :-)

reviews.author: Rachel T.
reviews.description: In What world do you go to Little Woodrow's and get AN OL FASHION MIXED with club soda... I'll tell you which ONE, Woodrows Southpark Meadows because they are adding  club  soda  to  their whiskey so therefore they use the illusion of giving you a decent serving. It's just a serving of club and a 1/2 shot of whiskey. News flash that's not part of the recipe... It is essentially orange pill to wipe around the rim, whiskey Pour  over an ice ball/block, bitters and then it's not meant to be shaken it's meant to be stirred   Yuck!

reviews.author: Amanda K.
reviews.description: Since I am the Yelp duchess of the UFC gym in Southpark meadows, I had to check out the UFC gym sponsored event at Little Woodrow's. As a side note, Cowboy Harley Davidson also co-sponsered the event. There was give aways and a chance to ride on a bike (it was stationary). I had a chance since I know the manager at UFC, to put my skills to the test and throw on some gloves and do some of my kick ass kickboxing moves. However, having been maybe drunk/heavily buzzed at the time this happened, I was more concerned of not falling on my ass and less concerned on my actual technique.   I honestly a little excited for this event because I really couldn't wait to see some of the UFC fights on the fight card. Plus I got a chance to check out Little Woodrow's since it is close to my house.   Overall Little Woodrow's is a dive bar. They don't serve food and it is strictly about the booze. You can order from the pizza place next door but if you read my review of that place I would recommend getting food else where.   Anyway, the bar also had a dusty dirty chiller machine with jager and whiskey fireball bottles chilled and ready for shots. I will say they need to clean that fan that keeps it cool before it catches on fire. haha This bar was great for watching the fights since they have multiple TVs and a huge big screen that comes down.

reviews.author: Ryn B.
reviews.description: I only started coming here, reluctantly, after the bar at the end of my street closed and this became the closest adult beverage dispensary. I've warmed up to it quite a bit. From what I can tell, it operates really well and you're gonna get consistency.  Things of note: - Large patio space with plenty of seating and TVs - I don't really care for sportsball, but they play all the big games, matches, etc. and a lot of people turn out to watch, and the community is just *fun* - Open mic standup on Mondays (it's not terrible usually!) - Attentive bartenders; have twice seen them taking care of too-inebriated patrons. - Good food truck, also have popcorn (from a local place) - Very regulated with last call and when you have to finish your drink by. They will be open at the posted hours. - Patrons can get a little crazy but they're almost always friendly.  A solid bar, by far the best in Southpark Meadows.

reviews.author: Joey R.
reviews.description: This is a fun place to spend a chill night. They have corn hole,live music and friendly service. Perfect place to let loose and enjoy a happy hour.  They have a patio that is shaded by large trees and protects from the sun.

reviews.author: Susan N.
reviews.description: Walked in the bar and no one greeted myself or my husband. Every table except one was full. The table had fake skeletons sitting in a booth so we couldn't use that table... they lost service over fake skeletons that shouldn't be out, it's about to be December lol. Oh well, never going back.

reviews.author: Ben L.
reviews.description: First time here and I'm loving it so far! They have a big backyard with a stage and also in the front. Lots of game time screens with a giant one in the middle for the main game! Love the atmosphere! It's fun and lively!

reviews.author: Ashley F.
reviews.description: I absolutely love this place. I go about twice a week. I love talking to the regulars there. They put up with my rambunctious puppy and the beer is great. My two favorite brews are the Big Ben and the green room. I also enjoyed the open mic comedy night.  Pros: 1. Plenty of seating  2. Lovely bartenders and Barbacks  3. Nice ambience  4. Free comedy show 5. Christmas lights and a Christmas decorated cactus  6. Friendly people 7. Dog friendly 8. Easy and free parking  9. Great food I ordered pizza and wings from Brooklyn pie company

reviews.author: Diego R.
reviews.description: I had an awful experience at the south park meadows location. After being IDd at the door I was harassed by a server while already sitting. It might have been racially fueled as I was the onlyHispanic person sitting at the table. Nobody else's was asked to re show ID and we're able to receive service. I will never come back and I urge you to spend your money elsewhere. The staff is as unprofessional and rude as they come. They ruined my night along with everyone I was with. If I could leave zero stars I would. DO NOT SPEND YOUR MONEY HERE! There are many other bars with better atmosphere where you won't get harassed!

reviews.author: Aaron C.
reviews.description: I have been coming to this bar for the last year.  Unfortunately, on my visit tonight, i found myself a bit surprised by my bill.  Tuesday night is "big beer night", which means that 22 oz drafts are the same price as 16 oz drafts.  Cool.  I drank  3 22oz lone star drafts.  Pints of lone star are 3.00, so, i was a little surprised when my tab was over $13.  I asked about it, and was told that lone star was different.  This had me start doing Math.  Apparently, on normal nights, 16Ox is $3, while 22oz is 5.50.  Your paying almost $.07 more per ounce on a 22oz glass than on a pint.  Even with the minimal discount of "big beer night", you are STILL paying more per ounce on a 22oz beer than on a 16oz beer.  Way to screw your customers  LW.  You now have one less customer.

reviews.author: Jess R.
reviews.description: Great place to watch the fight. Guy bartender was so nice and easy going. Only complaint is that a y'all curly haired bartender with a cap on OVERCHARGED MY DRINKS. My total was supposed to be $12.99 and she said $14. I just let her keep the $1 since she needed it so bad.. but cmon now. Stop over charging. Especially sober people.. but def recommend this place. Just watch the SNEAKY bartender.

reviews.author: Jennifer M.
reviews.description: This place...this place is AWESOME!  So don't come here.  You are going to make the crowd bigger and then you will take my seat at the bar and this will just get awkward.  Just kidding...maybe.  I love that they offer several cider options and that they check on you often.  I never feel like I was forgotten about.    No cover for UFC and the regulars that come here are just as friendly.  I actually met a couple of people here and we now hang out together.  Thank you Little Woodrow's for helping me grow my social circle!  They usually have something fun going on as well.  Totally my go to spot on a Saturday night when there is a good fight on to watch.

reviews.author: Ben D.
reviews.description: Coffee in the Time of COVID. There I was, deep in North West Austin. I really needed a cup of joe to soothe my nerves after the drive and the only place close by was a little boutique cafe innocuously named Coffee Shark. The out door seating area was populated by middle aged professionals, who I presumed were working on their screenplays while on lunch. The cafe was in an office place overlooked by Mac-mansions perched on the hills surrounding it.  I girded myself for the aromatic punch of patchouli and sandlewood mixed with the audible assault of world music and hemp-wearing hippies. I entered the cafe and was pleasantly surprised by the lack of the typical Austin vibe. The young lady at the counter took my order, a medium cappuccino, without a hint of pretentiousness. I perused the wares for sale, mugs and tshirts, local coffee beans, metal straws. Thinking I should prepare for disappointment I grabbed some sweetener.  The cappuccino arrived promptly, hot and inviting. To my delighted surprise it was rich, creamy and flavorful.  I skulked out of the cafe, my expectations of over-priced culture dashed on the rocks of pandemic panic-less normalcy. Great coffee and great service.

reviews.author: Samantha C.
reviews.description: Pretty nice for a hidden coffee shop in a large commercial complex. Would not notice it from the road or walking past unless you know what you're looking for, as it blends in with the rest of the modern building architecture. Not the warmest building from the exterior, but they've done a good job trying to make it welcoming indoors. A variety of seating with one high top table. Most of the seating is 6+ capacity tables, so if you don't like sharing, this is not the place for you to study/sit alone. There is bench window seating, but with two walls of windows I imagine those seats might get warm in the summer. Some outdoor seating as well, for those who prefer that.  I got the grilled cheese and apple sandwich. The flavor combination was well done, but I was a little disappointed by the ratio of filling to bread and felt the sandwich could have been fluffed out a little more in terms of filling. The chips were neither amazing nor terrible; pretty standard fare.   I also got two different hot chocolates. One regular with almond milk, one Mexican hot chocolate with oat milk. Of the two, I'd recommend the first one. Good flavor and nice quantity of whipped cream if you ask for it in a mug. The default seems to be to-go cups, so make sure you're clear if you want to sit and stay a while when ordering. My friend got the Mexican hot chocolate with regular milk and the spices smelled fantastic, but with oat milk they got overwhelmed and it was mostly an oaty flavor.   Welcoming and friendly staff. Would definitely visit again.

reviews.author: Elizabeth M.
reviews.description: I ran into Coffee Shark for a quick pick me up during my lunch break and was pleasantly surprised. First of all, the place is huge. I don't think anyone would ever have trouble finding a seat and it seems like a nice quiet place to work for an afternoon. I appreciated the fact that they had a lot of flavor options. I decided to get a Vanilla Rose Iced Oat Milk Latte and it was so good. The flavor was subtle and it was perfectly brewed. The only reason I knock it down to 4 stars is because it's definitely on the pricier side. I would expect to pay minimum $7 for a latte when you go in. While it may not be an everyday stop, I would still go back for sure.   COVID Precautions: Masks required for employees and customers.

reviews.author: Julie F.
reviews.description: First time here. The latte was terrible, really bitter and 3/4 foam. They gave me the wrong pastry, which is really a shame as the one I wanted looked delicious, instead I got a really dry cinnamon roll. The breakfast sandwich was fine, at least it was cheap.

reviews.author: Danielle D.
reviews.description: Great little spot with a big menu full of coffee and treats - lots of outdoor seating. Covid precautions are the best I've seen in and around Austin! Check them out!

reviews.author: Ace L.
reviews.description: Clean and quiet local coffee stop with a great menu. Coffee's really great but a wait over ten mins for two cups ain't it!

reviews.author: Shashikala P.
reviews.description: We went late morning, it wasn't  crowded but for weekday and late morning, there were more people than I expected. We went to this place to try the steampunk coffee as other fellow yelpers have mentioned but I dint see option of steampunk coffee on their menu. There was only oNe person behind the counter for taking order and  making.  We ordered  blueberry scone, cranberry muffin, cappuccino  and house coffee. Muffin was huge, both muffin and scone wasn't  fresh at all, tasted like, when you leave them for couple of day on  top of the counter and take a bite. cappuccino  and coffee was good, service is ok, they  have ample seating. Recommend  cappuccino and cOffee not baked goods though.

reviews.author: Megan L.
reviews.description: Probably one of my worst coffee shops in Austin I've been to. It seemed so promising, but my friends and I ordered three different drinks, and each one was incredibly medicore. The chai latte was almost bland, vanilla latte tasted worse than an instant version I could buy at a grocery store, and even the normal latte lacked flavor.

reviews.author: Sara O.
reviews.description: We've come here several times now so we must like it.   I have ordered a breakfast sandwich that's good. There's a pretty well endowed breakfast menu, not huge full breakfasts, like pancakes, but for a coffee shop there's a lot of offerings.  Our coffees are consistent.  It's definitely not my favorite, but it's always good. Consistency is hard, which is why I don't have a favorite coffee shop.   The outdoor area is great bc we always have my kids in tow and sometimes there's another kiddo out there for them to mingle with.   The details: It's an older, white, crowd. The industrial decor is neat, but the chairs are really loud when you move them.  There's plenty of parking. Staff is friendly.   It's always relatively quiet. *the reason i noticed the loud chairs *

reviews.author: Veggie L.
reviews.description: I live about an hour away from Coffee Shark but every single time I'm in North Austin I'm giddy because I get to go to Coffee Shark. My family has food allergies (celiac disease) and everyone is so kind and informative. The coffee is so smooth and absolutely divine. I actually bought a shirt awhile back because coffee from coffee Shark brings me so much stinking joy! I don't feel this way about any other local coffee shop! So grateful you are a part of Austin and I wish this business ongoing abundant success!!!

reviews.author: Kim K.
reviews.description: I miss pre COVID times because Coffee Shark was a great place to study and have some coffee and a light bite.   Coffee is good, food is even better. Most recently I ordered online - wanted a scone but got a muffin, but no bother, muffin was still good.

reviews.author: Ivan C.
reviews.description: If you're not Indian or white you'll get bad service. Also they shut off reviews on google so there's that. There's better coffee out there.

reviews.author: Judah J.
reviews.description: Coffee is good. I have nothing negative to say about that--just the absolute worst customer service I have ever encountered in a coffee shop to date. The owner, or whoever he was, was so terrified of people I wasn't even sure if I was supposed to be there. Pictures look great, I'm sure the place can be a lot of fun if it weren't for COVID-paranoia. Seriously, I went all over Austin that day and NO ONE was halfway as petrified as this guy.  My brother tried to take a sip of his coffee but was soundly rebuked for exposing his nose and mouth for 10 seconds. I understand we need to be careful, and we were, but if you go to a coffee shop you should at least be permitted to make sure the thing is edible before you leave!! BTW, we wore a mask and were very careful the entire time being there.  Won't be back. There are many other decent coffee stops in Austin.

reviews.author: Jerry E.
reviews.description: Quaint little place, convenient if you live or work nearby. Good food, excellent desserts, and consistent coffee brewing skills exist here.  4 stars because while everything is good overall, the nitro cold brew coffee on the other-hand well to honest...sucks! Its just weak cold brewed coffee, it doesn't pack a punch of caffeine like other cafes that offer it on their menu. If you're gonna do something, do it right or do it better!  But great little place. Indoor and outdoor seating. Good lighting inside and fairly quiet environment if you're working out of the office.   The staff is friendly but not super helpful.

reviews.author: Juliana H.
reviews.description: Such a cute little location. Iced mocha coffee was amazing and the baked goods are great too. Patio is large too and you get a view of the mountains.

reviews.author: Steph R.
reviews.description: Nice spot close by that had really flavorful drinks. We got a flat white and chai latte. I love coffee but I'd honestly would get the chai next time - it was absolutely delightful. We also sampled our fair share of pastries including a blueberry muffin, pumpkin bread, and croissant. The muffin and bread were really moist and delicious, but the croissant was very bready and not a flaky, buttery croissant I was looking forward to. I think they get their pastries from a local bakery so that was cool and I would definitely try out their other pastries. Will definitely be back!

reviews.author: Steve R.
reviews.description: Have been going here since moving to the area last spring. Service is always great and friendly, and enjoy the selection of pastries. Appreciate the COVID-19 mitigation measures in place--super prudent and considerate. It has become my go-to weekend stop for a takeout coffee and pastry.  Hoping to one day perform there (acoustic guitar and sing).

reviews.author: Bonnie T.
reviews.description: Occasionally I work nearby and I have always found Coffee Shark convenient any time of day. In the morning I can grab coffee, pastry or even a breakfast taco. For lunch they have a great selection of sandwiches, soups, salads and pizza. They even have bar service as well.  It's always clean and the service is nice. It's a great place to have in the plaza.

reviews.author: Lil P.
reviews.description: This place is amazing and the customer service is stellar except when the new tall thin guy with the backwards cap is working. He overcharges and fails to deliver. Literally....Doesn't make your drink. I've had this happen twice now. Not sure if he's a new manager but each time I walk in and see him, I want to walk out. Today was no different. Even the young kids working there have better customer service than he does. I'm a little peeved he's really screwed with the friendly vibe the others have mastered.

reviews.author: Missy J.
reviews.description: I've only been here once but absolutely loved it when I went in. Great beer selection, that's all we went there for, but their menu looks amazing for coffee and small plates. Very relaxing environment saw lots of people there working or just catching up with friends. The staff was incredibly sweet as well. They have a fun little outdoor area with games to play, and a few games inside too. If you're looking for a relaxing getaway with both amazing beer and coffee choices this is the place to go!

reviews.author: Brooklyn B.
reviews.description: Amazing gem hidden in Spicewood TX. Great pizza, great bar and amazing live performances. Trevor was our server and he served us very well. Would give this place a 10/5 stars if possible! Ask for Trevor when you're there!!

reviews.author: Sarah P.
reviews.description: We grabbed a quick weeknight dinner here and walked away happy.   The cauliflower starter was packed with flavor. My husband followed it up with the classic Good, Bad and Ugly, a pepperoni, sausage, and pepper pizza that was elevated by higher quality ingredients. I tried the mushroom pizza, which was tasty as long as you're looking for something different. An umami bomb with a mushroom pure sauce, speck ham, and rosemary.  Two pizzas + the cauliflower = 2.5 meals for us, so plan for generous portions/leftovers.

reviews.author: Chaese J.
reviews.description: Love this place!   The atmosphere on Saturday nights with the live music is awesome. I started coming here a few months ago and will continue to come - every time I am here the pizza is amazing and the staff is friendly.   The arugula pizza is my favorite. I also tried the bad decisions pizza and it was good - I am not a fan of how greasy it is but it is a pizza so that typically comes with the territory   I recommend this place to anyone who wants a casual bite with a fun atmosphere and good drinks!

reviews.author: Jasmin R.
reviews.description: We recently purchased a lake cabin in Spicewood and stumbled upon this place. Great outdoor ambience and delicious pizza! We love how family oriented it is too. Why 3 stars then? Unfortunately both times we visited our service outdoor was almost non existent. We waited a very long time before someone would make eye contact with us and come over to take our order. On both occasions it took over 2 hours before we actually received our food, due to waiting so long to finally be served. I know how important reviews are to businesses so I was reluctant to give a low rating, however I really think the service outside needs to be improved. We really want to love this place and hope management takes this review into consideration.

reviews.author: Steve B.
reviews.description: Love this place!!  We're new to the area and live local. Their Wood fired Neapolitan pizzas are fantastic!! Love the roasted sweet peppers, sausage and pepperoni. Ceasers salad is excellent! Great selection of craft beers and local IPA's. They bring in high quality Live music Thursday thru Sunday.  The Big Hurt is awesome!! But the best part are people and the their staff.  Damian is the best!! He always makes your experience feel special like you're family. Highly recommended!!

reviews.author: Bryan H.
reviews.description: The pizzas and music is outstanding and the customer service is excellent. (This place is awesome and great for birthday parties.)

reviews.author: Savannah B.
reviews.description: The boyfriend and I happened upon this place with the intention to visit the farmers market in the same parking lot. No one told us that market is only open on Sunday and it was Saturday. Ha!  So we tried this place out in their dog-friendly  backyard covered patio and we were not disappointed!  - Fresh craft quality cocktails on draft  - Super fresh ingredients in the salad and pizza  It was still pretty early so we had the breakfast brunch pie and a light fennel salad and it hit the spot perfectly. When you visit, you can order straight from the bar and Emilio will happily take care of you.

reviews.author: Kip S.
reviews.description: Sorellina is hands down the best pizza in the hill country. The pies are creative, well executed and feature ingredients from local farms. I don't care for the clam offering, but it's hard to choose a favorite among the others. I guess I'd have to give a slight nod to the 'Nduja Sausage though. Regardless of which pie you choose, the crust isn't just an obligatory substrate; it's got great flavor and texture.  The cocktails are outstanding, especially the prickly pear margarita. Sunday is Bloody Mary day, and you won't find a better one outside of the next one. The mix has got just the right amount of spice and it's filled with a skewer containing salami, pepperoni, an olive, a tomato, basil and mozzarella.  The owners and staff are great, and they recently remodeled an already great patio area to include a beer garden with 30 beers on tap.

reviews.author: Bri W.
reviews.description: Hands down new favorite pizza place, great for kids and families. The outdoor space is great and we enjoy going with our kids.

reviews.author: Andrea C.
reviews.description: I came here with my kids and parents on a Saturday night. There were lots of kids playing on the swingset and a good band. The pizza was great. A good time was had by all!

reviews.author: Brian C.
reviews.description: Delicious pizza and cocktails + live music. Wood fired cauliflower and arugula prosciutto pizza hit the spot. A great place to enjoy a summer Sunday night. Bartender working the outdoor seating knows what he's doing. Try the Garden Party if you're into gin and the Tumbleweed if you like a good Mexican martini. Small playground for the little ones run around while Mom and Dad enjoy everything else.

reviews.author: Flora B.
reviews.description: Our neighbors introduced us to this fabulous, cheesy thin crust pizza joint with an outdoor patio air conditioning system within Pedernales Farmer's Market. Enjoyed the Nelson-style country guitarist from the patio and great vibes at this joint.

reviews.author: Ally A.
reviews.description: Great pizza and I'm from New York LOL and great service I hate to come on here only when I'm writing a bad review because people always respond with you only write bad reviews it must be you LOL when really I'm only motivated to write a review when I'm treated horribly or some thing is really not right with the place I spend my money at so I'm trying to write more good reviews it was too short to post by just saying great pizza. But this place has great pizza

reviews.author: M B.
reviews.description: Our family ordered takeout from Pizza Sorellina for the first time tonight. The pizzas were thin crust and delicious! My only complaint is that it's slightly pricey for the size of the pizza. We also enjoyed the cauliflower appetizer which was quite flavorful. We'll be back.

reviews.author: Wendy W.
reviews.description: Best Pizza in Central Texas. Moved to Texas from Cali. And its the best pizza I have had in decades. My fav is the crust.... superior flavor! Great Salads. Staff was friendly and accommodating as we had a large group. Over all, this place is awesome! I highly recommend! God I love Texas!

reviews.author: Christina C.
reviews.description: Verde pizza fabulous. added ham. Also loved cauliflower. Fennel and Caesar salads and margarita pizza with pepperoni.  Perfect easy place to go as a family. Very friendly and cookies looked awesome, will have to try sometime!

reviews.author: Jeannie S.
reviews.description: The atmosphere is great! Huge outdoor patio with spectacular bar and wonderful craft cocktails! The bloodies are the best I have ever had-the tomato juice is made fresh on site. The garnish is a meal by itself! Pizza dough and toppings are unbeatable. Best pizza I have had since I left New York years ago. The beers are also great although I am not a beer drinker.

reviews.author: Jimmie C.
reviews.description: Great food! Great people!  Seriously good wood fired pizza.  Now they've got the outdoor beer taps open and a good selection which makes the beer garden a nice place to catch some music on the weekend.

reviews.author: Emily B.
reviews.description: I stopped in after yoga to see what a cinnamon roll pie looked like.  They happily revealed one.  I then asked Shane if I could order a brunch pie half pork belly and half sausage and he said no problem.  Let me just say, I'm not sure where it went.  I'd like to say the dogs ate it, but I devoured it.  It was absolutely amazing!  Crust had a nice char and the flavor was delicious.  Highly recommend.

reviews.author: Courtenay C.
reviews.description: Whoah... so yummy. Such a good place to hang out and enjoy the outdoors and some music.

reviews.author: Sydney S.
reviews.description: Yummy drinks! There are a lot of options to choose from. I enjoyed the $4 Sex on the beach and Blue Hawaiian cocktails. A lot of their drinks sounded delicious, even their shots. A live band was playing. They had a few games you could play like Connect 4 and basketball. It was hard to find a seat at 2pm on a Monday afternoon!Bartender was busy but provided excellent prompt service. Peaky blinders was playing behind the bar!

reviews.author: Ted G.
reviews.description: We were looking for a layover spot to wait on another establishment to open and chose to stop in for a few drinks.   Being earlier in the day, E 6th had not yet turned into Dirty 6th, rendering this bar a good place for a few drinks. I would expect a loud environment here, just like in any other bar down the block. Along with the drinks we were easily entertained by the hoops game, but if basketball is not your thing, you may find the claw game more interesting.   Either way the prices are reasonable, even for slightly watered-down drinks, and the atmosphere is manageable.  Cheers!

reviews.author: William B.
reviews.description: Kylie skims, I'm the i ditties paid 34 dollars Two double Tito's other bars paying less! She pours a 4 count and when question her try's to use smaller glass to insure double! Scammer all the way! Looks used to steal!

reviews.author: Christa M.
reviews.description: I was so amused by the barker outside that it lead me in.  The hilarity ensued inside with the claw machine.  Drinks were really good.

reviews.author: Oliver A.
reviews.description: Very awesome staff, very friendly and accommodating, I never thought in a million years they would have the Astros game seeing as we are from the Houston area and this is Austin but we asked and they found it and put it on for us, super kool!

reviews.author: Alison M.
reviews.description: Came here to watch an Eagles game with the family, awesome atmosphere upstairs! Great spot to catch a game, bartenders were both quick and friendly. The drinks were cheap and we were able to get Victory Beer ( our local town brewery back home). Love this spot for a group outing, can't wait to come back some day !

reviews.author: Adam M.
reviews.description: nothing special but they had some $4 shots were quite tasty.  would go again for the cheap shots but not for the atmosphere...

reviews.author: Melissa B.
reviews.description: The fact that I am giving a good review to a place on "Dirty Sixth" is insane and reveals more #chaoticenergy than I want to divulge or recognize within myself.  My friend and I came here early-ish on a Friday night and each ordered a drink. Kairo (?), our bartender, was very nice and recommended we each get the same drink, in a larger size, for a dollar less. This would be intriguing, but I am a huge lightweight. Somehow, I acquiesced. The shocking thing is that, while a typical bar would make its larger, cheap drinks weak in order to turn over money and booze quickly, NOPE. These were very strong. I could not finish mine, let alone come close, but the lack of upsell and shiftiness already separates this place from its counterparts nearby TBH. Also, the bathrooms were shockingly well maintained.

reviews.author: Steven B.
reviews.description: This an up and coming bar to 6th street in Austin. The staff couldn't have been more friendly. All the beers were excellent, and they had plenty of NFL games to watch on Sunday. Food is also available. What more could you ask for?

reviews.author: Dan M.
reviews.description: Came for a couple drinks when on a bachelor party. It was a good time on 6th Street! Didn't eat though. This review is more based on ambience and feel of the bar. Got a drink fast!

reviews.author: Whitney D.
reviews.description: absolutely one of the worst bars i've been to. always so dry and drinks have barely any liquor in them. will never come here again nor will i recommend to a friend. don't come here if u want to have fun lmfaoo

reviews.author: Konner W.
reviews.description: Girls.. if this woman is working good luck getting a drink. I waited at the bar for 15 min by myself:-)

reviews.author: Theresa C.
reviews.description: If I could give it a 0 star I would. My cousin and his colleagues came from out of town and wanted to experience 6th St. I, having been to 6th street many times, I found it extremely unsettling and sketchy that the bar charged an automatic 20% tip (for 1-infinity) patrons without disclaiming it before hand. This applies if you pay cash or card. Now, for context, what if I came to the bar with a $10 bill and drank exactly $10 worth of alcohol, then I receive the bill and it's $12.00. Then what? I only have $10 cash. Now had you told me that I would be charged 20% prior to drinking, I would have only drank $8 worth of alcohol that I could afford the tip.  Don't get me wrong, it's not the tip amount, in fact, had the 20% not been added, my personal tip would have exceeded that. However, since you took that choice away from me without prior consent, it pissed me and my friends off.  We spoke with management and they explained that it was some type of tourist tax (which is not a real thing in Austin). They had no written policy to show us or any credible explanation.  Needless to say, we will not be returning.  Oh and top it off, they stand in the front and advertise $5 pitchers of beer, when we got in they only had liquor  because the all beer on tap was out of order. Smh.  The drinks were sub par and it was dead. So  basically a waste of time.  In short, we believe it was not a tourist tax, but rather a black tax and mind you we are all well dressed professionals who just wanted to have a good time.  I will say that prior to the check being given, the bar tender was nice.

reviews.author: Emily C.
reviews.description: Out of stater here. Group of us just scootered by and decided to pop in for a drink during the afternoon.   Bartender was friendly. Prices were reasonable. No complaints.

reviews.author: Natalie Y.
reviews.description: We had a private party buyout here with about 350 people. Makell was great to work with. They are clean and the patio area is a nice offering for a 6th Street bar. Lots of tvs. Cool atmosphere. And great drink prices. We'll be back.

reviews.author: Danielle E.
reviews.description: A few weeks ago I went to Pour Choices with a large group of female friends celebrating a 21st birthday. The doormen called us in from the street advertising that ladies could come inside the bar for free (men would be required to pay a cover).  After allowing most of our party inside, the doorman stopped my two friends, a lesbian couple, before they entered. They were asked:  "Do you holla at boys, or do you holla at girls?" (asking about their sexual orientation).   After my friends responded that they are attracted to women. Then they were told they would be treated "like guys" and were asked to pay ten dollars each. The incident was very upsetting for my friends, as they were singled out for being a lesbian couple. None of the other women in our party were asked this question or asked to pay cover charge.   After the incident, I asked to speak to a manager. The original doorman we spoke to continuously cut into the conversation exclaiming that his sister is gay, and that he even asks her pay a cover charge before she visits Pour Choices. The manager made no attempt to correct the doorman's assertions. The manager simply said it was just the way things are- but that he could make an "exception" for my friends' 21st birthday just this once.   The fact that the doorman asserted even his own gay family members were not exempt from being charged a cover for their sexuality- implied that this practice of charging gay women had been occurring for some time. Furthermore, when the manager made no attempt to correct the doorman and offered to let my friends in as an "exception", it further substantiated that this was a common practice.  The ordeal left us all fairly distressed. My friends (the couple) had both turned 21 in the last week and were excited to explore sixth street for the first time. Instead they were met with discrimination and a horrible memory that will last a lifetime. We were expecting to enjoy ourselves, but instead left in tears. I hope Pour Choices puts forth a sincere effort to make this right.  NOTE: I am posting my review again because my original review was taken down. I received an email from Yelp saying my review was removed because it was "motivated more by news coverage rather than one's own customer experience with the business". My review in no way is motivated by any press coverage. Every detail of this review is based on my own firsthand experience.

reviews.author: Odessa F.
reviews.description: Everybody knows I'm no stranger to Dirty 6th. Every noteworthy memory I don't remember can be credited to the badassness that is the infamous 6th Street in Austin, TX. The value that Pour Choices added to the Austin nightlife when it opened up earlier this year has completely BLOWN MY MIND. Pour Choices has seriously upped the ante in making sure that they set THE standard on how a bar should look, and how it should run.   Any night of the week you can always count on them to make your night a great one. From the music, the accent lighting, the boujee drink selection, big ass TVs to sweat your favorite games, to the friendly (and good looking teehee) staff, it's just a place you wanna go to with your friends to shoot the shit, dance like there's no tomorrow, or just have a badass time people-watching.   Sure at times when it's busy, service can be a little slow, or it's so damn packed you can't move. This is part of the business and for them being 4 months in, I think they're doing a damn good job at rolling with the punches while trying to be the best bar they can be on 6th Street.   Kudos to the staff, to the owners of the bar for creating THE hangout spot that people want to flock to on a Tuesday night. Y'all are definitely a huge reason why Austin remains to be THE BEST CITY IN THE WORLD.

reviews.author: Paige H.
reviews.description: I really enjoy this bar. Rooftop access available. Drinks are good. The real gem is that they have the cleanest bathrooms on 6th Street. Lol

reviews.author: Orze K.
reviews.description: Pour Choices looks like a recent remodel on 6th Street, it lacks the layer of dirt that most spots do which is why you come to Austin. So in that regard it felt a little sterile. But overall it's actually quite nice inside which was a welcomed change.  Live music at the front of the bar was a nice touch, it added some energy which we enjoy. A frozen marg and a beer was probably $10 which is a great deal. We were only in here for one drink while waiting for a table at dinner.   Nice 6th Street bar to stop in.

reviews.author: Bianca N.
reviews.description: I'm making this review particularly towards the lack of communication from this company.   I went to this bar on a Friday night. Yes, it was busy, yes I had a great time. Drinks are always good, and the music is pretty good. Skip to the end of the night and I left my phone behind.  So maybe, just maybe karma is in my favor and someone turned it in. So I call. I call the number listed on google around 3pm on Saturday, no answer. No voicemail set up to leave a message. Nothing. So I assume they'll call back or maybe I called at a bad time..... who knows. So I wait and try a little bit later, around 8pm... NOPE. NOTHING. I've emailed the company using their website, and have heard NOTHING. It is now Sunday, 3pm... and still again, NO ANSWER! I get that it was my fault for leaving my phone behind, but the very least they could do is call me and tell me they don't have it. I see that they might actually care about these reviews, so maybe this will be what it takes to get a call back.

name: Halcyon
accommodations: Good for Brunch, Late Night, Dessert
Best nights on Monday, Wednesday, Saturday

reviews.author: Alice Y.
reviews.description: What a fun place to come to in winter!  I ordered a very nice latte (see picture below) and an adorable mini s'mores kit for me and my friends to enjoy while sheltering from the Austin cold! It was such a fun and cozy activity to do with friends in the winter. Highly recommend!

reviews.author: Caley C.
reviews.description: I wish I could give more stars, but as others have mentioned, the bathroom and overall upkeep of Halcyon dragged the rating down for me.   I've always had a pleasant experience with the staff and I enjoy their coffee. Also, sharing the s'mores with friends is a great way to wrap up the night.   I used to visit Halcyon years ago while going to UT and my recent visits shocked me. The paint and furniture could use a refresh and the bathroom is really bad. It really makes me question their cleanliness policies and it does not give me confidence that they take pride in their business. Halcyon has been a favorite in Austin so I hope they can make some changes.

reviews.author: Dara C.
reviews.description: Halcyon is a go-to for me. I am a self-proclaimed coffee connoisseur so I really love that this is a late night option for me. The employees are all extremely friendly and make great drinks! My personal favorite coffee cocktails are the Chocolate Espresso Martini and the Insomniac.  Despite their great selection of drinks, this place could definitely use some work. As others have pointed out, the bathroom is seriously disgusting. I can't emphasize that enough. On my last visit, there was a #2 just sitting in the toilet with a used tampon sitting in the urinal beside it. No paper towels to use as a barrier for eliminating contact with the door, just a roll of toilet paper left haphazardly on the sink.   I don't know why this complaint isn't being taken seriously, considering the fact that there are quite old complaints concerning the bathroom nightmare on this page. A dirty restroom makes me skeptical of the cleanliness of the food and beverage preparation and makes me hesitant to come here again.

reviews.author: Karina N.
reviews.description: I came here on Friday and had to come back Saturday because Charlie made me the best matcha green tea latte! It literally was a pick me up for my soul. I returned on Saturday and was bummed not to see Charlie but I did get a pretty good green tea matcha from one of the guys. I like this place and Charlie. I'll be back when I'm in town from Houston!

reviews.author: Carrie B.
reviews.description: Wanna have coffee in a really cool Austin spot? No??? Well you're in luck! They have alcohol!  This is a great hangout.  I can't guarantee you won't run into a douche. But most of the crowd are still as cool as back in the day when this was just a super cool coffee shop with a humidor!  I miss the the humidor...  But I'm always treated with great people.  And the placement is great at night.  Who doesn't need a coffee in the midst of club hopping! It's become a saving grace for me.  Great atmosphere. Great people. And great way to sober up to rally!!!!

reviews.author: Adam B.
reviews.description: Love the chill queer vibe here.  Right across the street from some gay bars, so has a nice spillover affect.  Good coffee and caf food menu, but apparently they also have alcohol!  S'mores: This totally brought out the little kid in me.  Nothing bougie or artisanal.  Just Honey Maid graham crackers and Hershey chocolate, but still wrapped up in original packaging, alongside marshmallows.  The ratio is 6 marshmallows in the 2 person order and 12 marshmallows in the 4 person order.  Unless you're looking for just a taste, I'd actually recommend the 4 person for 2 people, so you can really indulge.  A nice strong flame in the center so you can practice your marshmallow roasting.  Aa Bowl: Perhaps a tad healthier than s'mores.  A huge portion of cold thick aa at the bottom.  Some fresh huge blueberries alongside banana slices.  With a little granola for crunch.  Perfect for breakfast or even a dessert-like meal anytime.

reviews.author: Chastitie A.
reviews.description: I really love their cold brew coffee!  I typically get my cold brew with vanilla, hazelnut and oat milk. Service is typically efficient friendly.   Whats's really intriguing is the interior design, a lot of Austin art, with modern furniture that is great for relaxing.   I don't necessarily Cindy this a busy coffee shop, so if you want to to have a study/work space, it can definitely be a good go to spot. Also, they serve other beverages besides coffee if you're not a caffeine head like I am.   Enjoy your coffee inside, or take a walk at the park right across the street!

reviews.author: Jeff D.
reviews.description: Halcyon Coffee is a great spot for coffee and drinks in Austin! The cafe has a very casual vibe, and it's exemplified in the folks that are drawn to it. I recently spent a few hours at Halcyon in an afternoon with some friends, and we had a great experience of being able to relax, chat, have a few drinks and catch up.  Their coffees are fantastic, and the alcoholic beverages are solid as well - I had a Mocha Latte that hit the spot perfectly (good taste and excellent temperature, what more can you ask for?). I will say the Iced Chai that I had was a smidge on the sweet side, had too much cinnamon, and was lighter than I'd expect, so maybe just skip that one.   The S'mores snack was fantastic and just a cute/ unique experience for a coffee shop/ lounge - I can't say I've ever seen something like that where you get a little campfire brought to your table and get to roast marshmallows indoors! Overall I'd definitely recommend Halcyon - great drinks, great service, and a solid experience!

reviews.author: Annie S.
reviews.description: My family of 5 came in specifically for the smores and coffee and loved it. You get your own table side fire pot to roast your marshmallows in addition to getting a Hershey bar and graham crackers. After a long day walking around the city, it really hit the spot.

reviews.author: Priyanka G.
reviews.description: Stumbled upon this place while we were on a bar crawl. Soooo glad we found this place! There was a drag show brunch happening at the time, which made the place super lively and fun. We went immediately to the bar and luckily found seats there. All 3 of us ordered a chocolate espresso martini and we LOVED it. Still dreaming about this perfect martini and how I can make it myself.   Will I be back? Most definitely, they make my fav martinis

reviews.author: Alyssa L.
reviews.description: I have always heard and seen people posting/talking about this place, so I finally decided to try it out! I got an espresso martini and the franchises vanchilla. Both were absolutely amazing, and made superrrr fast! I also got the pimento grilled cheeses as a snack, and it was chefs kiss! Cant wait to come again

reviews.author: Kristen G.
reviews.description: My boyfriend found this place while we were walking around downtown Austin looking for coffee. This place is amazing!! Prices are on point. Coffee is fantastic. Service is great! Staff is helpful. Everyone was socially distanced and wearing masks unless eating or drinking. The smores set up is awesome! We loved making our own s'mores indoors! Hershey's chocolate of course lol. Definitely Recommend! The lattes with almond milk are excellent. I also love the chaggaccino! Happy they have milk alternatives and mushroom coffee!! Awesome!! Great little spot. They have outdoor seating as well as indoor. We came here a few times while in Austin. Definitely recommend!! The coffee is fantastic!!

reviews.author: Quin T.
reviews.description: We stopped in on a Saturday for a light bite and drinks and was met by a roaring drag party at 4:00 in the afternoon. It looked like they were having a good time, but we did not participate. The shop had a light stench to it from too many spilled drinks and the restrooms were extremely dirty which is the main reason I am giving this place 3 stars. We ordered the grilled cheese and a peach alcoholic drink and both were very tasty.

reviews.author: Vivian M.
reviews.description: Cute coffee shop. Cold brew is really good, great atmosphere and nice pit stop place to get away from the hot Texan weather!  They could pay a little more attention to the bathrooms, especially the one that is gender neutral. The smell was almost unbearable.

reviews.author: Anand D.
reviews.description: We went here on a recent trip to Austin. Relaxed atmosphere, friendly staff, and delicious drinks (both coffees and alcoholic beverages). I would return.

reviews.author: Hannah A  F.
reviews.description: I went with a group of 3 and got the campfire s'mores for 2 people which came with 6 s'more sets with it. It's a fun little experience and a good place to come with small groups but you are definitely paying more for the experience and less for the food.   Plenty of indoor and outdoor seating and free wifi too!

reviews.author: Michelle R.
reviews.description: Stopped by as I was walking downtown. The staff was nice and friendly. It's clean and quiet inside as well.

reviews.author: Marlette C.
reviews.description: Had a great time here during my visit to Austin. The boozy coffee bar concept was pretty new to me, so I was pretty excited to try it. I can't remember which of the coffees I had. Maybe the espresso martini? Anyway, it was lovely. It had a few roasted coffee beans on top, which I enjoyed as well. The s'mores was super fun. They had some comedians performing that night. One of them wasn't funny at all, but the rest were entertaining enough.

reviews.author: Michelle L.
reviews.description: One of the best breakfast burritos I've ever had ... The Ole Burrito!!  Balanced perfectly between the eggs, beans, chorizo and potatoes.  It's a must to check it out!  Super nice employees right here in the middle of Austin!

reviews.author: Shane L.
reviews.description: Normally love this place on the weekends. Staff is always super awesome and friendly, but went for the first time on a Wednesday and had the worst experience. The cashier was very dismissive and didn't seem to want to be there or help us. Further, the bartender would leave when he was the only one there and not make drinks. When he returned I asked for my drink and he responded that he already made it and then accused my friends of taking it, so I should ask them. He finally said he would remake it and continued to stand there, read the book of recipes for drinks, make others drinks, take others orders and never made my drink. When I finally just asked for a refund from the cashier he said the manager has to approve it. The bartender who accused my friends and didn't want to make my drink WAS the manager.   I get it when it's busy, but other than the six friends I was with there were 3 other people at Halcyon. Again, this is NOT the typical service they have but I was so blown away so DO NOT go to halcyon during the week.

reviews.author: Gina F.
reviews.description: Love, love, love this place! I come here often to work and hangout. There are a lot of spots to plug in, sit and work both inside and outside.   On top of all this, they have vegan breakfast tacos and yes they are extremely delicious. For someone like me who doesn't drink coffee (I know it's odd), really appreciate the delicious tea selection as well.   Thanks spokesman for being my go to office away from home!

reviews.author: Austin G.
reviews.description: In East Congress next to a Tesla dealership is an industrial part of town with tons of crafts breweries, a winery, distilleries and Spokesman Coffee. Walk inside and you're surrounded by an industrial space with high ceilings and murals on literally every wall. It's quirky and beautiful!   Walk up the the barista and order a coffee from a full coffee menu. They roast their beans and sell it across the country. Next to the coffee bar is an actual bar with beers on tap from ales to cider and even a fruit punch and pickle sour type drink.  I ordered a vanilla latte for over just $6, tapped into their wifi and found open seating in the back patio. Only 3-5 tables are near outlets inside, but the back patio has a few outlets. However, the wifi isn't as strong outside.

reviews.author: Vivian F.
reviews.description: Solid vibes and good coffee. They serve beer and food too. Seating is not the most comfortable but friendly staff! Parking is a bit tough as it's in a commercial lot, but there's additional parking across the street.   Wifi is very spotty, ended up needing to hotspot from my own phone to continue working. Wifi password is witty thought -  you'll see what I mean.

reviews.author: Jason B.
reviews.description: This is one of my favorite coffee places they roast their own beans they do Collabs with other places creating really good stuff. Morning noon or evening it's always good staff is always friendly and they serve beer tacos bake goods you can't go wrong.

reviews.author: Rob R.
reviews.description: Really cool spot. Dark, artsy, inviting. Very kind baristas, wonderful coffee, tasty vegan breakfast tacos. Arguably the best croissant in town offered as well (sour duck market). Love this place.

reviews.author: Christine L.
reviews.description: So funky and awesome in the warehouse area and indoor plants and Great Wall art. He enjoyed his cappuccino and I had a lovely time with a lime Roibos tea that was so relaxing and aromatic. Shaded picnic tables to chill out and enjoy the beverages and wedged in between the Austin Winery and Texas Sake this place must be sooo happening at night.  Highly recommended!!

reviews.author: Ashleigh J.
reviews.description: Stopped here one Sunday mid morning and it was pretty calm and quiet. Parking was easy, and we were able to order our drinks quickly. The aesthetic in the place is really light and fun, and they have a lot of outdoor seating area. There were a lot of people doing work/homework of some kind, it is definitely a place where you can come and chill for a while. There was a large selection of drinks, including some seasonal options. I decided to get an iced Americano which I thought had a good flavor. Drinks were to us pretty quickly, and there was a water station four easy water access. The cream and sugar area also had almond milk, which I thought was a nice addition. Most places usually only have half and half, so a non-dairy alternative was nice to see. They sell beer, however I didn't look at the beer selection so I'm no help on that! Worth checking out, I plan to go back soon!

reviews.author: Garnie B.
reviews.description: decent place for coffee in the afternoon...  like the art and decor.  kind of loud, so bring your headsets if you want to read / study   had a meeting with a friend there, just chatting.  The coffee was good, did not try any of the food.   Team there was helpful and friendly.   I would recommend this place to get away from the coffee franchises Supporting the local team.

reviews.author: Jen T.
reviews.description: This place is awesome. Got a hot chai latte with oat milk and it was delicious. Nice ambiance with plenty of plugs.  I gotta give a special shout out to the staff. There were a couple of people from the deaf community here when I came in. The staff member was just as courteous to them as everyone else and even knew some sign language. Love the inclusivity.

reviews.author: Lena L.
reviews.description: Love the coffee and the layout of the shop!  I ordered a vanilla iced latte and it was super flavorful and hit the spot. I also really liked the two story layout and the art all over the walls!

reviews.author: Victoria D.
reviews.description: AHHH THIS PLACE IS SO COOL. This is an excellent example of a business making an effort to seamlessly live in its environment-- in other words, this coffee shop found a way to complement its outside surroundings near the Tesla factory, and almost gives off a steam punk vibe. I'm a pretty sunny person, but even I can't resist. Also, the drinks are actually good. Very glad that they were able to have an aesthetic look and comfy vibe without sacrificing the quality and taste of their drinks. I got the matcha latte with oat, vanilla, and turmeric !

reviews.author: Sean Matthew L.
reviews.description: Spokesman is everything I want and more. I worry to yell too loudly about how great they are because then everyone will know and make them busy all of the time. On the one hand that's great for business, on the other I want to keep them all for myself.   A lot of coffee shops can be snooty and pretentious, but this ain't that. Everyone there truly loves coffee and people. They just want everyone to be caffeinated and happy. What better a mission than that?  They roast their own beans which means you're getting a truly unique cup when you go there. All of their espresso pulls are doubles to start. That's why I love getting the 1:1 when I go to sit down. You get a single shot of espresso and a baby latte with the other single shot inside. You also get a glass of sparkling water and a Hershey kiss. Total perfection. This lets you explore and taste the espresso on its own and then see it in a drink with the milk. It's an awesome way to discover what you might like or not like about a particular roast.
