Then on your way out if you liked it you can buy a bag of those beans to take home for your coffee there for the week. It's the best.

reviews.author: Lauren F.
reviews.description: Fun inventive coffee that is quite good. Love the unique flavors. Interesting location in semi-industrial area. Will be back!

reviews.author: Lauren S.
reviews.description: I looooove this place! I always get my coffee beans from Spokesman and the few times I decide to try something else, I always end up wishing I hadn't. They just have great coffee, great food, great people, and great vibes. Oh, and the art....killer!!

reviews.author: Annie C.
reviews.description: Really dug the vibe at this place. If I was a local I would be here all. the. time. The art on the walls is really unique and the art + music + beer/coffee options gave it an awesome grungy feel. Everyone was super friendly and it felt like a neighborhood kind of place where you could happily become a regular.   They also cover all the coffee shop basics- My Chai tea was great, the wifi was fast, plenty of outlets, and the seats were comfy.

reviews.author: Whitley B.
reviews.description: This is SUCH a cool place. It's my favorite place to work from right now. Great vibe, great beer selection, and good coffee. Staff is so nice. I love being here and feel at home when I go.

reviews.author: Elsa J.
reviews.description: Such a cool place, and so totally vibe-ing Austin. Major kudos to the Spokesman for embodying sustainability in a cafe setting. They've got compostable take away cups and utensils, which is so rare. Their tea comes loose leaf in a steal strainer, and all their food is severed on reusable plates and in mugs.  I got the Turkish tea, flavorful and now one of my favorites. I'm not sure if this is a house mix, but the tea tasted unique and strong. Unlimited hot water refills, just go up to the bar area and ask! With tea I got the tasty morning bun, kind of like a cinnamon roll but with different nuts and really big. Flakey croissant exterior with a goo-y interior, this was a really nice cafe treat!  I think tourists and locals both enjoy the distinctive graffiti art on the walls of this cafe. It's located in a shipping container area that has a nice outdoor seating place too.

reviews.author: Gabrielle A.
reviews.description: Such a friendly vibe at this shop. The coffee reminds me of my favorite place in New York so I'll definitely be Back!

reviews.author: Sharleen C.
reviews.description: San Francisco vibes. The art work all over everywhere kept my eyes, mind and imagination entertained while I waited for my coffee. Cool coffee shop...Starbucks watch out!!

reviews.author: Devin O.
reviews.description: I landed in the Austin airport and wanted to find a local brewery with good food and character. I found Spokesman on yelp and was delighted by what I found. Granted, I thought the navigation was taking me somewhere very odd as Spokesman is a bit off the beaten path and was a bit harder to find in the dark. But it's worth it. I was greeted by a friendly staff and an interesting menu. The beer was fantastic and I got a cold brew coffee to go for the next morning.    For food, I'd suggest the chicken salad sandwich. It was delicious! However, the bread is toasted a bit too much--so crunchy it hurt my mouth a bit. But overall, crisp and fresh flavors that left me wanting more. I'd order it again, just asking that the bread not be so hard.

reviews.author: Mark H.
reviews.description: We took the 6 pm sightseeing tour on a Saturday. This was a sunset tour in good weather. When we waited, there was free Wi-Fi from the nearby Hyatt. Great trip! We sat at the front for the best view. Quiet electric barge, no spray. Could not hear commentary; boat may need Bluetooth speakers at the front. Good views of downtown buildings! We saw two groups of egrets settling in for the night. We saw some bats flying out of the Congress Ave bridge! Not many bats because this was in November.  We missed a few bats because the boat returned to the dock to drop off some people who needed to use the bathroom :( The tour guide could have stated that the boat had no bathrooms. It is obvious to the guide but not to the first-time visitor. Tip: go to the bathroom before you board the boat.

reviews.author: Kristen P.
reviews.description: We had an excellent time on the Bat Tour yesterday. With family visiting in town, we wanted to take them on something that was fun for both adults and kids. Capital Leah was great as she lead us on the tour of the lake and city, with the finale of the trip seeing the bats fly out from congress ave bridge. Definitely recommend to anyone! We love our bats here in ATX

reviews.author: Denise W.
reviews.description: This was a no frills, relaxing float around the lake. It was a warm, humid evening and we enjoyed watching the city light up as the sun set. The bats are still finding their way back from Mexico but it was still fun to see the bug hungry little critters emerge a few dozen at a time and head out for a night of dining on the local farms. If you want the full bat experience that happens in July according to our boat captain.

reviews.author: Tracy B.
reviews.description: I've been on a few of these cruises and every time we have so much fun! Staff are courteous and let your crew just hang out and have a fun time under the lights and stars of downtown while cruising town lake. It's especially fun during bat season! Highly recommend for bdays, wedding parties or client events.

reviews.author: Kristin B.
reviews.description: Holy shirtballs Batman! Or rather bat mama's. Please please please do yourself the favor of taking this extraordinary tour. Captain Leah said dress warm and boy was she right. Sunset on the water delighting in the balance of nature and civilization. I was humbled.

reviews.author: Diana B.
reviews.description: Capt Alec was great. Nice lil evening boat ride. Very informative!!!! I would highly recommend very affordable

reviews.author: Beka H.
reviews.description: We had a great time on the sunset tour! It was beautiful and the guide (Captain Molly) was very knowledgeable and entertaining. Would strongly recommend!

reviews.author: Shannon L.
reviews.description: My daughter was visiting and wanted to rent the swans  parked at the Hyatt and easily found our way out to the dock was informed  about rules and how to move the swan ride around the lake  What a fun time my daughter and I had. Was a bit hot in the sun but brought water sunblock  and snacks  such a good time can't wait to do this again ! Thank you agaIn !

reviews.author: Vanessa L.
reviews.description: This place is not worth it! They made us wait for an hour did not tell us 4 people wouldn't be able to ride until it was time to sign the waiver! They are trash I will never come I do not recommend made me waist 1 hour of my trip!!! They suck!!!!!!!

reviews.author: Claire L.
reviews.description: Swan boats $40/ 2 hours for 4-person swan.   Great service and overall awesome experience.   We visited at almost 7pm and were able to enjoy the laid-back waters without too much of sun. Loved seeing the sunset. The breeze was warm and nice.

reviews.author: Jane O.
reviews.description: My family took the bat cruise and it was perfect. The tour included city views with running commentary followed by the bats flying out from under the bridge for a very long time. Our questions were addressed and we saw many unusual birds and other sights. It was a real highlight for me. My only concern was that my GPS took me to the bus entrance and I was almost late trying to find my way to the parking garage and then through the hotel to the boat dock. The rest of my family got there in plenty of time but they were more familiar with the area. I got a great video of the bats so it was totally worth the hassle.

reviews.author: Tom T.
reviews.description: It's a very entertaining cruise. Our Captain, Alec, guides you though the lake with interesting information and jokes. But the Bats were great to watch. Highly recommend the the Bat watch.

reviews.author: Philip G.
reviews.description: Sailed on 3.12 with Georgia at the helm and she did awesome. Loved her enthusiasm for music (being from Seattle and a huge music fan myself I can relate), Austin and the Bats. Keep up the good work and maybe see you at Hotel Vegas!!!

reviews.author: Lyla A.
reviews.description: Such a wonderful experience for our family!  You cannot reserve their Swan boats (first come) but the day we went, the four man boat was available.   We spent about 45 minutes paddling around Ladybird lake and had a great time.   The people working at Capital Cruises wore masks and offered our children life jackets.   We will definitely return!

reviews.author: Katie B.
reviews.description: Not sure if this is a winter thing, but the two times I've been on a self-captained boat (it's electric) with them in the last couple months it's only been $75/hour. We've always had 6 folks, so it's a super economical outing and it's BYOB and snacks. They have a little thingie for you to plug your phone in for some tunes, too.  Very little interaction with staff beyond checking in, getting the quick lay of the land, errr, lake, and when they help you dock at the end, so super COVID safe, in that respect.

reviews.author: Nicholas H.
reviews.description: We had a lot of fun on this cruise. The guide Gabe was super helpful and knowledgeable. Would return again when bats are more active in the warmer months.

reviews.author: Anita Y.
reviews.description: It's my second time visiting Austin and I found out my mom has never been on a pedal boat so I made a last minute decision to rent a swan boat. I'm glad I got there at the time I did because there was an even longer wait time for all the people who came after me. It was $18 total for us to rent a two-seater for up to an hour. Totally worth it. We saw Austin from a whole different perspective. Also, it was quite a workout - a nice one though.

reviews.author: Monique H.
reviews.description: I have rented from Capital Cruises several times. Twice was for bat cruises and once for paddle boards. All of which were a great experience!   They are open right now and a friend of mine and I rented stand up paddlebords recently for an hour on the lake. We went mid morning (they opened at 10am on a Tuesday) and it was glorious. Hardly anyone was on the lake. The staff is super friendly. They have a tent outside and a touch less payment system. Prices are reasonable and their equipment is good too. They have some outside cubbies for your stuff should you choose to leave anything at the dock. The pics are from the bat cruise in October 2019. Highly recommend!

reviews.author: Jenny S.
reviews.description: Great experience especially for the price. Lorrie our tour guide was knowledgeable and funny (and we had a bit of a weird situation with a passenger being disruptive which she and the other employees handled quickly and professionally). There was a neat boat tour of some major buildings before getting a good spot and seeing/learning about the bats. Will definitely go again when I have visitors in town.

reviews.author: Taylor L.
reviews.description: We did the bat tour, and it was lovely! A nice, long, educational tour of the city and the buildings from the river during sunset...ya can't beat it! Another person on the tour said she thought it'd last around a half hour, but we were on the boat for nearly 2 hours! Watching the bats was incredible. We went in early November, so we weren't sure how many bats would be left, and there were TONS! It's truly an experience I'll never forget. Thank you to the employees and captain!

name: San Jac Saloon
accommodations: Best nights on Thursday, Friday, Saturday

reviews.author: Amanda K.
reviews.description: If my husband and I are downtown we usually stop in for a drink here. Brian behind the bar is always fun to talk to and Johnny is always nice. I like this place because the bathrooms are decent for a bar, they have live music, there is a ring/hook game, and they serve cider.  Upstairs the other night they were having a comedy show which we sadly had to miss due to having other plans that evening. I believe they are doing more events up there but haven't been since during reopening after covid.

reviews.author: Helen C.
reviews.description: TLDR: Matt and Steve saved our Bachelor/Bachelorette party from complete ruin on Labor Day weekend. We owe them a great deal of gratitude for the UNFORGETTABLE, FIRST-CLASS EXPERIENCE in Austin!   I happened upon this bar when my friends and I were walking around downtown Austin for a combined Bachelor/Bachelorette party. From first glance, it seemed like a typical Austin bar. Later in the night, our party was moved from the roof top bar we booked at the Marriot Hotel to the crowded hotel lobby due to a severe thunder storm. Needless to say, our large party of 30+ was broken up between random groups of party goers, diminishing the original experience.   It was recon mode time! I called every available open bar in Austin to see if they were able to help our rowdy group. Denial after denial, only ONE bar was able to step up to the challenge: San Jac Saloon!! Matt was updating me prior to our arrival. He was friendly, respectful, and accommodating. When I first arrived at the bar, I was so excited to see the large space with a full bar and lounge area. I couldn't have asked for more! The party goers AND bride and groom were VERY impressed with everything San Jac Saloon provided in ways of atmosphere, drink variety, and ability to have a safe, fun celebration.  Steve was our outstanding bartender; he livened up the night with his humor and antics! It was such a wonderful experience that words cannot fully describe the sincere gratitude we owe to Matt and Steve!!   If you want to support an authentic, passionate, and all around AMAZING bar, please support San Jac Saloon. I'd like to think we got a nice, hearty slice of southern hospitality as guests and I would 100% go back again for more.   My sincerest Thank Yous to Matt and Steve! You two are superheroes.

reviews.author: Lauren G.
reviews.description: If you love country music, you'll love San Jac saloon! Not the biggest fan of dirty 6th, but San Jac is one of the only reasons I'll come here. The band this past weekend was by far the best they had yet. Super interactive with the crowd, the place was packed. Drinks are cheap compared to other bars in Austin. It's definitely a dive bar but a great one. They take song requests which we love!! You'll find both younger and older crowd here. Good mix.

reviews.author: Jane M.
reviews.description: Love love love the live music at this place! Such an awesome vibe. We had a fun night with friends while bar hopping in Austin on 6th Street. San Jac Saloon was definitely our fav. The beers op tap were great too. This place was super crowded on a Thursday so I can just imagine how packed it can get on a weekend. There is a speakeasy type quiter spot on one of the higher floors if you dont want live music. Either ways a great spot to have fun in Austin. Must visit.

reviews.author: Carolyn D.
reviews.description: I planned a reception for my organization's conference in San Jac's private event space and it was awesome! The staff was so friendly and professional and the space was awesome. The second floor Jack's Room has a retractable roof that just added a nice element and makes the space very COVID-friendly. Would highly recommend San Jac for a company party or reception.

reviews.author: Jennifer H.
reviews.description: First time in, but not the last!!  Great dive bar. Bartenders friendly and attentive. Live music was awesome (Chris Ray and the Nine Pound Hammers).  Great place to be yourself and chill out. Love it!

reviews.author: Marc S.
reviews.description: Cool place.  Stepped in for an hour for some live house band music 3 piece with the guy running his own drum set with his feet.  Bartenders were friendly, various seating types all over the place.

reviews.author: Karen M.
reviews.description: Absolutely amazing! Great live music, company's and vine. Dublin Johnny made our day by serenading my best friend in her birthday. If you are coming to Austin this is absolutely the best bar. Cannot wait to come back!

reviews.author: Margarita S.
reviews.description: Racist vibes ! If you are a POS or women in general this place isn't where you would like to be . Super unsafe . I've been sitting on these experiences for the last couple of months ago  and decided to write a review to prevent any other person from going though a experience like mine . Back in March I was uncomfortably sexualized by the bouncer Colton . When I explained to him that I felt uneasy with his remarks he decided to smack my ass in a "playful" way and laugh. I walked in grabbed my friends and left . Until this day it's really disturbing to me to think a individual like himself can still be employed in a high risk environment. Please stay safe

reviews.author: Cristiano D.
reviews.description: If you don't want to come here for the incredible live music, or the great drinks, or the great atmosphere.. then come here for Johnny. He's not Irish, he's from fucking Dublin, and he has been the star of our Austin trip. Wish we could bring him back to LA with us. So glad we decided to stop into this place.

reviews.author: Kristi W.
reviews.description: We were in town on a Monday night and heard the live music coming from inside. Went back to our place, Lyfted over and proceeded to have such a fun night. Great music- NCAA finals and the best part was STEVE!!!!!  We made a new friend in the friendliest and best bartender ever!  This place is not to be missed for a great live music/bar experience in Austin!

reviews.author: Jim W.
reviews.description: Weakest drinks of anywhere I've ever been. I've seen them pour 1/2 Oz shots.  Do not go here!!!!!

reviews.author: Tammy V.
reviews.description: Customer service is amazing. Live music is great. Drinks are strong. People are happy.

reviews.author: Edward S.
reviews.description: San Jac Saloon was the perfect location for the final night of my group's bachelor/bachelorette trip to Austin. After unexpected lightning forced us to leave our original outdoor venue, Matt and his team were extremely helpful and provided us at the last minute with a private upstairs part of the bar to host our event. Even with very short notice, Steve the bartender gave us great service and ensured everyone was having a blast. Great drinks and great people in a fun space, I'd absolutely recommend stopping by!

reviews.author: Kerri S.
reviews.description: The music was good and that's why I dropped in one evening a week and a half ago. However, they have this angry Irish bartender that was picking fights with several customers. Additionally, he sat at the end of the bar ignoring customers while he visited with friends. He complained when the customers gave him smaller tips and was rude the entire evening. You couldn't say anything without him yelling at or arguing with you. Not sure if this is the vibe the place is going for, but I will not be returning. I also spoke with a few of my local friends and family about my experience and they will be avoiding the place as well.

reviews.author: Tracy T.
reviews.description: We are so thankful that they were open when we visited a few weeks ago  AND they had live music. They practiced social distancing, wore masks, and even have plexiglass between bartender and patrons. We really needed a shot of live music and we got it. Thank you.

reviews.author: Victoria K.
reviews.description: This place is amazing! So we heard Jared was part owner and so we stopped by. We went earlier in the day  and we had a puppy with us. We met this amazing man with a beard (We think Brian?) he was so welcoming! He had us take a group photo AND he let us bring our puppy inside. I bought a couple shirts and we weren't planning on returning for the night since we had a reservation at FBBC at 6:00 PM. However unfortunately our two transgender friends had a bad time... It's a long story and we left a review on their page hopefully to fix the issue but we were so upset from the bad experience. So we told ourselves hey! Let's go back to San Jac they made us all feel so welcome and Jared and the other owner know how to run a bar. ID checks TOOK 2 SECONDS FOR EVERYONE We went back inside and the process was easy and we went back inside and walked upstairs. We spent 70 dollars on an Uber just to come back!! Brian was gone which made us sad because we wanted to tell him how absolutely incredible he is. But we met this very nice Irish man upstairs and he was incredible! He fist bumped one of us and we handed him a tip and man he was such a gem. The music in both areas was rockin and we felt so welcomed and at home at this bar. You see... we had some charity shirts for Jensen and Jared because I run an organization called Castiel's Angels and they needed updated t-shirts with their new television roles and charity organizations. We were told by Brian to bring them to brewery but after what happened we were like ... no let's bring it to San Jac. They took the shirts and we are confident Jared will get them without an issue. We will be back when we come back to Texas. We are originally from Nevada, Oklahoma, and California and this road trip was supposed to be special. San Jac made up for our trip and we were treated with such respect! Best bar ever!!!

reviews.author: Tonya W.
reviews.description: Our last night in Austin and we strolled down the street to San Jac''s Saloon and went upstairs and meet Dublin Johnny who made our evening ! Got the best drinks, great laughter and wonderful music !!!  Dublin Johnny is da best ever !!!!!!!!

reviews.author: Neena J.
reviews.description: Typical cowboy-ish western themed bar with live music. And this was on a Sunday night!! Full bar with open seating even a higher level with tables overlooking the live band area. The band played remixes of songs with a southern touch. There is a small dance area filled with energetic people!  The drinks are average priced with beers on tap.  Definitely had a good time and would surely return!!

reviews.author: Joe O.
reviews.description: If you are looking for a calmer 6th street experience, then I'd recommend heading for the upstairs bar as its more of a lounge than bustling bar.  Selection of whiskey, bourbon, and beer was solid. Nothing that will blow you away. The environment is mostly what makes this place a solid score.

name: North Italia
accommodations: Good for Brunch, Lunch, Dinner, Dessert
Garage Parking, Street Parking, Private Lot Parking

reviews.author: Michelle P.
reviews.description: I haven't been here since I lived in Irvine, but we were craving some Italian food after all the barbeque, so thought North Italia would be a safe choice. This location is very spacious compared to the Irvine location. I love the atmosphere and ambiance of the restaurant. It gives off a classy casual vibe. We came here for a late lunch around 3pm on Friday and there was no wait.   Margherita pizza - You can never go wrong with a margherita. We did feel like the proportion of the crust to the actual pizza slice was really off. The crust was super thick while the pizza was so thin and flimsy. Pretty hard to eat. The bottom of the pizza was also burnt. The pizza topping itself was really tasty though.   Spicy rigatoni vodka - The star of the show every single time! The dish is bursting with flavor and every bite is amazing. I wouldn't miss out on this. I've tried their other pasta dishes but this is always my go-to. It also does have a little spice kick.   Service was friendly and quick. We were a bit disappointed in the pizza but nonetheless, it was a great quick bite to fulfill our cravings.

reviews.author: Nicole C.
reviews.description: The food was DELICIOUS...that's where the positive stops. We were told 20-25 minute wait, ended up being 40 (no worries, estimating can be a challenge), ordered a $150 bottle of champagne which didn't see flutes (ever..) along with 3 cocktails. After waiting 20 minutes for glassware, we asked for wine glasses since "there were no flutes..the wind keeps breaking them" (or so we were told) still also didn't see our cocktails for 25 minutes (post order time) due to the glassware shortage. An hour and 15 minutes after placing our order until we asked about our entrees, 3 out of 5 arrived within 10 minutes of asking and we needed to wait another 10 minutes for ONE more and 4 minutes after that for the last (which happened to be the soon-to-be bride... go figure). We decided to skip table side dessert due to the time issue and asked for one coffee to go... saying it was lukewarm is generous... then the bill comes.   If you have endless time, don't want updates on what's going on, enjoy lukewarm coffee, and drinking champagne out of wine glasses THIS is the place for you!

reviews.author: Skylar F.
reviews.description: ABSOLUTELY REGRETTED COMING HERE!   1. On a positive side the wait was much shorter than they quoted us.BUT when we sat down our (party of 2) food took over 1 HOUR. We came for an early dinner at 4:30 before catching a show later that night. Our food arrived sometime close to 6. We both ordered pasta dishes which usually tend to be the quickest.   We were very easy going and polite despite everything going on. People who sat down after us have already received there food and we're still waiting. After an hour the manager eventually comes over to us to let us know our food will be out...20 ish minutes later it comes AND MY PASTA IS COLD. It was so cold the sauce was already solidifying.  2. Portions are extremely small. I'm so glad that this place wasn't crazy expensive cause then I would be super upset. We were so hungry we decided to eat and leave to eat at the show lol.   Beautiful area. Lousy service.Don't do it

reviews.author: Kent R.
reviews.description: First time to visit North. Others than very slow food delivery it was overall good experience. Our wait staff, Douglas, was excellent. We had Wagu dish + scallops entree. Both were excellent and menu was reasonable. There was no wait and they were half to three quarts full yet the two entrees took 45 minutes which was disappointing.

reviews.author: Lauren G.
reviews.description: I go to North at least once a month. It's one of my favorite places. Yes, it's a chain, and you can go in multiple cities across the US, but it never disappoints. This time I went I got the Charcuterie Board; you get a lot on it for being only $18. I also got the Italian Farm salad. I get this salad every time I go to North. I CRAVE this salad. It's my favorite thing. My boyfriend decided to try something new and got the spicy rigatoni pasta with Italian sausage. He loved it. It will now be one of his go-to's. Service was standard. I will continue going back over and over again because of the consistency, price, accessibility, and taste of food.  Pros: everything on the menu is good, well priced  Cons: need to have more specials

reviews.author: Emily M.
reviews.description: Lovely place for an afternoon lunch outside - the patio gets some lovely sun and is dog friendly. Their bruschetta is delicious and a great twist on the dish. I don't think you can go wrong with anything here! Service was a little slower than you'd probably get inside, but that's pretty usual with patio service.  I parked down the street at the library which was inexpensive and a quick walk to the restaurant.

reviews.author: Tawny T.
reviews.description: Food is good but they did not have angel hair for their spaghetti, nor they had any mayo to go with my coworker's hamburger.  Not our server's fault.   Our server was funny and efficient.  Kudos to him to elevate our experience, otherwise I would have given this a worse review.

reviews.author: Aurora C.
reviews.description: Girls night out. Sunday dinner. This place was great. We made reservations and was seated right away. They have indoor and outdoor seating. Inside is very clean and I love the decor!  I got the Sicilian margarita and spicy rigatoni vodka. Both very delicious. The bowls are filling.

reviews.author: Hammond H.
reviews.description: We had a wonderful lunch with the family at North Italia today.  The dishes were all well prepared and the pasta was freshly made. BTW...It is fun to watch them make the pasta in their kitchen. I had the Spaghetti and Meatballs with a large mixed greens salad ( see picture). The others had chicken pesto, Squid Ink Malfadine and shrimp over pasta and shrimp scampi over pasta. It was one of the few Italian restaurants that is open for lunch on Sunday. They also have a small Sunday Brunch menu ias well. I highly recommend North Italia at both locations. The food is always fresh. The wine was pretty pricey by the bottle but, that is to be expected.

reviews.author: Nandeeta P.
reviews.description: Always a huge fan of North Italia! White truffle garlic bread is always a hit. Soooooo warm and yummy and creamy. Love it always. We are vegetarian and got the spicy breakfast pizza special without the bacon... I can't explain how tasty it was!!! The sauce was spicy and tart and just to die for. The arugula on top was also so fresh!!!! We even asked for a side of the sauce to complement our strozzapretti pasta which we asked for without the meat. I had a glass of wine (usually don't like wine or alcohol while I'm eating ever) but the Riesling was actually mild and sweet and went well with the food. I will always recommend North Italia to whoever will listen

reviews.author: Blake J.
reviews.description: Pretty disturbing to see the calories of some of these dishes... we enjoyed our meal here but the service was extremely slow. I'm not sure if that's because it's SXSW and they're more busy and understaffed but we waited sooo long for our food and they didn't seem to be all that concerned that we had waited. Both the bolognese and the truffle garlic bread were great. The ricotta on the garlic bread was delicious and fresh.

reviews.author: Jennifer D.
reviews.description: I don't even know where to start because it was all wonderful. From the Pomegranate Mule, to the Italian meatballs, to the prosciutto pizza and followed by Tiramisu. It was all so good. Later that night I was lying in bed craving more of those dang meatballs. For me you know it's good when you want more and a day hasn't even passed. The white truffle garlic bread is also a must. So much flavor! Service was great. The only thing that's weird about this location is that there isn't really a place to sit while waiting for a table unless you want to stand outside... which is fine as long as it's not freezing outside. It's not enough to take away a star because the food and drinks were fabulous.

reviews.author: Shannon H.
reviews.description: A decent Italian fare.   The drinks were somewhat terrible, but the food was quite good.   The pizza and the meatballs were the best.   The minestrone soup tasted truly mediocre.   Bolognese was salty but tasty   Carpaccio could have used more dressing and taste.   The hazelnut torta was quite excellent

reviews.author: Katie B.
reviews.description: Pizza and salad delivery was on point. It's definitely an expensive order for the portions but the execution meets expectations.  The Pig was oink oink and the salad was very hail, Caesar!  I would order again when laziness prevailed over budget.

reviews.author: Laura C.
reviews.description: Just stopped in before heading back to San Antonio for a drink and aperitifs and are keen to try out their food options on a repeat visit. We had the classico charcuterie to nibble on and and we found it comfortably suitable for two with drinks. It was tasty and well balanced. Give it a try when in the 2nd district.

reviews.author: Paola C.
reviews.description: Very good and not too long of a wait time. Only down side is you have to find and pay for parking. Chicken parm was divine. Pollo frito was good but if you have to choose, pick the chicken parm.

reviews.author: Tommie S.
reviews.description: Listen: I don't eat much Italian food, but do yourself a favor and stop by.  You might need a reservation to experience such fresh and authentic flavors! I indulged in shrimp scampi, short rib pasta, butter cake--YAAAAASSSSSS!--and 2 drinks. Decor is cool and the atmosphere was perfect after a full day of @conferencing." Renee is the best!

reviews.author: Sandra Y.
reviews.description: Ugghhhh this is one of my favorite places of all time to dine at. Some items are hit or miss but I typically order an app, pizza, and pasta to share between 3 and have enjoyed everything I've ordered after trial and error.   The Calamari is arguably the best appetizer they offer. It's cooked perfectly and sooo good with the lemon squeeze and arugula salad on top. Any pizza has always been delicious and my favorite pasta has probably been the Strozzapreti although it is super heavy and filling. I think the location at the Domain offers larger portions at the same price point so I would recommend that one over the Downtown location tbh.   Also, they do free birthday desserts! My friend ordered the butter cake and it was divine. We love their sangria as well and a pitcher is great for a table of 3 to share.

reviews.author: Ashley T.
reviews.description: The food was delicious here! Everything about the place was great. We also ordered the calamari and it was my favorite! I would definitely come back here on my next visit to ATX.

reviews.author: katy j.
reviews.description: Met and exceeded all my expectations. The flavors were amazing in every dish that was ordered. The prosciutto burrito was my FAVORITE item we ordered. The asparagus was a nice addition and the truffle oil sealed the deal. Regarding appetizers - the burrata anolini was delicious. The heirloom tomatoes were roasted perfectly and fell apart in your mouth. I will be returning to North Italia asap.

reviews.author: Mitchel R.
reviews.description: Jason was fantastic! I highly recommend him to anybody looking to take a tour of wineries/distilleries.  Great communication, easy to work with, and deeply knowledgeable of the area. He made great suggestions, was flexible as needed, and took great care of us! He even got us a private tour of the cellar at Hawk's Shadow Winery.  Absolutely reach out to him if you're in the area.

reviews.author: Rick M.
reviews.description: Jason was very professional and did a good job planning the day. Could not have asked for a better experience.

reviews.author: Natasha A.
reviews.description: Such a dope ass place, it's a convenience store with the best bfast tacos you could ask for. The vegan options were good, fresh.  Love the coffee options, spicy green sauce is probably the best in the city

reviews.author: Jeff D.
reviews.description: Quickie Pickie is just an unassuming spot for a great experience - it's a combination of a small store, coffee shop, and mini-restaurant, and delivers on that combination in a great way. We initially stopped in after a nearby restaurant had a 1.5+ hour wait, and I'm really glad we did!  The staff at Quickie Pickie is super friendly, and quite helpful in making suggestions for coffees and tacos as well. The tacos are pretty decently sized, so I'd say 2-3 would be a good quantity for the average person. I personally got 3 and was stuffed by the end of them. There are a good amount of small tables inside and outside so it was fairly easy for us to nab a spot even at lunch on a weekend.  Overall, I'd definitely recommend checking out Quickie Pickie if you're in the area and looking for a bite to eat!

reviews.author: Michael S.
reviews.description: Came here after wishfully thinking we could walk into Paperboy on a Sunday morning... rookie move.  Lucky for me, QP has some solid breakfast tacos and coffee!   I will def be back for the tacos but might pass on the brioche breakfast sandwich, something about the bread didn't hit the spot.   Good salsas too!  Thank you Paperboy for the QP intro.

reviews.author: Manny G.
reviews.description: Excellent spot to pick up some coffee or cold drinks. The employees are super friendly and the vibe is chill. You can sit outside and enjoy a drink.

reviews.author: Alysha M.
reviews.description: Would definitely recommend if you want to sit with your laptop and get a little work done, have a beer or a coffee, just a place to stop in real quickkkk- no pun intended ;)  But the food was not a great experience for me :(  And there's not many seating options- uncomfortable and couldn't stay long because of that.

reviews.author: Bob E.
reviews.description: Neat combination of restaurant and store that has that Austin vibe to it. It has a limited menu, generally hot and cold sandwiches, but also has a selection of beers on tap.   I had and enjoyed the cheese burger.

reviews.author: Bree B.
reviews.description: Super cool pit stop for a quick beer or buying groceries or both. The staff didn't seem to be too inviting, but they were quite busy stocking the shelves and tending to the store itself. The beers on tap were great and very affordable. The grocery items were all slightly expensive, but were quite diverse - tons of vegan and dairy free ice cream options if that's your thing. Can't wait to go back and try the tacos. I think this place is a great pre-game or before dinner drink option without any frills.

reviews.author: Lolly S.
reviews.description: What a fun kitchey place. Perfect for an afternoon lunch. Great tacos!! My fish taco had the biggest piece of fish I have ever seen in a taco. Hubby had chicken fajita loaded with big chunks of chicken. A crazy amount of fries that came with a yummy green dipping sauce.  Huge selection of beers on tap  and also a good selection of wines and other beverages. With an array of people coming and going this place seems to appeal to a wide array of people.

reviews.author: Adam C.
reviews.description: My favorite hangout in Austin. Such a chill atmosphere. Plenty of beers, groceries, and made to order food.

reviews.author: Sam H.
reviews.description: Just moved to the neighborhood, and we've been loving the quickie pickie so far... my only complaint is that the drink selection (aside from beers) is very small...

reviews.author: Jen M.
reviews.description: I've been disappointed in Quickie Pickie lately. I feel like their standards have significantly gotten lower. Some of the staff are so rude, Acting like I'm inconveniencing them by ordering a coffee. And the coffee is rarely how I ordered it. It's so close to my work and convenient for breakfast, coffee and snacks but I think I will be finding a new place. It used to be so great and now it's terrible. The employees need training in customer service.

reviews.author: Catherine B.
reviews.description: Decided not to go to Hillside Pharmacy because they only had the brunch menu unfortunately! We saw Quickie Pickie and decided to head on over.  They have an incredible variety of national and international beers. I also appreciated the fact that they had a fridge where you could buy just a can. They also had a wide variety of red wines and non-alcoholic drinks. They provide free WiFi (password is winebeer) and have lots of seating inside and outside. This would be a great place to camp out with your computer and work offsite. There is a restaurant that serves hot food but you can also grab some quick refrigerated bites that are in a fridge on the right side of the place. I got the Waistline and it was pretty good, it was pretty dry. They serve their sandwiches with ruffle-style potato chips. I wouldn't come back for the sandwich but I do appreciate the beer variety!

reviews.author: Bridget K.
reviews.description: Being from out of town I think this is the coolest! A little grocery store with homemade food, outdoor/indoor seating and a dessert case! I felt like I walked into heaven. This kind of place is totally my jam!  They have a wide variety of drinks and various snacks you can choose from, grab and go food and stuff they can make there. It's also in a great, easy to walk to location.

reviews.author: Emily J.
reviews.description: We love quickie pickie! From the coffee to the food it's delicious! Its a short walk from our house so whenever I bring my daughter to the park we stop by first and get some fresh fruit for a picnic! The breakfast tacos are bomb as well as the hot sandwiches, I'd suggest the founder (: and I'd def stop by if you've never been, from my experience you can't really go wrong with anything !!

reviews.author: Alexandrea C.
reviews.description: (Review is for back in late 2016 when I first moved here. LOL delayed review...sorry.)  I used to work down the street and without exaggeration would come here like 4/7 days a week.   I always LOVED how it was like a small grocery and had a few isles worth of thoughtful products to choose from along with their actual menu.   The avocado and vegan tacos were my favourite--they PACKED them so you definitely get your money's worth.   Staff was always friendly and talkative. Wait times were never longer than they needed to be.

reviews.author: Elizabeth R.
reviews.description: I had a very poor experience at the quickie pickie this morning. After placing my order along with the orders of my 3 family members, we took a seat and patiently anticipated the arrival of our food. After about 30 minutes I walked up to the cashier and asked about the food, he said he would ask about it.. Moments later the long haired man with the attitude called me back to the counter and handed me a bag of cold bagals and tacos " I called this order like 3 times he snapped." (This I knew was untrue because I had 4 pairs of ears intently watching and listening for every single order that was placed.) Why he was so hostile, I cannot say. When I unbagged the food I noticed we were short a bagal. I went back to the man and asked for the bagal they had forgotten. He found the receipt which had no 'classic bagal' on it. Of course this meant nothing to me other than another mistake on their part and inconvenience for me. To my surprise he actually rung up an order for a classic bagal. "That will be 6.50$" I looked at him half shocked by what I was hearing. "I don't have any intention of paying for that" I replied. "Ok well just get out then." He sneered. I understand it I hard to find good labor these days. But never have I been so appalled by any establishments customer service.

reviews.author: Kyra H.
reviews.description: I had been told years ago when visiting Austin to come check this place out, but it just never happened until recently when we were asked to meet some friends here for brunch. It is such an Austin spot. The inside is kind of like a bodega, but they have a working kitchen and coffee bar. We arrived 5min til 2PM when they switch to their afternoon menu. The girl behind the register told us to make a quick decision because once they put the breakfast stuff up they do not pull it out again even if you were in line. I ordered a bacon, egg, and cheese taco. This is my go to order when getting breakfast tacos. I had considered getting two, but I'm glad I didn't. Those things are loaded! I took advantage of the three different salsas that you can put on your tacos as well.  Our group sat outside on the front porch. It was nice and seclusive. We forgot there there was traffic driving right by on the busy street.

reviews.author: J R.
reviews.description: I generally liked this place but I just went for the first time since covid started and their setup is not great. First, their online ordering system wasn't working. Then when I asked about it, the lady simply said "you can't order online." Yet, they're on DoorDash??? Both hand sanitizer dispensers were empty, and there were none next to the register despite the fact that they make you sign a paper with a pen - even if you use ApplePay. Food was fine. Not worth the anxiety levels provoked by this experience.

reviews.author: Cynthia C.
reviews.description: This place is basically a hipster convenience store coffee shop. I felt like a kid in a candy store shopping through their aisles of ice cream, healthy frozen foods, health bars, different jerkies, wine, and kombucha! I was very tempted to blow a lot of money here, and I wouldn't have even felt bad because of how healthy everything is. The prices are pretty reasonable, so you can get quite a bit here. There was even lamb jerky in bar form and I'm now obsessed with Kosmic Kombucha, which is brewed right in Austin. Matcha Peachu is a cleverly named flavor and delicious! I was happily surprised to have found Bobo's bar since I found them on Instagram literally the night before.   The coffee was yummy and a lot of people seem to come here for brunch. The people here are incredibly sweet and represent Austin very positively. There's also a good amount of seating inside and outside, perfect for the absolutely beautiful day that it was.

reviews.author: Jennifer M.
reviews.description: Not a bad coffee/beer and work spot depending on what you are looking for.  This place has a cool variety of groceries to choose from or a menu while you sit and do work.  The environment is comfortable and casual.  The chairs inside, however, are stools with no backs which is super uncomfortable when you work for long periods of time on your computer.  The food was also not that great.  All in all, it is not a bad little spot to get some work done and have a beer.

reviews.author: Deb G.
reviews.description: As others have suggested, definitely do a Tipster Walking tour early in your Austin stay.  We walked with Laura on the Downtown tour and the Eastside Art tour, both of which were fantastic.  She is knowledgable and a good story teller.  My husband and I learned a lot from her both historically and fun facts along the way.  She provides other suggestions while staying in Austin along with restaurant favorites.  Thank you Laura, keep up the great work!!! Glad you will be vacationing in STL soon!

reviews.author: Vic C.
reviews.description: Tipster Tours is a must do if you are visiting Austin for the first time (they also offer a tour in San Antonio's downtown if you also visit during your trip since it is only 90 minutes away from Austin). There are 5 tours available to choose from (some require a minimum of a group of 6 though) and are free! This walking tour allows for you to give any tip that you want after it is done. You are under no obligation to tip anything, but it would be nice for the tour guide to get something from you.   During our visit, we only went to the downtown tour, where you meet outside of the state capitol. My husband wanted to check out another tour but during our visit, it was raining and I just didn't want to walk in light rain and mud (yeah I'm a sore sport). For most tours, you just show up at the location. There is no need to RSVP (you can see the dates and time available on the company's website).  For our tour (about 90 minutes), we had Laura as our tour guide. Because this tour is all outside, we brought our little girl dog (she told us this was her first time having a dog on her tour). For this tour, it leaves the capitol, heads to the small park across the street, then to the governor's mansion (where you will most likely see either the governor's golden retriever, Pancake or their newly adopted little puppy golden retriever), various murals, other historical places and ends at the Driskill Hotel.   We learned so many things on this tour, the 3 of us enjoyed it (I am sure my little girl was happy to mark her territory as we walked along) and would highly recommend this tour. The walking is pretty easy and so most should be able to be fine.

reviews.author: Kim F.
reviews.description: Our guide, Laura met the groups on time and was easy to locate. No reservations or upfront payment is required. In fact, the tours are billed as free! However, being "Tip"-ster, they are appreciative of tips and in the FAQ suggest $15-$25 per person per tour. Over a 2 day period, we took 3 tours...Music, Downtown and Eastside Arts. Each tour was 1 1/2 hours. Laura was very knowledgeable and was easily heard and understood. Questions were welcomed and answered. At the end of each tour, we were given information on what we could do next. Check the website before you go, as the time had changed from the week before when I planned. The time change was bolded, so easily found. Highly recommend these tours. Since we were on a "stay"-cation, we may do the others they offer soon!

reviews.author: Robyn P.
reviews.description: There's a great new tour guide service in Austin and it's not to be missed!  Newly unveiled in October, this company allows participants to "pay" for their tour once its completed by tipping their tour guide. This is a fantastic idea because it practically ensures you'll get a fun and informative tour.   Joey, our guide, was very friendly and knew his Austin history. He delivered his facts and info with wit and humor which kept everyone attentive and entertained. I highly recommend him if it's possible to request a guide. Bonus: Joey looks like "Lip" from Shameless.  Have fun!

reviews.author: Bethany K.
reviews.description: Natalie's East Side Art Tour provided an amazing opportunity to see cool pieces on the east side of Austin. She was informative and super knowledgeable about local artists and different styles! She also had great recommendations of local places to try.

reviews.author: Ky C.
reviews.description: WILLY~~spelled like willy wonka not like willie nelson, was a great guide. we had him for our austin music tour which started at lambert's bbq on second. he came with a guitar and took us around to all the cool historic music spots and sang along the way. i would strongly suggest you spend some time with them and get to know austin!

reviews.author: marissa a.
reviews.description: I've done two tours so far, both with Laura. Had a friend in town to visit a few weeks ago and we did the Downtown tour, then returned yesterday with my sister for the East Side Art tour. I have to be honest and say that I didn't anticipate enjoying the art tour (art isn't usually my thing), but it was super fun and informative. Both tours were great and completely worth the time and money. Love the idea that you pay what you can afford in order to bring tours to people who wouldn't otherwise be able to participate. I definitely plan on making my way back to take the other tours!

reviews.author: Carrie B.
reviews.description: We did the East Austin brewery tour with Korie yesterday and it was amazing! Our group was made up of about 12 people from 5 different countries. Korie was informative and friendly and helped with suggestions of places to go after the tour. Now I want to sign up for more of the Tipster tours so that I can learn more about the city I've lived in for 20 years!! So whether you're an Austin native or just visiting, I'd suggest making time to tour the city with Tipster.

reviews.author: Bill T.
reviews.description: Austin music tour was great! Lots of fun and informative. Tour guide Willy was knowledgeable 'and s lot of fun. I would highly recommend this tour to anyone.

reviews.author: Lindsey S.
reviews.description: We had such a great time on this tour!  We did the Austin Music Tour and had a nice time with our guide Laura!  She took us to some cool places and it was fun to learn what the venues once were and how they came to be what they are today.  My boyfriend wrote down some places and we visited them later that night.  Walking tours are such a great way to explore a new city and I love the idea of tipsters- pay at then end what you think the tour is worth.  I also feel that Laura took the time to create a great tour and was very passionate about her Austin music!

reviews.author: Cody D.
reviews.description: Would definitely recommend! We did the Downtown Tour and our tour guide Joey was entertaining and new his Texas history. He provided a lot of  recommendations for the rest of our stay. No pressure to tip a certain amount...just pay whatever you can.

reviews.author: Jd C.
reviews.description: I had a great time on the east side beer tour. Even as a life long Austinite Kelly taught me a lot about the local beers and East Austin. Loved it, the beer flowed like wine and beautiful women instinctively flock like the salmon of Capistrano. Great work!

reviews.author: Shari F.
reviews.description: Great little place! Good conversation, good drinks, and great prices too. I look forward to visiting again. Thanks!

reviews.author: T. M.
reviews.description: We went for a "comedy" event and beers. 3 beers to choose from and we weren't impressed.  The comedian they brought in tried to pass off self- loathing, sexually disgusting monolog as comedic humor. Someone please tell him he's not funny in the slightest. The staff are not at all personable. This place doesn't even rise to the dive bar level.  Pop a Natural Light at home and you'll have a better time.

reviews.author: Charles M.
reviews.description: Great local distillery. Enjoyable spirits and a great atmosphere with even better people. Do yourself a favor and check them out!!

reviews.author: Jack G.
reviews.description: I've been going to this awesome little distillery for years. Great staff. Great outdoor and indoor space to just chill. My only issue is their recent partnership with Forrest Rogness to brew beer. Not only has he failed in the past, he is a disgusting human being.   Come for the spirits, cocktails, and atmosphere. Avoid the beer.   Love this place!!!!!

reviews.author: Mike D.
reviews.description: Driving up we questioned going in but we're happy we did. Excellent drinks and very friendly staff.   We got to sample a silver rum, pecan street rum and whisky: all were delicious.   Not much to say about this place as we were only a guest of theirs for 30 minutes, didn't feel like a place we could spend a afternoon.  Worth checking out if in the area but wouldn't drive an hour to get there.   5 stars on the quality of the drinks and friendly staff, loosing one star for the man cave feel. We would go back if in the area.

reviews.author: James L.
reviews.description: Spirit of Texas Distillery in Pflugerville, Tx My wife had a "Bold Fashioned" 2 star out of 5 It needs something creamy or sweet to bring it together. It completely burries the whiskey. However, the coffee flavor is out of nowhere and sticks out like a soar thumb.  I had the Spirit of Texas Pfluger Single Malt Whiskey  3 star out of 5 stars Had it neat, they don't serve it in a  Glencairn so if you're a noser, bring your own. It's a much better mixer whiskey than it is neat in my opinion. However, I did get about a 3oz pour so... Booya! (The picture is after I drank about 3/4's of it, lol)  Also tried their "famous" Pecan street rum, not a big fan of rum but this was actually decent. Given the choice I wouldn't buy it for myself but I would drink it if offered.  The distillery itself was tiny with not many places to sit. Even their tasting room was mostly a few couches with only a few tables. With that said, it was quite cute and had quazi sports bar vibe.   The staff was friendly and very happy to let us sample and make suggestions based on our tastes.   Overall, I'd come back.

reviews.author: Linda C.
reviews.description: Found this gem online and made a day trip. the distillery has limited hours, but are very accommodating to meet you for a sale. Michael was very helpful and informative on the phone, as well as at the distillery. Bought the Pecan Rum and Single Malt Whiskey. The rum was made into a American Dreamsicle, a recipe on the website with additional tips from Michael onsite. Excellent. Looking forward to enjoying the whiskey. Great service, great product

reviews.author: Niki K.
reviews.description: Honestly, I'm disappointed in this place. My hubs and I went for the first time here to see a comedy tour which the distillery hosted. The place itself is very small and decent enough- definitely no frills of any kind. They were hosting the comedy tour which was being held outside in their backyard space but they didn't have any of the tables and chairs set up for the patrons. Ppl were grabbing the picnic tables and moving them over to the stage...like shouldn't mngmt have done that ahead of time?? As far as their whiskey and rum, we did not care for it at all. After the reviews, I guess I just expected more. We kept trying it in different types of drinks and it just tasted like cheap stuff. Not to mention their prices! We had exactly 6 mixed drinks. Our tab was $70 before tip. That's $11.50 a drink! Y'all, this place is backwoods Pfluggerville not the dang Domain! I pay $11-$13 for my drinks at the Domain. So, $11.50 for this place was ridiculous. We will definitely not be back. And if you see an advertisement for the comedy tour- skip it. The first comedian was not very good (he had a whole table walk out and leave during his performance. Ouch.), the 2nd was decent but not in any way worth a $70 bar tab.

reviews.author: Mary B.
reviews.description: Wanted to try something new yesterday and decided to give this place a shot. We drove up to a small manufactured building and the end of a street  with some questionable establishments nearby.  Just inside of the building is a simple bar and small seating area. The employees are friendly and offer us tastings. We try each of their three offerings: silver rum, Pecan Street Rum, and their whiskey. I can't say I have discerning taste when it comes to rum or whiskey but I enjoyed them.  We ordered three cocktails from their menu (drinks are $6 each or 3 for $15) and took them to their back seating area. It was very no frills and reminiscent of a garage or basement man cave, with old leather sofas and a dart board. The drinks were all really tasty and could definitely be dangerous. We saw that they included generous pours for the liquor yet we could barely taste the alcohol.  We only remained at the distillery for about a half hour because there wasn't much else to do there. No food and no outdoor seating.  Not a bad place to go if you want to grab a couple of drinks and patronize a local distillery but if they'd like to keep customers there longer, the owners will have to invest in helping create more of an experience.

reviews.author: Gage R.
reviews.description: The employees are very friendly and fun to chat with. The liquor is excellent. The cocktails are creative and delicious. The lounge area is relaxing and comfy. On top of all that, the prices are surprisingly chill.  If you live in Pflugerville and enjoy alcohol, this is a place you need to visit.

reviews.author: Troy W.
reviews.description: A cool small business that just started to slang beers in addition to signature cocktails, Best whiskey in Texas (not my opinion, but fact). I heard a woman say that the drink she ordered NEEDS to be advertised as the cure for the common cold. Huge outdoor venue with a stage. Super friendly staff.

reviews.author: Christopher W.
reviews.description: My girlfriend tried to surprise me for my birthday weekend by taking me to your location in which she double checked your hours on yelp prior to arriving. When we were walking up the steps we noticed that there was an open sign lite up and when we walked in the bar tender said they have to close for an hour because he is the only one there and needs to help the band setup..... sounds like poor planning on the managements side. He said someone keeps changing their hours on Yelp but not sure about that hmm. Anyways he invited us back to see the show at 7 as they open back up for that, but was looking to have a drink and not be drowned out by a loud band. Maybe we will try your place again some time .....

reviews.author: Derek S.
reviews.description: My rating only speaks to the liquor itself. My in-laws went in and were raving of their distillery experience when they walked into my house. My wife's uncle dropped a bottle of single-malt whiskey on my counter and I decided to pour a neat glass after I poured 3 others for my guests. I really let this whiskey sit on the back of my tongue and savored the flavor. This is hands down the best whiskey I have ever had. I am more of a blended whiskey guy but the sweetness of this whiskey is absolutely perfect. I have my mixing whiskey, but this is definitely my sipping whiskey. There is definitely a strong vanilla taste going on with chocolate, but finishes hard with a good wood. Since having it, I am trying to find a way to get in there and pay my respects, but his review will have to do for now.

reviews.author: Casey M.
reviews.description: Great rum and whiskey! The whiskey is very complex (especially for only having aged for 2 years!) and I'm excited for the launch of their 4 year whiskey later this month! The rums are fantastic and unexpectedly smooth. Much love for this place and their drinks!

reviews.author: Amber E.
reviews.description: Awesome local hang out spot.  Amazing drinks and rotating food options (catering and food trucks).  Brand new stage with live music.  Family friendly and pet friendly.

reviews.author: Melissa C.
reviews.description: This a very cool place with a cool vibe. My son, Mike Hershey, distills award-winning whiskey and rum there. He's also the bartender and he, along with the owner, are friendly and welcoming. They have Friday night events, often with food trucks. Check out their Facebook  page.

reviews.author: Kim S.
reviews.description: First time here. Cutie little place. Nice rims and whiskeys. Was here for an event....sounds like they do a few throughout the course of the year.

reviews.author: Jack S.
reviews.description: This is a great little distillery where some really great spirits like Pfluger Single Malt Whiskey, Pecan Street Rum, and Straight Silver Rum are fermented, distilled, aged and bottled.   There is a cocktail bar where the spirits produced are used to create awesome mixed drinks. Usually, there is a really relaxed atmosphere with a lounge area, darts, shuffleboard and various kinds of music. Food trucks come on Fridays and there are live bands in the outdoor venue a few times a month. Sometimes, the distillery hosts special events for the public and also for private groups. Spirit of Texas Distillery is pet and family friendly.

reviews.author: Melissa L.
reviews.description: Exceptional staff, knowledgeable and personable, committed to making everyone's experience awesome.

reviews.author: Lucy S.
reviews.description: Great atmosphere with friendly and knowledgeable staff, Spirit of Texas is a fun time! The food truck out front is also delicious! It's a great little distillery that packs a lot of flavor

reviews.author: Lee M.
reviews.description: If you look up the definition of 'hidden gem', you will see a picture of Crowded Barrell Whiskey and their Fang and Feather tasting room. Period.  What's the big deal you ask? Let me offer a few reasons to stop in:  - whiskey tasting flights of 4 for only $11   - also offering other gin or vodka mixed drinks  - great tasting room with some cool, historical architectural elements   - wonderful deck under the shady oaks to enjoy the quiet Hill Country ambiance  - for beer or wine lovers, they also offer those (and snacks) in an adjacent  building  So this is simply a great stop off the beaten path if you are headed out to the Hill Country or just want something different that is just down 1826.

reviews.author: Christina G.
reviews.description: This place is a hidden gem, tucked away in the hill country. This spot is funded and supported by crowdsourcing. Very cool concept. You'll more than likely have new products to sample every time you visit. There are flights and a great variety of coctails. Today, there were 5 whiskeys to pick from. Only outdoor seating. The scenic views are amazing. I recommend walking around and checking out the grounds.  Friendly service, great drinks and chill environment. I'll definitely be back.

reviews.author: Eleanor C.
reviews.description: A little piece of heaven off the beaten path. Definitely stop in for an Eleanor New Fashioned! It's the best twist off a classic you'll ever have. These people are awesome!

reviews.author: Chelsea R.
reviews.description: We had a stop here on our dripping springs tour. If you like whiskey, this is the place for you. The whiskey tour itself wasn't that impressive, but you do get to taste whiskey right out of the barrel which is really cool.

reviews.author: Kevin S.
reviews.description: Absolutely fantastic. Had a private tasting with Daniel and Emma. Got to meet Rex, Fancy Dan, John and Brianna. One of the best days I've had. The whiskey is a bit young, but pretty good.

reviews.author: Kate R.
reviews.description: I'm gluten free so could not do a whisky sample. My husband did and enjoyed enough to buy a bottle. If you're not into whisky, there's a trailer on the property that serves beer, wine and some mixed drinks, plus snacks! Great outdoorbtables, lights, etc. Pretty

reviews.author: Marzio O.
reviews.description: This is really for Fang and Feather since the Distillery was closed when I went.  The Eleanors do NOT disappoint! Nor did the Black Walnut Cocktail mixed by the affable and amiable Richard.  I figured to spend about an hour or so but instead closed the joint down! The bourbon is delicious and as a Magnificent Bastard it was a real trip to find my name on the Wall of Magnificence.  The grounds are lovely and well worth wandering. If you get the chance to stop in and sample the whiskey you will NOT be disappointed! If you are a Magnificent Bastard, it is so much fun to see where our favorite videos are shot.  Alas, I couldn't finagle my way into the Vault! ;)

reviews.author: David M.
reviews.description: This is, quite simply, and awesome little place, nestled in an awesome little spot, surrounded by beautiful country, and serving awesome whiskey.  I had seen the videos on YouTube, and I had some time before my flight out of Austin, so I drove up on a Friday, had a cigar while I waited for the place to open (they have seating for cigar smoking on the porches!), and then sampled some of their wares.  It's excellent, and I really can't say more than that.  Try the whiskey neat, or in a drink - everything we tried was wonderful.

reviews.author: Jeremiah D.
reviews.description: Amazing pilgrimage to drink magnificently! I was in town for a work trip and had to visit the physical location where two of my favorite YouTube channels are recorded. The whiskey was delicious, the tasting room/patio didn't disappoint, and Daniel even spent some time chatting. Still blown away by the experience.

reviews.author: Grant M.
reviews.description: Everything about these guys is first rate!  The tasting experience, the education, the environment and most importantly, the Whiskey!   I hear they make good cocktails too if that's your thing.

reviews.author: Kim M.
reviews.description: We spent an incredibly pleasant evening with co-owner Daniel, his wonderful wife Katie, bartender Emma and the wider team at Crowded Barrel this week. Delicious whiskies and cocktails, outstanding property which was both beautiful and comfortable. If you're able to make the trip you'll have a terrific time, and if you're a magnificent bastard you'll have the time of your life!

reviews.author: Brent M.
reviews.description: We had a fantastic afternoon at crowded barrel. The bourbon is delicious and the cocktails are really good too. The property and the deck are beautiful with lots of seating. My favorite thing was the people though. So welcoming and friendly. Definitely check it out if you're a whiskey fan!

reviews.author: Jenny P.
reviews.description: Went there for a wedding was a very beautiful location, staff was great! We are from California and will definitely come back next time we are here in Austin!

reviews.author: R L.
reviews.description: Being a MB, it's not hard to imagine that I love this place and the people who make it happen. If anyone is curious about what joining the tribe looks like, check out the Whisky Vault and Whisky Tribe...it's a great group of people who love learning about and enjoying whiskey. Join us!  Crowded Barrel is nestled in the beautiful Hill Country of TX and we enjoy sitting on the deck and tasting what's up for the day. If you are curious and want to learn more about whiskey, you will enjoy this adventure.

reviews.author: K. B.
reviews.description: Great place off the beaten path located at the Wizard Academy.   Wonderful tree covered wood deck and gear drinks.

reviews.author: Charles G.
reviews.description: Found this jewel in the hill country Sunday and the place and patio are awesome!  The views are amazing and the bourbon was smooth.

reviews.author: Jon C.
reviews.description: First! Big fan of the whiskey vault. If I make down to the Austin area, I'll drop in for sure.

reviews.author: Marissa F.
reviews.description: Such a great tour from Sophie! Wonderful experience, learned so so much. Thank you!!!

reviews.author: Amy D.
reviews.description: The South Austin distillery and modern tasting room has a fantastic bar program serving phenomenal cocktails, offers tours, has beautiful patio seating and delicious food by Char.atx.  We visited when they first opened and were in awe of the stunning tasting room, lush green views, and one of my favorite parts is the tour to include a look inside their rickhouse. They are currently aging straight bourbon whiskey in 2020 with a projected release time of 2023. They are currently offering enticing cocktails made unaged new-make whiskey, along with craft gin, rum, and agave spirits distilled in-house.  Not only does this craft distillery provide a welcoming new space but they are also all about transparency and sustainability. Expect live music, events, exclusive events for members and more!

reviews.author: Amrita J.
reviews.description: What a gem of a place! I go down the street to Meanwhile all the time, but had no idea this place even existed.  Fierce Whiskers excited me as a whiskey fan, but I do like that they have options with rum, agave, gin and other spirits.   There is definitely a lot of potential for this space, it is so cute, however they've only been open for 6 months, so they still have room to grow, they don't have much seating outside, and it would be nice to have some music, or yard games, or something to do as you're enjoying a craft cocktail. Hence the lack of star to only 4 stars.   I had the Gold Rush for my drink, a whiskey, honey, lemon concoction.   That being said, I was here for a happy hour with an organization I am in, and we had a great time. We spread out in the lawn area and everyone had a great time.   They also have a delicious food truck on site: Char ATX.  More on that in my next review where I'll be talking about the food I got there.   Definitely a cute date spot, catching up with friends, but wouldn't say it's great for families or a large group really. I hope that they continue to add on to the space and grow to utilize the space more. I'll be back for sure.

reviews.author: JESSIE C.
reviews.description: I'm a fan! Went with some friends on a Sunday and we fell in love. The drink selection needs a little improvement but they are willing to tweak it to your satisfaction which we loved.  The food truck was very tasty they had a Oyster truck as well we didn't taste that but saw many people enjoying.  The land is beautiful with ample space to go with friends or a date or by yourself it's a chill ambience just like a whiskey distillery should be.  Deff going back!

reviews.author: Mark J.
reviews.description: Great young distillery. I cannot wait until their liquors have matured and are available for mass consumption. Their rye and gin were amazing, even as young as they are. The distillery and tasting room are very nice and a great place to have a drink with some friends. I see good things in their future.

reviews.author: Britney G.
reviews.description: Really cute spot! I hope to come back when they are doing tours. The facility is gorgeous, very trendy and welcoming. They have a lot of seats inside and outside and have food trucks on site if you are hungry. I liked their expansive menu of different and fun cocktails, that are also really delicious. The only thing is that you pay for not a lot of drink...but that's ok. Enjoy your company!  I hope they get more staff and maybe some waiters, because their can be a log jam at the bar with a line waiting on the bartenders to make these tedious drinks and it can take a long time.

reviews.author: Jodi G.
reviews.description: Wow!  A rickhouse right in Austin!  Sophie was a stellar tour guide.  David mixes fantastic drinks. Going to be a challenge to wait for 2023 release of their Whiskey.

reviews.author: Christine Y.
reviews.description: I'm in love with Fierce Whiskers! The main interior tasting room and bar area is gorgeous with deep tones of dark blues, leather and wood textures, and moody lighting. The large glass doors open up to a spacious outdoor seating area. The drink menu is fairly priced with cocktails that allow you to taste their very own whiskey, gin, and rum. If you prefer straight whiskey, they have flights/tasting samplers you can ask about.  I loved the food truck parked in their lawn (Char ATX) with delicious yakitori (Japanese meat on skewers).  They have tours of their facilities which sound really interesting. I think those tours are about $15/person (please verify with Fierce Whiskers for most up-to-date pricing).  Good-sized parking lot  This place is a hidden gem. Drive past Meanwhile and head straight to Fierce Whiskers. ;-)

reviews.author: Joanna S.
reviews.description: Super excited about what's going on here and what's to come! We visited while in ATX for our anniversary. Sophie gave us an incredible tour of the distillery. She was excellent and we learned a lot! The interior of the main tasting room is so beautiful and well thought-out with details we learned from the tour. The drinks were superbly made and delicious. Definitely will be back when visiting in the future :)

reviews.author: Desiree G.
reviews.description: I'm hesitant to leave a review because I don't want to lose the peaceful ambiance of this spot! Such a relaxing location with a great outdoor area. The cocktails are beautiful here. There was a Japanese food truck on-site that smelt amazing, even though I was already full coming in. Will be returning with my pups next time!

reviews.author: Ashley C.
reviews.description: Came here for a distillery tour and stayed to enjoy the taproom. The tour is $15 and includes a tasting. Fair warning their whiskey is new aged and won't be ready to be bottled for sale for another 2+ years. This made the tasting a littleeeee rough, but I learned a lot about whiskey so it was worth it. The tasting room is really nice and they have a great cocktail list - standard and seasonal. They host events regularly and there is a food truck on site.

reviews.author: David H.
reviews.description: Great new location, very informative staff. If you're looking for a nice quieter place to sit and try some new spirits, this is the place. I'd hurry, I don't think this place will be quiet much longer.

reviews.author: Ana B.
reviews.description: This place is really awesome. The atmosphere is very airy and relaxed. The food truck is delicious. Best part the whiskey! The drinks we had were perfect. They make their own cinnamon whiskey which is a way above fireball. Plus the staff is great. Super knowledgeable and friendly. Miles was our bartender and helped us pick the best drinks for what we were in the mood for. Fire in the sky and an old fashion.  Definitely going back!

reviews.author: J S.
reviews.description: The line is long, the menus are scarce, you make a line where ever you feel like it. I love a craft cocktail but it's basically chaos and wherever you can push in for a drink you should try. If you wait politely you will wait forever

reviews.author: Jason B.
reviews.description: Had such a great time on the tour today! It was fantastic. Really cool science and technology. The drinks are fun and it was a great time with my friends.

reviews.author: Heeteak C.
reviews.description: This is the first time this place. Cool tour and awesome bar. Still getting thing ready for full on bourbon sell but theyvhave a lot of great drinks. Must come by and experience it.

reviews.author: Matthew N.
reviews.description: Such a cool local Austin spot. Disappointed I have to wait 3 -4 more years to buy a bottle. If you are looking for something different to do go check it out!

reviews.author: Brandon H.
reviews.description: Had a great tour and great drinks here! Space is great for picnics and bringing your dog!

reviews.author: Madison R.
reviews.description: We really enjoyed our tour today!  Learned a lot about whiskey and the process that goes into the aging and distilling.  Would recommend

reviews.author: Amanda S.
reviews.description: First time visiting here and it was great. The atmosphere, drinks and staff. Sophie was supper informative and helpful. She has all kinds of information about the whiskey and membership. The bartender Jeremiah makes the cocktails beautifully. The experience I had with Sophie and Jeremiah is definitely a reason I will be coming became back here.  For food they have the food truck Char ATX that serve snack size portion of delicious food.

reviews.author: Kristoffer K.
reviews.description: From pick up, to drop off the experience was phenomenal! Spacious, clean, and comfortable. An unplanned stop to provide a bathroom break before arriving at our destination was provided upon our request and was greatly appreciated. We ended up losing one of our group and our Driver allowed us to wait and look for them. Additionally, a phone was lost in the furniture and again our Driver provided concern, patience, and assistance in order to retrieve the seemingly stuck device. I have now ridden with this service three times and every time has been beyond excellent.

reviews.author: Julia F.
reviews.description: We used ThunderDome over this past Memorial Day Weekend and had a fantastic experience. Daniel was incredible to work with. He was quick to provide a quote and answer any questions leading up to our trip, and was early to pick us up. 38 of us fit comfortably in the 40 person bus along with all of our belongings. The bus was clean, speakers were great, and Daniel truly went above and beyond for our group. We'll definitely be using ThunderDome for all of our future trips!

reviews.author: Traci S.
reviews.description: Daniel was awesome!  Right from the start he was quick to respond with a quote, details, etc.  Easy to work with and has the little extras like coolers, ice, waters, etc. that went above and beyond.  He was prompt, professional, a safe driver, accommodating and just an overall solid guy.  Would highly recommend for a group large or small!

reviews.author: Kristie L.
reviews.description: AMAZINGGGGG SERVICE! We looked into several party buses around the Austin area and compared quotes. Daniel beat everyone's price AND provided ice and cups when that didn't even cross our minds! THANK YOU THUNDERDOME SO MUCH FROM CAPITOL CHEVY! Definitely using your services in the future! The whole process was smooth, and overall satisfying!

reviews.author: Caitlyn L.
