The grapes have matured immensely since 2008 and glad to finally enjoy some good Texas wines.   Can't recommend this company any lower than *****!  Thank you Discovery Wine Tours for a memorable afternoon.

reviews.author: Carlin L.
reviews.description: Used Discover Texas Wine Tours for a 30th birthday. John, our driver, was wonderful. He called me a couple of days before to introduce himself and to confirm the pickup details. He also called me the day of and was on time. He made sure we were settled at each location and made it a great experience. Felt very safe - John wore a mask the whole time. Also, Kathie helped plan the itinerary. She's familiar with the wineries and distilleries in the area, and was very friendly. Couldn't recommend them more!

reviews.author: Lori M.
reviews.description: A.wonderdul time, from reservation phone call to driving away from the limo.once the 6.5 hour tour ended.  John was our driver...we knew from the get-go we were in good hands.  Discover Wine chose the wineries for us and all were unique, fun and obviously tasty (as was the restaurant they selected).  We'll be back!

reviews.author: Lynlee S.
reviews.description: Our driver John was amazing!!! Very sweet and professional. Gave excellent service and ensured my group of 2 had a great time at each location we choose. Booking with the owner Kathy was easy and she ensured the whole private tour experience was exactly what we wanted. Could not have had a better time!!! John the drive wore a mask the whole time and gave us a detailed tour of town while he drove! Excellent and safe driver. Perfect perfect perfect! Thank you!! If you want an intimate experience with lots of sights and great food and drink, chose this company to take you!!!!!

reviews.author: Lindsey H.
reviews.description: I was so impressed with this tour the first time we booked that I had to book it for another party! Well, this time it wasn't as impressive. I don't know if the business has just gotten bigger than the owners can handle but communication was subpar. It took several calls and emails to get answers sometimes.   At our first tour, Kathie took tons of photos and would pose us at the wineries. This tour, we had to prompt her. It was a cloudy day so not the best for outdoor pics but I was disappointed we took most of them ourselves or had to ask her to take the pictures.   Our tour was April 11, it is now almost 2 mths later I haven't received the few pictures we took. I emailed twice and have finally heard back that the SD is apparently not working. I'm not sure why I had to email to find this out, seems like this info should have been divulged as soon as the problem presented itself.   I hate to downgrade the star review but my second time with this company just wasn't as epic as the initial tour I took with them. The wineries all seem to love this company though.

reviews.author: Jessica C.
reviews.description: I would recommend you take your money elsewhere. The owner Cathy is the rudest person to deal with  and doesn't know manners or customer service. She is unprofessional and just straight out rude. Highly suggest on another place to go to.

reviews.author: Barbara H.
reviews.description: We had a small group of three, but did it right with a Discover Texas Wine Tour limousine. DTWT was very accommodating, scheduled the wineries we wanted to see, ordered the lunches, and then confirmed our selections a couple of days prior to our tour. At the last minute after visiting with a couple in our third stop, we changed our fourth stop to a different winery. Jason (our driver) was happy to accomodate us. My only regret is that we didn't choose a few wineries a little further out of town, so we could spend more time in the limo listening to our Willie Nelson songs. Jason was awesome, and I highly recommend this tour.

reviews.author: Vicki C.
reviews.description: We started researching half-day wine tours for my BFF's bachelorette party several months in advance and chose this company because of its good reviews and cancellation policy (full refund up to 7 days in advance).   First, the bad news. The booking process is way more arduous than it should be. My initial discussion about the tour plans happened over the phone, so I asked for a written, e-mail confirmation of what we had discussed - specifically how the deposit and refund policies work. It took me more than three weeks to get that first e-mail confirmation of our booking and deposit payment. I then went back and forth, back and forth, back and forth with the company, hammering out the details, like setting a pickup location and our choices for the winery stops. Many times, three weeks would pass and I'd have to make multiple attempts before I would get a response to my e-mails. Sometimes, the responses would be incomplete and we'd repeat the process of trying to get information confirmed. Seriously a pain for an experience that costs $129 per person.   Now, the good news. The online payment portal for each attendee was a breeze to use and eliminated the need to handle money all through one person. As for the actual tour itself, we couldn't have asked for a better experience. Our driver, Bobby, was on time and wonderful on the day of the tour. He was funny and polite and had good knowledge of the area. Also, very importantly, he was a good and safe driver! The Mercedes bus we took was very clean and spacious, and they provided water, cups and napkins. They also allowed us to bring our own food onto the bus. The three wineries we visited, Driftwood Estate, Duchman and Fall Creek, were all accommodating and fun. The views were lovely and we never felt rushed and made it back on time. It was raining when we got back to our car, and Bobby was so nice and helped us get our stuff back into our car in the pouring rain.   All in all, despite a wonderful wine tour, I'm not sure I would recommend this company, only because I spent way too much time hounding them throughout the booking process. While the wine was excellent, I NEEDED to drink after dealing with their horrible communication. Discover Texas Wines should strongly consider re-evaluating their communication practices and hire more people to keep up with the demand for their service. It's the only way they will stay competitive in the long-run!

reviews.author: Tara K.
reviews.description: We had an excellent experience with Discover Texas Wine. Kathie was wonderful to coordinate with, and took care of all our tour requests. Howard was a great driver and had fun music. Lunches were very tasty. Would definitely recommend for any bachelorette party.

reviews.author: Abby S.
reviews.description: We had the BEST time today on a wine tour for a bachelorette!! "Magic Mike" was the best driver and so much fun. Very reasonable price for the amount of time we spent, and an awesome car. Thank you!!!

reviews.author: Katie B.
reviews.description: We booked a wine tour to Dripping Springs for my bachelorette party. It was so great! Our driver, Roy, is what made it all so wonderful! I would highly recommend him!! He took lots of photos for us and kept us cool with cups of water.  We went to Driftwood Estate (beautiful views and grounds), Duchman family winery (beautiful Tuscan architecture), and Driftwood (had the best wines!). We did a half day and it was the perfect amount of time.   Couldn't have been any better! Thanks Roy!!!

reviews.author: Cyn H.
reviews.description: Had a great time on my stretch limo wine tour.  Hawk's Shadow was the favorite of the wineries we visited.  Bobby was our driver. Polite and helpful and knew to not be too chatty. Made our wine tour effortless and fun. An event to remember!

reviews.author: Carly J.
reviews.description: Wonderful private winery tour with Amanda.  So much fun!  Amanda was awesome and knowledgeable.  We had a great time!

reviews.author: Calley N.
reviews.description: We used this company for  a bachelorette weekend the company was extremely hard to work with. Communication with the company was extremely difficult. However, Mike (magic mike) completely turned a ruined weekend around. He was so nice and fun he sang to us and played guitar. I have never met a more generous and kind person. It might take you sending 3 emails to get responses from the company but definitely use Mike for your tour!

reviews.author: Kate E.
reviews.description: First off our driver, Roy, was the absolute best! He picked us up on time, was incredibly friendly, and funny even though we were a bachelorette party and knowing the possibility of it getting crazy with 7 girls. Seriously, request Roy. He made the trip a blast. There was cold water for us in the bus. Oh did I mention it's a Mercedes bus? Super nice! An AUX cable was available to play our own music too. The selection of wineries was amazing, perfect mixture between red and whites/dry and sweet, so every one of us could have something tasty. The drive was beautiful and not too far out of Austin. Overall, I am very impressed with this tour and the wonderful employees. Would definitely go again.

reviews.author: Jessica J.
reviews.description: I booked a Discover Texas Wine Tour last weekend for a Bachelorette Party. It was amazing! We had such a great time despite the somewhat unpleasant weather. Noel was so great and answered any questions we had before the tour. He was so accommodating and recommended some great wineries to us! I would definitely book with them again and recommend them to friends!!

reviews.author: Becca R.
reviews.description: Held an event with Discover Texas Wine Tour for my business and wanted to thank them again for a wonderful day. We booked this as part of a fundraiser/auction and it was such a success. The bus was wonderful, the driver was great and everything was timed perfectly. Highly recommend Discover Texas Wine Tours!

reviews.author: Dominique S.
reviews.description: Absolutely do not recommend using this company. I made the reservation back in January, gave my card for deposit and was told I'd be emailed a link for everyone to pay. Over the next two months I called and emailed asking about the link so my friends could pay their part and I was repeatedly told they were having issues. Okay fine, no big deal- I also emailed again saying we can just pay the day of if the link wasnt working and never received a response. The day before our tour, as I was driving from Dallas to Fredericksburg I get a call from Some guy at the company and he seemed very annoyed with me saying no one had paid yet. Um.. I'm sorry I didn't realize you finally sent it after months of my asking. (He had sent it the day before calling me to tell me no one had paid) The vehicle I requested was not the one that showed up. The driver Julia was late bc she did not write the address down correctly. We also had 3 girls cancel last minute, so we were down to 5 instead of 8. Considering there minimum is 5 I wasn't expecting that to be a problem but Julia felt the need to bring it up multiple Times as if it caused some inconvenience for her. Rude people, horrible communication.

reviews.author: Kyle D.
reviews.description: We had a great time on our full day tour! None of our group had been to the Texas wine trail, and our Driver Roy was absolutely spot on picking our 4 stops. Roy was a true gentleman and really took good care of our group all day long, making this a truly great experience. Noel was very helpful in booking us, even with a last minute addition to our party. I will be using these guys again in the future, and would recommend anyone who is looking for a first time trip to do the same.

reviews.author: Holly T.
reviews.description: What a fantastic time! Organizing a full day wine tour for 50 people in the Texas Hill Country may not sound like an easy task, but Noel at Discover Texas Wine Tours made it smooth and most importantly, unforgettable. His main goal is to make sure everyone is comfortable and has a good time! Most companies were not able to host a group this size, but Noel made it happen. He made sure our bus was the best he could find, worked to have a lunch catered for us at one of the stops, set up private tastings with many of the wineries to accommodate a group our size, even stopped to let one of the guys who didn't drink wine buy some beer. I can't say enough good things about Noel and how hard he worked for our group. I highly recommend him and look forward to another tour with him soon!!

reviews.author: Lee M.
reviews.description: I must say that Hy Rum has arrived.....and in a really BIG way. How so? Well, let me tell you. 1.) Their new set up on Frog Pond Lane just of Hwy 290 is not only convenient to the ATX visit, but it will become a frequent destination. 2.) Indoor seating - both at the Tiki bar, but the innumerable comfy seating areas look nice - and I can't wait to try them all! They are all in on the Tiki motif, as they really transformed this former pool supply facility into something special. Outdoor seating: Lots. Seating with a view of the Hill Country, under the twinkling lights, in the yard - or even around a game of corn hole. They have something for everybody, including your well-behaved dog. 3.) Drinks: Hmmm...where to start. Their seasonal drink menu when we visited in January 2022 was fantastic. The first thing you notice if you sit at the bar is that the bartenders are mixing and muddling with the using freshest, usually made-in-house, all natural ingredients whenever possible. The Hot Buttered Rum drink is amazing. It will have you googling 'recipes' before you get home. Warm, spicy, buttery, and with a whipped topping topped with a hint of rum flavor (yes, they whip rum into their topping). It was our favorite on this sunny, but blustery day. Another winner was their 'Knotty Hot Chocolate' with Mexican chocolate and cinnamon. On their 'regular' menu, I tried their Old Fashioned (in which you can choose Dark or Spiced Rum) and I can tell you it was spot on. 4.) People. We were promptly greeted and seated by Master Distiller James Davidson who also told us their story and even took time to visit with us a couple of more times. He was super friendly and funny. 5.) The Booze. We tasted several with our favorite being the Spiced, but their rum family offers Dark, White, Spiced, and several flavors: Coconut, Orange, Pineapple, Extra Rich and Spicy ('the Chupacabra' which has espresso, chocolate and cinnamon infused) and even a Scottish style gin (aka Jinn) 6.) Speaking of special, check this out: Hye Rum now has a weekly event calendar with something for everybody: Brunch and Learn, Family Night, Suppler Club, Cocktail classes, and even Mardi Gras. In addition, you can book a facility tour that includes a tasting flight for only $20, which we will definitely be doing next. Soon, they will add an 'Event Room' as well just to cover all their bases. All that said, Hye Rum is making all the right moves and seems to have hit the big time. All I ask is to save us 2 seats because this place may be hard to get into - and we will be back!

reviews.author: Connie C.
reviews.description: I'm so happy that Hye Rum moved right into my backyard here in Dripping Springs! Love their tiki themed tasting room and cocktails - it made me feel like I was on a tropical vacation.   I'm a big fan of coconut rum so I ordered the Cocojito and it was so good. My husband loved their pia colada and our friend had a rum flight and ended up buying two bottles their dark rum.  James, their master distiller and cofounder, was there on a Saturday and took care of us the entire time. It was so nice to see how passionate he is about his craft and the distillery, and making sure that all their patrons feel welcomed.   Looking forward to making this one of my regular spots!

reviews.author: Elizabeth B.
reviews.description: I came here at a recommendation of a friend and absolutely love the spiced rum. If you are a gingerbread fanatic, definitely worth a visit. Followed by the coconut if you loved Malibu in college. Sophisticated, but sweet rum

reviews.author: Koltin K.
reviews.description: Owner and staff are all incredibly Knowledgeable and welcoming! Wide arrange of flavors through their spirits that will satisfy any palate. Will be coming back. Join their rum club!

reviews.author: Laurie H.
reviews.description: Austin Wine Tours made my booking reservation easy and I'm a difficult customer. They worked with me on the wineries and Distillery the group chose to ensure that the time worked within our tour, so everyone could enjoy the tasting and lunch without feeling rushed. Austin Wine Tours also provided us with a great driver. I have to say our driver Charlie was awesome, he called before arriving, he was prompt and ensured we had everything before leaving the pickup spot. Charlie made our tour very comfortable, the ride to and from the wineries and Distillery was amazing. Charlie ensured that we were taken care of. We will definitely be booking another tour with you folks and requesting Charlie.   Thank you again,  Laurie

reviews.author: Carli A.
reviews.description: 10/10 would recommend Austin Wine Tours! First off, booking and choosing our agenda was super easy and they even let me adjust the headcount when that changed. On the day of, I got a heads-up call to confirm the time and pickup location. We had a larger, rowdy group of gals on a bachelorette trip and our driver Song took SUCH good care of us! She immediately asked us what music we wanted to crank and encouraged all the "wooing" from the back of the van. She also offered to take pictures of us, scouted out the best locations for group photos and even took TONS of candid pics of us while we enjoyed the winery and distillery we went to. She helped with all of the logistics of checking in at each stop and making sure we were taken care of. She also let us make a pee stop on the way home...and overall she was just SUPER nice and was basically hyping us up the entire day, making sure the bride felt special and making sure we all had fun. By the end of the day we all felt like she was part of the crew. Thank you again Song!!

reviews.author: Laura R.
reviews.description: I booked a wine tour for my sisters bachelorette and we had such a great time! The wineries were beautiful and we were able to schedule a stop at the salt lick for our private tour. Kyle was the best tour guide ever!! He was very personable, took numerous pictures for us at each winery and made sure we were having fun! I would def. recommend if you are looking at different companies to pick Austin Wine Tours (ZWay Tours) since I called 5 others and they were the most accommodating with what we wanted for a private tour and their price beat most of the other ones too!  Would def. book them again and request Kyle!

reviews.author: Rakeba S.
reviews.description: Omg! We loved our experience with Austin Wine Tours! Our tour guide Kyle was amazing and made sure we had a great time. Kyle was on time and made sure we arrived safely to both our locations. Overall our experience was amazing and we will definitely book again.

reviews.author: Devin H.
reviews.description: The review that I left in regards to the services booked through Austin Wine Tours was in no way false. I will stand firm by what was written.   I even received a call back in May while on a business trip from the shuttle service company asking if we would pay the overtime for Hugo because AWT had not paid them yet. We even tipped Hugo an additional amount for his extra time spent with us.   The response just posted (almost 4 months later) is also extremely unprofessional and misleading. We were promised a great time for a bachelorette party and were let down. Plain and simple. Those employed by AWT that we spoke with were rude as well. Secondly, I never said that AWT hosted prom events/transportation. I was told that the company that is usually utilized was completely full (by Brad) and that prom happened to be a priority and the school bus that was sent was all they could get us even though we were promised a party bus.   At the end of the day we were completely dissatisfied with the services offered by AWT. Calling a client a bridezilla (who in fact actually never spoke to any AWT employee), claiming your company has gotten PTSD from our group and falsely accusing our group to be racist by saying we told "blackie to leave" is unprofessional and disrespectful amongst other things said in response to our reviews. All of those involved would be happy to discuss this event again in a professional manner since you mentioned that we were offered a full refund when that in fact was not true. We were offered maybe $350 (I could be wrong on this amount since we haven't heard/spoken to anyone from AWT for several months) in return if we removed our reviews.  As a company you should take responsibility instead of blaming others for your mistakes that way you can fix the problem and do better for future patrons. Especially since there has been no money refunded at this point.

reviews.author: Christopher Jon M.
reviews.description: We had a great time this past weekend with Austin Wine Tours. I initially booked online and didn't know what venues to go to at first but they recommended the ones that we ended up going to even though it was completely up to us where we wanted to go which I liked. We decided after to tastings to go eat at Salt Lick BBQ and the food was amazing and hit the spot in between tastings. After that we went to our final tasting at Fall Creek which was right across the street and the service there was great. It made our bachelorette party very fun and we didn't have to worry about anything other than having a good time which I liked.

reviews.author: Julie B.
reviews.description: Austin Wine Tours is one of the best limo tours to see the wine country we have been on to date!  They were not only flexible with our dates and our last-minute reservation, they even upgraded our package with no additional charge!  We were celebrating four birthdays and  wanted a girls night out  where no one had to drive. The limo driver was prompt and worked with us and our pick up and drop off times.  When one of us left the charger in the limo he even offered to drop it off... We Are definitely looking forward to using them in the near future!

reviews.author: Kelli C.
reviews.description: Had the absolute best time on our Bachelorette party!! Hill Country was so much fun to see and the wine made it even more enjoyable. Sara was very helpful with planning the itinerary and gave us exact times so we could keep track along the way, and the vehicle was exactly as described and in excellent condition! Myron was an excellent driver. You should definitely plan with Austin Wine Tours! Amazing service!!!

reviews.author: Blythe H.
reviews.description: If I could give this company a negative star review, I would!!! Completely unprofessional and was hung up on!! They sent an incorrect party bus for a bachelorette party, contracted out at last minute to another company (who were amazing), sent us to Deep eddys where we were turned away!!! Brad would NOT let me speak and kept interrupting me. The professionalism of this company was simply awful. And they still have not refunded anything from this trip!!! Disgusted and I will never recommend this company to anyone. Spend the extra money and go elsewhere.

reviews.author: Linda T.
reviews.description: Booking our wine excursion was stress free the moment Sara answered the phone! Sara was very informative and laid everything out, giving us a doable timeline for the afternoon we wanted. The itinerary we received gave us a good idea of how long to spend at each venue. There were only 4 people in our group, so we were able to do a very flexible hourly option, with appointments at the wineries.  Since we had less than 5 passengers, our tastings weren't included (informed that going in) however, that did not deter our experience... it was awesome! Buying a bottle of wine at each venue was very affordable when we split the cost among us.  George, our driver, was professional and friendly; and the limo experience was awesome! You might want to bring snacks just in case someone gets a bit tipsy, but most wineries offer food of some kind. Thanks Austin Wine Tours, for making me look like a champ with my high maintenance friends... I'll be back!

reviews.author: Karen O.
reviews.description: After leaving the previous review, the company finally contacted me and issued a full refund.

reviews.author: Ansley C.
reviews.description: We had a group of 13 trying to get out to a few wine tastings to celebrate a birthday and I am so glad I reached out to David, the owner of Open Range Tours. He was quick to respond and helped me schedule a party bus big enough for all of us. David, our driver, showed up early and made sure we had everything we needed for the trip. He had a giant cooler with ice and waters that we were able to load up with seltzers. I booked our wineries ahead of time which made getting into the tastings a breeze. David made sure we got to each winery on time and went in ahead to ensure each winery was ready for us when we arrived. He even coordinated to have the band at one of the wineries sing Happy Birthday! David was absolutely fantastic, and we had a great time with him. We will definitely be booking with them again for our next trip. I highly recommend Open Range Tours to anyone visiting Fredericksburg!

reviews.author: Anjelah L.
reviews.description: My family and friends booked this tour for my birthday. We had 10 people in the bus and we couldn't have asked for a better experience. Our driver, David was AWESOME!! He had great recommendations and kept us (somewhat) on our schedule! He was a blast! Bus was super roomy and had everything we needed! We will be back and booking with open range again tours again!

reviews.author: J P.
reviews.description: What a great experience!  The 2 Davids were great. We booked this last minute due to the recent snow/ice storm and they were very flexible. We started at William Chris, headed to Pedernales and ended at Augusta Vin. The 15 passenger van was great for our group of 11. They offered water and took care of checking us in at each winery. David was a complete gentleman and carried all of our purchases and secured them in the van while we enjoyed our time tasting the different wines. He even dropped us off downtown so we would be on time for our dinner reservation.

reviews.author: Jennifer Y.
reviews.description: I had a driver cancel on me 3 days before my trip. David was so friendly and squeezed in my group through a cancellation he had. He was so nice and really helped us out!!

reviews.author: Lisa D.
reviews.description: David was extremely instrumental in getting a wine tour pulled together, despite many places being shut down (or car-to-go only) due to the latest covid orders. We enjoyed his friendly banter, nice and clean van, and all of the places we went. Will definitely book with David again.

reviews.author: Lauren C.
reviews.description: Absolutely gorgeous day out and about with our guide Mark-he even took us to see the bats after three totally different experiences tasting frozen sangria, fine local wines and tasty beer selection which took us back to Germany! Each location they chose for us was better than the next. Thank you so much for taking us out on a Bad Moms Tour

reviews.author: Tanya R.
reviews.description: You can't go wrong in chosing this company for your tour. David was our guide and he was fabulous. He was very helpful in picking out which vineyards to go to. He did everything possible to ensure we had a great time. Even helped me with getting the best cake ever for a surprise.  You will be very happy!! We will definitely be back! Thanks for everything!!

reviews.author: Lisa B.
reviews.description: Excellent company! Highly recommend! They were prompt and so accommodating for our party. Tour driver even went and picked up lunch for us while we were wine tasting. Don't hesitate to use them for your transportation needs!

reviews.author: Shannon Z.
reviews.description: Open Range tours was perfect for our bachelorette wine tour. David was professional and personable. He cared that we were safe and having fun. Once our tour, extended an extra hour, drew to an end, David even recommended transportation for our evening fun. Would definitely recommend Open Range tours and will contact them for future visits.

reviews.author: Keith H.
reviews.description: Open Range Tours is a great company. We've had the owner, David, several times, and we've never been disappointed. He cares about his clients, and goes out of the way to make sure their experience in the wine country is the best it can be. We've used him so much, that we will never use another company when we're in the region. You can't do any better than Open Range, trust me.

reviews.author: Nicole N.
reviews.description: "Double Pimp D" aka David was absolutely phenomenal.  We had a group of 13 in San Antonio go wine tasting in fberg for the day.  He picked us up from San Antonio, drove us up to Hill Country and around to 3 wineries.  As this was my first Texas wine tour, he did an AMAZING job of helping us select which wineries would be a good fit for the group.  As we had a decent amount of guys with us- he suggest Garrison Brother's Distillery which ended up being a HUGE hit!  He was extremely professional, courteous and just an absolute delight to spend the day with!  He also has a wicked funny sense of humor.  He was also very accommodating and ordered and picked up lunch for us so we could continue to enjoy beautiful Hill Country.  I would use him again in heartbeat and highly, highly recommend him to anyone wanting to enjoy Texas Hill Country!  Thanks David!

reviews.author: Amye B.
reviews.description: Do NOT recommend! We booked a tour for 8 people and everything was a mess from the beginning. We were told we would be upgraded to a 15 passenger bus. A 15 passenger VAN showed up with a dent in the side and ripped seats. We were told we could bring coolers. We were only able to fit 8 adults in the van with our two coolers- no way we could've had another person in the van. None of the wineries had been scheduled yet and the ONE we had specifically requested was not available. We had to scramble ourselves to find wineries, in which we were promised everything would be done ahead of time. The meat and cheese tray that was promised was a small tray that was bought during the tour at a convenient store to feed 2 people. Our driver was great, however the owner did not deliver what was promised and we were highly disappointed. There are plenty of companies to choose from, and I would NOT recommend Open Range.

reviews.author: B M.
reviews.description: David was very helpful in planning a last minute wine tour. He was attentive in making sure we had a great day! He picked places that were just right for what we wanted. Our driver, Lyn, made the day seamless and easy by being flexible and friendly. I would definitely use them again.

reviews.author: Mike D.
reviews.description: Used David for my wedding at the Lodge and Country Inn Cottages. They had great communication and made the wedding a breeze. Would absolutely recommend them to do a wedding again. Thanks David!

reviews.author: Dustin M.
reviews.description: David is the man! My wife and I had such a great experience. He took us all over wine country. He had great stories and knew all the great places to go. We will definitely be coming back.

reviews.author: Marge B.
reviews.description: I arranged a Girls' Getaway to Fredericksburg, so naturally I wanted to do a wine tour. I contacted several tour companies. D'Ann was extremely responsive and gave me several suggestions of where to go. Since I'm a wine club member at quite a few wineries in the Hill Country, I opted to do a custom tour and made my own reservations. Greg, the owner (and D'Ann's husband) arrived on time and drove us to 3 wineries where we were able to enjoy a nice, relaxing afternoon. Greg was so friendly, helpful and accommodating. I would highly recommend Open Range Tours...thanks, D'Ann and Greg!!!

reviews.author: Casey F.
reviews.description: D'ann went above and beyond for the tour for my sister's bachelorette party!  There were some general issues with scheduling and logistics that were my fault, but she very kindly fixed everything!  Our driver David was on time, helpful, and a lot of fun.  They know a lot about the wineries and have personal relationships with the owners/managers/tasting staff.  David also went above and beyond by making an extra stop for shopping/pie-indulging and by dropping us off at our dinner restaurant so we didn't have to walk from the visitor center where he picked us up.  Highly recommend!!!

reviews.author: Nicole D.
reviews.description: My winery tour with open range was excellent. D'anne took great care of my group. She texted me several times to keep me updated on the tour and even gave me her personal cell number so that I could reach her anytime. Our driver, Bill, was right on time. He was knowledgeable and very friendly. I highly recommend them for your next tour.

reviews.author: Holly P.
reviews.description: We went to Fredericksburg for a girls trip and wanted to spend a day at the distilleries and breweries. David was fantastic to work with planning everything out. I wouldn't have changed any of that part. But, once the day rolled around we were met with a hiccup. The driver, not David like I was anticipating after multiple conversations, arrived in a mustang for 5 of us. Obviously that wasn't going to work so I was offered by the driver only to cancel or reschedule. Our trip was planned around spending our day out and about so cancelling wasn't an option for us. After a phone call to David, we were assured our day wasn't ruined just a bit delayed. The driver left and showed back up with an SUV and away we went. The driver wasn't interactive and she didn't seem to even be having a good day... It happens I get it but come on. Anyway, we made the best of our day and enjoyed ourselves. When we were dropped off, I tried to pay but she said to get with David. No problem but I did have a problem with her then saying that she'd go ahead and take the gratuity and that the standard is 20%. I didn't even know what our total cost was to figure 20% but asking for the gratuity before I even paid for the day was in poor taste. We did go ahead and tip, and well mind you, because that's the kind of people we are. I ended up calling David and finishing out the transaction and once again, he was a pleasure to deal with. Overall, we'll use them again because I appreciated David that much. But, I'll definitely make sure we don't have the same driver. 5 stars for David but 4 stars overall for the above mentioned.

reviews.author: Mandy G.
reviews.description: If you're looking to visit some wineries in the outskirts of Austin, I recommend it with Arlen!   Arlen was sweet, knowledgable, and funny. He picked us up from our Airbnb and drove us 45 mins out and back, while we blasted some rachet songs to sing haha. He would check in on us during the winery to see if we needed anything or have any questions, and he would offer to help us take multiple pictures. He also got one of the wineries to allow us to explore their cellars!   On our last day in Austin, he drove by our airbnb to pick up someone else and honked at us as we waited for our uber. We were all so happy to see him again, as we all enjoyed our experience with him.   I recommend Texas Tipsy Tours with Arlen ;)

reviews.author: Brittany Z.
reviews.description: I have so many wonderful things to say about this company. I set-up an appointment online to schedule a private driver to Fredericksburg. Ashley called right on time. She was friendly and very informative.  She helped make the experience exactly what I was looking for. I wanted less sweet wines and a winery with food options. Arlen was our diver and was so knowledgeable and friendly. He picked us up right at the hotel in Austin. I felt the price for the experience is definitely worth it. If you were considering this experience, I highly recommend this company. They care and that is important.

reviews.author: Alli G.
reviews.description: Texas Tipsy Tours is simply the best of the best! Organized, thoughtful, fun, professional, and accommodating! They do all the heavy lifting with the friendliest spirit and let you and your group have the time of your life!  We had the BEST time on our tour and absolutely adore Arlen, our driver! He was the kindest, most considerate, thoughtful, responsible driver ever! He was so fun but also let us have our time to just be girls and we didn't have to open a single door, make a decision, or carry a single bag (if we didn't want to) the whole time we were with Arlen!  Also, the management team was incredible. Wei booked last minute and they were so accommodating and listened to our unique needs/wants for the tour! And we're so detailed in instructions. I have had bad experiences with wine/bus tours with other companies and I was SO impressed with the whole experience at Texas tipsy!

reviews.author: Rolanda H.
reviews.description: If your looking to visit wineries or distilleries in the  outskirts of Austin like Dripping Springs and the surrounding area I highly recommend Texas Tipsy Tours. They are organized and timely. If you're an out of towner like myself and decide to book accommodations in Austin they will pick you up from there and bring you back.   All of my future bookings I will definitely request Wade. He was very professional and personable, he made sure we were taken care of at each location on our tour. He also was more than happy to take our pictures along the way.

reviews.author: Ashley G.
reviews.description: We were on a girls trip and were lucky to have Arlen as our driver. He was exceptional, friendly and knowledgeable! He gave us great recommendations for places we were unsure about.

reviews.author: Karla J.
reviews.description: Debbie was an amazing host.  We did Winery, Brewery, Distillery on our recent trip to TX.  Such a fun experience.  Would do again in a heart-beat!

reviews.author: Stephanie T.
reviews.description: Y'all BOOK WITH THEM!!!!! I literally do not have one negative thing to say about this company. From the minute I called to book to the minute I said goodbye to our driver the day of the tour they were fantastic.   So when I called there actually weren't any times available. They worked with me to make sure they had a tour time and sprinter available for our group of 6. I had a million questions; they were patient and kind.   Our group was 6 but one of my friends asked if we could add an additional person. Reached out to TTT and they said sure no problem. Literally 3 HOURS LATER I got a call that another girl tested positive with covid and wouldn't be able to come with us obviously- they were so nice and made the switch back to 6. Very grateful for their exceptional customer service.   Day of our driver Bryant was early which was great! Got on the bus and let us have free range of the radio, answered any wine questions we had or any questions about Fredericksburg. He was a fantastic host. Always texted 15 minutes till our time at the winery was up and took as many pictures as we wanted. He was so sweet! He also made sure we were never thirsty or hungry. Which for a group of girls is very important- smart man! Haha   I've heard things about other companies having hidden fees and people getting charges after leaving Fredericksburg and we had none of that. Texas Tipsy Tours was very transparent with all of their pricing and they had no hidden fees.   Thank you TTT for making our trip perfect. You won't regret booking with them.

reviews.author: Mia L.
reviews.description: Sent a request in and received a response on a weekend afternoon in less than 5 minutes. Incredible customer service, they only fit up to 14 on their vehicles so we were unable to use them, but their owner takes quotes seriously!!

reviews.author: Kelly F.
reviews.description: My experience with Texas Tipsy tours was nothing short of perfect!!! From pickup to drop-off, Courtney (the owner) made our experience amazing! When I initially started inquiring about a tour a few months ago, many of the companies only offered private tours for a minimum of 4 people. However, Texas Tipsy Tours offers small group private tours (i.e. 2-3 people). This was perfect for me. She also made planning our trip so easy, and she promptly answered all of the questions I had.   On the day of the tour, she picked us up from our hotel in Austin in an Infiniti SUV (it was very clean too)! She even made a pit stop for me at a CVS on the way to our first winery. Throughout the 6 hour tour, she made sure we stayed on schedule. She even let us change a stop last minute because we wanted to check out a brewery!  One thing that was amazing was the comfort she provided! She allowed us to pick the music, provided phone chargers, and let us control the AC! She even opened our doors for us AND dropped us off/picked us up right in front of each place we went!  Overall, I highly recommend Texas Tipsy Tours, and I will definitely be back!

reviews.author: Audrey C.
reviews.description: Wow!  What an amazing day our group of ladies had with Texas Tipsy Tours.  We chose the half day option and were picked up right at our vacation rental (Farmhouse on Elder Hill) We wanted to just stay nearby so we visited Driftwood Estate Winery and Fall Creek.  We were planning to also see Vista Brewing (all in Driftwood), but we chatted and laughed so much that we ran out of time and Eric, driver/owner was flexible with our change of plans and let us just extend our time enjoying the fabulous view at Driftwood Estate.  The tour service was absolutely awesome and professional.  Everything done with excellence.  Thank you Courtney and Eric!

reviews.author: Ally H.
reviews.description: Awesome experience for bachelorette. Seamless communication with manager Courtney. Helped us make a great itinerary-2 wineries and 1 distillery. Group loved every minute. Driver Keaton was so friendly and professional and best of all company was affordable. Can't recommend enough

reviews.author: Ashton M.
reviews.description: I booked a private wine tasting tour with Tipsy Tours for a bachelorette party and it was seamless right from the start! They took care of everything and even placed our lunch order for us in advance so it was ready when we arrived. It was honestly one of the best tour experiences I have ever had and already booked another tour with them for later this year!

reviews.author: Chelsea C.
reviews.description: AWESOME! I worked with Courtney at TTT to plan my Husband's 30th birthday brewery tour. It was as easy as getting on the phone, explaining what I wanted, and Courtney took care of literally everything else. We picked the breweries we wanted and even included a food stop. She coordinated the bus pick up, drop offs, schedule, and even reserved tables for us at each stop. I love that we had our own bus (very nice one, by the way!), and had the flexibility to create our own tour based on beers and food my husband liked. It was the perfect Saturday in Austin! Payment was very easy as well - they sent me an invoice to my email and I was able to pay directly online for everything. Highly recommend, and thank you Texas Tipsy Tours!

reviews.author: Erin J.
reviews.description: We booked Texas Tipsy Tours twice in one weekend. I have taken quite a few van tours around the hill country and Texas Tipsy Tours sets themselves apart by not just being drivers but they truly host you the entire day. I will ALWAYS use this company going forward. We did a private charter from Driftwood to Austin, TX and back and Keaton our driver was a delight. He made sure we were picked up on time and each of our stops were easy and flexible. We did a mixed tour around Driftwood and Dripping springs the next day and our guide Eric executed the BEST DAY for us. He even picked up on what we were liking and recommended a change to our final stop to Vista Brewing and we were SO glad he did. At each stop he made sure we had plenty of water, snacks and chairs to enjoy the gorgeous venues. This is totally above and beyond what we would have expected from a driver. Courtney was so easy to work with and she helped make recommendations for our group ultimately making our weekend get away FLAWLESS. I promise if you don't use this company, you're wrong.

reviews.author: Kylie H.
reviews.description: Texas Tipsy Tours was absolutely wonderful. They curated a wine tasting for my best friend's bachelorette, and were so helpful and knowledgeable. Courtney and Eric are just the sweetest people! Would highly recommend if you're looking for a relaxed tasting without the hubbub of big party buses, AND if you're looking for a more personalized experience with people who can really throw a party. Fredericksburg can be confusing because of the many, many options, so Courtney's expertise in the wineries proved incredibly helpful. Highly recommend!!

reviews.author: Christy C.
reviews.description: We had an excellent experience with this tour company.  They were easy to work with and to plan our day.  We selected the premium wine tour and stopped at 3 wineries and picked up lunch at Hye Market.  The entire experience was well thought out and planned thoroughly.  Courtney is one of the owners and helped me figure out which wineries to taste.  Keaton was our driver and he was great!  I would definitely recommend this tour company.

reviews.author: Nancy R.
reviews.description: Our driver, Keaton, was amazing! He was so polite and kept us on schedule. The places we visited were amazing and so welcoming. Highly recommend!

name: Dripping With Taste Wine and Food Festival

reviews.author: Leila R.
reviews.description: This was my first, and sad to say, my last time doing this festival. A friend who had been a few times before highly recommended it and when I balked at the $40 (plus a $3.50 processing fee) "pre-event discount price" with the at the door price being $50, he assured me it was well worth it because there were so many great food and wine vendors, you get your money's worth.  This was absolutely NOT the case! Firstly, this whole thing just seemed disorganized at best and I am sorry, but for $50 ($40) they could have gotten a much nicer location than a dusty, stiflingly hot cattle stockyard!   As for what you get for $40, 6 drink tickets and 10 food tickets when drinks and food run you anywhere from 1 ticket for a meager barely 1oz pour for most of the wines to several tickets for very small portions of the food, you barely get $10 worth of food and drink! You can purchase ticket for $1 a piece, which is most definitely not worth the portions or pours you receive.   As for the vendors/vintners at the festival, there were not nearly as many as you would expect for the price point and the layout was just haphazard. Also, there were several vendors that were out of food by the time we got there just after 2pm...the "festival" was supposed to go until 6pm...so how the heck were vendors running out of things w/4hrs left!?!   The only highlight, for me at least, was the grape stomp, but even then, they ran out of tshirts to "stamp" with your grape-soaked footprints.   In any case, my $43.50 would have been better spent and enjoyed at an actual local restaurant where I could have gotten multiple full pours of wine and actual food instead of leaving this joke of a festival hungry, overheated, more sober than when I arrived, and feeling like I had just been scammed somehow. Lesson. Learned.   I am honestly shocked this "festival" has lasted 10yrs let alone one!

reviews.author: Valerie S.
reviews.description: I had a lovely time as the guest of a coworker. However, I felt like the overall value wasn't quite there for this event. Drink and food tickets went way too fast when some places asked for multiple tickets for less than an ounce of wine or a small sample of food. The actual value was about $1 per ticket. There were also some vendors that were somewhat rude or rushing. The whole point is to get business by having people try your product, right? Well there's some wineries I'd think twice about giving my money to after their lack of friendliness.   The options for food was more limited than I expected and many ran out of food even though we got there just an hour after the event started. There are lots of raffles going on and free koozies and pens galore. The arena was stuffy inside and though fresh near the doors you ran the risk of also eating dirt.   The music was good but there needed to be more sitting areas to relax and open a bottle of wine. I will definitely go back next year, but I do hope to see more offerings.

reviews.author: Ella D.
reviews.description: This was by far the most awful "festival" I have ever had the misfortune of wasting money on.   First of all, in 2012 it was held at the Texas Hill Country Olive Company. So all advertisements this year were of a gorgeous event at this lovely vineyard - The photos were of a classy event, surrounded by olive trees and rolling hills, adorable art booths scattered about the lovely property, smiling faces holding wine glasses. I was so excited based on what I was reading of the Olive Company event that I had my mother travel up 3 hours on the morning of Saturday the 14th to accompany me. Then I convinced another girlfriend of mine to join. We had our tickets in advance, $40.00 online purchase, and my girlfriend paid at the door - $50.00.   Now, regardless of where the ACTUAL event for 2013 was advertised as being held - between the advertisements on Yelp, on Facebook and scattered about Dripping Springs, it was VERY unclear to anyone coming from outside of town where the hell this event actually was.   So we arrived at the Texas Hill Country Olive Company to find no tents, no events, no nothing but a beautiful building surrounded by beautiful land. Inside there were very few customers. But we were greeted warmly, given amazing samples (DO go there and DO try their olive oils and balsamic vinegars and DO check out their $55.00 romantic date night packages).   Making the best of what was already frustrating, we had a few samples and they sent us on to the Dripping Springs Park Ranch - or something like that, up Ranch Road Twelve.   We were still optimistic until we saw the HUGE metal pavilion looming ahead, situated in the midst of probably two square miles of plowed up red dirt which will eventually be a parking lot. As we navigated in, driving through dirt among hundreds of cars, we noticed piles of dirt, bull dozers, caution tape... this entire venue was a.) an agricultural fair pavilion and b.) UTTERLY UNFINISHED.   I was mortified. I brought guests, I paid money, and we were supposed to be in the midst of lush, rolling hill country sipping wine and sampling cheese. Not walking through 300 yards of dirt to get to an unfinished metal building. This was already so embarrassing and already not worth the money.   We had to enter at the back of this enormous, godawful construction, walk through the art vendors, then across MORE dirt on the rodeo floor (where the paying guests tables were and the music) where we were given six drink tickets and ten food tickets. When we reached the one interior part of the building, we were encountered by swarms of casually dressed, generally rude, pushy guests who were buzzing around a square room with no proper traffic flow. There we found out that each drink ticket gave us ONE OUNCE of wine, which was poured by rude and distracted vendors. We also found that each food ticket did not entitle us to a sample - samples cost anywhere from 2 to 5 tickets. One ticket got you the likes of ONE chip with a dollop of something on it.   I was blocked and almost run over by a RUDE and completely OBLIVIOUS staff member who was blocking the only entrance to the tasting room. Other guests were hogging the only FIVE standing tables in the are, they'd put their purses up there and stand around and send other guests to get them samples, so there was no where to set down your things and you had to juggle a glass of wine, your tickets, your purse, and a plate of food and in order to eat it, back through the ONE door you went, down the stairs to the dirt on the rodeo arena floor.   We left without even using the tickets we had - not worth the paltry return for what we'd spent and what we had to endure to get there.   I will never return to this event. I want my money back from this event. The Dripping Springs Chamber of Commerce should be ashamed of the overall mess and disappointment this fiasco was - they don't deserve a dime of the money they raised from it.   TERRIBLE.

reviews.author: Nina H.
reviews.description: This is probably more of a 3.5 than a 4, but the low ratings to date are unjustified so I'm bumping it up.  I enjoyed the wide variety of beer, wine, and liquor to choose from, but I wish there were a few more food options. What made it worth the price of admission was the sommelier talk at 3:30 where there was no-ticket-required wine comparison tasting, and I learned a few things. Take advantage of those demos if you go next year. Also there were a few food stands with free samples no tickets required (pecans were a favorite, olive oil, chips and salsa, etc). I wish I had hit the liquor area sooner, they seemed to have generous pours. I may hit this event again next year, or I may not, but I definitely had a good time.

reviews.author: Miranda E.
reviews.description: This was disappointing. I've been to many similar food/wine tastings, but this one was very low value- you received drink and food coupons instead of the usual unlimited tastings most events provide. Also, expect to experience long lines in a hot event center. I'd recommend treating yourself to a nice dinner with wine over coming here.

reviews.author: Chrystal W.
reviews.description: I thought this was an awesome event!  Yes you had to pay $40 for entrance into the event.  For that money you receive a twin Iiquors reusable bag, some goodies inside the bag including a wine glass, 10 food tickets and 6 wine tickets.  Each wine ticket was good for a 1oz pour.  And the food tickets could be used at more than 10 food vendors for various amounts.  It is called Dripping with Taste because it is supposed to be a "taste" not a full glass or full meal.  I will tell you that I had plenty of food for my 10 tickets!  And got to try 6 different wines!    I will say that a previous post about volunteers having to work 2 hours and then getting unlimited food and drinks is absolutely false.  Volunteers had to work a minimum of 3 hour shifts but most worked many, many more hours not only the day of the event but also prior to the event and they got the same 10 food tickets and 6 alcohol tickets.  I learned a lot about local wineries, breweries, and distilleries and tasted some awesome food from some local restaurants that I had not yet eaten at.

reviews.author: Jared H.
reviews.description: If you choose to attend this festival, DO NOT PAY. You get 6 drink tickets and 10 food tickets for $40. 1 oz pours. That's about 1/6 of a glass of wine. So you pay $40 for a single glass of wine. HEB gave away 2 chips with salsa for 1 ticket, empanadas were 5 tickets. I was denied BUYING a bottle of water, so that the volunteers could have them.   This brings me to the point, if you want to go to dripping with taste, volunteer. They treat the volunteers far better than paying guests. They do their jobs for 2 hours then get to enjoy UNLIMITED drinks and food and get cool shirts that aren't available to buy to us regulars.   I was very unimpressed Dripping Springs.

reviews.author: Brandy E.
reviews.description: I was really excited for this, but sadly disappointed. Paid $40 ticket, which included 10 food tasting tickets and 6 wine tasting tickets. Get there and see that almost every vendor is charging 2-5 tickets for food tasting and the wine tastings are  only 1 oz pours. What??! What did my $40 pay for?? A couple sample size appetizers and a few gargle-worth 's wine samples! Furthermore, it was inside and stifling!! I'd much rather pay a little more and get unlimited tastings, at least I'd feel like I got my money's worth. Sorry Dripping, won't be back. Huge disappointment.

reviews.author: Chris T.
reviews.description: They did a good job this year except for signage. There was a huge lack thereof at the back entrance where they were having everyone park when I arrived.  Everyone parking had no idea where to go. Other than that, the new Ranch/event center is nice. There were lots of vendors and lots to choose from. The tickets were more than enough to try things and the staff were friendly. Dripping Springs is a gorgeous city that should be visited by all.

reviews.author: Holmes S.
reviews.description: A piss poor event.   It was raining when we arrived, I know that no one can help that, but we were one of the first to arrive and we directed to park at the back end of a mud field. Instead of filling up the lot nearest the event, we had to walk though a water logged muddy field.   Then the signing up volunteers, one of the online register volunteers, was the rudest person I have met in a long time. She reminded me of one of the Orks from Lord of the Rings.   So you get 10 food tickets and 6 drink tickets. What you fail to learn until you have paid ($50) is that 10 food tickets doesn't mean 10 small samples, all of the samples were multiple tickets. Essentially, your $50 gets you two tacos and the six drink tickets equal about one glass of wine.   A truly crap festival.

reviews.author: Charlene N.
reviews.description: This year was my second year to attend the festival. I loved it. I did volunteer this year to help and I am glad I did. I saw more of what hard work goes into making it a success. I still had time to taste wine and food and work to help this year be more successful than the last. I had fun and really love this part of Texas. Perfect place and lot of hard work went into making this a fun day.  Good job all who make this happen!!!!

reviews.author: James S.
reviews.description: After reading the other reviews I felt that I had to write one myself. Just how many wine festivals have these people attended?!  I have attended literally dozens of wine festivals, mostly in California. Believe me that the Dripping with Taste Festival is, by far, the best value on the market. Spending $40 for the initial tickets is next to nothing compared to the analogous events in California. AND purchasing additional tickets for a buck each is very cheap compared to other such events.   I have attended the last two Dripping with Taste festivals and plan to continue to attend every year. I look forward to this event based on the quality of the event and the very, very low cost. Both years I have come away with the feeling that I got more than my money's worth and found several Texas wines to add to my wine cellar!

reviews.author: B L.
reviews.description: Went to this event for my birthday and...gee...what a rip.  Like the other person said its located at a huge agricultural pavilion for horse and gun shows.  I live in Drippings and saw this massive structure being erected.  Its quite the eye sore.  That'd be fine if it wasn't so expensive.  Worse, it is actually held in a tiny closed off indoor part of the complex that's maybe a 1/8th the size of the whole place.  Needless to say, it was over crowded, people packed in like sardines.  My family wanted to leave rather quickly because it just flat out sucked.  Some the vendors were generous some were stingy and acted like it was a chore to deal with you.  Stay away from this event.

reviews.author: Elizabeth N.
reviews.description: The last time I went to this event was several years ago and I was very disappointed with the venue and the offerings and had not gone back. I decided to try it again this year since it sounded like a great venue but I was very disappointed here as well. The place was nice and large but very hot and had a messy, red dirt floor. Really, I spent $40 on a cattle pen?  The wineries were nice but there were not enough food vendors and most were over-priced. My legs and feet were disgustingly dirty by the time we left. It also made me wonder how much of that dirt ended up on the food.  That's two out of two disappointments with that event and I will not be going back until a better location is used. If it happens a third time, well it will be third time and your out. There are plenty of nicer wine events around Texas that don't charge that much for entry and are much more fun.

reviews.author: Laurie H.
reviews.description: We thoroughly enjoyed our day at Dripping With Taste. Having missed the event last year, we weren't sure what to expect at the new venue. Mother Nature decided that we needed some rain, and she was right! Though we were a little soggy when we arrived, that didn't dampen our spirits. We sampled food from most of the vendors, the quality was outstanding and we found everyone to be warm, friendly and knowledgable. As always, great wines, loved the beer garden, and glad to see the addition of spirits. The music added a nice ambience. We enjoyed our beer, wine and food sitting comfortably watching the shows. We had a wonderful day, we're looking forward to next year's Dripping With Taste. The Chamber should be very proud of this years event.

reviews.author: G C.
reviews.description: Definitely not worth your money. 50.00 per person with very little vendors for the money. 10 food tickets and 6 wine/spirit tickets. Filler vendors for example Sysco and HEB to make the place appear fuller. Don't do it.

reviews.author: Jonathan James R.
reviews.description: The night could not have gone any better. Vehicle was clean, music was perfect, and the service provided by the team was top notch. Any request that was made throughout the night was delivered on. I actually wish I could give 6 stars for a perfect evening.

reviews.author: Nick W.
reviews.description: George was amazing! We took went out to the Willam Chris Winery for the day and had the very best time going there and coming home with George. He is literally the best, nicest, and most fun driver we've had and will only use his services when we do trips like this. Thanks George!

reviews.author: Vinny P.
reviews.description: Great service! We did a brewery and distillery tour with Cool Bus ATX yesterday. Sam is the owner/driver and one thing she provides is unbelievable customer service. She's extremely easy to work with, provides a fun atmosphere on the bus and is very reasonable priced. I would highly recommend this service to anyone who's looking to get a group of friends together and tour around Austin.

reviews.author: Edwin T.
reviews.description: We had a 12 man bachelor party in Austin during Memorial Day weekend. The day we spent riding around in Cool Bus ATX was the absolute highlight of the weekend. Sam, the owner and driver, was unbelievable. Very accommodating, great driver, and super chill.   We planned to hit up the Salt Lick on the party bus and then venture around to some breweries afterwards. Sam made sure that the group got where we needed to be on time, had great suggestions for breweries, and made sure we were having as much fun as possible.  The bus is great. Fit everyone comfortably with enough room for a cooler in between all of us. Sam had her playlist turned up or she would hand over the AUX cord and we could play our tracks as loud as we wanted. The whole experience was incredibly laid back and worry free. I would absolutely recommend Cool bus ATX to anyone that wants to have a great time with a big group in Austin.   On a side note, if it is Sunday, make sure that you buy beer on Saturday because they don't sell it on Sunday before noon.   Thanks again, Sam!

reviews.author: Bailey S.
reviews.description: We just got back from an amazing weekend with Cool Bus ATX!! Sam, the owner, is very sweet and accommodating. The bus itself is awesome - lights, music (you can play your own music too!), plenty of seating, very well maintained and clean. Would recommend to everyone. Thanks again Cool Bus ATX!

reviews.author: Thad G.
reviews.description: Amazing tour, the level of service they provide is unmatched. I have been on multiple tours in Fredericksburg and this company by far is the best. Highly recommend!!!

reviews.author: Kim T.
reviews.description: I was invited to join friends on a wine tour this weekend and I have to say, I enjoyed myself.  Amber and Amethyst tours took good care of us.  Thanks for journey through the wineries. I had a great time.

reviews.author: Alexandra A.
reviews.description: 11/10 Recommended. Dianna and Lou were so friendly, funny and warm, which made our tour even better than anticipated. The van was so comfy and roomy with great AC and sound system. Throughout the tour they chatted with us and made us laugh, and y'all, they are so prepared before the trip. The snacks and beverages were tasty and helpful between venues. Definitely will be booking another tour next month. Highly recommended!

name: Keep Austin Wet Party Bus Rentals

reviews.author: Nicki O.
reviews.description: We booked for a bachelorette party wine tasting. I would most definitely recommend these guys!! The whole process was very smooth. Easy to reserve. Prompt pick-up on the day of. The bus was clean and comfortable. They took care of arranging all the stops on our wine tour. James, our driver, was fantastic! Most importantly, we made it home safely! Thanks Austin Wet Bus!!

reviews.author: Patrick M.
reviews.description: Santos set up the perfect wine tasting tour for our party.  The bus was so nice and clean.   Great experience.

reviews.author: Randy M.
reviews.description: Had a blast riding around on the Wet Bus! Booming system and watched The Anchorman on the big TV. The driver Pete was safe and fun throughout the trip while our friends were getting wasted-faced!

reviews.author: a j.
reviews.description: Our group of girls had so much fun on a vineyard tour with Keep Austin Wet!  My driver clearly had everything under control, so I was able to relax with my friends and start the party as soon as we got on the bus!  Our kids were so jealous when they saw the cool bus their moms' were leaving them in!  Honestly, the bus could have driven us anywhere and we would have had a good time, but Santos' attention to picking great vineyards and James' attnetion to keeping us on schedule made everything perfect!  Our group was different than most -- in that we wanted to take it slow and just relax and were not too concerned about whether we made it to all three destinations.  We also had some nursing moms and wanted to be sure everyone was accomodated.  James was very accomodating and once I conveyed that we were more relaxed he made sure we had all the time we needed.  I also felt like the driving was very safe and overall the attention to safety was as it should be.  The price was reasonable, as well.  All in All, Keep Austin Wet made our vineyard tour perfect!

reviews.author: Annie M.
reviews.description: What a great experience! I cannot speak highly enough about Austin Wet Bus. Santos was so enthusiastic about hosting our party, which was a welcome relief as that is not always the response you get from tour companies when you tell them you're a bachelorette party--no matter how well-behaved you may be! Our driver, James, was wonderful and so helpful the entire day, especially at the end when we elected to add another hour and an extra stop; he catered his recommendation to our needs (gluten intolerant guests + casual interest in beer and liquor) and we had an amazing experience. You can't beat the pricing, but for what we paid our experience definitely exceeded every expectation. Thank you so much for everything, and we look forward to using you again in the future!

reviews.author: Alexia P.
reviews.description: Planned a surprise Bachelorette weekend for my close friend this past November.  Throwing a surprise weekend is stressful enough but Woody was SUPER accommodating especially for being so last minute.  There were many tours that I could've chosen to stick with but Woody was so authentic about his services and was a person of integrity when it came to what he offered.  He personally picked us up from our little hotel we were staying at and drove us to all three of our tours. His tour bus was super clean and we all had a blast! He even offered to pick up some cheese and snacks at the HEB close by to have on the bus if we wanted! I really appreciated Woody taking the time to answer my numerous phone calls with questions I had as this is my first Bachelorette party I threw.  I HIGHLY recommend using Woody if anyone wants to have a great time and looking for someone to trust. I will be booking with you again Woody, thank you so much for everything!

reviews.author: Brad B.
reviews.description: Woody was great, our party had a wonderful time touring Fredericksburg wineries with him and he was very knowledgable about the area and the vineyards.  He has deep contacts at each location and was able to get a very large group into locations that have restrictions due to COVID.  We would all use Woody again when we go back to visit the Texas wine country.  Book with Woody you won't regret it.  Thanks Woody!!!

reviews.author: Christy S.
reviews.description: Blake was our driver; amazing sweet considerate young man! Go to narrow path and arrowhead wineries

reviews.author: Colleen F.
reviews.description: Wow! There are so many choices for wine tours in Fredericksburg that it can be a bit overwhelming. If you come across Fredericksburg Uncorked Wine Tours, stop your search and make the booking.   Organizing a wine tour for 18 girls as part of a bachelorette party was a breeze with Woody, the owner/operator of Uncorked. He gave great advice, offered competitive pricing (especially for the expectant mothers/non-drinkers in our group), and was easy to communicate with. Woody was incredibly patient during the lead up to our tour, and then was a funny, gracious, and attentive guide during our wine tasting experience.   Our tour was fantastic from start to finish, and I can't recommend Woody and the rest of the Fredericksburg Uncorked team highly enough. All (18) of us had the greatest time!

reviews.author: Meggan G.
reviews.description: We had the perfect day with Woody on the Texas 2 Step tour. He kept in touch with us from our booking up until the morning of the tour. He was very friendly, informative and kept us entertained. We learned so much about the area, got recommendations on places to go and heard some great stories along the way! He also made sure to take plenty of photos for everyone in the group. I highly recommend using his services for a great tour of wine country!

reviews.author: Geno C.
reviews.description: Great tour. Great customer service. Will love to go again and stay away from the routine from work.

reviews.author: Katie H.
reviews.description: Woody is amazing! Best driver and tour guide we've ever had.  Super friendly and personable.  Makes sure everyone is having the best experience.  Highly recommended!

reviews.author: Jenny S.
reviews.description: Woody was the best winery your host!! He took our group of 18 for a bachelorette party to three wineries and lunch was included. He took our pictures at each winery and also was very entertaining and extremely nice! He went out of his way to make sure we had a great time.

reviews.author: Kelsey M.
reviews.description: I've been to Fredericksburg twice on big girls trip, and woody was our guide both times - we won't ever go anywhere else! Book your tour, he picks you up and it's literally that easy!  Woody is very nice and knows Fredericksburg and the wineries so well. Don't go anywhere else!!

reviews.author: Julianne D.
reviews.description: Woody is the best guide ever! So accommodating, so nice, and very gracious. Such a great experience- he took such good care of us- I couldn't say enough great things!

reviews.author: Amy U.
reviews.description: This was an AMAZING experience!!! My husband and I are not about organized tours all that much, but this tour was not an organized group of people like a lot of tours are. He went out of his way to text us even before the tour and recommend places for us to go. We loved him so much we even hung out with him after the tour. He is an awesome tour guide and a blast to hangout with and knows anyone and everyone! Can't recommend this tour enough!

reviews.author: Catherine T.
reviews.description: Woody was absolutely amazing , my boyfriend and I came into town Thursday 3/17/16 and I really wanted to find a tour for Friday . I called him Friday morning at 8:50 hoping I'd get a call back before the 10 am tour and I did ten min later and I was able to get on his first tour . I honestly called three or 4 more tours throughout the week and left messages and he is the only one that called me back. Not only did woody come through, he came through at the last minute when I thought We weren't going to make a tour.  He was funny , knowledgeable and overall a great guide. He even recommended a few things that weren't apart of the tour (Alamo Springs Cafe) which we ended up going to and was delicious.  Lunch was not included but the place we went to was pretty great for a sandwich . I'd hang out and grab a beer with woody any night !  Thank you for making my boyfriends birthday a good one !!

reviews.author: TC R.
reviews.description: Had an awesome day with my family and friends. Woody hit all the best spots and we got lit Woody is the man!

reviews.author: Rachael T.
reviews.description: I can't wait to get back to Fredricksburg and have Woody show me around! We had a large group of ladies and Woody took such great care of us. I would highly recommend his services to anyone heading to Fredricksburg!

reviews.author: Sue F.
reviews.description: Woody is a funny,helpful, kind and an amazing guy. We were able to book one day in advance. He responded to my call right away and set us up with a 4 person private tour plus lunch. We all had a great time with lots of funny narratives. If you want to see a different side of Texas wineries, just call Woody. He will definitely hook you up.  What a great day with no worries.

reviews.author: Emily A.
reviews.description: Woody was lovely and quickly became part of our group. He gave helpful insight into each winery and took so many pictures (patiently!) I wanted to dub him the class historian  Cannot recommend his services enough!

reviews.author: Nelcy R.
reviews.description: Woody was nice at the beginning but there was miscommunication about lunch and he decided to take it upon himself to charge my credit card without my permission. I was upset and apparently he was too so he threw customer service out the window. I never agreed to Woody keeping my credit card information on file after he charged the wine tour for 11 girls (almost $1,300).   The driver Tommy was nice but he did nothing special and didn't know the basics of Woody's business. Had he known even a little bit about Uncorked Tours, there wouldn't have been confusion about lunch.   As far as the wine tour: William Chris and Lost Draw were my favorite wineries. Hye Market pretended we weren't there half of the time. Pontotoc was greedy with their pours.   Woody was very unprofessional and difficult to work with at the end. I would not recommend him. Book early to get the highest rated wine tours (2-3 months prior)!

reviews.author: Shannon M.
reviews.description: We had a great time on our wine tour with Bill! He was very knowledgeable and easy to talk to since the other half of our tour cancelled, so it was like a private tour for my boyfriend and I.  We really enjoyed the entire time and highly recommend booking a wine tour through Uncorked!

reviews.author: Natalie A.
reviews.description: My friends and I went on a wine tour with Woody a few Sundays ago, and it was great! I tried to book for Saturday but the tour was full. I called the number provided on the website and had a great conversation with Woody. He set up the perfect private winery tour for me and my friends on Sunday, since Saturday was full. It was a really great and memorable experience and I would definitely consider doing it again! We had our own spacious limo that we could sip on wine we brought with us, as well as some we purchased at the wineries we visited, while driving from one vineyard to the next (drive time between each location was max. 15 minutes). Overall a great experience!

reviews.author: Brittany B.
reviews.description: We had such a great time with Woody! We were on a bachelorette trip with 15 ladies, and had plenty of room. He picked up our sandwich platters at H-E-B that morning, and set up a little outdoor picnic for us at the second winery. The bus was top of the line, he was a lot of fun, and we would definitely do it again!

reviews.author: Jessica C.
reviews.description: So first....let me say that our group totally dropped the ball on planning.  We reached out to Carla 3-4 weeks before but did not confirm until the week of the wine tour.   By the grace of the "wine" Gods, Carla could fit us in her schedule!  She is completely open to letting you choose your places or you can follow her lead!   She picked us up at our accommodations which were several miles outside of Fredricksburg.  We did introductions and she laid out the things that were already scheduled for the day.  On our way to the first winery, we decided to "reroute" the tour to hit some lesser known spots.  TBH, we were excited for Carla's recommendations.    Our first stop was Six Shooter because of their variety of dry wines, sweet wines and meads.  You have to try the Jalapeno shooter!!!  SO GOOD!   Second, we made our tour time at Real Ale and did a beer tasting. Third, she realized the majority of our groups like Whiskey, so we stopped at Andalusia Whiskey in Blanco!  This place met the needs of our entire group (even the non-whiskey drinker) and was by far the most unique stop of their day!  If you go here, try the Cherry Cola cocktail!   We stopped for lunch at Pecan Street Brewing in Johnson City, where we drank lots of water and had really great food.   Our last stop of the tour was Zero815 Winery which had a cool mix of wines and friendly staff.   At the end of the day, Carla made sure that we made it back to our accommodations safe and sound.  We had the very best time and she knows some of the coolest places that you might miss without her expertise.  She was extremely professional and very down to earth.  She was always around to help with recommendations or just to snap photos of the group!     We highly recommend doing a tour with Carla and Texas Wine and Spirit Tours!   You won't be disappointed!   We'll be booking with her again the next time we are in the area!

reviews.author: Alejandra R.
reviews.description: I scheduled 2 group tours with Texan wine tours with more than 6 weeks in advance. The first tour was CANCELLED THE VERY SAME DAY we were supposed to go to the wineries. I traveled with a group of friends from Houston just to go visit the wineries  They also cancelled the second tour that was scheduled 2 weeks later. Our  weekend plan got ruined thanks to their lack of professionalism.

reviews.author: Vanessa T.
