reviews.description: I forgot to review this! But we did our tour with Carla in October and she was fantastic! Highly recommend.  Sending some people your way!

reviews.author: Haley H.
reviews.description: I cannot say enough good things about Carla and her touring company. Some girl friends and I came to Fredericksburg for a long weekend and did two back-to-back tours with her. The first tour on Friday was with another group and they had already decided to do wine so we were able to join in with them and had a blast touring the local wineries. She also took us to a local watering hole afterwards when we decided we all wanted to stay out for a bit longer. She was amazingly accommodating and super fun!! On Saturday we wanted to tour some distilleries and breweries and she helped us decide which ones were more along the atmosphere we were looking for. Carla is amazing and I can't recommend her enough!!

reviews.author: Stacey G.
reviews.description: I planned a bachelorette party for my best friend a few weeks ago. Leslee was amazing in setting up the perfect day for our group! She was always prompt in returning my emails and adjusting our itinerary to meet our needs. The weather wasn't the best the weekend of the tour, but Leslee made sure that we still had a fantastic time! I highly recommend D'vine Tours for a wonderful Hill Country experience!

reviews.author: Erin Y.
reviews.description: We had a blast! Leslee, the tour guide, is great. She knows the town and the people. The van is the nicest I've been in.

reviews.author: Megan B.
reviews.description: My best friend and sister planned a weekend bachelorette party for me complete with a wine and art tour. The weather was pretty bad that morning, so we started a little late, but the van that they have is really, really nice, clean, and spacious. She even has a little stool in case you need help getting into the van, and she helps everyone get in and get out. We went to three places around the Johnson City area. The first one was a quick tasting, the second one we learned A LOT about wine and got a lesson in how to properly drink wine, and at the third winery we got the most interesting history lesson about President Johnson and Lady Bird Johnson from the winemaker himself. Leslee personally knows the places and owners and was just the best tour guide. One of the places on the tour where we were supposed to also eat dinner at cancelled due to the weather, but Leslee was quick to find a different place for us to go to. She took us to a cute cafe in downtown Johnson City where we ate a ridiculously good dinner. We even went to Leslee and her husband's bar at the end of the day for one last drink and got a chance to meet her sweet daughter as well. I thoroughly enjoyed the tour with Leslee and highly recommend D'Vine Tours!

reviews.author: Susan B.
reviews.description: We did a private wine tour for my daughters 30th birthday and had a wonderful time.  Winding Road was accommodating and made excellent picks and recommendations for us.  They planned out all the logistics and kept us on track.  I would highly recommend this company!

reviews.author: Tammy B.
reviews.description: Jaston was so cheerful, professional, polite, knowledgeable and fun!! Katie put together a fabulous charcuterie tray that was such a nice touch mid tour!! We will definitely book another tour when back in the area!!

reviews.author: Maria D.
reviews.description: This was such a wonderful experience ! My second time coming . Our driver Austin is amazing I gotta give him "kudos " for being so patient with the crowds aNF being so graceful. The owners are amazing as well .  They are always truing to make things right if you feel a slight bit unhappy.  The tours were well worth it.  Every time I go I'm never disappointed. The  service is impeccable. There are three stops very rewarding and very well thought out and put together and the winery stops are spread out Enough to enjoy each place .

reviews.author: Thaddeus B.
reviews.description: This was a great experience, can't imagine touring with anyone else in the Hill Country.  Katie and Jaston extended every effort to fit everyone's plans together and were great communicating the plans and ensuring everyone was happy.  Done tours previously, but not had as much fun as this trip.  They have access to the good and interesting vineyards, in an area where new places pop up daily it seems.  The bus was comfortable, the ride was smooth, and the mood was great.  They have earned our business.

reviews.author: Leticia E.
reviews.description: Had a great time in Fredericksburg! The complimentary personal charcuterie tray was a very nice addition to the tour. The Winding Road bus is nice, clean, and well prepared for any weather (blankets, umbrellas, and water). I highly recommend Winding Road Wine Tours, and I will definitely be using their services again.

reviews.author: Kathy W.
reviews.description: We had a wonderful time with Jaston on the wine tour. Katie was integral in helping plan our event. She even made a guest appearance at the end of trip. We loved every minute of it. Thanks for helping us put together the perfect Hill Country Wine Tour. We look forward to many more.

reviews.author: Becky D.
reviews.description: Just had an amazing wine tour with Jaston and Winding Road Wine Tours! Very accommodating, took all the pictures we asked and was very knowledgeable. Would recommend to anyone wanting to spend the day in wine country!

reviews.author: Katie O.
reviews.description: BEST WINE TOUR EVER! Billy is so acccomodating and thoughtful. The wineries that were on the tour had amazing wine and atmospheres. Most certainly  would tour with them again!

reviews.author: Adam S.
reviews.description: My wife and I took this tour and really enjoyed it. A relaxing afternoon in the hill country tasting delicious wines. Billy was a wonderful tour guide.

reviews.author: Jerry S.
reviews.description: Absolutely great trip!  Visited 3 vineyards and all 3 were phenomenal!  Billy with WR tours was a wonderful host!  100% recommend Winding Road Wine Tours!  His bus is very comfortable and very roomy!  And he knows a great deal about the wines!!  Will definitely come back to Wimberley and use Winding Road!!!!!!

reviews.author: Heather T.
reviews.description: Awesome day and Billy was a great  driver and organized everything perfectly.  We would love to do this again!!

reviews.author: Lori C.
reviews.description: We had a great time today with Billy.  A great time with friends for a bachelorette party. Wonderful safe driving, good food and wine!

reviews.author: Don M.
reviews.description: Looking to experience great Hill Country wines and barbecue - we had both taking Winding Road Wine Tours Salt Lick Sunday Wine Tour.  The tour picked us up in Gruene in a new luxury bus at 10:30. We were greeted by the tour owner Billy Martin.  The bus was very comfortable with a u shaped seating arrangement and a table in the aisle.  Should seat around 12 people comfortably. The bus has a great sound system that is Bluetooth enabled - Billy played whatever we wanted from sources such as Pandora and Napster music service. First stop was Driftwood Estate Winery. Driftwood has perhaps the best winery views in the Hill Country.  I really enjoyed the reds and came away with a bottle of Longhorn Red to enjoy at our next stop Salt Lick Barbecue. Yes, Salt Lick is byob. It was beginning to rain and Billy dropped us off near the check in stand. He's thought of his customer's needs providing us large golf umbrellas. It was busy with people waiting to be seated. However, he got us seated right away. Our final two wineries were Fall Creek right across the street from Salt Lick and then Wimberley Valley Winery. Fall Creek has solid wines and the service for our group was outstanding. Wimberley Valley Winery was an unexpected pleasure. Their tasting room is roomy and comfortable with plenty room at the tasting bars and a comfortable seating area facing a large stone fireplace. They have a variety of wines bottled on site along with other wines from around the world. The grounds were spectacular with numerous large shaded decks to enjoy a glass or bottle as you wrap up your tour.  What a great Sunday drinking Texas wines, eating Texas barbecue and meeting new friends!

reviews.author: Paula B.
reviews.description: This is a wonderful wine tour with Billy in the Texas Hill Country. Billy was on time, friendly and very knowledgeable! There were 7 of us on a family vacation trip and we wanted to have a fun but classy wine tour where we got our money's worth and then some. As a new resident to the area, it's important for me to know what high quality tour guides are available. Well, Winding Road Hill Country Wine Tours with Billy is definitely the way to go, folks.

reviews.author: Jaimie M.
reviews.description: Absolutely 5 star experience! Billy was a great host and we all had a blast celebrating our friend's bachelorette party. The bus is extremely accommodating with a great sound system, places for drinks and COLD a/c! (Which was great for the warm weather outside). We had an absolute blast! Thank you so much for taking such great care of us!

reviews.author: Lisa S.
reviews.description: We were so impressed with our whole wine tour experience from start to finish that we booked a brewery tour the following day! Billy really did his homework! We highly recommend Winding Road Wine Tours!

reviews.author: Mike R.
reviews.description: Wow - Not sure I can adequately articulate what a great tour we had.  The bus/coach is beautiful, immaculate and has a great sound system.  The vineyards selected by Billy are great - wonderful grounds and fantastic wines.  Billy (great guy) is well known at the vineyards and ensures you get great service and a great spot at the tasting bar.  The charcuterie board for lunch in conjunction with a tasting in a private room was very special.  All-in- all just a wonderful experience.  Highly recommend this tour.  I understand he also conducts craft beer and spirits tours (next time)

reviews.author: Orlando L.
reviews.description: Had a really great time, would definitely recommend. They did a great job with the event and everything went very smoothly and the price was way better than most other services.

reviews.author: Mackenzie W.
reviews.description: I rented a party bus through this company a couple weeks ago. In the beginning, Robert was extremely accommodating and friendly. And our driver, Terrell, was great. We got dropped off at COTA for a show and had a great time!  But where it turned south was at the end of the night. I texted our driver 30 minutes before we needed to be picked up (like he requested) and he said no problem. Then we left the concert and were walking to the pickup spot where I gave him a call. He said he got in an accident but would only be 20 minutes and I said that's fine. 20 minutes roll by and I gave him a call again, no answer, but texted and said it would be another 20 minutes. We ended up waiting in the cold for almost an hour and well after most people had left COTA. Multiple people in our party ended up just taking ubers because they didn't want to wait. The whole point of a bus is so you don't have to wait.  The next day, I texted Robert saying we would like a refund for the extra hour we paid for waiting that we wouldn't have used if we had been picked up on time. He said he would call to discuss but never did. I've now sent him multiple emails - mind you, being incredibly nice about it. All I asked for was an hour refunded back - not the whole thing, not even half. But still no response.  The customer service level of this company is terrible should anything go wrong. So hire them at your own risk.

reviews.author: Neesh S.
reviews.description: Apologies for this review being so incredibly late but Austin Nites was the best! We had rented a party bus on pretty short notice to take a Bachelor Party to and from Lake Travis and Robert and team were amazing.   It was also Prom weekend so the schedule was packed for them but they still took care of us and worked with our schedule.   Our boat ended up staying out on the water longer than scheduled which through our plans all over the place and Robert was there waiting on time. Given his packed schedule, the driver did have to leave without us but Robert made sure to get me in contact with another service and they sent a bus over right away.   All in all, it was an incredible experience!

reviews.author: Snl H.
reviews.description: For $700+ for four hours we would have expected a better looking bus. Multiple dents around outside of bus. The AC barely working. Missing panels inside of bus missing or duct tape together.  Another party bus parked next to the one we had and it was so obvious how terrible looking our bus looked.   Can't believe owners would let this bus represent their company. Hope they use our $700 toward getting it fixed.   Driver was pleasant.

reviews.author: Michael H.
reviews.description: Fist off I'm hyper paranoid about drinking and driving so I usually use Uber, Lyft etc to get around town when I wanna go out and when I'm probably going to have a few drinks! But how is that supposed to work when you have a huge group? I called austin nites party rentals for a few reasons 1. I love puns and 2. I'm am austinite and 3. My group was over ten people and we wanted to go out and have nothing to worry about. Great party bus, great personable driver, great experience definitely reccomend these guys!! DONT DRINK AND DRIVE!! Call someone you can trust call Austin Nites!!

reviews.author: Charli R.
reviews.description: I'm incredibly frustrated with this business.  We had spoken a couple times in the months before I decided to book and I initially felt great about potentially booking with these friendly people.  When it came time to book I called them and was told, once again, that our requested date was open and we talked out an agreement.  The owner tells me we're good to go, and that all he needed me to do now was to send him my information so that he could get a contract sent that same day.  I'd explained to him that I was booking this bus ride to and from a party boat, and that I would be booking with them that day as well.   SO, I get off the phone and send my info.  I call my party boat folks to let them know I've just confirmed my bus, and I'm ready for a boat.  I book with them based on my discussion with these guys and put down $400 to hold our reservation.  It's been two weeks since I last spoke with this company and they have ignored my calls, texts, voicemails trying to figure out why the contract hasn't come through.  Our event is next month, and at this point I've been researching new solutions, and unfortunately the new solution means I can't use the same boat company, and therefore I've lost my $400 deposit.  I did not have this money to lose, but after being ghosted by this company I guess I have to take the loss and move on.  They seem like nice people, and it takes A LOT to get on here and write a negative review, but this has caused me a lot of stress and I want to prevent this from happening to anyone else.  I hope at some point I find out a reasonable explanation and can revise this review, but not counting on it.  We'll see I guess.

reviews.author: Horacio R.
reviews.description: BOOK WITH THIS COMPANY!  Robert did a solid job taking me and a bunch of my friends to Lake Travis and back on July 4th. His price was WAY lower than other companies I called, being the ONLY one that actually sticked to his regular prices during this busy day. He arrived early and was 100% responsive to my emails and phone calls. He arrive early to pick us up and was extremely friendly and professional. He helped us carry our coolers and accommodate everything on the bus.  The bus itself is amazing. Seats are stacked in two rows facing each other, which is great for dancing and socializing, since you are actually facing half of the crowd. The sound system is also very good. I almost feel that the bus trip was even more fun that the boat.   In summary, Austin Nites Ent. is the best on price/quality, Robert and his wife are responsive, professional and friendly, and the whole experience I had with them is positive. Would highly recommend anyone to use it, and will definitely consider using them again if I ever need to.  Thank you guys!!!!!

reviews.author: Lisa K.
reviews.description: What a great experience!  Driver was super awesome, the speakers were great and the bus was clean!!!!  We will definitely use them again!

reviews.author: Jerrod G.
reviews.description: They call you and say the bus is available and ask for a deposit over the phone.  But when we asked for a contract they go dark and won't respond. Their reviews are all their friends so not sure if this is a legitimate small business or not. There is another review on Facebook similar to our situation and she confirmed to us they went dark on her too.

reviews.author: Laura M.
reviews.description: Great experience with Austin Nites! Robert and Melissa were super helpful, accommodating, on-time (actually, early) and friendly! Would definitely use again.

reviews.author: A H.
reviews.description: I have used Austin Nites for the last 5 years and Robert the owner does not disappoint. They are punctual, courteous and very reasonably priced. We have had many fun events on the Big Blue Bus (UT games, holiday and birthday parties) and Robert always comes away with new clients. I highly recommend Austin Nites for any event that requires transporting a group. The bus ride will be the best part of your event!

reviews.author: David A.
reviews.description: I was down in austin with 19 other guys and we needed transportation for the entire night.  Robert was a great communicator before we got to austin and before he picked us up.  He was 15 minutes early, and had the bus stocked with ice, etc.  The bus was really nice, and perfect for a night out on the town.  Would definitely use this service again!

reviews.author: Emily W.
reviews.description: For my daughters birthday/last school dance we booked service with Austin Nites Party Bus.  From booking the ride up until the end of the night everything went as planned.  Our driver, Jared, was professional and so great to the girls and I during the time he drove us around.  The owners, Robert and Melissa, promptly returned my calls/texts with any questions I had before the night of the booking. The fee for the evening was wonderfully priced compared to other companies I had called around and gotten quotes from.  I highly recommend Austin Nites Party Bus based on my experience with them.

reviews.author: Sybil E.
reviews.description: We rented a party bus from Robert for my brother's 30th birthday. They were one of the only companies I found that didn't increase their rates because of prom season. I called about 10 other companies looking for fun and safe travels with almost all of them being ridiculously overpriced to take advantage of the prom goers. Robert was very accommodating, professional, and had awesome rates. He called two days before the scheduled time of arrival to check in and verify everything was still good to go. He asked if there were any changes in the amount of people and offered a bigger bus just in case. Our drivers, Patrick and Joe were awesome! Patrick called me early the day of to verify everything and let me know he'd be there at 8 and then called again when they were almost to our pickup location. They arrived right on time with an awesome bus just for us. He had coolers with ice, a flat screen tv, music system, AC and even a bathroom in the back. What more could you ask for? Part of the evening was spent at Graham's Central Station in Pville. We didn't realize prior that Graham's doesn't serve food anymore and had to order pizza to the bus. Patrick gladly retrieved our pizza and brought it to us when it arrived. We all had a blast, felt safe and were taken care of. Highly recommend Austin NItes and shout out to Patty PartyWagon, if you had a Yelp page, I'd write a review for you too.

reviews.author: Ryan W.
reviews.description: WARNING: We had a tight deadline to get to Lake Travis and the bus driver was 30 minutes late.  We had to take another bus or risk missing our charter.  He verbally offered to refund my money for his tardiness and then kept my funds and would not return them.  Now I am fighting to get those funds back.  LOOK ELSEWHERE.

reviews.author: Shani S.
reviews.description: What a wonderful time!  As a bachelorette "day party," we gathered together and hopped in the super roomy and comfortable All About Central Texas SUV and headed out on our journey.   Kim is extremely knowledgeable about each winery; the history, the best wines to try, the "wine club" or other bonus things each winery has.   We stopped in on 3 different wineries and Kim had made superb choices in each spot; from the wines to the view to the suggestions on what to try and how to make the most of our samples so everyone could try as many as possible (thanks for that tip, Kim!).   Be it an afternoon with a group of friends, or a romantic day for two, All About Central Texas is an outstanding choice.  Thanks for everything, Kim!

reviews.author: Donna D.
reviews.description: All about Central Texas was really great- Kim was so knowledgeable about the area and had great info on wine and Texas! I did the Fredericksburg tour and based on my wine preferences she had some great suggestions on which ones to stop in, there are so many! I even joined a wine club, the tastings were informative and she is just a lot of fun and I didn't have to worry about driving or directions and could enjoy the pours and some snacks.  I highly recommend All abt Central Texas tours, they are personable, you can really get to meet the others in these small groups- Thanks so much!

reviews.author: Alan A.
reviews.description: Amazing tour, Michael was a great host. He was so attentive and helped in every way. The tour was flexible and very fun. The children, 4 and 9, were entertained also. Michael asked many questions as to ensure the experience was what we wanted. Great time thank you so much.  Alan A US Army Ret.

reviews.author: Sarita S.
reviews.description: This was a surprise bday gift and it didn't disappoint! Mike was awesome and friendly...took us to some really great spots and on gave us the grand tour through texas hill country! definitely the best way to go if you want to experience the best of the best! well done!!

reviews.author: Ana R.
reviews.description: Definitely recommend! From our initial inquiry to the tour itself they were so accommodating and flexible! I filled out an inquiry form and then was contacted right away. We booked a private tour for a couples trip. Alee was great in providing suggestions and making sure to fit what we wanted as part of the tour. We got to tour Hawk's Shadow, then had a tasting at Duchman and ended our tour with some delicious BBQ from Salt Lick, next to Salt Lick Cellars. Tom, our driver was so nice and flexible with our schedule. He reminded us of how much time we had but did not feel rushed at all. We'll definitely be booking Slowpokes for any future trips!

reviews.author: Ana K.
reviews.description: Amazing wine tour. Our group was small but it was perfect. Linda really took care of us and was so much fun. You really need to check it out if you are looking at wine tours.

reviews.author: Ashley G.
reviews.description: This was soooo much fun! We did this for a bachelorette party and we had a blast! Lindsey was our Tour Guide/Bus Driver/Photographer/DJ/New Bestie! She was AMAZING!!!! I would highly recommend this Tour! We did Deep Eddie, Last Stand Brewing Company and Treaty Oak!

reviews.author: Michelle G.
reviews.description: Linda was fantastic and this wine tour was great! I was with a bunch of rather rowdy girl friends and she was endlessly patient and took good care of us. We had a great time and I recommend this company!

reviews.author: Deryck Z.
reviews.description: Linda is the best!!!! We did a tour for a bachelorette party and it was prefect. The personal touch Linda added made it so wonderful. She provide a very nice lunch and snack trays. Everything about the tour went so smoothly and was planned our perfectly. We even were picked up at our rental house so no one had to drive after drinking. All the girls on the tour said they would defiantly do another tour with Slowpokes Wine Tours!

reviews.author: Julie S.
reviews.description: Great day with Lindsey as our driver and tour guide! Highly recommend them-very fun day for our mom and daughter's weekend!

reviews.author: Thu F.
reviews.description: We have an annual girls trip and decided on a tour with Slowpokes Wine Tours.  There was a total of 8 girls on the tour with a couple that was paired with us and we were the perfect group.  Linda was the best tour guide anyone can ask for.  Our group had a blast and the lunch was an added bonus on the tour!  She kept us informed along the way and gave us the best details of each winery/distillery that we visited.  Linda was very personable and every location we visited had its own special charm!  Thanks for an amazing tour Slowpokes Wine Tours.

reviews.author: Kathy F.
reviews.description: We enjoyed a wonderful day set up by Linda at Slowpokes.  After talking with her she designed a day that was diverse and showed us a number of new things in the Dripping Springs area.  Our day included several of the high country wineries, one brewery and a visit to the quaint town of Wimberly. We highly recommend this group over  other Austin wine tour groups as they create a very personalized day and made sure everyone enjoyed the stops.   Our day started with lunch at Homespuns in Dripping Springs - excellent start to a beautiful day!  The Bloody Marys are highly recommended.

reviews.author: Brit F.
reviews.description: We recently completed a bachelorette party tour with Lindsey as our tour guide and it was the BEST! Lindsey chose our wineries very wisely; we started with lunch at Crowson (whose owner will drop incredible knowledge on you), enjoyed a rainstorm and a glass of red at the beautiful Ron Yates, and ended with cheese and BOOOOM wine at Hye Meadow Winery. It was lovely day of booze, conversation, and sisterhood. And, yes, we loved Lindsey so much she became a part of our wolfpack. Lindsey was fun, energetic, and knowledgeable about the area. I would definitely do this tour again!

reviews.author: April D.
reviews.description: I decided to surprise my mom with a wine tasting tour for her 60th birthday. Linda went above and beyond to make this tour special. She made a wine bottle with me and my moms photo on it with a sweet birthday message and quote.  She took so many photos of us, and really made us feel special. We were able to choose our wineries and she even picked us up and dropped us off at our BNB. She had the most amazing tapas tray, with cheese, mixed nuts, her special dip, crackers, breads and meats. She had this prepared and sat out for us at Wimberly winery,  halfway through the tour. At the end of this stop, she even had cupcakes for my moms birthday. I had actually called around different wine tours in the area and Slow Poke Wine tours offered the best value and I can tell you now, the best service. We wouldn't hesitate to do it again. This trip with my mom was priceless and so special. I thank you Linda for making an amazing memory for my mom and I.

reviews.author: Amanda W.
reviews.description: We used Slowpokes tour for my bachelorette party, Linda was great, she picked us up at the door of our rental house and had a perfect day planned for us. We went to a beautiful winery to begin and enjoyed a lunch spread while there; then we went to a distillery with AMAZING frozen mint juleps, outdoor games and great scenic views; finally we ended at the olive oil and balsamic producer for more snacks and great wine. Linda was very attentive to us and did a great job of keeping us on schedule without rushing us, she picked us up around 10:30AM and we returned around 4:30PM. Hope to enjoy this tour again in the future, a very diverse experience that I think even the guys would enjoy!

reviews.author: Mandy L.
reviews.description: I recently went on a bachelorette party with 9 girls with Slowpokes Wine Tours. It was absolutely perfect. Linda was so sweet and incredibly helpful. We didn't have to worry about anything! As soon as Linda picked us up she took care of everything. We just walked in and started having fun. She went above and beyond to make our day perfect.

reviews.author: Jennifer S.
reviews.description: Wow!  What a fantastic time!  Linda was on time, knowledgeable, NICE, funny, and showered us with attention.  She had everything taken care of - all we had to do is get off the van, taste wines and get back on again for the next stop. What service!  I highly, highly recommend Slowpokes and will definitely be seeing Linda again!

reviews.author: Julie G.
reviews.description: I could have sworn I wrote a review on here prior, but I JUST WENT ON MY SECOND slowpoke wine tour and it was just as wonderful as the first.  While a small group, Linda and Dave do an outstanding job of making everyone feel comfortable, no matter what the group size.  This time we went to 3 different venues and what a great experience.  They don't miss any detail.  They make the day enjoyable and relaxing.  Looking for the best wine tour in the Hill Country?  Look no further.  Slowpokes is the tour to book!

reviews.author: Trey C.
reviews.description: I used Slowpokes Winery Tours to go on a Hill Country wine tour on the day I got engaged, and I could not have asked for a better experience.  My now fiance and I rode in the Model T Ford, which was all-original except for the brakes. I contacted Linda with any questions, concerns, and booking, and Linda picked up my fiance in a Mercedes van.  We went to a great breakfast, and then David drove us around in the Model T Ford. The route was scenic, breathe taking, and beautiful.  The wineries we stopped at were great, and, the customer service from Linda and David was unbeatable.  They have a unique business that is more than just a van or limo driving you around to distilleries, breweries, or wineries (although they also have a Mercedes van option).  I am now going on another tour with them for a bachelor party, and they could not have provided more prompt replies to my requests for information related to travel, pick up at different locations, types of tours they offer, and pricing.  What a great business run by some truly nice and professional people who offer very reasonable pricing.  I plan to use their services again in the future.

reviews.author: Debbi R.
reviews.description: A Full and Wonderful Day   Our tour with Dale was fabulous. I wasn't sure what to expect, but it didn't take long to realize that not only is Dale a great tour guide, he's also a very personable and knowledgable man who makes you feel like an old friend.   The points of interest were superb and the last stop we made provided one of the best meals I've had in my life and most likely the best ribeye ever.   The day lasted longer than expected, but it was a wonderful day and ended up being just perfect. We are planning to use his rental venue for a retreat in the coming months and looking forward to it. I highly recommend his services.

reviews.author: Jaylan B.
reviews.description: First I would like to start with the facts.  1. We booked this tour months ago but unfortunately had to reschedule to a later date. (due to Covid19) This was not an issue for anyone attending the tour and the company got all $2800 paid for in full. 2. Yes $2800. We had 28 people in our group, It required two buses that were at their max capacity.  3. I would give a HUGE ZERO if I could.   The buses arrived at the pick up location 25 minutes early and expected us (all 28) to load up. Not all 28 people were even there yet. The male driver already seemed annoyed at this point.  We ended up pulling out at the agreed on time. When trying to leave the 2nd winery we couldn't. The drivers HAD LEFT and weren't there to pick us up. We waited outside in the sun outside for 30 minutes before they even got back.  But that unfortunately is not why I am writing this review   As we were loading the bus to go home the male driver said that would be charging us for a cleaning fee ($300) because someone spilt something on the floorboard. Pretty steep for a small spill that could be wiped up with a Clorox wipe but she agreed to pay it she sat down. Comments started to be exchanged about the steep fee and how the day had been complete chaos up until this point. The man began to get pretty heated and slammed the door. When he opened the door to his seat he said "who the f**k spilt something in my seat." Nobody had spilled something on his seat. Upon looking at the "spill" it appeared to be sweat from Him. He continued to cuss and yell and eventually told us to "get off his bus." We all piled off and the other bus also unloaded.  Now it is important to note the other driver said we didn't do anything wrong and that she didn't agree with how he was handling things. He told her he was in charge and that he would make the call. She became quiet after that. They ultimately left us there to find our own rides.  The male driver was rude and didn't speak unless spoken to the entire day. A beautiful day with amazing company was RUINED by this company and I will not recommend them to anyone!

reviews.author: Stacy L.
reviews.description: I booked a birthday trip for 6 people, hoping to add 2 more. Dale told me I could book the trip for 6 and then add the 2. When I called to add the 2 he told me he would have to see if that was even possible. I didn't understand why after he assured me it would be fine and a sprinter van hold more than that. He had given the sprinter van to a larger crowd and downgraded us to an SUV without asking me (same price). I asked him when I would hear back and he said whenever he located another vehicle. I made some calls and found a better business who really wanted to host me and our guests. I called again to cancel with Dale and was told I am not the type of customer he would want. I guess a customer who wants to pay more money to add more people isn't good... very strange. Talking to a woman like that is not ok. I hope that he was having a bad few days and that he doesn't always behave like this, but I was really shocked how rude and unprofessional he was. Pros: I got my money back.

reviews.author: Blair B.
reviews.description: The owner/driver we had was terribly rude and very unprofessional. He only spoke when spoken to and when he did talk he seemed annoyed.  Do not waste your money on this company! I've had Uber drivers converse more than this "tour guide."  Worst experience ever by far!

reviews.author: Susan G.
reviews.description: Rick was AMAZING! He is the guide with the mostest - a gentleman with a servant's heart, excellent taste in wineries, and a plethora of knowledge about this  beautiful TX region. He is truly one-of-a-kind and I'm so glad we took this tour with him. Thanks, Rick - see you again soon!

reviews.author: Marcia H.
reviews.description: We were celebrating our wedding anniversary. The tour was nice. The driver was great! We visited some interesting wineries. Seeing the Texas wine country off the beaten path was well worth it. We would use this company again.

reviews.author: Doug E.
reviews.description: We had a great time.  Well worth the money our driver Laura was great.  She was helpful and was happy to be there.  When I do this again I won't change anything.  I would use the same driver and tour service.

reviews.author: Amanda G J.
reviews.description: One of the WORST experiences I have ever had with a "wine tour" company. I have been on many wine tours in my days, across different parts of Texas, and their unprofessionalism and lack of customer service and just blatant disrespect was appalling.  This "wine tour" had a total of two buses and a party consisting of 28 people. A group of people that I have known for years that have the utmost of respect and common courtesy for any company that they hire or work with.  From the start of our experience, both drivers were incredibly rude and unfriendly. The bus lacked any amenities one would think this "Premier Hill Country Wine Tasting Experience" would consist of.  The first winery. * We arrived at the first winery at 10:48am to learn that the winery doesn't even open until 11:00am and that they WEREN'T expecting us at all... * Not the wineries fault. They were fantastic.  The second winery. * Again, wasn't expecting us, causing us to have to sit at a tent down a road from the winery. Again, not the wineries fault, they handled it incredibly. * When trying to leave the second winery, we couldn't. The drivers HAD LEFT and weren't there to pick us up. We waited outside in the sun outside for 30 minutes before they even got back.  The third winery. * As we were loading the bus to go home, the male driver said that they would be charging us for a cleaning fee ($300) because someone spilled something on the floorboard. Pretty steep for a small spill that could be wiped up with a Clorox wipe, but she agreed to pay it. (*To clarify, open containers were allowed as stated on their website: "Consumption of alcohol on the bus is allowed unless there are minors present.") Minor spills like this are inevitable when providing a service as they do. Comments started to be exchanged about the steep fee and how the day had been complete chaos up until this point. The man began to get pretty heated and slammed the door. When he opened the door to his seat he said "who the f**k spilt something in my seat." Nobody had spilled something on his seat. Upon looking at the "spill" it appeared to be sweat from him. He continued to cuss and yell and eventually told us to "get off his bus." We all piled off, and the other bus also unloaded.  I know these times are hard, especially for small and locally owned businesses, and by no means and am I trying to make it harder for them; in fact, I am going above and beyond to support them. After yesterday, I do think that they need to take a step back and re-evaluate their actions and really think long and hard about what they do and why they do it. In the end, when providing a service, the client always comes first.

reviews.author: Tiffany H.
reviews.description: This could not have been a better day! We highly recommend touring with Heart of Texas Wine Tours. We were so lucky to have found Dale Fortenberry. He is so knowledgeable about the area, the history and the vineyards. Dale went out of this way to accommodate the entire group of women with different tastes in wine. We all know that is not an easy feat, but he did it! Our next trip to the hill country will find us taking another exciting tour with Dale.  -Tiffany Raye

reviews.author: Christi C.
reviews.description: Absolutely best experience from beginning to end!   From ease of scheduling, picking us up on door step, and bringing us back, worry free.    Our driver Rick was great!  Shared info and answered all of our questions about the area.   He escorted us in to reserved tables at each location, pampered us all day!    Already planning our next trip with www.HeartOfTexasWineTours.com!  Thank you, Christi

reviews.author: Matthew V.
reviews.description: My girlfriend and I had a fantastic time on this tour. To be honest, the cost seemed a bit high at first but having never been on a wine tour before and I really had no idea. Afterward I realize it was worth every bit of it. Dale picked us up at our BnB along with everyone else on the tour that day and we were off to the first tasting.  He seem to know everyone along the tour and at each place they were very welcoming and grateful to have our group. It really was a fun time and we had the chance to try many different wines that we would not have normally picked.  Lucky for us it was a beautiful day and everything was just perfect. I would definitely recommend this tour to anyone interested in checking out some Texas wines, for a nice weekend getaway, or just to try something different.  It definitely helped that we had a good group of people who were also on the tour that day as well. It was a blast...I just wish we had taken more pictures.

reviews.author: Amy W.
reviews.description: Heads up - I'm only giving this one star so I can write a review. It would get a huge ZERO if I could rate it that way. First off, Dale is a pretentious, "underpaid monkey" as he likes to be called. He is rude, unprofessional, and has the audacity to 'hate mail' potential clients and I know I'm not the first one because I've seen the reviews! I don't have much else to say but be careful and do your research before spending any money on this place! The owner seems to not have a care in the world if it's not benefitting him. Also, be ready for rude phone calls and emails from Dale if he doesn't get his way. He was hard to get ahold of from the jump, not to mention I live out of town and couldn't wait for days in between responses. After not being able to make it to my appointment because he had failed to get back to me promptly, I proceeded on with my day. The next morning I wake up to the most rude, despicable email I've ever received. Just be careful and read reviews because from what I've read, if you want a beautiful wedding with NICE, FRIENDLY people, this isn't the place. I'll attach one of many emails. STAY AWAY FROM THE HEART OF TEXAS RANCH ALL TOGETHER!!!

reviews.author: Melody G.
reviews.description: Amazing time with a group of 7 of us girls. Our guide was Christy and she was outgoing and made us all feel like nothing was a bother for her. Picked us up at our hotel in Fredericksburg, went to pick up lunch, and then on to first of 4 wineries. She took care of everything. Even loaded up our bottles/goodies in the back of the bus and kept the AC on to keep it all cool.  Christy went above and beyond to keep everything organized, she set up our lunch, picked up our trash, offered to take us anywhere we wanted to go, and she kept us on time to all of our tastings. We bought a bottle of wine at the 3rd winery and drank in the bus on the way to the 4th. Lunch was a boxed lunch bought at local deli (very good). Everything was included. Everything was professional. The bus was large and comfy. Highly recommend this tour company!

reviews.author: Valarie M.
reviews.description: Dale was great getting everything organized and keeping us on track - and then also helping us change the schedule when we needed to.  very accommodating.  thanks Dale! you were a great host!

reviews.author: Erin K.
reviews.description: We had a great time on this wine tour celebrating my sister's bachelorette party. Dale was very prompt and polite returning my phone calls. He was also very accommodating as the number of girls going on the tour changed at the last minute. We went to Fat Ass, Six Shooter and Fiesta Vineyards which were a blast and everyone enjoyed the tastings. Our driver Rick was funny and a true gentleman. It was raining that day and he had an umbrella to escort everyone in and out of the tasting rooms so no one got soaked. One of the girls left their phone on the tour bus and Rick came back later that evening to return the phone even after we offered to meet him half way. We had a great time and would recommend this tour to anyone!

reviews.author: Tory H.
reviews.description: What a fun and relaxing time! The tour bus was very spacious and clean and the driver was very accommodating. The tour was carefully selected for us with every winery being better than the last! I cant wait to take another tour.

reviews.author: Keith R.
reviews.description: We paid nearly four hundred dollars and it was a joke. What was supposed to be a winery tour was a tour of places that sold wine. We went to a store in downtown marble falls, an art studio, a grocery store and at the very end an actual winery. This constituted our day.   This is NOT a day of going to wineries in the hill country. Everyone was disappointed on Valentine's day.   The guy who led the tour was nice but they clearly got kickbacks where we went.   When we went to lunch no one got their order and right when we were leaving this sandwich shop the tour guide asked, "everyone went to the tasting room, right?" We're talking about a sandwich place being a stop on the wine tour people.   Horribly disappointed. Considering tastings were at most $10 for each of the four "wineries" we went to, it was a rip off in value.  The company clearly avoided going to respectable wineries and instead went to dead end places where they could maximize their profit margin.   Avoid at all costs!!

reviews.author: Kat S.
reviews.description: We had a great time on this wine tour. I booked it only two days in advance and they took great care of us. I told Dale our tastes in wine and he sent us to three great wineries. We had the bus all to ourselves too! I would definitely use them again and recommend this company for all your wine touring needs!

reviews.author: Monica P.
reviews.description: Dale is great!! He helped us find some Texas wines that we actually like! We went to a few places I never would have thought to stop by and helped us pick out some good wines to try. He kept the ride fun even though we were with 2 other groups of people we didn't know. The van was comfy and well air conditioned and stocked with bottled water. Would definitely recommend!

reviews.author: Dawn N.
reviews.description: Even a rainy day couldn't dampen the amazing experience the Heart of Texas Wine Tours provided.  We visited four wineries and were treated like VIPs due to Dale's wonderful rapport with vineyard owners and staff.  Dale's knowledge of wine and  the specialities and uniqueness of each winery made the tour interesting and fun.  By the end of the day, I had not only made new memories, but new friends too!

name: Yellow Rose of Texas Wine Tours

reviews.author: Patti A.
reviews.description: Everything was great!  John, the owner was super cool.

reviews.author: Sara M.
reviews.description: This business is run by a single creep who deceives his clients and thinks he can because it's "his business", even though what was PAID for was denied to us. He is running the business with very unprofessional interactions with his customers and partnering wineries. I would NOT recommend using this company.

reviews.author: Morgan M.
reviews.description: I booked Yellow Rose 1 month out and had great communication with John, the owner. He ended up being our driver on our own private bus for a 40th birthday trip with 4 crazy girls. He was at our beck and call and did not complain once. We had 3 wine tour stops and then Luckenbach, and it was soooo fun!  All 3 places were each different than the other which gave us a great variety. Thank you John for a wonderful time!

reviews.author: M W.
reviews.description: Our group had a fabulous day with John at Yellow Rose Wine Tours!! It was so relaxing to sit back and enjoy the day with friends, all while knowing every detail had been taken care of.  This coming from a very "type A" personality is a huge 5 star! We did the "red rose" package, touring 3 wineries and had a few hours in Luckenbach.  John was friendly, fun and a great host. All we had to do is drink wine, visit with friends and enjoy the day! If you are looking for a fun experience, try Yellow Rose! We will be back next year to do it all over again!

reviews.author: Sasha F.
reviews.description: Do not use this "tour"!! It is cheaper to pay the tasting fees and hire your own driver. The owner is greedy and a complete A. We originally had 5 ladies who were going on the tour with us and one backed out. We didn't ask for a private tour and John (who I'm guessing is the owner) didn't tell us until we were already at the first location that he would stop the tour until we paid for a fifth person that wasn't there. No wonder he kept pushing cash, it was a complete rip off. It was either go home after that tour paying $125 a person..Or have two more tours while paying for a person who wasn't there. PS it's about $15 for the wine tastings. ($15x3=$45) It was not worth it. On a positive note, Gary at Hanhe Estates winery was amazing. Highly recommend this guy and his wine.

reviews.author: Michaela S.
reviews.description: A couple friends and I decided to go on the White Rose package and had a blast. We visited 2 wineries, a distillery, and a brewery. Our driver, John, was great. He made our experience in the Hill Country one to remember. He was very friendly and kept us on schedule without making us feel rushed. Overall we had a great day and would definitely book again!

reviews.author: Tiffany K.
reviews.description: We were very pleased with John our driver and Cindy's understanding of the wineries.  John helped us learn more about the area and really did a great job accommodating everyone.  Some of us picked up lunch and we ate it at the Fat Ass winery which I would highly recommend. Water was provided and the options at each winery covered all tastes.

reviews.author: Jordan H.
reviews.description: "Tour" is an awfully strong word. We were picked up and then drove for 45 minutes without our driver, John, saying a word about where we were going or how long it would take to get there. He then picked up 3 other people when it was supposed to be a private tour. He took us to the wineries but never said a word about where to go or what to do. He followed us around at the wineries and sat with us. He was 30 minutes late then forgot what the schedule was supposed to be and tried to keep us at the 2nd winery until 30 minutes after we were supposed to be home. He told us we could pay with cash or card, but he only actually took cash or PayPal, which put some people in a real bind. He hounded us about payment the whole time. It was awful and we will never do it again.

reviews.author: Kalena B.
reviews.description: This tour was amazing! I went with a bachelorette party and we had a lot of fun. Our tour guide was Brandon and he made sure that we were great. We got to play our own music on the ride from Austin and he picked amazing Texas barbecue for our lunch. Every winery we went to was delicious. I would highly recommend it to anyone!

reviews.author: Courtney H.
reviews.description: We had a great experience! We booked on short notice, but had a great time, and Brandon was very accommodating of our last minute trip. Come hungry on your tour because the barbecue lunch provided was spectacular! We were appreciative that Brandon was flexible with our tour schedule and ensured that we had a phenomenal time while on our tour! The tour had a nice mix of small, quaint wineries with an individualized experience, as well as more popular spots with an equally enjoyable guest experience.

reviews.author: Candy B.
reviews.description: Brayden and Deb are an amazing duo. Very personable and easy to work with. They aim to exceed your wildest wine tour expectations! The transportation (van) was very clean and well-taken care of. We had the van to ourselves on the couple's tour but it can easily fit a big party!  Booking a couple's wine tour on their website was super easy (and I'm sure it would be for big groups too)! The date availability, cost estimate, and customizability is spot-on. The moment you book, they send you a comprehensive list of wineries and distilleries (!!!) with rankings of the view + wine. They also have great options for add-ons, such as a charcuterie board or stopping by for lunch mid-wine tour. Love that.  There's no doubt I would choose and recommend 830 Elevated again for any future wine excursions in Hill Country. Thanks again, Brayden and Deb :)

reviews.author: Emily H.
reviews.description: WOW....Just WOW!!!!  We had so much fun celebrating my sisters bachelorette weekend in Fredericksburg and 830 Elevated Wine Tours exceeded all of our expectations!!!  Deb (co-owner and our tour guide) was absolutely AMAZING and she made sure that we had everything we needed!!!  Seriously can't wait to book again next time we are in Fredericksburg and we have already decided it needs to be a yearly trip for us!   They were so informative and helpful with picking out which vineyards would be best for us and answered all of my questions quickly and with helpful details and suggestions!!

reviews.author: Viviana V.
reviews.description: 840 were so easy to work with from website to actual tour. We had the most courteous tour guide Brandon! He was a gem and treated us well! Will book with them again!

reviews.author: Nicole Y.
reviews.description: We had the absolute BEST time with Brayden on our tour. From start to finish everything was so easy and customizable to what we were looking for while planning our annual girls trip. Prices are incomparable with Five Star treatment on a PRIVATE tour. Right after booking we got an email with a list of the area wineries and restaurants that had notes and ratings so we could choose where we wanted to go. This is a private tour so Brayden picked us up right in front of our Airbnb and we were off. We toured four wineries and he kept us on schedule but never rushing us. After the tours we opted for the night service so he dropped us off on Main Street so we could grab dinner, sing some karaoke and when ready to be picked up to end the evening just had to shoot him a text and he was there. We just cannot say enough good things about this company. Do not second guess - book with Brayden and Deb

reviews.author: Kim M.
reviews.description: Brayden and Deb did a FANTASTIC job hosting our small girls group! They offer private tours for the same price most other charge to fill up a limo or bus. They were on time and very accommodating, went as far as going to buy a stool for my friend who has trouble getting up and down the steps to the van. The wineries they took us to were exactly what we asked for. We never felt rushed and they handled everything for us and we never had to lift a finger to do anything. I would 100% recommend them and will definitely be using them again!

reviews.author: Laura H.
reviews.description: I came across 830 when our bed and breakfast cancelled our room and wine tour reservation (due to remodeling) a month before our 10 year anniversary trip to Fredericksburg. I believe they were on the city website as a recommended tour, but also Google directed me to them. Either way, I am so glad it happened this way - our experience with 830 was indeed elevated!!! The customized tour that Deb set up with me over the phone was exactly what my husband and I wanted - a distillery, a brewery, and a winery that made you feel like you were in Napa. Without even knowing us, Deb helped picked the perfect places for us to enjoy. Communication up until the tour and the day of the tour was prompt and courteous, always with our best intentions in mind (example: Deb texted us and offered to pick us up even earlier than planned due to the heat at one of the outdoor locations). The drive in between locations was full of great conversation, and we were thankful they provided cold water for us. The van was immaculate and the drive was very comfortable - I didn't know the luxury that a private vs public tour would offer! Deb was so knowledgeable (she's a local, of course!) and so sweet with helping us newbies figure out what to do. Her service went above and beyond, and she made us feel like celebrities. It was an absolute pleasure to work with them - do yourself the best favor and book with them!!

reviews.author: Kristin D.
reviews.description: We had a group of 10 girls book a wine tour through 830 Elevated this past weekend, and I could not more highly recommend this company!! They made the trip so easy, worry-free, and fun! Brayden and Deb were super communicative and gave us a wide variety of wineries to choose from. We ended up going to Baron's Creek, Signor, and Augusta Vin. Deb was our tour guide and took care of absolutely everything and was such a joy to be around. If you are headed to Fredericksburg and wanting to visit the wineries, you won't regret choosing to book through 830 Elevated!!

reviews.author: Kristen W.
reviews.description: We toured Fredericksburg with Brayden and he was very friendly, knowledgeable, and flexible with our requests. We were able to customize our winery stops which was not the experience we had previously with a different wine tour company. We spent the day with our group of four instead of getting shuttled around with strangers to fill seats (which I really prefer)! We requested a charcuterie board in the vehicle and Brayden picked it up while we were at one of our stops. We will definitely be back and use 830 Elevated for all of our future trips!

reviews.author: Pierre P.
reviews.description: Brayden and Deb were amazing! We will for sure book with them in the future. They made the whole wine touring and tasting experience so easy. Great conversations and excellent customer service. If you are going to go Wine Tasting in Fredericksburg, BOOK WITH THEM!

reviews.author: Amanda P.
reviews.description: My friends planned a bachelorette weekend for me that included the wine tour with 830 wine tours. We had such a blast and everything was above and beyond our expectations! Each stop was beautiful and the tastings were great! This was the highlight Of our trip! The owners are super nice and accommodated all of our requests and even had good suggestions for things to do and place to eat! We absolutely love them!! Can't wait to go back!

reviews.author: Jonathan Y.
reviews.description: I like their hustle. Wife and I wanted a private custom tour (because COVID). But the best we could find was a limo driver that would charge us almost what it would for 4 people. Then we found 830 Elevated. They're filling a niche most tour companies aren't by providing an affordable private tour option for couples. They were great. Small, young company. They don't have deep knowledge on wine like veteran companies but they are personable in that they also tour wineries themselves and can share their inputs.

reviews.author: Casey C.
reviews.description: The worst experience. Here's my story-   I booked with this company over a month in advance prior to my trip to Fredericksburg for my fianc and I's anniversary, as well as his birthday. After booking, the company was very communicative for the first few days. After the first few days, I did not hear a word from them until the week of our trip. I had told them a month in advance which places we wanted to go. The week of, they inform us that Augusta vin is not taking people for reservations. Which was fine, we went ahead with the other vineyard they had suggested. We had booked for a Saturday. That Friday at 3:00AM, they had informed us of a change of driver due to a family emergency which we completely understood, and now that our pickup time had changed to 11:30AM instead of 1:30PM. I wake up to that email Saturday still understanding, and we changed our plans to be at the pickup destination by 11:30AM. We are waiting there over 15 minutes for them to show, and no one does. We call, leave voicemails, and still hear from no one. 30 minutes passed, they send a TEXT MESSAGE informing us they aren't showing up for the entire time and that we are on our own for the entire day. LEAVING OUR PLANS FOR THE ENTIRE DAY RUINED. Incredibly horrid communication from this company. DO NOT BOOK WITH THIS COMPANY!!!! I seriously am understanding that situations happen in life, but they had guaranteed us a driver for the day regardless of what had happened. I was truly heartbroken to have not received a personal phone call from the company, instead they just send us a text that they are not coming. I have NEVER written a review for a company before, but this needed to be shared. We discussed the situation with multiple locals in the town, no one had ever heard of this company. Whatever you do, save your money and time.

reviews.author: Sara B.
reviews.description: 've been to places like this before (but for primarily beer rather than wine), and I love the setup - it's super fun. You get a card that's tied to your credit card to swipe or tap and then you have access to the wine you swiped for. Then you can get as much or as little as you want. It's a great way to try and explore new wines (and mead and some margarita inspired wines). Then you can load up on your favorite (what I did), or continue exploring. Really, two great options. Also, the guy working there was nice and very helpful. I've been telling people about how much I enjoyed coming here and recommending it.  Don't park in the paid parking next to Wanderlust if you can avoid it because it's stupidly expensive. Use that money on a Lyft or more wine.

reviews.author: Hillary S.
reviews.description: What I love: the music + aesthetic + the location    What I could live without: the flies + the prices + the customer service   I came on a Tuesday and it was incredibly empty. Like, I was thee only soul inside the establishment from 5pm-7pm. As a patron and especially a first timer, you'd think they'd have a little leniency if you order a 8oz of wine and ask to exchange. I understand you can taste your pours, which I paid for at least 5 of them averaging $2-$3 for each TASTE. After my fourth taste, I wanted to trust that I was getting a good one because most of them were and I promise to god it was the worst taste to my palette that I've ever had. And Lissen Linda, I'm not a bougie wine person. But for this 8oglass to be $15 I couldn't even stomach it and asked if possible to exchange. I said, "what's the policy if you get a wine that you absolutely can not stomach? Is that your own bad?"  She said, "yeah kinda. I'll call the manager but he's at another location"   Okay cool. 15 minutes later I find her and I'm like, "so can I exchange this wine or no? I don't need a refund"   "He said no"  I work in the service industry as well and look out for people all the time. I just feel like she OR the manager could have made an accommodation but maybe operationally that's not the way they run things. That's my bad for not tasting the nasty ass wine. That particular 1 oz pour was like $4 so I assumed it was good to be so pricy.   .

reviews.author: Yanira D.
reviews.description: Came in to buy a bottle of wine, bartender came from the back and did not greet us and told us "we're closed" although it was 9:25 and they close at 10pm on Sundays   I recommend updating the hours if you're going to close over half an hour earlier than listed

reviews.author: Cambrea D.
reviews.description: Me and my husband love coming here for date nights. A delicious and wide range of wine selections ! And a fun, unique vibe and friendly staff.

reviews.author: Loren T.
reviews.description: Visiting from St. Louis and looked up wine bars in the area and this one popped up. LOVED IT! The whole concept is awesome. Went to the 2nd location the following day and played Wine bingo and won. Inexpensive, great atmosphere and fun time.

reviews.author: Suzy D.
reviews.description: Fun idea and great indoor and outdoor seating. Some of the wines were meh but some gems! Took a few 1oz pours to find my go-to  - but it's like a fun slot machine. Go during HH for 30% off. Park under the i-35 bridge across the road for free parking during most of the day - read the signs to confirm hours (but parking outside the building is $10/2 hours all the time).

reviews.author: Chastitie A.
reviews.description: Okay, this place is super cool!  If you're into wine, and good vibes without having to feel so fancy... please come here! 56 different wines on tap. Cute inside decor with so much local art, and a bad ass patio in the back with a food truck that serves authentic Italian food! The food truck owner was extremely personable and kind! He even gave us the breakdown of the different methods of how to cook pasta in all regions of Italy.   FYI, even though this is downtown, there is a private parking lot.

reviews.author: Katie M.
reviews.description: Came, drank, conquered (ok stretch on that last one)  We came for the Yelp elite event and tasted our heart out! The original location off 35 is so so cute the moment you walk in. I will say the location at first struck me as odd - but the moment you walk through the doors you are transported into this little artsy wine oasis.   The wines on tap are so fun to browse and the wall art is so Austin it makes you think you can buy them (i mean maybe you can?!). The seating is ample indoor AND a outdoor to give you any desired vibe. Will absolutely be back!

reviews.author: Diana G.
reviews.description: Found this place by chance. Stopped since we saw it served wine. We were happy to see that it was a serve your own wine type of place. Wine on tap is such a great idea.   They give you a card that you use to get your wine. You get charged by the ounce. They do have happy hour. They have a good selection of wines. For those that don't like wine, they have a handful options (margarita, old fashioned)   The place is cute and they have a nice outdoor patio. They had a food truck the day we went.   Con:  - the wine comes out pretty fast, so you have to be careful as it can add up quick. If you want to taste first, be quick at closing it.  - there's no way to figure out how many ounces you are serving yourself.

reviews.author: Kacy L.
reviews.description: This is like no place I've ever been before, so you go in a pay by ounce for wine selected by you. Grab a glass and get to tasting. Not sure if there is some place like this in Dallas, but there should be. Absolutely amazing experience and beautiful atmosphere for you instagrammers.

reviews.author: Heather B.
reviews.description: From the moment we walked in we felt welcome! They were very friendly showing us how the process works. You could tell they were glad we were new. They truly have great enthusiasm for their jobs and this business. A new product even arrived and we were informed we came at a terrific time!   It was so easy to tap my Wanderlust card and release the wine. There's a great variety of wines to choose from, including wines from France, Spain, some sangrias and hard lemonade. Warning: make sure all the taps are closed before you insert your card. I didn't see that one was turned a bit and wine started trickling and money ringing up on my card. Because it's not very bright, I didn't see the wine flowing. Lesson learned!   There's an interesting room off the patio for private events. I'm jealous I couldn't pop in!   Happy to see the food truck. Mmm: truffle fries and bruschetta!  You MUST come visit this location!

reviews.author: Christina V.
reviews.description: I love a serve yourself wine bar! Wanderlust charges by the ounce and although it adds up pretty quickly, if you're able to pace yourself, you can have a whole evening of fun. I got out of there spending well under $50 for two people, so we really didn't go all that crazy.  Try a million different wines and mixed drinks! they give you a card at the entrance and it just rings up your total, then they charge you on the way out. We had an issue with a bunch of cork settling into one of our glasses and they were able to remove that pour from our tab. The only thing is that it's hard to keep track of your favorite pours because there are so many options.  There is also a ton of space to sit. They have inside seating/lounge tables, there is outdoor seating and there's also an additional event space which you can sit in. We sat in the event space with a large group and it was so comfy. I would love to return!

reviews.author: Xiao Z.
reviews.description: Have been here for the elite event and saved this great place to hang out with friends. We went there for some wine and found out that they also have a food truck in the backyard serving cheese board. Perfect! We had a great night talking and enjoyed the drink with snacks!

reviews.author: Kerri M.
reviews.description: I love the wine on tap concept and enjoyed choosing between all of the different wines at Wanderlust! When you walk in, they give you a separate card that you swipe before each one of your pours. I liked it because you could pour as much or as little as you wanted and it gave you the opportunity to try different wines without being committed to a full glass. Honestly, it reminded me of those self-serve frozen yogurt places. I also really liked the outdoor area - it was a great place to hang out with friends and we had a great time taking photos at the photo booth.  The only downside was that it was more expensive than I was expecting. They give you the price per ounce on the screen, but once you start pouring, it adds up VERY quickly. I could have spent the same amount of money on a way nicer and fuller glass of wine.  Overall, I enjoyed the concept and fun vibes. Would love to come back during their happy hour or something when things are half-priced!

reviews.author: Daniel S.
reviews.description: What a cool little concept and space to drink wine in downtown Austin. Came here during happy hour last weekend with some friends and was overall impressed with the wine tasting here. There whole gimmick is you you can try any of the wines on the wall tap and your charged by the ounces you drink. I will warn you use a light touch on the taps as I learned the hard way the first try. Most of the wines were half off during happy hour which makes for a great deal and I also liked that there was a range of wines from across the globe and wasn't specific to one region. They also had patio seating an Italian food truck in case you get hungry. The only downside like most places downtown is the parking but I heard that's less of an issue at their east side location which I'm excited to try next!

reviews.author: Courtney S.
reviews.description: What a fun place! It's not every day you come across a place with wines on tap. Wanderlust has so many options of all different kinds of wine. Red blends, dry white blends, bubbly, mead, etc. You name it, they have it!  When you arrive they swipe your card and give you another card, something like a hotel key card. You use this key card and swipe it before each self serve wine glass pour. The screen next to the tap will show you how many ounces you've filled up your glass and how much for the whole glass. The screen also shows how much each ounce of wine costs. Maybe I'm getting old and outdated but this was some cool technology! Probably the coolest, unique payment system I've ever seen!   There is a food truck on site with some seriously good pasta and appetizer types.   I can't speak to the parking situation since I walked from my location but I do believe there was a small parking lot.

reviews.author: Matthew W.
reviews.description: Wanderlust is an ATX gem for sure. They have outstanding service and a great wine selection. I also really like their cocktails on tap, especially the lemonade seltzer that they have. Every time I have come in, Blake has always provided excellent customer service and understanding of the wine offerings. Overall, I will be back many more times to this place for their superb wine and service!  2 pro tips: Come in on Wednesdays for half off and make sure to try heal of the boot food truck.

reviews.author: Maurice H.
reviews.description: Great atmosphere and great wine!! My go to on Wednesday's and any other day I want some good wine. The live performances makes my night I swear. If you're in the city and want some good wine, want to vibe with cool ppl and bob your head to some good music just stop by and grab your wanderlust card.

reviews.author: Mark A.
reviews.description: "Froyo for wine"; Fun idea, smooth process, nice spot, bit pricey.   It's a charge by oz place, like Froyo with all of the taps requiring an RFID card that you get by associating with a credit card at the front desk. Place the card on the reader and pour what you want into your glass. They have over 50 different styles, including mead, white, red, dry/sweet, and some wine-based cocktail style drinks.  They typically range from $1-3+ per oz so you'll probably come out with a $5-10 glass (4 oz) which is pretty comparable to most places.  There is both indoor and outdoor seating; interior is mostly couch seating and outdoor is patio/bench with faux grass. You can also bring dogs. The outdoor is a bit noisy, especially since it backs to another bar and is right under 35 so it was nicer indoors than out.  I don't usually drink wine because it gives me headaches and I certainly felt it the next day even after just 2 small glasses; possibly because of tasting so many different kind, so beware! Nice for trying something new but possible to get sick if you're mixing so much.

reviews.author: Courtney B.
reviews.description: Stopped into this downtown location after already visiting the location on Shady ln earlier in the week. I definitely enjoyed both locations for different reasons. I appreciate the way the wines are labeled in clear groupings so it's easier to just walk up and find what I'm wanting more quickly. They also have an Italian food truck in the back patio area. The truffle Parmesan fries were great and the pasta dish was a good portion. Lots of cute photo ops and decent areas of seating. I will say this location is much smaller and literally off the busy highway but still the experience they offer is worth checking out.

reviews.author: Nicolle M.
reviews.description: I really enjoy this Winery. They source grapes from California and Texas, but stick to what grapes from those regions do best. My favorite was their Russian River Valley Pinot and they had a special white from the green valley sub appellation I LOVED.   The tasting room is down to earth and simple- and expect a drop in by the owner! Great wines, friendly crew- recommend for the wine lover.

reviews.author: Melanie B.
reviews.description: Been wanting to check this place out for awhile now. Very close to our house in town and needed a nice Texas bottle of wine for a charcuterie board night.  Made reservations for 2... Very specific time slots available. We were arriving a tad early so I called first to make sure that was indeed ok and I actually got a call service... they weren't on site and first told me that they take walk ins and it was cool.... then he stopped me before hanging up telling me no... reservations required... he couldn't figure it out and didn't have access to the winery to check... that was odd. Walked in and got right in to a different table then I reserved since we were early.  You will feel like you're walking into a house.... lots of pictures and decor everywhere.... they are not minimalists :) Sat down and Ami took excellent care of us with the wine tastings and a couple snacks. We ended up grabbing a bottle of our favorite to go.  We were there for an hour. Felt kind of rushed. The owner was walking around the whole time we were there with an ipad scanning the room and tables... it kind of ruined the chill experience...  loved the nice friendly folks that were there drinking with their dogs... music in the background was nice. The wines were tasty too and Ami was super knowledgeable about them all. She was the best part of our time there.  I prefer outdoor wineries. There are no windows and it's all indoors in a strip center. I am very sensitive to floral air fresheners and strong chemical cleaners and they definitely use both. A lady was walking around spraying windex after people left very close to us and it was so strong it retuned the wine tasting experience trying to navigate the smell and taste the wine....  Overall the wines were good and the people were nice...  Windex spraying, calling a hot line instead of winery and Ipad guy walking around the whole time wasn't for me...  I like laid back relax and stay as long as you choose atmospheres with no strong cleaning smells while drinking wine. The bathroom is also very strong.... extremely blue toilet water... and fragrances... Doesn't mix well with food and wine..  Loved all the dogs and pics of dogs!  Ami gets 10 stars!!!

reviews.author: Sara J.
reviews.description: Ok yes, this is in a "warehouse" "strip mall" kind of exterior... HOWEVER, Once you walk in, you forget! It's so very welcoming and cozy...and the WINE! I've been to plenty of wine tastings that I had to figure out one I liked. This dilemma was figuring out if there was one I didn't like. My friends all agreed, and we actually tried to figure out if we could get another time slot reservation because we enjoy ourselves that much. The staff were so welcoming and checked on us often enough but not too often. There were snack options, and apparently on the weekends they try to offer food specials if you come hungry. We really enjoyed ourselves and look forward to next time.

reviews.author: Viviana M.
reviews.description: Family owned and operated the atmosphere was really sweet with pictures of the family hung on the walls. If you're a Cowboys fan reserve the Cowboys table. At my tasting favorite was the 2018 Chardonnay. If you try Bent Oak you will not regret it so check it out! Joanne and Bryan were the best hosts.

reviews.author: Dan G.
reviews.description: what a fabulous find on our trip in and around Austin!  The owner was delightful and the staff was fantastic!  Amie poured various wines and gave a complete history of how they were grown along with what to expect when tasting them.  She also shared with us stories about how she went to college for making wine and growing grapes which was fascinating. An added benefit was that they serve a bowl of pulled pork stew that was to die for!  And the accompanying piece of cornbread was also excellent.

reviews.author: Kevin M.
reviews.description: Walked in on a Thursday to try some wine.  Some amazing wines.  Super knowledgeable team and was a great experience

reviews.author: Jessica T.
reviews.description: Staff is very friendly the man directing our tour was very informative, we learned so much! The food was fantastic tough it would be a little nicer on a glass plate but that is just personal taste.

reviews.author: Joyce L.
reviews.description: Wow I was blown away by Bent Oak. It really does not look like much from the outside but my boyfriend and I decided to give it a try based on the reviews and we were not disappointed! We easily made a reservation on the website and came in at 2pm on a Saturday. They took out temperatures at the door and we were seated quickly.   We decided to go for the wine tasting first, 5 samples for $15 plus a stemless logo glass to take home! We really enjoyed trying the wines and enjoyed all of them. Our favorite was the Blanc du Bois because it was light and crisp but had a unique fragrant flavor from the floral notes and the apricot.   My only gripe was the reservation was only 45 minutes. I wish it could've been around an hour, we didn't get a chance to finish our wine or our charcuterie but it's not too big of a deal since we just took it back home. We also got another bottle of the Blanc du Bois to take home and they gave us a cute wine bag for the two bottles.   We will definitely be back again to try the rest of the wines!!

reviews.author: Paul R.
