reviews.description: What a wonderful discovery on a lazy pre-Xmas Sat afternoon. Who would have thought you could find a boutique winery that rivals any that I've visited in Sonoma.   Do not despair as you pull into the generic industrial park hard off of Anderson Mill Road in the CP. Walk-in past the small lobby area and step into their beautifully decorated tasting room.  Since we were the only patrons we received VIP treatment from start to finish.   We opted for their premium tasting menu and selected all reds. I'm not a TX wine fan but Dylan, our sommelier, expertly guided us through our tasting and as we concluded our wonderful stay my mind was changed.   My favorite was the Alexandar Valley Cab will more than suffice if you enjoy a big traditional Cab with a strong finish.   Their Spanish Mourvedre version is deep and rich and has a surprisingly strong finish,   There are a number of "light" reds as well. We were not fans but appreciated the flavor and balance of these wines.   Bent Oak does offer cheese plates and other small plates to accompany your tasting. Check their social media as they have live music on certain days.   Wonderful wine, an intimate setting, and passionate knowledgeable folks equals a 5 star experience.

reviews.author: Vipul T.
reviews.description: Good luck with the attitude at the front desk and the fact that they won't pick up the phone for a reservation. Waste of our time driving here, if you are passing by I would look at other places for wine tastings.

reviews.author: Laura S.
reviews.description: The wine selection is truly delightful in an abundance. So happy to have this treasure in our community. Perfect for a low key date night or a nice peaceful book. Will absolutely be coming back.

reviews.author: Claude W.
reviews.description: This was a real treat.  We looked for winery that was open before 4pm. We were staying in San Antonio and wanted to visit Austin TX. We found this place by searching best wineries near Austin. When we 1st arrived, it looked like a little store front in a strip mall. When we entered it was a whole different story. We were greeted by Debbie and Bryan who both turned out to be extremely gracious hosts.  They have wines grown in TX and CA. The TX grapes are grown in the High Plaines near New Mexico where it is warm during the day and cooler at night. I decided to do a tasting with only the TX wines.   The TX wine menu had 5 wines for the tasting menu. Started with the Chenon Blanc (quite nice with a buttery smoothness), proceeded to the Blanc de Bois, then the Roussanne (my least favorite), then switching to the reds starting with the Sangiovese and finally to the tempranillo.  The Tempranillo was my absolute favorite.    What really made this experience so nice was the wine Ambassador Debbie. She is just the nicest person who took good care of us. She also has a very nice sense of humor. Bryan was also very nice. He helped me pick out a few stainless steel wine stoppers. Bryan gave us great restaurant suggestions for Austin and San Antonio.  Do not be fooled with the entrance on the outside. It is misleading in the size and the value you receive on the inside.

reviews.author: Samantha C.
reviews.description: My experience with this winery has been amazing to say the least! Took two of my really good friends here today both who require wheelchair accessibility and felt very comfortable in the atmosphere. The reservation made ahead time was set up easily and the communication was quick and efficient through email. They were able to recommend a table that was best suited for us all to feel comfortable. It is very rare to actually be able to talk to the owners/wine makers about their products but they were the ones serving us the tasting! It really was a special experience not only for me but for my friends that have not gone out socially since the pandemic. Thank y'all so much for the inclusive atmosphere and making it such a memorable experience, we had a blast!

reviews.author: Pat M.
reviews.description: Very nice atmosphere inside.   Help was very friendly.  Pizza bread was out of this world.  I would recommend

reviews.author: Brandon K.
reviews.description: What a hidden gem! We were sitting at home on a Friday night, trying to find something to do. After a quick yelp search, we saw there was a winery up the street and open late. We decided to take a trip and check it out.  Driving up, you start to question if you are going the right direction but just keep going.   You walk in to this office center and are welcomed to the most friendly staff and environment.  Rarely do you get to sit down at a winery and speak to the head wine maker.   What really makes this place different is the fact that they have California and Texas wines. I'm no expert, but I've been told Texas grapes just don't compare.    The prices are great, and the options are plenty.  This will definitely be the family visit spot in the future.

reviews.author: Laura M.
reviews.description: Wine: Only tried one wine, the tempranillo. It was fine, not as bold as they usually are. I smelled some of the whites, and they smelled very sweet so I passed. Didn't even look at pricing because of what the snacks cost.  Snacks: wow, expensive. Tried a bunch of them with a group, overall not worth the price. Particularly the truffles. It was $27 for a teensy box of 9 pieces of terrible chocolate. Waxy texture, did not melt when you eat it, chalky, bad flavor. Dark chocolate is my fave, so that's not the issue. Who knew chocolate could actually be yucky? It came from next door, glad we didn't go there after.   Service: very good, sweet ladies.  Ambience: not good. Outside it just looks like a store front, inside is super dark, no windows, and looks like a Kirkland's from the 90s.... everything is red, has fringe, pretty cheesy. Not eclectic, just ugly and full of stuff.

reviews.author: Mindy H.
reviews.description: Living in Austin, this winery is located in our backyard. It's nice to be able to drive just 20 minutes and enjoy a good glass of wine, and meet the people who made it. I now have a place for out of town guests just spending the weekend to take a sip of Texas wine.  They focus on creating quality wines sourced from Texas and California grapes.  They do not blend grapes sourced from the two states together.  When you drink a bottle of Texas sourced wine, it is 100% Texas, and vice versa. Bent Oak has been around for about 3 1/2 years, and from what I have heard they are starting to find their stride.   When you enter the space, you will walk through the front gift shop to the back tasting room and production area.  They have gone to amazing strides to make a warehouse space homey. It feels like a Texas hill country family home.  We were warmly welcomed, and they even let us take our three well behaved dogs into the back area to sit and enjoy a tasting with us.  Everyone here was friendly and knowledgeable.    I was pleasantly surprised by the consistent quality of all their wines available to taste.  You can taste up to five wines from their menu.  The Blanc Du Bois was one of my stand out favorites.  There wasn't anything I didn't like on the menu.  I am not a fan of Chardonnay's but their California sourced Chardonnay was good.  Their reds were a bit young, but the Mourvedre from the Texas High plains was tasty and my favorite of the current options.  Medium bodied but with spicy fruity rich tones.  The Sangiovese was satiny smooth, but just needed some time.  I actually enjoyed their Texas wines more than the California options.    Clearly there is a reason why their wine club membership has a waitlist.  It's just a great group of people to hang out with.  It felt like being with family, and enjoying a great conversation over a nice glass of wine.  They are located next to Delysia chocolates towards the back of a warehouse area.  Wine and chocolate neighbors?  Yep, it's an amazing pairing.

reviews.author: Cindy L.
reviews.description: Stopped in yesterday. Always welcoming and we felt so safe especially with all the precautions they are taking. And if course great wines, can't wait to share the Cuve with friends!!!

reviews.author: Jasmine M.
reviews.description: Great Winery with awesome wine! John (wine maker) was amazing! Super nice and attentive. We came here celebrating a bachelorette party, we arrived a bit late, but they were so accommodating. Definitely recommend!

reviews.author: Nanette L.
reviews.description: Great wine accompanied with paired bites...comfortable atmosphere  too come on my own and listen to music...would recommend for all ages.

reviews.author: Curt C.
reviews.description: Viva El Gaucho!  This place is legit. I came here with a Porteno, someone from the capital city Buenos Aires. They attested to the legitimacy of the place- it even looks and smells like Mendoza they remarked...  We tried a flight of whites, a flight of reds, and a sampler plate with Morcilla, a blood sausage, some empanadas, and some proveletta, a gooey cheesy mixture, served with some pieces of hard bread. The food was all marvelous- where else can you find these more daring types of sausages, like a blood sausage! This is authentic stuff.  The wine was amazing- loved the Malbecs. They served up 2 malbecs- one high altitude, one low, and a cabernet that exemplified the region's wine. The whites were good, but Argentina is mostly known for its red wines due to the altitude and their fruity, herbaceous deep dark red wines.  The staff was great- they had a guitar player out beltin' out the jams on their picturesque patio with a great sweeping view of the hills that surround the place. They have a big fire pit in the middle of the outdoor area, which gives everything a smoky smell, that seems to blend well with the wines.  They have lots of outdoor seating under the trees, with comfortable seats, and even little teepees if you wanna do that.  I recommend everything here. It's a fun place with excellent wine and awesome food. I wanna come back for one of their outdoor all day grilling sessions that Argentina is so famous for!

reviews.author: Kenneth F.
reviews.description: Very nice selection of Argentinian wines, light charcuterie and occasional music.   We have been there on several occasions and always left having appreciated their wine, food and service.   We don't always do the tasting, but will buy a bottle and share it at one of their tables, either inside or out; depending on the weather.   What's great about this winery is the owners! They go the extra mile to assure every guest has a great time!   We look forward to our next visit!

reviews.author: Kim K.
reviews.description: My husband and I were recommended this location by a friend and we are so delighted that he did. The views are astonishing, and the Argentinian wine selection is stellar! The empanadas alone are worth the drive- exquisite. Highly recommend!

reviews.author: Bobbie S.
reviews.description: Loved this place .   Parker was great she knows her stuff about wine.  Food was great.   Had sausage platter, could share with 4 people.   Would be fun at night.  Views of mountains  spectacular.  Dogs are welcome.

reviews.author: Ginny B.
reviews.description: As a native Argentine and a veteran in the service industry I couldn't find a single fault in our visit to El Gaucho. This is going to be a long review because they deserve a long one. Let's begin with the service. We were 12. We asked a million questions before even arriving. Then we arrived and we drove our poor server crazy and she neverlost her smile. Adrian and Mirta, the owners and chefs of El Gaucho (not the winery, the restaurant) were extremely friendly and had a smile on their face the whole time. Now the food, OMG the food!. We Argentines love meat, and we are extremely picky about the quality of the meat, and how it is cooked. Well, first of all, the meat is from Argentina so that's a good start. Secondly, Adrian cooks it to perfection. We tried almost everything. Sirloin steak,flank steak, sweetbreads, sausage, even blood sausage. I don't usually like blood sausage but he made his magic and I liked it. The empanadas were divine! I'm very picky about empanadas. I used to make empanadas and it is hard work. They make the dough and the fillings. We tried the cebolla y queso, espinaca y queso, carne; every single one of them, perfection. We were celebrating several birthdays so we asked them to prepare a cake. It was a traditional cake from Argentina called Postre Balcarce. I'm running out of words to describe how amazing the food was. I thought I wouldn't be able to eat anything else but that cake was heavenly. Finally the location. It is a longdrive forsome but it is worth it. Beautiful views, live music some days, an area for kids to play. The owner of the winery is very nice as well. He was walking around the tables askingeverybodyhow we were doing. I can't say anything about the wines because I don't drink wine. Yes, I know, an Argentine that doesn't drink wine. Shocking isn't it? And I don't do the tango and I don't watch soccer (futbol people, futbol!!) except when Argentina is playing. Well there you go. I told you it was going to be a long review. I hope it will convince many people to visit this amazing place. NOTE: They also do delivery!!!

reviews.author: Jim N.
reviews.description: Good wines, excellent Argentinian cuisine.  Outside with live music, perfect Saturday afternoon.

reviews.author: JP C.
reviews.description: Good views... good wine... ok empanadas... ok customer service... and great cheesecakes.... was looking forward to having food but they were not cooking during our visit.   They had a two ban band which was perfect for the setting! Great outside seating!!! We got their at 3 and stayed for a few hours because of how it was nested in the hills with plenty of trees and shade.   Great place for a date, family, kids, dogs or a glass of wine for the day. We will be coming back and hopefully have traditional Argentine bbq next time.   Suggestion: serve espresso and/or coffee

reviews.author: Christine A.
reviews.description: This is a gorgeous spot with fantastic Argentinian wine!  Met an old friend here tonight who I haven't seen much since she moved to Austin while I was here for a work trip and we had a fantastic time!  The wines are tasty and the winery has some great indoor and outdoor seating with fantastic views, way up on a hill. Definitely go check them out!  I've also reached out to the management to see if I can get wines shipped back to my home state of Georgia!!!

reviews.author: Jane G.
reviews.description: Favorite place ever! Amazing food - come for the food and the wine is a bonus.  Argentinean beef grilled on open coal grill.  The atmosphere and hospitality are top notch.

reviews.author: Camila G.
reviews.description: As soon as we arrived we were kindly greeted by the owner who suggested a few of our favorite types of wine. We hung out outside and enjoyed the beautiful weather while watching the lovely scenery. We ordered the center cut ribeye and it did not disappoint. Also, best truffle mashed potatoes I have ever had! Adrian, the Chef, was beyond magnificent- he took the time to listen and we really enjoyed his cooking and conversation

reviews.author: Cesar V.
reviews.description: Please answer the phone. We've been trying to make a reservation since October, 2021, but haven't been able to speak with any of your employees. We also tried on line, but got no response.

reviews.author: Michelle N.
reviews.description: When we first arrived here, it was a bit confusing on where we were allowed to park as there were to signs indicating a designated place for cars - we ended up just driving all the way up the hill and parking alongside the roundabout next to the entrance of the winery cabin.   We had a reservation for right when they opened, and luckily so - it became extremely busy later on in our visit, so be mindful if you're planning on coming here that it's popular!   Staff is extremely friendly and attentive - they accommodated our group and let us even switch some tables around since we were the first there.   El Gaucho has a smaller wine list than other wineries I've been to, but they also had a food menu that was unique to others.   Provoleta ($12.50, +prosciutto $2.00): Comes out on a hot skillet plate with some slices of bread on the side. Really flavorful in provolone, obviously, but the chimichurri gives a nice addition to the dish. Felt like the addition of prosciutto wasn't worth, however.   Empanadas (2pc - $12.50): They have an option between beef empanadas, or a black bean and plantain empanada. I tried both and they were delicious in their own ways. Some people may stray away from the non-meat option, but I quite liked it! I believe they served this with the same chimichurri that was on top of the Provoleta.   Light Flight  1. Chardonnay: Their description is 100% correct, if you don't prefer Chardonnay, you might change your mind after trying this! Super light and refreshing, really easy finish. 2. Chardonnay Reserve: Huge jump from the Chardonnay - seemed to taste more full.  3. Malbec Rose: Really great end to tie the first two together, the sweetness is subtle but still noticeable.  They have a lovely outdoor courtyard/backyard patio where more seating is available, but unfortunately the day we went, it had just rained meaning most chairs were wet. I would highly recommend trying to come on a sunny day as I think it'd be beautiful!

reviews.author: Arianexys A.
reviews.description: Wonderful views! The wine tasting experience is great. The chef is very enthusiastic and the food was delicious! Great spot for couples, and also pet friendly (saw some families with their dogs). Would come back!   Of note, during the afternoon there might be some mosquitoes in the outdoor area, but they were kind enough to provide us with insect repellent.

reviews.author: Jeanne L.
reviews.description: This spot is one of my favorite places in the surrounding Austin area. It has unbelievably beautiful views, the owners and staff are so nice, and the wine is delicious. Sometimes they also have amazing live music. I've taken many friends here and my family as well and they all love it too.

reviews.author: Arlene G.
reviews.description: I never leave reviews. My husband and I came here for our honeymoon from Dallas, Tx. We were very excited, since we read great reviews. Honestly, I wouldn't spend the money on it, nor ever come here  again. There was only one lady working and no one helped us out at all.  They were originally going to set up something "special" since it was our honeymoon and it was not special at all. They were charging us $175 for literally a bottle of cheap champagne and a bowl of crackers and cheese. For what we paid for and what we got I don't recommend it at all.

reviews.author: Cathy L.
reviews.description: Very beautiful winery overlooking a gorgeous scenery of lush green trees and magnificent hills. Perfect place to come and relax with friends or family. The back area has an array of different seatings from couches to tables. There was also live music with, I think, the owner singing (who has a great soothing voice btw bravo).   There wasn't too many people when I went (Saturday Father's Day weekend) which I liked as everything was a lot calmer.

reviews.author: Cole U.
reviews.description: Don't sleep on this place! As we pulled up I had my doubts but was so surprised!!! They have an awesome selection-- got the sav blance and it was so refreshing. The food menu looked good but we didn't try any. The outdoor space is amazing!! So much space and awesome views.

reviews.author: Missy J.
reviews.description: Wow do I love this place! It's also on the way to pace Bend Park so I love to stop and have a bottle of wine and then go to pace Bend. I went during Covid so it was only bottle service but we absolutely love the bottle we got and the gentleman working with so sweet. Amazing views, relaxing atmosphere, I can't wait till everything is fully open and we can experience their food and wine tastings!

reviews.author: Ariel D.
reviews.description: Amazing location with warm hospitality and fantastic food.   If you want a taste of true Argentine flavor, this is the place to go.  Gracias, Chef Adrin!

reviews.author: Sarah C.
reviews.description: I was introduced to this winery by an Argentinean friend and I have to say I am pleasantly surprised. This winery is not only very scenic but also has excellent wine. I've been to many Texan wineries that are pretty but have terrible wine so this winery was a surprise to me. I'd love to bring my friends back there!

reviews.author: Liza M.
reviews.description: Amazing wine bar in Steiner!  And they are open during this winter storm from 4-6 today.  They saved my day!  Hope they save yours too!  Shop local!  Everyone that works there is nice and helpful!

reviews.author: Niki S.
reviews.description: Where's my sixth star, I mean, glass of wine?! ;) Tucked away in the north Austin hills, this place is a gem, worth trekking over for if you have any excuse to be anywhere near it.  This is the type of place that a group could enjoy, a wine beginner wouldn't find intimidating, and a wine snob could also find something to please their pallet. Good selection of all types, but not intimidating.  THE STAFF ARE ALL SO FRIENDLY AND HELPFUL! I was given a few suggestions from the owner, and they were all so spot on, I loved every one I tried.   Love the clean but welcoming decor, and how everything feels approachable and interactive (Glasses for sale, books, etc) and there's even some outdoor seating for those feeling a fire pit (if memory serves correctly, but the night I was here, the rain kept everyone inside).   Bring some girls, a group, or just stop by on your way home for a friendly wine bar with the coziness that makes you want to curl up and order an entire bottle and chat with folks.

reviews.author: Sara S.
reviews.description: Steiner Ranch has been slow to develop despite its rapidly growing population so I was so happy to see a new wine bar open up. Sloan + Parker was the perfect place to catch up with my girl friends. We shared a bottle of Napa Cab, a charcuterie board and delightful conversation with the hosts. The decor is great, ambiance is fun and it was overall a nice experience. Sloan + Parker is a much needed addition to Steiner Ranch!

reviews.author: Jen R.
reviews.description: What an amazing experience and we can't wait to come back... weekly!  I'm from Indiana, husband from California. We moved here about 15 months ago and haven't found any amazing wines we enjoyed until today! Don't know if anyone else has had this issue in finding great wines, particularly Cabernet, in Texas, but we have! We came in and were welcomed with open arms and amazing conversation! In depth information of wines and tasting until we found the right glass to order.  After 15 months of living here we have finally found our "home" in regards to wine and friends! We will definitely  be back and can't wait to experience all they have to offer! Down to earth people and an experience you won't regret.  P.S. the decor is amazing!

reviews.author: Jennifer E.
reviews.description: A friend of mine that knows the owner and lives in Steiner invited me to a ladies night at this establishment. It was extremely loud and busy.  It is obvious that this area needs something like this.  As a woman owned business, I am happy to see it thrive.  Deep into Steiner Ranch, I am not sure people who live outside of the area would be seeking it out but worth the trip if you are into wine and want to check out the space.  Could be a good place for a celebration.  Steiner probably has enough people to support.  Rose, white, red, bubbles and brews.  Cheese plates.  You can buy bottles to take with you with various mustards, jams, etc in their pantry. Glad I got to experience this location and wish them all the luck moving forward.

reviews.author: Dani K.
reviews.description: Absolutely love Sloan + Parker. I'll admit that I'm pretty easy to please in the wine department, but I really do love all the wines I've tried! I appreciate that the wine list is ever changing and that the employees all do an amazing job with recommendations and descriptions. There is also a pretty large price range so you're able to choose a glass based on how much you'd like to spend, which is great for their range of customers. Now about the decor/atmosphere: I'd like to have my home designed to look similar to S+P. It's fun and new and modern but elegant and sophisticated at the same time. I wouldn't change a thing!   My favorite time to go is on a chilly evening. I love to be curled up by the fire on the patio with blankets (provided by S+P) and a big glass of cab with live music playing in the background. Come on! That's heaven!   Do yourself a favor and follow them on Facebook. They host great events, my favorite being Sip In SWEATS. You will not be disappointed!

reviews.author: Kerry S.
reviews.description: This place is awesome! Peyton was an amazing host and knows the name of everyone that walks in. Incredible hospitality and ability to pinpoint you pallet to recommendations that will resonate with you. Hands down, five stars!

reviews.author: Chris B.
reviews.description: Fantastic place. They have a really nice wine selection plus a solid draft list for those seeking beer. Service is fantastic and they bringing in rotating local musicians as well. Highly recommend S+P.

reviews.author: Eric N.
reviews.description: Locally owned business that knows wine!  My wife and I love coming here for a drink and a bite then leaving with a bottle.  Our go-to place in the neighborhood

reviews.author: Ashley M.
reviews.description: I love S+P! It has a chic yet comfortable atmosphere and stellar wine and beer selections. It's a great place for a night out with friends and also perfect for date night. The owner really knows her stuff too! If you need a recommendation she can give you so many amazing suggestions.

reviews.author: Nate P.
reviews.description: Love coming here to relax (inside or outside on the patio) and get some glasses of wine. There are delicious beer options as well. They also have some snacking plates (cheese, charcuterie) and some other treats. If you're feeling indecisive, you can taste a wine before buying a glass (I find their descriptions to be spot on and helpful), and there's usually a few wine flight options on rotation.

reviews.author: Dan S.
reviews.description: Came out for a networking group and had a great time. Will be bringing my wife back. She would love this place!

reviews.author: Nicholas V.
reviews.description: Beautiful property, great wine, and equally awesome food + service.   First time here. We didn't have any preconceived notions.   Normally I'm not a fan of Texas wines but their wine was fantastic and unique. The Spot and Love Magick stole our heart.   The food was super fresh. Got the salami and cheese board. Excellent.   Good atmosphere. Good service.   Cant wait to come back!

reviews.author: Danielle H.
reviews.description: Beautiful peaceful spot to enjoy our afternoon after a hike nearby. Wine was lovely too!

reviews.author: Sarah H.
reviews.description: We loved our time at Hamilton Pool Vineyards. The wine was all delightful, the food was delicious, ambience impeccable, and the servers were all as lovely as can be. The drive out was absolutely gorgeous and it was a gorgeous was to spend our Sunday afternoon. (Live music was a great touch.) highly recommend checking this place out.

reviews.author: Keith L.
reviews.description: Great spot after heading to Hamilton pool, met with the owner and had a great experience. The chief and workers were all very nice. They have several Texas wines and a nice area to sit out and enjoy them paired with small plates.

reviews.author: Russ J.
reviews.description: Service was God awful. Our server acted like we were an annoyance to serve and recited his 'script' with a sing song voice. Dropped the bread on the way and then didn't replace it until we we had finished the cheese and fruit. We still bought two bottles. Tonight we opened the more expensive bottle and it had turned. It was like vinegar. So incredibly disappointed. Hard pass.

reviews.author: Pam F.
reviews.description: The grounds are beautiful!  What a great backdrop for engagement photos or a wedding!  Take a tour, attend a farm class, or volunteer!  Have some fun!

reviews.author: Anthony M.
reviews.description: Love this place! The sparkling rose' wine is awesome. Food is awesome. Service top notch . For sure a cool place to come . They for sure are respectful of the covid rules. We will be back!

reviews.author: Kimmie P.
reviews.description: Was so excited to check out this place today. Our server was okay, but describing our wine as tasting like an aquarium was a turn off. Also, there was a kid camp going on and children threw water guns at our table while we dined as well as crawled around by our table. Not the experience we'd hoped for. Our server ghosted during our meal and left us waiting over 30 minutes to pay so we could leave. Wanted to love this place, as it is a beautiful property with so much potential. With a few tweaks, it could be so much more.

reviews.author: Liz H.
reviews.description: Service was poor, but wines were good. We had the basic tasting and tried 4 wines. We enjoyed the wines. They were not very busy, and our sever was not attentive.

reviews.author: Ted G.
reviews.description: A great winery!  This is a beautiful winery and a great stop if you plan on visiting the other winery nearby or salt lick BBQ. Everyone is exceptionally helpful, they have a very comfortable tasting room, but I felt the tasting was way overpriced, so I decided to just buy a bottle of the Fall Creek Vineyards Tempranillo to drink while the rest of the group had their tasting.   They have an impressive operation and make some wonderful wines, definitely worth the stop. Cheers!

reviews.author: Chica B.
reviews.description: I visited this vineyards Dec 23 in the afternoon.  We were the only one in the winery.  We received good attention from the staff.  The wine tasting was really good.  Got to get one of the bottles for a present and an edged glass to keep.  I plan to visit Texas in a near future and this is one place that I plan to come back again. Wine first and bbq later.  Of all of the wines Mourvedre was our favorite.

reviews.author: Trenna H.
reviews.description: If you're looking to have a nice day trip from Austin, Fall Creek is a great spot.  I love coming out here for a wine tasting and enjoying the outside patio and having the vineyard to explore. The landscape is gorgeous and the staff are so knowledgeable and friendly.  Most importantly, the wine is delicious.    Pro tip- for an additional $8 you can add on an extra tasting of the ExTerra Tempranillo (usually a $100 bottle). It's amazing and a must try.

reviews.author: Sametra B.
reviews.description: The wine was amazing!!! Needless to say, we will be returning on our next trip to Austin. We are huge Cabernet fans and all of the wines were delicious. We took a few bottles home. When we tried the Tempranillo and it swept us off our feet. We have since found some of these wines in our local Houston Spec's.   The facility is clean and the grounds are well kept. The restrooms are also clean!!! Our host was simply amazing and went above and beyond to explain the process and enjoyed the discussion describing the notes we would/did experience. Really enjoyed the entire experience.

reviews.author: Nicolle M.
reviews.description: TLDR: relaxing atmosphere with nice white wines. Good on the spectrum of Texas wines but not on the level of French or Napa wines.  This is a great spot right across the street from salt lick. Parking lot is gravel but there's plenty of parking available. Hostess was extremely friendly and great conversation.  The wines themselves are good- we especially loved the Chardonnay and reserve wines. Based on Texas wineries, I have to say this is hands down one of the better vineyards. That being said, I have a deep love for Russian river valley wines (especially green valley pinots and Chardonnay's) and Texas grapes just don't measure up. Is that an unfair comparison? Probably.  Overall highly recommend visiting and supporting local. You'll want this on your wine tasting list of stops for sure, and best of all it's fairly close to Austin.

reviews.author: Kara G.
reviews.description: Fall Creek Vineyards totally exceeded our expectations! We have been super strict about staying home during COVID-19, but my #1 birthday wish was to get out ... in a safe way. With young children. My husband called Fall Creek ahead of time and was told that kids were allowed and that there was plenty of outdoor space.   We arrived around 2pm on a Wednesday afternoon and were greeted by a super friendly and knowledgeable gentleman. I wish I had grabbed his name, because he was seriously amazing. He let us know that a food purchase was required to be served on premise, which was not a problem at all because everything looked delicious (we chose a cheese platter), and gave us a wine menu as well.   We selected our own seats and were able to stay away from the party that came in after us. Our sommelier was so knowledgeable and provided everything in a COVID-19 safe way. He was also super sweet to our kids, even though our three year old was crushing crackers on the table (we cleaned up after him before we left but it was still so embarrassing).   All of the wines were delicious. We ended up leaving with their Tempranillo, their Sauvignon-blanc (vintners-selection) and two souvenir glasses.   We spent about an hour at Fall Creek, which ended up being the total highlight of my birthday, but could have spent more time there exploring their beautiful grounds  had we not had a dinner reservation.

reviews.author: Gerardo D.
reviews.description: Texas has great wines.  A short drive from Austin (right across from Salt Lick) you can spend a few hours in the vineyard, sit in the patio, or stay inside. Of course, there is wine tasting and a variety of bottles for sale.  Fall Creek makes wines in all price points. From the quite good inexpensive wines to award-winning bottles for people who really know their reds. I am a fan of their Tempranillo.  If you are in Austin, it's worth a visit!

reviews.author: Elise G.
reviews.description: TL;DR: Couldn't recommend this more for a safe way to spend the day with your friends during (and even not during!) Covid.  My mom's in town so I wanted to take her to a winery semi-close to Austin but not too far away. ENTER: Fall Creek. It's been recommended to me by several friends so figured I'd check it out for myself:  PROS: Seriously the nicest staff in the world. Thank you Daniel! Plenty of socially distanced tables and chairs in LOTS of different areas of the winery A bottle of their amazing Sauvignon Blanc - $22! Great snacks to accompany (I got Pimento cheese) They had live music on a Saturday with a full band. swoon! Across the street from Salt Lick if you want foods  CONS: Seriously none. Couldn't have asked for a more perfect day. Can't wait to visit again!   Pro tip: go to Desert Door nearby for more fun. :)

reviews.author: Andrew Y.
reviews.description: FCV at Driftwood is a nice little winery, with seating indoors and out. When we were visiting, there was only one other guest present (midday Tuesday). As a personal recommendation, if you're trying to social distance, I would suggest visiting here only during the weekdays when it's less busy, otherwise it may seem too crowded since the place is on the smaller side.  The food menu mainly consists of cheese and snacks that go well with wine but it's a little overpriced. The staff was nice but they were just there for the most part, nothing more to enhance our experience.   3/5 staff/service 4/5 nicely decorated interior and exterior 5/5 with the right company

reviews.author: Vanessa T.
reviews.description: Good stop on your wine tour! We opted for two full glasses of their most standout wines and although it was much more expensive wine than I'm used to, we did get a generous pour. The backyard terrace is peaceful and has many seating options. I would've loved to see an option where you could do a wine tasting outdoors, perhaps the same way you order a beer flight. I saw this because wine tastings are only offered inside.

reviews.author: Mark R.
reviews.description: We didn't care for this place that much. The dining/patio area was nice but seemed like some of it was off limits (maybe party rooms). Wine offering was limited. We had a Chardonnay, Tempranillo and a Lescalo. They were just OK but it was the end of our day before heading to Salt Lick so that could have had an impact. One visit here was enough for us.

reviews.author: Chelsea R.
reviews.description: The wine here is really delicious. They are only doing tastings inside. The tasting is a preset menu. You can order a glass and get food outside afterwards. The service is great and our waitress was very friendly and helpful.

reviews.author: Me Y.
reviews.description: Entrance is nice yet when you go to the back it needs a little tending. Table tops were messy, landscaping needs a little touch up, I'm hoping it was just a little neglect we might try it again later.

reviews.author: Erica G.
reviews.description: After 3 months of quarantine, two of us ventured out for a bff day of wine and views. Our 2nd stop was Falls Creek....it was so pretty with perfect sunny weather and enough seating inside and out. Covid is still among us so they offer hand santizers but you bring your own mask. Most patrons didn't have on of course once they had their wine in hand.   We opted to sit outdoors. Tables are 3-4 ft apart in some spots so choose within your comfort zone for social distancing. We grabbed a quick glass of wine and made our way to the next stop.   Looking forward to returning with the hubby this summer.

reviews.author: Tina M.
reviews.description: We really enjoyed our tasting experience here! We will be back. Knowledgeable and gracious, this winery is a must do for anyone in the area that wants an amazing wine tasting experience.

reviews.author: Christina R.
reviews.description: Went to Fall Creek for a wine tasting prior to dinner at Salt Lick.  We were seated in the indoor patio which was extremely warm.  No water was offered.  We requested the tasting - 5 wines that are pre-selected, you aren't able to choose.  After the second (extremely small) pour, we had to request water.  Decided to order a couple of apps for the group..we were brought store made hummus and pimento cheese - still in the plastic container, propped on a plate with a wrapped package of crackers.  Had to request small plates, which seemed to surprise our server.  By the end of the tasting we were all sweating as the sun was beating down on us and there seemed to be no AC. The wines were okay, but the experience and service could have been much better.  I wouldn't return.

reviews.author: Roy C.
reviews.description: Wine tasting was $20 for 5 small pours.  Can't select wines to try, only had 5 bottles open and only one was what I would have wanted.  Food prices were also high.  Place was fairly full but I don't know why.  Wines we tasted were fair at best.  Too many good one in the area to waste your time here.

reviews.author: Anielka E.
reviews.description: This vineyard was a delightful second stop on our day drinking in the Driftwood area. The wine picked by my group was light , refreshing and the perfect compliment to have after we had made a lunch stop at a brisket place. We had been feeling stuffed but this wine was so light and enjoyable to help digest our food while we enjoyed their peaceful tranquil outdoor seating area near a cute little pond. We also took advantage of their photo opportunity landscapes.

reviews.author: Mariz V.
reviews.description: I've had my fair share of vineyards from local like Grape Creek in Fredericksburg then to Castello di Amorosa in Napa Valley. I was embarrassed after taking my family to experience the wine tasting here. Although, some of the wine were fairly tasty, but the serving was small compared to the vineyards I mentioned in the beginning. I had never been to a wine tasting with a pour stopper that was new to me. Mind you they charge $20 per person for wine tasting. We were observing a table near us that was getting extra pour from the pour stopper technique. We decided to order 2 cheese plates ($25/plate) that came in this container after we finished it, which was a small portion by the way. We noticed that the container said "Best By: 2/12" we visited 2/13. So we alerted our server she politely checked with the back she was told that it meant Arrived By, which to me was odd. If it was "Arrived By" I think that's what they would've put on the container but I guess just to shut us up.  As to COVID capacity the patio was full we couldn't wait to leave. This is my family and I's experience I wish it could've been better.

reviews.author: Manuela A.
reviews.description: Our favorite wine spot in Austin. Their Meritus is a winner every time. Cute and cozy spot, very picturesque and everyone who works here is super nice and knowledgeable.

reviews.author: Kieli A.
reviews.description: Nicole was absolutely awesome in explaining the culture of wine and helped me understand such a tedious hobby of drinking wine! The esthetic is great! 5 stars big tips and full drinks! Awesome place. Ask for Nicole!!

reviews.author: Jana N.
reviews.description: It's a lovely wine room.   Our wine guy was terrible. I'm guessing he was having a bad day. Or maybe we looked like we weren't big spenders. Who knows. He was very unwelcoming. We had to ask him questions he just didn't give us any information about the winery at all or the wine club. Must have been a bad friday for him.   I passed on getting a flight b/c of the wine guy. I got a glass of a red blend to go so I could shop around the square. The wine was fantastic. I was going to buy a bottle but found another place on the other side of the square.

reviews.author: Jason C.
reviews.description: We've been through a handful of wine rooms and wineries around Central Texas this is a nice little quiet spot never really super crowded and delightfully not very loud so we could carry on a conversation the wine selection here is great but be prepared to spend a little bit more than you normally would we spent $28 for a bottle of Muscato which is pretty reasonable, But the people here we're super friendly and the service was great so for that price I must say I could do that again

reviews.author: JoAnn H.
reviews.description: My husband and I shared a flight of wines. Very inexpensive. $12 for four tastings. We both enjoyed our choices. Our favorite was the strawberry wine with effervescence. A nice experience. I would highly recommend stopping in.

reviews.author: Vaughn O.
reviews.description: Barons Creek was our first stop on a planned wine tasting adventure around the square. We were greeted by our sommelier Tom, seated, and the tasting process explained. Tom provided a charming mixture of highbrow wine knowledge and light humor as he took us through our tasting journey of 5 red wines. The wife liked all of the wines, and I liked all but one (a tempranillo). Never fear! Tom is here! Tom saved the day (and the Tres Primos reputation) by pouring us an extra taste, but instructing us to first chew a chocolate-covered coffee bean before pouring the wine across that bean in our mouths. This somehow transformed the flavour into something amazingly pleasing for us both!  We also ordered chicken empanadas, which were surprisingly delicious! For some reason we did not expect such flavor and complexity from a wine bar's kitchen. The empanada crust was crispy and flaky, with a filling of chopped chicken, onions and seasonings that burst into the mouth with each bite. This was no Tex-Mex kitchen empanada. Hats off Barons! Hats off!

reviews.author: Meghan A.
reviews.description: Visiting Georgetown...Was on a search for a search for a romantic day date and ran into this place. I am more than grateful to have walked into this place.   Chris was behind the bar and he welcomed us right away! The place provided social distancing and comfortability. Hubby and I just absolutely loved the service and feeling of what a wine tasting is meant to feel. Chris was so wonderful with the wine process.   Will be back for sure!

reviews.author: Kate H.
reviews.description: Service was not the best. The server was not very attentive to my group. My friends and I had to ask multiple times to get our glasses filled..... during a tasting.

reviews.author: Steven D.
reviews.description: One of our favorite places on the square! If you like wine at all, come here. Anthony and his crew makes it so fun. I learn something new every time we visit and I've never felt that "wine snob" view at all. Just great wines a and even better people.

reviews.author: A H.
reviews.description: I'm so glad we chose Barons Creek over all the competition on the area. Anthony truly rolled out the red carpet and made our experience rememberal . Seven of us had the pleasure of tasting six different house made wines and delicious appetizers.

reviews.author: Anna-Maria C.
reviews.description: This place is a must-go on The Square. Not only are their wines delicious, the staff working there are amicable and knowledgeable. Chris especially helpful as he knows a lot about their wines and brings charisma to the already-inviting atmosphere. Definitely have to stop by for some vino!

reviews.author: Kim D.
reviews.description: We called ahead to see if they were open before driving an hour. They said they were open but neglected to tell us that their services were limited without reservations because of it being Valentine's weekend. We are new wine club members and felt like we were treated very rudely when we arrived. We loved our experience at Barons in Fredericksburg but would not recommend the Georgetown location. Our plan was to buy a case of the Boots wine but after they way were treated, we left our Boots behind.

reviews.author: J. S.
reviews.description: We spent an hour of fun here tasting wine but did not much care for their selection of provided wines. Barons had more of an uppity vibe to it, so maybe I wasn't picking up what they were putting down from the jump as I tend gravitate toward a more casual atmosphere... especially when it comes to wine tasting.   They were nice and helpful here and poured us a cup of Tempranillo and Crazy Train on our way out, to drink while we walked around the square. Both good wines but did not justify the price tag for us.

reviews.author: Josh O.
reviews.description: We love Barons Creek. Anthony is amazing and constantly ensuring guest have a great experience.  Thankful to have this in Georgetown.

reviews.author: T R.
reviews.description: Absolutely delightful service and atmosphere. It's so great to have a place on the square to enjoy wine. The bottles are a little pricier than expected (I think maybe you need to join the wine club?) but if you are looking for a solid enjoyable afternoon or evening out with friends, a nice cheese plate or a bite from the restaurant next door, and knowledgeable sommeliers who can find you something you will enjoy - you can't go wrong.

reviews.author: Elizabeth K.
reviews.description: I don't know what I was expecting when I walked in, but I was blown away. It's beautiful inside. The wine counter/bar is long. There was live music. The staff was very friendly and knowledgeable. We did a wine tasting and then sat down with a glass. I'm really glad this is here. It's perfect.

reviews.author: A. J.
reviews.description: Awesome place to have some wine.  Friendly and knowledgeable staff.  Ask all the questions about wine you want and they will have the answer.   Has piano in back.   Decor is nice and the place is super clean.   It's definitely a fun stop around the square.  Go have a glass or two!!!

reviews.author: Blane W.
reviews.description: Great atmosphere. Cool vibe walking in. Presumptuous personality behind the bar. Extravagant prices. $15.16 for what looked like maybe 6 oz.  Wine was decent, yet no desire to return.

reviews.author: Marco Antonio G.
reviews.description: Love the new location and all the wine hosts. Friendly, kind and eager to share their knowledge of wine. If you happen to stop by say hi to Anthony, he's an awesome person who knows a lot. And lets not forget the wine! So far we love all the wines and location and will keep coming back. Highly recommend.

reviews.author: Kelly O.
reviews.description: Chris is amazing. He made our very first wine tasting experience incredible. We went as two couples and had a great time conversing with Chris and learning about the wines we were introduced to. 100% recommend.

reviews.author: Bailey B.
reviews.description: This place is super cozy and perfect to go to on a cooler rainy day, and not crowded at all; the server was polite and made a good choice when I asked him to surprise me after informing him I preferred drier spicier reds.

reviews.author: Ty'Trell D.
reviews.description: If you're looking for a place in Austin to escape the cold or to simply enjoy good food and drinks - THIS IS THE PLACE! Visited this place with my family on a cold day in Austin and we surely enjoyed ourselves. The wine selection to choose from is wonderful and the prices are very affordable. The staff are extremely friendly and personable. The ambiance is cozy and welcomes conversation. This would be a great place for groups, a date, or a solo excursion. My favorite part of the entire experience was the food truck, Out of Nowhere ATX. We all ordered the Texan burger and it was the BEST BURGER WE'VE ever had!  I encourage everyone to try this place out. You won't regret it!

reviews.author: Shveta M.
reviews.description: Large space where they kept most of the amazing artwork/murals from Infinite Monkey! They have a very big selection of wines and you can choose your pour by slipping in your tab card and pushing a button. Maybe I'm just old but I had a hard time figuring out where the pour was coming from and lots spilled out each time. Think they could do a better job at explaining/labeling!  Other than that, it's a fun space for a group hang or to go with a couple friends or a date.   We went on a Thursday which is their all night happy hour day and it was loud bc there was also karaoke. Again, maybe I'm too old, but it was LOUD!  The food truck in the back was open and the burger and fries I ordered were ok. Nothing to call home about but heck, it's food. Wish they had a better option to pair with the wine.  Overall, Worth checking out but personally, not my vibe.

reviews.author: Kelsi D.
reviews.description: This is such a cool way to taste wines!   They've got over 60 wine taps and you get a little card to use at each tap. Each one is priced by the ounce so you can pour as little or as much as you like and try them all! They had a good range of lower priced to higher priced wines from all over the world.   Some of the taps were out of order when we eat but they still had a bunch to choose from.   They also have a bar if you don't want to use the wine taps. The tap room wasn't air conditioned when we went but it's a nice open space to have events or hang out when it's not too hot. It was their soft opening so I believe they plan to have AC in this room it just wasn't working at the time.   The main room has a ton of seating as well and fun games you can play or you can just sit and chat and look at all the amazing local murals on the walls as well as all the fun thrifted Knick knacks and furniture. One of my favorite spots in Austin for sure.

reviews.author: Amanda K.
reviews.description: I have been to this location back when it was Infinite Monkey Winery. I was sad they closed due to the 'Rona. Anyway, I am glad it is up back and running as Wanderlust.   Upon entering you can grab a glass of mead from the bar area or head into the winery to pay by the pour with your card. They have tons of wines to choose from to include sangrias. There are picnic tables inside and a small courtyard near the food trucks if you want to hang out outdoors.  They have a few food trucks on-site that will be opening soon. One of them was kind enough to pass out bread samples. I am gluten-free but my husband indulged in some delicious bread which he said was AMAZING.  Overall this is a cool little area with more to come to include a coffee place, brewery, and restaurant. I will be back for sure because the location is chill and the wine was good.

reviews.author: Katie M.
reviews.description: Location #2 for wanderlust wine did not disappoint!!    The two locations are wildly different it makes you do a double take - is this the same company?? But yes - they can do all the vibes with all the great wines.   This location has a huge barn area for massive parties and events, a cozy interior, and another even cozier private room. The bathrooms are beautiful and the place, although huge, is still absolutely comfortable due to the layout.

reviews.author: Elizabeth M.
reviews.description: I live right next door to the new Wanderlust and was too excited when I learned that they were doing their soft opening. My boyfriend and I came in after dinner one night to see the new location and grab a few drinks and I can definitely say that we'll be back. The wine isn't on tap just yet since they're still finishing up construction but there's still plenty of options and the staff is eager to help. We spoke to Ashley at the bar and she was amazing, she told us all about the building, the wines, events, and what was to come with the space. Not only was the wine great but the atmosphere is just unmatched. The building is decorated floor to ceiling with murals and graffiti art from local Austin artists. I can't wait to come back when the whole package is together!   COVID Precautions: Masks are encouraged and hand sanitizer was provided.

reviews.author: Heather B.
reviews.description: Love the art deco! Variety of areas to seat, including a room with artificial grass. Large room has many picnic tables with transistor radios and manual typewriters adorning them.   Excellent selection of wine and sangria. Provides a great opportunity to try a variety of regions of wines that you would be unable to do in a restaurant setting. However, it is expensive.  I had less than a glass and a half and spent over $20.   There are 3 food trucks, but they were closed when we were there (Sunday).  This would be a great place for a group event or just a large group attendance (that happy hour people forget to RSVP for--this is the place to accommodate them!). It is so spacious in the main room.   Parking is an issue. It's only available on the street: so carpool or rideshare.

reviews.author: Jiyoon S.
reviews.description: Came here on a Tuesday, where it was extremely dead (maybe 15 people tops) and despite an awkward ambiance we had a good time! First off, the space is fantastic - huge lofted ceilings, seamless indoor/outdoor (perfect for COVID), visually interesting seating and art. The indoor portion comes loaded with comfy couches and armchairs which I can appreciate! A fantastic venue that I'm sure would've been much more vibrant during peak hours.  The service is great, really enthusiastic and knowledgeable sommeliers accompany with a great playlist. The wine selection here is decent, definitely a more robust and diverse selection than the downtown location.   Great location for large groups or a birthday party. Would totally come again (albeit on a busier night)!

reviews.author: Sara B.
reviews.description: This spot is like the original Wanderlust (put a credit card on file, and you get card to swipe for different wines on what is essentially as a pay per ounce buffet). With this buffet, you're paying more for the nice items, per ounce, though.  This location is larger, though, and more artistic both in the decor and the fact that they have performers there. Additionally, they have a larger selection at this location vs. the original location. That said, while it's a larger selection, there's less variety. At least when I went there they didn't have margarita-inspired wines or mead. If you loooove wine, then, this is the place for you (or if you're looking for a more creative atmosphere), but if not I'd recommend the other location.

reviews.author: Angela G.
reviews.description: A great place to try different wines and hang out with friends! They have a ton of seating indoor and outdoor. I tried a Moscato and a Sangria, both of which were very delicious! Check them out on their half off days (Mondays).

reviews.author: Laurene A.
reviews.description: We finally made it to the Wanderlust location on a Tuesday, ahead of leaving for a vacation, as were looking to spend a day just relaxing near home and day drinking. There are tons of choices of wine, and even more places to sit and relax! The staff explains the process to you, but after our first visit, we definitely realized there could have a little better thorough explanation, and notation made about the happy hour each day. My husband and I each received our own card for pours, even though we were on the same tab, so it's VERY easy to lose track of how much you are spending collectively, because your card only shows what YOU have spent so far. The choice to have small, medium and large pours is nice, because even though each wine has a description, you just don't know until you try it! There are several food truck options, but they don't open until later in the day. There are also some mead wines, and some non alcoholic options inside, as well as games to play! There are also dog-friendly areas and water bowls, which are always a plus for us!  Our only complaint was the staff; we arrived just after their posted opening time, but the door was locked. We walked around back, called out to anyone, and got no response. We left for a bit and came back and it was finally opened. We inquired about it with the long staff member after she finally appeared, after about 15 minutes of waiting, and she seemed to think we didn't know what we were talking about. And as I mentioned, the explanation was not very thorough, and we had to wait another 10 minutes to cash out because she kept disappearing. We chalked it up to an one-off thing, and let it go, but it was still quite strange. I would think busier times might be better!

reviews.author: Kia L.
reviews.description: The inside of wanderlust is so creative! This location decor has a graffiti, gritty feel? They also play a lot of hip hop/ rap which is not only refreshing but gives this place an authentic feel! There is only street parking at the Shady ln location so keep that in mind! Once you arrive you receive a Pour card that you can use to access each tap. They have white wine (Chardonnay, resiling,etc) and red wine varieties. They don't have food but there are separately operated food trucks! Overall I think the wine is a bit over priced but love this space for studying, exploring a creative outlet or chilling with a few friends. It's a VERY quiet space. There's outdoor and indoor seating. I will be back sometime I hope they host comedy or spoken word here... seems like an appropriate venue!

reviews.author: Xia M.
reviews.description: It's a little complicated pouring the tap in the beginning. But once you get the hang of it, you're in! I like the added perk of having a taco truck outback. The interior space is luxurious, and the outside sitting space is reminds me of a barn. You get the best of both worlds. I come here for the sangria, usually on tap #61 and #63, but by the time you're reading this, they may have changed the drinks. This could seem a bit pricey unless you go during a happy hour. When it's not 50% off happy hour on certain days of the week, then an average day will have 30% off from 3pm to 6pm.

reviews.author: Jana N.
reviews.description: What a fun event. I love the idea of wine by the once. I'll go back for sure. I hope they open up a venue up north.

reviews.author: Ashley N.
reviews.description: I love Wanderlust Wine Company! It's such a fun environment, and they have so many excellent wines to choose from! If you haven't been to the new Eastside location, it is seriously one of the coolest buildings in Austin. There is so much local art there! Plus, the drag shows on Sunday are Dope!

reviews.author: Joseph Y.
reviews.description: Great little spot with locations downtown and on the east side. Have been to both but we greatly prefer the East side location as it is considerably larger. We like to be able to bring our pup and there "outdoor" area is super pet friendly and is conveniently where all the wines to sample happen to be. The addition of 3 new food trucks is just the icing on the cake. Go check it out, you won't be disappointed!!!

name: The OASIS on Lake Travis
accommodations: Garage Parking, Private Lot Parking, Valet Parking

reviews.author: Eva D.
reviews.description: Quiet a disappointment, to be honest. Not sure what exactly was I expecting when we came here. Pretty much all venues were closed, which makes me believe it is a weekend spot. Unless you are there to eat, you will just be walking aimlessly around. Not a bad thing, but as I said, for some reason I was expecting more. They views, however, did not disappoint.   We didn't eat there and my review is solely on the grounds and whatever they offer outside the restaurant.

reviews.author: Arkee B.
reviews.description: How easy for the white people to just switch tables huh? We were seated directly under the sun and I requested to be switched to shaded area its was 95 degrees out, I was asked to go downstairs and ask to switch table and was told I have to go back in line by Ashley. We waited for an hour to get our table.   The white people seated in the same spot and they just switched tables right away, with no trouble. We stayed where we are seated by the way. This place is a big joke. Food were also just ok and overpriced.   Thanks to Thomas our server, the only good thing that happened with our visit.   My mom were also visiting from Italy and found this place hilarious.

reviews.author: Jv V.
reviews.description: I've been visiting this place for 6 years the beer is consistently great, the quality of food so fresh. Incredible view and different atmospheres. Definitely a destination while visiting Austin.  I played a music show today for SXSW and I highly re one that it for mostly any kind of music  Very friendly and charm crew!

reviews.author: Zivanka G.
reviews.description: The staff was friendly, fast, efficient, and over all everything about this was a wonderful experience and the view was absolutely amazing even if it was a bit cold out.   Fajitas came out hot and sizzling, drinks were well made and super tasty and we enjoyed everything about it. I will absolutely come here again. And you should visit if you're near lake Travis.

reviews.author: Chris F.
reviews.description: Okay so you don't go here for the drinks ($12 "hurricanes" that put me in a sugar coma), you don't go here for the food (microwaved food for $20+ a plate) you come here for the camp atmosphere and the view!   The tea is this, you wanna bring out of town guests here, have a group event etc, it's a restaurant that has a gift shop, so know what you're getting into here. It was fun and worth a visit. What was even more exciting was finding a dairy free ice cream Shop on site!

reviews.author: Ryan T.
reviews.description: We hadn't been to The Oasis since 2005 before the original one burned down, so it was wild to see how much it's grown and changed. We went with low expectations considering what we'd read about the food and cocktails, but we weren't disappointed. Is it great food? No, but there are decent options on the menu (beef fajitas and the chicken pecan salad were winners). The Beau's Plate salad and enchiladas weren't as good. Service was outstanding, and so was the view.

reviews.author: Hernan V.
reviews.description: Just for the view that's it. My wife order a Mojito and it was terrible we told the waitress that it had no alcohol. " it has 2 shoots"  Will it's water down. Food we did not order just appetizers. For my Daughter kids menu quesadillas with fries. Fries were cold. After all the bad reviews we read of this place we just went here for the view.

reviews.author: Angie M.
reviews.description: ON LAKE TIME!   It was my last day in Austin and my brother wanted t show me something a little out of the ordinary. We had just been going shopping oh and drinking. I wanted to experience the nature side of Austin.   The Oasis on Lake Travis was the place for us to venture out too. My brother said he had not been to it before, but wanted to try it.   To my surprise it was something grand. Absolutely gorgeous views of the lake and the more upscale houses Austin has to offer.   My brother and my parents had had a bite to eat prior to coming here, but I had not. I went shopping a the Domain and they had gone eating. From what I have heard, The Oasis is good for drinking, but not so good for eating. Their food is honestly sub par at best.   We ordered some drinks and chips and guac for the table. But I wanted something a little more in my stomach. I got the grilled shrimp tacos. They were good. But I have definitely had better. The only thing was that they were super spicy. I was not expecting them to be that spicy. All of a sudden my tongue was sweating and I was uncomfortable with that.   This is a must stop for the views. The views are outstanding. But the food was not the best. The mojito I had was strong. It was like one sip and I was already feeling it.

reviews.author: Terri B.
reviews.description: Oasis, oh how I love you.   I've been coming to the Oasis for years, literally my whole life. It has always been amazing, and they have expanded it considerably since the fire. The outdoor decks are sprawling, so many places to take in that view. And y'all, it had the absolute most stunning view of Lake Travis.   I just lost my father and was in need of an escape and some fresh air. Today I brought my dad's convertible mustang out (I MAY have gone kinda fast) to have lunch on this perfect blue bird day. I definitely felt his presence out here with me.   My server was so friendly and had the best customer service. I really enjoyed her serving me. I ordered a swirl margarita and chips and queso which were delivered quickly. For lunch I had a mixed fajita with steak and shrimp, refried beans and the fixings. Food was delicious.   I love the art they have installed around the restaurant. Really gorgeous bronze sculptures and we'll appointed gardens.   Thank you for a perfect experience.

reviews.author: Robert E.
reviews.description: Went for dinner here last night with a colleague! I was honestly kind of worried based off of the reviews that the food wasn't going to be good. The area has changed so much since I was here 20 years ago, it's almost like a little city around the restaurant of stores and even what looked like a little hotel and parking garage.    Anyways the view was of course amazing, known as the sunset capital of Texas, it def lives up to that, we even were able to see a plane land in the water to watch the sunset which was really cool!  As for the drink! I had the tropical depression which was sweet and fruity and perfect for the atmosphere! We both ordered the fajitas and I'm going to say they were some of the best fajitas I've had in years, quality meat like actually real skirt steak in nice sized strips with great quality thick chicken breast strips! Queso was great! Salsa was great! Chips were great! I really couldn't have asked for anything to be better.   Don't always go by the reviews is what my moral of the story was because you might be surprised!

reviews.author: Jenny F.
reviews.description: Paying for the view  Place: It's a good place for family trip or just get together. The restaurant is surrounded by shops like coffee, ice cream, clothes , candies, photo hub and a lot more. BUT the most magnetizing place here is the view of the lake and the sunset.   Food: The food was not that special but became one because of the view and people/person you are with. Honestly if only the food we rating here, I'll give 3 not bad but not good as well.   Also expect long wait/line for the restaurant. While waiting we roamed around so we didn't really got bored. There's lot of shops and artist that offer their services like, caricature drawing.

reviews.author: Jim H.
reviews.description: The Oasis is great for outdoor dining and has an amazing view of Lake Travis, especially during a sunset.  A couple of weeks ago, I visited Austin for a quick weekend getaway.  A small group of us came out for lunch and we didn't have to wait long because it was an early lunch and the weather was a bit cold.    PROS:  Even though the water level was a bit low, the view of Lake Travis was AMAZING!  Make sure to sit outside to be able to enjoy the view.  During the summer, it's worth it to make reservations during the sunset to get the most out of your experience.  The wait staff are super friendly and are attentive to all your needs.  CONS:  I will echo some of the other reviews on here and say the food is mediocre Tex-Mex at best.  We ordered the shrimp tacos, fish tacos and beef fajitas.  The tacos are decently seasoned, but the rice and beans are a bit bland and the dish overall was a bit cold.  The fajitas did come out nice and hot and the meat was seasoned well.  I will definitely be ordering the fajitas for the next time.  The drinks and desserts we ordered:  an Irish coffee, the Fantasy Chocolate Cake (which is a flourless chocolate) and the flan.  The Chocolate cake was surprisingly delicious while the flan was a bit too thick for my liking, but the flavor is really good.  The area surrounding the restaurant also has eclectic artwork to look at as well as small retail shops to explore.  Due to Covid each store has limited hours so you may want to call ahead to see if they're open.  Overall, it's a great area to sight see in Austin.  Especially if it's your first time.

reviews.author: Dean S.
reviews.description: Service was great. View is amazing. Food and drinks were okay but mercy... so expensive. Chips and guacamole, two drinks were $50? We wandered around for a bit. Lots of closed stores in same location. Kind of feel bad giving them three stars but it is what it is.

reviews.author: TJ H.
reviews.description: The Oasis on Lake Travis is one of those tricky places where you have to average out the good with the bad to get a good idea of the place.  The good:  No question about it, the sunset is second to none, awesome views, awesome picturesque scene, and just about all of the outdoor seating has a great view of the scene. An additional positive, is the parking.  Easy to get to, plenty of free parking for the complex they are in, and even has valet parking if you prefer not to walk the 100 yards to the restaurant.  The not so good: I don't want to say the food was necessarily bad, it was just mediocre Mexican cuisine with a relatively small selection compared to your normal Mexican place.  To go along with the mediocre food is a price of about 1.5-2x what you would typically pay, but again you are here for the view not the food. The service also was not bad, but I think "nonchalant" would be the best way to describe it.  So the real question, would I recommend it? Yes I would but just go into it with the right mindset that you are going for the view, you are paying for the view and you will not be disappointed!  I would probably not go back if I am in Austin, but I am glad we went once.

reviews.author: David T.
reviews.description: Came here around 4:30pm on a Sunday to with a party of 5. We waited an hour to get a table outside with a nice view of the lake. Food is pretty basic so just know you're paying for the view. The drinks might be another selling point, but I didn't have any.    In short if you have out of town visitors and want to Wow them take them here for the view. That's about it.

reviews.author: Jenniffer M.
reviews.description: I saw lots of pictures online of this place and decided to go. It is definitely beautiful view. I was able to get an appetizer while looking at the lake. There was a waiting time, but it went by quickly. There is also a gift shop on the first floor that has souvenirs for all.

reviews.author: Jesse D.
reviews.description: Good view... strong drinks... but VERY pricey for average food. The drinks are pricey too. All that I can deal with. But you gotta deal with the hoard of madness and the service is VERY VERY slow. 90min for a table and 60mins waiting for the food to come out of the kitchen. You guys need to figure out something for your staffing crunch at weekend dinner. It's pretty bad

reviews.author: Karen D.
reviews.description: Came here on a Sunday morning when they opened at noon, and there was no wait time. Sat upstairs with a nice view of the lake, however b/c it was a square 4 top, only 2 people had the optimal view. I wish they had those half moon booths, so everyone could have a good view.   Ordered the salsa, queso, and fajitas (chicken and beef) for 2, which was plenty for 4. The food came out very quickly, but there were times we struggled to flag our server down for other requests. The salsa was very runny, and the chips were broken up. I wish there would have been more whole intact chips. The queso was tasty. The meat was a bit dry. Beans were good, but rice was a bit too "cafeteria" in terms of flavor and texture. The grilled veggies and guacamole that accompanied were good though.   Overall, you come here for the super touristy experience. I've heard the sunset views are unbeatable!

reviews.author: Ashleigh J.
reviews.description: I was excited to come here since it's so popularized on IG and TikTok. We weren't hungry so we decided to just get some chips  and salsa and a couple of drinks- which we were able to enjoy on the deck as the sun was starting to set. It cost about $50 for our two drinks and chips, but we were sat quickly and had drinks quickly after ordering- it's a beautiful place to grabs drinks and watch the sunset and enjoy the beautiful view.

reviews.author: Justin M.
reviews.description: I don't get the hate. Are the prices high? Yes, but you're paying for the view/ambiance, not necessarily the food. Having said that, the food quality is pretty good and the service has always been good for me (though we are admittedly only there for weekend lunch service since we always have kids).   My shrimp tacos were well flavored and a good (yet not overflowing) portion. Menu wise they could definitely work on their beer selection - need more craft beers and some varied selection of beer styles.

reviews.author: Britt W.
reviews.description: We've used Vine Vault's white glove delivery service for years on shipments large and small with zero issues. First class operation. Highly recommend.

reviews.author: Lacey W.
reviews.description: Very pleasant addition to the downtown scene!  This is a perfect place to house an expanding personal collection of wine.  First and foremost a wine storage facility grown into a tasting lounge and concierge service.  Vine Vault staffs a fantastic sommelier, Nicole, who is hands on with personal service and planned events.  Even more interesting is that it happens to be located in the old vault of the Bank of America building.  Inside the facility is the actual bank vault and the exterior vault door is a key piece of the decor as you enter from the garage.  Think of a cigar lounge atmosphere (sans smoke) for wine drinkers....leather club chairs, cozy atmosphere, glassware and some snacking options.  Perfect spot to participate in one of their wine dinners, host a client social hour or simply enjoy a nice bottle before dinner downtown.

reviews.author: John G.
reviews.description: Under no circumstance should you trust this company with anything more than a $20 bottle of wine.  One of my wineries in Napa shipped a case of very expensive Cabs to me via Vine Vault.  It was shipped from Napa on 11/5/18 and received by Vine Vault in Austin on 11/6/18.  Vine Vault then proceeded to sit on the wine until I went searching for it. It was finally shipped to me via FedEx on 12/4/18, almost ONE MONTH later!  NO RESPONSE from company or managing partner, one Elton Potts. I have no guarantee that the wine was properly stored, as temperatures in Austin in November were frequently in the mid to upper 70's and into the 80's on a couple of days.  I intend to return the wine to the winery and will STRONGLY suggest that they cease using this poorly run company.

reviews.author: Doug K.
reviews.description: Great job on pickup, timelines and attitudes of all concerned. Convenience was important and they are.

reviews.author: Mallorie T.
reviews.description: This place was simply amazing! Everyone who worked there was so kind and the food and sangria were great! The views were very pretty and they have a cute little porch you can sit on with super comfy rocking chairs. We got the bread and olives / olive oil plate as well as the red sangria, both were phenomenal! I will be coming back soon!!

reviews.author: Katie B.
reviews.description: You know how back in the day folks had a milkman? Well, I wanted a piece of that nostalgia but don't drink milk. What I do consume a decent amount of, though, is olive oil, so I went about getting myself a mOOn (yes, I did just combine man and olive oil and no, I'm not ashamed of it).   Really, I was low on olive oil and missed my window for my grocery delivery so took the opportunity to support local and explore Texas Hill Country Olive Co.'s offerings.  The website is super easy to navigate and they have a wide variety of olive oil and vinegars, along with bundles of multiple if you don't know where to start. I received my order within a two-day window during the week from Xmas to NYE, without opting for any expedited shipment, so that was a lovely surprise.  I am a fan of anything chili or jalapeno, so I opted for their jalapeno-infused OO, along with two standard olive oils just to have on hand. The 100ml bottles run $12 each, not including shipping (my 250ml that I usually get from Imperfect Produce is $4.79), so a pretty stark contrast in price. I used the jalapeno on popcorn the other night, as well as toasted bread, and it didn't really have any kick to it, which was disappointing. I was hoping that for the price, it would be a boombastic flavor ball, so I could justify its purchase and continue to patronize from my mOOn.   I am so happy I could support local, and maybe if I visited the estate, I would have a better appreciation for the product, but as a stand alone, I most likely won't be ordering again.

reviews.author: Ryna D.
reviews.description: Well that was underwhelming.. I read about the olive farm and thought it was something unique so we stopped by for a visit. Unfortunately I was told by one of the ladies in the shop that they suffered a huge loss in their crop a few years ago and the olive grove is still recovering..
