Which meant that there isn't much to see in terms of the olive trees. I did an olive oil tasting but that in itself wasn't that memorable either. It felt a bit like a wasted trip to be honest..

reviews.author: Chris W.
reviews.description: I highly recommend trying their award winning olive oil set (my favorite is the verde) and different flavors of vinaigrettes: white lemon, prickly pear, fig, etc.! I bought several gift boxes for friends and colleagues; everyone was very excited to receive them. They also sell pesto artichokes in a glass jar packages with a cute wooden spreader. Shopping locally was a personal goal of mine this year. I thought this place was perfect! They gifted me a box of very delicious butter pecan cookies when they rang me up. I ate all of it in two mins... couldn't even remember what brand it was.

reviews.author: Jay L.
reviews.description: I don't understand this place. It is basically a gift shop and a small restaurant. I wonder where the olives come from to make their myriad of products? Doest seem like the olive tree orchard is producing enough olives for more than a few martinis! We were greeted kindly at the door but there is really nothing to see here. We were expecting an opportunity to sample some of the products before purchasing but no tastings were offered or on display. So we are back to the fact that you drove here to enter a gift shop. Hmmm  p.s. I see after reading reviews thst perhaps large trees died last winter which is sad. It also appears that tastings are offered here but the kind lady who greeted us did not mention them sonperhaps they are scheduled or have been stopped for covid so check before you come so you aren't dissapointed like we were.

reviews.author: Michelle L.
reviews.description: Beautiful property although the olive trees look like they didn't survive the snowpocypse. You can walk around the property. Staff are very friendly. Supposedly the owner picks the grapes and they have a few types of wine that gets made somewhere else. Can't tell you how it is since I didn't feel like purchasing a glass or bottle. They don't do wine tastings anymore although there is a sign out front.   Their olive oil and balsamic vinegar was tasty on fresh bread. The flat bread was just that... flat. To a crisp. The margarita flavor meant some cheese and basil but not really any tomato flavor. Wouldn't recommend the flatbreads. It was a good idea but poorly executed.

reviews.author: Andrew Y.
reviews.description: The place is really not worth visiting unless you're coming out for the tours. It's a gift shop where you can already buy mostly everything online to begin with. The restaurant menu is terribly overpriced for what you're getting on the plate. Think margherita pizza but at the size of a standard flour tortilla.  My recommendation is to save your money, go straight to the olive oil section in the store, buy in bulk, go home and create your own tray of olive oils and eat it however way you want to enjoy it.   The olive oils are exceptional by the way. Infused garlic, rosemary and sola stella were my favorite. If you're into balsamic, the strawberry infusion was a surprise crowd-pleaser in our house.   3/5 stars for the giftshop/restaurant location. If this was a review specifically for the olive oil, I would rate it much higher.

reviews.author: Ruthie W.
reviews.description: In planning for our day trip, I thought about checking out an olive orchard. Years ago, I had read about Sandy Oaks olive orchard but never quite made it out to visit. On my search online, I found Texas Hill Country Olive Company in Dripping Springs. The timing might not have been the best since the arctic freeze affected the olive trees. We did see both mission and arbequina a year and a half old olive trees. Under the shade of the oak tree and a breeze, we sat to listen to Cara (one of the owners) share the history of how their family business started. With a brief visit with the resident chickens we headed indoors for the abridged version of the mill tour. Finally understood how extra virgin olive oil is made and not to ever buy light olive oil!  After the olive orchard and mill tour, we joined the tasting tour ($10). There were so many varieties of olive oil and balsamic vinegar and flavor profiles similar to wine tasting. I loved getting to combine the balsamic vinegar with the olive oil and tasting with the bread and apple.  It was fun shopping at the store. Goodness with making choices though! I knew I definitely wanted their olive-based products.  Next time we'll have to stay and enjoy some lunch.

reviews.author: Ryan D.
reviews.description: We had a fantastic time! We were already in the area visiting a distillery. Lots of winding roads to get there from Cedar Park but worth the trip. We bought bread and olives and had a flight of olive oils to taste with small pieces of bread. They serve wine and beer too. The bistro had already closed but we will definitely be back. The staff was friendly and informative. We even walked into the olive grove to see the baby trees up close. The Sicialian olives with garlic are amazing. We also bough feta cheese olives. The caramel sauce we bought went great with Frederick peaches we bought on the way home. We also had some delicious Gelato which was cold enough to take to go.

reviews.author: Jamie P.
reviews.description: This was our first visit to Texas Hill Country Olive company. The employees were very friendly and explained the ordering process. We were able to snag a couple rocking chairs on their front patio and enjoy the beautiful weather. The Salumi plate was one of the more interesting charcuterie boards I've ever tried. The cheeses were on point, some sharp and others soft with herbs and spices. It could have used a bit more jam and crackers overall. The view off the porch was worth the stop itself. Would definitely recommend trying when in the area and I'm sure a tour would be fun when the trees are in season. I was disappointed they didn't have olive oil tastings going on due to Covid, but I also understand.

reviews.author: Leslie W.
reviews.description: This place was great! It was mobbed due to spring break and it being a Friday, but the staff handled everything with graciousness and good humor. The sausage flatbread and Sangria were awesome!

reviews.author: Hal F.
reviews.description: This place is heavenly!  You feel like you have been transported to Tuscany, the scenery, the smell of the food and olive oil when you enter the place is divine.  I am in LOVE with this spot.  I went last week for my Birthday with Brother and Sister-in-law.  It was wonderful.  The olive oil is probably the best I have ever had, I ended up buying a bunch of olive oil after lunch.  We sat for two plus hours, eating, drinking and just enjoying the scenery.  We were so incredibly lucky because the weather was amazing, and there was a beautiful breeze so it was cool and comfortable.  We had a variety of different sandwiches and anti-pasta...everything was to die for!  I can't wait to go back.  What an incredible GEM.

reviews.author: Madison P.
reviews.description: I attended the Rockwall farmers market today, and Texas hill country olive company had a stand there. All of the oils and vinegars sounds amazing, but decided to try the blackberry balsamic vinegar. All I can say is wow!!! The blackberry flavor is strong, sweet, and so natural. I can't believe how amazing it tastes. I can't wait to go back and get the basil infused olive oil and the strawberry balsamic vinegar next!

reviews.author: Rhonda L.
reviews.description: Customer service was ready to help you not only taste, but understand the various olive oils. The entire experience was where you felt welcomed and like you could love whatever olive oil you chose. Great pit stop on our journey today.

reviews.author: Karen D.
reviews.description: Came here on a weekday afternoon and bought several olive oils. With the yelp check in offer, you get 2 half glasses of wine to taste. I had a red and a rose - both were excellent. Service was so friendly, and this shop is endearingly charming. Highly recommend!

reviews.author: Lauren B.
reviews.description: Fun experience, not offering tours due to snow storm of 2021 there is no harvest/olives in the field. This is not a winery as listed but can be ordered.

reviews.author: Hollie B.
reviews.description: FABULOUS. Great experience. Must go. We had the sausage pizza after our tour and tasting and it was PHENOMENAL. The crust was so good. Probably one of the best pizzas I've ever had. The tasting was great and the history of olive oil was super cool to learn. Definitely visit! They don't have many olive trees right now because they lost them in the latest ice storm.

reviews.author: Camille L.
reviews.description: Touring the olive orchards was so much fun and an unexpected stop on our visit to the area. We've always wanted to do olive oil tastings and orchard tours in Italy, so were happy to find this until then. Unfortunately, due to the pandemic they aren't doing tastings at the moment. You can buy all the oils, as well as many other foodie items in their store. They also have a bistro with a nice menu, we came after eating lunch so didn't get to try anything. We tasted a few wines and thought they were okay, a little too acidic for our palates. The highlight was walking through the orchard and seeing the olive trees. I'd like to come back before the olives are harvested.

reviews.author: A M.
reviews.description: Food was wonderful and great presentation! Management and team really want customers happy.

reviews.author: Gergana S.
reviews.description: This was such a great outing for a Saturday morning! We did the orchard tour which was ~45min of walking around the olive trees and learning more about the process of growing and processing olive oil, as well as the different varieties. Our tour guide was great - very friendly and knowledgeable!  The tastings are cancelled due to the CORONA restrictions but we had a lovely lunch in their shaded outdoor patio. Highly recommend the olive oil and olives platter.  Speaking of COVID, great to see everyone wearing masks and the business itself enforcing the regulations. Felt very safe walking around and eating there.  And, of course, we couldn't leave without purchasing some of the delicious extra virgin olive oil and balsamic (which is not made there but commissioned from the special region in Italy).  Would highly recommend, especially if you have friends or family visiting in town. It's a short 40-50min drive from Austin.

reviews.author: Diane S.
reviews.description: If you saw the pics online and thought you'd be sipping wine in an Adirondack chair by the lake, you will be disappointed. You have to be a member of their club to be enjoy that.   However, despite this, you won't be disappointed you made the trip. The suburbs are approaching but there is enough open area on the drive there to make it relaxing. They greeted us as new visitors with a tasting of their Cuddles Cuve, light and refreshing. We decided to get a couple of glasses of wine and sit outside. They have cheese plates available too. Their Chardonnay and Red Blend were very good.

reviews.author: Britney G.
reviews.description: Ok, it's a little off the beaten path from all other wineries in the area, but well worth the visit. They do require reservations, so don't forget to do that! They have a beautiful set up with great views and allow dogs on the outdoor patio. The staff is friendly and the wine is really delicious. We left with a couple of bottles!

reviews.author: Jim F.
reviews.description: Be aware that these people do not do anything without a reservation. They were nice enough to seat us but it was obvious there would be minimal service. The staff present were quite nice, just busy. We were allowed to buy wine to self serve on the back porch and were welcomed to be inside the tasting room or outside which was near the vineyard - very nice out there.  Their vineyard was planted in 1999. That may be a little unusual for the immediate Austin area. The vines and the grounds are very well maintained.   As far as the place, it is beautiful. It has the feeling of Napa but with Austin-area live oak trees.  The property borders Lake Travis though it is barely visible from the tasting room area. There's an exclusive members only area that is on the lake.  We purchased the Claros Reserve which is a Norton grape (hybrid) and is the grape grown on the estate. The wine was surprisingly excellent and cost $35.   I think that, with a reservation, this would've been a superior experience.

reviews.author: Sabrina R.
reviews.description: Our visit to Stone House Vineyard was a true highlight of our anniversary vacation and and a delightful way to cap off our trip. The property is absolutely gorgeous - I mean you can truly just sit and relax for hours while you take in the stunning view. I had made reservations but we arrived a tad bit early and Liz was happy to accommodate us sooner. I'd like to take a moment to offer my sincerest appreciation for Liz as she made this experience so memorable for us. It was our first proper wine tasting and she truly took the time to explain every single wine to us - notes/scents to look for, best food pairings, explaining the difference in textures, where the grapes are from - I mean the whole nine yards. She even showed us the safer, beginner way to swirl the wine to really delight your senses before tasting. I had added a cheese board to our reservation which we thoroughly enjoyed! Liz was patient with all of our questions on the wine (and cheese), had a wonderful sense of humor, and just a lovely personality to deliver a phenomenal package of customer service. Every single wine we tried was delicious! We took home a bottle of Claros but we seriously wanted to take home one of each. If we weren't relocating soon, we would 100% have signed up for their membership. If we get to visit the area again, we will definitely stop in. I highly recommend visiting!

reviews.author: Gina F.
reviews.description: Had an amazing time visiting Stone House Vineyard! I wish I had known about it before. A short drive from Austin and well worth it. The wines were excellent with a lot of variety and worth the cost for the tasting. The property is stunning and did I mention the view of Lake Travis? They graciously let us sit in the members area and explore the property after our tasting and I'm seriously considering joining the club. Highly recommend!

reviews.author: Shannon R.
reviews.description: Good wine and great people!!!! Went to a few wineries in the area and this one is definitely worth the visit.

reviews.author: Natalie S.
reviews.description: DON'T COME HERE WITH KIDS. Can't speak of the wine, because we didn't have any. No tastings, just by the bottle. No glasses and no kids aloud anywhere on the grounds. Disappointing, because we drove out of our way and had our young daughter with us. Were hoping to have a nice little picnic. Waste of time. It would have been nice if it were posted on the website. It was a beautiful vineyard!

reviews.author: Sherry W.
reviews.description: This vineyard has a nice view of the water. You get five wines for $20. Only one wine was from Texas. A few of the wines were very poor in taste. It is table seating inside or  they have tables  outside. I prefer Spicewood winery.

reviews.author: Shannon F.
reviews.description: Absolutely beautiful and handling COVID well. You need a reservation but we found that there was plenty of space and it was quiet and we really enjoyed that. The wine is delicious!

reviews.author: Nikita D.
reviews.description: Came here for wine tasting and was very impressed with the vineyard. We were staying at Horseshoe Bay Resort and were deciding between several vineyards to try in the area. I'm really glad we ended up trying Stone House. We decided to sit on the patio for our tasting. I tried the classic tasting and my dad tried the reserve tasting. The wines were mostly from Australia. They had one of their house wines on my menu. I thought the quality of wines was very average. We also got a cheese board which was really good.  The area was picturesque and we were allowed to go down to an area for wine club members. They had an enclosed outdoor area for members only with a view of the lake.  Overall, if you want to go to a vineyard with great views, this is the place to go.

reviews.author: Chassey W.
reviews.description: This is a fantastic little vineyard tucked away on the south shore of Lake Travis. Sit up on the patio or down by the lake. The employees were super attentive and very kind. The cheese plate a great compliment. And they let us have our fur baby on the patio too . The special reserve Pinot noir is excellent!

reviews.author: Kelli C.
reviews.description: A beautiful hidden treasure. The atmosphere is fantastic- views of Lake Travis and grape vines sitting under a covered patio with a blanket and fireplace. It is definitely off the beaten path, but that is what makes it so serene. We enjoyed our wine tasting, and purchased two bottles of the Shiraz.

reviews.author: Ben G.
reviews.description: To start - what an absolutely stunning property! The service and entire staff was incredibly warm, friendly, helpful and engaging. We came with our 2 dogs and had a truly special, romantic early evening on my fianc's birthday. The wine and tastes were exceptional and we will definitely be back! Thank you!

reviews.author: Lindsay M.
reviews.description: Had such a great experience here with my family. We came on a rainy Saturday and they were nothing but accommodating. We had the best welcome with Jaramy, she was so informative and polite. We were greeted with a welcome drink then walked through their wine selection. We decided on a bottle to share with an amazing charcuterie board. The outside patio was covered with great views of the estate. Overall a great vineyard with great staff.

reviews.author: Amanda H.
reviews.description: This is by far the best winery around the Austin area.  Great staff and there isn't a wine they serve that I would drink.  That's hard to say for most Texas wineries.  They have beautiful lake views for wine club members.  I highly recommend it.

reviews.author: Annie M.
reviews.description: Excellent vineyard. The winemaker is from Australia and they have wines shipped from their Australian vineyard.

reviews.author: Amy K.
reviews.description: Champagne and Rose' Lake Travis views. Absolutely beautiful and relaxing. The service is friendly. Dogs are allowed. Lake views. Relaxing lounges. Champagne is delicious and rose is more on the dry side. Love this place.

reviews.author: Lisa P.
reviews.description: From the minute we walked in, Jaramy made this a special experience for our group, me especially. She welcomed us and gave us a nice toast of something bubbly and told us about the vineyard and its owner, Angela. The wine of the month was Angela's Wish. I was having a particularly emotional time with it at this point because my beloved grandmother, Angela, passed away recently and had wanted to visit this area. I, of course, had to get the wine of the month so I could keep that bottle. I told Jaramy of my grandmother and the significance of the name of the bottle and she listened with an open heart. My group also got a nice charcuterie board and sat outside. Though it was pouring down rain, we still had a lovely time conversing with others and enjoying the view.

reviews.author: Brittany A.
reviews.description: Warm atmosphere and welcoming staff. Andy was very accommodating of my family and I. The wines were delightful and the charcuterie boards were delicious and had a good presentation. They really made sure we had a pleasurable experience. I will definitely be back in the future!

reviews.author: T W.
reviews.description: The wine was wonderful and the view was amazing!! Bo was our sever. He was great! He took his time telling us about the place and each wine. We almost didn't come because of the reviews about the lake being blocked off , a benefit for members only. We asked and they let us go down and check out the place, no problem at all. We were there for hours!

reviews.author: Vincent W.
reviews.description: Fantastic tasting room with some good Texas wines.    The reds here standout!  Service is always excellent, fast and friendly.

reviews.author: Kris M.
reviews.description: Based on the other one star reviews here, I am not the only one with this experience, but the workers here are extremely rude and very pretentious. When I visited Fredericksburg, I went to multiple wineries and this was BY FAR the worst. The employees have no manners, and don't treat you well regardless of your membership status. My friends and I felt uncomfortable and judged the entire time we were there. Overall, there are much better wineries in the area with much nicer staff and better wine. Don't waste your time or money when there are other amazing options less than a mile away

reviews.author: Natalia R.
reviews.description: Covid review 12/2020 No seating for non-members and I suppose no kindness for them either. I went to the front and was rudely "greeted". We left because why would I purchase wine from someone who seems to treat me without professionalism since I'm not a member? Hmm not a way to acquire new members!

reviews.author: Holly S.
reviews.description: We did the wine tasting which was way over priced $30 for only 4 tastes. I felt ripped off. I'm from CA and Temecula wine tastings are $20-25. Go down the street within walking distance to Georgetown winery. The glasses were $8-10 with much better service.

reviews.author: Cora W.
reviews.description: Good wines. Wine club is good - we get the mixed wines. Always get a glass when we come. There's an upstairs member lounge and an outdoor patio. Small selection of food. Service is always with a smile.

reviews.author: Gary G.
reviews.description: Classy space, nice location and excellent wine.  Had the distinct pleasure of being served by waitress Jennie Tedesco while drinking an excellent red wine blend.  Jennie's ability to know exactly what we wanted before we did was truly enjoyable and her knowledge of wine and friendly professionalism made for a great Saturday outing.  Have been to both the Grape Creek Vineyards near Fredericksburg and to the Georgetown tasting room.  Each are excellent, but the Georgetown location with its wonderful staff are the reason we keep our coming back.

reviews.author: Sarah S.
reviews.description: This was an amazing experience. The food was just as good as the wine !! The pizzas were amazing. The charcuterie board was to die for, meatballs were okay, and garlic hummus was a winner.

reviews.author: William B.
reviews.description: Conveniently located on the Georgetown Square, Grape Creek Vineyards tasting room is a welcoming oasis of great wines and friendly "tasting ambassadors". You know Grape Creek's wine is good: they earned almost 2 dozen medals, including three Double Golds, this year at the prestigious San Francisco Wine Competition. And their wins encompass all styles, with Double Gold wins for red, white and Port. My Tasting Ambassador, Sandy, was exceptional! As we talked, she discerned my tastes and made a couple of recommendations that turned out to be spot on. She was knowledgeable and responsive, and a delight to talk with. Having been to many tasting rooms and wineries in the Texas Hill Country as well as from the California wine regions to the New York Finger Lakes, my experience at Grape Creek exceeded my expectations. Highly recommended!

reviews.author: Angela P.
reviews.description: This was the second stop during my Saturday night wine bender. I've never been here before. My friend is a wine club member and invited us to accompany her and her significant other to a tasting. We ended up enjoying a bottle! It was delicious. We sat in the reserved section on the second floor and finished the bottle and relaxed. Grape Creek has a nice selection of local wines to choose. Although the facility is small, the atmosphere is friendly and quaint.

reviews.author: Phillip H.
reviews.description: These guys are extremely rude. We all purchased memberships and wanted to enjoy our wine on the patio which was mostly empty. Since they made us split up our party of six we got two tables that were close together. Apparently management had a problem with my girlfriend and I orienting our chairs towards our friends table so we could all talk to each other and came and got in our faces to tell us we have to turn our chairs around and face forward. What is this kindergarten? The wine was alright, but definitely not good enough to justify the $40 per bottle price tag. I've found better bottles at HEB for under $20. Don't waste your time or money. There are plenty of other wineries in the area of the same quality that are more affordable and less rude

reviews.author: Erica G.
reviews.description: Grape Creek is my official go to for Georgetown vino. After signing up in Fredericksburg, I've quickly come to LOVE their red wines...particularly Bellisimo. It is absolutely delish and my go to red for my collection and for gifting to friends.   While the main building itself is somewhat small and doesnt offer the option to sit downstairs (GC....this is overdue), there is a members only room available upstaird with views of the Gtown Square.  The patio however is the reason people gravitate towards this winery. There is live music, nice fans to keep you cool in summer and heaters for the winter.  My only dislike is the changes hours...it closes at 6:30. Far too early and down the street are alternatives that stay open til 9 or later.

reviews.author: Shelley F.
reviews.description: Visited during a recent trip and was delighted.  EVE WAS AMAZING - she explained things so well on our tasting!

reviews.author: J. S.
reviews.description: Could not love this winery more. Although... standing in line when you first walk-in did seem a bit off, it was merely just a way to help usher traffic through more efficiently. Luckily, the line went quickly or this would probably be a different type of review, as someone * wink wink* who doesn't do well with lines for absolutely anything, except that one Prince concert 30 years ago.   Needless to say, we came, we tasted, we joined the wine club and now we are big fans. Especially of their Rose of Malbec. That deliciously tasting watermelon jolly rancher (without the sugar) wine has changed wine drinking for me and completely justifies the $30 price tag.

reviews.author: Mike M.
reviews.description: Fantastic service and wonderful atmosphere. This place does it right. It is very comfortable, the staff is welcoming and just an overall great place to spend some time and relax on the square in Georgetown. Whether in the members only room upstairs or out on the private patio, this is a very nice place.

reviews.author: Russ V.
reviews.description: Good wine, fun old/down town feels, great staff, what more do you want? We signed up for the membership cuz yum!

reviews.author: Emily M.
reviews.description: I'm really unsure what to say about this place. I've only been here a couple of times and the staff member that helped us was amazing. I decided to join the wine club because of her level of service. However, it's hard to get a hold of someone on the phone. I have a simple question to ask but no one will ever pick up the phone. When select the button to speak to the tasting room, their automated service starts all over again. Yes, I can email, but for a simple question, picking up the phone should be an easy option as well.  Also, the times on yelp versus their times on the phone are inconsistent. That needs to be updated.  Bottomline, they lack communication.  It's really annoying and frustrating. I plan on canceling my wine club membership and going elsewhere due to the experience that I've had.

reviews.author: Kenneth B.
reviews.description: This winery is smack downtown Georgetown and has a really great feel. It has a great assortment of wine that is reasonably priced. I really like this winery, with the exclusive access to seating upstairs. I love the live entertainment outside lounge area. I really like this winery! I also like how EVERY time you come to the winery, you get a complimentary glass of wine! Of course, you need a membership.  I don't live in the area so I have a trek to make to receive my complimentary glass of wine for me and a guest. However, when I am in the area you better believe I am here. I just started my membership last visit but failed to write a review after a couple of bottles. My apologies. I was informed that my three bottles qill be mailed to my residence in Harker Heights, Texas. I will be sure to post how that goes. You can cancel the membership at anytime. More to follow after I really get a chance to experience this establishment.

reviews.author: Kami S.
reviews.description: We were sharing a couple bottles on the patio (my friend is a member) when an employee (who was drinking a glass of wine herself) came out and told us extremely rudely that they were closed and we needed to get out. She started jerking things away from the table while we were still sitting there. We had previously been sitting there calmly, not being loud or offensive in any way - it felt very abrupt and extremely rude. We realized after we were booted out that closing was at 5 and this intrusion happened at 5:10, it wasn't like they were waiting on us for an hour. Even though my friend is a member we won't be coming back.

reviews.author: Joey G.
reviews.description: We bought our membership in Fredericksburg, but we live in Round Rock. When you join the club, you get two glasses a day, and we are regulars at the Georgetown square. Everyone there is very friendly. We do miss the live music in the back. But it's nice to grab our glasses and sit on the square.

reviews.author: Pamela M.
reviews.description: Grape Creek Vineyards is about 2 miles from my best friend's house in downtown Georgetown. We had so much fun there!  My sorority sisters came to Georgetown for Austin's ACL Fest and added on extra days to sightsee.   Grape Creek was a wonderful respite.  You stand in line, describe your likes to the salesperson, and taste. Then, you get wine by the glass (I think it was 10$/glass) to enjoy on their relaxing patio, and bottles to go.   My BF is a frequent member and has a card to get 2 free glasses of wine a month.   A very nice spot to relax and enjoy good wine and good conversation.   Thank you Grape Creek Vineyards!

reviews.author: Mark S.
reviews.description: Have you ever had something you loved so much that you didn't really want to share it?  Well that's the relationship I have with the Wine Cellar. This place is amazing and we love it but like a good secret,kinda want to keep it to ourselves. Their wine selection is the best in town and their prices are amazing. Stephen, Tim and John all know and love their wines and are some of the nicest people we know. They offer weekly tastings that allow you to explore all sorts of different wines affordably.  If you love wine, this is your place.

reviews.author: Amy E.
reviews.description: Love this place! Excellent selection of wine and small bites featuring local Austin purveyors. Follow their social pages for unique tasting events. The friendliest most welcoming staff- it's no wonder locals frequent this shop and bar.

reviews.author: Daniel C.
reviews.description: Best place near Austin for wine. Very relaxing atmospherere, both indoors and out, unique selection. Steven can get anything. The workers and the guests are all amazing. Steven, David and John are the best people ever. You can ask any question and they can always lead you in the right direction. All the other guests will always help you feel included, if you are nice. A great place for everyday wine, party wine and whatever wine. The people here will always help you out. Plz call us if you're heading over, we'll join you

reviews.author: Chris B.
reviews.description: OK so this is a hidden gem for the hills of Lakeway. It looks like a little nothing store in a retail setting. You get inside and it's a really warm atmosphere, the bartender wine host was great friendly. There's a terrific selections of wine, there's a nice little bar, there's a private room on the side, I think it can be reserved possibly?  I have to tell you this was a secret spot that people should know about! The prices were reasonable, the wine selection was great the  atmosphere is five stars!  Give it a shot guys!

reviews.author: Melissa T.
reviews.description: After a wonderful massage wanted to have a glass of wine outside with a friend.  I had my service dog with me, however, there was only one table outside to sit at but there was another dog who tried to attack my dog nearby. So when we asked to sit inside, they refused to let us in with my service dog.  After a heated exchange, I was told "F" You" belittled and verbally attacked by several customers and the owner.  I was very appalled and would never recommend this place that was so condescending and refused our service.  I have the right to take my service dog wherever I go.  This is the most shocking appalling and disrespectful situation I've ever experienced at a public place!! Negative stars!!

reviews.author: Tina W.
reviews.description: Ethel's is the ideal place to meet friends for happy hour after a long day's duties.  (It's a great escape just before OR after the a massage appointment from down the walkway as well!) Fantastic selection of wines from around the world. But it's the atmosphere, the PEOPLE and POSITIVE vibes that attract me MOST to Ethel's Wine Market.  Lovely setting. Great selections. Sincere service.  5+STARS

reviews.author: Gina P.
reviews.description: This is the new location and rebrand of Lake Travis Wine Trader. Same warm and amazing staff, but in a modern and beautiful new setting. I love the classy Texas vibe-a perfect blend of feminine and masculine decor. The staff truly treat you like family. The wine selection is superb, with something delicious for every price point. Ethel's is a gift to the Lake Travis area.

reviews.author: Renee S.
reviews.description: Awesome service, fabulous atmosphere and delicious cheese plates.  We had a Galentine's Day group of friends celebration at Ethel's and what a celebration it was!  Their back room is a hidden gem-so cozy.  We shut the place down!  The choices are amazing.  A go to must in Lakeway!

reviews.author: Toni Y.
reviews.description: This is a hidden treasure in Lakeway. Staff was very knowledgeable and extremely friendly. Great wine selection. Warm and cozy atmosphere for one, couples or large group and events. My husband and I went on a day they had free chair massages. So that was a bonus! A must visit place in Lakeway

reviews.author: J H.
reviews.description: Love this wine market!!  Fantastic place for wine enthusiasts in Lakeway!

reviews.author: Mike R.
reviews.description: Incredible selection, awesome lounge, great food and service!  The staff is incredibly knowledgeable and the space is perfect for entertainment.

reviews.author: Kim N.
reviews.description: I discovered Ethyl Ambrosia literally around the corner from my house while walking my dog. What a fabulous discovery. I sampled the product and became a believer. All my friends are getting Ethyl Ambrosia for Christmas, and those who have already received theirs are clamoring for more! Their tasty, vegan, alcoholic shots are a hit in 4 flavors (I'm partial to the ros).   Give these a try and you'll be sold!  They're perfect for events or just kicking back at home. And their patent-pending twist cup makes shots classy.

reviews.author: Jaclyn L.
reviews.description: The workers were very nice and it was a neat place. It is not the best location and was a little hard to find but once we got there we were very happy. There's free tastings and then you can buy individual shots or a box of 20. They are vegan Jell-O shots and the cups they have are super cool. We got the box of 20 and they're 15% alcohol.

reviews.author: Brandon S.
reviews.description: Our group scheduled the Real Austin Tour. Our guide, Nick, was great. He was at the meeting spot early, he was friendly, and did a good job getting us around the city. The tour was mostly driving with him pointing out different sights and areas of interest. I think the best way to describe it is getting an overview of the major hangout spots/areas, being familiar with where they are and what they offer.  He had some good recommendations for food and music venues, which we appreciated. I'm not sure we would have missed any of the areas explored on the tour (6th street, east Austin, Rainey, south Congress). It's still nice to be able to focus on taking it all in and looking for interesting places while someone else is driving though. There are details and trivia that he provided that would be missed as well, had we gone on our own.

reviews.author: James V.
reviews.description: Awesome tour. Ike the tour operator and owner is very knowledgeable and passionate about his city. Highly recommended! Thanks again, good luck and always remember to "Be Kind."  James

reviews.author: Larry H.
reviews.description: We did a barbecue and winery tour to Driftwood with a tour guide named Marty.  He was amazing.    The tour was relatively simple, to the Salt Lick Barbecue and two wineries,   The wines were better than I expected (who knows about Texas wines????) .  But the highlight was Marty's knowledge of the area and his way of making us feel comfortable, welcomed and interested in Austin.  We'll be back.

reviews.author: Michelle R.
reviews.description: Great tour today with Jason.  He was very knowledgeable about the history of Austin, the music vibe, the food, the neighborhoods.  We learned a ton and our visit here will be too short to take in all the cool places he spoke about and recommended.  I would highly recommend this tour.  Take it on your first day here so you'll have ideas of where to eat, what to see and venues to check out live music!!   Kudos Jason!

reviews.author: Denise S.
reviews.description: What a fantastic tour!  Jason is extremely knowledgeable and shared so much about the area including history, music, eateries and more. Don't miss this tour company!

reviews.author: Lisa P.
reviews.description: This was an awesome way to see the city.  Covers a lot of ground.  Ike was an incredible guide - so informative and asked each person what they wanted to see or learn about.  Provided so many great recommendations for things to do, places to eat and things to see.  Definitely recommend doing this first thing when you get to the city so that you can plan things to do on your trip.  10 out of 10!

reviews.author: Janice N.
reviews.description: It was an Awesome tour with Martin! My husband and I did the  Hill country wine and bbq tour. Martin was very friendly l, entertaining and provided great information. The only downside was most of the people in the group (we were the only minority) weren't really talking to us and we felt excluded in their conversations, I guess they weren't aware of their racial biases. But overall it was a great experience plus love the BBQ!

reviews.author: Janet W.
reviews.description: We had an awesome tour with Jason at Austin Detours. He was a wealth of information for other venues to visit while in town and very knowledgeable about the music scene in Austin. We stopped at 2 lovely wineries and the Salt lic barbeque. It was a wonderful way to see places outside of the city.  I would highly recommend this tour and Jason!

reviews.author: Jacky F.
reviews.description: It was my boyfriend and I's first time in Austin and we were so glad to be able to experience a tour to Salt Lick BBQ and 2 wineries along with our wonderful tour guides Henry and Marty! They were both very knowledgeable about the area and had lots of great recommendations about how to spend the rest of our trip. We both felt very welcomed and I definitely recommend this tour if you love wine and trying out Texas-style BBQ! You won't be disappointed (:

reviews.author: Janet R.
reviews.description: Visited Austin for the first time with my husband to celebrate our 29th wedding anniversary. Decided to do a city tour and found Austin Detours online. Our experience with Jax, Ruben and Evan was great. They all know so much (interesting things) about Austin and their enthusiasm left me wanting to stay longer to learn more about this great "weird" city that I've grown to love. We rode around for two hours with 2 other couples in a van and it was perfect. The time flew by. I didn't want it to end. I would've loved hanging out with Jax, Ruben and Evan all day. Jax even treated us to gelato at one of her favorite food trucks in Barton Springs. How sweet was that!! We definitely will return someday to Austin to enjoy all there is to enjoy. Thank you, Jax, Ruben and Evan. It was a great pleasure meeting you all...truly!!!

reviews.author: Jose M.
reviews.description: Amazingly friendly, lay back and super informative.  Jason was our tour guide. He opened my eyes to the city and everything it had to offer.  After I left the tour, I felt like I understood what Austin was about.   Thank you so much for everything.

reviews.author: Janet O.
reviews.description: First time in Austin and I wanted an overview of the city with an emphasis on its history.  The Austin  Visitors Center was easy to find and had the tour i was looking for.  Trace, the guide, was one of the best tour guides I ever had - and I have traveled a lot. He was excellent!  The price was very reasonable for two hours.  Highly recommended.

reviews.author: Hinnah S.
reviews.description: We do sightseeing tours in every city we visit! Austin is a great city! We thoroughly enjoyed our tour!! We got to experience the "food truck culture", of Austin. Got to marvel at the beautiful architecture of the capital building. The waterfront was peaceful and serene! Our guide was great. He was So very informed about the city and offered lots of suggestions for points of interest. The only reason, one star is missing. The sprinter van! Yes it was comfortable. But unless you have a window seat. You do not get much of a view. Maybe the company could invest in a double decker bus for the ultimate sightseeing experience!

reviews.author: Dan F.
reviews.description: I don't usually take tours when I visit a destination, but decided to give Austin Detours a try because of their fantastic Yelp rating. If others are saying good things about them, then it's probably worth trying. I signed up  the Real Austin Tour the night before and got an immediate confirmation. Their website says "a city overview in just 2 hours" which was perfect, but with a little mishap and trouble with parking, it ended up being around 2.5 hours. The van was roomy and clean, and a nice component of the tour, well, because less walking. I can imagine during the hot summer, the van with a/c would be the preferred way to tour around the city.   The tour took us through many neighborhoods and major sights around Austin. Enough that, I went back to many of the stops to explore further. There were many interesting facts pointed out and of course, the scary stories and legends make it all very fun and a bit silly. Stopped off at one of the cupcakes food trucks for a tasty treat, all included with the tour. If you're in Austin, this is a great little tour to see many sites in a short span of time.

reviews.author: Daniela R.
reviews.description: Chris was the best tour guide! We came from LA and really got to learn about Austin's history, hot spots, best food spots, sports, the Capitol building + so much more. I highly recommend this tour. The van has AC which is nice.    and he was funny! We loved Austin!   Thanks Austin Tours for helping us fall in love with your city!

reviews.author: Kim B.
reviews.description: Great and informative tour.  Trace was our guide.  He was very personable. Asked everyone what they wanted to see or if there are highlights they wanted to achieve. Explain things very carefully and just made it really fun. I recommend this to anyone.  This was my first trip to Austin and thanks to Trace and Austin detours it will not be my last!

reviews.author: Nicole W.
reviews.description: Tour was amazing. I was very happy to see that the groups were very small, about 10 people total including the guides. I really liked how we were able to leave the car and take photos at some of the murals. My tour guides were amazing. 10/10 would definitely do it again.

reviews.author: C R.
reviews.description: Custom tour of breweries and food trucks. Tour guide was Jason.   Exemplary business with extremely nice employees. Everyone on our ten person private tour commented on how unusual it was to have such a convenient and easy way to tour breweries and food trucks - and we are locals to begin with!   One employee (MJ) traveled ahead of group just to order food  and block tables.  This was worth the price of admission by itself.   The sprinter van was very well kept and new.   Jason was a great guide! I will def be using these guys for future adventures.

reviews.author: J J.
reviews.description: We had the most amazing day with Jason Weems as our tour guide xtrordinar!!!!  We started the day off being picked up exactly on time at our hotel. Off we went to arrive a few minutes before opening at Salt Lick BBQ and were immediately escorted inside to order. Jason takes care of everything before hand so all you do is sit back, relax and enjoy. Next stop wine tasting at two different wineries. Fun,Fun, Fun!!! Lots of wonderful commentary all the way. Jason loves what he does and he is a real people person. A trip down South Congress finished out our day with all the fun facts from our personable guide. We had the best day ever!!!   Jason is also a singer and writer and offers purchase of his signed copy of a wonderful book he's written on Austin.   High Five Jason Lindsay and Toni Southern Ca

reviews.author: Anna R.
reviews.description: Marty was a great guide. He was knowledgeable and fun. He fit right in with our family dynamic.

reviews.author: Robert H.
reviews.description: The drive is as peaceful as the landscape is serene. Like everything in and around Austin, there's a sense of "for now..."   And that's why Vista Brewery is a smart play. It may be a drive out of the way now but soon it'll be right in the middle of everything.   Hopefully not too soon...  On a cold, sunny day, the grounds are a welcomed sight for adults and kids alike. The two buildings are new and impressive but not imposing on the landscape.  Now, the beer. The stouts were quite impressive. They were smooth and strong with a distinct personality. I tasted three of their stouts, loved all three for different reasons. My wife had a couple ales and was equally impressed.  The food was acceptable but not something to write home about. I feel like they could take it to the next level if they brought on 1-2 food trucks but I get that may not be in the cards for now.  All said, it offers something for everyone and you're bound to leave happier than you came in.

reviews.author: Michaela P.
reviews.description: Really like the venue and that they've completely opened back up. Looks like a great spot for a group event or private party.   Dog friendly. Plenty of parking. Seating inside and out. Small menu with plenty of Biergarten faves.   Just wasn't digging the beer this time. We did a couple of flights and sampled 8 different brews. The Blonde Ale was okay. Hubby and I both liked the Destination IPA. He likes the Dark Skies. Overall, the beer was a little off. Maybe next time.

reviews.author: Chelsea D.
reviews.description: Great staff, live music on Sundays. In and out door seating. Firepits and heaters for cool nights. Didnt try, but had food menu, as well!

reviews.author: Amanda S.
reviews.description: In lieu of having a wedding reception, we hosted a wedding luncheon for 40 guests at Vista Brewing in the Barrel Room. The staff was welcoming and extremely helpful and the venue was stunning! All of our guest commented on the amazing food. We could not have dreamt up a more perfect location. Thank you to the staff at Vista!

reviews.author: Valerie V.
reviews.description: Wonderfully off the beaten path.  I absolutely loved the modern space inside but also the very rural outdoor space. Wonderful areas for kids to play and adults to chill. Lots of great beer options for everyone no matter what your taste is. I tried the Everything is Aussome - an Aussie sparkling ale. It tasted a lot like an IPA to me. I may have expected it to be a bit lighter in taste but still a great bold flavor. Great for groups, family picnics, or just a fun day out to relax. Definitely worth the stop in the area.

reviews.author: Trevor D.
reviews.description: Beautiful spot, used to be great.  Beer is pretty rough these days.  Food offerings were always a bit comically small before the pandemic, but delicious, now they're just overpriced and not very good.  I miss the friendly staff, seems like they cycle through staff pretty regularly now.  It's a long drive and probably not worth it  these days.  This place used to be the absolute best.  The beer was epic.  Such a shame.

reviews.author: Daniel S.
reviews.description: This brewery should be on everyone's stop if your going to Salt Lick just down the road. Stopped here on Friday night and caught the tail end of their acoustic live music set which they happen to do every Friday night. They stage by far is the best set up I've seen In the area under a natural oak tree with twinkling lights scattered above. Could easily see this place being a great wedding venue. They also had a nice little hiking trail where there's additional seating and a kids playground located further down. Now let's talk about the beer and the brewery. The brewery is huge and has a nice modern approach with a little Texas flare. As far as beers I ended up trying a flight and by far definitely grab a Barton creek gold on a hot summer day. If your looking more of a full bodied beer destination ipa would be my choice. Can't wait to come back here once the weather starts to cool down.

reviews.author: Danielle D.
reviews.description: Gorgeous brewery and hang out spot tucked away in dripping springs. We got brewmaster flights and a little meat and cheese board. The beers were good - and rotate so it encourages you to be repeat visitors. Absolutely worth the stop especially if you're in the area.

reviews.author: Matthew W.
reviews.description: I haven't found another brewery on the level of Jester King, but Vista brewing got the job done. It has a great location right by Deep Eddys and Salt Lick BBQ, which allows you to make a nice day trip out of it.  Starting with the service, my party and I were seated immediately and were served. For drinks, we ordered  1. Adair 2. Zwickled  All the beers were excellent, especially the Adair.  For food, we ordered  1. Pretzel  2. Brisket Sandwich   The food was also great and a lot better tasting than other breweries, for sure. I did think it was interesting to have brisket pastrami cold, but it was still solid.   Overall, I will definitely come back to the spot because they have great food and even better beer.

reviews.author: Jason K.
reviews.description: My wife and I were on a long weekend vacation and went to Salt Lick for BBQ on a Sunday. (Amazing BBQ!)  We were looking for a tap room, since Texas doesn't let you buy beer beer before noon on a Sunday.  Vista has a huge outdoor seating area and they have a real good beer menu. I got two IPAs. They had snacks you can buy as well and I got a beanie and they had stickers if you ask.  Very nice people at the bar and lots of COVID appropriations were in place. Their free was was super good as well!  A really great place to try!

reviews.author: Allie R.
reviews.description: I absolutely love this brewery! It is located on a huge plot of land with lots of room for games, swinging chairs in the trees and live music, making it the perfect place to hang (even with children). Awesome selection of beers. They also have food available.

reviews.author: Andrew L.
reviews.description: Came here on a Saturday evening, was pretty easy to get a reservation and their patio had tons of open space. They did a great job of enforcing masks when people aren't seated at their table and made it easy for us to keep distance while in line.   Their beer selection is very diverse, so I opted for a flight in my first round. I was pleasantly surprised they allowed you to include their more expensive barrel series in the flight which made the 4 4oz pours for $12 a great deal. While those were tasty my favorite was the dark Pilsner, for such a dark beer it had a more mellow, malty flavor than you would expect.   Food wise it was fairly typical brewery fare, but the $1 hunks of watermelon really hit the spot on a hot August evening.   If you're looking for a brewery a little outside of Austin to escape the city for an evening I'd definitely recommend checking them out!

reviews.author: Brenda G.
reviews.description: Came here for a friend's baby shower.  It's near Salt Lick and there was a short dirt driveway before the parking lot.  Our friends had an area reserved for the event but there seemed to be plenty of seating.  The service was great and it's a perfect location on a nice October day.

reviews.author: Ron U.
reviews.description: I wish I could give this brewery six stars, we absolutely love coming to Vista brewing. There is something there for everyone including the wine lover, most of these breweries only cater to brewing beer but Vista also has a good selection for wine. They always have cool food trucks with tasty items to round out A wonderful visit that you won't forget anytime soon. It also has a wonderful playground for kids and a band that's just the right amount for a venue like this. Bring your friends your family you're out of town cousins because this place is all that and a bag of chips.

reviews.author: Sandi N.
reviews.description: Vista Brewing is one of the Breweries exempt from the new closed bar order (during Covid19) because of their food to alcohol sales ratio. We were excited to make a reservation for a special occasion and were assured (by way of Facebook messenger) that their "kitchen was open and ready for business". We arrived, ready for some good beer and food.  First disappointment: Their reservation check in system. A chalkboard sign indicated a table for to-go order pick ups and simply an arrow for reservations. No employee to greet, direct or be helpful. 2 employees filling to go orders as we stood in what we estimated to be the 'reservation' line. Several people were behindus when 2 young women cut in front of us and said loudly "Will you take walk ins" and to our astonishment they got an employee's attention who completely ignored us and helped them get a table. Very rude!  Once we were checked in we found a table in the shade and went to get our beers and food. Disappointment #2: No food. Only popcorn and a cheese plate. That was it. We told them we had been assured over messenger that their kitchen was open and they shrugged and said  "Don't know what to tell you. It's being renovated."  I can't understand how they are allowed to stay open withbeer and POPCORN sales as food, under the Governor's new restriction.  At this point we already had our beer so we went back to the table to make the best of it.  Disappointment #3: the amount of flies and mosquitoes. We go out to another "farm style brewery" frequently and have never had an issue with flies or mosquitoes like we did here. Maybe it's one brewery using a spray service vs. not? Maybe it's dogpoop from being a dog friendly brewery (although, so is the other farm Brewery we go to...) We had 4 mosquito bites while sitting there and this was at 5:00. Flies were insane.  It was a disappointment all the way around as we had really been looking forward to several hours of relaxation, beer and food out under the trees.  Added on 7/11:  I have not changed a word of my original review, however I am adding a Star based upon the great communication I have had with one of the owners, Kent, who wrote to me after my original review.  He seemed genuinely interested in my feedback and responded in a very thorough manner.

reviews.author: Alena D.
reviews.description: My husband and I love vista brewing! The owners are so friendly, it's family friendly and they follow covid guidelines so we felt very safe. We love sitting indoors and outdoors depending on the weather and like that we have that option. They have live music on weekends and the beer/wine selection is good. Pre-covid their food was farm to table and delicious. We're anxiously awaiting the return on their standard food items. Definitely a great place to check out!

reviews.author: Anita C.
reviews.description: Come for the beer, don't stay for the food.   We came here for the first time and ordered a bunch of food and beer. The beers are good. The food is not. I didn't realize the current menu is because of covid. The sandwiches were all cold. The pimento cheese dip was good but hard because it's also cold. Literally everything came out of the fridge as they handed it to us.   It was a terrible first impression. I understand it's covid, but I think they could've at least heated the sandwiches or tried to make some better food that can be packaged.   Great venue. Not sure I'll come back.

reviews.author: Garnie B.
reviews.description: Had a school event there and it was great.  Plenty of seating in and out.  lots of room for the kids to run about and having a great staff about was wonderful.   only ding was the coordination / distribution of food.  Basically they ran out for our guests, and well, there is nothing you can do about it.   Events are hard to plan for, especially with family and kids, so we will work with them next time to better handle the food service / serving.   The beer was good, the wine selection was pretty good.   What i liked the most was the atmosphere. on a cool evening, with the stars out, it was a great place to be to unwind and chill with friends / family.    Plenty of parking..   Finding the place...well, thats tricky.  See punch in the address in Google Maps, you will be ok, just know that when you get close, slow down, and know the entrance is on top of a hill ... so you can miss it if you are not paying attention.   will I go back: of course, and I would recommend you go and visit.

reviews.author: Ed G.
reviews.description: Friday afternoon at the Vista Brewing pop-up at the galleria!  Perfect weather, perfect pour!  Check it out!

reviews.author: Alex V.
reviews.description: First time ever at Vista! Also first draft beer (not Crowley/growler) since beginning of lockdown. Such a great spot.   COVID: Vista has a GREAT outdoor area with plenty of tables distanced from one another. The ordering process specifies 6 ft of distance in line. Hand sanitizer is everywhere. Beers are delivered in single use cups. They have also started their live music Fridays again where you can venmo the artist tips. Masks are required everywhere but at your table.  You can make a reservation on Open Table for their outdoor area. Currently, they are open until 8PM.  We brought our own chairs and a blanket to use as a tablecloth. We also brought our own glasses to pour the beers into. I love beer out of a glass so this was a need for me.   Overall: This brewery has a ton of good stuff going for it. It's a little out of the way for Austinites (40 minutes), so you've got to make a night out of it. We're generally bigger IPA fans, so there are a few breweries we would check out ahead of this one. BUT they still have a ton of great beers on tap, and it is so worth checking out.

reviews.author: Nilofer M.
reviews.description: If you want delicious and fresh Italian food with a beautiful indoor dinning experience I would highly suggest this spot. I came across it while searching on Reddit and made the best deduction of having dinner there for my 28th birthday!  Our waitress was the NICEST person I've ever met. Super kind, didn't rush, had great recommendations and allowed my boyfriend to surprise me with two little cakes.   Everything on their menu hits the spot but I got the fettuccine dish and my boyfriend got the penne vodka (which he claims is the best he's ever had). The drive is a bit long from ATX but 100000% worth it.  I will be visiting back when the weather is nicer to also enjoy the vineyard next door

reviews.author: Lynn Y.
reviews.description: Ordered to-go. Person answering the phone was delightful and friendly. I ordered the Daily Special Mahi Lupo. The vegetables, broccolini, tomatoes, and artichoke had a very nice flavor. However, the brocollini was served without trimming the huge stalks which were too thick to eat so you really didn't get much brocollini. The bread was stale. The oil for dipping was great. The mahi was disgustingly undercooked and slimy. The fish didn't flake, it slithered. If they fire grilled it, it jumped out of the fire real quick and was almost alive. I tried to nuke it for a minute but it just didn't work. I spent close to 50.00 for a meal I mostly couldn't eat. I love the setting, the villa feel of the place but I can't spend that kind of money for a bad meal. To-go orders are even more important to get right than in-house since there is no chance to replace it or remedy anything. I am a sushi fan and can eat raw fish, but this was like nothing I've ever seen. I prefer my fish dead before I eat it. Come on guys I pay you guys to catch the fish AND cook it for me!   Sorry, my picture are too big for Yelp and I am too tired and disappointed to try to fix that.

reviews.author: Tony C.
reviews.description: It's good... fire wood grill for the meats, pasta sauce was a little bland ... Service was top notch!  Need a reservation!

reviews.author: Kia L.
reviews.description: This place is really great for date night and a good glass of wine. I came here on a Saturday around 5pm which was extremely busy with kids everywhere. I had the Brussels sprouts as an appetizer and they were way too salty. The main was the risotto which was so interesting with the garlic probably wouldn't order it again but it was flavorful. The service was so slow but he was extremely friendly so we appreciated the service. I would dine here again in the summer for a glass of wine in their outdoor area.

reviews.author: Charli V.
reviews.description: Had a great dinner with my partner the other night at Trattoria Lisina. We didn't have an appointment but were able to grab a table right away.  The driveway was hard to see coming off the road but I suppose this is due to the "dark sky" community. Albeit, Some extra signage would be nice.   We ordered meatballs as an appetizer and these were delicious! The garlic toast that comes with this dish is soooo tasty!   Focaccia and oil is complimentary, wish the bread was softer and less greasy but it was free..   We split the taglierini portofino. It was the right amount! The scallops in the dish was perfectly cooked, the shrimp may have been over seasoned but the lemon butter slightly cuts the seasoning.   Over all, We spent about $80 for our meal and 3 drinks.  We were pretty satisfied! Thanks for the great service and delicious Italian!

reviews.author: Brittany D.
reviews.description: We had a great experience!! We came for the day with my grandmother and two infants. Our waitress, Krista, was so kind and attentive. We had two of the local wines and they were so light and fresh for lunch. They made accomodations for me since I'm a vegetarian too. Picture is two of the meals we got- the lasagna and the Alfredo pasta.

reviews.author: Gary C.
reviews.description: Lived here 15 years and this was my first visit. The waiter was very well spoken and versed with the menu, specials and wine list. I ordered the swordfish and it was exceptional! Everything was perfect this the 5 star review.

reviews.author: DrHilda C.
reviews.description: Excellent food, ambiance and service! Absolutely recommend anyone wanting a lovely meal-go here!

reviews.author: Eric G.
reviews.description: We brought food from here to a table outside the winery nextdoor.. with wine from the winery. I think this is your best bet if you're looking to eat and be away from crowds (for COVID).  I have to say all the food was good. The linguini was my favorite, followed closely by the mashed potatoes. The breads (focaccia and garlic) were each tasty, i could eat that focaccia all dayyy.  The lasagna was good, a bit heavy for me, though.. but what do you expect with lasagna!  I'd probably skip the Caesar salad next time..  While not my favorite Italian food ever, the grounds are beautiful, and it's a great place to bring a date or some friends and have a picnic style meal with some wine ;)

reviews.author: Mark W.
reviews.description: This place is a visual feast--a beautiful building of European flavor with a substantial Vinyard nearby, surrounded by beautiful oak trees, and beautifully maintained gardens.  While it is not easy to get to, it is the only gourmet restaurant I know of that accommodates helicopters.  (We arrived by car.)  We have met Austin friends here several times and the food has always been excellent, but we all agreed that it is now even better than we had remembered it from pre-covid days.  Warm bread came early with a plate of olive oil and herbs for dipping.  The antipasto plate and the fried calamari were both excellent, with a spicy dipping sauce.  Our friend loved the pasta dish with sauted scallops, and the 8 ounce filet that my wife and I shared  was the best of our eight decade lifetime.  We will be back again and again.

reviews.author: Wes B.
reviews.description: Dinner at Trattoria Lisina on FRI 25 MAR with friends.  The menu was really diverse and the food was very good.  Michelle was our server and she did an outstanding job.  And thanks to Paul for ensuring that we had a great time. A very memorable experience for our anniversary!

reviews.author: J H.
reviews.description: We visited on a Wed evening. The restaurant was not full and the service felt really rushed. We also had an early reservation. The marsala sauce on the veal was wonderful though we could have skipped the lasagna. It is a beautiful, destination restaurant. The service was friendly.

reviews.author: Nicole B.
reviews.description: Driving to Trattoria Lisina from Austin is always a fun field trip out into a totally different part of Texas. No traffic, windy two lane roads and there you are, in a vineyard in the middle of nowhere. I'd have never guessed a place the size and class of Trattoria Lisina would be nestled in hill country like this.  The inside felt distinctly Houston/Dallas vibes: much more corporate and big scale than a little mom-and-pop, but in a good way. Nice and air conditioned with plenty of space too. Now for the food:  The focaccia they serve with garlic/herb olive oil is OUTSTANDING. I could have eaten it all night, so so good. Like fools we ALSO ordered garlic bread. The garlic bread was toasted baguette slices that were burnt and dried. No bueno. Also: how is one bread item the best thing on the menu and the other maybe the worst? Strange, but anyway, don't get the garlic bread when you have garlic oil and bread in your lap, overflowing. The calamari was ok but the entrees were amazing. The osso buco was SO TENDER and so full of flavor. It came with a little marrow spoon and was a huge portion. My husband got the crispy duck with polenta cakes and cranberry salsa and he was a big fan too.   The service was so nice and sweet and the setting was beyond stunning. I really liked my time here and would definitely take guests when they visit too!

reviews.author: Darla E.
reviews.description: I would just like to share with you the most amazing afternoon we shared with your team. Simply AMAZING. From Tim, our waiter, the manager and that totally handsome chef (younger, with a trim beard, beautiful smile.. Sammy?) cooking on the left side of the grill.  My stepdaughter would like to thank him for a gorgeous dinner  We can't praise your restaurant enough.  We love you and can't wait to visit again.

reviews.author: Ashley L.
reviews.description: We ordered a little bit of everything for my sisters birthday! Wish I had gotten more picture of the food, but we really enjoyed ourselves and the conversation. My favorite dish was the fettuccini Alfredo with shrimp. Highly recommend the tiramisu!

reviews.author: Taye M.
reviews.description: Wow! Great food. Great service. Great atmosphere. This is the place to go if you want Texas fancy. What I mean is it's a relaxed but beautiful place. The food is worth every penny.

reviews.author: Anna T.
reviews.description: We had a large party and one of the waitstaff spilled an ENTIRE TRAY of iced water on one of our guests. We understand mistakes happen but NO ONE from management came to apologize and no concessions were made, not even a drink or the meal of the person who got soaked.   Poor management.   The meal was fine and we still have a generous tip despite leaving with horrible sense of proprietorship.

reviews.author: Mandy T.
reviews.description: Tuscan feel, amazing food and wine!  Loved the pasta lemon butter and shrimp.  Super delish and don't forget the tiramisu - so delish and huge helping

reviews.author: Ka M.
reviews.description: Cute place with decent food. We came here on a holiday weekend (a Sunday night) with reservations and they were very busy. We had the meatballs, crab appetizer, and bread service appetizer. All were very good. I really enjoyed the meatballs. For dinner we had the seafood pasta and the osso bucco. Both were okay and could've had some more flavor. My pasta was a bit bland. Food portions are large and we were too stuffed for dessert. Service was good.

reviews.author: Jim N.
reviews.description: First ever dining experience at Trattoria Lisina.  We we did for a special occasion, a "mile stone birthday."  We drove 1-1/2 hours to get there!  Let's start with negatives (which I don't normally do!).  The most expensive menu item, aside from the bottle of wine, was a pistachio encrusted red snapper filet.  The fish was 2x over cooked, and was tough as leather.  The main problem was it's a filet, skin on, blood line still intact.  As a seasoned Gulf fisherman and chef, I know you need the blood line cut out of the filet, even the fishing guys on YouTube get that.  Great piece of fish, tough to cut even with the knife provided.  It's not all about presentation.  Issue raised with waiter (Joseph S), and "he could have the manager come over to discuss."  As a waiter, when the dish is bad, take it away and redo!  The craft cocktails were OK, not worth the $14-$15 price tag.  The star of the evening was the calamari fritti, which was great!  Fresh, hot, tartar and marinara sauces were on point, terrific.  The veal osso buco, the best in TX, by far!  There's something about fresh bone marrow!  Dessert was the tiramisu, which was awesome, until James S added to the bill.  Overall, Trattoria Lisina is a "destination" restaurant, but for the $$, it's not worth the hype.  Enjoy one of the Mandola locations in ATX, the food is better and the price tag is 80% less ...

reviews.author: Nicole W.
reviews.description: Water 2 Wine was a fun experience for my husband and I. As I was reading some of the other reviews, I learned that you could make your own wine. I called ahead to see if there were any open appointments on a Friday afternoon and Jenny answered. She has a very fun, bubbly personality and told us to swing by anytime. We were able to taste several different wines before we decided what we wanted to make. We spent about 1-1.5 hours there. We look forward to designing our own wine bottle labels and returning in 6-8 weeks to bottle the wine.

reviews.author: Jen B.
reviews.description: Absolutely love this place. The owner, Jenny, is the best. She's fun, friendly, thoughtful. All the staff are wonderful.   I've made many batches of wine here. The wine making process is really fun from tasting and selecting the wine you want, to making it and, the  funnest part, bottling. You can customize your wine label and they print it for you to put on the bottles.   You can bring your own snacks and get a bottle to enjoy.   I would highly recommend everyone to try making a batch of wine at water to wine. They make great Xmas gifts too.

reviews.author: Neshia R.
reviews.description: Let's start with how cute this place is! I walked in and felt like I had been invited into someone's home the staff was extremely friendly and knowledgeable im from out of town and im so glad I made the stop here  before heading home! Ambience is nice 3 free wine tasting and the bottle prices are extremely reasonable and you can make your own wine. If you're looking for a place with a good vibe where everyone feels like family this is the place will return every time im in Austin!!

reviews.author: Michael B.
reviews.description: Water 2 Wine is best described (at least as they themselves put it) as 'Build-a-Bear for Adults'!    I visited this establishment thinking it was a simple wine tasting spot.  Actually, they also provide services as your own personal vintner and label maker, where you can taste, create, and label your own wine!  While I have yet to try this full service out, the staff was very friendly, the wine (tried the whites only) was excellent, and you can palpably feel how fun the process is.  Definitely coming back to celebrate good times with a custom-made wine!

reviews.author: Joy W.
reviews.description: Ok, but why is this place SO cute?!  I went here for a wine tasting years ago with a girlfriend and as a fun catch up, we decided to meet back here.  What a fun tradition we want to continue!  The staff here is outstanding, they have great thought, and make you feel comfortable.  We had some neighbors at a different table order food in and  thought that was hilariously brilliant!  You are definitely recommended to buy a bottle as all winery's usually do, but this spot doesn't make you feel pushed to - which makes me want to buy another bottle.  I love that this is tucked away in the city and you don't have to go to the city limits to do a wine tasting.  I would HIGHLY RECOMMEND this to any and all of you!

reviews.author: Laura F.
reviews.description: Water 2 Wine is perfect for so many occasions... date night, girls night, happy hour, a pop-in for a glass of wine, or a night of wine making/bottling with friends. We were sad when the Round Rock location closed down, but found this place to be a million times better. The decor is cute and thematic, with tons of inviting spots for seating, whether you're looking for a romantic spot for two, or some couches for a larger gathering. The best part is the staff - super friendly and helpful while we try to make the tough decision of what to drink or take home. The free samples help too!   Making our own batch of wine is a yearly tradition for us. We get together with friends to start the wine (which of course involves a good time trying the different wines first), design our own labels (or get help from W2W), throw a gathering to bottle the wine, then have bottles to hand out as wedding favors, Christmas gifts, or generic gifts.   We are club members, so we stop by at least monthly for a couple glasses of wine and to pick up our bottles to enjoy at home. Whether you're joining wine club, making a batch, or just stopping in for a glass or two, Water 2 Wine is a fantastic neighborhood gem. I only wish they were in my neighborhood!

reviews.author: Alexandra M.
reviews.description: Came here with friends who decided they wanted a wine baby and we tagged along to help them taste wines. It is a very laid-back tasting room. Staff is very friendly and helpful. Prices are reasonable and tasting is free. You can even make your own wine, which is exactly what we tagged along to do and that gets you 28-30 bottles. Highly recommend this place - Cheri and Jenny are so knowledgeable and make the whole process so easy and fun!  Only downside, no Texas wines... but this isn't necessarily a con -  all their wines are made on-site with grapes from various vineyards.

reviews.author: Chris S.
reviews.description: The wine they make is so tasty. They let you have three samples so that you can find the wine you would enjoy.  When I come here I always take home a bottle.  The staff is veery knowledgeable and friendly.  They also do custom labels if you buy I case I believe.

reviews.author: Maria G.
reviews.description: What a lovely place to sip some wine and worth doing the wine club membership if you like wine in the slightest even.  The staff are awesome. They make excellent suggestions whether you know what you're looking for or not. They can get you going in the right direction.  Sulfite free wine? Is my understanding. I don't know a lot about wine, but know that's a good thing to be free of. I can say the ports and fruity wines are a good dessert. My family and friends love the other wines.

reviews.author: Natasha C.
reviews.description: I just love this place !! They are so friendly and even if you are new they treat you like family. The wine is good and the cheese platter is huge ! One of my absolute favorite places I've discovered since moving to Austin !

reviews.author: Taylor T.
reviews.description: Went in not knowing what to expect from the store front but was pleasantly surprised. Personable and knowledgeable stuff and many wines to try! Your first 3 wine tastings are free and then a dollar per tasting after that. Additionally you can make you own wine which is a unique experience!

reviews.author: Keri B.
reviews.description: If you are a young couple, or an old couple, or an odd couple, and you decide you want a wine baby, you may be a bit worried about where, when and how to do that.  It's a big step and you should have nothing but the best for your Vino Bambino, so please look no further than Water 2 Wine, and Jenny in particular.  She is the BEST midwife for your wine labor.    We just had the best experience making, bottling and labeling our wine baby.  It was smoooooth sailing and immediately made me want another :)  When you decide to make your own wine, first, you'll get to sample the wines, ALL of them if you so wish.  I spent two afternoons sampling bunches of them and all the staff were generous and enthusiastic in helping me find which wine I wanted.  Then, you make an appt for conception.  It's fairly simple  and pleasurable.  Again, you can grab a glass of wine as you work, mixing the juice and water and yeast in a giant white bucket (Carboy), churning away for about 10 minutes and then your part is done for about 6 weeks!  The rest of the staff will ensure that your baby gestates comfortably and appropriately, testing its ph and sugars until its ready to be born.  Then the magic happens.  As the parent, you'll have full creativity in naming your baby.  In which case, you can pick any 3 images you like, decide the wording and color scheme and font of the label, email all that to Jenny and she'll print out the most perfect labels.  You can then invite a bunch of friends to witness and help in the birthing.
