You can bring in all kinds of snack ems and the fine ladies at Water 2 Wine will immediately ply your guests with tastings of their wine and you can buy bottles (and bottles) to facilitate in the birthing process.  Everyone in your party can try their hand at filling bottles, corking bottles, melting the lid foils, and sticking on labels.  In the end, you'll have about 30 bottles of fantastic wine ( I recommend the Gruner!) to share and take home.    They make for fantastic house warming, business, wedding, new baby, Christmas, Hanukkah, etc gifts.  In fact, if you decide last minute you'd like to adopt a wine baby for Christmas, they keep a bunch already made and ready to label for your Christmas party or gifts.    Best thing was, our friends had so much fun and it was such a new experience for all of us that we WIN again as the hostess with the mostest.  And, even though I had grand plans of using this wine at our housewarming party, I doubt it'll last another 8-10 months so we may indeed make another baby next year.    Jenny and the rest of the staff really made this so much fun and interesting with all their cool contraptions and accomodated me with the music I wanted (got to have appropriate Edith Piaf wine birthing music!) and never left a wine glass dry in my group.    So grab your partner, in life, in business, in crime, and get to makin that baby! They're the best kind of babies, they don't puke or shit or cry and instead of causing you stress, they relieve it.  And in the end you'll have the coolest collectible bottles.

reviews.author: Heather B.
reviews.description: I love this place! My husband and I come regularly, and  from the minute we walk in the door, it feels like we're visiting old friends. Jenny, Dustin and Cheri are knowledgeable, friendly and so much fun. Every visit is a good visit.

reviews.author: Stacy S.
reviews.description: Jenny was fantastic! First time here and we had a great time. Wine was amazing and the service was incredible.  Between my in laws and my husband we took a a few bottles home with us. We will be back for sure and would love a Cedar Park location!

reviews.author: Robert W.
reviews.description: Love this place! Great place to stop for a glass of wine and taste a few more after a long day of work!

reviews.author: Kate F.
reviews.description: Visited Water2Wine for my birthday this past December. LOVED IT! Cute, cute tasting room with tons of puzzles and activities, plus adorable furnishings. The menu was huge and the options would suit almost every taste. You can also print out custom labels for your bottles! TONS of fun for a big group, or an intimate outing. You can also bring your own appetizers to come sit and enjoy while tasting some delicious wines.

reviews.author: Jesse D.
reviews.description: Water 2 Wine has taken your normal wine drinking experience and given it a unique spin by providing you the keys to the winery and letting you become the vintner. You make your own batch of wine, create custom labels, bottle it, and best of all, taste the fruits of your labor. By having you do this work on site they are able circumvent certain regulations resulting in less sulfites and other chemicals than store bought wines.  I have been visiting Water 2 Wine for about five years and actually created a batch with my wife and we gave the custom bottles of wine away as gifts at our wedding. The gifts were a hit.   Water 2 Wine imports their grapes and juices from other vineyards. This is not uncommon for vineyards in Texas as most don't grow enough grapes, if any, to meet their own demand. When you decide to make a batch this is where you will start. You will mix the juice, and depending on the type of wine you are making will add flavors like oak.  After you make the wine it will go in the back room for fermentation where the staff will guide the wine along over the next six to eight weeks changing containers around six times.  About two months later you will come back and bottle your wine. You add your label, fill the bottle, cork it and shrink wrap foil around the top. Like a good chef test tasting food a lot of quality assurance goes on during this process. This is a perfect event to bring along a group of friends. Hopefully you end up bottling more wine than you drink.   You don't have to make wine. Water 2 Wine is also a spacious wine bar, with a large selection of wine, where you can stop in just to drink some wine. All of the wine is made on site by the employees. They don't sell food but you are welcome to bring in food to eat with your wine. There are plenty of tasting options or you can buy by the glass or bottle. The staff is very friendly and have been one of my favorite aspects of every visit.

reviews.author: Kris U.
reviews.description: Very friendly, exuberant staff.....check. Interesting concept (make your own wine!) and fun factor....sure, check. Free wine tasting (5 tastes offered).....check. Their "ready made" wines.....uh well, let's just say I do not believe you can make decent wine out of water; and from the wines I sampled it seems that's just what they are trying to do.

reviews.author: Linda M.
reviews.description: Attended a fun wine pairing class (groupon deal) -- a great time and highly recommended! I have an alcohol allergy (it's an Asian thing! ;-), so it's awesome to learn about and try some low sulfite wines. I'm not really a fan of wine (or alcoholic beverages in general) for obvious reasons, but if I were, I'd buy it all here! Enjoy!

reviews.author: Carie H.
reviews.description: The team at W2W knows their stuff. I'm only disappointed I didn't visit here earlier in life. The crew is helpful, knowledgeable and always friendly.   Whether it's a glass of vino after work, a place to gather on weekends with friends or a fun place to work remote during the week W2W has it all.   I always thought you could only make wine here and was surprised to learn it's also a wine bar and retail destination.   Stop by and challenge the team to find you the perfect glass- they won't disappoint.

reviews.author: Larry E.
reviews.description: I love this quiet oasis away from the chaos of other places! The Barolo is really good and I grabbed another bottle today and also picked up a Pinot Grigio.  The wines do not have the chemicals that I don't think should be added. A wine should stand on its own!  "Custom wine without the chemicals"  Supremely good! I'm a wine snob as I was raised with it and also living and working around the world I was able to have some of the best wines in the world. No, I am not rich . Wines that are sent to the states are really jacked up in price and I was able to get what I wanted and bring it back. One thing I did learn is that you don't drink an expensive wine as a part of the meals but enjoy it on its own. I bought 2 bottles of Barolo to have with an Italian meal. It was a great fit. This little place has fulfilled the perfect fit! The lady who owns the place and makes the wine is quite nice and understand all of the above. I will be back!

reviews.author: Ryan S.
reviews.description: The owner heavily supported the riot and charging of the senate today. She thinks BLM is a sham and is a major supporter of attacking protestors. Also doesn't believe in masks or covid.

reviews.author: Montalvo A.
reviews.description: This owner supports the terrorist who attacked he capitol today! Not a business I will ever support again!

reviews.author: Chuck C.
reviews.description: Just stopped in at this cool place after eating next door...nice wine tasting environment - great bar, good vibe, super cute dog, beautiful mural painted on the wall and a friendly owner.   Bought a bottle of the Tuscan blend on the recommendation of the owner - I will open, taste and add a review later - I'm only giving it 4 stars for now because I haven't tried the wine, but I like the place...more to come!

reviews.author: Marco G.
reviews.description: The owner openly supports terrorism, sedition, and chaos. Dont support this business.

reviews.author: Desiree S.
reviews.description: Sunday afternoon - the OPEN sign is on, we have just had a really great meal next door and I have always wanted to go into this place.   So, we walked in and no one was in there. Thought to myself...maybe they are in the back. Talked a little louder with my husband and daughter and the cute little dog that greated us.  Then this woman walks in and we made cordial small talk.  I asked if they were open because she seemed quite perturbed that we were inside. Confused because I had seen the open sign. I asked "Are you open?"  She said annoyed "We are getting there...."  We quickly walked out and will not grace those doors again!  Rudeness doesn't win! Love and kindness wins!!

reviews.author: Toni A.
reviews.description: Best wine I have had in a long time out of the United States. It has low tannins and robust flavors. Mary is the definition of a connoisseur. They do custom wine bottle labels and build gift baskets. MY FAVORITE!!! Her shop is filled with fun items and the cutest dog ever!!!

reviews.author: Becky B.
reviews.description: First winery on our Mom Daughter wine adventures in Austin.  Called ahead of time to get the scoop.  Immediately fell in love with Mary's sass.  Uber'd over and was not disappointed.  Although they don't serve food, she suggested a few restaurant take outs nearby and allowed us to bring in and eat there.  Mary does it all!  Wine maker extraordinaire she is!  Loved our first wine stop experience!

reviews.author: Joseph R.
reviews.description: This lady was so rude to my friend and I. You could tell she wanted nothing to do with us and tried to rush our tasting as fast as possible. She did not want to answer any of our questions and not once looked us in the eye. I'm not sure if she is a racist, homophobe, doesn't like young people, or all of the above but you could tell we were not welcome. I would never come here again and I continue to tell my friends and family to never come here too.

reviews.author: Nikki J.
reviews.description: I DO NOT like wine, and found two wines I LOVED! My husband who does not like wine either LOVED this wine. Place was small but family owned. I felt real relaxed and comfortable and enjoyed my tasting! Owner was so nice! Going to sign up for the monthly wine club because the wine was SO good. Defiantly recommend this place! Went with a bachelorette party and the owner was accommodating to all 13 of us, and found a wine each of us loved! Go for the GREAT wine!

reviews.author: Courtney W.
reviews.description: RUDE service and bad wine.  Menu isn't even accurate, i.e.: mislabeled as Italian wines but really French.  There are so many better places in the Austin area. Do not waste your time.

reviews.author: Lisa R.
reviews.description: This place seems to attract a lot of women's meet ups and networking groups, which is obviously why I know of it. The owner is jovial and the atmosphere is good for a casual meet up.

reviews.author: Samuel C.
reviews.description: I'm not a drinker.  I have a low tolerance for alcohol, and wine hits me particularly hard.  But I attended a group wine tasting here with a friend yesterday, and thus our tale begins...  I got there as the second serving of a six-wine tasting was progressing, and I was immediately struck by the smoothness of the wine that was being served at the moment, a Gewurtraminer.  Shortly after sipping that wine, I mentioned that I had almost no tolerance for alcohol.  Steve, the master of ceremonies for the tasting, told the group that Austin Custom Wineries did not add sulphites, the major cause of wine intolerance, into their wine as most wineries do for preservative purposes.  As a result, though the wines should be drunk within five years, the wines are eminently drinkable for even the lightest of weight drinkers like me.  Seriously, I can't even finish a bottle of beer (Shiner).  So I was able to partake in the tasting!  I didn't drink all of each of the wines, but I had more than I normally would have felt comfortable with (to avoid headaches), and I suffered absolutely zero ill effects.  It was amazing.    Also amazing: ACW's selection of dessert wines--ports and ice wines.  Maybe I'm just not a fancy wine connoisseur, but those dessert wines are drinkable and tasty.  And since they have no added sulphites, all I have to worry about is the alcohol content!

reviews.author: Lisa T.
reviews.description: Been really happy with this group since finding them several years ago. While the recipes might have changed over the years, they never cease to bring a great selection out every year. The port wines have been some of our favorites, raspberry chocolate port in particular. My husband has always been a fan of their blackberry merlot. We moved north of Austin, but when ever we take a trip to south Austin area, this spot is a must stop! Don't forget to ask about their wine club too; it is a great way to sample the variety of flavors they bring out!

reviews.author: Scott K.
reviews.description: Was glad to finally visit this winery.  Met one of the owners.  He was very welcoming and gave us so much information about the wines his winery makes.  We tasted 6 wines for a $10 fee.  The grape juice is purchased and then the wine maker takes it from there to make several different wines.  The server gave generous pours to ensure we tasted the wines fully.  He used 6 separate wine glasses to ensure we tasted the different wines which I thought was nice.  Most wine places used the same wine glass to sample the wines.  We enjoyed visiting with the owner.  A very pleasant gentleman.  I really recommend visiting this winery with your friends.  If you don't know anything about wine, not to worry because the owner will make sure your wine tasting experience is a positive one.

reviews.author: Georgia B.
reviews.description: This is a great place in the Sunset Valley area to stop in and take a break from the hustle and bustle of shopping. We get to sip on our favorites as well as try new ones...Malbec is our favorite so far!

reviews.author: Marian K.
reviews.description: I love this small winery, A great place to sit quietly for a good bottle of wine.

reviews.author: Lauren B.
reviews.description: We had intentions to get food next door and then saw this winery next door... never made it to the restaurant and stayed here instead. Got more than we bargained for when we walked in. Wonderful people working here, great environment and tasty wine. Will DEFINITELY be back here.

reviews.author: Karen H.
reviews.description: I got hooked on Austin Custom Winery due to the less amount of sulfolamides (I know I mis spelled that)!  Mary and Steve are excellent hosts... I love that they are patient and accommodating.  I also recently became a wine club member... Lots of perks, including getting to create my own wine label with custom picture!  So happy I found this AUSTIN business!

reviews.author: Jeremy R.
reviews.description: Consistent flavors and unique blends! The big nice bar is fun to sit at and the wine variety never ends. Every return is met with a new wine rolling out while still able to get there staple wines. The wine club is my favorite now getting on  a discount on bottles I'm buying anyway. I shall be back

reviews.author: Vanessa L.
reviews.description: This was the cutest hidden gem. They had cider on tap, and in bottles to enjoy there or take home. It was reasonably priced. Highly recommend the gold rush cider, we took a bottle home we loved it so much. They offer live music and trivia. You were able to walk around the premises where we thought we heard peacocks. We say a bee box on the premises not sure if they harvest their own honey for their boards but I wouldn't doubt it. I will definitely Be returning!

reviews.author: Kaci C.
reviews.description: Wonderful place! We went on a recommendation while we visited family. The ciders were great, as was the food. The only issue we ran into was that we ordered hummus, and the person taking our order didn't let us know that it didn't come with bread or anything else to eat it with. Considering we had just had a conversation with her about it being our first time there, we're about to present she didn't let us know that important bit of info. Not a big deal, and the person who brought us our food outside asked if we had ordered anything to eat it with and quickly brought us an order of a baguette.  Aside from the establishment itself, the vendors selling goods were all friendly and talented, and the other patrons of the establishment were friendly as well. We struck up several conversations with passers-by.  I would definitely go back!

reviews.author: Alysha M.
reviews.description: Super cute space- so much potential. The guy who was pouring our flights was super nice, we were excited at first to have finally checked this place off the bucket list. However, the ciders weren't that great unfortunately...we would've kept on drinking anyway, just probably ordering the other cider/wine/beer that they stock, not make. We were there on a very dead weeknight- only 3 other people were there, so you'd think they'd welcome more business- but we had to leave because we were told that we couldn't eat the tacos we got from a nearby food truck...if they sold food, I'd understand, and we would've ordered dinner there...but all they sell is super overpriced make it yourself charcuterie items (a whole block of cheese, a whole baguette, etc). The way we were told that we couldn't eat our tacos rubbed me the wrong way and the vibe was just sadly killed, so yeah, we won't be back :/

reviews.author: Jennifer M.
reviews.description: Very unimpressed with this place. This place has such potential! The set up is super cool and the place has a great vibe. It is a little hard to find and the road is a little rough in their lot. The place was completely empty when we were there. The ciders were all just okay and some were super sour and not great at all. The bartender was the best part of the experience. He was super knowledgeable and so friendly. Probably the biggest downfall and what would definitely bump them to at least a 4 star is their lack of food. There are no food trucks on site, they only sell outrageously priced charcuterie boards, and we found out the hard way, don't allow outside food. We were told after we got food brought to us that it was not allowed. We would have stayed and continue buying product had they allowed us to eat. Rather we sat in their parking lot and ate on our talegates. This place is so out in the middle of nowhere you would think that they would have better food options. They also were not very nice when delivering the news. Needless to say we won't be back.

reviews.author: Ardie S.
reviews.description: How have I not reviewed the kind people at this wonderful establishment yet?  I so enjoy the the solace of their old farmhouse venue. And the great ciders they serve up certainly do not hurt the wallet or the ambience.  It's so relaxing sitting at the picnic tables out among the oaks listening to your favorite band. Strategically placed fans hidden among the trees aid in making the glade that doubles as a stage tolerable even on 90 days.  In these seemingly never-ending days of the pandemic, it's also refreshing to see the servers masking up indoors and out. I tend not to venture out too much for exactly that reason, but felt totally safe here even when ordering inside the tap room.  Maybe I should keep it a secret, but it's also one of those places you want to share exactly because it is so very special.

reviews.author: Ellen G.
reviews.description: We love Texas Keeper Cider! Their tasting room is out a ways from Austin, but is on the most lovely grounds. They often have wonderful live music and their drinks are absolutely perfect for a Texas summer. They are so refreshing. We got one of the picnic baskets and it was full of yummy cheese, sliced meats and bread. Highly recommend!  It is worth noting, they do not have a full lunch/dinner menu. They basically have an assortment of DIY charcuterie boards, which we really enjoyed. However, if you go expecting a full dinner you may be disappointed.

reviews.author: Mildred A.
reviews.description: Pretty great ciders! Did the tasting. Eat before you go if you are a fatty like me. I wasnt too fond of the food although i love their jellies! Nice outside area ... dogs and children allowed.  They also have live music!( but I was just there for the cider)  Will definitely go again!

reviews.author: Devon G.
reviews.description: The cider, the wine, the live music! What amazing vibes! The staff is friendly and it has some farmhouse style that is warm and comfy. They have a layout showing how sweet items are and let you sample, so you pick the right one!  Parking is massive and close to the large lot that houses bee keeper.

reviews.author: Rachel G.
reviews.description: My new favorite place in Austin. Love everything about it.  It's basically the only Place I ever want to be. If you haven't been yet- get on the ball!  The cider is so delicious - nothing is overly sweet and they have a good assortment of dry and well-balanced choices. Their sampler is 9$ for 5 generous pours and is a great way to find the cider you like most. For us it's the rose, but the original is a close second. Your best bet is to purchase a bottle and drink affordably. You even get a discount when you purchase bottles to go (although I'm not sure if that's just at the end of the night - we've closed this place down a few times).   We are also big fans of the food. The carrots in a blanket are so yummy and very unique! A must-have. The curried egg salad is a go-to as well. It's made with eggs from their own chickens! They also add pickled veggies on the side which is always a win for me.   The location is so spacious and beautiful. Plenary of tables inside and out. Even a great view from one side where you can watch the sunset over the trees. I've enjoyed live music there and loved the tunes they were playing inside.

reviews.author: Jodi H.
reviews.description: The ciders are essentially tribute to the apple gods, extremely generously priced, and the cidery is tucked away--makes for a great escape from the city of Austin!  Came on a rainy day with some girlfriends after dinner, and we LOVED it. It reminded me of Jester King Brewery because of the fact that it felt very off-road and secluded. If you're driving at night and a little too fast you might miss the entrance, so slow down as your GPS tells you you're near. The stone cobble walkway is so organic and lovely, that it felt like we were entering into a storytale cottage. Upon entering, everything screams wood and warm pinterest vibes. The three of us sat down at their tall barstool table, and started on our flight! What prices! Normally they do 5 for $9, but they tapped out of one of the selections so we did 4 for $7! Such a great price for the variety of ciders. I loved their hefeweizen + cider combo, and the first cider on their flight list (a name I forgot). Everything was so juicy and tasty, would highly recommend coming back.   The staff is very knowledgeable, and the lady doing the taptending that night was so sweet and helpful. She trusted that we knew which selection we were on during our flight. She also told us that there are five cideries in all of Austin! So for my cider lovers--let's hit all of them up.

reviews.author: Marianne L.
reviews.description: I have been a long time fan of Texas Keeper Cider. I love the Tap Room, the grounds, the staff and especially the cider. The cider is dry and they make a wide variety of ciders to appeal to many palates.  They have successfully reopened the Tap Room and I decided to have my belated retirement party there. I was able to reserve a space for my large group and the staff was very attentive. If I had one criticism, it would be their food choices.  It's now a make your own picnic, and you choose cheeses, meats, and sides. It's not really a charcuterie tray, as they don't prep the plate.  The cheeses,  meats and bread all need to be sliced.  This made eating difficult with a large group. Most of my guests had to leave early so they could go eat somewhere else.  I know this new menu makes it easier for the staff, and they are a cidery, not a restaurant, but I miss their old menu.  I will still go to Texas Keeper Cider, but may not hang out as long.  (Or make sure I eat beforehand!) Overall, it's a beautiful South Austin gem.

reviews.author: Calily B.
reviews.description: I don't know why it took me so long to get here but now that I've been, I'll be telling everyone about it and making return trips! If you're a fan of Argus Cidery, you'll like this place. I do think Texas Cider Keeper is making cleaner ciders than Argus (nothing was infected or had off-flavors).   It's easy to miss the entrance, but it's right next to the cemetery! The outdoor space is very quaint but all Texas and has tons of picnic tables. The tasting room is beautiful with butcher block tables and plenty of seating.   We opted for the tasting flight menu which is five 2 oz. pours for $9. Their mainstay Texas Keeper Cider No.1 is dry, refreshing and well balanced. I'm not a fan of sweet ciders, so this was perfect.  I also really liked their Grafter Rose -- which is made with Rome apples and some grapes, which gives it the beautiful rose hue. It's also on the drier side, which is nice.   Our least fave of the five had to be the Cider Weizen, which had a bit too much coriander (and this is coming from a girl who LOVES coriander and hefeweizen beers).   The bartenders were all knowledgeable and really try to give you an explanation of each cider they're pouring (a la a wine tasting).   They also have a tempranillo wine on tap because in Texas it all falls under a "fruit fermentation" permit. Apples, wines, it's all the same permit.   I'll be making it a point to come here more often, and I would if traffic getting through downtown and south Austin traffic weren't so bad.

reviews.author: Kris U.
reviews.description: One year later I returned for their 1st Anniversary Party and release of The Grafter Blanc.  For $9.50 (w/fees) your ticket included your admission and 10 oz tulip glass (not the standard 12 oz tulip most breweries sell for $5-6). There were no drink tickets included; all cider and other offerings were for purchase only.  Certainly not the best deal in town....a town full of breweries with taproom festivities.  The Grafter Blanc is definitely my favorite of their ciders, with the perfect balance of acidity, tartness and dryness.

reviews.author: Katie N.
reviews.description: Wow! So before coming here I always assumed ciders as overly sweet and flavored froo-froo drinks for those who don't like beer. I have never felt so mislead before! Cider is made from apples (no matter what the flavor), and real, legit cider is found here! It isn't overly sweet and there are many different kinds! Some reminded me of wine and a not-so-Sweet cider mixed together.  At Texas Keep there is room to bring a large group, or even the dogs or kids to run around. There is a small indoor area with games and a huge outdoor area with room to move about and enjoy the Texas sun (or stars).  The people here really enjoy and are PROUD of what they do. They are excited to tell you the story behind the names of the ciders and what they entail. They have seasonals and guest bottles and taps. Normally I would feel gross trying something out of a bottle opposed to tap, but the whole experience was so eye-opening, I didn't care. They told me their 1 bottle of (maybe a 750ml cider) has about 10mg of sugar in it as opposed to he "cider" I knew such as Angry Orchard that has upwards of 50mg PER BOTTLE! Yowza- no wonder they were too sweet!  I was definitely iffy about coming here since they didn't serve "regular beer", but I'm definitely glad I stepped out of my comfort zone- and you should, too!  Only reason it's not 5 stars- the food "truck" setup (not a truck just a station) was out of food by 6:30p on a Saturday night. We had ordered 1 of the 4 items on the menu for our group to try. When we went back to order our favorites, they claimed they were out of everything and turned around and took 1 more order. Annoying. So we ordered a pizza and left early to meet the delivery man at home. Maybe have more food or more options and we would've stayed until the 9p close.

reviews.author: Matt H.
reviews.description: We went here with some friends for the first time. It's a beautiful place at night to sit out on the lawn under the string up lights with your dogs and enjoy some cider.  The bartender was awesome and more than glad to educate us on all the stuff that goes into making cider.  Our friends got this HUGE cheese board that was really well priced too.

reviews.author: Amanda P.
reviews.description: Such a gem that's tucked away in far South Austin/Manchaca! The. Best. Cider. It's fresh, crisp and abundant here. Even a little bit of mead on tap too. We've been here during all seasons of the year and the property is always gorgeous and inviting. Staff is so knowledgeable and helpful. The kitchen is Now built in to the main tasting room. The fresh house made popcorn is absolutely awesome. This is a family friendly establishment as well and very nice of them to accommodate young children in a pretty adult setting! We are very thankful and grateful and it certainly keeps us as loyal customers.

reviews.author: Emily W.
reviews.description: We enjoyed a quick drive out to TKC on a Sunday. It was awfully hot and there was plenty of shade. We brought our dog too but he could not go inside which was challenging even for ordering. Our favorite cider is the No. 1! There was an event going on that sounded fun so we will definitely check out those options. We did not order food, just did a shared tasting. No one came outside to check on us or offer to pour and tell us about the cider which is common when visiting wineries with our dog and friends. It's a cute little spot for a weekend drive.

reviews.author: Liz S.
reviews.description: Sper cute romantic spot to come with your significant other or girlfriends.  The atmosphere is excellent.  They had live music on Saturday when we ran into this cute spot.  We ordered a flight of cider and had some garlic kettle corn, but regretted not getting the cheese plate because it would have been perfect with the acidity of the cider.  Zach, who served us, made our experience more memorable.  Definitely a spot to visit when in Austin.

reviews.author: Vicktoria R.
reviews.description: Super tasty food. Drinks are tops and they have toys for kids in their outdoor area. Seating was nice and the misters keep it comfortable even in the summer heat.

reviews.author: Seela M.
reviews.description: This is a great place to bring out of town guests. The 9$ flight is lovely and a bargain. The grounds are beautiful and the staff friendly. You can hang out and play bird games or sit outside on picnic tables. The food is not quite  awesome yet, but decent if you want tot munch along with your cider. The ciders are dry dry dry and not gross apple soda tasting like Eastciders (barf). "Stillage" is amazing.

reviews.author: Allie R.
reviews.description: Beautiful winery that gives you extremely comfortable vibes. Perfect place to enjoy great wine in a casual environment. Plus the winery has amazing views. I ordered a red wine that was local as it is made from grapes they grow themselves. They do flights, glasses, or bottles. I split a bottle with friends and they re-corked it so we could enjoy later at home. There are also nearby breweries so you can make a day out of heading here.

reviews.author: Lauren M.
reviews.description: We stopped here on a beautiful Sunday afternoon and it was a lovely treat. Apparently not many tasting rooms are open on Sundays, but this one was.   They have a lot of space to spread out and it was perfect for an easygoing afternoon.    We tried two bottles based on the recommendation of the owners. It turns out she was from Houston and went to my old high school. (Go Waltrip Rams!). They also have a tasting room in Houston.   We'll be back again.  The owner mentioned that you can volunteer to help with grape smashing so that might be fun to try.   Cheers and enjoy!

reviews.author: Michelle L.
reviews.description: The husband and I went to visit while in Dripping springs for a weekend wedding. The tastings are done by reservation to limit the # of people, but the lady was accommodating and let us walk in for a tasting since the couple that booked for that time hadn't shown up yet.  Nice variety of wines. Enjoyed their sparkling and the Tempranillo the best. Very pretty property with a lot of shaded seating outside for you to easily drink a glass and enjoy a summer Texas day.

reviews.author: Alex L.
reviews.description: The perfect winery does exist! Amazing wine and even better friendly/helpful staff. Felt at home!

reviews.author: Manuel R.
reviews.description: A teal experience.  What an incredible winery.  And super owners.  Definitely going back.

reviews.author: Xiaoting X.
reviews.description: Enjoyed the Tempranillo and montepulciano. But the value to taste is still low. Complex and Balanced wine but low intensity. Would love to support Austin hill country wine but value is low compared to  Italian reds.

reviews.author: Katherine S.
reviews.description: Nice atmosphere and view, despite the lack of any healthy grape vines.   Service sucks. We sat down with a group of 9 girls when it was not whatsoever busy and were (eventually) greeted with "hey so we can't do tastings because this is a large group without a reservation." We were happy to purchase by the glass or bottle, so this wasn't an issue but we were all taken aback by this greeting and found it pretty rude and uninviting. We barely heard from our waitress/hostess the whole time we were there.   The wine was just disgusting and overpriced. Of the bottles we purchased, the pinot grigio was the only decent one, which wasn't even made by this winery.   There are MANY better options, who actually enjoy and appreciate your patronage...keep driving!

reviews.author: Travis H.
reviews.description: My wife and I stopped by to check out this beautiful place, and it did not disappoint! Robert, the owner, was very nice and helped find my wife the perfect bottle of wine. The grounds are beautiful. Brittany was very helpful as well. I would highly recommend stopping by if you are in the Dripping Springs area.

reviews.author: Kelley H.
reviews.description: We absolutely LOVE Solaro!! We stopped by on our way out of town for a quick visit, and we fell in love. Brittany was fabulous and the owner, Robert, was very accommodating and friendly. Everyone was knowledgable and helped us find the perfect wine. We will definitely be back to this hidden gem!

reviews.author: Brittney K.
reviews.description: Organic vineyard + family run + wine OUT OF THE WORLD. It's a must! I've been here two weekends in a row, and I think it'll be a Saturday tradition! So much better than Fredericksburg.

reviews.author: Mike M.
reviews.description: Nice little place but nothing to really write home about. We arrived on a Saturday afternoon and unfortunately there were at least 2 bridal parties there.  It was very loud in the tasting area and it appeared they had only 2-3 people working.  They mentioned they had not expected such a large influx of people.  They did their best, but it was very hard to hear and they were bouncing back and forth between a lot of people trying to pay and split checks and do pours, etc.  Yes, the pours were very small and it was $15 each which is kind of pricey for that size and the wines that to me were very light.  I like bold flavors, not fruity and these were not bad, but not worth the price for me.  If there had not been so many people and it be so loud it might have been a little better, but we will not go back- crowded or not.

reviews.author: Manuela A.
reviews.description: Terrible wine. We had to buy a bottle because they used the Covid excuse when mind you down the road wineries we can do tastings or by the glass. We love big bold reds so we were guided to their 2015 Cab. Worst ever. The boxed $4.99 from CVS is much better. Wow, super disappointed to be conned into buying a $45 bottle of wine plus having to buy their "charcuterie" which was literally some cheese packets and nuts in a white paper bag handed to us for a total of $70. Rip off. Safe yourself the money and taste buds, and hit up Fall Creek or even Bell Springs.

reviews.author: Huong H.
reviews.description: I infrequently write reviews but I feel that this deserves one. Dishonest and shady practice. went there for a tasting with some friends recently. It was our first time there. Tasting was $20 per person. Seems like the price has gone up from recent years based on the prior reviews. Not a big deal. At the end of the tasting, I bought 3 bottles. The staff came over with an iPad, charged me the three bottles plus the tasting, told me to sign on an iPad and asked for my email. She said that she would email me the receipt. I never got the receipt. Saw the charge on my cc bill which did not seem to make sense. I emailed them and then called them requesting a receipt to be sent to my email. Apparently, when they charged me, a 20% tip was automatically added by default to the TOTAL (including the wine bottles that I purchased) . Not just to the tasting. I called and spoke to them Bc I felt that this was not appropriate. I don't mind tipping on the service but on the wine bottles that I am purchasing to take home?? I was pretty much told by the staff tough luck. I have been to many tastings in the past and this was definitely new for me. It's not the end of the world but it's the principles..you know. Definitely will not be back and would not recommend to anyone.

reviews.author: Anthony M.
reviews.description: Some of the best red wine i have ever had here. Great place to hang out and they have music on Saturdays .

reviews.author: Asher S.
reviews.description: Beautiful estate. The owner came over and talked to us and was so sweet and pleasant to talk to. The woman, Lauren, who walked us through our tasting was equally as sweet, friendly, and knowledgable of all their wines- which were delicious. Very light reds, European style. So if you're into more California/west coast style wines, it'll be a bit different for you. If you're looking to do a large party I'd recommend giving them a call in advance to help set up for your group to give you the best experience possible. Large space, beautiful building, yet feels very cozy. Definitely a great spot to hit on your day trip through wine country in the Hill Country. (Their Sangiovese and Cab 2015 were incredible.)

reviews.author: Janelle M.
reviews.description: My husband and I both had a wine tasting ($15 each) 1-ounce pours which is fine for just a taste but I agree with the other reviewers that it's a little pricey for what you get. The wines we tried were unique but not to justify paying 28-48 per bottle, yes it's "small batch" but if they're that much the tasting should be comped.

reviews.author: Erin L.
reviews.description: Was out in the hill country this weekend with a friend just meandering around during our staycation. We stopped at Jester King before this and just looked for cool places nearby when Solaro Estate popped up on the map. Wine, closeby? Sold.   Since we'd never been there before, we each decided to do a tasting so we could try their 6 best wines. Their whites were crisp and refreshing, but I didn't fancy any of the reds. I usually love pretty much all reds and favor them much more than whites, so there's a good chance my tastebuds were just all out of whack this weekend.  When we finished our tastings, it was raining cats and dogs out, so we decided to have a full glass of white and sit outside to watch and listen to the rain fall on their tin roof patio. It was glorious, even when the rain got so intense that literally everyone else who was outside went inside to hide from the aggressive mist. Since my friend and I are classy AF, we were in workout clothing and makeup-less, so we didn't mind the rain one bit. It was extremely peaceful, and seeing the gorgeous rows of grape vines behind the veil of rain was a memory I won't soon forget.   I'll be back for sure!

reviews.author: Mindy H.
reviews.description: I just recently moved from Switzerland, and was surrounded by fantastic wine tasting experiences.  I was nervous about trying Texan wine, but started my Texan wine experience at Solaro after having read many different experiences about the local vineyards around the Dripping Springs area.   The tasting room is located in the vineyard, which is great. I love that this is a small production place, with a family oriented feeling, and the staff are knowledgeable about the wine and production.  I guess the owners can often be found in the tasting room, but just happened to be away the Saturday we went.  They often have events, and we were enjoying one of their Saturday live music events from 2-4pm.  They have a great indoor and outdoor seating area full of charm.    For $10 per person you can enjoy a tasting of their varietals.  There was nothing that was bad, but from the tasting list, I enjoyed the Miscela Bianco the best. After enjoying all their selections, I signed up for their annual wine club, which was a great deal, and then was able to taste some of their higher quality more expensive wines, which were great.  I look forward to going back and touring the vineyard, as a benefit of being a member.  We also signed up for the grape stomping that will be taking place in the next couple of weeks as they need a bunch of people.  What a great opportunity to be part of a grape harvest!  I could have spent several hours just hanging out here. I only wish they had some food to enjoy with the wine and music.  Next time I will remember to bring my own picnic.    I am very happy to have been proven wrong regarding my concerns about Texan wine! Thank you Solaro!

reviews.author: Lauren V.
reviews.description: Whether you're visiting Austin or a local, pick a gorgeous day and go here. Such a beautiful setting and incredible wines.  Very reasonable cost for flights and if you catch her before she leaves for Italy, you can meet (and very impressed by) the nation's youngest sommelier.   Take a day, order some fantastic wine and exhale.  You've earned it.

reviews.author: John S.
reviews.description: Wine is mediocre quality, but the high prices  combined  with the surprise  charges against what was stated sours the experience. Who charges for water during a wine tasting?

reviews.author: Caryn N.
reviews.description: Time to celebrate another birthday and boy I love this place. I want to go in a date and romance myself lol!!!!   You are allowed to bring in our own food and we bought plenty of bottles of wine and a cake to celebrate my girlfriend 35th birthday

reviews.author: Stephanie B.
reviews.description: I came here for a wine tasting with my sisters over the weekend.  The staff was friendly, conversational, funny, and engaging.  The wine was delicious and the charcuterie board was nice about $25.  They were bottling wine there in the store which was neat to watch and they would talk to customers about the process.  They have some cute instagramable conversation spaces for seating.

reviews.author: Amy Q.
reviews.description: Super helpful and friendly staff and yummy wine options! We were able to taste several options and guided along the way.  Love this place!!!

reviews.author: Genel M.
reviews.description: It's a lot of fun to go with friends, share  a cheese plate and trade sips from flights of wine. Good way to discover new wines.

reviews.author: Jessica E.
reviews.description: Such a cool joint! Went twice in one weekend! There are many choices and no headaches to go with the wine!

reviews.author: Kaila W.
reviews.description: I love this place! My friend and I decided to stop here on our way back to Austin after a long day of being in the sun and swimming at blue hole in Wimberley. We were a bit skeptical because of its limited reviews on yelp but I'm so glad we went and tried it out. Their wine is great, their flights are customized to your individual pallet, and their charcuterie board is to die for. If you go during the summer be sure to try their peach/apricot wine. I thought it would be way too sweet for my liking but it was a great refreshing summer drink! They are located in a small development that also has a few shops, a bakery, and Nate's coffee and cocktails right next to it... and we can't forget, this place is only two blocks from Louies barbecue

reviews.author: Hayley B.
reviews.description: Owner is very friendly and approachable. The inside is beautiful with huge windows and fun lounge furniture. They also have a patio! Loved the wine we tasted and had a good cheese board accompanying it.

reviews.author: Tiffany C.
reviews.description: Cool and casual atmosphere with lots of options.  From the very dry red to very sweet white and everything in between.   A tasting is reasonable and you can make your own menu or the Water 2 Wine team can put one together for you based on what you tend to like.  Then get a glass of your fave and hang out.  Cool casual atmosphere and a great way to start off any night!

reviews.author: Aubrey P.
reviews.description: So happy this place is here! Beautiful interior and great wine! Went for the first time this weekend, and recommend The Carrington for a wonderfully smooth red

reviews.author: Peter S.
reviews.description: Take a venture off the main road through the countryside of the Texas Hill Country on rough roads through the forest over creeks to a beautiful vineyard covered meadow and keep going up the hill to the terrace overlooking the field and stream below. You'll have a great time.

reviews.author: Sylvia R.
reviews.description: We chose this winery because we saw a 5star review but found that it wasn't all that. They only offered wine tasting and no tour. The wine selection was rated at 2.5 with a group five of us. However, we highly recommend Wimberley Valley Winery. Very spontaneous, staff was very welcoming and the wine tasting was amazing.

reviews.author: Arely G.
reviews.description: We visited on a Saturday they had live music on a patio that overlooks the vineyard with a Beautiful view. Service was amazing and the wine was great .

reviews.author: Michelle L.
reviews.description: New winery, family owned and run. Limited selection of tasting to 3 that were made of Texas plains grapes but they were all good wines. The biggest attraction, which will guarantee they'll be successful is the view and gorgeous setting. They put a large deck on the hill so you can enjoy your wine while looking out at the vineyard.

reviews.author: Hilda S.
reviews.description: The views are breathtaking, the wines are fantastic and staff are very friendly. From the whites to ros and reds, the wines are delightful. Likes them so much that I became a wine club member. Looking forward to returning and introducing friends to this winery.

reviews.author: Caroline B.
reviews.description: Wonderful place with some great wines! The staff was delightful and friendly. The place wasn't too crowded but they just opened in November and I think people are going to be learning about this place and packing it out very soon!   They grow grapes on the property but all the wine I had was outsourced since their weren't ready yet. They had three wines to try (white, rose and red) but will be having six very soon as their home grown grapes are about ready. I enjoy dry, less sweet wines and these were perfect. Highly encourage you to put this spot on your wine tours of Wimberly! They also have some snacks/small bites if you are hungry.

reviews.author: Linda A.
reviews.description: This is a "Hidden Gem"!!! What a wonderful winery!!! We went relatively early to avoid any crowd and the staff were welcoming and informative.  They now have 4 wines and all of them were delicious. I'm not a sweet wine drinker and gratefully none of them were sweet. One crisp white, 2 ross and a red. We left with a bottle of the red and one of the ross too. The property and views are beautiful. They have two decks with tables and umbrellas to relax and enjoy the wine, the views, the weather and a fabulous charcuterie platter. It is a bit tricky getting there BUT it is well worth it. Don't miss this delightful vineyard!

reviews.author: Lizi P.
reviews.description: Beautiful and quaint, a smaller winery and much more intimate. Sipping wine on the large patio deck overlooking the vineyard made for a perfect early afternoon.  Charcuterie  was most generous for two ladies that love cheese and their gorgeous white blends, a new favorite spot to be revisited!! Somaliere Darryl was most delightful, definitely knew how to relate the flavors of their wine and listened to accommodate our palate.  Love this spot as would Bacchus!!  Thank you so very much Limestone!!

reviews.author: Kaitlin Z.
reviews.description: Owners were very welcoming and friendly. Wine was great and snacks were so tasty! They had fun games and beautiful places to hang out on the property. Definitely will return.

reviews.author: Haley Z.
reviews.description: Great little shop on the Georgetown Square. They offer wines that you can purchase and take a plastic glass of and walk around the square and shop. The women working at the counter were all smiles and had great recommendations. They have kitschy gift shop gifts, local goods, and some snacks you can purchase. There are a few caf tables inside and some chairs outside to enjoy your purchase. The wine was just fine, more light and very sweet, but the experience and service at this laid back tasting made it a worthy stop.   A must stop when experiencing the square to enhance your time!

reviews.author: Jason C.
reviews.description: We often stop here for a glass or 2 of wine.  The people here are always welcoming and kind.  The wine selection and good and prices are reasonable.  If your hungry they don't have a full menu but they do at least sell finger food snack items. They also sell great local spices, maple syrup, olive oil, and other great items.  Great stop at Georgetown square!!

reviews.author: Christina G.
reviews.description: First time here on a Saturday during Market Days. I love this place and look forward to becoming a member when I move to Georgetown this summer!  Super friendly staff! My friend and I were greeted promptly and given an overview of the wines for our flight-sampler. We scored a small table. This was a huge win as there are limited seats, I believe up to 25 seats. The staff checked in on us as we tasted our way thru the wines. When we finished tasting, we bought a glass of our fave wine and continued to walk through market days on the square.  Anywho, if your walking the Georgetown Square, stop in for a tasting and or a glass or 2. Cheers.

reviews.author: Vandesha L.
reviews.description: My sister came to visit so we were on a little adventure. She wanted a souvenir so we stopped into some of the shops downtown. We landed in this wine room and ended up sitting for a wine flight, good conversation, and lots of laughs. While we didn't get a wine membership we did buy 2 bottles and cigars for Dad. The staff was lovely and their COVID practices made us feel safe.

reviews.author: Sarah F.
reviews.description: Fun place to stop in, grab a glass, and walk around the square. The lady we spoke to said the owner is going to add more seating in the future. You can do the wine tasting but have to be seated. I had a red blend and my husband had cranberry. They both were sweet and light, which is just what we were in the mood for. I didn't want to carry bottles around the square but next time I'll take a few home.

reviews.author: Holly S.
reviews.description: Awesome wines, good prices and great service! They even offer appetizers. Will be back!

reviews.author: Stacy L.
reviews.description: I left Grape Creek and now I come here. They are always friendly, and their wine is very unique. Forget California and embrace Texas here! Their holiday cranberry wine was a huge hit with family, and there are so many wonderful wines. You will love it here.

reviews.author: Vaughn O.
reviews.description: The wife and I visited Georgetown Winery for our second tasting of the day on the square. After a more upscale experience in a different tasting room on the square, it was pleasant to ease into this more relaxed space. We were promptly greeted by the hostess, who became our server, and perused the menu of wines. $10 each for a sampling of 4 wines. Nice price, and fitting to the setting which would have been appropriate for beer as well. Neither of us remembers which wines we ordered, except for my two port samplings, but neither of us was overly impressed either. My ports were good, if extremely sweet and fruity, and the wife liked 2 of hers. She was disappointed in her first choice, which was the most expensive wine on the menu as priced by the bottle.  We didn't buy a bottle, nor would we return if we ever visit Georgetown again, but the ambience and carefree environment did add to an overall relaxing day on the square.

reviews.author: Angela P.
reviews.description: I love the ambience. Had a glass of cabernet Sauvignon and walked around. The shop is quaint and the service outstanding. In addition to tasty wines, they sell fabulous trinkets. I can't remember the last time I laughed so hard!  I took photos of the towels and signs that made me laugh. Check them out. BTW, I'll be back.

reviews.author: Nicole E.
reviews.description: Nice chilled laidback spot for a spot or two to wine tasting. Room and tables to seat 1 at the bar to larger groups in the back. Lots of fun wine related plaques, signs, wine toppers, shelves full of bottles and every imaginable gift item for wine lovers. Nice indoor garden feel from the string lights lining above your head. Very rustic and cozy feel with all of the wood from wall to wall shelves to tables and chairs and floors. They serve wine in plastic cups. In the back there are olive oils to try out.

reviews.author: Julia G.
reviews.description: Georgetown Winery is an adorable little handout in the heart of Georgetown. This is a great spot for a date night, girls night, or just an afternoon with a small group of friends or family. The actual vineyard is located in Rockdale Texas- this is just a small tasting room right on the Georgetown Square.   For $10, you can taste 4 wines. My spouse also got 4 tasting, so in total- I got to sample 8 wines. My favorite was the Big Tex which is aged for 9 months in oak. A full bottle will set you back only $24. Create price for the quality.  I also love their Viognier, I love white wines- and this was so light. I would casually sip this on any warm summer day. One thing I didn't love their fruity wines. The Blueberry and Blackberry wines tasted like they used artificial flavoring. The couple next to use was absolutely loving the blackberry, so maybe it just wasn't for me. Totally fair.   They also have cheese and crackers available. I feel like any wine tasting isn't complete without a good cheese plate. Unfortunately, we had dinner plans right after, so I enjoyed my wine cheese-free.   I absolutely plan on coming back here soon for some wine + cheese.

reviews.author: Denis A.
reviews.description: Laurie and Heather were wonderful today! Even in quarantine, they managed to provide a wonderful (socially distanced) experience. We are wine club members and LOVE this place ($50 per quarter gets you 2 tastings, 6 full glasses, and 2 whole bottles of wine). The perfect spot to enjoy some quality wine and some quality time with friends and family. We always bring cards or a board game and have a blast.

reviews.author: Bonnie G.
reviews.description: Went here on day trip on our way to Austin. Stopped into the winery and the two ladies were not helpful. We had to ask all the questions about the winery and their response was short and curt. We we the only people in the winery and yet they felt as if it was an inconvenience to talk to us. Will not return. Will continue to visit  the other Georgetown in South Carolina where people are more welcoming to all.

reviews.author: Joey G.
reviews.description: We are club members, and we love going to get our wines. The peach wine is amazing. They also have a lot of very good reds. We love all the little knickknacks in the store also.

reviews.author: Littledebbie9959 N.
reviews.description: This winery is awesome! Friendly ladies, very personable, you feel like they're your friend and they are!  Prices are more than reasonable and membership even better! They observe the rules over and beyond! Owners are great! The music is wonderful!

reviews.author: Erin T.
reviews.description: The best winery for friends.  My friends and I have only been members of this winery for about a year, but this is honestly one of our favorite locations to consistently come and visit when we're all together. They have sweeter drinks and wineritas for people who aren't fond of dry wines and their wine club memberships are literally built to be shared. There is table seating inside where you can sit for hours and catch up. Laurie and Heather in particular are so sweet with their service and their recommendations. I can't think of where else I would rather spend my weekend.

reviews.author: Kristen V.
reviews.description: This is the perfect meet up spot with your girlfriends. That's not to say that I don't see plenty of men in here, too. It's a great spot for day drinking. Any day of the week. And I know from experience.   I don't bother doing the tastings here - I know exactly what I like. Their unoaked chardonnay is butter and smooth. After that I move over to their pinot noir - which isn't too sweet but not so dry that I need to carry in my own water bottle. I do not drink fruit wines but my sweet lil granny does and she swears by the pomegranate and blueberry.   You can buy gifts and chochskies here. I always like to pick up a few bottles of wine before I had home to visit family. Their wine club is probably the best you can be apart of in terms of benefits.   I would really like if they would provide bread so that we can try the olive oils. Probably smart that they don't do that or else all of us winos would use that as food. :)

reviews.author: Kimberly G.
reviews.description: My favorite winery!  I feel like family every time I walk in the door.  Chelsea and Lori give the absolute best service, and I love bringing friends in to try their wine.  Chelsea and Lori can describe every wine and recommend tastings, glass, or a bottle.  Always a fun time at Georgetown Winery!  Thank you for making my family, friends, and me feel so special.

reviews.author: Roxanne T.
reviews.description: Stopped in for a second visit during a crowded weekend event, and thoroughly enjoyed both the service and our wine-tasting. My partner liked two of the reds so much she bought a bottle of each.  This is a long narrow shop that has lots of knick-knack items displayed so we did not move around much, but it was fun to read all the funny quotes on the signs and towels and glasses, etc. The folks at the bar were helpful and friendly, and we enjoyed this visit much more than our first.

reviews.author: Becky K.
reviews.description: This review is for the tasting room in Georgetown Square. The location closes at 6 and wine tastings end at 5:30. The room is quaint with many cork decorations and tables made from wine barrels. There is a good selections of whites as well as reds. My favorite was the peach wine. Staff was knowledgeable and friendly.

reviews.author: Danielle Z.
reviews.description: My friends and I went on a wine tour for our friend's birthday party the first weekend in August and it was great!   From the beginning stages of planning, Francesca, (the owner, planner, driver, etc.) worked her hardest to make sure the event was personalized for our group. Fran was also very quick with correspondence and letting me know important information and what she needed from me.   We decided that the Wimberly/Dripping Springs tour was the best route for us since a lot of people had already been to Fredericksburg wineries. Fran picked us up at 9am in Round Rock (she'll work with you on your pick up/drop off site) and she drove us around in an air conditioned mini tour bus! Did I mention that the bus is BYOB?! We brought on our own ice chests and bags for snacks which was great for the 45 minute trip we had! Fran also has a DVD/CD player on the bus but we brought our own speakers for our iPod. She also had tips on wine tasting and a map of the wine country for us to take a look at on the road.   We went to three wineries and an olive oil orchard. It was so hot outside for the olive oil orchard that our group decided to leave early but the rest of the wineries were all inside and all of the staff at the wineries were so nice and informative. One of our friends even bought a case of wine from one of them! Remember to bring money with you in case you fall in love with one or more of the delicious Texas wines that you have to buy a bottle or two!   Fran also arranged for our group to have Saltlick bbq plates for us at one of the wineries! Our group pre-ordered either turkey, chopped beef, sliced beef, etc. We had our sandwich with potato salad, coleslaw, beans (the best beans I've had in awhile), extra delicious seasame seed bread, extra bbq sauce, Tiff's Treats cookies, Sweet Leaf Tea, water, etc. etc.! It was a lovely lunch outside at the winery. We were all so full! But all of that came in the price of the tour! Fran even got us a deal with a cake-maker and we had a birthday cake waiting for our friend along with candles to surprise her!  Fran and her business associate, Melinda, were with us during every tour and let us know when we needed to move on to the next winery. They really made sure we that were ok and having a great time. They even had patience to take pictures of us with our multiple cameras.   We all headed back around 4pm and returned safe and sound (and still pumped up from the awesome day) around 5pm. All in all, it was a great day! Fran really has a great business and will personalize tours for all types of groups. She's very professional and you can tell she takes pride in what she does and will go the extra mile to make you feel your group is top priority! We'll definitely be going back to try more tours with L'Avventura Dolce, especially when the weather cools down! Great job!

reviews.author: Chantelle W.
reviews.description: L'Avventura Dolce hosted 16 Love-A-Bull members as we toured two Hill Country vineyards and an olive orchard. The experience was everything I would want in a day trip - fun, relaxing and informative. Francesca is the outfit's owner, and is also the engaging tour guide. Her commitment to customer service is stellar. She also donated a portion of the day's proceeds to Love-A-Bull, which made the trip extra special. The experience was so positive, I wrote a review about it here: https://chantellewallace.com/2014/02/12/hill-country-wine-tours-with-lavventura-dolce

reviews.author: Keri R.
reviews.description: Such a fun day! We wine toured for a friend's birthday party to 3 different wineries. The owner was friendly and fun and was great to provide lunch for us at our first stop. I would definitely recommend L'Avventura to other groups wanting to check out wineries of the Hill Country.

reviews.author: Kate K.
reviews.description: I'm torn writing this review.  We booked their bus for a winery tour for my bachelorette party, and they unfortunately ruined it (really by no fault of theirs...but still).  We were scheduled for pick up at 1.  At 12:30, they called to say that their bus broke down and that they would be an hour and a half late.  At 2:30, they finally showed up in an old, dirty van.  My group and I were squished together with all our things, and what's worse is that we couldn't really see or talk to one another.  The speaker system rattled and was distracting.  Also, since the wineries close at 6, our tour was cut drastically short, and we had to rush.  We also had someone who had to leave early, so in turn, had to miss the entire tour.    The only redeeming quality was the excellent customer service of the company.  Both the driver and the owner were truly wonderful and apologetic.  I know that these things happen, but I do think that having an acceptable backup vehicle is important.

reviews.author: Love P.
reviews.description: Just went on the Magic of Christmas Lights tour this weekend with a few of my friends.  Our host guided us on a tour of the Christmas lights in Wimberley, TX (at the EmilyAnn Theatre which was 9 acres of amazing holidays lights - one of the best light displays I've ever seen in my life) and in Johnson City, TX.  My friends and I had an amazing time, as did the rest of the bus based on the jovial environment (laughter, singer, and a showing of "The Christmas Story") created by our host and bus driver.  L'Avventura Dolce's Christmas Light tour will definitely be one of my new Christmas traditions.  Hopefully, other special events are in store for the future.   Cheers!

reviews.author: Denise K.
reviews.description: My sister and I took the Texas Hill Country and LBJ Ranch tour from Austin.  It was a fabulous day!  Our tour guide, Ray, went above and beyond to make sure we had the best experience possible.  We stopped at both the birthplace and childhood homes of LBJ before visiting the Ranch, where we toured the home he and Lady Bird resided, we then spent a couple hours in the quaint German town of Fredericksburg where we enjoyed lunch and a little shopping.  Then a quick stop at Luckenbach Texas, where they were having a food truck festival and live music.  We were impressed with this tour and encourage others to give it a try.  Thank you again Ray for making it a great day!

reviews.author: Cherie S.
reviews.description: Whether you're planning the most memorable party experience, an unforgettable winery excursion, a super-fun mural tour or an exciting tubing trip down the river, you will definitely have the absolute BEST time with Experience Austin! And, those are just a few examples of their offerings (the ones I have been lucky to experience so far)!   Nancy and her team take care of absolutely everything, and Nancy will think of all the details you never even knew were possible to make your experience an amazing one that you'll never forget!

reviews.author: Destani R.
reviews.description: I've been on quite a few tours (floating the river, wine tour, hiking, Christmas party bus...just to name a few) and I've always had the BEST of times! Nancy is top notch and knows exactly how to create an unforgettable experience. It's a great way to bond with friends, new and old. I highly recommend, you'll leave w a smile and tons of pictures to look back and reminisce. Cheers

reviews.author: Matt M.
reviews.description: Nancy helped plan and organize my gf's 40th birthday which was absolutely amazing!!! She set up such a unique and amazing experience for all of us to enjoy while making the process seamless. Highly highly recommend, you'll be impressed!!!!

reviews.author: Brianna W.
reviews.description: My friend and I had a great time on the murals your. They showed us all the hot spots for murals, tourist attractions, and local eating spots. It became a mini Austin tour. The tour included a large number of famous Austin murals all over town with a brief history of each one. We were so happy with our tour, I highly recommend this tour!

reviews.author: Mallory S.
reviews.description: This was the very first thing we did when we got to Austin and I'm so glad we did! We saw beautiful murals, our driver and guide was excellent with helping us take pictures and had AMAZING recommendations for food and activities in Austin (we even went to his recommendation for dinner and it was fabulous). Smalls groups so you don't spend forever waiting for all of the group to get done with the pictures, luxury van to toodle around in, first-timers should definitely do this!

reviews.author: Naomi S.
reviews.description: Look this was so worth the money! Definitely a great girls trip idea for those from out of stay. The driver was amazing and very professional.

reviews.author: Deb M.
reviews.description: Very disappointing experience! We booked the Waco trip on  Monday for Wednesday my husband gave our credit card. They were to text our receipt and confirmation to us. When we didn't receive anything, my husband went back on Tuesday and the tour person said we were scheduled for Tuesday and they were leaving! We only had Wednesday available and made that very clear. My husband was unable to get a confirmation we would be credited or not charged. He was given Nancy Palo to contact and have not heard from her 4 hours later. I wouldn't use this tour company and remember to always get everything in writing by any means before you leave the establishment. Very very poor experience.

reviews.author: Mbolle E.
reviews.description: The staff was amazing. It was a little confusing when it came to finding the buses for the shuttle because the instructions weren't really clear. However, I'm giving this a one star because on the shuttle while performing karaoke the staff allowed a white passenger to say various racial slurs on the mic without immediately removing the woman away from the microphone, they didn't even attend to condemn or stop her. At the very least they could have stoped karaoke or stopped playing songs that allowed people to say those slurs so loudly and confidently. As the only black person on the bus it was extremely uncomfortable and dealt with inappropriately. Don't plan on ever using their services again.

reviews.author: Jeff C.
reviews.description: It was a great experience doing the mural tour with Veronica! She knew her knowledge as well as adding some personal experiences in it. Or made my girlfriend and I felt like we were from Austin. I'm glad we had the chance to do it. Thank you!

reviews.author: Erin L.
reviews.description: We did the day trip from Austin to Waco (Magnolia Market).  Had a great driver (Victoria) who was so sweet and accommodating.  Had a great time!

reviews.author: Nicole J.
reviews.description: Mural tour of Austin was fun, informative, and beautiful! Victoria was our tour guide and she was very personable, attentive, knowledgeable, and accommodating. She offered to take photos for us in front of the various murals and she is an awesome photographer! We had a lot of fun and will use Tour Austin to go on more tours soon!

reviews.author: Jacqueline S.
reviews.description: Our Tour Guide, Markie, was absolutely fun, knowledgeable, and extremely helpful with information and answering questions.  She was flexible with timing and made our schedule to accommodate what we wanted to see and do.  She listens well, makes suggestions, and is an excellent driver.  Book this trip!  You will really enjoy it!

reviews.author: Samantha S.
reviews.description: The Austin Hop On Hop Off was a great way to see the city with added history along the way.

reviews.author: Kevin B.
reviews.description: I had a terrible experience with Tour Austin. We had booked 2 tickets for a bus departing at 3:30 PM. Upon arrival (15 minutes early), we were told the bus was full. We ended up being forced to wait until 5 PM before departing and missed a good portion of the concert we were being shuttled to.  Additionally, we were separated from the rest of our group who had boarded the 3:30 shuttle seconds earlier. The concert began at 5 PM. It was clear that passengers who had booked later ticket times were given our seats on the 3:30 PM shuttle instead of us.   Upon departure from the concert, the bus location changed several times which caused a ton of confusion amongst the passengers.   To top it off, repeated attempts to reach out to Tour Austin to remedy the situation have failed.  They have continued to ignore my emails regarding the issues but seem to be able to still send me emails asking for a Yelp rating, so here it is...  Update: owner has reached out and refunded tickets

reviews.author: Bette L.
reviews.description: We thoroughly enjoyed our Austin Selfie City tour with driver Dash and guide Cierra.. They were very patient and answered all of our questions, did not rush us and gave us time at the various murals to talk about what was the story behind the mural as well as some local gossip! They were easy to engage in discussions about Texas, history, places to go, etc... we were looking for a street Art tour but we actually got so much more... the tour traversed the city so we got the flavor of how different each neighborhood is. They were very knowledgeable about music venues, restaurants and bars ... well worth taking this tour. Marty and Bette, NY, NY

reviews.author: Jessica W.
reviews.description: Me and my husband have just moved to Austin and didn't know much about this beautiful city! We had a tour with Markie from Tour Austin and she was amazing. She was very informative and made the tour a lot of fun! She is very personable and knowledgable. We are very grateful for this experience we felt like it was a great thing to learn about the city.

reviews.author: Jesse R.
reviews.description: We were very pleased with the services provided by the Tour Austin shuttle to the Austin360 Amphitheater July 26, 2019. We felt safe with Ken, our driver. He was amicable, friendly and engaging and entertained us by playing music of the artist we were about to see, Beck.  On the return trip he once again played music, this time it was classic rock tunes that we all sang along with. Thank you Ken and thank you Tour Austin, we will use you again.

reviews.author: Kirsten K.
reviews.description: I went on a private tour of wine country and it was absolutely amazing! Tour Austin put together a wonderful customized tour that included all of my favorite types of wine. Our driver Delisha was knowledgeable and very friendly and the car was comfortable! I highly recommend taking a private tour through Tour Austin!

reviews.author: Rocio R.
reviews.description: It is an awesome experience! I wish they could sell beer at the bus that's the only thing.

reviews.author: D C.
reviews.description: Great Experience! We used this service from Austin to Fredericksburg for a wine tour. Driver was on time and very helpful in making sure we made it to all of our wine reservations. Bus was clean and they transported us as if we were precious cargo. Would use this service again.

reviews.author: Elvira A.
reviews.description: Stopped by this charming wine shop for the first time, and absolutely loved it! First of all super pet friendly, so we were off to a great start. I'm not too familiar with wine, so Nancy made a fabulous suggestion. The sparkling wine Naveran hit the spot!   The ambiance is chill, so you want to stay awhile. She has beautiful local art decorating the indoors and plenty of outdoor seating. There is also lovely music playing in the background, and just a friendly place! Will definitely make it a must visit spot on trips to Wimberley!

reviews.author: Laura H.
reviews.description: Nancy knows. As the owner she curates great wines at affordable prices and makes them available to her friends. Everyone is her friend! This is a generous, comfortable place and the perfect spot for a leisurely afternoon of sipping.

reviews.author: Paul V.
reviews.description: Fantastic spot in an idyllic setting.  Nancy is very entertaining as are the two other gals who run the place Lia and Katie.  The international wine selection is tops.  Beer too!  And my dog was allowed !

reviews.author: Caitlyn S.
reviews.description: I picked this place at random when my friend and I decided to meet up near Wimberley. It had good ratings and it looked nice. It turned out to be the best decision; there was a huge event (and beautiful weather) so the heart of Wimberley was PACKED. This place is a bit outside of the main part of town and had plenty of parking, and the best part was it was not crowded. :) They've got minimal seating inside, but plenty of outdoor seating. They also have a nice selection of both beer and wine, plus some yummy snacks (like edamame and hummus!). My friend and I both opted for the wine flight: 4 tasters of wine ranging from red to white to bubbly, all great, and the staff was attentive and ready with the next pour in order to keep the cold ones cold. We had a lovely experience. I definitely recommend if you're near the area!

reviews.author: Amanda C.
reviews.description: I finally made it here!! Unfortunately, the owner Nancy was on holiday break however, Dawn did not disappoint!! She not only catered to me, but also to my husband, son and his girlfriend by making us feel like family!! Dawn made a cozy fire for us to sit around and kept the ros, beer and Pellegrino pouring!! We couldn't ask for a better ambiance. Thank you Casa Vindemia!!

reviews.author: Denise M.
reviews.description: Message the owner on Monday to confirm her hours today. Only to show up and be told she closed at 6:00.  I won't be returning.

reviews.author: Christian W.
reviews.description: Wow! Was driving back down from Dripping Springs and came through Wimberley and sure am glad we did.  This little house is full of rooms and nooks that give it a very intimate feel where you and your friends and family can congregate and feel at home. The bar is loaded full of wines and the staff here isn't shy in regards to providing you with samples and information on each of them.  I don't know very much about wine, but was able to follow along and still get an enjoyable experience out of what they had to offer here. We came on a Sunday afternoon so you know I had to try the mimosa out. Crisp, clean, and refreshing!  Be prepared to shell out some $$ as this place isn't the cheapest option, but you do get a high quality and a large amount of variety which is hard to find in Texas.  Support this local business and lets keep their doors open! Spots like this are hard to come by.

reviews.author: Gina H.
reviews.description: I notice this little wine shop in Wimberly as I walked past and fell in love with the wines from international wines from all over the world. Today I did wine tasting for six dollars a for several wine tastings plus you get a cute small wine glass for free. Delightful place to take your spouse or date.  The host is very smart about the wines they sell here and enjoyed the smooth wines tastings I received. It located downtown Wimberly so you can't miss it. I certainly will visit again soon. It does cost a few dollars more but worth the fun you have visiting such a cute cosy wine store. So stop in and see what I mean .....happy wine hunting!!!

reviews.author: Jack R.
reviews.description: A sweet little place to escape the cares of the world. Nancy chooses great wines for her customers and has both glasses and bottles available.  She also has some high quality beers and other drinks for sale. If the weather's nice enjoy your time under the oak trees outside.

reviews.author: Jeffrey R.
reviews.description: We came here for a friend's birthday party as a first stop on our party bus tour, and the wine tasting was fantastic. I highly recommmend coming here any time.
